reviews.review: Bike tour. This was a great tour! Definitely shows you the beauty of Amsterdam! Riding on the streets were hectic but an experience to remember!!

First class way to enjoy Amsterdam. Really well organised tour from start to finish
Bikes in very good condition - easy to find starting point.
But what made it such fun was our guide Mike - she was both professional and great company. Highly recommended - best day thing we did in Amsterdam.

Countryside Bike Tour - Windmills and Wooden Shoes. Cannot say enough great things about our experience with Mike's Bike Tours in Amsterdam. Our tour guide (Girl) Mike was ah-mazing! She was fun, concerned for our well-being, fun factor and safety as well knowledgeable about the city, the country - it was fascinating. I would say this is a MUST for a visit to get out of the city for a few hours. Affordable and great fun.

Lovely Bike Rental Shop. We popped in after doing some research on where we could rent bikes that weren't obviously tourist bikes. Having visited Amsterdam many times before and cycled there every time (and borrowed friends bikes in the past) - I wanted to avoid being obviously seen as a tourist. They were very helpful inside and explained everything we needed to know. We were given a bike each, including bike lights, 2 locks for each bike, storage bags that went on the back and a pouch for the front. We opted to rent with insurance just in case anything happened and were pleasantly surprised that this only cost us 23 euros for 3 days. The bikes were great and I would hugely recommend using Mike's for bike rentals in the city.

Great orientation tour with a brilliant guide. We were lucky enough to have Matthias as our guide when the four of us went on the longer city cycle tour. Matthias was engaging, intelligent and gave us a fantastic overview of the city's history and culture. This has to be a great way to see a city. We have done cycle trips in many different cities worldwide and this was a great tour. Thank you Matthias for being and excellent guide and also for your recommendations of other things to do. This tour is a must!

Fun, informative and worth doing!. We had a good tour with Matthias (knowledgeable, fun, friendly and helpful), we found this just right for getting your bearings and it was fun just cycling around the canals and taking in the views. I and my daughter thought it was a good trip and found it interesting, could have done with a little time to take photos (but absolutely recognize this is not possible when doing a group tour) but took a few when possible and then took bikes out the day after to stop at our leisure and took our photos then. Would recommend it. Never once felt unsafe, kept to the group and the guide made sure all of use at dangerous points were all together and crossing together on the larger tram roads. Thanks!

Solo Traveler. When I arrived in Amsterdam, I had been traveling Europe for 7 weeks and done 3-4 bike tours and 5-6 walking tours in other cities. This was probably the worst tour of my entire trip. My tour guide was one of the older guys in staff, I think his name started with an S, and I was under the impression that he was tired of giving the same tours and really didn't care about the customer experience. Didn't have that good of a time and would not recommend. Better luck with another guide.

Unprofessional Guide . I thought for a while before deciding to post this. I dislike giving negative reviews and try to judge people to the good. However, the tour guide was unprofessional and made several remarks that made me uncomfortable. Throughout the tour he said:"Such a nice thing, four women trying to obey me." (In the context of giving biking instructions to me and 3 other women.)"So I'm sitting in a tree, with all these attractive gay men around me. I wish I was gay - but I like girls. So they dragged me out of the tree and into the bushes and, well, you can imagine the rest." (I found it odd to be asked to imagine sexual assault while biking through the city.)He made a few other remarks, but this should give you a general idea. Three people left the tour early. I should have left, as well. He took this very personally - and then loudly and repeatedly used profanity to describe the people who left. TripAdvisor's guidelines will not allow me to publish what he said. Go to a different company. I've gone on many tours around the world and this has never happened before.All of that being said, he was knowledgeable about the city and did take us to many interesting places. The bikes provided by the company were high-quality. Unfortunately, his remarks somewhat overshadowed his touring skills.

The Highlight of our Trip. If you are an experienced cyclist, you need to include this tour in your planning when you visit Amsterdam. We had Sam as our fearless leader, who expertly wove us in and out of the masses of moving bicycles and traffic without a hitch. The four to five hour tour leads you through interesting parts of the city, but my favorite by far was the country areas. Sam had a good grasp of the history and everyday goings on in the city and a great sense of humor we all enjoyed. Going through the country, we saw many animals, beautiful homes, farmland and canals. We stopped at a working dairy farm. There, they not only made delicious cheese, but surprisingly, they also made wooden shoes. We were able to watch the process of both and buy some in the gift shop they had on site. Amsterdam is full of interesting architecture, friendly people, unique boutiques and sites you won't ever see anywhere else. This bike trip will make your visit perfect! (Thanks, Sam. It was truly a pleasure to meet you.)

Fantastic tour highly recommend. We thoroughly enjoyed our cycle tour yesterday with Mikes Bikes. Thank you so much to Matthias our guide who gave us such an interesting tour with a great insight to Amsterdam's history and culture answering all questions so well, as well as making us all laugh and have a lot of fun! Thank you also Matthias for showing us the rijsttafel restaurant with incredible food which we really enjoyed, and for recommending to us the verzetsmuseum which is a great alternative if you haven't booked tickets for Anne Frank's house. A thoroughly enjoyable tour and perfect to get our bearings of the city. We would definitely recommend to all and will be sure to do another one when we return!Ella, Hugh, Ken and Christine Comrie.

Brilliant way to see the city!. We did this on our last day as we didn't book in advance. I would highly recommend, its was a really good way to see the city.
Guide was very friendly and had loads of knowledge.
I just wish we had booked in advance of our trip to do on our first day.

Perfect First Day in Amsterdam!. Had just flown in from the states - up over 30 hours. Beautiful sunny day, so we signed up for the Countryside tour. Grabbed some items for a picnic at a nearby grocery before the tour beforehand. There were 11 in our group, ranging from late twenties to late sixties. Our guide, Girl Mike, did a great job maintaining a manageable pace for everyone and was very entertaining. It's about a 27km ride beside the Amstel River, with frequent stops, including several windmills and a farm where gouda cheese and wooden clogs are made. It was at this stop that we ate our picnic lunch. The farmer who runs the place was a hoot.The terrain is very flat, with the only hills being going over the bridges. Easy, beautiful ride with a very organized, professional company. Highly recommend!Note - we visited in the off season, but they had groups arriving/leaving nonstop. Several in our group had walked in that day and requested a tour, and they accommodated us. If you're going in the summer, it might be a good idea to buy tickets in advance.

Really enjoyed this tour. We took the bike tour that took us to the country side. There were approx. 13 of us. We were the oldest at 65 & 69, but it was easy and everyone was able to keep up. We stopped at a windmill, a cheese "factory"/wooden shoe maker, a beautiful park and plenty of the city. We actually rented bikes the following day to tour on our own. I suggest this to everyone...it was great!

Wonderful experience for people going to Amsterdam for their first time.. It was my first time to Amsterdam, and I googled for what's best to do with just 1 day. I had only 1 Sunday because I was on a business trip. Anyway, Google related me to this City bike tour which had quite a lot of positive comment, so I gave it a go together with my another friend. We bought coupons online and it was quite easy.SInce it was our first time to Amsterdam, it took us a while to find the meeting point with the help of Google map.Staff there were friendly and helpful, and the tour lead humorously introduced us some basic safety advice. Then we split into smaller group of 14. I think they are very experienced and well organized.Our lead took us to quite many places, usually 10 minutes ride apart, and at every stop he would explained to us the history of the spot, and we took many photos along the way. The bike was quite easy to ride, as the seat is big meaning it is very butt friendly, and basically Amsterdam is quite flat, and thus those gears are good enough for small slope up in many situation.There happened to have a Marathon going on, and thus we didn't go to the Museum square, yet all the other spots we visited were beautiful, especially under a great sunny and windy weather.Everyone in the small group enjoyed the 3 hours tour, just a little bit of sweat, yet can see many area of the Amsterdam area. Special thanks to our handsome young tour guide, and I will highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam for their first time.If I am making a come back, I just need to rent a bike there. ;)

Great visit to the Dutch countryside. Our family of six thoroughly enjoyed a trip with Mike's Bikes out of Amsterdam to the surrounding countryside. Matthias was a great guide, putting everyone at ease and helping us navigate the bike lanes of Amsterdam before the city quickly gave way to fields and canals. Despite a rainy day the kids had a great time and the stop-off at the cheese farm and clogs workshop definitely gave them a taste of a very different way of life. The bikes were good quality and well maintained and we enjoyed the good humoured friendly atmosphere of everyone in the shop. Highly recommended.

Mikes Bikes the best. We like to take bike tours in the cities we visit. It is usually a fun way to see the town, get a feel for the area and have some fun. Today we had a group of 9 bikes. Our guide, Mike, ( a woman named , Mike) called us a family and suggested we stay together. We were all given biking protocol for the streets of Amsterdam along with rain ponchos. Both were helpful as there are throngs of bikers and unpredictable weather. Mike was informative on the history and the culture of the city. She was kind, personable and hilarious. Cannot remember ever enjoying a bike tour more. We had some bike troubles, flat tires etc, which were promptly resolved by a cell phone call to the main store which sent an employee with a ' new' bike. We celebrated the end of our tour with beverages of local beer and coffee and lively conversation. Loved it. Loved it. And Mike, made the tour so fabulous. Way to go, Mike !!

Great way to see what is outside the city. Love it, the bike ride was easy and comfortable. Once we reached the countryside we could relax away from the hustle of the city. The farmer has a good sense of humour and proud to speak five languages. Give yourself enough time to find the bike shop from Central Station, almost in front of DoubleTree hotel.

Outstanding, with Lots of History and Information. Our excellent guide, though American born, was just simply fantastic. He led us through the maze of streets in the city of Amsterdam. Then led us through a romp in the countryside, eventually to a working dairy making gouda cheese, and wooden shoes. It was a great ride, good pace, viewing working wind mills, farms, and fabulous residences.

Great bike tour of the countryside . We did the countryside tour which included a visit to a farm that makes cheese and clogs, (watch out ladies the farmer is a bit mental but harmless enough, although surprisingly fluent in Chinese :)). Daniel, our tour guide was very friendly and full of information and super dry dutch wit which was great and the whole thing was really nice and relaxing despite cycling nearly 20 miles :)

Awesome tour . Colonel was our guide and he was super fantastic in taking us around the great city of Amsterdam! We learned a lot about the city and I loved how we get to stop at the end to have a drink and chat with others on the tour and to ask any questions. He was so enhusiastic and had tons of energy. Riding a bike around Amsterdam is not easy but he made it possible for all of those involved. We thoroughly enjoyed every minute of this tour. I highly recommend it!

Highly recommend. Tour was very enjoyable. Time went too fast. Will be telling my friends. Our tour guide was Daniel, who was very funny and very informative. And once the tour was finished everyone was helpful of where to go from there and how to get there.

The best way to see the city. We booked our Mike's bike tour of Amsterdam easily online before we left for a weekend break. The guys at the bike store were friendly and welcoming, and gave our group a really reassuring pre tour talk about how to manage in the Amsterdam cycle tracks.Jeff, our cycle tour guide was amazing, keeping us all safe and together, stopping off at all the interesting places on our route through the city, telling unusual and interesting stories about the places we visited, including the Museum quarter, Vongelpark, loads of beautiful canals, Anne Frank house and even taking in a stroll with our bikes down a street in red light district. Amsterdam is gorgeous and cycling with such a fun tour guide gave us a great feel for the place and helped us find our bearings!

Best way to see the city!. We had done a bike tour in Paris with a different company and had a great experience and really wanted to do a bike tour whilst in Amsterdam. The guides explained the bikes very well, with a bit of humour, and we were given a bike to ride (obviously) the bikes had bags either side of the back tire and a bag at the front for all of your belongings. The bikes were very comfortable and a very 'cruiser' style. Our guide was very good at explaining the rules of the road in Amsterdam and was very attentive to our safety. We stopped at certain points and our guide explained the history of where we were, our tour then ended with a stop at a pub near a great location.Would recommend to anyone going to Amsterdam, as long as they're comfortable on a bike!

Great way to see the city. We had hoped to join the bike tour, but unfortunately it was full. Instead, we hired bikes and headed off on our own, which we really enjoyed. The crew at Mike's are very helpful and easygoing - especially GIdeon, who was kind enough to outline his favourite places in Amsterdam so we wouldn't miss out on all the gems. The bikes are great, and the hire shop is centrally located so you can get anywhere quickly once you pick up your bike. We would highly recommend.

Good tour. Would've liked it to be more informative. . We did a bike tour. It was good. I wish we could have learned more about the history and stories of the city. If you are not comfortable on a bike, I suggest not going. You will be too focused on the road, with all the traffic and won't be able to experience the beauty of the city

Cheese was delish :). My friend and I booked a last minute trip to Amsterdam. We were able to do a lot of the city by walking and canal, so we chose the Countryside Tour for bikes. Biking in the city was kinda nerve racking, but girl Mike really explained things well before and during the tour. She really prepped us on what to expect on the city streets before hitting the country side. Girl Mike was really fun, loved all her Dutch comments and I'm sure we could have swayed her into taking us for a pit stop at a pub if we tried. The cheese was delicious and bought some for home. Seeing the clogs was okay, not sure intriguing - mostly cause the farmer is an odd dude. But overall, a good experience. Also, I appreciated that had some backup panchos for us that morning in case it rained. My only 'complaint' is that instead of taking a packed lunch, it would have been nice to stop somewhere to eat... even if it was only for 30 min. While traveling, it's not super convenient to have to find something to pack for lunch. But we managed to grab some croissant sandwiches from some cafe before we got to the bike shop so it was fine, but lunch at a cafe/pub during the tour would have been better.

Mike's Bike Tour. Nice long ride through the city and the country side. Just make sure to stay single file on the right side. Lots of bikes and scooters in this city!!! The tour is great exercise, all flat so not hard, and our guide was funny and knowledgeable. There is a stop on the tour at a farm where you will see cheese and clog making. It would be nice to actually see how the cheese is made, but the farmer explains it. By the way, he is a very cheesy ladies man...LOL...you will see what I mean.
Nice way to spend an afternoon. We went on the tour to see windmills and a cheese farm. The guide (lady Mike) was very informative and entertaining.

Thanks to girl Mike for a great day out!. I rocked up to Mike's Bikes Tours slightly worse for wear after a big night out fearing the worst but the bike tour to the countryside was just the tonic and helped me recover much faster! ;) Girl Mike was the hostess with the most-est! We had a great time and having a local as a tour guide certainly adds to the cultural experience. I did this bike ride 17 years ago and its hardly changed...its requires low levels of fitness, just watch out for cars and other locals on bikes. You are soon in the countryside enjoying windmills, green fields and eventually a cheese farm. We also had a cheeky beer on the way home! I can highly recommend this tour...even if you are broken from a heavy night before. Big thanks to Mike for all the restaurant, pub, markets etc tips after the bike ride. Enjoy!

Rainy but fun!. The tour was a relatively quickly moving bike tour through Amsterdam. I recommend having a good level of familiarity on a bike and a decent amount of fitness. The tour was informative and Colonel provided us with entertainment along with an insider look at Amsterdam life.

Great experience. We had a great time we saw lots of Amsterdam and were given a pleasing balance of information about Amsterdam a good way to enjoy a bike ride. I would recommend this over hiring a bike yourself

Crazy but fun cycle through the city!. Did a private tour with 12 adult friends (late 40's - early 50's). It was a trip, very comfortable bikes (better than our bikes at home). Friendly and knowledgable guide (Jeff from Canada). He had great stories and clearly knew the city. We lost him once but he quickly circled back to find us! It is not for the faint hearted, cycling hear is hectic with lots of traffic, pedestrians and other bikes. This was a highlight of our trip and we saw it all! Also went for a drink at the end of our trip and shared more stories. Reasonable prices, quality bikes, good value! Remember it is Amsterdam so if you want a G rated trip, you should ask in advance and take a private trip...we were a group of adults and asked for the full version of the stories ie red light district but if you want a family version, you should ask in advance. Great fun, would definitely do it again and recommend to friends!

Mike's Bikes is the place to go for Rentals and Tours. I have rented bikes from Mike's Bikes and also gone on their Country Tour. Anytime I am in Amsterdam I will go to Mike's Bikes! We went on the country tour, which is a nice ride through the city of Amsterdam and then through the countryside (Where we saw a Windmill and went to a Cheese Farm). Such a fun day and you learn a lot of history and fun facts about the area. When we rented bikes for a week, any problem we had with the bike they will address, fix and/or give you a completely new bike. Gideon and Anna were so helpful, Thank you!!!!
Fun way to see a LOT of the city!. My girlfriends and I had Diego as our guide and we had an awesome 3.5 hours seeing ALL of Amsterdam. Bike is definitely the way to go!

Excellent tour !. We took the 3-hour tour. Our tour guides were the "Colonel" and Simon, both very informative, easy going, and friendly. A very nice tour, greatly balanced between cycling and hearing awesome stories about Amsterdam. We had wonderful sunshine, cycled all through the center of Amsterdam including Vondel Park, and at the end had a beer in a nice place...Highly recommend the tour and these guides !

The best bike tour! . We (husband & I) had a wonderful time on Mike's Bike Tours. Our guide was Sam- an absolute legend! The bike ride takes you out of the city, along the countryside & into beautiful Dutch living. Pack lunch if you're doing the 11am tour as there isn't anywhere to buy it. You stop at a cheese making farm & get a good rest there seeing the cows, pressing cheese into moulds & of course clog making. It rained our whole time but we all laughed & got on so well it didn't even bother us.Sam was so helpful & a crack-up to hangout with for the 4 hours. I couldn't recommend a better tour to do whilst in Amsterdam. The bikes are easy to ride & they provide you with ponchos if it's wet, so you're in good hands with these guys :)

Unsettling experience. Unfortunately I can't recommend this tour. Our guide, Vince, was constantly ahead of us. He didn't really assist with the hazardous Amsterdam bike experience which made the entire ride a harrowing experience. Further, when we did stop the facts he told us about Amsterdam were not correct as was verified by our city tour guide the next evening! I was very disappointed by the experience and I would definitely not recommend Mike's to anyone.

Second time as good as the first!. I took this tour the last time I went to Holland. It was just as awesome! Sam, or AmsterSam as he is also know, is hilarious! The ride into the country is beautiful. The cheese farm is a little cheesy (lol), but it is excellent quality and delicious! Anyone who rates this tour badly has absolutely no sense of humor. I've also seen some comments about how the level of physical activity is hard, but that is not the case (unless you can't walk to the parking lot). Mike's bike shop is efficiently run, professional, and friendly. Highly recommend!!

Super fun time, request the Colonel. Had an awesome time touring the city, and our guide the colonel was great. Showed us a ton of interesting random stuff, and had great stories. Will be taking it again on the next visit

Excellent . One of the highlights of visiting Amsterdam. The guys took us outside Amsterdam, about 40 mins cycle and then visited a cheese farm, cycled through the forest, stopped at the a former Olympic location and windmill and the best was where we crossed the water and stepped on this mushy, soft grass where one group jumped up and felt the vibration underneath ones feet. The guys are great, up for a laugh. Really enjoyed it!!

Fun way to see the city. I did the mini city tour as I was in town on business and had limited time. It was a fun way to get to see the city and participate in the local tradition of riding bikes as the primary mode of transportation. Our guide was actually Canadian, which was a bit odd, but he seemed to know his stuff. I learned a lot about the city and some of its history. As you can imagine, 11 people trying to follow a guide through the city during rush hour was a bit challenging. If you want to do this tour and you are a less than confident bike rider, I would suggest skipping this tour. I watched a few in our group struggle, get in the way of locals, etc. so I would recommend the tour and Mike's bikes for those that want the experience and are comfortable riding bikes through a bit of chaos...I really enjoyed it.

Great way to see the city and Dutch countryside. We had a great time on our countryside bike tour with Mike's. Our tour guide Daniel was a native of Amsterdam with a funny, dry sense of humor. There are a million bikes whizzing around Amsterdam so it was great to have a tour guide to help navigate the busy city. We chose the "country tour" which brought yus outside the city where we saw an old windmill and learned about all of the drainage that keeps Amsterdam - once a swamp - from suffering flood damage. We also stopped at a cheese and wooden shoe factory. A farmer gave us a tour and he was a big character. He is one of only 3 producers of wooden shoes and he showed us how the machines work. We loved the tour and would recommend it to anyone in the city.
Great way to see the city and country.. Fun day and excellent tour guide Mike. If you want to experience Amsterdam like a local this is for you! Its a big day out and you need to pack lunch.

A must do in Amsterdam. This tour was definitely a highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. Highly recommend to anyone looking to get a perspective on how most locals get around town as well as getting a nice background on the city's rich history. As long as you can ride a bike and aren't afraid of sharing crowded streets with vehicles, other bikes and pedestrians you will be just fine, so don't be intimidated by how crazy it looks. Also, be sure to get Jeff as your guide. I have been on tons of guided tours and Jeff was by far one of the best guides ever.
City Sightseeing With a Flair. Great way to get an overview of the city, plus learn strange historical facts that you actually remember. Our guide was witty and biking made you feel like a local. FUN

Wonderfull guide, hazardous route. In General just Superb. Guide was absolutelly the best. Bikes are in good condition and Easy to operate and not heavy at all to cycle. Biking in Amsterdam is nice but lack of helmets and agressive driving and other Bikders make to Hard to survive. If Biking among the cars is not your thing, then figure out something Else to do.
Mini City Bike Tour! . We had a great time and made new friends! We went on the Mini City tour because our flight in was late, but we had a blast and will do the Country tour next time we are there!
Nice Amsterdam Taste. It was really nice cycling around Amsterdam. Bikes are good and the guide was a nice guy (unfortunately, i forgot his name!). Could recommend to friends touristing in AMS!

Again: JEFF was AWESOME!. Funny and interesting tour with your guide Jeff, who speaks an excellent english (maybe because of the fact that he is a native speaker :-) )Althought the traffic in Amsterdam is a little bit "special", Jeff guided us to many great places and told a lot about history and beyond.

Fantastic! . Had a really great time on our mini city-tour yesterday. Our guide, Daniel, was excellent and made the tour fun as well as educational. The route was beautiful and showed us various different parts of Amsterdam which we probably wouldn't have seen on our own. Would definitely recommend Mike's Bike Tour to a friend.
City bike tour. Excellent way to see the city in 3 hrs. Great guide. We had a private tour, recommend if you have min. 6 persons. Thanks to Mike!

Great bike tours. My husband and I did both the city and the countryside bike tours. While both were great, the countryside tour with Daniel was the best. Seeing more of Amsterdam was fabulous, and Daniel is a super nice guy full of knowledge about the country. I highly recommend this tour. And they take credit cards.

Country tour. The country tour was great, it was like a one-stop shop for all things Dutch. We got to see a working windmill, bike through the swamp lands, go to a clog/cheese farm with a very interesting, eccentric farmer. Another cool (and maybe scary) thing was being able to bike through the busy streets of Amsterdam.One thing I would suggest is perhaps asking if a biker on the tour is new or inexperienced with biking (maybe during the booking process because they did ask at the beginning of the tour in front of a big crowd and no one spoke up) and having an additional guide on hand to assist them on the tour. Biking through Amsterdam is quite a challenge for even someone who knows how to bike, but for a beginner it can be absolutely terrifying. So having that extra support on hand would help and improve the experience for all the bikers on the tour (both intermediate and beginner).

Great way to see the city!. This was the first thing I did when I arrived in Amsterdam and I'm so glad I did. The tour was a great price (they also have bike rentals) and we had an excellent guide who serenaded us with detailed and quirky tales of the city. He also blew bubbles and was very attentive! We finished up the tour at a local brewery which was a nice way to end the tour and meet fellow riders (especially as a solo traveler) Highly recommend!

Great team. We booked rentals for a school trip, Gideon and Casper were most welcoming and helpful, and gave us directions to very nice places. We highly recommend them!Also, make sure you have lots of time ahead, Amsterdam is really great by bike.

Country Tour. Recently took the country bike tour with my wife and had a fantastic time. The guide, Mike (not the owner) was the best - fun loving and shared her vast knowledge of this wonderful city. I had not ridden a bike in about 30 years, and although we covered many miles, we took many breaks and the tour was very flat. What a wonderful way to see the surrounding countryside. Biking in Amsterdam is a must and I highly recommend this company for their professionalism. If your lucky you'll get the ride with Mike, although I'm sure all the tour leaders are wonderful.

Great city bike tour - just do it. We had a great tour with Diago. He was informative and had a real personal connection with the history of the City, which was great. Biking in Amsterdam is a must and by far the best way to get to know the City and Mike's Bikes was quick and easy to book, ran on time and was well organised. I would highly recommend it and we will consider doing the countryside tour with them when we next visit Amsterdam.

put on must do list. we had the best time with mikes bike .we did the country side ride and it was amazing we stopped at places on the way out of town and were given a bit of history, Stopped at a windmill and checked out a chess factor and clogs .the ride was about 26ks but it was a easy ride as most of Amsterdam is flat I would put this on your must do list and the crew at mikes bikes are a lot of fun and make your time even more memorable .thanks mikes bike for a amazing day out

Do this bike tour!. My husband and I did the mini city tour with Sander on our third day in Amsterdam, and we had a BLAST! Sander was incredible through and through. He was hilarious, passionate, engaging - and also was really wonderful in preparing us for the rush hour bike traffic on a Friday. Would highly recommend!

I'd say Bike with Mike!. We took a mini tour of the city. I think its a great way to explore the city if you're low on time in Amsterdam. The guides seemed really friendly & were always willing to explain about the city. Highly recommended!! Pros: They start on time. Approachable guys. Well organized.
Really nice way to discover Amsterdam and her campagne.. 4 hours in bike to discover Amsterdam. The guide was excellent, and the bike maintained for a really nice travel accessible for all biker.

Countryside Bike Tour. What a wonderful great time we had over 4+ hours seeing not only the city but countryside. If we could go higher than 5 stars I would - Daniel was an excellent tour guide and it was a great way to spend Saturday afternoon in Amsterdam.

Lovely countryside tour with Girl_Mike. So lucky that it was this warmspell in Amsterdam, just this early September week. It was such a brilliant sunny day. Girl_Mike was fun and informative and handled us 8 or so cyclists well. Next time I would push for swimming in a canal also! Overall, if you love cycling, it's a bit slow, so maybe next time I'd rent a bike and a guide and go all over. Yes Girl_Mike? :) Also, maybe Gideon?, in the office, super cool, let me store my backpack with laptop, as I was just arriving in that morning and not checking into the hostel until later. And the bikes are super comfy! Made me wonder if I should change my ride at home... Well organised, smooth, and not expensive. Thanks Mikes Bikes.
Great way to see a lot of the city in a short time . Such a great time. Saw amazing things and heard great stories from history. Cool employees. Very laid back. Highly recommend

Good Tour. I had good time on the bike tour even thou I had 25 years not riding a bike. It came back to be after a few blocks. For a person that has not much time in the city you can consider this a crash course on the basic. The service was very good and pace was good.

3hr city bike tour. Sander was a fabulous guide! He was thoughtful in his directions and instructions; knowledgeable in his talks; entertaining in his delivery! Can highly recommend this as a way to see a lot in one afternoon and learn about the history, the structures and the people!

Great trip into the country. . Went on the Country tour at Mike's with Pete as our guide. The bike's were easy to ride and well maintained. The trip through Amsterdam city is a fun experience but they make sure you get through safely. Once you're out by the river, it's a really nice cruise to the cheese/clog farm. The farmer is eccentric to say the least and definitely has some opinions about Asian clog imports! The cheese is amazing though. As expected, you exit through the gift shop but there's no pressure to buy anything. It's a good spot for lunch so pack some food and drink. There are saddle bags on most bikes for your stuff. It's a nice way to see the city and some of the country even though it's only a few km away. Would definitely recommend.

Wonderful Amsterdam into, good bikes, fun guide. This was one of the first things we did after arriving to Amsterdam - what a great way to shake off the plane ride, and get your bearings of the city. Our guide was Sam, who had lots of colorful humor! We did the "country" tour which takes you out to a dairy farm that makes cheese and Dutch wooden clogs - the farmer there is a bit crazy :-). The gift shop at the farm is great. The route is actually a good mix of countryside and city.The bikes were cruisers that smoothed things out nicely for riding on cobbles. The folks at Mikes do a good job with bike safety briefing. On the busy day that we went, the queue to use their toilet before the ride was very long so you might want leave extra time for that.Overall, this was a very fun experience. I recommend doing this ASAP after arriving like we did.

One of the best ways to see the city. We had an amazing day out with Matt. The perfect way to see the city - you cover so much ground that you really get a feel for everything and see a lot.I would definitely recommend this as an activity for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Great Tour and friendly staff. So we got lost and missed the time we were supposed to go on our bike tour. Fortunately we had another 3 days in Amsterdam and they were very flexible to let us come on another day and time. We did the mini bike tour through the city which was the perfect amount of time. Our guide (Diego) was a character - very friendly and funny! It is such a big biking city so I recommend it - kinda makes you feel like a local. We got lucky and there was no rain the day we did our tour while most of the other days had some rain.

Country Tour with Karl. Carl was ok, but his brother Karl was awesome. We had 13 people in our group and had a great leisurely ride through the countryside. The bikes were well maintained and extremely easy to ride. Karl was part standup comic and part tour guide. Thank you.

Awesome overview of the city. We took the short city ride which is around 2 hours. Our guide Mike was very funny and she took excellent care of us all. As we are from UK, the road orientation was opposite in Amsterdam, so it took us some time to get used to it. You need a certain level of confidence on bikes, because Amsterdam is a busy city and the alleys and bridges are full of people.Out tour took us through Museumplein, Anne Frank House, Red light district and over the canals. It was a nice way to get acquainted to the city. The bikes were in a good condition, our guide stopped us at various places and gave us the histp=orical backgrounds of different monuments. Certainly a must-do.

Great way to see the city and surrounds.. Booked a bike tour before we left the UK. Location is good, maybe a 15 minute walk from the Central Station and on a main road so easy to find. All the staff were brilliant - very friendly, funny and helpful - and spoke perfect English. The tour began with a safely briefing and demonstration of how the bikes worked - this may sound daft but in a strange city it's important to have the bike set up to suit you and to know which brake lever operates which brake, how the gears work, etc. There were 30 of us on this tour so we split into 3 groups of 10, each with its own tour guide; we had Mike and she was briliant - very funny but also informative too. One tourist was delegated to stay at the back to make sure we all got through lights, etc and we were told of the procedure to follow if anyone got lost.The tour itself took us along city streets, some quiet and some fairly busy, so I'd advise anyone booking to have a degree of confidence on a bike. We stopped a couple of times and grouped together to hear Mike tell us about the area or how Amsterdam was built and developed before carrying on into the countryside to cycle along the banks of the Amstel. Weather was great, pace not too fast but we did make progress and once out of the city everything felt a lot more relaxing.The tour included a couple of stops, one at a windmill and one at a Gouda and clog farm. The windmill stop was literally that, a stop to look at a windmill without going in (it's a private residence) but the Gouda / clog stop was much more interesting as we saw cheese being made (and sampled some different types) and saw clogs being made too. The farm is a very laid back, family run type business so we stayed here for a while to eat lunch (bring your own), refill water bottles and shop for souvenirs. Mikes Bikes no doubt get a kickback from the farm for bringing tourists in (this was joked about) and the farm needs tourist money I guess to help it survive but don't feel used or under pressure to buy anything. However I'm glad we bought some clogs and trinkets - the clogs in particular were the best I saw in the city and reasonably priced and I'd have been a bit miffed with myself if we hadn't bought them there and then; yes it's a bit of a pain carrying them back in your backpack but go prepared, it's worth it.Overall this was a great day. Booked for 4 hours and ended up taking over 5 but would have done more if we could have. The group was great, Mike the guide is brilliant and this was definitely a highlight of our holiday. Thoroughly recommended.

Perfect way to spend first day in Amsterdam. We did the Country tour with Pete. He was very entertaining and conscientious. The weather was amazing. We enjoyed the visit to the farm and even purchased some cheese. A great way to end was a stop at Brouwerij Ij for a nice cold beer!

great way to see this city with knowledgible, fun guides. Did a 4 hour tour riding out of city to countryside along the Amstel river. Included a cheese factory tour and clog making by locals which were both interesting. Bikes were good, well maintained and importantly a comfy seat. If you do this tour bring your own lunch and water, it's not available on route. Guide not only gave us heaps of info about Amsterdam but delivered it in a fun manner but not over the top. Really enjoyed the day. Thanks Pete.

Very helpful,friendly and good value for money!!. 5 of us hired bikes from Gillian(not sure if I heard it right) and Anna who were really helpful. Gillian marked all the must see places on the map(which we forgot in the shop but he was nice enough to do it again for us). We were meant to return the bikes by 6pm but group got split up and one of our friends got lost.Gillian (hoping thats right name) was more than kind enough to not just explain the way to her on the phone but he actually went to get her as she started panicking. The bikes were in great condition,very affordable and safe!I would without a doubt,recommend this place:)

Amazing!!!. Today we took the city bike tour with Matisse. It was brilliant, so informative he knows his stuff. Spoke excellent English. He is a credit to Mike BikesThe craziness of the bikes in the city I had watched, and now on one. The tour was perfect great way to see the city. If you do nothing else in Amsterdam you must do this. All the staff were great and friendly. Thank you so much.Amy and Mark

A must do. This was amazing!!!! Love it.I did the country side tour with my husband. We both loved it. After a mountaineering expedition and trek to Mt. Blanc we went around switzerland and we didn't enjoy as much. It was this bike tour which got us back to the adventurous mood with a hint of relaxing. Wish we did this even earlier.
Excellent way to see the city. We went on the mini city tour with Girl Mike, and it was an incredible experience. She is an excellent guide, and I cannot recommend this tour enough

Great tour, great guide and cheap!. We were group of 11 girls that took the private city tour. Got a great guide who took us all around the city center and even took us a extra circle that we really loved! Would recommend them to anyone.

Really Fun & Informative. I did the 3 hour city bike tour (which ran a little over 3 hours b/c we stopped for lunch and beers) with my friend from home and two of my friends who are from The Netherlands. All four of us had a great time and even my two local friends said they learned so much about Amsterdam! We rode with Jeff and there were about 12 people in the group. I didn't ask, but everyone in the group seemed to be in their late 20s. The group was from all over the world but everyone spoke perfect English, which was good b/c the tour was in English. The actual bike route itself is not hard, as you're simply riding through the streets of Amsterdam (which is how most of the locals get around). The most challenging part for me, someone who doesn't traditionally ride a bike ever, was being aware of all of the locals speeding past who are very familiar with this mode of transportation.I enjoyed this way more than my canal tour, as it was way more personalized, engaging and interactive than sitting on a boat and listening to an audio recording. Also...inexpensive! =)

Countryside bike tour with friends. What a great way to tour Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside. It seems wrong not to bike here, but for those of us not used to urban biking, this was a much safer way to do it. As a bonus you got a great scenic tour, a great guide and a visit to a cheese farm (even if the farmer was a bit odd). A must do while in Amsterdam.

Country Tour. My husband and I took the country tour today with Carl. We had a great time and it was the highlight of our day! Carl was a friendly, knowledgable guide and made everyone on the tour feel safe and comfortable. Riding through Amsterdam at first was s little nerve wracking, but by the end, we were sailing along like pros! I would suggest that more information about sights be provided while traveling.

Best value for money. We chose Mikes bikes because it was cheap and a good location to our apartment - we did not go on a tour we just got 2 bikes that had no issues - good locks and good storage! The staff were all very friendly and helpful - banter was good and we even got some free postcards

Very good fun and a great few hours. The bike quality is excellent, the tour is just right. We saw some lovely places and were lucky to have such a fun guide, Daniel, who added some great colour to a fantastic day. Worthhhh it
Country tour. We had a wonderful time on the country tour. Highly recommend this institution and the tour guides are brilliant! Thank you

Best bike tour! . This was the first ever bike tour I've been on and I was very impressed! It was not only a lot of fun, but our guide was amazing! His name was Jeff and he had so much knowledge about the city as well as good restaurant suggestions afterwards. He was really funny and overall made me feel very comfortable and safe on the tour, considering how intimidating a bike tour can be in Amsterdam. As I've travelled through Europe and done more bike tours now, I still compare them to my first one as it was of such good standard! The bikes were really comfortable too and smooth to ride. They weren't as awkward as a few others I've ridden. I would really suggest to go with this company and I will definitely be back to do it again!

Probably good if you're not two minutes late (and don't go to the rental shop). My sister and I were two minutes late for our 11am countryside tour. Two minutes on a bike tour is not usually an issue as most of the time people are getting their bikes in order and the tours don't leave until 15 to 20 minutes late. However my sister and I ended up at the wrong location as well. When we walked in at two minutes past 11 and spoke with the man at the desk he explained that the tour had supposedly already left from the other location (with out even making a phone call to check) and that our options were to take a city tour (which we had already done) or get a 50% refund. Now I understand that we were late and at the rental shop not where the tour departs from but I had pre booked a reservation online and already pre paid. I also never received a confirmation email from the company. We must have spent about 5 minutes going back and forth with the gentleman at the desk saying how we got lost trying to find the location and never got an email and he kept telling us well its not my fault you're late and that you're at the wrong location it is all explained on our website. Well Im sorry but two minutes late when you know we are coming and not letting us join the tour at a different location (such as the first stop which was right down the street from the rental shop) seems a little crazy to me. Then as if we didn't understand what the man at the desk was saying a women who works in the shop walks over and starts saying the exat same things. Basically my sister and I wanted a full refund for the tour that we couldn't join and the two bike shop employees were very confrontational saying how nothing was their fault. Obviously that is true none of the occurrences were specifically their fault but would expect a bit more calm, friendly, and accommodating service from the number one company on trip advisor. When all is said and done the tension did break and the man offered to give us a daily bike rental and refund the rest of out tour price. He also very nicely showed us the bike tour route for us to follow and gave us some great suggestions for lunch and where to go/see. Honestly everything did turn out for the better my sister and I enjoyed riding around the countryside on our own and not having to follow a tour schedule. We also were able to meet up with the tour that we were supposed to be on at the cheese farm/clog factory and the tour guide put us right in with her group. Basically I am sure this is a great great company but we had a bad experience with the two people at the rental shop being so confrontational at first.
country side tour. the tour was amazing Mike was sunny was all the money she did a perfect job . if want to see something deferent also to feel how the Dushe people live do it.

Country side tour. One of the things I love about hiring tours is that you get to see places you wouldn't even know about if you went on your own and this tour gives you that! We saw Amazing, interesting and beautiful places around Amsterdam! Daniel, our tour guy was super cool and funny, made the entire journey very enjoyable. I recommend 100%! Ámsterdam is so much more than just weed and with this guys you can actually see it!

GETTING BETTER ACQUAINTED WITH THE CITY. I've walked Amsterdam several hours each day, so I have a good sense of it. But taking the ubiquitous bike is a worthwhile experience. Follow the guide through smaller streets, stop for an explanation of different areas. Though the guide was pleasant, I generally prefer more in depth information. After all, they are "guides". How else are visitors supposed to learn? My suggestion...when you do the "snack, drink" pause, take the opportunity to get her everyone around and provide better history. People riding all strung out can't hear you beyond the second person in line.

Great bike tour. We prebooked this tour prior to leaving the UK as a group of 6 adults. We were put into groups of 10 as a lot of people turned up for this tour. Our guide was very informative and stopped at points of interest. It was a good pace and we were given instructions of what to do if we lost members of the group in this busy city. Our guide gave us extra time as she said that our group were very nice. We covered a large part of the city and we were then able to return later to places of interest that we saw along the way. We would recommend this tour

Great way to experience Amsterdam. Yes,it can be a little crazy riding a bike in Amsterdam. And you should definitely not take the city tour if you are new to bike riding (as our guide told us, this is not a city where you want to learn how to ride a bike). But if you're reasonably comfortable on a bike, and pay attention to your surroundings (mainly other bikes and the occasional car), there is not better way to get around the city and experience its neighborhoods. We had an excellent guide -- Mattias -- who provided just the right mix of history and contemporary observations.Our bikes were in excellent condition, and even had saddle bags for our water and other belongings. We were blessed with excellent weather, which certainly enhanced the experience, but I imagine a little rain wouldn't be a bother.

What an amazing bike tour!. We had the pleasure of doing a private bike tour with Pete. The tour took us through the countryside and we got to discover a side of Amsterdam away from the touristy areas. We got a highly tailored experience with our party of 4. Our guide Pete was super knowledgeable and took us to a farm, a windmill brewery, and showed us a variety of cool things in the countryside. I would highly recommend doing a tour with this company, even more so if you can spend a little extra to get the custom private experience. It really is worth it, as we saw another big tour group behind us going a bit slower, probably having to miss some of the sites. The countryside tour is neat if you want to see a different side of Amsterdam that isn't really advertised. 30 minutes out of the city you'll see some of the most beautiful fields, and learn about farmers and the flow of water into the city. Thank you Pete and Mike's bikes.

Country tour - 4 hours. Our tour consisted of a group of 14 and we were led by a wonderful tour guide Karl, who was fantastic but had really bad jokes... only joking. But to his his credit he didn't lose anyone. This is a great tour, very easy riding and takes in a lovely part of the Amsterdam countryside. Would definately recommend this as a must do in Amsterdam. Thanks. Trev & Sue Melbourne Australia

Countryside ride . Mike's Bikes is a well run operation. They are efficient at getting you equipped, informed of the ride and matching you up with bike that fits.Best of all they do it making you laugh and feel at ease.The ride isn't hard but I wouldn't take anyone less than 12 or with little biking experience.You see so much of Amsterdam and the surrounding area all the while like feeling like a local as the city is so bike centric. The windmill, cheese and wooden shoe making are a bonus to a great ride.Pack a small lunch and bring water you'll get a chance to eat. The guides are excellent and entertaining. I would recommend this company to any of my friends who like to ride.

Outstanding. It was outstanding, and it poured rain on us. I'm certain our guide was Daniel, and he provided our family an excellent learning experience. They have great quality bikes, rain gear and anything else you require. They have water and other supplies at their shop. I wouldn't even consider another guided tour because these guys did an amazing job. Thank you very much for a great morning.

Saturday Night HIgh. I did this mini bike tour with my three grown children on a Saturday night at 4....and it was more fun than I imagined. They provided very good precautions and we really did get to see all of the highlights. The city was absolutely chock a block with tourists and citizens so we got a good feel for the city. It was a highlight of our stay. So much fun!

We like Girl Mike!. There are 2 Mikes, the owner (male) and the guide (female), we had the good fortune to go on a 3 hour tour with Girl Mike, and it was great! She has great knowledge of Amsterdam and knows how to share it! Great fun to ride with, and very educational.We also rented our bikes there for the weekend, great bikes very good to ride on!

Great day. Our guide Karl was funny and very informative. We did the countryside tour on an incredibly wet August day and the weather did not take from his enthusiasm. Would recommend Mike's Bikes tours to everyone!

Best bike tour ever!. These guys are so nice! the tour is really beautiful, and the guide guys are extremely nice and tell you all the story around amsterdam. The guy who looks like jesus is so funny and very helpful! Definitely doing the bike tour AGAIN when going back to amsterdam!

Female Mike was Ace. We booked a city tour with Mike's Bikes after reading the good reviews from here & were definitely not disappointed. There was a large group of us who were split into 3 smaller groups, each with a different tour guide. We got "Female Mike" as they call her, and she was excellent! She was qwerky, witty & had excellent knowledge of the City, being a local and all. She took us to all her favourite spots & not through Vondelpark like other tours, due to the time restraints. Along the way she gave informative talks about all the landmarks in the region & a brief history of them too. Amsterdam can be quite an intimidating place to cycle, but she made it extremely comfortable for us. At the end of the tour we were taken to a nice little pub where we could get a drink from, after the not-so-tiring bike tour. We hired bikes ourselves from Mike's Bikes (with discount) the next day to do some more exploring. Definitely recommend!

Countryside bike tour - a great afternoon!. My two teenagers and I rode through the countryside with Girl Mike and thoroughly enjoyed the ride, the scenery and the commentary provided by our guide. The first part of the ride goes through part of the city. I never felt unsafe, but I certainly was glad that my children were paying attention to what was going on - the cars, the other bikes, the moped riders. There was a lot to process while keeping up with the group. We got out of the city and on a lovely path through the polders to see windmills, wildlife, and beautiful houses. Mike's Bikes suggests that you bring a lunch and water. Heed this advice! When you arrive at the cheesemaker/clog maker's house, you will definitely be in need of something to eat. We didn't buy anything at the souvenir stop, but it was interesting to hear about making the cheese and the clogs. The quirky gentleman who gives the tour is apparently one of only three clogmakers still left in the Netherlands.Girl Mike was fantastic. She loves Amsterdam and has funny story to impart to the group along the way. There was a bit of history as well, but not too much. She was quite careful to make sure no one was being left behind. That having been said, you do need to be ready to ride against the wind and be very comfortable on a bike to do this trip. It was a great way to spend time in Amsterdam - highly recommend.

Great day out! . My husband and I did the countryside bike tour! Our guide was hilarious and very well informed. The sites were great and the pace of riding was ideal. Overall great value for money and would highly recommend the tour.

Cannot be missed, excellent.. I did the countryside tour today with Sam and I am writing the review now to make sure it's all fresh in my head! Such an amazing guy, and all the team there are fantastic. Not only do they have an incredible knowledge of The Netherlands as a whole, they are also full of practical knowledge about how not to get hurt on a bicycle in Amsterdam. It's not a strenuous cycle at all, but it is long, so don't try lining something up to close afterwards. You'll see so much of the city, as well as a windmill on the way out to the highlight of the trip; the cheese farm. The farmer is eccentric and hilarious, and the cheese is devine. He'll show you how he makes the cheese, how he makes the Dutch clogs, and you'll also see the cows who begin the whole process. There is also a wonderful gift shop with cheese and plenty of lovely trinkets and collectibles for friends and family. You'll then cycle on to the forest, and also into Vondelpark. On your way back to the bike shop you'll take a different route into the city and pass the Reijksmuseum, and the I AMSTERDAM sign.This tour was absolutely without a doubt the highlight of my trip, it was so informative and there is so much to see on it. It's unbelievably good value. I write this review from the bar of my hostel in my Mike's Bike Tour tank top, which I bought with my 15% off discount card that every biker receives at the end of the trip!

The Colonel is a great leader!. Did the city tour one day and country tour the next with Sander (a.k.a. the Colonel) both days. He was a great guide who mixed in lots of information with good stories and humor. He looked after everyone in the group so well and was a pleasure to hang out with. Even joined us for a few beers on a patio after the second day. The city tour covered a lot of ground with several stops learning about the neighbourhoods we were seeing. The country tour involved visiting a nutty farmer who made delish cheese and wooden clog shoes. The ride along the Amstel river was great as was the forest ride. If you take a tour ask for Sander. You won't be disappointed.

Funny Tour Guides! . As Amsterdam is the city of bikes, what better to see the city than on bikes. Don't let them scare you at the beginning of the tour, it is a great time. You get to see many sites throughout the city. Bikes dominate the roads there! Well worth doing, just remember that locals hate (and we did after doing a cycling tour!) tourists on bikes so you have to be well aware.

Awesome must do . This bike rental was super awesome! Really good prices and really nice staff! The bikes were light and easy to ride! Staff was very helpful gave us some really cool spots to check out like vondell park and the windmill brewery super awesome must sees! We rode the whole innet city in 3-4 hours with some breaks. You must rent bikes from here super awesome!

amazing service and wonderful bikes. amazing service and wonderful bikes.We took the bike tour during a 2 days stay in Amsterdam where wanted to make the most of every minute. The bike tour and in particular our guide was brilliant. He was very helful and saved us both money and time !

Fantastic. Our tour guide Daniel was very informative and had a good sense of humour. Our 3 children did this tour, approx. 28k's, and found it relatively easy. (Aged 12 ,14 & 16). They have a reasonable level of fitness. The pace was steady and we got to see a lot of the lovely country side (we did the countryside tour). Would thoroughly recommend this. We made a mistake and booked the wrong day but the staff were very accommodating in changing this for us.

Mike's Bikes - fantastic 3 hour ish tour. Took the 3 hour Amsterdam cycle tour - 2 adults and 1 teenager. Fantastic bikes, great guide (Diago) and amazing route. Saw loads of Amsterdam - highlights being Jordaan, Vodelpark, windmill / brewery - but all good. Great thing to do and highly recommended.

Bike ride through the country side. Started in Amsterdam and rode out to the country side. Viewed a windmill. Stopped at a Dairy/Cheese making farm, where clogs are made also. Able to view the country side first hand.

Unfassbar gute Tour. "Having been to Amsterdam and not coming back won't happen. It's like eating one peanut."
--Jeff
Guter Mann, super Tour. Nächstes Mal wieder!

Perfect for our stay in Amsterdam !. The staff is very warm and nice. We appreciated the explanations and the adaptability.
A seat had been stolen on our bike and Mike's replaced it immediately without fee. Do not hesitate!

Lovely trip. I too my 14 year old son on the countryside tour. The weather held out but we had been given rain gear in case of showers. The bikes were in good condition. The trip lasted about 4 and a half hours. We went with Sam who was lovely, funay and kept control. My only criticism would be that the group seemed large. There were 16 of us. Cheese and clog factory was interesting and entertaining. There was no hard sell to buy the wares on offer. Next time I would hire bikes and do the same but only because I've done this trip first! Great way to see lots if short on time.

Girl Mike is an excellent tour leader. We saw the spiky hair, false eyelashes, biker boots, and wondered what we had let ourselves in for; but from the moment Girl Mike introduced herself, we had the best tour we could imagine. She was an informative and observant leader and her tour of the city that she clearly loves was outstanding. She is funny, knowledgeable, considerate, entertaining and we thoroughly recommend her as a guide.

Countryside Tour. We took the Countryside Tour and it was amazing. I took my three kids (ages 10, 15, 17), and while we are all competent bikers, we do not usually bike this far but we found the tour very manageable. The countryside was absolutely beautiful and we enjoyed the tour of the cheese farm.The only reason I'm giving this tour a 4 instead of a 5 is because of our tour guide. There were several guides, and our group got stuck with the nasty Australian whose name I don't recall. There were other tour guides who seemed much nicer. Within 5 minutes of leaving the bike store, our guide was scolding a woman in our group for not keeping up. Instead of asking if her bike was ok, he remarked, "Do you not see the gap between you and the bike in front of you?" and then "Do you not drive?" My 10 year old was the only child in the group. She had no problems keeping up, but the city biking intimidated her. At the beginning, our guide suggested that she stay up close with him, which I thought was a good idea, but after the first five minutes of the tour he ignored her and she was unable to push to the front of the line. She easily kept up with the group, but there were times at the beginning and end of the tour (when we were leaving and then re-entering the city) when she was confused about whether to follow the group or follow the traffic signal during road crossings. She knew that our guide would be angry if we missed the light, but some crossings required a single file and there was no way we would all make it within one light cycle. This created an unsafe situation. On the way back into the city, our guide barely looked back or even paused at lights to see if we had all made it through. Of course he was charming enough when requesting a tip at the end of the ride.I would still recommend this tour and we were able to ignore our guide and have a wonderful time.

Exciting countryside bike ride!. We finished off our European vacation with a countryside bike tour with Mikes Bikes! We had a great time!! Our tour guide was awesome and knowledgable about each silly question we asked. We enjoyed getting to experience the countryside of Amsterdam and LOVED the farmer and the tour of the cheese and clogs. The farmer was hilarious and his family was very welcoming. We got to try (and buy) some amazing cheese and clogs! We each took home some souvenirs and raved about the amazing time we had. Highly recommend Mikes Bikes!

Mike's Bike - Amsterdam mini City tour. Fabulous tour of the city. Tour guide was very knowledgeable and an expert at navigating traffic and getting us through the crowds! Great overview of Amsterdam and a good place to start your visit. I would highly recommend this bike tour.

Fantastic Countryside Bike Tour. My husband and I absolutely loved our bike tour. From the get go, the staff in the shop were friendly and accommodating. We got given our bikes (easy and comfortable to ride) and headed off without any fuss or hassle. Our guide (Daniel) was hilarious. Great, informative knowledge of the city and sights and very patient with all cyclists- but with a charm and sense of humour that added to the relaxed atmosphere of the trip. It was one of our favourite bits of our 4 day stay in Amsterdam and would highly recommend. The farm is fun and a nice lunch spot and its a lovely day to see a bit more of beautiful Amsterdam. The trip lasted the full 4 hours (maybe a bit longer)- was great fun and not too strenuous at all. Really really super.

Gorgeous Countryside Tour!. My partner and I went on a countryside tour which took us through the city and out to the countryside and we visited one of the three remaining windmills left in Amsterdam which is absolutely beautiful :) we then went to a little farm where we were run through the family's cheese making business and their clog making business which was really interesting and enjoyable! This is a fantastic day out our tour guide Sam "Amstersam" is fantastic, he was funny and really knowledgeable! Learnt quite a lot on the tour and we both just really enjoyed the atmosphere created by the tour! Thanks heaps if we are back in Amsterdam we will try one of your other tours. I would definitely recommend this for anyone wanting to see a different side of Amsterdam!

Great tour. A friend and I booked their bike city tour and it was really fun. I hadn't cycled for a very very long time, but they were very helpful and patient. We were given a poncho cause it was kind of raining, which I thought was nice of them.Daniel was our guide, and he was quite funny and knowledgeable. He took us to a pub after couple of hours cycling, which had nice beers. We really enjoyed the tour and we'd definitely recommend it!

Amazing Countryside Bike Tour. Took the country bike tour on a Saturday which included a stop at a cheese farm where they made clogs. The tour started a little disorganized as groups were assigned. But once we got that squared away, our guide, Karl with a K (what a potty mouth...I loved it) did an amazing job keeping our small group together and very informed. This bike tour was actually my favorite activity of my trip. Bikes were in very good conditions as well. If you do this tour, try to get Karl as your guide. He was hilarious!

Great countryside bike ride. Loved the bike ride and our guide Pete was great and shared interesting information about the sites we visited. Would be five stars but we stopped at a cheese and clog factory and the guide for the clogs was bizarre at best and inappropriate (too much time spent there). Otherwise great and would definitely recommend for tours.

The best way to see Amsterdam - on bike!. We did the 3-hour city bike tour and it was fantastic. Best way to get a sense of this amazing city. Our tour guide Daniel was very friendly, knowledgeable, and funny. He gave us a great mix of history, culture, stories, and insight into the Dutch mindset. Very comfortable Townie bikes with saddlebags to store your things as you ride.
Great tour with Jeff. Great way to see the city! Comfortable bikes, and even with a sudden downpour the tour was good fun. Thanks Jeff!

Nice tour of the city, limited info. This was a great way to see a lot of Amsterdam and partake in their typical form of transportation. Bikes were very comfortable, come with a saddle bag for storage, and a bell. They do not provide helmets. Our guide, Diego, did a nice job keeping the group together and showing the city. However, his explanations seemed rushed and unenthusiastic. Maybe he was just having an off day. We stopped at a cool bar with a "beach" near the end of the tour for a drink/ break. Advice: bring water (or you can buy it in the shop where the tour starts)

Excellent & an easy paced bike tour .... We took the 3 hour city bike tour in Amsterdam and it was a great way to get introduced to the city. The bikes were very comfortable and our guide was excellent. During the tour, we made several short stops during which the guide would give us information about the places. We really enjoyed the tour and would recommend it to those visiting Amsterdam - it's a great way to get oriented to the city.

fantastic. Jeff (Geoff, not sure the spelling of his name) was a fantastic guide, and we loved the countryside tour. It was the perfect balance of seeing a little bit of the streets of Amsterdam along with the countryside just outside the city. The windmill, farms, and the parks we saw were amazing to see. I would 100% recommend this tour to anyone, and if you can try and get Geoff/Jeff as your guide.

Must do in Amsterdam. This 4 hour bicycle tour of the countryside was perfect for seeing and learning more of Amsterdam and escaping the hustle and bustle. I found the pace to be leisurely, but not too slow. I thought the amount of stops was perfect - enough to have a rest and be informed about the area stopped in, as well as just being able to enjoy cycling in the country side.Big thanks to our guide, Daniel. I felt well looked after, especially whilst navigating through the city. He delivered facts about Amsterdam in an interesting way without overloading my brain, he also introduced me to Dutch humour :p

Depends On Your Tour Guide. I used Mike's Bike to tour the city. This seemed like a wonderful way to see Amsterdam, and it was worth it to explore the city on bikes. However, most of the time was spent biking with little explanations on what we were passing by. Plus our tour guide was very rude and disrespectful in his use of language, which was a big turn off. I guess with a different tour guide it could have possibly been better.

Country bike tour. 4 hours seems like a long time for 15 mile bike tour, but along the way we took time to regroup, and no-one felt left behind in our group of 12 cyclists. Interesting history along the way also. Daniel was our tour guide and did an excellent job keeping us together and engaged.

Good place for tours and rentals. We rented bikes for our family and took a tour with the company as well. We rented our bikes from the other location, which was fine except they didn't have small bikes for children. We ended up with slightly larger bikes for the kids, which turned out just fine. Cycling is really the best way to get around the city - we really never used our tram passes. As for the tour, we took the one through the Countryside, which I would recommend. The ride along the Amstel was lovely, and visiting the cheesemaker was something we all enjoyed. Would recommend.

My highlight of Amsterdam!. Booked on a recommendation of 2 friends of ours, my girlfriend and I were not left disappointed!Our tour was led by Jeff (Geoff?!), a fantastic, knowledgeable, entertaining chap who was in his element! Leading the bike ride whilst showering us with bubbles(!), he took us through the streets of Amsterdam at a perfect pace, stopping at appropriate intervals for a rest and to fill us in on interesting stories and some history.The tour lasted around 3hrs with a stop at a pub at the end; a cracking little place by a swing bridge we would never had found were it not for the tour. The bikes were it top condition too, all with their own individual traits; my girlfriend had Winnie the Pooh, complete with bell!This tour is ideal on your first trip to Amsterdam, your first day if possible, as you see all the sights and get a real understanding of the city and it's layout. If I were to visit again I would almost certainly go on Mike's Bike Tours again!
Best bike tour ever. Jeff was awesome as a guide, good mix of humor and fact. Gideon at the shop also provided great insight on other things to do in the city.
Good way to see the city. We (a group of 4) took the 3 hour afternoon city tour of Amsterdam. Great way to see the city. Not a difficult ride. Good overview of the city.
Jeff was awesome. A must do whilst in Amsterdam, best value for money. Jeff was an awesome tour guide filled with knowledge and hilarious facts!

A Great Experience. The bikes are in great condition. Our guide, Jeff, was funny and knowledgeable about the city. He was attentive to our safety and made sure everyone had a great time. The tour through the city was beautiful, fun, and informative. We traveled in a group of 9 bikers. This group size allowed everyone on the tour to get to know each other. Near the end of the tour, we stopped for a beer and made friends with the our tour mates over a drink, while taking in a wonderful view. If you are traveling through Amsterdam, a bike tour with Mike's is a must!

Passengers loved it.. I work for a travel company that takes young people around Europe, and we use Mikes bikes regularly. Passengers always have the best time on their tours. Recently we had Daniel and he was fantastic. Super friendly and warm with all the passengers and also really informative and engaging. Thanks guys!!!

4 hour bike ride with windmill, cheese & clog factory. What a fantastic trip. Not sure what we expected, but exceeded our expectations. The guide was brilliant, kept the large group well informed and safe in the parts of the town we had to cycle through and was informative. Brilliant value for money and a great way to see the outskirts of Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend. Make sure you allow enough time to get to Mike's Bikes, we underestimated and were 10 minutes late, so allow enough time as it is a good 10-15 minute walk from central station. 10/10

Lots of fun!. This was a great way to see the country side of Amsterdam and also some of the city.
Even though bike riding around the city seems like the scariest thing ever, it wasn't. Our guide Daniel was very helpful and funny too. Highly recommend any of these tours!

Awesome tour. I joined the tour solo as I was in Amsterdam on a business trip and had an extra day. My tour guide was Girl Mike and she was amazing. The tour itself of the clog and cheese factory were a great yet touristy attraction, but Girl Mike, with her upbeat personality was great at showing us some bike paths outside of the city and telling us some interesting facts about Amsterdam. I am a huge fan of Amsterdam, but she def made me fall in love with this city even more. Thanks Mikes Bikes ToursMartine, Vancouver Canada

Definitely recommend the country tour with Karl!. Such a fun tour, would definitely recommend! Karl was an excellent guide, very engaging, funny and knowledgeable. It was a great way to see a bit of the country and really get a chance to enjoy the surrounding areas. The bikes are in great condition and very easy to use. Also, it is a great deal for about $30, remember to pack a lunch!

So much fun!! . We did a bike tour with Diego for my cousins hen do and it was so much fun. Ideal way to see the city and Diego was an amazing guide, taking us on a bar crawl of the city while amusing our rather raucous group along the way. Definitely worth doing as the tour provides a safe route of the city. Would definitely visit again!

Jeff was awesome!!!! :-). Amsterdam by bike is probably the most enjoyable way to discover the city - Jeff supplied us with a lot of interesting bits and Bytes - not the standard "this church was built in ..." information, u forget by turning round the next corner!We really had fun and can recommend this tour without limitation!THANKS JEFF

Great way to see Amsterdam. Mikes Bike Tours is a great way to see the sights and streets of the city. The tour guides speak English and have great knowledge of history and culture... including the quirky stuff that is unique to Amsterdam. You must be reasonably confident on a bike however.

Disappointing Experience. I have been on this tour multiple times, and was really disappointed this time around. But I think it had most to do with our guide Diego. He went too fast (many times leaving the group behind as he crossed streets), he did not provide much information to the areas we were seeing, and was genuinely not friendly. If you do take this tour, ask for another guide- it will ruin the experience.
Fantastic tour!. We did the shorter 1.5hr tour with Daniel and he was fantastic! Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a quick but through feel for the city

Very thorough and highly recommended tour of Amsterdam and the countryside. Our family of 5 (3 adults, 1 teen, 1 ten-year-old) took a 4-5 hour private tour with the female Mike. She looked like a rock star(!) but was very sweet, made sure we were all safe, and gave us a lot of historical information about the city. We biked through the city streets into the countryside to see a windmill and a farm where they make cheese and wooden clogs. It was very interesting and the cheese was delicious! Then we biked through a beautiful park, had a nice lunch, and returned to the city. This bike tour was a highlight of our trip!! We felt like the locals, many of whom bike for transport. You need to be a decent bike rider and be able to bike many miles to participate in the tour. The biking is not difficult and the bikes are easy to use,but kids under 10 and those who are elderly will not have the stamina to keep up. Highly recommended!!

Incredible Adventure!. We had the best time! Mike's Bikes is the way to see Amsterdam. My cousin and I did the tour through the city and had the most incredible time. Our guide, MT, had the perfect mix of historical facts as well as relevant fun, entertaining information. I highly recommend this tour to anyone!!

Best bike tour in Amsterdam! . After already being on another company's bike tour while in Amsterdam (and being severely dissapointed) we decided to do mikes bikes because we had already done a previous tour with these guys in Munich. We were not dissapointed!! Jeff (Canadian tour guide & Amsterdam local) was fantastic! He gave us some seriously interesting history, while adding in random cool facts. He made it so interesting & he was also funny. I highly recommend this tour because not only do you get a awesome quick view of the city within 3 hours, you will have a laugh & learn a lot. Jeff was also able to give recommendations on good places to go out & eat. We had a great time!!

Well recommended.. My partner and myself decided to rent bikes while in Amsterdam, Mikes bikes was on one of our many searches and I am happy to say that we made the right choice.
