The bikes were well maintained and the staff in the shop were really helpful and friendly. The price was 10 euros each for the day. Each bike comes with 2 locks and keys and a bag attached to the front to pop any bits in that you may need.I would highly recommend this place if you want bikes that do not have a hire name emblazoned all over them too (as the locals don't realise you are tourists when you cut them up ha ha).Just remember to drive on the wrong side and try to avoid the tram tracks. ha ha.x

What a fantastic way to see the city of Amsterdam!. I wanted to do something fun and unique as a way to see Amsterdam. My wife and twin 13 year olds took a 3 hour tour with Mikes Bikes. What a great choice. We got to see the entire city as everyone in Amsterdam sees it...by bike. The tour guide was born and raised in Amsterdam, and was very knowledgeable. Amsterdam is very flat, so even though we rode almost 10 miles, I wouldn't call it strenuous Our group that we were in was about 14 people, so manageable when we would stop to listen to the guide. I would highly recommend this tour. I was a tad apprehensive about having our 13 year olds bike around the city. But is was pretty easy.Charlie C from Princeton NJ

Amazing Tour. You don't have to be in super shape to enjoy this ride!The view is amazing the whole way thorough the tour! We got to go to a windmill, cheese factory and see wooden shoes be made! It was both educational and fun.Be sure to bring some extra cash because you will want to buy the amazing cheese there! There are many different flavors and it is easy to travel with it back home! I recommend taking extra water and you do need to bring a lunch!

Loved it!!!. Believe everything they say on their website. It is a fabulous ride. The age limits for kids really do apply. The city cycling is not a place for the faint hearted. Lobed every minute if it. Took the country try tour with Pete. Fabulous for each and everyone one of our family of six. Watch the sun. Enjoy it. You do need a level of fitness. They are honest when the say this. It's not hard, but not a basic ride navigating the city and then enduring a good ride. Strongly recommended!!
Countryside Tour. Totally enjoyed it! Pete is an amazing guide, he really love sharing the city to the group. I will recommend to my friends and family.

Countryside tour. Really recommend this bike tour, but only if you're fit enough to cycle for 4 hours. Bring suntan lotion too as the cycling around can get windy and you can easily catch the sun. You have to be sensible whilst cycling too as there are many hazards around, you will be cycling in the busy city centre too.

City tour. I knew mike's bikes from Munich (fabulous) and this tour was different but still great. Daniel was so knowledgable and took great pains to talk to everyone. Don't worry about being unfit, it's an urban area so you're rarely riding for a lengthy time. We managed to get a visit to vondel park which was lovely. Biking around gives being in Amsterdam a local flavour and I think everyone should do it.

What an awful tour guide. My family and I booked their leisure country tour, the guide announced at the beginning of the tour that if you are going to slow us down better not come, then he went on with a very rude time to list other issues that might slow him down, not the tour, him, needless to say some of us did not take the tour and found his tone and instruction offensive! There are nicer ways to give instructions! Chose another company, this is not worth the condescending tone of a leisurely day out

Great ride and fun city tour!. We had a fantastic ride even though it rained heavily for an hour. We dried off and kept going, had fun and saw a lot and learned a lot! Having said that: Do not do this ride of you cannot ride a bike and multitask with traffic at the same time! Traffic is bad: pedestrians, cars, bikes, all of them! If you can handle that, I highly recommend this city tour! Would have done the country tour the next day if the teenagers had gotten up earlier! Will definitely do next time!

Favorite part of our trip! . This was our favorite part of the trip! We did a countryside tour and arrived about 8 minutes early which allowed us to tag on the early tour with female Mike who was an excellent guide. Riding 30 in didn't feel like work at all- the views were beautiful and the land is so flat making this truly enjoyable! Plus, Mike had a lot of knowledge about the city being she's from their her entire life and we learned a lot. It was our favorite thing we did in Amsterdam! Plus they have a student rate!

Awesome half day trip. Went with a friend and had an amazing time! Biking in Amsterdam keeps you on your toes but once you're out in the country it's open rodes. Guides are funny - provide a bit of history. The cheese and shoe stop are fun

Very well led ride through Amsterdam City (tough to navigate) and Cheese farm etc in country. Beautiful weather - knowledgeable and personable guide Mike (the female Mike - much much more attractive!). Good company also on the trip ranging in age from 20 to 70 - give or take a bit.

Country Side Bike Tour. We had excellent weather on the Country Side Bike Tour. We loved getting to see the outside parts of Amsterdam and LOVED the cheese/clog farm visit. The only issue with our tour was the size, there were 15 people in our group, including a family of 8. The family was not able to keep up with the group and we had to frequently stop, which was annoying. It was the adults, not the kids, which needed frequent breaks. However, our tour guide was great and tried his best to accommodate everyone. Mike's Bikes was great and easy to use, just wish the group had been smaller to get through the streets of Amsterdam a little easier. I would recommend this tour! Great way to experience Amsterdam. You do not have to be a really experienced biker to do this, just able to actually ride a bike and be able to go 18 miles over 4 hours. You stop throughout the tour, but you should be able to bike at a decent pace for 30 to 45 minutes in between stops.
not wasted money. funny guides with lot of knowledge, the rote around/across Amsterdam takes about 4 h - really worth it!!!

Fun a. I had the chance to join the Countryside Tour 2 weeks ago. We had a regular Amsterdam weather (scattered showers and cloudy); however, the guide made sure we all enjoy the trip all the way. The tour goes around different sights at the countryside, then though the city (the itinerary may change) and is perfect to be your first trip when you arrived to this magical city.I will recommend this tour for families (with kids over 13 years old) and any other person willing to pedal for over 20 km.Good fun and workout at the same time!.

Great way to see the city. We did the city tour one day and the country tour the next day. Bikes are very comfortable and very professionally run. Guides are informative and entertaining. We loved both our tours and certainly would recommend anyone doing it if they never been to Amsterdam before. It is great to do what all the locals do - ride a bike!

City and Country Tours. Had such a good time on the city tour with Matthias, decided to do the country tour the next day, where we enjoyed Daniel's guidance. Enjoyed both tours despite windy weather and major events. Great way to get the feel of Amsterdam and nearby country side. Highly recommended, both guides were great.

Excellent day out. Don't be put off by the longer distance. You ride 15-20 minutes maximum at a time and the leaders are very conscious of abilities so don't rush. Daniel is a great guide and was entertaining throughout the day. We were lucky it didn't rain but it was still very windy. Warm weather clothes are recommended if the weather looks overcast. Overall a great experience and nice to get out of the city. Make sure to pack a small snack because you could get home after 4pm

Really great way to see Amsterdam. The county tour with our fantastic tour guide Daniel was brilliant. Don't be put off by the distances... It was a leisurely ride on flat terrain. Stopping at the cheese farm and seeing how wooden shoes are made was the highlight. Highly recommend!

city tour. Great guide, great insight on city, wish I had done it first day of our trip so I would have known what to visit, confortable bikes, they give you raingear, I left my backpack at the store but they give you purses to hang on bike for sweathers or waterbottles, after touring the city the last stop is at an open air cafe' very relaxing, highly recommend it (but not for young children as the car-bikes-trams traffic is very heavy).
Great country tour. We had a nice journey, although it was really rainy weather... But still no problem even while raining, because you are always get a raincoat.
Great fun . Easy bike ride with great host Girl Mike - she was fun and informative. Would have loved a map which showed just how far out we rode to cheese factory send windmill.

Cruising through the Countryside of Amsterdam !!!. Our family was back in Amsterdam for the day on July 5 and this time we booked the countryside tour with Mike's Bike Tours and once again we were NOT dissapointed! What a wonderful day we had!! Our tour guide was "Mikey" blond hair, dutch accent, and she was absolutely awesome. ( i hope i got your name right! ) She gave a wonderful informative, educational and entertaining bike tour throughout the countryside! Wow.. she was funny and led us safely around the roads, canals and bridges. We had some rainfall but it stopped quickly just as it had started. They provide rain ponchos, which kept us dry each time it came down. It was totally fine.According to my fitbit, we biked 18 miles and were out 4 3/4 hours. Best day ever again in Amsterdam! Worth every dollar, best way to see the countryside/outskirts of Amsterdam! Thank you Mikey for a wonderful day! (the family from Pennsyl U.S. & the tall guy that rode in the back... :)
excellent. Jeff did an outstanding job leading us on the city bike tour. This is the second time we have toured with Mike's Bike Tours!

Neat city, good way to see parts of it. We did two tours with the Amsterdam branch of Mike's, and were pretty satisfied with them. Our tour guides had a good attitude and were effective at shepherding whole groups of people through the unfamiliar Amsterdam bike system- as long as you know how to ride a bike, you'll be fine, they'll take care of you.Unless you're time-constrained, take the "country" tour and skip the "city" tour. In our city tour, guide Matthias knew the tour and was charming and funny, but the tour itself didn't give us a sense of direction- orientation to the city or much of a sense of where to visit next (though it was not a bad tour by any means, and if it's the one you can do, do it!). The country tour actually also spent a fair amount of time in the city and covered most of the important historical and landmark elements as the city tour (though our guide Mike lent her own distinctive air top the presentation)... plus you get to see a lot of distinctively Dutch stuff other than the architecture. A slight negative note on the management. While our guides were great, we had an initial bad time setting things up; we tried to book online, and first it said it failed, but then sent us a reservation (but didn't charge for it). Apparently they were full and this was a website glitch, we were told when we arrived; but not five minutes after we were booked into a later tour, we saw them tell someone else that additional positions might open up due to cancellations (and they did). Furthermore, we also booked our second tour on the spot but didn't get the multi-tour discount, nor were we even told about it until the end of the first tour (though to be fair, they did refund the discount after we pointed this out); and when we paid, we weren't given a receipt or ticket or any other indication we'd paid, other than being told we were "in the system". Which we were, in the end, no further snafu, but all of these interactions felt weird and a little off-putting.But back to the tours. Take the countryside tour if you can, and the city tour if you can't, and cycle your way round this incredibly unusual city.

Solid bike tour experience. . I did the mini city tour (because the regular one booked up too quick. Also beware of the online booking, I booked online and got a reservation number but didn't get charged, then when I emailed I was told the tour was now full. A little HR help might be in order in Amsterdam). Anyway, Mattias (sp?) was my guide and he was really fun. He was attentive making sure no one got left behind and made sure everyone was engaged in the experience. That being said, the city tour really just hits a bunch of the touristy areas that you could really see on any tour. If you only have two-ish hours though, still worth it. Two days later I did the Countryside tour. TOTALLY worth it. If you have the 4+ hours Take this tour. You see more of the city and get to see a windmill and a cheese farm. The areas of the city we went through really show more dimensions of the whole city and is a wicked cool trip. "Girl Mike" (Mika) was our guide and she had lots of fun things to say on the trip. Overall a really good time. I would have given 5/5 for both tours if not for my initial booking issue.

Awesome Rides. We did the country tour and mini city tour all in one day. Totally do-able. The location is super easy from the train station.Aaron was our country guide. Cool guy and very informative. Easy going California boy who clearly loves where he is now. Country is beautiful and such a peaceful ride. Loved the stop at the cheese farm. We did buy cheese and FYI it does not last quite as long as they tell you once you cut into it back home. It is really good though. LOVED the souvenir shop there. Got some good stuff. The family who runs it is great. Loved doing business with them. Bring lunch with you on the country tour. You have time to eat it at the farm.We did the mini city with Daniel. Totally different than Aaron, but cool just the same. And of course very knowledgable. The city is quite interesting and he gave us a lot of insight and history. The whole crew at Mikes Bikes is friendly and helpful.

Beautiful sights. We had a great time despite it raining at the end of our country tour. Some really great scenery included. The cheese and clog farm was fun and informative. The farmer is hilarious and speaks a plethora of different languages.Carl was our guide, he made the trip really easy going and fun. Would definitely recommend the country tour!
Bikes for rent. Bikes rental, excellent service, very friendly man who helped us. No charge for extra service. No waiting lines. Go there!

Bacon and Eggs . . . No Juicing!. We booked this tour based on feed back from trip advisor, we were not disappointed. The day was a bit gloomy weather wise, but apparently a typical summer day in Amsterdam.We arrived a little early to check on the booking and weather and were made to fell most comfortable. The large group was split into 3 x 11 people and all issued bikes, rain ponchos and instructions and we were off.Our tour guide Karl (With a K) was a real blast, funny and informative, like a good laugh and manage to take the pi$$ from people in an easy going way, sometimes with the filter off!With a large group, there would always be wide differences in abilities and this was handled well by Karl . . . Bit of an eye-opener on the interaction between cars, bikes and pedestrians in Amsterdam . . all getting along nicely.Cheese making and clog making (history) were included in the tour and at 4 hours long it was great value.Some confidence in riding a bike is needed, especially in the city areas but anyone could do this flat ride.Thanks for a great time and the cafe suggestion afterwards . . . Bakers and Roasters . . Kiwi tucker.
When in Amsterdam you must Bike!. This was a very fun tour with a great guide. It was great to see the city by pedal. We had a beautiful day and saw so much.

City Tour. I had a great experience on the city tour with Mathias. Not only was he enthusiastic about showing off the city to us, but he guided us safely through which is no easy task. I returned the next day to rent a bike for the day.

Ok Biking City Tour. Decided to take the city tour with this company as I used another company for the country tour before (which was really good by the way). Meeting location was a short walk from our hotel and directions were very easy to follow. Once we arrived to the place we were greeted by one of the tour guides although the atmosphere was a little informal - not clear who was responsible for what. It took them few minutes to get organized but after that, things flowed more smoothly (not sure if it was related to the size of the group). They ended up splitting the group in two (about 12-13 bikers each which was appropriate). They provided rain coats ("ponchos") just in case but no helmet (I really like that as I don't like using a helmet while biking but if you will like one, not sure they will offer it). Biking was easy (is almost 100% flat) and they will take you to areas in the city that you may not find on your own. The guide offered some history, which although good, not at the level of other tours that I have taken. All in all, tour is good but not the best that I have taken in Amsterdam.

Sightseeing . Gideon and Anna were very helpful! Hired bicycles for the day and went off on our own after being given advice from the above. Brilliant! You can certainly make the most of your time in Amsterdam on a bike!

The best bike tour!. Although raining, the bike tour led by our guide lady "Mike" was the best! She was very informative and fun. We enjoyed the visit when we stopped for beer and genever and her advice on eating locations and local customs.

Country Tour. You have to do the country tour! I loved seeing the clog and cheese factory. Our tour guide also let us pet sheep! Be sure to pack a hearty lunch and make sure to leave room for all the delicious cheese you can purchase at the farm! So fun!

Fun and Friendly View of the city. My husband and I took the country tour because I didn't feel like I really wanted to compete with the aggressive way cyclists ride in the city. I ride at home but on designated cycling paths so this was a change of pace. I highly recommend going on this ride; it gave us a feel for the city and the country. The whole team was friendly and funny and unpretentious. Aaron - the team leader of the trip made everyone feel comfortable and ready to ride. Our guide was Diego and i enjoyed his short little bits of info that he gave throughout our trip. Occasionally we would stop and he would explain something we were seeing or what our upcoming section of road would be like. We stopped at a windmill and a cheese factory and also a clog factory adjacent to the cheese factory. The clog maker is odd - let me warn you...just odd. And slightly creepy. But - the cheese next door is awesome. Diego gave us some guidelines on riding in the city which is helpful. The weather was gray and threatening rain the whole time so they handed out ponchos just in case. I think we ended up on the tour for about four hours which was perfect and we clearly got our money's worth.

Country tour. Our family took the countryside tour. You have to cycle through about 20 minutes of city first. This trip includes a visit to a farm. This farm makes cheese and wooden shoes. The farmer was very informative and entertaining.

Must do! Fun and Easy adventure :). If you can ride a bike, you MUST do this. It's a relatively painless ride even if you are out of shape (like me!). The views are great and you experience Amsterdam in a totally new way. I recommend the Countryside ride to the cheese/shoe factory.I cannot say enough good things about this company. They take great care of you and it is a lot of fun. This was my second time with Mike's Bikes and they have my business for life.Don't miss out on this! Do the countryside bike tour.

Super friendly staff. Great bike shop. We did a tour and rented bikes for 5 days. Tour was fun and informative. Rental bikes were very comfortable. We were very impressed with the store staff, even when the shop is filled to the brim with people (right before a tour leaves) they still give great personal service and are so friendly.

Friendly informative guide. I first did the country tour, which lasted a little over 3 hours. Super easy and pleasant ride (despite the typically cloudy weather), and sites exactly as described — you get to see a windmill, cute houseboats, and a cheese/wooden shoe factory. Daniel (the guide) is extremely charming and knowledgeable. I had so much fun, I came back the next day to rent a bike by myself. The rates are a steal, and Daniel gave awesome recommendations for easy places to ride. Was thankful for the local knowledge, especially as someone who isn't a huge biker! Would come back again, thanks!
Really awesome tour. I went on the country bike tour with Canadian Jeff as our guide and he really kept us all laughing the entire time, particularly with the insane cheese guy.

Amazing. Absolutely amazing, will definitely be back again if back in the area! Did the city tour and learnt so much about the city and the history of it, while having a great time biking around. Thanks heaps!
Countryside tour. Pete our guide was hilarious, we made good time after visiting the funny farmer so had time for a beer

Good tour of the city. Our tour of the city was lead by Diego, a pretty chilled out guy with great hair! We a a quick briefing before the tour on how to cycle safely through the city & to ensure everyone was proficient enough on bicycles & were then allocated our bikes. Each bike has its own name based on it's personality we're told & I was given Wolverine, was a bit gutted to miss out on Darth Vader, a matte black beast!Unforuntately, for most of the tour it was raining, Mikes bikes did offer everyone ponchos (which made you look like ET) we chose not to use them as we had waterproof jackets - wish we had gone for the ponchos as these can go over the handlebars & keep your legs dry too.The tour itself was pretty decent, managed to visit plenty of different places (Red light district, maritime museum, Vondelpark & skinny bridge to name a few). Each included a short stop with some information about the places. Diego was on good form & managed to get a few laughs with his commentary. Final stop was a nice brewery with a working windmill, got a chance to sample the beers & cheese.You don't need to bit particularly fit for the tour, but you must be able to cycle, the dutch take no prisoners!

Afternoon Ride. We did the 3 hour afternoon city tour - it was great, got to see all the main sites, frequent stops with a knowledgeable guide. Be prepared to get a little wet with the inevitable rain, but they did supply really good poncho's which kept off most of the rain

awesome service!. Gideon and Patrick at Mike's Bikes really took care of us this weekend. First they fitted us out with some great bikkes, then they took some time to help us map out a trip from the city center to the countryside - was really spectacular. Their help really made our day and I really appreciated the friendly/warm attitude!

Great concept but poor execution. Friendly staff and good equipment but country ride was more of a suburban jaunt and our guide Carl was downright rude. On a trip that was advertised as being family friendly, he was impatient with my 15 year old when she could not keep up, and then rudely blamed us when we missed a major turn despite the fact that he failed to wait to make sure we were with the group. There are lots of bike shops in Amsterdam - I'd shop around.

Country tour. We did the country tour, which has a brief ride through the city streets and then out into the country. We visited a farm, cheese maker and clog maker. The tour guide was good. The only complaint I have is that the tour is not limited to a certain number of bikers. There were 14 people on our tour, which was way too many people. It was amazing that our tour guide was able to keep us all together and ensuring people didn't get run over. If I was to do it again, I would search for a tour that limited bikers or do a private tour. This was still a very good experience.
Fantastic Tour!. Really enjoyable tour, informative and really easy to follow while navigating the Amsterdam traffic! Definitely a cool way to see the city and main sites!

Countryside tour. Sam our tour guide was excellent. Friendly and funny, he made the tour interesting, pointing out all the large and small quirks of Amsterdam. The farm was neat, and the cheese was quite excellent. We purchased a couple small wheels of cheese, and clogs, prices were very good. The biking pace was manageable for all ages. Highly recommend this tour.

Great way to see Amsterdam!. Ever since my husband and I took a bike tour in Copenhagen, we have been obsessed with seeing and learning about cities this way. This tour will not disappoint. Our local guide, Mathias, took us through the Red Light district, Museum Square, the Jordaan district, and much more. At every stop Mathias gave us a brief, but interesting history of what we were seeing. Near the end of our tour we rested at a quaint little bar (I wish I could remember the name) for refreshments. At the end of the tour my husband was given a beautiful XXX bike bell for being Mathias assistant; the man who rides at the rear of the pack to ensure all riders are accounted for. Next time we plan to take the countryside tour (we received a voucher for a discounted rate after we took the city tour; wish we had more time in Amsterdam to use it)! Mathias was very humorous and knowledgeable!

City to the country ride. Fun, easy ride with plenty of stops for any experience of rider. (You must know how to ride a bike of course.) Our tour started with two people that never learned to ride a bike@$!#/^&*, they were escorted back to the shop after one hit a pole. Guide was attentive, funny , and knowledgeable. A stop at a dairy farm for some fresh cheese.

City tour is a must!. My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed the city tour through Amsterdam! It was a great way to experience cycling through the bustling streets of the city whilst remaining safe. Our tour guide was very informative and told us about many of the major attractions in Amsterdam. The bikes are in good condition and the tour goes at a steady pace so people of all fitness levels are able to enjoy it. Also would love to do the country tour as well some day as we enjoyed it so much! Very much worth it if you are planning on cycling around the city!

Good at first, quickly turned terrible. My girlfriend and I did Mike's Bike Tour, and I enjoyed it. The tour was fast paced, so you need to be good on a bike while there is a lot of traffic around (people, cars, other bikes). Our tour guide was great and knowledgeable, she answered all of our questions very well. However, if you are not an experienced biker, this tour may be difficult for you since the tour guide kind of had a "tough love" approach when it came to making sure everyone was comfortable while riding. Okay, that is the good part.After the tour, we both rented 2 bikes. These were absolutely terrible, and very dangerous too. My girlfriend doesn't ride bikes much, so the whole time we rode, I was trying to explain to her how to switch gears and that it is so much easier once you can do this. After much frustration that she was having with her bike, I finally tried it for myself. When changing the gears, nothing happened. It felt as if it was on the highest gear in all of the gears, changing them did nothing. No wonder she was having such a hard time. This was just HER bike, mine was much worse.We were on the way back to the shop to return the bikes, about 2 miles out. I was in the middle of a busy intersection filled with cars and other bikers when, suddenly, the pedal completely flies off of the bike, This interfered with another bikers path and made them, as well as me and 2 others, fly off of our bikes. Luckily no one was hurt somehow, but that did not stop all of these locals from brutally cussing me out in Dutch, which I absolutely don't blame them for. After that encounter, I had to ride my girlfriends bike back to the shop to make it in time before they closed, while my girlfriend walked the bike back to the shop for 2 miles and met us there. She was furious, as anyone would be, and I was no exception.I kept my cool in the shop while explaining what had happened, and out of the 4 people that were involved in this conversation, only one asked if I was even okay after hearing that I wrecked in the middle of a busy intersection. They all acted extremely nonchalant, apologized a few times, then gave us HALF of our money back since "one bike was broken".My girlfriend and I were literally speechless, we had absolutely no words for this and just wanted to leave immediately after dealing with this incident and the ridiculous way that they handled it. We thought we would get AT LEAST a full refund, not to mention something ON TOP OF THAT. But a 50% refund and a few forced apologies is all we got. Loved the tour, but everything after that was simply awful.

Great way to learn about Amsterdam. A fantastic way to explore Amsterdam and surrounding areas and learn about the city that is more than the typical sex and drugs. Our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and gave us a tor of a farm windmill, gouda cheese farm and the canals. Highly recommend.

Mike's bike as a company is awesome, tour guide Vincent not so much. Let's start with the awesome part, I bought the countryside bike tour through their site for two people. However my friend was in an accident hence was not able to make it. Mike's bike was awesome enough to refund me for that as well as gave me a 5 euro discount refund for using my own bike.The countryside bike tour itself was quite underwhelming. Unfortunately our guide Vincent, was quite impatient hence we spent half of our time either waiting for the rest of the group to catch up or chasing down lost tourists from our group. He was also not very informative.We saw two attractions, a windmill where we just stopped to take pictures and the place of a cheese and wooden shoe maker. The latter was a lot of fun.The experience could have been made better if they are more strict with the quality of their tour guides as well as reducing the size of the tour group so that it would be easier to travel in a smaller group.I would suggest just renting a bike and doing the countryside ride on your own.
Fun Way to See Amsterdam. Had so much fun with Mike's Bike tour with my 2 daughters in their 20's.Great way to see the whole city, learn a little history and enjoy a beer at the end.

Fun and informative bike tour. Great bike tour led by Girl Mike, a funky and entertaining guide. We did this tour with our 15 year old daughter and we all loved it, claiming it to be one of our holiday highlights. The city tour took 3 hours including pre-tour talk and stop off for a beer/juice on the return leg. Tour took in Amsterdam's usual and not so usual hotspots with explanations from our guide, but what I really enjoyed was seeing snapshots of everyday life such as group in park doing Tai Chee, little children going to swimming lesson and kids playing footie. It was clearly explained that the bike trip is for confident cyclists and I would echo this. We dealt with city traffic and oblivious pedestrians so you need to have your wits about you. The ride itself was easy with frequent stops suitable for all fitness levels.
Awesome bike tour!. Top tour! Quality bikes, very knowledgeable, safe and fun. Recommend the countryside tour with Karl as a guide. Even managed to arrange excellent weather for us!! 😊

I felt like we saw the whole city. The good: We have used Mike's Bike Tours in Munich so of course we picked them when we came to Amsterdam. Daniel was our tour guide and he was excellent. He did a great job getting us all safely through a very busy city. He was also a knowledgeable and interesting tour guide. The city is so beautiful and by bike is the best way to see it.The OK: I do feel the check in staff at the front desk could be a little less gruff and my husbands back break on his bike was not up to par. The tour was already under way by the time we discovered this so we just carried on.To sum it up: I would still use Mike's Bike Tours again.

Saw amazing parts of Amsterdam!. Took the countryside tour with the cheese tasting and clog demonstration. Pete was our guide and he did a fabulous job! He took us to amazing parts of Amsterdam outside the city that we would have never found ourselves! He was also very knowledgable on history of Amsterdam. We had extra time at the end of our tour so he even took us to an awesome windmill brewery to end the trip. Great time! Definitely would recommend this tour!

Fantastic tour, one of the highlights of my trip. I went on the 3 hour city bike tour with Daniel in early May.The tour was very well organised, and safety was always kept in regard as the roads can be pretty unforgiving if you don't pay attention! The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, it felt like you'd known them a long time as soon as you arrived at the meeting point at the shop.Our guide Daniel was enthusiastic and charismatic, full of local knowledge and always happy to answer any questions we had.We saw the main sights of the city and I really learned a lot about the place as well as the locals and culture.Our trip ended with a stop at a local microbrewery in the city for a pint and a chat.We were blessed with blazing sunshine which made the trip even better.Highly recommended!

Great break from the city!. Early in May we spent a week in Amsterdam and on our next to last day there, we went on Mike's Bike countryside tour. It was just what the doctor ordered! Our guide was Stevan (ASK for Stevan!) and what a fun day it was - with the minor exception of the "...entertaining Dutch farmer at his cheese farm/clog factory", but we'll get into that later... The ride was mostly outside the city and the weather was beautiful. There's no difficult terrain and it's great for just about everyone. Now... about that cheese farm/clog factory. The cheese part was fine; didn't learn too much, but it was fine. The farmer, not so entertaining. It was fascinating to learn how they make inexpensive clogs quickly, but he was more of a distraction (a bit annoying) and took away from the overall experience. Certainly not enough to drop this trip anywhere below "very good". Especially with Stevan. He made up for anything on the negative side. Overall, I highly recommend this tour and especially if you've seen most of the highlights of Amsterdam already and need a day to get away!

Awesome cycle tour. Perhaps the most enjoyable cycle tour I've ever had of a city (and I've done a few)! Largely down to the fabulous tour guide (Daniel) who had a wonderful sense of humour and made the day fantastic. Another highlight was visiting one of the three remaining wooden shoe makers left in the Netherlands to see how they are made. The farmer and his family also make excellent gouda cheese. Highly recommend this tour!

Absolutely Amazing! . My girlfriend and I took this tour and it was great! The tour was great paced and the views were great! The tour guide that we had was super friendly and had a ton of great information. If you want a bike tour where you see the city, country, taste cheese and see windmills this is a can't miss!

Does Mike really exist?. Rented 2 bikes for 4 days. Sure they were a little beat up but they work. The lady in the store was extremely helpful and got us hooked-up with bikes as-quick-as. Great service.

Bike rental. We simply wanted to rent a couple of bikes for the day. The staff and dog were very friendly and helpful. The whole process only took a couple of minutes. The bike weren't flashy or brand new but were more than sufficient for a day around the city. Everything worked on them and rode well.
Great tour!. Fantastic tour! Very informative and picturesque. Our tour guy was Daniel and he was delightful! He also kept us safe and was very attentive. Totally recommend this tour!

Wow. Best way to experience Amsterdam. I have nothing but great things to say about Mike's Bike Tours! The staff and guides here are SO friendly. They're fun, but very professional. I was here three days in a row and got nothing but amazing service.I took the Countryside Tour with Vinny, which was a great way to get comfortable with biking in Amsterdam. They bring you to a Windmill and a cheese farm with the wackiest farmer ever. You get an opportunity to buy cheese, but you're not obligated. This tour brings you through tons of parks, and it's a really nice way to get out of the city. Although the tour is long, it goes at a very leisurely pace, so I'm sure that most people can keep up without getting tired. I also did the Mini tour, which is a short 2-hour tour through the city. The guide was so interesting and funny (shame I forgot his name), and had such great insights. The pace is pretty good, providing you can keep up in the city. There are lots of bridges and streets that you need to cross, so be aware. The bikes are well-maintained. Each bike has a basket in the front where you can put stuff. If you take their tours, they give you 7-gear bikes with handbrakes. Regular rental bikes are pedal-brake bikes, but work just as well. If there was ever a right way to do Amsterdam, it would be through Mike's Bike Tours. It was one of the highlights of my trip.

Outstanding ride and guide. We wanted to rent bikes in Ansterdam but were a bit hesitant doing it on our own. We found this tour through Viator and we were so impressed. Our guide Stef was awesome as he has lived there most of his life and gave us great info along the 25k/15 mile ride that took us outside the city along the Amstel River. We had a stop along the way at a working cheese farm. We were shown the process of cheese making and in addition the owner also makes handmade Dutch clogs. Great gift shop on site to taste and buy cheeses that are packaged for travel back to the US. Thanks for an awesome 4 hour tour Stef!!!!

Great trip.. We took the bike tour in the rain on our first day arriving in Amsterdam. It rained on and off the entire afternoon. Our guide was excellent and was adept at waiting for everyone. It was a bit crazy with the traffic and experienced local bikers but we had a blast none the less. My only concern was with the hazard that the ponchos played in having the hoods obstruct our vision at crucial moments. They can't be responsible for the rain, however, so it is what it is. The beer we purchased at the end was a welcome treat.

Country tour was awesome. Five of us took the country tour and would recommend to anyone. If you are worried about biking in the city it is easy (I am not an expert cyclist) as it is mostly away from traffic and you leave the city in about 20 minutes. There are a few stops at a windmill and Rembrandt statue, cheese and clog making farm, low lands, and largest park. You pass the Olympic stadium and bike through Vondelpark and museumplain on the way back to the start. The route is a circle so you don't repeat the same places on the way back.

Countryside Bike Tour was AMAZING!. The highlight of our Europe vacation, the countryside bike tour was a blast. We biked a little through the city before heading to the countryside where the views were all stunning, we were able to feed some animals, see windmills, and the trip to the farm with the cheese (tastes amazing) and clog factory tour was awesome and so enjoyable. It was truly one of the best experiences of Europe and we would recommend to anyone.
Out in the countryside. Great bike tour! Fun and scenic. It was safe for all ages and very reasonable. I would highly recommend.
A great tour. Fantastic guide and a really good tour, only criticism was that too much of the tour was spent in the cheese factory but that aside, well worth taking this trip

Experience Amasterdam!!. We booked a Mike's Bike countryside tour your yesterday as part of a hen weekend, and it was such good fun. A fantastic way to experience the city and country and Pete our guide was funny, entertaining and really knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend this to anyone coming to Amsterdam.Thank you!

Extraordinary guided tour!. We're 6 friends from Denmark - and we can't recommend the bicycle guided tour enough. A fantastic way to see the city, to get the funny, interesting and dark stories, and the concept of the guide giving their personal views as well doesn't get betterMany thanks to Mathias (might be incorrect spelled) and Mikes Bike tour from all of us

Perfect sightseeing . We visited Amsterdam as a family and decided to take the bikes for our sightseeing adventure throughout downtown, Vondelpark, Jordaan and NDSM-Dock! We were on our own and didn't take any of the offered tours. The Service at Mike's Bike Tours & Rentals was very friendly. They helped us adjusting the bikes and even supported us with hints of what to see and where to go! The bikes worked great and didn't look very touristy. So we had a little feeling of being undercover tourists! Whenever we will be back in Amsterdam we will book at Mike's again!

Experience Amsterdam like a local!. Booked a city bike tour ride (2-3 hours) but at the last moment changed it to the 4-5 hour countryside ride. So happy we changed our plans since we rode through the city anyway and were going by the sites we were going to visit anyway. Once we got on the country roads it was beautiful. You could see the non-city architecture as well as a working windmill. Got a better feel for the lay of the land. Also, stopped at a working farm where they make Gouda cheese and we were able to meet the cows :). Went inside for a funny and brief tour of how they actually make and store the cheese. Then a short (folksie) presentation on how they make their famous wooden clogs. The guy was funny and engaging and wore all the traditional gear to take you back in time. Then we continued our journey through the canals and parks and back through the city. Felt like a complete tour. Would highly recommend this tour and this company. Very easy to reserve and accommodating when we changed our plans. Easy bike ride as well. Just have to know how to ride a basic bike and follow the leader.

A great tour of Amsterdam!. Hidden away on a side street is Mike's Bike Tours. The building looks 300 years old. The tour of Amsterdam was exciting and not at all tiring. We were able to stop at a windmill brewery towards the end of the tour and had a local draft beer, a cheese plate and roasted meats. This is a must tour.

City Highlights and Countryside Tours. We went on both of the tours offered daily by Mikes Bikes. They were both excellent. The bikes are comfortable and the guide very knowledgeable about everything Dutch in Amsterdam. We feel we have gained a real insight into Amsterdam in a short period of time that would have been difficult otherwise. Daniel took us to many of the iconic buildings and gave us historical information about The Netherlands and its formation and the amazing dikes, canals and levels of the land.

City and Country tour. Fantastic! Would definitely recommend doing a mike's bike tour. We did the city bike tour and also the Country bike tour. Our city tour was with Daniel who was very mindful of making sure everyone kept up in the city, he was also very knowledgeable and very interesting to listen to. We also enjoyed our Country tour, more about seeing the beautiful and peaceful countryside as there weren't as many knowledge filled stops, it was cool to see an old windmill and see how they make cheese and clogs.

Biking Bliss. My husband Paul & I took the country tour with Daniel this week. We had the challenge of navigating the city traffic for a short time before heading out of the city. Daniel made sure we were safe and it was fun being amongst the locals. Once we were out of the city it was really relaxing and he stopped to explain the history of the windmill and some background on Amsterdam. Bikes were really comfy and not even a sore butt after 4 hours of riding. This should definitely be on your to do list while in Amsterdam! Michelle & Paul, Australia.

Great introduction to Amsterdam . We had booked the city tour as our first activity on arrival in Amsterdam and chose Mike's bike tours on the strength of their TA reviews. We were not disappointed!Our guide was Sam who was a funny and provocative (in a good way!) leader. As some other reviews mention, this is a tour that reflects the laid back approach of Amsterdam to issues like drugs and prostitution. It is not for the uptight or easily shocked.The laid back approach includes the brief instructions at the start of the tour but they were all we needed. The shop had helmets but no one wears them in Amsterdam. The bikes were comfy and easy to ride. I had panniers for my backpack.Some people mention that they found cycling in Amsterdam difficult. As someone who commutes by bike in central London, I can assure you it is not! There are no Lycra clad warriors on racing bikes - everyone makes their way in a relaxed manner on old fashioned "sit up and beg" bikes.We were a group of 12 and Sam appointed one of the group to be a "tail gunner" to make sure we all stayed together. This worked well and we did not lose anyone. It took a bit of time to get used to the discipline of riding in a group but Sam was really attentive and looked after everyone.The tour was meant to take 3 hours but we were out for about 30 minutes longer. That was because Sam was so engaging and we had some really good discussions with him about Dutch attitudes to drugs and sex - perhaps not something you get with every tour guide but we felt we understood a lot more about the country as a result. It certainly corrected some misconceptions we had.It was a great start to the holiday and really helped us to get our bearings for the rest of the break - both in terms of the city's attitudes and its culture.
Marise. We did a 3 hr bike ride around the city.. Can thoroughly recommend it. I enjoyed it so much I'm booking a country side trip. Sam our tour guide was fun and knowledgable .We had a great time !

Bike City Tour. This place provide good rates for rental however I was disappointed with the quality of the City tour. 1) Too many people in the group, about 10 people which is really hard to manage in busy Amsterdam streets and having people with different level of skills in the group2) only 5,6 stops to provide some information about landmarksI think it would be a good idea for tour guide to have a uniform with a distinctive color so it would be easier to spot her in the busy Amsterdam streets.in general Amsterdam is not that big, so I would recommend just rent a bike and cruise around yourself.

Country tour. My husband and I took the country side tour in the beginning of May. We had beautiful weather, and we had a great time. It was one of the highlights of our trip. It was so nice to see the areas outside the downtown of the city. We did not take the city tour, but I think the country tour was a better choice for us because it's a little too hectic biking in the city traffic and Amsterdam is a fairly small city, so we were able to see most of the downtown on foot throughout our stay. I would highly recommend this tour!

City Bike Tour. My husband and I took the city bike tour on the first full day in Amsterdam. It was great! Our guide, Daniel, was terrific! He was very informative and gave us a real flavor of the city that he grew up in! He has a wonderful sense of humor. Daniel recommended a restaurant in the neighborhood where we were staying that tried out later in the week. It was great as well! All in all, a fun experience that we highly recommend!

Getting around and finding out about Amsterdam. Getting about on bikes with a tour guide was a great way to explore a new city. Mikes bikes were very affordable, knowledgeable and friendly. They spoke perfect English and we spent 4 hours touring all the best places. To top this we were given a discount card for any future tours or bike hire. Couldn't fault it but I would advise to book in advance because they are so good that they get booked up.

Beautiful countryside. We booked the countryside tour on a Sunday and we loved it! A great way to see the regions surrounding Amsterdam - we rode out of the canal centre along the Amstel, then into Amestelveen, Bosbaan and near around the Olympic stadium, through Vondelpark, museumplein and then back. I don't recall the exact route but we also stopped off at a windmill, and at a cheese farm. Well organised tour, and a very helpful tour guide who easily managed the big group of 18 people! Good for the average rider and a great day out especially on a sunny day. Highly recommended!

Brilliant bike tour of city. Went on the 3 hour bike tour of the city.Our tour guide was Marius - very informative and we got to see parts of Amsterdam you would not see yourself .Highly recommend mike bike tours .

If you are looking for something different to do.. Our guide was so informative, attentive to our needs, and comical. Truly an entertaining experience. He definitely made sure our experience was positive. Although Amsterdam is a "biking" city, to master the streets was challenging - our guide told us up front the rules of the road and our biking experience was not a challenge at all but very enjoyable (and a sense of accomplishment). We did the tour of the countryside, windmill, cheese making, ... It was an easy ride and anyone can do it (I'm 61 and in good health). We pretty much did all the typical touristy things in Amsterdam, so this tour was a nice addition for something to do on our last day. So glad we saw a different side of the area.

Great way to be introduced to Amsterdam. Probably the most efficient way to get around the city. With David, an excellent guide, we had two hours experiencing the various atmospheres of Amsterdam along with a handful of short stops for facts and history lessons. Recommended!

Countryside bike tour. We did the countryside bike tour with Mike's bikes. It was a great way to see some of the countryside and learn the local bike road rules! Our tour guide Sam was very knowledgable and what he didn't know, he just made up (which we wouldn't realize anyway). He was very good with our questions and with making sure everyone was safe. You don't need to be overly fit for the tour as it's an easy ride at an easy pace.

A tour around the countryside. Five lovely ladies biking around Amsterdam, our guide was fun and informative, the bike ride leisurely. A wonderful way to go sightseeing. Very well organised and a fabulous day out x
Countryside bike tour. We did the over 20km countryside bike tour with stops at a cheese maker/wooden shoe maker. Great way to see the land. Made getting on a bike in Amsterdam less scary!

Horrendous Weather, still fun . Went on a tour as part of a Busabout, the weather was horrendous with rain, wind and hail, however, Sam, our guide made the trip still worthwhile. Would be even better on a sunny day but still no complaints!

Second time, just as great!. I took a Mike's Bike Tour in 2010 and when we went back to Amsterdam last fall, I told my husband we must absolutely go again! We did the country tour which involves a scenic bike ride along the Amstel river and then a visit to a working cheese farm where we bought enough cheese for a year! Our bike tour guide was fantastic but I can't remember his name (english, late 30's early 40's). My husband said it was the highlight of his entire trip to Europe! We highly recommend!!!!

Do as the Dutch do.... This tour was the highlight of my time in Amsterdam. Our guide, Daniel, was extremely knowledgeable about the city and also very personable. He made sure to ride at a comfortable pace, always looking back to make sure everyone was keeping up. I saw and learned more about the city than I ever would have on my own, so it was well worth every cent!

Amsterdam city tour by bike.. The best way to see the city is by taking a bike tour. The young lady I believe may be called Nikki was absolutely brilliant. Looking after us from start to finish. The tour was over a couple of hours long and we stopped to view some amazing places of interest. She was very knowledgeable and answered all our question.Bikes were great too. Highly recommend this tour.Our only regret was we didn't take our camera which fits on our bike helmet to film the crazy bike traffic.

Mike's Bike Tours. This was the first thing we did when we arrived in Amsterdam and it was a great introduction to the city. The staff were very friendly. However, I would avoid taking children on this tour. During our instructions, the guide used profanity more than once. During the tour, we stopped in the red light district and received a very detailed description of how legalized prostitution works. This was fine; I realize it is part of the city's culture. However, as we moved on, we were asked to get off our bikes and then walked them alongside the windows where the prostitutes were working. We also lost 3 members of the group for quite some time.

A Toir City in Amsterdam. A must if you in Amsterdam. I think T (Italian girl) was our tour guide and she effortlessly showed us around the town and she was fun and informative. One can see most of the inner city attractions and Amsterdam has such good bike lanes that it makes for fun riding. The whole experience was very well organised from start to finish. A MUST !!!!!

Country Tour. Signed up for the Country Tour after being in the country 1 day and seeing the crazy bike traffic. The guide was funny and waited on us. Some got stuck far behind because of traffic on a couple occasions and he waited if they could see us or doubled back to find them. The guides insisted we have snacks. I balked at this bc I often bike long jaunts without a snack; however, they were right. I needed that snack after we arrived at the dairy farm bc the wind wore me out. Such a good time; AND they gave me a card for a percent off at their bike tour in Munich that is GOOD FOR LIFE. Fun time. Fun guide. Great deal.

What a trip!!. This was the best excursion we attended in Amsterdam. He had Aaron provide our group with a tour around the countryside- we went to windmills and a cheese farm and a couple additional stops were made to provide some information on the history of the area/buildings. The tour guide and farmer were absolutely hilariously and we had such a great time!! I highly recommend using this tour company!!

cool double bike. I took a double bike to hang around Amsterdam. I crossed also the canal on the ferry to reach the fantastic NDSM and ride until the Moulins area. Fantastic! Take care of the other bike riders....are crazy!

Such a good tour. Went on the city tour which was 3 hours long but we ended up being out over four hours due to all our questions.The bikes are superb to ride well maintained the staff are friendly and very knowledgeable. Of all the tours I have ever done this was my favorite.

An ace way to see the city and some of the surrounding countryside.. We enjoyed our city tour so much, we went back the next day for a Countryside tour. Bikes rule in Amsterdam- cycle lanes everywhere and its FLAT!!! This is an efficient friendly organisation. The guides are fun and knowledgeable. This is a fab way to get your bearings in the city, get some inside information and helpful tips for the rest of your stay.

Great people. Good tour . Some safety issues. An interesting tour and friendly, enthusiastic guide. We loved getting out of the city ..and getting some exercise!The group was 15 , including some inexperienced cyclists wobbling through the city initially. We lost 3 and later a further 2 people . A guide at the back as well as one at the front in high vis. Jackets would have made all the difference.
Amazing!. We enjoyed our city tour so much! It was very interesting and we really enjoyed biking around the city learning little bits of information about everything.

Biking around Amsterdam. Excellent service! They made sure that I was quite comfortable with the bike before I went out in the city. Took one of their bikes around amsterdam and had an absolute blast! One of the highlights of my trip

Karl was Brilliant. Me and friends did the country side tour with Karl. Informative but in no way dull - as many "guided tours" can be. Karl was hilarious and a brilliant Tour guide, as im sure all the guys are.
Thanks Again Mikes Bikes :)

A BRILLIANT 3 hour leisurely bike tour around the whole city.. No matter what your age providing you can ride a bike and stay on it this is a FUN way to see Amsterdam. The guys at Mikes are fantastic, jovial, informed local people who ensure you are there to enjoy yourself and have a safe well informed experience. I cannot recommend this enough just try and pick a dry day. If it is raining they still go but they do provide rain wear - ENJOY! I did and I'm 72.

countryside tour. Very bad experience. You always need to wait for someone from the group thatis getting lost. The tour guide checks evwry hour if someone gets lost and then the rest of the group needs to wait. Just a waste of time.

Great way to see the city . We did the city bike tour (about 13km) on the last day of our trip and just wished we'd done it on the first day! There was about 20 people in the group which sounds like a lot but it didn't seem like a problem. We did a loop of the city at an easy pace, stopping at various points of interest. Our guide Mateus (forgive me if that's not the right spelling!) was very knowledgeable and told us a great deal of interesting things about the city. The tour took in some interesting areas which we probably wouldn't have seen if we just hired bikes ourselves. The shop itself was really nice and sold lots of cool bike accessories, and all the staff were very friendly...we just wished we could have stayed an extra day and do the country tour too!

Country tour. The bike tour is enjoyable and relaxing, you get to cycle on the suburbs of Amsterdam along the canals and river. You get to see one of the remaining windmills, there is a gentleman that actually lives in the windmill. You got to a farm and see how the cheese is made this is a very brief talk, you then meet the clog maker who is an eccentric and jolly character who is great fun, he will definitely put a smile on your face. You can taste their cheese in the shop and try on some clogs. You then have the opportunity to eat a packed lunch that you may have brought with you as there is not a lunch stop on the tour. You get to ride into Amsterdam bos park and vondlepark before returning to the bike garage. Unfortunately you don't see any tulip fields around here.

Biking in the country. Did a four hour bike tour to the outskirts of Amsterdam to a place where the owners made cheese and wooden shoes. Seeing the outskirts of the city and some countryside from a bike was interesting. Even though route was flat, it seemed we were always riding into a wind. Tour from 11-3. Stop at factory allowed those who brought food and/or drink to eat. Not a suggestion from tour site and no water was provided nor recommended on tour site. That would be a good addition. Karl was a good tour guide.

Highlight of our family trip. Booked a private group tour as we were unsure about 'Red Light' area with children (girls aged 8 and 11) and lots of the general bike tours, found on-line were un-suitable for under 13s. Sam was a great guide. We did a fab cycle around the city and did indeed go into the red light area, albeit briefly. We all enjoyed our tour hugely. Recommended for families.

A ride exactly. As advertised. The ride was labeled as a ride into the countryside to see a windmill and a working cheese farm. Although completely touristic, Ihe ride was exactly that. When one of the riders became too tired to continue, the staff was completely professional about offering her various options on how to get back to town.

Great way to start your holiday. We learnt so much from this tour, really glad we made it (our ferry was very late). We were able to see all the landmarks we had planned on spending a day and a half getting around to each one in just three hours. The guide we had was really knowledgable of the history of Amsterdam and also the Netherlands.

A fun, informative tour!. Myself, husband and two kids (21,17) had a great time on the tour and would highly recommend. Safety was paramount and our guide Daniel was conscious of this at all times. Riding around Amsterdam is not for the faint hearted and was quite an experience. Daniel gave clear instructions on how to ride in the city - and made it clear that locals were not patient and would happily use a few expletives if you got in the way! We heard quite a few! Tour was informative and fun and ended up in a lovely bar serving some of the best beers - we returned that evening because it was so good! Highly recommend this company - bikes were amazing and I want one for home! Staff friendly and Daniel a great guide. Thank you!

Great tour!. What a great time my boyfriend and i had! We decided to do the city bike tour, my boyfriend being very skilled on a bicycle, me not so much, i was a little apprehensive, i had no reason to be! The staff in the shop were very welcoming and reassuring. We were given our safety brief which was both informative yet fun, given our bikes (i had a pink number named Elton John!) And off we went. Sam, our guide was great! We had a couple of girls in our group who, lets just say, would have preferred to have stayed in bed as they kept yawning at Sam and couldn't have been less interested! Rather than let them ruin the tour for the rest of us, Sam, using his banter and charm made light of it and carried on regardles - good for you! We had several stops on the 3 hour tour, museum square, Vondelpark, Anne Frank museum, red light district amongst others and culminating in a rather nice beer at the windmill brewery! Don't worry if you dont drink as they have a café next door selling soft drinks, coffee - and a rather nice apple tart! Sam made this tour for me, extremely knowledgeable and great fun. My boyfriend and i are planning to come back to Amsterdam later this year and will definitely be booking another tour!

Excellent cycling tour. We did the countryside cycling tour today. This is well organised and very friendly staff. Our guide was Karl. The tour starts in the city but soon gets to the quieter and safer areas along the Amstel. We stopped at a windmill and a farm. the cheeses at the farm we very tasty and there was a short explanation on the cheese making and wooden shoe making. There was time for those who brought their picnic lunch

Busy City Tour. Our guide was great and very knowledgeable. The tour was different than the one in Munich we took as Amsterdam is much more busy as far as traffic in a country with more bikes than people. We saw a lot of sights and went to a micro-brewery at a windmill which was on my list of sites to see any way and the place was great! We did go to the Red Light district and weed was discussed so think about bringing small children on this tour.

Great family activity whilst visiting Amsterdam. We did the Countryside Tour whilst in Amsterdam for a few days last week. I echo the other positive reviews. This is a fun activity, which is suitable for anyone who can ride a bike - as evidenced by the diverse make up of our group. The cycling is not tough - our children, aged 13 & 10, both coped well & enjoyed the tour. MB clearly know their business & are good at what they do. Our guide ( Sam ) was excellent and was a major factor in our enjoyment of the tour. Highly recommended.

Fantastic time in Amsterdam . Being part of a group of 30+, they split into three more manageable groups. I'm pretty sure it was the three hour city tour. It was such an awesome great epic way to spend three hours. I had the best time. One of the highlights of my 40+ days in Europe. If you book this BIKE tour and don't know how to ride a BIKE, then your just stupid. My guide was knowledgable and fun and enthusiastic. So thankyou Karl/Carl (not sure how you spell it)!!! I loved hearing about your travels! you were right, the burgers around the corner really are the best in the world. Hope to see you again!!!
Great way to see the city. We did the city Tour with Sam- it's a great way to orientate yourself with the city. We got to see a lot in 3 hours and had the rest of the day to explore ourselves

City Tour - great way to see Amsterdam on a time budget. Having used Trip Advisor comments to find a tour which suited me I was not disappointed. I only had a day so it was a good way to see more of the city and learn more. Mike our tour guide knew his stuff. The bikes are comfy and easy to use. The locals on their bicycles take a a bit of getting used to but just remember to look out everywhere for them! Would definitely use them again if I get back to Amsterdam.

Do both the city and countryside tour! . We did both the city and countryside tour and both were great! Tons of information and very enjoyable along the way. Buy a lunch on the corner of the road the bike shop is located on and your set to go. Both the tours really made our trip. Ideally, do them earlier on in your trip as you'll pick up tips on places to eat and drink along the way

Somewhat cheesy!. Firstly I want to say that the guide on our tour was lovely and friendly with plenty of local knowledge. Maybe we had conjured up a perception of what the countryside bike tour was going to be like, ie more rural, less touristy. The aspects that let it down for our family was firstly stopping for 15 minutes to take pictures of a windmill which is on a roundabout. Secondly the farm, which is 10 minutes cycle from the windmill and so obviously geared up for tourists. The owner/farmer has got his patter off to a fine art which is great if you have come from distant lands and know nothing of the european culture but not if you are british like us. There was nothing authentic about it and after tasting some slivers of cheese and showing us how clogs are made, we were then taken into the enormous gift shop, encouraging you to buy cheese, clogs and a whole variety of memorabilia. The cycle did improve after this and we ended up cycling back the via the Amstel forest and the vondelpark which was pleasant.

Countryside tour. Would highly recommend going on one of these tours. The guides our funny! Also going on a ride with a guide gave us more confidence to bike out in the countryside on our own later in our trip. The cheese factory they took us to was very cheesy (literally and figuratively), but still overall it's a great tour.

If you want to take a bike tour this is the company to choose.. We took the city tour on a cold and damp day. Not to worry waterproof ponchos were provided that keep you nice and dry. Mike led our tour and what a great way to put his history degree to great use. Mike provided us with a great tour of the city taking in all the sights. The tour ended with a drink in a lovely cafe and a chat with newly made friends. I would highly recommend Mike's Bike Tours.

Fun. Mike’s Bike Tours offers half-day tours around the canals in town, and a ride outside the city to see windmills and a cheese farm and Dutch clog factory (touristy, but fun). December through February, you have to book in advance (minimum 3 people).

Country cruise. Just completed the country bike tour with Aaron. What a fantastic tour! The ride was not too strenuous and aaron our guide made sure everyone kept up! The farm stop was wonderful, the farmer was so lovely and funny. Be sure to pack a snack or lunch. thanks for a great final day in Amsterdam!

Bikes, the Dutch Countryside, and Cheese. We had a great tour with Aaron at Mike's Bikes. We were provided ponchos in case of rain, and we departed their bike shop, biked through the city, and out to the countryside. Our first stop was a windmill then we proceeded to Rembrandt Hoeve Cheese Farm and Clog Factory where we got to meet the happy cows, learn about cheese production and learn about clog manufacturing. Beyond the cheese factory, we went to a nature reserve filled with different types of birds. Someone had an asthma attack in the middle of the tour so we were delayed a bit. Most of us grabbed a beer while our guide helped the young woman and waited for the ambulance. I was very impressed with how he handled the situation, and all of the guests on the tour were very understanding as well.We did this on our first day in Amsterdam. I would suggest getting to the know the city first then taking the countryside bike tour. If we were to return, we would definitely book their city bike tour.

Thanks Egg!. We went on Mike's Bike Tour on a Tuesday afternoon at 12pm with Michael (Egg) in a group of about 12. We were given safety instructions and a quick briefing before heading off. It was slightly daunting for a short while on the bikes as we got used to other cyclists/vehicles on the road, however, our guide made us feel very safe and guided us through traffic lights and busy streets. We visited many sites including Vondelpark, Museumplein, Old/New Church, Red Light District and heard some history about each. Our guide was able to answer any questions that our group asked. My bike handlebars were quite loose, however, Egg had the equipment with him to fix the problem and ensured my safety was paramount. We then stopped towards the end of the tour at Cafe Nel and had some hot drinks to warm us up! The tour was 100% worth the money and we would definitely recommend it to others visiting the city as it is the best way to see Amsterdam and become part of the culture.

Excellent tour on a chilly day!. Small tour with Mike himself on a chilly overcast day. We were taken around all of the cites and even treated to a warm drink (excellent touch to the tour and exactly what I needed!) Friendly and kind staff, a tour worth doing!

Amazing tour!. I am so pleased my partner and I booked the 3 hour bike tour with Mike's Bike! It is the best way to see the city. The first 5 minutes is scary as you're constantly looking around you for traffic and other cyclists but we soon became confident. Our tour guide was ace, very informative and we thoroughly enjoyed the cycle!

Ideal way to see Amsterdam. Arrived at Mike's on a cold morning last week for 12.00 tour. We were a small group of 11, a mix of characters and nationalities. Our guide was Sam, who was brilliant, he selected bikes for each of us, gave an introduction ( checking that we could all ride) plus safety instructions, guidance on what do if someone gets into trouble or separated from the group, he then nominated the tallest member to ride at the bike to be the back marker.Our progress was good and we all followed Sam's instructions when it came to traffic lights, turns left and right and keep to the right to avoid trouble with local cyclists etc.We stopped at a number of locations where Sam would provide historical and amusing stories. When we came to the Red Light area we had to walk the bikes through, other stops were at areas of interest ( Hate to say it Sam but according to the Van Gogh Museum he shot himself in the chest!!!)Like other reviewers, we stopped at the Microbrewery in a Windmill, time to sample a couple of their brews. Wound our way back to Mike's after a most enjoyable nearly four hours.A great way to see the City, and in my view the highlight of my few days in Amsterdam.

Really a fun bike tour - highly recommended. We were a fairly large group and we booked in advance. We had a basic safety talk and set off for a fantastic and informative tour. Highlights for me were cycling through Vondelpark. This was relaxing and by far the best way to see the park which is quite large.The roads were busy and a times a bit scary but the guide with us was excellent at giving us direction and keeping the group safe.We stopped at several destinations along the way and our guide had lots of information and knowledge and answered questions.

Felt like an Amsterdammer. Booked the tour for my daughter (21) and I. Try to do a bike your on city breaks as the guides are always knowledgeable about their city and know the back streets do you see more of the real place. We were not disappointed. Arrived to meet the group and collect bikes, given a brief but funny introduction to riding the bike, a few safety rules and we were off.The your lasted around 4 hours, very good value, Laura our guide was good fun, learnt as much about the people and culture as the historic sights. Amsterdam became real. A look back in time as to the reasons the people of the city are so laid back and accepting of others. I learnt a lot and lived cycling about. We went through Vondelpark, the museum area, the red light district, Anne Frank house, up and down the canals, looked at buildings and then towards the end stopped at a bar in a windmill. I recommend this tour as a brilliant way of seeing the city, feeling part of the city and having a giggle. Laura was brilliant and her love for Amsterdam came across - absolutely book it and give it a go if you visit Amsterdam.

Had a great day riding around. We ended up doing this tour on a rainy day, but thankfully ponchos were provided and a positive attitude was carried by our fearless guide. This tour really unlocked some history of the city that was a little more off-beat. Instead of the typical historical tour--we got more information about sex, drugs, alcohol, hippies, etc. I really actually enjoyed the mixture of history with the story of the people. We ended up at a windmill bar, and had some food, then headed back. We really liked all of the places we visited and got a good lay of the land in a quick, non-boring way.I would definitely recommend this tour!

Great tour!. My fiance and I did the countryside bike tour. It was a four hour tour that went along the Amstel river and along the dykes. It was truly lovely! We were really lucky, due to the threat of bad weather there was only one other person on our tour, it was like getting a private tour! We stopped at a traditional Dutch windmill as well as a working dairy farm/wooden clog factory. The people there were really great, a lot of fun, showed us how they make the clogs and make the cheese. Got to try a lot of their delicious cheese, too! And our guide, Sam, was great. Cool dude, led a fun tour. Definitely one of the best things we did during our trip. If you are in relatively good shape, this is a must!
Great Tour!. Great way to see Amsterdam. Laura was a great tour guide with a wonderful personality and sense of humour which added to the afternoon.

Best part of our trip!. I can't express how impressed I was with this tour. My friend and I were only in the city for a day and a half and we wanted to ride bikes like the locals and see the city. We did exactly that on this tour. We walked in, paid our fare, and shortly afterward we were matched with a great guide (forgot her name)! It was quite intimidating to ride through the city because there were a lot of other riders and cars out on the roads, but our guide made us feel quite comfortable. I stayed right behind her the entire time! We stopped along the way to take pictures and she gave us a brief history. We even stopped at a bar to have a local drink! Our guide was really interested in catering our tour to what we wanted to see, so we got to see everything we wanted to see! We even rode into more "suburban" parts of the city, which was pretty cool. Would definitely recommend this bike tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Canals, Red Light & Pedal Power. My Son and I had a one day visit to Amsterdam and wanted to do something different to the usual, just sat in a bar and watching the world go by, so we decided to book a tour with Mike's Bike Tours as we wanted to see a bit of Amsterdam and not just the usual areas around Centraal Station district. So glad we did as we had a very enjoyable 3 hours touring around the Canals and over the Amsterdam Alps as Aaron called them (Canal Bridges!).Our host for the trip was 'Californian' Aaron, who was pleasant (Awesome!) and considerate to the group in terms of ensuring we all safe and kept together, even though all on the tour were experienced cycle riders, cycle around Amsterdam is totally different to cycling anywhere else (well at least in the UK anyway), we did have to endure all the seasons in one day, snow, hail, rain and sunshine, but if go prepared then it is no problem, plus the shop will provide 'ponchos' free if the weather is wet.Found Aaron very knowledgeable about the areas he took us too and engaged us in his humorous but educational talks in each district we went to. Really good value for the cost, I am already looking forward to doing the countryside tour they do sometime in the future when ever next I am passing through Amsterdam.

Would highly recommend. As soon as we stepped in the door we felt very welcome. We were advised to grab some lunch for the trip from the local sandwich bar on the corner (at the end of the street on the corner, can't remember the name) which was great advice. We were lucky as it was just the two of us plus the tour guide so it felt like a private tour. Although it was scheduled to rain all day, the staff were still very enthusiastic about taking us on the tour. Unfortunately we did get caught in a down pour but the ponchos provided kept us nice and dry. The tour guide was full of knowledge and was keen to answer questions we threw his way, as well as being very friendly. Would recommend this to anyone who wants to see sights outside of the city centre on a relaxing cycle ride.

Great Way to see the city. Easy tour to see a lot of the city in a short amount of time. Our guide offered some unique and personal information about the city and sights. Even with some people in the group who struggled to ride a bike, the tour was enjoyable. Take it slow and take in the city while riding a bike like a local.
Great way to see a city. Great tour to see different parts of town. My only improvement would have been to include an excursion that takes you a bit our of town.

The most fun bike tour anywhere. I beautiful Sunnyvale bike afternoon in Amsterdam today with AmsterSam ( yes that is his name) as our guide with Mikes Bikes. As he told us at the start, if you want a long boring history lesson go to Wikipedia- if you want to have a fun time and enjoy his totally engaging, but irreverent, commentary on the city - then this is the ride. At the end you get to hang out together at a local brewery - and I think all twelve us strangers felt really connected by this personal introduction to the city. This is a must for those visiting this amazing city- not to mention you actually might be able to find your way around the crazy streets when you are done. By the way the ride is super easy and relaxed.

Deeply disappointing service - would not recommend, far better and customer focused options. Firstly, I would like to put for the record, I am a very positive and accepting reviewer and for me to post something negative requires a high number of things to go wrong, and only those that are human influenced.
