In other words, I tend to see the positives in most situations. However, Mike’s bike tours has questioned my faith in some of these “apparently professional” operations. Mike’s had been highly recommended on Tripadvisor and after a positive experience in Berlin with Fat Bike Tours (review to follow - the company that had been originally set up by “Mike”), we were looking forward to spending the short time we had in Amsterdam (5 hours) on a bike tour of this iconic city. All indications were positive, we interacted with them via email, debated whether one of our party would be able to physically deal with the tour and they were made aware that we would be arriving into Amsterdam slightly in advance of the tour starting and may be arriving close to the start time, possibly 5 to 10 mins late depending upon Amsterdam traffic from the central station at their location. Through all our interactions, there was no suggestion that there would be any problems with arriving a little late.However, this is when the problems started. We arrived at the shop 5 mins past the hour (as already communicated) and were told that we were too late, as the group was already in the middle of the safety briefing! This involved much ringing of bells the whole time we were trying to get onto the tour. They stated they could not pause the safety briefing just for us and did not have the capacity to give us such a briefing (quite interesting, as there were at least 3 staff standing around chatting and drinking coffees). No amount of referencing email discussions, the fact we were only in Amsterdam for 5 hours and we were there and ready to go moved this person. She simply said, “you’re too late and that’s that”. They obviously had enough on their tour already and really did not have one ounce of consideration for the customer. When it became obvious that this person was not going to change her mind (the other staff seemed v uncomfortable standing around as we discussed this), it was like pulling teeth to get her to give us advice on what we do / whether there were any other tour operators she could suggest we use – on the one hand unwilling to pass the business onto the competition, but also completely inflexible in their interactions with customers!!In summary, very disappointing from an obviously successful and "apparently" professional outfit who lack any ounce of customer service and are very inflexible. I would highly recommend avoiding them and go with another more customer-oriented service, such as Green Bikes and King Bike next door. Reviews on them here

Best way to see Amsterdam!. Mateus was our excellent guide, we saw all areas of Amsterdam and learnt about the city and its history. Great value for money and loads of fun, a definite thing to do in Amsterdam

Countryside Tour. This was great fun - we had a group of 10 and our guide was excellent. We rode for about 15 mins. then stopped to look at a Windmill, then rode again for similar time and kept stopping to look at sites and attractions and had a break for lunch (bring your own) and then continued on. It felt great to be part of the countryside. It was raining on the day so we were supplied ponchos which kept us mostly dry. It wasn't hard even though we are past riding bikes at home.

Great fun - watch out for Americans falling off!. Took the tour on a cold Thursday afternoon and despite the weather had a great time. Laura (sp?) was excellent as our guide. Despite traffic felt really safe apart from one of the Americans in the group falling off in the park which was hilarious- there was no one anywhere near her. What had she been smoking? Saw many of the main sights over the 3 hour tour and would recommend to all. Also learned a lot from Laura on our frequent stop.

Fun cycle around Amsterdam. It was a bit tricky for us to actually find the shop, however once we had found it we really enjoyed our tour with Mike's Bikes. The bikes were very comfortable and well-maintained. The tour was comprehensive and covered all the main city tourist attractions as well as some more 'off the beaten track' locations (I especially enjoyed the stop in the Windmill Brewery). Our tour guide was pretty funny as well as very knowledgeable, although he did annoy a family on our tour by swearing/talking about some of the dodgier activities to do in Vondelpark in front of their kids. However my fiancé and I thought it was hilarious and the whole tour was very good craic and there was a nice relaxed atmosphere. The cycling wasn't too strenuous either.

Bummer. Having experience with the Fat Tyre Cycle tours in Berlin and Paris, I thought I would have a similar fantastic experience in Amsterdam. Not. Guide was friendly but we learned little of the history and the "petite histoire" of the city. Cycled fast and a lot in the same neighborhoud. Hardly time for pictures but extra time to go into a café (drinks not included in the price) Paid 25 euros; too expensive for what we got.

Most Fun I've Had in Europe. I signed up for this bike tour with 3 other friends not really knowing what to expect. We all LOVED it. Amsterdam is a biking city and it was a blast to learn about it while traveling like a local! Sam was so much fun and was very knowledgable about Amsterdam. We were put in a group with 5 other people and it was a great group size. I would go back and do it again tomorrow if I could.

Probably best to just rent a bike, not do the tour. Surprised to see such great reviews for this place - I'm guessing they are all based on the bike shop, and not the tours. The tour wasn't BAD by any means, but if you are at all looking to learn anything, or to stop and take some photos, this is definitely not the tour to take. The guide, Aaron, was a really nice guy - very funny. That said, he seemed to know very little about the history of anything we saw. A huge chunk of time was spent (the wasted) at a pub, as opposed to touring around. The bikes were good and reliable, but as some one that has done many bike tours in many cities, I'd suggest skipping this one.

Awesome Bike Shop. This is a cool bike shop on Kerkstraat. They have bikes for sale and all types of bike equipment. They also organize bike tours which I didn't do because it was too cold for me. But I'll definitely try that if I return in warmer weather.

Fabulous.. Visited Amsterdam for 3 days. Decided to get out of the city and ride along the Amstel to a small village and have lunch. Mikes bikes were brilliant. They gave us directions and their bikes are second to none. Made our Amsterdam experience so much better. The young man who served us deserves a mention (wish I had got his name). He was so helpful. Thank you.

Great rental bike place. Easy and affordable way to get around the city...by bike! They made the rental process painless as it can be. The bikes were not advertised with any logos so they blended in, and did not scream TOURIST.

Entertaining Excursion out of Amsterdam. Did a morning bike tour out to the windmill and cheese/clog making farm. Highly entertaining, our guide was hilarious and helpful. If you are a bit stressed about cycling through the city - the guides at Mikes look after you really well, and teach you how to deal with it. Only a short period of time is in the city anyway, then you are free and clear for a gorgeous and leisurely cycle through the countryside and parks on the outskirts of Amsterdam. Highly recommended!

Rolling Along. Great guide...informative and with a sense of humourGood way of keeping warm on a freezing cold day!!!Useful way of getting an impression of the muddled ,deliberately confusing layout of the city

Book it. They are great.. Lovely three hour your if the city. Upset we couldn't get a country tour but we were visiting during the colder off period. The rude is gentle but at times you might get muddled with road rules. Just stop if worried. The guide is great at coming back and making sure everyone is ok. They provide a good basic awareness of the areas and historical notes but don't expect an encyclopaedia. I'd start with a bike tour and plan the rest of the trip from there. Great service and quality of money and time.

Nice folks but not enough info. You want a good laugh? You will get it. You want lots of details about the city, its history? You won't get it. The guide is really cool as a person but does not give enough info. I don't regret it at all, but my advice would be to read Amsterdam 101 or similar before taking this. Oh, cool and comfortable bikes btw.

Laura showed us the beautiful spots of Amsterdam. Got there 10 minutes early to stock up on gloves and beanies s it was 2 degrees but beautifully dry. Great knowledgeable peronalised tour of the town, ending up in a cool Micro brewery for beer and hot sausage.

Best way to see Amsterdam! . My boyfriend and I spent a whirlwind three days in Amsterdam. This tour was the best thing we had done! We had spent a day walking around the city and thought we had seen everything but the tour showed us so much more! Matthias was a wonderful tour guide, very knowledgable and interesting. I hadn't ridden a bike for a couple of years so was a little nervous about riding around a city but Matthias took great care of the group. He cycled at a steady speed and was constantly keeping an eye on us. The only thing better than this tour was Matthias' flowing hair. An absolute must and I could not recommend this highly enough!!! Thank you Matthias and the team.
Highly recommended! . Matthias was a great guide and very knowledgeable. We were lucky to have a small group and enjoy a micro brewery beer together at the end of our tour.

Expensive & no good. Dont rent a bike in Amsterdam! This is a lovely place to walk around, stopping by every now and then doing window shopping or just for a snap. Renting a bike is expensive and they strongly recommend you to pay for an insurance in case your bike is stolen. This, plus the worry of where to park, makes it a real nuisance.

First day arrival from Detroit - tired!. We had fun - good introduction to the city upon our arrival. Just be reasonably fit and able to adjust quickly to other bicyclists, cars and changing lights. In other words - be comfortable with city traffic! We toured with Mike's here and in Germany.

Soggy, but nice bike tour. I actually took a bike tour with Mike's Bikes in the summer of 2014. I remember that I had a long layover and decided to venture out into the city. It was raining and though I had not booked a spot for the tour, I decided to find the shop and join the tour. Because it was raining so hard and I did not have gps, I was a bit late arriving to the shop. The group was in their rain gear and about to take off, but they waited to get me set up to join in. We saw a lot on the tour, but I was so drenched with rain that I had to shop for a replacement jacket in order to return to the airport.LocationPopular with lots of shops and restaurants.It was easy to get to/from the airport; I took he #197 bus for 5 Euro. All of that info is on the website and they responded quickly when I emailed them with additional questions.Cost: 20 EuroTime: 3 hoursRoute: covered a lot of locations Ike parks, history, lots of canals, sort of rode like the locals.With a scheduled stop at the windmill bar/pub.Guide: Sam was nice, friendly yet snarky and knowledgeable. Was a bit too chatty at the end and I had to run off to return to the airport since I was on a 9 hour layover. Also, apparently they have a cat in the store and I don't like cats so I was anxious to leave because of that situation.It was raining, rather pouring rain and they provided us with rain ponchos. However make sure you get something other than the red ones, because that's what I had and it was worthless. We did have some pockets of sunshine.They provide coupons at the end of the tour for discounts on other tours and bike rentals.

Highly Recommended!. I had Alec for the City Bike Tour, and he was great! Our group of nine (including Alec) spent about three hours cruising all of the sights of Amsterdam from the well-known to the just plain interesting. At the end we all biked to a local pub for a drink :) Great way to spend an afternoon in the city.

The best introduction to Amsterdam!. A tour with Aaron at Mike's Bikes was our first activity in Amsterdam. It was a perfect intro to the city and Aaron, having lived there for decades, was able to give us a knowledgeable tour with a great Californian vibe. He knew so much and really connected with our whole family. This tour really set the tone for our whole trip and got us really comfortable with the streets of Amsterdam very quickly.Aaron was also really flexible about where we went, giving us a ton of discretion and taking us to a fantastic apple pie place for a short break.I will probably do this again every time I go to Amsterdam.

Brilliant tour of a brilliant city - FUN. I visited Amsterdam for the second time in early December 2015 and decided to book a bike tour at Mike's Bike Tours after reading about them in my Lonely Planet guidebook. They sounded like a fun bunch and the kind of place I'd like to be. I wasn't wrong! Mike's Bike Tours is full of fun people who have brilliant knowledge of the city and delivered the tours in a fun yet informative way. I've always wanted to ride a bike through Amsterdam but was worried about getting lost and wasting my time on the bike by looking at my GPS or my maps, so taking a tour was a brilliant way to ride a bike through the city and maximising the time I had.Our guide from Mike's Bike Tours was Vincent who led a great tour and was full of facts and information on the city. The most interesting to me was the history he told us on the Jordaan area of the city.The tour culminated in a drink in a local bar (the name escapes me, but I do have a card at home!) where we all enjoyed coffees and Amsterdam brewed beer which was the perfect ending. Thanks so much Vincent and Mike's Bike Tours - I would highly recommend these guys!

Fantastic way to see Amsterdam like a local. This was an easy and enjoyable way to cover a lot of ground in Amsterdam. Jeff, our guide, shared some very interesting stories about Dutch culture. Well worth the time.

Fantastic bike tour! . I booked this bike tour to see the city as have been on them before and they really are a great fun way to see many of the sights. My husband and I did the tour with tour guide Sam. He was friendly, funny and very knowledgable. Despite the weather being very miserable, we were given ponchos (good thick ones, not the cheap ones!) and had a wonderful time! Would definitely recommend. Thanks Mike's bike tours!

Great bike tour of the city!. I thoroughly enjoyed this bike tour through Amsterdam last week. Jeff was awesome - very knowledgeable and funny. All the insights about Dutch history and cultural aspects were a highlight of my trip. I'd recommend this bike tour to anyone!

Fun way to experience the city!. As a first time visiter to Amsterdam, it is very hard to get used to seemingly endless stream of cyclists and you may find crossing the road as a daunting task. Mike's Bike Tour turned out to be the perfect way for me and my friend to get to know the city and also how to navigate around Amsterdam. Our tour guide Sam was very informative and made sure that we stay safe through out the tour. I would recommend going to Mike's Bike Tour in the first few days that you get to Amsterdam as it really give you a good summary of the city and its history.

Excellent!!!. Extremely friendly staff greeted us on arrival. Our guide was Sam who was very knowledgable and funny! He was very approachable and had all the answers to our questions. Riding through Amsterdam with the locals can be a little intimidating by yourself so doing a tour like this before hand to understand how the streets work is a great idea. Would definitely recommend this business to anyone coming to Amsterdam.

Great Country Bike Tour with Alec. We went on an awesome tour with Alec back in November while on a girl's holiday. I'm a travel writer/blogger and found out about the tour through an acquaintance's blog. The three of us definitely wouldn't consider ourselves to be avid bikers, but we still had a great time learning about the history of Amsterdam and peddling the country side. Alec constantly had great bits of info to add and it made the trip really interesting. We felt that the tour was a great value for the price. Due to our visit being in the off season, we actually ended up having a private tour, just the three of us. We bought more cheese than planned at the farm, and are still enjoying it back in the states. I would highly recommend doing this tour if you're considering biking in Amsterdam.

Do it!. Formative, engaging, sightseeing, exercising.Loved the tour, would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam. We done it as part of our Topdeck tour. Not a bad word was spoken about the bike tour from anyone!

Great rental place, amazing cycling tour!. We rented bikes for 4h one day to see Amsterdam like the locals and it was amazing.Your first experience of Amsterdam may be: OMG those cyclist are insane! But when you get on the bike, you just become a local and it is oh, so lovely :)We also booked a countryside cycling tour, which was great - we cycled through the forest and lowlands, we heard all about the history and architecture. We visited a cheese farm and clog factory, and finally took some pics under a windmill. I definitely recommend this tour. The bikes are uber-comfy and the support is great!
Fun and informative way to see the city. My friend and I were in town for just a day and wanted to see the best parts of the city. Jeff was a great guide. Super knowledgeable and funny!

Set us up for a great independent bike ride. Really helpful staff, showed us exactly how to lock up our bikes to make sure they weren't stolen. They understand that there is a lot of bike theft in Amsterdam (as in people setting down their bikes and people come up and swipe the bike). I would definitely recommend buying the insurance with the bike rental (€2 instead of €300 for a new bike, no brainer). We did not do a bike tour but did our own trip up to Marken. The bikes did really well in and out of Amsterdam and I really appreciated that there was no big sign on them advertising that we were renting the bikes. They also provide lights for the front and back of the bikes, since all bikes must have these in Amsterdam, along with a bell. From the research I did before renting here, Mike's bike rentals were cheaper than many other places and I liked the before 6 pm rental for bikes which was very convenient for us. If you want to rent bikes in Amsterdam, rent them from here.

A fun day out for a couple of oldies. One of the highlights of our trip to Europe. We had been told that the countryside tour was worth doing, how true that was.Stuart our tour leader, was very personable, provided good commentary, and rode at a pace that meant we were all relatively close together. It was a lovely sunny day when we set off, however on the return the weather became showery, not to worry, Mike's Bikes provide bike ponchos to keep you dry.The route was interesting, you see a mixture of city and country landscape. There are several stops along the way, giving you time for a rest (if you need one).The farm was a highlight, the farmer will have you smiling, if not laughing!As two 60+ travellers, we had fun and would highly recommend this tour.Remember to pack your lunch or snacks and a drink. The bikes come with panniers.

Countryside Tour - Perfection!. Mike's Bike Tours is the best company hands down. We did another tour with We Bike Amsterdam of the city center and wished we had just done all of our bike tours with Mike's. Took an absolutely lovely and perfectly paced tour of the outlying countryside. Our fearless female guide, Mike, was absolutely hilarious and successfully navigated our group of around 20-25 out from the busy city center to the quaint, verdant countryside. We saw a real windmill, visited a farm where wooden shoes and traditional gouda was made, and just loved winding through the parks, along the canals etc. Definitely recommend packing a lunch. We had the opportunity to rest and eat at the farm and took full advantage. Sandwiches and water for us, perfect. Highly recommend this tour - it was a favorite of our entire trip!

One of my most memorable moments in Amsterdam and Best Guide ever!. I have always heard about the wonderful bike tours in Amsterdam & so I decided to do one with Mike's Bike Tour, after the great experience with Mike's Bike Tour Munich. The day was forecasted to rain, but I decided to book it anyway as it's my last day in Amsterdam. Turn out to be my lucky day as I was the only one in the rainy day and get to have a private tour with the lovely guide, Alec! He is very knowledgeable about the country's history & sights, and he speaks with much passion and interest which makes it so much more interesting. Alec is also very patient and just a very genuine nice & down to earth guy whom I really enjoyed our conversation while riding along the beautiful countryside. The path that we took along the Amstel River, polder lanscape, passing a windmill and the parks were really serene and such a good way to explore the Amsterdam's countryside. Even though it was raining on & off but it really doesn't matter and it's quite refreshing in fact.This is definitely the highlight of my trip in Amsterdam & I highly recommend joining Mike's bike tour. Thanks Alec for making my trip in Amsterdam such a memorable one, a good way to end my 6 weeks Europe trip! Cheers, Dennis

Leisure. I went on the country tour 15 years ago and was very excited to bring my boys to do the same. The weather was not good, but it didn't stop us. Our guide was great! Friendly and very patient because I quickly learned I was as fast on a bike anymore. He helped us and made it fun with a great smile and funny jokes. So we finished our tour and even though weather was not great. We all enjoyed it. Thanks Mike Bike tour for another great memory.

Excellent bike tour. We did the countryside bike tour on a Sunday morning during our week long honeymoon. We did a lot of research to try and find the best one and we were not disappointed it was really great. We were a little nervous about biking on the streets of Amsterdam so the countryside tour was just what we wanted. It was 4 hours long but by no means strenuous with lots of stops to take things in. The bikes were comfortable and our guide Sam was really easy going, patient and helpful. You don't really get much time to eat so I would recommend packing some snacks that you can eat quickly and perhaps eat something light before beginning. The tour itself spends sometime on the streets of Amsterdam although I was too busy focusing on riding to really take things in too much, then you get to go through Vondel Park. Next is Amstel Park and a stop at a rowing lake. After that you stop at the Riekermolen Windmill, which was great because we really wanted to see a proper windmill and were not sure how else we would have been able to, then you go through the Amsterdam Bos Park (forest). One of the most interesting parts was we stopped at a cheese farm outside of Amsterdam. The farmer shows you how they make Gouda cheese the old fashioned way which is pretty cool and in the end you can buy some. They also make clogs and he shows you that too. It was very cool and something you surely would not get on other bike tours. In the end we had to cross the Amsterdam Marathon which was a little crazy, but Sam did a great job of making sure everyone was okay. Also it was a little bit of a rainy day but that did not take away from our experience and they provide you with ponchos if you need them. Overall it was a thoroughly enjoyable experience and I would definitely recommend having it on your list. Probably one of the best things we did on our honeymoon.

Lovely tour: I <3 Laura. . Excellent bike tour, even in the miserable November weather. Started a little chaotic (don't worry) with people a little scared for their lives. The tour was smart, concise and informative. Laura was a fun and authentic guide with a unique perspective on Amsterdam /life. Give it a try and see how much of a "dutchie" you are!

Fun day on a bike!. We took the countryside tour which was easy and very pretty--would have been prettier if it we hadn't picked a foggy day for a bike ride! There were 15-16 of us in our group and our guide, Stuart, did a nice job making sure no-one got left behind, gave us sensible pre-ride instructions, gave us a short interval to ride at our own pace (faster, that is!) toward the end, and stopped at intervals during the tour to provide a nice thorough history of Amsterdam and what makes it what it is today. You could tell he really loves Amsterdam. This is lovely way to spend a half-day. I would recommend gloves, at least in November...I was so glad I got them in their shop right before the ride.

When in Amsterdam , Cycle !. Holidaying in Amsterdam is a great experience for various age groups .The liberal attitude is a way of life here . While here , we wanted to live the Dutch life , so the obvious mode of transport to do sightseeing was the Bicycle .After a bit of look around , We went ahead with ' Mike 's Bike Tours ' . It was a decision which i m happy about . We did a city tour , about 12 km in around 3 & half hours . The group was not too large . Just 10 of us ( including my family of 4 ) . The Bike company very sweetly gave us poncho raincoats to use in the unpredictable weather , which was very useful as it started to rain midway into the tour . The trip guide ' Diego ' was very informative and attentive. We were shown practically the entire city and some very interesting places with their history and importance ( Vondelpark , Skinny bridge , Red Light district , the brewery /windmill , the Rijksmuseum , etc ) This tour is recommended to all visitors coming to Amsterdam , as u really get a feel of the city in the Dutch style . Overall a great experience and a fun trip .
Nov 2015. Riding around Amsterdam with Jeff was great. Liked that they offered ponchos in case in rained during the ride. Would definitely recommend!

Fun tour with a great guide. Fun bike tour with a great, funny, knowledgable guide. Gave us the time to stop for photos. Cycling was an awesome way to see Amsterdam without having to walk. I would recommend Mike's Bike Tours to anyone looking to try this sort of experience.

Great way to see the country. Because Amsterdam is rather flat, take a bike tour to the country where you get to see how they make cheese and wooden clogs. Our tour guide was from England and loved Amsterdam so much that he stayed. Great humour helps. He was ver informative and thoroughly enjoyed it.

Country Side Bike Tour - The guide ruined it.. Mike's Bike Tour was highly recommended on Google and TripAdvisor, so I thought my friends and I would give it a try. Overall, the tour was well planned and the sights were interesting and fun. I especially liked visiting the countryside family owned farm - it was definitely the highlight of the tour and probably the saving factor on why I am reviewing this as average instead of poor.My biggest complaint was my tour guide. Stuart wasn't a bad guy, just an inconsiderate tour guide. My tour consisted of around 15 people, where not everyone was at the same physical fitness level. I am in my twenties and pretty active (no where near marathon runner, but I am not a couch potato). The tour guide was biking at an extremely fast pace. For example, the tour guide would be multiple kilometers in front of the last person. Furthermore, after seeing the distance between all of the bikers, he continued with his pace. After 20 minutes into our longest stretch, he realized he has lost half the group and instructed those who could actually keep up to wait, relax, take pictures until he returned. After collecting the other members of the tour, he breezed by us, didn't wait for a briefing and continued to bike ferociously down the path leaving my friends and I to quickly hop on our bikes and huff and puff to catch up. Finally, the biggest problem was after about 10 minutes into the tour one of the participants lost the group. Instead of calling or going back to the store front location he used google maps to find us at the country side farm. The tour guide DIDN'T EVEN REALIZE HE WAS MISSING SOMEONE..... How horrible. For a seasoned tour guide to not even realize he didn't have his entire group was telling enough. The participant had to use offline GoogleMaps because he was American and did not have cell phone reception in the Netherlands to locate us. And GoogleMaps ended up leading him down a path with a fence that he had to hop over and throw his bike over! Ridiculous.Tip, go on the country side tour, just get a different tour guide!!!

Not worth it - very let down. We had such high hopes for this tour and had been really looking forward to it. Unfortunately because of our bland guide it was a total disappointment.We had been hoping to learn about Amsterdam's rich history in a fun way but all we got was a guide who wasnt interested in being there and made it seem like to much effort to engage in conversation with the group.We stopped along the way about 5 times so the guide could talk about the area and everytime he wasn't very clear with what he was saying, kept going around in circles of montone drool and when questioned on anything it was clear that he had no depth of knowledge. The bikes were great and worked fine but thats about all we got...could have been great if our guide was better.

Rental too expensive. We rented bikes for 3 days and it was a little bit more expensive than other places. Il didn't care much but was really disappointed when we decided to give back the bikes on the morning after at opening time. They made us pay one more day although we asked before and it was the same for them !
superb. Great trip through Amsterdam the guy knew all of the history and could not be faulted excellent value for money

fantastic day. we must have picked the best day to go out and about with stuart on our bike ride.... sunny wether nice easy bikes to ride dutch bikes are so much more easyier to ride then our bikes...

A magnificent incite to Amsterdam with lighthearted enthusiasm. A positive introduction to Holland, "Duchies" culture and their fabulous city. Laura led us through art, heritage and pragmatism to a brewery. Perfect.

Tour Guide not prepared.. A child on our tour got a flat tire and the guide did not have a spare tube. We had to wait over 30 minutes for someone to meet us with a tube. We had to wait additional time at the dairy so that the guide could charge his phone. Then when we got back he did not have his keys to the shop. This tour has the potential to be a 5 star tour. Hopefully, I was just there on a bad day.

Mike's bike tour with AmsterSam. Our tour guide Sam was hilarious, made the whole tour very enjoyable, besides cycling in Amsterdam is suicidal! :)We enjoyed it very much, went around in the city with a group of 7. We saw all the major sights, plus we visited a wind mill, a brewer. I took about 3,5 hours with lots of stops and information. Very good, very funny

Great 'DAM city tour with brewery stop at the end!. Riding a bicycle in Amsterdam can be a bit intimidating for the novice - but this city bike tour proved that riding in Amsterdam is a real pleasure. Enjoyed the Friday noon tour. Bike were comfortable with seven gears and hand brakes. Tour Guide was enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and careful to keep the group together and safe. Ride concluded with a stop for a Dutch pint and good conversation at the end - but I suspect your results may vary. I would do this exact tour again - when I visit 'Dam again. Highly recommended.

Great bike tour at fabulous price!. Had a fun time on the noon "City tour". The weather was perfect! Sam did a great job of leading the tour through the busy streets. His commentary was entertaining and educational. I highly recommend Mike's.

Great way to get around Amsterdam. I joined the countryside tour which started from the bike shop. There were dozens of bikes to choose from and the owner and staff were able to quickly and efficiently set riders up with a suitable bike. Rain gear was loaned out (and with the typical weather of Nederlands, came in handy). Bike helmets were available by request though most riders did not use them. We rode through the city a short distance before making our way out of the busier areas. We stopped periodically for description of the history and interesting facts about Amsterdam. It was very informative and the pace of the ride was very comfortable for someone who doesn't cycle regularly. The visit to the farm was a nice experience and has made me a farm-fresh cheese lover. We also stopped by a working windmill and rode along the dike for portions of the tour. Guide was friendly and attentive to the group. When in Amsterdam, the bike is the main mode of transportation so give it a try!

Great way to start your exploring of Amsterdam. Great guide. I loved the itinerary. Our group was quite large at 16 which meant there was some waiting while people caught up. I love to start seeing a city on a bike and in Amsterdam, it makes even more sense as it is the most bike friendly city I have been to.
Good fun. Great way to get to know the city. Very knowledgable tour guides. Would recommend doing this before rising by yourself.

It does what it says on the tin. This tour is exactly what it sets out to be. We get our bike, have a brief intro and off we set. Through a park, along a canal, through the polders, visit a cheese factory and a windmill and return along a wonderful cycle path along the Amstel river. Our guide Stewart (English) was really very good, with a great sense of understated English humour and very informative (read - not boring stuff). A really great outing and good to see a bit of the countryside around Amsterdam. We all enjoyed it thoroughly.There are two reasons I have not given it a full 5 stars. 1. When we arrived the owner had just realised that there was an overbooking/cock-up and he stomped around cussing and swearing loudly. It made us very uneasy and several of us moved out onto the street to get away from his histrionics. Not very professional to vent your ire in front of your clients.2. There was a stop at a chess/clog factory (not sure how realistic this was though). The farmer telling us about the cheeses was quite funny and entertaining. The chap in the clog section was really quite shocking. His jokes were rather patronising and often bordered on the racist. Very unpleasant.

Amazing countryside bike tour!. I was really keen on going for a bike tour while staying in Amsterdam and I made the perfect choice by going for a countryside tour with Mike's bike tours and rental! I was taking the tour on 1st November, the day when the shop was moving across the street. Despite all the hassle with moving, everyone was well organized, very polite and nice - great customer service! As there was almost 30 visitors, they split us up into 2 groups, I went for a tour with Stuart (hope I spelled the name correctly!) and it was just lovely! Unfortunately the weather was not very tour-friendly as it was very foggy for the first half but we managed and got some sun after we left the clogs and Gouda farm. I haven't sit on a bike for almost 10 years so was a bit afraid of the 25ish km tour, but it was as easy as it could be! Even the bits of cycling in the town were managable. The countryside is all flat, so you don't really need to be in good physical shape to finish the tour. Definitely recommend taking this tour if you want to get to know Holland a bit more! Also Stuart was very knowledgable about history of Amsterdam and it was a delight to have him for a tourguide. I would definitely go again!

Fun even in the rain. We had a great day doing the Country Bike tour. The ride was easy (haven't ridden a bike for 15 years and wasn't sore at all the next day), though was very glad to be in a group on the tour as the Amsterdam streets can be a little crazy to the uninitiated individual who is used to being on the other side of the road! Even though we had poor weather (raining all day) it was still a great experience and I would recommend this tour to all.

Amazing. Had a fab countryside tour which included a cheese factory visit were they make cheese and cloggs. Tour guide Aaron was very laid back and funny. Great way to see Amsterdam and really good to travel around the way the Dutch do you know youve survived Amsterdam when you have travelled on a bike and survived haha. Really worth a go. Thanks.

Highlight of Amsterdam . We had an awesome tour with our guide Stuart. He was extremely knowledgable and passionate about the city and had a relaxed way of delivering the info so it wasn't boring. My wife was a little scared at some of the larger intersections (she hasn't ridden a bike since she was a kid) but still got through the day and enjoyed it. It was the highlight of my trip!

Brilliant . Fantastic tour, great and knowledgeable guide who was more than happy to amswer questions and provide information on restaurants and local info. I plan to return and do it again with my partner.

Great way to see the city and close-by country side farms!. taking the country tour was a great idea when seeing Amsterdam, since it shows you some of the rural areas outside the city. Great features like the rashly farmlands and cheese farm, as well as the windmill were great to see. Stuart guided very well and is a natural at informing and entertaining the small group we were with. The bikes were also well kept and very comfy to ride, with bag space to keep items (and bought cheese from the farm!)

A great way to see the city!. We pre booked the tour before arriving in Amsterdam and were not disappointed. As an inexperienced cyclist it was easy to follow the group and there were lots of places to see along the way. The tour guide kept a keen eye on the group so as not to lose anyone and was full of information about the city. We would definitely do this again.

Not so much a tour, but keep up with the leader. We did this as part of a Top Deck tour. Three groups were taken around the city. My group leader only stopped at the I Amsterdam sign. But after that it was just a ride around the streets, so became a bit tedious as we were not told any of the history or attractions. Other groups did stop at various points and had a chance to take photos. It may depend who you get as your group leader as to whether you get to stop of not. The bikes were comfy though and riding around the city was an experience I enjoyed.

So much fun!. This tour was so much fun! I wouldnt consider myself a cyclist (hadn't been on a bike in years before I did this) but the bikes provided were easy to maneuver. The guides were friendly (funny) and informative on the history of the areas we cycled through. Visited a working cheese farm where the farmer doubled as a comedian as well. An all round great experience and lovely day out. Worth every penny. If you do end up going in the colder months, don't forget gloves and a hat. Even if you think you might not need it, you WILL need it! Also, try not to wear jeans. Even though its comfortable cycling in jeans you wont feel the after effects till the next day. Bike rash is a real thing!

Great Coutryside Tour with Lady Mike!. We had a blast on the Coutryside Tour with our amazing guide Mike. Mike was so much fun and she brought a great attitude to the tour. The bikes were very smooth to ride and we didnt have a problem navigating out of the city which I thought would be a little scary. The ride was beautiful biking through the countryside along the canals and seeing the farms. We got to see an old windmill before stopping at the gouda cheese farm where they also make wooden clogs. The farmer was funny and showed us how the cheese and clogs are made. On the way back we rode through two gorgeous parks including Vondelpark. It started to rain at the very end of the tour which was a perfect ending to a great countryside tour!

Countryside Bike Tour - Highly Recommend. Countryside tour was great! Awesome way to briefly experience biking in the city (as you head in to the country) and a really great way to take in the Dutch countryside - away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Our weather was great and the views were beautiful! Tour guide (Aaron) was super relaxed/fun - I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam! Fall was a great time with the leaves changing and mild temperatures.

Hooray for the Hippies!. What fun and educational this was. Laura the guide was cool. Her stories about the hippy population in the 70s was so funny. Its an easy and fun ride for three hours stopping at many places. Very sociable if you make the effort to talk to other riders. No fear for traffic if you are a reasonable rider. Laura don't forget the free beers in the underground flea market I told you about...... LOL

Could (Should) have been better!. We enjoyed our bicycle tour outside of the city- but the group size was way too big. One of the employees told us that one of the guides had called in sick at the last minute- so instead of 3 groups of riders, there were 2 groups. We had 21 people in our group- way too many, I think, for safety, although we didn't have any problems. And also too many to really hear the guide when he stopped to give us some info.I found the guides affect to be very flat, didn't sound particularly interested in what he was telling us, seemed to be more interested in his hair and the few young single women!Nevertheless, the city part of the ride was short and fun (though a little stressful with the traffic) and the ride through Vondelpark, Amsterdam forest and the countryside was quite pleasant.Cheese and shoe-making demo, a little hokey, but OK!Route was flat, no problem going the distance.

Brilliant Fun. We took the 3 hour tour of Amsterdam. From the start the staff were professional, Knowledgeable and fun. Our tour guide Deigo was great fun, full of really interesting facts about the city. He was attentive to the groups needs and levels of competence of bike skills which was reassuring as moving around the center of Amsterdam is a little hairy! Would highly recommend this tour as you see some really interesting parts of the city as well as the obvious highlights.

Fun, easy and beautiful!. I went with a group girls (early 20s) and did the country bike tour with Aaron as our guide (who was amazing at his job) in a group of about 18 people of mixed ages and cultures. I had not been on a bike for about 10 years because I have an irrational fear after an accident I had when I was younger. I was super nervous but the team at Mike's Bikes made me feel safe, fit me with the perfect bike and took the stress off my shoulders for the day. I'd say the route was 98% flat, 80% very minimal traffic and at a perfect cruising speed. The scenery is so incredibly beautiful and the cheese was the tastiest I've ever had. It was such an amazing experience. From someone who knows how to ride a bike but isn't very confident, it was 100% worth the €25 I spent.
Amazing tour. Best way to see the city and get advice on a lot of attractions around the city. Definitely recommend!!

Our first stop next time we're in Amsterdam!. Unfortuantely, we've only got our bikes the two last day in Amsterdam, and how we regret this! It's definitely the best way to see the city and easily get around.Went here based on reviews on Tripadvisor and didn't regret it one bit! Location is perfect; we left by bus to airport and the store is only 5minutes walk from the bus 197 station.Staff was really pleasent and helpful, bikes in great condition, and prices good.Next time, definitely our first stop!

Best way to see Amsterdam. . Every city has a best way to see it. This tour is by far the best way to see Amsterdam. The tour guide was incredible with years of experience of the country and could answer any questions we had about the city. The bikes were great and as it is flat it takes no effort at all. The city is very safe with separated cycle lanes and helmets available if you wish. There were all ages on the tour and there was only 10 people per tour guide. I'd honestly recommend this to anyone in Amsterdam!

Nice ride - big group. I liked this tour and the route. Mostly along theAmstel Dike with obligatory stops at a windmill and cheese factory. The bikes are Electras, comforatable and easy to ride.The route was good but I was in a group of 20 and it was VERY slow moving. Some people in the group seemed to have read about bicycles but have never been on one! As for me, I never got out of second gear and was passed three times by joggers.Pro tip: Do NOT volunteer to be the tail end charlie person rounding up the group as you go... Not a good way to enjoy the tourI would seek out a much smaller group tour in the future.

Jeff was awesome . A very enjoyable way to visit Amsterdam . Jeff made it fun by giving us the facts and the gossips. The weather definitely help but it was a hit for both me and my teenager son. Thanks Mike's Bikes

What a Great Way to See Amsterdam From a Bike. We like active vacations but don't necessary want to do extreme sports. So having a way to take a leisurely ride on a bike sounded interesting. 25 km?! Not a big deal but it did concern me. Not to worry. If you can walk several miles then you can do this bike ride into the country.We went in October and had a beautiful sunny day with the temperature in the 50s.. Light wind. Awesome sights. Great group from around the world. We got to see a windmill up close, cheese and traditional wooden shoes being made, and ride away from the busy city center. Great guides. The group included teenagers to older folks (like me) in their 50s.Definitely would recommend doing this bike tour here or in other cities.

Amsterdam Countryside Bike Tour. We really enjoyed our tour. Mike was so much fun and enjoyable to be around. I would highly recommend, but definitely bring a sandwich. Just a couple sample of different cheeses. I read the tour as more of a meal of cheeses. But Mike's Bikes told us to pack a sandwich and snacks, so that was just us reading the description incorrectly. I really am so happy we did it!

The best way to see Amsterdam . We thoroughly enjoyed our 26km bike tour through Amsterdam! Our guide was awesome and really funny! We stopped at several historic locations in the city and also in the countryside. The stop at the cheese farm was awesome and we got to see clogs being made and even bought a pair. This is the best way to see Amsterdam because you feel like a local, riding your bike through the small streets and over the bridges. Strongly recommend this your, you won't be disappointed!

Spent a cool morning cycling with Sam . Thanks Sam for the great day. The poncho certainly came in handy for the drizzly weather. My bike 'Pamela' proved a great companion and I met some lovely people from all over the world. I loved zipping around Amsterdam with Mikes Bikes Tours. Thank you.

Edutainment by Bike. Find out how Amsterdam was built on a vast Delta plain, why the picturesque dwellings of the city were deliberately made to lean and why they have hooks at the top, what was the solution to prevent late night pissing drunks falling in the canals, the city psyche about real estate after 1960's squatters' riots, where to go for free, acoustically fantastic concerts, where to go if you can't bear the long queue outside Anne Frank's house, and of course how not to make a fool of yourself with hash cookies and legal prostitution. All this and more I learned on the bike tour with veteran guide, Jeff. Thoroughly entertaining, enjoyable and fun-packed 3 hours of cycling in the heart of the city.

Good way to see the city. Biking is a neat way to see Amsterdam. Our tour was split into two groups and we feel that was still too large of a group. A tad hard to understand the tour guide due to noise in the areas we stopped at.

Best part of our trip!. Our countryside bike tour was the highlight of our trip! Aaron was an amazing tour guide. We had about 13 people in our group. It was nice to experience riding in the city and riding in the country. The stop at the farm was awesome. We bought several wheels of cheese......SO GOOD! The tour is not strenuous. It's fun, engaging, and you learn a lot about Amsterdam. Make sure you bring a camera for the beautiful parks!

Fantastic fun on two wheels. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our 3 hour bike ride last Wednesday. Our guide Sam gave us a very informative and colourful insight into their beautiful city ablely assisted by trainee guide Laura. Despite being pensioners we held our own with the youngsters!

Perfect Experience in Amsterdam!. My wife and I were in Amsterdam and didn't have much time there. We wanted to see as much as possible without cramming in too much that we wouldn't enjoy anything. This was the best way to do it. Our tour guide was phenomenal and very knowledgeable. I believe his name was Tim, he was the tall Canadian guy. He was very friendly and approachable and made this a great experience. We were able to see so many of the landmarks that we had on our list. We also go to witness the city on bike, which I feel is how it should be witnessed. The scenery, the ride and all the stops were spot on. I highly recommended this tour to anyone who visits Amsterdam. It is an absolute must!

Great Tour for Amsterdam!. Diego was an awesome tour guide and long time resident of the city giving him a lot of insider knowledge and history about the city. Was a very pleasant ride/route and we stopped at the windmill brewery for some sudz. I first went to Mike's Bike in Munich and this trip lived up to the same experience there. Would recommend!

Terrific company . Did the tour on a Sunday. Large group so they split us into 3 groups of a dozen. Diego was my tour leader. He was very knowledgeable, articulate and friendly. We had a great extended break at the beer stop in the windmill. Awesome day and way to see and learn about Amsterdam. Diego was the best. I highly recommend this outfit

Amazing bike tour seeing real Holland countryside. When you can't cycle like the locals in the Dam yet want to feel the cycling joy this is the tour to do. The route was very well planned and guide was super helpful. There are stops to see windmill, visiting cheese factory as well as cycling across parks and country roads.Was great to see the peaceful side of Amsterdam.The tour would require pre booking and leaves around 11 daily. Only suggestion is that we had a rather large group around ~18 despite some told it will be 12~15.

Super fun!. My husband and I took a bike tour of the countryside. Although it rained the entire time, the panchos Mike's provided were awesome, they kept everything dry. The ride was gorgeous. We stopped at a family farm and saw how the Gouda cheese is made. We also visited a clog factory, which was very cool. We learned about reclaimed land and the dyke system. My only complaint is we didn't have enough opportunities to take pictures. We were told at the beginning of our ride not to take pics while we were on our bikes because we would stop and be able to take plenty of pictures. Other than the cheese factory and visiting one windmill, we never stopped. Other than this, it was really fun!

Excellent group tour. Excellent our guides were very knowledgeable - Stuart and Aaron. We did it as part of a Topdeck Tour group optional extra. Not the best rider but after a few minutes i was ok. We weren't on too busy streets
Great way to see Amsterdam . A relaxed, easy tour which gave great insight to Amsterdam. Jeff and the team were fab. The best bike tour I've done in Europe!

Counrtyside. When we knew we were going to Amsterdam-we knew we would do a bike tour. I'm rating it as EXCELLANT because the tour, the guide and the bikes were EXCELLANT! I would have liked it better if it started at 10:00 instead of 11:00 only to have given us the opportunity to get in one more sight seeing activity that day. Also, our group of 15 or more was too large with just one guide. I love biking but biking with the crazies in Amsterdam was something else. I got lost once and yelled at twice and I do know bike etiquette! Still-loved it!

A great way to see the countryside!. After seeing how crazy cycling in the city centre was we decided to go on a biking tour out to the suburbs and I'm so glad we did - the tour was great fun!! We cycled to a windmill and then to a cheese farm / clog makers which were both great to see, and then through the olympic park and the 'hippy park'. The route was really enjoyable as it was mainly down quiet, flat roads and the tour guide was really friendly and informative. This was one of my favourite experiences in Amsterdam and I think doing this alongside the city sightseeing is a must.

Feel like a local!. OK - They will know you're not a local on a rental bike, but who cares?This is hands down the best/ easiest way to see Amsterdam.The wife & I rented 2 bikes for 48 hours, and I believe it was apx 60 Euro?Not bad for 2 days of transportation. We rode EVERYWHERE! They include a lock and sell you on the " insurance " , what ever works, I didn't want to be on the hook for a 400 + Euro bike.Got the bikes, ran around town, and took em back. Couldn't have been easier!

The best way to explore and learn!. Jeff did and excellent job as our tour guide throughout the 3½ hours nice, sunny, yet chilly Sunday guided city tour. He told good and informative stories surrounding Amsterdam's history in an un-even way, many funny anecdotes to season the trip. Even though the traffic in Amsterdam is crazy, we managed to get around safely, and Jeff always gathered the group and had the full overview the entire time. The pace was adequate yet we still drove around 20 km.Take this trip!
Amazing way to see the city!. Great way to see the city and our guide had excellent knowledge. Definitely recommend to anyone visiting.

A Mixed Bag. If you want to be a part of a captive audience for a boorish farmer who will try to sell you cheese and clogs, this tour is for you. I suppose the one hour stop on his run down farm boosts Mike's earnings, but I really resented that a paid-for tour would have a stop like this. The souvenir shop plays, like most others, only to outdated stereotypes. Also, there was really no place at the farm to eat the food Mike had encouraged you to bring because the two picnic tables were covered in a hardened green slime of some sort. I guess Mike expects you to eat while standing, like the cows. But how was the play Mrs. Lincoln? Actually, not bad. Peter, our tour leader, was very knowledgeable, interesting, and well-spoken. I also think he's a man of integrity who's not fully bought into the farm stop. And, of course, riding through the bucolic polder so close to central Amsterdam on a nice day can't really be beat!

Yes!. My friend and I had a flight delay in Amsterdam last Sunday which caused us to have a free day to explore the city. Mike's Bike Tours was thee best thing we could have done. Our tour guide was the guy from Canada and he was hilariously fantastic. I can't think of a better way to see this fabulous city. Side note: you better get a fast start for riding over the canal bridges. Some of them are steep!

Best part of our trip to Amsterdam. My husband & I spent 5 nights in Amsterdam back in early September and we both were excited to book a cycling trip while there. So we did our research on Trip Advisor and found Mike's Bike Tours and it was only a 30 minute walk from our hotel. So we walked there the day before we wanted to take the tour and booked it for the following day! It was everything we were hoping for and more! Started the tour at 11:00 am, which gave us plenty of time to walk to Mike's Bike Tours and even had time to grab a late breakfast right around the corner. Bike tour took us out of the city and into the surrounding country side of Amsterdam. Stopped a wind mill for pictures and then at a local dairy farm where we got to taste a bunch of his artisan cheeses...oh my stars...was the best cheese ever! We loved it so much we bought some to bring back to Canada , so it toured with us all through out Europe for almost 4 weeks. Because it was wrapped in wax, it made it home safely! There was also a clog demonstration at this local farm and a great gift shop where you could purchase their cheese and clogs and lots of other amazing souvenirs! Then we had time at this farm to eat our lunches that we brought along out on some picnic tables they had there for all the cyclists on our tour! Had a lovely trip back to the city and we were so thankful we booked such an amazing biking tour. Lots of fun and great way to see Amsterdam and country side! Would definitely book with Mike's Bike Tours on our next trip to Amsterdam!

City bike tour. We did the city bike tour but because our daughter was 10 we had to do a private tour. The difference was that the guide only lightly touched on the red light district and we didn't ride through it. Our tour was great. We did it on the first full day we had in Amsterdam and the information and history given on tour was very helpful for our following days in the city. We knew where things were and what we wanted to go back to. Amsterdam is a fabulous city for bike riding. Bikes rule, and everyone gives way to the bikes. Very safe and easy riding, and the bikes are so comfortable. It's a bit weird at first because you sit upright and your seat is low so you can touch the ground with both feet. The design of the bikes make this work though. Very cruisy and fun.

A Bikers Paridise. I am a business owner of Seattle Bicycle Tours and this was my first stop to check out Amsterdam. Sam was our groups guide and did a great job navigating us through the most amazing bicycle pathways I have ever experienced. Seeing breathtaking views and crazy Dutch buildings and genius ingenuity I was in awww of Amsterdam and thank Sam for teaching me the bike edict and history of the Dutch. What a people, I love them. This should be your first stop to learn the amazing bike ways and some Dutch culture then when you are on your own you can rent a bike from Mikes. You must have a bike here bikes rule. I am already planning my next trip back. See you again, Thank you Mikes Bike Tours you guys are awesome.

Great tour, great people. I did the city tour with Geoff as my guide, we had a small group just 12 of us, I arrived at the meeting point and was rather nervous but I loved every minute of it, best way to see Amsterdam and Geoff was a great guide, very relaxed and good fun, we spend sometime having refreshments at the windmill and getting to know all the other people,Thank you mikes bikes, you made my holiday

Fabulous!. We had a wonderful afternoon with Sam!! He was a complete professional, including us to laugh, learn and all in all have a wonderful afternoon on the Countryside Tour. We highly recommend this as not only a reprieve from the bustle of the city but also to get an interesting view into the life of one of the last cheese/clog makers, and some interesting and noteworthy sights outside Amsterdam. Would do again!! We did two tours during our stay, this was our favorite.

A great way to see the City.. My wife (51) and I (58) have just had a great city bike tour around Amsterdam with Geoff. His approach is relaxed, at times irreverent and thoroughly entertaining. You will learn about Amsterdam and it's past, but he'll throw in a fair amount of more recent 'history' and social comment that lifts the tour out of the ordinary. It's great value for money, explores some of the less 'touristy' streets and gives an interesting insight of modern Amsterdam.If you're easily offered then don't go. Sex, drugs and rock'n'roll are all part of Amsterdam's vibe and life, and any tour that ignores this so as not to offend isn't truly representing the city. Geoff puts it all into perspective from a personal viewpoint and leaves you thinking that other cities / countries could learn something (even if you don't personally agree with each and everything). Don't do this tour if you're going to stress about timetables. Our three hour tour happily turned into a four hour tour as our group (between the ages of 20 - 60 I'd guess) generally got on well, enjoyed Geoff's chatty presentational style and relaxed for quite some time at the windmill / IJ Brewery, where I can thoroughly recommend the beer, sausage and cheese!

A must-do!. I went on the bike tour to the countryside with two other female friends and we had a wonderful time. Do not be intimidated by the "cyclopaths" you may encounter in the city. The bulk of this trip is spent out in the open, riding along scenic paths and taking in gorgeous views of the Dutch countryside, as opposed to dealing with oncoming traffic and negotiating the narrow, cobbled streets with hordes of tourists and fellow cyclists. We made a stop at De Riekermolen, a historic polder drainage windmill that dates back to 1636, and the visit to the cheese farm and clog factory was most enjoyable - I even got to feed the cows! The farmer Roel is quite the character; at one point he grabbed my phone and proceeded to take selfies. All in good fun, and entertaining nonetheless! Plus, he makes seriously good cheese. Speaking of food, be sure to pack a small lunch to bring on this journey. The bikes we got had a basket in the front, which was very convenient as I was able to place my small messenger bag and lunch in it for the ride. All the bikes had proper names, so if you see "Coffee Racer", say hi for me!Last but not least, our guide Sam was wonderful. He was affable and willing to answer tons of questions. He quickly sprung into action when a senior lady in our tour got separated from the group by following local cyclists at a busy intersection. In the end, we all made it back safe and sound, and happy to have chosen Mike's Bike Tours.  I'd definitely be interested in longer bike tours to the Dutch countryside, if they were to offer them.

Amsterdam country tour. Aaron was a congenial and knowledgeable guide. He was well versed in the history and modern issues of the area we travelled. We had a better tour than we anticipated. Thanks to Aaron and Mike's Amsterdam Bike Tours. The cheese maker/farmer was a bit cheesy but the wooden clog making was interesting.

Country tour is excellent fun!. I went on Mike's Country Tour on a solo visit to Amsterdam. It was the cheapest such tour I could find (€25) and I must say worth every penny and more. The crew are extremely friendly and helpful and our tour guide, Pete was extremely knowledgeable and amusing! The ride itself is not at all strenuous and the views in and out of town are lovely. The windmill is a nice pitstop for photos but the highlight is the cheese and clogs farm tour with the eccentric multi-lingual farmer! Throughly reccomended!

Excellent half day out. We were 32 in two groups, well organized, good bikes, the countryside tour is about 4 hours with one hour rest at a cheese farm. Not difficult at all and the proof is I did it. A must do in good weather. The guide is nice. Informative and always checking that everything is safe and in order

Cruise at a casual pace.. I visited Amsterdam in September and had an included bike tour from my holiday group. We had Mike's bike tours as our rentals, this was an awesome experience. We had a fantastic leader who was funny, informative and help us whenever we needed it. His knowledge of the dammed city was extensive and he was only to happy to answer our questions. Give a bike tour a go next time you visit, and i highly recommend looking up Mikes for a ride, cheers!
Tour the city like a local. Very fun way to tour the city. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and clearly loved Amsterdam and its people. Highly recommend the tour.

Best Part of Amsterdam Trip. No trip to Amsterdam should be complete without this tour. Can't recommend it enough. Our guide was full of life and information. Pacing was good for the beginner bikers but a bit slow for the rest of us due to necessity. The countryside was stunningly beautiful.Hop on and enjoy the ride.

Great ride through Holland countryside! . From the moment we arrived our guide was friendly, upbeat, and genuinely excited to do the tours. He explained the basics of the bikes (7 speed, very easy), and what to do if you become separated (you have to ride through city to get out in the country). We went off with a group of about 14, riding through the country, stopping at an old windmill, a cheese making / shoe making (wooden clogs) farm, and a few other beautiful spots.The farmer making the shoes was incredibly charismatic and entertaining, couldn't take our eyes off him! Afterwards you go through the gift shop where you sample cheese that they make and can buy it for €8 for a small wheel or €11 for a larger one; that cheese is great! Highly recommend this tour, don't forget to pack a lunch (not included and nowhere to purchase on the way)! There are saddlebags and handlebar bags on all the bikes so it's easy to bring everything along. Thanks Aaron for making this ride memorable!

Great cycle tour. Lovely tour great way to see Amsterdam and went all over the city from residential areas,canal routes, parks and even the Red Light district.Mike was knowledgable and very interesting and managed to keep all 18 of us together --- well most of the time!Bikes were well maintained and we were even treated to a beer towards the end of the tour.Thanks Mike.

Nice scenery. Our guide Sam was great. Rainy day but fun. If you ride a lot your own lighter bike is likely to spoil you compared to a rental bike. Relatively rear saddle position relative to the crank makes for some extra knee work. Low gear (big cog in back for the non bikies) was locked out apparently intentionally. Ride is basically flat terrain though. Some care needed in traffic as you get out of the city.
Excellent Bike Tour. We recently went to Amsterdam and had a bike tour with Maria Teresa, she was awesome, she was always attentive and was knowledgable. I wold recommend it to friends and family.

Wheelie great bike tour. Chose Mike's bikes to do a bike tour in the countryside mainly because I couldn't find any others that were still offering the countryside tour on the day we wanted to go. And how glad were we that we went with Mike's bikes ...VERY. The shop was easy to find, the staff were friendly and helpful and our guide Sam was fabulous. He was very funny, knowledgable, down to earth and just a really interesting guy. The tour took us cycling down the Amstel river first to a windmill and then to a cheese farm where they also made clogs. The farmer was definitely a character and there shop where they sold cheese, clogs and souvenirs were very reasonably priced. I bought a little clog shoe key ring which was 1,50 euro. In the souvenir shops in the city they were charging anything between 4 and 5 euros! I thought the tour was then over and we'd be cycling back to the city however we carried on further out of the city and then into their Forrest. Stopping along the way on several occasions for Sam to show us things or explain bits about where we were. Had a fabulous time and would thoroughly recommend them not just for the countryside tour, they hire out bikes and also do city tours. Go try them out you won't be disappointed.
Nice Ride. Excellent tour of the countryside. Our guide Pete was very informative and showed enthusiasm during the ride.
Very competitive prices and nice people. We really enjoy biking in Amsterdam, first of all the renters were super nice, the bikes in good shape and at the right price!

Zippin through Amsterdam!!!. What a terrific day in Amsterdam being led by our really, really great tour guide, Stuart!! He gave us a fun, safe outstanding day, biking up and down the beautiful tree lined streets with the canals right in the middle... We had a small group of only 9 and Stuart shared his amazing knowledge and provided great interesting facts of this fun city. The staff made sure you were very comfortable on your bike, fit you well and Stuart always made sure we were safe at all times even though there was no concern at all about being safe in Amsterdam. Everyone is so friendly and biking is the thing to do... everyone uses a bike! Would highly recommend Mike's next time you want to take a tour here in Amsterdam!!! We had a fun day!

Awesome way to see more of Amsterdam! . We just spent the day being guided around Amsterdam by our fantastic guide Peet. His history knowledge was amazing, and his Dutch/Canadian humour made the day great fun. Cheese, Clogs & Windmills, and the sunshine joined us too. Highly recommend! Thanks to Peet again for a top day! Lisa & Matt

A must when visiting AMSTERDAM. Had a really good tour guide with modern bikes it was a beautiful day and was great to see the country side of Amsterdam. We visited the cheese making factory and they had the best cheese ever! The sites and knowledge of our guide was great, learned a lot and is great for all ages.Just remember to bring lunch we didn't.

Don't be a tourist, be a traveler!. I have rented a bike for 24 hours at Mike's because by the time I got to Amsterdam, all tours were done for the day. So I took a bike, a map and started exploring on my own.The guy at Mike's marked known spots on the map and approximate times and it was really helpful. I had the best experience biking through the canals and streets of Amsterdam. If you're in Amsterdam, a city full of bikes, you have to have to have to do a bike tour or rent a bike and go exploring. It's the best way to be at Amsterdam. You won't feel like a tourister, you feel like a traveler. My Best Regards to Mike's team.

Countryside Tour. We had a great time. Mike (the lady not the man) was a cracking guide. The weather wasn't a problem with excellent ponchos and great bikes. While the clog and cheese making was interesting, the ride through the polder country and forest was by far the best thing. Happy to recommend it to anyone.
Great Way to see Amsterdam. This was the best bike tour we had been on. Loved it. The scenery was great, the bikes were comfortable and our guide made it even more interesting and entertaining.

Thanks Mike!. Had a fantastic time on the city bike tour with Mike, she was a great guide with good historical and cultural information about the city. Would definitely do the tour again and would recommend to anyone looking to get an insight into Amsterdam!

Bike tour that lives up to their reputation. Super knowledgeable guides who enjoy what they do. Fun activity. If you show your Amsterdam Card they give you 10% discount. Free WiFi in the shop that you can use while you wait for your tour to start. Guides also share their tips on good places to eat around town.

The only way to see Amsterdam. Called in to see them on the off chance they could fit me in, and they did. We had Karl with a K who was great and also had a sense of humour:) Only 4 of us on the tour which was great. Unfortunately, it started to rain after half an hour but we were provided with rain macs which were great and kept you dry. Would highly recommend this company. I did the 2 hour tour which was more than enough as I was only in Amsterdam for 2 days.

Fantastic!. Went on a city bike tour of Amsterdam and loved it! Despite being a rainy Monday morning our tour guide Sam did a fantastic job in lifting our spirits and showing us around the city. He is both funny and knowledgeable and would definitely recommend him (and the company) to anyone!

Christine's 40th Birthday. We had a ball. We were a small group of 5 ladies on a 40th birthday trip. Our tour guide was Karl and he was fantastic. We had a safety brief to start, which was great. We then got our bikes and were off. My word what an experience. We cycled all over Amsterdam, taking in the sights and sounds, it was truly brilliant. Thanks to Mike and his team. It is a must for travelling to see Amsterdam, and because it is a smaller company, you don't get given a bright yellow bike and have to join a group of 20 or more!! Fantastic.

The way to explore Amsterdam. We took a basic tour around the city. Our guide was Sam and we loved him! He was making jokes all the time, took us to all most important places in the city and provided us with brief history in each stop, took us to a cool bar in a windmill at the end and we loved it. He gave the whole group a good introduction speech on what to do and not to do if we lose the group on the traffic lights, gave us good safety tips for the crazy Amsterdam traffic and well we survived so I guess he did a good job. I wish if he included some practical tips such as restaurants to go to and stuff like that and if he maybe showed us on a map where will we go so that we could easily find these places later on our own.We felt safe all the time, had such a good fun thanks to Sam, bicycles were good and comfortable, we think it's a good value for the price and definitely recommend Mike's bike tours :)

Excellent. We had lady Mike, she was fantastic! Very informative and kept us laughing the whole time. This is a great way to learn more about Amsterdam and see everything else the city has to offer. Also it was good to get out of the city for a couple of hours. Riding in Amsterdam is very busy and can be a little crazy, however I felt safe and enjoyed the ride.

Mike's Bike Amsterdam Tour. This tour was amazing! It definitely is a must do. You hit all the sights and you get an idea of the lay out of the city. The tour was scheduled for 12-3 and my group went to 3:30! I booked this via Viator.com. My tour guide was Diego and he was awesome! He knew so much history and brought us to a brewery with a big windmill called Brouwerij. Had great local beer! There are a ton of bikers in amsterdam so i would not suggest a bike tour to somebody who is not comfortable on a bike.
Great fun. Karl was our guide and he kept us laughing much of the tour. Wonderful way to see Amsterdam. The booking process online was easy. This was one of the funniest things we did in Amsterdam.

Thanks Karl!!. Found Mike's online and decided to give the bike tour ago since my dad and I love cycling. We had a blast! Our tour guide Karl told us a bit of history but not too much so we didn't fall asleep while he was talking. Great funny guy! We did both the city and country tour with Karl. Would definitely recommend a tour with Mike's and get Karl if you can!

The best way tou see the city. We were 6 friends and we booked the City Tour. It felt like the right way to see Amsterdam, the city which it seems that there are more bicycles than people! Our guide was Jeff, and he had a lot of stories and information, but more important - he told them clearly and with a lot of humor . We really enjoyed it... It was the best attraction we did in the city.

Neat Bike Tour. Our guy was Mike, one of two tour guides. She was quite knowledgable of the city of Amsterdam. Lots of personal experinces throughout the ride. Nice leisurely pace and we did a little over 2 hours. We were not looking for a full day ride, just an overview of places to return to later in the trip. I highly recommend the ride. Mike even turned away a few late arriving sign ups rather than put us through another safety talk. Only 7 people on our ride. They even had rain gear ready when it started to drizzle.

Could have been better. Biking in Amsterdam is a stressful experience. Bikes, cars, trams and mopeds whizz by in a chaotic way, and I'm an experienced biker! The city tour was ok, but I think it would be a different experience depending on which guide you get. I guess this one did not have one of her better days...

What a great tour . OK this is my 4th trip to Amsterdam and this tour is the best thing I've ever done in town. They take through the entire city and you see it all. Laid back tour guides, no agenda, and even a stop at a pub. One tip would be try to ride near the front of the pack. My group had 15 people and part of the time I was the last guy, and part of the time the first guy, much smoother near the front.

Highlight of the trip. Booked online with Mike Tours before arriving in Amsterdam. Arrived for a midday bike tour and we were greeted by our tour guide Pete. We were suitably kitted out for the weather conditions with a Poncho and given a pre cycle briefing. There was around a group of 12 of us which followed Pete around the city. We stopped at various points and were given some history about the different parts which broke up the cycling. Towards the end of the cycle we enjoyed a few cold beverages in a local bar which went down well making the tour last around four hours. Well worth the money spent. Ridding in the city is a bit daunting to start with but once you've got to grips with the fact that you just need to have eyes everywhere its an enjoyable and fun way to see the place. Despite the monsoon rain shower we cycled in this was by far the best way to tour the city and a must do whilst in Amsterdam. Highly recommended.

Nice chilled out tour of the city . We went on the bike tour as part of a top deck tour. We were in a group of 14. I'm guessing if we just came on our own we would probably have been in a smaller group.The bikes were in good condition and better than the ones we had on our last bike tour.The tour itself let us see a good amount of the city and was at a leisurely pace. The guide didn't really talk to much about the places so it was more of just looking around than actually learning about the sites. All in all an enjoyable tour.

Enjoyable ride through Amsterdam's suburbs and countryside. My husband and I had a really enjoyable tour with Mike's Bikes. We took the 11am tour and road through the suburbs of Amsterdam and then visited a cheese farm and watched clogs being made. Our guide was Peter and he gave very informative feedback about the areas we rode through.It was recommended that we bring something for lunch as we were riding over the lunch period. We ate lunch at the cheese farm. Great experience.

Great way to tour the city!. We took the afternoon tour with our guide Diego and about 14 people. Diego took us to all the interesting sights and gave us great insights into the city's history. The bikes were fine and the bicycling was relatively easy. The pre-tour instruction about bicycling around Amsterdam was essential.

My favorite part of my trip to Amsterdam. This was by far the best part of my vacation to Amsterdam. This was my second time going to Amsterdam and the city isn't that big so I wan't to get out and enjoy the countryside a bit more. The staff at Mike's are extremely patient and well versed. They made the trip fun. Roundtrip the country tour is approximately 18 miles and I'm not in the best of shape and had no problems at all. The terrain is easy and flat and the scenery is amazing! I was a bit intimidated in riding a bike in the city, but it's not far from Mike's until you are in the country. The group stays together so no one gets left behind. Thanks to the wonderful guides at Mike's!

Obviously the best way to see Amsterdam. Bikes are king in Amsterdam and what better way to get around than a bike tour.
