You could just rent a bike, but dealing with the traffic including all the other bikes would be trying for the neophyte.The bikes are California cruisers, if you want to ride Dutch bikes try another company. They are well maintained. The staff are knowledgeable and actually quite funny.WARNING. The afternoon tour includes a walk through the red light district which despite all the tourists is a working red light district. If that offends you take another tour.There is a nice visit to a Brewpub under a windmill at the end.
Best way to see the city. Highly recommended. Our guide Mike was amazing and very informative. Bikes are really cool and we got to see parts of the city we didn't even know about. Be at the back ;)

Blessed biketour. What a nice way to explore Amsterdam! I did the biketour on a sunny day and it was wonderfull, our charming guide Diego gave us an insight in the mentality of Amsterdam. I loved biking underneath the 'rijksmuseum' and by the water. The guide gave very interesting comments, created a great atmosphere, and we finnished with a beer!

Did 2 tours!. We did the city tour the first day we arrived and enjoyed it so much, booked the country tour for the next day. The bikes are easy to ride, the terrain flat as expected, and the guide excellent. We had Karl both days and he was a great guide and a lot of fun. Suitable for all ages and all weather. Rain ponchos provided for if (or when) it rains. Don't let that put you off, you won't get wet.
Glad I Biked in Amsterdam. Great way to see city and get to know its biking culture. Mike and his team are awesome. Be smart, follow their lead and you will have a great time!

Cool way to see the city. To say that Amsterdam is a nightmare to navigate is an understatement so it was great to be taken around some of the major sights with a guide who knew exactly where they were going. As with any tour with a local we got some cool stories which you would never hear without a guide. Travelling in a group of around eight people was perfect and our guide gave us some great tips on the best places to get food and also gave honest opinions on sights which were worth paying for, or not as the case may have been.

The tour that rides in the rain!. To say the weather wasn't co-operating would be an understatement. We were worried that it would be too bad to even start the tour but we were all equiped with rain gear and saddled up to forge on with our trusty tour guide Peter. My husband and I are not novices to the bike tour scnene.....it's really the first thing we do when we come to a city and unpack in our apartments. Peter was wonderful, adding humer and historic information at every stop. Some people just didn't get the joke.....perhaps they just need to lighten up. Amsterdam is a very tolerent and progessive thinking community....as the saying goes....when in Rome.....you get my meaning.The tour was great! Rain, wind and anything else.....bring it on. Peter knows the city and the 3 hour tour went by like nothing at all. If we lost bikers at lights, he waited and rescued. He never lost sight of our crew....as annoying as it was every once in a while.Last stop was an infamous "brown cafe"....he layered up the bikes, locked them up and we stolled in like royalty. A couple of shots and beers and we were dried up and ready to ride back to our starting base. Let me tell you the rain was coming down in buckets at this point. Good thing we were out when we were cause the last 1km ride was the wettest of the tour!No matter, worth the tour, rain or shine......absolutely a great time :)If you can't take a joke.......stay home!Ed and GretaGeorgetown, OntarioCanada
Scenic, Countryside and Suburb RIde. Had a fun few hours on comfortable seated bikes with friendly guide - Mike the lady with the Spiky Hair. A little steep in price for what it is.

Lovely way to see Amsterdam. I really enjoyed this tour and would definitely reccomend a bike tour for your visit to Amsterdam! I am not a great cyclist and I managed it. I was expecting a bit more information about Amsterdam throughout the tour. 19 euro for students was the best price we found.
Fantastic bike tour around city of Amsterdam. This tour was fantastic. An engaging and entertaining guide (Mike) made cycling around the beautiful city of Amsterdam a highlight of my trip.

Great way to see the city. We did the 11 AM city bike tour with Diego. We broke into a small group of about 8 people which was perfect! Before going on the tour I was very nervous about riding a bike in Amsterdam but Diego did a great job keeping the group together and making sure we were all safe. It was the perfect way to see all different areas in the city and learn a lot about Amsterdam and its history. Diego was very knowledgable and had great stories. We loved the stop at the windmill brewery towards the end! Great tour, well worth the money!

The best way to enjoy a short city break.. You know the feeling when you head into a city on a short break, you hit all the 'attractions' but still come back without a feeling of having actually enjoyed? If you can relate then this tour is the best way to beat that feeling.I highly recommend the city bike tour and the countryside tours, content wise you'll have a lot covered in a relatively short duration of time, without feeling rushed.The tours are organised by a bunch of pros who know what they are doing and have some of the coolest personalities.I really enjoyed the gentle cycle rides through the city and the country side. The cheese farm was not what I had thought it'd be, but hey! that's what travel is all about! Keep an open mind and you'll certainly have a great time!

A chilled and fun way to explore the countryside around Amsterdam. We had a brilliant time on our bike tour around Amsterdam and the surrounding area. Pete, our guide was very friendly and provided lots of interesting facts. The pace of the tour was very chilled and we had plenty of time to take pictures and admire the scenery. Half way through, we stopped at a local farm and were able to sample some homemade cheese and watch the farmer make a set of wooden clogs! Would definitely recommend for anyone looking to understand the city a little more and experience some beautiful countryside as well.

Great experience. What a super way to see Amsterdam! We had a great tour with Jess as our guide on a beautifully hot sunny day. There were about 10 of us on the tour and Jess was really informative, friendly and helpful (thanks for the recommendation for where to grab something to eat after the tour!). We stopped off half way at a craft brewery in a windmill which was fab. Would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam and would do it again, it was such good fun.

Great tour. Have done a few bike tours on our trip and this one was something different. Cheese making, clog making and touring the countryside. Our guide Sam was funny and informative. We actually arrived late and thought we had missed it. The team were able to still get us on the tour. Awesome group of people working there!

Really good tour . Amazing tour of the outskirts of Amsterdam on bikes. Lots of great sights and good information. We also got to stop at a cheese and clog factory. The tour guide Mike (a lady) was great

Countryside tour. Great tour. Safe, informative, fun and good exercise. Mike's Tour Co. was professional, they answered every email quickly. The tour started right on time. Our guide, Girl Mike, was funny and gave us lots of info about the area. I wish I'd had time for the city tour as well.

Fabulous bike tour - great organization!. Sam took our large group on a combo city/country tour. He helped us safely navigate the streets and told use great stories about the history of the city. This tour was a highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. Thank you Sam and Mike!

Awesome Countryside Bike Tour with Karl!. I really wanted to cycle in Amsterdam but I was a little intimidated at the thought of trying to navigate all the other cyclists on the road. The Country Bike tour was the perfect solution!Our guide Karl was excellent, very charismatic and entertaining. He had tons of extra cool facts he gave me while I was riding behind him. He constantly made sure everyone was happy and comfortable.The cheese farm/ clog factory is really interesting thanks to the super eccentric farmer. He's a bit odd, but very friendly.It's a good idea to pack some snacks for the break in the middle.

FANTASTIC MINI TOUR!!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!. My wife and I booked this tour only 1 day in advance and when we went to the location everything went VERY smooth.We had a bit of trouble finding it since we are from Canada, but I didn't expect to know where everything was anyways.We were given a brief introduction about what we will be looking at and the rules of the tour. Our tour guide gave us a rundown of what he expected from us (staying in single file, giving the right of way to certain people on the road, etc.). He was very polite and professional. He has a very obvious North American accent, but said he had been living in Holland for 26 years (we are from just outside of Toronto and knew the city we came from).On the tour itself, our tour guide was always looking back to make sure the group was still together. He never had to stop because our group was pretty good at getting around. Two girls did get booted from the tour. Not sure why, but our guide mentioned that if he doesn't feel we can handle a bike then we will not be allowed to go on the tour as we were going at 4PM which is rush hour.We stopped in many different districts. Our guide gave us a very brief, but detailed rundown of the history of certain districts and laws such as legal prostitution in the Red Light District and marijuana tolerance. Our guide also made a few funny jokes to lighten up the mood.I would recommend this place highly to anybody who wants to see a complete overview of the city of Amsterdam and just a bit of its history. This was the mini city tour which lasted 2 hours, but totally worth it. If I knew it was going to be that good I would have booked the full tour. AWESOME!!!

You must do this!. Just brilliant! Jeff was a great guide! We were in a group of 11 great people and spent over 3 hrs exploring the city. A much needed beer was a great way to get to know your group and share your experiences of Amsterdam.
Recommended if first time in Amsrerdam!. Great way to see the city and the outskirts of the city, it is a fun and funny tour. Not too hard, from inexperienced to experienced riders.

City Tour. These guys (and girls) are great! Entertaining while in the shop, and entertaining and informative on the tour. Not only do the share their knowledge of the city and it's history, if you hang around afterwards they'll also recommend places to eat, other places to see, etc. Will definitely be going back to to the "Country Tour" before I leave.Money well spent!
Fine Bike Hire Place. Really cheerful and helpful staff and well maintained bikes, making a trip to Amsterdam memorable and fun. Great cycling territory. Value was fine.

Fantastic way to see the city . We thoroughly enjoyed our trip to Amsterdam and the bike tour led by Jessica. She was friendly, helpful, knowledgable and had a good sense of humour as well as making us feel safe in this busy city!We saw so much and even had time for a beer by a windmill! I would thoroughly recommend this company and will definitely use them again.
Bikes best way to see Amsterdam . Tons of fun and tour guides terrific. We took the city and country guides and enjoyed ourselves immensely...highly recommended for all!!
Jeff Was Awsome. I had Jeff as my tour guide. He was really knowledgable about everything culture and history about the city of Amsterdam. He is definitely living life to the fullest Amsterdam style

A must do to experience the culture of amsterdam! . I was a little nervous to get on the bikes, not having biked since I was a child but I was completely fine after a few minutes. I suggest starting with the countryside tour as we did, to get used to the bikes as navigating the busy city roads of amsterdam can be a bit intimidating. Sam, our tour guide was friendly, funny, and knowledgable about the History of the countryside. The guy at the cheese and clog farm was rather creepy (his love for Asian women rubbed me the wrong way), but the cheese was amazing! Bring some bread and you have the perfect sandwich for lunch. I wish it was longer so we could see more of the countryside - it was beautiful!

City tour - highly recommended. I went on the 4 hour city tour - just turned up without booking. The guide was excellent, and it was a great way to explore the city with a group of other people.Finished up in a nice cafe in the Jordaan for a beer.

Best day in Amsterdam. We were blessed with warm sunny weather for our Cheese and Clogs tour. "K"arl was our tour guide and a great guy to hang out with. Easy flat ride. Had our 12 year old with us and he loved it as well. Make sure to pack a lunch - a bottle of wine goes well with the cheese! Offer some to your guide... :)

Jeff was Awsome. Jeff was amazing. Really knows what he is talking about and can answer any question you have weather it's about the culture or history of Amsterdam. Great guy and definitely living life.

Favorite part of our trip! . Lots of fun. Probably better for adults rather than families as some of the tour guides jokes wouldn't have been well suited to a younger audience. Our guide was friendly, knowledgable, and overall seemed to love his job. We did the countryside tour, although I've heard city tour is good as well. Might want to bring a backpack, as we did, in case you purchase souvenirs on countryside tour. I would highly recommend!

Countryside tour . Thoroughly enjoyed the countryside tour during our stay in Amsterdam. Our tour guide Aaron was friendly, funny and kept us well informed throughout the tour. There wasn't a huge amount of stops, but that suited us as we wanted to be out enjoying the countryside and views, rather than stopping every 2 minutes. We did stop off at the cheese and clog farm which was enjoyable and informative. As per their website, you do need to have some experience/confidence with cycling - mostly just to manage getting in and out of the city as the road systems can be quite confusing and chaotic to a tourist. The bikes were very comfy and easy to ride which all helps thoughWould definitely do it again

High expectations lived up to. My friends and I were visting for only a few days and were looking for a cheap, high quality bike tour to cover all the main attractions in Amsterdam. We chose Mike's Bike Tours as the city tour started at 12, which meant that we could get up later. The staff were knowledgeable and relaxed and made sure no one got left behind. Plus the bikes were so comfortable to ride on. We stopped for a break at a very nice brewery and the 3 hours flew by in the hot Amsterdam sun.

Amsterdam Countryside Tour. Great way to see Amsterdam outside the canal ring. We had a great guide (Pete) who had lots of excellent info to share and who always let us know what was coming up on the next segment. Our kids (age 10 and 13) had no trouble at all keeping up. The visit to the dairy farm midway through the trip was very well done - informative and authentic without a hard sell at the gift shop. Everyone else at Mike's was cheerful, entertaining and efficient. Highly recommended.

Countryside tour. This tour was a perfect way to escape the city and see the countryside. The cheese making and clog making were very interesting. Pete our tour guide was excellent as he empowered us at the end by explaining how to use the cycling routes on our own.

Good tour, guide could use some manners. I really wanted to give this a good review because the actual path of the tour was great. You get out of the city and visit a dairy farm where they make cheese. You also get to see the dutch clogs being made. The reason I could not give this tour a 5/5 was a couple incidents involving out guide. He was funny and had a lot of enthusiasm, I will given him that. The tour, however, started on a rather bad note when one biker decide to go back. When we were leaving, they saw her chain was broken and therefore she was delayed. Our guide proceeded to call her out in front of the entire group for being slow and needing to pick it up. If he had been paying attention he would have noticed what was happening before we left the shop. Biking the streets of amsterdam is a little intimidating at first and I think as a guide it is important to give people some time to get used to it. He instead mentioned her slowness again and she decided to go back. I really do feel like she would have become more comfortable once we got out of the city. I'm sure its frustrating to wait but when you work in the tourism industry you have to have some patience. I just really feel like what happened to this customer was not right. There were a couple other times when the group was crossing at a busy street and I felt that he should have waited for everyone. It is not possible for that large of a group to cross the street before the light changes and people get left behind. Overall, a good tour but the guides need to realize they're dealing with tourists who are not famililar with the area.

Fantastic way to see Amsterdam. Having been to Amsterdam a few times before and wanting to actually see the sights of the city and understand the history of the city, we decided on doing a bike tour. We are go glad we went on the City Tour ran by our guide Stuart. My fiancé is not a strong rider, but there was a very informative session at the start of the tour that put her at ease. Throughout the ride their were plenty of stops, so for people that are worried about lots of riding don't be concerned. It's a relaxed pace. The history of the city was covered as well as a few of the more recent developments. Great little touch to have a local beer at the end as well. Don't hesitate to book this tour. It's a great way to see the city

Great tour for all ages. We took the countryside tour with with Stuart and were not disappointed. He set a pace that worked well for the wide range of age and cycling ability of those on he tour. He gave good information about the history of Amsterdam and his affability made him a great tour leader. Good safety was observed on the tour.
They aim to please. This is our second time with Mike's Bikes, our first was in Germany.We love the energy, knowledge and flexibility of the guides. We would choose Mikes Bikes again in a second!

Brilliant Value for Money. Booked the "Countryside Tour" in order to experience a little more of Amsterdam than the city centre. So glad I did! As I'm not a confident cyclist I was glad to leave the chaos of the city, bikes, trams and scooters and enjoy the more peaceful cycle lanes of the surrounding coutryside. Super tour. Much enjoyed by my husband and teenage daughter with a brilliant guide (Vincent) who gave us just the right amount of information about the scenery we passed. I would thoroughly recommend this tour as a way to get a good overview of the country your visiting.

The best way to see Amsterdam !. Rent a bike or a tandem at least for a day ! It's the easiest way to move in Amsterdam !Too bad it's not possible to return the bikes after 17.30, we'd like to cycle longer !

Fun and easy way to see Amsterdam. Highly recommend this tour! I did this tour with my sister as a quick and easy way to see the sights of Amsterdam. Our tour guide Diago was excellent, he provided information on the history of the city as well as advice on what else to see and do in amsterdam. He was very funny, which made the trip all the better! A definite must in Amsterdam !!

Great tour. Mike's Countryside tour is the way to go. Biking in the city is kinda crazy. If you're unfamiliar with Amsterdam, pedestrians DO NOT have the right of way in the Netherlands -- you'll have trams, buses, bikes, cars, pedestrians to navigate. Doing the countryside tour is far less congested. You do have to bike out & then back into the city. Guides are great, funny & colorful(Karl). Stops along the way, the city is pretty flat so this is not strenuous. A stop for lunch(which you bring yourself) at a small dairy farm is great: tour the traditional cheese processing & dutch clog making(the farmer is one of three or four in the country doing these things the traditional way). Go early, buy tickets online in advance.

Entertaining bike tour. Our tour guide Stuart made this tour very enjoyable and pleasant for my friends and I. The tour took in some of the most well known cites of Amsterdam and brought us to places that I would not of been to if it wasn't for this bike tour. The staff at the rentals are very friendly and it is great value for money. Stuart was very informative and passionate about his job and this made the experience very enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Best day out!. I was nervous to book this city day tour as I haven't rode a bike for a long time but once I was on, it was like I never got off.The guides were all so nice & friendly. Great personalities & told us stories in such an interesting way. Loved learning about Amsterdam and riding past all the main sights. It was one of most memorable days out of my whole 6 week euro trip!The sausage and cheese at the beer garden afterwards was yummm too! The beer... not so much to my tasting.

16 mi. of very cool, action-packed excitement!. We chose the 4.5 hour country tour. What a blast! Our eccentric guide Mike (yes, Mike is female) was terrific. Don't let her spiky blonde hair exterior fool you. She is actually a world-travelled scuba diver and accomplished biking Dutchman. We stopped at a cool windmill and a neat cheese producing farm. The strange and funny farmer also makes authentic wooden shoes. The cheese was delicious. Awesome scenery and blissful family fun. Watch out going to and fro the city center. If you are a novice biker or a nervous mother, it will certainly challenge your sanity! Once outside the inner city bustle, the relaxing enjoyment really kicks in!

Bike tour. Brilliant tour Knowledgable guide... Regular break stops, so don't need to be fit! Visited a brewery at the end of the tour A good tour to do before renting out bikes yourself to get the hang of the roads! Best part of our trip!!!

Make this the first thing you do!. randoms. And we loved it! Was such a good way to get your bearings of the city - especially for first timers to Amsterdam. And it was even better to help us get used to everything being on the other side of the road (we are from nz). Diego was funny, and honest. We stopped at a brewery for a yummy and potent beer. My partner and I actually hired bikes from these guys for another two days after the tour. Biking is definitely the way to get around Amsterdam. And if you're nervous about it do a tour first. Diego helped us cross roads and intersections easily and made sure each and everyone of us were safe and with the group at all times! Thanks for a great day!! Fully recommend.

Best Thing I did in Amsterdam. So glad I did this! Cheap for what you get. The guides are very knowledgable and friendly. I did the countryside tour and it was nice to get a little out of the city and see beautiful Dutch scenery. Highly suggest!

Countryside Bike Tour is a must!. Thank you female Mike so much for the fabulous countryside bike tour. The best bike tour I have ever done and lovely to see another side of Amsterdam. Highly recommend this if you get a nice sunny day and fancy getting away from the city for a while. Mike's Bikes also teach you cycling etiquette for Amsterdam which is extremely useful for nervous cyclists - something which was lacking in other cities!! Ding ding!

Best way to experience the city - strictly for first timers. My husband and I had a splendid time with Mike's city bike tour. We enjoying riding in the middle of the city, around the dams, along the beautiful architecture and parks.The guide was very easy going and shared quite a few stories about the city and various stops we made about.If you have been here before or ride bikes regularly, I suggest you just hire bikes and buy cycle route maps...it may get boring for you to ride at slower pace and hear about the regular stories about the city. Tour ended with a stop at a lovely bar.Tips/ advice:- I believe it is best for first timers to the city- Not for you if you want to click a lot of photos on the way as that may not be feasible- try to book in advance and call if possible to make sure you know about any other additional tours on your chosen dates- Wear comfortable clothing and carry minimal baggage with you. Bottle of water is recommended.- There are no toilet or water breaks

Not worth it, just hire your own bikes. My family came to visit me in Amsterdam and I thought this bike tour would be a fun way to get them acquainted with the city. In reality we could have seen double the amount of sights on our own. The guide, while nice, spoke very softly and it was hard to hear what he was saying. On what was suppose to be a 3 hour tour, we saw a total of 4 sights, even though 15 are mentioned on the website. Being a resident of the city, I found the guide's choice of route very odd. At points, such as after leaving Vondelpark, we were taken on a very out of the way route with little scenery and riding for 20 minutes without stopping. In reality, he could have shown us Leidseplein and the Anne Frank house in route to the Jordaan (which is only a 5 minute bike ride from the park, if you take a route that makes sense) in half that time. In any case, it seemed as though the tour was drawn out to have us just riding around instead of actually giving a tour. And finally, I was a bit disappointed that all the other reviews mentioned ending at Brouwerij het Ij for a drink while we were brought to a basic spot just a few blocks from the bike store. I had gotten my family's hopes up that they would get to go, and we had plenty of time left! But again, it seems as though the easy thing was chosen over giving us an in depth tour.

Great way to spend a day. we booked this online the day before and had a great day with Sam as our guide. We did the countryside of Amsterdam tour and saw a totally different side of this city. He was a great guide and made sure we had a safe but interesting ride.

Could've just hired bikes. We did the 2 hour city tour and both my son and I felt we could have just hired bikes and cycled around ourselves based on the lack of stops and information given on this tour. Also the guide fancied himself as a comedian. Had I wanted to hear constant jokes I would have booked a comedy show. I have done may city bikes tours and this was by far the most disappointing. Based on our experience I could not recommend this tour.

Best way to see Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a cyclists' city, and as the locals know, this is the best way to get around the city. Lively and entertaining guides will keep you well-informed, and prevent you from embarrassing yourself as a rookie cyclist in Amsterdam. I did the countryside tour, and found it to be relaxing, not strenuous at all. We visited a farm which makes both cheese and clogs, and passed through some of the prettiest parts of the city. Highly recommended.

Great ride out of the busy centre. We did the tour out to the amsterdam country side and stopped off at a local cheese producer and wooden clog maker. Our guide (Pete) was full of stories, focused on our safety and enjoyment and this was the highlight of my stay in Amsterdam! Tip- They even offer ponchos to borrow just in case it rains on the tour!

Just Amazing. Just an amazing country side tour, easy ride, great views and places. Our experience started by email, quick and relevant info was provided by Michael, when arriving to Amsterdam, people try to convince us to take other tours or bike rentals, we went for Mike's as so far we had a very good response, at the store all the guys and girls were cool and friendly, the guide (Sam) was great and also funny, and if we talk about the price, also good price compare to other bike tours offers in the city.

Pete was a great guide!. The countryside tour takes you on a beautiful ride through part of the city and into the countryside. Pete offered several interesting facts and stopped at several locations to explain meaning. He ensured through group stayed together despite the hectic Amsterdam traffic. During the stop at the cheese farm, you encounter a delightful dutch family with a charming daughter and VERY eccentric father. They explain how the cheese is made and how the clogs are shaped. Pete then took us back into the city, explaining many landmarks along the way. He was very friendly and happy to take photos. Excellent experience!

City, Country side and clogs!. Took my aunt and her 3 friends on one of Mike's tours through the a bit of the city and out to the country side. We visited a farmer who makes clogs and sampled gouda. It was such a nice contrast of what Amsterdam has to offer. My aunt and her friends were novice cyclists and Mike did a great job of making them feel confident. Would definitely take another tour with Mike!!

Funnest thing ever. My sister and I took the three hour city tour today and it was 100% worth it! Our tour guide Diego was a lot of fun, constantly cracking jokes, but he also did a great job of making sure the group kept together and no one got left behind at intersections.The tour itself is a fantastic way to see Amsterdam and work out where you want to go back to. Every little while we stopped and the guide gave us some really interesting history about the area.The bikes are easy to ride, and the pace slow enough so that you don't get tired out. I would recommend being competent on a bike first however.I would recommend this tour highly, great value for money!

Awesome day!. We are a family of 6 and had Sam as our guide in the country tour. Had a great time, Sam was an incredible guide and we can't wait to eat our cheese we purchased! It was the highlight of our trip!

Ring my Bell :). Booked last minute as an activity to do in the rain....and boy did it ! Our tour guide was a guy called Stuart from Preston who was very knowledgable and good company. We were in a group of 15 people of all different nationalities which made the adventure more exciting.As stated the weather was a awful but the company provided water proofs which were great. We went on the country tour which included a visit to a cheese farm (much purchased ) and a windmill and other local sites outside of the city. Would really recommend this as a great family activity which lasts around 4 hours covering around 20 km.

Like a guided bike ride . Having been on at least one tour in some form in each city on my itinerary, I have come to certain expectations on what a tour should include. Our guide, Karl was almost like your embarrassing dad with his rubbish bill and ted like air guitar motions. When I go on a tour, I expect the guide to be knowledgeable about the history and culture of the city. Instead, we only learned about prostitutes, weed, a few churches, a bridge, the weigh house and why the buildings slanted. This may have been acceptable, if we weren't just aimlessly riding our bikes for about an hour. As the tour was two hours in duration, riding around for an hour may have been a trick to drag it out a bit longer. In short one of the worst tours we experienced and I feel Amsterdam has far more history than just weed and prostitutes!

Stranded in Amsterdam. My mom and I were towards the back of the group when we approached a traffic signal. When the light turned green, most of the group proceeded to cross but 4 of us were left behind. We struggled to see our group over the flood of people on bikes and we got separated. As hard as we tried to catch up, we had not seen which direction our guide went and we were utterly stranded. Luckily, we had a map in our bag and were able to navigate back to the shop.I want to highlight that the situation was handled very well by the owner. He was incredibly apologetic, gave us a full refund, and he had a stern discussion with our tour guide.Before the incident where we were separated, the tour was fantastic. The ride was leisurely (a tad more stressful in the heart of the city), scenic, informative, and fun. Besides his blatant negligence, he did a fine job. I wanted so badly to give a good review but I cannot get over the fact that we were stranded alone and our guide did not even notice we were missing.

Family fun and adventure. My husband, two sons (ages 13 and16) and I rented 4 bikes from Mikes Bikes. Mike's provided us with 4 sturdy, comfortable bicycles and 4 panniers so we could easily carry all of our things around the Netherlands. While I was researching and planning for our trip Bente, one of the staff, was very helpful and very patient in answering all of my questions over email and helping us to get the best bikes and accessories possible to support our trip.  We were very happy with Mike's customer service, their bicycles and their helpful staff . We would recommend Mike's Bikes to anyone who is doing a cross-country tour of the Netherlands and needs a sturdy, comfortable bike. The price was cheaper than shipping our bikes from Canada.

Amazing day in the "liquid sunshine". Our countryside tour was booked for the Tuesday following the worst wind storm in Amsterdam in many years. It was still windy and rainy by the time Tuesday came around and we were a bit hesitant to go on the trip but I am SUPER glad we did. Despite the rain and cold I couldn't stop smiling the entire day. we loved every second.Those of us without rain gear were loaned ponchos to wear to keep the rain off and after a quick lesson in how to ride a bike in Amsterdam we were given our bikes and set off (all the bikes have names, I rode Dr Freeze and my partner rode Milo). The initial ride through the city was very easy and helped us get used to the bikes and the roads and how to be considerate of other people on the roads. By the time we reached the countryside we were all confident and happy to chat and see the sights as we rode.Our guide for the day was Mike (not THE Mike, GirlMike) and she was AMAZING. She had so many stories to tell and was happy to answer any questions we had. She would stop the group every so often and tell us a bit about the sights and history of the area. If you're lucky enough to get her as a guide, take the opportunity and ride with her when you can, I got to hear some amazing and fun extra facts as we rode along. She always kept her eye on the group and knew where we all were, there was never a risk of us being left behind or lost.The farm we stopped at was from a different time. The farmer was obviously very smart and skilled and we loved learning about the cheese and clogs made there. Make sure to bring some money because you will want to do some shopping in their gift shop.The ride was long enough to wear us out for the rest of the day but was constantly over flat ground, there were no real hills so it was easy to get used to the gears and cruise along if you needed a break.TIPS:DON'T test your bell!!! They work and you will just annoy the neighbours.Bring food! While you can buy cheese at the farm the ride is long and goes over lunch time and theres no opportunity to buy anything really filling. We brought along a couple of sandwiches each and had them at the farm, after the tour.Bring water! Most bikes have a front pouch so it's easy to bring along a bottle of water and have it in easy reach.Learn which brake is which! It's not the same on every bike and you don't want to go over the front.If you intend to do some shopping at the souvenir shop at the farm, make sure you get a bike with saddle bags to carry your stuff in.Ask questions! The guides are there because they enjoy what they do and love to talk to you so make the most of it.I highly recommend the countryside tour and Mikes Bikes. a highlight of our trip for sure.

Entertaining and informative into to Amsterdam. This is the best way I can think of to be introduced to Amsterdam. Cruising around the streets on the bikes is a lot of fun and helps you figure out traffic rules that will help you in the rest of your stay. Our guide was awesome and he had some really good stories to tell! I highly recommend :)

Good bikes at a reasonable price. Easy to rental and reasonable bikes. We rented for 2 days within 10 minutes. I am sure it would have taken an hour for the paperwork in the UK!Bike came with 2 locks - one of which was heavy chain link. Serious security!We biked to Zandvoort via Haarlem and the bike worked well, although it did rain on the way back( I can't blame Mike's bikes for that)

See Amsterdam like a local. We chose to take part in the Amsterdam City tour which lasts approximately 3 hours including a pub stop. The is also a countryside tour and an abbreviated city tour. Our guide Karl was excellent in his description of the city sites. Anyone choosing this tour should feel confident on a bicycle before proceeding as you are on streets with cars, local bicycles and pedestrians. A restroom is available at the beginning of the trip and at the pub stop. Our group contained 12 people and because of the flat terrain was not strenuous. Karl provided numerous stops for commentary filled with little known but interesting facts about Amsterdam. This is not appropriate for young children as the commentary involves a truthful description of Amsterdam's Redlight District as well as the coffee houses.

Excellent tour. Beautiful day and Beautiful city tour, our guide Jessica gave us a tour of the key sights, provided some fun facts about Amsterdam. Overall excellent tour the staff was great definitely help us understand how to get around in Amsterdam.Must do this tour and book in advance you tour or bike rentals as they end up being sold out quickly. Next time we will try the country tour

Good way to see outside the Amsterdam Centre. We travelled in a group of 5 and took the 4-hour countryside bike tour led by Sam. Attempting to cycle in the city before reaching the countryside without running anyone over or getting run over is certainly an experience in itself!We visited a windmill, a cheese making family run business who also made wooden clogs. We tried the very nice cheese and were entertained by a very friendly host with brilliant multilingual skill during the clogs workshop!If you go on this tour, remember to pack some light snacks and water. The bicycles come with a caddie at the front and/or on the sides.things.

City tour is a must!. Brilliant trip brilliant guide! We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! Very informative! 100s of company's to choose from but I will always recommend this one! Next time I go back I must do the farmers one!

Fantastic tour. We had Karl as our tour guide and we did the countryside tour.He was informative and fun. He took us to a windmill, a cheese makers and we we also able to do a longer ride through the forest due to having extra time. Fun fun fun!

Best way to see Amsterdam. The city tour itself was extensive - we covered many places in the 3 hour bike tour and did not feel rushed. Our guide Peter was fantastic - very insightful, friendly, funny (has the best one-liners) and was able to produce lots of fun facts and recommendations for the remainder of the time we had in Amsterdam. When back in Amsterdam, I look forward to booking in the countryside tour with Mike's Bike Tours.

Great to get out of the city. A huge turn out for the tour time, they split us into 3 groups. After the safety talk, we were on the way. Karl was a great guide, funny and very knowledgeable. We quickly left city proper and made our way to the country side; stopping at the cantilever bridge, a windmill and a cheese farm in the first half of our tour. We also rode through the forest. A lovely day seeing the country.

Awesome Experience!. With a small group of people from all over the world we discovered Amsterdam with bycicles under extreme conditions: it was ' Gay Pride' Parade and the City was crowded. Our guide Stewart directed us safely producing soap bubbles - sweet idea! Stewart was well informed and told us a lot about the city. Highly recommended!

VERY WONDERFUL CYCLE THROUGH THE COUNTRYSIDE. We took the 5hour countryside bike tour led by Pete. The pace was easy to follow, they were very informative in highlighting Amsterdam biking road rules to avoid any mishaps, and definitely very informative information shared along the way.The view was very impressive, and the frequent attempt to take a photo whilst cycling around the countryside was far safer than in the city. We visited a windmill, rode through beautiful surroundings with houses, lakes, and greenery, and also visited a cheese making family run business who also made wooden clogs. There we were highly entertained by the host at the farm who was full of jokes while educating was about cheese, and we had lots to taste.Really worth the time to soak in a different side of Amsterdam through this cycle.If you need, it would be good to pack some light snacks and water. The bicycles come with a caddie infront or on the sides, so you definitely have space to store things.

County side tour!. It started off as a wet and rainy day. I was worried I wasn't going to be able to do the tour with how hard it was raining, but the tour went on! The bike shop provided us with Panchos and they were a great way of keeping dry during the rain. I can't remember my tour guides name but he was great! He was from the UK and he was hysterical. That was my third time doing the tour and I will be back again.

City Bike tour with Jeff was awesome. The 3-hours bike tour around Amsterdam was great: we visited places I haven't yet seen when exploring the city on foot. Even though we covered quite a lot distance, the tempo was just perfect, and Jeff looked after us very well & made sure no one from our group got lost. So, 5 stars to Jeff.

Wonderful way to get to know Amsterdam . From the first emails Kate made us feel at home. Her husband Stuart took us on a fabulous tour of Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside...parks, farm, cheese and clog making. Their deep knowledge and thoughtful responses left us inspired about this place. Beyond the tour, they gave us great recommendations for how to spend time here too. Biking is always a terrific way to get to know a new city. It is an especially big part of the culture here. It was great to be in the flow.You will love this tour.

My Bike Tour Extraordinaire. I will always remember this bike tour and how great it is. The staff are knowledgeable locals and take care of their customers very well. It was informative historically and a great variety of country and city. Meisje Mike is the best! Very helpful staff! They are organized in their delivery of the bikes and very thoughtful when riding thru the streets to wait and make sure everyone is accounted for. Would recommend in a heart beat!

City Cycle Tour with Diego. I really enjoyed seeing the city sights of Amsterdam on a cycle tour, in a group of about 10 people. Our guide was Diego who I found informative and entertaining. The bikes were in good condition with bags attached and the company provided a wet weather Cape which was needed.

Countryside bike tour. This 4-hour bike tour was a great way of getting away from the usual sight-seeing and gaining another perspective on Amsterdam. It was one of the highlights of our stay. The route is flat and picturesque. The bikes are well-maintained and comfortable (no aches and pains the next day). Our guide (Sam) was very entertaining. Behind a laid-back/'anything goes', typically Dutch persona, his dark secret is that he is actually responsible/well-organised, safety-conscious and a good communicator. Although some of his commentary was 'near the knuckle', he created a very relaxed mood for the group on the tour, which added to the experience.

Great tours, terrific guides!. We were in Amsterdam for 4 days this month and the bike tours with Mikes are what we remember the most! We took both the city tour with Geoff (fabulous story teller and patient guide), and the countryside tour with Sam. We were encouraged to ride like the locals and with the super-comfortable bikes, a good grasp of the Amdam riding rules and conscientious guides, we were able to do that. This experience renewed my interest in biking, so much so that I am even buying my own cruiser to start biking at home.Bravo Mikes!

Very nice tour and tour guide!. Me and my two 20 year old friends went for the country side bike tour. We had Stewart as guide and he was great. Very friendly and knowledgeable. There was a mix between cities, parks and farmlands on this ride.
City Tour with Jessica. Had a great afternoon with Jessica, she was fun and informative. I wish we had more time in Amsterdam to do the country tour as well. Great value, highly recommend.

Countryside Amsterdam Cycle Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed out countryside tour with Pete. Approach was just right for us (wife and son, 17 year old boy) - relaxed, informative, interesting and challenging (cycling in city!). All ages, shapes and sizes on the tour and everyone appeared to enjoy it. I would certainly recommend it to anyone going to Amsterdam - as it lets you get a better picture of how Amsterdam was built/created and how they still manage to keep from going under water.

Country tour. Thanks to Stewart/Stuart for bringing his insights to our tour this morning. I loved the countryside, especially the river and forest bike paths. Sam did a great job with the briefing and getting things moving!

Good bikes, nice price. Bikes with gears and handbrakes! And no external signs that I'm a tourist. Pretty convenient price, €8 for a day, till 6pm, insurance included. Bring a credit card or ID as deposit. Nice staff.

City and Country Tours - Jul 23/24. We did both the City and Country tours. City tour was with 'Girl' Mike and was fantastic. Mike was knowledgeable without being boring and was able to cater for various personality types and riding levels on the tour. Despite the traffic being a bit crazy, Mike always had control of the group. The sites visited were a good mix and covered history, culture and contemporary info.The Country tour was with Pete and was amazing. Again, Pete had a mix of personalities and skill levels and despite the group being quite large was able to keep us together, interested and entertained. The sites on this tour were simply breathtaking. Both tours were a great way to see Amsterdam. We would do both tours again.

Overpriced tour. I did the mini evening bike tour and I thought that it wasn't worth it. I did a lot of free walking tours that were much more interesting and told a lot more about the city. On this tour you bike very slowly in the group for 5-10 minutes, you stop for 2 minutes for the guide to tell you a couple of facts and you move on. You don't get a really good sense of the city. I would recommend doing a free walking tour instead and just renting a bike to go around, it's cheaper.

A Bike ride not a tour. We did the Country Side Bike Tour. Did we enjoy the ride through the country? Yes. Did we think it was informative? Only a little bit. Our guide was very nice but offered very little in the way of information. We visited a cheese farm, which was disappointing. They had a couple of cows to look at; which, if it was your first time seeing a cow, might have been exciting. We were then ushered into an area to hear the cheese farmer tell us about how he makes cheese. The farmer had more fun making fun of the group than telling us about how cheese is made. We then went to the next room to see how he makes wooden shoes. Boring and a sales pitch. Finally, we were moved through a room to purchase cheese and shoes. All of the cheese and shoes are available for purchase in the city. In short, the stop was a great way to keep the cheese farmer/shoe maker in business. I would not recommend this tour unless you are looking for a bike ride to the country and in that case, I would recommend renting a bike and going on your own tour.

Worth the time!. This tour was definitely the highlight of my time in Amsterdam. My guide was interesting and informative. He was also very patient if we couldn't get everyone across the street at the same time. He told us the ins and outs and was more than happy to answer questions. It was 3.5 hours which was a bit long, but we got to see so much and get acquainted with the city. I'll recommend to all!

Great private tour!. My kids (12 and 14) and I booked a private countryside tour. Mike was our guide and he was great - very informative and entertaining. Kept the kids interested for 4 hours and the bike ride was relaxing and cooling (as it was very hot and humid while we were visiting in early July - the wind felt great!). Would highly recommend the private tour if you do not want to be with a big group.
Awesome tour!. We took the City Tour - our guide, Jessica, was lovely. Everything you want a guide to be - engaging, knowledgable, and patient. Can't wait to do the Countryside tour tomorrow.

Great countryside bike tour!. We went on the countryside bike tour and had such a good time! The weather was perfect and the tour took us out into the beautiful countryside to visit a windmill, cheese and clog factory, and to just cruise around all of the beautiful landscapes. It was an easy ride and there are pretty much no hills in Holland. Two days later, we rented bikes from them again (with a discount!) and road out to Zaanse Schans to see all the windmills. It was a beautiful spot, but not the most leisurely of rides at about 40km roundtrip.
Mini City Tour. We had a smaller group and Jeff, our tour guide, was great, good stories, very informational but not boring. Great way to cover a lot of ground in 2 hours.

Countryside tour. We did this tour today and we had a great day!! Was great riding through the country, we saw a side of Amsterdam we wouldn't have seen otherwise. The cheese and clog farm was good to see. Jessica was our guide, she was great! Very funny, easy going and a great guide in general. We would highly recommend this tour
Bike ride through Amsterdam . Great bike tour great information regarding the city Diego did a great job highly recommend using Mike's and asking for Diego

City tour was Exceptional, Country tour seemed overbooked. I'm sticking with 5 stars, even though the country tour had too many in the group (@17!!). Mike's deserves 5 stars because of the guides, who are excellent. Our favorite thing in Amsterdam was the City Bike Tour with Maria Therese (T.). If we're ever back in Amsterdam, we will do the city tour again.

Great way to experience Amsterdam . We took the country side tour yesterday with Karl. We had a great time getting out of the city and visiting the cheese and clog farm. My only advise would be to plan this trip for a dry day if you are here for a few days! We got soaked during the first half which just makes it that little bit harder to take in the beautiful scenery! Enjoyable none the less as tour guide is entertaining as has plenty of knowledge on the area!

Fun time in the countryside but spent way too much time at a cheese and wooden shoe factory. This was a fun trip out of the city centre. The guys at Mikes were very organized and had all of our bikes ready for us. But on a weekday, over 60 people showed up. We ended up breaking into 3 groups of 20 each. A group of 20 was way to big. We spent a good amount of time starting and stopping waiting for the second group to catch up due to intersections and just the sheer volume of bike riders in the city. We spent a lot of wasted time going thru a cheese making farm where there was a man who made wooden shoes. Out of the 2 and a half to 3 hour ride, 1 1/4 hour was spent at this factory. Make sure you pack a lunch and some water or else you will be without something to eat for the entire trip. Some of the bikes had side bags to carry personal items. The ride was really easy very flat. Once we got into the countryside and the forest, the ride was really fun. I wish we had more ride and less stop.
Great time with Jeff!. Thanx it was so much fun. Jeff knows how to tell stories, we had a great time on the 3h City Tour. But better not use the toilet...

Countryside tour. My wife and I did the countryside tour with Stuart on July 15. It was rainy but the tour was awesome. Highlight of our Amsterdam visit. Stuart knew his history and wove his knowledge throughout the ride. At 4 hours you get your money's worth and you see a part of Amsterdam you wouldn't otherwise see.

Great outdoor peak at Amsterdam. Our family of four really enjoyed our trip with Mike's Bikes. The staff are very friendly and knowledgable. The bikes are easy to ride, light weight aluminum. Our guide took us to the outskirts of Amsterdam where we stopped at a traditional windmill. Then we visited a family farm that has made cheese and clogs for decades. We ended our tour back in the city after a ride through the park. This was one of our favorite activities.

City tour on Wheels. There were 16 of use eager tourists ready to enjoy the sights of Amsterdam while riding through the back streets of the city. Our guide, Sam was very knowledgeable about the city's history and had a great sense of humor while sharing the history of this great city!We passed by several iconic places in Amsterdam: Passing through the bike tunnel at the Rijksmuseum, stopping to take photos at the IAMSTERDAM sign, Vondalpark, Ann Frank's home, Red Light district, and final stop at the only Windmill that produces beer!Mike the owner, Sam and the other bike guides were very professional and made the whole experience very enjoyable! A really Fun group!! I highly recommend a city tour on Wheels!

Can't leave Amsterdam without seeing these guys.. I seriously recommend one of the first things to do when you arrive into Amsterdam is do a guided tour with these guys. Our tour guide was Chris, for a very wet Monday morning he was in great spirits and always had a smile on his face. We left the place still laughing at all his jokes. The bikes were perfect for what we needed them for. It was absolutely pissing down the whole trip but they give you huge Poncho's to wear so you and your bag and legs don't get wet. What a dream!A must for any first timer in Amsterdam.

Jeff was awesome. The mini tour was a great way to get a taste of Amsterdam. Highly recommend it! Friday at rush hour was a challenge, but Jeff did a great job keeping us all together. I had accidentally bought 3 tickets instead of two, and they instantly offered to refund the extra payment, before I even had a chance to ask!

Utterly disappointed. I was really excited for the countryside tour, however I was left utterly disappointed. I made a reservation online and even made sure that I had an email conformation stating that I can make my payment in cash since I was unable to do so online. Upon reaching the shop for the tour, I was told that the tour was full and I had to be turned away. It was extremely disappointing as my reservation has all been for naught. I was offered the city tour instead; however it was clearly not was I was looking for as the itenary of both tours were so vastly different.

Mini bike tour was super fun!. Mike (the girl, native of the Netherlands) was our tour guide and she was very fun! She was funny and was so willing to answer any and all questions. We ran out of time to do the full-length bike tour so we just did the mini one (2 hours), but it still felt like enough time! She showed us the highlights and explained some history of Amsterdam.Biking on the streets of Amsterdam can be a little terrifying because there are SO many bikes and pedestrians, and then also cars to add to the mix. But they give a brief safety lesson before leaving that made me feel a little more confident. My only regret is that we didn't do it sooner on our trip here. Next time, we'll do it when we first get to the city so that we can do all of the guide's recommendations afterwards. She gave us all of these cool places to go and things to do, but we're out of time now! Definitely recommend doing the tour when you first arrive so that you can truly experience the city like a local.

Fantastic day on the tour! . My tour guide "Egg" was amazing! I never knew so much about the Hapsburg dynasty, and I really didn't think it could possibly be entertaining. But Egg was able to entertain all 16 of us for the three hours we were on the tour with stories ranging from the monarchy, the reformation, Hippies, underground illegal techno squat parties, and even the recent developments in yeast technology for modern baking techniques. And all the way keeping all of the group safe and organised. If you are in Amsterdam, this is a must do. Make sure that you get Egg as your guide. He was one of a kind!

Fun way to see Amsterdam. Jessica our host was a great fun guide to have, she made the tour fun and easy, this tour is a great way to get the feel for Amsterdam, and feel like a local for a few hours.The stop at the local micro brewery was very welcoming to quench our thirst as it was a warm day. It is so easy to ride around Amsterdam as it is so flat.

July 2015. My husband and I had a great day on our bike tour. We didn't know what to expect;The day was rainy and cold and we thought we might not be experienced enough to ride along but we saw the crowd was a mix of people. It was a great tour of places in the city I've never seen and would never have seen if it wasn't for the tour. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable. It was easy to keep up with him and our group opted to ride for an additional hour because it was so much fun. The cold didn't matter. The rain didn't matter. It was a great day.

Get Around Like A Local. We did the city tour at the beginning of our week-long trip to get the lay of the land. We had such a good time, and realized the city is so easy to bike, that we kept our bikes for the rest of the week. Mike's was flexible about our rescheduling and the bikes were in good shape. Having the option to bike through the city really changed the tone of our trip--we're now focused on biking in other cities we visit, too. You don't have to be in great shape to ride because the only hills are at the bridges, and there's virtually no car traffic to deal with. The intersections with trolleys can be a bit dicey the first time you do it, but give it a day or two, and you'll feel like a local.

Fantastic Countryside Tour with Sam. Wonderful experience from start to finish. Booking in process ran perfectly, briefing by Sam was perfect, all our group were made fully aware of dangers, what not to do and do while riding a bike in Amsterdam, and we found the information very useful. Sam was a lovely guy, and made the trip a fun experience. Great ride through Amsterdam and countryside, visiting a cheese/clog farm...lovely to meet the farmer!!!We were so please with our experience, we booked bikes the next day with Mikes Bikes and went off on our own.Again the staff in the booking office were really helpful, and I would have no hesitation at all recommending Mikes Bikes, and would certainly use again for a fun and safe experience. Thanks for making our time in Amsterdam speacial.

A Must in Amsterdam - very accommodating. We landed on the 1st of July in the wee hours and Mike's was gracious to look after our hand luggage while we were on tour. Stewart/Stuart introduced himself to a full tour and explained the bikes and a few road rules, be sure to make a booking first to secure your spot as one couple could not be accommodated. What a great way to appreciate the City in the little time we were there. Stuart who had lived there for 14 years took us to the Museumplein, Vondelpark, the Jordaan, Skinny Bridge, Brouwersgracht stopping at Brouwerij ‘t IJ in Funenkade which adjoins the De Gooyer Mill, the tallest wooden windmill in the Netherlands, time was not a thought as Stuart gave you his personal tour of the Amsterdam he feel in love with and never left.

A Highlight of Our Trip. Low key fun in a small group setting. The riding was easy, the guide informative and fun. What better way to see Amsterdam than on bike? We did the country tour. My wife & I had a great day,

Tiring but Great Time. Friend recommended this tour but what we did not expect was how windy the countryside would be on those days we were in Amsterdam. To be honest, some parts of the ride were really tough but the sights and the CHEESE was totally worth it! Mike was a great guide too and was very attentive to our needs and safety.

Fantastic!. Our group of 4 rode with clog wearing Karl yesterday and thoroughly enjoyed the bike tour. He entertained us the whole afternoon! It was a beautiful ride through the countryside and through parks. We saw parts of Amsterdam that we would never have found on our own.

City and Country. I would recommend this tour for tourists who would like to know about important points of AmDam and the nearby country-side. I'm a very experienced bike rider, and although the ride was easy and slow paced (easier than I'm used to) I still had a lot of fun and gathered a lot of info. The personnel was friendly and patient even under the demands of a variety of customers’ wishes. What I particularly liked is that the personnel hung around after the tours to chat with the riders. My tour guides were Mike (the Dutch woman) and Marie-Teresa. They were terrific, well informed, funny and extremely patient.

Nice Ride/Limited Information. Riding a bike is a great way to see the city and the sites but in terms of information from guide it was lacking. Easy ride and very flat. Good way to get bearings and see sites but due to size I would recommend walking tour instead and hope the guide has more information of history of the city.

Mini Tour with Big Impact. Our family ranging from 17-57 in age road the mini bike tour to keep us going after a morning arrival from Seattle and Boston. After a quick nap we lined up for the 4pm tour. Perfect way to a get sense of our surroundings, plus we were treated to an amazing overview of the city and history of Netherlands. Great bikes and the guide was fantastic! Thanks to Stewart.

Countryside Tour. Our tour with Mike today was wonderful! She was very entertaining with her knowledge of the area and the stories she told. We were not disappointed at all. It exceeded our expectations! Mike kept a close watch on everyone, stopping when needed for the rest of the group to catch up. She warned us about possible traffic and explained how to navigate through them safely. The ride through the city was a little scary but the countryside was amazing.

Great bikes!. We aren't very active people at home but decided to rent bikes whilst in Amsterdam (when in Rome!) and we had such a great time whizzing around the streets!We didn't do a tour but rented two bikes for the afternoon. We chose Mike's bike's as the pricing was really transparent on the website and included insurance plus two locks. The bikes also blend in a bit more than the other tourist bikes as they aren't heavily branded.The shop is in a central location and easy to find. Absolutely no problems and would definitely rent more bikes from here if we return to Amsterdam.

Must do if you're a 1st time visitor. Karl was our guide and was very knowledgable and engaging. We did the 11:00, 4 1/2 tour (easy ride & pace) of the countryside and cheese / clog factory on a stupendously gorgeous day. Sunny & mid 70's. Good pace and fun to ride on beach cruisers. Remember to bring a sandwich (or something) for the stop at the farm. And, a helmet might be a good idea, too. (Bring your own. Ya never know)

Fun ride into countryside. We had a great time riding with our guide, Peter. He was informative and entertaining without being too cutesy. Our bigger group had been split into three smaller groups, and one other guide, named Mike (a woman), looked like she would be fun, too. The pace was just right and it was not a difficult ride at all. Getting out of the city was a little challenging as there are so many bikes and pedestrians on the street, but Peter was good at managing all of us (17 in our group). We rode along the Amstel River, which was very pretty. Our stop at the farm was a good break. My husband really enjoyed the farmer, who showed us how to make cheese, sort of, and also wooden shoes. I thought the farmer was too much of a cheesy (pun intended) entertainer, and not nearly informative enough. After the farm, Peter led us through some polders and along a dike, then through a sprts field and along Vondelpark, with stops along the way for information. All very pretty. Well worth the ride.
Excellent guide!. An excellent guide took us to all the great sites of the city. He was knowledgeable, funny and gave us all the insights we needed to bike safely in Amsterdam!
Bike tour. Loved it!!! Visiting the country side of Amsterdam was amazing!! You will try the best cheese in the world!!
city tour. fantastic experience with mikes bike tour.. very friendly staff .. and alex was just very funny and informative... bike they use are very comfortable

Too popular for their own good?. I opted for the city tour as I had done the Munich tour many years ago.The tour is very well organised and the staff are competent and friendly. The bikes are well maintained and there are enough to go around. The slightly hippyish appearance and manner of the staff isn't going to suit everybody but there are several other companies doing similar style tours if you want something more corporate. You certainly cover lots of the city centre on a bike and I saw bits I hadn't visited in my 3 days there already. My tour guide didn't try to sell us anything or recommend any drugs.On my day there were over 40 people. We were split into 3 groups and the groups kept getting caught up in the same areas which got awkward.Also, some people in my group cycled slower than an arthritic snail. I appreciate that not everybody is Bradley Wiggins but give me strength! We spent so much time waiting for stragglers to catch up and get across the road junctions when I feel we could have got another stop of interest in.There has to be a market for a tour of 4 to 5 hours of no more than 8 people in a group where they have to pass a cycling proficiency test before being allowed on the tour - perhaps, can you ride one handed, can you change gear, can you get out of 2nd gear? That would attract a more adventurous participant and be more fun for them and the guide.

Great day bike riding. We took the country tour for 4 hours, it was so much fun, the guide was incredibly informative, the group were fun, but riding thru the city, thru the forest then next to the river was wonderful. Thanks to a very energetic team at Mikes.

A great tour wtih Diego. The people at Mike's were very friendly and helpful. They made a special change to accomodate my 8 year daughter. Biking in Amsterdam can be intimidating, but Diego kept us all in line and made it safe and great fun

So much fun!. We done the Countryside Tour on July 3rd 2015 and it was absolutely fantastic!!Our tour guide Mike was really friendly and she was good fun. Even when we lost a couple and someone got a flat tyre she remained calm, dealt with the issue and we were off again :)For a 24km it was very enjoyable and the bikes were comfy!Definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see parts of Amsterdam and parts outwith it.The cheese farm was good to visit and the farmer was crazy (in a good way).

Great tour. We took the country tour on July 5, 2015 with out guide Stuart. It was an amazing tour with tons of interesting facts. I didn't know tons and hadn't done a city tour yet and I really enjoyed it. I would suggest it for anyone looking to learn about Amsterdam quickly and see historic Dutch culture

Just ok bike tour, not what I wanted.. a slow bike ride with lots of repeated information from the hop on hop off bike tour. Not much new information Provided. Maria Theresa was a wonderful tour guide though, very patient with the members of the group not so comfortable riding a bike. I would have preferred a faster pace and seeing some different parts of Amsterdam but if you haven't had a good look around the place yet this tour would be a good first stop.

Great Mini Bike Tour. We are traveling with 2 teens, 15 and 19 and we all had a great time. Our tour guide, Pete, was very informative and gave us a good briefing before setting out on the tour - as it can be intimidating to cycle in the very crowded streets of Amsterdam. But we all became very comfortable and it was an excellent way to see the city. We had done a lot of walking ourselves and a canal tour, but we covered a lot of ground in this tour (in only 1 1/2 hours) and saw many new places. Pete was funny and knowledgeable about the city and history. Highly recommended!

Tour? Nope!. I came here because it was highly rated on trip advisor. I asked about the tour, he asked how many were going when I told him 2, he said the guide was sick! If you are a big group you may have better luck, else stay away.

Awesome Ride.. We tour the entire center city of Amsterdam and were able see almost all the well known site. Our guide was very informative. Unfortunately so we had a very large group (several guides called in sick) and it was unusually warm for this time of year. We also had some people who couldn't ride very well and caused slow downs with the already large group. Overall I would do it again.

The best thing we did in Amsterdam. At first we were worried that we would have to bike for four hours but the bikes are surprisingly comfortable and really easy to ride. The instructor (Karl) was hilarious and knowledgable and looked out for our well being. The tour of the windmill, forest, cheese and wooden shoe farm and the park was amazing. So much done in a couple hours! I would definitely recommend to anyone (besides kids)!

Well worth it. I did the countryside tour and it was great fun to get out of the city and see the more rural areas of Amsterdam. The traditional windmills and cheesemaking farm were pretty good as well. Despite the weather, it was a really good and our guide (whose name I can't remember but I think it might have been Alex) was awesome. I also managed to get myself a free Mike's Bikes bell at the end of it for holding the rear!

Great Two Wheel adventure!. Great Experience. Our guide was Kate, she was very knowledgeable about the city, politics, history, and more subjects. She educated us on the historical sites, buildings, kept us all together and had wonderful conversation at the end with a beer! I would highly recommend this adventure - a must do in Amsterdam.

Great fun. Great fun to be cycling round the canals. We did the two hour city tour on a Sunday. Diego our tour guide provided an interesting commentary on the key sites. We were in a group of 12 and after a short time everyone was confidently cycling along with the locals. Amsterdam is a " city of cyclists " and Mike's bike tours is a great way of joining them

Good decision!. Booking things via the web is a lottery at times but this stab in the dark was a great success with my family, phew! From the beginning of our experience with Mike's Bikes we were impressed. Our safety demonstration by the beguiling Mike, had everyone's complete attention and we felt confident that we would be okay on the bikes. Our guide, Sam, was not only handsome, a local, well versed in his city's history but incredibly funny and kind. His repartee and humour with our 11 year old daughter really enhanced the trip for us! The company's approach to the safety of the participants and the fantastically comfortable bikes, coupled with the fact that it was no more strenuous than walking made it a wonderful day out,

Great Tour That Takes You All Over, Really!. What a great ride to see all over the city without wearing yourself out. Mike and crew run an exceptional tour operation. They are laid back, funny, safe and informative. It's hard to get all four of these things in any tour and these folks pulled it off effortlessly. Diego was our guide to see all the important historical points of interest and they all came with stories. He smartly led the tour through the city streets without any stress to even the novice riders. We learned about the beautiful city parks, micro breweries and the soft underbelly. A must go for all any and all ages.

Really enjoyable. Standout of our trip, felt like a local cycling around, was a great way to see the city and find out more about it, would definitely recommend. Liked the fact we were split into smaller groups. Great staff and facilities.

Countryside tour was worthwhile.. I am usually sceptical about joining tours as I have been disappointed, but this tour was recommended by the Busabout guides and I am so glad that I listened about bought a ticket. The countryside tour was amazing, not only did Sam have us working our way through the busy Amsterdam streets, but we got to explored Dutch countryside and learn about Amsterdam's history and architecture in the process. There was an added bonus of stopping at a farm and learning about Gouda and Clogs while being able to taste a variety of of the farmers cheeses. Although some may consider €25 a bit pricey, it is at least a 4 hour trip and an amazing experience. Will recommend this to people travelling to Amsterdam in the future.

Excellent Bike Tour with Great (Subjective) Tour Guide. This was a great experience. A great way to see the city and bike ride among the busyness of the traffic. The guide was great, giving general information strongly influenced by his own, but entertaining, opinion.

Do it!!. We did Countryside tour. It is the best thing we did in Amsterdam. If you like riding bicycle this tour is perfect. Little bit expensive maybe (25Euro) If you learn the route you can just rent a bike (8Euro) do the same tour by yourself. But with a crowd and funny tour guide it was enjoyable...Just do it before you life cause after 4 hour you'll be tired :)

A bike ride that keeps you on your toes!. The Countryside bike tour was loads of fun. Guide had excellent commentary and set a good pace for a mixed group of kids and grannies. Getting out of the city to the countryside was quite an experience as the bike, people and vehicular traffic in Amsterdam is frightening! You will need to be comfortable with no helmets and risky drivers all around you. It seems that Dutch are not too concerned about brain injuries as there is not a helmut in sight - in a city of over 800,000 bicycles. Still - I would highly recommend this tour as you will get a chance to see ingenuity of the Dutch in the canal and land reclamation work.

Fun tour on bikes. My tour leader was Mike (woman) and she is a sweetie. She is fun, funny and informative. We biked out to a farm in the country outside Amsterdam to see cheese and clog making, which was fun. I liked the second half of the tour the best as we biked on the dikes and through two parks (VondelPark) and the really big one whose name escapes me. Both parks are beautiful. Mike was great about explaining the rules of the road for our trip through the city. I always felt safe. I did this tour on my own because my teen did not want to join me, but I could see the teens on my tour really seemed to be enjoying themselves. The biking was pretty easy and we had people aged from about 12 years to 60+

Amazing views of the Amsterdam's countryside. What a way to experience the city and learn how to ride thru the city of Amsterdam. You get to visit a cheese and wooden shoe factory and experience how both are made. Then afterward feel free to try the cheese along with purchase their cheese and/or shoes. Amsterdam is the beautiful city with lots to see outside the red light district. And of course our tour guide Jeff was awesome and very knowledgeable. Highly recommend this tour.

Shocking bad manners!!. I didn't go on the bike tour but was in front of the Old Church today admiring the facade with a group of tourists and their Mikes Bike tour guide next to me. I was admiring the view and overhearing the guide when he stopped and rudely asked me if I was enjoying the show! He curtly explained that the tourists had paid him for his services! How incredibly rude! Did the man think he owned the square?! Embarrassing for the tourists in his group!

Must do!!!!. Geoffrey took us on a awesome ride out of the city and into the farm areas which was tons of fun. As Amsterdam is flat it was not strenuous on the legs. I would recommend this tour and business to anyone. Geoffrey was a great tour guide!

Good biking company. My 2 sons took this tour with Diego, it was a short 2 hr tour of the city and both my sons were very happy they took the tour.
Diego was a great guide who showed and gave detailed history of Amsterdam to the participants of the tour.
Rates were competitive with other bike tours.

Awesome country side Ride. Me and my friends really enjoyed the country side tour on our first visit to Amsterdam. I booked online but another friend was able to join us without a booking. Staff were helpful and friendly . Our guide , Aleks, was well organised , gave us instructions before the ride and explained where and how often we were stopping. He seemed very knowledgeable about Amsterdam's history and happily shared it with the group. Totally recommend it . Make sure to bring water and something to snack on as it is a long ride ( ~ 4h)

A quick ride through the outskirts of Amsterdam. This is not the tour de netherlands but you will get a look at life outsides of the central tourist area. This tour is great for those of us who gave up peddling but still want to see a bit more of Amsterdam. There regular stops and explanations along the way and my guide Alec was superfriendly.

Touristy but fun. The windmill stopped at is only from 60's and there for tourists. Cheese tasting and wooden shoe factory also touristy but our guide Pete did a great job getting us safely through the city. Great way to try out being a local and guides make it fun

excellent way to break out of your comfort zone and cycle through some beautiful amsterdam sites. Fantastic countryside tour with mikes bikes, booked online and they even recommended another company to help when I requested a tandem so I could collect it and come on the tour. The guide was funny and relaxed even though we were all a bit wary of the Amsterdam traffic. Full of excellent advice and information our tour went to a cheese and clog farm with a linguistical genius for a farmer who comfortably switched from English to polish to Malay ! the ride was a little scary , a whole lot of fun and a fantastic way to be introduced to the Amsterdam cycling experience. Will definitely be going again

Great tour of the city with Nick. We began the morning getting an "orientation" from Diego who explained the rules of the road in Amsterdam. Basically, ride with confidence as the Dutch do, stay on the right of the bike lane, ride single file, do not try to cross on a red light or dodge the tram, and don't fret if you get separated at a stop light because the group will wait. It took a while to get out the door, but I was glad to have gotten good clear instructions.
