Side note: I took a country tour with Yellow Bike tours a couple of days later and they didn't do as a good a job explaining things, so members of our group were all over the place and confused about how to comport themselves. After having tried both companies, I would whole-heartedly recommend Mike's tours over Yellow Bike. Mike's also has better bicycles. They made sure everyone's feet were able to touch the ground from a seated position, therefore the bike felt sturdier and more comfortable. Yellow Bike gave us "Dutch" bikes that you have to pedal backward to brake, which is fine, but they were uncomfortable and too high for me. I had to stand on tip-toe (I'm 5'4") unless I got off the seat, which meant I had to fully stand when I wanted to stop the bike. We shorter women would struggle to stand quickly when we had to stop which led to a couple of mishaps along the way. Back to Mike's...there was a very large group of people for the tour, so we were divided into three groups. We were lucky that our group only had 8 people; I believe it's usually groups of 10-12. We were also lucky that we got Nick as our guide. He was an affable and patient Canadian guy with some funny anecdotes. As a history major I would have enjoyed a little more history, but it's not a major complaint. The three people in our group had an awesome time, and by the end two of us came away with crushes on Nick. So cute!To summarize, an excellent way to see a lot of the city in a short time and have a lot of fun. The general traffic in the city, the mopeds in the bike lane, and the Dutch riders were intimidating, but it just added to the excitement. Also, we were taken through the Red Light District, which I found fascinating. There may be some who would be uncomfortable with the ladies in their windows, but it was daytime and there were plenty of other tourists. Actually, some of the women seemed annoyed that they were being gaped at by people walking their bikes while they're trying to work. Amsterdam is a beautiful and interesting place. Mike's Tours is a perfect way to begin your exploration of it.

Awesome guide, informative tour and good bikes.. Highly recommended tour with a great guide, Mike who is a fun person and she is also really knowledgeable, fabulous host who took us around Amsterdam.Me and my friend - we both loved every moment of the tour. It was exciting, and we have visited many attractions, and learned more about them thanks to Mike.It was a rainy day but the tour organizers were very well prepared and equipped, so they gave a raincoat to everyone on departure.There was also a quick health and safety training before we got on the bikes, and an additional person taking care of the whole group.Our City Tour took about 2,5 hours and was really fun.At the end of the historical "need to knows" we headed to a typical Dutch pub where we all tried the traditional local drinks - not only Heineken - then we ended the experience back at the base point.The price and value for money is absolutely fair, gained many nice memories.

Great way to see Amsterdam. We went full-blown Mike's Bike Yours during our recent jaunt to Amsterdam. Started out with a mini City overview with a fantastically entertaining tour guide (whose name escapes me... perhaps it was Jos?). It allowed us to acclimate to biking in Amsterdam, and gave us confidence in the city layout (i.e., you will get lost!), while informing us of interesting tidbits and background of the city highlights. Bikes were comfortable and the tour was not strenuous. Secondly, we did the countryside tour. 50 people showed up, and they split the group in 3. We had yet another entertaining guide who took us through the city to a windmill and a farm. The scenery was lovely and the tour guide was excellent. Except, I found there were long stretches of biking and I would have loved a few more quick stops along the way - even for one minute just to stretch a muscle. And while the farm (cheese/clogs) was charming, we felt it was just a means for the farm to make money in the gift shop, where the prices were much higher than they were in downtown Amsterdam. We still bought plenty :)Lastly, we rented bikes through Mike's. The prices were fair, the bikes were easy to use, and the experience was priceless.Thanks Mike... we'll see you again next time!

Great Private country side tour with Sam. We had a fantastic experience with Sam from Mike's Bikes on Friday. The weather was threatening and some of my family -- my husband, myself & our kids (ages 13-16) did not have much biking experience.Sam was great at giving a quick overview, explaining mechanics and helping us to quickly navigate beyond the busy city proper. Sam was extremely knowledgeable about the history of the city, friendly and attentive to our interests and needs. He did a great job of ensuring that we stayed together, and knew just when to take a respite beneath the trees to avoid a downpour. The highlight of our time in Amsterdam! Thank you!

Great bike tour with a fun guide. Really dug Mike's Bikes. Had read about them in a travel mag and heard they were just a little bit wacky which was right up my alley. The online booking was a breeze and when we showed up early for our tour Mike himself was very friendly and we chatted about rock n roll for a bit and then he recommended a great place down the road to grab some food before the trip.The tour itself was fun too. We had a great guide named Pete who was witty and friendly and fun and maybe even a little bit hopped up on the potweed which made the trip feel authentic ;) He had great stories and jokes at each stop and kept the trip moving and feeling fresh. Would definitely go on the countryside tour next time I'm in Amsterdam and would certainly use their service in Munich as well...

Country Bike Tour. We enjoyed our Country Tour with Mike's Bikes yesterday and found the organisation, information and guide great.Our tour was organised without being overly controlled and there were plenty of stops along the way where the guide gave us information about Amsterdam and the area, answered questions and explained the next leg of the ride. The ride itself was not strenuous and no real hills are involved - a medium level of fitness and confidence riding a bike is all that was required.Riding a bike in the streets of Amsterdam is a bit daunting as the rules seem to be being made up as they go along - who gives way to who, looking and merging all seem to happen but as an observer it all looks fraught with chaos. Having our guide explain the basics was a great help.I have seen some comments on TripAdvisor that the cheese factory visit is a tourist trap and yes it is very touristy but is was also informative and a bit of fun - you can take or leave the more tourist focussed bits. Interestingly many of the people in our group purchased products - cheese, clogs etc.

2 Day Bike Rental. Great experience with this company. Everything ran smoothly mechanically with the bike as well as with the company. Very reasonably priced especially for students. Best way to see Amsterdam (although I guess I don't have anything to compare to).

Mike's bike countryside tour in Amsterdam. This is a great way to see the beautiful Amsterdam countryside. Jeff (our tour guide) was very knowledgeable and personable. We had a wonderful time exploring canals, parks, and a cheese making farm. The bikes were in good shape and the 4 hour ride was easy with many stops to hear the history and take pictures.

Private tour not flexible. I booked a private tour by bike for our family in May 2015. The email correspondence went well, but when we arrived the overall energy of the workers seemed unhappy. Our guide was not flexible, although I book private for flexibility. The tour ended an hour early and we were glad to be done. The country side was lovely and the parks were nice to ride through, but I think the management must be having some internal issues with all the long faces in the office. We asked our guide several times if we could stop to have a cup of tea or take him to dinner and he refused. He took us to a cheese and shoe making factory and we felt a bit like we were on a bus tour stopping at the prerequisite tourist traps. We did enjoy learning about the cheese and shoes, but there was a missing component to the overall experience that left us less than completely satisfied.

Surprisingly great!!. Generally a group of around 8-10 people....I did a city tour and our guide was great. Had altogether a different view of the city after the tour.Great value for money and excellent way to enjoy the city.

Great day with Mike's bike tours!. We signed up for the countryside tour of Amsterdam and it was well worth it! Our guide, Pete, was fantastic. He had a lot of knowledge about Amsterdam's history and development. A highlight of the tour was our stop at the cheese farm. As we got off our bikes and went into the barn we were just in time to see a cow give birth. It was a bonus (although some were squeamish). The farmer was charming, funny and also very knowledgeable. The cheese was delicious. Everyone bought a little and we sat outside and enjoyed our cheese. The farmer also made wooden shoes. He showed us how he made the shoes and all the different uses for them. After the farm we continued on our tour. Pete led us through some great spots that we would have never found on our own!All in all , my family would highly recommend a tour with Mike's. If we ever make it to Amsterdam again we will sign up for another tour.

Great countryside tour. Had a great time on this tour with Mike! The bikes were good to ride and we were able to see lots of different parts of the countryside which was great. The cheese farm was especially cool. We witnessed a cow giving birth while we were there! And the farmer there was a bit crazy but very entertaining and taught us a lot about cheese.

So Euro. Amsterdam is beautiful. The canals, the brown cafes, and the little market places beg to be explored. If you're short on time or your feet are begging for a break, take this tour. You get to see the city and zip around like you know what you're doing. The guide gives you a bit of history at each stop with time to take photos. My only complaint is that it wasn't long enough. Tip:If the guide asks for a volunteer, VOLUNTEER.

A great way to see Amsterdam . We went for both the city and countryside tours and both were excellent! Our tour guides Stuart ( for the city) and Mike ( for the countryside) were both knowledgable, entertaining and bubbly. Thumbs up for the both of them. My bicycle had a brake issue for the city tour and this was replaced efficiently halfway through the tour. This is indeed a great way to see Amsterdam. Do as the locals do- cycle!

A fantastic way to see the city. Colin took our group around. He was very good making sure the group kept up and were safely across intersections. His instructions were clear and easy to follow. His knowledge of the city was terrific and presented to the group with humour. Definitely one of the best ways to see the sights of Amsterdam!

Bike tour. We enjoyed our two tours,the first one was the city tour with Stuart and the second one was the countryside tour with Mike. They both did a good job,informative and efficient in keeping us together as well as being helpful and entertaining. Bikes worked well although we needed a bit of time adjusting to the seating position as we are more used to road bikes and mountain bikes.one needs to be careful crossing the roads though,as traffic can be confusing with so many cyclists. Thank you.

Amazing Service!!!!. Was recommended Mike's by a friend who frequents Amsterdam. It's just a little shop on a back street, non of this labelled bike craic pointing out that you are an obvious tourist. Extremely friendly English speaking staff. One of our keys broke in the lock (luckily just around the corner) so we wondered back, told them exactly where it was and they gave us another bike. They are also great if you need to know where to buy a new suitcase!! Thank you :) - finally, great location if you are interested in biking around the vondelpark, museum sector, van loon house, Anne Frank house.

Great Fun. Booked the mini city tour with a bit of trepidation, having read some mixed reviews, but we had great fun with Aunty Mike as tour guide. She has a great bubbly personality and looked after our group of 5 really well. We had an easy to understand briefing of do's and dont's when cycling in Amsterdam and had a nice tour of Amsterdam's highlights in the time allowed. Husband chuffed at being given a bike bell at end of tour for agreeing to act as tail end charlie for the group.Thank you Aunty Mike!
Hilarious tour guide. Did the countryside tour with Karl, was definitely worth the money, more for how hilarious he was. Got to visit a cheese factory as well which was an added bonus
Nice one Diego!. Great tour! Groups not too big, saw all we wanted to see. Our guide Diego was very knowledgeable and fun! Would definitely recommend.
country tour. our guide,Karl, was amazing!- what incredible energy and full of fun and historical facts!Highly recommended!!

Good but not great. My friend and I took this tour after reading reviews on tripadvisor and a really great experience with a bike tour in Bruges. We left the shop in groups of about 15, which is definitely mentioned on the website, but is WAY TOO BIG for a city like Amsterdam. If you weren't trying to catch up to the group, you were waiting for the ones stuck behind at a light or crossing. The guide was funny but mostly uninformative. We stopped 3-4 times for about two minutes while she told us nothing of great consequence. We returned around 3 PM after spending most of the day biking. Overall, the $20 I spent on this is nothing to complain about, but in the future, I'll rent a bike for way less instead of taking this "tour."

Wonderful time in Amsterdam. I did have a great experience with Mike's Bike Tours in Munich, therefore I said I need to come with Bike tour one day in Amsterdam.I take the countryside and mini tour. We have a good view and really enjoyable to ride under sunshine, wind and beautiful landscapes.We did visit cheese farm and it's worth to visit. I found the price is lower than tourism area (around €1-2)when I walk around Dam.Our guide, Stuart. He's a professional tour guide. Our team had 17 ppl (countryside tour)and 8 ppl (mini city tour). As a big group, he handle very good and always check our status. Full information that included history and culture. When we stay with small group, we also have many interactive and ask questions when doubts.And, the staff who on duty in the shop also very helpful. I'm glad to come with Mike's Team.

Bike with Peter. Peter was a very informative fun leader of our Country Bike Tour with Mikes Bikes. It was great fun..about 12 miles. We took several breaks and it was very manageable for all ages. We went to a farm for a cheese making and wooden shoe making demonstration. Interesting. We had a photo op by a windmill. I could have had more photo ops but that was ok as we had a large group. I would highly recommend Peter. The tour company was very organized and thorough.

Nice tour, terrible guide. We enjoyed the bike tour but our guide, Amster-Sam, was awful. He was uninformative, unfunny and rambled about nothing for most of the tour. He was unprofessional, picking up a previous tour rider in the middle of our tour and trying to get her phone number. She recieved much more attention on the tour than the other 10 paying customers.Previously, we had done the Mike's bike tour in Munich. We enjoyed it so much that we sprinted off our train in Amsterdam to do this one. It was so bad that if the order was reversed, we would definitely have skipped the tour in Munich.

Great biking tour!. These guys really give personal, fun and interesting tours! We had Mike, a lovely female guide, on a private tour recently and we enjoyed every moment! In 3 hours we managed to cover large parts of Amsterdam so treat yourself to this experience!
Excellent experience. Quick, informative and great tour of the city. Got an amazing orientation and feel of the city in those 2 hours.Diego was brilliant as a guide!

Interesting, knowledgeable and fun guide!. If you have a half day or only a few hours, do not miss Mike's City bike tour of Amsterdam! I brought a few visitors to Mike's for both the 4 hour and 2 hour city tours. They are both great! We got Stuart as our guide both times for the short city tour. Stuart is interesting, knowledgeable and gives a great perspective of the city. He gave us information on its history, architecture and social standing on issues. He was respectful and articulate. I plan on doing the country tour next. Thank you for a great tour!
Great way to see the city!. Awesome way to see the city like the locals do! Karl was a fantastic tour guide and it was great fun :)

Good way to see the city. Spent 3+ hours riding around seeing all the sites. Bikes are easy to ride but it is definitely congested! Try to get on a tour with only 8 people. Much better that way since you have to stop at lights to wait for everyone. Great for families.

Whistle stop tour of Amsterdam. With only 3 days to take in all that Amsterdam has to offer (sights wise!), we decided to opt for a cycle tour with Mikes bike tours on our first morning, based on tripadvisor reviews. It was a great choice, Maria Theresa was a great knowledgeable guide, with a dry sense of humour! This tour is not for the faint hearted as it is pretty fast and furious, but then it needs to be to cover all we did in 3 1/2 hours, including a much needed beer at the fabulous Windmill brewery. When we booked the tour the inference was that the group would be around 12 people, ours consisted of 15, plus the guide. As the person who (happily) opted to be the rear rider, this was 3 too many people, we often ended up split at traffic lights and everyone would be forced to wait whilst the lights went around again. BUT this was certainly the only downside of what was overall a fantastic and great value for money cycle tour, in "the city of the bike!"

Best way to see the city!!. We did the 3 hour city tour and had a great time. U get to experience it like a native and feel like your part of the city. Maria was our tour guide and she perfect. It was the right amount of traveling between stops, with information that informative without being too much. I had been on a red light distict tour the night before and we hardly did any walking, the tour guide just talked to hear himself talk trying to impose his views of everything on me, which wasn't any fun. I would highly recommend this bike tour and ask for Maria. There isn't a better way to see the city.

Found the City too Congested for a Bike Tour. I was so looking forward to this activity but it fell short of my expectations. I am a leisurely rider, and found the city route congested and intimidating. Curiously, cars seemed polite and patient but local bike riders were downright rude. Tourists are an annoyance to them and they don't hesitate to bully touring riders. Shame on you! I was so preoccupied with not getting run over, I can't tell you a single thing about the stops we made. Our guide, Diego, while extremely sociable and agreeable, was a little lacking in historical info. The highlight could have been a ride thru the park but unfortunately we zoomed thru. To add insult to injury, it was miserably cold and rainy. If I were to do a bike tour again in Amsterdam, it would have to be a country ride.

Very Good Overview Tour of Amsterdam. This bike tour of Amsterdam was very high quality for the price. It cost about 20 Euro for the tour and we hit the major spots such as the Anne Frank Museum, I AM Amsterdam sign, canals, and the unknown windmill bar at the end. We did not get admission into any of those places because (1) the lines were too long anyways for the 3 hour tour, and (2) only information/history and sight seeing were done on this tourOur tour guide's name was Maria and she was very knowledgable about the area and fun to be around during the tour. The complaints that I have about the tour was how fast we jumped from site to site, barely giving us time to take pictures, and how out of control the biking was from place to place. It honestly was hard and sometimes dangerous to keep up with the guide. This makes the tour more interactive and interesting, but for a tourist in th area, the biking was unnecessarily dangerous when going through intersections or areas with pedestrians. Overall this tour would be recommended, especially for younger travelers as it might not be good for someone with weak bike experience or older travelers.

Best way to experience the countryside. Countryside tour was fantastic. Karl (with a K) was an enertaining and informative tour guide. The path was flat, lined with green fields and the river Amstel. Easy ride, suitable for anyone (though it helps if you know how to ride a bike!). Take your own lunch, and a bottle of water, and you'll have a really great time.

Quality is good. I really enjoyed the service from the moment I walked inn , they guided me on the best package for my tour and even showed me the bikes they had for kids and child seats . Very clear demo on the locks and the bike I rented showed no issues at all during the day.. Location couldn't be better . Just dropped the bike back and hoped back on the train 3 mins later .

Don't skip riding a bike in Amsterdam!. Our group of four did the two hour mini-tour. What a blast! The riding was easy. The sights were great. And our guide Diego was wonderful. We stopped periodically to get a little history from Diego and snap some photos. If you only do one thing in Amsterdam, it should be a bike tour!

Great way to see Amsterdam. We loved Karl. He made the trip funny and he was very informative. Our guide Karl was animated and knowledgeable. We were taken to many city attractions including The nine Streets, the red light district, vondelparks, the zoo, museum square and so much more. Great guide and a great way to see Amsterdam. I was the butt lady and received a Mikes bike bell for bringing up the rear of our 12 person tour group.

really enjoyed it. We enjoyed the city tour (with Nick) so much we did the country tour (with Karl, (bring a picnic lunch)) the next day. The friendly and informative guides take away all the worry of struggling with maps, going the wrong way and unfamiliarity with the bike path/pavement/road layout. After an essential briefing you jump on and follow like happy ducks. Brilliant, highly recommended.

Amazing cycle tour around Amsterdam with Geoff. This is the only way to see Amsterdam. You can book online & it's easy to get to Mikes Bikes by tram from Amsterdam train station. €22 for a 4 hour cycle tour - we saw everything from Anne Frank's house, the Van Gogh Museum, Red Light & Blue Light district & a real live windmill. Geoff was friendly & very well informed about every aspect of Amsterdam from history to fashion to architecture to restaurants to local customs. I could have listened to him all day. He can even roll a cigarette using both hands while cycling! very impressive. A huge thanks to Mikes Bikes for a wonderful tour around Amsterdam. :-))

Very Disappointing Countryside Tour. I was disappointed with my experience with Mike's Countryside Bike Tour. This company was highly recommended on Trip Advisor so I was very excited when I booked it for 9 people. Here's my breakdown of the whole experience: The bikes: Most of us were comfortable and happy with our bikes. They were accommodating when it came to providing a bike for every height. The countryside: The one bright spot in our tour. Biking through the country side was very lovely. It was my second time in Amsterdam so it was nice getting out of the main city for a few hours. The tour guide: Our tour guide's name was Diego and he didn't seem enthusiastic about the information he was presenting nor taking us around. He was also very impatient with us and seemed like he couldn't wait to get back. The cheese/clog farm: The host kept making these racial comments throughout the tour. We were taken into the gift shop after the short tour and most of our group bought cheese. We were specifically told that we did not have to refrigerate the cheese nor keep it cool in any temperature and it would last "10 years." However, that was not the case. Every single one molded. My husband and I spent over 30 euros on the cheese!If you want to experience the countryside, I recommend you renting your own bikes and doing your own tour.

Fun with minimal effort. We booked the country tour in advance, and we're apprehensive when we showed up--there were 45 people that day! The safety brief stretched on and I was getting nervous, but about 1130 they divided us into 3 groups to head out. Once the admin was done we were off! Some of our group didn't seem at all familiar with a bike or traffic signals, but things straightened themselves out fairly quickly and I was able to forget about all of that. Karl, our guide, was fun and entertaining. The ride was easy and relaxing. Would have liked more stops with photo ops, but to be honest there weren't THAT many photo ops--one windmill and the cheese/clog farm/shop, with a few parks as well. I'd recommend this if you're looking to get out of the city for half a day, but I don't think it's essential to your visit to Amsterdam in any way!
Excellent service. Before arriving in Amsterdam we arranged the rental. Great location, great bikes and great price. This was easy. Thanks Mike!

tooo many people. 15 bikers in a busy capital with only one guide. We kept stopping for head counting, and the tour guide kept saying im sure you know about this.. if we did we wouldn't need a guide? We were shown around by Maria (italian).. if the group was smaller would have worked alot better. Also as it was so large the tour guide didnt show much patience.. and wasnt the friendliest. Shame but caught some walking tours which were excellent (sanderman i think they were called) and it was a much more pleasant experience - would recommend them!

loads of fun. Arriving at 11am into a 30 group, I was apprehensive. The group was split and we then set off onto the streets into the countryside. This company had everything well organized and despite the excess of foot /bike traffic this tour had to maneuver. Both guides were extremely professional and responsible. They were fun, playful and attentive to all the customers. I brought three 19-21 years old and all had fun. I was glad to have my rain jacket.

Country Tour....it deserves 6 stars!!!. I did the 4 hour Country Tour and (hands down!) the best activity I did in Amsterdam. Our guide was Karl (with a K!) who made the entire tour such great fun. It was wonderful to get out of the city see the beautiful countryside. It was informative, safe and well organized. There were so many great reviews on this site and they were all correct! I would highly, highly, highly recommend this tour/tour company.
Excellent. Beautiful countryside bike tour with entertaining, knowledgeable guide (Jeff) and comfortable bike. Only downside was large group of over 20 riders.
Mr. Wonderful. Fun. Safe. Well organised. Informative. The best way to see the city especially if you are a 1st time visitor. My wife and I loved it. One of our best decisions so far

Country Tour. This review would of received a 'very good' rating if it wasn't for the racist comments stated by our tour guide and the male owner from the Cheese and Clogs Factory. Pete thought he would humour a family with an Asian appearance by asking if there were any more earthquakes back home!? Insinuating that they were from Nepal! First of all - completely insensitive and unprofessional to be said by the tour guide. Second - how dare you humour the fact that hundreds died!!! Lost their lives and homes!!! Families and communities torn apart by a tragedy due to a natural disaster! Seriously tactless and insensitive - advice, think or don't speak!Second racial discrimination was from the male owner of the cheese factory. I won't go into detail of what he said. The situation was he labelled the tourists according to appearance and assumed they spoke their heritage language whereas these were the third generation who grew up in the US and not in the country of their cultural background. He kept referring to one girl as Korea! Which wasn't her name and she grew up in New York, so she had no idea what he was talking about. She responded politely and reflected the mannerism that the owner lacked.The actual bike tour was really good. Pete has clearly does this all before etc etc Also two girls from our group stopped early, one was asked not to continue and one didn't feel comfortable even after trying. Neither of them received a refund from the office even thought Pete said they would!

Fantastic trip into the countryside on nikrs. Wow what can I ssy. After avoiding cyclists for a day my husband and I decided to book a cycle tour into the countryside. It didn't seem too cheap but it was worth it. It was about 4 hours long which included plenty of stops including stopping at a windmill and Bligh maker. We felt safe and well looked after. Recommended from about 10 years and up. Such a fun and memorable day. Thanks guys

Never again, tourist trap!. We did the country bike tour with Diego, and while he was somewhat informative regarding the history of the city, throughout the tour he was not accommodating in allowing us to take photos and also disorganized. It's understandable that the group is on a timed schedule, however, none of the tourists complained when we had to wait over 20 minutes for the group behind us to catch up (they had some sort of bike issue), yet he would not allow us to take 5 minutes at the various stops to snap photos. We did not know how long we had at the cheese farm (for example, no 5 minute warning) and when he said it was time to leave he was upset that some of the tourists had to use the restroom. He rushed us through the rest of the stops after and just kept telling us there would be opportunities to take photos at later points but there were none. When we asked him to take a photo for us at our last stop he quickly snapped one before everyone was in place and when asked if he could take another he said "no"! What's the point of going on these tours if the tourists aren't allowed to take photos?Also, I believe the cheese farm/clog factory is a total tourist trap. I bought 2 wheels of cheese there, and I specifically asked prior to buying if it would be okay if the cheese were not refrigerated (our hotel did not have a refrigerator). They said that it would be fine and that the cheeses in the wax casing go 8-10 years without going bad. Less than a week later, both unopened cheeses were covered in mold in the bag. Thats 40 euros down the drain. The cheese farm/clog factory is just looking for any profits they can. I would not buy from there and would suggest going to one of the nice cheese shops all over Amsterdam. Overall the only positives about the country bike tour was the scenery itself. The guide was horrible, the stop was horrible, it was overall one of the worst tour experiences I've been on. I'd highly suggest renting your own bike and biking around yourself! There are bike lanes that stretch outside to all the parks in Amsterdam, and it would be easy to do the country tour on your own. Do not waste your money at Mike's Bike Tours.

Best tour ever!. Me and my cousin went to Amsterdam to celebrate her birthday and so we decided to have a countryside tour on the day of her birthday because she loves cycling and sight seeing. I really happy we chose Mike's Bike Tour because we really had a goos time. We we're 'cruising' on our journey to the Wind Mill and to the Cheese factory then down to the 'below sea level' point. Aaron was really helpful to us and made sure we are all complete and ok since we were a big group.

Great Countryside Bike Tour. This tour was perfect for finding out about the city and the surrounding countryside. We really enjoyed our countryside bike tour (lasted for a little over four hours in total) with Stewart our English guide, who was excellent in that he made it very interesting with his knowledge of the history of the area with lots of information on Amsterdam, all done in a very laid back, humorous way. We had great weather on the day and the bikes were easy to ride and comfortable. We had a group of eighteen, it felt well organised from start to finish with regular stops along the way.
A definite must do when in Amsterdam. Just back from the countryside tour. Such a brilliant way to see Amsterdam. Would recommend this company. Very warm and welcoming. Couldn't fault it.

Nice tour. We went on a tour on a sunny Sunday. Diego was our guide and he was very nice. He told us a lot of stories about the places we stopped at.
We had a very nice stop at Brouwerij ij.

Another great Mike's Bike tour. .This was a great tour and we really lucked out on the weather. I took the Mike's Bike tour last year in Munich and this year in Amsterdam. Went this year with my 24 year old son and even he had fun! This is a pretty flat ride except going up over the canal bridges which are nothing of an incline. The only problem I had was at the farm. The farmer said that if you don't cut open the cheese that it will make it through customs. Well, in the US you cannot bring the cheese that has the meat inside. I didn't open it up and the customs lady said she wouldn't allow it because it had ham inside the cheese so she threw it out! I didn't even get one bite! So just buy the cheese without any meat and maybe that will get through.

Great Way to Get Aquainted with Amsterdam. The guides were knowledgeable concerned about safety, but yet easygoing. This was a great introduction to the city. We went all around and stopped at several places to hear descriptions or explanations. There was a large group signed up the day I went, so we were split into groups of 10-12 -- an appropriate number. A very good experience -- I felt I did not need to go on a canal cruise after this trip. It was supposed to be for 3 hours, but it went longer as we stopped for a light refreshment near the end. It was not tiring at all.

Easy way to tour Amsterdam. I enjoyed this tour, it was a rainy day and we were provided with ponchos which were very handy. Tour guide was very friendly and informative. The bikes were easy to ride and use to get around the streets. It was an awesome way to see Amsterdam.

Fun Tour, not to be missed!. What better way to see Amsterdam than to be like the locals and ride a bike? My friend and I had only the weekend in Amsterdam to explore after a work trip and this was recommended to us as a fun way to get a heavy does of tourist in during a 4 hour window. And it delivered exactly that! IF you haven't been to Amsterdam, let me just say that the biking there is intense, and there is no way I would have felt comfortable just taking out a rental without a guide. Our tour guide, Karl "with a K", was hilarious and offered just the right amount of facts mixed in with chill bike riding. We did the Country Tour that leaves the city and goes out on a ~15 mile loop to see a classic windmill and to visit a cheese/clog farm. Both of those attractions are 100% geared to tourists but just be OK with that and enjoy it! The ride also goes through some lovely areas and parks. For about 25 quid, its a steal.If you are hesitant because of your biking skills, DON'T BE! Neither of us had been on a bike in several years for any extended period of time and it was totally fine. The land there is fairly flat so it's also not particularly strenuous. Highly recommended! Thanks for the great tour guys!

Good.....needs improvement . We enjoyed the tour. Riding the bikes was very fun and was the absolute best way to see the city. I loved that the bikes were just normal bikes and didn't have a huge logo for the company plastered all over them. We were lucky to go on a beautiful sunny day so the experience was great at times. It wasn't all great though. Our group was way too big. We had some very inexperienced bikers who had a tough time even getting around the city. We ended up spending a lot of time making sure these people were safe and didn't get hit by cars. I would have liked it much better if the group could of been smaller.Second,our guides constant talking about marijuana and prostitutes got old real fast as did his effort to hook up after the tour with the single ladies in the group. I understand some people might come to Amsterdam for that but that shouldn't be the overriding theme of our bike tour. We found that very unprofessional. I would definitely do a bike tour again but I would try somewhere else to try and a guide who can tell me more about the city and less about coffee shops and where he can take ladies to after the tour.

Definately a must. A great experience with our canadian guide. One should definately make this tour in order to see the best of Amsterdam, and get a feeling of how you should go around on a bike before you rent one of your own

Great tour of the city. Saw that the tour is recommended on the Trip Advisor app and decided to do it with my girlfriend. We were definitely not disappointed, Mike's tour offers a fresh take on the touring experience with some light hearted jokes and great tips for what to do in Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend it for a first activity in Amsterdam (especially when it's a nice day outside)
Wonderful experience. Biking is a great way to see the city of Amsterdam - see it like locals. The guided tour gives you a chance to warm up to the biking speed of the city.

A bit of fun around Amsterdam. I really enjoyed riding around Amsterdam with my tour guide, I believe his name was Diego. I hadn't rode a bike in over 10 years, but it was almost like I had always ridden a bike. As this was part of our TopDeck tour we didn't do the whole city tour. Overall I enjoyed my tour. I want a bike when I get back home.
Top deck tour activity . Awesome experience! The guides were great, friendly funny with heaps of info, the bikes were good & easy to ride, great way to see the sights of Amsterdam!

Just rented bikes. Didn't do the tour. Just rented bikes in two occasions, and always had a good experience. First time in 2010, nothing remarkable, pretty straightforward, not cheap but not too overpriced as other places can be in the area, and had good bikes for 3 hours in Vondelpark.This time, with wife and 2 year old daughter, rented 2 bikes (one with toddler seat) and the guys at the store were really really friendly! They had a lot of fun with my little girl and even gave her a bike bell as a gift for giving a try with the child seat! Definitely recommend and will be back for a third time!

See Amsterdam the right way!. A truly fantastic way to see Amsterdam! The tour involved biking through the city with periodic stops where the guide informed the riders about various aspects of the city's history. Bikes are high quality and each is unique so you can 'blend in with the locals.' Our guide was knowledgeable and laid back. He added an extra detour to a local brewery, and he clearly truly enjoyed showing his city to the group. We were nervous about navigating the busy city streets on bikes, but the tour included tips to keep up safe. The guide was very aware of each member of the tour, and motorists/trains are very considerate of bikers.

Average. I did the city tour with Mike's Bike Tours and was left feeling underwhelmed. We had a very large group and spent most of the three hours simply trying to keep up with our guide, Mike (presumably not THE Mike). She would take off as lights changed or pull out in front of vehicles meaning that 99% of the rest of the group was left to tackle unknown streets and traffic on their own. This was daunting as none of us knew where we were going let alone felt comfortable navigating the traffic. At some points on the tour I felt completely unsafe riding my bike and heard several other group members say the same thing. The tour itself takes you to interesting parts of the city with a bit of commentary but I didn't gain any further information to what I already knew. I wouldn't do this tour again and I wouldn't recommend to my friends. The bikes were comfortable and easy enough to ride through the city.

Interesting tour but guide needs some training!. We enjoyed this 3 hour tour of the city but the guide seemed to spend more time talking about his drinking and "'weed" habits than the history of the city. HIs colourful language using the F word was not appreciated. He often wondered why the group was not laughing at his jokes but perhaps it is because we were all fed up with his comment that he was hung over. He asked for a tip at the end but then said that he most likely waste it on booze or drugs-no one left a tip!!One on one he was very well informed and obviously knew the city . A good tour but I hope you don't get this guy for a guide. This is a business and it is not suitable to have a guide act like this with a group of all ages from youth to mature tourists.

Awesome way to see Amsterdam. Karl is the King! Fantastic day riding around Amsterdam. Must do to see the sites and to orientate yourself for exploring later. Definitely recommend Mikes bikes over the other bike tours. Extremely friendly & funny staff. No boring commentary and a nice 'relaxed' ride. U guys are the bomb. Melbourne xo

Cycle tour of Amsterdam. I strongly recommend anyone interested in experiencing this city book a cycle tour with Mike's bikes. Very knowledgeable and down to earth guides and staff introduce riders to the many areas of Amsterdam. From the quiet streets of the Jordaan to the hustle of the Redlight District they cover it all. It was the highlight of my trip.

Best idea ever!!. We did a city tour with 'Jeff' and 12 cyclists. We had a terrific 3.5 hours and stopped at some sight seeing areas along the way. Jeff was very informative and plenty of humour to add to the day. He made negotiating traffic and people seamlessly easy. Highlight of our stay in Amsterdam and definitely recommend it!
City tour. Amazing tour though the city thanks to our guide Diego! Showing us the nice places and where we should take a visit, thank you!
Highlight of my trip in Amsterdam. Love the City Tour with Mike's Bike, its really the best way to see Amsterdam, our tour guide Diego was very knowledgeable and awesome!!

Great tour. When in Amsterdam you just have to ride a bike. This is a great tour to cover that. You ride from the canal district out in the country and back again. The sites and scenery are great. The cheese and clog factory was a welcome stop and very detailed and informative. Our guide Pete was very knowledgeable, great guide. Thanks Pete.

Excellent value bike rental. This is the second time with have used Mike's Bike rental. Yes, the bikes are slightly older than the bikes from other rental companies, but this is reflected in the price. They are extremely good value for money and always very friendly.

Best way to see Amsterdam.. This is an excellent way to see Amsterdam and get some local history and insight about the way of life in Amsterdam. Stuart was very good and gave us plenty of information about the sights. The ride is not strenuous and we stopped every 15 minutes or so for some local knowledge from Stuart and some water. We visited a farm where they make both cheese and wooden shoes. So we got to learn about both in one stop. Great fun!

An older and wiser Mike's Bikes experience, 10 years after my first!. I visited Amsterdam for the first time exactly 10 years ago and my friends and I splurged (at the time) on a Mike's Bikes tour for the afternoon. We had an absolutely brilliant time with our hilarious guide and learned a load of useless yet fun facts about the city and the countryside.Fast forward to today...I was back in Amsterdam for a weekend, older, wiser, and wanting to do the same tour we'd done before for memories' sake. We sadly didn't have enough time to commit to the whole tour (they absolutely don't let you leave the tour early if you're on the tour) so decided just to rent bikes for the day instead.It's true Mike's doesn't have flashy, shiny, or particularly well-maintained bikes on offer to rent, but have you seen the rest of the bikes in Amsterdam? That's not unusual! We were thrilled to find a bike rental for the day was about 1/3 the price of the tour and set off on the exact route the tour was headed.We ended up riding much further than we intended, but it was too lovely not to...by great timing alone, we arrived back at the cheese and clog farm just minutes before the Mike's Bikes group and did the exact same tour with them (for free). After we finished, we were free to adventure at our leisure without being held back by a large group. It was glorious!Mike's tours are great if you don't want to think about where you're going and aren't fussed about waiting for people to stop and take photos. If that's not your things, the bikes are a really great and cheaper alternative.

Great Bike tour but don't rent the bikes!. We took a bike tour the first day we got to Amsterdam and had a wonderful, very knowledgeable tour guide who led us all over the city. It was a great way to get oriented to the city and also to how to bike in Amsterdam, which is definitely scary at first. But a great way to get around. And at the end our tour guide gave us lots of helpful info about biking trips going outside of the city. So, the tour was great. But, the problem was the bikes you rent from them are not in good shape. My husband got a flat tire 10 miles out of the city and we had to walk the bike back to our hotel. I was further disappointed that when we called Mikes from our hotel, they wouldn't even come pick up the bike insisting that we bring it back. So take the tour, but rent from a better bike company of which there are many to choose from. You will pay a little extra but its worth it!

Best day in Amsterdam. Was the best idea to do this tour, so my husband tells me. He who doesn't like tours, loved it. We have been to Amsterdam three times, this was the best way to see it. Our tour guide Jeff who rides The Dude is the best tour leader. Very informative and covers the past and present events with a cruiser attitude. With a well earnt beer or two; to finish. Well done to Mikes bike tours.

Amazing bike tour of Amsterdam countryside. We booked the countryside side tour in advance of our trip. Finding the location and checking in for the tour was simple. Carl/Karl was our tour guide. He was hilarious and made the tour really fun. You go along the Amstel river, bike outside the city, see a windmill, fields, cheese/clog farm, lake, forest, and bike back in the city. The cheese/clog farm was cool to see as the cheese was amazing. It was a 4 hour 18 mile bike tour where you bike for most of the time. While some claim it is not strenuous, it seemed a bit strenuous especially if the wind was against you. However we had a great time and the bike seats were really comfortable. I miss my bike the 'Grape Ape.' All the bikes have a names. :) Make sure to eat a heavy breakfast before the tour as you don't stop for lunch anywhere. Also bring water with you too. We found the time for guests to eat snacks they brought after the cheese/clog farm was a waste of time.

Not much history, but. So glad we got to go on side streets. Not much fun or history on the bike tour until after we bought our tour guide a beer. After that he relaxed and opened up and became much more relaxed. Over all it was fun and we would do it again.

Best part of our trip. We chose the "country" tour of Amsterdam. It was about 5 hours. Our guide took us through areas of Amsterdam we would have never seen had we not taken the tour. Gorgeous parks where the locals row, train for field hockey, soccer, etc. I wouldn't necessarily say it was "country" but we were outside of the central Amsterdam. Great tour!

Excellent value and so much fun. We went on this tour on a sunny November Sunday. Our guide Yessica was very good at keeping everyone together and provided a really interesting commentary to the ride. We covered about 10km but it was not strenuous, very gentle with lots of stops. Our last stop was at a pub in a windmill for local beers and cheese. This is certainly the best way to see Amsterdam and I would definitely do this again.
Back country tour. Nice and easy ride out of downtown Amsterdam. We had a fun guide (Karl), decent bikes, and nice scenery.
Sam was the bomb! . Thanks for the tour Sam. My husband and I found you very entertaining and incredibly humorous! Thanks for the great tour.

Countryside tour is a must-do!. I spent time on my first day in Amsterdam with with walking tours getting to know the history of the city. I booked with Mike's Bike Tours for a ride through the countryside for my second day. It was time well spent. The group was about 20 people, and we had excellent weather. The ride was along the Amstel River and then along other canals. We visited a windmill, farm, and the Olympic grounds from the 1928 Olympics to name just a few sights. My bike was comfortable and well maintained. Our guide was great and seemed to really enjoy showing us around.

The tour you must take. This is really a must'see tour. Every time I visit AMS with different friends, this is the first thing I do. The tour has a perfect duration and it is exaustive at all. The guides are really well informed and English native speakers. My tip: Program yourself to take the tour as you arrive in town. After that, rent a bike and go back on the sites you enjoyed most.

Best way to explore Amsterdam. I was travelling alone to Amsterdam for the weekend and decided to take this bike tour. I highly recommend taking this tour on your first day in Amsterdam, it helps you orientate and you basically get to see every highlight the city has to offer! The staff were knowledgeable, entertaining and extremely friendly. Can't wait to go back to Amsterdam and visit Mike's Bike again!!!
Best day out.... Bikes, windmills, cheese, flowers...What more could you ask for In a day out in Amsterdam. Best day of my trip! Thanks to the fun and knowledgable guides.

Nothing compares to the simple pleasure of riding a bike - especially on this tour!. Booked whilst in Amsterdam; hassle free and fun from start to finish. The weather was miserable but the tour was an absolute joy. Three hours of easy riding, full of both historic and recent facts and stories. Interesting and entertaining! Lots of stops and opportunities to chat and absorb the beautiful surroundings. Suitable for all ages and cycling ability. Great bikes, all named! Alec (our guide) was friendly, humorous, helpful and knowledgeable. Definitely recommend 'Smurfette' & 'Quid'.

Countryside Tour with Mikes Bikes. We booked out tour online and the next day arrived at Mikes bikes to find all was in place for us, and the 35 other people who booked. This was not a problem for the crew, they had us all organized in a flash and split into two groups, after our ride rules and info session we hit the Amsterdam pavement and quickly into the countryside. With no hills to climb it was a relaxing and very enjoyable cycle, a tour I would highly recommend.

Great way to see the city. I did the city tour with a group of friends. Diego, our guide was very knowledgeable and friendly and had a great sense of humour. The tour was a little over 3 hours and took in the lots of sights, there was even time to visit a brewery and windmill on the edge of the city. Our guide gave us lots of interesting information about the city and was happy to answer questions along the way not just about the places we visited but also about places to eat & visit. The bikes are very comfy and easy to ride. If you want a chilled way to see the city and learn lots in the process this is definitely the way to do it.

See Amsterdam and feel like a local. Great experience. We were broken into groups of ten and each spent three hours with a knowledgeable and entertaining guide. All the main sights are covered and we felt that we had experienced Amsterdam like locals - on bikes. The trip to the micro brewery at the end is really good

Great tour!. Me and my wife had a Great bike tour with them. The Guide Alec, from california, and Diego, took us inside the real amsterdam with a funny touch of way to teach the history. Great time!! Regards for you! José and Sheila from Brasil.

100% recommend renting a bike from here while in amsterdam. Four of us travelled to Europe and spent about three days in Amsterdam. We heard about this bike tour place from a friend, but decided to just rent bikes ourselves for one day while in Amsterdam. The guys working there were very friendly and helpful. They showed us where to go for a nice ride, and plus Amsterdam is really flat so renting a bike is the fastest, easiest and cheapest (and fun) way to see the city. I'm not lying when I say this was probably the best day of my life. We went to the cafe up the road, bought a couple of pre-rolled spliffs and explored Amsterdam for the day.The prices were deadly too, just a few Euro's. I'd recommend these guys and recommend renting a bike to explore Amsterdam.

A hilarious family bike tour of Amsterdam, you must do this!. We have done a few walking or biking tours of cities now as its a great way to see the great bits in a short period of time and Mikes Bike Tours was by far the most fun one we have done. Sam our tour guide should do stand up but fortunately he does tours and looked after the group very well, we all learnt a lot about the city and managed not to get run over by any trams in the process. The bikes are modern and well maintained and although the four hour tour may seem like a chore, the country is flat and you only ever cycle for a few minutes at a time. Going to go again the next time we visit (going to look out for those ducks though, very nasty creatures according to Sam....).

Great fun for an afternoon. My two kids and I had a great afternoon in the company of Geoff and Diego from Mikes Bike tours. An entertaining tour around Amsterdam City with lots of interesting and funny information about Amsterdams past and present history

Highly Recommended!. Mike's Bike Tour (countryside) was everything as promised. Fun, informative and upbeat guide (Alex) made it a relaxing and super interesting trip. Hearing the history and funny anecdotes along the route makes it a rich experience, not just a bike ride. Bikes were comfy, rain gear supplied as well as saddlebags for your stuff; leave the backpacks behind. Great way to start a holiday in Amsterdam as you get an overview of the area and can learn a lot from the guide about what else to do during your stay.
Great fun. Really enjoyed the city bike tour with Stuart! excellent value for money!felt we got a great overview of the city! Especially loved the beer stop at the micro brewery! Thanks Stuart!

Great Bike Rental Experience. We did not take a tour with this company, just rented two bikes from them for two days. We found the pricing reasonable and online reservation process easy and fast. The check-in was quick. Our bikes were great. They were less obvious as some of the other bike rentals that splatter logos all over the bikes. We like to think that we didn't look too touristy on them, although us pulling over frequently to double check where we were going gave us away, I'm sure!So glad we decided to see the city on bike. It afforded us a very different way of seeing of Amsterdam. We were able to do a spa day at a spa about a 30 minute ride from where we were staying in Jordaan, so we got to see a part of the city we never would have seen without the bikes.

Making the most of 3 hours in Amsterdam. Having one day in Amsterdam mike's bike tour was a great way to see the city and feel like a native. Comfy bikes and the only hills being the bridges over the canals, with an informative guide Stuart, we will definitely be back to spend more time in Amsterdam. Looking forward to doing the countryside tour with them next. Highly recommended.

Great tour of the surrounding countryside. This was a great tour with a stop at ta farm on the way. The time flew by, and the guide was really caring given that I wasn't confident in my cycling skills to begin with.

Great Tour & Interesting Information. If you're visiting Amsterdam, I would highly recommend doing the country side bike tour. It was about three and a half hours (not entirely spent biking). We were able to arrive early on a weekday and sign up for the tour about thirty minutes prior to departure. Our tour guide was great (Alec) and provided a lot of interesting information about the country and its history. We biked to a farm and learned about cheese and wooden clog making. Cheese samples included! It may be a good idea to pack a snack or water. Overall, a great way to experience the country side of Holland.

Fun Bike Trip through Amsterdam and surrounding countryside. My husband and two kids (young teenagers) had only 3 days in Amsterdam. The best time we had -by far!- was the trip with Mike's Bike Tours. The place was easy to find in the heart of the city, the tour guide was friendly and knowledgeable, and the bike ride was absolutely wonderful! We went through the city (which I have to admit was a little scary with all the cars even though this is definitely a biking town) but most of the day was spent riding through grassy areas outside of the city. We rode along the river and stopped at an old wind mill for the perfect Amsterdam photo opportunity, then continued to a farm house. There, we were given a demonstration on the making of Dutch cheese, then wooden shoes. Of course, we then were able to purchase either. We bought cheese and brought it home. It was so good we wish we had bought a bigger wheel of cheese! We brought sandwiches on the ride, and ate lunch at the farm before heading home (on a different scenic route). We really felt like we saw a lot of Amsterdam, and we enjoyed a beautiful day outside with a group of other tourists out to have fun. This was one of the best experiences of our entire 2 week European vacation.

Highlight of our trip. Out tour guide, Aaron, was amazing. Out boys loved him. Aaron made our bike tour totally famil. Aaron made our bike tour totally family friendly. Everyone in Mike's Bike Shop was friendly and very helpful. This was our first bike tour and we all loved all it.

Fantastic Tour. My 14-year-old son and I went on Mike's Countryside tour, and I recommend it very highly. Alec, our guide, did a great job giving us a fun, informative tour, and was able to chat easily with everyone. Their bikes were very nice (especially compared to our other city bike rental), and the ride was a perfect distance and time. I had been a little worried beforehand that a 4-hour ride would be too long, but there are several stops along the way, and the time flew by. I would go so far as to say that even if you're only in town for one day, this is a great activity.

Thumbs up to the country + city bike tour!. If you're in Amsterdam, you can't miss this - I was in the city with 9 other friends and we signed up for the 4 hour country and city bike tour: we were not disappointed! Even though 4 hours seems like a long time to be on a bike for people who are not regulard bike users, the bikes were very comfortable and easy to manage so we didn't feel tired, also because we had stops every 20 mins or so.Stuart, our guide, was very informative and entertaining, and we even had a chance to meet an eccentric farmer who showed us their cows and how they make cheese and clogs! Definitely to be done if you're into exploring the countryside life and getting out of the city to take a break from the crazy local cyclists!
Countryside Tour. Wonderful tour led by Aaron! I would recommend it to anyone who wants an authentic experience outside the busy streets of Amsterdam. Money well spent!

A different way to view the City. We booked this tour as part of our first visit to Amsterdam. Pre-booked the tour via their website, which was very easy and straightforward. Our tour guide was Stewart (the Canadian guy everyone keeps talking about) who provided interesting information about Amsterdam, whilst keeping us all entertained with his stories and humour. He also made sure the group were all safe during the tour, even going back to look for one member when he went astray. Thoroughly enjoyed this experience, and it gave us a good insight into places we wanted to revisit over the weekend. Must do when you are in Amsterdam.
Fun and educational.... We had a blast! Nice and scenic ride. Our guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. I highly recommend this if you visit Amsterdam.

Fantastic!. It was a very pleasant experience. Our guide was so passionate about Amsterdam and The Netherlands, so it was a real adventure to find out his stories and to take his path through this fascinating city. The tour lasted more than 4 h, we had a drink in a local brewery and we definitely don't regret that one day of our visit to Amsterdam was monopolized by this trip. It's well worth it!

A must do. We took the city tour on a cold day in March but were warmed up by our Guide with a fun laid-back tour. I'm terrible at remembering names but I think it was Geoff a Canadian guy who had lived in Amsterdam for several years. He took us through history, politics, hippies, sex, drugs and I think the only thing he left out was 'rock & roll'.We ended the tour in a Windmill with micro brewery attached, fantastic beer and a chance to warm up.Going to book another bike tour when we return in the summer.

Not your stodgy old tour. I took the city tour on the first nice day of the year. Guide was a Canadian who had lived in Amsterdam for several years. He provided sort of an edgy view of the politics and last few decades of the city's history - I learned a lot and enjoyed hearing that point of view. Liked hearing a bit about how the hippies of the 60s and 70s influenced the local culture, about the drug and prostitution culture, and most of all about the Dutch philosophy behind their laws. Guide made sure we were all safe. Nice to cover a lot of the city in only three hours, and a good way to get an overview and decide where to focus on future trips.

Loved Both Tour and Rental. My boyfriend and I had only three days in Amsterdam. We had been traveling through Europe for two months and this was the only city that we cared to spend the money on a tour, one, because our stay was so short and we wanted a summary of its offered highlights, and two because we wanted to experience the obvious biking culture. Our opinion, you haven't experienced amsterdam unless you find your self pedaling through streets of crooked houses, flowering parks, and over the lovely canal bridges. The tour was fantastic, led by a native dutch gal. It wasn't dry and boring at all. We really felt like we got a feel of life in Amsterdam. The bikes were SUPER comfy and easy to use. All in all...so worth it. We recieved discount cards after the tour and went back the second day to rent bikes and do some of our own exploring. We rode along the Amstel River (suggested!) Through a cute, neighboring village, two parks, and through the city. For four hours, with the discount cards, and as students, it was 10€ for the both of us together! So great. Definitely recommended.

Great way to see/learn about Amsterdam. Our tour (led by Alec, an American who's been living there a couple of years) was entertaining, informative and gave a great overview of the city. If you're able to I recommend beginning your visit with this tour - it covers a lot of ground and lets you get a sense of where things are and which parts of the city you might want to spend more time in. It also does an excellent job of covering the history (which I was sadly ignorant of), which helps put some of what you'll see in the museums (if you go to any) and the present-day culture (including, of course, the more famous/infamous aspects) into perspective. Oh, and we wrapped the tour up at a brewery, which was just awesome.

So much fun. We did the city tour which was apx 3 hours. Lots of fun, stopped several times for lots of fun facts as well as historical ones. Our guide was great, definitely recommend, would do it again!

The Best Way to See Amsterdam. The bike tour by Mike's Bike Tours in Amsterdam absolutely has to be the best way to see and learn about the city. Our guide was fantastic, knew the city, and made the trip a lot of fun. We not only got to see the major sights of the city, but also many of the different neighborhoods with their unique architecture and histories. You cover so much more ground on a bike than you could ever do by walking or canal boat tour. To top it off you get to also experience first hand the biking culture of Amsterdam. Not to be missed.

A great way to see Amsterdam. This was a brilliant day. Our guide was Aaron and I was chosen to be the back-marker in the group. Started with a good safety briefing and then set off on a tour of all the interesting places around the city that would be tricky if left to your own devices. We would never have found all the interesting places if we had simply hired the bikes and gone off on our own. Highly recommended.

They burnt down the stock exchange!. Mike's Bike Tour is a suitably cheeky breeze through Amsterdam, a city where the bike is king and where the king and royalty in general appear to be regarded with anything from amusement to contempt if the history we were taught was anything to go by. This is the tour where you don't just go through the red light district you find out about the history of the Amsterdam social experiment with everything from the mass squat of Vondell Park to cannibis selling caffs covered. And you form an entertaining tourist convoy which accomodates seasoned city cyclists and people who have not ridden a bike since they were kids. Our tour guide put safety first and made sure he rescued any stragglers. He was also friendly, approachable and laid back whilst being a mine of information and anecdotes. I came away from an invigorating day feeling i'd understood the character of this quirky city better. If you're staying a few days then book Mike's Tour at the beginning because it'll help orientate you quickly.

wonderful way to tour the city. We really enjoyed our bike tour of the city (although a short clarification of road rules beforehand would have been good for a slightly nervous rider). It was a great way to see a lot of the city. Our guide was informative and friendly and made sure everyone stayed in the group, which was helpful! Not too strenuous of a ride for a sometimes cycler either. Would recommend!

Great place to rent a bike in Amsterdam.. Super affordable, close to our hotel, wonderful staff and excellent bikes. We really enjoyed going with Mikes rather than a big chain. Would definitely use again on our next trip.

Best prices in town.. We rented three bikes for a day, it was waaaay cheaper than any other place we visited (6 euros per bike from 10 to 18). The attendants were very nice and showed us how to use the lock system.

fun and informative tour. Good bike tour around central Amsterdam, with good guide Aaron. Saw lots of city areas we may not have stumbled on, Enjoyed the combination of semi-frenetic cycling and then 10 min breather or coffee shop (really, coffee). Bit scarey with no helmets and, evidently, little roadsense amongst the natives.

Best way to see Amsterdam - forget the canal tours. This was really great! Alec was our guide and he was fanastic. This has to be the best way to see Amsterdam, just like the locals. We were a family of four (including an 11 & 13 year old) which made some interesting challenges for our guide at some "adult" points (red light district, coffee houses etc) but he was very professional and the others in the group didn't miss out. Go for it, this is really good!

Easy rider...... As a group of 10 we had a private tour with Vincent.Riding was very easy going and Vincent had plenty of knowledge to keep us entertained throughout the tour.Bikes were solid and comfortable.
Best bike's rental place in Amsterdam!. Great bike spot Amsterdam, 8€ (insurance included) 24h bike :) Good service, very nice people. Dont miss it!

Really great tour. I went on a 4 hour bike tour around Amsterdam. It was a great way to experience the city (much better than the canal tours in my opinion) and our guide (Stuart) was very engaging. I'd definitely recommend it.

Loved it - highlight of trip!. One of the two top highlights of our recent Amsterdam trip - the other highlight was Anne Frank House. Our guide Jessica was informative yet humorous. Fantastic way to familiarise yourself with the city in 3.5 hours!

Girls Trip. My friend and I did 4 days in Amsterdam and this is a perfect way to start off your trip! We got to see all the major sites and get great insight on where to go for good food and beer. The tour guides were all informative and helpful and the old mill house was my favorite. If we had more time and proper gear to wear, we would have done their other countryside tour. Biking is a great way to see the city without getting lost lol

Great bike tour of Amsterdam. We had a 3.5-hour bike tour, led by a fun and knowledgable young Dutch woman named Jessica. We saw a lot of the city center, stopped for a piece of apple cake and coffee at a place she knew, and learned a lot about the history of Amsterdam. Great way to see the city, and the cycling is leisurely. Jessica did a good job of helping us navigate the traffic in the few spots where things could have been tricky.
Fantastic!. Did a bike tour with a tour group on a Saturday morning. They took us around the city and gave us another insight into Amsterdam! Defiantly recommended!

So much fun!. I have done a canal tour and walked all over the city. This is the way to see Amsterdam. We did a three and a half hour city tour and we saw a bit of everything. The exclusive Jordaan area, the Red Light district, Vondelpark, the Museumplein. Our guide was funny, clever and a great storyteller. The story of the hippies living in Vondelpark in the 60s and 70s was one of the highlights of the day. We felt like we WERE Amsterdamers on our bikes. Cyclists rule the city and it's so great to be apart of this culture, if only for a day. The pace of the tour was great and we stopped for a drink at nearly the end of the tour at a bar in a windmill. I would highly recommend this experience and intend to take the country tour the next time I'm in Amsterdam. Note, there's a really great healthy take out food store just down the street, to grab a quick snack before the tour.

Great Scenic Ride. We did the country scenic ride early morning and had great weather.Pros:Well organizedEasy to bookGreat tour guide, Pete!Very scenicCons:Bikes are very well used!The dairy farm/shoe maker stop.The shoemaker was mostly concerned with flirting with the young women in the group and made them all gather around him so he could tease them. I personally thought the guy was condescending towards the entire group. It would of been nice to make more quick stops to take pictures of the wonderful country side.That being said it was well worth the 4 hours. 5 stars for Pete our Tour guide!!!

Excellent city and country bike tours. I booked a city and a country tour with Mike's Bikes for a recent trip to Amsterdam. The city tour (led by Alex) was great fun, with lots of interesting information about the city and as an added bonus it was a lovely autumn day. It's a great way to familiarise yourself with the city and how to handle cycling in Amsterdam. Alex was professional but laid back - we had a thorough briefing about the bikes, traffic etc.The country tour (led by Stuart) included a stop off at a farm that makes cheese and clogs, which was so interesting. Stuart provided lots of information and history about the polders, as well as the current issues Amsterdam and the Netherlands face with climate change. He was an excellent tour guide. I'd recommend both these tours and both guides.

Best Bike Tour... by far.. Doing the Mike's Bike Tour in Amsterdam is a no brainer. The guides are exceptionally knowledgeable, charismatic, and approachable. They are eager to answer questions, with unique and interesting perspectives. While stopping at major historic and cultural sites within Amsterdam they inject humor, personality, and individualism. into their presentation. If you haven't tried it yet... you should. Our guide was Stewart, and he was phenomenal.

Class!. We did the city tour and it was brilliant. Geoff was our guide and despite it raining the whole time he made it extremely enjoyable. His knowledge was great could have listened to his stories all day. Well worth every penny. The best thing we did and a great way to see lots of the city.

Fun even in cold weather!. I did the country bike tour by myself in November! We had a group of 6 people. Our tour guide was nice, very knowledgeable, and had a great sense of humor! It was cold and rainy during my bike tour but it was still a great time and the biking keeps you warm!

The way to go. Hired the bike for 24hrs but kept it for longer. If you want it for longer keep it then hand it when finished they chare you at the end and it works out cheaper, def dont need insurance if you lock it up properly

Such a great way to see the countryside!. Listen up, people. This is not going to be a workout. It's an easy ride into the countryside. Wooden shoes. Cheese farm. The Amstel River. An authentic windmill. What more do you want? We went to a Champions League game (Ajax vs. FC Barcelona), Room of Riddles, and did this...and it's hard to choose which experience was best, they were all that good. Mike's Bikes rocks!

Awesome way to see the countryside of Amsterdam. I did the country tour which was excellent to get out of the busy city. Guide was really knowledgable and interesting, stop off at the cheese factory was great. Easy ride super flat but bring a beanie and gloves in winter because it gets super cold! Great value for money would recommend to everyone

Riding in a picture, just beautiful!!!. We are lucky to have a small group of five people and our tour guide, Sam, took good care of the group and brought lots of fun. The countryside views are stunning of course and the cheese farm is lovely. And you can buy the cheese there and they are cheaper than the shops in town or the airport. Definitely it's one of our favorite tours in the whole trip. Also, they got some cool ding dong bells at shop for sale. I got one for my new home, as a doorbell. So happy. One last thing, Sam said their bikes are all from the States and it's good because the seat is more comfortable. Tried and totally agree with that.

Great value and fun bike tour - ask for Alec!. Mike's City Bike Tour was the best value so far in Amsterdam. Four hours of very enjoyable cycyling on a comfortable and well-maintained bike. As a long time cyclist but first time visitor in Amsterdam, the guided tour helped me become more familiar with the rules and customs of biking in the city. Likewise, the tour helped me prepare for 3 more weeks of cycling in the city by pointing out areas of interest and routes I would not have discovered on my own. The tour guide, Alec, was entertaining, informative about Amsterdam (history and present day), very responsive to questions, and looked out for us but at the same time was very laid back and didn't rush the group like some tours I've been on. I'm going on the Mike's Country Bike Tour tomorrow!

Great Experience. After reading many reviews we decided to do this as soon as we arrived. Our guide , Jessica, was brilliant . It was a great way to see the sites and learn about the city. The only thing I wasnt prepared for was how unpopular tourists on bikes were with the locals. That dampened the experience for me a bit.

Best Tour in Town with Jessica!. As an Amsterdam local, i have tried out several companies with visiting international friends for bike tours. Jessica (Jessie) is absolutely the best bike tour guide in town, without a shadow of a doubt. First tour I actually learned something new about my own city, she is clever, funny and extremely kind. I love, love, LOVE the passion that she has for her job, and Amsterdam. It shows. Keeps the less experienced bikers perfectly safe. What a brilliant idea to stop at the beer brewery inside a wind mill. Me and my friends, also loved having a Dutch tour guide, as hearing the perspectives of a born local truly is an extra for the real experience.

Incredible city guide. I really suggest you to take the tour before walking around the city! Great overview for you to decide where to go later. Our amazing tour guide "Jeff" made us enjoy it even more! Congratulations!
Nice bike rental. It's a nice place to rent a bike. My only complaint was that my handbrake a were subpar leading to some close calls on the road

Great time. Best way to get a overview of the city. You ride through parks, very busy and also calm neighborhoods. Our guide was fun and knowledgeable and we went for tasty Dutch beer at the end. Every person taking the tour also gets a discount for another tour or rental.

The best thing we did in Amsterdam. We did the city tour with our two children, it was great fun, went all over town with a very knowledgable guide (albeit Canadian!) the bikes were very good and we all decided it was the best thing we did in Amsterdam.

The best introduction to Amsterdam. We went on the City Tour (with Geoff) and on the Countryside Tour (with Sam). Both were great tours and both guides were attentive, witty, informative and fun. The best way to see Amsterdam and get a flavor of this great city. Fully recommended.

The most fun! . My wife and I had Jeff as our guide. He was great. His knowledge of the city was awesome and told funny stories. Bikes were well maintained and comfy. Out of all the tours we took over our week stay in Amsterdam, this was my favorite.

BEST 3 HOURS IN AMSTERDAM. Want to see the main attractions in Amsterdam and get the city's history without the boredom?!? Then these guys are your first port of call. We had a 6'7" gentleman by the name of Geoff and he was quite simply the best tour guide I've ever listened to. Factual but extremely witty, personable but keeps everyone safe. And keeping 16 tourists safe whilst tootering around a major city on bikes through busy intersections and constantly crossing paths with other bikes is no mean feat in itself!!!It really does give you a sense of the city and culture as you meander around every significant cranny with half a dozen stops to catch your breath, take pics and giggle at Geoff's fabled take on history. The first time you are called an 'IDIOT!' for veering into another's path really seals the deal re culture...Could not recommend these guys highly enough... Brilliant couple of hours!!!
Best Bike Tour. We had a blast on our Bike Tour. Alec was a great guide. Gave great recommendations after the tour as well. We would do it again in a heart beat.

brilliant tour. We've done a few bike tours over the years, I have to say this had to be the best.
