We were given an introduction to the group by Sam who was brilliant, he actually included my 10 year old son in his jokes which I really appreciated as kids often get overlooked. The group was large so we were split into two groups of 15, Stuart our guide was like a walking encyclopaedia, absolutely brilliant, his knowledge of the city was incredible, he was friendly and entertaining and you always felt safe as you were cycling through the countryside and through the city, we got to see a windmill, cheese factory and clogs being made. My husband did his homework well!! I urge you to do this tour, terrific!!!

Helmets available. Was a bit apprehensive about taking a tour as we had not seen much evidence of cycle helmets and watching the locals cycle was a lot scary. But when we booked our tour with Mikes bikes ,there were plenty helmets available , even though we were the only tour members to take them. Sam the tour guide was entertaining and knowledgable. We had great time and peddling was gentle and traffic was ok. Finished up with a well earned drink at the windmill pub and a good view of some bonus zoo animals.

Fab Tour!!. This was a great way to see more of Amsterdam. The weather was mostly awful but we were provided with ponchos and had so much fun it did not matter. Sam our guide was very entertaining. Amongst the places we visited a windmill,a cheese farm and passed through Vondelpark which was beautiful. Money well spent. Would highly recommend.

Amazing way to see Amsterdam. Such a better way to see Amsterdam. You feel like a local riding a bike around the city and you get great history facts along the way. Our tour guide Alec was very informative and told us the history with humour. He got along with us all very well. For those who think riding a bike around the whole city will be tiring and exhausting, it's not in at all!! I would recommend this to anyone. And you are rewarded at the end by going to a brewery inside of a wind mill

Great time, perfectly inappropriate and educational. We loved our afternoon with Sam from Mike's Bike Tours. It took a few minutes to not be terrified of riding a bike in Amsterdam. We were amazed at how well our guide kept our group from getting lost in the city, even through busy intersections. Sam was equal-opportunity insulting and kept everyone laughing. We learned a lot about the city and the people in it from him. The tour lent itself to meeting new people too and we're keeping in touch with some great people we met. Couldn't believe that we covered almost the entire city in just a few hours! And that included the stop for beer at the windmill. Highly recommend this for one of your days in Amsterdam.

A very nice way to see Amsterdam. We visited Amsterdam in October 2014 and one of our aims was to book a bike tour. Mike's Bike was an excellent choice! There were 7 of us in the group, couples mostly, everybody had a good sense of humour, so we had much fun during the tour as well as while having a drink afterwards. Mike's an experienced guide, great knowledge, easy to approach, interested in us travellers as well. We enjoyed the tour so much that returned the next day and rented bikes for the whole day (got a discount for attending the guided tour). Mike told us a lot about Amsterdam's history and modern day and there was plenty of room for questions. The tour bikes were really comfy (the ones we rented independently the next day were bit more ...eee.. tired :D), the guide competent, the company enjoyable. Glad to recommend their services any time!

Our guide could have been better. We did the bike tour out of the city. We were a mixed group. We got the facts but not much more. Our guide, Vincent, could have been a bit more engaging. Nice guy not a great tour guide. It was mentioned in the brochure that we could bring lunch. What wasn't mentioned was that if you didn't bring lunch there wasn't a place to buy lunch or a drink. This could have easily been mentioned at the time of purchasing tickets. There was a family with 2 young children who hadn't read that info and they didn't have lunch or a drink. One of the children struggled and it was only near the end that our guide adjusted the bike. There was also no back marker and in a group with range of riding abilities a back marker would have been good. I think it is a but far for a family with young children (8-12 yrs old about), I am not sure if this was mentioned upfront, and they still decided to do it, but perhaps another tour would be better suited. The tour was not bad, but it wasn't brilliant either. I think it has potential to be a better tour but perhaps guide dependent. my sister in- law had done it before and last time had a good guide. It is nice to get out into the countryside and I would definitely recommend it for that, but probably guide dependent.

Loved it!. It was a perfect, sunny September day after a long stretch of rain. My wife and I booked a city tour, both being in Amsterdam for the first time (as tourists, at least :)).We're not particularly in shape, but love to ride bicycles, so we were a bit afraid and skeptical if we will be able to keep up. To our delight and thanks to a great guide who was keeping a watch-full eye on all of us (11 people), we had absolutely no problems managing Amsterdam traffic and bike paths. The bikes are included in the price of the tour and they are perfectly designed for Amsterdam streets. They are very easy to drive and we felt very relaxed and safe riding them.Our guide, Jeff, was in lack of better words, perfect! He managed to take us to all or most of the important places and do it with ease. He shared a lot of funny stories you will not hear from typical tourist guides. And he was very pleasantly surprised by all of us, because we managed to keep pace with ease. As a bonus, we received a little longer tour and had a refreshing beer at the windmill brewery.In the end, tour took a bit more than 3,5 hours and it was excellent!I highly recommend the tour, it's very relaxing, yet informative...
Never had so much fun. Had such a laugh on the city tour mike was our tour guide she was so fun if you want to see the sites book this

Amazing country side bike tour. I joined the country side bike tour and was really AMAZING by all means... price was cheaper than other companies... Guide Stewart was amazing very knowledgeable and provided us with loads of information about Amsterdam and so funny and helpful he even offered to help us with information regarding where to go, to eat or to do in Amsterdam and to be honest his recommendations was all great... route of the tour was unbeatable with wonderful views of the country side... bikes in a very good conditions pluscgot to meet new people too.. if i will be back anytime to Amsterdam I would definitely join them again in another tour.

Cheap, unobtrusive rental. I didn't go on the tour, I just rented a bike. It was the cheapest rate I found PLUS it was the only place that accepted what I could provide as a deposit - I had a passport, a driver's license, and a debit card, but no credit cards, and most places required either the passport AND 50 euro cash (which I did not have) or credit card copies (without accepting debit). Since that was not an option for me I'm glad I went with Mike's, which had less obtrusive, more basic looking bikes anyhow. Granted, my lavender bike was slightly noticeable, but a lot less than a bright orange MacBike or something. All in all it was a good deal for a basic bike rental. (Now as someone who didn't know her way around that well, I did get very turned around and confused by the extent of the bike traffic, but that's hardly the rental company's fault!)

Great way to see the city. This tour was unexpectedly good. Jeff was very entertaining and provided great history and insight into the places we visited that you can't get from books. Well worth it. Everyone rides bikes in Amsterdam so this is a safe way to experience it first hand.
Entertaining ride.. We had Geoff/Jeff and he was great. Did a tour of all the stuff you would expect to see and allowed us to get our bearings on the city. Would recommend.

Excellent bike tour getting the best of city and countryside. Really enjoyed our bike tour through part of the city and into the country .We were nervous of hiring bikes in the City not having any city bike experience, but cycling is one of the best modes of transport in Amsterdam and there is great infostructure. Our tour guide Stuart was really helpful informative and approachable and made the experience enjoyable. It was really good to see a proper windmill and clog making factory if you can call a old Dutch farm a factory =] I have to say the farmer is pretty eccentric but hilarious, "I don't like men , so come closer ladies " My misses isn't the stongest on a bike and she managed fine due to good organisation and confidence given from the instructor.If we had more time we would have done the city tour as well!!

helluva ride. A great bike ride! We were seven people (3 women and 4 men) led by Mike throughout the city. There was much info to absorb but the whole experience was fun. Mike's humour is the best. Traffic whether pedestrian, cars or fellow cyclists fell into a synchronicity that at times fell into the magical. Occasionally we'd take a break and find out about the neighbourhood we were in. Near the end we stopped at a cafe and had a libation. A most excellent way to spend the afternoon.

Fun and informative way to cycle in Amsterdam. Cycling is a must in Amsterdam, and what better way to do it than a guided tour of the city with the friendly, enthusiastic, and at times downright hilarious Mike's Bikes? For only 18 euros each we were each given a light and easy-to-manoeuvre bike, instructed on the rules of the road and the cycling bell code (one ring means 'excuse me', two means 'you seem not to have heard me', and frantic ringing means 'get the *** outta my way!'), and then taken on a two hour tour of the city by a funny a knowledgeable guide who would stop us all every now and again for all sorts of stories about the area we were cycling through. My only caveat would be that the roads of Amsterdam can be a little scary, what with the bikes, trams, cars, motorcycles and pedestrians going in all directions, none of whom believe in braking, and while you quickly get used to this, it does mean you spend most of your time with your eyes firmly on the road ahead rather than checking out the scenery. For this reason if you want a really thorough tour, a walking tour might be better (but doubtless less fun!).

Excellent countryside tour. Had a fantastic time on the countryside tour with tour guide Stuart. Although quite long, the ride is fairly easy. The toughest part is negotiating the traffic. We had a group of 16. Stuart was very knowledgable about all things of Amsterdam and has a fantastic sense of humour. Stop off at a farm cheese factory and clogg making was interesting, and the ride through the parks and forest was great. Highly recommend this tour as a good starting point to then go off and explore Amsterdam.

The Only Way To Go!!. We had a week in Amsterdam and the first thing you need when in town is a bicycle. Mikes is central, friendly, and has reasonable rates. Our steeds where old but well maintained and took us all over Amsterdam.

The best way to get to know the city. Wanna spend an afternoon (or morning) laughing out loud while biking and getting to know one of Europe´s main touristic destinations? Don´t hesitate and do one of Mike´s Bike Tours :-)Due to a pretty busy schedule, we decided to do the Mini Bike Tour (2 hours) which turned out to be an amazing idea! Although biking in the traffic jam clearly is a dangerous thing, I would absolutely recommend it it to all adrenaline lovers who seek for different ways of getting to know the city :-)If possible ask for a guide called SAM (he was brilliant and absolutely hilarious) :-)

An excellent way to see (and learn about) Amsterdam. Our group of 2 adults and 3 teenagers did both the City Tour and the Countryside Tour.The City Tour with Alec was fantastic (we rated it 5/5), after a bit of disorganization getting the bikes out of the garage, we had a wonderful time cycling thru the streets of Amsterdam on a hot July day. Alec provided an excellent balance of history and fun, and some good restaurant recommendations as well. Our highest recommendation!The Countryside Tour was also fun, but we rated it only 3/5. Pete from Ottawa was our guide and he was excellent. There was much more cycling as you would expect and he did a good job explaining the history of the area. But we spent far to much time at the cheese farm/clog factory. It is a total tourist trap with a creepy owner making us all a little uncomfortable as he tried to chat up the "pretty lady" in his lame presentation. The cycling really was fun but the length of time we wasted at the tourist trap was unfortunate.
Definitely do the countryside bike tour!!. Did the countryside tour today. Was an amazing experience passing through scenic countryside and stopping at a windmill and a cheese farm along the way....

Great Fun - Awesome way to see the sights!!. Did the City Tour with Karl and was an UNREAL day!!! Had a ball the bikes were great, the sites are awesome and the knowledge of Karl about the city and sites was really good and always hilarious...the beers at the end of the day were awesome as well!!I suggest doing this as early as possible into your trip to Amsterdam so you get your bearings and get suggestions for everything!!!!

Country tour was great! . Did the country tour and it was beautiful! The cheese and clog farm was very enjoyable. Was a really nice way to see a different side of the Dutch culture. I had a great time! Was a really easy ride, I haven't ridden a bike for years and Although I was a bit shaky to begin with but soon adjusted! Would definitely recommend!

Had a ball. There's a few different companies offering bike tours of Amsterdam, like most we followed the Trip Advisor rankings and this one worked for us time wise, booked the full city tour last minute and it ended up being highlight of the trip. Everything is relaxed, well organised and reasonably priced. Our guide Stuart was awesome. Knowledgeable, very funny and constantly making sure we were all happy and well informed along the way. The bikes are super easy to ride, although it should be said, Amsterdam presents a few more challenges than some cities if you've done these rides before elsewhere. It's a busy city, with people, bikes, cars but as long you're aware of your surroundings it's all pretty easy. This is the city of cyclists afterall so everyone is very used to people scooting around. Stopped for a few beers at the end, had a chat and got the inside word on anything we wanted to know about the city. Just do it. It's a lot of fun.
Fantastic day!. Great day with Pete, he is very knowledgeable and approachable guide. We did the countryside tour and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Countryside Tour was such a splendid way to end my time in Amsterdam. Mike's Bike Tour provided me a great way to spend my last day in Amsterdam. I simply could not leave Amsterdam without getting on a bike. This tour provided me with a truly memorable experience. I opted for the Countryside tour. Our tourguide with a nice Englishman that was very well versed with the history of the City of Amsterdam and Holland as a whole. He was extremely friendly and accomodating. We took a scenic ride through the Countryside where we visited a farm where they make cheese and Dutch shoes. We did not feel any pressure to buy anything but the delicious cheese sample made it a must. Touring through the countryside provides one with a different experience of Holland and a much needed break from the excesses of Amsterdam. I can't recommend this tour enough and if I could provide it with 6 stars I would.
Excellent guided bike tour around Amsterdam. Excellent tour, Jeff was our guide. Very informative and funny. Nice few beers at the end of the tour too. Very enjoyable!

Great cycles!. Loved the cycles the company had to offer - they were extremely easy to ride. We did the mini city tour but would have liked to do the full city tour (they were booked out!). The mini city tour showed us all the main highlights of Amsterdam and also got us used to the bicycle traffic rules in Amsterdam. Staff was great. Though we would have liked to hear more about the city on our tour.

Amsterdam Countryside Tour. This was a nice little tour mainly outside of the city. Our tour guide, Stuart, was funny and knowledgable. He provided us with a great history of Amsterdam's foundation as well as more current events. He also answered any questions and provided suggestions for other activities available in Amsterdam.
City bike tour!. Had a fabulous time with Jeff, our guide. Great way to see the city, Jeff was super informative and fun. Highly recommend this!

Great Company, comfortable bikes!. We rented bikes from Mike's after reading some of the feedback on Trip Advisor before our trip to Amsterdam. The staff was friendly and courteous, as noted in previous posts. They made sure the bikes we used were in good condition and appropriate for our height. The staff member also showed us how to use the locks and provided a city map. We loved riding around the city! We also rode out to Muiderslot Castle. If you're not used to a lot of bike traffic, as we were not, it might be a good idea to spend a day or two walking around Amsterdam to adjust. It was a lot of fun spending the day on bikes!

Great tour. I started my visit to Amsterdam w/ Mike's Bike Tour, and it was a great way to get an overview of the city. Our tour guide took us to all of the major spots-- Vondelpark, the Museum Quarter, the Plantage, the Red Light District, Dam Square, the Jordan and more. I'm not in great shape and hadn't ridden a bike in several years, and I had no problem keeping up. My only suggestion for improvement would be smaller groups--my tour group had nine people.

Excellent tour. Very informative bike tour, helped us to get our bearings at the start of our weekend in amsterdam. Loved the brewery stop at the end. However can be busy along the way with other bikes, cars and trams to watch out for on the route. The guide always stayed close by to check none of the group were missing or behind. Was planning on doing the countryside tour but on booking decided on city tour maybe this was the wrong choice as I struggled with the busy streets and crossings at times. Would reccommend but just need to be roadwise.

Best bike tour ever!. I joined Karl's mini city bike tour and it was the best decision I made in Amsterdam! The tour was fun, well paced and spontaneous, such a nice break after joining a few other tours around Europe that all felt a bit stale and rehearsed. Karl was a great guide, funny and quite a character with some great anecdotes, but also giving us a great informative and conversational overview of the city. The best way to see Amsterdam is with mikes bikes! One of the best memories of my 4 month trip.

Not Good Enough!. We took a Mike's Bike Tour of Amsterdam following a Rhine River cruise because we were going to be spending 3 days in Amsterdam and wanted to get a feel for the city. The bike tour was not a pleasant experience. The city was extremely crowded with bikes and people being a Sunday afternoon and very difficult to negotiate on a bike or otherwise. The route was apparently chosen without consideration for traffic or construction and was a hectic experience. It was so difficult to ride, due to the congestion, that it was impossible to see the city. We only stopped a couple of times for "information" and missed a lot of parts of the city that should have been included on any tour... although we did stop once for "beer" at a nice brewery in a windmill. The people at Mike's need to spend a little less time being "cool" and a little more time selecting an appropriate routes that will enable their customers to enjoy the ride and "see" Amsterdam. There must be better bike tours than this!

Great way to be introduced to the city.. We did the city tour today with Jessica, she was wonderful. Nice easy biking, the canal alps were easy to handle so don't worry about straining yourself. I will say you do have to be careful so remember that is your responsibility, not the guide who may be 50 yards ahead, it's a busy town and just be aware. The price was the value buy off the week so far. Jessica really wanted to make sure we enjoyed ourselves and her sincerity came thru. We stopped 6 or 7 times with the highlight stop for some nice home town beers, the nibbles were nice too. I would highly recommend this fun afternoon to everyone.

Great way to be a part of the cycling culture. This tour is fantastic if you want to spend your day riding the streets of Amsterdam without worrying about getting lost. However, I found that the whole tour was spent riding, with very few stops and minimal information about the city. I feel the tour could really have benefited a bit more from that.

Worth Every Minute (And Penny)!!!!. I was in Amsterdam with a group of friends on a whirlwind Europe trip. We booked a countryside bike tour with Mike's Bike Tours and it was the highlight of our trip. They are quite organized in terms of reservations and getting things started on the tour but the real magic happens once you get going. We had a fantastic guide who was both informative and a lot of fun. We left the start point in the city and worked our way out to the countryside, visited the most amazing cheese farm I've ever been to (buy the cheese) and then finished the tour with amazing views of the countryside. It was a good five hours of riding but the bikes were very comfortable and we had people of all ages on the tour. I would highly recommend and take the tour again!

Mike's Bikes Amsterdam City Tour. This is a fantastic way to explore Amsterdam. The tour office is really central so very easy to get to and the prices are very reasonable - just 21 Euro for a three-hour tour and you get a discount card for any subsequent bookings. Our guide, Natasha, was very friendly and knowledgeable and took us to "real" Amsterdam as well as the obvious tourist spots. We cycled in a group of 12 people from all across the world and ended the tour with a beer. It's a brilliant tour and well worth a go.

Great time had!!. Booked a bike tour of the city, what an experience, myself and my partner loved it!! If your going to do a bike tour, would recommend Mikes Bike Tours, we had a fantastic tour guide and lots of banter and fun had. Fantastic!!

Great day!. We took the countryside tour which if you like bikes and want to see more than central Amsterdam this is the tour for you! All the staff at Mikes Bikes couldn't have been more helpful and friendly,safety was a priority but we also had great fun! Riding along the Amstel river, through the wetlands and back through the woodland was a welcome change from the crowds. Even the visit to a local cheese and clog maker was enjoyable! Can't recommend this enough.

Fantastic way to experience Amsterdam. My brother and I took the mini city tour last week with the guide Pete. He was great looking after everyone and gave us an informative and humorous tour of the city. I highly recommend this bike tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.
City Tour. We had a great time - 2 adults and 3 kids. Go with Alec if you get the chance - very knowledgable about the City and clearly loves living there. We had great fun.
Excellent choice.... We choose the countryside bike tour. It was fantastic. Our funny guide takes us to perfect places, such a cheese farm and amsterdam's forest.

very convenient way to explore Amsterdam. the tour was fun, the guide SAM was a little crazy & fun all the guys at Mikes are friendly and helpful. i have seen most of Amsterdam in 3 hours. if i had more i would have definitely gone for the countryside tour.

Everything as it should be.. Very friendly yet professional guides. Bikes were reliable and decent. Rented a bike right after the tour - should've rented one as soon as we got to Amsterdam! Next time!

Harbor Tour. Our tour guide, Pete, was smart and really an insider in Amsterdam. It was such a pleasure to ride with him in the city and around the harbor since we weren't yet familiar with routes and traffic. The Harbor Tour is less touristy than the common city tours. It focused on the waterways that make Amsterdam what it is, and some of the redeveloping areas of the city and their history.

A great day out. We did the country tour and had a fantastic time. It was well organised and the bikes were good quality. The groups were broken up so there were not too many people in each group. You must take food as there is not any to buy on the way.

Great, down to earth, helpful and legitimate business. The city tour was informative, easy going, fun and interesting, and bike rental is good, the locking system is tedious but they're decent bikes at a reasonable price, and the staff are helpful and friendly, would highly recommend and intend to go back their myself

Great way to start our first visit to Amsterdam.. Pete was very knowledgeable about the history of the City. The city tour was a great way to introduce us to this new treasure. We will now rent bikes and explore a little more on our own.

Great way to see Amsterdam..... This is a great way to see the city. Started from the r location in Amsterdam, we cycled around most of the city, seemed like it anyway, and ended with a stop at the Windmill for a well earned drink! Kate, the guide, was very informative and very, very funny!! Stopped at most of the main attractions and gave us a good view of the city from the bikes. Great fun and well worth the time and effort.

Get on A Bike and Get Out of the City. We visited Amsterdam the weekend of the Gay Pride Parade and the city was crowded and crazy. Luckily, we arranged to take the Mike's Bike Tour outside the city. It was so nice to get out of the city center and ride through the countryside. Our guide, Mike, was absolutely hilarious, but also informative. We visited a windmill, a cheese & wooden shoe shop, and some lovely parks. The ride is easy and uncrowded most of the way. If you want to get off your feet and have a fun day out, book a Mike's bike trip.

Be a part of Amsterdam, Ride a bike. Started our Amsterdam stay with a Mike's bike tour. Karl (with a K) led a group of us around the city, stopping at the main places of interest and providing an interesting and amusing narration along the way. A beer stop towards the end was fun and allowed the group to ask questions. Learning how to bike in Amsterdam is essential, and with what we learned on our tour gave us confidence to bike the rest of our stay. Liked the city tour so much we ended up returning for the country tour on our last day in the city. This time Stewart as guide. The clouds opened up and we rode in downpours, but the large ponchos they provide managed to keep us relatively dry, and it was fun. Tour along the Amstel river included a stop at a windmill, a farm that produces cheese and makes wooden shoes, and ride thru the countryside.When in Amsterdam, take the bike tour and commute like the citizens of the city. It is a great way to see more of the city than you can ever do walking.

Great way to see the countryside. We went on the Countryside Tour today. Our guide Mike (female) was excellent. She was so positive and upbeat. You start in the city but before you know it you are cycling along the river in the country. We saw a windmill and went to a cheese farm and clog making. It was great. We really enjoyed it and it is definitely not too strenuous - quite relaxing once you are out of the city. It was a small group of about 9. Would recommend it if you have a day to spare while in Amsterdam.

Mike (the pretty one) bike tour fun. Wearing her clogs Mike led us out to the countryside to experience the windmill, cheese and clogs. It was sooo much fun and a must for anybody!! Even my 80yr old dad loved it (and Mike) :) Mike is very passionate about her city which made the trip even more special. I feel that I know so much more about Amsterdam from doing this tour.So if you want a laugh on some very comfy bikes book a tour with these guys.

Mini city tour and bike hire. Took the mini city tour then continued the bike hire for the weekend. City tour gave us the basics of biking in Amsterdam and a layout for the city. With confidence gained we spent the weekend zipping all over on some great bikes. Reluctantly retuned at the end of the break :( No giant logo's on the bike screaming 'Tourist'.Great service, with relaxed friendly staff. Email correspondence before was both prompt and helpful.

Great tour. In spite of the fact, that it was raining nearly during the whole trip, it was great. I took the country tour and it was the best choice. You ride along the city and the country site, getting the info from the guide ( not too much but well enough to get the impression ). The guides are very positive, so the humor and happiness are the bonuses as well.

Countryside Bike Tour. The Countryside tour was a lot of fun. You start out in the city and bike out to a cheese farm where they also make clogs. There's a gift shop there and free cheese samples. The ride is very nice and flat. It did rain hard on our trip, but Mike's provided the proper rain gear. We still got wet, but it was minimal.As for our guide, he was a self-proclaimed vagabond that was very much into himself. It got old real fast. Then he was basically demanding tips at the end of the tour (so we could help him get to Japan and New Zealand). He had the gall to tell a German couple who was on the way out the door that he wished he knew how to say 'tip' in German. They looked shocked and came back and gave a few Euros.This was my 3rd Mike's Bikes Tour (first 2 in Munich) and the first time a guide has ever been like this. The tour itself is nice but our guide was just a farce.

Great tour of the city. We went on the rainiest day ever! Torrential rain and thunderstorms for the whole 3.5hrs tour. Still it didn't dampen our moods. It was a fun tour of all the major attractions in Amsterdam and we really enjoyed it. The guide was knowledgable, and the bikes great a favourite of ours as we collect Elecrtas. I would use them again for a country tour.

Pleasant Countryside Tour. Did the countryside tour back in late July and had a good time. It was nice to see a different side of Amsterdam. My guide was Mike- the girl! And she was quite jolly, making the tour even more enjoyable. We went to a clog and cheese factory, saw a windmill and got a bit of info on Amsterdam. With good weather, this is a great tour.

Awesome, low key would do it again. Did the city tour, roughly 4 hours. Really great trip, saw all the major sites and ended at a Windmill brewery right outside the city. Our bike guide Sammy was the best!!

Rented bikes for a few days - offered discount without asking.. Very friendly and not out to rip you off. i rented two bikes and they asked where i was staying, then offered discount i wasn't aware of. then also gave student discount. bikes were in good condition. highly recommended, and great value.

Great fun. Loved it. There's safety in numbers riding bikes in the Dam!
Alec was a fantastic guide who was passionate about his topic and true to his word went back to retrieve lost riders! Cheers!

Great afternoon with the bike posse !!!. We went on a 3 hour city tour with Kate on the 24th August What can we say.........fun,informative,great tour guide,beautiful city and really cool old school bikes,a great way to spend my birthday.Kate you were a star,you made everyone feel part of the group If you want to see Amsterdam off the beaten track then get out of the cab walk to mikes and get on a tourOur tour ended up being 3 and half hours long because we stopped at a pub for a beer and lost track of time because Kate was regaling us with some great stories about Amsterdam .Bike,1 beer and some local history,perfect dayNeil and Michele London UK

Great!. Nice experience! You can ride on comfortable bikes with good guide and enjoy in this nice city.Staff is friendly and professional.Don't miss this tour if You are in Amsterdam , because is really one of the best thing that you can try.Good ride and all the best !

Best part of our trip. Karl was our tour guide and he was so fun and knowledgeable that it made the experience very enjoyable. Even though it rained a bit they provided us with very good ponchos (not like the ones we bought in town that fell apart, trust us, spend the money and get good ones) and we still had a blast. The cheese farm was really interesting and please note the cost of cheese here if you want to buy it is less than you'll find at all the retail stores, so we wished we'd bought even more. The tour covered windmills, many parts of the city, a working cheese farm etc. etc. We'd been to Amsterdam before but really felt like we learned a lot more and saw much more of the city by doing this tour. Thanks Mike's Bikes and Karl for a great time.

Best Way to Spend a Day in Amsterdam. I absolutely loved Mike's Bike Tour in Amsterdam. My boyfriend and I only had a couple of days here, but doing this tour is a great way to see the whole city in an afternoon. You need to ride a bike while in Amsterdam, it's quite simply the best and most sensible way to get around. Although a bit intimidating at first, I enjoyed biking with a group as it's much easier to get around. We had Mike as a guide, and he took us through the whole city with a few stop offs to get lots of information. We were told not only about the modern life and culture, but we received tons of history on this amazing city. Mike was fun, laid back, and full of information. He even took us to a local beach bar that he loved, and we all enjoyed a nice beer on a sunny day. This tour was amazing, and has really made me want to visit Amsterdam again. If you are looking for an easy way to see the city, I would highly recommend this tour.

A great way to see the sights but with few stop offs.. I was looking forward to a bike tour in Amsterdam after doing one in Paris and being extremely impressed. The staff immediately seemed more relaxed here and just asked us to hop onto the bikes and away we went. In total, we perhaps did 4 stop offs around Amsterdam and our guide provided us with a brief explanation of each place we stopped off and general historical information about the country. We were in a group of 12 and unfortunately 3/4s of the way through the tour, one person fell off their bike and the guide had to go back to get her. After this incident, she took a while to get the courage to get back onto the bike and the tour guide just seemed to get very grumpy and annoyed with this 'inconvenience' and appeared to rush us back to the place after this incident. I gave it very good as the information he did provide before this incident was interesting but he could have been a bit more patient and allowed the rest of the group to continue to enjoy the rest of the tour. Cheap too!
Great tour. We had Sam as our guide he was excellent very good sense of humour would recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam who wants a quick break from the craziness

Nice Bike Ride, Would Have Enjoyed More Information. I'm kind of a bike tour junkie--I love them. So when we booked a weekend trip to Amsterdam, the city of bikes, I knew we needed to do a bike tour. We picked Mike's based on the good reviews, but I was a little disappointed in the actual tour. The guide was great at taking us around the city and the ride was really fun. We got a great feel for what it was really like to get around the city on bikes. My gripe is about the content of the stops. I wish I had known that there would be such a focus on the coffeehouse culture and bar scene in Amsterdam. Yes, I know a lot of people come to Amsterdam for that. But I would have like to hear a little bit more about the history of the city and other things. We did have a few folks in our group who were really interested in this, so maybe that is why the guide focused on that, but I wish I had known this would be the focus before signing up for the tour, because I might have chose something else.

Lots of fun on bikes!. We took the Countryside tour and had a lovely time. The bikes were in good condition. Carl was an entertaining and informative guide, full of information on the city and the canal system. The ride itself was fantastic, though could be a bit long if you are not used to being on a bike. Bring your lunch or a snack to munch on during one of the stops. All that fresh country air can make you hungry!

Amazing experience. It was super fun! Riding along the countryside and city. Our guides were nice and helpful. The whole experience was so good that we didn't mind getting caught in the torrential rain (only felt cold and miserable after the tour was over) . It covered most of the quintessential touristy attraction like windmills, clogs and cheese and dykes and canals. Our guide was knowledgeable and his stories made the thing more fun. Would definitely recommend this one and personally would prefer an open country road to a crowded city one.

BEST TOUR, BEST GUIDE! GREAT FUN. My husband, our 2 teenaged boys, and I went on a 3 hr Amsterdam Bike tour with Mike's. Our guide was Kate. What can I say? It was awesome. Kate was fabulous; highly entertaining, knowledgable, and an amazing multi-tasker, as our group's flat tires, slipping chains (NOT mike's bike's fault) attested. We only wish it had lasted longer. Thank you for a most memorable tour of A'dam and one of the best memories we have about our 5 weeks in Europe. From 4 happy Canadians.

great countryside tour - amazing guide. its a great way to spend your money and time. I was a bit affraid of riding a bike inside the city and so we took the countryside tour - with less traffic. The weather was amazing and it was definetly one of our highlights at the trip.

Mikes bikes is a must!. We did the bike tour with Karl and it was great! A barrell of laughs with some fantastic sights. A must if you want to see some country side of holland. And its a very easy enjoyable bike ride!!

Awesome. Mike's Bike Tours (City and Country Tour) were awesome. We enjoyed the pace of the tours and each tour offered something different. They are good ways to get acquainted with the city and your surroundings.

Sam the man in 'dam!. Group of 4 of us, after reading reviews decided upon booking a trip. Had a great tour of the city with Sam, who kept us amused with his funny stories and anecdotes. Bikes were very comfy and easy to ride and the time passed very quickly. Would definitely recommend this trip to anyone.

Great way to really get to know a city. We were a family group of eight (21 - 61 years of age) and took a tour with Sam on a Saturday afternoon. Although the city was pretty crowded, Sam managed to keep the group together and nobody got lost. He was a fun guy and very knowledgable, and he provided us with a very good overview of Amsterdam (and its people) in just two hours. Everyone enjoyed it and I don't think there is any greater way for a tourist to explore the city. Especially with Mike's Bike Tours, you will rather get an idea of how the city is like today (its flair and trends) than learn about years or specfic architecture styles. This tour is really different, and we loved it. Sam was also able to answer some pretty specific questions about Amsterdam's history, so I guess he is flexible on this account. However, you should just accept that any good travel book can teach you about facts and figures, but this is a great way to actually engage with city life. Highly recommended.

Sam, the entertainer. We recently visited Amsterdam and thought what better way to explore the city but on a bike? We did the regular city tour with Sam as our guide. Sam was fantastic fun - entertaining, knowledgeable and very much conscious of ensuring everyone was ok and having a good time. The advantages of doing a bike tour such as this one over a walking tour is that it allows you to cover so much more ground in such a short amount of time. For those of you who have done bike tours in other European cities, you may find Mike's tour a little less focused on the history of the place and more focused on learning about what goes on in the city nowadays. A fun way to get to know Amsterdam.

Chasing a Windmill Outside Amsterdam. Countryside Tour was a perfect introduction to cycling as a means of transportation in Northern Europe. Pete, the guide, amazed all by wearing wooden klompen as cycling shoes for the tour. He offered information on local cycling etiquette, such as using hand signals, that have been very useful. His advice about congested spots in the city was also valuable. Tour highlights included riding atop a dike to the windmill stop, seeing how cheese is made on a farm and wooden shoe production plus a ride through Vongelpark . Tour length of about 20K was just right, although the strong Dutch wind was a factor at times. The tour participants were a mixed English speaking group and got on well together. I'd recommend this tour for anyone who can handle the distance on a bike. It's mostly flat with a few "Dutch Mountains" AKA overpasses.

Great fun, great guide. We had the tour with Carl... The day was awesome. From start to finish it was well run and prepared. Carl was a great guy, provided continuous laughs on tour and provided some great advice/tips, also his knowledge of the city throughout the tour was excellent, very educational as well as fun. If you want to see the city and you're there for only a couple of days, this is a MUST DO. All the best Carl, have a good one mate.

awesome way to see amsterdam.. we had karl as our guide, and he was fantastic. kept us laughing the whole trip and was very knowledgable.
would definately recommmend this tour to anyone visiting amsterdam.
Highlight of our Amsterdam trip!. We had Karl as our tour guide & he was fantastic! Would highly recommend Mike's Bike's. Super affordable & best way to see Amsterdam.

Best Part of our Trip. We pre-booked the countryside bike tour with Mike's Bike Tours and what can I say???? The how to cycle in Amsterdam advice given was great and the guide Mike was hilarious and gave us an informative insight around certain parts of Amsterdam as we went on the tour. The cheese factory and clog making factory was excellent with another very funny and amazing crafter talking us through his work. The sights were beautiful and it was lovely to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city to see another beautiful part of Amsterdam. I would recommend this tour to anyone and thank Mike's Bike tours and his brilliant staff for a great experience. Thank you

Absolutely excellent tour. We had been in Amsterdam and wanted to rent bikes, but after walking about city centre were bit apprehensive(mostly as we kept getting lost in old town :-(...)Booked city tour with mikes bikes due to excellent reviews, introduction from Sam informative and extremely funny, no one does humour/sarcasm and matter of factness anywhere in the world like Dutch people, we love them more for it.Bikes very comfortable and set off with the best of very good guides, Jeff, he was a brilliant guide who's knowledge was comprehensive on every subject. He gauged group expertly and stories and information had us in stitches. Nothing too much trouble, even when we requested stay at windmill bar longer so we could have a couple of beers(well we are Scottish).Tours are an absolute must for everyone visiting city, we booked countryside tour for next day, and Stuart our guide was again fantastic.When in town again would book tours just to meet up with guides again, or Jeff could meet up for drinks and things then a club, number one guy. Sam you could do a stint at comedy festival in Edinburgh, hilarious without trying pmsl.Thanks for everything, everyoneBlythe and Anne from Fife

Forget the boats- best way to explore the city!. We did this tour with my two elderly parents who were scared of cycling in the city and as an alternative to a Graachtentour - an absolute win!A bike tour is definitely the way to go over walking/bus or boat tours of Amsterdam - it was great really taking in the city like a local, actively on a bike, and we saw so much more of the city than we did on a later boat trip.Mike's Bike tours in particular were great - the guide was knowledgable, looked after us, we were and felt save at all times, saw all areas of Amsterdam, including all the obvious sights as well as hidden gems/ up and coming areas, got insider tips on nightlife/museums and where to go and were not disappointed when following the recommendations.Their bikes are great, in good shape, and they have a fitting model for everyone. The tour was fun, informative, safe, excellent value for money, and overall the best way to see Amsterdam!

Fantastic city tour. We booked a tour in advance and toured the city with a guide called Stuart.It lasted approximately 4 hours and was definitely worth the price.We were told lots of very interesting facts and got to see all the big attractions in the city as well as being given tips on where else to visit in our time there.Would definitely recommend.

Great Fun, Great Way To See The City of Amsterdam. Biking in Amsterdam is a must do experience and Mike's Bike Tours did a great job all around. They were accommodating, friendly and made my time in Amsterdam completely memorable. I will definitely go back and take some more of their tours upon my return to Europe. The tour itself very enjoyable, and very entertaining guide.

Amazing way to see Amsterdam. I was on a hen do in Amsterdam this weekend and we had a city bike tour with Karl. All 7 of us loved the tour. Karl was an amazing tour guide-very funny and knew so many interesting things about the city. It felt more like we were cycling round with a friend.At the start you get a talk about the history of Amsterdam which was great. Then we cycled around for a few hours and then ended up at a really cool beach bar by the river to have a beer!Such a great experience-my favourite activity of the weekend. It's the best way to see the city, especially if you are only visiting for a few days.Next time I'm in Amsterdam, I'll definitely try their countryside tour.Highly recommended!

Worth the time!. We booked the bike tour with Mike's not knowing what to expect. When we arrived with our 10 and 12 year old kids, we were put in a larger group, made up of other English speaking tourists. I was a little worried at 1st that 2 hours on a bike would feel like a lot. I was totally wrong! In fact, I wished we had more time. We saw a good amount of the city and stopped along the way to hear about it- take in the sights and take pictures if we liked. Our guide, Sam was very sweet, funny, friendly, and clearly comfortable with himself and his love of Amsterdam. Riding the bikes around Amsterdam was an adventure- and required a little bravery- dodging motorbikes, cars, pedestrians, and many MANY of the other city bikers. I thought that was hugely part of the fun. I highly recommend taking the tour for 2 hours or longer if you have the time. It was well worth it. On a side note, as a Jewish family with children touring Amsterdam on a day with a big Palestinian rally, I was nervous as our tour ran into this very large presence on the way. Hearing about some anti-Jewish sentiment in Europe at present, I was a little concerned about what might be said. Although Sam did not know that we were Jewish, he handled the presence of the rally on our tour with sensitivity and with an anti-political stance that made our family feel safe and secure. We are very grateful for that as well (particularly in the presence of our children). Anyway, it was my favorite part of the day.

Superb Tour. Completed the Countryside Tour with Pete today. Couldn't have been any better. Safe way to see the Dutch countryside with an informative and entertaining guide. The additions of visiting a traditional windmill and working cheese and clog makers were a highlight. Well worth every Euro and would recommend to everyone.

Countryside tour well worth the money. Did the tour today wit a friend and had a fantastic time. The tour guide was English and had a wealth of knowledge about the area and it's history, and a cracking sense of humour. We cycled through the city and he explained the origins of Amsterdam and the engineering marvel it is. Throughout the rest of the tour he did a lot to explain the development of Amsterdam, and stopping at a windmill, in reclaimed land and water basins really helped to tie the commentary together. Finally, stops at the rowing lake and in the Vondelpark allowed us to understand the social attitudes that make Amsteredam the place it is today.The visit to the cheese/clog farm felt a little touristy, and the farmer who made the clogs seemed arrogant ("the Dutch still make wooden shoes because all you tourists come and buy them from me"). The cheese on sale in the farm shop was gorgeous but it did feel as if we were only brought to the farm in order to spend money.Overall, the guide was excellent, the bikes in good condition, and the ride is peaceful and pleasant and at around 4 hours, you certainly get your money's worth. An excellent way to see more than the regular tourist areas and learn more about Amsterdam.

Great way to see Amsterdam. We've had the City Tour on a Sunday midday and we're lucky with weather. It is a very nice way to see Amsterdam. Riding pace is very much ok and Sam, our guide, make it enjoyable with his humor and stories. Price is reasonable for what you get and bikes are very comfortable.

Spectacular. For a tourist in Amsterdam you can spend all of your trip in the city and see or learn not much, the countryside tour brilliantly takes you back to the real roots of the history and culture of the area by going through picturesque landscapes, guides were brilliantly witty and defiantly knew their stuff on the area along the route! Would not leave without taking part in the countryside tour, you haven't seen nothing until you've taken it!

Excellent Tour and value for money. Did the countryside tour with the partner found it brilliant to get out of the city and go for a relaxing ride to see the other side of Amsterdam, tour guide very informative and entertaining. had a real hot day so made it even better, farmer quite amusing character and can even go for a dip in the river by the farm as it was hot!Amazing trip back to HQ through a number of parks all absolutely buzzing with other cyclists and masses of people enjoying the weather. City part of the tour not for the novice rider though in terms of road sense, very hectic and things come at you in all directions.To nit pick I would have liked it to have been made more clear or to have been told in advance that there is no food available to purchase throughout the tour so you need to being your own, probably essential seeing as the tour runs right through lunch hours.

Awesome way to see Amsterdam. Me and my boyfriend from Aus did the tour today with Alec and had a ball. Great value because we saw so much plus our guide was really informative and entertaining. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is looking to get around town and learn some history :)

Great Way to See More of Amsterdam. If you go to Amsterdam - you must ride a bike. If you go on a Bike Tour - Mike's Bikes does a great job. Got in a good ride "out of the city" and got excellent information from our guide - Pete. An easy ride - and great bikes by the way.

Excellent way to spend the day!. We did the countryside bike tour with PETE. He was informative and entertaining. The weather wasn't awesome, but the information and the stop at the cheese factory/wooden clog shop made it well worth it. We have been recommending these guys to everyone we see! The staff was all awesome, seems like it would be an awesome place to work!

Beautiful way to see the city!. We went on a sunny, breezy day. The parks we rode through and the scenery in general were spectacular. We stopped at a working farm where they make Gouda cheese and clogs. We also saw a windmill where a person actually lives! Our guide was British and very entertaining. He gave good explanations of various sites and also took an interest in the riders this elves.

Quickest way to tour Amsterdam. I went in a group of 10+ all teenagers. The bikes are in great condition and easy to ride. The tour guides do go a bit fast so be careful on sharp corners. There's so many bikes in Amsterdam and it's a great way to get a feel of the city.The tour only last 1-2 hours and is quite quick, but it's good to do before you sight see as you get to grips with where everything is.

Waste of money. I booked this with my husband and another couple we were traveling with. We were all excited to do the mini city bike tour and see a little of Amsterdam since we only had a day to spend there, but I was very disappointed with the experience and company. On the bike tour, we only stopped a few times to be given info about the site or city. The bike route wasn't that great either, a lot of times we had to get off and walk our bike. At one stop, our guide went on about cannabis, where to get it, how much to smoke, etc. I thought she was going to give some interesting facts about it and how the city manages it but she kept going on about her opinions with medical benefits, smoking it, etc. She went on for so long about it I almost expected her to try and sell us some right there or point us to a place where she gets part of the profit. There is so much more to the beautiful city of Amsterdam than cannabis.It also didn't help that at one of our stops a local came out and yelled at our tour group. Our tour guide and the lady went back and forth arguing because the local did not want us stopped in front of her house. It seems like the company could have picked a better location, as there were obvious signs posted in the windows stating, "F*** OFF TOURISTS" and "NO TOURISTS."I thought we would get to see some interesting parts of the city and learn a little about it while on the bike tour that we wouldn't see or find out on our own, but our group walked away feeling like we had just wasted our money and 2 hours in Amsterdam we can't get back.

Private tour!. We turned up at the meeting point & were the only ones that showed - worked in our favour as we got a lovely tiki tour around the city with our guide Sarah. Fun times rambling around & we had non touristy bikes which made it better as we could blend in well with the locals!

Great fun. My 8yr old daughter were on a trip to Amsterdam and I decided we should do a Countryside Bike Tour on the Sunday - luckily the weather was fine and it was a great trip - easily manageable for aged 5/6 upwards and lead by Karl who was brilliant both in his knowledge and his sense of humour.I would not hesitate in recommending this to anyone - we decided on the countryside as the city is really a bit mad for youngsters I think and the cheese farm was great too.

Good value.... Firstly this is well located and cheap, bikes are a bit rough and ready too but road worthy nonetheless. You will see many other brand new hires around.Great for seeing canals and further afield. Helps if you are used to riding a bike, best not to be in a group either when it is busy. Keep off the pavements and abide with no cycling streets as well!We cycled up the Amstell river which is really nice and takes you into the country side. Avoid hotel bike rentals, they are expensive.

Great way to spend 3 hours. Disclaimer: I am an experienced cyclist. We did the city tour which is not for the faint-of-heart. Riding in the city mixes you in with the other millions of bicyclists, scooters, cars, and trams and there were a few pretty hairy intersections. Experienced cyclists will have no problem with the traffic. Beginners may have some anxiety with the traffic, but the terrain is beyond easy with the biggest "hills" being the canal bridges. My wife also went on the tour and she had no trouble with the terrain or the traffic although she was out of her "comfort zone" for most of the ride.That being said, I thought the tour was fantastic. Our guide, Mike (not "the" Mike) was Dutch, and very funny. And though she was not a Netherlands history scholar, she had enough information to make the stops informative and interesting. The total ride was a little over 8 miles through at least a dozen different areas of town (including the red-light district), including a 20-minute beer stop at a local bar in the Jordaan area of the city.This shouldn't be the first thing you do in Amsterdam, but you can pencil it in for the 2nd or 3rd day of your visit.

Most memorable part of our trip so far. I will not go into the details of the country bike tour as my fellow reviewers have all done a great job describing the sights along the way; I will say that our entire family (Mom, Dad, two teenagers and an 8-year old) LOVED this activity and agreed that it has been a highlight of our visit to the amazing city. Although the meagre cheese slivers offered at the farm were disappointing and we did not relate to the clog farmer's humour, our guide, Carl, was a hoot and did a wonderful job explaining the points of interest along the way, patiently answering our questions and always injecting our adventure with humour and irreverence. I am not a cyclist and was a touch apprehensive during the "rules of the road" pep talk. Getting out of the city made my heart skip a beat a couple of times, especially when observing my 8-year old navigate speeding traffic. However, we all made it back in one piece and I would encourage anyone desiring to see another side of Amsterdam to BOOK THIS TOUR! No regrets whatsoever.

Best Bike Hire in Amsterdam. Looked at few places for bike rental and they had the best rate for quality of bike that I could find in the city (hired bike for 4 days (24hrs). And got discount for their tours.Bikes don't look like other ugly tourist bikesAlso did the countryside tour one day (4hrs) and had an excellent time. Guide was friendly with lots of tips and was excellent with making sure everyone kept up.Farm visit (cheese and clogs) part of tour and wasn't a huge commercial operation which was nice.Booking in advance for tours is a must

Great fun!. Thumbs up to Mike himself for an awesome tour of Amsterdam! Thoroughly enjoyed the outing and will definitely be recommending it to other friends in NZ who are traveling about soon. Can't wait to come back! Keep up the good work :)

Pretty nice 'escape' to the Amsterdam countryside. Well the weather wasn't great which was surprising for the middle of July but not uncharacteristic of Amsterdam for the rest of the year! but the staff kindly provided us with large ponchos for extra dryness… we had a nice ride out into the countryside and were well-guided towards the windmill, cheese/clog factory and back again. the bikes were good and easy to use. would have liked the guide to bring a little more to the tour with some more explanations and talking about amsterdam etc just for a little bit more value for money, but in any case a wonderful outing and chance to ride a beautiful dutch bicycle in amsterdam (mine was beautiful and named 'purple rain' apt for the weather conditions)

Out of the city and into the countryside. We booked the countryside tour over the phone the day before we went which was good because they did sell out. Mike was fantastic. She had a largish group to keep together and she did very well. The ride itself was great fun. Through some of the hectic streets and then alongside the canals it was beautiful. The cheese farm and wooden shoe factory were great and informative while the parks and bike tracks on the way back were awesome. Overall, the team at Mike's were fantasic and I highly recommend you go see then on your visit to Amsterdam.

A real 'Joy' Ride.. We used Mikes tours and rentals on our second trip to this fantastic city as the previous company we had used were no longer offering the city tour, it was very good value for money our guide(not Mike but another of the team, cant remember his name)was friendly and enthusiastic, cant recommend them enough, book in advance if possible as they were quite busy.I also recommend them as a rental company, unlike most the bikes you get are not the typical tourist rental type so you dont stand out as much as you would with rival companies like MAC bike etc.

Great bike tours for everyone. Very friendly guide, lots of anecdotes
Cool bikes with nicknames and no pub logos on them.
You can rent a bike for a small price with or without a tour.
We did the Amsterdam city tour, was really great even for people who rarely ride a bike.

Amazing tour and amazing tour guide. We really enjoyed this tour. We were unsure to start with due to confusion of being in a new city more than anything, but trust me it is worth it! Out tour guide (Mike) was lovely and we learnt so much about Amsterdam. We chatted with plenty of new people and learnt a lot about making cheese and clogs. A definite must of a 1st or 2nd time visitor to Amsterdam. One of our favorite parts of our trip.

City Tour. The bike tour was amazing; thanks to Pete our tour guide. We got to see so much more than we expected. My entire group of friends laughed through out the tour and this was one of our best trips by far. Thank you Pete. The photo provided does not do this tour justice; but my friend tried to use the bike as a motorbike. We all appreciated the patience by the tour guide & other tourists alongside her who 'tried to keep her alive' on the busy streets.

Leave guidebooks back at hotel -- jump on bike tour!. Skip the boring hop on, hop off bus tours, leave the guidebooks back at the hotel and instead spend 3 hours touring Amsterdam with Mike's Bike Tours. Pace is comfortable with plenty of stops so you need not be in great shape. If you know how to ride a bike, you'll be fine. Biggest challenge is to avoid all the Dutch bikers in every direction. If you can't beat 'em, might as well join them! Guides are very knowledgeable and entertaining. Highly recommend this bike tour on your first day. Fantastic way to get oriented to Amsterdam's major attractions. Loved biking through interesting neighborhoods, along canal, etc.

Brilliant!. Fantastic way to see the sights and decide where you want to spend more time. Great mix of history, quirky and informative from our exuberant guide Mike ( the female!). If you don't have much time in Amsterdam, do this tour. If you have lots of time, do this tour first!!

Great intro to Amsterdam and a value. We did the City Tour on the first day we arrived in Amsterdam. Mike was very informative and entertaining. The tour is a very easy ride through the city with plenty of stops for information. Our group was a little big (24 I believe) because one of the guides was off that day, but it was not unmanageable. We made a stop at the end at a restaurant which I thought was a little inappropriate at first, but there were other things to do than spend money at the restaurant and Mike took the time to sit down with everyone individually and answer questions while there. As tour customers we got 2 euro off rentals later in the week (5-6 euro for all day rental) and went out to the countryside following Mike's instructions on where to go. We then used the bike's to go back to all the places we wanted to hit again.

3 Hour excursion highly recommended. Just completed a three hour cycle through the extended areas of Amsterdam with a delightful lady guide, Mike. She was so informative and had a lovely easy manner (as well as a body to die for). We were taken to some out of the way really interesting parts of the city that we would not have got to any other way. A great way to get an overview of Amsterdam. Time at the end of the 3 hour cycle to catch a beer on the way home. Really great tour.

Highly recommended. A friend advised us to take the city cycle tour when we arrived to get an overview of the city. Not only did the tour do this it was informative and very enjoyable. The main guide, Pete was personable and pitched the content of information just right with humour.My wife and I hired a cycle each which is the best way to get around the city. The tour helped us understand the road/cycle/pedestrian network!If you go on the tour you get, if I recall correctly, 10% off the hire price.

Do the Countryside Tour. There is more to Amsterdam than the city center (though that is awesome). On this 3.5 hour tour you see some of the beautiful country and parks just outside the city, stop at a cheese farm, learn how they make wooden shoes, and witness how well the Dutch have integrated modern urban life with their natural surroundings. Peter was our friendly guide with the right combo of humor and education. Its not very strenuous, though you should be comfortable riding a bike in sometimes busy city traffic. Bring a sandwich to eat during the farm stop about half way through. Wear comfortable shoes as you will bike over 12 miles. ,

Great way to get out and about. We did the countryside tour on a beautiful June Saturday. You go about 1.5 hours down the Amstel and then stop at a not-too-touristy "farm" where they make cheese and wooden shoes. Best part is the countryside and parks you go through on the way back. Even saw a real windmill. Our guide Mike was fabulous (this Mike was a she.)

Take a tour with Mikes!. There is so much to see in Amsterdam. While so much of it is being inside at amazing museums, you must take the time to get out and about! We came to the city at the end of June, beginning of July. We took the Mikes bike tour to the country. Our biker guide was Kate. A fun, Irish woman that's been living in Amsterdam for the past 10 yrs. It was an easy ride, yet felt like we got some good exercise. We were able to ride for about 20 to 30 minutes a few times which was nice to not always be stopping and starting. We went out into the country to visit a windmill as well as Rembrandt's farm where we learned about them making Gouda cheese and wooden shoes. Very friendly folks. Then spent the rest of the trip riding through the country side and a bit in the city. It's a great trip to learn history and a bit of the Dutch culture. Fun to met other folks from different countries on the trip with you. We would highly recommend Mikes's as one of the must do's for your summer visit to Amsterdam. You will need to bring a lunch and if there's rain, they have poncho, but you could bring your own. A backpack is great to carry your phone, lunch and extra jacket if it get cold. No need for fancy biking clothing...just go and enjoy yourselves, and make sure you ask their opinion on the best places to eat in town. Locals opinions are the best. You can also find Mikes Bikes in other major European cities.

Lovely good time. We really enjoyed the bike tour. Even though we hit a bit of rain it was well with it. We took the 4 hr country tour which was really only 3.5 hrs or less. I'm glad our kids are older teens as there was only one bathroom break and difficult navigating the streets of Amsterdam. Fun!,

Great Way To See the City. I took the 4-hour tour and was not disappointed. Our tour guide Jeff was funny, informative and took great effort to see that we were safe and entertained. Amsterdam traffic (both auto and bike) is not for the faint of heart so I'm not sure that the tour is a good choice for younger children, but I had a great time. Well worth the money!

Best Bike Tour Ever. I took the city tour my first day in town and am so glad I did - it was a great way to spend an afternoon. Stuart was an incredible guide and, unlike other bike tours, we weren't stopping every five minutes for the sake of stopping and looking at random places. You actually get to ride on this tour and get a feel for the city and learn about its history in a few well placed stops. The bikes were very nice and well maintained . As someone who rides quite frequently, I was a bit intimidated when I first arrived. This tour has the added bonus of learning the dance that is biking in Amsterdam and gave me the confidence to rent a bike for the rest of my stay.The staff were incredibly cool and helpful - they clearly enjoy what they do and were more than happy to help with recommendations around Amsterdam.

Absolute blast. Pete took us on a mini tour. Was nice to have a small group so I felt I could ask a lot of questions (and get my picture taken since I was a solo traveler). I would recommend going on the first day of your trip so you can see the city and then decide what you want to do later. If you have the time I would recommend going for the longer tour, but the mini was still great and got to see a lot.

Great activity to do with a teenager. Visited Amsterdam last week with my 16 year old son. We booked the city tour. Good to be navigiated round the city without the stress of having to organise that ourselves. We also saw much more than if we had walked as we could get between places more quickly. I was a bit nervous about cycling on the right and the speed of the locals but our guide, Vincent, avoided the busier rounds and it was fine. Highly recommended.

Do this- highly recommend. Excellent bike tour, would recommend this to anyone wanting to bike around Amsterdam! Reasonably priced and they are not trying to rip tourists off. Perfect mix of bike riding, paired with sight seeing, some history of the Netherlands and tips for things to do after the tour and throughout your stay in Amsterdam. The guides are awesome- funny, friendly and helpful and cover everything!!

An unforgettable day !!!. Good welcome with anecdote in french, really friendly ! We rented our bikes for one day in a very good price ( inclusive insurance) and we were not disappointed. It is a real pleasure to discover Amsterdam under this angle, to walk along canals, along Rijksmuseum to the Center Nemo via Amstel... Then, yes, Amsterdam is one of more beautiful cities to the world, intimist and relaxed... We are in love with it!

Amazing. My wife and I rented a bike during our stay in Amsterdam to be able to further visit the city. The staff at Mike's bikes was really nice and helpful. The bikes were good-looking and worked well all day, so that we were able to ride all along the canals and within Amsterdam's beautiful parks. It's also worth to mention that Mike's bikes is the only bike provider in Amsterdam that does NOT set ads on his bikes, so that you can enjoy the ride and discover the city whilst feeling like a local and not a salesman. At the end of the day, we paid less than 10euros for this great day of ride for the both of us, which I believe is really great value!We warmly recommend to rent a bike at Mike's place and would certainly rent again a bike when we come back in Amsterdam.

Wonderful!. We took a private bike tour with Stewart from Mikes and had a great tour. Not only was he very personable but he had a great knowledge of Amsterdam and the history. It had to be one of the best bike tours we have ever taken. I would strongly suggest a private tour with Mike's and if you want a great experience ask for Stewart. You wont be dissappointed.

Worth it!. I hadn't been on a bike for more than 15 years when i decided to do this. I spent most of the city part of the tour (the start and the finish) nervous as hell. The fact that I'd only slept for 4 hours the night before didn't help. With that said i totally enjoyed the tour. The leader even assigned a couple of more experienced riders to keep an eye on me and kept reassuring me that I was doing ok. The leader is also very knowledgeable about the city and all the sights on the tour. I loved the countryside and the explanations on how they keep the water our of the city. I managed to find very nice gifts for family back hone from the cheese factory. It's a pity though that factory doesn't serve any lunch. I think they should have a vending machine and sell some bread and visitors could make their own sandwiches. The cheese is fabulous Btw...i'm sad that i didn't buy a lot more. I also enjoyed biking through Vondelpark, nice break just before negotiating my nervous self through the traffic again. I'm glad I've ticked biking through Amsterdam off my bucket list, and glad i decided to do it with Mike's Bike Tours

Excellent cheese and clog bike tour. We did this tour based on the reccomendation from our Busabout guide and loved it. The guides were fun and friendly, the biking was flat and the bikes were comfy. The short tour of the cheese and clog factory was great, and, the people working there made it special. I would reccomend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

So much fun!. If you visit Amsterdam you should definitely try biking around. This bike tour was one of the best experiences from my trip. I liked doing the tour opposed to renting a bike as figuring out the Amsterdam streets can be very tricky. There are definitely street rules that you need to learn before biking. However, if you are adventurous definitely rent a bike there and just explore! The tour was great! I felt more at ease following someone down the streets of Amsterdam.

Awesome awesome awesome. We did the country side tour. It was great! I loved the wooden shoe shop & cheese factory. You don't need to be a professional bike rider to enjoy this tour. Afterwards, we rented bikes for an additional 24 hours, as we find it easier to get around rather than the busses. I would definitely recommend this tour!!!

Fun and informative. Great tour guide, full of interesting information told in a funny way. Comfortable and modern bikes and carried out in an orderly way given how mad the other cyclists in Amsterdam are! Quite a distance from the main city centre but worth it for the tours, perhaps not standard bike rental.

Great tour, wish the guide didn't talk about drugs the full trip. Good tour and we enjoyed it. The only strange side was that our guide Sam talked about drugs the entire time. He referenced the bike staff, mechanics, managers, everyone in the company was always stoned. It wasn't funny and wasn't necessary at all? Other down side was our lunch spot. We ate lunch on some nasty tables at a cow farm. Nothing wrong with the farm, but there were so many other spots to eat that weren't smelly and covered with flys. Maybe it was just our guide????

Enjoyable countryside ride. Our group was recommended to Mike's bicycle tour by our hotel concierge. We opted to embark on the countryside ride. The guide gave a detailed briefing before starting the riding. The first part of the ride was quite challenging as we were getting used to the traffic condition in Amsterdam. The ride became more idyllic after reaching the suburb area. Our first stop is the windmill. Amsterdam is not famous for its windmill and this was the only windmill we saw in this trip. Next, we visited a cheese and wooden clog farm factory. The farmers made their own cheese and wooden clogs. We were allowed to purchase cheese and wooden clogs at the gift shop. After the factory, we rode through the lowland (> 2m below sea level), parks and suburbs before ending our tour where started 4.5 hours ago. It was not a long riding journey, but be mindful about the traffic condition. It is important to observe safety rules while riding on busy roads where motorists and cyclists are fighting for the same road space. Overall, the bicycle tour was a wonderful experience. I shall recommend Mike's bicycle tour to anyone who wants to visit the countryside.

Bikes are King of the Road in Amsterdam!. Took the City Tour (3hrs) around Amsterdam. The guide (Kyle or Carl....I can't seem to remember) was a great joker and gave interesting facts and tips around the places we cycled to in the City. The last stop was the last windmill in the city where there stood a microbrewery. It was quite tiring but interesting overall.

Depends who you get. I went with a tour group around July 2013, which was very large so they split us into two groups. My group was fine, it was run by a lovely English guy who clearly enjoys the Amsterdam lifestyle and was out to have a good time and ensure we did too, while also taking our safety seriously. The other guy, however, was a cranky bugger. He did the safety spiel at the beginning and pretty much told us that unless we were very confident bike riders, we should go away and not waste his time. Well, since we had paid up front as part of our tour and had not been told about this before we got there, we all decided to go ahead with the ride anyway, although some of us felt very unwelcome as we had not ridden since we were kids. The group that went with this man all had complaints at the end. They said that the guide basically just took them to a local park, and had them follow him around and around the park in circles until the time ran out. My group was taken around the city (which is what we paid for), but the other group completely missed out on seeing the sights we saw. Many of them felt very disappointed. I'm so glad I got the nice guide!I will say that if you are going with a large group, it does help to be a fairly confident bike rider as you will have times that the group gets separated by traffic etc, and you will need to push yourself and ride quickly and efficiently to catch up with the group. It is a very fun experience (if your guide actually does his job and takes you around the city), but it is also terrifying if you're not used to European roads and traffic behaviour.

Perfect way to see Amsterdam. We had booked a private tour for four, and Sam the guide was very good. A two and half your bike tour is a great way to see the city of Amsterdam, and Mike's Bike tours seem extremely professional. Luckily the weather was perfect. Try the soup store nearby and their great Cheese Rolls. Highly recommended tour.

THE POWER. The first thing we noticed when we entered Amsterdam was that our taxi stopped for bike riders! This is unheard of in Australia so we took the opportunity to experience the supreme power of the biking experience in Amsterdam. We did the country tour and thoroughly enjoyed 4 hours of lush beauty that is the Amsterdam countryside. The tour took us to a cheese factory, which was rather light on for information,and a clog factory, which was more informative and presented by a rather quirky fellow who was very amusing. We than cycled through the woods and back through a city park, with traffic stopping for us the entire way. It was a lovely ride, however, it would have been more enjoyable if the guide had stopped talking occasionally so that we could simply take in the view.

Good day out and good value. We did the city tour. The weather was fabulous so we were lucky. The tour and tour guide were good. The route seemes well thought out and the organisation was fine. Why only four stars. The blurb said beginneer friendly "As long as you can ride a bike" two of our group were not confident as they hadnt ridden a bike for a while. The guide asked about our confidence level established two has issues but then did nothing. Still a very good day and everyone coped in the end.
