Fun way to spend the day!. Did the country tour with Mike, very informative and fun. gave us a good handle on how to navigate the city by bike so we felt more comfortable renting bikes from them on our own. Super friendly staff and very helpful.

Typical Amsterdam - laid back but professional. We went on the city tour with Stuart as the guide. He did a great job of educating us about the history and social culture of the city - with a particular emphasis on its engineering. The trip was relaxed, plenty of time for questions, very informative and nobody had an accident in spite of the busyness of Amsterdam. Highly recommend Mike's Bike Tours.

Highly recommended. We took the 4hr countryside tour, which takes you thru parts of the city then out to a farm where they produce cheese and clogs. We thoroughly enjoyed the ride. Our guide was great and the route was not strenuous (I am not particularly fit, nor a regular cyclist!). We would have done another tour with Mike's if we had the time on this trip!

Great Way to see the Country side. We thorougly loved our bike tour thru the Dutch Countryside. Stuart was our guide and he was very good. He answered all of our questions and kept things light and entertaining. We got to visit a dairy farm, where we taste tested cheese, and got to try on some clogs. It was a fun couple of hours. Very relaxing once we were off the busy streets of Amsterdam.

Great way to see Amsterdam. We landed in Amsterdam at 10:00 am and were on a Mike's Bike Tour at noon. Great way to orient yourself to the city, keep active after a long flight, and see main sights while learning from a guide. Just be ready to ride through the very hectic streets of Amsterdam!

Enjoy the ride. There is nothing like it.. Excellent staff. Mike is sooooo funny. Alex is great too. Nice talking to our Canadian guide Jeff though he didn't ride with us.You just have to do this if you visit AMS. My advice is to enjoy and go for the ride. The bikes are in excellent shape.

Country side tour. My husband and I signed up for the 4 hr country side tour which included a visit to a cheese factory. Our guide Mike was great. She was extremely informative and funny and very friendly. its a great way to get used the city and get a feel of it. had great fun. definite recommendation
Great way to explore Amsterdam. Our guide, Mike the Egg head, was a wonderful guide with great knowledge & passion for the city. A great way to get used to the city & its way of life.

Fun in the sun. We had a fun tour with Mike (female) guide who knows the city very well. She was fun, funny, and we learned a lot about the city. She gave detailed answers to our random questions about this statue or that symbol. Her agility in keeping our group together was awesome, even when facing an instant re-route for a local running race that had blocked our path. Mike recommended great places to eat and drink, and gave an excellent local flavor to our tour. Also, as the numbers increased for the noon tour, Mike (male--the owner) stepped in and divided us into three groups of about 10 riders each. It would be nice to start the tour a bit earlier in the day. Great price and I highly recommend.

One of the highlights of my trips. Took two tours during my 5 days stay in Amsterdam; the 2 hr short city ride, and the 4 hr countryside ride. Both were a great experience but for different reasons. These rides are great to do shortly after arrival to get use to the city in a short period of time. Our guide was informative and extremely funny. Can't recommend enough!

A wonderful way to explore Amsterdam. If you are visiting Amsterdam, put a trip with Mike's tours on the top of your list of things to do. My two 20-somethings and I took the Countryside tour and absolutely loved it. Our guide Mike was funny and warm hearted. She created a great sense of community within the group and had a lot of fun and interesting facts about Amsterdam and the locations that we were visiting. The trip is not overly strenuous and gets you out of the city proper to get a better feeling for the Dutch way of life. We all felt that the bike tour was the highlight of our trip.

Don't leave Amsterdam without doing this!. An interesteding and fun way to learn about the lighter side of life in Amsterdam as well as it's history. We booked the three hour city tour online a couple of days before arriving not really knowing what to expect. Our tour guide, Kate, was fantastic. She was really knowledgeable about the city and presented all aspects in an entertaining way that kept us engaged throughout. Amsterdam is a busy city and although you don't need to be Bradley Higgins to keep up, you do need your wits about you but that's part of the fun! By no means a criticism, if you are are bringing teenage children with you, ensure you have an open mind. All in all, a great experience, not to be missed!

First Class - City Tour. Before thinking "can i ride well or far enough" you don't need to worry! We pre booked online and arrived with an open mind. Jeff, our Canadian tour guide was not only funny and patient but extremely knowledgeable of the city and it's history. Tips for a great tour, pack a light weight rain coat if rain expected, a bottle of water and some money for the pub stop near the end. Rain covers will be provided by Mike's bikes if requested and they sell bottles of water in case you forget. Great day!! Thanks guy's

Fun and Educational.. Highly recommend this tour whilst in Amsterdam. The staff really look after you. My husband and I are in our 50's and we had no trouble handling this tour. Staff give you a run down of all the do's and don'ts beforehand. Our guide Steward was very knowledgable, so we got a good overview of the cities history whilst exploring the sites.

Country side with Carl. Touring the country side with Carl was fantastic. He wore clogs the entire time!!A very funny guy with lots of information to share and a good old laugh along the way.Highlights were the windmill, the cheese farm and clog factory.An easy ride with no hills, just remember to pack your lunch.

Great city ride!. Great way to see the city and get an interesting history lesson too. Aaron guided our group of pickleball tournament players for a very fun and educational tour. He had all kinds of unique things to say about the history of things and history of language. For example, do you know the history of "Yankee" or "stinkin rich"? Our group does now. Highly recommended!

Countryside Tour. Awesome 4.5h tour, would definitely recommend, our Tourguide Jeff was great, explained a lot of things about the Nehterlands and Amsterdam. Looking forward to our next trip and do this tour again.

Countryside tour - great fun. We did this countryside tour in May and really enjoyed it. Great value for money; very knowledgeable and positive guide; excellent selection of spots to visit to get a good range of experience across a short time without feeling pressured or rushed. Only suggestion is to make it more obvious what the lunch options are (bring a packed lunch or buy cheese - only cheese! - at the cheese farm or get a snack at the snack bar about 3/4 the way through the tour). We definitely recommend this tour.

Great full city tour with Kate, but dont bother to prepay!. Fun and memorable full city tour with Kate for our family of four. Amsterdam is a very busy city but Kate did a great job and everyone was safe and happy. The tour covers all the big sites in the city and even includes a stop for a tasty microbrew under a real windmill. While the cycling isnt strenous, there is a lot of bike, pedestrian, tram and some auto traffic to contend with. There are also a lot of quiet streets, parks and dedicated bike lanes too. You do need to be comfortable on a bike but you dont have to be in great shape. I would not prepay and book though their web site next time for a few reasons. One, they have lots and lots of bikes and essentially unlimited spaces so you may want to match this activity to the best weather of your first days in amsterdam. The second is that you get a discount card which you can use on your next tour or rental. We prepaid for two tours so we now didnt get the discount on the second tour. My own issue, of course, but its something you can avoid if you are doing more than one tour. The shop is well organized and the staff is very friendly and very competent. This is going to be one of the highlights of our trip im sure. I will review the countryside tour that we have coming up.

Good day out on the countryside. I hired a bike for a day and also went on the country side bike tour with Stuart as the guide.. the pace was just right and the time just flew by.. the cheese tasting and cloggs was a good experience.. the main attractions are the windmill and the farm.. the rest is just views of country side and the river.. overall its a good experience and it would amaze you as to how quickly you are out of the bustling city! would recommend Mike's bike tours ..
Best way to see Amsterdam. A must do when in Amsterdam, took two different tours with this company and had the time of my life on both tours.

Excellent customer service!. My wife & I rented Mike's Bikes for 10 days - biking in a loop through the Dutch countryside & towns, starting and ending in Amsterdam. We picked Mike's because my wife has an Electra bike at home & we know how comfortable they are. Dealing with the staff at Mike's was pleasant, and we were quickly on our way. I will say that these bikes seem to be mostly used for short tours & day trips - they are a little beat-up, but they fit in well with the millions of other city bikes in Amsterdam. If you are taking them for any amount of time, I recommend inspecting your bike well before you set off - make sure the tires are at a good pressure, that the shifting works well, nothing is rattling/rubbing, etc... We had one major problem on our trip with one of the bikes (a problem which could not have been prevented, I believe), and Mike's Bikes went above & beyond to help us get everything fixed & back on the road. Thanks Mike.

Countryside tour is a must!!. Best day I had in Amsterdam! We ventured out of the city and through the countryside while learning about the culture and history along the way. Our tour guide Kate was fantastic and added a lot of laughs to the tour. The cheese and clog farm was fantastic. Definitely recommended for those wanting to experience a little more of Amsterdam!

Thank You For The Great Time!. I pre-booked a bicycle for EUR8.00 per day for four days. I was given an Electra which had front and back pedal brakes and a pouch on the handlebars. I never had any problems with the bike and I used it for an average of ten hours a day. I kept the bike overnight.I also joined the countryside tour (EUR24.00) using the same bike I rented. We were taken to a cheese farm which doubles as a factory for wooden shoes (it was called Rembrandt Hoeve). The next day, I joined the city tour (EUR21.00). I liked the countryside tour better but only because I've already been biking for days prior so I'm already pretty much acquainted with Amsterdam. I can't say anything bad about the experience because (a) the rental and tours were worth the money; and (b) everyone in the shop is really friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend the rental and tours to anybody who plans to visit Amsterdam. :)

Countryside tour is fantastic!. We had a great time on the countryside bike tour with Pete. He was knowledgeable about the city while adding in some humor. The tour brought us to a bit of a tourist trap but it was entertaining nonetheless (especially the shoemaker!). The scenery is beautiful; too bad it's hard to stop and take pictures (you don't want to lose the group)! I would recommend doing this early in your trip and then renting a bike after (we got a discount card after the tour). A bike is a great way to see Amsterdam! This was one of my favorite things I did on my trip, highly recommend!

Great experience on countryside tour. My husband and I had an amazing time on the countryside tour with Pete, on May 20th, 2014. We loved the short history presentation held at the beginning and the security tips Pete shared with us before de tour. While enjoying the landscape, cycling was safe and we felt part of an elite group doing something really amazing. The cheese farm and the windmill were the main attractions, well deserved breaks during the tour. It was the first time we witnessed a clog making (wooden shoes) and we enjoyed the colourful presentation held by the farmer.Overall, best experience in Netherlands so far.

Great way to see the city and countryside. 5 of us first of all did the mini city tour, we were a little daunted as Amsterdam is so busy but we all survived and enjoyed ourselves. It was a last minute booking made over the internet but we are so glad we did it. The mini tour lasts 2 hours and you see a lot of the city and go to some of the main sites - you don't stop for that long but you have enough time to take a photo or two which is all you need. 3 of us then decided to do the countryside tour on the day we were travelling home, it left at 11am and we were back for about 3pm. You cycle through the city and along the Amstel river to a cheese making farm which also makes clogs. The weather was absolutely stunning and we had a lovely day. I think if I ever make a return to Amsterdam I would now be confident to hire a bike myself after these tours.

City Tour and Countryside Tour! Must do.. My husband and I did both the City Tour (with Pete) and Countryside Tour (with Kate). We loved both and thought it was the best way to see Amsterdam!!! Would recommend the tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam!

Great time on the Countryside Tour. Just back from an excellent four hour tour with the fabulous Maaik. Gentle cycling on quintessential Dutch sit up and beg bikes which are really comfortable. Love Amsterdam for its live and let live attitude to all people and BIKES (why does this not happen in the UK and where we live in Guernsey?!). No road rage and everyone manages not to hit each other.After a few city cycle paths, it was out to the countryside, checking out all the houseboats, enjoying the breeze on a hot day. Visit to the farm where we tasted cheese and met the farmer who was quite a character and showed us how to make clogs. Then back through beautiful parks where everyone was sun bathing, cycling their dogs (in baskets in front of the bikes) and even tiny babies. So laid back.There was a range of experience of cycling on the tour but Maaik was great at stopping enough to make sure that she still counted us all in.Totally recommend. (Cannot understand the recent review where someone whined about his wife not being given a women's bike - there was no such thing - they are all the same!)

This is the group you want for a Bike Tour of Amsterdam!. We joined this group of tourists when we realized the date we booked was a wrong date. They accommodated us without issue. Pete took charge of one half and Mike took the other. The information Pete gave us about the history of the city and country was beyond what we expected.Take the 3-4 hour city country tour. You won't be disappointed.

If you only have time for a couple activities do this for sure to have an authentic and unforgettable experience!. From Toronto, Canada and visited Amsterdam for a few days. I would definitely 100% recommend this bike tour, our guide was Pete who was friendly and knowledgeable and it was a wonderful way to learn about Amsterdam while experiencing cycling throughout the city...Do this for sure...we also did it while it was pouring rain and still enjoyed it just the same.

Countryside tour with Stuart. This is a really relaxing way to experience the bicycle culture of Amsterdam and get a little outside of the city at the same time. Stuart was so friendly and immediately made us all feel at ease. It is very clear that he loves the city of Amsterdam and truly enjoys sharing his knowledge of the city history, architecture and engineering. As we went along, he found spots to stop, show examples of how and why the city evolved and really make the tour interesting and not just scenic. We enjoyed a nice picnic at the cheese farm. The farm was quaint and the cheese was tasty. You can pick up some Holland souvenirs if you are so inclined. And the prices weren't over-inflated. Also we learned a little bit about clogs and how they are made. The gentleman doing the clog demonstration was very enthusiastic and a little eccentric. Very entertaining. I would recommend this tour even if you don't bike regularly. I was a little tired and sore the next day, but there were no really strenuous parts. And Stuart was also very conscious about not loosing anyone straggling behind.

More than just a city!. I have been on several bike tours around the globe and REALLY enjoyed this tour! We met before our tour began, were briefed on the bikes and our route! This was to be a country tour on a beautiful April day! We started in the city and made a couple of stops for an informative overview. We then headed out at a leisurely pace and stopped a few times for facts on how the city grew, developed land from the canals, jobs, and other historical facts! We stopped at a beautiful windmill on the Amstel and were given the background on how it worked in its day, the importance of it then, and why it's being saved! Then we cycled further into the countryside to a cheese factory and clog maker! This was interesting, but a bit "cheesy"! We brought home some cheese and are enjoying it just as much as when we had the tasting!!The countryside tour then headed through a few parks that were developed "for the people"! This was very interesting to hear about. How several generations of political power knew to develop for the workers and athletes to enjoy! I took away from this trip a sense of how Amsterdam has taken care of itself and it's people! It is way more than coffee shops and the Red Light District!!! So glad we did the tour with such a professional, well equipt, knowledgable, and professional outfitter!

Great way to see Amsterdam. I took the three-hour "city" bike tour which starts at noon. My son did the same tour a few weeks earlier. There are other tour options, but I think this is the best. There were 17 of us, all on bikes, led by a very knowledgable guide. In the three hours, we saw almost everything you would want to see in Amsterdam, at least on a "drive-by" basis. Parks, canals, museums, Anne Frank house, red light district, capped off by a stop at a giant windmill which doubles as a micro brewery. The windmill was the only actual stop where we went inside; all other areas were simply riding by with stops to explain the neighborhood/attraction. The course is very flat with only a few short "hills" to go over the canal bridges. If the weather is nice, this should definitely be on your itinerary.

Rain, but that was fine!. Just returned from a very wet and windy weekend in Amsterdam. We had pre-booked the cycle tour for the Saturday. It didn't stop anything, we were given capes to wear and the tour went ahead, even though we were soaked the tour was excellent, no idea how far we travelled but we visited e main sights and was given a brilliant commentary by Stuart. I would definitely recommend this tour and would love to do it again in the sunshine!

Beware. This tour started off with the tour guide refusing to give my wife a woman's bike and went downhill from there. Very little biking. Stoned guide offered to bring us to pot shop after bike tour. Spent more than an hour at a bar/restaurant. Maybe one hour of biking. Did not even compare to other bike tours we took in Europe.
Knowledgeable and fun. Our guide was fun, knowledgable and happy throughout our country side bike tour of Amsterdam. The guys in the shop were helpful and friendly. Would recommend!

Country tour. We did the four hour country tour and really enjoyed it! Our guide was Karl (I think?!) and he was funny, but also very knowledgeable about Amsterdam and the surrounding area. I was a bit nervous about the lenght of the tour as I am 5 months pregnant, but you stop for breaks and have a good stop at the cheese and clog farm - also there are no hills or strenuous parts to the cycle. You might want to pack a lunch to bring with you, or have a late breakfast (11am-3pm tour)We would do this tour again, Thanks!

Best Bike Tour !!. Took the Countryside Bike Tour on 29April2014 with Jesse. He was awesome as a tour guide, giving us great details on the city and the countryside, with little stories en route. I highly recommend this tour. Didn't even feel like we biked 25-30km, easy ride, and great scenery, and again, Jesse's knowledge of the area was fantastic!!!! Thank-you !!!
Excelent. Mike's guys just rock. Want to go around in Ámsterdam and check the city highlights in great company? Must do it with them, great tour, great people!

Book this - fantastic!. We went in the 2/3 hour city tour. We were 5 women with mixed cycling ability. The tour was just brilliant and the perfect way to see and experience the city. Our guide - Karl (with a K) was fun and informative. The time flew by and we covered a huge area and got a great feel for the city. The tour was also very reasonable compared with others and the bikes were in great condition.

Highlight of my holiday. I could not recommend Mike's Bike Tours more, the City Tour was the highlight of my trip. Mike was our tour guide and did a fantastic job of creating a sense of camaraderie in the group. The tour was great fun, far better than the stiff, rehearsed and frankly boring tours I have experienced elsewhere. The stop for a drink towards the end of the tour gave the group a chance to get to know each other and a few of us even went exploring Amsterdam together afterwards. The bikes are comfortable and the ride isn't strenuous at all and it's great fun to see the pedestrians dash out of your way when you ring your bell :) I will definitely be doing their Country Tour on my next trip. I would recommend doing the tour early into your holiday, you will get to see a number of places worth exploring later that you may never have come across otherwise.

Great way to see the city. City tour with Stuart was a great way to see the city, I would recommend the tour at the start of a visit to get your bearings and some very useful information on places to see.The bikes are really comfortable and require minimum effort to get around.I shall be back for a trip out into the country next time.
Fun!. Great way to see the city! Tour guide was funny and entertaining as well as knowledgeable. Would recommend for a first time visitor to Amsterdam.

A Way to See Amsterdam. Sam was our city tour guide in April, 2014. It was an okay bike tour, only wished he would have given more of a tour/talk about the history and sights of Amsterdam than about reefers, beer and Red Light District. We wish we would have taken the country bike tour instead, perhaps we would have heard less about all of the above.

Great Escape from the City. The countryside tour was just what we were looking for to escape the crowds of central Amsterdam and cycle along some country paths. Our guide was incredibly knowledgeable of the history of Amsterdam's architecture and engineering and he had a good sense of humour too, so it never got boring. The bikes were much better than our hotel rentals and had lots of various pockets to put cameras and bottles of water and things in. Buy a sandwich from Stach just down the street from the office because the cheese farm is an ideal spot for a picnic.The cheese and clog farm was a lot of fun and the windmill was pretty, but the best bit was just cycling along the country paths away from pedestrians and tourists. Even though we were quite a large group, the guide never lost anyone, even in the heavy bicycle traffic around the Rijksmuseum. Having very high expectations after doing a Mike's Bike tour in Munich, we were not disappointed.

Great way to see the city. We went on the city tour with Sam as our guide in April 2014. Even though it rained a little bit, we still had a lot of fun. I think it was actually better going in the rain because the streets were less crowded. Sam was a great guide and had tons of interesting information to share about Amsterdam. I recommend this tour as a good way to get acquainted with the city and learn a little of its history.

Great way to see Amsterdam!. We went on 2 tours with this company - the City Tour which was a great introduction to this fabulous city, followed by the Countryside Tour which was a delightful way to see outside Amsterdam. As we were staying in Amsterdam for 2 weeks, we hired bikes from Mike's for several other days as cycling was the most efficient and pleasurable ways of getting around the city. The bikes were comfortable and easy to lock.

Ring Mike's bell in Amsterdam. This was one of the highlights of my recent visit to Amsterdam. Our guide was funny, insightful, cool and successfully navigated our 2 hour Mini City Tour through a hectic afternoon before King's Day. The bikes were hip and the stories we heard were interesting. Great way to see the city from 2 wheels! Thanks, guys!

The locals way to see the city. I throughly enjoyed my bike tour with this group. My tour guide Sam was fun and informative, but also very safe and kept a mothers watch over the group. We did the City tour and covered a fair amount of area including VondelPark, the Museums, the Jordan, the flower market and by Ann Frank House amoung others. We had time for a nice canal side break to rest before heading back to the beginning. The bikes were in good condition and each person was checked out and sized to be sure they would be comfortable, The store was easy to find and the staff was very friendly and spoke many languages including english. I would definitely recommend them for a tour and when I go back I am going to do the countryside tour.

Assistance. We were booked in to Amsterdam Bike Tours which ultimately was booked through Yellow Bikes Amsterdam. We were totally confused and went to the nearest Bike shop that being Mike's Bike Tours. The staff were most helpful in everyway to the point that we were able to find the opposition and pointing us in the right direction. Knowing what we know now I would have chosen Mike's bike tours because they have more offices around town and culd not have been more helpful. Thank you Mike's Bike Tour Staff

Don't miss this tour and do it on day one. We did the city tour with Mike's Bikes. Our guide was Jeff who was fantastic fun and very knowledgeable about Amsterdam including the stuff you won't read in the tour guides. The pace was easy and there were lots of stops to give everyone a chance to learn a bit about the key sights and areas. It is possible to cover a lot of ground on a bike so it is an ideal introduction to the area and a good thing to do on day one of your trip. Its a pretty relaxed and fun tour and while it was billed for 2 1/2 hours it took nearly 4. The final stop at the brewery by the windmill was well timed and I was happy to buy Jeff a drink. Highly recommended.

Everything you could want in a bike tour!. I just recently returned from a trip to Amsterdam over Easter and had the pleasure of taking the 3+ hour city tour with Mike the man himself of Mike's Bike Tours. The place is very central and easy to find, and the guys are all very friendly. There were about 30 people for the city tour so we broke into two smaller groups of 15 which was ideal. A quick lesson in road rules first then we set off into the sunshine. The tour canvassed a good amount of ground, city sights and picturesque bridges, traveled at a good pace and kept the group together despite the crazy bike and pedestrian traffic in the city! Mike was very charismatic, passionate and informative and all in all I had a great time and met some lovely people on the tour. My only advise would be to eat lunch or a large snack before the tour! Would highly recommend the city tour and hope to return and check out the country tour myself another day.

Start you trip with Mikes. Start your trip in Amsterdam with a bcycle tour. You willhave the overview of the city and also get interesting and valuable information. Our guide was both funny and knowledable, the perfect guide I think.

epic.. I'm 18 years old. Most fun way to experience Amsterdam. Afterwards, I took the boat tour and walked around and it wasn't as great or memorable as the tour. Interesting, brief, humorous explanations of landmarks+ comfiest bikes you'll ever ride. You get a good idea of Amsterdam so you can go back to the places that caught your attention. A good decision.

Highly recommend country tour. This tour and the guides were great. We were pleasantly surprised by the amount of information they had to share about Amsterdam and it's history, architecture and culture. It was such a beautiful ride that our main disappointment was not being able to stop randomly to take photos. The authentic cheese farm was fun and entertaining. And, our bikes blended in much more than other bike places that shouted TOURIST! The riding part was 23km (14.3 mikes) but it was not difficult riding at all. We highly recommend this and enjoyed it more, and learned more, than on one of the boat canal tours. And we even left a camera in one of the bike bags and they held it for is. Great place. Highly recommend.

This is the way to see Amsterdam. Our experience with Mike's Bikes was excellent from start to finish. We booked in advance but needn't have since they were easily able to cope with lots of customers turning upon the day by putting on an extra tour. Our guide (Stewart) was top class: informative, patient and approachable. We learned loads about Amsterdam and its surrounding countryside and the visit to the cheese making, clog making farmer was not to be missed! The tour was a great combination of urban and countryside easy cycling and accessible for all ages and abilities. Great value and definitely worth taking the time to do.

Fun and interesting. The countryside bike tour was excellent and great value. Our guide led us safely out of the city through nearby countryside, the edge of the forest and the Vondelpark. The tour was educational but always fun and as a group we were encouraged to chat and look out for each other. Altogether a wonderful 4 hours+

Excellent Countryside Tour. My daughter and I just got back from a 4 hour tour of the countryside outside of Amsterdam led by Stewart. I am 60 years old, not in tip-top shape, and have not been on a bike in 40 years and I was riding in a group of 7 other visitors of varying degrees of biking experience, including my daughter who rides regularly in New York City and a young couple from England who had been riding around The Netherlands for several days on their own before we met them on this tour. Stewart is a great guide and is extremely knowledgable about the history and feats of engineering that has made Amsterdam what it is today. He also has a great sense of humor and provided some nice insights into Dutch culture and customs. His encouragement to those of us whose riding ability was not a strong as others while providing an enjoyable outing for the stronger riders seemed effortless. The weather was great, the countryside was beautiful, and I got to come home and boast to my sedentary friends about my rediscovered biking ability. Take the tour, you will not regret it.
Perfect City Tour. Insights and exercise and we learned how to survive biking in Amsterdam. Perfect way to see all the city and save your feet for the Museums.
Fantastic. Great 2 hours with our guide Jeff the Dutch Canadian, light hearted narrative of the sights ,sounds and views of the city from a local. Definitely recommend to any one.Enjoy

Great time on the country tour. We were a little worried that this tour, over 20 km into the dutch countryside would prove too difficult but decide to be brave and go for it. I am very glad we did.the bikes were great, the views lovely, stuart the duide was informative but not tiring and the group was really nice. It made for a lovely day

A wonderful way to see the city!. We couldn't decide how to spend the day in Amsterdam. The weather was warm and sunny and we wanted to take advantage of it. While searching the Internet for an outside activity we stumbled upon Mike's Bike tours. The city tour was leaving in less than an hour. We decided to walk to the shop and see if we could sign up for the tour. We made it there with 15 minutes to spare and could sign up on the spot. Instructions and safety tips were given before we departed. Jeff, our tour guide, did a great job of stopping every so often and explaining about the area we were in and pointing out interesting facts. He was knowledgable about Amsterdam but he also had a great sense of humor. One of the last stops was a bar at a windmill. We stopped long wnough to have a pint and then head back to the shop. The tour lasted about 3 hours. The bikes were easy to ride and Jeff made sure everyone stayed with the group. We would highly recommend this as an activity while in the city and would do it again.Bikes are everywhere and it is a wonderful way to experience how the locals get around!

The best way to tour Amsterdam. First of all, if you visit Amsterdam and don't get your behind on a bicycle at least once, you'll regret it. It's really the way to get around in this city with more bikes than people. Mike's Bike Tours is an amazing way to get going. We had a fantastic tour with Stuart through the city, including going through Vondelpark, the red light district, and several other locations. Stuart was very informative about all things Amsterdam from the city's history, to its culture today. We made a stop at a brewery in a windmill for a beer before heading back to our starting point. An amazing day, and a wonderful way to fall in love with the city... if you haven't already yet!

Great day in the countryside. Was a beautiful (if cold) day, but the canals and farmland just outside of Amsterdam was beautiful. Visited a windmill, a clog factory, then cut through a lot of countryside and forest, finishing up riding through the Vondelpark. A lovely day out.

Solid tours and rentals. Took the country tour mid week and it was the perfect get away from the city at the same time as giving confidence to biking in the city. Came back later I the week to rent for the day and it was nice having very little markings on the bike (just a small number on the rear fender). When I go back I will definitely be renting from mikes again.

2.time, still not disappointed! Great way to discover Amsterdam. This cycle tour is a realluy grat way to discover Amsterdam within 3 hours! Will highly reccomend. This time we cycled with the manager of Mike bike tours, Mike. He was very informative, hillarious and gave us an enjoyable day.

Loved the countryside tour!. My husband and I did the countryside bike tour with another one of our couple friends. We absolutely loved it! Stuart was our guide, and he clearly enjoys what he does. He was very knowledgeable and fun to spend the day with. It was about 4 hours long and we biked an easy 12 or so miles. It's a great way to see the city and learn a lot about it's history. We did pick up sandwiches before the tour for on our lunch break which worked out nicely. We loved learning about the windmills, cheese, clogs, and canals. The Gouda was so good, we brought plenty back to the US in our carry on! I just wish we had more time to do more of their tours. Mike's bike tours in both Amsterdam and Munich were the highlight of our Europe trip!!

City bike tour March 2014. Thanks to our guide Stuart for a very enjoyable city tour on a fabulous sunny day - especially the pit-stop at the Windmill for a craft beer. We're already planning to do the country bike tour the next time we're back! Highly recommend this tour as a great way to see the city.

Sat Afternoon. Excellent tour conducted by Mike, or Egg as he prefers to be known.
3.5 Hours cycling around the town centre, stopping every 10 to 15 mins to get a short history lesson.
Great weather, but can be done at any time.
Finished off with couple of beers in one of the large squares.
A great way to see the city.

See more of the city, than you ever could on foot. Fantastic tour, the first 3 mins are more than exciting... but you soon as you get used to the thousands of cyclists, mixed with trams, cars & tourists, then its the best tour ever. It just really helps having someone who knows the places to visit via the most interesting route. Very knowledgeable guide with a good sense of humour. Cant recommend this tour enough.

Excellent bike tour. Went on the country side bike tour last weekend with Stuart as our guide. He was extremely knowledgeable and made every part of the tour very interesting. The tour took 3 hours and was a great way to see the city and countryside

Bike with the locals, fun and easy bike option for seeing the city. For a low price, you get a decent/comfortable cruiser bike to ride with a group (we had 15) lead by a knowledgeable guide. Amsterdam is quite flat except for some bridges over canals and the biking is tame... basically if you are remotely comfortable on a bike, you can do this tour. The guide routes the group around the city stopping frequently to point out key sights and interesting facts. This was much more informative than the hop-a-bus or hop-a-boat tour options in the city. The city tour lasted almost 3 hours with frequent stops and was quite enjoyable. There were lots of great pointers of places you would want to go back to on you own to spend more time. This is probably not the best option if you are interested in taking lots of photos, but you can get some great ideas of where you want to return for your pictures.

Best way to see amsterdam. A great city to cycle around. I would recommend the café in the Vondelpark (best sandwiches ever!). The people we hired bikes from were genuinely friendly and helpful; the bikes were excellent and REALLY good fun. We took 3 teenage girls who were very dubious about spending a day cycling - and they absolutely loved it. An excellent experience for 1 day in Amsterdam. I would highly recommend it.
Best Bikes for the Best Price. Awesome bikes (not obvious tourist beacons). Cheapest prices i could find with the added bonus of their current winter deals. Absolutely hassle free service. thank you

Great tour - good pace, flavour of the city and local knowledge. Very enjoyable cycle tour. Small group, solid bike, reasonable price with a guide who's relaxed and knows the city. Good knowledge and information shared over the course of approx 8-10 stops throughout the 3 hourish tour. My favourite part was the pit stop at the windmill pub for some authentic Dutch (tasty) beer! Highly recommend it, great value for money.

Great guide and best tour of Amsterdam. Geoff our guide was very entertaining and informative. We were lucky as we had a small group and lovely sunny weather, albeit cold. We took this cycle tour on a Sunday and found Amsterdam no problem to cycle around. Geoff always ensured we stayed together and Amsterdam is a very safe place to cycle. I do not like cycling on public roads, but Amsterdam is a completely different and enjoyable experience. We visited lots of interesting places with information provided by Geoff.Whilst in Amsterdam we joined in the walking tour and a canal cruise. The cycle tour was by far the best.

Brilliant!. We had 2 nights in Amsterdam and this tour was a perfect pit stop of all the main attractions and certainly whetted our appetites to return and what we should see when we do!Geoff was a brilliant, confident, knowledgable & entertaining guide. I'm not great at setting off on a bike, and am uncomfortable cycling close to others, I'm not sure whether I'd be able to cope in the summer when I imagine there are lots more cyclists about. Something perhaps for other 'nervous' cyclists to be aware of. On the other hand I ride my bike about twice a year, and managed the ride comfortably, and without incident. So it wasn't that bad :)It's a great way to see a beautiful city. :)

Amazing tour, brilliant guide. Despite being a big (20+) group Jesse kept us all informed and in line (ably assisted by me as "assman supreme"). The bikes were well maintained and Jesse was so much fun. My chain came off - my fault not the bike's - and as I was at the back no one noticed. However, Jesse was back within a few minutes to find me, had me back on track in seconds and back with the group shortly afterwards.The tour goes around most of Amsterdam taking in all the main sights as well as a micro brewery for a short refreshment stop (there is a cafe next door for the non-drinkers/kids). The city is very safe to bike in and we thoroughly enjoyed the afternoon.One word of warning, have lunch before you join the tour (or a very late breakfast!) as you don't get a chance to eat anything until about 14:30!

Fantastic tour. Fantastic guide.. What a wonderful tour by Jessie we experienced today. Despite initial poor weather Jessie ensured that we had a phenomenal time. Very knowledgeable, charasmatic, friendly and entertaining guide. Could not rate higher.

Fantastic way to see the city. When visiting Amsterdam we decided the best way to see it would be to do so by bike, as the locals do. So we went on trip advisor and found mikes bike tours, it did not disappoint! We had a large group off 20 people but that didn't cause any issues, we had a fab guide who cycled us around all the main attractions as well as taking us on some more unique routes.it gave a great view of the city and was really informative, the tour was for 2 hours but we ended up staying out for 4 hours so it was definitely worth the money. I would recommend this tour to anyone who likes to bike ride.

A lovely ride but not a great commentary. This is the second time I have been on this bike ride, the first time was great. This time I was in a large group and it was very difficult to hear the commentary for anyone who was not side by side with female guide. She had her head turned towards whatever she was talking about and those behind her couldn't hear anything. I think the group was a bit large but it was an enjoyable time anyway.

5+ stars!. I did the city tour and it was like biking along with a friend that was extremely knowledgeable about Amsterdam! The city is not that large - so the biking distance is not very long. Further there are not many (if any) hills - so it's quite a great way to see a lot! The guides were all wonderful in giving plenty of recommendations of things to see/do in the city. It's a wonderful place to get yourself oriented to the city. Go even if it's raining :)

Look no further. Everything you wil want in a bike tour you wil find with Mike's. Great guides ( i highly recommend Jeff), comfortable bikes, good route and generous amount of time sent on the tour. In Amsterdam one must experience the city on a bicycle and Mike's didn't disappoint.

Great guide, fun ride. Spent a Saturday in Amsterdam and toured the city with Mike's Bikes. Great 3 hour ride, all in English, pointed out some restaurants and locations I went back to after. Knowledgable and fun guide, made some unique stops and great insight. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see the city as an insider.
Countryside tour was fun and easy paced!. My bf and I enjoyed this because you get to see outside the city and visit a cheese/wooden shoe farm.. And see a wind mill. Very nice tour.

The highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. We cannot praise this tour highly enough. Our English guide, Stuart, was wonderful and delighted and entertained us throughout. He was extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the Amsterdam history and way of life. He had lots of local tips to share too! Seeing Amsterdam on a bike is THE best way to enjoy the city. We enjoyed it so much we took advantage of the 50% off offer the next day and hired the bikes again, this time to enjoy the city on our own. Fantastic service, wonderful guides and comfortable bikes. Don't hesitate! Tip: you get a discount if you like their facebook page! :)

Fantastic Tour - Highly Recommended. Booked the city tour with my girlfriend for my first trip to Amsterdam and her third time.Our tour was operated by Geoff, our amusing Canadian guide who was very insightful on his time spent in Amsterdam and the sights to see. He ran through a quick history of Amsterdam and the surrounding area to get ourselves up to speed with The Netherlands. We then went through a quick safety drill and how to get the most out of our bikes and that was it - we set off to a lovely day zooming around in between other tourists and the hell bent locals.As I am quite tall and easy to spot in a crowd, and not to mention somewhat threatening on a bicycle Geoff ordained me as tail end charlie, and as a show of appreciation, I received a complimentary Mikes Bikes Amsterdam bike bell, which I will be installing on my new bike when I eventually return to Australia!A thoroughly enjoyable tour, and most likely one of the best ways to see Amsterdam, especially if you have little time in town. Even if you don't, still book a tour with them and enjoy yourself!

City tour - fun, entertaining and informative. There were three of us and we were looking for a bike tour close to where we were staying near Leidseplein and Mike's was within walking distance. We chose the 3 hour bike tour as it was starting close to when we arrived and were so glad we did. Jesse was our guide and we had a great group of people. He vowed to show us all the sights as well as give us a feel for the 'real' Amsterdam and he definately delivered. After this tour we felt like our sightseeing was accomplished and it had actually freed up more of our weekend for museums etc. There was an excellent intro to biking in Holland and how the group would stay together etc. If anyone got stuck at a red light they were caught up within a minute and Jesse even knew which lights we had to cross quickly to stay together. We saw just about the entire city - De Jordaan, Dam Square, Museumplein, Vondel Park (with a history lesson), red light district (with cultural explanations), the port, a windmill and more. I would do this again as it was definately worth the price and the bikes were really comfortable, This tour was suitable for all of us even though we were a little worse for wear and I don't cycle very often, it wasn't too taxing.

Best part of my trip to Amsterdam!. I was traveling alone and really wanted to rent a bike around Amsterdam but wasn't comfortable enough with the city to do so on my own. I did the Countryside Bike Tour which lasted almost 4 hours and it was a lot of fun and great exercise. I would say this is my favorite "touristy" thing I did in Amsterdam/ Holland, seeing the city the way a local would, and I would definitely take more tours from the company if I'm ever back.

Another Awesome Tour With Mikes Bikes!. Just returned from a trip with the "girls" to Amsterdam. Most of us have done Mike Bike Tours in Munich, so we were excited to see Mikes in Amsterdam as well! We all agreed that the best part of our short trip was our City Tour with our guide Jeff! He was equal parts informative and entertaining... we asked tons of questions and he was very patient with us! Our stop at the old windmill brewery was also perfectly timed, as we hid out inside during a little rain shower! We all hope to visit Amsterdam again and check out the Countryside tour!Jeff was awesome!!! We highly recommend you take a tour with Mike's and ask for Jeff!

The best way to see Amsterdam. We have been to Amsterdam 3 times before, but we saw so much more and learned so much more from one tour with Mike's Bike Tours. We did the City Tour on 24th October - what a beautiful day and what a great bunch of people to do a tour with. The tour was easy to take in, cycling at a pace suitable for everyone, with frequent stops where our guide explained everything that we had just passed, places we were about to go to, giving recommendations along the way constantly. We stopped for a drink at the windmill and got to know our guide and the group even more - advertised for 3 hours, but we were out for nearly 4 hours. This is the ideal way to see and learn about Amsterdam - if you don't manage anything else, do this tour. You will be entertained.

I am so glad I did this country tour. It was easy.It was fun. It is safe (bikes have priority over cars and drivers know if that hit you they are automatically in the wrong <g> - if only London had the same law).It was a slow serene flat ride along canals and cycle routes over the Skinny Bridge and out along the Amsel in the October sunshine first to a Windmill then a small farm for cheese and clog making demo, Onwards across polders and back through Amsterdam Bois and Vonderlpark.I bought a cheese at 11 Euro / kilo - much cheaper it turned out than the same cheeses in town.A lovely easy slow ride with a fun guide that anyone could do in less than half the time but then would miss out on the fun and the sights.Well worth doing if you have the time - this ride took about 4 hours including lunch stop - bread and cheese.Oh if you go on a tour you can get half price cycle hire throughout your stay.

You just have to do these tours. City Tour with Ashley was fab. All the stuff you didn't know you needed to know delivered by Ash, the craziest and most entertaining man in Amsterdam and then some. The only way to spend a few hours learning about this wonderful city.In fact the tour was so fab, we came back the next day for the Countryside tour, again with Ash the man. Whoever decided to add the mad farmer with his clog-making and cheese-making needs a medal it was such fun.We had great weather for the whole weekend, but had we just had Ash and the City, we'd have been just as happy.Thanks Ash, thanks Mike's tours, you made our weekend!

Mike's Bike tours. If you don't do anything else while you are in Amsterdam, do go on this tour. Egg took us on a 3 hour private tour of the city - and because of his great enthusiasm and knowledge I now understand so much more about the history and economics of Amsterdam. Cycling in Amsterdam is a safe and a fantastic way to see a lot in a short time.It was great fun, very comprehensive and good value.

Best tour and great value: mini city bike your . My husband and I took the mini city bike tour last week, which is a shortened 2 hour version of the original tour they offer, and despite the rain, Stuart gave us one of the most comprehensive tours we have ever had. His knowledge and enthusiasm really opened our minds to Amsterdam and made our trip so much more meaningful and enjoyable. Two hours was the perfect amount of time since our trip was pretty short and the price was super reasonable and worth it. I would recommend this as a must do to anyone visiting Amsterdam for the first time or anyone wanting to learn a whole lot about it in a short amount of time!

Best Amsterdam City Bike Tour��. We did the tour on Saturday 12th in the lovely winter sunshine and took on most of the sights on our trip which lasted about 3.5hrs in total including a stop off for a well deserved beer. I would say it's the best way to integrate yourself in to Amsterdam life as bikes appear to priority of any mode of transport including on foot. It's safe it well managed and most of all it's a lot of fun and with minimal effort( amsterdam is flatish). Go and book you won't regret it one bit.

Great way to meet Amsterdam. Nothing like a guide who loves the city you are visiting to make you appreciate it even more. We had a great and safe ride, after having gone through a detailed and entertaining history lesson. The bicycles were in good working order and the guide did a great job at keeping the group together as well as giving us tons of information and recomendations on what else we should see.

Great way to visit amsterdam. An amazing 3h30 tour of Amsterdam with multiple stops to enjoy the town. Plenty of historical stories, and also some good stories about the red light district. We had Neil as a guide, he was really funny and interesting. His tips for what else we could visit, restaurants and cafes were really valuable for the rest of our trip. Great job, will do it again.

The best way to experience Amsterdam. We wanted to see Amsterdam on a bike and this place came highly recommended. But imagine our luck when our city tour was conducted by none other then the big boss himself. Mike turned out to be a very humorous dude but yet so we'll informed about the intricacies of all he was talking about. When we went for the countryside tour our tour guide Karl ( with a K ... From Birmingham had us in splits throughout. Anyone visiting Amsterdam for the first time have to go for a bike tour with these guys. They are really passionate about it. A big thumbs up from me.

Perfect city for a bike tour. We knew Amsterdam was bike friendly before we arrived, but WOW! So once we got there and saw just how easy it was to navigate the city on a bike, we decided to do a bike tour. We chose Mike's because I had done a Mike's tour in Munich 15 years ago, and I'm glad to say that the experience was just as good. Our tour guide was friendly and full of interesting anecdotes, the bikes were good quality and easy to use, and the city is just so conducive to riding! We took the two-hour tour, which gives you a taste of the different neighborhoods. There are plenty of stops, so it's not strenuous, and you can take your camera for some good photo ops. Be sure to bring a few extra Euros along, as you'll stop somewhere for a drink near the end, and you might want to buy a t-shirt as well. You can make reservations online ahead of time or try your luck as a walk-in, like we did. Overall, a really nice way to get a feel for Amsterdam.

Wonderful bike tour!. Our guide, Stuart, was excellent. His knowledge of Amsterdam, his awareness of the environmental needs and future of the Netherlands, and his charming personality made for a most enjoyable experience. We spent time learning about the canals, windmills, cheese and wooden shoe making, locks, etc.

Two Tours!. We took the Countryside Tour and had so much fun! We learned about Mike's from Munich. These tours are lead by very knowlegable and funny guides! The country side tour got us out of the city to see the beautiful country, Amstel River, beautiful houses and windmills! We had such a good time, we did the city tour another day. The info overlapped just a bit but each guide is just a bit different and little details were different. It helps to take a bike tour in Amsterdam because it makes you a better pedestrian too!Highly recommend this!

Best Place to Rent Bikes. The BEST place to rent bikes from in Amsterdam. We have rented from here twice now, excellent service, so helpful. Haven't been on the tours (our choice to explore on our own) but were provided with maps and recommendations of where to go ourselves. We wouldn't consider going anywhere else when we're over there.

Great view of surrounding area. We really enjoyed our trek with Carl, a logorrheic, enthusiastic Brit who kept things lively and fun. And the ride, the countryside, and the opportunity to see a lot in a few short hours were all great. Highly recommended.

Smile guaranteed!!. Had a great 2 hour mini city tour. Tour guide Carl had us laughing all the way round. Would certainly recommend this to anyone who's not been to Amsterdam before as a great way of getting your bearings and seeing the sights. Hopefully we'll get back to Amsterdam and take the country tour.

Excellent City Bike Tour. We were only in Amsterdam for a day and would thoroughly recommend you to experience a bike tour with Mike's Bike Tours. We had a small group of 8 fellow riders with a fantastic guide who stopped every now and again to talk about the sights. The 2 hour city bike tour was easy on the legs and gave us the opportunity to see parts of Amsterdam that we wouldn;t have been able to visit if we were just walking. We wish we had time to take part in the countryside tour but that will have to wait until next time.Organisation, payment etc was easy and had no concerns with safety.Until next time.....

Fantastic City Tour. My wife and I took this tour yesterday. What a great way to see Amsterdam. Stuart was our guide and he was great. Learned much about the history of Amsterdam and its architecture. Takes a bit to get used to the manic traffic of cars, scooters and bikes, but you adjust quickly. Saw every part of the city in this 31/2 hour tour. I would highly recommend this trip early in your stay in Amsterdam. Wish we had time to take the country tour, as well. Go, you will not be disappointed.

Excellent countryside tour with Stuart, great guide. We went on the bike tour today, everyone at the shop was very friendly and helpful. The bikes were fine and had brakes on the handlebars - no back peddling to stop! Stuart our guide was brilliant, very knowledgable about the history of Amsterdam and The Netherlands. A great way to spend a few hours.

Enjoyed Countryside Tour. We really enjoyed this gently paced tour. it is amazing how quickly in some major cities you can be in the countryside. Carl was our guide and he was very entertaining, he was good with our 10 year old who road up the front asking questions the whole way and also kept the adults interested. The farm visit is a shameless sell of clogs and and cheese, but that was OK because clogs and cheese are part of what Holland is famous for, we bought both! We must have been a bit behind time as the trip back had increased pace and fewer stops, trailing the group out a bit. It would have been good to have more stops and more snippets of information. The ponchos supplied for wet weather were fantastic. Our trip was mostly dry but when it rained they stopped us from getting wet. Overall it was great, and even though the traffic in town was very busy, riding a bike in a country where bikes rule was quite easy.

You can find slightly cheaper places.. We rented bikes in Amsterdam for a day. They take a form of ID as a deposit. I was kind of nervous that they would loose it. The storefront didn't appear that organized. But Thankfully everything was fine. The service was good, and the staff was friendly and helpful! But be careful biking around, there are pedestrians, cars, and other bikes all over the place. The bike locks are annoying to use, but unfortunately bike theft is a problem in Amsterdam. I think it costed about 12 euros to rent a bike for 24 hours. Later on I saw a few bike rental places for as low as 9 Euros/24hours.

Most fun you can have on a bike!!. My wife and I have just had a brilliant bike ride with Carl, he made it fun and a laugh, it wasn't hard because there are no hills!!, unless you count the bridges. Definitely recommend it if you want a good time.

Fantastic tour, awesome guide Aaron. We booked a private tour (my husband and I) for our first morning in Amsterdam. Money and time very well spent. We instantly warmed to our hospitable, laid back and interesting guide who clearly had a real passion and energy for this city. He made us feel very at ease and wound us through the streets and alleys of his neck of the woods, all the while, explaining what he loves best about Amsterdam. We learnt a great deal and bought a fantastic 'alternative guide' book, which he wrote himself....it's great! The bikes were great and nice to ride. Thoroughly enjoyed our three hours and would recommend to anyone - good for getting your bearings early on. We'll now rent bikes ourselves. Ask for Aaron if he's available....you won't be disappointed!

City then Country. We took the city tour our first full day in Amsterdam. Mike the girl, not the owner, was our guide. She was great. Very knowledgeable about the city history and local customs. Also very laid back like a tropical local. We enjoyed every minute of the 3 hour tour. It gave us a good outline of the city and lots of ideas of what else to do there. We took the country tour the next day. Ashley was our guide. Again very, very easy going. He played iPod music while we rode. The country tour is a lot more cycling, and covers more country. The cheese dairy and clog making stop was ok, though we had to wait for the group ahead to clear out before we got our demonstration.All in all, the guides made it a point to keep us happy and entertained, like their jobs depended on it. Good work if you can get it. Definitely recommend them for the first timer to the city.

Freewheeling. This is a brilliant way of seeing the city. The tour was fun and off the wall. Particularly after the brewery visit. The guide was entertaining and well informed. The only reason I hesitate to rate this excellent is that it is up to you to keep pace and negotiate the many tiers of Amsterdam traffic. We found this small challenge added to the fun and now consider this to be the best method of seeing a city.

Cheese and Clogs. It was a beautiful day in Amsterdam, and a group of us went along for our bike tour. We had Carl, yes Carl who is great guy from England and he took us on a great ride.. Showed us some amazing sights and had such a passion for cycling and culture of Amsterdam and was a great laugh... Would go again any day!!!

Countryside Tour- Great 4 Hours. We took this tour with Pete as our guide. He was great fun and also very informative. I was a bit nervous during the ride while in the city- those Amsterdamers are serious bikers and there is a LOT of traffic but Pete was confidant, assuring and got us through! The group that showed up on our chosen day was large and I was initially a little worried I wouldn't be able to keep up or hear the guide's info. In fact, they split the people up into smaller groups and each had their own guide.I especially appreciated riding alongside the Amstel- it was peaceful even though there were other bikers, cars, and pedestrians. The tour stopped several times for information from the guide which was presented informally and with humor but taught me many things I didn't know despite all of my reading about the city and the area.I am not a fan of tourist traps but I truly enjoyed the farm stop. Yes, I knew the plan was to sell me stuff but I can look past that and really appreciated seeing how wooden shoes are made as well as learning about Dutch cheese. We bought some cheese, but passed on the wooden shoes despite the fact that Pete had worn his for the entire ride to show us how comfortable and useful they are.On the ride back, we stopped in Vondelpark. I especially enjoyed seeing this historic and beautiful park which I could not have fit in into my trip. All in all this is a fun way to get outside of the city for a non-taxing ride with someone who knows the area.

Start with a bike tour at Mike's Bike tours - seriously!. First thing we did was take the tram to Mike's bike store, to do a 3.5h tour. The tour was great, very relaxed atmosphere, a lot of fun, and we ended up going for a beer in a local brewery. We took note of the places we wanted to come back to after the tour and during our stay in town. We got to rent the bikes for 2 more days at a reduced price thanks to the tour, and the staff were very accommodating, fun and very helpful. They even helped us book museum tickets, and exchanged our bikes for newer ones as soon as they were available. Thanks Mike and team, you set us up with the right spirit for our visit to Amsterdam. Will visit them again when I come back, and recommend this to people who want a local flavour vs. the traditional standard off-the-shelf tours.

Awesome Ride. My second tour with Mikes Bikes my first being close to 10 years ago and it's still the best thing to do in Amsterdam. Biked with 28 people from all over the world and had a fun time. Very easy to do and an inexpensive way to see the countryside of Amsterdam which is beautiful. Our girl guide "Mike" was a blast from her quirky dress to funny stories she had us laughing the whole time. She was very informative as well and showed us how to follow bike path maps in case we want to rent bikes on our own. I'm in my fifties and my daughter in her twenties so its fun for all ages! exceeded expectations!

Great Bike Ride. My wife and I took the Countryside Tour with Pete as the guide. He was a great guide. He shared information about different sites along the way. He was funny and entertaining. The ride was not hard and the pace was enjoyable. The stop at the cheese farm/clog factory was entertaining. The farmers is quite a character. Had lunch at the farm. Then rode back. We would highly recommend this attraction.

Great way to see Amsterdam. I saw this review on TA & thought it would be the perfect way to experience Amsterdam. Amsterdam was our final destination on our Avalon Rhine River Cruise. We made the reservations online the morning we arrived. I agree with the reviewer who said at first it seemed a little bizarre during the orientation. Once we got on the streets it was a little chaotic, but once you got the hang of it it was very exhilarating. Our tour guide, Thomas, was wonderful & very knowledgable about the history of his homeland. We rode thru the Red Light District, the Museum District, Vondelpark & ended up at Thomas's favorite microbrew where we enjoyed local brews & the company of our fellow bikers. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip.

My favourite activity of my two month holiday. I loved it! I hadn't gone on a bike ride in a while, and was a little nervous how I'd go in traffic. It was BRILLIANT! The tour guide - I forget her name! - was a cracker of a dreadlocked Irish woman, and completely fantastic. She was careful in making sure noone got left behind, but you don't feel babied at all. It's still a bit nerve-racking, given the little hills, but the bike lanes and general respect the city gives to cyclists really makes a difference. We went for a short city ride as part of a big group and saw some great sights. The park was my favourite part. It even drizzled and noone cared, we were having the best time. The best money you'll spend on an activity.

Fun and informative. Some friends recommended that we try this bike tour and we were not disappointed. At first the tour guides seemed a bit bizarre and the whole setting a bit grungy but we quickly got into the right mood and greatly appreciated the sense of humor of the team and their desire to make this tour a fun tour. The bikes are decent - in working order and comfortable, but not new. Many bikes have a side pouch for gear and the company gave us ponchos for rain (unfortunately we needed them most of the ride). The pace was easy although the route does require good bike handling skills and our 10 year old daughter was struggling at first to mange with the narrow streets and cars, Also note that the Dutch don't wear helmets and none were offered on the tour.

When in Rome... I highly recommend, even as a budget traveler, that you take this tour. We saw so much in a relatively little amount of time. I think our tour was about 4 hours long, and our tour guide was pretty good - the content was sometimes a bit questionable, but nonetheless it was interesting to see the city from a local's perspective. Another reason I would HIGHLY recommend this tour is because it gives you confidence on a bike in Amsterdam, and a bike is THE way to get around. Statistically it is safer to be on a bike then a Pedestrian in Amsterdam, which I would experientially agree with. The roads can be a bit chaotic, and it takes a little while to understand the rules of the road. Take this tour the first day of your visit and then rent a bike - it will make your trip very enjoyable!

Excellent way to see a bit of the countryside. My daughter and I went on a countryside ride yesterday. We both thought it was the best thing we did in our short visit to Amsterdam. It was very easy, and the bike paths were very safe - and scenic. I would not really call it "country side" but rather "gentlemen farming" area. However, the ride gave us a good feel for the canal system, and the lifestyle of Amsterdam. Great parks and great bike trails. Well worth the time!

Informative, funny, and very laid back tour of Amsterdam by bike. I highly recommend Mike's Bike Tours in Amsterdam. I've been to the city numerous times, but learned more about Dutch history from this tour than from any guide book, and the history lesson was funny and unique, not a moment of boredom. The bikes are not labeled and matching like other rental places, so you feel and look like a local (well, except for not being quite as graceful as people who ride in Amsterdam all the time). The guides take you on their individual tour of Amsterdam, so you get a different feel depending on your tour guide's favorite spots, but each tour does appear to hit the big attractions in the city. It was well worth the price and wonderful fun for a few hours. I look forward to going back to do their harbor and countryside tours.

Tour guide was charming, but trip was a hype. We spent close two 60 euros for a trip to the "country side." In reality, it took us to a farm that clearly survives entirely as a tour destination and that is just outisde the city in the suburbs. The trip is billed as a 3-4 hour ride, but a good hour of ours was spent on the farm getting sales promos ("demonstrations") for the cheese and wooden shoes that are the farm's main products. (No extra charge for canned, sexist jokes.) We could have spent half that much to rent bikes outside the downtown area where Mike's is located and taken ourselves on a day trip to Haarlem or some other nearby town. The country is flat, so biking is easy if you start outside the city (which is only hard because of the incredible congestion). Our tour guide, Mike (not the Mike of the company name) was charming and well informed, but did not make up for the high price and the short trip. Note for readers from Boston -- this was like taking a trip to Allendale Farms and calling it a countryside tour.

Bike if you want to see it all!. This is my 5th time in Amsterdam but feels like my first time, why? Simply because I bicked around the city. Karl was our guide and he was great and witty. Had a 3 hours tour and it was sunny and nice. Highly recommended, they alao give you a discount card if you go back to them for a bike rental. Worth every penny.

Great guides, fun day out. All the staff at Mike's Bikes are very funny and cheerful. We did the countryside tour with Ashley who was fun and laid back and made the whole experience enjoyable and interesting. He kept an eye on everyone and stopped when anyone started to fall behind. The bikes were really easy to ride (didn't even brake a sweat). The tour of the cheese and clog making farm was interesting, and the staff there were friendly and fun also. It was a relaxing day out, and a good way to get to know the rules of the Amsterdam roads if you haven't cycled there before. Plus, if you do a tour, you get 50% off bike rental if you return. Bargain!
Only way to see the city!. Excellent. Guide very informative, fantastic personality made everything fun and interesting. Great way to see the city.

Fantastic experience, highlight of our holiday. We went on the "Mini City Tour" which was 2hrs long on Monday 5th August - it was brilliant value for money, at 15 Euro each as we were students. We were a group of seven tourists, five American students and myself and my boyfriend, led by Karl the tour guide. It was a really warm sunny day and the small size of the group made it easy to negotiate crossings and stay together etc.I was initally nervous about cycling in a busy city full of trams and experienced cyclists however our entire group had similar thoughts and after a safety briefing and instructions from Karl ("Stay on the right hand side or you have a death wish!") and a rather shaky few metres at first, we were zooming around the streets. Karl was incredibly friendly, a brilliant tour guide with a wicked sense of humour, keeping the infamous parts of Amsterdam light hearted. Our tour lasted for 1hr 40mins and was perfect. The cycling wasn't hard at all, I didn't feel like I'd covered 10km of Amsterdam til my legs were sore the next morning! We'll be back to do the countryside tour or the full city tour on our next visit. I couldn't recommend this highly enough!

Amazing tour that ended poorly. First off, I would like to say that the Countryside Tour itself was amazingly fun. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed riding our bikes around the reclaimed country side and visiting the cheese and shoe factory. Our guide was extremely friendly and the workers we interacted with before the tour were very amiable.The reason for the low review is because of what happened at the end of the tour. Long story short, after being separated from our group because of a red light, a few of us realized we had been left behind and were lost. After getting in contact with the main group via phone, and unsuccessfully being found by the guide, we were told we should find our own way back to the starting point of the tour. With the help of my map and some directions from friendly locals, we made our way back to the tour beginning, only about 20 minutes after the expected time of arrival. While we had been lost in downtown Amsterdam, all in all the few of us stragglers were not any worse of the wear and were still in fine spirits.Upon arrival back to Mike’s Bike Tours, however, one of the workers greeted us extremely gruffly. The worker then proceeded to berate us on how we failed to follow the protocol for if you get lost (which was wait until a guide finds you) and informed us how upset we had made the tour guide by getting lost. It is unclear why he felt the need to speak to us in this manner as we were the paying, foreign customers who had been lost. Moreover, the tour was over—why would we need to be reminded of the rules if we were never going to do the tour again?This was extremely disappointing because we had been in fine spirits until this point despite being left behind by the guide. The way the worker treated us really left a bad taste in our mouths, and soured what had been a great tour. The tour itself was great and I would have recommended it highly if it were not for being treated so poorly. My advice is that if you do this tour, make sure you bring a cell phone and a map because in the chance you get lost, and the guide is unable to find you, you will have to find your own way back to the bike shop. Oh, and be prepared to be “taught a lesson” by the workers when you return!

Waaaay more fun than a tram. I opted to rent a bicycle from Mike's Bikes and am so happy I did! Amsterdam has dedicated bike lanes and I covered so much territory on the bike that I probably never would have done on foot.The folks at the bike shop are easy going. I rented the bike online and picked it up the next day. They do ask for some sort of security deposit for the bike. I didn't feel comfortable leaving my passport, so instead let them take an imprint of my credit card. They returned the credit card slip to me when I returned the bike. I received good instruction as to how to lock the bike (they provide two separate locking systems). They also provided a really easy to read street map of Amsterdam, which I used during my entire stay in Amsterdam. (I liked their map much more than the one I bought at the airport for 2.50 euro.)As it turned out, I kept the bike overnight and returned it after approximately 26 hours. The people in the office didn't even charge me for the extra few hours, which I would have been happy to pay for.I highly recommend this bike rental company.

Our favourite day of the holiday. Highly recommended. We booked the counrtyside tour before we left for Amsterdam and it was absolutely brilliant. There were a lot of people doing the same tour as us that day and we were split into three seperate groups each with their own tour guide. Each group contained less than 20 people. From the sounds of things they don't normally have as many people in one day. The tour was only 23 Euros each and worth every penny. We began with a short introduction from Pete who was very funny and clearly enjoyed his job. We were in the last group with Stuart. After getting our bikes we headed towards the Amstel River. Stuart explained fully what route we would be taking and what we should expect. Some basic road rules were also given which was very helpful in some cases. Throughout the whole tour Stuart explained about the area and some excellent facts. The ride was an easy ride and we were lucky to have fantastic weather. The farmer at the factory is extremely knowlegeable and a delight to listen to. The bikes come with storage so you can carry your water and camera etc. The tour starts at 11 and returns between 2-3 depending on what speed the group goes at so you may want to take some lunch. There are a couple of tables outside the farm where you can enjoy your sandwich before continuing. They have the tandem style bikes so that you can take a child on the tour and on our tour Stuart the guide was using a bike with a cart on the front with two small children in it while their parents cycled with the group. Stuart was great with the kids and keeped them entertained. We enjoyed it so much that we hired bikes the following day and cycled through Vondelpark, the forest and back along the route we took the previous day, however, the weather that day was not so great and cycling in the heavy rain was tough. Please don't let the weather put you off though. Rather than sit in your hotel room staring out the window grab a bike from Mike and get out there - we laughed more in the rain!

Best Vacation Day!. We went on the countryside bike tour and it was incredible! We started by riding from the shop out to the countrside besides a river to a 17th century wind mill. Mike's guides are fantastic and provide great historical info and make the bike tour a blast. After stopping at a cheese and shoe factory, we then circled back into a town through one of Amsterdam's wonderful parks. Go on this tour and you'll love it!!
A definite must in Amsterdam. Loved the beautiful parks, weather was perfect, and the cheese farm and clog maker visit was very interesting. Mike is a great tour guide, full of energy and very funny!

A must do. We were in Amsterdam in July so the warm weather helped a lot. Besides taking a bike tour with Thomas, which was a great entertainment, we have rented bikes for our stay and this I must recommend to everyone going to Amsterdam

One if the highlights of my trip. Went on countryside tour and was totally brilliantYour guide whose name escapes me was just fantastic (guy from Chorley) lots of interesting facts and info that you wouldn't find in guide books. Quality comfortable bikes and an absolute pleasure. Cheese visit although a bit touristy was interesting - would def do a your with this company on future trips

Amazing bike tour!!. I did the 4 hour bike tour through Amsterdam with Mike! She was amazing - and so full of energy!
I loved the tour because we were able to leave the chaos of the city and see the real Amsterdam! Beautiful parks and amazing cheese at the cheese farm!
