The best way to experience Amsterdam. I researched the best way to experience Amsterdam and decided on Mike's Bike Tours. it was very informative and a fun way to see the city. We took the Countryside tour. it was 21 miles but well worth it. We visited a windmill and a cheese and wood shoe shop. The guides were very easy going and caring. If you have never bike this long make sure you do it during the fall or spring. In the summer is very hot.

A must do adventure!. My sister and I did the 2 hour mini city tour in a group of 9. Tomas was our guide and he was very informative and obviously passionate about history. The locals take cycling very seriously and the tour at times was heart stopping but we all survived! We took this tour only hours after landing and it was great to do as we saw lots of the places we were planning on visiting over the weekend. Girl Mike and Ashley were very funny and welcoming. Not sure if the older people with us enjoyed it as much as we did though.

The countryside is absolutely stunning. My girlfriend and I spent a few days in Amsterdam and decided to take on a bike tour, as Amsterdam is after all a biking city. We chose Mike Bike Tours, as we'd be able to see more than just the city and go into the Dutch countryside. The tour was fantastic! Our guide was great and we even got to visit a cheese and clog farm, where we could see how they were both made and have a bit of a nibble. The Dutch countryside is beautiful and I would push every visitor to make the time to see it through Mike's Bike Tours.
Country side ride. Best thing we did in Amsterdam and Pete the guide was very funny and informative. Family all liked it very much. A definite yes to anyone thinking of getting bikes. Jon

A quieter bike tour to get out of the red light district. Mike was awesome... very knowledgeable, interesting and funny! Been on a Mike's tour before and this had less stops in comparison but was a nice way to refresh on a busy city to city holiday.

Best way to see Amsterdam. Staff and tour guides absolutely brilliant, great to cycle around instead of plodding around. Tour guide "Mike" was excellent, learned miles more than from a guidebook with humour thrown in. Plenty of photo ops and chance to sample traditional pub beer with a boiled egg for measure. Met great people. Loved it so much we have booked the countryside bike tour for tmrw. Can't wait to see windmills, cow tip and go to the cheese farm! Bikes even have their own names, we can fully recommend Vlad the Impaler and Smurfette. It's ace.

Fantastic. We (myself and my boyfriend) booked to go on Mike's bike tour on 1st August, it was a great way to see the city. Our guide 'female Mike' was fantastic and very funny. She explained the tour and directions well and was a wealth of information. Amsterdam if you haven't been is really busy especially with bikes so this is not an easy job with a large group of tourists. The bikes were really comfortable and now thinking about changing my mountain bike for one like Mike's Bikes. Thank you for a great day, a definite for anyone visiting the city.

Awesome country bike tour. We did the Country Bike Tour on Monday 5th August and our quirky (girl) guide "Mike" was fantastic - funny, knowledgable and thoroughly entertaining. She patiently and happily answered the constant barrage of questions from our 9 year old daughter, and paid careful attention to ensuring no one got left behind. She gave us a tour of some of the remarkable country surrounding Amsterdam, including a cheese factory and windmill. It was a great way to spend 4 1/2 hours but it is important to note that our guide Mike definitely made this tour exceptional, memorable and thoroughly entertaining! A definite must for a first trip to Amsterdam!!

Brilliant Bike Tour. We did the tour on Saturday 3 August which was the Gay Parade to the city was packed to capacity. Our guide Stewart was brilliant very articulate and knowledgeable about the city of Amsterdam. He was friendly and so charming and showed us all the best sites and loads of information on the way. The whole group was really nice and friendly and we had a laugh. We stopped at a small brewery and had a beer which was lovely. I have done other bike tours in London and Berlin which were brilliant and this one certainly is one of the best. The only slight criticism would be the day was really too busy in the centre but that was no reflection on Stewart.

Superb experience!. Cannot recommend these guys enough. The tour we took was the 4 hour countryside tour and it was an excellent insight into the outskirts of Amsterdam.Our tour guide was really interesting and made the trip in all honesty. I had the dubious pleasure of bringing up the rear of the procession and made sure that our party of 12 didn't get lost!If you have enough time, I recommend taking the countryside trip and them maybe re-visiting the park/forest areas either on bike or on foot another time.€23 was a fair price to pay!

Couldn't ask for a better bike tour!!. I had an absolutely amazing time on the countryside bike tour thanks to Mike's!! Our English tour guide was hilarious but very informative. He made the tour non-stop fun!! The ride was easy and the views were great! This offers a very different view of Amsterdam than what you will see near Amsterdam Central Amsterdam has a beautiful countryside that doesn't get the credit it deserves. The Dutch cheese farm was also really interesting. I enjoyed learning about how cheese is made and enjoyed the cheese tasting even more. I also got the chance to see an infamous wooden clog carved! I would highly recommend this tour, especially this tour company, to any Amsterdam traveler. When I got back to CA, I was wearing my Mike's T-shirt in the store and when I checked out the sales associate said, "Hey! Mike's Bike Tours!!" You just can't go wrong with Mike's.

Fun bike rental!. We just rented bikes here, didn't do a tour. The staff are great! Super friendly and knowledgeable. The rental process was quick and maps were free. Bikes were easy to handle, not brand new, but mostly in working order.

Great Tour Great Time. Hi Pete......thanks for the wonderful bike tour with you (it was the noon tour on Tuesday July 16, 2013)...we did enjoy the time with you, we are greatful to you for your profound background about Amsterdam's history you shared with the group.....it was always lively.....Pete, we'll be back to do the harbour tour with you....Again, thanks for the great time we had with you as our tour guide...and keep up the thrilling way of taking the folks with you......Cheers, Manfred

Great way to see the city. Only had a 8 hours in the city as I was on a long layover at AMS. Decided to do the City bike tour and it was great way to see city. Would recommend to anyone, assuming you can ride a bike :)

make sure you try it. mike bike tour and bikes rent al is the state of art of Amsterdam essence: fun, competente, diversità, respect and EASY !great fun and informative Tours.if you go Amsterdam go bike, if you go bike you go Mike.

Highlight of the trip. If you do one thing in Amsterdam make sure it's this! We took the city tour and it was brilliant. I was a bit anxious, not having been on a bike for many years but the ride was easy and the tour guide, Mike was great. If you want to get to know your way round the city this is the way to do it- it really gives you a sense of the layout.Mike was funny and enthusiastic despite it being over 30 degrees and sweltering in the city! Just wish we had done it on the first day rather than the last so that we would have had time to do the country side tour as well! next time!

Great Tour With a Great Guide. A few years ago I had a great experience with Mikes Bike Tours in Munich so when I found out they had a tour in Amsterdam, I jumped on the opportunity. The entire staff in the office was extremely welcoming and our tour guide, Kate, was funny, friendly, and informative. She was a pleasure to be around! She gave us historical information with a few of her own anecdotes that made the tour quite enjoyable. She advised us on different must see attractions as well as recommending some great places to eat. After the tour, we rented bikes for the rest of our time in Amsterdam and it was totally worth it. Everything seems so close when you have a bike. Once again Mikes Bike Tours doesnt dissappoint. Definitely go for a tour with them and rent a bike!

An easy ride with great people. I took the country bike tour with Mike's Bike Tours and it was fantastic. Karl was our guide and always wanted to have a chat and a laugh. If you were up the front he would talk your ear off and gave the best information about the area. The weather was perfect which helped but you knew the staff all really cared about their jobs. The bikes were top notch too, I definitely recommend going with Mike's!!!

What a great tour. We did the countryside tour with Mike's Bike Tours. We had a very informative pre tour talk from Stuart, then the group was divided into two as there were 38 of us. Our bikes were 'easy rider' style bikes, some had panniers, most had a front zipped bag for water/camera etc. The ride out of the city was scary enough if you are not a cyclist. Our guide Mika led us safely out of the city to the start of the countryside trail. The windmill is lovely and not a long cycle. We continued on to the cheese farm. Unfortunately the farm owners have not made any provision for the cycle tours arriving at their farm. The cheese on offer is delicious but you have to bring your own bread/crackers drinks etc as there is nothing else to buy there only cheese and souvenirs. There was only one bench seat for 38 people, we were lucky there were no bus tours in. From there we cycled back towards the city via a forest, through Vondel Park to Mike Bike's office. It was 24 kilometer and took 4 hours with stops, it was an easy cycle, all flat, there were all ages in our group and all levels of fitness.

Cool Bike Company. We went with Mike's Bike Tours for both the mini-city tour and the countryside tour and really enjoyed both. We found their prices fair, and the guides were awesome guys! We had a really fun time and I'd recommend going with them if you are interested in seeing more of Amsterdam by bike and learning more about its history.

Fun way to explore the area. Went on the country tour and loved it! Ashley our guide was so much fun and informative. The countryside was gorgeous and enjoyed the picnic at the cheese farm. Be sure to take your lunch. The ride was easy and relaxing. Loved seeing the rowing area from the 1928 Olympics. Stop for yummy ice cream on the way back. Staff was great at the bike shop as we rented bikes the next day to just explore on our own. A great value too.

Great way to experience Amsterdam. My wife and I did the city tour with Mike (girl Mike) and it was great!! It was a little intimidating cycling in Amsterdam at first, but it only takes a few roads to really figure out what you have to do (BE CONFIDANT!) really enjoyed seeing the city this way, and it gave us great ideas for the rest of our stay

great way to explore amsterdam. we have opted for country side tour of amsterdam. guide mike was knowledgeable about amsterdam and dutch history. quality of bike was good and provided bike according to personal preference. bike ride was real fun and explored traditional windmill, cheese factory.

Fun tour, some good sites.. The tour guide was great and funny. . The cheese/wooden shoe farm and windmill were definitely interesting but we felt like we still didn't get to see all that much on the country tour. It was an easy ride but there were way too many people on our tour and we had to keep stopping as people got stuck at traffic lights and such so it was boring and seemed to drag on at points. Would have enjoyed a bit smaller groups so as to move more easily and quickly through the city. A fun, easy tour if you are looking for something to do there.

Interesting. The company is staffed by hold overs from the 1960 hippie seen. Dreadlocks, tattoos is the trend with the staff. We arrived early and the staff we spoke with were disinterested saying the guide would be with us soon. They then all got in a group to share jokes and a smoke.Fortunately Stuart was our guide who was a more conventual Ex Brit. Very knowledgeable very informative and a excellent city guide. 10/10 for his services. Bikes are big cruiser type bikes and a bit heavy but good conditition. Not my sort of bike but a good compromise I think for all types 10/10We come across this company several times and from reading other comments I can see why people could be non plused. The hippie types are loud, boisterous and one was doing his damdest to win a date with some pretty German girls in his group.I think we were lucky that we got Stuart . The tour was good but the other staff were not my idea of professional guides and I am sure the outcome would have been worse if we were with them.

The best way to see Amsterdam!. We absolutely loved the city and the countryside tours. We did the city on Sunday and the countryside on Monday. The biking was not physically demanding, they kept us safe from the chaos on some of the streets and showed us the classic sites. It is a great way to see amsterdam. We also appreciated the tour guides, they integrated very interesting history with a touch of humor. They were very friendly and laid back and did a great job. I would recommend this as a must do while in amsterdam.

Great tour for the whole family. Our whole family including 2 children ages 8 and 10 did this on the last day of our vacation and it was great. I actually wish we had done it earlier in the trip. We did the country tour because I was afraid of riding in the city with children. It was a little challenging to ride our bikes out of the city because there are cars and bikers everywhere which can be scary with children. Once we got out of the city the tour was very enjoyable and our guide was very informative. We stopped for lunch at a cheese and clog farm and the kids enjoyed seeing how both were made. Our guide was very accommodating and we took a short cut back when the kids were getting tired. I would definitely recommend.

Plenty of exercise but little else. My husband was really excited to ride a bicycle around Amsterdam. I was more interested in the history, architecture, people and culture of the city. Well, we got plenty of exercise but little else from Mike’s Bicycle Shop.Our guide, Jeff, was full of information on the Red Light District, coffee shops that sell pot and the history of drug use in Amsterdam. If you’re visiting Amsterdam to get your party on, he’s the guide for you. If you’re there to learn something about history, architecture and the people who were instrumental in the development of this lovely city, ask for another guide or choose a different tour.I will admit the bikes were fine; they were comfortable and all riders were fitted and the equipment was in good condition. The route was beautiful with lovely buildings and beautiful parks. All the things that you expect to see in Amsterdam. Although I took lots of pictures of wonderful streets and buildings and canals, there was very little information shared to make those pictures truly memorable.

Not a fun time. Based on the great reviews, we were expecting a great bike tour, but that wasn't the case. First of all, biking in Amsterdam is not for the faint of heart -- bikers are very aggressive, and you need to be very vigilant. Our group of 23 was really too large to safely navigate the streets of Amsterdam, and our guide, Jeff, didn't seem to care whether the group stayed together, crossed the streets safely, or basically stayed alive. In fact, he lost two of our group in the Red Light District, when the bike chain fell off one of their bikes, and he didn't even notice they were gone until someone brought it to his attention. By then, we were 15 minutes down the road, and he needed to go back and find them. Also, he didn't share much about the history of the city, instead, focusing on the do's and don'ts of buying marijuana and mushrooms, as well as the going rate for prostitutes. I would not recommend this tour for anyone but those who don't want to learn much about the city and who are comfortable being left to fend for themselves.

Excellent!. We were 4 adults on the Countryside Tour. Right from the moment of booking the staff were friendly, helpful and always ready for a laugh. We had Pete as our guide and he was really great, even taking the time to chat with us after arriving back at the garage. It was a fun but informative tour and the stop at the cheese/clog farm was a good place for lunch (take something along as food isn't provided). It felt a little like going on a school trip but not in a bad way! Group size was perfect (we had 18 in ours) and the tour itself was just the right difficulty. Having not ridden a bike in around 15 years I found it easy enough. The bikes themselves are comfy and easy to control and the safety talk at the start made us all feel ready to handle the city roads at the beginning of the ride. Doing the tour gives you a discount on all future rentals and tours with the company - forever!

Lots of fun in the sun. This is great, an absolute must when in Amsterdam. We did the city tour which was 4 hours of easy biking and chatting. You get a great overview of the city and an understanding of how things are laid out. Guide was friendly and informative and gave good tips of restaurants, bars and such when we stopped for a beer.

Great Bike Tour. My wife was a bit concerned about the traffic, but they did a great job of keeping the group together. Pete was our tour guide and he was really great. in 3 hrs we saw the entire city and many neighborhoods and tourist spots. We both really liked it and thank Pete for a great tour. The stop at the bar near the end for Jenever, beer, and apple pie, was great too.

Best bike rent and tour in AMSTERDAM!!. Once you are in Amsterdam, make sure you visit this place!!If you are a student and planning to join a tour (any), they may give you more discounts and the rent and tour fee!! RECOMMENDED!!My friend and I joined the countryside tour and our guide, Pete, gave us lots of knowledge about Dutch history, the canal expansion, monarchy, Dutch Renaissance Era and lots of it!! Our tour stops were basically:1. The Skinny Bridge in Amsterdam (forgot the name)2. One of the oldest windmills in the countryside3. Cheese and Clog Farm (get to try the cheese in the farm and purchase some souvenirs too)4. Cycling around the countryside (get to see horses, sheep, goats and lots of luxurious houses too)5. Vondelpark6. Expensive shopping streetsOur guide, Pete, was super knowledgeable about his local history and you will definitely be interested in his explanations. The matter of fact is that he is quite friendly and enthusiastic too!Nevertheless, you may want to prepare some food since it is going to energy-consuming the hilly roads and so on. If you want to grab some food, there is a bread shop sells good food (especially their meatball sandwich!!) called 'STACH' for the trip.Pretty much enjoyed the trip and it is recommended to all!!

Great fun. Good way to see the city accompanied by knowledgeable, humorous, easy going tour guides. Cycling in Amsterdam is not an experience for the faint hearted, but if you put aside your fear of falling in a canal or colliding with a tram, this tour is well worth it. We booked with 2 children aged 13 and 16 and they enjoyed it too. We booked the countryside 4 hour tour which allows sightseeing in city and countryside with a visit to cheese factory and clog making. Recommended!
Fun and interesting. Brought my 7 & 9 yr old kids and had a great time. Best way to see a city is by bike. Pete did a great job and was informative and entertaining.

Such a great tour.. We had Kate as our tour guide(I'm pretty sure that's her name) she was fantastic! Spoke quite fast for some but she was so lovely! She took us through the city tour and it was great. Couldn't fault it!

Definitely include a Mike's bike tour - ask for Karl with a K!. 8 of us - New Jersey girls - had a few extra hours and decided to take bike tour around Amsterdam. It was a fun, relaxing and fast way to see the city. A bike tour in Amsterdam allows you to somewhat blend with the locals as they all ride bikes more than cars every where too.Karl with a K is one of Mike's bike tour guides. He is very entertaining and has many side stories about the city that you will not get from a travel book!Highly recommend this bike tour!

Magic roundabout. It was a great tour and it lets you get out of the city and see the country side. we stopped along the way and patted sow cows, tasted some cheese and saw how clogs are made! it was well worth it!

great way to experience Amsterdam. My husband and I did the Countryside Tour. He bikes everyday and I do so only rarely. But we both enjoyed the experience and found it worthwhile. The bikes have very comfortable seats and you can get one with a pouch to keep your purse/raincoat/lunch. The pace is easy enough that you can talk to others while you bike - which is fun to do. I think a better name for the tour is "green spaces of greater Amsterdam. You don't get very far from the city - and while you do see a windmill and working cheese farm, it's all very pat and controlled. You go through some lovely green areas beside canals and come back into the center of the city through a couple of very nice parks. All in all it's a fun day out and a great way to see a bit more than you can on foot.

Great country side tour. Had a great trip with Pete (who sported clogs for the entire trip!), into the country a few weeks ago. Pete was enthusiastic, conscientious about safety, and encouraging about riding in the city explaining the 'rules of the road' so we could navigate with confidence. He was knowledgeable about the windmills, the dykes, the polders, how water is managed and the history of the Netherlands, Amsterdam in particular. We made a circle tour so there was always something new and interesting to observe. The bikes were comfortable with 5 gears (all you need, even with the wind). Mike's Bike Company is responsive to feedback and appears to take a personal interest in the quality of their tours. We would highly recommend their organization as a great way to explore Amsterdam and the neighbouring countryside.

Enjoyable Bike Tour. We reserved the country bike tour with Mike's Bike Tours in May 2013. The bikes were very comfortable to ride and had very good shocks. It was a very rainy day unfortunately so it poured most of the tour. A cloth like ponchos was supplied but they weren't very waterproof and we were pretty soaked. Bring a plastic one with a hood if it is a grey day. We had a very nice and well planned route out into the country. We visited a cheese farm and stopped to have a tour and sample some of the cheese. Also they made wooden shoes there and we were shown how quickly they can make a pair and which wood they used. They had a large gift shop there and we had time to buy cheese and any other souveniers we wanted. We had previously stopped at a local grocery for lunch items and we enjoyed the shelter of the farms barn from the rain to eat our lunch. On our way back to Amsterdam we stopped at a Windmill and our guide told us the history of the Windmill. The tour was cut a bit short because of the rain but it was well organized and I would recommend a bike tour in Amsterdam. One negative point was that our tour guide made reference to weed smoking a number of times as a great pass time after work and seemed to think that everyone had the same interest. In a mixed group of old and young it wasn't very professional.

Fun even in the rain. We thought we picked a relatively decent day to go for a bike ride .... sure enough we were hit with a torrential rain storm during our country tour. Since we are from "Sunny" Vancouver, we are use to the rain and biking in the rain. Our guide made the best of the situation and we trekked through the rain in our red ponchos that they supplied. We cut our ride short as not everyone enjoyed the downpour, but never-the-less it was a nice ride seeing the countryside and parts of Amsterdam that one would never see if not for being on a bike.We would do this ride again .... only this time in hopefully when it is sunny ;)

Great way to experience Amsterdam. Highly recommended. Our guide, Stuart, was very knowledgeable and gave us overview on the history of Amsterdam, plus an insight into Dutch society today. I'm not a big bike rider generally, however, found the tour well within my riding capabilities, even at 3.5 hours duration.

A must while in Amsterdam. My kids recommended mikes as they loved it. My husband and I went on the mini city tour and the country tour. Thoroughly enjoyed both. The mini city tour gave us some good perspective on where to go while in town and the country tour was both educational and enjoyable. Very easy riding. Knowledgable tour guides.

Great time biking around Amsterdam with Karl. We did a city bicycle tour with Karl as our guide on the 10th of June and it was money well spent. Karl was quite knowledgeable and interactive will all of us which made it more interesting and enjoyable. Previous to the bicycle tour we did a city bus tour(red buses, hop on, hop off) and it is an absolute waste of your money, there is no tour guide explaining different areas but instead they give you earphones and you listen to recordings, useless. Alexandra and I thank you for the bicycle tour as it was a lot of fun and I'm still holding you to the BQ at your place on the water. :)Thanks again,WilliamOttawa, Canada

great day with the family.. Signed up via email.Got great directions.Our guide Ashley was awesome and made an effort to include everyone and ensure that my daughters (12/9) were safe and had a great time. Amsterdam culture can be a challenge to describe around younger ears and he did an awesome job. our tour was very nice. Took about 3.5 hours and I'm guessing 10-12 easy flat miles. Lunch (bring your own) was at a farm where they make clogs and awesome gouda cheese.My kids never once complained about the distance or the time. Ours was the country tour.Great priceGreat guidesGood bikesAwesome tour.Book with these guys they are awesome.

What a Blast. I wanted to do a bike tour while in Amsterdam and was told Mikes was the best. How right they were. I spent about 4 hours touring the city and was entertained the whole way by our guide Karl.He was funny and witty and the whole experience was worth the money. We got to see a lot of the touristy stuff but also some off the beaten path stuff that really made it worthwhile. You really need to ride a bike in Amsterdam to really get a sense of what the life is like there. Great day out and highly recommended.

Great tour of the city. I did a 2 hour mini city tour when I arrived in Amsterdam. The tour was perfect. It went all over the city and offered great information along the way. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Best bike tour in Amsterdam!!. I did the countryside tour with Mike yesterday! She was so informative, and hilarious! We had a little 8 year old in our group and she was really accommodating for him! He was a little trooper! We ate cheese! Which was amaze! And generally just had an awesome time cruising around Amsterdam! Highly recommended!!

Fantastic service and tours. Brilliant! The staff are very friendly and relaxed. We had issues with the bikes when locks were cut in an attempt to steal them and a pedal broken, so we took them back and were sorted with new bikes within seconds. Shopped around before hand and these are by far the cheapest and best quality!We did a country tour near the end of our stay in Amsterdam and met Karl. Great chap who is loads of fun. After he showed us some of the best local spots and even headed back to his boat house after. What a experience! Also, as we went on a tour we got refunded half of our rental cost!! Couldnt be better :)

Riot on wheels. Our guide, Ashley, was hilarious, and very informative. Our group was a bit too large, and half of us got lost from the group at one point but that wasn't the tour's fault. We got to see all of the major sites along the tour and enjoyed a colorful telling of the history. At the end we stopped at an Irish Pub and had a nice drink and snack. If you are looking for a good way to get an overview of the city before you go exploring the city in depth this is the way to go.

When in Rome, ... I mean Amsterdam. Amsterdam is a biking town, so this is by far the best way to see it. My girlfriend and I rented bikes for a 4 hour block. (We didn't go on a tour.) While their website advertises that the bikes are inconspicuous, this is a half truth. While they don't have a giant advertisement going across them, my girlfriend's bike was fluorescent orange. Everyone else in town seems to be riding the old school looking black bikes. This is obviously a minor issue. Th bikes themselves were in good condition - essentially cruiser bikes with the ability to change gears. Riding around town is quite safe. Even the streets along the canals aren't very crowded, so you don't have to worry about constantly maneuvering around pedestrians. We were able to ride to Amstel Park in about 30 mins from the office, and it's a nice ride that I would recommend. There's a windmill at the end of the park as a little bonus. The bike staff were friendly and helpful and this was my favorite thing I did while in Amsterdam.

DO IT :). We would definitely recommend this bike tour!! Amsterdam is such an interesting city in that EVERYONE bikes... there are more bikes than cars! So it was cool to become a part of the culture. Our tour guide was super fun and upbeat and kept everyone laughing the whole time! We did the countryside bike tour which was so fun! We went to a cheese/diary farm and sampled some cheeses and saw Dutch shoes being made and it was a really need experience! Very informative and fun! Definitely take advantage of this entertaining way to experience Amsterdam!

So much more than I expected!. I recently took the Countryside tour and LOVED it! Our guide, Stuart, was very informative, patient, and fun. If I go back, I will definitely do another tour. Being from Missouri, I really didn't know how I would do on a bike in a city that is so bike-oriented. Even though there were a couple moments where I was overwhelmed by the traffic, it was a piece of cake. The bikes are very easy to ride, and if you're lucky, you'll get one with a clever name. :)

Best bike rental shop in town!. We were steered to Mike's Bike's from our concierge at Marriott Renaissance Hotel, and he did not do us wrong. The price was lower than anywhere else, the bikes were solid, two locks provided, and the staff was friendly. We did not do a tour, we just rented bikes for 2 days and set off on our own using maps and downloaded tours and recommended stops. You can get to the best brewery in town in 10-15 minutes tops on bike, so you can get anywhere. Not much else to say here other than if I am ever renting bikes in a town with Mike's Bike Rentals, I will always choose them first.

Efficient service and good discrete bikes. We were in and out of there in about 5 minutes each time, with 2 good quality bikes, lights, and locks. Good to not have "TOURIST" written everywhere on the bikes. Well located close to Vondelpark so it is the perfect start to a ride in this fantastic park (especially when the sun shines). Staff is friendly and laid back, Amsterdam style. Bikes have Dutch type pedal break but you can ask for a hand break as well, if available. Rental cost EUR 24 for 2 bikes for 24h, including theft insurance. Need to leave an ID or a print of your credit card as guarantee (EUR 250 replacement price -- which frankly is much, much more than they cost -- unless you take the insurance, the bike is stolen and you return the keys to the locks).

Lots of fun!. Friends had told us about Mike's Bike Tours so my daughter (21) and I made sure to do this the first day we arrived in Amsterdam. It was a lot of fun! Our guide, Ashley, was very laid back and informative about the area. Even though there were seven of us on the tour Ashley made sure that none of us got lost or seperated from the group. We enjoyed our tour so much that we also did the Mike's Bike Tour when we got to Munich! I would highly recommend this to anyone at any age. It is a very relaxing way to see Amsterdam and hear some of the history.

Not to be missed.. It was raining the whole time we were there, and by the end of the bike tour we were absolutely soaked through. But no regrets whatsoever - that's how good the tour was. Our tour guide, Karl, was absolutely funny, engaging and knowledgeable. He had us all laughing at every stop, and yet gave us a great tour of the city and it's main attractions (we took the city tour). The whole group enjoyed the tour and had a great experience. And after all, Amsterdam is just about the flattest city ever. Cycling doesn't get any easier than that. In addition, to quote Karl, Amsterdam is "the one city where drivers actually notice cyclists" - EVERYONE there cycles. So what better way to experience the city and it's culture than on a bike?

Best way to see Amsterdam. We did not do the tour, we just rented the bikes to go around Amsterdam. It was the perfect way to go see the city. We spent 12€ to keep the bike for almost two days. The bikes are easy to use and very confortable!

Don't miss the Harbour Tour!. My group of friends visiting Amsterdam together scheduled a custom version of the Harbour Tour, and I have to say it was the highlight of our visit to the Netherlands. Our guide Pete was knowledgeable, friendly, and patient, and he took us on quite an adventure through city streets, across bridges and ferries and canal locks, and out to amazing parts of the city we never would have seen otherwise. If I had to pick a tour highlight, it would be the artists' warehouse at NDSM-Werf, but really the entire thing was fantastic. Everyone loved the tour, and we would recommend it to anyone who is a moderately capable cyclist.

Perfect Way to See the City. Amsterdam has a lot of little roads and it's pretty easy to get turned around. Since I try to take a bike tour every time I travel overseas, this was the perfect way to get to know the streets a bit better. We had Ashley as our guide, and he was knowledgeable and very entertaining. We never felt rushed, and got to see a lot of the city that we otherwise would have missed. At the end of the trip, we stopped off at a pub for a brew as well. I would highly recommend doing this bike tour when you come to Amsterdam.

MIkes Bikes Tour - a Must DO in Amsterdam. We are avid fans of cycling tours in every city that we go too and Mike's Bikes is a perfect way to get acquainted with a city and discover some of the secret parts of it.The tour cost around 20 euros and last for about 4 hours. There was a great little history lesson at the start of the your in the bike shed and then we hit the road. The groups were a good size (about 8-10 riders per guide) and we regularly stopped off to look and explore.The guides were very knowlegable and obviously loved their jobs. They gave plenty of insider knowlege and were happy to answer any and all questions - particularly about the red light district and the coffe shops!The whole operation is very well organised and we would thoroughly recommend the tour to anyone spending a weekend in Amsterdam - it is the best 20 euros you will spend!

A great way to see Amsterdam. Amsterdam is such a wonderful and complex city and what better way to learn about the many neighborhoods than on a bike. Stuart was our guide and he was entertaining and informative. A really fun afternoon.

Great way to see Amsterdam. We did the country-side tour and it was definitely worth it. Karl & Stewart, our guides, were incredibly knowledgeable, friendly, and entertaining. We rode through the city and into the country, stopping at a windmill and a cheese and clog farm/factory. Overall, it was a very fun experience and a great way to see parts of Amsterdam that we may not have seen otherwise. We ended up renting bikes afterwards at a great price. Highly recommend the tour and bike rental during the remainder of your stay, as bikes truly have the right of way in Amsterdam over cars and pedestrians! Biking is definitely the best way to get around in Amsterdam.

22kms of fun and Amsterdam scenery. We ventured to the countryside tour today and had an absolute blast!!! Our tour guy was entertaining, friendly and provided a great tour of the country side. Suffering from a left over cold so the riding was a bit breath taking at times but the average pace was good. The wind was out and being an aussie whitey i should of thought to put on suncream, bit sunburt afterwards haha. I have a new found respect to the bike riders of amsterdam, after almost hitting some others during the ride lol bit different to mountain bikes! We thought the cheese was great but as others mentioned the shoe guy was a bit of a toss and not a positive of the day. The parks and forest was lovely! You really get to see alot more than just staying in the city! Thanks Mikes Bikes Amsterdam, wont forget this day!

Good time, but average. We are big fans of bike tours and do them in every city that we can. As usual, this is a great way to see the city and was enjoyable. But by comparison with other bike tours we've done in other cities with other companies, it was average. A little too much talking and not as entertaining as others. Would still recommend as I don't have any other bike tours in Amsterdam to compare it to.

Nice trip, too much talking. I took the countryside tour last week. It starts with a little riding in the city and hearing way-too-long explanations about the ground layers and the canals. If you're an engineer you might find it interesting, I thought it was way too long and detailed. The tour then went to a cheese and shoe factory. The cheese lady was nice, the shoe guy was creepy. Forcing jokes and generally embarrassing. The gift shop afterwards felt like a tourist trap. Then, after a negative start, the tour went on to actually riding in the countryside, which was nice. We went through a forest and the Vondel park and it was a lot of fun. Overall it's ok, it would have really been great if the guide would talk less.

A great day out, highly recommended!. We booked onto the countryside tour, which started at 11am from the Mike's Bikes shop. We booked it online before we arrived in Amsterdam, for 23 euros each, and all we had to do was hand over our receipt when we got there. Our tour guide (Pete) was very informative and made sure everyone knew what they were doing and showed us how to adjust our bike seats properly. He was also very entertaining, and made the trip fun but educational at the same time. The tour was around 4 hours long, so take some sun cream (I forgot!) and a raincoat - you can never tell in Amsterdam. Also take plenty of water, but if you forget this, there were bottles of water for sale in the bike shed for 1 euro each. The tour wasn't strenuous at all, the pace was easy to keep up with, and I actually found it quite relaxing!The scenery on the tour was very picturesque, and it felt great to be out in the open. Along the way, we visited a traditional farm where cheese and clogs were made. We were shown how the cheese was made and kept, and how the clogs were made and decorated. This stop was a great place for lunch, and added a cultural element to the tour. You also get the opportunity to taste the cheese and buy some for yourself, as you won't be able to buy the traditionally made version anywhere else! As long as you can ride a bike, this tour is a wonderful way to explore Amsterdam, whether you go as a couple, on your own, or as a family. It is also a great way to meet other people - there was a whole mix of people from different countries and backgrounds on the tour. Highly recommended!

Absolutely the best tour - don't miss out!. I have been to Amsterdam on several occasions but the bike tour was by far my favorite and most informative tour! We did a 3.5 bike ride through the city, providing an excellent overview of her history and culture. Our tour guide was extremely knowledgable, nice and fun. This is not a difficult tour in terms of fitness - you bike for a few minutes and stop to discuss an area...that and Amsterdam's only hills are her canal bridges! Couldn't recommend this tour more and will certainly look to do their tours in other cities!
Excellent tour!. Excellent countryside tour with my wife and our 11 year old son. We were led by Stuart who was brilliant! We had a really enjoyable day with some great bikes. Book it!

Good Fun, wonderful sites, comfy bikes, good day out. We did the country bike tour which included the cheese and clog factory. The tour guide was rather entertaining, maybe not suited to kids but appropriate for young travelers. The sites were lovely and a leisurely ride makes it for a perfect day and way to see the city and country side.

Great way to see Amsterdam. We went on the country tour with Stuart and had a great, informative day despite the cool temperature. We could never have found this route on our own. Bicycle riding in Amsterdam is not for the 'faint of heart' and it was great to have Stuart on the lead. Highly recommended.
An excellent way to see Amsterdam!. Lots of cycling, lots of bikes, lots of history, lots of sights, lots of humour and LOTS OF FUN! (and Mike you were brilliant!)

City/Country bike tour. Cold and windy day, but the trip was well worth it. What a great way to see city and country areas under the guidance of a knowledgeable guide. A little history and explanation of the dikes, along with fascinating views of the scenery along a few of the many, many miles of excellent cycling roads in the Amsterdam area.

A good Amsterdam intro. The tour itself was part of a topdeck trip that was included in our tour so I can't really comment on value. Was a good way to get a feel for the city & to get our bearings. The tour guide himself was a bit of an idiot, didn't really warm up to his attitude - maybe it's the culture of Amsterdam but a 40 year old man bragging about surviving on only Doritos and hot chocolate for 2 weeks didn't really inspire me to want to explore the city further. Could have perhaps taken a different angle and not bragged for the full 2 hours about being a drug addict

En helt suverän upplevelse och ett härligt sett att uppleva Amsterdam.. We were nine women who had the amazing pleasure of being guided through Amsterdam on bikes. Our guide Mike was faboulus and shared so much of her Amsterdam knowledge. The bikes were great too ride on Thank you.

Best tour experience. The best way to know amsterdam is riding a bike, it is practical, fast and economic. The guide treated everybody well and told us many interesting facts about the city, its history and his citizens perspectives. Better than on a bus and more fun than just walking.

A glimpse of living like a local. This is a great way to get your bearings in Amsterdam. I was on my own but Mike quickly made me feel comfortable in the group. We were 8 people which was a nice size. She gave us a brief overview of the history of Amsterdam, picked out the correct size for our bikes and briefed us on how to safely navigate the streets on a bike. The bikes are Electras and they are very comfortable to ride - excellent quality. Coming from North America I was nervous about the lack of helmets but I saw very few helmets on the locals so I wasn't surprised that they weren't offered.In no time we were off on our tour. Mike stopped frequently to tell us about what we were seeing and she always had a good story to make it interesting. We stopped at a cafe for a drink but it was near the end of the tour. I think it would be better to try to find somewhere to stop in the middle of the tour.All in all I would highly recommend taking this tour. I did the canal tour almost right after I finished the bike tour and there is no comparison. If you have to choose- do the bike tour.

Forget the canals, this is the best way to see Amsterdam. Great few hours riding around Amsterdam. Excellent way to get your bearings and figure out what you want to see and how to get to it easily (not that public transport is hard to figure out though).Our guide was entertaining and knowledgeable. Something that is usually hard to achieve.One thing to be weary of is this is not a great tour if you are not confident on a push bike!! Fitness not a problem as it is mostly flat but the other cyclists, motorists and even pedestrians are more aggressive than you will be as a tourist. But once you get into the groove of things things move pretty fluently.Thanks for the great experience guys.

Good, but too much waiting around. Had a fantastic tour guide who was hilarious and informative (with the fuzzy hat), and really enjoyed the tour itself - beautiful countryside, gorgeous cheese and an easy cycle. However, there was too much waiting around - 20 minutes at the bakery for people to pick up sandwiches (when the site tells people to bring food!), 20 minutes waiting for the farm tour, and 20 minutes waiting for people to finish up in the farm shop. This hanging around reduced my rating, which was a pity, because the tour itself is great - cut out these, and it would be perfect.

Fantastic way to discover Amsterdam city. We were a group and visited Amsterdam for a day as we were attending a Salsa congress in Nordwijkerhoot. We therefore wanted to take advantage of this single day and see as much as we want to see. We choosed therefore Mike's bike tour which lasts around 3.5 hours. This tours starts every day at 12.00. It cost 20 euros per person. You need not to prebook and we dropped in. There were a very big group on this day and at the start a indrouction to Amsterdam city was given (history) The guide was hillarious and informative. Then the group were divided into 3 different managble gruoups. The bicycle we were given were very easy to cycle and had 7 gears, enough to cycle in the city of Amsterdam. The guide led us through all the parts of Amsterdam and were very informative. The guide was relaxed and did not stress the group to hurry and i am sure every one felt comfortable being in this group. It was a very good and informative way to look around Amsterdam and I would strongly reccommend Mike bike tour to see the Amsterdam city. Enjoy!

Highlight of our Europe trip. Did the clog and cheese farm bike tour and it was such a good day out. Our guide (can't remember his name but he had dreadlocks and wore awesome nike clogs!) was so funny and really made the day amazing. A must if you are in Amsterdam and want to do something a bit different

Great experience!. I definitely recomend the city tour! It was great for a first city overview. Our guide provide us with nice information in a very funny and relaxing way. A great experience in Amsterdan.

Amazing Country Tour of Amsterdam. I was in the Netherlands doing a nine week internship and on my last weekend in the country my fellow interns and myself decided to go to Amsterdam. We signed up for Mike's Bike country tour that went a little ways outside the city to a quaint little farm where we got to see how cheese and wooden shoes were made. The farm was fun but what stood out the most about this bike tour was the fantastic tour guide. Our tour guide was Carl and I HIGHLY recommend him as a guide. He was friendly, outgoing and hilarious. He had our group laughing the whole time and was always making jokes. On the way to the farm he stopped off at a great local restaurant called FEBOs where we grabbed some milkshakes and fries. He knew everyone at the restaurant and was even able to talk them into letting me mix milkshake flavors, banana and chocolate was a great combination! After the farm tour Carl took us the back way to see even more lovely Netherlands country side. When we arrived back I felt I had a must better idea and feel of Amsterdam. I highly recommend Mike's Bike Tour and request Carl he is a fantastic bike guide who will keep a smile on your face the whole day :)

Fun day on a bike!. We did the city tour and enjoyed it. It's a nice way to get a general overview of the city and get a sense of where things are. It's definitely not for the faint of heart though!! You are constantly looking out for bikes, cars, trams, pedestrians, and at the same time take in the sights. Our guide was fun and informative, but I would have liked less of the coffee house information and more historical and general info. Towards the end of the tour we stopped in a bar and had a drink and conversation. The bikes were comfortable and easy to use. We took a tram from Central Station to within a few blocks of the bike shop. Overall, we had a great time. I would recommend it with the idea that you're having fun seeing the city and learning about the city in a very general sense. It's not like a walking tour that gives you tons of info, but you could never cover the amount of territory that we did on the bike. It helped us to know where we wanted to go the next day.

Be aware. I booked a tour via this company's website and payed the amount for the tour in full by PayPal.On arrival for the tour, I was told that they have not received any PayPal payment and I will have to pay the full amount in cash. After handing over the cash I was informed that I cannot be given a cash receipt. On my return home I double checked my PayPal account and saw that the transaction for Mike's Bike tours were completed 5 days before the tour date. I find it very irritating and time consuming to have to request a refund.The tour guide was very good.I was in Amsterdam on a very busy day, so did not enjoy the tour - not the fault of Mike's bikes. The city was so busy that one had to concentrate very hard on the cycling safely and therefor missed a lot. A country tour might be a much better option. I also did a self guided tour through the bulb fields, starting from Keukenhof - bikes to rent outside the main gate. That was excellent and I would love to do that again..

Riding and Learning Amsterdam. We managed to go on our tour during a period of three consecutive sunny days in April. Stuart was grand! After an extensive and interesting in-shop amsterdam (geographic, historical, and social) history lesson, our group of 9 pedalled off. Stuart's quick safety tips (which wouldn't pass the US's standards) were in keeping with Amsterdam's laid back attitude. During the multiple stops throughout the city, Stuart filled us in on a variety of local facts, thoughts on regional attitudes, and helpful visitor information. The tour was low key, but comprehensive. It's obvious that Stuart enjoys sharing what he loves about Amsterdam, as well as, being knowledgable about regional politics, social considerations, and quirky trivia. Towards the later end of the tour, we stopped at a pub to sit and whet our whistle and we continued to toss out questions, that he happily answered. Thanks, Stuart for a wonderful time. As an aside, our group rode a mix of bike styles and colors, so we didn't draw an extreme amount of attention to our tourist situation. It was a blast!

Bike Tour Amsterdam April 2013. Took a chance and booked a Mike's Bikes city tour on line before arriving, no need to worry its just great, Three of us turned up so we had a personal tour led by Ashley who was knowledgeable and great fun to be with. Bikes v good quality, tour was easy pace, anyone who can rid a bike could manage it. Great way to see the city, orientate yourself and find out things you want to look at further. Trip was so good our 15yr old son insisted we went back the next day and did the countryside tour, which was led by Stuart. This was a little longer but still easy riding and involved a short visit to a small cheese farm - thought this may be a bit 'touristy' but it was a working small dairy farm, and it was well worth going for the cheese alone. Stuart was a brilliant guide and we learned loads of interesting stuff about the buildings and infrastructure of Amsterdam. Great fun, good value - essential Amsterdam experience.

Good but could have been so much better. Based on previous reviews I booked the country tour. First, if you do not feel comfortable on a bike, definitely go with the country tour. Much more enjoyable and relaxing. Riding a bike in Amsterdam can be a bit overwhelming, especially if you want to be able to enjoy the sights.Our tour was led by Kyle and he definitely was entertaining but if you are looking for information and facts about the city, that definitely didn't happen on this tour. At least he was honest and said up front he wasn't going to make things up. Having said that, it was nice to get out of the city and ride along a dike. We passed some interesting sights & buildings, and it would have been great to actually stop and take pictures but that really wasn't an option. The guide seemed to be more interested in getting us back to the city, so he could enjoy the nice weather. I think our tour lasted less than 3 hours, even when you take in to consideration the review time at the beginning, getting the bikes out, etc. I would have to agree with another reviewer, that any larger of a group would not be fun, since even with only 8 of us, it still took 2 lights to cross most major intersections. Would I use this tour company again? Probably not. Unfortunately, the other one did not open til early May.

Fun 2 hours on city tour with guide!. Our guide, Carl, had us laughing from the time he gave us our bikes! We were traveling with our kids who are young adults (17 and 20) and had a fabulous time...one of the funnest activities we did as a family while in Amsterdam! We enjoyed a good balance of history, blunt facts about prostitution and humor. I would not consider the humor appropriate for young children, at least not on the city tour. Perhaps the country tour is more tailored towards younger kids. Riding bikes in Amsterdam takes confidence. Being on the Mike's Bike Tour gave us the confidence we needed to avoid crashing into pedestrians, other bikes or cars. Ballasters along the road....well that's another obstacle that confidence doesn't quite help with :-) ...sometimes, they seems to jump right out of nowhere!We had a great time!!

Great tour, great guides, great experience. Before taking this tour I was afraid that the group would be so big that we wouldn't be able to hear what the guide had to say. In contrary, when I took the tour today the big group was split into 2 smaller groups. There were still quite a lot of people in the smaller group (10-13), but the guide (a woman and a man, each of whom was responsible for one small group) only talked at the stop point, and he was very knowledgeable about the city's architecture and its history. I have nothing to complain about the tour.

A super way to see Amsterdam. Cyclists rule Amsterdam so it is a good idea to join them. We were shown the sights of the city by Mike. I do feel you need to be confident on a bike to do this but it is great fun and a super way to see the city.

I wish I could say I liked it more. We chose this tour based on all the good reviews here, also based on the fact not much else was open this early in the season. I think I would've enjoyed the tour more if it had been split into smaller groups. We just had the lady "Mike" and 15 of us. This made the tour take forever because every time we had to cross an intersection (there are A LOT of intersections)- it would take at least 2 light cycles to get us all through before we could continue. So a lot of stopping, and since I was at the back, if she was talking I certainly couldn't hear her 14 people back. She had a great personality, was entertaining, and gave us some fun facts, but she didn't really help me get my bearings for where we were in Amsterdam as we weaved around town- though I'm sure it's not easy to do in this city anyway. Didn't get a whole lot of history from this tour besides the introduction we had in the bike shop. Still a fun way to pass the morning, just would be better if they split up the groups or limit the amount of people they'll accept in a morning.

Great way to see the city!. My sister a friend and myself took this tour with Karl. We were only in Amsterdam two full days so based on recommendations from friends and tripadvisor reviews decided this would be a great way to see the city while seeing as much as possible in 3 hours and saving our feet since we'd come from London and would go on to Paris. I can't recommend this tour highly enough! Karl is a hippy :-) so cute! If you're offended by pot and or sex I'm not really sure what you're doing in Amsterdam. The tour lasted about 2 1/2 hours and consisted of a group of about 8. Karl was incredibly informative and funny. I hadn't ridden a bike in years. Although it seemed a bit intimidating as the Dutch ride their bikes quite confidently we were able to catch up on the rhythm of the traffic quite quickly. Streets are narrow and there is quite a bit of traffic but getting a feel for the streets added to the entire Amsterdam experience. Would do again in a heartbeat!

best tour!. I have visited quite a few city's in my short 25 years....this was the best tour of one I have had. Our bike tour guide, Ashley, was extremely knowledgable on the whole history of Amsterdam , local life, obviously being a local. He was fantastic! Such a great character, really painted a picture in your mind when describing the history, past or current affairs, art, music....just do the tour...and the best thing it was cheap! We the rented our own bikes for the weekend because we felt so comfortable getting around, it the best and fastest way to see the city.

Great!!. Fantastic tour into the countryside, visiting a Dutch cheese farm and clog makers! Really interesting and funny South African tour guide! For €20 I would really reccomend it!!Make sure you wrap up warm though!!

Soooooooooooo cold, but fun!. We had a brilliant tour with Karl "with a K" this weekend, he kept us entertained and informed at the same time. Bikes were easy to ride and in good order, the brief before we left was thorough and amusing.The outing it's self is slightly daunting at first but you quickly get used to the traffic and how things work. A cold snap during our visit in mid march meant -1*c plus windchill, dress warm with hat gloves etc or SUFFER.Karls personality meant our group of 8 quickly bonded and we all chatted during various stops. One of my favorite stops was the windmill/brewery, some extremely tasty beer in there!!!Karl being himself (biggest hippy in the world) meant many references to pot smoking and other drug use, but this is Amsterdam and he's such a hippy that I expected nothing less but if you're easily offended or frown upon drug use, prostitutes etc it's not for you. That said, it wouldn't be ideal for children unless the tour is varied / toned down to accommodate children.Overall well worth 20 Euros (17 for my partner as she's a student) and it was the best part of our trip.

One of the highlights of our stay in Amsterdam. Superbly quirky, informative and entertaining cycle tour of Amsterdam.Very friendly welcome. Good, modern and well-maintained bikes which our guide "Karl with a K" ensured fitted each of us properly, and after a short but reassuring briefing on how to stay safe in the city traffic and what to do in the event of a breakdown or getting lost, we were off. Saw places we wouldn't have seen and things I doubt we would have heard on some more mainstream city tours, with two timely and welcome refreshment stops.Despite the freezing February weather, nine turned up for the tour and under Karl's idiosyncratic and funny leadership the group quickly 'gelled' and there was a lot of chatting and joking which helped to make this one of the highlights of our four days in the city - it was certainly the best-value twenty Euros we spent while we were there. If you are offended by the sprinkling of info on prostitutes and marijuana cafes then it might not be your thing (and you probably shouldn't have come to Amsterdam in the first place!), but can only say that we were still talking about our Mike's Bike Tour on the flight home to Stansted. Read the Tripadvisor reviews and just go.

Excellent way to see Amsterdam. Really good tour, great way to see Amsterdam. Karl was very entertaining. Bikes, trams, cars and people were a bit difficult to negotiate at first but soon got the hang of it. Take the tour you wont regret it.

Enjoyable experience!. I thoroughly enjoyed my bike tour. Although it was a bit cold and I find the Amsterdam bike system a little intimidating the friendliness of my guide and the nature of the trip made it worth it. Would definitely recommend for people looking to see some of the city by bike and get some local insights too!

Totally fun!. We did a tour of the city, we went past all of the top attractions in amsterdam! It was a great introduction to the city. Our tour guide was hilarious and offered some great local insights! (Thanks Karl - with a K!)

Best way to see Amsterdam. The bike tour was amazing- such a great way to see the city and our guide was fantastic- he had such great knowledge of the city and was really funny. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Amsterdam as a must!

Brilliant way to see Amsterdam. Had a morning tour in 1 degree weather and it was great! Our tour guide was hilarious and loads of fun. She was informative as we stopped at certain places, but because it was cold, didn't keep us standing around for too long. I would highly recommend anyone going to Amsterdam to take a tour and enjoy this unique way of seeing the city.

wonderful tour. I did a 15-mile bike tour out to the countryside and to a Dutch farm. This was a wonderful tour. The guides were very friendly and knowledgeable and there were a lot of great people along on the tour. It was really nice to get out of the central city and see a Dutch suburb and the countryside. Highly recommend for people physically fit enough to do the tour.

A little too casual for me.. This is a good tour for people who barely want to get out of the city and have a bike tour that won't get your heart rate up at all. Ashley was our guide. He was funny. You spend the first what seems like an eternity watching him give a presentation about Dutch history in the shop. I'd rather just take a bike ride and get historical tidbits on the way. He really didn't tell us what we were passing on the way (except for Vondlepark). The stop at the farm for cheese and to see how the wooden shoes are made is super cheesy. When it was over, I had no idea what our route had been or what neighborhoods we passed through. I'd probably look for a more professional bike tour next time. Or just rent a bike and go my own way with a tour book.

Great fun and highly informative.. Amsterdam is a fantastic city, full of character from every nook and cranny it possesses. Quite honestly, I'd have to say Mike's Bike Tour is the best way to capture what this city has to offer, and in a relatively short time. Not only is it a great experience to ride the bikes through town with the locals, but it's a great way to learn a little history and a lot of helpful information that can be used for the rest of your stay in town. Our guide was Stewart, and he could not have been a better guide. He was incredibly informative and a great communicator. When it came to biking, he made sure our trek was safe and helped make the ride comfortable. When my buddy's tire went flat, he had it fixed within a few minutes. The ride was a nice mix of biking for a bit, then resting a short while as our guide informed us of where we were, where we were headed, and some key points / interesting facts about our surroundings. Mike's Bikes was really great - give it a try.

Great way to see the best bits of Amsterdam. I did the City Tour which took a couple of hours. It's a great way to get acquainted with the city, and get some tips on the best places to see in more detail later on. Riding around on a bike really makes you feel like a local as well. Can't recommend my guide (Mike) highly enough. The bikes are safe and reliable and the route chosen goes to all the important parts of Amsterdam, with very informative and helpful commentary.

So much Fun. This guided tour through the countryside is a must do when in Amsterdam. The bikes are comfortable, the guide is informative and funny. The stop at the cheesemaker/clogmaker was great! I would do this again. Any time. On the pink bike.

Awesome ride through the countryside around Amsterdam! Great commentary by Stuart!. Had a cool stop by a cheese and clog maker and proved quite informative about the history of The Netherlands and the story behind the canal network in Amsterdam.

Countryside Bike Tour. A nice tour through the country, even at this cold and miserable time of year. My partner isnt the stongest cyclist, but she coped fine with the reasonably relaxed pace, the way we avoided roads with heavy traffic, and the lack of hills in the Amsterdam area.The country tour rides for around an hour to get out of the city, then takes you to a cheese and clogs factory, the kind that you have the feeling operates only for bus loads of tourists on their holland visit. The cheese and clog factory was OK, and you get a chance to buy from their shop at the end (of course...). At the shop, the cheese is well priced but you can get the same souvenirs for cheaper in the city.The bike tour was informative and interesting, we enjoyed a lovely day in the countryside.Leaves at 11am and arrives back at around 3pm.

Great way to see Amsterdam. What a great way to see this city! After a brief orientation ( basically a way to make sure you know how to ride), we were taken on a 3 hour tour of the best parts of the city. Our guide Maaike was knowledgeable, entertaining and safety conscious. I will recommend this tour to anyone coming to Amsterdam. The only thing I would caution someone on is that if your intimidated by the traffic then a different tour might be better for you.

Fantastic tour and guides. It's all about the bike in Amsterdam so how could we not give it a go? We found mikes bikes on trip advisor and with all the excellent reviews we were not disappointed. We decided to do the city tour and our guide Ashley was excellent and really funny. I hadn't ridden a bike in over 15 years but apart from a few wobbles it was fine. We covered heaps of ground and saw a lot of great sites. The bikes were comfy and in great condition. We had a fantastic time and would definitely do it again next time we're in Amsterdam. Highly recommended!!

Amsterdam in a day. I had only a day to see as much of this bustling city as possible. This 3 hour cycling trip on cruisers was just the thing. The guide's combination of informality and informative presentation was helpful. The high heeled snakeskin boots in which she cycled were quite entertaining too! Tour suitable for young or old and any level of cyclist.

FANTASTIC, Entertaining way to see Amsterdam. Did the bike tour after it being recommended by a mate. Awesome guide, Ashley - very knowledgeable and entertaining. The bikes are well serviced and the tour takes you to all the best sites in Amsterdam. Definitely worth a go, and also great place to meet other like minded people. Tour starts at midday and is 2.5-3.5 hours. (this was the city tour). WELL WORTH THE MONEY

Great service. Great service and good prices for bike rentals during your stay in Amsterdam. I did not do the tour that they provide but was just very impressed with the great and friendly service I received. Will definitely rent bikes here again on my next visit to Amsterdam.

WORTH THE EXERCISE AND EFFORT!. I found this sight on the internet, and I'm glad that I did. My husband and I joined a group that totaled 14 (from all over the world) on a 12km bike ride and had a great time. Ashley was our guide (and comedian) that led us out to visit a windmill and a farm that makes cheese and wooden clogs (one of only 5 left). The ride was easy (even for my out of shape husband) because it's completely flat, except for the bridges over the canals. The country side is only 30 mins bike ride out of the city of Amsterdam and well worth the experience.

Perfect ride distance with a little history and fun.. Took the tour in October with the family (13 and 11 year old children). Nice journey through the city, then country, then back to the city via Vondel Park. Stops along the way to learn a little about Amsterdam. Stopped to see how they make wooden shoes and the local cheese. Given that there is around one bike for every person in Amsterdam, you never really feel at risk while riding through the streets. They are used to it there. If you have the energy (and it doesn't take that much), this is a great way to see some of Amsterdam.

Great Way to Spend a Day!. First, I am an avid cyclist, with great equipment, and used to many, many miles on the bike in a day. But, for me, the countryside tour was perfect, easy, and relaxing. As long as you can ride a bike, you can do it! We rode about 20 Km. from the middle of Amsterdam, to the Amstel River, then along it to outside of the city. We stopped at a windmill, then at a cheese farm and wooden shoe maker's. We continued on to some dikes then back into the city through a couple of large parks. We were gone about 4 1/2 hours. The bikes are well used and only have about 3 gears, but are perfect for this ride which is on flat ground. Our tour leader, "Mike" (not the owner, and a female), was great fun. It was a perfect fall day in early October. It was really nice to get away from the busyness of the city and into the beautiful countryside, and to also learn a bit of Amsterdam history. I love walking Amsterdam and visiting all of the museums, but the bike ride with Mike's was the highlight of my visit to the city.

Mikes bicycle tours amsterdam. My wife & I just returned from AMS. I took the city bicycle tour while she shopped. Being an avid cyclist I looked forward to this, I am 70 and bike a couple of thousand road miles a year in Middleboro, Ma. The guide Peter was an unbelievable font of all things Amsterdam and an excellent guide. I don't regret the tour, however bicycling here is not IMHO, is not the best way to see amsterdam. For two and a half hours you must constantly be alert for pedestrians, cyclists, scooters, cars, and trams. There really is no way you can cycle and see the sights except for the briefest of moments, to do otherwise risks a collision. My next visit will definitely be with Mikes Tours, but next time I'll opt for the countryside.

tour. hi just back from a weekend in amsterdam with some friends .
went on a tour with mikes tours . it was a great 3 hours saw a good bit of the city
and our guid was very nice and help full . if ever i go back would do another tour with mikes bike.

Great way to see the city. We did the city tour with Pete and had a good time. He was very knowledgable about the city and its history, and we seemed to hit all the highlights in three hours. Amsterdam is a very bike-friendly city but it was really busy the weekend we were there. Pete told us proper etiquette and instructions for riding around. A few in our group weren't listening or didn't follow his guidance and therefore would fall behind, brake before going up a hill, just stop in the middle of traffic which was really annoying. Overall it was a great tour but as with any group, a few can ruin it so listen to the guide and use common sense. They offer student discounts with ID and at the end of the tour we were given a coupon for half off bike rentals, valid at any time. They don't take reservations, just show up before the tour. Highly recommend, you don't need to be in amazing shape to keep up. It's mostly flat except going over the bridges which aren't very steep and fairly short. They hav ponchos available to bring with you in case of rain.

Would use Mike's Bike Rentals again!. If you are going to Amsterdam and want to hire some bikes to get around, I would strongly recommend going to see these guys! They were very helpful, gave us a great price for a group and were extremely friendly! Also the bikes were, smooth, reliable and comfortable too! Look forward to the next time I go to Amsterdam and using Mike's bikes again.

Feel like you are riding with friends. I had a one day layover in Amsterdam and wanted to make the most of my time. My B&B recommended Mike's Bike Tours. What a fun way to get a feel of a truly unique bike town: in three hours I learned many interesting facts, saw various districts and got a chance to stretch my legs before resuming my travels.The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. We had a nice small group (about 8) of folks who were also very interesting and fun.This was well worth the time and expense. I only wish I could have taken the countryside tour too...maybe next time.

On your bike. We did the countryside tour which takes you to the outskirts of Amsterdam via a cheese farm and windmill. Pete our guide was informative, funny and very knowledgeable. The farmer was hysterical and very politically incorrect and really made the visit memorable. A great way to spend 3 hours and very good value

Informative tour!. Did this tour on a cold, rainy day. Good thing that Mike's offered a poncho for those of us who didn't have a raincoat. Despite the fact we were freezing and wet, Ashley gave a great tour! It was very informative and fun! We were sad because we wanted to do the country tour the next day, but the weather didn't permit. We didn't want to be drowning in rain again. Overall, the tour and tour guide were great! Will go again, and next time when it's hopefully not raining.

Countryside Tour. My wife and I just went to Amsterdam and we had a great time riding around on bikes with our tour guide. We lucked out with sunny weather all day and had a blast. You must ride a bicycle when in Amsterdam.

Great bike tour of Amsterdam's adjacent countryside. Jumped on a Mike's Bike Tour for a 4 hour trip along the dykes and through the polders next to Amsterdam city. In 10 minutes we left the bustle behind and were enjoying the countryside. Both in our fifties, and faced with Amsterdam's incredible cycling culture, the tour was an ideal way to experience a little of Dam's cycling. It wasn't too hard, but without the tour we would have been reluctant to jump on a bike. Leadership was informative and helpful, the tour is great and it really was a highlight of our time in Amsterdam - thanks, MIke's Bikes.

Great Tour. This tour was great! We took the country tour and not only did we see beautiful places, Stewart provided us with so much good information about Amsterdam. Biking in Amsterdam is a must, do it with these guys. You can also rent bikes and explore the city on your own as well.

Tour with Stuart. Had a great time! Took 3 hours and wasnt difficult, even for my middle aged mom who hasnt ridden a bike in decades! After touring, you get a discount to rent bikes thereafter for 5€. Stopped at various locations to talk and had a beer at the windmill. Stuart was very knowledgeable and very attractive; so not a thing to complain about. Highly recommend. Bring gloves, sunglasses, and a scarf just in case!

Tour with Ashley was awesome. These guys are all a lot of fun-you can tell that from the start. We had Ashley and he was funny and gave lots of valuable information. Easy chilled out pace, no hills or anything like that would recommend to any fitness level

Great city tour, with a fun and funky guide.. Mike's Bike's are definately the company to choose when you are wanting to explore Amsterdam. The three hour escorted ride, was great fun from start to finish. A quick talk on the history of Amsterdam, then a group of about twelve of us set off on a tour of the city, on our bikes. Mike, our funky and friendly guide, was an absolute star. I think we were all a little bit captivated by her, as she led us through the city, taking us to all the areas of interest. Her commentary was very witty, and she regaled us with tales of Amsterdam. We were also taken into the Vondelpark and other quieter areas away from the more usual tourist haunts. When the weather deteriorated, Mike took us to a quiet pub, for a few drinks to shelter from the rain. This was a great tour, which I didn't want to end. Will definately go on further tours with this company in the future.

Cheap, super fun tour with great guides!. My husband and I did the countryside tour on our honeymoon and had a great time. The tour guides were knowledgeable and fun and helped everyone have a great time. It was a low key tour that helped us see the beautiful countryside. We were also very impressed by the visit to the cheese farm. THe cheese was delicious. Smoked gouda - to die for! Yum!

Nice bikes, good prices. I rented a bike from them. The bike was in great shape, much nicer than most rental bikes I've used. The guy was pretty friendly and helpful. The prices were a little bit better than other shops I've checked out. The bike also came with two locking systems so you can park the bike for a bit if you'd like. All in all, a very nice experience.

Excellent way to see the countryside and learn some history. We did the country tour with Stewart. The tour was great and Stewart was very knowlegeable and gave us a very comprehensive history tour throughout the trip. We had a super group and had a lot of fun on the tour. The visit to the farm was very interesting, and meeting the farmer is a must ! What a lovely and eccentric character :) Worth every penny.

Inexpensive, Interesting, and a LOAD of Fun!. My wife and I took the countryside tour, with Pete as our guide. I would think it would get so old taking a bunch of tourists for a bike ride, but Pete seemed to thoroughly enjoy hanging out with us. With a sense of humor he gave us an insightful introduction to the city, Holland, and the Netherlands. He carefully led us on a winding route out of the city to the beautiful countryside. The pace was perfect for us. At each stop he shared interesting history or background of the site/location. We stopped at a farm and sampled cheese while hearing how it's made. Then the farmer demonstrated how they make wooden shoes. The route back to the city took us through Vondelpark. It was definitely the most fun we had on our three days in Amsterdam. Thanks, Pete!

The best way to see Amsterdam. The group and guide can make or break these tours and we're pleased to say we joined a great group and Pete was a terrific guide.A short but very informative history lesson followed by a short bike and safety session and we were off to see the sights. There were frequent stops to describe the sights and we cycled mainly on quieter streets and cycleways. Pete was careful to keep the group together at all times and waited to make sure everyone got through the busy intersections. We walked our bikes through a couple of pedestrian only areas (the red light district) and stopped for a beer at a lovely little pub with a beer garden.
