When we checked a map afterwards we realised there was no way we could have covered the distance by foot in the five hours we were there. It was a great way to orientate yourself to this lovely but geographically confusing city. We only had one day in Amsterdam but we had such a positive experience we will visit again. Thanks to the group and Pete. Tour date June 13 2012.

Countryside ride. This is a nice activity to get out of the city and see a windmill and a gouda & wooden shoe factory. The ride is very nice outside the city. The stopover at the cheese & wooden shoe factory is a little bit "commercial". Nevertheless, it is a very nice tour with energitic animators!

What a Great Way to See Amsterdam. My husband and I did the 4 hour country tour with Mike at Mike's bike and had a blast! It was a great way to see the city and beyond, Mike our tour guide was a delight and her knowledge and love of her city and bike riding really added to the fun. We were from Down Under so were riding on the opposite side of the road, so doing a tour like this was just ideal. Enjoyed seeing some of the city, getting out into the countryside and then riding back through some of the parks.

The best way to see the sights!. I have to admit I was a little nervous before the tour having not ridden a bike in a few years, but it's right that its something you never forget!! And what better way to get back on a bike than with Mike's Bike Tours! Hairy moments through the city but that all helped in getting the overall buzz that this tour gives you. We had Pete guiding us and his knowledge was immense - all helped along with humour too! A good 4 hours with the first hour getting some history at the shop before heading out with stops along the way to take in the sights and even a much needed stop at the Brown cafe. A great way to see Amsterdam when you first arrive in the city and all without having your nose stuck in a guide book!! They were recommended to me and I'd highly recommend to others.

Great way to see Amsterdam. Stuart was our guide for this close to 4-hour bike tour of Amsterdam. After about 20 minutes of the history of Amsterdam - including historical maps - in the bike store, we toured the city. What could be better than seeing a city where so many people ride bikes, by bike! You get some exercise, you see many parts of the city, and you're not as tired as you would be walking. We even had some rain, but even that was no problem with waterproof ponchos provided. Stuart had loads of information that he offered and seemed to know the answer to every question we asked. There were 10 people on the tour and it was no problem for everyone to feel part of the action. You obviously need to know how to ride and be comfortable riding in a city, but there are bike lanes everywhere and many, many bikers. Great tour overall!

lots of fun, authentic, and cheap. Great tour of the city that was so well planned that I was able to show my friends the same sites the next day! Mike is a character; her big personality made the tour fun for our group of 6. THe guy next door tried to get us to rent from him when I went back with my friends the next day, but I wanted to give Mike's the repeat business. I paid attention and noticed that their prices were cheaper than most if not all the other places around Amsterdam.

Countryside Tour. We just did the countryside tour (myself, wife and two girls ages 13 and 9) and it was wonderful at every level. We saw great sites and learned a lot about the history of Amsterdam. Couple that with the service of Mike's and having a guide who was extremely knowledgeable with a great sense of humor. I'd highly recommend this tour for families or individuals.

Knowledgeable guide - fun ride. This is the way to see a city. Having done Fat Tyre in Berlin (also highly recommended) we found out that Mike's was affiliated to Fat Tyre and we headed straight their on our first full day. We had a really enjoyable ride around sights as varied as posh museums to dodgy cafes! Our guide (Aaron) was a laid back American who knew the city well and was a mine of information. We then hired bikes for a couple of days, which was well organised as well.

Entertaining bike tour of Amsterdam. After a warm welcome, and a short wait for more people to join the group, their was an introduction to Amsterdam's history and biking safety info for surviving the streets. Then it was time to grab a bike and Pete, our guide, kindly lent me a coat to keep warm, before it was time to set off. The tour was fab, with a gentle cycle around the city, interspersed with lots of stops for our guide to share even more info (often humorous) on the sights of Amsterdam. I would definitely recommend this to anyone - should definitely be on your to do list when in Amsterdam.
Only way to see Amsterdam!. The tour was perfect! Ashley was extremely knowledgeable and great fun! We would recommend this tour to anyone!

the best way to see Amsterdam is with Mike's Bikes. Mike's Bike's with the best way to see and learn about the city. Ashley was the best most informed and entertaining history teacher we've ever had. We would recommend this tour to anyone, even if they think they know about the city
Don't miss it. Loved this tour. I have done the canal tour many times but loved seeing the city by bicycle. Our tour guide Karl was informative, fun and funny. Highly recommended

Start your stay in Amsterdam with this tour!. This is the best way to learn about Amsterdam, the town and its different parts, old and new. A good 3 1/2 hours cycling with a few stops at strategic places. It's great fun but also you will learn a lot with a great guide. It is really worth it, would recommend 200% as a family but with children 10-11 or older, as a group of friend or alone as you can meet other people too. Try and do the tour on your first day everything will be much easier afterwards, you willl your way better. Mike's bike is not that easy to find, take a good map.

Well worth it!. Went on one of Mike's tours this week as a group of 11 through the city and parks of Amsterdam, an awesome guide and a very good introduction to Amsterdam and the local means of transportation. Would highly recommend this as a good start to the day getting out and enjoying the fresh air of Holland.

Good fun.. We throroughly enjoyed this tour. However we could have enjoyed it more had Mike's bike tours stuck to their policy of removing people from the tour who are not capable of riding competently enough. We found that the visit to the cheese/clog making farm was a funny and enjoyable experience and the cheese was yummy, however the shop here was highly priced, there was also a chance to try on clogs. We don't think that this tour would be very family friendly, but suitable for anyone able to ride a bike, as the ride is mainly over flat terrain. Our guide (Pete) was eccentric and great fun but also very knowledgable and interesting.

Great/best way to explore Amsterdam. Great organized tour (specially if you're a large group), smoothly cycling through THE bike city of Amsterdam with Mikes stories that are nothing but tiring - he even repairs two flat tires in 5mins while explaining the origin of Amstel and dam...Highly recommendable!!!

Fun city and country tour. This is a great way to see the countryside around Amsterdam and get out of the city. The tour host was very knowledgeable and gave great information along the way! Highly recommended if you are going to Amsterdam!

Helpful staff. Easy to rent a bike.Bikes are new and in an excellent condition.They give you a map and explain where you are allowed to park the bike.A lot of bike tour guide starting from the central station store around 2PM for aprox. 17EUR. That's a very good option to have a general view and a first contact with the city and the city's cycling rules.There is a free parking place (actually it's the next door) where you can securely leave your bike during the night if you need one.

Interesting & fun tour of the city & surounds. This tour is a great intro to the fascinating & quirky city of Amsterdam. Really interesting stories about the city & its history. I learnt a great deal on this tour & the guide had good stories & jokes. It is an easy & scenic bike ride & covers a lot of the city & pretty surounds. The cheese/clog factory is an experience! Something different to see. You get to see a traditional windmill still in operation which is cool. Overall a relaxing and interesting tour.
Great tour. The guide for the country tour was really informative. It was an interesting tour and nice to get out the city.
Interesting and entertaining. A great way to learn abo it Amsterdam. Out guide was very informative and entertaining and was more than happy to answer lots of questions

Fun in Amsterdam with Karl!. My 13 year old daughter and I went on the city tour with Karl. He was funny, easy-going, and knowledgeble about Amsterdam and its culture and customs. I think if George Carlin had a son, Karl could've been him! He expertly guided us through the busy streets (and it was Sunday, when traffic wasn't so bad!), stopping at points to show or explain something. We got a quick overview of how Amsterdam was formed prior to starting the tour. We were able to stop for a quick snack--13 year olds can't go too long without eating--and stopped for a beer at a brewery. The whole group seemed to enjoy themselves. Karl was good about keeping some topics at PG-13. I'd go wtih Mike's Bikes Tours again, given the chance.

great way of exploring Amsterdam's outskirts. We enjoyed our bike-tour immensely, the weather was beautiful, the tour-guide great and we all had a wonderful time. Its not a strenuous tour and can be done by anyone who is reasonably fit. Highly recommended!

Fun cycling tour in the country. On my last day in Amsterdam I went on a guided cycling tour, exploring the country just outside the city. My group had probably the most fun-loving guide ever in Ashley, a cheeky guy from South Africa, who provided a lot of laughs all along the way. And he was wearing cloggs all the time while cycling!We explored parts of the city and then the countryside to the south-east, where we stopped at a windmill, and then also went to a farm where cheese was produced, and cloggs were made. The people working on that farm were absolutely bonkers, but in a good way :) At the end of our visit we stocked up on some fresh cheese.I would definitely go on this tour again, as it was good fun, and Amsterdam simply screams at you to get on a bike.

Excellent country tour. Took the guided bike tour out into the country along the Amstel River on a sunny Wednesday morning in August. The crew at Mike's Bikes are friendly and very informative. We had a blast, and enjoyed the bike ride plus the cheese and clog making tour out in the country. On our next visit, we plan to do the city tour, and also to rent bikes and head off on our own for a few days to tour more of the countryside
Excellent value. Friendly staff and €6 for 4 hours on well-maintained townbikes with big comfy seats! Bikes come with both heavy duty lockable chains and light duty locks on the rear wheels .

Best part of our trip.. Amsterdam is a city for bicycles, so naturally cycling is a great way to see as much of it as possible. I would recommend Mike's Bike Tours to anyone visiting Amsterdam. We joined them for the Countryside Tour which was fun, easygoing, and informative. Our guide, Karl, was entertaining from beginning to end. The bikes were comfortable and even came with baskets for water bottles or purchases made along the way.

Great Bikes. Great bikes, easy to use, good quick run through on the road rules and how to use the bikes & locks beforehand. The only thing that I can pick a flaw with is the bike seats were very uncomfortable after a while, however, still had a great day on the bikes despite all of the rain

My favorite thing we did in Amsterdam. We took the country tour and it was fantastic. Hands down my favorite thing that we did on our trip. It was so nice to see the country side of Amsterdam and visit the super fun cheese farm, where they gave us a short lecture on the process and then allowed us to sample many of them! Our tour guide (Mike?) was also great. He went at a comfortable speed and told us everything we needed to know before venturing off. I found myself wishing we could do this on a daily basis. Definitely recommend.

A Must Do in Amsterdam!. My husband and I took the country tour in June 2012, and we absolutely LOVED it. In fact, we think it was the highlight of our weekend in Amsterdam. The people from Mike's Bike Tours are friendly and funny, and our guide was just great, he was knowledgable and made us laugh a lot. The people who run this pace are young and free spirited (read: a tad alternative), so not a place if you are a bit stuck up or require to be treated like royalty. That said, we found everyone was very pleasant and customer friendly.The tour starts at the bike shop. You get a safety briefing and a short history lesson of Amsterdam and surroundings, and after that they provide everyone with a bike (nice ones too!). They have bikes for every size and they are very easy to ride.The tour itself is great fun, you visit a cheese factory and a wind mill, and you get more than a glimpse of the beautiful Dutch countryside. The pace is quite relaxed, you stop at all major crossings and the guides do all they can to make sure no one gets lost, or worse.The tour was fun and relaxed, and we really recommend you give these guys a try when you're in Amsterdam! You won't regret it!

Good way to visit the outskirts of Amsterdam. My girlfriend and I had a lot of fun today during the tour. Our group guide, Karl with a K was awesome and very friendly. He entertained us during the tour and when we stopped as well as giving us information on the various sights. We stopped at a cheese farm where they also craft wooden shoes. It was a cool experience, the shoemaker guy is definatly something... haha. Great way to spend 4 hours if the weather is on your side here in Amsterdam!

Stuart - The fountain of knowledge!!. A fantastic afternoon. My guide Stu was very informative and enthusiastic about the city and the sights Amsterdam has to offer. He put a lot of effort in to his welcome presentation and talks throughout the tour. He was quit interactive with our group and seemed to care if we were having fun and were interested. He finished the tour on a high were we sampled some of the local beers in a restored windmill brewery, which made the ride home quite entertaining. Thank you to Stu and the team at Mikes Bikes.

A horrible experience at Mike's Bike Tours. We wanted to do this tour after reading all the good things in the Trip advisors. But my experience is completely opposite. My family consists of my wife and 4 year old son. After reaching Amsterdam we had a telephonic conversation with Mike and were informed that the trip for the country tour starts at 11 in the morning. Around 10:30 we called our guy to understand where his shop is as no tram or bus go there. Moreover a suggested 10 minute walk seemed much longer for us. By the time we reached there ( after 20 mins of fast walking) I realised that the briefing already started. So wanted to talk to Mike again but instead had to deal with few people ( almost thugs and no manners at all). These guys do not know how to deal with customers and probably have no formal education at all as it appears from their behaviour. After a rough 5 minutes discussion I realised that this is not a place for families at all and made my mind about an alternative. The same evening I got in touch with another travel agent. The duration of this country side tour is 6 hours instead of 3 hours that Mike is providing and we had plenty of time in Volendam, Marken and Windmills. Ultimately I felt that it was actually good that we missed Mikes trip and could find for another option which is much better and safer for families.

The best. The only way to see the city. Wonderful day, Ashley was a superb guide.......Can't wait to return. My group routinely participates in bike tours wherever we travel. London,Paris,Barcelona,Rome, and now Amsterdam. Forget about walking tours, bus tours,or any other mode of transport, biking is the way to go. Mike's is located in a great area, and we were able to venture outside of the city. Our trip included a visit to a cheese factory and clog factory

Amsterdam City Tour. I only had 48 hours in Amsterdam and wanted to do something that would enable me to see the entire city in a day. WELCOME....Mike's Bike Tours. We had a great group of 10 people and Ashley was our tour guide. His knowledge and expertise of the city was fantastic. The tour was very informative, light hearted and a simple ride. We were able to access the entire city in the space of 3.5 hours at a pace anyone can enjoy. I highly recommend Ash as a tour guide and have no doubt you will love this experience. 11/10.

MUST DO in Amsterdam!. My husband and I traveled around Western Europe for 2.5 weeks for our honeymoon and this was BY FAR the best part of our entire trip. We did the city tour our first day in Amsterdam. Our tour guide Carl was fun and passionate and provided great history and cultural information. We had such a great time that we came back the next day for the country tour. This time Ashley was our tour guide. Another phenomenal trip. This was the best way to see the countryside. It was relaxing and beautiful. The tour of the cheese/shoe farm was fabulous! What a total cultural immersion to learn how Dutch cheese and wooden shoes are made! Thank you Mike's Bike Tours for such an amazing and memorable experience!

Country side tour. A very nice experience. Very nice staff in the shop and very nice guide for the trip. Usually its groups of around 12 people. The spots we visited were quite interesting and the explanation we were given was informative. They supply rain gear (poncho) if necessary.

Great way ti explore the city!. Rather than the excellent informative tour the guide gives you, it's the fascinating way to explore the city without having to worry if you have gotten lost already (cause you are in a pack). The bikes are great, adjustable to height and speed. Very recommendable tour.

Really fun. Good bikes, great guide and lovely countryside. The people at the cheese and clog sites are crazy, but awesome! The clog guy cracked me up. Relaxed atmosphere and a good way to get out of the city for a bit. Would definitely recommend!

County bike tour. Was a nice tour, nice to get out of the city. Rose along the river Amstel to a windmill then farther down to a cheese and clog farm for a tour with a lovely, but crazy, man! We were the only 2 people on the tour so we set our own pace which was nice, would think the larger the group the more difficult the tour would be. Guide was a bit odd but funny enough and provided good conversation!

great bike tour. Had a wonderful bike tour of Amsterdam and country side tour/ Our guide was very infromative/ Went to a farm with cheese making and clog making shop/ had nice ride through country side. Bikes were in great shape and well maintained/ easy paced riding. Would recommend this tour!

Informative, fun, and great guide. This was one of my wife and my favorite activities in a 17 day through Europe. Our tour guide was Ashley (Rastafarian from South Africa). He knew a lot about the city and history. The route was relaxing and beautiful. We saw all the major sites and got all our questions answered. Ashley was able to show all the sides of Amsterdam from the tourist attractions/traps to the local favorite spots. He also went above and beyond to invite anyone from the group to hang out and grab some coffee. My wife and I joined him, and we sat around joked and laughed for a while.Ashley made this a truly memorable experience that we'll never forget, and always remember as having a blast.Mike's bikes = ATour Guide Ashley = A++

Great bike tour to see both city and country. I liked that this tour included seeing parts of Amsterdam city and also going out to the countryside. Easy to ride bikes and great tour guides. It may seem a bit geared towards backpackers, but that wasn't much of an issue with us as we were there to sightsee.

Best part of my trip!. I recently took the Mike's Bikes countryside tour in Amsterdam, and it was the highlight of my 4-day stay.The guides were all so friendly (we met a few at the shop at the beginning) and on the ride Pete was great at making sure everyone was comfortable and entertaining us at the stops along the way. Luckily we had a beautiful sunny day for our trip but were provided with rain gear in case. I didn't do the city tour but certainly would have if I had time, chose the country tour as I wouldn't have gone out of the city on my own (not knowing where to go) and it was a lovely way to see it. Also, for those worried about the riding part - I am quite unfit in general and did not find the ride too strenuous at all. The bikes are very comfortable and there are enough stops and a relaxing pace.Well done Mike's Bikes - if I am back in Amsterdam I will be back for the city tour!

It was so good we went back the next day and did the city tour!. I took my 13 and 15 year old children on the country tour first. It started to pour with rain just after we set off but Stuart's lovely, happy and encouraging personality kept everyone in good spirits. The farm was a little too commercial for my taste and I was hoping to really see how they made the cheese rather than an empty demo, but the crazy farmer was very entertaining as he demonstrated his clog making which was great. Stuart suggested we take some sandwiches with us to eat at the farm which was lovely...you can buy them at the Italian deli next door to the shop before you leave too. The following day we did the city tour with Stuart too, the kids loved that as well, and Stuart gave us lots of local knowledge about the better museums and galleries to visit. I really liked the personal touches and kindness that these boys show to their clients. I must say without their tours and local knowledge we wouldn't have enjoyed Amaterdam as much as we did. I feel like I really have a good understanding of the history and how it has shaped modern day Amsterdam, socially, physically and politically. What more could I want?As far as the helmets go, well I loved not having to wear one but I was a little concerned with the kids not wearing one on the busy roads, and my son did take a fall on the country tour (completely his fault). If I could offer one area of improvement...it would be to offer helmets as an option... Australians are hard wired about helmet safety and have been indroctinated about the horrific consequences of head trauma....However anyone of us taking this tour who grew up in the 70's did manage to make it to Amsterdam in 2012 after a childhood of no helmets on both bikes and skateboards ; ) and sometimes I do just love riding with the wind in my hair!

Country side bike tour. Very different bike tour than Paris city tour for example. This tour took you out of city into country side for a 22km bike ride along flat surfaces so ideal for all age groups. Bike were easy to ride & well maintained. Went to cheese tasting & clog making factory which was nice & saw Amaterdam's wind mill. Great afternoon out. Mike & colleagues are friendly & very helpful. Cost was €22

Simply Brilliant!!. So I am 1 day back from my trip to Amsterdam and just had to get in my first review of many tonight. Mike's Bike Tours was excellent! Such a friendly bunch of people run the place and they get everyone involved. My group had a guide named Pete who was so informative and took you on a tour of the Amsterdam countryside, he explained everything so well and still had people laughing. We went to a nice farm and visited a cheese maker / Dutch clog shoe maker - I recommend the Smoked cheese, I'm going back with a truck next time! By the end of the ride I was stuck thinking 'awwww is that it?' but in fact we had took a ride so long but yet THAT enjoyable I lost track of time. Also I was made "[--]-man" of the group having to stay at the back but it was cool because I got prizes!!! :OD I won't tell you what they are, just get yourself to Mike's Bike Tour and see for yourself. Thumbs up guys! I'll be seeing you again when I'm back in a couple of months :O)

A Must to See the Dutch Countryside. We, 3 American kids (ages 14,13,13 )and two adults, took Mike's four hour tour that leaves around 11 and returns around 3. Our guide was Pip. Overall, this is one of our favorite activities in the Netherlands. In a fifteen minute ride, you are in the Dutch countryside. Pip did a great job of making stops and explaining house boats, the construction of a park, windmills etc. He has a terrific sense of humor. The trip went fast. As soon as you get on a bike, one obtains a different feel for the city. The tour was never boring. We got great exercise but it was not too much at all for the kids. Actually, the trip flew by. The price is reasonable and the guide and the tour were great. I highly recommend. This is not a tourist trap.

Great country side tour. My wife and I had Ashley as a tour guide and it was a blast. He was quite knowledgeable and very funny. We covered a lot of sites and miles, but he never made the tour seem rushed in the slightest. Everyone we met at the bike shop & garage were also very nice. The bikes were comfortable, and the cheese farm was awesome, and we met some great people on the tour. We could have done with an extra stop on the second half of the tour, but it was also raining pretty hard at that point. Overall I'd definitely recommend these guys from the country side tour - you get to see neighborhoods and things you'd never see otherwise, and it's great fun!

Friendly and fun for all ages! Both my teen and I loved it.. I did the Country Tour on our first day in Amsterdam, along with my teenager. We had a great group of people from six different countries, ranging in age from 17 to mid-60s. (Three of them had been out with Mike's Bikes on the City Tour the day before, and they liked it so much they booked the Country Tour. That said a lot.) Our guide was 'Mrs. Mike', their woman guide. She gave us the perfect mix of information and humour and was a fantastic guide.The bikes were very easy to ride. I ride a lot at home and Mike's Bikes are similar to mine--safe for all ages and levels. (Nothing fancy-schmancy like racing bikes.) We had no small kids in our group, but I'd say any child who was a confident rider and aged 9 or 10 would be fine. 22 kms sounds like a lot, but it is virtually flat the whole way and you go at a leisurely pace. I'm no athlete but I found it fine, as did all the other people in our tour. Mike did a great job of keeping tabs on her flock and making sure we all kept up.The ride was very picturesque. Although it was billed as a Country Tour, we got info. and photo ops. at many points along the route and I felt we had a very full tour. Some tour guides I've seen barely stop for photos but Mike was good about juggling half a dozen cameras. The cheese and clog farm was entertaining. The farmer had the gift of the gab and had everyone laughing. Make no mistake--this is a tourist farm, but that's what you came for! The farm-fresh cheese was delicious. Mike stopped at a bakery on the way for those of us who wanted to pick up bread, and we had a simple but wonderful lunch outside in the sun. (Beer and other drinks can be purchased at the farm, but no food other than cheese.) Clogs of all shapes and sized are available and it was interesting to hear about the various uses for this typical Dutch shoe. (My one tip is not to purchase the colorful wooden tulips at the farm. They look lovely and I thought they were exclusive to the farm. However, I found very similar but cheaper ones in several gift shops in the city.)Probably the highlight was the gorgeous scenery and being part of such a fun group of people. Our tour ran a bit late, but Mike confirmed that nobody had to be back in a hurry. The weather started off with a little rain but we all got ponchos. By noon, the sun was out and it ended up being perfect weather for a bike ride. We rode back at a leisurely pace through some gorgeous parks. Really great value for money.I'd certainly go again and so would my son. Thanks, Mike's Bikes!

Made our trip!. We did the country tour of Amsterdam with a guide called Ash, not only was he a crack up but his knowledge and passion for Amsterdam was un questionable. Best part of our trip!!Hailey & Tom- Australia

Fun ride with good guide. Very knowledgeable and informative guide, but the 'countryside tour' was a bit disappointing. Visit to a traditional dairy farm which consisted of a smelly, flithy cow barn (very unhygienic) with an explanation of how cheese is made by hand, and a cheese tasting. Would never pass any Health & Safety regulations! You could buy cheese but only in big blocks, and there was no other food, only a coin-operated fridge for cold drinks. Our Tour Guide had brought bread along for those who bought cheese, but it would have been nice to be able to buy fresh bread rolls /snacks/coffee and have a light meal. The only place to sit was next to the smelly cow barn. Also at cheese farm was a traditional clog-making display (about 10 minutes), which was also disappointing. We cycled for 5 hours (with stops where guide talked) without a proper meal break! Luckily I took biscuits with, othewise we'd be fainting of hunger!

Nice ride but not loads of information. Very long ride if you do the country but wouldn't recommend the city as there are too many bikes, trams, cars and I wouldn't feel comfortable. If you want a real farm this isn't for you it's more like an old farm that's now a shop for tourists - in saying that, we didn't mind and liked it. The ride is very pretty and there are virtually no hills which is a bonus - just a tad too long we think. Overall it was a good way to get put of the city for a few hours but warm your legs up :)

Fun, fun, fun - thanks heaps Ashley!. Went on the country tour and the guide (Ashley from South Africa) was great - ensured everyone was ok (we are in our 50s) and made it through the rapidly-changing traffic signals. Great experience and enjoyed all aspects, including the usual "tourist" visit to a farm etc. This is a great way to see "rural" parts of Amsterdam. Tour briefing was a laugh with Ashley and his maps!!! During the ride he was happy to chat about all sorts of topics, so felt very welcome and part of it all rather than a "number on a tour". Ashley also made sure he chatted to riders on their own. Highly recommended. Will do the city tour next time.

Amsterdam by bike. Did a city and countrysite tour and liked both of them. I met nice people. When you want to discover Amsterdam on nice way, don't hesistate and book Mike's Bike!
thanks to the guides and the group.
Br
Jo
Belgium

An Easy Enjoyable Ride. I did a ride into the country as part of a small group and it was great. Amsterdam is very, very bike friendly. The tour took us to interesting places including a farm where cheese and clogs are made. We had a very enthuastic and knowledgeable guide. A great way to see Amsterdam.

City Tour. We really enjoyed this tour. It had pretty much everything you'd want out of a bike tour - the staff were friendly and down-to-earth, with lots of local knowledge and we saw all the main sights that the city has to offer. Our tour guide, Ashley, was great because he was a really nice guy and had lots of interesting stuff to tell us about each place we went. As for the cycling itself, we were a bit apprehensive about the busy roads beforehand but our tour guide knew what he was doing and was able to make the cycle feel easy and safe. It's about 3 hours in total but the time really flies. Overall an awesome tour which we would definitely recommend.

Great teen (and grown up) vacation activity in Amsterdam!. This was already on my try to do list, and when we met a group of 20-somethings from Australia in London who had just come from Amsterdam (and we were headed there) said "Be sure you take th Mike's Bikes Countryside tour", it was a must do! Our group consisted of my 2 daughters (13 and 17), my husband and I. We took the 11 a.m. Bike Tour of the Countryside. Even with sketchy weather (they provide rain gear just in case, but we didn't need),we had a great time. Everything is so flat that riding for around 4 hours was no problem - plus there are stops along the way. Our tourguide (Stuart) was very interested in what he was telling us about - and not too hard to look at either (which is helpful when you have teen girls in tow)! You need to be fairly comfortable with riding a bike - gotta go when the traffic breaks, gotta keep up. I wouldn't do this with a child under 12 - no matter what their bike skills. Although,I think they may have had some bikes with trailer or baby seats for those with little kids, maybe even a tandem bike. We wish we had time to do their other tour, the city tour, but with other tickets we had purchased, not time. We had so much fun, we put Mikes' Bikes tour as part of our must do list for our 1 day in Munich later in the week - which we also thoroughly enjoyed and will post on separately!

Mikes Bike City tour. It was a great experience. We had a friendly knowledgeable guide, who showed us the sights and sounds of Amsterdam. He was also able to tell us the interesting stories about different places in Amsterdam. The bikes were easy to ride, and overall it was a very fun experience

Best bet for a countryside tour. Spent a great few hours biking with Stuart. Informative, amusing and beautifully scenic. Cheese and clog tours were surprisingly entertaining and most importantly, not much pressure to purchase. A wonderful way to see a totally different side of Amsterdam.

Brilliant!. Did the city bike tour with Ash yesterday. Really good fun and Ash was very knowledgeable and funny. I was a bit nervous about riding around the city navigating the traffic, trams and bikes but it felt safe with Ash and I really enjoyed myself. Highly recommended way to see the city

Don't hesitate- hire Mikes bikes and do a tour.. Having done lots of research we decided on hiring bikes and doing a tour with Mike.He offered half price bike rental if you go on a tour. We sorted it our by email beforehand. The manager Bente was very responsive. The 2 of us went on the Countryside tour and also hired bikes for 4 days(Pretty much the whole of the time we were in Amsterdam), Great value at 76€ all- in including insurance.Hiring bikes is a great choice, you can get around all of Amsterdam so easily on the bike using the dedicated tracks/sections of roads. It's incredibly busy and at first you feel like your life is at peril! - but you soon get the hang of it. The culture seems to be that cars treat bikers with respect. we were that any accident involving a car and a bike is generally seen as the cars fault( we didn't see any incidents in the 5 days we were there). It's a great experience and you see so much more than by walking.Mikes Tour was great to do as you see more than just the city and very informative and 'miss mike' was fab guide. No hesitation in recommending Mikes Tours/Rental. Had a puncture one day, and no quibble they just changed the bike straight away, and we were off again.If you like adventure ( on a mild-ish scale) you should do this.

Absolute must-do in Amsterdam!. I choose the 4pm "countryside" tour (instead of the 11am) which was a great choice considering there were only 11 of us in our group! Our English guide "Pip" was AWESOME he was so knowledgeable - he could answer any question we threw at him - and he kept the commentary light and fun while being really informative. Of the 11, there were four children (aged 10 to 15) and he kept the humour appropriate. He really made the tour fun - although I'm sure every guide would be awesome. I highly recommend this tour (and this company in general) it's something (and somewhere) you'd never go by yourself. The price is totally right at 22Euros too I thought - for four hours of entertainment! I'd do it again and I'll recommend it to everyone! Thanks Pip!!

A bike tour is the perfect way to see Amsterdam. We just happend to chat to another tourist who recommended that we add Mikes bikes to our itinerary. We are very very glad that we had that chat, One thing you cant help but notice is the number of bicycles. And there is good reason - its a great way to get around the city! We found the people at Mikes very knowledgeable with a good sense of humour. We did the country tour and I would definitely add this to your tour of the city. Also, having come from Australia where bike helmets are required by law, I must say I enjoyed the freedom of not having to wear one. We went with our two teenage boys who also really liked the trip.

Tour ok, concerned with lack of helmets. The tour itself was fine with some commentary and frequent stops...I was not impressed with Amsterdam in general. However, I was highly disappointed in the lack of helmets and the condecending attitude towards my concern for my 10 year old daughter having a helmet! There were no acceptable helmets for her, which bothered me. The tour is a good way to see the city, but they really need to address this issue.

Mike's Bike tours Amsterdam. Took the countryside tour last weekend and thoroughly enjoyed it! I was quite nervous of taking the tour as I am an inexperienced wobbly rider. My friends convinced me that I could not go to Amsterdam without riding a bike, so reluctantly I agreed. Our tour guide was a lovely young man called Stuart who was not only gorgeous but extremely knowledgeable about Amsterdam's history and present day struggles. The cheese farm tour was a strange but fun experience with the crazy farmer. This turned out to be the best thing my friends and I did on our holiday to Amsterdam and it was extremely good value too! I would definitely recommend Mike's bike tours if you are going to Amsterdam, they also rent out bikes ( at a discounted rate if you take the tour first).

Sweet ride. Experience this bicycle ride when you are in Amsterdam. The tour guide was very good and giving so much of information about Amsterdam. We get a very good insight into cheese as well as Holland's traditional wooden shoes manufacturing process. Step into one of the pairs of the wooden shoes. It is a perfect peice of souvenir we can take home. There is another beautiful scene at one of the vintage Wind Mills along the route of this tour

Bike rental to trust. We hired bikes from here having read some poor reviews of other outfits. Service was very friendly and informative, bikes were new and easy to handle, and the experience of four hours viewing the canals at our own pace was really enjoyable. I beleive that you won't get ripped off by this place!

Should be ranked Number 1 of things to do in Amsterdam!. This was bar none, the best thing we experienced during our trip to Amsterdam. It was a pleasant overcast day and my husband 10 year old son and I spent the better part of our day doing the countryside tour. "girl" Mike was our guide and while she totally rocks her rock and roll look, don't be decieved..she is one sharp lady. She gave a very informative and humerous trip through a few parts of the city and we made our way to the countryside. A cheese farm with a witty cheese maker who also happens to make wooden shoes was a great place to stop and have a picnic lunch. Meeting the various people from around the globe was an added bonus, and it was nice to chat with others over our picnic. The biking was a very nice pace and the bikes were in good condition. Very well run....and very highly recommended. I would do it again in a heartbeat!

Great Fun Tour. After numberous galleries, museums and monuments this was a great escape. We did the tour to the countryside and loved it. It was great to see another side of Amsterdam. Our guide "Mike" was very informative and loads of fun. Anyone could do this ride as the bikes are in good condition and everywhere is so flat, not strenuous at all. This would be suitable for all ages. You can even hire the bike for half price after the tour.

Great tour. We took the country tour and loved it. It was great to learn some of the history of the city and also get away from the touristy places. We rode for a few hours but it wasn't strenuous at all. We made sure to hire the bikes for as long as we could afterwards because it is simply the best way to get around the city.

Fun and informative city tour. We spent the afternoon riding around Amsterdam leaning about the history and enjoying the atmosphere of the city. We finished at a local " brown pub" for a well deserved drink. The whole experience was fun, informative and relaxed. I had a great time.
Ideal. Reasonably priced in an unreasonably priced town. Rent the bike for as long as you can and avoid the trams. Also took a city tour. Pete was excellent. Fun city. Ask for student rates.

Bikes, Bikes and More Bikes. If your interested in having a fun, educational and laid back experience in amsterdam there is no better way to do it than on Mikes Bike Tours. Four couples from all corners of the world gathered one morning at Mike's where we meet, then educated and entertained by a young englishman named Stuart. His history lesson of the Netherlands and Amsterdam was just the right amount of time and information. After a brief and thorough explanantion of bikes and biking around Amsterdam we jumped on our bikes and pedaled away for the next three and half hours. It was a leisurely, comfortable pace with multiple stops for picture taking and historic facts. Our city biking trip had a great ending as we stopped at a brewery for beer and snacks ~ cheeses and sausage. If you ever go to Amsterdam stop at Mike's Bike Tours and enjoy a fantastic adventure. We did.

A good way to explore amsterdam. We went on two bike tours with mikesThe city tour and the country tour,both were interesting and recommended-the city tour takes you all around Amsterdam the red light district and the coffee houses as well as the park,the country tour takes you to a windmill, cheese farm and clog factory,both tours are at a leisurely pace with plenty of stops and information given.

Bicycle and scooters. Great way to browse Amsterdam is to rent a bicycle or a scooter. There are bicycle and scooters way all over the city and you can enjoy your freedom in a nice and cheep way or just go in organized bicycle or bike tours. I have been in Amsterdam many time and I was just trying this for first time and I will for sure do it again.... practical, refreshing, healthy and quick way to make more out of your trip...

Great Tour. Did the countryside tour on Tuesday the 5th of June, really Informative, fun filled 3-4 hours, only wished I had done it at the start of my 4 day visit as opposed to the end as it was a great way to get a handle on the city and its surroundings!Very safety conscious company and believe me you will need more than you wits about you to negotiate the city streets. Actually refused to let one girl go on the tour because she wasn't competent enough on a test run, ended up missing out on approximately 8 other potential customers as her friends didn't want to go without her.Even at that still ended up with 31 people who showed up for the morning tour which begins at 11am. However the group was split into two with different guides, we ended up with Pete, knows the history of the city, keeps a good eye out for everyone and is full of cheesy jokes, so great time was had by all for a very reasonable 22 euro.

Disappointing!. We have taken quite a few bike tours around european cities and decided to do the same in Amsterdam. It was a bit disappointing though because the most information we got about were the usual clichés of reefers and booze! We decided to rent bikes during our stay and got a much better view of the city than we had during the tour. Rent a bike there at Mike's but don't take the tour!!

GREAT 1st day in Amsterdam. Myself and 4 others arrived in Amsterdam late on a Wednesday afternoon. We wanted to get a quick feel for the layout of the city and get some ideas for places we might want to go during our 3 day visit to Amsterdam.Most bike tours end around the time we were arriving. Bente from Mike's was able to arrange a private tour for the five of us via email. I thought it was very reasonable (30 euros for a 3 hour tour).It turned out to be everything we expected and more. Three of us wanted to try herring (for the 1st time) and Pete brought us to his favorite place in one of the markets (Mike met us there). YUM! We got a lot of ideas and made a mental list of everything we wanted to go back to see on foot. (Hint - you may want to bring paper and a pen to take some notes.) However, our apartment was just around the corner from their shop, so we stopped back in the next morning to get a little more information on where certain things were. What a great bunch of people! Super helpful and very friendly!Give them a try - you'll be glad you did!
This is THE bike tour to take in Amsterdam.. Been on lots of bike tours, and this is the best. Ashley and crew are super fun and know everything about the city. I highly recommend this tour.

Thoroughly Entertaining, Matt Robitaille is awesome!. Great tour, Matt is thoroughly entertaining. He really knew how to pump up the group and keep us entertained, both on, and off the bike. Matt had a wry and slapstick humor that made the day fun and his utilizing a boom box set a nice cadence for the day - all guides should use one!Highly recommended, these guys are a blast!

You'll come out of it dumber than you started.. It baffles me how so many people could rate this tour highly. The red flag for me should have been its strong recommendation by Lonely Planet, because, after all, if Lonely Planet likes something, than you almost always know it's going to be shallow and juvenile. But I still wasn't prepared for Mike's Tour. Our guide--I'm not sure he ever gave his name, but that's probably to his advantage--was friendly enough, but unless you came to Amsterdam for weed and nothing else, he had very little insight to offer on Amsterdam. Everything was about smoking--kinda sad. But the biggest problem was his refusal to cap the number of tour participants. I was about the 15th person when I got there, but more kept coming, and coming, and coming. Our guide said he was going to split into two groups with separate guides, but he never did--and we ended up with 32 people on our tour through some of Amsterdam's busiest streets! It was bedlam. He is very lucky there were no injuries. He also didn't weed out the good bicyclists from the bad by testing everyone. We had two young ladies who practically didn't know how to ride bikes: they could generally stay on but had no sense about rules of the road, and they would do dangerous things like stop in the middle of a lane, or cross on the inside of a parked car, wedged between the car and the curb. Mind-boggling. The only thing that redeems this tour was that our guide, realizing he had invited a few too many, gave us a discount off the cost. But I still couldn't recommend this tour to anyone. Even if you're a stoner, find a tour with more content and then visit the coffeeshops on your own time!

City tour. My husband and I just finished this tour. It was excellent. Our tour guide was Stuart and he was awesome! The tour began with a little history of Amsterdam then we went through the. Ity for about 3 hours. We took a 30 minute break at a brewery which was nice. There were 8 of us in the group which made it easier for all of us to keep together. I highly recommend this trip.

Fun!. Went on this bike tour with a friend while in the city. I enjoyed the bike ride, and our guide. I forgot his name already, but he is tan, blonde, blue eyed, nice guy.Only things I'd approve is:- let us know what canals we are at... and which districts when we are biking around so we can get a better idea of where we are within the city.Also, if you bike often, the bike pace of the tour will be a little slow for you. This is definitely for people who never bike or only occasionally. But it was still enjoyable even at the slower pace.
Best Daylight Activity.. If you wanna feel the spirit of Amsterdam, that's the right please. Awesome. Easygoing. Cool.

A great way to experience Amsterdam like a local. Thanks to Mike's Bikes for a thoroughly enjoyable four hour Countryside tour. Our guide was Pete who, like all the staff, was exceptionally friendly and did his best to make us laugh throughout while also giving us some interesting Amsterdam stories. We certainly know the place much better now. Physically, the cycling is really easy. Mentally, a little more difficult in some short sections where it would be handy to have a head that can swivel like an owl's, with bikes and pedestrians arriving from all angles - but that's just Amsterdam and it never felt dangerous. The cheese farm and the clog-making were even interesting enough to offset the fact that you then get sent out through the gift shop. There was no pressure to buy anything though - and the cheese tasted great! If you've got the time to spare, this is guaranteed to be a highlight of your trip.

Best Memory of Amsterdam. Bicycling and Amsterdam are intertwined like fire and heat. You absolutely cannot get an authentic Amsterdam experience without biking through it. In America, cars are on the top of the totem pole with regards to road dominance. In Amsterdam, they're last (after bikes, pedestrians, and trams, respectively). Having said that, I can't think of a better way to spend four hours than be guided through the city and its rural surroundings by the tour guides at Mike's. Our guide, Pete, spoke perfect English and seamlessly melded enlightening historical and cultural facts with cheeky quips throughout the tour. The ride isn't physically challenging at all, but you'll feel satisfied and even energized by the time it's finished. With all the wonders Amsterdam has to offer, the most lasting memory will undoubtedly be our Country Tour with Pete.

Great City tour with great bikes. Did the city tour the day we arrived and loved it. Gave us a great idea of where things are and where to go. The tour guide was great. The best part is the deal you get on the bikes if you want to keep them longer. Best price in the city. We planned for an extra day, but it is soooo much easier to get around on bikes, we kept them for the 5 days. Highly recommend Mike's and keeping the bike.

Great Tour.....Pete's the man!. if this tour is not on your Amsterdam itinerary, about time you put it! pete (our guide) is a great guy and knows the city very well. He takes good care of the group by ensuring everyone is together and coming to rescue whenever you are in trouble. The tour starts with dos and donts of riding bicycle in the city - and there are some serious rules. Quality of bicycles is very good and unlike other rental/tour places are not really conspicuous, riding a bright red bike with the operators name painted in front screams TOURIST and trust me you don't want that.The tour takes you through all the major parts of the city and good be a good reference point for planning your trip. At 19 euros a person for adult (there are discounts for students) is totally worth it.

Great guides. I went on the 4 hour country tour. The tour guides had approximately 10 bikers in separate groups, so it was manageable. The bikes are in good shape. The guides stopped and provided interesting information at different points in the tour. Visited a cheese/wooden shoe farm. Stayed too long. Bike shop probably has agreement with farm. This could be reduced. Otherwise, great tour

Excellent introduction to the city and fun too. 5 of us did the city tour, it was great. Very informative, the guide was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable and made the tour really interesting. We passed through most of the major tourist areas and really got our bearings of the city as well as lots of interesting facts. Only negative for us was the lengthy half hour history talk before we set off but I can see why they do it, our party although interested in the history of Amsterdam almost left after 20 mins but glad we stuck with it. Riding the bikes was good fun although despite all the cycle lanes, crossing junctions was at times hair raising! Of our group of 16 only one Person fell off once so not bad. Felt we had really earned our beers at the micro brewery - beer fab but staff there quite surly considering they must be making a fortune by the bike tour guides taking groups there every day. I would 100% recommend this tour, and the staff at the shop and our guide ( from chorley funnily enough !) was great and really friendly.

The Place to Rent from. We decided to be brave and bike while in Amsterdam. We didn't want a bike tour; we just wanted to ride to places like Vondel Park. We are so happy that we found Mike's. Mike's is not easy to find as it is on a side street, Kerkstraat (we more or less stumbled upon the place), but finding the shop is worth the effort. First, the person we dealt with was friendly and helpful. Next, the bikes are not as conspicuous as the bikes are from more tourist-familiar places such as Yellow Bike. Finally, the price was reasonable. We insured our bikes for the 3 hours we used them and the total cost was 10 euros per bike. If you are looking for a good place to rent bikes, try Mike's.

Great bike tour - Easy ride for all ages. This was our 3rd visit to Amsterdam & we wanted something a little different to the usual walking or coach tours. We'd seen online videos of the tour & thought we'd like to give it a go even though we're both approaching retirement age. At first my wife was a liittle anxious, having never cycled in a city before. She needn't have worried. Pete, our guide was fantastic. After a short briefing we headed out into the Dutch countryside getting up a fair speed. Pete would constantly look back to check that everyone in the group was ok. The countryside was beautiful & the cycling easy. We had a few information stops along the way & the opportunity for a few photos. We especially enjoyed cycling through the wood on the way back. Good clean air & a great sense of freedom. I would certainly recommend this tour as a must for able-bodied people of all ages. Thanks again Pete !

Mike. Mike in our review is a lady by the way, not the owner , a blonde with aviator glasses and yellow clogs with a pink pilots helmet. Good start ! She was our tour guide, great fun and a real enthusiast for Amsterdam. Really enjoyed the whole tour, we took the countryside tour and got a really good idea of what a wonderful place this is to live. The bikes were of a superior quality and the cycling was very easy and relaxing. Strongly recommended. Thank you Mike! John and Karen Mclaren

Wheely, wheely good. Sorry, couldn't resist that awful pun. Mike's Bikes deserve better than that. Wheely. I took the 'countryside tour' with them today after spending 2 days exploring the city myself. And what a great way to end my weekend. First of all, you're on bikes. New, shiny, comfy bikes. Then you get a great insight into the country - the architecture, the crazy water ways, and a potted history, Then you get gorgeous cycling along canal side routes I doubt you'd find yourself if you just rented a bike (which of course you can do through Mike's Bikes.)No doubt it helped that today was a lovely sunny day. And that our guide, Ashley, was cool, calm, funny, chilled and informative. And that we saw cheese being made and clogs being carved. Windmills at work. Hares running in the fields. If you want to see a slightly different side to Amsterdam, I couldn't recommend this highly enough. Wheely.

Great bike tour. I did this on the last day of my trip and I am so glad I did. I did the countryside tour and absolutely enjoyed it. Great scenery and easy ride. Anyone can do it. The cheese farm and wooden shoe's were cool. This is a great way to see Amsterdam. One of my favorites.

Great way to see the city by bike.. We went on a Mike's bikes tour of Amsterdam and it was great. Karl our guide was a great laugh and also knew a lot about the history of the city and pointed out good areas and places to go. THANKS Karl, it was awesome. From the best group of the day - the happy Brits!
Great. The guide was really friendly and helpful, saw the best of Amsterdam at good value. Really enjoyed it

Good Value for the money, Friendly service. Wasn't expensive .. nice bike .. several locations .. friendly service .. besides you cannot get to Amsterdam an not ride a bike ... it's like the best transportation there

Fun ride!. Took the countryside bike tour with Karl at the beginning of April. It was very cold, but not rainy that day (thank goodness!). Visited the clog/cheese shop, the mustard flavored cheese was yummy! The ride was easy, and I got to understand why everyone in A'dam rides their bikes--you get there faster, see so much more in the same time, and it's fun. Biking through Vondelpark was cool, as well. The tour is a little light on actual history, so if youre looking for a 'history of A'dam' tour, this wont be for you. However, if you want a chance to stretch your legs and see a wide swatch of the area outside the main squares, go for it!
High service and quality. Rented a bike for one day. Fast and excellent service.

Just Do It. Our family of 4 went on the Countryside tour our first morning in Amsterdam. What a great way to get an overview of the city and some history. Pete and Mike(lovely tourguide in training) were our guides and they did a great job. We rode thru the city then out to the country to visit a little working farm where they made clogs and gouda. Maybe a little touristy at this point, but after all, we were tourists and it was fun. We had such a good time we rented bikes from Mikes for the rest of our stay in Amsterdam. I would highly recommend doing this. The first couple of hours were a little intimidating but the freedom of having a bike in Amsterdam was incredible. We got to all the major sites very easily and our boys ages 12 and 14 had a ball. We wouldn't do Amsterdam again without touring with Mike's and renting their bikes again. Awesome!

Great countryside bike tour. On one of the few sunny mornings, I decided I would join Mike's countryside bike tour of Amsterdam. The group was large - 30 people - so, they split us into two groups. I was a little unsure about riding on city streets, but after one busy intersection, we followed the Amstel River. The ride was beautiful following the river, then through Amsterdam Bos, Amstelvein, and a stop at a cafe on the sight of the 1928 Olympic rowing venue. Ashley, our guide was always concerned about our safety. Returning through Vondel Park was an easy ride. I would recommend, even if you are mature - (over 70).
Great City Tour. Didn't book, just turned up... great bunch of lads who took the tours... Had a giggle... very easy riding...Would recommend to anyone

Wasn't worth the time. I think this tour would be fun if you had extra time and if you lucked out with a great group and a great tour guide. I unfortunately didn’t have such luck. We biked into the country, which was lovely. However the “farm” that we biked to was essentially just an attraction. The “farm” had tour groups constantly rolling in and it had a gift shop which made me realize it was an easy tourist stop. Also, one of the girls in my group could barely bike and would get off and walk her bike most the time (despite how easy the bike path was). This slowed the entire group down and added an extra hour to our tour. Lastly, while my tour guide was very kind and funny, he also took the time to teach the group how to smoke marijuana out of his own personal vaporizer that he had on him. While I didn’t care if he was smoking on our trip, I did care that this slowed down our tour even more and since he was now high, he made more stops than usual to point out various things that only a high person would find important. If you have an extra day with nothing to do, then take this bike tour. If you do not have time to waste, then definitely pass.

Great tour of the city. On our last day of our April trip to Amsterdam, we took the city tour. Our guide was Karl and he had great stories about all the places we stopped at. The ride was great - the only difficult parts are where you cross a canal. One other warning - since the tour rides in a single file to allow the faster Amsterdam natives to pass our slower bikes, there are some instances where the group can be split up crossing a street when the traffic light turns. I've also seen some people in our group crossing on a red to keep up. It will be good for the guides to stress how to handle that situation to the group ahead of time.

Best thing we did in Amsterdam!. Nice, slow paced biking with lots of breaks listening to our guide Carl's stories - he had us laughing throughout the tour despite the rain etc. Really worth the money!

Karl Rule's - Loved the Country Tour. If you visit Amsterdam and you don't spend time on a bicycle, you missed out for sure. We didn't want to rent bikes but did was to spend some time on one, so my wife and i did the country tour with Mike's. We enjoyed it very much. Our tour guide Karl took us on a fun, easy route through the city and then onto "the country.". Really its only about 4-5 miles southwest of the city. On the way you'll hit a dairy farm, huge windmill and a wooden clog maker. All very cool. Quick tip, bring a backpack for the cheese, you'll want to buy. Weeks later we're still eating it. Also, cash only, no cards for cheese and clogs. Overall, i would definitely recommend Mike's Bike Tour. Karl made it especially awesome.

Really Fun Way To See An Overview of the City!. I recently took the city tour when in Amsterdam mid April and it was really fun! Ashley was our tour guide and his relaxed way of sharing wonderfully interesting historical facts about the city was delightful! The tour itself is not overly strenuous and covers almost all of the key areas in the city. I highly recommend this Mike's Bike Tours!

A 'must do' while in Amsterdam. We did the country tour with Carl who was brilliant - he was very entertaining and informative. We were with my 17 year old son and his friend and they thoroughly enjoyed it. I would definitely recommend this for families with teenagers. It was really nice to see Amsterdam from the countryside too - it gives a completely different perspective to Amserdam.

Fun day out on wheels. My finance and I decided after several days of taking in Amsterdam city by foot to take up the challenge of Mike's country bike tour. It was our last day, and we were both super-happy did this.Our guide Carl was great - really friendly, included the whole group in his stories (all 18 of us), and quite funny too. We had a lovely time biking through the country, checking out a local cheese farm, where the family also make clogs and a stop at a windmill. The best part for me though was just seeing quite a different side to Amsterdam - the parks and countryside.As long as you can ride a bike I would highly recommend the tour. It was my favourite part of our trip and worth every euro.

Excellent to learn amsterdam. We have enjoyed Mike's Bike tour during our first day in Amsterdam. It is perfect to get a quick overview of the city, and to plan your further visits. We had a big group (19 people), but our guide Carl made the best of it. Well-spend money.If you do the tour with children, be aware that the tour crosses the red light district.

A one night stand with Mike's Bikes.. We were greeted by friendly and energetic staff at 12pm on the dot. Mike (a.k.a Egg) gave an informative talk on the history of Amsterdam. He managed to clear up some questions that myself and my partner had been pondering before we had even asked. Our guide Ashley was entertaining, funny and interesting. The tour took us round all the major attractions of the city. It was a really good way to orientate ourselves without the inevitable hassle of getting lost. The ride was about 3hours but very managable for all the people on the tour (one girl managed to knock off her chain and fall off her bike in the space of half an hour but Ashley came to her rescue). I would highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting the city it is well worth the money.

Excellent Tour, a must for those who want to do more in Amsterdam. Took the country bike tour on a cloudy late march day, had Claude as our tour guide, and had a great time. In total, you bike about 22 km through the city and then into the countryside and then back through the city, all in about 3.5 hours. The tour was not difficult or strenuous and I saw that some older couples (mid to late 50s) didn't have a problem with the distance at all, mainly due to the Netherlands being flat. The cheese and clog farm was amazing, probably the best thing on the tour. Claude did well pointing out different things as we biked along, and kept a good pace throughout the tour. I plan on doing another Mike's tour when I get to Munich or other places they have them. They are well worth the price and give you a much more in-depth view of your surroundings than if you were sitting on a bus or in a canal boat. Riding is made very easy by new 'american' bikes which were enjoyable. I'd say that this was probably the highlight of my trip to amsterdam and I would def. do it again.

Highlight of our trip to Amsterdam!. This was the highlight to our trip! We showed up at Mikes at 11am like the website said to (no reservation) and we were the only ones! Maybe because it was a cool and cloudy day, but it worked out in our favor because the smaller the group the better. We decided on the country tour. Our guide Ashley was very laid back and did a good job teaching us about Amsterdam along the bike ride. We got on our bikes and rode through the city and made a couple stops along the way. I was a little wobbly at first, but did ok, didn't run into anybody! it's totally flat here so no worries if you are not in shape, its a very leisure ride. We rode out to the country side, took some pictures at a Windmill, and then stopped at a farm and some tasted cheese and saw how clogs were made! Got to meet a 2 week old baby cow too! We bought some cheese here to take home as gifts and it is really yummy cheese! On the ride back we stopped at a cafe and had a beer :) We just had so much fun, and really got to see some cool stuff. I would recommend doing these tours early on in your trip to get a feel of the city and to become more comfortable riding a bike before you go off on your own! So happy we did this tour!!
Super!. Love this tour! Beautiful scenery, cool tour guide! Definetly do it again!

Bike tour, March. My husband and I went on a Countryside bike tour with Ashley. We both highly recommend the tour, which takes you quickly out of the city and onto some fantastic roads. We visited a cheese/clog-making farm, had a delicious lunch and had great company with other travellers.

aaron is one cool guy. went on girls weekend to Amsterdam and as we had done similar tour in Florence last year thought bike tour was ideal way to find locations in Amsterdam.This was amazing even more so than one in Florence. Aaron had us in stitches from first few minutes of meeting and three hours wizzed by.Only disappointment was we didnt have time to do the countryside tour the following day.Best £16.00 ever spent.Thoroughly recommend.

Good introduction to Amsterdam. Undertook a bike tour on the day we arrived...a Friday. Glad we didn't leave it to the weekend as it was far busier and we thought the bike tour helpful to get your bearings and some useful tips...ie where to buy the best chocolates, for those of you wanting to partake, the best coffeeshop.Guide informative, group a little too large...18 of us! and a little chilly, but definitely worth doing.4 hours for 19 euros, not bad value!

Very good.. Took this tour with my wife back in august,our guide who was a canadian guy called pete was full of info and had some great humour.the bike tour was at a average pace and the bikes we used very good.cheese farm was quite good, saw clogs made and free cheese tasting.Take a drink with you and you can also buy a beer or two at the cheese and clog making farm.you also ride back throught the vondelpark.Very good bike tour and not a hill in sight.

100% reccommended. My Dad and I went on both the Countryside tour (with Carl) and the City tour (with Stuart) and we had the best time, the bike tours were definately the highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. The bikes were very comfortable and easy to ride, we liked them so much we hired them for the rest of our stay.

BEST EXPERIENCE OF THE TRIP. I went with my school May 2010. We were there 8 days and it was the best part of the trip. Get Pete for the tour he is so funny. I had to stop riding because my stomach hurt from laughing. I would go back if I went back to Amsterdam
firendly and helpfull. great day out on the bikes for 10 euros, the best way to get about Amsterdam!

Such a fantastic day!!. When researching some of the things to do in Amsterdam, Mike's Bike Tours sounded interesting. After having read all the tripadvisor reviews, I was convinced that this would be the perfect day out for our family. We have a 15, 12 and 10 year old and they had no problems at all on the bike ride. Pip our tour guide was extremely knowledgable and gave us just the right amount of information about all the sights we visited. He has a great personality and really made our day special. We did the Countryside BikeTour as we had already walked around the city and wanted something different. For a family of 5, the cost was very reasonable and was real value for money. We especially liked the idea of visiting a windmill, cheese and clog factory. We saw cheese being made and got to sample lots of different types of beautiful Dutch cheese. The clog making process was very interesting, the kids watched on in amazement. Since you have the chance to buy things at the gift shop, ie. cheeses, clogs, t-shrits, mugs etc, don't forget to take some cash as none of our credit cards worked in the shops machine. Think a lot of people get caught out on this and end up not buying things!!! We were lucky and ended up borrowing money and paying it back after the bike tour. Our family had such a fantastic day, none of us wanted to get off the bikes as we didn't want it to end. Thanks so much Pip, we will remember this bike tour forever.

Fun and funny english language bike tour around core of Amsterdam. Our tour guide was Carl, who I think has a background in performance or standup, because he kept us laughing the whole tour. We enjoyed the tour very much and learned some. Cycling in the core of Amsterdam can be a little chaotic, especially in a tour group, but it was more than manageable for the novice urban cyclists in our group, and it's quite safe given the extensive cycle track network.No general topic cycle tour is going to give you enough information if you expect a PhD dissertation on politics or recent history, but this was one of the better-informed cycle tours we have gone on in a few European cities. It's enough to orient you to the city and take in a few sites that you might not have gone on, plus you're on a bike, which is very fun!

Pete was great on the countryside tour!. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Pete, who is funny and full of facts about Amsterdam. A bright dude. We went on the countryside tour and loved the cheese farm, relaxing pace and gorgeous scenery. Highly recommend this tour to anyone going to Amsterdam!

Great introduction to the city. My girlfriend and I decided to take a city tour on our first day in Amsterdam to basically get our bearings of the city and hear a bit of history. Even though the weather wasn't perfect we decided to head out and have fun anyway. There was only 3 of us on the tour which I thought was a good thing. The tour guide - Carl - made the history introduction fun and easy to understand and left us with a good knowledge of how Amsterdam came to be. The 3 hour tour went by really quick, as there was so much to see. Carl did an amazing job at explaining each stop and giving us easy hints how to find places if we were to head back at another time. Overall, even though it wasn't the best weather for it, the tour was definitely the most ideal start for out trip to Amsterdam. P.s bring gloves! We didn't and our hands were freezing.

Great way to see the countryside. My boyfriend and I had an amazing time on Mike's Bike Tour. We did the countryside tour which starts in the city, stops at a couple places and then all of a sudden you're in the beautiful Amsterdam countryside. The windmill we stopped at was pretty and we had plenty of time to take photos and stretch. The cheese and clog farm we stopped at was great. The farm owners were hilarious and the cheese (which I bought a lot of) was deliciously creamy and they give out free samples. The guide took us around to many pretty spots and I really got to see the beauty in the outskirts of the city.One of the reasons this was such a fun tour was our tour guide, Karl. He was awesome. If you get Karl you are guaranteed a good time.For those of you traveling with boys who are not so psyched about bike tours - before we went on this tour my boyfriend was less than excited to go because he thought it would be lame. He ended up loving it and even told his friends how good it was when we got home. This ended up being one of our favourite things we did in Amsterdam (Heineken Brewery and Canal Dinner Cruise were the other two - which you should also do!).If you like beer (and really, who doesn't?), I suggest offering to be the person who rides at the back and makes sure no one lags behind, because you'll get a free beer at the cheese and clog farm. My boyfriend was very happy to have volunteered :)
brilliant. great guide, great tour, a bit different to shopping and drinking.. lovely afternoon - 4hour country tour - 22euro, good value and good fun
A really great way to see Amsterdam and spend an afternoon. Everything about the Tour was excellent, particularly the guide. I loved the bubbles...

Loved it!. As a roadie, I really wanted to taste cycling in Amsterdam so I showed up for the noon ride on a cloudy, cold day, which did not seem to bother any of the locals. Joined by a couple of Ausies and three UK-ers, our guide Pit fitted us with Townies and on we went exploring Amsterdam he nourished us with educational information about the city's history, culture, cycling manners, etc. Just like the other reviews on this site, the excursion exceeded my expectations and I recommend it wholeheartedly regardless of your level of cycling. Note: don't bother bringing along your helmet as you'll be the ONLY ONE wearing one, like I was, unless it is your personal preference.
Mikes Bike Tour was awesome!. A fantastic way to see the city, with a knowledgable and fun guide. Thanks guys!

Wonderful ride through Amsterdam and into the countryside - one of the highlights of our trip. We had a fun tour guide on our country-side bike trip outside of the city. You go to kind of a silly touristy cheese/clog far, but in any case, it was nice not to have to worry about directions as we just followed our guide through the city, along canals into the peaceful countryside.

Excellent excursion !!. We took the Countryside bike tour and it was awesome !! Everyone should sign up for this!! Pete, our guide was jovial, well informed and gave us detailed briefings on the places we passed by. I loved the cheese and clog factory and this was a great treat. To those who love cheese, do buy the cheese in the factory as its really good. Another value added advantage to these tours is that one can rent the bicycles for a cheaper rate upon completing the tour. Its a good way to spend a day at Amsterdam ! My only complaint is that I wished the pace of the Bicycle tour was a bit slower! ( but that's only me, everyone else seemed to cope just fine).

The true flavour of Amsterdam. Good fun and informative tours of Amsterdam, but the nicest thing is the sheer pleasure of biking around the canals and admiring the architecture. Something for everyone on this tour (and you'll have to try it to see what I mean!!!).

Not to be missed, relaxing pace and informative. Enjoyed a bike tour in Paris ( Bike About Tours) and was recommended to try Mikes Bike Tours in Amsterdam rain, hail or shine. Well rain and hail it did, and despite the lack of sun shine, we thoroughly enjoyed the indepth history provided by our easy going and friendly tour guide - Peter, and the comfortable journey from the city to the lush country side. We stopped at various points along the route including a traditional windmill, and a quaint cheese and clog making factory. If you're after an easy paced tour with an experienced and friendly team, I highly recommend Mike's Bike Tours. This was my 2nd bike tour in Europe, and if you can ride a bike, skip the tour buses and join a bike tour instead.

Wet N Wild. Had a great time in the hail, wind and ofcourse heavy rain on the Amsterdam countryside bike tour today. Pete was an excellent tour guide and he was very informative on local customs and history, telling us all about why and how we see the scenery before us.The tour was good value for 22 euros which included a free poncho and on a nicer day would have been more leisurely for all. The Cheese tasting and Clog making were well worth seeing and it provided a break from the cold & wet. It was very good fun and I would highly recommend this activity whilst in Amsterdam.

Terrific experience, even in the rain!. Signed up for the tour on a rainy day in Amsterdam. Karl was a terrific guide, touring around the city and showing us the sites from the "ground level". We especially enjoyed the experience as it helped get us comfortable riding bikes in the city. Excellent and would ride with them again!

City Bike Tour was excellent.. even in the rain!. A friend and I did the city bike tour starting at 4pm. Staff were friendly and the guide was great. She told us a lot of interesting facts and also had a great sense of humor! Near the end of our tour (Last 30 minutes) it started raining pretty heavily, but this didn't ruin our ride! All bikes had pouches with very protective raincoats so that no one got wet. I personally think bike tours are a great way to experience any european city - but in amsterdam it's definitely a must! Also, bring your student card for a 2 euro discount!! :)

Great way to see the city. Just did the afternoon tour. Starts at 4 and goes around the city. Lasts about 3 hours. Guide was Pip who provided great info and insight on what the town has to offer and see. Would do the country tour if had the time.

Ride a Bike in Amsterdam, everyone's doing it.... If you haven't seen affinity the Dutch have for bikes when visiting Amsterdam then your not in Amsterdam. Mike's Bike Tour was recommended to us when we rode with Fat Tire Bike Tours in Berlin. We were so glad we followed that recommendation since we had a fabulous time.
