Dad is a runner and mom aspires to get more exercise, never broke a sweat. The 11 year old's only complaint was that Stuart went too slow! Even with Amsterdam's liberal views on marajuana and prostitution, any references sailed right over the heads of the children. We were in a group of about 12 or so, and except for one part were we were cycling into the wind, we stayed in the front of the pack to keep up with our kids. The few stops were welcome but did not drag on. The kids really thought the farm was the highlight, free cheese, and then some purchased for later. Ask the 9 year old, who by the way , rang her bike bell constantly, her favorite memory, she loved that Stuart ( our guide) told us about the newborn calf in the barn. She spent much of her farm visit watching and petting the newborn.Nice history and references without over doing. Stuart had to talk fast a few times due to very dark and ominous clouds... During the last serious weather burst,Stuart had us dash under a bridge for cover from the rain and sleet! Then the skies cleared and we lingered back to Mike's Bikes!They never even asked our names when we showed up, then payed at the very end. A full 4 hours, not all of it cycling. Thanks! We had a great time!

A "Must Do" during any trip to Amsterdam.. Went on this trip on Wednesday 10th March (my birthday). There were only 5 in total on the tour but Egg was an incredibly knowledgeable and interesting guide. A great way to see the city, a brilliant way to re-introduce yourself to cycling. The day was freezing so always take gloves, scarf and hat unless it is the height of summer. Makes the beer and tequila you use to help defrost yourself all the more enjoyable.

Cheap Rentals after tour. We went on the coutry tour, which was fun and we would definately recomend. They rent bikes at half price after you've been on the tour. The bikes they rent are different than the ones they tour with. I preferred the rental bikes, but that's because I have coasting (backpedal) brakes at home. I think they also have handbrake geared bikes for rental too. Biking is the best way to get around amsterdam!

A must do in Amsterdam!. I did Mike's Countryside Bike Tour and it was a highlight of my trip to Western Europe. The ride is not strenuous but just a little nerve wracking as you have to navigate the city a bit first before you head out into the countryside. You feel like a native of Amsterdam by the end of the ride! The scenery is beautiful and the guide will add a ton of great info about the city and the country. It was approx. 20 kms roundtrip.

Take this tour!!. Great tour. my wife and i took the day countryside tour. they take you south through amsterdam and very quickly into the countryside. first you see a windmill, and then you are off to a clog and cheese factory. (very good cheese!!). our guide then took us through the beautiful back roads and countryside. the tour takes about 4 hours, but it flew by! our guide would stop from time to time to point out interesting facts about amsterdam. the main office is located near the main tourist area. very comfortable and easy going staff. they make you feel confident in their abilities and don't rush you through the tour. take comfortable clothes. dontworry about rain, as they provide rain gear. definitely worth the price of admission.

The only way to get around is by Bikes, so much fun!!. We have just got back from Amsterdam and had a great time! It is true that the only way to get round is via bike and they accommodate so much better than the UK do.We found Mike's Bike's in Amsterdam and they were great! They not only had cheaper prices than anywhere else in Amsterdam, they provided bikes that match your outfit, style or riding!We were only meant to hire a set of bikes for a few hours then ended up having them the whole trip!Would so recommended, and if you don't like it you can pay by the hour!

Great Fun - A Must Do!. My wife & I just returned from a 2 week vacation in Amsterdan & Germany. We did a 3 1/2 hour city bike tour through Mike's Bike Tour. It was great and a lot of fun. Frankie was our guide and he's a riot. Age should not be a concern as our group ranged in age from 25 to 70 years old and everyone had a wonderful experience. The cost was reasonable and worth the experience

Great way see the countryside of Amsterdam. We spent 2 days in Amsterdam. On the 2nd day we showed up for the 4 hour Countryside Bike Tour and Petra was our guide. She was funny the entire time and I seriously think she really enjoys the frills of Amsterdam, just kidding, we love you Petra.The tour was pretty cool and spent some time in the city, through Vondel Park, out through Amsterdam Bos Forest, and then to the countryside. The stop at the cheese/clog factory was great. The people there gave an interesting account of making cheese and clogs. They also seemed to enjoy poking fun at the different tourists. Happy girl with the Big Smile from America and Happy girl from Australia LOL. It was a nice experience plus there was beer available and some free cheese samples. We liked the experience. On the trip home we stopped by the windmill and took some interesting pictures. Petra offered to take a picture was was also nice.The ride back into Amsterdam was a little more exciting since more cars and locals were out plus it started to drizzle most of the trip back. I recommend this to anyone who wants to see something outside the proper city of Amsterdam.

The highlight of our Amsterdam visit!. We took the countryside tour. It was nice to get out of the city for a while. It was an easy ride too. I hadn't ridden a bike in about 10 years and did just fine.

The highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. We did the Countryside Tour which is one of several tours on offer. It's a great way of getting out of the city (as lets face it you can cover the city by foot or boat anyway). The tour is run daily, starting at 11am and lasting about 3 hours (approx 18 miles). It's very reasonably priced too at 22 euros per person (remember to take cash as they do not accept credit cards). The tour is not at all strenuous and most of it is on quiet cycle paths and countryside roads which are all very flat! You get to see a traditional Dutch windmill and visit a cheese farm which also makes clogs. There is also the opportunity to sample and buy some cheese/clogs/souvineers and more!The highlight of the tour has to be the tour guide who was quite simply hilarious! He was very knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam, and kept us all entertained with his numerous and humerous stories about his country. He had a bit of Gene Wilder about him too which added to the amusement!I'd highly recommend this tour if you want to spend a couple of hours away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre.

Amsterdam the way it was meant to be seen!. Mike's Bike Tours is one of the best things you could do as a first time visitor to Amsterdam. The tour starts with a little bit of history of the city, its founding, the problems it had to deal with, and how it evolved to become what it is today. The bike tour is not demanding physically and in fact you will hardly break a sweat! The tour guide was very knowledgeable and extremely friendly, willing to adjust and tailor the tour to the liking of the group. All in all, the tour lasted about 3 hours, including all the stops we made in the various part of Amsterdam. You also get a 50% off voucher if you're interested in renting a bike to tour on your own, an option I highly recommend!This was my second visit to Amsterdam and my first time cycling throughout the city. I must say, I covered much more ground and got to see quiet a bit more biking than I did walking, and at the end of the day, I did not feel half as tired. No wonder all of the Netherlands cycles! I highly recommend it!

The best thing to do in Amsterdam. After a few days (or maybe hours) in Amsterdam, I was really tired of walking the canals with the other tourists, consulting my map, avoiding getting hit by a bike while trying to walk around the hoards of tourists who seemed to just stop in the middle of the sidewalk. So, I decided to go on Mike's Bikes countryside tour.The tour was great. It had been a while since I'd ridden a bike and I'm turning 50 soon. Safe to say I'm not in the best shape I've ever been in. The tour was fun, interesting and the ride was easy. We rode through the city, getting a little bit of history on the way until we rode along the dyke on the Amstel River, visited a windmill and finally a farm and wooden shoe factory.The whole trip was a blast, the scenery was gorgeous and the trail network was just mind-blowing.The best part of the whole thing was that I was able to rent a bike for a week at 1/2 price because I had taken the tour. Now I have a bike and a map and plan to get out of the city as much as I can.I don't know about the other bike rental companies, but my experience with Mike's Bikes has been outstanding. There are really good people working there. They are helpful and friendly and they know what they are doing. And the tour guide was full of information and kept us entertained.Two thumbs up for Mike's Bikes Tours.

my butt still hurts...... but we had a great time. Crazy getting out of the centre of the city of Amsterdam but once away from the cars,trams and commuters,It was a very nice bike ride.Our guide Steve was very knowlegable about Amsterdam and the Nederlands in general and was also quite funny!The mountains (canal bridges) were tough to get up if you didn't get a running start or in the wrong gear and the whole time our guide was always keeping an eye out for his charges.A bright red teeshirt at the rear in the guize of Roy,was a big help! as we made our way to the country,we saw most unusual living quarters and so really beautiful farming lands.The cheese farm we visited was a tourist stop but heck,,,thats why we were there and with some wooden shoes and acouple of rounds of gouda we were off and pumpin.This trip includes a few breaks,one being at a windmill that was quite beautiful and a stop in Vondel Park for more information from our guide.Then back to town for the mad dash to our starting point.All in all it was a very lovley experiance,one anybody should do if they go to Amsterdam. Mike's Bikes...A+ Thanks for the memories! Rick from Jersey!

Amazing ride, excellent guide. The bike ride was the most enjoyable part of my stay in Amsterdam and i think a major reason is because the guide Shaun was great. He's funny, knowledgeable and has plenty of interesting stories to share during stops, so the only way to have him tell more stories is to hope more people in the group have punctured tyres!The countryside is such a lovely cycling trail, paved cycling paths, river on one side and beautiful dutch houses on the other. The windmill is a great place to take pictures and i thought the chesse and clog farm was very interesting. Not much other opportunities to take pictures except at stops but its sufficient just to enjoy cycling past the countryside and taking everything in. And of course, asking Shaun lots of questions from the history of Europe to how the windmill works to nice places to get Dutch food.

Loved it!. We loved this tour. We chose the countyside tour and arrived just on time. Our guide was originally from Canada and did a great job. Unfortunately I can't remember his name. There were about 15 in the group my husband, because he is tall, was chosen to bring up the rear and make sure no one got lost. That was fine by me as we could go at our own pace. The bikes were great, easy to manoeuvre and with saddle bags to handle our sweaters & water bottles. The tour is billed at 4 hours but it was about 40 minutes before we even left the bike garage. We stopped at the Magre Brug for a little history on Amsterdam, then biked out through the countryside on gorgeous paved trails along the dykes. Biking in the city was a little intimidating at first, but once we got into the countryside it was calm and lovely. We stopped at a windmill where tour busses dropped of groups as well. Had a few pics and a little more history of the area, then on to the cheese & clog farm. There was a bathroom and our guide offered us all a beer for €1, then we went inside. It seemed like a humble little family operation at first. They gave us a demo on cheesemaking and a little sample, then showed us clog making. Then we were led into the store which was huge and had tons of tacky Dutch souvenirs, clogs and cheese. We did buy a bit (cash only) and then we were on our way again. We biked through more dykes, farmland and canals full of houseboats, then back into the city and through Vondelpark, which is lovely. We aren’t in top shape but weren’t too exhausted after 3 hours of riding. I thought it was good value at €22 per person. But we had forgotten to have breakfast and there was no stop for lunch so we were starving by the time it was over. Also had spent all our cash at the clog/cheese factory so had to pay by credit card which was no problem.Highly recommended for great scenery.

Bike Amsterdam is the way to do it!. I went on the Countryside Bike Tour. Overall I had a great time, the ride was good, so were the bike and safety enroute, a good experience. Good route choice departing and arriving back to Amsterdam city. Amazing how quick we had the city behind us and the infrastructure of the bike lanes very impressive. Mikes shop in Kerkstraat is excellent for location and decor. I think what I personally was a little disappointed with was the too long stop at the windmill factory where we were presented with how to make Dutch cheese and clogs! And then led into a showroom to buy samples of it all. Here the ike tour lost a little of "bike experience" in my book and became just like another sight-seeing tour. This stop was far too long as well. Maybe also a few more stops enroute would suit the tour - the guide, "Egg", seemed to know lots more than he shared around on the day. But all up: A recommendable excursion - just bring a little patience while being parked at the touristy clogs/cheese windmill.

A Different Side of Amsterdam. After reading reviews, a friend and I decided to take the Countryside Bike Tour. We appreciated the fact that reservations were not necessary. We simply showed up at the address on their website (Kerkstraat # 123) at 11:00am and we were accommodated. Approximately 40 people showed up for the tour and there were two guides, so there were 20 bikers in each group. Although this may seem like a large group, the guides were great at making sure no one got lost or was left behind.The tour is about 18 miles long, but do not let this deter you from taking the tour. I am by no means an expert bike rider. In fact, I would probably describe myself as an inexperienced, accident prone bike rider, and I both survived and enjoyed the tour. Although the beginning of the tour takes you through busier streets with cars and other bikers, 90% or more of the tour is on deserted or isolated countryside roads (hence the name of the tour), where there is little risk of getting hit by a car or another biker, or falling into a canal, etc. Petra was our tour guide and she was an absolute delight. She was informative, enthusiastic, and fun. You can tell that she really enjoys her job, which leads to an enjoyable experience for all on her tour. The tour included official stops at a windmill and a cheese and clog farm. Some unofficial stops included a lake, a park, a Picasso, and a stop along the road to taste some berries. The bike ride is peaceful, and you will have the opportunity to see cows, horses, parks, families having picnics, canals, trees, etc. I would recommend that you give your camera to the most experienced bike rider in the group (someone who can simultaneously ride his or her bike and take pictures). At the end of the tour, everyone pays for their tour. It is 22 Euros per person and 19 Euros if you are a student or senior. If you have ANY student identification card, they will honor it and give you the discount. Just don't forget to bring it with you!I highly recommend this tour to anyone. It is a nice contrast to the Red Light District and the coffee shops. Enjoy!

Mike's Bike Tour was the highlight of our visit to Amsterdam!. You cannot visit Amsterdam without taking advantage of this fabulous bike tour! Our first day there we signed up for the tour -- it's a full 2 1/2- 3 hours so you really get to know Amsterdam and what is worth seeing.... and totally get your money's worth. It sets you up for the rest of your stay in the City so you know you're way around. You must try to request Pete for your guide-- he is a blast...funny, knowledgeable and one cool dude!. Recommend highly!!!

Great time!. This was the highlight of our Europe tour. We had so much fun biking through the countryside with Pete. The whole purpose of the trip is to enjoy the countryside and make a few scheduled stops, which is exactly what we did. The cheese factory was cool and I highly recommend the smoked gouda. I bought some and lugged it around the rest of Europe for a month. It was well worth the effort to bring that fabulous cheese home.

Average. Unfortunately this tour was more of a person leading you around Amsterdam/Amstel area than a 'guided tour'. Its a great way to get out of the city (is only in the city for about 20 mins - with one stop to be told something). Its great to get on a bike and get out into the countryside and see all the house boats. City forrest is also beautiful to ride through. Our guide was terrible though. If you get there and have a choice of tourguides - DO NOT go with the girl with dreadlocks, I think her name was Patrice. She was the worst tourguide i have come across. She was patronising and false when talking about things.I've been on 2 Mikes Bikes tours before and had a blast - so it really does come down to your guide.In saying that - its an easy stressfree way of going for a long ride around amsterdam area - just dont expect to find out anything new about what you might be looking at.Ps. No chance for photostops (except at the windmill).

great time exploring the countryside. guide was great and friendly, we all enjoyed the trip. first take you along the many canals in amsterdam, then slowly into the countryside, a stop at the windmill then into the farm where they make cheese and clogs. smoked cheese was fabuloous! after which, i thought the tour was a bit draggy and my sore butt wasn't helping after 3 over hours!:) nevertheless, a great bike tour, had fun!

Didnt get a chance to go, they changed the time!. Im sure the tour would have been great, however after pre-booking us on one of our party rang the day before to confirm and they had moved the tour from 10am to 4pm and cancelled the combined boot tour, thanks!! There were 19 of us so we needed to book something in advance to ensure we got a booking. We booked something else at late notice and it wasnt great, thanks mikes bikes, great help!!!! This was one of the things that everyone was looking forward to! There are loads of bike tours in Amsterdam, I would suggest to anyone to try these first!!

Good Time. We booked our tour through www.expedia.com and were able to trade our vouchers in for tickets once we arrived. We were a little confused at first because we were told to meet in front of the Museum Shop from Expedia, but no one ever met us there. We got to Mike's though and caught up with the group during a safety briefing. We went as a group of 5 and had a pretty good time. We got to see a windmill, cheese factory and clog factory plus see some of the stuff outside the city. I was a little disappointed because I thought we were going to get to see more of the city itself, but instead you ride through a lot of parks. Overall, our guide was very knowledgeable, it was well-priced, and we had a good time. Just make sure you bring food along or eat before hand because there's no time to stop for food!

Great Bike tour. The bike tour is extremely entertaining would definitely recommend it. The country tour does not cover as much of the city as they claim. A good 1.5 hour is spent in silence riding to and from the farm house, the farm tour is excellent but the souvenirs there are over priced. The same souvenirs are available throughout the city for half the price- (IE mini clog bank 5euros vs 10euros). The ride is not as easy as they claim- atleast half of our group would not be able to make it over canals without walking their bikes. Does not include a canal tour as some have claimed on this forum. Would recommend it though.

A Must-Do even if the weather's bad!. Went on the Countryside Tour with a group of 5 others in late April and despite the rainy weather, we all had an amazing time! Not having been on a bike for years, and coming from a country that's driving on the wrong side of the road, I expressed my concerns to Petra, our guide about not being able to keep up with the rest. Petra was extremely reassuring and the rest of the group members were also kind enough to keep a lookout for me in case I fall behind. Petra gave us a brief history of the Netherlands before we started out on the tour proper - in typical Dutch humour which I totally enjoy and appreciate. It was tough trying to scale the first slope in the city, but I gradually got the hang of changing gears when a slope is approaching and was able to maneuver through the streets of Amsterdam rather successfully by the end of the tour!As others have mentioned, the tour first arrived at a windmill for some photo ops and then on to a cheese and clog factory. It wasn't even the thrill of seeing a windmill or sampling the famed Dutch cheeses that made this tour so amazing. It was simply the joy of cycling in the midst of the beautiful landscape of Amsterdam and into the countryside, where ducks waded and beautiful tulips abound. The fact that it was raining actually made the cycling even more pleasurable. It felt so refreshing to be out there on a bike in the drizzle with raindrops pelting onto your face - even though we were all craving for a hot chocolate at the end of the tour because of the cold.Since we were a small group, it wasn't too difficult for us to keep speed with one another. Petra had this really bright orange daisy on her bike - so you can always see her from afar and know you're not following the wrong bicycle. On top of that, she stopped often and made sure that every member of the group was present before we rode on.It was seeing Amsterdam in an atypical manner - witnessing the beauty of nature at its best by weaving right through it - instead of merely looking at it through the windows of a tour bus. We had some extra time left towards the end of the tour and headed to Vondelpark where Petra amused us yet again with stories of the Dutch's liberal laws (apparently sex in the park is legal!). We also saw The Fish, a Picasso sculpture at Vondelpark and then cycled through Leideseplein before we headed back to the shop to return our bikes. By then, I was already a relatively accomplished cyclist who was capable of handling the many slopes of Amsterdam!

A great way to get out of the city!. Trivia: There are more bikes in Amsterdam than there are people. So if you want to participate in the local transport, then head over to Mike's Bikes. Now, we're no Lance Armstrong, but we're casual bike riders. The countryside tour that we took was 3.5 hours long, and even our biking butts were sore at the end. It's not strenuous if you're in shape, but if you think 45 minutes straight on a bike might be too much, then I'd reconsider. :)There are several options at Mike’s Bikes. You can just rent a bike for a day (be sure to lock both the wheels and the body, as even Rick Steves had his bike stolen, and he's a travel wiz!) or you can join a bike tour. Mike's Bikes has a new (2009) city tour of Amsterdam, or there is the countryside tour. I was intimidated just walking among all the bikes in the city (and avoiding the people ringing their bells at me) so we chose to venture a bit outside the city limits on the countryside tour, which takes you to a windmill and a cheese and wooden shoe farm. The countryside tour is led by a guide, and ours (Shawn) was well-informed, if only slightly haughty in his professorship of us. My complaints about the tour would be these:1. I think the size of the group was too large. We had about 15 bikers, and when you’ve got that many people in a single file line, the chances of all 15 making it across a busy intersection before the light changes is not good. I found myself in that situation quite a few times, where half of the group was light-years ahead and the other half stopped by a light. I was concerned that we would lose the guide and be stranded where we didn’t know where we were. He did stop and wait for us each time, but I still would’ve preferred a smaller group.2. I'm a photo hound. I wanted more picture stops. With the group size situation mentioned above, I was scared to stop and shoot for fear that I would get lost.The cheese shop (and the free samples) was amazing, and I made an impulse cheese buy and also bought a pair of wooden shoes. Because it was a sunny Amsterdam day, we biked the long way home (which I did standing up, because I was so sore!). We came back through Beatrix Park as well as Vondel Park, which was beyond crowded thanks to the nice weather. Make sure you know what the people in your group look like, or you may end up following another biker another place!Of my top Amsterdam activities, I'd place this as number 2 - with number one being a canal tour. So I'd say that's a pretty good recommendation!

Mike's Bike Tour..... My mom, aunt, and I took the city tour of Amsterdam last weekend. It was a blast!!! My aunt is not use to biking and only fell over once - minor scrapes thank goodness! Trying to navigate the trams, pedestrians, and thousands of other cyclists made the Bike tour challenging but very fun. The guides are very funny and give a good tour of Amsterdam. This tour is so much better than sitting in a boat listening to the commentary in 5 different languages.

Amazing tour guides, lots of fun, and beautiful scenery. I enjoyed the countryside bicycle tour so much that I stuck around for the city tour an hour after we got back. Pete really knows his stuff about Amsterdam, and has been living there for 20 years. Great fun, and I really enjoyed the things we saw, especially the beautiful countryside.

See more of Amsterdam. Our family took in the countryside bike tour (Shawn) and had a wondeful time. I have been to Amsterdam twice before and this was by far the most enjoyable activity. Our guide was knowledgeable, humourous and very accommodating. We got a chance to see a lot of Amsterdam that we hadn't viewed before.

Off the Beaten Path. It's fun exploring Amsterdam and it's vicinity by bike. The tour takes you to a windmill with tulips for photo ops, then continues along the countryside to a cheese and clog factory where you get to try some stinky cheese :) The rest of the trip rides you through some quaint areas of Amsterdam. This tour is good if you're looking for a quirky tour while in Amsterdam.

Fun Bike Ride. Had a great time on the Mike's Bike Tour. Our guide was funny, informative (and good looking). We had people of all ages and sizes on our tour and everyone had a great time and made it back in one piece.

Great day!. We took our almost 2 year old son on the Countryside Bike Tour and we all loved it. It is a very nice ride through town and out along a lovely bike path with a stop at a windmill for a photo op and a stop at a farm that makes cheese and clogs. The cheese was very tasty and we brought some home. The baby loved the trip and fell asleep towards the end. He was angry when he had to get off the bike and begged to ride every bike we passed until we flew home!The ride is not taxing if you are reasonably active. I play tennis 2 times a week and Spin at the gym about once a week and it was an easy ride, although I was more tired that evening as we chased the little guy around town. I would say it one of the highlights of Amsterdam for all of us. We did have nice weather, mostly sunny and about 7 degrees. Gloves are key on winter rides...

A MUST to do when you are in Amsterdam. I had been to Amsterdam without much planning and so I randomly signed up for Mike's Bike Tour because it's just two blocks next to my hotel. Out of my expectation, the bike tour was extremely exciting and fun, most importantly the cheapest and easiest way to travel around Amsterdam. Don't just limit traveling range within the city, Amsterdam is cool because of its scenery in the countryside.p/s: After the day I had my tour, me and my friend even repeated the same route on the next day to make sure we didn't miss out any nice spots.

VERY disappointed!. I went on this tour a couple months back on the suggestion of Tripadvisor reviewers. This was extremely disappointing and not at all what I expected. I bought the city tour that was supposed to have a canal ride. Most important point is, this tour is NOT fit for those who don't exercise regularly and/or are pretty fit. I'm in my late-20's and used to play sports regularly but haven't done anything too active for ~5 years now. I'm considered healthy & quite fit by my doctor. The biking for this tour felt like I did a marathon. I sorta did, since my tour was 3-4 hours long of almost continual biking on not entirely flat terrain. So beware those who are out of shape, this is NOT for you!Another gripe: The canal didn't show up after my group had waited for about half an hour at the designated site. We were offered vouchers to take a free canal ride at another time. It was just a day trip for me, so I lost out on any canal ride, which I really wanted to do. Plus side is, they amended my fee & charged me the rate of the city tour without canal ride.Also, I guess this would be a good tour for those who don't want the touristy things & just want to go through neighborhoods & see "the real city". I was disappointed because most of what I saw or took pictures of were not recognizable to family & friends. Guess I wanted a more "touristy" tour.

Amsterdam in all its beauty!. This tour was definetly one of the highlights of my trip. This time of the year it starts at 11.00am in the museum quarter. U get a little hisory lesson from your guide and then you make your way through the streets of Amst to their bike shed where they size u up for a bike. I can't cycled a bike in years but this tour is not demanding. You cycle along canals, across the skinny bridge, down by the Amstel and then out off the city. U stop off at a windwill for group shots and then head on ur way through lovely suburbs until you come to a farm. This farm is run by a farmer who is great fun and speaks about 20 language!!! He shows u how he makes cheese and clogs and then u have a chance to do some tasting and some buying!! Then its back on your bike and back towards the centre and through Vondelpark. I did this tour on a sunny, cold day and it was beautiful, but it may be miserable on a rainy day. After the tour hit Leidesplein for some food.. its close to the bike shed and has lovely restaraunts.

Can't go wrong with either tour. We did the city tour on Saturday and loved riding around the city so much we kept the bikes for that evening to go to dinner and breakfast the following day. Since the City/boat Tour was fabulous, we also went on the Country Tour. The tour guides flood you with information and fun stories. They take you everywhere seeing everything. It was well worth the money.

the best tour ever!!. This is one of the best things we did in amsterdam!! I think everyone should go. The guide was very good and we learned a lot about the history and other intersting things about the city.The tour is very well put together, they help you select and adjust your bikes, they go at a very good pace (not too slow so you crash into each other and not too fast that you feel your getting left behind), the guide is very considerate of other cyclists and always make sure we don't block other people since we were a large group.On our trip we did a bike tours in berlin, brussels and amsteradam and this one is by far the best!! Also you get a very good deal on bike rental after the tour too!!!

best two things I did in Amsterdam. I took the country tour on a Saturday. This got me beyond what I could see on foot. Had a great talk with Pete, our guide. I bike a lot and found this to be a very easy ride, and I decided I wanted a bigger challenge. So I inquired about renting a bike for the day and asked for a suggested tour route. Mike recommended Marken Island - over 10 miles outside the city. I came back early Sunday, rented a bike for the day, rode to Marken and back -- along a dike, through rural trails, around the island. This was the absolute best thing I did on my visit to Amsterdam!I carried my camera, and my photos are here: http://flickr.com/photos/randycarey/sets/72157607773146531/Only regret is that Mike had only fat-tired bikes available, and this made my out-of-city trip more demanding physically.
Wonderful. Wonderful tour. A must do in Amsterdam. Our tour guide was wonderful and answered any questions we had. Easy bike ride and the cheese and shoe making farm was a fantastic top.

Fantastic fun experience. The tour was great. Our guide was informative and funny. I thoroughly enjoyed cycling in Amsterdam. My 11y daughter and I rented bikes to cycle with after the tour and had no problems.

A "MUST DO" Amsterdam experience!. We went to Amsterdam for 3 days in August 08, and this was the highlight of our visit (as well as the excellent Anne Frank museum). There is a choice of 2 tours, Bike and Boat tour, which concentrates more on Amsterdam town, and the Countryside tour, which we chose, as we wanted to see outside the city centre.We waited outside the Rijksmuseum, by the reflecting pool, and Sean duly turned up and gave us a quick potted, entertaining history of the Netherlands. Then a quick walk to the garage a few blocks away to collect the bikes. We saw an old 17th century windmill (occupied, so we kept a respectful distance!) and then onto a cheese/clog factory. The owner gave a very amusing chat about cheese and clogs, which cleverly persuaded you to buy some cheese to take home! (Garlic & herb cheese: delicious, but keep it in the fridge as the outside goes mouldy quickly!!) We cycled back past the Hilton Hotel where John Lennon & Yoko Ono did the "hair peace/bed peace" thing - writing on the window just about visible. Through Vondelpark, enjoying a drink and a sit down, before cycling back.Sean, our guide, was very knowledgeable, and very friendly. I liked the whole informal vibe of the set-up, ie enjoy the tour and pay at the end (to elicit more tips!!) Gives you a really good feel for the place. Waterproofs are provided, but maybe bring your own, as it often rains. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Great experience. My daughter and I did the Country tour with Mike's Bike and guide Pete. We enjoyed the experience thoroughly. Pete mixed in a good bit of history with a tour through the countryside.The cheese/clog stop was a bit touristy, but fun enough. We did purchase some cheese for a bike-picnic we did ourselves the next day.We also did a Mike's tour in Munich, and my daughter's done them in Paris and Barcelona (Fat Tire in these last two cities). I think they are always a worthwhile method of getting acquainted with a city (or countryside in this case).

Had a good morning ride. We took the bike tour with Mikes after reading trip advisor. We were a bit dubious because of the weather and our fitness. There was no need to worry , although the weather was threatening it didn't rain and the ease of the ride was great. Our guide was Sean , an American with dutch roots, and he was fantastic. His knowledge of Amsterdam both past and present was exceptional. We were lucky there were only 7 in our group, there is usually up to 20 and this made for a more intimate ride as we got to know the other riders. The ride was a highlight of our Amsterdam stay and would recommend it to any one of any age.
Good. We did the countryside tour. It was good to get some fresh air after flying. Its not far or fast, I hadn't been on a bike for years and managed okay. A thing to do on your first day.

Favourite Bike Tour. My sister and I visited Amsterdam last weekend, and whilst we were there we decided to do the Bike and Boat tour with Mikes bikes. It was absolutley excellent!!!!! The tour was great the canal cruise (which we enjoyed while having free beer and lunch) was a great way to see the city from another angle! Our tour guide (Pete) was fab really funny and infomative he made the whole day really excellent! All the guys at the shop were really friendly and helpful! It was a great trip and a bargain at 29 euro especially since the tour lasts approx 5 hours! Our tour was small only 11 people which made it even better!I would recommend this tour to everyone a fantastic way to see the city and meet new people on your travels! A must for all visitors! And remember to bring your camera!Ireland

Perfect way to see the city!. First time to Munich and this was the ideal way to see the city. We were only there for a few days and did not have much time to spare. Our guide was Franky and he was awesome. He was so entertaining and funny, all the while a wealth of historical information. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who is looking for a unique way to expereince Munich.

Highlight of Europe trip. I went on Mike's Bike tour while in Munich. I went as part of a large group and never would have known about this if I was traveling on my own-which would have been a huge regret because Mike's Bike tour was a highlight of my european vacation. Frankie was our tour guide and not only was he informative, but hilarious and fun. There were about 20 of us on the tour and he kept track of all of us and made sure we had a good time. I could think of NO better way to see Munich than this Bike tour. The tour is a few hours long and at a nice leisurely pace. Plenty of time for picture taking along the way and also as well as a pit stop in one of Munich's (and the world's) biggest beer gardens. I highly recommend this tour to anyone going to Munich! It was so much fun!

Great Tour. We took this tour during our two day visit to Amsterdam. It was a great way to see the city like a local. We met near the Rikesmuseum, walked over to their shop, got our bikes and started the tour. The guide told us a bit about road safety (though funny, none of us wore helmets, though on the other hand neither do any of the locals, which is odd to me as an avid road cyclist.) We toured around several parts of Amsterdam via roads and bike lanes. It felt safe at all times due to the bikecentric vibe in Amsterdam. We stopped at several points in the tour to talk about various points of interest. After touring the city a bit, we stopped at one of the windmills, talked a bit more about Amsterdam, took some pictures, and then proceeded on to the cheese farm / clog factory. Though the farm is a bit of a tourist spot as much as a working farm, it was interesting to see it. From there we proceeded back to Amsterdam, toured Vondelpark, stopped for a drink at a cafe, and then headed back to the shop. All in all it was a great way to see Amsterdam, move around like a local, and have a good time. The bikes were in great shape, and were overall good to ride. (though of course they are not as nice as our road bikes at home!) The bikes were Townie Electras which is a good brand with good components. Our group was 10 people plus the guide which was a great size for this tour. A few more would be okay, but no more than 20 which I think is their limit. They did not take our payments till after the tour. I would reccomend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam. As long as you can ride a bike you will have a great time.

A great way to see Amsterdam. I took the "bike & boat" tour with my 15 year old daughter on our 2nd day in Amsterdam. Our guide was Sean, an American who has lived in Amsterdam for 10 years. We were really lucky that there were only 5 people on our tour, (not the norm according to Sean. He said he usually has 15 0r 20 people). We rode around Amsterdam for about 2 hours, stopping here and there to learn about the history of the city. We both found it fascinating and very enjoyable. After the bike ride, we went on a leisurely canal boat ride, which although not "guided" was very relaxing and a fun way to see a lot of the city. Sean did continue to point out things of interest -- although mostly we just chatted with him and the others on the tour. The traffic in Amsterdam, both cars and bikes, is a little nerve racking, but the ride is slow enough and flat enough that anyone can do it.

Fantastic Tour. We did the Countryside tour which took us through the city and then out to a windmill and cheese/clog making farm. It was a fantastic tour. Our tour guide, Stuart, was very knowledgeable and a very nice guy. The tour was a fantastic way to see the city and the country and to also learn some history of Amsterdam. I highly recommend this tour and we will definitely be using these guys if we are in Amsterdam again.

excellent- a must in amsterdam. Had 5 days in amsterdam weather was perfect... sun beating down... no better way to see the city and countryside on this tour.The guys are imformative and very funny. canal and bike tour best way to go. Great day out and builds up a thirst for your heinken on the canal.crazy not to do it!!!!!!

Excellent!. A fantastic day out. A great way to see outside the city, very informative and lots of fun. The weather was beautiful so we got to see the countryside in all its glory. Our tour guide was Digby but unfortunately this was his last tour before going to Spain. Shaun seemed nice too and was passionate about A'dam, the people and history etc. They do a variety of tours so next time we shall be booking for the city tour as well

Great way for a fun and engaging tour! Great staff too!. I only heard about Mike's bikes here on tripadvisor the night before I was to fly. I sent an email and got a confirmation by the next morning on where to meet (which is on their website too). Easy!I was traveling alone in Amsterdam and met a few other very nice people in the group. I took the Sunday tour which takes shows you some of Amsterdam outside of the touristy area. It's stated as a 4 hour tour but it's worth the time. It's been a number of years since I rode a bicycle, but the ride was very easy. We saw the suburb areas where the average person lives and also saw some fancier neighborhoods. We rode through Vondelpark (like NY's Central Park but in Amsterdam), which is very nice especially since we had amazing weather (sunny, warm, breezy) for riding a bike. We went to a couple of windmills and a cheese and clog-making farm (seems a little touristy because a big busload of tourists arrived as we were leaving, but it was still fun - you can't really go to holland without seeing cheese and clogs!). At the second windmill, we stopped to get beer and all of us stood by the canal and hung out. Great times! I liked riding through the streets (almost like a local!) and seeing the other parts of Amsterdam besides the touristy museums, it made my visit more complete.I also have to say to that our guide, Pete, was wonderful! He was full of knowledge, before we left the meeting point, he gave us a quick highlights history of Amsterdam and while we were biking he would tell us stories about each area. I did not know anyone in amsterdam, so it was great to hear about what the locals think about their society, politics and the world. Also, I stupidly left my sunglasses in the bicycle pouch when I left and I only realized it when I was about to fly. I called them up when I got back to the united states and they had found it and kept it in lost and found. They are perfectly happy to make arrangements to have it sent back to me. All in all, Mike's Bike Tour is a great group of people and a fun tour!Btw, there's a student discount. If you show your student ID (I showed my american college id) you only pay 19euros, otherwise it's also worth everybit of 22euros!
Mike Bike Tour. Highly recommend. Great way to see countryside. Very helpful, friendly, knowledgable guide (Pete). All other staff very sweet and helpful. Good value would use again.

A Fun Day. This tour was fun! It's true, it does take you out of the city, along the canals and to a cheese/clog farm. I thought that was good, because it's easy to find Dam Square etc by yourself, you don't need a tour guide to show you. You get a good, long ride on the fun bike too! Despite the terrible wether the day I went, I had alot of fun! The tour guide, Mike, did seem completely disinterested though - just rattling off information like a machine. He seemed more interested in talking about the coffee shops...

I REALLY enjoyed it. I really enjoyed Mike's Bike Tour. The tour goes through the city and out into the countryside. You tour a cheese farm and clog factory --which is a little touristy, but still fun. The ride is fairly easy, but you must get used to the bike and car traffic.Our guide (Sean) was very knowledgable about the city and its history. He fielded questions about any imaginable topic, and made everyone feel comfortable. My bike "kitten" was a little old and abused, but seemed to fit in with the local style. I highly recommend this tour, as a way to see the city and learn its history.

The best bike tour in Amsterdam. When in Amsterdam, the only way that people get around is to ride a bike.If like me you are not used to riding a bike, I have not ridden for at least 25 years, and you want to have a go, then Mikes Bike Tours is the best way to do it.Not only do they make you feel at ease but you also get to see some of the wonderful countryside of Amsterdam that you wouldn't see yourself.I was quite nervous at first but they explain everything and when you get going its great.You get to go to a cheese farm, where you can sample the locally farmed Gouda cheese and also see them making clogs.Then you ride through the countryside some more and stop at a fabulous windmill.We would definitely recommend this bike tour and if you get Sean and Pete, well then you are made for the day.Also I forgot to mention that you stop for a beer or two.Have a great time.

Really great - informative & fun (& easy!). My boyfriend & I were a bit skeptical about this (after the reviews on here), but thought it might be fun. We went on a Winter Tour late Feburary (only runs Friday & Saturdays) Mike was there on arrival & was really friendly, as were all the staff. Our guide Shawn was possibly the most enthusiastic tour guide I have met. Usually I get irritated by the lack of real interest by tour guides & their ability to flee at the end of a tour or when you ask a question... or even not waiting for all the group before talking. My only problem here was I couldn't think of anything else to ask - dutch history, drugs, [--], wars, trading, politics, monarchy and of course bike riding.. all these topics & more were covered. We saw the cheese farm/clog factory (yes touristy, but fun, i mean I've never seen clogs made before! and was a working farm/factory - also nice to see a bit outside the main city), the Hilton (John & Yoko), rode through different districts in amsterdam with info given on each of them, Vondelpark, Beatrixpark, and rode down the road (!) that the Germans used to flee from Amsterdam. Great for an overview of Amsterdam, both historically & geographically ... and what better way to do that than on bikes! Before leaving we rented bikes (half price as we had been on the tour) and got some info on good places to go (villages outside amsterdam). Would recommend to anyone that can cycle & will definately be renting from Mike's Bikes next time we are there.

Waste of Time. This tour was a complete waste of time. You only see 2-3 sites within the city center before heading out to the windmill/cheese farm. The cheese farm is a complete tourist trap; it's obvious that they only care about selling Dutch shoes or cheese. In addition, I thought our tour guide was a bit rude, yelling at me to join the cheese tour when I was desperate for a drink. Do not waste your time with this tour if you only have a few days to see Amsterdam.

Love the bikes and people. Wow, can't believe that Mike's Bike got such a bad review. My experience there has always been fantastic.I've been going to Mike's Bike ever since they opened up next to the Hans Brinker Youth Hostel. The bikes are these fantastic Beach Cruiser style bikes with absolutely no signs on them screaming turist. and they charge one price for all bikes either with gears and hand brakes or the simple one speed backpeddle brake that I've personally fallen in love with. They have always treated me great and given me fantastic tips on where to go, what to see and which concerts and parties are going on. The staff there can be really funny and in winter time when they are not to bussy they'll take time out for a longer chat. I always bring my pasport to leave as a deposit because that is pretty standard in most bike rentals shop in Amsterdam as there is a lot of bike theft. I would deffinately recommend Mike's Bike as I love the bikes and service there!

Outstanding!. This was a fabulous day out in Amsterdam. The tour guide Benjamin was so knowledgable and so nice. Halfway through the tour it poured rain, so we had to pop into a cafe while it passed, but Benjamin extended our tour time to make sure we got to see everything. Definitely wear some comfortable shoes since there is quite a bit of walking, but it not strenuous at all.I was traveling solo and this was a perfect way to spend a morning getting familiar with the city and learning some history. I highly recommend booking a tour with this group - they are top-notch!

the best way to tour the city. Rob,you are the best guide we could expect to show us this amazing city.thanks for letting us know the city from the inside.we had a great time with you.thank you very much

Red light district tour with That Dam Guide. Mark was fabulous. The only tour company and guide to use. He is very knowledable about the district and we have a new respect for this area and the woman that work there.

Spectacular! 5 STARS . Wow. What a way to introduce ourselves to Amsterdam. During the first weekend of October, my husband and I went for my 30th birthday weekend and I knew straight away this was a special city break for us. Rob led a small group of 10, myself and husband included... all along the rivers and throughout the city. He was knowledgeable, entertaining and interesting. The 3 hours felt so relaxed and we were never rushed and any questions we had, Rob was always there to answer them. If you are thinking of going to Amsterdam, make it a point to book with this company before you do any other tourist attractions. Looking forward to going back and perhaps, booking the country bicycle tour - next time! Thanks Rob... (James & Tia)
Learned so much, very eye opening. Wonderful, very straight forward and respectful! We learned so much! It was fascinating, thank you Lealu!

Excellent, informative and classy. We went in October 2016 on a walking tour of Amsterdam with Mark. He was excellent, informative and knew the history of the city very well. He keeps the group size small and it works very well. Much better than the unruly free tour guides out there - well worth the expense.
Red light district with Lealu. Very interesting tour with many insights. Lealu was great, explained everything with details and humor, making it a fun 2 hours.

Out - of - the - Box Tour Experience. Rory took my wife and me on the Countryside Tour. Felt like we have known the guy for a long time. Hundreds of small and funny detals described, along with the pictoresce scenery. Highly recommended, due to the uber-relaxed atmosphere within the small group of tourists.

Don't look elsewhere-just book !!. Had a great countryside tour with Rory & 6 American couples which made for an interesting day out ! A lovely way to spend a few hours in the company of a great guide & like minded people. Will certainly look these chaps up when we come back. Excellent !!

Red Light District & Countryside Tour with Mark. Tours were both wonderful! Red Light District tour was funny and historical. It was nice to learn about the history behind it and the current social issues with that area. It's always nice to know which spots are better than others. The countryside tour was also a really nice way to see some of the countryside right outside of Amsterdam. We got to walk through two little towns, learn about the history of the dams, have apple pie, cheese, walk inside a working windmill, and stop by a dairy farm. Highly recommend!

Red Light District tour - Lealu. Did two tours in one day with Lealu (city and RLD) and she was such a fantastic tour guide! The groups were kept small which greatly enhanced the experience. Lealu was very knowledgeable and told us a lot about the RDL history, the women that works there and how their business operates etc. She was able to answer every question we have. This tour is great to learn about the sex industry in Amsterdam and also great for those who wants to find out which bar or theatre to visit if you are interested in spending some time at the district watching shows.

Benjamin, That Dam (Entertaining) Guide. Benjamin provided three hours of entertainment. Not quite standup comedy, but three hours on our feet went by quickly while we got snippits of history, economics, sociology, geography, philosophy, engineering and architecture, all laced with good humour. With our small group of seven (apparently never more than ten) Benjamin kept in touch with his clients, responded to questions and engaged in conversations as we walked. He had his route and knew what he wanted to cover but did not come across as a tape recording. Benjamin told us that he did not grow up in Amsterdam but moved there and fell in love with the city. His enthusiasm showed. We also picked up the fact that he has traveled. With this background, coupled with his intelligence and quick wittedness, he is a master of his craft. The walking is easy in Amsterdam. The Dam Guide Tour is definitely good value.

City tour with Lealu. My husband and I recently went on the city walking tour with Lealu. I thought this was a great introduction to Amsterdam. Lealu took us through historic and notable sites, and places we wouldn't have seen on our own. The pace was relaxed, and the small group size is so much better than a large group and was worth the price. Highly recommend!

really nice tour with mark. We booked both the red light district tour and the city tour. Mark is a very entertaining guy and knows how to get facts across but not in a "tour guide" kind of way. We really liked the small group size (less than 10 persons), so that the tour is really flexible. Mark took notice of our interests and changed the tour along the way (there is no fixed route, he just shows you what he likes). So for everyone who is interested in taking a tour that is not a free tour with more than twenty persons and a tour guide selling you something, but in a tour with a honest guide, who really tells you what is a rip-off an what to recommend than take this tour. It is well spent money.

Historical Walking Tour of Amsterdam. Our book club decided to do one of Mark's walking tours of Amsterdam based on the book ‘Amsterdam: A History of the World’s Most Liberal City’. We were all familiar with Amsterdam and choose Mark to show us a side to Amsterdam we wouldn't have seen. He succeed. We walked down streets we had never been on, past canals we hadn’t seen before, and went to a restaurant that I for one had been by several times before and had no idea it was there. Mark was very easy going about the tour and at the end of the day my mouth was sore from laughing (always the sign of a good day). It was a great day for our entire group and many of the ladies are thinking of organizing another tour with Mark either for our group or with visitors to the Netherlands.

A "must" in any season. Second tour with Mark in as many years, and always impressive. Knowledgeable and intuitive, he excels at keeping us engrossed and entertained...and oblivious to the weather. A "must" in any season. Highly recommended.

Verdent country side. Yes it is more than worth the time & expense to experience the Dutch caring for the land. Rorey brings the tour together with a sense of ease and curiosity. I was amazed and delighted to be out of the city and among the villages and farmers in their daily lives, connecting the wind, water and earth in a circular dance. I have a new perspective of what the Netherlands is really about.

2 excellent tours with Lealu. We took 2 tours with Lealu in one day, the general city tour, and the red light tour. Both were excellent !! Lealu was punctual, and quite pleasant. During both tours she did a great job of keeping our group of about 7 tourists together, and quickly she had the group melded together as new friends. She showed us so many city sights, and history, that it was a great overview. The red light tour was very very good also. It was extremely busy there on a Saturday night, we would have never ventured through it on our own. She kept our group together, and seemed very conscious of each of us, which we all appreciated. She shared all sorts of insight that we would never have known about the women, lifestyles, and neighborhood. Thank you so much Lealu, we thoroughly enjoyed our time with you ! We felt that it was time very well spent with you.

Red light tour. A lot of fun and really recommend the tour, its not too long, a little under 2 hours which was about right.It was a small tour which really helped since we saw multiple tours with twice our number which didn’t seem half as good.

Great guided visit to amsterdam with Rob. We did a 3h visit to Amsterdam centre with Rob.Rob makes the visit really enjoyable and dynamic, groups are small and you feel involved.Also nice detail of making a coffee stop in a fantastic place.Will definitely recommend as part of a visit to Amsterdam

Enjoy to the fullest! Thanks Mark. I truly enjoyed the countryside tour by Mark on Oct 8th. This is an added bonus to my 1st Amsterdam trip :)This is a small group with total 8 people including Mark our funny and nice tour guy.He drove us and let us walk around to beautiful areas around Amsterdam on a sunny day. He is knowledgeable, very friendly and very cheerful :)He took us to all places with beautiful sceneries. A small village, Monnickendam, a farm and the windmill. I can see a lot of animals and nature in this tour in which I didn't expect before this trip and hardly I can find in my current living city.Besides, we can ask a lot of questions and he gave us plenty of time to enjoy and take pictures. I never feel there s a moment of rush and enjoy the beauty of nature.We drank coffee, ate apple pie and have a picnic tasting different cheeses.Thank you Mark! I agree what you say this leaves me unforgettable memories in this tour and I love Amsterdam even more

So glad we did this.... Lealu was fantastic. Four of us friends on a break together; we were the only ones on the City Tour with her so it was really a pleasure to spend this time walking around with her. Passing the hustle of larger groups, we felt really lucky. Lealu was warm and friendly. We spent 3 hours on this enjoyable tour, peppered with history, shops, red light district, top tips one where to go. Places we would have never known about or stopped out without her. We all got so much for this walk and it set us up for the rest of the weekend... could not recommend this enough, do it!

Excellent intro to Amsterdam . This is a small group of experienced guides who went independent and set up their own business. The tour groups are small (our group was 10, their maximum) which means it's not a messy herd with stragglers. We did the Amsterdam city tour with Rob, who was entertaining while giving us all we'd hoped for about local history, language, architecture and culture. An excellent tour.

Perfect Walking Tour. We did the city walking tour with Rob and it was a great outing. We had about 10 people in our group and he was able to set a pace that accommodated everyone in the group. Rob is from the U.S.A., but has been in Amsterdam many years and obviously loves the city and the Netherlands. He was well prepared, interesting, and helped us understand the Dutch perspective on current events as well as their history. He also followed up with an email with suggestions for further reading for those of us who expressed interest. Great guy, great tour.Highly recommend!

Great Tours. We did 2 Dam tours--the Countryside and the Red Light District. The countryside with Mark was fun and a bit funky which we loved. One of the places we visited an automated dairy farm that was really interesting and fun. He was a great host and gave us a cheese break with wine!! We also visited working windmills. We went with Leala on the Red Light tour and I was very comfortable going with a woman guide and learning the history of prostitution in Amsterdam and how it runs today, The tourists/customers were raunier than the "ladies". Both tours were small group tours7-8 people.

Countryside Tour!. Rory was our guide for the day and did an excellent job! We had a small group and great interaction. All the stops were enjoyable, but the farm visit was special. We enjoyed learning about the milking process (very high tech!) and meeting Bruce the dog. The windmill visit was very special. Food was excellent. I highly recommend this tour!

Flat out excellent.. Rob was amazing. Just having come off two weeks of daily walking tours on our river cruise, I was thinking "bleep, why did I book another walking tour?".Thankfully I was completely wrong and Rob did everything right. Right speed, right amount of talking, right places and interesting information. Glad we did it, thanks!

Best tour of our trip!. We took 2 tours with Mark and were very pleased! He knows the city, the people and was a true (and funny!) educator. I feel so well informed and was able to come back and teach a few things to my friends. Highly recommend That Dam Guide to anyone traveling through Amsterdam. I also really enjoyed that the group was small so that we all could hear him talk and didn't look like a bunch of tourists roaming around the city.

Countryside tour- a great break from the City!. We booked the countryside tour since we were only really visiting the city of Amsterdam and wanted to get a small taste of more than just that. Our guide Mark was super informative and took us to a lot of great places. Especially enjoyed the picnic at the Windmill. Nice small group of people so it was easy to socialize. If we are every in Amsterdam again we will definitely book another tour with them!

The best way to get to know Amsterdam . Before you arrive in Amsterdam book the city tour with Mark. Without doubt this is the most enjoyable and informative way to get to know this dynamic city, plus Mark will give you great tips (best fries, best cookies, best restaurants) and all without a single incentive. This small group walk is like hanging out with a new, well informed friend who wants you to appreciate and love Amsterdam. What's not to love!

A 10 - Best walking tour guide in Amsterdam. Must thank all contributors for helping me to find The Dam Guide,, I did reserve two of their tours on my recent visit to Amsterdam, Patrick made the Red light district visit an interesting and educational tour, respecting in every sense the privacy of the girls working in the area, The following day and again with Patrick I took the tour to the Windmill area, It was a breathtaking countryside, we stop at a private farm where we saw how the cows are milked on their time. And when the cow fill the need to be milked, it was incredible! We had the opportunity to see several week old calfs, and Patrick keep us informed and entrained for several hours, he manage to offer us snacks, cheese and wine under the shade of one of the windmills, absolutely a lovely day. I highly recommend That Dam guide tour.

RLD Tour with Mark. Second time with Mark but first time for the RLD tour, and he delivered. The tour is intimate (only max of 10 people), which allows you to ask questions. Mark is very informative about the inner workings of the RLD and its players, as he works closely with the Prostitution Information Center. You get a good summary of the history and political insight on the issue of prostitution that is different from the prevailing theme promoted by the local government. This tour (and all his other tours) are worth the time and money.

A great informative and fun introduction to the red light district. Lealu was AWESOME! She picked up the tour last minute to cover for her co-worker which was very nice, and did an excellent job! We learned alot about not only the current red light district as it stands, but also the history and future of it. Lealu did a great job of making us all feel comfortable in the district and suggesting fun things to do in the area after the tour. We really appreciated her suggestions before and after the tour.

Fun, Educational . . . and Funny. We booked two tours: the three-hour walking tour in the central city and the six-hour countryside tour. Both are strongly recommended. The guides (Benjamin for walking and Rory for countryside) were congenial, knowledgeable and funny. The walking tour is a great way to begin your exploration of the city, while the countryside tour gives you a glimpse of Dutch rural and village life. You visit a cheese farm and a windmill, the mechanical ingenuity of which is dazzling. We had a great time, learned a lot and laughed a lot!

Dam and RLD in one day!. I am currently in an extended trip to the Netherlands and had yet to really get to know Amsterdam so I booked a walking tour. Lealu did such a great job, super informative and energetic that I decided that I would book the Red Light tour for later in the evening. Mark was the guide for that and he is nothing short from amazing!!! He made the tour!!
That Dam Guide. We were very impressed with That Dam Guide, and our Guide: Lealu!! She was fun! Informative! and well versed on the city and history! Great time spent!!

Countryside Tour. This was by far the best tour I've taken overseas! Rory was a fantastic tour guide who provided historical and ecological information in a way that was entertaining and interesting. The small size of the tour made it feel so personalized. I've never been on a tour where everyone really go to know each other like we all did, which added so much to the experience. It was also nice to see places off the beaten path. After the tour, Rory emailed us all the details of everywhere we visited, which is a such a nice touch! I cannot recommend this tour enough!

A great tour!. I am not the "reviewing" type and this is my first review on Trip Advisor. It is with this in mind that I highly recommend That Dam Guide. Suffice to say, there is good reason that this tour is highly rated. My wife and I had a fantastic time touring the Netherland countryside. Thanks for everything Rory!

Red Light District Tour. Ben was great! A very funny and knowledgeable guy. The tour takes you through the streets and Ben has lots of fun and interesting info about the district and Amsterdam in general. Good times from the San Diego crew!Thanks Ben!

Fantastics city tour. We went on a small group Amsterdam city walking tour with Mark. Small group tours are wonderful, no need to move around tall people or strain your ears to hear over the city noise.Mark speaks perfect English and is extremely knowledgeable about Amsterdam's history, changing culture and values. He also gave us wonderful insight into the locals perspective, he has lived in the city for many years and has a Deep understanding of the red-light district and the women who work there, the local take on coffee shops, gentrification and other current issues. He took us to a super hip design cafe and we had the worlds best cookie. I highly recommend booking a private tour, he can create a custom tour for you! He has even made his own map and shortlist of the best restaurants, snake shops and attractions. Mark is funny, clever and an accomplished guide! I can't wait to visit again and try one of his other brilliant tours!

That Dam Guide - Dutch Countryside Tour 09/2016. My wife and I did the Dutch countryside tour in late September 2016 with Rory Brosnan as our guide. We were looking for something outside Amsterdam, but fairly close by, that would give us highlights of local life and a chance to see some of the Netherlands outside the big city. This full-day tour fully met our expectations, and then some. Our group was small - just four people. We visited a couple small villages, a local farm and a windmill. Overall the tour was perfect in terms of length, distance from Amsterdam, and what we saw. Rory was an excellent guide and made the tour both informative and fun. We highly recommend That Dam Guide for tours in and around Amsterdam. (We also did a city tour with That Dam Guide, but that's another review.)

Red Light District . Benjamin was a great guide. I have to say I was not sure if I wanted to see the Red Light District but this is the way to do it. Benjamin had a lot of energy and did a great job explaining the history and culture of the District. Worthwhile!

Not an average tour! The best! . Benjamin took 10 of us on a witty & informative walking tour of Amsterdam! I have a very short attention span and am not the MOST interested in history - but he kept me interested and engaged the whole time! Would definitely recommend these guys!

Fantastic guide. We were 20 minutes late, but Benjamin was still waiting in case we had the time wrong. He then guided, informed and entertained the 4 of us for the next 2 and 1/2 hrs covering the full story of Amsterdam's fascinating history. We toured around the whole town and it felt like we had taken minutes. We discussed Dutch politics, our own history and politics, the conversation never faltered. A great way to tour the town.

Great Tour. These guys are awesome. They made the tour very fun while also keeping it informational. We did the canal tour with Cameron and he was great. The group was small and therefore it was more personal than a typical tour would be. We were able to take beer on the boat. The only downfall was that it rained during our tour and the boat wasn't turning left at the end, but we were good anyway.
Terrific tour. We had an excellent Amsterdam tour with Mark - funny, informative and enjoyable. Highly recommended.

An excellent tour!. A small group tour with Rob who was fun, informative and very enthusiastic about Amsterdam. This is the first activity we booked for our 3 day trip to Amsterdam with our 2 teenage kids - it gave us the perfect 'base information' and more - a must do! The walking pace was very relaxed and included a cafe stop so suitable for all ages and abilities.

Amazing tour - Awesome tour guide, so informative, Super small group! . Our tour Guide Lelu was the best. The group was only 7 people which made it a perfect situation to ask questions and have a more personal experience. The group had a blast. I highly recommend anyone spending time in Amsterdam to do the city tour. Already looking to book my country tour with them next!

Countryside tour. We took the countryside tour with Mark and enjoyed every minute. I appreciate the breadth of knowledge, balanced with his humour. We experienced the trueness of The Netherlands from walking through a small market to climbing a windmill. The apple pie and picinic was an unexpected please. Thank you

Totally worth doing.. I did this tour with Lealu in September and I didn't know what to expect but I really, really enjoyed it. Lealu was incredibly knowledgeable about the district and could answer just about every question we had. After overhearing other guides we passed I realized she was also very respectful of the district and those who work or visit it. I work as a tour guide myself so I really appreciated how she lead the group, she was easy to talk to and attentive to everyone. I would even do this same tour again.

Amsterdam Walking Tour. Excellent! Rob didn't just relate facts from a history book but gave interesting, informative and amusing insights to the national psyche that provided us with a better understanding of the cultural history of The Nederlands

Amazing Countryside Tour. We took the countryside tour with Rory in mid-September. He was very informative and had no problem answering the many questions that were thrown at him. We had an amazing time and loved the fact that the tour didn't take us to all the tourist filled places. We were able to actually see what The Netherlands was really about instead of being trucked to a road stop to buy souvenirs. 2 thumbs up. Highly recommended!

City Tour. We took the city tour with Rob and we were extremely happy with our decision in tour companies! The group was small which was nice and we covered a lot in 3 hours. It was nice doing this at the beginning of our stay in Amsterdam, I think we appreciated the city a little more knowing everything Rob taught us. Rob knew a lot about the city and answered any questions our group has. Highly recommended That Dam Guide Tours!!!

Private walking tour with Mark. With a day's notice my daughter arranged for a three hour private walking tour with Mark. As we had five adults the cost of €175 versus €125 for the small group tour turned out to be a great decision. We walked through the oldest neighborhoods of Amsterdam including the red light district while learning about Amsterdam's history and current policies. Sunday had intermittent rain but Mark was nimble and informative as we huddled under our canopy of umbrellas, ducked into a few spots for a beer and warmed up with street fries and chocolate cookies. Going at our own pace and having our questions and interests addressed made the tour a very positive experience for the whole family.

Fantastic Countryside Tour. We came back to Amsterdam during the summer and wanted to see more of the country. Rory was our guide and he was a warm and witty fellow. The tour itself was pitch perfect - varied, but not rushed. We travelled "back country roads" (as Rory put it) and saw a gorgeous little town that is untouched by tourism (and all the better for it). There were so many highlights, though of course the windmill topped it off. Again, very few tourists there and we ended it all off with a lovely picnic. A fantastic day out and highly recommended.
Dutch countryside . Great tour. The sites we visited were not only interesting but also photogenic. Rory was a great guide and we had a lot of fun. Thanks again.

Red Light District Tour. Our tour guide, Mark, was phenomenal. My husband & I are from Denver, Colorado and this was our first trip to Amsterdam. We absolutely loved it. Great food, great people and this tour was the last thing we did before flying home. Mark was very knowledgable and very careful to make sure we had the best possible experience. We would definitely recommend doing this tour to our friends and family but if you have a stick up your butt about nudity or anything dealing with the Red Light District, I may recommend one of the billion churches in Europe as a better fit.

Lealu as a guide ='s 5 Stars. Lealu's City Tour was one of the best we have ever taken. She communicated promptly before our arrival regarding the time and place to meet on September 7th, was very knowledgeable, made the tour extremely interesting and also knew where to find the best cookies. Going to Amsterdam? Definitely sign up for a tour with her. Wish we had also taken her night tour. Thanks Lealu!

Best Tour I've ever been on . I did the City Walk with Benjamin and had an amazing time. He was informative, humorous, interesting, and I felt like I took a lot away from the tour. It was a great experience and I fully plan on partaking in another one of their tours.

City tour with Lelou.. Booked this last minute tour to take advantage of some hours in Amsterdam, next time wil surely do again. History, hidden spots, local food hints, securely answered our questions. Thanks Lelou for the simpathy, knowledge and energy!

AMAZING TOUR! Look no further!. Before my partner and I flew to Amsterdam for a quick long weekend getaway from the states, we booked the Red Light District Tour with Lealu. Not knowing what to expect we had high hopes. Since we were only there for a long weekend (not enough time to spend in Amsterdam, wish I didn't have to come back), we figured we'd do a walking tour to immerse ourselves in the culture and history of this amazing city. Trust me when I say our expectations were blown away!! WE LOVED LEALU SO MUCH! The Red Light district tour was great! We learned so much from how it began to how it's currently running! After the tour we were able to navigate around the charming Amsterdam streets. We loved everything about it. The small intimate size of the tour, the personal touches Lealu added, and the local insight on the city. We loved the tour so much we reached out to the company asking if there were any possibilities to join the Historical walking tour while we were there. They were so accommodating and willing to help fit our schedule it was no problem at all! Luckily, we had Lealu as our tour guide once again on this tour and it was even better! We actually became friends! Before we even started this tour she asked everyone if it would be okay if we went a little over time. We all mutually agreed and Lealu took her time explaining historical figures as we walked around Amsterdam. Totally recommend doing this tour on a Sunday morning as not that many people were out. We really had the chance to connect with Lealu and we all stopped for a quick bite in one of her favorite hidden cafes!Look no further, I truly mean it! These guys are great in accommodating your needs, keeping tours personal and intimate with small group numbers, and just all around amazing genuine people! We totally would have done the country tour if we had more time! Honestly doesn't matter how old you are, I totally recommend this tour- especially with Lealu (no offense to the other tour guides, I bet you're great, just had Lealu on both tours)
RLD tour with Lealu. Had the most enjoyable experience going on this walking tour. Lealu is fun, informative, and very professional. Not one dull moment! A must-do.

Red Light District Tour. Did a recent red light district tour with Mark and it was fantastic. He is a very funny, very personable guy who really knows the ins and outs of the business in the district. The tour was informative, the appropriate length and overall just very well done. Highly recommend.

Learned so much!. We recently took the countryside tour with Rory and thoroughly enjoyed our destinations and avoiding the usual tourist traps. We had the small towns and villages we visited all to ourselves while enjoying a delicious apple pie and coffee treat.
