But what was most surprising was how interesting the visit to the dairy and tulip bulb farm we visited. The use of more humane treatment coupled with high technology really intrigued our whole group. And learning about the harvest of bulbs was a unknown market to us. The Dutch use every inch of land they have for farming and Rory went in-depth about water management which is quite a feat. We were a bit of an inquisitive group and Rory always had the answers. Only thought he might have engaged more while driving, but he got us everywhere safely! Our cheese tasting picnic was the end to a great day. Small group tours all the way!!

The best walking tour I've been on. We went on the tour with Lealu as a guide and it was amazing. The three hours (or a little bit more I think) just flew by. The historical parts were interesting, the various small facts about artsy paving stones, cats, cafés, bikes, bike fishermen etc etc were also very interesting. She has a very nice sense of humor and I think she made everyone on the tour feel seen and comfortable. She sent an informative e-mail after the tour that also was much appreciated.

Such Fun!. My daughter and I were comfy in the front seat of the van with Mark on this countryside adventure and loved every minute of it. We were with six others which made it delightful...not too many. We visited a beautiful dike village (Durgerdam) and a wonderful little town called Monnickendam. We walked through Monnickendam to admire the architecture of this small quaint gem. Stopped for a refreshment and apple pie which allowed us to get to know one another a bit more. Our final destination was the Schermer Windmills. We were able to go inside to see the interior design as the workings and history were described. We then sat down to a cheery light picnic fare of which the highlight was Beemster Cheese. All in it was a lovely day spent with a terrific guide...Mark!

Brilliant walking tour. I had read a fair bit about these guys and how they operated and signed up for a 3 hour walking tour with Benjamin today. Benjamin was great, very informative and fun with his pointing out of history and various facts about the city and areas we walked. Would highly recommend and would do again next time in Amsterdam.

Off-the-beaten-path, small group contryside tour.. Mark, our tour guide, provided our group of six seniors with a wonderful day driving through the Dutch countryside. We saw dykes, and visited the town of Monnickendam where Mark takes his guests for Dutch apple pie and coffee at the perfect coffee break time along with a walking tour of the town. We drove by Edam, visited a farm that raises tulips and is also a dairy. We explored a working windmill and Mark provided a lovely picnic. Rather than drive back to the center of town, Mark dropped us at the free ferry which took us across the river and just a few blocks from hotel. It was a wonderful day made so very special by being a small group and visiting places where there were only a few other tourists. One can tell that Mark has spent hours scouting out places to take his clients. We would definitely take the same tour again because I am sure Mark will have found interesting new places to visit.

Great Dutch Countryside Tour. We had an excellent 6-hour countryside tour with Mark during our short stay in Amsterdam. This was a great small-group tour (maximum 8). We wandered through the countryside north of Amsterdam with a number of interesting stops along the way. Mark was an excellent guide, giving us lots of information and insight throughout the tour. We got a follow-up email from Mark with more information on the different places we stopped after the tour was over, which was a very nice touch. Highly recommended.
Supercalifragilistic. My sister and I went on a city tour with Mark this week. He was awesome and knowledgeable. Stop looking for other tour guides. They are best.

Mark does a great tour of Amsterdam. We found Mark on Trip Advisor and were convinced by his excellent reviews to give him a try. We did not regret it. We spent 3 1/2 hours with Mark touring many parts of Amsterdam. He is knowledgeable, personable, and has a great sense of humor. We walked all over the city and although Mark had a path planned for us, when we indicated a different interest, he changed our route and attractions on the fly and did great. We highly recommend Mark to anyone looking for an Amsterdam guide.

Dam Good Guides. I know I am not the first to play off this pun, but these guys are damn good. Very knowledgeable and informative, they easily shift between explaining the culture and history of Amsterdam and giving advice on the restaurant and tourist scene for later exploration. Their suggestions helped me create themes for the next few days of my trip. If you enjoy a smaller, more personal tour That Dam Guide is a must. Lealu was my Red Light District guide and Mark was my Amsterdam City guide and both were fantastic. Mark offered an in-depth history of the city while Lealu deftly explained the complexities of the RLD with a sense of humor that kept us fascinated and entertained. Absolutely one of the best tour experiences I've ever had.

Wonderful guide. We did the countryside tour with Mark in September 2016 and had an amazing time. The small group size is a much more engaging way to see the beautiful Amsterdam countryside. Mark is a wonderful guide that selects wonderful, out of the way, sites to show you the history of the Dutch reclaiming the land from the sea. He also buys you apple pie and makes you a lunch time picnic that makes it highly personal and interactive. Believe all the other reviews and select these guides for the most amazing Amsterdam experience.

Very enjoyable day. A friend and I went on That Dam Guide's Countryside Tour with Rory as our guide. The day was an absolute delight. The van was a bit tight for 8, but our fellow travelers were all very pleasant and interesting. The time spent in the van is minimal compared to all we experienced. Rory is a fun, friendly and professional guide, he planned a day packed as full as possible....we requested to see everything we possibly could! The highlight was the windmill in Schermerhorn....wonderful! This is a tour that allows a lovely glimpse of The Netherlands without being in a crowd with other tourists. We were all sorry when the tour came to an end. I regret we didn't have more time in Amsterdam to do more tours with this organization. I highly recommend That Dam Guide!!

Amsterdam City Tour. As a first-timer to Amsterdam, my wife and I booked a tour with 'That Dam Guide' after reading some positive reviews. We were not disappointed. Our guide Rob was a walking encyclopaedia on Amsterdam, it's places, people and culture - all related in conversational style, allowing time for questions, anecdotes and humour. We hardly noticed how quickly the three or so hours passed and how much we have learned from Rob which we could not have attained from a guide book, audio tour or any other walking tour. Thanks Rob

A great diversion . I was flying through Amsterdam and my connecting flight was delayed 6 hours. Rather than hang out at the airport all day I grabbed an Uber and took this tour. Airport is close to downtown about 20 minutes. Tour was perfect. Very enjoyable and good history as well as tips about local favorites. Also the guide gave a great overview of the subtleties of Dutch culture. Pragmatic, financial over social, live and let live. I even had time for lunch and beer at a cafe before I headed to airport and boarded my flight home. By the way, I stored my luggage at baggage drop at airport making this an easy, painless process.

Great overview of Amsterdam. We were in Amsterdam for our first visit so we decided to take in a walking tour to start our vacation. We booked with Lealu and got a great tour of the city centre. We were fortunate to only have one other person with us so it felt really personal. Normally these tours are sold out. Lealu was great and very knowledgeable adding humour as we walked the streets. There is quite a bit of walking however if you are up to it, it is a good tour.

Wonderful tour and wonderful guide!. Route was great to see the countryside. Rory was fun and knowledge! Trip was not rushes-- we had plenty of time at all the beautiful stops! Group was small which is excellent! Highly recommend!

A great intro to a beautiful city. Rob took us on a great, informative 3-hour tour of the older parts of Amsterdam and along the way imparted the history, culture and personality of this unique city. We learned a lot and the pace was slow enough to take some photos along the way and ask questions. I highly recommend this tour as an introduction to Amsterdam.

Amsterdam Walking Tour - the BEST in any city!. After traveling through Amsterdam many times, my sister and I finally stayed in the city for a week. We started with a 3-hour walking tour with That Dam Guide. Mark is knowledgeable, interesting and FUN! He makes history "live" while looking at old buildings, crossing old bridges, meandering down alleys and walking on old streets.

Hanging with the guide. Mark was great! He was on time and packed in a lot of info in 3 hours. Also shared some of his favorite eateries and a particularly innovative shop. He knows the history, culture, architecture, vibe of Amsterdam and shares it well. Be ready to walk and you'll see plenty.

Countryside Tour. Rory's informative tour of countryside outside of Amsterdam was just right. He took us to several different places and led our small group with professionalism and care. It felt more like having a very knowledgeable friend show us around a place he really liked than a commercial tour. This was a terrific experience that I would highly recommend to anyone interested in the landscape and history of Amsterdam and the surrounding area.

Informative & Fun. We did the Red Light District Tour. Our guide, Mark, was incredibly knowledgeable and made out tour fun. It was great that he was able to balance the controversial discussion of sex workers and silliness that is the Red light District. You do get to see all aspects of the Red Light District. The only reason that I did not give the tour five stars is that Mark was sometimes hard to hear. But definitely worth the cost.

Small group tour of Amsterdam. Booked a tour with Rob based on the reviews on TripAdvisor. Turned out Rob was double-booked, and Mark took over. Our tour had only 7 people, which meant that Mark could really spend time answering our questions and tailor the tour based on our interests and capabilities.Mark did a fantastic job of not only showing us the city of today, but giving us the history of the city and its people. This was a combination of city and state-level history lessons interspersed with more personal tales about specific people that lived or visited the city.Mark also gave us a flavor of the city by stopping at city markets and shops as we toured. This really made you feel like a local.This is a wonderful tour and I would recommend it for anyone. My only qualifier - it was long (3+ hours), so be prepared to walk.

Could recommend this guide more. It was my first trip to Amsterdam and we decided that a walking tour would be a good way to see the sights, learn something about the city and maybe find some recommendations for food and drink.Well we were not disappointed in the slightest with our tour. It is a small group of 10 which was ideal and Mark was extremely knowledgeable. Throughout the tour he had many facts and fun bits of knowledge.The tour lasted for about 3 hours and the time seemed to fly by. If you are looking for a tour of Amsterdam I would highly recommend this one!!

Lealu offered the most enthusiastic adventure of our trip. A two hour tour with Lealu was orgasmic!! Peep shows, indoor brothels, and snorting chocolate (really). While I did not partake in that last option, I wish I could go back and try. Lealu offered a wonderful and enthusiastic yet educational view into the RLD. You may just want to walk thru quickly and tell your friends you've been. But, Lealu will show you a behind the scenes view with a follow up email that literally ranks the prostitutes! Amazing. Thank you!

Great trip out of the city!. We went on a wonderful 6 hour trip outside of Amsterdam. Our guide, Rory, was friendly, humorous ans knowledgeable. He gave us great insight into the people, country and life in the Netherlands. We had great food (apple pie and, Beemster cheese), got to see the inside of a windmill, and walked through quaint little Dutch towns. Highly recommended

Great tour of countryside!. Perfect, unique tour! Highly recommend it.Loved being in a small group (6 guests & Rory). Felt like driving around with a group of friends. Great overview of Dutch water control system, complete with tour of working windmill. When I booked tour, I wondered when/where we were going to eat lunch. Never fear -- between the large, delicious apple pie in the morning and the cheese and wine (plus crackers, fruit, cold cuts) in the afternoon, there was more than enough to eat.

Excellent overview of Amsterdam history, food and social behavior. My sister and I were in Amsterdam last week, our first visit. As an orientation the first afternoon, we took Mark's three hour walking tour and in the end, felt we knew a little history, we knew our way around and felt comfortable in the historic center. Mark handed out his new map - the best, clearest map of all the maps we had. As a bonus, his map lists restaurant recommendations, too, and the two we tried were excellent. At the end of the week, we joined Rory's countryside tour, for a break from the city. We are so glad we did! In a relatively short drive away from Amsterdam, we were in the Dutch countryside of dikes, farms, cows, tulip bulbs, cheese and windmills. Not only was it a lovely peaceful drive, we learned about managing water to create this rich farmland and visited a pretty waterside town where we were the only tourists. It was a great way to end our packed week.Both Mark and Rory are excellent guides, informed and informative, humorous and interesting. We both recommend That Dam Guide without reservation. Thank you, guys!

That Dam Guide Is A Dam Good Guide. Mark met us (3 women), at our hotel, the Ambassade, for a three hour walking tour. We have had a lot of private guides, and Mark stands out as The Best! Informative, engaging, entertaining, he more than fulfilled our expectations. Besides historical highlights, he took us for a spin through the iconic Red Light district, an experience in itself! I can't think of a better way to spend three hours, than to spend it with Mark. He made us fall in love with Amsterdam. Do it!

Took two tours I liked them so much!. Super friendly and personable. First I took the 3 hour city tour with Rob. Funny & attentive. Plus, you could tell he loved his job. With a small group there was ample opportunity to ask plenty of extra questions. On another day, I had Rory for the country tour. We lucked into a tiny group, just four of us (usually 10). Going to the old wooden windmill built in 1636 with a small group was a treat. We went to a location not attended by the big tour groups. Most tour buses travel with a huge group which would be far too crowded for these charming windmills. We also visited small towns, a farm and a cheese shop. The farm was so innovative, using a self-milking system for the cows. You have to see it to believe it.

City Tour with Rob. This was a great tour and very educational. Rob was a great tour guide. He was very knowledgeable and witty. He made the tour entertaining and very interesting. My husband and I had a great time and we highly recommend this tour.

Countryside Tour. We took the countryside tour with Mark and it was a fabulous experience. We wanted to venture outside of Amsterdam to see windmills and cheese making. We traveled with a small group of 8 in a van. The entire tour lasted just a little over 6 hours. We visited the quaint little town of Monnickendam where we had the best apple pie ever. We toured one of the working farms where the produce the milk to make Beemster cheese. This farm also grows and sells tulip bulbs and we learned a little about that too. We visited a windmill and had a wonderful lunch with several samples of Beemster cheese. On our way back we stopped at the Beemster cheese factory store where we were able to select cheese to buy right off of the rounds and have it vacuum sealed to put in our luggage. Mark was a great tour guide. He was very energetic, organized, friendly, humorous and informative. I would highly recommend Mark and That Dam Guides to anyone who is visiting Amsterdam.

Interesting and informative. We went on the tour with Mark this week on our first day in Amsterdam. His tour was excellent - lots of information about Amsterdam and Dutch culture along the way with tips on good places to eat and further exploration. He also does a longer day tour out of Amsterdam that looked very good too - maybe next time!

Exceeded Expectations. We booked a 6-person "Countryside, Windmills & Cheese Tour". Mark Law is knowledgeable, friendly, and a Dam Good Guide. He had a picnic lunch for us which was a bonus. Couldn't have been more informative and relaxing.

What an awesome experience!. We went on two tours with Mark and both were exceptional. If you are looking for informative guides who are passionate about providing a personalized and informative experience then book your tour today! Thank you and hugs,Brantlee

Excellent and Informative Walking Tour. We had Mark as our guide. He was friendly, relaxed, and a lot of fun to be around. He gave us a fabulous tour of the city--very informative with lots of history and fun facts! The time flew, and Mark actually gave us extra time to answer all of our many questions. He also provided great recommendations on things to do and places to eat. He is an excellent resource for Amsterdam! A truly memorable experience!!

Wonderful tours. We did two tours with That Dam Guide. One was a walking tour of central Amsterdam. Benjamin was a great guide who pointed out lots of interesting sites with some funny and informed commentary. The other was the countryside tour, with Rory, which was just as delightful. We decided we needed to see more than the downtown area. This tour took us about an hour out of the city and included a fishing village, a windmill museum, a tulip farm and many other areas. We got a much better understanding of the history of the area. Who knew windmills were mainly used for pumping water and reclaiming land from lakes?

Walking tour with Lealu. Lealu loves her city and it shows. She was very informative, objective, and kind. The walking tour they designed covers a little piece of each neighborhood in Amsterdam. Lealu shared information only a local would know and had a good humor. The tour is lengthy and you should be prepared to cover quite a bit of ground-good shoes and energy are needed. The city is all hustle and bustle and you should definately be aware of the bikes! Anyone can enjoy this tour although young children might not appreciate the value of it.

The tour with Mark was brilliant. We had the private 2 hour tour with Mark and it was so much fun! Shocking to get to know this industry but fun. He knows so much about the industry, fun facts and was really informative. Mark was fun, candid and has done his research about the red light district. I would recommend this tour to everyone.
Fantastic!. Took the walking tour of the canal district with Lealu. Just great. She was charming, friendly, and knowledgable. Recommend it highly for any new visitor to Amsterdam.

Tour with rob brilliant!. Had a fantastic morning with rob on the city tour. I have been to Amsterdam 4 times before and still I saw many places I hadn't seen before and learnt a lot about the history and also background to modern culture. We had such a small group of 7 which made it easy to hear and also very easy to ask questions - rob showed his extensive knowledge even more under our grilling! And I think he enjoyed going "off piste" every now and then. I could not fault this tour At all. I would recommend to anyone with no hesitation.

Great mix of history, culture and sights!. We had Lealu for the city tour and she was amazing! A great mix of history (just the right amount, never got bored!), insight into local culture (how the locals really live) and brought us to some really cool spots like the guy making the fresh poffertjes. Recommend to do at the beginning of your trip to get an idea for spots you want to go back to later! Thanks Lealu!!

Brilliant insight to the city. Did the city tour today with Rob, three hours that passed very quickly and was very manageable for a couple of pensioners! It was a brilliant small party tour, we passed many large groups and we were pleased we were not part of them we were all able to ask questions and engage in the tour, rob was interesting, engaging, informative and very respectful of the city and the locations, I will be recommending this tour to my friends.

Red light district tour with Lealu . Based on all the rave reviews we booked somewhat at the last minute a walking tour of the RLD with Lealu as our guide. My wife and I had a great time. Lealu was so informative and opened our eyes to so many details of this famous part of Amsterdam. Lealu, thank you for the pride and respect you show in regards to the area and it's occupants. Your mix of knowledge, humour and wit made for a top notch experience. Don't hesitate to book this tour, you won't regret it.

Red Light District was fascinating. Myself and 7 other friends booked the Red Light District walking tour. We did this back in April - so it was a while back and I keep thinking about it. It was a wonderful tour with loads of information and humor. I wish I had written notes down after the tour to remember everything. Lealu was a wonderful guide and ambassador for Amsterdam RLD. Thank you for the enjoyable and informational evening, I wish I could have walked the whole city with this guide.

Two great tours. We went on the Countryside Tour with Rory and the City Tour with Mark, and really enjoyed both. I ended up being glad that we went on the Countryside Tour first because it gave a great overview of the Dutch water management system (more exciting than it sounds) and it gave more context to the City Tour. The Countryside Tour was definitely the highlight of our trip. Rory is really knowledgeable and has a great sense of humor. I thought the entire tour was really well designed and fascinating. It's the perfect pace- never boring or rushed. All the stops are great, but I did especially love the visit to the dairy farm. The apple pie stop and the wine and cheese picnic weren't too bad either. Highly recommend this tour.We went on the City Walking Tour a couple of days later and had a great time with Mark. It's a small group, and you learn a lot about the history and culture of the city. Mark is a very enthusiastic and conscientious guide, and I enjoyed his insight into various aspects of Amsterdam life.

Countryside tour with Mark. I highly recommend this tour. I truly enjoyed myself. Mark was a very informative and gracious host. I learned more about Windmills and milking Cows than I cared to know. LOL ! The best part was the little picnic he prepared for us - wine, cheese, slightly gloomy skies. . Oh, and that Apple Pie! I'm still dreaming about it. Thank you so much, Mark.

Country Tour. Really enjoyed our tour of the countryside with Rory. He was a wonderful guide. The villages we visited we lovely. Learned a lot about water management and the role of windmills. Enjoyed the wine and cheese tastings.

Mark is FANTASTIC!!! Amazing tour guide. Mark was so interesting, informative, knowledgeable and patient with a great sense of humour. The kids (ages 11, 12 and 15) and I had a brilliant 3 hour tour as part of a larger group and really enjoyed ourselves. Highly recommend Mark's Dam Tours - great value for money!

Country tour. Mark was a fantastic guide - he said a lot without saying too much and took us via a lovely less worn route. I couldn't recommend him highly enough. Thanks Mark for a very memorable day.

3 hour walking tour . We went on the three hour walking tour yesterday with Lealu. We booked online and all went smoothly. We loved the tour. Lealu knows her city well and gave us many interesting facts. We were shown the hidden churches and a beautiful courtyard and many other interesting buildings that we would have otherwise missed. It was a small group of 10 . I can definitely recommend this tour

Highly recommended. We joined Rob for the old city tour - small group of 8 so it had a great personal touch. The tour lasted over 3 hours but was at a gentle walking pace and with a break mid way so absolutely fine for all abilities. You get a fantastic insight into the city and the guide was very knowledgable - everything from architecture, history, and general life in Amsterdam, through to the background of the drug industry and red light district.There are many companies vying for your business but I would highly recommend That Dam Guide - an excellent way to spend a morning - beating the generic pre-recorded narrative of the larger companies hands down.
Dam Good. Great city tour with Lealu. Very informative & Lealu was lovely to be with. It was great that the group was limited to ten people.
Dam fab!. Fabulous introduction to Amsterdam and the Netherlands. Rob was very knowledgeable and engaging We are looking forward to our next tour with Lealu.

Dam! That's a good guide!. We booked two tours with Mark of That Dam Guide – City and Countryside. Doing the city tour on our first day in Amsterdam was a great introduction to the city, gives you an idea of where all the major attractions are and helps you plan the rest of your stay. Mark is a fun and knowledgeable tour guide, who pointed out many things that one would normally miss if walking unguided. He had many recommendations, and even discounts, for things to do after the tour. Our group of ten, which is his maximum, was the perfect size for walking the narrow streets of central Amsterdam.The Countryside tour, which is limited to seven, was fantastic. We visited a couple of small towns, stopped into a café off the beaten path with a beautiful inner courtyard, observed fish smoking, visited a small farm and got to chat with the farmers for some time and of course a windmill where we observed the inside of the working windmill and took the requisite touristy photos. Mark brought a lovely picnic lunch and we sat around chatting surrounded by the Dutch countryside. Our small van allowed us to go and see places where the larger tour buses don’t go and created a friendly atmosphere for the entire experience. We even sent Mark out on a reconnaissance mission to identify a vegetable field. He obliged like a good sport. Now I’m keeping my promise.There are free tours out there but with far larger groups. With That Dam Guide you’re paying for a more intimate experience. It is worth every euro cent.

That Dam Guide. We arrived to meet up with our tour leader only to discover we had read the reservation wrong and the tour was to have been the day before. We found another guide with the orange pom pom and found out she was waiting for her group and was also with the That Dam Guide tour company. She accepted us into her group so instead of having a big disappointment, we had a Great! tour. Our guide, Lealu, was one of the best we have ever had. She was fun, very informative and very thorough. I would highly recommend a That Dam Guide tour and I hope you get Lealu. Have fun!

Small group walking tour of Amsterdam. August 18, 2016We enjoyed a three hour walking tour with Lealu as our guide. She was well organized, knew her hometown backwards and forwards, all off which made our tour of Amsterdam a real treat. It was one of the best tours we have been on!

I wish we could have more time with Mark!. We booked Amsterdam walking tour with Mark who happened to be an excellent guide. And I mean it! We are both professional tour guides, so I guess when we go on holiday, our expectations are high and we are very critical. And Mark passed the test :-) Book this tour at the beginning of your stay, it will give you a good understanding of the city and its people. Mark doesn`t only have the knowledge and is a good story-teller, but what made the tour was his personal touch into it. I learned a lot from what he said about his life in Amsterdam, people he knows, things that happen to him. He is very friendly, open-minded and has a great sense of humour. Thank you Mark for a very pleasant, joyful morning on our first day in Amsterdam. Let us know if you ever come to Warsaw.

Fab city tour ... great guide. It was literally raining cats and dogs the day of our tour but that didn't deter our guide Benjamin who delivered us a great tour in spite of the weather. He was professional, funny, knowledgeable and interesting. The small group meant we could ask more questions all of which Benjamin was well equipped to answer. The tour was informative and gave us real insight into both the history and soul of The Netherlands. I would definitely recommend both this tour and our guide. Thanks for a great first day in Amsterdam.

Great tour. Mark Law met our group of six at Dam Square. After brief introductions, off we went to see the sights. Mark was incredibly informative, knowledgeable and easy to understand. He brought Amsterdam alive for us. His relaxed pace made it easy for all of us to keep up. If you are looking for a reasonable, small group experience, this Dam Guide is the one to go with. I just couldn't imagine walking the streets of Amsterdam with a group of 20 or 30 people.
Exelent!. Grate introdution to the city. Lots of interesting stories, many of them you simply wont find in the guide book! I did enjoy. Recomendation what to do next I found very usefull!

Best DAM Tour. We were a group of six (age: 60ish) world travelers looking for a good individualized / small group tour where we could see the culture, hear about the history, and ask lots of questions. We read trip advisor and decided on That Dam Guide (Mark Law). Pre trip planning and communication set the tone of efficiency and piqued our interest in the adventure. Mark met us at the Hotel, introductions all around, and we were off to the country (really into the country immediately, not a long trip on the motorway to get to the country). We stopped in a little town along the dike for a history and geography discussion (Mark is very interesting and has a number of "map" aids to help us understand "Amsterdam". We then visited a small town (very pleasant walk through cobblestone streets and discussed more of the culture stopping for a delicious slice of apple pie and drinks. Then off to a local farm were we got up close and personal with the cows, the tulip harvesting, and the owner - fun! Finally we did the "windmill" and a fantastic picnic. We now know so much more about Amsterdam, the culture, the history and had an opportunity to have a wonderful day in the countryside. Mark did an excellent job, clearly is attentive to every detail both in the planning and execution and is very flexible to meet the needs / desires of the group. (the picnic spread provided by Mark was "to die for" and was just another highlight) - this is a tour designed for small groups that want to have a personalized experience and not get caught up in the "large tourist bus full of pushy people" paradigm. I would and will strongly recommend this tour to everyone as a must do when in Amsterdam. Bottom line: "IT WAS FUN AND WILL BE FOREVER REMEMBERED" - Thank you Mark for taking such good care of us! PS: not only did he provide us with a great day in the country but followed on by giving us a great recommendation for dinner at Cote Quest as we got back into town - I wish we had hired him to do the city walk and red light district also.

Red Light District - Lealu is an excellent guide. I went on this walking tour with my two teenagers and we all thought it was excellent. With a small group and our excellent guide Lealu, we learned a great deal about the history of Amsterdam and the past and current issues of this area. She truly is an excellent guide (and a fellow Canadian :). I have been on the larger walking tours and they don't compare.

Red Light Tour - Informative, Respectful, intriguing. Had a great tour with Lealu. Went all through the Red Light District. Lealu was informative from an historical , political and social point of view. Explained everything around and answered any questions with responsibility, sensitivity and respect for the workers.

Wonderful tour of Amsterdam. We took Lealu's tour of the old city in Amsterdam. She was absolutely amazing and we learned so much about the history of Amsterdam! She took us to places we never would have found on our own. Highly recommend!!

Fun, alternative and informative. By keeping the group size small, it allowed this guided trip to be personal and easy to engage with everyone else on the tour. Benjamin was very informative, funny and quirky (with or without the bobble hat). The 3 hours flew by and we thoroughly enjoyed every minute. Thank you

Personal and charming countryside tour. I took the countryside tour with a friend. Rory was our guide for the day, he was enthusiastic, knowledgeable, charming, and attentive. The tour was really fun - it had a nice mix of facts (presented in an entertaining way) and stops for delicious apple pie or cheese and wine. We got to see a windmill from the inside, and pet the dairy cows. I really recommend this tour, it's a nice and affordable alternative for the large impersonal bus tours!

Perfect small group tour. What a great tour! The size of the group is 8-11 people so it's easy to hear the guide, ask questions, and feel like a friend is showing you his/her home town (they are!). I got a wonderful sense of the city and its history from the tour-- this gave me the information and orientation I needed to make the most of my stay. Beats the big bus audio tours!

Wonderful trip with Rory and Kiki. We didn't want a big bus tour or a private tour, and our van tour with 4 other travelers was perfect. It took us off the beaten path. We didn't go to a wooden shoe factory or a giant tourist cheese shop. The tour stops were interesting - beautiful countryside, a stop at a farm to see the cows get milked, and then for a picnic to try the local cheeses that the farm sells milk to. Durgendam and Monnickendam were charming and uncrowded. Rory was congenial and informative. Highly recommend!

Amazing Tour!. So, here are your options if you're looking for a guided tour of the Red Light District. 1. You can choose a typical large group tour, you know the sort of thing, 30 people trailing after a guide, sometimes with headphones as it's almost impossible to get such a large group together in this area to talk to the guide direct.OR 2. You can book a tour with That Dam Guide. They are really amazing and here's why. They offer genuine small group tours. There were 5 on our tour last night so we could listen and chat to Mark, our guide, throughout the 2 hour tour. Mark has a wealth of knowledge not just about the area but also all aspects of what it's like for the girls who work in the area and the challenges they face. He showed the utmost respect for the girls. Whereas we saw the large group tours pointing, sniggering and giggling which after Mark's explanations seemed disrespectful and inappropriate.It's not all serious though as Mark is a really funny guy and we had a lot of fun with him! Lastly, he sent us links to his blog and other related sites where we could get great advice for best places in the city and follow up on aspects of the tour.So, the choice is yours, which type of tour would you prefer?Thanks a lot Mark!Helen and David - 15 Aug

RLD and City Tour. My wife and I took the two hour RLD (Red Light District) Walking Tour with Lealu on Saturday night and the area was hopping. Lealu was an excellent guide who obviously does her homework. She covered the history of the neighborhood and all aspects of how it functions from legislation and licensing to how they calculate their taxes and everything in between.We returned to the same meeting place on Sunday morning for a 3 hour walking tour of the old city with Benjamin who is a history buff who loves Amsterdam. That combination made for a very enjoyable tour. Benjamin covered a lot of material but interjected humor which kept the group smiling.My only regret was that we didn't have the time to take That Dam Guides' tour out into the countryside to see the water management system employed by the Dutch.

Absolutely superb. Can't recommend this tour company enough - excellent knowledge, fun, interesting, small group - an out of the box tour that gives you so much more than the typical tours we have been on before.

Dam good! It would be nice to have tours like this in every city!. First time in our life we decided to book a guide because of the good trip advisor reviews – and we didn't regret it. Our teenagers were mourning about it, but quickly changed their mind on tour. Discovering the city with Lealu was really interesting and entertaining, she brings history to life and showed us many nice places we wouldn't have seen by our own. Great tour, great guide with hearth and soul! Highly recommend even if you're not for the first time in town.

The most professional and friendly tours. Very friendly guys. I did all 3 tours that they offer. In Amsterdam city tour Lealu was amazing taking us around streets of Amsterdam telling about its history and how the city shaped up. While the RLD tour with Lealu was equally amazing roaming around RLD area, knowing its nitty gritty how it works, laws, taxes, history, clubs, coffeeshops etc.. Country side tour with Mark and Rory was fantastic. The Apple pie we had in Monnickendam is the best i ever had. Amazing quite town. Then visiting working windmill was amazing. Overall dont think just book this.

GREAT Tour. After taking this tour I am surprised that it is not listed as the number 1 tour you should take. My wife and I travel a lot and have been on many tours and this one was far and away the best experience we have ever had. The group size is small and that really adds to the experience. Our tour guide Lealu took great effort to personalize our tour and her attention to detail and history of the city was impressive. After watching other large groups following a guide through some of the small areas the tours go through there was no way anyone in the back heard anything the guide had to say. This tour is well worth the price.

City Tours & Red Light District Tours from "That Dam Guide Lealu". I was booking two tours (City Tours & Red Light District ) with That Dam Guide Lealu(Aug 12, 2016). The guide for both tours was Lealu. Her real name is different, but I cannot remember her Dutch's name. She is a wonderful/professional guide and very knowledgeable. We had a group of 7 people for each tour which is a perfect group size. Lealu answered all of our questions completely. The meeting place was very clear and easy to find. I understood Netherlands and love it more thanks to her guide. I love the tours and thank you That Dam Guide Lealu, particularly the guide. bt278

Very good tour . We had a three hour tour of Amsterdam with Benjamin and it was probably the best walking tour we've ever been on. Our guide was very enthusiastic, very entertaining and really brought this fascinating city to life. He put the city's history into context and made areas like the red light district make perfect sense. Highly recommend.
Really good !. A three hours visit with Mark through Amsterdam, it was a great moment. Thank you very much for making us discover the city and its secrets !

Great tour with Lealu. Seven of us took a private walking tour of Amsterdam with Lealu, and all agreed it was wonderful. She did a fantastic job of answering our many questions while maintaining her narrative through the streets and byways of old Amsterdam. It is impossible to think of how it could have been better for us. Thank you, Lealu, for a lovely afternoon. Even though we were jet-lagged, you informed and entertained us in such a delightful way!

What a great day . My 15 and 16-year-old daughters and I had a lovely afternoon with Mark. We went to a lovely fishing town and had the best apple pie at a super charming facility for challenged adults. I know it sounds a little odd but it was just lovely Mark is so easy-going and informative. The countryside was amazing. We had a wonderful tour of a windmill like I had never seen it before and a trip to great farmI would definitely recommend it and also suggest that you book with him directly and not through another bigger

Country Tour. We did a country tour from Amsterdam today. We choose this type of tour because it was a small group and personal and had good reviews on TripAdvisor. We had 3 full days in Amsterdam and it was great to finish with this tour. Saw windmills which was one of main reason for choosing the tour and the lovely country side. Stopped for coffee and apple pie at a lovely venue and also had a wine and cheese picnic at the Windmill. Great day out.

red light walking tour. did tons of tours on our trip but this one with Lealu was by far our favorite. she was super informative, interesting, and respectful towards the women. not sure what my expectations were for the red light - probably assumed it would be trashy/aggressive. and at its worst, maybe it is a little bit. but it's also a super beautiful and cool district with so so much history and it was great to have some of it filled in for us. the tour went by very quickly, covered a lot of ground. we were in the pouring rain but still had a great time!

Comprehensive Amsterdam. We actually visited Amsterdam in April of 2015, but I'm just getting to write the review now. We have traveled extensively before and after our Amsterdam trip and by and far this was the best private guide we have ever had (equaling Hong Kong.) In Amsterdam we were a party of two families with four teens total. We got to see so much of the city and fall in love with old style Europe. The surroundings feel old, but the environment feels new. Mark is able to excite all ages and give pertinent information as you spend your hours with him. He joined us for lunch at the end and felt like one of the family. Lastly Mark sent an email with interesting video and book suggestions that came up during our time walking Amsterdam with him. That is the true making of a complete guide! Sorry for the delay in this review, but better late than never.

Excellent & Informative Tour - We highly recommend it!. When we arrive in a new European city, the first thing we like to do is take an informative tour and learn about the city, country and its culture. We want a real tour that includes extensive facts and stories (not just glossy overviews by some student). We hit the jackpot with the tour by That Dam Guide. We signed up for the countryside tour by van and it turned out to be a private tour (just us two) and Rory, our guide, was extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the Dutch Water management system and other aspects of Holland. The tour is an excellent value as you visit a long list of places and Rory did a great job keeping it interesting and fun:1) We drove east out of Amsterdam and stopped at the little dike village of Durgerdam, where Rory gave an overview of the day. 2) We drove back-roads through Waterland and learned all about the Dutch Water management system. It was amazing to learn about how the Dutch people are so industrious.3) We stopped off and explored Monnickendam (Monks Dam). We had coffee and delicious apple pie at the Weeshuis (which means orphanage).4) We visited a working dairy farm and met the wonderful hard-working owners and received a tour of their automated milking process and how they store, sort and sell their two million tulip bulbs - fascinating facts and stories!5) We stopped to taste and buy cheese at a local cooperative, Beemster Cheese, for an afternoon picnic. The tasting was great and the cheese store will vacuum seal the cheese (good for up to two months) so you can take some home. It is a real store (not just show) and you get in line with locals to buy cheese - a tasty and fun experience!6) We stopped in Schermerhorn where we visited a windmill. This is where we had a picnic and toured the inside of a windmill and learned about how it operates and serves as a residence so it can be turned into the wind on a 24/7 basis - again, fascinating stuff and Rory, our guide did a great job educating us!If you are looking for a wonderful tour of Amsterdam and the surrounding areas filled with tons of informative facts and stories, you need to take a countryside tour with That Dam Guide!

So much more to it than meets the eye. In other words, great eye-opener.. The tour is quite straightforward but at the same time so much more in-depth. The information gathered is much more enhanced by the fact that it is a tour with a small group only. Very good when you have questions to ask mark and then turn it into a conversation. Mark is especially informative and I'd recommend joining this tour and finding it out yourselves.

Excellent tour, lovely guide. We booked with That Dam Guide as a result of an enthusiastic recommendation from a colleague, and we're very glad we did. The tour was on our first day in The Netherlands and was exactly what we needed for background to the country in general and to Amsterdam especially. Mark is well informed and amusing and we very much enjoyed his tour. Highly recommended, book well ahead if you can. Many thanks to Mark.

Great Overview of Amsterdam. Lealu provided us with such a wonderful tour of Amsterdam. She asked us what our interests were and ensured the tour was tailored to things that we found interesting. This was a first day in Amsterdam so this gave us a good idea of places we wanted to go back to and explore further. Lealu was also great at setting a good walking pace for us seeing as we had just arrived to Amsterdam and was running on no sleep! Highlights of the tour included a shop that only sells products from family businesses that have been around for over a hundred years (approx.) and the best rated fries shop in Holland! We also really enjoyed Lealu's wealth of knowledge and sense of humour - the tour seemed to go by very quickly! I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wants to get a good feel of Amsterdam!

Great RLD tour. Mark was a great guide who really knows the RLD well. He has great comparison and genuine interest in the history and culture of the women who work here. I highly recommend him and this company.

Amsterdam with a friendly face.. Following an in-line skating trip with my wife, we completed our vacation with a stop in Amsterdam for a couple of days prior to returning home. Having scheduled the "Red Light" & "City Walking" tours we found that our time was well spent. With Benjamin as our guide, we plied our way throughout the city while he provided the narrative & details we would not have noted on our own, or may not have read about. He was very knowledgeable of the city highlights and provided many wonderful insights into the history of the city and the impacts affecting it today. Having a bit of humor certainly added to the entertain value of the tours. We then followed up the city tour with the "Countryside" tour the next day. We had a fabulous time with Rory as well. Having a smaller tour group, 6 people, certainly made this experience so much better than one of the larger corporate tours. Rory had taken us to several places that we would not have otherwise ventured too, we were very happy with the cities and places we had visited. Exploring Monnickendam and stopping for coffee and pie at a local orphanage made for a splendid morning. We then headed out to stop by one of the dairy & Tulip farms, it was surprising to see how modernized the farm is. Our last stop, Schermermolen, was a visit to see a working windmill. It's amazing how the windmills were originally built and for the purpose behind them. Rory covered the history of the windmills and why they were put in place and how they are still in use today.We had a wonderful time and experience with both guides, Benjamin & Rory. Both guides are very knowledgeable with the history of Amsterdam and the surrounding areas. They made the last few days of our vacation very memorable and we were thankful to spend time with them.

The highlight of our trip. My family loved this tour! The tour is like taking a laid back walk with a friend. Benjamin is fantastic!! He is so knowledgeable regarding not only the history of Amsterdam but also it's culture, architecture,customs and foods. Combine that with an outgoing, friendly personality and a great sense of humor and you have the perfect tour guide. Benjamin said, " I don't love Amsterdam because I live here. I live here because I love Amsterdam. " His pride in his city really showed. I think that is the reason this tour is so good. It's not guided by someone " just doing a job" but by someone who truly loves his city and wants to show it off and share it with others.  We took the tour the day after we arrived and it really helped us to learn a lot about Amsterdam and orient us to the city which helped us when walking around later in our trip. I love that this tour is small. We had 10 people in our group. I never felt like I was being rushed along and Benjamin was very open to us asking questions. I highly recommend this tour !! PS It did rain some on the tour but I had several umbrellas with us and the rain did nothing to detract from the tour.

Refreshing Countryside Tour. This was such fun with Rory, our guide, who had a wealth of knowledge about the Dutch Water management system (way more interesting than it sounds!) and all aspects of rural Holland. Our questions were answered with honesty and wit, he drove the 7 of us around the countryside, pausing when we wanted to take photos and provided us with a very welcome glass of juice/wine, cheese, cold meats & fruit at lunchtime after we had spent time wandering around the spectacular working windmill. A total hit and a very welcome respite from the city.....and oh, did I mention the visit to a fascinating dairy farm with the most amazing computerised milking system and the walk around a truly pretty village where we had coffee & apple pie?? Soooo good!

That Dam Guide - Mark was awesome!. Mark was a wonderful guide - my 13 year old son and I spent over 3 hours with him on a beautiful sunny afternoon and learned a lot, laughed a lot, walked a lot (wear good shoes) and even ate a little. He took us all over Amsterdam and provided a lot of information about the Dutch today and about their history. He's a kind hearted person, with wonderful stories and it's easy to see that he really enjoys what he does and has a true respect and love of Amsterdam. Well worth it - you will come out of this tour much more informed - there is so much more to Amsterdam than the Red Light District (RLD). Thanks Mark!!

Walking tour of Amsterdam . Lealu is such a knowledgeable young lady. We enjoyed our tour very much. Tour was very interesting, even our teens enjoyed the tour. We especially appreciated the follow up email that we received from Lealu. She remembered our interest during the tour. We received more information with that regard afterwards.

Amsterdam City Tour. Our tour guide, Benjamin, did a fantastic job. He was very knowledgeable, while extremely entertaining. We spent 3 hours on a beautiful summer day learning all about the amazing city of Amsterdam. I would highly recommend this tour company - and Benjamin!

Wonderful country side tour!. I had an amazing time on the country-side tour with Mark. He showed us many non-touristy, beautiful spots in the area around Amsterdam-- rolling green fields, quaint towns, delicious apple pie, and even a working Windmill, which we could explore! The picnic was classy -- nice wine and Dutch cheese... overall a great experience! Because the group was small we got to know the other people on the tour and ended up having a really enjoyable day. I highly recommend this tour when you're visiting Amsterdam!

Excellent walking tours of city and RLD. Ben was an excellent guide. Lots of information and very entertaining. helped me to understand the city and the culture of Amsterdam much better. Was a lot of fun and would definitely recommend this tour highly.

Brilliant tour of Amsterdam . Lealu was a fantastic guide. We were a little unsure about Amsterdam but Lealu put all our fears to rest with a fantastic walking tour of this majestic city. Her knowledge of the city was in incredible. Her knowledge was only surpassed by her delivery and her friendliness! Totally recommend. We were deciding between a cycling tour and a walking tour and glad that we chose the That Dam Guide. Thanks Lealu!

City and RLD Tour. My wife and I took two tours with Mark, the City Tour and the RLD tour. The main benefit of these tours are the small groups (capped at ~10) instead the huge, huge groups of the Sandman tours. If only choosing one I would choose the RLD tour primarily because you can tell how passionate Mark is about the RLD and the history and the women who work in the district. We actually had the opportunity to have a beer with Mark after the RLD tour. He's a great guy. You can't go wrong with his tours.

city walking tour. We took a private walking tour with Lealu. She was energetic and very knowledgeable. She knew the history of Amsterdam and answered all of our questions. We enjoyed our tour with her and highly recommend her and That Dam Guide tour company as we took two tours with them. Both were excellent!

Great day trip to the countryside. My sister and I took this tour with our parents, and it was a great way to finish our trip in Amsterdam!We got to walk around a quaint fishing village, a small dairy farm, and an old windmill. Our tour guide Rory told us all about how water is managed and land was created in and around Amsterdam.Seeing the inside of a windmill was honestly way more interesting than I could have imagined. Seriously. Really really cool.We ended the tour with a picnic of cheese, wine, and other snacks!Rory was great, the whole tour was great! I really recommend it!

Red light tour...awesome. We had Benjamin as our guide (not his real name), with a small group. Immediately he relaxed the group making us all feel welcome. His knowledge of the area is fantastic and his passion was outstanding. He has changed our view of the district and see it from different perspective...Funny, knowledgeable, passionate and interesting tour. Thanks Ben, a superb experience to end our Dam visit.

FANTASTIC TOUR - A must for Amsterdam!. My wife and I took this tour in May 2015 when we visited Amsterdam for 4 days.It was fantastic, entertaining and informative.Mark is truly a great guide and he is passionate about Amsterdam. He is extremely knowledgeable about the sex trade in Amsterdam and the tour provides a great overview of the history and the current trade through the historic red light district.This tour was way above my expectations since I was expecting something a little more dark, sleazy and perhaps tasteless.It was absolutely great and I highly recommend you take this tour if you plan on visiting the red light district. Your appreciation of the trade will change and Mark will certainly bring you another perspective. Walking the street of the red light district is simply not enough to appreciate this part of Amsterdam.Mark was truly a great guide!Not recommended for kids ... Obviously!

Fantastic way to get to know the city. We had Benjamin as our guide for the walking tour, he was absolutely fantastic and we are so glad we took the tour! He gave us insights into the history of the city as well as into present day Amsterdam. To top it all he had a great sense of humour, which kept our small group thoroughly amused through the morning!

Excellent way to learn about the City. We were in Amsterdam a couple of weeks ago and decided to do this tour based on the reviews. We had Lealu as our guide and she was great! There was so much information packed into this tour, that we felt it was worth the money and the time spent. Lealu was so helpful in suggesting various things to do and places to eat, following the tour. Her follow up email with some added information for our visit was also helpful. Thumbs up!

Walking Tour with Mark: Simply outstanding. There cannot be a better way to begin exploring Amsterdam city than to walk with Mark and get introduced to the city , culture and information on not just WHAT but also WHY .The best part is we were a small group of 10 or 12 people unlike the procession of 40 or 50 which we witnessed.We could listen , ask questions and relate to possibly every thing Mark told us. During the walking tour, Mark took us not just around the important monuments, it was a mix of cultural and socio character of the city and how Amsterdam has evolved to be what it is now. A must do on the first day of arrival in the city. Thank you Mark, and keep up the good work

Loved it!. Mark was a wonderful guide! We did the 3 hour City Tour with Mark on a chilly afternoon in Amsterdam. Mark was quite kind and helpful when my husband and I showed up to realize that I had accidentally only booked the tour for myself! Despite my error putting him over his usual 10 person max, he was very understanding and just allowed us to pay him in cash for my husband at the end. Very nice!The tour itself was thorough but also elementary enough for first timers in Amsterdam. He did a great job of representing the city in all its individuality. Mark gave thoughtful and great recommendations for dinner, museums, etc. during a coffee break near the end of the tour. Definitely recommend this tour!

Red Light District Tour with Mark. I took the red light district tour with Mark a few days ago. What an eye-opening tour, and not just for the reasons you think. Mark gave a fantastic tour with lots of interesting back stories of many of the local establishments, a brief history of the politics surrounding the district, and what the current situation of the sex workers today. He was very respectful of the workers. He had lots of funny tidbits to tell us. Take the tour and ask for Mark!

Everything you wanted to know and more!. All I can say is you truly have no idea what goes on in the RLD without this tour. There is SO much more than just the girls in the doorways. Fascinating information and our son admitted that he was not completely mortified being with us - thought it might be awkward but the tour had lots of humor to help make it more comfortable. Highly recommend!

Mark delights teaches and surprises!. Great tour - from design insights to history to best fries and cookies. No selling or commissions - just Mark's love of the city. And he ran over time with everyone's permission, then stayed 5 minutes more just with us to help us plan our next day's activities. We had already been in city three days - but saw all new things with Mark!

Awesome Dam Country tour. Rory and Mark are amazing guides! They're funny and professional….Our kids ages 10,12,14 (as did my husband and I) found the information on the tour about dykes, farming, animals and windmills extremely interesting. They took us to small quaint towns while explaining the history of the Netherlands in a captivating way. We visited a cafe and had some delicious homemade apple pie. Then we visited a working windmill and they described all the mechanics and history of it. It was intriguing how everything worked and seeing how people used to live in the windmill. Fascinating! I would highly recommend this tour for anyone interested in seeing more than just Amsterdam when they visit! After the tour, they followed up with an email to remind of all that we had done and provided us with some suggestions of good local restaurants (which we tried and were impressed with the food). They also gave us local canal cruise suggestions - which was outstanding. Book with them - it's soooo worth it!!!

Interesting RLD tour!. After reading reviews here, decided to go for the RLD tour. Lealu was our guide and she was very friendly and approachable from the very start! At all times, she was interactive with us and encouraged us to ask any questions. It was a 2 hours long tour, but Lealu managed to kept the tour interesting throughout! Definitely recommend this to anyone visiting amsterdam! :)

Ask for Rob "That Dam Guide". The first thing we did in Amsterdam was to go on a walking tour with Rob "That Dam Guide". Rob was very informative and enthusiastic, you could tell he loved the city and wanted us to fall in love with Amsterdam as well. The narrow alleys, secret cafe, beautiful canals, the BEAUTIFUL flowers - Rob we loved your city!! Thank you for lovely tour.

Great tour of some of the less touristy parts of Amsterdam's surrounds.. Rory was a great knowledgable guide and had clearly made an effort to scout some of the less touristy, more authentic attractions of Amsterdam's surrounds. We would definitely recommend to others!

Dam Guide Awesome!. We booked Mark for a private walking tour of the City of Amsterdam for two. Very professional arrangements. He met us at our hotel and, as that is where we wanted to end, he adapted his route. He was informative, funny and a wonderful guide. He took us by interesting sights many of which we went back to the next day to tour inside! He made wonderful suggestions for restaurants and museums. He was the reason that we look back at our two days and nights in Amsterdam with such fondness and wonderful memories.

Great introduction to the city.. Our first stop in Amsterdam was this walking tour. We choose it because of TA reviews and had a wonderful experience. Lealu took her time to show us the sights and followed up with interesting links for us after the fact. Great tour!

Delightful Amsterdam Countryside Tour!. Having been to Amsterdam before, we wanted something really unique outside the city and Mark, owner of That Dam Guide tour company, provided it and more. From my initial contact with him, everything was very professional and caring in the way he helped make provisions for my husband's limited mobility. On the day of the tour, to say he went out of his way to help my husband is an understatement. Our visits to small local waterland towns (read no tourist buses in our way) were wonderful and punctuated with a unique apple pie stop. Our stop at a small, but very automated farm with many diversified products was even enlightening to this former 4-Her. Learning about water management in the Netherlands was facinating, but seeing it in action was even better. Our fun day was rounded out with windmills, a picnic (wine, cheese, nibblies,etc) and a cheese factory. Even my well-traveled and hard-to-please husband had a great day. Do yourself a favor and book with Mark and his associates at That Dam Guide tour company, while in the Amsterdam area. Money well spent!!!

Fantastic First Day in Amsterdam. My friend Shirley booked Mark for a private walking tour of Amsterdam on our first day in the city. Mark is very friendly and easy going. His email correspondence with Shirley was always prompt and professional. Mark is an extremely knowledgeable guide and taught us a lot of different things about Amsterdam from history to present day. He was very good about giving us tips on how to be safe from pick pockets and advice on the culture in Amsterdam. He is also a very fun guide and a good sport with pictures and answering all of our questions. He is very good at gauging his audience and was very patient. We didn't feel rushed and overwhelmed. The walking tour with Mark was a great way to be introduced to the beautiful city of Amsterdam. Thanks Mark :)

Very Good Red Light District Tour.. Really enjoyed That Dam Guide Red Light District Tour. I had previously done this tour with another company and this tour was superior. I beleive that our tour guide's name was Benjamin. He was very informative and quite humorous. He is also quite the beer expert and. Is anxious totell you about the best beer around and where to drink it. I recommend the tour if you are interested in the Red Light District.

Great overview of the city. This was the perfect way of getting introduced to Amsterdam on my first day there. The tour was easy to walk and covered a lot of ground and important sites. I enjoyed the tour guide, Benjamin, as well. Very acidic sense of humor...which I like. He is quite proud of his Dutch heritage and shared a lot of interested facts about the Dutch that I didn't know. (This was great info for me as I am Dutch on my dad's side.) I have a new found respect for the Dutch!

Things that make you say hmmmm.... Lealu was our guide for the RLD tour and we had a great time! It was a warm Saturday night, loads of people out, Stags and Hen Do's with bridal parties all dressed for fun and Lealu with her straightforward, open and 'no holds barred' explanation of her neighbourhood and its colourful inhabitants. She encouraged all questions and made everyone feel comfortable asking. Just the right amount of time on this tour and meeting point located centrally and close to the district.

Get to know Amsterdam. We loved That Dam Guide walking tour of Amsterdam. We covered a lot of territory in a short period of time. We even touched on a corner of the Red Light District. Mark had so much interesting information to share about all the areas and great stories about the city.

Fun tour with a personal touch. Recommended!. We did two tours with Mark: The Red Light District Tour and The Amsterdam Walking Tour. Both were informative and fun, but The RLD tour was the best. Mark is very knowledgable about the ways and regulations of the district - it was very interesting. He was friendly, smart and accommodating. He also sent additional info via email after the tour! I would absolutely recommend him to anyone.
Fun and interesting. A great tour that took us out of Amsterdam and to see some of the country side, windmills, locks, dams and more. Very nice non-touristy locations and authentic experience.

A lot of fun!!. We took the RLD tour and it was really nice... Benjamin took us into the red light district and it was an amazing experience. Was kind of a rullete of emotions: we were laughing, we were serious, we were learning about the girls, discovering the neighborhood, analyzing the building, talking about drinks and bars, the brown cafes and the coffee shops... really a nice experience and a realle realle fun tour... we enjoy it a lot... we even thinking in taking again if we go to Amsterdam...

One day in Amsterdam, excellent tour!. I only had one day in Amsterdam (long flight layover) and spent a big part of it with That Dam Guide. It was a great tour! Our guide was informative, funny, and personable. After the tour we all got lunch together at one of the restaurants she recommended. Highly recommended!

Amsterdam City Walking Tour. We have been to Amsterdam a few times . This was the first time we did a walking tour.The weather wasn't the best. But Lealu or guide made it so interesting and engaging , we forgot about the weather. She was so patient with our group of 10 who had a tendency to lag behind. We learnt so much more and interesting facts about Amsterdam that the rest of our holiday became more interesting . The 3 hour tour was fully worth the time and money.Lealu was very knowledgeable .She would answer all our questions never hurried.It was a totally very pleasant end enjoyable experience.Booking was very easy they were available on phone for any queries.Communicated wehen we were thinking of cancelling the tour due to bad weather. Mark's gentle persuasion and Leallu 's patience paid off.I would recommend the thedamtour to anyone who is visiting Amsterdam

Great company, do not need to look further!. We had a walking tour with Mark and Countryside tour with Rory a couple of days ago. For starters, Guys have impeccable work ethic - Mark answered all my emails, even not related to the tour (questions about the city) very quickly. He gave us a great tour, did not try selling us anything, and although we had a break, it was short (around 15 min) with great coffee (and cheap one) mostly for bathroom use. They do stick to small group policy - our friends wanted to join us on a full tour and Mark offered other time options but did not add two people to the full group. We learned a lot and enjoyed every moment of it. The next day was a Country tour. Rory met us well in advance and with our agreement waited for 15 min for the couple, running late (they never showed up). We went to the beautiful countryside, village where we met only four tourists with their guide. It was definitely not a tourist attraction, rather the small nice town. We had a tasty apple pie and tried herring and eel. After spending time in the country we ended the tour with visiting windmills and a great picnic with cheese tasting, wine, and meat. We never felt rushed, had friendly conversations with other tourists, and overall had a great time. After both tours we got follow up emails with links to different information. We had many tours over the years, but this company definitely stands out.

Lives up to Expectations!. This is the only tour I pre-booked for our time in Europe, and that decision was based on reviews I had read at Tripadvisor. "Trust me," I told my husband, who doesn't like our vacation time tied up with tours. He and I both LOVED our tour with Benjamin, not only because he was charming and witty but because he was so darn knowledgeable and passionate about the city. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone--take it early in your stay to get a real sense of the city. You will appreciate it all the more!

Absolutely Fantastic!. My husband & I took the City Tour with Mark and the Red Light District Tour with Lealu. Both of them were absolutely fantastic! Both Mark & Lealu were entertaining and informative. We have done a number of walking tours all over the world, and these two were among our most favorites. We were happy that we did the tours at the beginning of our stay in Amsterdam as they gave us a better feel for the city and made our trip more worthwhile. Both were completely worth the time and money, and I would highly recommend them. (Mark even went the extra mile and helped me get the Museumkaart during our break which was beyond appreciated.)

Walking Tour with Mark. Just back from a thoroughly enjoyable short break in Amsterdam. Our walking tour with Mark was an excellent introduction to the city, covering Amsterdam's history, culture and social customs, all delivered with humour and enthusiasm.

History, geography and social customs delivered with humor.. Mark made our walking tour around Amsterdam some of the best hours we spent on tours during our Baltic cruise. His knowledge of the city and its history, customs and people gave us a real appreciation for the uniqueness of Amsterdam. He even adapted our route so we could be in the "middle" of a Monet painting on a canal bridge and then took our picture there. I didn't really know if I would like Amsterdam, but Mark's introduction to the city made me fall in love and want to return.

Unforgettable city and country tours!. Fresh from Amsterdam where I and my husband spent a marvellous holiday. Among the things we liked best were the two tours we took with Mark. I cannot remember the last time we had so much fun on any tour! What made the experience so great was Mark's genuine friendliness, helpfulness, vast knowledge on everything Dutch, a great sense of humour and hospitality - he even bothered to set up a picnic! He took us to places no other regular tour operator takes you, sent us links to loads of interesting stuff about the Netherlands and the Dutch culture. We returned home armed with lots of new knowledge. Being a teacher, this is what I appreciate all the more!

Nice, personalized overview of the city. Small groups make for a very personalized experience as you are introduced to the culture, buildings, and history of Amsterdam. Well worth the time and money. Come with any questions about absolutely anything in the city because your guide will go out of his way to make sure you get answers.

Red Light District Tour with Lealu - Well worth it. My wife and I researched private guides for a Red Light District tour and came upon Mark's name in the Rick Steve's forum. After contacting him, we were pleased to learn that his associate Lealu would be available to take us on a 2 hour guided tour.First and foremost, both Mark and Lealu were extremely professional, provided specific instructions on when and where to meet, the cost, and even pictures of Lealu and the location to insure that we could meet her. As this was all done over email, it definitely made the process significantly easier having a picture.On the day of our tour, Lealu was prompt and wearing the very obvious pom that was in her picture. We approached her and she immediately identified herself and was extremely courteous and firendly.The tour itself was exactly what we wanted. Lealu lives and has worked in one of the shops in the Red Light District giving her an intimate knowledge of the location. She provided an informative perspective on both the lives of the women working there, the culture, businesses, and helped to dispel the myths and misconceptions about the RLD. She was unabashed and did not shy away from subjects that could be considered sensitive and told both the good and the bad allowing us to form our own judgements from facts. We walked throughout the entire area, crossing the various canals, going past the coffee shops, "theaters", windows, churches, canals, and even the 5 star restaurant. Even as it started to rain, Lealu assured us that she would continue the tour and wasn't done until we had seen everything, regardless of the time. I truly believe that we got an insiders perspective of the RLD. Lealu was very friendly, extremely knowledgeable, and well worth the money and time invested. The next day, we had an included tour from our River Cruise and they brushed through the RLD with an almost "avert" your eyes attitude. Having spent the previous evening with Lealu, we were disappointed by the way that guide avoided the subject. If you are at all interested in learning about the Red Light District, I strongly recommend spending the time and money with Lealu. You won't regret it.
Amazing day!!. This was a great tour for the price! Mark was wonderful and we really enjoyed this tour, would like to do others with him!! I would recommend this tour to everyone!

Amsterdam Country Tour and Red Light Distrcit Tour. Mark took us on the country tour and it was just fantastic! He is a pleasure to spend time with and was knowledgeable and so funny and entertaining! Lulu took us on the red light district tour and was also brilliant. Wonderful sense of humour and passion for the city!Both tours were a max of 6 people and were personal and not rushed. We could have carried on for many more hours with them both!I can HIGHLY recommend both tours and both tour guides!

Entertaining. Educational. Not overwhelming.. Did the walking tour with Mark. Well worth the time and cost. Have already referred my Facebook friends And suggest you put this tour group high on your list.

City tour with Benjamin!. Tour of a fantastic city with a small group and a guide on steroids! :) First and foremost, Amsterdam is a fantastic city, with so much history and interesting past that unless you have a fantastic guide who is knowledgeable and passionate, you could easily overlook the basic essence of the city and get caught up in the other famous or infamous things associated with this place.We had a wonderful experience with Benjamin, not only did we become more aware of the city, we had loads of fun as well, thanks to his energy and good sense of humour. And, don't forget my opening line - overcast conditions, which quickly turned into persistent rain. Even then!! :)Our experience of this city became much more personalised after this tour. And, during my second visit, i got to know Amsterdam for the first time. :)Tip for travellers - this tour requires a lot of walking, so dress comfortable with a good pair of walking shoes.

Relaxed tour :). My husband and I took the countryside tour with Rory and had a great time! The tour wasn't rushed and he had a great amount of knowledge about the history of water management and how it fit with the Dutch way of life. Was a great way to spend a day seeing more than just the Amsterdam city center. Definitely recommend taking the time to spend a day with Rory exploring windmills and dairy farms!!!

A great way to learn Amsterdam.. Lulu made my time in Amsterdam so much more enjoyable. After this tour I was able to easily manage my travel in the city. Lulu gave the perfect mix of basic knowledge of the city and history of the city. She knew any question I asked and was happy to answer any I had.I would recommend this to my friends, family and anyone looking to know the city of Amsterdam.

Nice Tour. If you are looking for a small intimate walking tour with a maximum of 10 people, this is the tour for you. Rob, our guide, was knowledgable and personable. We enjoyed the 3 hour walk with a stop in a nice cafe mid way through.

Red "enLIGHTened". Benjamin was the perfect guide for our tour around Amsterdam's red light district . He has a good sense of fun and is very knowledgeable about this part of the old city. Tour is from 8 to 10 in the evening and along with providing a better understanding of the sex industry you will get a nice overview of the old town center. Fun evening activity.

Enjoyable walking tour. We spent three hours in the rain with Benjamin. Even though the weather was cool and damp (in late June) we had a great time. Benjamin is a terrific tour guide, extremely personable and enthusiastic about his City. We learned a lot about Amsterdam and saw some wonderful sights. Take this tour!
Good tour . This was a lovely tour. The guide was knowledgable and friendly. A great way to see the city. Excellent tips given too. Really glad we did this tour! SO Happy!!!

Excellent Amsterdam City Tour. This was a great tour. Lealu is very pleasant and informed. She walked us all through the city. It was our first day in Amsterdam and was the perfect start to a wonderful stay in The Netherlands. A private tour is the way to go.

Private Tour with Lealu - she was fantastic!!. We had such a great tour with Lealu! We decided to try a private tour because we love to focus on the history of an area and really move at our own pace. We were with our two teens, and I wanted them to see the Red Light District and have an understanding of what happens there, but in a PG13 version of sorts. Lealu was just wonderful with pace, answering our questions, assessing my kid's interest in different things, and sharing the local's view of Amsterdam. She was a delight, and we all laughed, because it rained through the entire tour!
