After the tour we received a great follow up email with some of the information we'd discussed, recommendations for books and more information.

Wonderful tour of Amsterdam. Lealu was our guide on a great tour of Amsterdam. Very informative and entertaining. The group size was small and we even had lunch together afterwards. Lealu sent a follow-up email with links to great info to learn more about Amsterdam and related topics.Take this tour!

Small group tour with lots of information.. Can't tell you how pleased I was with the tour with Lealu. She told us so much information, yet we were never rushed. She keeps a pleasant pace and lets you ask as many questions as you would like. I was totally blown away with this tour.

Small group and very informative and interesting. Our tour with Mark with everything he promised and more. It was appropriately paced and fascinating. Even though I had knee surgery, I could keep up . His tour was entertaining as well as factual. We enjoyed him so much, we took him for lunch when tour ended. I would recommend That Dam Tour for young and old.

A fantastic walk with an excellent guide!. We booked a tour from Australia - with Mark Law of "That Dam Guide" fame. Mark was so welcoming and informative. He limits the group size to 10 and as a result everyone is "in the front" when the group stops and everyone has the chance to ask questions. We thoroughly enjoyed the walk and highly recommend it. Mark even sent us some useful websites as a follow up to our questions. Excellent experience!

Small groups and very interesting!. I did the red light district tour on friday.Our tour had only eight people in it, and that really is great! When I saw the other tours, I often couldn't even count how many people there were listening to a shouting guide.Because of the smaller groups, it gets a lot more personal and you can ask as much questions as you'd like.The guide is very knowledgable and really put an effort in showing us the best spots around.She explained us how everything works and how this neighbourhood came to be. A must while in Amsterdam!

Great experience for families too. We did the 1/2 day tour with Rob and it was so worth it. Iinformative, fun, and well paced, He did great with the teenage kids in the red light district. He had great little stories and behind the scenes ape vents! Great for all.

The Countryside Tour is Amazing!. We took the Countryside Tour with Mark in May, and I must say it was one of the best tours I have ever been on! Mark is a delightful guide. He is warm, personable and knowledgeable about the area. He planned stops that were interesting and off the beaten path, and was a wealth of information on the waterlands area and how it was developed. We stopped at two quaint villages, were treated to Dutch apple pie and coffee, and tried a strumpwafel. We then visited a farm that produces milk for the local cheese industry before heading to a windmill area. At the windmill, we were able to climb up inside and see it working, without crowds! Afterward, Mark treated us to a picnic lunch with different varieties of local cheeses, as well as wine, grapes, meats and crackers before we headed back to Amsterdam. Tours are limited to 6 or 7 people, and I found the price less than the “big bus” tours offered in the area. It was a delightful day in the company of a new friend!

Spirited Away.... My fiancee and I did a private walking tour with Mark. It was our first time visiting Amsterdam so I figured it was worth the money to find a reputable tour guide. Thanks TripAdvisor! Mark was very passionate about his job. Through the tour, I learned so much about the wonderful people of Amsterdam, it's rich history, art, architecture and the red light district culture. Mark was very informative and injected the tour with a nice humor. This tour was definitely the best way to get to know Amsterdam. Make sure you take your walking shoes though. If you get hungry during the tour or need to use the bathroom, just speak up. Mark knows all the spots.

Great Experience!. I booked the 3 hour City walking Tour and it was very informative, relaxing and a great way to get to know the city. There were only 6 other people in my group so it was almost like having a private tour all by yourself. Our guide was very knowledgeable of both the history and the social scene of Amsterdam. He was engaging and interesting to listen to. I will definitely try another one of their tours if I am lucky enough to be in Amsterdam again.
Nice overview of Amsterdam. Mark was very friendly and knowledgeable and made the tour pleasant. I would recommend this tour because of the size of the tour (10 max) which makes it very nice.
Excellence!!!!! . Far exceeded my expectations, #1 choice for next time and I compared with others. They catered to everyone, making my stay a memorable one. THANKS!!!

Excellent Tour!. A buddy and I took the walking tour of Amsterdam led by Rob. Rob provided a great balance between history and life in the city. Pace was not too hectic, yet we visited many important sites and had time for photos and conversation. Rob also took us to a delightful cafe for a perfectly timed break.The group was small, which made the walk more personal and pleasurable. I will take this for again when I return to this beautiful city!

European Adventure 2016. We arrived into Amsterdam on a Friday about mid-day. We checked into our hotel and then proceeded to meet our guide from "That Dam Guide." Our guide's name was, Rob, and he was nothing short of AMAZING!!!! We were a group of 6 and there were 4 additional people in our group. Rob made each and everyone of us feel like we were the only ones on the tour!!! This was a three hour walking tour of Amsterdam and in that short amount of time I'm pretty sure Rob took us to EVERY neighborhood in Amsterdam!!! His knowledge of his adopted city is EXTENSIVE (he's originally from NJ in the USA!!)!!! He regaled us with great stories about life in Amsterdam!! His energy and passion for the city was wonderful!! Our group learned so much in such a short period of time!! He had keen insight into Amsterdam's history, government, social norms and simply everyday living. He was able to squeeze in a quick stop to an out of the way cafe (only the locals know about) for a quick coffee and cake break...the apple cake was delicious!! I'm so very glad we decided to do this tour on our very first day in Amsterdam!! I"m so very glad we decided to choose "That Dam Guide" for our tour!! Most especially, I'm so very glad that Rob was the one chosen to give us our tour of Amsterdam!! What a comprehensive, extensive, incredibly interesting introduction to a wonderful city!! Thank you Rob!!

"Fun in Amsterdam with Benjamin". We were a group of eight and were fortunate to have Benjamin as our guide for our magical tour of Amsterdam. Benjamin delivered his information in a factual and knowledgeable manner with a witty, "tongue in cheek" sense of humor. It was delightful to spend the day with him and learn so much about the beautiful and engaging city of Amsterdam. This is my favorite city of those we visited and would love to return someday...Only if Benjamin was my guide! I highly recommend "The Dam Guide Tours"Wear comfortable shoes and prepare to be amazed!

Red Light District Tour with Lealu!. We had a wonderful guide in Lealu! She was so fantastic and she REALLY knew what she was talking about. She spoke with authority on a subject that she clearly has studied extensively. Doesn't hurt that she lives in the neighborhood! I highly recommend this tour company. Everything was handled perfectly from learning more about the tour on the website, booking the tour, email communications, meeting place ... everything. Just perfect. That Dam Guide is awesome and Lealu is the bomb!

Different, excellent and fun. . Great guide. Mark is knowledgeable and delivers information in a fun and easy to understand way. If you're looking for a different kind of tour, That Dam Guide is the guide to go for.

Tour to remember. On June 8th a group of eight of us met our tour guide Benjamin. He took us on an informative, enlightening, unforgettable and funny tour of Amsterdam. It was the best tour I've ever been on. Because of the size of our group, we could ask many questions along the way. I left the tour with a new way to look at the world around me. Highly recommended!

Outstanding walking tour of Amsterdam!. League was an awesome guide. She took us on an excellent private 3 hour walking tour. She is SO knowledgeable and presented the information at a perfect pace. She made the who,e experience so interesting and fun. The 3 hours flew by and we had a fabulous time just ineteracting with her. She made any adjustments we asked for and immediately got a good sense of our group and what we liked etc. she was so generous with her knowledge - both of historical information and living in current day Amsterdam. Would HIGHLY recommend taking this tour. Thanks Lealu!!!

Tour groups are always under 10 people!. All the walking tours we saw in Amsterdam had so many people in one group that the guide had to use a microphone. Not so with That Dam Guide. Tours are limited to ten people. We had seven. That's a small enough group that we could stop half way through our three-hour tour for a coffee in a lovely building where Rembrandt once painted and sit together at a single table for a continued discussion of all things Amsterdam. Rob is a wonderful guide. I'm a history buff of sorts and I was really impressed with the depth of his knowledge.

Great tour and fun guide!!!. We booked our tour based on great reviews and we were not disappointed. Our guide was Rob. He was informative, funny, really knowledgeable about the history of the Netherlands and Amsterdam. We wandered onto little nooks we missed while out on our own. At the end of the tour he made some suggestions of places to go and highlights not to miss. We were lucky enough to hang with him after when we all landed at the same cafe. Not to miss tour for a great overview of the city. Was almost 4 hours bc the small group liked to gab and ask questions. Rob was great and did not rush is thru and he took time to answer any questions asked.

Welcome to AMS. We arrived in Amsterdam, checked into our hotel and then immediately set out to meet our tour guide. We had a private walking tour scheduled for the morning. Shortly after arriving at our meeting point, The National Monument, we were approached by a kind young man named Benjamin. Benjamin was to be our guide. After brief introductions, we were given our loose itinerary and off we went! Benjamin had a deep knowledge and understanding of the city and it's history. His passion for Amsterdam was contagious and I found myself being immersed in this foreign city. As stated before, the plan was structured but loose. Benjamin had an idea how he wanted us to view Amsterdam but also wanted us to have the freedom to ask questions or step off the beaten path. A highlight for me was when I asked about jenever. He immediately took us through the winding streets and brought us to his favorite jenever bar. After showing me the proper way to enjoy the tasty spirit, we were back on track with the tour. When we finished the tour 3 hours later, Benjamin sat with us and highlighted many of the things we saw on a map. He stayed as we asked countless questions about the city he clearly loves. Benjamin was a genuinely kind, entertaining, and knowledgeable guide. I could not have thought of a better way to start our time in AMS. He introduced us to a city that I now love as well.

This is a great way to get an overview of the city. My family of four (including two teenagers) thoroughly enjoyed our 3 hour walking tour with Lealu. She was energetic and knowledgeable. The tour size of 10 people was near perfect and it seemed everyone enjoyed themselves. She was patient with questions and gave thoughtful answers. She treated the subjects of sex workers and drugs with aplomb to a group that went from preteen to retirement age. Kudos, and thanks for the intro!

amazing tour!. Lealu was a great tour guide for the city walking tour. It was fascinating, fun and the 3 hours went by very quickly! She also did a good job of asking if anyone needed a break -- but the stops along the way where she explained what we were seeing and it's history were the perfect little breaks. Lealu also didn't seem to get thrown off track when random questions were asked -- her knowledge of the city was pretty amazing. I highly recommend this tour and would try another of That Dam Guide's tours.

The best guide I have ever had, anywhere!. Walking tours are one of the best ways to see Amsterdam but the guide you choose does make a difference. The concierge at our hotel suggested we book a private tour, however, we wanted something a little less expensive yet still intimate, so he told us to go on-line and check out That Dam Guide. We couldn't have made a better choice. My wife and I have traveled to over 60 countries throughout the world and we've taken many tours, some good, some bad. But, I must admit, I've never enjoyed myself or learned as much as I did, on the Amsterdam city tour I took with Rob. He's an incredible guide! As promised, the group was small; only 10 of us, and boy did we cover a lot. Rob made us feel right at home. It felt like he was just showing a group of friends around the city. What a fun way to explore Amsterdam as well as learn a little bit about city's history. I'll always remember my visit by the day I spent wandering the streets of Amsterdam with "that dam guide", Rob. A not to be missed experience. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Small group, knowledgeable guide. I was tempted to take a "free" walking tour but after reading many reviews online, I opted to pay for a smaller group experience, and I'm so glad I did... it was my first time in Amsterdam, and who knows when I'll be back, so I figured I'm worth it :) Anyway, Mark was a great guide, never pushy, no stupid stops at stores trying to get us to buy things so he could get a kickback. Just a nice, informative, well-paced walk all around central Amsterdam, with a group of 9 other people. He told us some history, some tips about the city, and glimpses into the politics and issues facing The Netherlands today. Our small group of 10 was diverse in age and nationality, and I think everyone had a good time. Highly recommended! Saw many of the "free" groups going by with 3 or 4 times as many people. Felt like I made the right choice.

Red light district with Benjamin. Went on Red Light tour with Benjamin. Tour was amazing. Ben has great knowledge of the area and was very funny. Highly recommended. Small group worked well as area was very busy.

Awesome guide!. Mark did a wonderful job incorporating history and fun facts. We also asked him to customize our tour, to show us some local food and drink. He did not disappoint! We were traveling with grandparents and teenagers who all enjoyed the tour. Thank you, Mark!

Really glad we chose That Dam Guide. Deciding on an Amsterdam tour group was difficult. A number of them had excellent Trip Advisor ratings, and some were free. In the end we chose That Dam Guide because of its reasonable price for a city tour and the fact that they limit tours to 10 people. I'm glad we did as Rob was a terrific guide, and we didn't visit just the typical sights in Amsterdam. Rob, an accomplished American musician who has lived in Amsterdam for 14 years, showed us the important areas and buildings but more importantly, provided interesting insights into Dutch culture and history and gladly answered questions.

Great Tour. I did the tour with Benjamin and we were only three people which was great! Benjamin knows a lot about the city and its history and he knows loads of stories. Definitely recommend this tour.

City Walking Tour. Our group of 8 took the city walking tour with Benjamin. He was one of the best tour guides we have had on our many vacation tours! We visited all of the major sights in Amsterdam, and Benjamin was extremely knowledgeable about each site. But it was his personality that stole the show. He kept us laughing while we were learning. He even arranged a canal cruise for us through another tour guide for later in the evening. This was money well spent, and we highly recommend this tour guide outfit.

The Dutch Countryside Tour - GREAT DAY OUT!. I was looking for a tour that was a little more intimate than the bigger tours, yet still reasonably priced and was put in touch with Mark and Rory who I was told run small group tours to the countryside. I booked immediately and was not disappointed with the outcome. They promised a small group (tick!), a comfortable ride (tick!), visits to unique areas (tick!) and fun (tick tick!). A great day out, very well organised and yet not too rigid that you feel rushed. Highlight of my Amsterdam trip and highly recommended!

Lovely afternoon with Rob. We were searching for a walking tour for our first day in Amsterdam and we were impressed by the reviews for this. It wasn't cheap but it was definitely worth the money. Rob was a great guide and he handled the group well, even when people were quite rudely talking over him and disrupting the flow. It was the perfect way to start our trip and we learned lots - Rob really knew his stuff and could answer all questions. His enthusiasm for the city was evident. Would definitely recommend to any friends or family visiting Amsterdam.

Excellent walking tour. Took this tour today with Rob as our guide. He is very knowledgeable, friendly and energetic. Tours are small - no more than 10 people (there were 9 on ours), so it is very easy to interact with Rob and the other guests on the tour. I would highly recommend this tour - incredible value.

Excellent tour. Went on a city tour with this company. Our guide was knowledgable and engaged in doing a great job. Tour lasted about 3 hours. Much smaller group (10 max) make it easy to hear and easy to move around the city. Definitely would recommend.

Great Walking Tour. Just finished a walking tour with Mark, and I cannot say enough good things. He was very knowledgeable, gave us a great historical overview of the city and a 3 plus hour tour of the old city filled with antidotes, and fun facts! He said something about always wanting to be a teacher, well he sure is a great one! And all this for $25 euros....truly a bargain!
Great tour highly recommend . Went on this tour today with Rob. Excellent balance of walking and information. Well worth it as you will see things that you are unlikely to find on your own.

Amsterdam city tour. Great tour guide maximum of 10 people in group really helpful and full of knowledge. Made us feel really at ease. For anyone visiting Amsterdam book this tour as soon as possible as you will get a lot more from the following days

3 hours went too fast. Rob led my brother and I on a fun overview of Amsterdam along with 5 other English speaking tourists. Knowledgable of history, warm, engaging and spiced with his own experiences of moving to Amsterdam 12 years ago, Rob took us to beautiful canal corners, history filled sites and an airy, tucked away cafe for a break mid-way. Highly recommended to take a small group. In the midst of the hustle and bustle, we felt privileged to be so nimble.

First rate walking tour of Amsterdam with Lealu. This is the best kind of tour: a small intimate group (there were just 7 of us), and a good combination of seeing things and getting just the right amount of historical background.

The tours made my vacation spectacular. Our first tour was the City Tour with Mark. We enjoyed it so much we scheduled the Red light tour with Lealu, and the Countryside with Mark. Great tours. Great people, great memories.You must do these tours. They made our vacation one to remember.

Great city tour with Lealu. Just got back from the city walking tour. Lealu was a wealth of knowledge, both historical and present day, and her stories were entertaining. We were able to stop and sample some of the foods that are popular in Amsterdam. She also gave us pointers and guidance for visits to some of the popular tourist sights. All in all, it was a great 3+ hours! Thank you, Lealu.

Afternoon Tour with Benjamin. We really enjoyed the tour. Only had one day in Amsterdam and we got the most of it by doing this tour. Benjamin was very knowledgeable and fun. It was great value for money!! They keep their tour groups small which was great...we saw lots of huge tour groups.

Countryside Tour (windmill and cheese). Thank you both Rory and Mark for a wonderful flavour tour of the Dutch countryside.Really enjoyed the whole experience, right from front the start to the end! The tour was very well organised, informative (both Rory and Mark were very knowledgable) with just the right amount of jovial entertainment. Tour was very planned, walking through the quaint town, detailed tour of the windmills and not forgetting the lovely picnic kindly laid out for us. I would highly recommend this tour my friends and family.

Countryside, Windmills & Cheese Tour. We had a truly memorable day with Mark and Rory! They were super friendly and charming, highly knowledgeable and went the extra mile to give us an 'off the beaten track' experience. My favourite part of the trip was the visit to the windmill, viewing the inside which gave us a real taste of what it must have been like to live and work there, followed by a picnic by the side of the dyke. Thank you guys for a wonderful day - shall be recommending you to all my friends and family (let me know if you decide to introduce a sailboat trip, I'll be your first customer ).

Very good tour with Rob. For $25 euors per piece a great deal.. We were scheduled for a 3 hour walking tour with Rob . We were very luck it was only the 2 of us. He was knowledgeable but not boring . My husband gets bored with tours but Rob held his interest for all 3 hours . He actually made sure at the end of the tour that we got on the correct tram to get us to the flea market. We also did the Red Light District Tour with Lealu and she also did a nice job. There were 10 people on that tour and 10 was manageable .

Lots of inside information on the Red Light District. We did the small group tour with Mark and he provided us with a wealth of information about this unique area. He was very respectful of the girls and what they do while at the same time providing us with enough salacious details to keep us entertained. He is friends with some of the working girls and provided us with some interesting insights into the benefits of working in the district for the girls as well as some of the behind the scenes politics. Make sure you do this tour with That Dam guide. Smaller operators are always best!

Amsterdam Walking tour with Benjamin. We were staying in The Hague and took the train in for the Amsterdam Walking tour with Benjamin. The start of the tour is a 5 minute walk from the Amsterdam Centraal train station. The square were we started the tour had a great cafe - The Grand Cafe, I think - were we had lunch (good food, nice beer/wine selection, great service).Benjamin clearly loves Amsterdam and he was a wonderful guide - friendly, funny, and very knowledgeable. Benjamin answered all of our questions, gave enough history and context to appreciate what we were looking at. I really loved that the tour was so small and mobile. The big tour groups - we saw several - move at a much slower pace and are much more structured. Benjamin gave us options for what all we wanted to see and even waited in line with us when we all wanted to stop for french fries!Benjamin also joined us for a beer afterwards (our treat - take care of your guide!) and gave everyone directions for how to get back hotels, etc and had suggestions for other things to do and see while in Amsterdam. A Great Guide and great tour all the way around.

Highlight of our trip with Rob. The tour that was done with Rob was honestly one of the highlights of our Amsterdam trip! Rob is incredibly knowledgable of this great and quirky city. He kept things very interesting and knew every answer to every question we had! I kept asking my boyfriend what was his favorite thing from Amsterdam? He said the tour with Rob was so great! I loved hearing this as I had booked it without him even knowing we were going to do the tour. Rob took us to places we wouldn't have known of otherwise. Honestly, best money spent! You will NOT regret booking a tour. Guaranteed! Thank you Rob for a great tour, we're envious of your life in Amsterdam! :)Tony & HildaSan Francisco

Geert's Passion for Amsterdam Brought It To Life. We enjoyed an extraordinary walking tour of Amsterdam's city center today, with Geert as our deeply knowledgeable, witty, and thoughtful guide. He answered all of our questions with great insight and patience -- and his love for the city and breadth of understanding of its history, politics and culture through the ages made for an unforgettable afternoon. This was a rich experience that helped us appreciate this wonderful city in a whole new light.

Red Light District at night with Mark. We thoroughly enjoyed our night walking tour with Mark. As advertised the group was small and as 2 single ladies we felt very safe, which we may not have, had we been wandering on our own. Mark was highly amusing and entertaining, full of fascinating insights and stories. We have already recommended this tour to other friends. Tracey & Kelly

Great Walking Tour of Amsterdam. We had a wonderful experience with Rob as our tour guide of central Amsterdam. He clearly loved sharing his knowledge of Amsterdam, it's history and querky side notes with fellow English speakers. We was very approachable and gladly answered questions, pointing out some easy to miss sights as well as explaining the Dutch people and their history in our brief time together.

AWESOME!!!. Signed up w/ That Damn Guide for their city tour & their RLD tour. Marc was prompt in answering my questions, helping me plan my itinerary. We had Benjamin for both tours. You can pick his brain on everything Amsterdam-history, art, etc. Stopped for munchies along the way and I'd asked about the tulips in Keukenhof since my visit was late in the season. So we stopped by the flower market. Both tours were different enough and I highly recommend this company.. It's a small group, flexible and you'll get more out of it than the large 20+ ppl groups.

Informative History Lesson. We really enjoyed Lealu's relaxed, informative presentation of Amsterdam Centrum. We learned a lot about the history and beginnings of this cosmopolitan city as well as interesting and unusual little tidbits of life in the city of today. We highly recommend this tour as a great starting point to understanding the city and to finding your way around.  This is a three hour walking tour along cobbled streets. Make sure to have your camera!

Great tour. Had a great walking tour of the city today with Benjamin. He is a charming young man with a wealth of knowledge. The small group made it a great experience. Well worth it and highly recommend.

If you are going to take a tour, take this one!!. This tour was recommended by a friend back home and I am so glad I took her advice. Benjamin was a great guide who was very knowledgeable and witty! They keep the tours to a max of 10 people, which is nice and it didn't even feel like three hours went by! Take this tour!!

Enlightened tour of the red light district . Lealu was a fantastic, knowledgeable, funny and friendly guide as she enlightened us in the real life of those working in the red light district, how the industry has changed over the years, and what makes up this lively neighborhood. Highly recommend this tour and this guide!

Benjamin brings Amsterdam to life. We spent 3 hours walking around Amsterdam with Benjamin, who was a mine of information - both quirky local knowledge and deep historical data. He made Amsterdam make sense and much easier to navigate on foot. He also has a great sense of humour, so the time passed quickly. Take his tour early in your stay to get the most benefit.

Spectacular Experience. Mark conducted a spectacular tour, an informative but entertaining and in depth tour. The day was rainy and chilly, and if the guide were any less than focused and captivating, I might have dodged into the next warm spot for coffee and protection from the day. Mark quickly responded to the questions/interests of the participants, the "flow" of the walk, and the weather. Four from our family joined the tour; we all left saying: fabulous experience, wish we were here longer so that we could take the countryside tour. WE will join that when we return. Thanks Mark.

Perfect way to get to know Amsterdam. I took the city walking tour with Lealu as the guide. It was a small group, only 5 very congenial people. It was a casual tour, and being so small we were all able to have a conversation and ask questions whenever we liked. It was obvious that the guide loves her city and made us feel welcomed immediately. We went on small streets and saw parts of the city that I never would have seen. Everyone should take this tour. Much better than any bus or canal boat tour.

All about Amsterdam. We enjoyed a great day walking Amsterdam with Mark today. He provided all sorts of information - history, architecture, culture - all with humor and warmness for his chosen hometown. Mark was receptive to questions and the interests of the group. We had a couple of yummy stops along the way including tea, Frites and the 'best cookie in the world'. We enjoyed our companions on the tour in this small group as well. Others in the group had done the country tour with Mark as well - jealous - and they loved it. Thanks Mark for a great tour and the post-tour information that we have already explored!
Interesting tour of RLD. We had a small group tour of the RLD with Lealu. Interesting overview of the goings on in the RLD. Humorous and light.

City tour with Lealu. Lealu met us promptly at our designated meeting spot. Our group consisted of only 2 couples so the tour was quite intimate. Lealu took us on a 3 hour leisurely walking tour of the city of Amsterdam including the "Red Light District" and gave us lots of history along the way, pointing out many points of interest including Rembrandts home. Lealu was so down to earth, it felt like we were with an old friend. We also stopped at a lovely cafe for some apple cake and cappucino. A truly delightful tour. I highly recommend That Dam Guide.

You will laugh. We did the Red light district tour with Benjamin. He was a truly wonderful guide who blended knowledge, respect and most importantly humor into the casually paced walking tour in the red light district. The historical and contemporary perspective on the Dutch culture was insightful. This tour is well worth it for the laughs alone. Most highly recommended.

Red Light Tour (RLD) with Mark. Technically this was the first thing we did when we arrived in Amsterdam. It was a small group and wonderful experience. Mark quickly got us acquainted and spoke from his own experience of living around the area. His witty comments really made the entire walk more comfortable and leisurely. He really took time and showed us red light area with an entire different perspective and always keep a dialog going. Highly recommend, you won't regret it.

The City and the RLD tours. The best way to learn about Amsterdam! That Dam Guide Tours was very professional and delivered as advertised. Our group of 4 adults booked The City Tour 05/02/2016, our first full day in Amsterdam. Our guide, Mark, was friendly, informative, talkative, and spoke great English. Our group had only 10 members as promised. This tour was fun and a great way to get started in Amsterdam. We booked the Red Light Tour the next evening with Mark. Once again, fun and informative and only 10 in the group. That Dam Guide keeps their groups small and this makes questions easy and conversations fun. It is worth the price. We saw several "free tours" with 20-30 travelers crowded around 1 guide.

What a day!. My 5 friends and I had a private tour with Mark, That Dam Guide <3 - and we loved it! We had a fantastic day and an interesting journey through the city -we really got the pulse of Amsterdam. So relaxed, so chilled. Mark was truly fun to be with, extremely knowledgeable, and gave us remarkable insight about the history,culture, and politics. We ended up taking a beer with him after the tour. What a day! I highy recommend this tour !

Great Tour! Take it as soon as you arrive in Amsterdam.. Booked That Dam Guide tour with Benjamin a few weeks before arriving based on the fantastic TripAdvisor reviews. We were not disappointed! 3 hour walking tour, we had the 10 person maximum which was very manageable and personable. Benjamin was SO knowledgeable and funny. He gave us such a wealth of information and we saw places we returned to later that we would never have found on our own. I cannot speak more highly of this tour group. They do accept tips, but asked for a Trip Advisor review as a higher priority. Thanks Benjamin!

Walking Tour. We would highly recommend Benjamin and That Dam Guide Amsterdam. Benjamin's knowledge and personality along with the small group size and leisurely pace made this the perfect introduction to Amsterdam.

Dutch Country Side Tour. Had a really lovely time touring the Dutch countryside with both Mark and Rory. The route was breathtaking and they provided lots of info about each town/area we visited. We saw picturesque villages, fishing towns, tulip fields, sheep, cows, swans, windmills and tree-lined narrow backroads. Every place we went was very local (no tourists) and people were very friendly. We stopped at a cafe in a little town and had lattes with delicious Dutch apple pie. Then later, they set up a picnic next to several glorious windmills. Red wine and all sorts of different Beemster cheeses. A thoroughly delightful time and highly recommended.

Best Red Light Tour Ever!. We scheduled the Amsterdam Red Light tour during our April trip. The guide was knowledgeable without being crass. He gave us the most wonderful information about the history of the Red Light District, as well as the current status and future progress.I would highly recommend Mark for any tour. If we had more time we would have scheduled the City Tour or the Windmill tour.

Day Walking Tour with Benjamin . Hi all, first off I did not realise that this was the number 1 walking tour on trip advisor as my wife had booked on our behalf. We had the day tour with Benjamin which started at 10:30am. I can honestly say that not only was Benjamin very knowledgeable but he had a real passion for all things Amsterdam and this was noticeable throughout the entire tour. He was happy to go at the pace of the group and was more than happy to have anyone ask questions about landmarks throughout our tour. I learnt a lot about the city in short space of time and would recommend this tour to anyone planning on a short stay in Amsterdam as it gives you a good grasp of the city quickly. Best points of this tour are its small group sizes (4-8) we were lucky enough to have 4 and the passion from our guide. Would recommend and well deserving of the 5 star rating!Thanks again, Jason and Kate.

A must do. We toured with Mark on our one full day in Amsterdam. What a great experience, we were able to see so much of Amsterdam in the limited time that we had. Mark is very knowledgeable and was able to design his tour based on our input. If you want to get the most of your time in Amsterdam, contact him.

Tour of Amsterdam with "That Dam Guide". We just got back from our tour with Mark, That Dam Guide. Excellent is an understatement. My husband, a history buff, loved Marks's deep historical knowledge of not only Amsterdam, but the history of Europe that effected Amsterdam. Mark was a lot of fun and had a wonderful sense of humor. Would definitely recommend this tour to everyone.. A must do!

Perfect City Tour with Lealu. We had a personal 3 hrs City Tour with Lealu. It was absolutely perfect to get in touch with the City of Amsterdam.
In addition to the interesting Informations about Amsterdam, Lealu had some useful advices for us - e.g we know now the best apple pie in Amsterdam.........

Excellent do-this-first activity to do in Amsterdam.. I could write a great deal about good this tour is but I would only be repeating many of the very accurate reviews already written. Suffice to say that Rob provides, in addition to a comprehensive overview of the the city, insight that travel books cannot adequately portray. We loved the small group approach too...far more personalized. Thanks Rob - it was an excellent tour and we enjoyed chatting with you.

Did the city tour and the RLD tour. Did two tours. The RLD tour with Lealu was pretty good. She had lots of energy and enthusiasm!! The city tour with Rob was fair. He knows his stuff, but there was too little commentary while walking between sites and spending 40-45 mins having a coffee break in a three hour tour is not proper.

City walking tour. The absolute best way to walk Amsterdam is with Rob! This young gentleman is from NJ USA but had lived in Amsterdam for 12 years. He knows the city like a book and speaks the language like a local. What a find! He took us through the streets for 3 hours and it felt like one. We stopped along the way at a special quaint cafe for cappuchino & break! What a talented guy- pianist, composer, teacher & self employed as a guide! He is personable, interesting and entertaining! Thanks Rob for sharing your knowledge with the 10 of us and the perfect introduction to the streets & sites of the city. Thanks for safety tips regarding the million bikes coming at us in every direction. Prebook this tour online, you will be so glad you did!

Great Way to Start your visit!. My husband and I did two of Mark's tours which were the group city tour with Benjamin and a private Red Light Tour with Mark. They were both excellent. Benjamin is very enthusiastic and funny and made the time fly by! The city tour is great for getting your bearings and hits the highlights! Being in the group was also fun to be able to chat and exchange experiences. We did a private tour of the Red Light with Mark.....it was also great but would recommend not taking them on the same day as we did!! We took more steps on that day than any other on our month trip! Mark was great as he really has a unique perspective as he lived in the RLD for a time, above one of the establishments , and has known many of the people who work there and is familiar with their point of view. Mark is very casual and comfortable to be with. I just wished I had known about the trips into the countryside that he has now started. The reviews sound great and if I was planning now, I would sign up for all three of his offerings! His groups are not large.....so do it now:)
Highly recommend. Great informative tour with humour and passion. Time well spent on both day and night tours. We'll worth the money.

Best tour I had. Me and my friend took the Amsterdam city tour and I must more than satisfied. It was the best tour I ever had. Mark knows a lot about the city and its history. Not only did he bring us through major stops and explain interesting information about the city, but he also provided a very interesting perspective of the city and its political/social situation withing the Netherlands and the world. Mark is also very personable and nice to hang out with. Recommend taking a beer with him after the tour if possible.

Took two great tours with them.. I was on my first trip to Amsterdam so decided tours would be a great introduction to the area. I first took the city tour with Rob and found him to be very knowledgeableand outgoing. I then followed up with Lealu on a RLD tour.She was very engaging and knowledgeable. I recommend the tours and the guides both very highly.
Dam fine tour guide. Had a very pleasant walk today with Mark. Pace was just right, lots of info, tips, recommendations and humor. He accommodated our requests, tailoring our route accordingly.

Just a great way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam.. We did the City tour with Mark just yesterday and happily recommend this awesome tour to anyone and everyone coming to Amsterdam. Mark knows his stuff but really doesn't take himself too seriously and is just a cool, relaxed, honest, informative guy who makes you feel like you are being shown around Amsterdam by a friend. It was a great introduction to the city with helpful recommendations and entertaining insights. We don't have time to do another tour with Mark but absolutely would if we could.

Well worth it!!!. Lealu and That Dam Guide Tours provided a great foundation for getting to know the city inside and out. Well paced, knowledgeable, and a great starting point for any newcomers to the city. The small maximum group of 10 is a nice, understated feature that That Dam Guide provides, ensuring that the tour is as personal and as informative as possible. Lealu was great!!!

Great Tour. This was a great tour. We toured all of the major spots in Amsterdam. This is a beautiful city. I recommend this tour to anyone that goes to Amsterdam and wants to learn a little history. I booked this the day before we were leaving. We wanted to do a walking tour and this was perfect.

Amsterdam City Tour, Red Light District Tour, and Countryside Cheese and Windmill Tour. I booked all three tours with this amazing team and was so glad I did! Benjamin, Lealu, Mark, and Rory were all very knowledgeable about the sites they were touring. Our group sizes were 4-10 people, which was perfect to make each tour memorable and individualized. City tour with Benjamin was a wonderful introduction to Amsterdam on my first day there. Benjamin is passionate about history and is able to engage every person on the tour with his sense of humor. He even gave us pointers about some of more specific sites we wanted to see. Lealu made the RLD tour a very informative and interesting experience. I feel like I gained a deeper understanding of the RLD and its workers. Mark and Rory completed my Amsterdam visit with the Country side tour. Two absolute charming tour guides, who made each one of us feel right at home. We met at a central train station and, after brief introductions, were taken on a shuttle through the beautiful countryside on a small van. We went into a non-touristy old town, where we had coffee, delicious home-made apple pie and some interesting facts about the town. We then proceeded onto seeing the Windmill, and had it pretty much all to ourselves to explore and to take photos. Finally, we finished the tour with the most unique cheese tasting at a farm! Mark and Rory never rushed us, and even extended our stay there when they saw that we were all fascinated by the daily proceedings of the Farm. Mark brought along his professional camera and even was kind enough to take some photos for us (since some of us quickly ran out of our own phone battery). All in all, I was extremely pleased with each of the tours, which were the highlight of the trip in themselves. If you are looking for a small-group tour that incorporates a wonderful balance between history and humor, I cannot recommend this team enough.

Awesome City and Countryside tours. I took the City tour with Mark the second day I was in Amsterdam. What's an eye opening, I learn so much about the city. Small group tour is really nice to walk together and ask questions. It was very interesting and fun through 3 hours that I spent with Mark. Couple days later I took the countryside tour with Mark and Rory, not disappointed even this is the new tour that they just opened up. Mark and Rory took me to a small and quaint town (no tourists), we walked around the town and stopped for a coffee and apple pie. It is really delicious. After that we went to the non-tourist windmill, stop taking pictures with tulips field then cheese tasting. Have I told you it was really a relaxing day?

Amsterdam Countryside Cheese and Windmill Tour. What a fun time! Mark and Rory are terrific. We saw so many beautiful sites, (climbed to the top of a windmill), learned the history and had wine and cheese and oh yes, delicious Apple pie. We were lucky that the tulips were in full bloom and we visited a farm and saw them in all their glory. Cannot recommend them enough! Wish we had known to take their walking tour as well! A do not miss tour if you want to get out into the countryside with a small group (the beat way!)

Well done. We did the 3-hour city tour with Rob. Enjoyed it very much, Rob is very pleasant, knowledgable and personable. We covered so much ground and learned and saw so much we never would have on our own. Highly recommended.Thank you Rob!

Amsterdam Country Tour. Went with Mark and Rory yesterday on a country side tour of Amsterdam. It was GREAT! Saw the beautiful country side, learned so much about Amsterdam, had fantastic Dutch Apple Pie at a small cafe, cheese and wine in a tulip fields, went to a cheese factory and then climbed inside to the top of a working windmill. We went to places tourist do not usually get to see. FANTASTIC !. Thanks Guys.

Awesome tour of Amsterdam!. did the Amsterdam city tour w/ Ben - it was great! lots of history, ben was hilarious, felt like i really got to know the city and its history and people. small group maximum was excellent and made things efficient as we covered quite a bit of ground. thanks!

Whether you're visiting the city or you think you know it, Mark's tours are eye-opening!. I did both the Day walking tour and the Red Light District walks with Mark. I have known the city for three decades so I didn't think I needed an introduction but I did these tours on the recommendation of a friend and would like to pass on that recommendation. Mark taught me so much that was new and interesting, and much that was useful too. I was walking alone and thought I might find the group a bit daunting but with his charm and erudition, Mark warmed everyone up, and the groups are intentionally small enough for comfortable interaction. He skilfully combines anecdotes with refreshing social awareness and I learned with concern about the impact of gentrification on the people of Amsterdam and the things that have made it what it was. Particularly in the Red Light District the long struggle for sexworkers' rights is facing new threats. There were well-timed breaks in delightful spots where we could sample local delights. A year after the walks I am still reflecting, and writing this overdue review to reminisce.

Very Well Done, Fun, and Informative. My Husband and I went on the Red Light Tour, and we loved it! Mark was incredibly knowledgeable, funny, and gave amazing insight about the culture, politics, history, and future of the Red Light District.

Perfect combination of information and humour, oh, and carrot cake!. Perfect introduction to Amsterdam which enabled me to get the most out of the rest of my visit and I was even able to pass on quite a bit of the information to the study group I was with.

Great tour with a Great guide. I been meaning to make this review for a quite some time, a while ago My Mum and I went on the Day walking tour and the evening Red Light District tour. Both were great, Mark is a great guide funny and informative. He only does small group sizes to so that was great to be able to actually hear him and ask questions easily. Would definitely recommend!!!

Walking tour. Excellent city tour with Benjamin fun from start to finish very informative and going the extra mile if there was something specific you wanted to see. One of the best city tours we have had

Great Tours with Lealu - City and Red Light. We greatly enjoyed both the city walking and Red Light District tour with Lealu!! She provided tons of interesting and fun information on both tours. The pace of the walking tour was nice, not too fast, not too slow. It's great that the tours are kept to a maximum of 10 people, it is more personal and engaging. Lealu also took the time to offer suggestions and mark restaurants (and the walk route) on a map for everyone and even sent a follow up email with more information. She had a good sense of humor and you can tell she really loves what she does. Would recommend to anyone who wants to learn and have a good time!

The highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. First of all I want to thank previous reviewers of this tour because that is the reason why we chose it. We booked a Sunday morning walking tour of the city with Rob. He was there on time with his orange pom pom which was easy to spot! There were supposed to be ten of us but I believe one didn't show. Rob did an excellent job at the beginning with a 7 minute introduction to the history of Amsterdam. He spoke very clearly and his English is perfect. We walked through several areas beginning with the outskirts of the Red Light district. He explained things you have to watch out for as a tourist as well as getting deeper into the history of the city and its population. About two hours into the tour he took us to a little cafe inside a clothing store which was a nice surprise. It was a bit chilly outside so it was nice to sit down and warm up. I won't give away all the surprises but suffice it to say this tour has been well thought out and Rob did a great job with the delivery. The next day we had already signed up for a bus tour of the city and were extremely disappointed with it compared to this. I suggest booking this tour at the beginning of your stay as it will help you learn where everything is and develop a strategy for what you see and in what order. We thought so highly of it that we even gave another tourist Rob's card while eating lunch on a day tour to Volendam. I'm sure that tour operator wasn't happy about that but I am a firm believer in giving credit when it is due! What are you waiting for? Book this tour already!!!
Walking tour with Rob. We had a great time and learned so many new things about Amsterdam. Rob was very informative. We also loved the stop in the "hidden" cafe for some coffees.

Fast Three Hours. When I first learned we would be doing a three hour walking tour on a CHILLY afternoon in Amsterdam, I thought it might be a long uncomfortable three hours. WRONG! Thanks to Mark, it was not only interesting but fun and delightful with stories and side notes delivered with humor and genuine knowledge of this city and its history. We saw more in the three hours than we could have ever accomplished on our own. The affection that Mark has for Amsterdam came through in his charming presentation ... the time just flew by. We used several of his tips later to continue exploring on our own. I highly recommend this tour for a great introduction to Amsterdam.

Brilliant tour with Lealu!. I booked on the 3 hour city tour as I had time to kill before I met up with my Dutch friends later on and I must say even though it rained all day in Amsterdam, it certainly didn't dampen our wonderful guide Lealu's spirit and sense of humour! She was incredibly knowledgeable about the area, was full of interesting and witty stories and followed up with an email with references she had made in the tour which was very helpful. We stopped off at a cafe and had delicious hot chocolate which was lovely as we all got to know each other in the small group. Lealu is a warm, friendly, fun lady who is a fantastic tour guide and I would highly recommend this tour...in fact I even recommended it to my dutch friends!Ps: Lealu, I ate at that pancake house you recommended and went for the apple and bacon. Delicious!

Execellent introduction to Amsterdam, the city's history and the many interesting places to explore. We took this tour the first day we arrived in Amsterdam and it was very worthwhile. Lealu was an excellent guide and very knowledgeable. I recommend taking this tour early in your visit as it gives a great background on the life, culture and things to see and do in Amsterdam.

Mark's tour was excellent!. Our first day in Amsterdam and based on Trip Advisor reviews we booked with Mark. We had 7 people and it was a very enjoyable and educational experience. Mark has a delightful sense of humor and was able to convey the spirit as well as the landmarks of Amsterdam exceptionally well. A great start to our visit. His recommendations were spot on as we were able to take advantage of some of them later in our stay.

Fairly good walking tour. We had Rob for this walking tour of Amsterdam. Overall the tour was fairly good. I liked the small size of the group - maximum 10 people. Rob is American, but living in Amsterdam for more than a decade. He had good information about Amsterdam and hit most of the highlights. There was a nearly 40 minute stop in the middle of the tour at a small café, which seemed unnecessary. If I wanted to go for coffee, I could have done that myself, but to take 40 minutes of a three hour tour for a coffee break seemed excessive. The only good point was that it was cold outside, so it was at least an opportunity to warm up. Overall it is a good small group tour at a reasonable price, but perhaps grab a coffee to go!

League is the best Red Light District guide! . A smiling fresh-faced young woman that knows all the facts and figures regarding prostitution in Amsterdam and describes it in a funny but no nonsense way. A pure delight. I'd definitely go on another tour with her!

Money and time well spent. Lealu made us feel very comfortable. She's extremely knowledgeable and answered all the questions we threw at her. We had already seen some of the area but learnt a lot of the history behind it which was actually quite interesting. The intimate group size of ~10 is ideal because you can ask questions. Would definitely recommend.

Great introduction to the city. We joined a City tour with 7 others with Benjamin. Despite the cold weather it was a great morning, interesting, fun and informative. Benjamin is amusing, very knowledgeable and funny. A fab insider's view of the city.

A truly wonderful insight to Amsterdam and its history told by an enthusiast 🤓. City tour on a bright crisp Saturday morning with Benjamin. He told his stories in a knowledgable and entertaining way, with stops at local markets and calling out places of interest all the way along. Highly recommend!!

Ask for Rob. I know three hours sounds like a lot, but Rob is spellbinding and the pace is leisurely. He's funny, smart, his English is perfect and he loves his city. He knows the history, the culture and the people and you do as well by at the end. The groups are small so book ahead from home before you arrive. If we hadn't we wouldn't have gotten in. I've been to Amsterdam several times and learned more from him yesterday than I have on any other visit to this city.

City Tour with Rob.. Rob's guided walking tour of Amsterdam took us from the Beursplein through the red light district, the medieval city, the canals, the secret gardens. and the history of Amsterdam. He includes his own knowledgeable understanding of the Netherlandish language, culture, mindset, and world view with perfect concrete, personal examples garnered from more than 12 years of working (as a musician/composer) and living among the people of Amsterdam. Wonderful!!! Thank you!Ask for Rob...he is terrific.

Do this first!. A great introduction to the city. This small group tour, led by Benjamin was over 3 hours long ...including a chill out in a cafe . It was a great overview of the city, it's history and its quirkiness. Benjamin is well informed and a real enthusiast ..we all had a great time . Free tours are available le in the city ...but this one was worth every penny!

Familiarize yourself with the City. Tour is given in a small group- mine was only 5 people. This was a great way to get acquainted with the city. I highly recommend making this one of your 1st activities in Amsterdam. Took the tour with Benjamin. He took the time to talk to everyone on the tour, getting to know a little about each of us. It felt more like you were hanging out with a friend rather then being led by a tour guide. We passed a few larger groups where they were just following the guide holding a flag. Glad I wasn't with them. He was very informative and was able to answer any questions about the city and gave recommendations on where to go. We followed one of his museum recommendations and was not disappointed. If I was ever back in Amsterdam- I would look to this tour company again.

Must do!. 3 of us took the Amsterdam city walking tour with Rob. You learn a lot. He is from the Eastern U.S., but has lived in Amsterdam for years. He speaks excellent English and answers all your questions. You stop at a cafe in the middle of the tour to go to the bathroom and can get drinks & snacks. We HIGHLY recommend this tour.

OFF THE TOURIST TRACKS. Small group. Good company. Knowledgable tourguide. Featuring an interesting tour OUT of Amsterdam and off the tourist trap/cks > visiting the REAL Holland, the `REAL 'polders', a REAL working windmill, a REAL cheesefactory, the REAL Dutch

Best Tour and Guide. Rob does it all...history, stories , sense of humor . Amazing tour...so worth the time spent. Highly recommend! Rob will even advise on other things to do. He speaks English and Dutch

Superb Tour with Rob!. On our first day in Amsterdam, we did a 3 hour afternoon walking Tour with Rob, commencing at 2.30pm. There were 4 of us and 6 other people on the Tour which was excellent as it meant everybody heard everything Rob said and he engaged with us all. Other Tours just have too many people on them! The Tour was both interesting and enjoyable with Rob's knowledge, detail and fun! He also took us to a delightful, tucked away little Cafe for afternoon tea mid-way through the Tour which we would never have found on our own. Re-fuelled by gorgeous cake, scones and cream and tea, onwards we went and we were sorry when it all concluded at 5.30pm, the time just flew by:-( If you want to learn about Amsterdam's history, current day circumstances and have fun, don't go on any other Tour than this one, Rob is fantastic and the Tour comprehensive in its nature. If you take this Tour at the beginning of your visit to Amsterdam it will help you to decide what else you may wish to visit in detail etc., and use your time wisely. Thanks Rob, you are an absolute gentleman and an exemplary Tour Guide - we wish you every success in your primary role as a Composer - you are an awesome talent!

Netherlands countryside small group tour. I went on an awesome tour of the countryside in the waterland area of the Netherlands with That Dam Guide. I was very lucky to have 2 guides, Mark and Rory. They are smart, funny and had a nice itinerary. The group was small, friendly and fun. We met at Amsterdam Centraal and left the crowds and bustle of Amsterdam for a peaceful day in the country. We first visited Monnickendam, a picturesque fishing village where we strolled the waterfront and quaint streets, stopping for a coffee. Next, we traveled to see a set of windmills. We got up close looks at the mechanics of pumping water using the windmill. We also had opportunities for fabulous photos of canals, windmills and fields of tulips. Mark and Rory are quite knowledgeable and were able to explain the complex canal system used to move water and keep places dry. The highlight of the day was the wine and cheese tasting. We tried several different Beemster cheeses then visited the Beemster factory for another taste and opportunity to buy cheese. We got back mid afternoon and I would do this tour again in a heartbeat. Beautiful views, a great and funny host, and wine and cheese? What could be better? I highly recommend the Country side tour with "That Dam Guide"

Best tour of many in numerous cities. My wife and I toured the central neighborhoods of Amsterdam with Rob on The Dam Tour. Rob Is highly personable, very well informed, friendly, articulate and entertaining. We'd read books about Amsterdam's rich and complex history and culture before taking this trip and Rob made sense of it all. The time flew so fast we were amazed at how much ground we covered: from medieval history to the regulation of pot, with revealing asides into what makes this magnificent city and its inhabitants unique.
Walking Tour of Red Light (with Lealu). Lealu was great, made us feel comfortable in the red light and knew a lot about the area and its residents (being one herself)
Walking TOur of Red Light with Lealu. Lealu was very knowledgeable, helpful, funny and professional. I highly recommend any of her tours. We covered a lot of ground, history and sights in two hours.

AMAZING TOUR. Funny entertaining informational and overall the best tour I have done! I usually hate tours but I could do a tour with mark every day!!!! If you don't use this tour you are doing it wrong
AMAZING!. We had a tour of the red light district with my class while we studied abroad, and it was an amazing tour. Mark was super knowledgable, funny, and friendly. Would highly recommend!

A Dam good guide. I cannot recommend this tour enough. I took their "city tour" which was a three hour walking tour around the old city. The amount history and culture that was conveyed to us in a short time was exceptional! The nooks and crannies of this old city were pointed us by a man called Benjamin. What a guy. Friendly, smart and funny he made the tour amazing! The good thing about this company is that they keep the tour groups small and their guides truly love their city. It makes for a much more personalised tour.I again want to highly, highly recommend this company's tours as a great way to introduce yourself to Amsterdam.5 stars

Red Light District Tour with Mark. This was one of the best tours of my life, and I travel frequently. Mark was knowledgeable, compassionate, and very funny. Rarely is information presented in such a thorough manner. Definitely recommended!

Red Light District tour with Lealu. Signed up for the Red Light District tour with Lealu on a Saturday night and I have to tell you that is the way to experience it. Fantastic to be in smaller group where you could ask questions and Lealu was not only knowledgeable about the area but passionate about the residents and the area. Loved ever minute of the tour and recommend as a must do for anyone visiting Amsterdam. Thank you Lealu! Our time with you was a definite highlight of our trip. It was terrific to visit and see an area from the perspective of a local.

That Dam Guide with Leaulu. What a wonderful tour. Lealu was terrific. Funny and so knowledgeable. Small group. Her tips on where to eat were great. We went to the brew pub she recommended in the Red Light District. Learned a great deal about Amsterdam. She is so generous with her time. Our tour was scheduled for 3 hours but she gave us close to 4. Highly recommend this walking tour.

A must do in Amsrerdam. Mark gave an excellent overview of Amsterdam. We touched on every aspect of the Netherlands. Thoroughly enjoyed the personalized tour and would highly recommend it. A great way to get a feel of the culture

Insightful, friendly, and well run. A well-paced, interesting tour with a small (as in, perfectly sized) group. Benjamin was our guide and he explained the history of the city well, adding just the right amount of humor and color to his stories. I'm glad I found this tour, as many of the groups we passed had three or four times the number of people and seemed a bit more crowded and rushed. Amsterdam is a fantastic city, and Benjamin and this tour group represent it well.

FUN, Not Too long, well informed, entertaining, and a small group - PERFECT!. THAT DAM GUIDE ROCKS!!As a rule we despise guided tours and try to sponteanously find our way in the local culture. Too frequently we find something that we would have loved to do, on our last day - oops, too late! So...We have taken to finding a walking tour on our first jet lagged day in a new city (partly to keep us up, partly to get a 'lay of the land', partly to stay out of the pubs until dark- haha). Leeluu and the That Dam Guide fit the bill Perfectly! She knew enough to give an informative and fun tour, and to answer ALL questions. The groups are small enough that you get time to ask questions about whatever you may be interested in, and Leelu helped each member of the tour with info to make their stay in Amsterdam what they were looking for. One couple wanted to go clubbing, another interested in history etc. At our coffee break, we all sat down and she gave us each a city map, and pointed out things/places that we might be interested in (clubs, brew-pubs,history sites etc). Most were not on the official map, so she wrote them in - perfect! She also gave us all hints on local do's and dont's and how best to get about, again - Perfect!!NOT expensive, NOT a big Group, NOT too long (about 3 hrs). Again PERFECT for an intro to a new city!
Tour with lealu. She was funny and full of knwoledgeVery generous with her time. Instead of 3 hours she gave us 4 wonderfull hoursCool places you cannot see without her

Great tour with Benjamin. We went on the city tour with Benjamin and really enjoyed it. He was friendly and funny and really knew his stuff. Would definitely recommend, worth doing on your visit. Easy meeting point to find close really to Dam Square. Thanks Benjamin!

Excellent tour with Benjamin. Benjamin gave my partner and I a very informative, interesting tour. We were in a small group of just 7, including Benjamin. The tour was very factual but not boring, like some tours can be and Benjamin's dry quick witted sense of humour gave a great edge to the walk. Definitely recommend.

Fantastic Custom Tour With Lealu! :). I visited Amsterdam last week with a group of friends and my sister for her hen party weekend. We wanted to learn about the history of the city as well as drinking and partying and so I booked a custom tour a few weeks in advance of our trip. I booked the tour through Mark who was extremely helpful in advising me with what type of tour I should book, how much it would cost and all other details. He sent me pictures of Lealu, who would be our guide and pictures of the National Monument where we would meet her. As none of the group had ever been to the city before this was massively helpful on the day as we were able to find the monument and Lealu, with ease. On the day our bus from the ferry into Amsterdam was late, making our half ten start time for the tour impossible to make. Mark had provided me with Lealu's phone number and therefore we were able to text her to arrange a later time to meet. Lealu was so helpful with this and didn't mind that we pushed the tour back at all. She was so friendly and kind and we all felt very comfortable with her. We had a 2 and a half hour tour round Amsterdam with Lealu and it was interesting and insightful from the word go. There is so much to learn about the city and Lealu knew so much. She answered all our questions and kept us interested for the duration of the tour. We all agreed that although tours like this can sometimes become boring, Lealu's fun and approachable attitude made the two and a half hours fly in and kept the content exciting and fun to learn about. We visited the red light district and obvious attractions but also the outskirts of the city, hidden places that we would have had no clue were there if we hadn't been with a guide. Lealu was not only helpful during the tour, but also advised us where to eat out during our stay, where to go for cocktails and where the places to go for a night out are. We had booked another activity directly after our tour but had no idea how to get to it so Lealu even had the good grace to walk us right to its door step. We would never have found it without her! I cannot fault the service we were provided or the experience of the tour from start to finish. I even received a follow up email from Lealu, making sure we had enjoyed the tour and providing me with information on books I could read and documentaries I could watch related to the content of the tour. Lealu and the team are amazing at their jobs and I cannot recommend this activity enough. If you want to see the city of Amsterdam and learn about it's culture and history then this is the tour for you. A must do for any visit! :) Alex and the hens, Carlisle

Fantastic RLD Tour!!. We did the Red Light District Tour with Lealu and it was very interesting and funny. She explained a lot about the history and the development of this area and even sent us a mail afterwards for a chance to follow up with topics we learnt about :-)
Great value for money. Can highly recommend it.

Great information, adds real value to your trip. This tour gave me new insight into the city. I learned and saw things I NEVER would have on my own. I could have gone on for 6 hours. One reviewer wrote. Red Light District. Definitely not a “con,” but the classic openness/tolerance of Amsterdam is apparent and may not be appropriate for some conservative people. Cut me a break. Then stay in Iowa.

Ben's passion . We thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Ben. His love for history and Amsterdam itself showed through clearly and we could not help but be caught up in his stories. I've done the canal boat tour and this walking tour is a hundred times better than those audio tape guides. The pace was leisurely and Ben accommodated our request for a small detour to the Flower market where we stopped to buy some bulbs. Thanks, Ben! Keep up the passionate storytelling!
Worth every penny. Benjamin was our guide and he was awesome! We had a great time with him and he knew his stuff. Super fun tour!

Acclimated to City Quickly. We (family of 4 (2 teens)) were part of a group of 10 for a 3 hour tour walking tour of Amsterdam.Pros: - Hit high spots in the city. The route/path was good to see the things you would expect to see in the city center.- Guide was very enthusiastic about the city. It made it nice. It was like he wanted us to love the place like he does.Cons:- Our locations were confusing. As we walked, we saw some interesting areas/site, but had no reference where we were. For example, we had some good fries, but had no idea how to get back there. It would be really nice for the guide to show you where you were on a map. If nothing else, just tell you which way is north. - Red Light District. Definitely not a “con,” but the classic openness/tolerance of Amsterdam is apparent and may not be appropriate for some conservative people (and children). Recommendations:- Follow the tour on a map so you know how to revisit sites.

Great way to experience Amsterdam. Mark did a fantastic job of showing us around the most important spots in Amsterdam. He really knows a lot about this city and manages to explain the history and other interesting things about it in a really enthusiastic way. I really enjoyed it and learned a lot!

A walk with Mark. Done the City tour with Mark and he was very informative and clearly loved his adopted city. There was only one other person with us so it was certainly very close up and engaging. Mark's knowledge and wit ensured the three hours flew by and we got an insight into the city the guidebooks could never give you.

Great job Rob!. Insightful, informative, enjoyable, enthusiastic, characterful... The list could go on. Rob did a fantastic job of showing us the ins and outs of Amsterdam. Highly recommend this tour to anyone.Dam good!!

Excellent walking tour. We did the central Amsterdam tour with Lalou, can't fault it. She made it interesting, took us all over the place, and gave us a real feel for Amsterdam. Great value for money. Strongly recommended.

Best Tour ever. We usually hate tours but this one was 10 people max so we gave it a go. Rob was faultless. He was so knowledgable without being boring. He brought the whole group together so everyone could hear everything. If you want to see parts of Amsterdam you won't find on your own take this tour.

Fabulous is an understatement!!. Mark is a wonderful knowledge funny and friendly guide!We did the RLD tour and it was amazing.Mark offers a perspective on the district that you just dont get anywhere!  If you want a very special personal tour then this is the place to start. Would have loved to do his daytime tour also!! Thankyou Mark!!

Wonderful walking tour!. We had Mark as our tour guide and he was fantastic! He is so knowledgeable and passionate about the RLD. The tour gives you a different perspective. Also visit the tour guide website for great recommendations on restaurants. The tour was one of the best parts of our trip!

Eye-opening RLD tour with the knowledgable Lealu!. This was one of the highlights of our Amsterdam trip. Lealu was a great tour guide, with vast knowledge of the sex workers and other interesting features of the RLD. We got to learn about many sides of the RLD, including history, alternative types of 'window', the coffeeshop phenomenon and types of entertainment around the district. Lealu did not rush the tour; there were many opportunities to ask questions and time to take in what we were looking at(!) We took this tour on the second night of our trip, but I'd actually recommend it for the first night if you can, because then you will have the rest of your stay to return to the RLD and experience some of the things Lealu talks about, like the popular restaurants, bars and shows. It was very different to how I imagined, but in a good way, and I would recommend to anyone wanting to find out more about the RLD than meets the eye.

Don't miss this!!. My husband and I are usually not big "tour" people, as we like exploring on our own. However, we wanted to get a sense of Amsterdam on Day 1 so we booked a tour with Ben. SO GLAD we did it. He was knowledgeable, hilarious, enthusiastic, passionate, and interesting. The tour covered a lot of ground in a relatively short period of time, and it was extremely personalized - Ben made sure he knew our interests in the first few minutes and catered his overview to those. I also loved the small group aspect of the tour - we were only five people, and I believe the tours are limited to ten - so we were able to go off the beaten path to a certain degree. Absolutely recommended.

Great tour guide - great tour .... Mark is a knowledgeable and friendly tour guide, who shares his love of this city with those in his group. Though we had visited Amsterdam twice before, his tour and insight provided new information and perspectives. Got to see some sections of the city, we'd never find -- and learned lots in the 3 hour tour. We've taken scores of walking tours around the world -- often you get what you pay for -- the free tours are not focused and often times lead you to shops or restaurants where the guide is obviously getting some sort of consideration. Not so with That Dam Guide. Small groups ensure an opportunity to hear everything and get some excellent restaurant sight-seeing tips. The company is looking into the possibility of day tours out of Amsterdam. Would really be interested in that, when we return. Tip: Take this tour on your first day -- it's an excellent way to get your bearings in the city.

Great personalized tour. I would highly recommend a tour with That Dam Guide. We were three adults and three kids and enjoyed it very much. We saw some of the free tours around with groups of at least 20 people and I know there is no way that they had the same experience we did. Mark was great and very informative and tailored it to the six of us and making various stops for raw herring and the best chocolate cookies to eat plus a chocolate shop where we were able to stock up for Easter candies to bring back to the US. If your have kids this is the way to do a tour of Amsterdam because Mark will work with your needs.

Did you know that the average buyer of sex in Amsterdam only lasts 6 minutes!?. My wife and I spent three days in Amsterdam and took advantage of the City Tour and Red Light District Tour. Mark and Ben were both great guides and the group size from 4, on the first, to 10 on the second tour, really made the walks enjoyable and low-key. Humor, knowledge of local history and willingness to make recommendations for good activities before/after the tours were tremendously helpful. Ben's conversational nature of guiding was decidedly a highlight. Mark's personal relationships with the sex workers and ability to help transcend stereotypes and biases make the Red Light District Tour a can't miss. You'll have to go on the tour to find out more about the 6 minutes. FYI - a walk around Amsterdam in March can be pretty chilly...dress warm!

Fabulous Walking Tour. We did a 3 hour walking tour today with Rob and it was excellent. Rob provided a great deal of information on Amsterdam's history and contemporary culture in a relaxed and friendly way. There were ten in our group which was far better than the groups of 40+ that we passed on our walk. This is our first full day in Amsterdam and thanks to Rob we feel well oriented for the coming five days. Highly recommend the company and specifically Rob. Thanks for the great tour!

Red Light District Walking Tour. Took the Red Light District walking tour with Benjamin. Found the tour engaging, humorous, informative, and at a great pace. Benjamin was quite knowledgable about not only this part of Amsterdam but the city itself, and offered excellent perspective on the history of this area.

Excellent That Dam Guide walking tour of red light district. A great tour led by Lealu. It was informative as well as being fun. Lealu clearly has a great knowledge and love of the area and told many interesting and funny anecdotes. We really enjoyed her sense of humour!

Engaging and informative. Rob does a terrific job of presenting the history and culture of the city in an accessible and enjoyable way. The tour was intimate and perfectly paced. A terrific way to orient ourselves to Amsterdam.

Dam Good. Thanks to Mark and Lealu for the City tour and the Red Light tour, two of the highlights of our visit. I alway make a point of researching and finding a great guide wherever I go and these two were up with the best

Amsterdam City Tour with Lealu. The tour with Lealu was amazing. The other people in the tour cancelled and I was a little afraid that it would be cancelled or re-scheduled, but Lealu was so nice and just told me that I got myself a private tour. We walked around for the 3 hours, except for a stop to get an amazing hot chocolate! Lealu is very knowledgable and told me many facts and details about the history of Amsterdam. Her way of explaining things made it very interesting, and it is evident in her passion and all the quirky/special details she shared that she loves Amsterdam. I learned so much about the city that I felt like an expert. The next week I met some coworkers in another city in Netherlands and I found myself repeating time after time, "But you know, my tour guide told me .....so and so..." :-) Lealu also gave me information on interesting places to go, I tried two of the restaurants that she recommended and they were excellent. Lealu was so nice, she treated me with great respect, took my pictures, waited for me, answered all my questions. I felt like I was walking around with a good friend. Thanks Lealu!
