You are awesome and I had a great time!If you want to get to know Amsterdam better and enjoy the secrets and history of the city do this tour. This company is excellent, they care for their customers and they work hard to provide the best service.

Different Take on the Sights. Mark dispensed interesting tidbits of info not normally given on a walking tour like how many bikes are fished out of canals every year. It made for a more interesting tour. He knew the history of the city as well and we even stopped for tea to get out of the biting wind. The three hours went by quickly. My daughter and I were both looking forward to another tour with Mark.

Fun Group Tour. Mark gave us an excellent tour. It was a small group so we really got to a chance to connect with him and ask our own personal questions. In addition, he still provided the general city information you would get on a big tour. I highly recommend this tour for your trip. Me and my wife really enjoyed it. He also has red light district tour I will be doing on my next visit. Thanks Mark.

Great small group tour. Mark gave us a great tour! He is very knowledgable about history and so positive about life in Amsterdam. It was a pleasure to learn why people love living here so much! Do this on your first day so you have a sense of the City. Also, it's well worth the reasonable price to be in a small group (ours was 7)--we saw some free tours with 25 people. That size would have been tough for asking questions and even for hearing the guide. Dress warmly and wear comfortable shoes--the tour is outdoors and goes in any weather.

Interesting tour. Walking tour with Mark. Interesting, informative and fun. I would recommend taking this tour as early into your stay in Amsterdam as possible. Great way to discover interesting areas of the city away from the usual tourist areas.

Excellent tour 5*. Booked a three hour private tour as a couple with Lealu around the RLD & City.Fantastic knowledge and passion for home town. We learned lots about the history of Amsterdam.Was certainly one of the best things about our short stay.Would not hesitate to recommend.Many thanks!!!

Red Light District Tour. What a fantastic 2 hour walking tour with Lealu - so informative and interesting. Her personality and passion for the tour made for a great experience for us all. This is the best way to visit the area and gain an understanding of the history and complexity of the area. Many thanks again.

Great tour small group. Loved our tour with Benjamin. He gave us great insight into the history of Amsterdam and it was a great way to get our bearings of the city. It would be beneficial to do this tour on arrival to get the most out of the rest of your stay. Our group only had 6 in it which was a good way to get to ask questions and Benjamin was kind enough to let us decide where to stop for food and drink on route and to also recommend restaurants for the rest of our trip.

Wonderful, informative fun afternoon learning history and Amsterdam anecdotes. Mark's tour wove history, architecture, anecdotes and his personal recommendations that led to a wonderful afternoon for our family. We've toured other European capitals with great guides - and Mark ranks at the very top of some wonderful experiences. I HIGHLY recommend him, he is a wealth of information and we thoroughly enjoyed the time we spent with him. Thanks Mark - we hope to return and learn from you again!

great guide with good balance of history and fun. Mark was great! really good balance of what we saw and did, great fun but also really good historical information and interesting anecdotes. 8 of us in group so really great to have a private guide, very good value, covered a lot of ground. really recommended!

Fanatastic walking tour, a must if you want to see the best and hear about the history of Amsterdam. Mark was a great guide. So informative, but made it such fun. Definitely the best thing we did in Amsterdam and in fact so good I booked again with my family. We had breaks for either coffee or beer, tried cheese, chocolate cookies etc would never have found half the places if not been on the tour. Such an advantage being in a small group or private tour especially when you see the big groups going round. Value for money and couldn't recommend it highly enough. A must do !
Great fun and informative. . Must do! Loved it. Really great way to learn about the city and where to go/what to see. Guide was really pleasant and knew everything one could want to know

Great small group walking tour. A great introduction tour to Amsterdam. We had Benjamin as our guide and he really gave us a wide variety of information and fun stories. We saw a vast amount in our 3 hours and things that we would have never found on our own. As a travel professional myself I would have no hesitation in recommending this to cusomers and friends. It was value for money. You can get a free tour but they are packed with people and you just don't get the same one to one attention.

Best way to visit the RLD. I was hesitant about going to the Red Light Distract while my husband and I visited Amsterdam but after reading reviews of this tour, I decided to book a tour. My husband and I both voted this tour as one of the best things we did in Amsterdam. Lealu, our tour guide, was so informational and made the experience amazing! It was much more an experience to learn about the culture and history of the RLD rather than just walking around yourself. I highly recommend this tour.

Free walking tour. We popped down to dam square for a free walking tour with an orange umbrella guide but by mistake we went to the red umbrella guide which we were glad we did, it was a few hours long with many stops he was so informative with his history knowledge good sense of humour and very good english . Deffo recommend it . Our guide was called Axel

Very informative and fun!. We embarked on the Amsterdam City Walking Tour with Rob as our tour guide in mid-February. What a great time! Rob was very informative, enthusiastic, friendly, and gave us several recommendations and insider tips for our time in Amsterdam. I highly recommend Rob!

Tour with Rob. Actually we are locals from Amsterdam, but we thought it would be great to take part of a tour in our own city once. Rob knows a lot, is a very enthusiastic person and learned us new things about the area we live in. It felt like a small holiday in our own country, only a few streets away from our own house. It was amazing! Thanks a lot and keep up the good work.

Amsterdam City Tour with Rob. I highly recommend this tour. Rob is very informative and interesting to listen to. We learned so much and saw things we would not have discovered on our own. A great way to see the city and worth the price!!!

excellent tour, informative, fun and great value for money. we went on the tour yesterday with Rob, who had some great anecdotes as well as a wealth of information about The Netherlands, history, culture and a personal perspective too.

Great Overview of Amsterdam. We (3 people) took a private tour with Rob late in the day, the afternoon we arrived. We really enjoyed his tour. As we walked he shared information about the city and the sights. He was very friendly and he answered all of our questions. He had somewhat of a set plan, but he was able to personalize / tailor it to our interests once he heard our questions and got to know a little about us. We would recommend this tour on the day you arrive so you can get an orientation of the city before exploring on your own.

Lealu made us fall in love with Amsterdam!. The first thing we noticed about Lealu was her warm and calm spirit as she welcomed our small group before beginning the walking tour. This was important considering it was a cold and rainy day! We definitely hit the jackpot by booking this activity as first-time visitors in Amsterdam. The tour is comprehensive and you leave feeling you have become one with this gorgeous and historic city. If you are on the fence about which tour company to go with, TRUST ME, choose That Dam Guide. You won't be disappointed!

That Dam Guide with Rob. Rob was a really great! He was very friendly and answered all of my questions. The tour was very informative and showed us both important and hidden gems in Amsterdam! Would really recommend!!

A personalised, interesting, fun-filled and informative tour!. Last December, we visited Amsterdam with a group and took both of Mark's City Tour and Red Light District Tour. Both were brilliant. He was interesting - obviously genuinely loves the city and knows the history with a passion. He was entertaining - adding anecdotes and stories that brought smiles to our faces. He was generous - not only with his knowledge, but even provided a "P-mate" for the ladies (a disposable tool which enables us females to pee standing up! Something very useful if using the public loos). Also, Mark refuses to accept commission - this is different to a lot of the Amsterdam guides, and a comforting thought. He showed us interesting shops and cafés and gave honest and local advice. The Red Light District tour was particularly eye-opening and Mark provided some exceptional insider facts! To add to this, after your trip, he sends very interesting stuff by email. The tours are reasonably priced and Mark restricts the number for each tour, to ensure it is manageable and not over-crowded. Yes, we definitely recommend him if you want to tour the wonderful city of Amsterdam. Book him as soon as you can - he is obviously very popular.

🌟🌟🌟🌟. Amsterdam is an amazing city ☺Me and my friends had a lot of fun.Our guide guy was Rob and he was reallyyyy amazing. He learned us a lot about the city. The culture and everything was interesting. And Rob's english was perfect so we understood everything correctly.Hopefully we will visit Amsterdam again in summer and of course we will choose again your guide.Have a great time everyone. Best regards.Lori

Personalised tour. Brilliant personalised tour for 13 UK midwives. Catered to our needs coffee breaks on demand. Told us lots of local history, recommended great places to eat. Made out trip unforgettable

The Best Walking Tour in the Dam. Had the tour on the 28th of January with Rob who is a great guy who know the history of Amsterdam quit well and we got to enjoy a break at this great authentic cafe. The tour lasts for around 3 hours in which you will enjoy some beautiful scenery and hear about the history of Amsterdam. It is fun, entertaining and easy going. I was quite lucky as i was the only one on the tour :D so i got a private tour for the price of a normal one.

Red Light District & City walking tours. A group of friends and myself went to Amsterdam in Sept 2015. Our first night we met up with Mark. He was awesome! We did his walking tour of the Red Light district and it was amazing. Our tour group was just our group of six friends(not some giant group of tourists being herded about). We were able to walk around at our own pace and talk with Mark and get all his cool little tidbits about the district and its history. The next day we met back up with Mark and took a customized walking tour of the city center. A little history, a little culture, a little of the odd facts/trivia and we were able to just enjoy the sights and get recommendations from him about what to do and where to go for the rest of our stay. Mark was knowledgable, friendly, and helpful. I highly recommend him and his 'That Dam Guide' group. I was a great introduction to Amsterdam.

Take this Dam (RLD) Tour!. tl;dr version: Mark is an awesome, fun, knowledgeable guide.Long version: I took the Red Light District (RLD) Tour with Mark and had an awesome experience. There are several things I look for in a tour: (1) communication, (2) flexibility, (3) professionalism, (4) knowledge, (5) personability, and (6) humor. Mark clearly communicated everything I needed to know about the tour in advance of the tour -- I knew exactly what to expect, where to go, and who to look for. On the day of the tour, Mark contacted me to see if I would be interested in rescheduling the tour because it was bitter cold, raining, and I was the only person who had signed up for the RLD tour that evening. He offered several alternatives, but unfortunately the alternatives didn't work for me. That didn't phase Mark, and he demonstrated his professionalism and commitment because he still gladly met up with me to give me a private RLD tour that night. Although the tour was only scheduled for two hours, we spent nearly three hours exploring the RLD during which he shared his knowledge on the RLD's history, current politics, and local restaurants/bars. And he did so in truly engaging, entertaining way. Almost three hours later, we finished the tour only because I was tired. Over the next few days, I checked out several of the restaurants and bars that Mark recommended -- they were all awesome, and, because of Mark's connections, I even got discounts at several places!

Excellent Tour. My husband and I had Rob as our guide. It was great to have someone so knowledgeable who also made it really interesting. Although the weather took a turn for the worse it didn't matter because we stopped at a lovely bar overlooking the canal. We would definitely recommend That Dam Guide to anyone, it was so much better than the larger group tour.
Walking tour. Meet the lovely Mark for a walking tour of Amsterdam this weekend. Cheerful, friendly and informative - thank you

A Dam Good Tour. We took the 3 hour city tour with Mark a few days ago. He is an excellent guide, very knowledgeable and personable. He shared his knowledge of history, places and people (and food!) in an interesting and entertaining way. And when the weather did not cooperate we enjoyed hearing more stories during the short break in the warmth of the Droog Cafe. We though his honest commentary, thoughtful insights and helpful advice gave us a much better understanding of the city. I would definitely recommend this tour. Three hours well spent.
Great tours with a great guide!. Took a city tour and the red light district tour with Mark. He was friendly, knowledgeable and funny! Highly recommend :)
Great tour!!. 3 hour walking around Amsterdam, learning a lot, laughing a lot... It was interesting, cozy atmosphere, we had a great time!!

KNOWLEDGEABLE, FUNNY GUY; HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. My wife and I took two tours with Mark during a recent trip to Amsterdam. We found him to be very knowledgeable about the city and very willing to help us with any questions we had about the city. A native South African, he is a native English speaker and has a good sense of humor. Highly-recommended.

Fantastic and Fun Tour!. My wife and I booked a 3 hour walking tour around the city with Mark on Friday 8th January. Mark was a fantastic guide with a lot of historical knowledge of the city and some fun facts. Mark also showed us a lot of great places to get a bite to eat and introduced us to the best chips and cookies in Amsterdam ( I can highly recommend both! ) If you want to find out more about the city and get a feel for the locations in a personal and fun way ( with plenty of humor ) this is the tour for you. I for one will definitely be going back to the beautiful city of Amsterdam in the future and will definitely be booking another tour with Mark as he offers a more intimate and personal service and you don't feel as if you're just being passed along a conveyor belt. Highly recommended.

Amazing! . We made the round of the city on cruise! You struggle to understand everything through the microphone of the boat but in general you don't mind that much cause your mind is captured by the view of the old canals of Amsterdam!

Fantastic!. This 2 hour tour from Mark is great! He is so friendly and really knows his staff. What is good is that he gives not only an educated tour but a personal one too. Having made some friends in the red light industry he can give a great inside to the real lives of the workers here. There was plenty to see and options to stop for drinks along the way. From condom shops, adult shops, the bars and nightlife to the history and origins. Something for everyone. If I ever visit Amsterdam again I would definitely go on this tour again.

Amazing Tours. On my first day in Amsterdam I did the city walk with Rob in the afternoon and the RLD tour with Lealu that night. Both tours were excellent. The city walk gave me a great overview and history of the city and I was able to plan what I wanted to explore in more detail during the rest of my stay. Rob was a great guide and was very knowledgeable about the city. I think the only way to see the RLD is in a small group with a guide. If I had not done this tour, I would have left Amsterdam having missed an opportunity to really see the area and hear about the politics and human side of the district. Both groups were just the right size at about 10 people and were really fun.

Highlight of our Trip!!! Book with That Dam Guide!. We took two tours with That Dam Guide Company and have nothing but positive things to say about both tours. We did a day city walking tour with Benjamin and then a Red Light District tour two nights later with Lealu. Both tours were informative, fun, entertaining and memorable. They both had immense knowledge of the area and conveyed the information in an entertaining way. The time just flew by. Lealu (Red Light District Tour) and Benjamin (City walking tour) were awesome and I wouldn't hesitate to book with this company again.

Good information, fun tour. I enjoyed the red light tour with lealu. She was very informative and easy to hang with. I would recommend this tour. Some of the information was redundant from other places I got info from, but that is to be expected.

Choose this tour!. So glad that we chose 'That Dam Guide' for our tour around Amsterdam! I love a walking tour and have done many in cities around the world - always so disappointing when it feels like one long sales pitch for various bars/restaurants/shops...Mark's tour is NOTHING like that! He makes a point of it not being like that. I prefer finding out quirky little facts and anecdotes about a place and really getting a feel for it rather than simply wandering from site to site hearing things I could have read in a guide book anyway - this is why Mark's tour was perfect for me as it was exactly the sort of thing I find most interesting! Couldn't recommend this tour enough - book it now!

Trip wouldn't have been the same without Mark's tours! . I visited Amsterdam just after Christmas with my boyfriend and we couldn't wait to see what the city had in store for us.We did the RLD tour and the 3 hour walking tour with Mark. Both were fun, educational and interesting. Mark is a really funny and knowledgable guy. He knows all there is to know about Amsterdam and makes you feel very comfortable with him.There were 10 people on both tours - just the right number. There are bigger groups you could book with other companies but you dont get the same quality as in a group of 10. Mark was an excellent guide and so many locals know him around the city. If you get a chance to book a tour with Mark, grab it!

Red Light District with LEALU. We experienced a very funny and interesting tour through the red light district of Amsterdam - Lealu explains everything very detailled and she is a really nice Person with a good sense of humor. Dont miss this guided tour otherwise you only see bare naked girls in small red windows. With this tour you get very good Impression of the Business of Sexworkers and a very entertaining evening.

Great and funny tour of Amsterdam. We did both tours with Mark. It was very funny and interesting. He´s a great guide and fills the tour with his fantastic knowledge of the city, the history, the people and a lot of funny stories. What we really liked, was that he truly cares about the city and it´s people.

Best way to see Amsterdam!. We did the 3 hour city tour with Mark when we arrived in Amsterdam and it was excellent. Mark is informative, funny and caters the tour for your needs. He gave us a great insight to the history and culture of Amsterdam covering everything from politics to the red light district. Mark points out all the major attractions, and if you want him to he will advise you on places to eat and drink and activities to do during your stay. Our group was so small (8 people) it made the tour more personal and informative and gave you the opportunity to ask as many questions as you like. I would highly recommend this walking tour. we felt it was the best way to see Amsterdam.

The human side of the RLD!. We did the RLD tour with Lealu - really interesting!!To be honest I wasn't so keen on hanging out around there because it's super touristy and filled with seedy tourists behaving badly. But Lealu did such a great job of talking us through the realities of the area and guiding us through the streets. She really put us at ease. Her knowledge of the area provided a great perspective that we wouldn't have understood if we'd just walked through on our own. Thanks Lealu, well worth the visit!

Excellent tour of Amsterdam - great value!. Mark's tour of Amsterdam was the best walking tour out of several that we booked in Europe's largest cities during a trip where we spent several days in London, Paris and Amsterdam. Extremely well organized, very good communications during the booking and right up to the start of the tour.We particularly appreciated Mark's ability to provide an entertaining but deeply insightful overview to understand the city and its context of history, geography and other forces that shaped it to be what we see today. In contrast to other tours, Mark's intelligence and wit and "big picture" approach really impressed us --- like attending a graduate seminar with a college professor who knows how to both entertain and educate. He was also full of fun "hip" information that we enjoyed learning - everything from bicycle culture, to Dutch swearing, the monarchy, and how the city has taken unique directions in handling everything from squatters, to junkies, as well as cannabis and the sex trade.As a result, both of us (15 year old high schooler and 55 year old engineer/dad) equally enjoyed the time. Appreciated also the hard cap of 10 people per tour which made the group manageable and allowed us to have an individualized experience at a very reasonable cost.Highest recommendation - top tour out of about 10 we have done this year in travelling through Paris/London and Amsterdam. We picked the best walking tours throughout based on tripadvisor reviews, but this was much, much better than the rest..

AMSTERDAM OVERVIEW IN 3 HOURS!!. Lealu provided an informative and fun overview of Amsterdam in our Walking Tour of 3 hours - just 7 of us - prebooked the tour - timings and content were excellent - very helpful with recommendations for 'eateries' for the rest of our stay . . set the scene for a great visit to Amsterdam. Thank you.SallyC

Amazing Tour Experience. Mark knew everything we wanted to know about Amsterdam and was engaging for everyone on the tour. I'm not usually a big fan of guided tours but this was fun and enjoyable from start to finish.
Wonderful tour with Lealu. Fantastic! A great overview of the city and introduction to different neighbourhoods and the city's history. Worth booking in advance.
Wonderful guide. I did the Red Light tour my first night in Amsterdam--learned so much! Lealu was absolutely fantastic--super knowledgeable, funny, and down-to-earth. Definitely recommend!

Very Knowledgeable and Edutaining Guide. As Mark was busy, he organized Benjamin as our guide. After a small hick-up concerning the exact meeting time, we had a fantastic guided tour around Amsterdam. One of the best tours we've ever been on. Both entertaining and full of information. Both me and my wife can definitely recommend Benjamin.

We learned. We laughed. We saw a peep show.. Frankly, Mark is fantastic. He is funny and entertaining, filling the two hours with stories and history. What makes him truly excellent, however, is that he cares about the district and the people that work there as more than just a tourist attraction. As a result, you learn more about the women themselves, why they do the work, how they stay safe and healthy, etc. Mark makes sure everyone is having a good time, so if you're interested in seeing more (a peep show for example) he'll give you the opportunity, but there's no pressure to see or do anything. This is the one tour of our two weeks that we all said was a total MUST.

Excellent guided tour in Amsterdam. We have already done a lot of guided city tours, this one was by far one of the bests. The tour contains a mixture of information (history, architecture, facts about Amsterdam, property prices, red light district, social dimensions, eating and drinking, ... As the group size is limited to 10, it stays very informal. We had a stop in the middle of the walk in a typical Amsterdam pub. Really very, very nice!!

City walking tour. My husband and I experienced one of the best tours in all our years in travel. If you are ever in Amsterdam, we highly recommend Mark. His tour showed us so many sights of this beautiful city. His easy going style and abundant knowledge of Amsterdam mixed with a great sense of humor made for an enjoyable experience we won't soon forget.

Excellent guided walk with Mark. On our first day in Amsterdam we decided to book the walking tour to get orientated & I can say Marks tour did that and so much more. I'd recommend to anyone wanting a shortcut orientation, guide to must sees & detailed but fun insight into the history and people of Amsterdam.
Highly recommended tour. Mark took us on a fascinating tour, we were a small group,so u can ask him what ever u r intrested in.Mark, wish u all the best, see u in Tel aviv...marry christmas

Brilliant Tour. Myself and my boyfriend did the red light tour with Benjamin and it was one of the highlights of our trip.Benjamin was full of information and was very friendly and likable.It was really nice because they don't do big groups and there were only 4 of us on the tour. We have been to Amsterdam before and thought we knew all there was to know about the area but we learned alot and also saw quite a few things we hadn't before. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wants to find out more about the red light district or Amsterdam in general!

Interesting insight into The Red Light District. We did the Red Light District walking tour with Lealu on a rainy Friday night and found it most informative. The whole concept of the RLD is a little alien but Lealu was very knowledgeable and gave us lots of interesting facts on the political, social and economic aspects surrounding the sex industry in Amsterdam. It certainly made me reconsider some of my pre-conceived notions..... Would highly recommend this tour!

Great walking intro to Amsterdam!. My wife and I took the city tour with Benjamin on our first day in Amsterdam, and it was a great way to get an introduction to the city! Our guide knew a lot about the historical and modern day city, and was able to show us all sorts of sites, both well known and off the beaten path. Highly recommended!

City Tour with Benjamin. My husband and I did the city tour and what a fantastic way to spend a cold Tuesday. Benjamin our tour guide was funny, enthusiastic and had an amazing knowledge about the city. Being a small group there was plenty of opportunity for questions and little detours which only made the tour better. We had already been in Amsterdam a couple of days and this tour changed our perspective on the city completely. Would highly recommend.

Walking Tour RLD. I went on Lealu's RLD tour on a cold and windy Friday night with a small group of 3 Americans. In spite of the small number on the tour, Lealu was very informative about the history and current working conditions for the people in the RLD, and entertained us throughout. I highly recommend the tour.

Small and intimate tours, lots of information and a great oversight of Amsterdam!. My boyfriend and I booked the RLD tour for our first day in Amsterdam but our flight was cancelled from bad weather. We managed to get over there the following day but the RLD tour wasn't on.Mark was super helpful and rearranged for us to go on the city tour with Lealu. We had already missed a full day of our short stay so we were panicking a little. We didn't know what to do or see or how to make the most of our stay! We are blessed that we ended up on this tour as it really was a fabulous guide for the rest of our holiday.Lealu is really friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, kind and generally a wonderful person to have in your company. We only had a few in our tour compared to others we came across, who had over 50 people!! How could you even hear what their tour guides were saying?! We were able to ask lots of questions about the best restaurants, the best sex show to go to, the best coffee shops etc. Lealu got us a map and penciled all these in for us. She also recommended a gorgeous little local Christmas market which was only 20 minutes from us, on that very day. So although we missed the previous day due to bad luck, we felt like she helped us to jam pack our few days with very specific activities which we might never have found.She also brought us through the Red light District and gave us some history on that which we appreciated seeing as that was our original choice of tour.We got a very thorough understanding of what makes the local people who they are. The history is fascinating. We really loved learning about the people and the culture and it set up the rest of the holiday as we now had some knowledge to help us appreciate everything we saw next. She helped us choose what to do with our time and she really did make our holiday because we had the confidence afterwards to navigate the city and go straight to the best bits (for our needs).It was December, and I was wearing flimsy leggings. Please dress up warm! Lealu, bless her, brought us to a little shop selling cheap scarves, gloves and hats, at which one of our group bought some warm clothing. The weather obviously wasn't her fault but it was a little distracting which was my own mistake. We didn't feel the cold until towards the end so it didn't make too much of a difference.Thank you Lealu, we will be back with you for the Red Light District tour for sure :-)-Sandy and Mark

Polished experience. We did the city walk with rob. I must say that it was an incredibly polished experience from start to finish. You could tell immediately that he has been giving tours for a long time as he really knows his stuff with loads of nice little touches (like discreetly managing to chat with each person individually at some point on the tour). Couldn't recommend highly enough

Great, informative, friendly walking tour. The best way to experience cities are walking tours...and Lealu at That Dam Guide didn't disappoint. Limited to 10 people, the discussion was informative & intimate. A wealth of historic & local, knowledge, I only wish I had more time to schedule one of the another tours. Thank you Lealu. Hope to see you only next visit!

Great tour, highly recommend . I did the city walking tour with my mother last Tuesday which lasts 3 hours. Our tour guide was Rob, very enthusiastic about all aspects of Amsterdam including history, culture, modernism etc and was an absolute joy to spend the 3 hours with. The time flies by and there is never a point where it feels like it's dragging (which to be honest I was expecting when I heard it was 3 hours long, so I was pleasantly surprised!) We saw other tour groups walking around the same areas as us which had upwards of 20/30 people - our group only had 6 which meant we could move around a lot easier, everyone was able to hear what Rob was saying and we had the opportunity to chat and ask questions, all of which I imagine would be much more difficult in the larger groups. I would definitely recommend this tour to friends and family and if I'm ever back in Amsterdam I will be doing their RLD tour.Thanks for a great tour!

Knowledgeable and fun...what more can you ask for? :). Myself and my friends had Rob as our tour guide with a small group of others, and not only did we learn a lot, it was also one of the best memories I have of visiting! Rob is very friendly and knows a lot. Highly recommended.
What a nice group of guides!. What a nice group of guides. Al lot of interesting information of the beautifull city. I realy recommand these tours!!!!

Excellent, knowledgeable, friendly and most of all fun. We had seen people struggling to hear on the big free tours in the city, so thought this would be ideal. We were a small group of six. Rob was interesting, knowledgable and fun to listen to has he told the story of Amsterdam. He really brought the city alive in a fun way. The tour was three hours long but was regularly punctuated with mini stops along the way to look at interesting places and items that represent Amsterdam. It was a great way to get to know the city and learn about its history. Thoroughly recommended.

Highly Recommended. Myself and my partner booked the walking tour with Rob for Saturday morning (after having it recommended to me by a friend who had done it the week before). Booking online was easily done when booked we received an email with directions and even a picture of the meeting point.There were only 8 In our group and Rob made effort to talk to each one of us along the way. Something that could not have been done if we had joined a large group. Rob was friendly, funny and full of knowledge. We were never rushed walking around it was a very easy walk and we didn't feel bombarded by information it was more like a conversation with interesting facts. Would recommend it to everyone you don't need to be very interested in history to do these tours it is not like a lecture but a lot of interesting facts while seeing a beautiful city.

Great tour - small group more personal and friendly. We would definitely recommend this tour! We went on the city tour today with Rob as our guide - Rob was humorous, knowledgable and very personable. We saw things we would never have found on our own (eg. 'hidden gardens'). He entertained us with tales - both humorous and serious- along the way, and the 3Hrs passed very quickly. Also worth mentioning is that we had a need to make a fairly last minute change to our tour, due to flight delays, and Mark (the owner) was able to accommodate our request - thank you for this!

Enthusiastic, friendly and educational. Excellent city tour with Rob- Amsterdam couldn't find a more enthusiastic resident. Small group meant I was able to ask questions as we went along, certainly learnt lot. Would recommend.

The tour company to use. I've done both free tour companies and ones you pay for up front - my biggest advice, avoid the free ones. While the free tour guides themselves can be good, think about what you are getting (if it's a huge crowd, will you hear?) and how they make money (they have to make money, of course). If you want a great tour, get a good company with a good guide.Mark with That Dam Guide was excellent. He was an informative and entertaining, and really knows both the old and recent history of Amsterdam. The trip is well worth the money. (And even though he doesn't use the "hidden commission" way of making money, he gives you a card that you can show to various stores and get a nice discount.)

Insightful and a most do. We did both the RLD (Lealu) and city tour (Benjamin). I cannot stress how useful these tours were. We learned so much in both sessions and got to travel the city as if we lived there. Lealu and Benjamin know their history very well and provided us with plenty of tips regarding where to eat, visit, see, explore. The groups were very small and both guides allowed us to take our time and ask plenty of questions.Do not go on those guides that have 20 to 30 people.... specially when visiting the RLD. We had a very small group and we blended in to the crowd as if we belong there.I have to once again thank our great guides for the wonderful time we had. I highly recommend these two tours. Mark the owner was also great following up with us and providing great links for things to do. Thank you.

Do This Dam Tour! You Won't Regret It.. It was cold, windy, and it even rained on us during the tour, but we would do it again in a heartbeat. Our tour guide, Benjamin, was energetic with a great sense of humor. He delivered the history of Amsterdam in a most entertaining way. Small group tours are the best because everyone is able to see and hear the guide; everyone gets their questions heard and answered; and, by the end of the tour, everyone has made a new friend.

RLD Tour with Mark. Had an illuminating tour of the Red Light District with Mark. He was an absolutely excellent guide with a fascinating back story on his experience in Amsterdam. We learned so much about the politics and history of the Red Light District. Mark talked about what it's like for the workers in the area and the changes the city has gone through. He pointed out the various points of interest, shared some hilarious and inappropriate stories, and kept the drunken stag parties away from us. This is the only way to see the Red Light District and keep it classy but still on point! Highly recommend to everyone who wants to learn about the real stories of the district without being overly explicit. Still, definitely not a family-friendly tour simply due to the nature of the area.

Rob is awesome!. We went for the city walking tour with Rob and few other folks. Rob provided us with a great experience and covered all the important sites and the history behind them as well. We definitely recommend his walking tours!

Great tour by Mark!. We did the city tour with Mark in October and had a great time! Booking the tour was as easy as could be. I was able to check the booking calendar online and select that date and time I wanted. Mark lists not only the dates and times of each tour but also the title of the tour, the name of the tour guide, and how many spots are available for each. It's up to you to choose, and it's easy! It's obvious Mark is a professional tour guide, and his operation reflects that.The tour itself is very informal. Mark is casual and lots of fun. He expertly guided us around much of the central area, giving out tips and advice for further exploration of Amsterdam. Although Mark has done these tours many, many times, we had the feeling that each tour is a fresh experience for him. We've been with guides who seem to have memorized their spiel and just recite what seems like a script by rote. We never got that feeling with Mark.Sign up for this, go take a walk, and enjoy!

Excellent introduction to Amsterdam. Wow - what a great tour! My husband and I met up with four other couples for a morning city tour with Mark. The tour was excellent, giving us all a great history lesson and a walking orientation to sections of Amsterdam we might want to revisit - which we did! The tour was so good that we plan on arranging a private tour when we next revisit Amsterdam.

City Walking Tour. We did the city walking tour with Rob on our first day in Amsterdam. Great to get a feeling for the different areas and to be shown parts which I would never have visited (the Beguine neighbourhood). Rob was great and made the effort to speak with everyone. Loved his little snippets of interesting stories and city history. Well worth the €10 as the 3 hours flew by.

A must do tour in Amsterdam. Rob was great, knowledgeable and personable. 3 hour tour with a 15 min break in the middle for coffee or something. Highly recommend for any first timer to Amsterdam or if you want a sense of the different areas of the city maybe to note where to come back to.Dave and Sheri, Boston.

Mark is Awesome!. There is absolutely no reason why this isn't number one. Zip. Zero. For comparison we did three other tours and Mark blew them out of the water. This is a genuine Amsterdam experience for everyone. We did the day tour and saw so many amazing things. You will find the best cookies you have even eaten, probably the best cheese I've had this year, and find yourself in a few Monet paintings. You will laugh, learn a ton, and see places that no other tour will take you.
Fantastic tour . We did the city tour and Rob was great very knowledgeable. Great overview of the city and its history. Highly recommended

RDL tour. Benjamin, our guide was fantastic this evening. Pointed put all the great watering holes, explained everything in a really lovely way that played to all the group requirements (only 7 of us, which was great). Gave a real flavour of RDL and very balanced informative view, thank you. No pressure Rob for tomorrow's tour!!!

Great red light tour. We recently did the red light tour with Ben. Ben was really knowledgeable with a great sense of humour that kept the tour interesting. This tour was a good way to orientate yourself in the red light district and Ben recommended places you may wish to visit later. You do no go to any sex shows or smoke any drugs which is what many people think when you say you a doing a tour like this! So stress less and book in!

Don't miss the Red Light District Tour with Benjamin. We did the Red Light District tour with Benjamin on Saturday, 14th October 2015. Very entertaining and knowledgeable. Despite the driving rain at times! Informative about the history of the city, RLD, and sex/prostitution trade and regulation in Amsterdam. Great walking exploration of landmarks, including commemorative art and buildings. And recommendations for ... well ... different types of establishments. Don't miss it.

Best Introduction to the City. Booked a walking tour with Rob, for our first full day in Amsterdam. We were only a group of 10 which made the tour much more personal and interactive. It was an excellent way of getting to know the key areas of the City and learning something of the history. Rob was informative and entertaining, and gave us a great recommendation for a restaurant in Chinatown. The length of the tour was just right. Rob followed up the tour with an email containing interesting links if people wanted more information - a really nice personal touch. Thanks Rob.

THE Tour to go on - hands down. Couldn't have asked for a better guide, Rob was excellent - unbelievably knowledgeable and passionate about Amsterdam, kicked the tour off with a 2 minute summary of the entire history of Amsterdam.As we progressed through the tour he provided us with more historical information, coupled with useful facts and tips to aid us on our stay in Amsterdam - for this reason I would highly recommend doing this tour early in your stay; it will give you ideas and advice which may greatly benefit your experience.The tour covered a bit of everything really, and gave us a good feel of what the place was about, as well as making future navigation around the city easier for our stay in Amsterdam. I've never known 3 hours go by so quickly, I'm usually looking at my watch waiting for it to end (particularly as I'm not that into history), but I can honestly say I was entertained and interested for the duration - even the rain didn't bother me!Thanks again to Rob for being probably the most knowledgeable and approachable tour guide I've ever met.Highly recommended - enough said.

A great walking tour and guide. Rob was very knowledgable and interesting, a great tour with small numbers and he gave us a great recommendations for a restaurants and bars that we would of never found. Many thanks
Excellent Tour with Benjamin . Excellent tour, very informative, a must-do in Amsterdam! A 3h walk through the city center which was very entertaining!

A must do!. My husband & I visited Amsterdam for the first time last weekend & I found That Dam Guide on Trip Advisor. We met Rob on Saturday morning & had a great tour! He was very knowledgable about the sights & history of Amsterdam. Also the group was only 8 people which was so much better than a large one. Also, we went on some of Robs recommendations that are on their website & were not disappointed. Thanks so much rob & That Dam guide! xx

Perfect small group tour. My husband and I took the City Tour with That Damn Guide. Rob was a fantastic guide through Amsterdam. He keeps his groups small which allows everyone to hear and interact, which is great. Rob has a ton of knowledge about the city and throws in some fun stories along the way. The City Tour was a perfect length (3 hours) to get acclimated to the city and a bit of the history. The tour stops for a short break which was also nice. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone wishing to get a short intro to an amazing city.

Dam Guide:a must do. Benjamin entertained our group of 10 to a witty and very informative historical and modern day view of Amsterdam that we would not have seen or become aware of using a self guided tour book. Visited the Resistance Museum as suggested by Benjamin, not a high tech installation but very appropriate for the subject. Lots of +++ in taking this walk including two edible treats which every visitor to Amsterdam would be Dam mad to miss.

very informative and fun. I would recommend the red light tour to anyone who wants to know about the red light district. You will learn about the history and current situation of the district.The tour gives you a new perception. Mark was a wonderful tour guide. He was funny, and informative.

Brilliant. I selected this tour as it was rated so highly on Tripadvisor. It didn't let us down. Not only do you cover a lot of ground physically Mark is very well versed on the history of Amsterdam. He is also very knowledgable about activities around the City and can recommend which are worth doing and which aren't. Good for adults and kids.

October 2015 Amsterdam Stay. We did the red light district tour with Mark Friday October 23. We had a small diverse group. Mark was very knowledgeable about the district and the girls who work there. He has a great sense of humor and was very personable. A very explicit tour and I highly recommend Mark if you are interested in the Red Light District of Amsterdam.

Really Outstanding City Tour!. This was the best way to learn about the history and culture and be totally entertained along the way. Benjamin was our guide and he did an OUTSTANDING job. He was intelligent, humorous, and well-informed. There were four of us and he impressed us all! We learned so much while walking around the city with him, he was able to answer our questions and along the way we laughed and enjoyed his stories. I highly recommend this tour - best bet for your money!
Highly useful walking tour of Amsterdam. Benjamin was prompt, informative, friendly and a great guide. I highly recommend taking this tour as you first arrive, to set the table for your trip!

Interesting and informative tour, with some laughs thrown in. I went on Mark's Red Light District tour with a few friends on Friday night (Oct 30) and thoroughly enjoyed it. Mark made it very interesting, giving insights into the whole industry and the lives of the girls working within it that I doubt you'd get with one of the large tour groups. Mark brought a lot of humour and honesty to the tour of an industry that's often seen as sordid and seedy. A great tour at a good price... I thoroughly recommend it!

Great small group tour. The thing that attracted me to book with "That Dam Guide" was all the fantastic reviews on TA & the fact that the groups are a maximum of 10 people. My husband & I did the tour with our 2 teenage children last week & we weren't disappointed. The reviews on here are well deserved. Mark was interesting & informative. We learned lots about Amsterdam & Dutch history. Mark was entertaining, with lots of funny & personal stories & observations. He answered questions & gave us a couple of suggestions on places to visit & recommended a restaurant for dinner. I would highly recommend these tours. Thanks Mark for a great afternoon.

Great way to solidify a couple of days in Amsterdam!. myself and my girlfriend had already been in Amsterdam for 5 days when we did this tour and had walked the city fairly extensively and also completed a bike tour, so we thought maybe we would be seeing a lot of stuff that we had already. This wasn't the case! Mark showed us around alleys and spots that you really would need a guide to really find, and the information and history he gave was really top notch. Totally agree with his sentiment about large tour groups(which we encountered) - they are a dreary affair, so if you want an authentic and personal tour of this fascinating city definitely give this a go!

Excellent tour!. Great and informative tour! Learned a lot about the Red Light District and even got some recommendations about good places for lunch/dinner afterwards from Mark. 10/10 would recommend.
AMAZING. Mark did an awesome job and is very knowledgeable! I would take the tour again and recommend it to anyone going to Amsterdam.

Great Introduction to Amsterdam!. We did a City Tour with Mark on the afternoon of Oct. 22nd. I chose this tour because of the small group size and the numerous positive reviews and I'm so glad I did! Our tour was informative, interesting and humorous. Mark gave us an overview of the area, its history and made recommendations along the way for other restaurants and attractions. He has a great personality and immediately sets the tone for a fun afternoon. We followed several of his recommendations later - the Indonesian restaurant, cheese tasting and the sweet shop. All great! Mark is an outstanding tour guide!

Dam Good Tour. What a great way to discover Amsterdam! Benjamin is the perfect guide. He was incredibly knowledgeable about the city and its history. But, at the same time, he was witty and often irreverent, which made a three-hour walking tour go by in no time, leaving us wishing for more. The tour was well-paced with a nice french fry with toppings break along the way.

Fantastic introduction to Amsterdam and Dutch culture. Lealu delivered a very enjoyable, interesting and comprehensive City Tour for around 3 hours. We learnt about the history and culture of Amsterdam as well as seeing a lot of the sights of the city and getting to know our way around. Lealu pointed out some nice cafes and bars to go to and gave us some museum recommendations which were helpful for the rest of my stay. The small group size (10 people) made the tour a lot more personal and interactive and we were encouraged to ask questions throughout. I highly recommend That Dam Guide.

Very Informative, Very Informal (and Fun!). Went with a class to take a Red Light Tour, Mark did a great job providing info and keeping a bunch of university kids entertained. Can't recommend Mark enough :) 10/10 would tour again.

Amazing Tour, Amazing Guide!. Mark gave an AMAZING tour to my class when we visited the Red Light District. He was great at telling stories and putting humor into it all. Would HIGHLY recommend to anyone who wants to gain new perspective on the Red Light District.

Two tours. Too much fun.. My husband and I took both tours with Mark - a city and the red light district. Both were fantastic! Mark not only provided historical details and the current affairs of the city, but he enlightened us on the Dutch - the views of the people, the immigrants, the political ideas and so much more. It was an educational experience that I have already shared with so many upon my return home. The tours are kept small and intimate. They only do parties of 10. Mark is truly fabulous! He is a great story teller and again, the education he provided was unforgettable. He opened our eyes to different view points and showed us the true beauty of Amsterdam. If you are going to pick one over the other - go with the red light tour. The city tour is great, but the RLD is very unique.

Lealu, thank you!. We booked That Dam Guide thanks to all the reviews on this site and I must say they were right. The group was small (10 ppl) and our guide Lealu super friendly, professional and interesting. We did the morning tour of central Amsterdam and loved every corner and every story that came with it. Great experience, thank you Lealu. Hope to come again and see more of your glorious city! Ciao

Two tours, both fantastic!. I went on both the City Tour and the Red Light District Tour with Mark - both were fantastic. Mark has a great ability to tell stories and relay information. For anyone spending a couple of days in Amsterdam I recommend both tours.

Small groups. Mark's tour is limited to 10 people and that gives it a massive advantage over the other tours we saw which had hordes of people slowly shuffling across the city. One of the great irritants of a large tour is hanging around waiting for everyone to catch up and with such small groups that doesn't happen. We could take small alleyways which would be off limits to larger groups and Mark didn't need to bellow to make himself heard.Needless to say, the commentary was excellent, well balanced between old & modern as well as personal experience & reflection. I also liked the fact that whilst Mark has negotiated some discounts for his clients with selected shops, he does not push you into them and expect you to buy.

Benjamin was awesome. I took the day tour with Benjamin. He was very thorough, fun, knowledgeable and great company. He certainly has made me fall in love with Amsterdam. I would very strongly recommend taking this tour. You simply can not miss them.
Perfect. What an incredible experienceMy 3rd time in Amsterdam and I still haven't had enoughOur guide was hilarious and knew his stuffI would recommend taking this tour to everyone

Very educational and Fun. Fresh "off the boats" from a tropical country, the Red Light Tour was our first tour in our European holiday and it didn't disappoint. In terms of our guide's qualification, I have no doubt that Lealu (?) knows her stuff being able to work in a sex shop and a coffee shop before she got the call to talk to strangers and take in them in a strange land that is known as Amsterdam's Red Light District.In this walk, she talked about prostitution, drugs, peeps shows, freedom, the churches, and the organization. It was great and very informative.

A tale of bubbling cultural ecology, a lively brew !. Mark shares a brilliant rolling familiarity with the sights and sounds that surrounds a still dynamic conjugation of wealth and values that is and has been Amsterdam. A deeper appreciation of the people and place left me seeking a more subtle understanding of the Dutch.

The best Dam Guide!. I took the walking tour today with Mark and 9 of my fellow Americans and it is by far the best tour in the city! Mark has loads of great information about Amsterdam and the tour really helps you acclimate to the city. Mark has a great personality and I would recommend anyone visiting Amsterdam to book a tour with him. He's that DAM good!

Fun, Funny and Educative. I don’t have a Tripadvisor account therefore I can't post the review by myself so i use my wife's. This was not my first time to Amsterdam, however this time my wife and I have decided to take a formal walk tour with a guide.We got Rob, wow... he knows so much about the city, we learned a lot, it was detailed and clear, spiced with humor, although we are not native english speakers, it was clear and well understood. Despite the cold and rainy weather, the time flew and the end came in almost no time... we could easily proceed for few hours more, and I warmly recommend this tour with Rob

RLD tour - fun & interesting!. Mark was a lot of fun and his walking tour of the Red Light District was both fun and interesting. A good deal of information regarding the profession, the district and other sex businesses operating there. We really enjoyed this tour and highly recommend for those visiting Amsterdam.

Fun and educational. Mark made our trip to Amsterdam entertaining, informative and memorable. He showed us all the local sites while providing a historical narrative. We would not have seen Amsterdam the way it is meant to be seen without him. Thanks for a good time Mark!

Red Light District must. Mark took my prostitution class on a tour of the Red Light District. He was great with accommodating the large size of the group and was effortlessly funny. Very energetic and blunt, Mark was not afraid to share the details of sex work. Learned so much and was definitely worth every minute!
Mark is great!. Mark gave us a tour of the Red Light District for our class trip, and he was a hit! We were impressed with his extensive knowledge. He answered all our questions well too!

Great tour. We booked this based on the reviews as a way to spend our first day in amsterdam and learn a bit about the city. Benjamin was really informative, and we learnt a lot about the history of amsterdam. We are really glad we did this tour, and liked the small group size which meant everyone could hear everything clearly. I would recommend this to anyone visiting amsterdam.

Amazing walking tour of Amsterdam!!!!. I found Mark here on Trip Advisor, and all of his reviews were amazing and everyone seemed to have an amazing tour...so naturally I booked. I am SO glad that I booked a tour with him because not only is he funny, he knows his stuff. It's not just a "here's the red light district, blah, blah" tour...instead he goes into a historical detail and helps you appreciate and fall in love with this amazing city built on canals without even knowing it. I cannot say anything bad about this amazing tour. We were able to cover all of Amsterdam during our 3-4 hour tour, take plenty of pictures, ask questions, take breaks and stopped into many cafes for some drinks and fuel while heading to our next destination. Mark is amazing and he will answer any questions that you have and even help with directions once the tour is over (since it ends in a different district).I recommend booking his tour in the beginning of your stay in Amsterdam so you can get a brief feel of the history and neighborhoods before it's too late. Have fun!

Very informative RLD tour with Lealu!. We joined the red light district tour with Lealu. We learned so much and we enjoyed it! She knew was she was talking about and was very approachable and friendly. She was also very funny. She had recommendations and suggestions which we appreciated very much. I will highly recommend the tour to my friends and family!Some things to note:1) If you plan to join any walking tour in Amsterdam, it is recommended that you use shoes with good support. You will go through a lot of cobbled streets.2) It was a rainy night, but the rain was very light. A water repellent jacket with a hoodie did the trick. We didn't need an umbrella.

Great way to see and learn about Amsterdam!. We toured Amsterdam with Mark and had a blast (even in the rain)! He was very knowledgeable and engaging and provided great tips and recommendations. I highly recommend That Dam Guide for a fun way to learn about Amsterdam!

Fantastic and totally worth the money! . We had Lealu as our tour guide in Amsterdam and she was fantastic! She had a ton of knowledge on the red light district and seemed enthusiastic about her job! She even followed up with tons of great info to further our knowledge of the area we toured! You can't go wrong with this tour! Thanks Lealu!

Great tour!. We took the city walking tour a day after we arrived and Mark was excellent. Very informative, engaging and gave us some great recommendations for restaurants/bars etc - many of which we used. Cannot recommend That Dam Guide highly enough! John & Elaine, Scotland.

Benjamin was absolutely the BEST!. Booked a Tuesday tour with That Dam Guide in advance of our stay in Amsterdam. We were not disappointed. Benjamin was our guide and he was an absolute delight. Very informed and had a great dry humor. He made the city's highlights and history seem fascinating. I would highly recommend this outfit. They are the best!!

Great walking tour. My boyfriend and I had a great time on the Red Light District Walking Tour. Mark came recommended and did not disappoint! We were a small group of ten so it was easy to get around and Mark always made sure we were together. Very informative and interesting tour that I would definitely recommend.

Rob is the best!. Our American, now resident of Amsterdam, tour guide was the best. He was smart, personable and kept us on track. The tour really helped us get our bearings in this very compact city and helped us to understand some of the culture.

Fantastic Red Light District Tour with Lealu. I signed up for this tour a few days before we arrived in Amsterdam. We were lucky to have Lealu as our guide for a tour of the red light district. She was really knowledgeable about the district and shared lots of interesting information - some funny and some serious. It was a good mix. I also really appreciated the small group for this tour. Highly recommend!

Walking Tour. My husband and I had a an amazing walking tour with Mark, the smaller groups of 10 are great and we met some lovely people. Mark has a mass of information and answered all questions, please don't go with the bigger tour groups you will be wasting your money, cant wait to go back and do another tour with him.

Great Tour of Red Light District . Book this tour through Trip Advisor and we're not disappointed. We booked a private tour and Ben was very informative and knowledgeable about the area. He kept the subject manner light but interesting through out the 1 1/2 hour tour. There were areas and spots that he talked about that you would miss just walking around on your own. Don't miss this!!
Great tour. Our family really enjoyed Marks tour. It was a great Intro to Amsterdam and we highly recommend! Our kids are 11 and 13 and they really enjoyed as well

Great first impression of Amsterdam. We had Mark for our tour and it was a great experience! He was very funny yet informative--great mix of history and current events. It was my husband and I's first time to Amsterdam and it was the perfect start to get to know the city. Strongly recommend.

Superb….. Benjamin was our guide on our day time tour it went very well having a small group was just superb !We got to learn so much with his very unique way of putting across the history and information which makes this a great city .Would Recommend

Brilliant RLD Tour!. My boyfriend and I went on the RLD tour with Lealu on 9th Oct. Our first time to the city, I was a little anxious about visiting the RLD by ourselves and so decided to book the tour before we went. I felt a lot safer and a lot more at ease with Lealu's reassurance and hilarious stories! Would 100% recommend to anyone!

Very Informative. We took both the city tour and the RLD tours with Mark, and both were excellent. Tours offer a different perspective of the RLD, lots of local knowledge including everything from where to eat, best evening entertainment, best coffee shops, etc. Mark also sends follow up emails including links for additional information. I highly recommend both tours for anyone (well, over 18 for RLD :)) visiting Amsterdam. If Mark does not know the answer, no one does.

City Tour. Rob took us on a very interesting tour of the city. He was informative, personable and even though from New Jersey, a nice guy. A few items for improvement: Rob, you need to "shake your orange Pom-Pom" so you can be seen a little better at the start of the tour. And a little more time for snacks at the middle of the tour. Overall, excellent.

Fascinating first steps into Amsterdam. I highly recommend taking a city tour with Mark at the beginning of your stay in Amsterdam. He gave us a great overview over sights, cafés and shops. The 10 month-old goats cheese is divine - thank you!

Fascinating View of Amsterdam. We took a city tour with Rob. He was informative, interesting and best of all, hilarious. We learned so many fascinating tidbits that we would never have found in a guide book. He was attentive to the whole group, even with the periodic downpours. We especially liked his follow-up email with further resources.

HIGHLY RDOMMEND THE "RED LIGHT" TOUR!!!!. We had the pleasure of having Mark guide us through the Red Light District. Unlike other groups we passed which were very large, this is a small group (10 people). Mark's knowledge on this area is excellent and his views are very enlightening. We found it to be an excellent value and highly recommend this tour! The two hours flew by.
Red light tour. Good tour. He was knowledgeable and friendly. Crazy area to see. If we were here longer we would of done his city tour too.
Outstanding. Mark was a perfect guide of both the city tour and also the red light district. He was very knowledgable and made the tours fun to be a part of! Wouldn't hesitate to recommend him.

Enjoyed our Red Light District tour. We did the Red Light District tour with Lealu as our guide. She was prompt and the tour was limited to 10 participants (actually 11) as advertised, which seems essential for such a crowded area. Lealu has great knowledge of the history of the district and the sex workers stories. She did a particularly good job in finding out what our main interests/questions were and tailoring the tour to make sure they were covered.If you are reluctant to venture into these areas on your own, but still want to experience the red light area, you won't be disappointed with this reasonably priced tour.
City tour. We had a great time, Benjamin taught us some great info about the city that we certainly wouldn't have learned otherwise. Definitely glad we went!

Excellent view of the central city. We had an extremely pleasant walk with Benjamin through portions of the central city. His presentation of information was very helpful and past theatre training enhanced his capacity to project this to his participants. Between stops, he was easily engaged in conversation and this served to broaden our exposure to the development of the city and Dutch culture beyond what we would learn just looking about. We'd definitely recommend this tour.

Getting a feel for Amsterdam - walking tour with Leandra. 3 hours walking with Leandra with a refreshment break in the middle - was best tour we've ever done. Leandra made it informative in a more interesting and personal way than most guides. Small group size was great - especially in those small streets. Very much appreciated her love for the city and how it grew to be the Amsterdam that it is today. Many thanks

Red light tour. Took this tour with Mark and it was both entertaining and informative! Highly recommend this tour to anyone interested in finding out a little bit more about Amsterdam! Great tour group size and a lot of fun!

Above and beyond. We found Rob's presentation smooth, informative and fun. Our plan was to arrive in Amsterdam at 7 AM get to our boat and then meet the tour at 10;30 AM. Arriving late by plane we contacted him and said we would be about 30 minutes late. He said not to worry and go to the appointed site. When we arrived at 11:15 the tour had left but standing there was the owner of the company who gave us a quick introduction as he walked us to where the tour was and we joined the other 10 guests for a great tour. That was personalized service.Doug K.

Great tour- very informative!. Mark did a fantastic job. The tour was both very informative and entertaining. Mark had certainly done his homework, I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting this wonderful city.

Top quality tour. My wife and I and both of our parents went on this tour when in Amsterdam having found it on trip adviser. The reviews looked great and suggested that this wouldn't be your standard walking tour. I am pleased to say that was exactly right. Benjamin was our tour guide and he was absolutely brilliant. We saw and learnt a lot about the city and Benjamin kept it really entertaining and funny, yet extremely informative. My wife and I are early 30's whilst both sets of parents are early 60's but it was pitched perfectly so everyone enjoyed! It was the highlight of the trip and can't thank them enough for such a great day. As has already been said on here when you see a large group of around 30 odd people walking on a 'free' tour you realise how much better this tour is. Group size was perfect and it encouraged everyone to mix which again made the tour more enjoyable. If you go to Amsterdam do this tour!
Very informative. Mark was a great tour guide. He's done lots of research and has great stories. I would definitely recommend it. He keeps the group to only 10-11 people, nice size.

Regular City Tour and Red Light District Tour. I ended up showing up to the wrong spot (my fault, I have no sense of location), and he kept his phone on for me until I showed up. He tries to make each tour unique and interesting. We stopped halfway for some Dutch Beer and for a bathroom break to make sure we could last the long haul (It is a much longer tour than most). He knows all the merchants on the streets and makes tours interactive (went inside a cheese shop and grabbed us each a slice).His tours are booked about 3 weeks in advance, so get your tickets before they sell out!

Great tour - fantastic variety. Rob led the ten of us on a wonderful stroll through Amsterdam. I was very pleased with the variety of places we visited around a lot of the city. We hit all the advertised sights and quite a few more. Rob's stories about what we were seeing made the tour so interesting - he is very knowledgeable about the city. I highly recommend this tour. At the end of the tour, be sure to take his recommendation on where to get real pancakes!

Red light district tour . I did the red light district tour with Lealu and it was amazing! She gives interesting facts about the area and pretty much how everything works and the changes Amsterdam is trying to make currently! Lealu is adorable and funny! Highly recommend!

A great introduction to Amsterdam. We enjoyed our walking tour with Benjamin who provided insightful commentary and information which helped connect the history of the city and region with contemporary Dutch society, We had just come off a Rick Steves your of Spain, and no local guide on that tour did a better job than Benjamin did for us in Amsterdam.

Awesome tours & tour guide :). We signed up for a city tour and Red Light Dist tour in the one day. We both really enjoyed Marks commentary, his humour and his tips of best places to eat. Gave us a great insight to the city and the people which we found to be quite unique. Try to plan for first day of your visit. 10 ppl per tour is awesome, we could hear everything said and got to meet & enjoy the other ppl in the tour also who were lovely. We would all say as we passed big groups that we were so glad we weren't with them. Good on you Mark, Gill and I wish you the best :)

Small group - big story. Benjamin gave our group of 10 a high-octane introduction at each stop, then followed up as we walked with full and patient answers to all our questions. He adapted to our interests and nothing was glossed over or dismissed. Others advise booking this tour for your first day in Amsterdam. It was my third day and just as good - I had a bit of knowledge and many more questions than if I'd just arrived. Walking around the next day I saw bored walking groups of 20 or more and was delighted and a bit smug that we'd had such a great experience. Totally recommended.

Those Dam Guides - Lealu & Mark. Hi - Based on TripAdvisor reviews I signed up for 2 walking tours - The Red Light District which was guided by Lealu and the history of Amsterdam tour guided by Mark.They have such knowledge and passion for the city and the history. Much respect for the people, the past, present and future.Of course their personalities is really what makes the tours spectacular. I was in Amsterdam and this was a great way to learn and see so much in such a short time of such a fabulous city! So great to know the stories behind so much.Another most desirable factor is that it is just a group of up to 10 people which makes it intimate and easy to stay as a group and get to know one another. Added bonus. :)Thank you Lealu and Mark for most memorable times!

Great Red Light District Tour with Lealu. This was a great tour that lasted two hours. The groups are limited to ten people. This is a plus as you are not fighting to try and hear the guide compared to other groups that we saw with 20+ people. Lealu was a great and fun guide and answered all the questions asked with great humour. We didn't realise how much there was to the The Red Light District so don't be put off by the two hour length, it's really interesting and fun. It sells out a lot in advance so I would advise booking well in advance.

Amsterdam city walking tour with Benjamin.Dam Good 😀. This was our first time to Amsterdam and we highly recommend this tour.Try and book prior to arriving and do the tour on your first day so that you enhance your stay in the city.Benjamin is knowledgeable,funny and never boring.He speaks clearly and is easy to understand.Tour groups are small, max. 10 people and after the tour you end up having a very good insight into the history, social and economic development of Amsterdam.Best city tour we have ever done.

Mark is fun and informative. We are so pleased that we booked a city tour with Mark. It was a great introduction on our first full day in Amsterdam. Mark is a storehouse of information, very pleasant and inclusive, and even sends links to his tour group of things he discussed. He also offers a tour of the Red Light district, but we hadn't booked that and it was full - wish we had booked! Mark was fantastic. And he books small groups of 10 so it is very easy to hear him and ask questions to which he is very responsive.

Wonderful city with the most fabulous guide!. I just did the tour today with Mark and it was fantastic! The group size was a nice 10 and the three hours sped by so quickly. There can be no better ambassador for Amsterdam then Mark who is not only very knowledgeable but entertaining and engaging as well. It is best to do this tour early in your visit so that you can take advantage of Mark's excellent travel tips.

Excellent tour with Benjamin!. We wanted to book a city tour to give us an overview of AMS. Found That Dam Guide through TA, but their group city tour was booked on our available days. Instead, I was able to book Benjamin as a private guide for our family of four (we are traveling with two adult daughters 22 & 24) and we all enjoyed the tour immensely. Benjamin was funny and very interesting. We all appreciated the rich history (without being boring), antidotes and backstories he provided. He has a true love of Amsterdam and it's people, and that shined though on this tour. Also, Benjamin, thanks for the tip on Pannenkoekenhuis Upstairs - We ate the most delicious pancakes there the next afternoon!

Just what I needed to know day 1. I set this up for this tour for within five hours of landing. Thanks (!) United Airlines for making that not happen. I emailed Mark from the States and he was gracious enough to move us a day. Benjamin made this tour amazingly entertaining, profane and informative. With a small group limit we were able to cover a great amount of the city and ask questions. Made friends on this tour who followed us along to other sites after the tour. Looking forward to doing this again.

Excellent Tour. We took this tour on September 11th, from 10:30-1:30. It was excellent. We had a small group and he took us on sort of an extended tour since everyone was in pretty good shape and could keep up. Very informative. He really knew his subject and the history of the city. Also very funny as well. We covered a lot of ground. We stopped at a french fry shop and cookie shop which were both fantastic. The city is absolutely beautiful. We bought our tickets ahead of time on line. The only problem we had was that the tour ended in a different place and we had to get back to the train station. Mark was very helpful however in giving us directions back to the train station. One of the best walking tours I have done. Would highly recommend.

Great way to learn about Amsterdam. Had a great experience on Mark's City Tour. Learn a lot about the history, people and local sites. He gave us recommendations for anything we wanted to do, including canal rides, restaurants, and treats. Recommend this for anyone who wants to make the most of their visit to Amsterdam. Thanks, Mark!

Informative, fun and respectful of the trade...i can see why this tour is #1!. The tour was everything i expected it would be and more. Mark is a fabulous tour guide and provides an informative and very respectful insight into the Red Light district and the people who work there. I would definitely recommend this tour and Mark to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Tomorrow we meet up with Mark for our city tour. I'm sure it will be as great as this one was.Now go ahead and book it...you will not be disappointed!

Brilliant tour with Rob. We had an excellent tour with Rob who was a friendly, knowledgable and a brilliant tour guide. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour and Rob's recommended Dutch pancake café was a bonus! Highly recommended!

City Tour with Rob (Friday 25/9/15). Great City Tour - we were in Amsterdam this week and tried to book this early Aug for when we arrived on Wednesday but it was full. Tip 1 - book early for your first full day in town great way to find you're way about. This did not detract from the tour although we knew our way about the main areas by the time we took this. Rob took us to so many different streets and places so it was great to see other parts of the city. Rob was very friendly and informative (one of the best guides we have had and we have done many city tours). Our group was small (10 people) so it was easy to move around. Rob provided a tremendous history of Amsterdam as well as the lay out of the city from medieval times to present. Tip 2 - have a good Breakfast as its 3 hours and the lunch stop is only a short coffee and muffin snack. Thoroughly recommend this Tour and Rob.

Red Light Review. A very entertaining and informative evening with Mark wandering around the alleys and canals of the Red Light District. My husband, two friends and I really enjoyed the humour, sensitivity and history. Mark had so much to tell us and share about the area and the workers. Highly recommend Mark and this tour to all visitors to Amsterdam, you wont be disappointed! PS Thanks for the Pmate Mark!!

Dam Awesome!. My first trip to Amsterdam and I've just finished the red light district tour with Mark this evening. The tour was fantastic! Mark was totally engaging, witty, and very clearly loves what he does and the city that he calls home. Having done a city tour earlier in the day with a different tour company, there is truly no comparison... Do not hesitate to book a tour with That Dam Guide! It's definitely worth it! I only wish I could've joined one of his city tours during this trip ... Oh well ... I'm pretty sure I'll sign up for it if I'm lucky enough to visit Amsterdam again! Thanks for an entertaining and informative tour Mark!

The best Dam tour in Amsterdam.
