My wife and I booked a tour of the Red Light District on our recent trip to Amsterdam.Our guide was Lealu and we had a Dam good time :)There was 8 in total in our group (2 no shows) and it was a very relaxed casual tour, much like strolling around a city with some friends, one of whom has an in-depth knowledge of the city.Lealu brought a great mix of history, humor and facts which leave with quite a different impression of the RLD than you may have originally had. It is a fascinating place with a colorful history.Whilst on our tour we passed a few other walking tours which must have had around 30 people in the groups which reinforced the fact that we had booked the best Dam tour in the city :)I can’t speak highly enough about how much my wife and I enjoyed this tour and Lealu’s company for the 2 or so hours we explored the many alleys and streets of Amsterdam’s Red Light District.10/10

Great job Mark!. Thank you Mark! My husband and I recently took Mark's RLD evening tour and enjoyed ourselves immensely. What a wonderful way to demystify the Red Light District whilst at the same time making us feel comfortable in the area. We very much appreciated Mark's commentary as well as his insights into the Trade and its workings. Following our tour we were comfortable enough to return the follow evening on our own.

Great introduction to Amsterdam & the Netherlands. We toured with Mark yesterday, this being our first time in Amsterdam it was a perfect way to get acquainted with the city. Mark knows his city and its history so it was very informative. Last night we went to one of his suggested resturants De Klos for ribs, have to be honest probably the best we've ever had! Certainly the best meal in our 3 week European vacation! THANKS Mark.

Dam Good Guide!. Best three hour walking tour for someone who is traveling solo and wants to get a good history and grasp of the city! Our guide, Ben, was amazing and very funny-which is so helpful on a long tour. We met in front of the stock exchange which was super smart...Dam Square, where other tours meet, is very busy and loud. Lastly, it was a nice small group. I saw other groups that were large and I liked that ours wasn't and that I could hear what Ben was saying...because he was entertaining!

great intro to Amsterdam. Did the Dam tour with Benjamin. He is knowledgeable, personable and humorous. A great 3 hours. Learned the history of the country and city as well as orientation of the center city.

"Bags and biz from Benjamin". Incredible! Talk about an awesome experience. I had been in Amsterdam for 2 days Prior to going on this walking tour, and my best advice is book it quickly before it's sold out and plan the first afternoon for it. The history and sense of humor from our tour guide Benjamin was just as fun as seeing the sights. He even went out of his way to let us stop when and where we wanted with a nice little surprise half way through for a mint tea and sit. I had gone shopping a bit just prior to the tour (not a good idea, btw, unless you're close to your hotel and can drop them off) and my bags started to rip at the handle about half way through the tour. Benjamin saved the day, grabbing a couple plastic ones that were able to combine my things and make carrying them so much easier! Thanks for an awesome time and a wonderful guide. Those dam guys rock!!

Don't go to Amsterdam without booking a tour with That Dam Guide. This was probably one of the most informative tours I have ever been on. Mark is an expat who loves his adopted city and also loves sharing his knowledge. The City Tour was the first thing we did when we got to town and it was the smartest thing we did. Everything we learned about Amsterdam in the next several days was informed by Mark's in-depth knowledge and experience. Highly recommended!!!

Great way of learning about the Red Light District. I found the tour informative and interesting. Mark is very knowledgeable and provided the group (9 in total on the tour) with ample opportunity to ask questions as the tour progressed. Being in a small group (we often saw groups of 20+) meant we were able to move around easily and everyone was in a position to hear everything that was said. Thoroughly recommend it as part of your trip to Amsterdam,

Excellent & Informative RLD Tour. We chose to do the Red Light Tour on about the only evening we had available in Amsterdam, which turned out to be very rainy. Lealu and the tour more than made up for the sketchy weather though, and we had an outstanding time.Rendezvous with the tour group was easy and the communication up front on meeting time, location, etc was very appreciated. The information was great, without being sensationalist or unbalanced, and Lealu was able to share all of the little details that come from living in the area and spending a significant amount of time really understanding the history and culture.We got a little insight into everything the infamous area has to offer, as well as a bit of general stuff about the city.Excellent all-around tour!Visited September 2015

Excellent tours of the RLD and the city of Amsterdam!. We did the RLD tour with Mark and the City tour with Benjamin! Both were very informative and enjoyable! A great way to learn about the culture. Both Mark and Benjamin were funny and made the tour very interesting and enlightening! I highly recommend seeing the city with That Dam Guide. Thanks, guys for a memorable trip!

Both Entertaining and Informative. My girlfriend and I went on the Red Light District tour with Leilu. Leilu was very knowledgable about the district and the sex workers industry and history, and was very funny as well. We learned a lot of t while also experiencing some new and interesting sites such as the red light windows, a brothel, and a peep show. Highly recommended.

Excellent tour with Benjamin. We did the walking tour with Benjamin. He was an excellent guide, friendly, informative, and personable. He made sure to interact with everyone on the tour. He was able to answer all our questions from the history of the city to where to go to eat. The tour was small, only 11 people, which made it so much better. It lived up to all the reviews I read about it and can only echo what others have said.

Wonderful walking tour - highly recommended!. I did the city tour with Mark in August, and I would strongly recommend him and his tour to any visitor to Amsterdam. He is friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming. The tour was excellent value, especially given he keeps the tour groups small - though this means it is definitely important to book well in advance! We saw all the main sights of Amsterdam, and Mark's information and advice about the city was excellent. He was also more than happy to give general advice about the city, and to spend time during and after the tour answering extra questions, giving extra recommendations, marking things on maps etc. - do take advantage of this because it will prove valuable!One of the best walking tours I've done in any city.

Comprehensive Red Light District tour with Mark. We chose to do the Red Light Tour on our first night in Amsterdam, as we figured it'd be a good way to get our bearings around this part of town.Mark made himself easy to find and was extremely friendly upon meeting. He was instantly telling stories and setting us up for the tour, explaining where all of his information came from.With a history of living in the area, and plenty of friends working in the Red Light District, Mark really does know what he's talking about, and he has a great way of telling you.We got a little insight into everything the infamous area has to offer, as well as a bit of general stuff about the city. We even came away with some recommendations and discounts for local restaurants/bars, and they turned out to be great.Great stuff, thanks Mark.

Great old city walking tour. Mark Law is a long time Amsterdam local who not only knows his way around the most interesting parts of the city but knows how to pace his walk and tell informative yet very entertaining stories about it. We went well over our scheduled three hour tour and learned a great deal about history, culture, biking and where to get the best ever chocolate cookies. The group of 11 was a good size. I would recommend booking this tour early in you stay; it will help orient you to the rest of your itinerary. And book ahead, because the schedule fills up fast.

Highly Recommended.. Lealu was an excellent guide, very attentive and professional. She was also very entertaining and funny. I would strongly recommend you do this tour! Communication from booking was perfect and we were sad to leave Lealu afterwards.

Excellent tour of RLD. If frank talk about prostitutes, sex, sex toys, sex shows, sexual politics and the ilk offend you...then you do NOT want to schedule an RDL tour. However, if you are intrigued by what has made the Red Light District tick all these years and learn about the life and even the motivation of the prostitutes who pose in the windows, then you are cheating yourself if you go to Amsterdam and don't take this tour. I have never taken a tour before...I've always scoffed at the hoards of tourists following a tour guide holding a plastic flower above the crowd. I figured I could always pick up a book, google a question and learn on my own. But the kind of info Mark can share with you is one of a kind. Many others have gone into detail about Mark and the info he can share and they're all correct. I enjoyed his tour because he was able to share some intense and sometimes shocking information with a light touch and a sense of humor that made us all relax and enjoy the stories without judgement. The respect and admiration Mark has for the RLD and the women who work there shines through. My bf and I came out of the experience feeling much richer with information and appreciation for a unique neighborhood. I can say in this instance, it was well worth paying for the tour. Heck, you might even get a "door prize". I did! Thanks to you, Mark, for taking us thru the RDL on a terribly rainy Friday night in early September! Hope your dental emergency was taken care of easily!

Great walking tour. My friend and I did the City Tour with Mark today. Despite pretty awful weather we had a great time. Mark was very helpful and totally willing to answer all questions. The tour went for even longer than advertised and included taking us to a number of spots to sample different local food. Highly recommend

Great tour. This was a great 3 hour tour of the city with a small group of 9 people. We learnt lots about the history and it was a fantastic way to start our holiday. Our only regret is that we didn't book the red light district tour for the following day. I will definitely book this on our next visit.

Great city tour with Benjamin. Had a great tour with Benjamin, really made us all laugh, very knowledgeable and engaging and learnt a lot about Amsterdam. Benjamin has a real love of the city and puts an amusing spin on it all. Money very well spent on the tour.
Fantastic insight into a beautiful city. Ben was a fantastic guide and in 3 hours conveyed so much about the city, its history and how to enjoy it. Could not recommend it highly enough - thanks!

Great low key tours. We did the Red Light district tour with Mark then the CIty tour with Rob. Both were great: Mark with his well researched and often cheeky look at working life from the girls' perspectives and Rob with his gently-delivered but nicely detailed walking history tour. Much better than the run-of-the-mill big city tours.NIcole and Marcus

Excellent Tour!. Lealu was an excellent tour guide. Very knowledgeable, friendly, funny, and sweet. Well worth the money to see such an interesting part of Amsterdam's history. We had a great time, and we would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a walking tour of Amsterdam.

Great end to our Amsterdam stay. I booked this walking tour after reading the reviews of other travellers . We were not disappointed. Mark has in depth knowledge of a city he obviously loves living in. He shows you his Amsterdam. The beauty of it is the groups are very small. We passed many large free tours on route. He took us to savour the best French fries in town followed by the most delectable chocolate cookies. I shall recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Highly recommended. He also has an in depth website with recommendations aplenty.

Super tour, great value, great tour guide . I can't say enough good things about Mark and his tour. I had been burned in Paris by not following the Trip advisor ratings so when I got the Amsterdam I went with the ratings. I was so pleased with the tour which was already rated number one on trip advisor. Mark was great. I booked the tour on the phone speaking directly to Mark. We met the small group of 11 at the appointed time and began a walking tour of old town Amsterdam. Mark was a wealth of information on the history of Amsterdam, current culture, and the mindset of the people. We walked the red light district, the old town, and learned about the canals, the people, the monarchy and the culture of Amsterdam. He answered any questions and pointed us in the right direction for cafes, bars, coffee shops, or restaurants. Excellent job. Well worth the price.

When you arrive in Amsterdam, do this tour first. We did the City Tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. Mark manages to present an incredible amount of information in an interesting and entertaining way. Having done many tours in different cities, this would have to be at the top of our list. Mark is passionate about Amsterdam and, besides the historical information, he provides excellent tips on avoiding the tourist traps.

Fun, Informative and Great Sights. Benjamin was an excellent guide which was conducted in English. We learnt a lot about the history of Amsterdam and saw some sights you would not find easily such as the Begijnhof. There were some great stories from Benjamin about the holocaust and the response by the local community. There were some lighthearted jokes about the English too! It was quite leisurely with a break. Thoroughly recommend.

Walking tour with lots of interesting facts of amsterdam. This was not our first walking tour in Amsterdam, but our third and will still learned a lot of interesting details as well as a general overview of the city's history. Rob was super nice and we had a great time :-)
Great Red Light District Tour!. Mark was a wonderful tour guide - entertaining, informative, and humorous. I really enjoyed the experience and would recommend it to friends and family.

Mark is a terrific guide....mixed fun facts with great history. We arrived at our hotel, 5 minutes before the scheduled tour....and made it! Mark provided a great introduction in his walking tour to Amsterdam and his groups of 10 are the perfect size.

Best guide you can get!. Our flight out of the states was delayed six hours, so we got to our hotel right as the tour was starting, and were an hour late to the start of the tour(if not more). I called Mark and he was kind enough to set a meeting point halfway through the tour and tell us where to meet him. After the tour, he even sat with us while we had a pint, and told us other good areas of Amsterdam to go too. He was spot on. Highly recommend.

Insightful tour of Redlight District. Our family of three, particularly my college age daughter, enjoyed the Redlight District Tour with Mark tremendously. Mark provided a lot of insight on what life is like as a professional working the Windows based on his personal relationships. He also showed a lot of respect for the women working there and presented his views on why a controlled environment is better than driving that business underground. So the tour was fun, informational and has a human side to it.

Funny, Informative, Fun.... I attended the Red Light District tour with Lealu. Just as advertised, she was entertaining, very funny, and very informed. It's obvious she's done her research, not just throwing out random facts one can look up on Wikipedia. And simply stated, she's a riot, very funny and genuine. Highly recommend!

Funny tour guide with intimate knowledge. . I think with a topic such as this, that the guide having a real insider knowledge about the topic really makes a difference, as opposed to a tour guide who is sensationalizing everything just to shock the customers. Mark is passionate about what he does, and that's because he knows the workers well. He lived near them for a long time and continues to interview them. They know him. So he talks about the topic with a passion that is very genuine, but also with a lot of caring for the workers themselves. It would be easy to dismiss them all as "whores" or assume they're all being held against their will since many would like to believe not many women would want to do this for work, but that would be incorrect. Mark's deep knowledge and sense of humor makes this a well spent two hours.

Wonderful tour of red light district !. Lealu was a fantastic guide on our wonderful tour of the district. She was so knowledgeable and respectful of the workers and their trade! I'll never hear the term "S & F" without thinking of her again.
I highly recommend this tour!

Fantastic start to several days in Amsterdam. I'd thoroughly recommend and to book early for when you first arrive. Rob was engaging, starts with seven minute history of Amsterdam before covering all parts and all aspects of life here past and present. Great start to time here as you get guided through loads of districts and get to know the route around town.Rob was informative, light-hearted, yet had an expert knowledge of Amsterdam's history and never stopped explaining stories and detailed information to us.The group is limited to 10/11 people which others have mentioned but makes for a very enjoyable 3 hours.

Even better than expected. This was fun. We took the Red Light District Tour in the evening and Mark was funny and warm. It wasn't sleazy; it was like talking with friends. I was so glad I wasn't part of one of those large groups tromping through. You can tell he's put a lot of thought into the sequencing of the tour, the stories he tells, the practical information he gives out, and how to do it all respectfully. It was a better tour than I expected. Mark was super upbeat, and he gave a great explanation of the history and the current issues with the sex industry in the city. Plus, there was a fun follow up email, and we got a discount card for various things. If you want to go to the red light district, I would do this tour. You can ask your questions, and have them answered, and have a lot of fun.

knowledgeable and passionate guide. Mark told us histories, anecdotes and jokes about the city, showed us where to eat, shop (with his discount card) and find further tours. It is a very enjoyable walk even in a rainy day. Highly recommend the City Tour for the first timers to Amsterdam.

Red Light District tour with interesting, funny, witty, informative Mark. Best tour/tour guide ever! The group is limited to 10 people maximum so it's an intimate, informal, engaging 2 hour walk. It was raining the night we took the tour, but Mark was so warm, witty, informative and caring that we hardly noticed the bad weather. Throughout the tour, it was very apparent that Mark clearly loves and knows Amsterdam. We also took the Amsterdam City Tour with the same guide. Could not have been more pleased! We were a bit wary about taking the tours because we had been in Amsterdam for the 2 previous days exploring on our own, however, we learned SO much and saw so many things with Mark that we never would have could have seen by ourselves! Now, we just want to be best friends with Mark. He is just that good. TAKE THIS TOUR!!!!

Amazing tour with Lealu!. We had such an amazing time on our Red Light District tour with Lealu! We stayed near the RLD and had walked through it 4-5 times already at all times of day and night, but hadn't noticed any of the things that she pointed out and explained to us. From the frat houses to Dirty Dicks to the banana and peep shows to tiny alleys - she illuminated so many areas of the neighborhood that we're glad we got to see (and learn more about) before we left town! She talked about the business with the utmost respect for the industry, and a great sense of humor. You can't visit Amsterdam without taking this tour!
Knowledgeable, funny, smart. Great guide. Only 10 people, got to ask questions, moved quickly and very informative. Take this tour. Lealu was terrific

Wonderful guide, fascinating tour. Mark is fabulous! My husband and I took the Red Light tour on a very rainy Monday night . Ordinarily I might think about departing early since the weather was so bad - but not with Mark. His tour is interesting and informative and fun. You truly sense his admiration and care for the women who work in the district. He tells you all about the safety measures and strict regulations - I certainly came away with a new, enlightened perspective. His tour feels very personal and warm. Don't hesitate for a second - a tour with Mark is the way to visit the Red Light district.

dam good interesting tour. Top shelf tour of Amsterdam guide was opinionated funny and knew the city. Toured parts of the city not normally scene by tourists. Great knowledge of history. Reasonably fee, saw great neighborhoods. Highly recommended especially for those that want an overview of the city and its different neighborhoods.

Great walking tour. I've been to Amsterdam a bunch of times but never had time to take a tour. Found this tour and I could not have been happier that I joined Lealu's tour. She lives in the neighborhood and has May interesting stories to share along with the history.

What a nice surpise. Lealu gave us the opportunity to find good reality and stories behind a lot of Taboo's thoughts in Red District . All our questions have found an answer with her, and we really enjoyed the tour every minute. Thank you Lealu.

Choose Mark for in-depth history of the city from the 16th century on.. We found Mark to be well-informed, smart, warm, and a pleasure to be with. Whether you are interested in the best gelato or diamond guilds, Mark has the inside scoop. He can talk with authority on Amsterdaam today or in the 16th century in ways that are both informative and entertaining. He even sent us articles and web pages after the tour! Wow! You won't go wrong by booking with him!!

Awesome red light district tour with Lealu. First booked this tour to cover some free time on Friday evening and not being seen as the creepy single guy walking through the red light district, but was more than pleasantly surprised. Lealu had great in depth knowledge about the area and we stopped at several places to understand a lot about history and development of the area, rather than just pointing out obvious bars and windows. The small group was another great surprise, as we watched other tours with 30+ people rolling through the small streets. I'd book it again in a heartbeat!

A Dam Good Guide. Mark is a real pro and he gives a very personal, insightful and fun tour. The group sizes are limited to 10 and the pace is perfect to get a real feel for the city, its history and inhabitants. The tour covers the early years, socio-economic influences, culture, language and traditions, while sauntering through alleyways and over canal bridges. If you're new to Amsterdam, or want to kickstart your knowledge of Amsterdam's rich history, this is a great place to start. Which other guide would actually say, "I've run over time but if you're in no hurry I'd like to show you more..."? We really enjoyed our afternoon!

Start your time in Amsterdam with Mark!. Mark is one of the best tour guides I have ever had! We were jet-lagged and tired when we arrived here and started with a tour of the red light district. Mark was engaging and compassionate when telling us stories of the women who work here. I really have a broader view of the situation of the openness of prostitution in Amsterdam. if I had just walked around with my husband, I would not have understood and would have felt the dehumanizing effect without understanding why the women choose to be sitting in windows here. he has done his research and talked to many women in this situation and is able to tell their stories. the next day we went on the city tour with Mark and enjoyed his stories of the coffee shops and the fascinating history of this city. He also gave us recommendations of places to go and gave us all the websites for further reading. Start your trip with Mark. Amsterdam is a confusing city to walk around in and you will get a local's perspective from an articulate and funny person who will feel like a friend in less than 10 minutes. Wear good walking shoes for the cobble stones. The walk was not strenuous and we stopped for a break midway through.

Phenomenal Tours with Mark!. My friend and I went on Mark's City Tour and Red Light District Tour last week, and they were both amazing! I am a tour guide myself, and I have a very high standard for guides, and Mark certainly exceeded that standard! He limits his groups to 10 people, which makes a huge difference, especially in the small alleys of Amsterdam. Unfortunately, it was raining during our tour, but he kept our attention until the very end. He offered us ponchos, introduced himself, gave a historical background, and then we were off. He struck the perfect tone of history, practical information, and what the city is like today. In the evening, luckily the rain had stopped, and we went on his evening tour, which is where he really shined. His friendships with some of the women who work in the Red Light District allowed us to see what goes on behind the scenes, and how the industry really works. It was fun, but also truly educational, and we left with a much deeper understanding of the sex work in Amsterdam. Our only regret was that we could not spend more time with Mark. Book Mark right away! He and his guides are the only way to see Amsterdam!

Red Light District tour with Lealu was great!. Seeing the number of positive reviews for (owner and founder) Mark, I was initially hesitant to select a different guide when his tour times were booked. I'm so glad we went ahead and booked a tour by Lealu, who is a resident of the Red Light District and brought a great personal touch to the information she relayed. I highly recommend both Lealu and the RLD tour, which was well-structured and covered a large array of topics.Lealu provided great information both about the history of the district as well as what actually "goes on" in the brothels and the various types of sex shows. She spoke about sex practices in a very relaxed and matter-of-fact manner that seemed to put everyone in our diverse group at ease, and made us feel free to ask whatever detailed questions were on our minds. Lealu has a playful sense of humor but at the same time was immensely respectful, both of the women whose work she was discussing as well as the individuals on the tour. She kept the perspective(s) of the sex workers front and center in the stories she recounted, which is not something that is easily gleaned from reading about the RLD in books and on the internet.Choosing the 7:00 pm tour time on a Saturday night was another happy accident. At this time of year, it meant that our 2-hour(plus) tour began in broad daylight, extended through twilight, and ended in the nighttime, and the constantly changing light highlighted different aspects of the surrounding architecture. Even more interesting to me was getting to observe the functional transition in the neighborhood throughout the tour as the prime hours for sex work began to approach. Walking around with the group in the beginning felt like sightseeing in almost any other tourist-y section of Amsterdam, albeit with sex-themed shops and signs in greater abundance, but very little going on in the windows. As the tour progressed, we began to see a steady stream of women arriving to begin their evening shifts in the windows. For me, watching the women arrive in their street clothes, smiling and chit-chatting with their neighbors as they crossed the thresholds into their rooms, was one of the most interesting and unexpectedly compelling aspects of the tour. By the end of the evening, the vast majority of the windows were occupied and the women (literally) geared up for business. In short, the tour was both educational and fun. The phenomenon of sex work is a complicated topic that cannot itself be adequately covered during a single tour, but Lealu's discussion of its practice in the RLD will make me think about it in new ways going forward.

Terrific overview for our first day in Amsterdam!. Can't say enough good things about our tour and the four of us were very happy that it lived up to all of the reviews we read before we booked. We were in a small group of 9 and the tour was amusing, informative, interesting, and well paced. Everything we were looking for! Also, the follow up emails covered everything we were promised. Highly recommended!

Insider's View of a Unique City. While spending a weekend in Amsterdam, my wife and I chose That Dam Guide to give us a look at the old part of the city. Mark is a long-time resident of the city, who escorted our small group of ten people for three plus hours of exploration in the city. Our tour started near the old Stock Exchange, led through some of the oldest parts of the city, passed through the red light district, and then crossed over to the other side of the central Dam to explore the 'middle class' and 'working class' neighborhoods built in the 1700's. Mark has a wealth of information on the city, its history, and for those interested, how things work today. We had a couple of folks interested in how coffee shops work, and there was more than one question about the red light district. Mark is a pleasant and intelligent man, who can tell an excellent story while leading his groups through the streets. After the tour, he made himself available for more questions, provided advice about other tours (especially the canal boat tours), and about the best places to visit, eat, and avoid.I recommend this tour for any adult, and for kids who are worldly enough to handle the red light and coffee shop stories. Nothing is X- (or even R-) rated, but the content is necessary in order to understand this extremely liberal city.

A different kind of walking tour, highly recommend!. I went on this tour with my partner in early August, after reading great reviews on Trip Advisor. We have been on one or two walking tours of Amsterdam before, having visited the city 4 or 5 times, so we wanted to do something different. We did the Red Light Walking Tour, and I can honestly say I learned so much! Mark was a really great guide and it was so interesting to hear the different perspectives of the sex workers he has gotten know over the past few years. It really opened my eyes and made me think differently about the RLD and sex workers in general. Also, the information Mark sent via email after the tour was really interesting and just added depth to the experience that other walking tours just can't match. We also visited the pizza place Mark recommended, got a discount with his card and had a great meal! All in all, a great experience and would highly recommend to anyone who is curious and open minded!

Great insight into the city of freedom - Amsterdam. I was in Amsterdam on my own for a couple of days this month and after looking up on a number of walking/cycling tours I booked the RLD tour with Mark's The Dam Guide. Having done a few of these tours in Europe I feel I am in a good place to evaluate a tour of this kind and by virtue of that I would rate Mark's tour very highly on the following grounds - First, the tour was not over crowed and was interactive and Mark went at a perfect pace when describing the nitty gritty of the city. Secondly, Mark is passionate about the city and his subject which helped me relate to the socio-economic issues of the city. Thirdly, Mark had a great sense of humour and he was very animated which I enjoyed quite a bit. Finally, the tour is very fairly priced and the logistical issues were managed to perfection. Overall it felt very real and not a boring history lesson. I would highly recommend this tour.

Best Walking Tour -- An Absolute Must!. Upon visiting Amsterdam for the first time, it is always hard to find a balance between sight seeing and simply exploring -- until you meet Mark, that is! I was blown away by the vast swath of his knowledge both historic and modern in regards to the city's history, culture and fine arts. My only regret was that we were unable to make it to the Red Light District tour, which I hear is even more fabulous (if there can be such a thing). He purposely keeps his group under 10, which truly enhances the experience. We had other tourist walking tours stroll past us, and it was horrible to see so many people trying to wedge together to hear what their guy was saying. Thankfully, we did not have that problem, and I could not recommend the tour enough!

a most informative and enjoyable afternoon. Mark offered the ten people in his City tour this afternoon a great mix of entertainment and education. He has a unique perspective on Amsterdam as an ex-patriot who loves the city and has learned a great deal about it and who wants those on his tours to leave knowing more about what makes the city tick. Make sure that you book in advance, because Mark limits his tours to small group. One of the best tour guides that I have experienced.

A Great Way to Spend an Afternoon. I thoroughly enjoyed the Amsterdam City Tour with Mark. He comes across as incredibly passionate and knowledgable about what he does and loves sharing the history, fun and all the nooks and crannies of Amsterdam you might otherwise miss. It was great that the group is limited to 10 people so he can tailor his delivery to each group, it's easy to hear everything he has to say and you all feel inclusive. I would highly recommend any of Mark's tours.

Totally enjoyed the Tour given by Mark. Mark knocked the ball out of the ballpark when he gave to our group a tour ofthe old part of Amsterdam. He engaged with all of his guests and took the timeto answer every question that came his way with patience and gave when it wascalled for the genesis of the building or structure that he was telling us about. Informative, down to earth ..... Also, ask him about the cow we saw...a first.Vince Debow

Fantastic!. If you go to Amsterdam you must book this tour. Rob was a fantastic guide, a host of information, extremely witty and friendly. As other people have said, a lot of tour groups were large, but with this one being only around 10 people, it is much better and you don't feel lost among the crowds.In just 3 hours you will learn so much about the city all delivered in a fun and informative way. You are taken to places that seem hidden from view, you would just walk past them otherwise.Highly recommend That Dam Guide, you guys are doing a great job!

Tour with extraordinary information add-on. The tour was consisting of just about 10 people. This was helping to stick together, move around quickly and get all explanations of Mark in a clear way.The information itself was not just a plain mentioning of facts but Mark managed to transfer his opinion about what is currently going on in the red light district. Important to mention: We didn't get the feeling of being somehow brainwashed, it was just very enlightening to get a perspective on the whole business apart from the stories transferred via news and media in the common way.After the tour we have received an informative mail with some additional information based on what was mentioned by Mark during the tour.Big recommendation to everybody who wants to be motivated to make his own opinion about what is going on in the red light district and not just walk around.

Best walking tour ever. Rob was a fantastic guide. The group was only 11 people whereas other groups seemed to be about 30 people. Our walking tour took in many aspects of Amsterdam The Red Light District,the Main Sights and the Historical. Rob explained how Amsterdam has been slowly built and is continuing to be built. He explained about the buildings and the canals. He was really fun and gave us the lighter side as well as the serious. Rob answered all our questions and had a lot of knowledge..I would highly recommend this tour for any visitors to Amsterdam. It was both fun and informative.

Best Tour Guide!. This is the absolute best tour of the red light district! While looking at tours before we left I came across Mark on tripadvisor and the reviews were great. After doing the tour I can say this was without a doubt the best tour we did during our whole 2 weeks in Europe. I did not really know what to expect from a red light district tour but this was the perfect combination of humor and information. Mark is so well informed on this area. He also takes smaller groups so you can ask questions and not get lost in the crowd. I saw other tour groups in the area while we were there and from just a brief observation I could tell it was no where near as good as Mark's tour. My friends that took the tour with me had nothing but good things to say. He has a deep respect for this area and women that work here. Even if you do not necessarily agree with the red light district I would recommend this tour to educate yourself.

Tasteful and informative. I and my teenage children were part of a group of 9. Mark gave us an excellent and informative 2-hour tour of Amsterdam's Red Light District. He included interesting information on the history of the RLD, and various related political issues, keeping things light and amusing with his own brand of humour and little anecdotes and stories. His tour is very well researched and we felt we were getting the facts. We are only sorry that the city tour offered by the same organisation was sold out for the duration of our stay. Highly recommended.

Fantastic. Benjamin was the most entertaining tour guide that I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. His tour helped us get our bearings in Amsterdam so we could explore the city during the rest of our trip. We enjoyed his company so much so, that he almost came and visited Ghent, Belgium, with us. Couldn't have asked for more.

Great tour!!. We did the city tour today with Mark and inspite of bad weather it was very enjoyable! After a short and interesting historical overview he walked us through this beautiful city telling amazing, some funny some critical stories. Very recomendable - also because of the small size of the group (limited to 10 persons)

Funny and informative tour. I'm not normally a touring type, but this one was well worth it. Mark limits his groups to 10 people, which ensures that you can hear what he's saying and lets him tailor his stories to each group. The stories are historical and cultural in content, and pretty hilarious too. I especially liked that he tailored his stories to relate to us. He also has lots of helpful recommendations about restaurants, cafes (with coffee), coffee shops (with more than coffee if you know what I mean), and anything else you might visit Amsterdam for. Obviously, if you're visiting Amsterdam don't expect everything to be PG, including this tour :) Have fun!

Fun and informative. Chose the RLD tour for myself and 2 friends. Mark was our guide and we had a great time. I booked the tour without telling my friends as walking tours is not their thing!, but they thoroughly enjoyed it. Highly recommend this to anyone. We also visited the pizza place which was recommended and used the discount card Mark gave us- delicious.

Best Tour Ever. Having a week-long trip, my family decided a guided tour on our first full day in Amsterdam would be the best way to get our bearings, and we got far more than we bargained for! We met Benjamin in Dam Square in the morning and he guided us through the city while giving us one of the best history lessons I've ever experienced in such a short period of time. He is SO full of knowledge and has a such a wonderfully charming disposition that it felt as if we were just going for a stroll with an old friend. The tour was incredibly comprehensive and at the end of it I found myself more comfortable roaming around and exploring on my own. From The Jordaan District through the 9 Streets, Dam Square, the VOC and the Red Light District, Benjamin will tell you the background of all of it and you can tell that he truly enjoys sharing his abundance of knowledge. If you're taking a trip to Amsterdam and you want a great way to get to know the city, Benjamin is your guy!

Highlight of the Trip!. Benjamin's tour of Amsterdam was probably the highlight of our week in Amsterdam. We experienced the history of the city in a way that everyone in our group enjoyed- with great humor and insight into how the Dutch think. He was absolutely hysterical. He also has a clear view of how the Dutch have influenced the world over the centuries, but was able to present his tour in a way that non-history buffs could enjoy as well. He also shared the best of Dutch food with us and gave us opportunities to purchase edibles along the way. THE BEST DAY OF OUR TRIP.

Amazing historical and actual facts of RLD. That Dam Tour Guide is adorable, has a good sense of humor and knows tons about the Red Light! During our 3h tour, he told us not only about the history of RLD, but also some context of the current situation of the professionals working in the area. I totally recommend the tour for all types of public.

Fab!. Went to the City Tour. Upon arrival mark was friendly and inviting. We went towards the end of our trip due to sell out tours all week, however Marks tour was worth every cent. We learnt so much in 3 hours and would recommend it to anyone. Book in advance though as this tour is very popular!

Helpful Guide and Great RLD Tour. I booked this tour over the Internet, and from the get-go, Mark was helpful regarding setting up our evening activities. He helped us reserve a table for dinner at a wonderful restaurant and also was instrumental in a photo opportunity. And then, when we met, he continued to share his wealth of information regarding the RLD, its current challenges, and the sex workers.

Red Light district tour. Very informative, interesting tour with a bit of a provactive edge. It was great having someone who was very familiar with the district and workers explain the social issues and politics while at the same time spicing it up with details about the whole red light experience. Would highly recommend Mark as a tour guide!

Rood Licht Wonderful Tour. First night in Amsterdam (8th August) and we're off on a tour of the RLD with Lealu.There's a pretty eclectic mix of people & nationalities in the group, as we head off to the first place of interest. From start to finish this tour does not disappoint! It's eye opening, it may perhaps blow out the water some of your preconceptions or supposed myths. Lealu was incredibly knowledgeable and therefore informative. She was occasionally a little mischievous and all the way through very witty (which we certainly enjoyed!)The RLD is a contradiction of many kinds and all the more fascinating because of that! We saw numerous other tours of upwards of 25 people, with a tour organised by That Dam Guide you'll be part of a group of 10, which was absolutely perfect! Having read several other reviews it's very clear that all the guides actually connect with the place, Lealu actually mentioned that one of the people that is involved in a show in the RLD also attends her yoga class!Hopefully I'll return to Amsterdam in the future and will not hesitate in booking one of their other tours!Highly recommended!!

Dam Guide was Dam Good. Right off the bat, first thing I liked was that while being five minutes late to the meeting point, we still saw Mark standing there smiling with the rest of the group. He was great about making sure we all were able to see and really hear him speak through the noisy areas. We did the Red Light Tour at night, and I felt completely safe with Mark as our guide. He had great tips for those intrested in pursuing the windows ;) but he also made sure to throw in enough information about the politics and economics behind the scenes. A solid 360* when it comes to the RLD Tour.Also: During our stay Mark was fully booked up for the next few weeks(rightfully so) and so I had emailed him asking to please let me know if any spots open up. Thankfully a couple days later I received an email from Mark saying that there was two openings for the next day. Great communicator, and hella glad we were able to take this tour.

City walking tour. What a great tour! Learned so much! Felt like we were walking with a close friend. Wish we could have done the Red Light tour too. Mark's tours fill up fast so don't delay. A highlight of our visit. Great recommendations too for dining etc. Highly recommend you take his tours and not the ones with 30 or more guests.

Red Light District Tour - Very informative and interesting!. The size of the tour was 10 (max) which was great - because Mark could tell us everything and follow up questions could be asked easily.One thing special about this tour was that Mark wasn't those average guides who would only show you the main tourist spots and tell you the info which you could get from Wikipedia. He would really share his knowledge and insights with you and how he was personally connected with the place.Thank you Mark for showing the interesting side of RLD (which I couldn't get from books/online!).

Fantastic tour guide. Thank you. We thoroughly enjoyed your 3 hour tour of Amsterdam yesterday. Great tour guide with tons of information, small groups, very passionate to give you a real Amsterdam experience.

City tour and RLD tour. We took both the tours and trust me when I say, even 'Amazing' would be an understatement. Mark has a great sense of humor and he uses it very well to tell you about the place. Not a word seemed boring in both the tours. The best thing is that he restricts his group to a maximum of 10 so that he can maintain a personal touch.It was absolute fun. Its a must for anyone and everyone.Cheers Mark if you are reading this!!

Red Light District Tour. Mark did a fabulous job with his tour tonight. We had ten people (his max), and everyone could hear what he said and keep up with the others--no lagging behind. Mark has a wealth of information gleaned personally by talking to many of the sex workers here in Amsterdam. He truly cares about their safety and their welfare, and he is very knowledgeable about the area. Very highly recommended!!

Red Light District Tour with That Dam Guide. Of all the places and things we did while in Amsterdam, the Red Light District Tour with That Dam Guide was one of the most enjoyable and educational experiences. Mark has more insider knowledge about the area, its history, and its future than most people you'd find anywhere. He entertains while he educates and once it's over, we walked away with a finer appreciation of the scene. For the price, it's a real bargain and most worth-the-while! Highly recommended!!!
Red light Tour- Amazing. What a brilliant and informative tour. This is a must! Book with Mark he's a great guide who makes it fun but interesting!

Very Informative and funny!. It was mine and my husband's first visit to Amsterdam and we wanted to visit the red light but were unsure where to start so we booked a tour with Mark. He was very funny and had a genuine insight into the area, having lived there and he knows some of the girls, this meant we found out what it was really like and he told us stories from his own experiences. Must do in Amsterdam!

An excellent tour. A friendly tour guide with a great knowledge and understanding of Amsterdam, its history, and its neighborhoods. He also had plenty of tips about great places to eat and visit in Amsterdam. Highly recommended.

I learned some and it was fun.. Everybody arrived a few minutes early and we started right away. Our route was dogged - by trucks, a mini-bulldozer, church bells and even a fellow playing bagpipes - just about every time Mark stopped to speak, but he took it with good humour. Plenty of suggestions about dining and a brief history of Amsterdam and some of the neighbourhoods. Thank you Mark!

Wonderful introduction to Amsterdam. My husband and I booked the City Tour with Mark for our first day in Amsterdam on Saturday July 11th. To be honest, what sold me on That Dam Guide was the website associated with the tours that includes many recommendations for where to eat, drink and other things (check it out!). The small size of the group impressed me, only about 12 people in total. This allowed for a much more personal experience, giving Mark lots of opportunity to answer individual questions. We hit all of the highlights, like Dam Square and the Red Light District, but I really did feel like we got a proper overview of some of the relevant history of the city, where to go and what to see. The 20 euros is worth it not to have to battle with a sea of other tourists in one of the "free city walking tours" that are everywhere. Thanks for a great introduction to Amsterdam Mark!

Walking Tour of Amsterdam was great!. Mark was out this week, so had Rob give the tour. He did an excellent job, was very knowledgable and presented both the historical and present-day views in a way that was both informative and entertaining. We covered a lot of ground. Lots of walking, so be sure you've got the right shoes. Really glad I booked this tour and recommend it to anyone looking for a nice way to see Amsterdam in one afternoon
Great Guide. First time to Amsterdam, and decided to do a tour, and glad that I did. Mark is full of great information about the area, and gives a very informative, and entertaining tour.

Fun and informative tour. The tour ran even longer than advertised. Mark is very passionate about Amsterdam, it's history and culture. We learned much about where the best places to visit are. The group is intimate enough that hearing the interesting commentary and insights is a breeze.Mark kept the day humorous and I am sure that all on the tour enjoyed it immensely.
Nice insiders view of city!. Mark did a great job and was quite entertaining! I would def recommend! I learned a lot as this was my first trip to Amsterdam and got a few questions answered as well!

Can't miss experience!. My husband and I booked Mark's tours a few months in advance of our travels and we couldn't have been happier or more grateful that we did. We started with the Red Light District tour on Thursday night and also did the City tour the following morning. Mark is an awesome and dynamic guide who incorporates history, fun stories and local flare throughout his tour. The RLD tour was absolutely fascinating, especially given Mark's personal history with the area. Mark provided lots of factual and practical information which proved to be very helpful especially if you wanted to take advantage of some of the fun things the district has to offer later at night. The next day's City tour provided a much broader overview of the city and its history. With fun anecdotes woven throughout, I'm so glad that we opted to sign up for both tours (especially as there was very minimal overlap between the two). Mark truly provides the full experience and I relied heavily on his website and, specifically, food recommendations. My husband joked, "You only frequent the places Mark suggests, don't you?" But it's so true! They were all excellent (Cote Ouest before our RLD tour - we actually bumped into Mark there as well!, the rijstaffel at Restaurant Max was one of the best meals we've ever had, the Pancake Bakery, Da Portate Via for pizza, Winkel 43 for apple tart, sugar 'N ice for waffles and cheese tasting at Reypenaer).It is apparent that Mark wants every single person on his tour to experience Amsterdam to its fullest and he truly tries to facilitate that as much as he can! I can't recommend him as a tour guide enough!!

A must-do for any visitor to Amsterdam . Rob was very knowledgable of the history of the city and kept everyone entertained; very personable with an excellent sense of humor. He knew the ins and outs of the city, and answered everyone's questions. I highly recommend you take his tour.

'A must!'. We did the morning tour with Rob. A most informative fun tour which Rob made so interesting. A great way to learn about Amsterdam and the history of this beautiful city. We would highly recommend this tour.

Both tours were fun and informative!. We took the both the City Tour and the Red Light District Tour with Mark on 2 successive days and in between went to several of his restaurant suggestions (which were fab!). Both of the tours were incredibly interesting and very informative...exposing us to insights of Amsterdam you can't get in any tour book. He's appropriately humorous and upbeat...and great fun to be around, like having a very knowledgeable friend show you around. The small group (10) made it easy to ask questions and get to know others on the tour, who were from all over. We saw quite a few of the "free tours" around and we were so glad we weren't one of those huge groups...I have no idea how anyone can hear anything! Be sure to book in advance because several in our City tour wanted to book the RLD tour for the next day and he was sold out. I Highly recommend That Dam Guide for touring Amsterdam.

Top guide, highly recommended.. Marc is an excellent guide, very funny at times and gives a lot of context on why Amsterdam is the way it is today, which I really enjoyed. Well worth the money and I would take the Red Light tour next time too.

Well worth it!. We went on the city tour with Rob and he was great, so informative and just great to chat to.The tour went for 3 hours with a short toilet and drink break.The groups are kept to a small size which is really good as no one gets left behind and you can hear everything thats said.We will be doing the red light district tour tonight with the same company just a different guide, I will post a review on that later.

The best place in Amsterdam besides food !!. We have learnt the history and evolution of RLD. We have seen the girls in action. We know the do and don't. We visited the condom shop and sex inducing products which we have never imagined. And all these are possible from The Dam Guide... Mark Law! Highly recommended.

Top marks for enthusiasm. Mark is a fabulous guide. He is very knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam and communicates this in a fun and enthusiastic way. I highly recommend Mark as a tour guide!
Great tour with Rob!!. It was really great tour by our friendly guide Rob, lot of information and details to learn with short story of each detail that makes the tour also fun.
Wonderful tour of Amsterdam. Thank you to Mark for an informative and entertaining walking tour! We enjoyed learning about your interesting and beautiful city. An enriching and fun afternoon.
A great beginning to a wonderful visit in Amsterdam. Fun! Informative and interesting. Well worth the time and $. Our group was diverse and everyone enjoyed it.

Entertaining and Informational. We were very happy that we booked the tour. It was a lot of fun but very informational at the same time. Mark was very approachable before and after booking. He was quick to answer our questions and had some great tips. We recommend this tour to people that are unfamiliar with Amsterdam. If you plan to stay for several days you should definitely take this tour first.

A Dam Good Guide for a Must-See Neighborhood!. First of all, the Red-Light District has got to be right up there on the "Must-See" sites when traveling to Amsterdam. And touring it with a knowledgeable guide is essential (unless of course all you want to get out of it is the shock value). Mark is not only knowledgeable, but he's witty and interesting, and has a real passion for the neighborhood, its history, politics, and people -- mostly the women -- who keep it so vibrant and alive. His stories, many from first-person interviews and his own friendships and neighborhood interactions, helps personalize the experience. You will come away from his small (about 10 people) and lively tour, with a deeper understanding and appreciation of this colorful and intriguing historic neighborhood. Loved the tour and the Red Light District...thank you, Mark!

Great and informative tour! (Red light) . Lealu was our guide for the tour, and she did a great job. She is a true local, chatty, fun and knows what's worth telling on a tour. This tour isn't a tour simply for those who love sex and drugs in a tacky wrapping, but is also interesting for those who want know more about what Red Light is about.

Two MUST-DO Tours in Amsterdam. We recently spent a week in Amsterdam and took both the Walking Tour and the Red Light Tour with Mark. We loved both tours.Mark is a historian, and we loved hearing about the history of Amsterdam and learning more about the city. He limits the tour to only 10 people, so there is plenty of time for questions, private conversations with him, etc.The Red Light Tour was of particular intrigue for us. We have never seen anything like the Red Light district, and wanted to better understand how it worked, the background of the women, the culture, etc. Mark has actually interviewed different women in the red light district and was able to give us real stories during the tour.I highly recommend both tours!

Great experience!!. We did the Red Light District Tour with Marc a few days ago and it was maybe one of the best things to do in Amsterdam! We had a great time with lots of information and insider storys so that we just can recommend it to everyone!Thanks Marc, it was great!
Super Tour. We did the city tour with mark. we enjoyed it very much. it was authentic and very interesting. the booking was very easy and we felt very comfy with him. thanks mark for the great time!!

Reason for being #1. I left this tour feeling so pleased about how genuine Mark was. I didn't even walk away thinking "money well spent" because it did not feel like a tour where facts were being rambled off left, right and centre like the others I saw along the way. Thanks for a great tour Mark! I hope you continue to stay at number 1 because you and your tour deserve it!

A true delight. Right from the get-go you know you will have a good time with Mark. How could you not with a man who wears an orange pompom on his head. However, not only was the tour fun, it was full of information. Mark knows Amsterdam and is eager to share bits of information that only a resident could provide. We were a diverse group of five adults and we were all extremely happy with this tour. We had just come off of a Rhine river cruise with many tours and the consensus was Mark was the best. Highly recommended.

An Intimate Experience. Much like most big cities, Amsterdam has a variety of tour options. You will not be disappointed with "That Dam Guide" and Mark himself.The tour, ours being a Red Light District Tour, was more intimate (pardon the pun).Mark provided unique insight into the sex industry in Amsterdam. His views, information, and stories about the RLD, brothels, and prostitution, were eye opening, entertaining, and made you feel something about the area.We left with many questions beyond the very in depth look Mark gave us to the area, and luckily, Mark invited us to a local microbrew after where we were able to get the answers to all of our wonderings.It was an intimate experience all around. Don't choose a larger "free" tour while in Amsterdam, choose That Dam Guide. We've done many walking tours across the globe, and this one sits among the best.

#1 . A massive thanks is due to Mark for making our last day in Amsterdam so memorable. We wished we had joined a tour at the start of our trip to make the most of all the fantastic tips and suggestions Mark gives along the way. We're already planning a return trip..! Mark is so informed, funny, friendly and above all, really passionate about his job. We felt he really personalised our tour to our needs and interests and would highly recommend either of his tours to anyone visiting this beautiful city. Thanks again Mark! :)

Friendly, frank and fresh. We were part of a small group (8?) of people who didn't know each other and we were about to go into the red light district t together! Mark made us all feel welcome as he took us around the streets. He was respectful, knowledgable and hilarious. The tour was a great way to start our time in Amsterdam and Mark settled us in quickly. I can't rate him highly enough!

Informative Walking Tour of Amsterdam. My friend and I joined Mark on a walking tour of Amsterdam recently. Mark is very knowledgeable about the city and it's history and shares his info in an informative, and contextual manner. We both learned a great deal, and we were able to appreciate Amsterdam in a new way as a result of his tour. I highly recommend him.

Dam Good Guide. I found Mark's tour on Tripadvisor for our group of 5 and have to agree with all the excellent reviews. We did the city tour, and one of the reasons I chose his tour is because he limits his tours to 10 people. He wears his silly hat for the entire tour so it is easy to spot him and follow along if parts of the city are crowded. Mark has an excellent knowledge of Amsterdam and shares it easily. He is funny and makes the tour fun! I especially appreciated all his tips and suggestions as to where to eat and what to do after his tour for the remainder of our time in Amsterdam.

The way to GO!. I chose Mark's tour because he was rated #1 on TripAdvisor, and there is a GOOD reason why. We took the city tour, which ended up being nearly 3.5 hours of history, fascinating behind-the-scenes facts, gorgeous scenery, and helpful hints regarding food, drink, hot spots, shopping, etc...I feel like there is no better way to get an overview of such a fascinating city. Intimate sized group and tons of info. Mark went over on time and STILL stayed afterwards to help answer any further questions, recommend further points of interest, or point people in directions they wanted to go. His love for this city and dedication to his customers is unmatched!My only tips - wear comfy walking shoes, and bring snacks! The tour went from 10:30 to nearly 2pm. There was a stop along the way for drinks and snacks, but I was pretty famished by the end of the tour!

Don't Miss a Tour with Mark!. My friend and I travelled to Amsterdam for the first time. We did the city tour and we were lucky to have Mark as our guide. My friend and I, both in our early 30s, were joined by two families with young children and another solo traveler. Mark found a way to make us all laugh, and teach us many interesting facts about Amsterdam's history and culture. He tailored the tour based on our collective interests, even taking us to his favorites fries place, and chocolate cookie shop, after my friend and I mentioned our interest in sampling some great food spots. Mark's love of Amsterdam is apparent and a tour with him is not be missed.

RLD Tour. We had a great time with our guide, Mark, on our Red Light Tour. He was very knowledgeable about the history of the area and gave us great info on what to expect (and avoid). Mark obviously loves the city and it shows with his enthusiasm.

Incredibly Entertaining. Mark obviously knows, loves, and cares about the Red Light District. I found this tour by looking on trip advisor, so I'm writing this as my way of giving back to fellow trip advisor readers. (First time reviewer right here!). It is very easy to understand why Mark has gotten such great reviews from everyone.My husband and I did the Red Light tour. We are in our twenties and there were others in our group that looked to be in their 60s. That tells you the variety of people on this tour. I'm pretty sure at one point or another everyone literally laughed out loud. Mark has first hand accounts about tons of stops on the tour. He cheekily chalks it up to tour guide research. What really came across is how much he cares about the industry. My husband and I discussed that afterwards. He limites his tours to ten people not just for the enjoyment of those on the tours, but so he is not obtrusive to women who are trying to make their living. We saw other large tour groups gawking and blocking the streets and I was glad that I was not part of them.I learned far more about the policitcal climate than I thought I would. All that information was interspersed with humorous stories. I truly learned something today and that made the experience worth it ten times over.We even took Mark's advice and went to Da Portare Via afterwards for amazing pizza at a discount thanks to Mark's card!It would have been a much different experience if we decided to just explore the Red Light District on our own. Do yourself a favor and book Mark's tour. And book it fast! We wanted to do his City Tour, but it was already booked up and that was about a month ago!

That Dam Guide. We had a great tour with Mark. The group is small, and he attempts to answer all questions that he is asked. He covers a wide range of items and topics on the tour; history, art, architecture, recent and historic politics, history of vice in the area, local culture, and local recommendations of various shops and restaurants. I would recommend taking this tour when you arrive. He will give a great and fun crash course in Amsterdam.

I came to Amsterdam with my 16 yr old son and 15 yr old daughter.... We decided on Mark because he is #1 rated here. I can tell you for sure that #1 rating is well deserved. Mark is a fantastic tour guide. I would and do recommend him highly. The whole family enjoyed it immensely.

Fun and informative!. Had a great time with Mark and a small group touring the Red Light District. Very informative and insightful. Mark is great and has many stories to tell. Felt at ease and comfortable. Would definitely recommend his tour.

This is your guy!. Mark was wonderful. Not the same old boring stories and facts. He was fun and interesting. He was also very accommodating, he gave us choices if we wanted to detour to see other things. We had a bite of free cheese and stopped at a cute local coffee shop for a break. He also gave us real suggestions for places to eat. We ended at a local Saturday market which was nice and he showed us the best apple pie in all of Amsterdam and it was! Thanks Mark for a great tour.

GREAT OUTING. My wife and (adult) daughter and I went on the City Tour with Mark. Mark is quite intelligent, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and fun. It is clear he loves what he does. He loves Amsterdam and he loves people. One thing that I truly appreciated about the tour is that he doesn't try to steer you to buy things in places with which he works (like so many tours do). I would strongly recommend his tour for your first "stop" in Amsterdam.

Great tour, very witty guide. Went with Mark on his City tour and had a great time. He was knowledgeable about all the history of Amsterdam and imparted so much more than what one would read in a history book. He told us historical facts about Amsterdam that just made the city come alive. My 14 year old boys as well as my husband and I all enjoyed talking to and listening to Mark. He gave us some great ideas for other things to do with the kids and was spot on as they both enjoyed a Microbe exhibit he told us to go to since we were going to be in the area of the Zoo. He recommended some great restaurants and snack places all of which have been delicious. We whole heartedly recommend a tour with Marc as I'm sure a good time will be had by all.
Amazing. Informative funny enthusiastic great Red Light district tour with Mark really knows how to give a great tour.

You MUST tour with Mark while in Amsterdam!. Mark was simply an incredible tour guide. His knowledge, wit and personality made for an amazing day. My husband and I enjoyed it was much as our 15 and 12 year old kids. It is a great over view of Amsterdam--just the right amount of history and current events. Mark is so informative. We learned, laughed, walked and discovered all sorts of things!His reputation was incredible and he surely lived up to it. I would suggest this tour for anybody going to Amsterdam.

Must-Do Amsterdam Activity!. This tour was my favorite part about Amsterdam! Mark does a wonderful job of showing a very interesting, informative, and humorous perspective on Amsterdam. He is willing to tailor the tour to your interests and the small group size (roughly ten) keeps you engaged. It is clear that Mark loves the city and his job! A must-do activity!

Great guide!. Mark of That Dam Guide tours in Amsterdam, NE was just as good of a guide as fellow Trip Advisors had stated. He was amiable, witty, and kept things very light. At the same time, he displayed a very broad and thought-provoking perspective regarding the lifestyle of the area. After the tour, Mark went out of his way to recommend a favorite restaurant (Côte Ouest) and even called to ensure that we would get a table, since it was at the last minute. Thank you, Mark, for making our tour very enjoyable and interesting.

Great Introduction to Amsterdam. We like to take at least one guided tour at the different places we visit. This was a great choice! Even my (getting a little hard to please) 13-yr old son said he enjoyed himself and thought the stuff Mark shared with the group was a good mix of fact and humour. He definitely knows his city well. We went back to try some of the food places he recommended in the following days and were very pleased with the recommendations.

Great job, Rob. Rob, our guide, had the right mix of humour and serious tour guide information. A thoroughly worthwhile and enjoyable 3 hours learning the history and current day events of Amsterdam, with a passionate, knowledgeable and personable guide.
Great tour. I had a great time on Mark's tour. He was quite adaptable to what the group wanted to see and hear about. I will definitely be recommending him to my friends and family.

A great way to see and learn about Amsterdam!. My wife and I just returned from an amazing trip to Amsterdam. One of the highlights was our walking tour with Mark. In fact, my sister had done two of Mark's tours a few months back and recommended him to us. We sure are glad she did!! Mark was a fantastic tour guide that showed us varied and different parts of the city, while providing us with a great history lesson of Amsterdam throughout the tour. He knows his stuff! And he makes Amsterdam history fun with his delivery and style. The size of the group is just small enough (around 10) that you can interact with him and he can easily respond to all questions. Forget the large impersonal corporate tours - go local and go fun with Mark!

Amazingly fun and informative. I took the city tour and the red light district tour with Mark last week, and it was fantastic! Mark has clearly done a lot of research, and his personal relationship with Amsterdam lends itself to amazing stories on the tour! I would definitely recommend it for your stay in Amsterdam.

A-1 Tour of Amsterdam!. Mark's tour of Amsterdam was fantastic!!! He is a very enthusiastic and kind guy. He is very engaging, and knowledgeable in the Amsterdam History and tourism which shows throughout the tour. He started by giving us a map and a poncho, and then proceeded to tell us an interesting overview of Amsterdam's History. Then, he walked us to different places in Amsterdam and provided interesting facts and stories. We had a break at a nice café place, where he chatted with us and gave us directions and tips for places we wanted to visit. My hubby and I enjoyed this tour very much. It was so refreshing that the three hours passed without us noticing. He actually extended his tour half hour more to tell us about Anne Frank House and to take us to a market, and we appreciate that! It was well worth it. We'd recommended without reservations!

The best damn guide ever!. I cant recommend Mark enough! He was witty, informative, passionate and honest. He does the job cuz he loves the city, the people, the culture, the women (??? :D)...and there's nothing commercial about him! His RLD tour is a must...believe me it'll completely change your perspective of the women working there!There's no one better...than That Dam Guide!Cheers Mark!

Very informative and entertaining. We took a walking tour with Mark. The 3 hours past unnoticed! He was very entertaining and had lots of interesting details about the city.We enjoyed it very much. His email: mark@thatdamguide.com+31 (0) 6272 69604

Fantastic private tour!!!. We arrived in Amsterdam too late for the group tour and Mark very kindly agreed to do a private tour in the afternoon for a group of 5 ranging in age from 18-50. Everyone in the group loved it - it was a great mix of historical information, humour, and tips on things to do or places to go during our stay. I'd recommend doing it at the beginning of your trip to get a feel for the city. All of his recommendations were spot on, it was well worth it and my family were very impressed!

Amazing Tour But Too Long. We did the City Tour, four of us, which was amazing. Mark is a knowledgeable, witty, informative and likable guy and his narrative held everyone’s interest, for most of the time. The tour started at 10:30 and we stopped for a drink break at 12:30, it then carried on until nearly 14:00.As much as we enjoyed it, by 12:30 we were toured out. It is a 5 star tour Mark but 2 hours is about right.

Best place to have a beer in Amsterdam!. We spent 5 days in Amsterdam before moving on to Tanzania. We were so lucky to find this cozy little spot on our first day and went there every night for a nightcap. The beer is so smooth and delicious, and the employees are happy people who welcome you with open arms. We just had to stop in one more time on our return trip to the states after our safari and Sharmila was working as our good fortune would have it! She is such a warm person and remembered us which made us feel like regulars! Would highly recommend this place for anyone just wanting to relax with an excellent beer. Thank you.

A a tour with that damn Guide ( Mark) is a must do in Amsterdam!!. We absolutely loved this tour with Mark. Well organises; Small group ( only eight); Mark was excellent - knows the red light district well and in particular many of the personalities who 'reside' there. He has undertaken a lot of research and it all pays off in his tour; Well structured, amusing, plenty of anicdotes as well; genuine guy who has the workers and personalities in the red light area at heart. I would say an absolute must tour !!

Red light district tour. Took advice from trip advisor and it was right again! Great tour, good mix of humour, history, information and compassion for the workers. Saw tours of 20 people+. So glad not on one of those! Thank you.

Excellent introduction to Amsterdam[. We arrived in Amsterdam and were a bit taken aback with the number of things to do and see given our pit stop of just 3 nights. We'd signed up for Mark's tour a couple of weeks in advance, which I'd strongly recommend you do as well, since he does small group:-)s of 10 people per tour. This is key as it allows for great conversation along the way, and you're not being herded from stop to stop, only to wait on a group of 50 tourists to all catch up. I say that from experience as we passed two such groups. I believe those larger tours are free, but the nominal fee for Mark's tour is worth it just for his local perspective and recommendations (during our break he even called a restaurant and made a dinner reservation for someone on our tour since he said she'd never get in without one...and she got the last table of the night!)As for the tour itself, as most everyone else said, it's very fun and informative, and you get some great random facts about Amsterdam that I'm sure you'd never hear in a large group. As a few others have commented, it really is like having a good friend take you around town. Along our tour we stopped at a cheese shop and wound up returning there the following day for a cheese/wine pairing class, where we learned not only about cheese, but also got some more excellent "local" tips on where to drink & dine with the locals.All in all a great few hours with Mark, and I highly recommend his tour to anyone who's looking to learn the basic history of Amsterdam as you see some great sites along the way.

Great Tour. We were in Amsterdam in May and were looking for an orientation tour of the city. We picked Mark's tour and couldn't be happier. He is quite a character who really wants you to learn something about his city. I felt we were walking around the city with a friend. Highly recommended!

mark the best. mark was up on all the history and knew all the great places to see in the city-we could not have had a better person--book him-fun jokes and tons of knowledge-we certainly enjoyed his group tour and would do it again on returning to amsterdam

Great tour of the city. We had a wonderful city tour with Mark today. Combined a very interesting history of the city with visits to fun and quirky places. Mark has a terrific sense of humor and a kind and patient manner. We ate the best fries in Amsterdam, the best chocolate cookie anywhere, and sat on a very special bench for a teenage girl (think Gus and Hazel). We came away with a great sense of both the history and the current state of the city (modern protests and so on). The pace was excellent. It's amazing to look back and think of how much we saw in just three hours, without feeling at all rushed or overwhelmed. I remember looking across a canal and learning about very old houses, while in the foreground a barge mounted crane pulled bicycles out of the water. I give Mark my highest recommendation, and I'm so glad we started our Amsterdam visit with him.

Amazing Small group Tour! (That Dam Guide). Based on all the great reviews I went ahead and booked both a RLD tour and the City tour. This is the only Trip-Advisor review that I have ever took the time to write, so hopefully that just proves how amazing these tours were. I cant stress enough how much better the small tours are. Amsterdam is sometimes a very loud and busy place, and unless you are a few feet from the guide, you will probably have trouble hearing him. He is extremely knowledgeable about the history of the city, as well as the RLD. It was nice to be able to just walk the streets and talk to him one-on-one. And don't be worried about the RLD tour, it is pretty laid back and ages ranged from teens to people in there 80s. Also, make sure to take his restaurant advice, he truly does know some of the best places to eat. I tried the apple pie at a restaurant next to the farmers market, andit was probably the best I have ever had. Do your self a favor and book this tour, after all how often are you in Amsterdam? might as well get the best tour while you're here.Josh- Houston, Tx
