Great way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam!. Great way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam!This was a fun, informative and relaxed tour. Marc was very knowledgeable. It would be best to do this on the front end of your trip, I went back to several of the places that were covered on the tour.

A highly must-do tour with Mark!. I did my researched for City tours in Amsterdam and came across Mark's, and was pretty convinced. I booked both the City tour and the Red Light District tour, of which my husband and I truly enjoyed both!Mark is full of enthusiam and shared with us lots of history and details of the city while also giving us a unique perspective on what's going on with the sexy ladies at the Red Light District area. You can sense his passion in his tour and he goes the extra mile to share with us the best cafes and restaurants. We particularly enjoyed the Whiskey bar and the French cafe recommended to us! To date, we have already shared with our good friends back home and told them all about Mark's tour!

Absolutely Amazing!. First time in Amsterdam and this was an amazing tour! My sister and I went on both tour and loved them both! If I ever go back I know I will be taking these tours again! Mark is super awesome and upbeat, and he really knows his facts and genuinely loves what he is doing! Loved being in a smaller group, it made the experience more fun! I can't say enough about this tour! Just take it yourself, you won't regret it!

That Dam Tour, walking tour of red light district, amsterdam. Amsterdam red light walking tour by Mark (that Dam tour)was fantastic. His english is perfect, and he has a great respect,for the ladies, and their profession. His language is fun and fortright.. Lots,of fun and very interesting. The tour finishes around 10pm, so still lots of time to explore the city. Very friendly and helpful guy. Highly recommended !!!!

A "Must Do" when visiting Amsterdam. We went on both tours (Red Light Tour AND City Tour) and thoroughly enjoyed both. We liked being in a small group. Mark was fun and upbeat and seemed to genuinely enjoy sharing his knowledge about Amsterdam. On his website he makes suggestions for places to eat/snack and his suggestions were spot on. We tried Da Portare Via (fabulous pizza in the Red Light District.) When we returned to Amsterdam to visit the museums, we ate at Venkel Salades (twice), Sweet Cup (for a great cup of coffee), Chocolaterie Pompadour, Droog (for a tasty lunch), and on another day while visiting the Jordaan District, we ate at Kinnaree (for a scrumptious Thai dinner) Mark gave us a discount card to use a some of the places. You can make arrangements to go on the walking tours via his website. When I did so, we got an immediate response. He also sent us follow-up emails with interesting links and facts that he spoke of during our tours. Fun, fun, fun!

Great tour guide, small group. We took Mark's City Tour and the Red Light District Tour. Mark is very interesting, had lots of good stories to tell and he is quite an advocate for the women in the Red Light district who are organizing into a union. However, I found that tour a bit depressing and wonder how many of those women, if they had other options, really want to be there. The RLD tour was 2 hours but the City Tour was 3 hours and a bit long, especially having to stand most of the time. Mark did take us by a great cheese shop where we bought some delicious goat cheese and also pointed out Da Portare Via where had the best pizza ever! Both places gave us a 20% discount with Mark's card...he says he doesn't get a kick back but passes that on to his customers. It was easy to find Mark with his orange tassel on his hat and easy to follow him on the sometimes crowded streets. Very worthwhile!

Geert ìs the one to request. I took a handful of 11th graders from and international school and Geert Sillevis, who ìs young himself (28 ish) related to the students on a level that engaged them and peeked their interest. He had them asking questions non stop and keep them laughing. I will be calling him again for next years group!

Excellent tour with great guide. Me and my husband joined Rob on the 3 hour tour of the City. Rob really knew the City ad its history and made the 3 hours fly by. It was a great tour and great fun. We would recommend this to anyone visiting the City.Lyn

You MUST do this tour with Mark!. My friends and I joined a group tour with Mark on a cool, breezy day in May - and loved every minute of our time with him. He is so knowledgeable about Amsterdam and its history, and shared that info in such a fun and charming manner. Not only did we learn so much, but we had a great time doing it. His passion for his city is obvious and you will love your time with him - book it!

Great tour and fantastic guide!. Mark was very knowledgable and gave a terrific tour of the red light district. He was informative, humorous, and honest about the district and all of its pros and cons. This small group tour is the way to go!

City Tour. Did this tour with my husband and in-laws. Mark was an outstanding guide. Full of great information and a really good sense of humor, Mark will be sure to give you what you're looking for on your tour. Not to be missed. Looking forward to the Red Light Tour next time we are in town. Thanks again, Mark!

Fun and entertaining walk through the Red Light District!. Mark at That Dam Guide was an absolute joy to follow around through the Red Light District for a couple of hours. He was very informative with not only the history, but with many insights to the inner workings of the district. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone with a curiousity about Amsterdam's most infamous tourist destination!

Mark's the Man!. My wife booked two tours through Mark, the driving force behind "That Dam Guide" and we thoroughly enjoyed both! The two-hour Red Light Tour gives one a unique perspective on what's going on with the ladies in the windows in terms of working conditions, safety, the costs of owing a window and the politics of the sex worker business in Amsterdam.Mark's narratives are at times, "colorful" so I would call this this tour for adults only. Highly recommend!

Fantastic tour.. My best friend and I decided to book a red light tour with Mark after the fantastic reviews on here.We were keen to see the area but weren't really sure how best to go about it as we didn't really know what to expect being first time visitors, but I'm really glad we chose to do a guided tour with Mark as he's so knowledgeable and insightful and certainly put an interesting spin on the tour. The time on the tour just flew by incredibly quickly!Mark met us in the stock exchange square and was very friendly and welcoming. There were a few people who didn't show up but he patiently waited for around 10minutes in case they had gotten lost.He pointed out all the interesting shops, told us hilarious stories about certain stores and I think what makes his tour worthwhile is that he knows the girls personally. He used to stay in the are, and used to run errands for them.A few of his close friends are ex workers too so he's got a good knowledge and experience to share.His tour is a great way to get a feel for the red light district, it felt like a great atmosphere and whilst walking around we seen everything worth seeing . He advised us the best places to eat in the area, and the best shops to go to. If you're looking for a little more than just a look he also advised the clubs to avoid and the ones worth a visit.All in all, very interesting tour and worth doing.Mark is lovely and I'd certainly book some of his others tours in future if I went back to Amsterdam. Thank you Mark for an enjoyable evening!

Google Walk. The seemingly obvious reason for the cheesy title owes its credit to Mark-for it often felt like an information galore. Mark often adds interesting bits of information to spice up the experience. Furthermore, he follows it up by sending us emails regarding any topics of interest delved into during the tour. What I found highly enriching was Mark's satirical and humorous description of most of the sights-thereby making them even more memorable. Would definitely recommend his day-time tours.

Highly recommended!. Went on the RLD tour with Mark whilst on a cruise stop-over. It was really informative, Mark really knows the area, its history and many of the people who live and work there. I am sure that if we had decided to "go it alone" we definitely wouldn't have gained such an insight into the area. It was great fun and really good value for money!

Around Amsterdam with Mark. Wry wit and good humor make touring with Mark a good way to introduce yourself to Amsterdam. The time rolls by and a lot is packed into a short space of time, but it is jam packed with facts and stories. We highly recommend getting acquainted with Amsterdam with Mark and sorry we did not book the private tour based on Russell Shorto's book about Amsterdam which I had just finished reading. Definitely book a tour with Mark...you will be glad you did.Thanks, Mark

RLD tour . Walking around the RLD with Mark is like walking with a close friend who happens to know sex industry's socio-cultural history and where to get the best bites to eat. I highly recommend starting your Amsterdam experience off with a "That Dam Guide" tour.

Walking tour with Mark. We just ended our walking tour of the city with Mark. I was accompanied by my 3 children all in their early twenties. The tour started quite on time. His instructions were accurate and we had no trouble spotting him at the starting point. Mark was very knowledgeable and had a lot of information that was very new to us. He very kindly marked out our maps with easy routes so that we could re visit a few of the attractions. If you are looking for an "insider's" view of this beautiful city then Mark is the right man to take you around. We all loved our tour today. More of a friend than a tour guide:)

Red light tour. Mark was very informative and extremely knowledgeable on the area, the women and all that was going on in the area. We did the tour on a Sat night....it was a perfect. We thought this was a great way to see this part of town and would highly recommend.

Great Experience. Excellent tour with a very knowledgable and funny guide. Lots of walking but we saw so much. We had two small children and he always ensured that we weren't left behind. Would HIGHLY recommend this tour. Very reasonably priced too.

Amazing tour. Mark was funny, witty and really knew a lot about Amsterdam's and Holland's history. the tour was amazingly informative and fun, the fact that the group was of ten people made the experience really personal, you can see he's really invested in his work and tries to get to know each and everyone of his group, I would really recommend him !

Insightful, Educational, and Fun!. Marks tour was the highlight of our visit to Amsterdam. A definite way to feel the pulse of this exciting city today mixed with the its rich history. Wonderful tour.

Fun and informative. Mark took us on a great tour that included both the old and the new. He was very knowledgeable about the history of the city and excited to share it. Our kids (13 and 19) also thoroughly enjoyed the tour, and not just for the excellent chocolate cookies we had halfway through. We chose to have a private tour, and strongly recommend it if you like to have the tour tailored to your interests.

Entertaining and informative!. Mark is en excellent guide who seems to be truly passionate about Amsterdam and its history. He knows all that is worth knowing about the city and his way of sharing his knowledge is very humoristic and entertaining. It is great that he allows a maximum of 10 people on each tour, which makes it possible to have a dialogue and adjust the tour depending on the interests of the participants. As an extra bonus, he sends en email with additional information about Amsterdam after the tour.

Very insightful and informative. This was our second visit to Amsterdam and our second red light district tour. Mark's tour was by far the better of the two. The points of interest were the same but since Mark had spent time talking to the prostitutes about their experiences working in Amsterdam's Red Light District, he could provide an insiders' perspective. He was also extremely funny and personable. I would definitely recommend this tour.

Excellent private walking tour of Amsterdam. Mark is the guide who is bright and articulate, witty and funny. His ability to give an 800 year history of the Netherlands in 5 min was impressive and entertaining. It offered a basic timeline that the walking tour elaborated on. It enriched our appreciation for the historical sites we stopped at. After a full day with Mark, we felt like he was our friend. The hours flew by before we knew we were to say goodbye.

Excellent way to start Amsterdam visit. Mark gives exceptional tour. Walking & talking pace perfect for enjoying & snapping photos. His information & commentary witty & certainly interesting. He also offers information for further learning & some discount coupons for the area. Highly recommend taking his tour FIRST thing! Thank you Mark!

Very Informative and exciting. Mark was a great tour guide. He was very polite and friendly, answered questions during the tour. He even recommended places he goes to in the city. I definitely gained alot of experience on tour.

Mark is the guide you want!. Mark's humor and knowledge combined with the small group sizes makes his tours the best!!Mark doesn't rush, likes answering questions, is honest and even helps with your personal itinerary.Give him a try, you won't be disapointed!!!

Excellent Tour from a Passionate Tour Guide. Mark has to be the funniest and most passionate tour guides that I've ever had. My group took his in-depth tour based on Russell Shorto's book, and I couldn't have been happier. He ran through the history of the city, brought us to unique sites that a typical tour would not have, and gave us great suggestions for restaurants around the area. You can really tell that he loves Amsterdam, and he loves sharing that love with everyone he meets.

Enjoyable Tour. Clear and informative. Mark clearly has a real passion for his subject. The three hours raced by all too quickly. I agree with other reviewers that the limited number of participants is a real plus for this type of tour.

Red Light District Tour. This was a very good tour. Mark was knowledgable and humorous and gave our small group an insiders view of the district and its business. He knew several of the prostitutes and was able to give us some insights into the business that were unique. Overall, it was a very good tour and I recommend it highly.
Red light district tour was fun and enlightening. I really enjoyed Mark's insight and humour - I got so much more from this tour than I would have walking around on my own or with a larger tour.

Amazing. Mark is a national treasure. The Red Light District tour could be called looking through the glass from both sides. You get to see how the ladies are viewed from outside, and the problems and issues; and you get a feeling of what it is it like to look out of those windows at the eyes gawking at you.Don't miss this tour.

A very entertaining and eye-opening experience in the RLD. I wanted a small-group tour for seeing this part of the city and to learn more about the history and Dutch attitude toward it. Mark provided us with a lot of very interesting info and funny stories, all of which made this a perfect way for us to experience the Red Light District.

Fantastic Tour. We only had time for one full day in Amsterdam and I am so happy we spent our morning with Mark! He is very informative and shared so much history of this beautiful, friendly city. I highly recommend this tour.

Best guide we've had in Europe. We've had many tour guides throughout Europe. Mark is the best one we've had so far. We like guides who are not only informative, but also humerous, opinionated and allows his audience to participate and ask questions. Mark was all of these things. He comes across as a "live and let live" guy, just like the city.

Tour for people who hate tours. \Mark's tour is informative, fun and non-touristy. Limited to 10 people, it offers a great overview of the center of the city. I'd rather self-tour than be herded around in a big group, esp. in Amsterdam where the sidewalks are narrow and bicycles are whizzing by you silently. But Mark's walking tour is nimble, well-paced and offers lots of good tips about what to do and how best to do it in Amsterdam.

Edgy and street-wise, very smart. If you want deep history and nuanced story-telling with humor through in, use Mark. We really appreciated his knowledge. I took 12 graduate students who had read Russell Shorto's book on Amsterdam, and this was a great follow up to that book.

A must do when in Amsterdam!. We booked to do a red light district tour with Mark whilst in Amsterdam this weekend and we were so pleased we did!Mark was friendly, funny and very well informed on everything to do with the Red Light district. I thought two hours would be too long to do a tour but I can honestly say the time flew by and it was so much fun!We learnt so much about Amsterdam and the sex industry as well as hearing some very funny stories and it was a real eye opener and changed my view completely on the sex trade in Amsterdam. I can honestly say I came away being more open minded and informed about the whole thing and I am glad I am. I cant recommend Mark enough, he only does smaller groups so you get a very professional experience unlike the other tours we saw with 30-40 people in them! He also offers any advice after the tour in terms of where to go and eat and drink etc - Highly recommend Mark and his tour!!

Informative & Entertaining! . Follow Mark on his Amsterdam walking tour & learn about the city's rich & fascinating history, sure. But you will also be entertained! I am a better tourist for having taken this tour which enlightened me on many dimensions of Amsterdam culture.

Great intro to Amsterdam. I took the day tour as I only had 11 hrs on a quick trip through the city. Im so glad I did the tour with Mark because it gave me great insight about some of the history and culture of this "unique" city. Now I definitely want to come back and visit for a longer period. The excitement and passion really showed in Mark, and right from the beginning it was clear that he really enjoys spending time with people and sharing his knowledge. We need more people in the tourism industry like this guy. Nowadays it seems like everyone is in a hurry to make a quick buck and just goes through the motions. Well not Mark. With such nice small groups, you really feel like you get a personal experience. He also has a pretty cool discount scheme with a few vendors where you get a discount if you show them his card, nice touch. Lastly, Mark was very very helpful leading up to the trip with my numerous questions. He showed me exactly where to store my bag (for a cheap price) during the tour, and gave excellent food recommendations. Take this tour, it's a great value for 20€!

Engaging and enlighting. My husband and I choose Marks tour as we like smaller intimate groups. This tour was fun, informative and engaging. Mark is extremely passionate and knowledgeable about the area and is keen to share his stories and experiences with you. This tour was both educational and fun, well worth doing and we thoroughly recommend. Thank you Mark.

Excellent in depth, informative tour of Amsterdam!. It was an absolutely awesome experience walking around the amazing city of Amsterdam. Mark was funny, knowledgeable, friendly and really great to have lead the tour! Definitely recommend to anyone who wants to see what Amsterdam is all about!

Visit Amsterdam,greetings from Slovenija. The tour was excellent,very nice and easy,You realy get the inside information about the red light district.Mark was a very interesting guide,And i would recomend the tour to anyone...Thanks again for the tour.

Excellent Red Light District Walking Tour!. I took Mark's Red Light District Tour and it was excellent! I am female and traveled by myself so I wasn't sure how to go about exploring the RLD. Taking the tour with Mark was excellent. The area is so interesting (as to be expected) but if you're not with a local who knows the ins and outs of the area, you'd miss out on a lot of the nuances (e.g. big girl alley or the statue dedicated to the workers) as well as the history of the trade and the current politics surrounding the area. Mark's very knowledgeable about the workers and their trade, the history, and the area. He's also a lot of fun and infused the tour with great stories. He even sheds light on how to 'engage' a worker. What really stood out for me though, was that Mark talked about the workers in the RLD with a ton of respect, zero judgement and highlighted a lot of issues they face as well as the misconceptions they have to deal with. As a female, I appreciated that. And oh, the small group size of the tour is such such a PLUS!!! We ran into one of the big company tours and oh boy, how anyone heard what the guide was saying was beyond me. Plus who wants to look like you're on a tour in the RLD anyways? The huge group screams tourist and you annoy the locals when all 20 of you are blocking the narrow alleys. With Mark's small group we were more inconspicuous (just a teeny weeny bit) Lol. Highly recommended! Btw if you didn't already assume this the RLD tour is explicit so not recommended for anyone not comfortable talking/hearing about sex.

Great walking tour. Mark was great and it felt like being with someone you knew just taking a walk around Amsterdam but getting great facts and information at the same time . I would highly recommend the tour my only regret is we should have done the tour on the first day !

Informative and entertaining!!. Great tour, informational fun, perfect pace. Mark is knowledgeable and knows the right mix of history, politics, and humor. We did hte tour our first few hours in town, it was a great way to stretch our legs after a long flight and to get the lay of the land, plus we had time to go back and explore some of the interesting sites Mark pointed out. I am still thinking about the wonderful waffle I had on our break.

Take This Tour. This was an excellent way to get an introduction to Amsterdam on the first day of our visit. Mark showed us a number of major sights while discussing Amsterdam's history. His wit and sense of humour kept things fun. His recommendations regarding the best places to eat were greatly appreciated. One of the best features of his tour is the small group size.There were 7 of us which allowed us to hear what Mark was saying and to go to shops/cafe's which would not accommodate the much larger tour groups we saw. My wife and I give That Dam Guide a big 2 thumbs up!

Terrific Experience. Mark was great. We learned a lot on the Walking Tour of Amsterdam! The 3 hours just zipped by, and we had time to talk to the others on the tour as well. I can't wait til my college kids start touring Europe on their year abroad. I will definitely send them over to Mark to get a feel for the city. Don't hesitate....just book it! We also went on a bike tour and a food tour, and Mark's info was all fresh and interesting. I had no idea what we paid (as we had booked it a while before we went) until we got home, and I couldn't believe how cheap it was. A great value!

Great Tour. Mark was a brilliant tour guide. His knowledge throughout the areas we visited as well as his political, economic and historical knowledge was excellent and everyone on the tour was kept interest at all times. I would recommend this tour.

What a Great Dude. Super awesome guy! Mark is extremely knowledgeable about Amsterdam, as well as funny and kind. His tours are limited to a certain number of people, which gives a really unique experience. He gives you his business card, which gets you 10% off some really good restaurants. I would definitely recommend him. And I recommend that you follow his dinner recommendations - amazing.

Fantastic Tour. Mark was a fantastic tour guide. We annually travel to Europe, Canada, the US, or Asia. Mark's tour is exactly what you need - a mix of culture, history, present day life, and humor. His exhaustive studies have well prepared him to articulate the story and bring to life the city of Amsterdam. thanks again, Mark!!

Love Mark's Tours. Mark's Red Light District tour is excellent. Fun, informative and very respectful toward the workers in the area. I highly recommend! When we were in Amsterdam last year, we took Mark's City Tour, and it was also great. Mark limits his groups to 10 people, which allows for more interaction and questions. He's the real deal and won't disappoint!

Great Guide. We did the walking city tour with Mark and he was great. Highly recommended using him. He was both knowledgeable and entertaining and did a great job of teaching about Amsterdam history!!

Best choice if you wanna go to the red light district but you are afraid of going yourself. Great sense of humourNice and friendly tour guideEasy and interesting explanationUnexpected souvenir (if you are the lucky one)Informative tour

Great Guide. We took Mark's walking tour our 1st day in Amsterdam. Mark was full of knowledge and tips for places to go and things to do. He directed my thirsty friends to a good pub and my sweet-toothed friend to a ice cream waffle shop! Everyone was happy :)

A fun and informative tour. We were a group of 4 and hired Mark for a private tour. We've all been to Amsterdam before but were interested in seeing things we hadn't seen before and finding out some of the more quirky pieces of information. Mark understood exactly what we wanted and he certainly delivered! He was informative and interesting without being overbearing. The tour went along at a pace that suited us with stops for coffee and snacks. Mark is obviously passionate about Amsterdam and has done lots of research. He was able to answer all of our questions in great detail. We all agreed that it was a great tour and would gladly do it all over again. We highly recommend Mark to anybody interested in learning about more than just the general tourist attractions.

Definitely a great way to start exploring Amsterdam!. Mark is a friendly person and a great guide. The tour was very informative and lots of fun. The recommendations he gave on where to go, eat, etc. were good as well. Highly recommended!
Very good tour . Enjoyed this tour very much. Prices are higher than other companies but it's worth having a smaller group. Mark is very knowledgeable and we enjoyed ourselves.

A must-do tour of Amsterdam!!. If you are visiting Amsterdam for the first time like we were, you MUST do a tour with Mark!! We took the City Tour on our first day, and it was the perfect introduction to Amsterdam. Mark is extremely knowledgeable not only of the history of Amsterdam but also its culture, and he offers great advice on what to see and do around the city during your stay – from a local’s perspective. He is also very personable and entertaining. One of the best things about this tour (besides Mark) is that he limits the size of the tour groups to a max of 10 people and he runs every tour himself. So you’re always getting the best guide! Keeping it small allows for so much more dialogue as you’re walking and flexibility. We had some unfortunate rainy/windy weather on the day of our tour, and Mark was able to lead us into a couple small cafes to stop for a coffee break and give everyone a chance to dry off and warm up. Even better, he knows so many of the local eateries and small businesses that you can get 10% when you mention his name. Thanks, Mark for an amazing tour! Would definitely do it again.

Personalized and Educational. This was a great small group tour. We had a nice walk through the city and Mark was very informative. He was prepared too - with free ponchos for everyone since it was raining. He took the time to answer all our questions. He really loves the city and you can tell he is passionate about his work.

Great way to begin our time in Amsterdam!. With only 3 days to explore Amsterdam, our decision to take a tour with Mark on day one was a good one indeed! He shared many highlights of the city, including commentary on historical facts, interesting myths, and humorous stories about the city and people who live and lived there. This small group tour allows plenty of opportunity for interaction between the group and Mark, who provided a very personalized tour. He is an excellent tour guide and the pace of the tour was good....not too long and never boring! I highly recommend a tour with Mark - you'll enjoy it and have fun too! Thanks Mark for getting our first day in Amsterdam off to a fabulous start!
Great tour. Very friendly tour guide. We loved that it a small group where we could easily ask questions. He offered much more than just a tour.

Not on tour - but friends were and we are impressed!. We (husband and I ) live outside Amsterdam so when friends come from the states to visit we never know who to recommend. My friend found Mark's tour on this trip advisor and booked when they landed. As I work in the tourist industry I wanted to make sure they got a quality tour....even we are never sure who will give the "right stuff" during the tour. I liked the fact that it was smaller groups as I know that the larger groups never get the kind of quality and personal attention as a large group. His price for the tours is great! The information provided to my friends was spot on and I know ment more coming from someone who lives and works in the city than if it came from me or my Dutch hubby.He ended the tour on time and close to the location where he said he would so it was easy to pick our friends back up so they could make the eveing plane to Germany. Thanks Mark for filling this important visit for my friends with information on this great country!

Respectful tour of the Red Light District. My husband and I were impressed by the way Mark conducted his Red Light District tour. Our group was the maximum size of ten members--much smaller than the other tours on offer--making it easy to navigate the narrow streets and alleys and to see and hear what he was showing and telling us about the history & ongoing evolution of the area. We appreciated the mix of humourous and sober anecdotes about its characters and businesses and the challenges they currently face. Thanks, Mark, for your very interesting and illuminating tour.

Dam good tour.. Mark's knowledge and perspective made for a very educational and entertaining few hours. It was a great way to get to know the city at the start of our week in Amsterdam. Highly recommend!
Do it. Mark knew his stuff! He wasn't a boring tour guide!And I hate guided tours! He gave recommendations on museums, bars, sex shows and smoking cafés; what more could you ask for??So do it. Easy.

The Best Dam Guide. The tour was excellent as all of the reviews stated. The small size allowed ,my group to have a very personalized experience. He covered all of the highlights in an effective manner and was knowledgeable, insightful, funny and entertaining. He has a passion for Amsterdam and respects each and every aspect. I highly recommend this tour as a must do. The tour made my trip to Amsterdam worth it.

Educational and Engaging. My husband and I took this tour March 22nd with our 12 year old son and 15 year old daughter. My kids were totally engaged and entertained the entire time - could there be a better endorsement? We highly recommend spending time with the Dam Guide while in the beautiful city of Amsterdam.

Wonderful Time!. We took this tour after reading other great Trip Advisor reviews and were not at all disappointed. Mark was funny, very informative and incredibly passionate about the city. It felt like we got a real perspective on the local flare and mentality as well as a very thorough and entertaining take on the history of the city. We also loved the more intimate feel as he only allows around 10 people at a time so you get a much more personal experience. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a tour.

Interesting and fun. Booked a tour on the site and got confirmation emails immediately for the next day. Emails explained where to meet and how to recognize our guide, Mark. As it had just started sprinkling, Mark was kind enough to provide a basic rain poncho, free of charge, to anyone who wanted one. The tour of the city covered political, geographical, and some religious aspects of Amsterdam, recent and past. As a first time visitor, I thought the tour gave me enough background to get a feel for the city and left me wanting to know more and explore on my own. At the end of the tour, Mark took time to highlight some of the spots we saw and some of his favorites on our maps. He even invited anyone who wanted to come to join him for a quick lunch at a street market. I would recommend That Dam Guide to anyone who understands English.

Wonderful, informative, funny. A perfect walking tour, from start to finish. Mark has a very warm, open style, quickly getting rapport with the group. Engaging and interesting throughout the tour, handling questions well, as well as showing countless bits of local knowledge. Gave an interesting insight both into Amsterdam and the Netherlands. Our only wish is that we should have taken his tour at the start rather than near the end of our stay. Recommended without hesitation.

Very informative and pleasent. Thank you, Mark, for a very informative and well articulated guided tour. We did the tour on our first out of three days in A, and we advice others to do the same. I was also very pleased to vitness how much devotion you put into maintaining our safety on our walk through the busy streets of Amsterdam. Keep up the good work! Regards Ole Petter

A bit of an eclectic mix.... Just like the city itself. I use guides in every city I travel to and Mark was a cut above the rest. Most will give you an excellent history / sightseeing perspective, with Mark, you get more of a quirky and social commentary as well. Let's face it... you don't need to know the history of the RL district or bicycles... but to find out the going rate, the working girls perspectives and how many bicycles are fished out of the canals every year-- well, that it more captivating. I was travelling (unusually) with my 75 year old mother, who did very well -- it is 3 hours on your feet. I wish my teens would have been with us, as they would have really enjoyed the liberal view of this great city. Personally, I think Mark undercharges... v every other guide i have taken with such small groups. He really does mean no tips, which is nice, but I think unfair. I told him this, but like all businessmen starting out, he is underpaying himself. Worth twice the price. Best guide in any city I have travelled to

Informative and entertaining!. Mark is evidently very passionate about Amsterdam! He gave a great insight into the Red Light District and some of the characters who work there on what was a small and personal walking tour (unlike all of the other tours around)We would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam for the first time - very interesting and informative!

Entertaining, fun and very interesting tour of the RLD. We recently did Marks Red Light District tour and thoroughly enjoyed it! The small group size and the fact the Mark has lived in the area made it feel like a much more authentic and personalised experience than many generic tours, which can be a scrum just to hear the guide!We both left with a very different view of the Red Light District than we were expecting, thanks to the stories about the workers in the area the history of district. It also felt like a safe way to see the area for a couple of newcomers to the City like us!I’d highly recommend Marks Red Light District tour, we found it entertaining, funny and the behind the scenes info he provides gives a very different view point on the area to what many may think! He seems genuinely passionate about the area, the rights of those who work there, and what the district contributes to Amsterdam, which really came across in the tour. Over all it was one of the highlights of our trip and a great way to learn about the the most famous part of Amsterdam!

First ever walking tour. Sorry for the late review, my partner and I absolutely loved the tour Mark. You probably don't remember us but it was the day Karma leant you a hand, One couple cancelled and then another rang you from the train and joined us late. I have to say the tour was extremely interesting, funny and well worth the money. Thank you for an informative and fun day out, I really cannot stress how fantastic this tour is...Take IT you will not be disappointed !!!

In depth knowledge of Amsterdam history with quirky side stories. Mark tailored our tour to be interesting for those in our group who knew Amsterdam fairly well, and also for those who were not so familiar. He made the time we spent with him fly by, and entertained us with stories that were historically accurate and added some spicy tidbits that kept us very engaged. We had a great time!

great tour guide with excellent recommendations. As this was my first trip to Amsterdam I wanted to learn as much as I could about the city and explore as soon as we arrived. I am extremely glad we chose to go on a 3 hour walking tour with Mark on the first day of our trip. Mark was very honest and gave great recommendations, all of which we tried. This was very useful and allowed us to eat and enjoy the city more like locals would. The information provided on the tour was very interesting and gave a historical snapshot of the origins of the city. I enjoyed Mark's liberal perspective. A great tour, wrap up warm and make sure you bring comfortable foot wear! The red light district tour was similarly enjoyable and informative with excellent insights through Mark's personal connections. In particular, the small group size was an a clear advantage of this tour when compared to the other companies.

Probably the best tour of my life. Mark was a remarkable tour guide. He's so funny, charismatic, and informative - I learned so much about the Red Light District. This is definitely the man to go to for a fun exploration. There was never a dull moment.

Fun and exciting tour! Fantastic guide in Mark!!!. This was such a wonderful find! Mark was a great tour guide with hilarious stories and "behind the scene" information. He also really did a great perspective from the ladies point of view as he is friendly with many of the ladies and showed a very different side of what people would generally think about working ladies in Amsterdam. This included the history of prostitution and old and current legislation regarding the Red Light District. He answered questions and the walking tour showed us a lot of the unique shops in the area. I would highly recommend this tour for a small group environment, the larger groups seemed miserable and I doubt they could keep up or hear their guides while on the tour. Mark is a gem and such a wonderful spokesperson for Amsterdam and the ladies of the Red Light District. A safe environment to tour this area of Amsterdam. I would go on any tour Mark guided!!! Two enthusiast thumbs up! :)

Safe and informative journey through RLD. Thanks Mark for wonderful, informative and safe time through Red Light District. We were skeptical initially about the stories heard of RLD. But this tour certainly helped in banishing those myths about RLD. I recommend to change its timing to later in the evenings maybe from 9 pm or 10 pm in summer as it is hardly dark at 7 pm.

Highly enjoyable and informative. We try find a recommended guide either as a private guide or who has very small groups when first vesting a new town to get an understanding of the history, culture and layout of the place (I had visited Amsterdam on number of occasions 40+ years ago but the memories are blurred for some reason). The guides who are the best in my view are those who are honest and enthusiastic about the subject - Mark met all of our hopes and expectations.For a first time visitor (or if you have not gone deeper in to the history of Amsterdam than you get on a canal tour), I highly recommend Mark's daytime tour.

Amazing guide!!!. Mark was a great tour guide! He was extremely nice, confident and outgoing. He provided me with the History of the Red Light District which was both informative and interesting. He did this with a group of 20 students which would be intimidating for anyone, but Mark did a wonderful job. I would most definitely recommend him again! He was absolutely wonderful! If I could,I would give him more than 5 stars!
Very Informative and Fun!. Mark was a very outgoing person that made us laugh a lot and at the same time shared his knowledge on the red light district in a very detailed manner!.

The Right Choice. A friend and I chose Mark to do the Red light tour beacuse of his great review ratings and because he had no issues working around our tight schedule for the private tour. Mark is a wonderful individual with a wealth of knowledge when it comes to the Red Light District. He gave us many interesting facts in detail about the different alleys, prices, how things worked, and the history of the place. I particularly liked that he had great respect for the girls working there. He answered all the questions we had and even offered to email us regarding any additional info we needed or answers to questions we may have.It was an interesting experience with the right guide. We were glad we chose right, and had a lovely night touring and taking photos of the different alleys and the canal.

Exactly the type of person you hope to meet when you travel anywhere. If I could I would give more stars. Mark went above and beyond my expectations of a tour guide. He provides not only a great depth of knowledge of the city but also is a global citizen open to all perspectives and inquiries, which lead to fantastic results. I also appreciated the small group size. I am not one who frequently reviews, but this experience truly merited further support. If your are visiting Amsterdam wanting to skip the tourist traps, you don't need to look any further.

Awesome guide!. We took both to city tour and the red light district tour with Mark. The small group size was great. He encouraged questions which you do not get with the big groups. Very entertaining with nice history of both the city and red light district. He also pointed out some nice food spots which we totally hit up and they were great.If your looking for a great tour guide with a fun tour take one with the Dam Guide Mark.

Entertaining and informative. Excellent tour. Our guide was both personable and knowledgeable. The small group size (this tour is limited to 10 participants) added significantly to the pleasant ambiance. This is a one-person company so the owner/guide really wants to provide a quality experience,

10/10. Awesome tour! Mark was so friendly and engaging and he clearly knew a ton about the city. If I am back in Amsterdam at any point I would definitely take another tour with him. Would highly recommend!

The perfect tour! Fun, informative and small group. I was traveling solo in Amsterdam. I am SO GRATEFUL to have fond Mark's day tour. I have taken many tours by companies - I will never do that again. This tour was perfect -Fun, unscripted, personal, flexible, detailed and friendly. Mark has a great knowledge of Amsterdam and gives incredible facts about the history with quirky fun comments sprinkled in. If he was my history teacher I clearly would have paid better attention and learned so much! Even when the weather decided to rain on us, Mark was adaptable and took the tour inside where he continued his story and suggested some fantastic beverages. Perfect! Looking forward to a return trip and the night tour! Thank Mark - it was a pleasure to meet you.

two excellent tours!!!. If you want a tour that is informative and fun then these are the ones to do!! We did both of the tours - first the Red Light District tour on Friday night and then the the Walking City Tour on Saturday. We found both tours excellent and informative. With Mark keeping the group numbers limited to 10 he can tailor the tour around the group; also you get to know the other people in the group.

City and Red Light Tour. We spent a full day with Mark,first on a daytime city tour and then on the nighttime Red Light District Tour. We really had great fun on both . We liked the small group and Mark was really nice and fun to be with he had so much knowledge to share with us and really oriented us on our day in Amsterdam. I would highly recommend him as a tour guide. Enjoy this wonderful city! Christy and Doug
10/10. Incredibly informative tour, Mark was great! It's very nice to have the small groups that Mark offered. 10/10 tour, would highly recommend to anyone coming to Amsterdam.

A Definite Highlight. I went on the Red Light District Tour - this was excellent, Mark was engaging and had a lot of interesting facts and anecdotes about the place. He even offered to photograph us and provided a lot of follow-up info by email about things he had mentioned on the tour. We went past the huge groups of 30+ that other tour guides were showing round, and there's no way they could have had as good an experience as us in our group of 10! Highly recommended!

Well-done. First off, Mark is a nice guy, he is funny, engaging and has a big heart. His knowledge and connection to his city is apparent and his tour is fun, funny and well-worth it. Bawdy, gooey, eye-opening and shocking to some...we had fun!!

Red Light District Tour. We booked the red light tour with Mark after reading about him on trip advisor and we certainly weren't disappointed. The tour started at 7 and Mark was easy to find with his lovely hat! He gave the group a brief introduction to the area and about what we were about to witness. We then set off and were entertained for the whole 2 hours we spent with Mark. He had so many stories and an inside knowledge of the area which made us see it in a whole new light. The tour itself was very personal as he only takes 10 people at a time (not like some of the other big tour companies that you will see with 20 - 30 people). We were able to ask questions throughout the tour and Mark had an answer and a story to go along with it for every one.After the tour Mark kindly invited us all for a drink and brought us to a lovely local bar that we would never have come across ourselves. He also emailed us after the tour with lots of helpful information (ideas for places to eat etc.) and a lovely souvenir photo from our night in the red light district.Would recommend this tour for all, don't leave Amsterdam without meeting Mark! Thanks a mill Mark,David and Maeve :)

Dam Insightful!. After reading the reviews, I had no hesitation to book Mark. He was so helpful from the start to the very end. We were planning to come into Amsterdam on the 2nd week in March, and he normally does not begin his scheduled tours until the day we left, but he was so accommodating, offering us a tour on a Monday, and guess what ?6 other people came on that day as well. Mark is witty, intelligent and always accommodating to our group. It was blustery and a bit chilly on the tour date but he warmed us up with stories and history, I even got a souvenir from Mark to remind me of my Amsterdam trip ( a portable ladies' toilet...for those times when I cannot find a toilet). Mark, just to let you know that I have yet to use it, but will always think of you when and if I need to . We wanted to book the Red Light Tour, but couldn't fit it into our schedule, Support this local guy and you won't be disappointed!!. the other 'free" walking tour...the group was way too big! The orange hat was a funny touch!

Great tour!!. Did a 3 hr tour with my husband and 2 children. We were originally supposed to have a private tour but due to flight delays had to cancel and join up with a group. I wasn't disappointed as there was such a small group of us it felt just as personal. Mark has a wonderful knowledge and love of the city. Loved hearing the history and other interesting facts and stories. Would highly recommend.

The best Dam tour guide in Amsterdam!. My wife and I were in town for a conference last week, and decided to do a tour of the city. After checking some of the top tour guides, we opted to go with Mark. I can honestly say that his tours (we did both the city tour and the Red Light District tour) were the highlight of the trip. Mark is incredibly knowledgeable about the city and its history. At the start of the tour he gives you an “800 years of Amsterdam in 5 minutes” talk which is a great overview and really sets the stage for many of things he will show you on the tour. I asked questions throughout, and he always had great, thoughtful, and often funny answers to my (likely ridiculous) questions. I was asked which tour I liked better, and it’s really difficult to say. The city tour was full of interesting history and funny anecdotes about the city. The night tour (RLD) gives you an interesting glimpse into a world you (or at least I) seldom see. I should also note that the RLD tour isn’t just about the sex and sex workers, but a walk through the history and current political climate and social issues faced by the RLD workers; it was really fascinating.Many tour guides get “kickbacks” if they show people specific businesses and the person returns to purchase something. Mark has opted to pass these savings on to you. If you flash his business card at a handful of establishments, you can get a discount (what he would have gotten as a kickback) on your purchase. In addition, you will see tours packed with 20 to 40 people, which seems crazy. Mark caps his tours at 10, and you get to know the other tourists along the way (one of the great things about his tour is interacting with people from other countries). After the tour, Mark sends you some more information about the city, and links to some cool stuff. In addition, he will take a picture of you (and/or your group) at a fantastic spot in the RLD. The pic is emailed to you along with the other info he sends.Finally, even if you don’t go on one of his tours (but let’s face it, you absolutely should), check out his website for great food options. Some of the places he lists are real gems, the type of place a tourist could never find on their own. He provides excellent directions on the site, and if you tell him you want to eat at a place, he will point it out (or explain how to get there) while on the tour. I’ve done tours all over the world, and this was easily one of the best.

Red light district tour with no fuss and no getting lost!. We booked the trip with mark after being recommended by family. We had a great time, mark is a very knowledgable guy and we had a laugh too! He took us to all the main parts that we needed to see and know about and gave us lots of information on the red light district, probably more in depth than any other tour as he used to live above one of the windows when he first arrived here, making friends with a few of the girls, so getting to know the stories behind the window I guess! There were quite a few organised trips, with about 25-30 people, going on at the same time. We were a group of 10, a mix of couples and groups and it was a lot better. We could hear what mark was saying, we didn't miss anything and we didn't get lost! We had a few people come up asking us where this certain group was as they had got lost along the way.... Not very fun if you ask me!! Would recommend doing the tour and not going to the Red Light Secrets museum which is on the red light district. Red Light Secrets creates a very negative view on the girls and the workings of the red light district, if you want to know the truth, book the Red Light District tour with Mark and Mark only!!!!!!!!!! Will be recommending to anyone going to Amsterdam ☺️☺️ Thanks Mark, we had a great time!! Kirsty and Craig

That dam good! . Great tour. Mark is very knowledge and makes the tour a very personal experience by only taking up to 10 people. I would highly recommend taking it early in your stay in Amsterdam to establish your bearings and great spots to visit/eat.

Took 2 tours in one day and both were excellent.. We visited Amsterdam for 3 days and wanted to make sure that I had an overall view of both the city as well as the RLD. We took the city tour in the morning and also the RLD tour in the evening. Mark did an excellent job on both. He gave some history of the city during the morning tour and pointed out the main highlights and during the evening tour gave a good bit of information on the RLD. It is very nice because he limits the tours to a small group so everyone is able to hear and ask questions freely. Very informative and good job.

Great Tour. We spent time with Mark for his Red Light District Tour. While not the typical tour we do, it was one of the best things we did. The meeting point was easy to find and Mark was easy to find with his orange Pom Pom hat. We were a small group of 6 which made this a very custom and informative tour. While with Mark we saw another tour group that was huge. Based on the topic and area the small group was much better. Mark has a first hand knowledge of the area and has found a way to be factual, interesting and keep an open environment for questions. Mark has done his research and brings up many interesting perspectives on the topics covered in the area. I would highly recommend this tour. It is unique to Amsterdam and done well by Mark. Very reasonably priced and worth the money.

Amsterdam in 3hrs!!. Mark was amazing! In the beginning of the tour he gives you a short history lesson about Amsterdam and then makes his way through the city pointing out the rich history of Amsterdam and explaining their traditions. Mark does a great job of pointing out good places to eat, and attractions to see. He is very personable and the group isn't big, so you can ask as many questions as you'd like.

Great value. Thanks Mark for our thoroughly entertaining 3 hour introduction to the enlightened city of Amsterdam.We left the tour knowing a lot more not just about the history and sights but as importantly the psyche of Amsterdam'ers!

Fantastic walking tour. We just did the City Tour with Mark and think it is a must, especially for newcomers to Amsterdam like ourselves. Mark is a fabulous guide - he really knows his stuff, and is a wonderful communicator: constantly interesting, funny, responsive and informative. The tour gives a great overview of Amsterdam's history and its key neighborhoods and milestones, and brilliantly conveys its spirit - Mark's enthusiasm for the city is highly infectious. Plus he gives a lot of useful tips about good places to see and go afterwards (we did the tour on the first day of our stay and it was really useful in helping us to orient ourselves). The strength of the tour not only derives from Mark's personality and knowledge, but also from the fact that he keeps his groups small and intimate, which meant that he could respond well to our various different interests and questions and didn't need to spend his time shepherding (and counting) us and shouting at the top of his voice to be heard. Seriously, can't recommend this tour highly enough.

Fun evening out. We had a great time with my wife and a bunch of blokes from Essex in the red light district. The brewery at the end was great and the Pizza place amazing. One of the best pizza I have ever had, funny that was in Amsterdam in the red light district. Have to mention though the sex shop shown on the tour was massively over priced compared to another one we visited later and one of the places shown Hospital Club or something like it is a hold out for the laziest strippers and most boring show I have experienced.

Tour with Mark. Having read all great reviews about Mark's tours, I decided to sign up for the Red Light District tour last Saturday and both me and my husband had a blast. Mark is so knowledgeable and funny. He has so much charisma. We learned so many facts from the past, secrets from the current days and plans for the future of this area. He keeps the groups small, as opposed to other tours of 30/40 people. I highly recommend this tour to anyone!
A great introduction to the city and its history. Mark gave us a great tour! We learnt a great deal and there wasnt a question Mark couldnt answer. Highly recommended.

A Must Do!. Mark is an awesome tour guide! We went on his Red Light District tour and he is so knowledgable and gave us a different perspective of the Red Light District with his stories about the women he knows working there. This tour was my favorite part of our trip and I would recommend it as a must-do for anyone visiting Amsterdam!

Get Ready to Meet the Best Dam Guide Ever!. With only a few days to explore Amsterdam, we wanted to hit the ground running (3 adults + 3 teens) and a tour seemed like a good way to get started. We took Mark’s day tour, and had such a fantastic time, we decided to take his Red Light tour (later in the evening) as well. Mark is incredibly knowledgeable and personable, and is an absolute gem of a storyteller. You will be thoroughly entertained! Mark deliberately keeps his groups small. It was well worth paying for the intimacy and maneuverability that a small group allows for (I think he limits his size to 10). He took us into cheese shops and jenevers distilleries for tastings, and showed us secret back-of-the-way places we would have never found on our own. Mark was prepared to provide us with raincoats and p-mates ☺ (we ended up not needing either) and he took us up the steepest hill in Amsterdam!It was cold on the day of our tour. He guided us into a (brown) cafe where we were served the best bowl of split pea soup (full of ham and potatoes) and toasted sandwiches I’ve ever eaten. Mark got us oriented to Amsterdam – historically and politically – and also encouraged us to get to know each other. It was delightful to share conversation and drink beer, and hang out with the members of our group (who were from all over the world). Mark is originally from South Africa, and is quite in touch with of all the cultural and social nuances of the people in this city. ***If you want to see the Red Light District and really understand what you are seeing, do not miss the opportunity to take Mark’s tour. You will be in excellent hands. (We left our teens at home for this tour, but a family with us had a 17 year old and she did just fine.) Mark holds nothing back. He’ll answer all your questions and then answer some you perhaps were embarrassed/afraid to ask. He’s frank and candid with so many fun stories about real people who work in this district, he’s done his research, and collected interesting objects (you’ve got to see to believe!) if only he could replicate himself – every visitor to Amsterdam should take a Red Light tour with Mark. In addition to being a very natty dresser, Mark is clever, funny, likable, good-looking and authoritative. He is highly professional and subtly irreverent. To summarize, I would describe Mark as part Oxford tutor, part Crazy Uncle and part Golden Retriever.I won’t be a spoiler and give away the details, but suffice to say, you will have a GREAT time on either tour. He provides excellent follow-up (on e-mail) if you want further information about anything he’s mentioned. It was simple to sign up for his tour on-line, and he was easily contactable by phone and by e-mail, and was more than happy to help us with practical matters like finding an electrical adaptor, helping us through the ins and outs of locking and stashing our bikes, recommending places to purchase whatever it was we needed whether it was a Chinese food late night snack for our hungry teens, or sex toys, or brownies, he knew where to send us.He asked us not to tip him, but if we enjoyed his tours to please let people know. I am so glad to write this review! I loved this city, and Mark’s tours were truly my favorite things we did in Amsterdam.

Both thumbs up!. Mark is the best tour guide I've ever had. He knows his city extremely well, and he has a gift for telling the stories that make this city's history come alive. Our group included a family from Singapore, a Urugayan, and our group of three Americans. Mark put us all at ease with his wit and friendly manner, and we were soon all chatting together like old friends. We all had so much fun that we signed up for his Red Light district tour the next night. Once again the depth and breadth of his knowledge was impressive, and his great sense of humor was on display as we learned the history and culture of this unique district. I recommend mark's tours to anyone who appreciates history, culture, and wit.

Fantastic guide!. Mark is warm, witty and deeply knowledgeable about Amsterdam. We went on his City tour as well as his Red Light District tour. The groups were small, and it felt like the tours were tailored to our interests; they were definitely one of the highlights of our trip. Questions were encouraged (and fully addressed), nothing felt scripted. I'd wholeheartedly recommend Mark's tours to anyone visiting Amsterdam!

That Dam Guide is Dam Good!!. We were a group of 8 on Cunard's Queen Victoria for the New Year voyage, on 31st Dec we visited Amsterdam and decided to book a private tour rather than those offered by Cunard, well, what a great decision! A quick look on Trip Advisor highlighted 'That Dam Guide' as a potential winner and a quick email exchange made the booking for the last day of the year. Mark met us at the terminal where we were berthed, spot on time and wearing the fetching pom pom that we would grow to love as we toured. Having introduced himself as a South African living in Amsterdam there was obviously a good story behind the change of location and lifestyle which I will leave for him to expound on I will only say it is fascinating and different - well done Mark. However, to the tour - in short it was great, Mark obviously knows his subject and delivers it with a passion born of experience. Do not be put off by the 'walking tour' bit, we were a group of 8 aged 60 - 74, reasonably fit and not a zimmer in sight and managed without any problem, it goes without saying that the route has no hills and coffee/beer breaks can be fitted in whenever required. The route can be be as varied, long or short as you wish and if you have specific sites to visit, for whatever reason, let Mark know, his knowledge seems to be inexhaustible.We covered the city area and then had a great lunch in the Cafe Sonneveld (meat ball recommended) and beer delicious. Then it was off to the Red Light District (RLD) - very educational!!!! Finally we stopped at 'De Prael' a micro brewery located in aforementioned RLD that produced some wonderful (and strong) beers. During the whole tour Mark continued to fill us with information and stories that brought the whole place to life. If I could give it 6 stars I would!

A Wonderful and Informative Tour by Mark. Mark was a great guide and his tour was a wonderful and informative one! I really enjoyed the tour organised by Mark. Thank you Mark for the interesting tour=)
Charmaine

Stress-free Red Light District!. We were a bit hesitant to venture into the famous Red Light District ourselves, so we organised to go with Mark, and I'm very happy we did! Mark is professional yet friendly, and only takes a small group, so you really get a chance to chat and get to know each other. It's also easier for you to see the sites in a small group, rather than the massive ones of about 30 people that go past you. Mark is informative and engaging, and really makes you feel at ease. He also gives you an insider's perspective on how the industry actually runs, having lived above a window in his 20s. It was also really interesting to hear about the politicising of prostitution, which I had no idea about! Afterwards Mark took the majority of the group out for a drink at a local bar, where I think we were the only tourists there! Mark gave us good tips for things to see and do, and also sent us lots of information afterwards. We had a really great time, and I'm sure you will, too.

Terrific introduction to Amsterdam and the Red Light District. This is a long overdue review of the tours we took with Mark. We took the Amsterdam tour in the morning and the Red Light District tour in the evening and really enjoyed both of them. In case you are wondering if there is overlap, there is none. The morning tour was a great overview of Amsterdam, its history and uniqueness plus little gems of information and entertaining facts that Mark sprinkles in throughout the tour. The Red Light District tour is very different but a lot of fun. The amount of information and detail that Mark shared were amazing. If you are looking to pick up some stories to entertain your friends this is the one to go to. You will get a follow up email with the links and some of the stories Mark shares in his tours.

A tour guide that feels more like friend!!!. My mom and I did a tour with Mark and felt like we were with a friend not a guild. Mark did a great job of accommodating one of us who loves history and one who does not. Mark told us many personal stories about his life in Amsterdam and other locals which made our connection and understanding of the city and culture stronger.If possible take a tour with Mark when you first arrive to the city. This will give you a great layout and overview and then you can go from there. I would recommend Mark and his tour to anyone and would definitely book with him again if we are back in Amsterdam.

Best thing we did!. Really enjoyed the tour! So interesting and fun! I am not a huge fan of walking or the idea of tours but it was a highlight of a great weekend in Amsterdam. I am total convert! I would advise to book early and get a tour early, then you can pick the most enjoyable things that Mark mentions to do on your remaining days!

Fun, informative - the best guided tour. Hi, I took the 'That Dam Guide' tour on 25th Dec 2014. I had a great experience. Not only is Mark very knowledgable but also very funny. He made the whole experience a lot of fun. I prefer this anytime in comparison to the big guided tours like Sandeman's where people are herded together like cattle. Mark always had a small group. Infact I liked his Amsterdam day tour so much that I actually requested him if I could also join his Red Light Tour in the evening. Both tours were really good. My trip to amsterdam would not have been so much fun without this trip. Its a nice idea to take this trip in the first few days of your stay as this gives you a very good orientation of the city. Amsterdam is my favourite city in the world and Mark s simply the best tour guide!

Mark Law's tour was outstanding!. I took "That Dam Guide" on a trip end of November 2014. The tour was outstanding, Mark was fun, very knowledgeable, and planned a really interesting and entertaining route for us. This was my first visit to Amsterdam, and at the end of the tour I knew much more about the city and its intimate history than my husband who had been to Amsterdam many times before. I strongly recommend the tour to anyone, whether a first-time visitor or a long-time one. And a big thanks to Mark.

A "Must Do" in Amsterdam. This was one of our best experiences while in Amsterdam. Mark was extremely knowledgable about the city and it's history. You could tell he was speaking from a base of knowledge and not just spouting off facts that someone may gleen off of the internet. His sense of humor only added to the fun. He conducts small tours of ten people which made the interaction with him easier. We stopped mid-way through the tour for a beverage break, which allowed time to ask questions about specific areas of the city we wished to see. The cost of the tour was very reasonable and well worth the value recieved. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting the city.

great intro to Amsterdam. We started our time in Amsterdam with an afternoon tour with Mark. It was the perfect introduction and would recommend it to get an overall feeling of the city. Great stories and good to have someone with local knowledge of this wonderful city. A friend had recommended Mark's tours and we also did the night tour the following day.

Informative, easy-going and fun!. My girlfriend and I did the city walking tour and I would highly recommend it. Mark has an easy-going, fun and informative style and the tour is a great mix of in-depth history, fun facts and trivia. It really inspired me to learn more about Amsterdam. I think it would be particularly useful to do this tour on your first day as Mark is full of useful tips and recommendations. A really nice touch was the way we received an email packed with links to material that came up during the tour. It is obvious that Mark really cares about what he does and has thought carefully about how to deliver the best possible experience.

Don't go to Amsterdam without doing this!. You can get free walking tour guides in Amsterdam, but the groups are massive and they spend half their time trying to sell you things. Better to book with Mark and have a small group, more interaction and a great experience, he is a knowledgable and lovely guy.One of the first things Mark asked us is if we had anywhere to be afterwards in case it took longer... none of us did so our tour lasted much longer than the alloted time. I can't reccommend this tour enough - we had a guide book but this tour was so much more interactive and you could put the history in context and understand so much more about the culture and the way in which things have happened over the years.Mark also took us to a cafe (not the 'special' kind!) and provided tips on where to go and when and marked a map for us where everything was. One of the things that we wanted to do was watch the official NYE fireworks - Mark told us exactly where to stand and we had a great time! He also told us to get to the Anne Frank museum at 8am in the morning (an hour before opening time) to avoid the queue which we did. I think if we hadn't we wouldn't have been able to see it as the queue behind us was immense - we are very grateful for the advice.Mark also sent us an email after the tour with lots of further information on things to do and some links to find out more about amsterdam itself.Overall excellent - don't go to Amsterdam without doing it!

The only choice. Being a bit hesitant to enter the Red light district of my own accord, I felt a suitable way to see and find out more on the district was to use a tour guide. Mark was BRILLIANT! Some of the sights on the RLD tour are quite graphic (which is to be expected) but rather than letting us feign awkwardness mark approached the subject straight on encouraging the whole group to let go a bit and understand the dynamics of the district. the Tour group was very small about 7 of us which made ti even better when we were being followed by groups of 30+ and it allowed your own questions to be answered! We all went to the pub afterwards and was a good chat! He is so knowledgable and you will deffo come out having learnt more.

Fantastic tour guide. I went on 2 walking tours with Mark in November- the City Tour and the Red Light District Tour. He was highly recommended by a friend from home. Both tours were fantastic. Mark is very knowledgeable of the history and culture of Amsterdam-places, people and sites. He was very engaging and personable. He tailored the tours to the size and makeup of the group. I learned a lot about the city in a very fun and informative way. I highly recommend his tours.

Dam Good. Mark provides a customized tour he adapts on the fly based on the groups interests. He provides real insight into why things are the way they are in Amsterdam including the politics, drugs, sex trade and history in an engaging yet informative manner. Far from your average "cookie-cutter" walking tour, he does hit the main sites and provides enough anecdotes and personal tidbits to keep everyone engaged. I would definitely recommend his tour for those looking to maximize their investment of time in learning more about Amsterdam history and attractions.

Insightful, Intelligent, Passionate. We decided to go on the daytime city tour with Mark following amazing trip advisor reviews, we certainly were not disappointed! He's wonderfully insightful, gave lots of amazing advice and recommendations and unlike a lot of tours, took us to places that he genuinely enjoyed and knew were good, as opposed to places that pay tour guides to take people there (everyone who tours must have experienced this!! Annoying!!) We had such a lovely time with him and were also able to ask loads of questions which is really handy if you want to see specific things, he really does know the place inside and out and is incredibly passionate about what he does. Mark also sends you lots of helpful emails, sadly I was not able to view whilst I was there (due to outlook, couldn't view any emails whilst there) but am saving so that I can use next time I visit.Would whole heartedly recommend this tour!!! :)

Great. After doing a large group tour of the city in the afternoon it was refreshing to join a much smaller red light tour in the evening with Mark. He has a real passion for the place and gave us a great insight into the culture, people in the area. He also made the effort to take photos for us (and emailed them to us after the tour) and took us to a great little pub following the tour which was nice. Highly recommended.

Best Guide in Amsterdam. Massive thanks to Mark! We went on his tour as we decided that doing the rld by ourselves was a little sleevy and might as well learn something at the same time and Mark had the best reviews by a long way, and all I can say is he's earned them. The tour was just the right mix of informative, funny, shocking and sex filled as you would hope. He seems to know everyone and everything about the rdl and clearly cares about it and the girls working there. Overall I can't recommend the tour enough.

Excellent tour - the best in Amsterdam. Since going on the tour with Mark, I have since been comparing his knowledge and overall tour experience to other tour companies in Amsterdam - he is truly the best if you want a truthful, insightful and intimate understanding of the real Amsterdam. Really enjoyed learning about the ancient and modern history of Amsterdam, plus local tips on where to eat and explore. Once you go Mark, you never go Grayline.

Great day in Amsterdam. thanks to Mark!Though it was raining we enjoyed a great walk and I took a lot of information together with funny stuff and insider tipps on Amsterdam. Thumbs up, I highly recommend the tour!

Top tour, Top Guy, Highly Recommend. We really enjoyed Mark's tour. He is a warm, intelligent, engaging man who provides a fabulous insight to a great city. We had a totally international, group of 9 - I believe 10 is the max for these tours and that is perfect. Mark ensures a real authentic tour, clearly loves the city and has a respect for the city, it's people, it's workers and it's history that is totally sincere and provides an informative and interesting insight delivered with an engaging sense of humour.He clearly approaches each tour with flexibility responding to what comes up from his group. We learned lots and am sure saw and experienced many things that we would never had done had we explored alone or on a more commercial tour with a big group. This was a fabulous three hours, we never felt rushed and felt like we gained a real insight into Amsterdam life, topped off with a fantastic local pea and ham soup at the street market and an introduction to Winkles and their infamous Apple Pie and Cream, the highlight of our weekend - so good we went back on Sunday.Well done Mark, you are doing a great job and we cant recommend your tour highly enough.

Perfect Way To Start A City Break In Amsterdam. We went on the City Tour on Saturday the 13th of December. The tour was amazing and the perfect way to start a city break in Amsterdam - ideal for getting your bearings and learning about the city. Mark provides a perfect balance between a knowledgeable tour and one that is amusing and entertaining to go on. Below are key points about the tour:1) An average rating of 4.96 / 5 from over 450 reviews shows that you are getting a great tour.2) Mark limits the groups to a maximum of 10 so you get a personal tour that is tailored to the group's interests.3) A 10.30 start and approximately 13.30 finish make it the perfect activity to start your trip leaving you plenty of time during the remainder of the day.4) The tour isn't too short / long and breaks are well managed so you aren't exhausted and can enjoy the tour.5) Mark is able to recommend from firsthand experience the best attractions to visit, places to eat, etc.6) Instead of getting commissions from these recommendations Mark asks that people who go on his tour get discounts.Overall, this is an awesome tour and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who visits Amsterdam.

Informative, funny, fascinating. We really enjoyed the tour with Mark, who kept things fresh and interesting whilst being informative and thorough, but never dull or preachy . Great value, highly recommended .

Red light district. Loved our tour with Mark. We only had eight in the group as opposed to 30 in other groups we saw. We saw things we would not have known about on our own and learnt a lot about the sex workers.Mark was very informative and a lot of fun. I particularly liked the respect he showed the workers .

Awesome Day despite rain.. We came close to missing the tour because the address I put in google gave me a location around the corner. Luckily we found the group and have an great time and day despite really bad weather. Mark is basically a walking Wikipedia! I've been to Amsterdam over 12 times visiting my friends who live there but had never taken a tour like this. Despite thinking I know a good bit about Amsterdam my knowledge was minute compared to Mark!!!! He even had ponchos for the group which was extremely thoughtful since many in the group were unprepared to spend the day in driving wind and rain. I would recommend this tour to everyone, even people who grew up in the region!

Great Fun!. My girlfriend and I took this tour our first morning in Amsterdam. Neither of us had been to the city before, and we were hoping the tour would provide an informative introduction to the city. Despite pouring rain, the tour was a ton of fun! Mark (the tour guide) provided a huge amount of information on the city, most of it quirky and interesting. The small size of the group and the informal nature of the tour also made the experience feel more like hanging out with a group of people in Amsterdam rather than a formulaic tour, which is what I'd imagine many of the larger company tours to be like. There was plenty of opportunity to talk to Mark personally and get to know the others in the group. Highly recommend!
