Best DAM guide for the RLD. Mark runs a great tour , he is respectful and knowledgable about the area, it's history and offers insight into the workers experiences . I would recommend Marks tours to everyone that visits

Despite rain, wind and cold... the most fun and informative tour ever!. We loved the tour with Mark and learned so much more than we expected, particularly about Amsterdam history, sociology and political culture. This is not a cookie cutter tour of buildings, canals and squares. Because we were a small group we could each get our questions answered and had pleasant interaction with everyone in the group. Also personally important for me was that I could HEAR everything Mark said. It was especially lovely to have two extended cafe stops for refreshments and to warm up. Very enjoyable time, and great referral to Da Portare Via for pizza lunch. Yum! Highly recommend not to miss the best Dam guide.

Great tour!. This was such a blast and one of my favorite parts of my visit to Amsterdam. Mark knows so much about this city, its culture, and its history. I love that he shared important history about Amsterdam, but also fun and quirky information. We had a small group of 8 people, so it was a great size for the tour. Its worth the money and a lovely way to see the city.

Best DAM Guide Ever!. We decided to book Mark's Red Light District Tour for Saturday night and we were definitely not disappointed. Mark is very informative, humorous, and just plain great at his job. I really appreciated the small group atmosphere (there were 6 of us on the group and Mark tries to keep it under 10 at all times) especially when we saw several other tour groups of at least 30 people. I could imagine that it was very uncomfortable to be in those large groups around the throngs of people on the street and the small sidewalks in the district. Mark provided great insight and perspective on the history and current state of sex work in Amsterdam and he showed us specific things to note in the RLD that we again visited the next day. He also took the time to have a few drinks with us after the tour and answer the bevy of questions that we had. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip so if you are ever in Amsterdam, don't forget to book a tour with the Best Dam Guide!

A must to know Amsterdam beyond a map. Mark showed us the city from a different point of view. We learnt simple but interesting things from the past in politics, medicine, ... to the present. And good to be small group. Indeed worth it the price and time !!!!

Great stuff!. We had a really good time with Mark this morning. We were a multicultural group, but this posed no problems and he made us all feel welcome. Most of us ended up having some street food at the market with him. He is a mine of information and happy to answer any questions and make relevant recommendations. His site is also full of good tips. Above all, his honesty and love for the city shines through. I really recommend him for a great way to learn about this lovely city.

Fun and informative!. My wife and I had a wonderful time with Mark and thoroughly enjoyed our tour of Amsterdam! Mark was full of interesting stories and facts about the history of the city and of all the places we visited. His website is also full of priceless tips about restaurants and places to hang out and see in the city! I would absolutely recommend this to anyone who is new to the city but also to those that have been before as I guarantee you will learn a lot of new things!

Great Tour of the Dam. A big thank you to you Mark!A super friendly guide with lots of little stories and facts to share. Mark filled the 2.5 hours with lots of info about the scity and kept me entertained. What I love also is that his groups are limited to a small number.. 10 I think, which makes it a more intimate tour where you don't feel rushed to keep up and there is plenty of space to ask questions. Mark is not pushy, nor is he tied in with any establishments to get us in there and spend our money. He genuinely loves to share his city with us. I have lived here for a number of years and I learned loads and got to know the city all over again. I am now full of new ideas where to take my friends and family when they visit.Thank you!

Awesome guide!. I'm gonna keep it short because it's just so simple. Amsterdam will be Amsterdam no matter what tour you take, but the tour guide makes all the difference on whether you enjoy it or not. In this case, the right mix of history, comedy and nice tips and places to visit make Mark an awesome tour guide. It's an awesome tour to begin your stay in amsterdam.

Well Worth the Time. We took the Amsterdam city tour with Mark in November 2014. When travelling we like to start our visits to a city with a guided tour. It helps orient us and plan the rest of the visit. Most guided tours we have taken are good, some terrible and some excellent. Mark's tour is in the excellent category.
Very Good Tour. Very good tour, very informative and interesting, tour guide was great. My first time in Amsterdam and felt it was a great introduction to the city, the culture, and the history.

Dam good activity in Amsterdam. my wife and I spent this evening during the red light district of Amsterdam. I had visited the area twice before but never with the guide and found this experience to be way way more interesting. Mark is really knowledgeable of the area and of the business of prostitution, and he helped us have a much better appreciation of this industry and the community within Amsterdam. I highly recommend him to visitors as a guide.

Excellent guide and tour!. We really enjoyed the tour of the RLD with Mark. It was the perfect mix of information and entertainment. It was all based on Mark's experiences living in the RLD, getting to know the women working in the windows and his own research. My partner had been to the RLD several times before and learned a lot more on the tour than we ever could have in a book. You can't go wrong with this tour! Well worth the time and money.

Excellent Guide. We went on Mark's Red Light District tour. He was very personable, knowledgeable, and humorous. He shared firsthand experiences from living in the Red Light District himself, as well as stories relayed to him by the women who worked in the area. He is passionate and dedicated to what he does and does so in a manner that is respectful to the women that work in the Red Light District. We really enjoyed that the group was small so that we could focus on what he was saying, as well as navigate through the streets together as a group. After the tour, he provided us with additional information and websites, which were fascinating and informative. He goes above and beyond the expectations of a guide - a true model for guides to follow. When visiting Amsterdam again, we will definitely attend his other tour.

RLD Tour - Captivating and fun!. We went on Mark Law's tour of the Red Light District on a Saturday night.The tour lasted roughly 1.5 hours and was an informative, yet a light-hearted fun way to explore the RLD and learn more about Amsterdam in general and the Red Light trade there.Mark was a very pleasant, friendly guide. The tour was made more personal by only allowing small group numbers and having personal photos taken on the tour. Without going on the tour, we wouldn't have discovered gems that lie within the RLD. However, the tour was short enough to be able to explore at your own pace after the tour had finished.I would definitely recommend Mark's tours if you want to learn more about Amsterdam in a fun and friendly group!

A Slice of Warmth on a Chilly Day. It was a tad chilly the day we took our tour with That Dam Guide. We still had a wonderful experience learning all about the history and present of Amsterdam during our Saturday morning tour. This was our first visit to Amsterdam so we wanted to learn as much as we couldand we walked away very satisfied. That Dam Guide really knows his stuff and passes along the information with humor and excitement. So glad we made the choice to join his tour.

Brilliance under a fuzzy cap. Mark - that Dam Guide. I took to him immediately; what a lovely chap.Mark gives an amazing rundown of the Red Light district - his firsthand experiences living there, personal anecdotes and stories from the ladies working in the district, and his passion for the history and economic / sociographic / demographic of the Red Light district makes him the perfect person to take you around on a very personal tour.I was lucky to have only another couple on my tour, so Mark zipped us around the place showing off the juiciest bits of the District. We laughed plenty with his stories of the old, young, and cheeky women working in the area. If you're looking for a shallow tour and gawking at scantily dressed ladies of negotiable affection, this isn't it - Mark knows more about the history and nuances of the area than any of those other free tours.He's also a foodie - fantastic recommendations on drinks and eats in Amsterdam (btw Mark I went for the Chinese restaurant - the Lamb Roti was just the thing I needed).Trust me - go with Mark. He knows.

That Dam Guide Is Good!. This was my first time in Amsterdam. What a treat to have such an eloquent, knowledgeable guide to present the history of the town - all the way to the present day with its civilized forward-thinking inhabitants. To my surprise, Amsterdam is classy. I felt comfortable and liberated walking around town. I did not see a policeman anywhere!A few weeks after we got home, thinking about Mark's presentation, I realized what a special presenter he is. He captured my complete attention for the entire 2½ hour tour, despite the cool and windy October weather. My wife and I can proudly say that we have made a friend in Amsterdam and it's on our lost of places to re-visit.We highly recommend anyone planning to visit Amsterdam to take one of Mark's tour. He lays out facts with a flare and humor, whether your interests are in art, architecture, history, drugs and/or the sex industry. Or just like us – we just wanted to get our bearings and some sense of the city. We got more than we bargained for. Dam, what a guide!

Great in depth and fun tour of Amsterdam. Mark Law is a wonderful tour guide. He really knows Amsterdam past and present. It is a great way to get to know the city in a whole new way. He is entertaining, fun and helped us understand what makes this city unique.Bravo!
Excellent, do it!. Really enjoyed the tour, gives whole new perspective and understanding to the area and the girls. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend

an interesting and funny way to discover the red ligth district. We had booked the red light district tour with Mark on saturday evening. We spent a very interesting and funny time!Mark knows very well the quarter and its inhabitants and small stories are mixed with the story of the neighborhood. From erotic stories to current issues with immigration and the place of the prostitution in the society, Mark gives you al lthe faces of the red light disctrict. He has got a delighted sense of humour and he is really respectful!Do not expect a tour in a formal manner. It is more!do not hesitate!

Insightful and good value City tour on foot. Mark's tour gave us a good insight into what makes Amsterdam the city it is today. He has a wealth of knowledge of Amsterdam past and present and shares this with ease, inviting questions throughout the 2.5 hour course of the tour.He obviously loves his adopted city and this shows through in his presentation.You learn about the geography, the architecture, the commerce, the infrastructure and what it is that makes the city tick. He deals sensitively and respectfully when presenting the facts surrounding Amsterdam's more liberal attitudes and leaves you wanting to know more about this fascinating city. He mixes all this with genuine pointers to the best restaurants, food shops and markets and follows up with some good links for further reading.Highly recommended.

Awesome tour . Such a funny tour guide and knows many of the important people who are influential in the red light district. He will give you a perspective that is unique and one you can only get on his tours. Definitely take this tour!

Great tour. We took the City tour with Mark this morning and would highly recommend for those who like to avoid mass tourism especially in a busy and highly touristic city such as Amsterdam. Mark is knowledgeable, gave us a lot of history and information about the city and country, answered our questions and since he only takes small groups (10 or less, we were 8) we felt he was there for us.

A Must Do Tour of Amsterdam. We booked this tour from home about 2 months before we arrived in Amsterdam. Mark is a fantastic tour guide. He is knowledgeable, personable and honest about his beloved Amsterdam. I was afraid he would be more suited for younger people because we are in our mid 60's, but I have to say we thoroughly enjoyed this tour from start near the Red Light District to finish in the Jordaan Market area 3 hours later. This is the way I like to learn (or relearn) history! There were 9 in our group, ranging in age from the 20's to another couple in their 60's. Everyone was attentive and asking questions. The older couple had been on Marks RLD Tour the night before and said how much they enjoyed it. So my husband and I tried to sign up for Marks RLD Tour for that night. Sorry to say there were already 10 people registered. Mark sticks to 10 people max. Be sure to book in advance so you will not be disappointed as we were. So, do not hesitate to book these tours, you will happy you did. I loved Amsterdam! And thanks Mark for the follow up email with links to Netherlands/Holland info. Very interesting. Did I say I love Amsterdam!?!
Excellent Guidance. very personal tour.very knowledgeable regarding almost all questions.recommendations have prooven very valuable.

Outstanding tour with amazing, impassioned insights.. We booked both Mark's city and red light district tours, and hugely enjoyed the time we spent with him. The morning city tour is a fabulous way to get your bearings if you're unfamiliar with Amsterdam, and we both felt we knew not only the background and history of the city far better after the tour, but also had a greater awareness of the geography of the city centre as well. Mark loves his history, and we loved his passionate discourse on the birth of the city, and its place in European culture to the modern day. It was great to have a small group where we could always hear him, and easily chat and ask questions if we wanted. We saw some of the so called 'free tours' marching around the city at the same time as us, and just didn't feel like we'd have got the same from a tour with 40 other people! There's very little crossover with the red light district tour, and we found it equally interesting and above all a lot of fun! Mark is always ready to share an interesting anecdote, and particularly his impassioned opinions about the red light district, having lived there for a while, and got to know many of the local characters. Hugely recommend either or both of these tours if you're going to be in town.

Interesting n Fun!. Following the hat with the orange pom pom was a fun way to get to see the Red light district at Amsterdam. Mark was remarkable with the stories and provided the history of the red light district in an entertaining manner. The group was small (10 people) making it easy to hear him and take our time at each location.

Fantastic tour. Very much enjoyed this city tour with Mark. He is very knowledgeable and does know a 1000 stories about Amsterdam from its early days centuries ago. We therefore learnt not only about architecture but also how Amsterdam developed into what it is today.Total tour time was 3+ hours as Mark took lots of time to answer our questions and share interesting stories.Would always book again!

Fantastic tour with Mark. We booked Mark's City Tour and had a great time. We flew in early that morning and decided this tour would be a great way to get our bearings.Mark is very quirky and infomative. He also gave us some great suggestions for our time in Amsterdam.We wouldn't hestitate to recommend That Dam Guide.

Start your Amsterdam stay with this tour.. Mark is a one man business and clearly has put a lot of thought into how he wants his tour to be unique and different. You'll learn about history, how Amsterdam "works". and other must do places to visit, eat, and experience. He keeps the tours small to allow provide enough time for everyone to get their questions answered. This was a great way to start our visit and used many of Mark's recommendations afterwards. Must do!

Red light district!. Mark shares incredible knowledge and passion into his tour. History of prostitution, politics, personalities, locations, behaviors,... Mark turns the "red light district" into an "enlightenment experience"! We recommend this tour to anyone who's looking for something truly exciting. Thank you Mark :-)

amazing tour of Amsterdam. Mark is a wonderful tour guide he is totally informative fun full of energy and gives you the best tour ever Mark obviously studied the history of Amsterdam as there was not a question he could not answer . He showed us fun places to eat and recommended other sights we needed to see. Mark did not worry about time he actually went over the amount of time the tour was suppose to take. If you are traveling to Amsterdam you definitely need to hire Mark you will not be disappointed.

Great overview of Amsterdam!. Mark knows so much about Amsterdam, and you can tell he does a lot of research to be the best. He talks to people, goes on other tours and basically is an amazing guide. He give a lot of historical info about the buildings and places you visit, which is great. It was raining and cold on our tour, but I couldn't believe how fast our 2 hours went! Definitely would recommend Mark.

Funny and informative Tour! . Thanks so much, my friend and me had a great time listening to your stories. Loved the restaurants you recommended. Apple pie as well as pizza place. He took so much time and even extended the tour to answer individual questions.

Outstanding Guide - Really knows Amsterdam. While Mark is known as the go-to guide for modern Amsterdam, he is also a gifted racounteur on the intrigues of the Golden Age, the foundation of the VOC and what happened where in Amsterdam regarding the early development of the modern market economy (it all started here). You might not get this from his marketing materials, but he has a tremendous amount of information about what was going on here 400 years ago, and what is still standing that relates to it. Oh, and as several other reviewers noted, he does know all the best places to eat.

An authentic experience. Mark is an amazing guide with a very authentic and honest approach. His tour give you a better understanding of Amsterdam, it's history and current way of life. He is a great story teller and have spent a lot of time and energy doing proper research. He will so advise you on good places to eat, drink, visit and he is extremely helpful and polite. I strongly recommend the Mark experience.

Excellent Guide and Tours. We did both the RLD and city tours with Mark. He is a professional who was there on time and worked with one couple who had a taxi driver take them to a different part of the city. Both tours were very informative. He covers a lot of territory, especially in the city tour, so be prepared for some walking. I was most impressed with the way he listened to the questions and made subtle adjustments to the tour, e.g., stopping by the Dutch West Indies Company when one indicated she had family who had worked for them. He than helped us find a good restaurant for a late lunch.
Red Light District Tour. Met with Mark for a Friday evening tour of the Red Light District - Mark is a fantastic guide - an insight into a completely different world - highly recommend

Great tour to start our holiday in Amsterdam. Wonderful tour. Mark knows his way around Amsterdam and I loved the way he helped us understand the history of the city while engaging us with his humor and intelligence. He gave us suggestions on the best places to eat, drink and the tours that we might enjoy the most along with tips on the best times to go to different attractions. I appreciated the time and attention he gave our group. He keeps his tours small on purpose so that he can have more intimate conversations and get everyone involved. Thank you, Mark. It is an ideal way to begin a vacation
Very unusual tour.. We really enjoyed the tour. A small group (7 people), a lot of new information submited in a funny way, a lot of tips for other attractions in Amsterdam. I really recomend.

Excellent City & Red Light District Walking Tour. I did both the city and red light district tour with Mark (and his orange pompom!).Mark is an excellent tour guide that is very knowledgeable and humorous. He provides a very informative tour that covers topic related to Amsterdam that covers from politics, history, cultural, food, etc. (too many to name all!). One more plus point: the tour groups are organized in small group size (10 person max), where you are able to have his undivided attention and can just throw him with any question.

A wonderful tour of beautiful Amsterdam. My husband and I went on the city tour with Mark at the start of our long weekend in Amsterdam. What a wonderful tour it was! Mark is a knowledgeable, engaging and funny guide and we thoroughly enjoyed our 3 hour tour around the city with him - we enjoyed endless good views and learning lots about the city's colorful history as well as lots of random (and fun) facts and stories! I would recommend this tour to anyone without hesitation!

Good, Insightful Tour!. The Red Light District Tour was fascinating. Anyone can walk through the district, but this tour includes social insight and information that really adds to the experience.With a small group, ark gives personal attention to all questions and comments.David

Amazing walking tour!. I did the Red Light District tour. It was extremely fun and also very interesting and informative. Mark has many facts and stories about the Red Light District that he tells in an engaging and comical way. I HIGHLY recommend this tour.

Fantastic!. We took both the City Tour and Red Light Tour with Mark on the same day. The City Tour lasted roughly 3 hours and was extremely interesting. The Red Light tour lasted about 2 hours and was a lot of fun! Mark is an engaging story-teller and knows just about everything there is to know about Amsterdam and its history. He added background information to the sites and provided a local perspective on Amsterdam's culture. Afterwards, we all went to a great brewery for fantastic beer! I learned so much more than I could read in a guidebook and enjoyed the opportunity to ask questions along the way. Groups are kept small so that everyone has a chance to follow along and engage with Mark. His website is also packed with great tips and information! We had a great time with That Dam Guide!

The BEST Walking Tour!. We took the City Tour and the Red Light District Tour. I definitely recommend both! Mark is both really knowledgeable about the city and super friendly. He takes his time to answer questions and take pictures for you. He has a lot of great facts and secrets that you probably won't find in other tours. The groups are small so you never feel like you missed anything. He has a passion for his tours so you know that you are getting good, genuine information. I HIGHLY recommend both tours.

excelent. Mark is wonderful - interesting, knowledgeable and with a real service talent.He was able to pass over a huge amount of information in a concise and interesting way.He is very sensitive to the groups needs and is willing to make changes along the way accordinglyMost important ' at least till now he only guides small groups which allows a much more intimate tourloved it and highly recommend ! start your trip with this tour!

Excellent and a lot of fun. We just came back from a five-day visit of Amsterdam, and booked Mark's tour in advance for our second day. It was great! Mark was very friendly, knew a lot, and really gave us a "full taste of the city". The groups are small, and it is easy to follow him, He is full of good tips and suggestions, and is willing to answer every question you have. Time flew and we didn't even notice how, and were really sorry that the tour was over. We had not booked Mark's other tour of the Red Light District thinking we would not be interested, after the first tour with him we changed our mind but it was too late and were sorry about it (when we tried to book, they were fully booked already), We took this tour because of the recommendations on Tripadvisor, and did not regret it. It was great!

Excellent and highly recommended!. Very insightful, interesting, and fun guide; I'd advise you to start your stay in Amsterdam with the city tour as we did, and couple it with a Red Light Tour an evening (it was fully booked unfortunately for us... next time ;)). Note Mark can give you some discounts on a few services such as massage or local cheese tasting. Highly recommended!

The BEST Amsterdam Walking Tour. HOWFUN! A thorough and thoroughly enjoyable 3 hour tour without a shipwreck! Mark gave in-depth answers to a HUGE range of questions to 10 lucky people smart enough to book HIS tour instead of the big guys. Hip, smart as a whip, fun, kind and oh-so informative. He quickly picks up on the make-up of the diverse little group and makes sure everyone stays caught up. Recommended as the first thing (or close to it) that you do after you arrive to fully appreciate Amsterdam. History, Canals, water management, architecture, religion, markets, the Amsterdam Stock Exchange, the royal Family, taxis, CHEESE, Beer, Cannibis, Red Light District, Wars, 80 year, WWII...is that enough?! We were fascinated the entire time, and rewarded with an earned ending stop at the market, followed by Winkel 43 apple pie. Thank you, Mark, for the wonderful morning!

Perfect Way to Spend Part of Your Day. Knowing nothing about Amsterdam, my husband and I booked this tour to learn more about the city. We were very pleased! The guide was incredibly knowledgeable, even changing the tour to focus on parts of the city people were interested in learning about. He knew answers to every question and every story he told was incredibly interesting. We would have done his Red Light tour but it was fully booked! I highly recommend That Dam Guide!

RLD Uncovered. Mark is an extremely knowledgeable guide who provided a fascinating insight into the Red Light District. The small group was perfect and at all times he was respectful to both the girls and patrons in the area. What could have been a tacky evening turned into something that was fun, interesting and educational.... Don't go anywhere else, if you can get a space on one of Mark's tours don't miss the opportunity, you won't regret it....

Great Day of Amsterdam. We did Mark's tour for the City and Red Light District. Mark combines history with interesting anecdotes about Amsterdam for a great tour. He was very helpful in guiding us to other spots we might want to see during our visit. Would highly recommend - was some of the best money we spent on our trip.

Great Red Light District Tour. We had a great time with Mark on our tour. This was our second Red Light District Tour (we did one with another company as Mark's was full) and this one was by far the better option. He made the tour fun and extremely informative. There were only 8 of us in the group which made it more enjoyable and we ever grabbed a beer with him after the tour. It was a great time, definitely highly recommended!
Fantastic tour! Best time ever!. Mark is a fantastic guide, we learned so much during his tour and had lots of fun. Even our baby enjoyed the tour! Thank you Mark for a great time!

A great tour of Amsterdam's Red Light District. Frankly, we didn't know what to expect when we made a reservation for Mark Law's evening tour of the Red Light District, but based on the TripAdvisor reviews for Mark, we booked it a month in advance of our trip. And we're glad we did - Mark did an outstanding job of presenting the color, the culture, the details of what go on in the district today and in the past, and the social perspective on legalized prostitution. Take the tour early in your visit ... it's definitely allowed us to look at the Amsterdam street world from a different perspective through the balance of our visit. Mark was a lot of fun and informative ... a great combo!

great way to see amsterdam. We spent the whole morning with Mark getting to know the ins and outs of Amsterdam. Mark is very knowledgeable and is a great storyteller. What's also nice is it doesn't feel like one of those scripted tours where the guide has ready made answers and jokes or the ones that shepard you around on an exactly timed route. The group is small enough so he can relate to the different questions and interests of the participants, and you can see him determining the route to take advantage of the best things that might be happening that morning. The tour was supposed to end at 1.30 but we continued till after 2 pm, after he made sure none of us were in a rush anywhere.I can highly recommend this as a really good way to get to know the city before you go exploring on your own! Enjoy!

Excellent RLD Tour. . We took the Red light district tour with Mark on Fri 3rd Oct. We have been to Amsterdam a couple of times in the past and always wanted to know a little bit more about the history of the RLD. So on this trip we booked the 2 hour RLD tour with Mark based on his excellent Trip Advisor reviews. Mark provides a fantastic insight into the area and the girls who work there. His tour is done at a good pace with plenty of time to stand and take in the atmosphere. The size of the group was perfect (max 10 people) which works well on the crowded streets of the RLD. The stories, facts and history that Mark talks about are all delivered with passion and clearly well researched or from first hand experience. Overall a very well organised, factually interesting tour delivered with great humour by a gentleman who is passionate about what he does. Thank you Mark.

Great Way to Explore Amsterdam. My wife and I read about Mark's tours and booked it their reviews. We were not disappointed. The morning tour was a walk though the history and culture by this amazing city through Mark's creative narration. It was the highlight of our stay there. That evening we took the Red Light District tour which was just as amazing. He explained the ins and outs,excuse the pun, on this exotic area of the city which takes on it's own persona at night. Mark apply she own special touches that make this a joy. Thanks Mark.

Good insight into the life in Amsterdam. We took the walking city central tour with Mark. It was an interesting day seeing the different aspects of the City. He was very informative and helpful in giving us information on other things we wanted to do in Amsterdam. He gives you great insight as to the personality of this interesting City. Thanks Mark for a great morning.

Fun and informative. We took this tour on our last night in Amsterdam. It was a great conclusion to wonderful city. Mark is the perfect tour guide for the RLD. He is very informative, and you learn a lot, but his irreverence at times makes you laugh, and so the tour was fun. He is very respectful of the women that work here and he conveys to you who they are. It certainly is not the normal walking tour, but one of the most memorable. Money well spent.

A really great tour by a wonderful guide.. My husband and I took Mark's 3 hour walking tour of Amsterdam in late September. Mark was on time and easy to find (with his distinctive hat). Greeted us with a smile and was a wealth of information for our first time in Amsterdam. We both highly recommend using Mark if you are going to want someone to who knows the city inside and out and can relate all of that in a way that you will thoroughly enjoy.

The Reviews Are Spot On!. Did Mark's RLD Tour on Saturday night at end of September, the reviews provide all relevant detail. So without wishing to repeat previous detail, I'll endorse that this walking tour comes highly recommended, is great value and ideal that it's conducted as a small group size, a maximum of 10 people, as Saturday was really busy. Mark is very knowledgeable and the 2 hour duration from 7pm is well-paced. You won't be disappointed and Mark provides an opportunity to experience the RLD from a slightly different yet very informative way.

Top Tour. Me and my boyfriend travelled to Amsterdam for the first time on Friday night. We had booked onto the city tour on Saturday morning and thank god we did! It was the best way to get our bearings of the streets and know where to go. We were so impressed with Marks knowledge and passion about the country and areas. It really added to our trip. With it being such a small group the tour is a lot more personal and you get to know Mark and the people on your tour. He is just a genuine, nice guy who loves his job and makes it enjoyable for everyone!

RLD and City Tours. My husband and I took the Red Light District Tour on Friday and absolutely loved it! His love and knowledge of the city were clearly evident! He was a remarkable tour guide and our expectations were easily exceeded! After the RLD tour, we were super excited we had signed up for the City tour the next day. Walking through Amsterdam (without the tour) would have been nice, but Mark's City tour allowed us to appreciate the beauty and history of Amsterdam! I would highly recommend these tours to anyone visiting the city! In fact, after returning to our hotel after the RLD tour, we recommended it to someone we ran in to at dinner! A+++++!

Red Light District "Correct Information" Tour. We found Mark from the No.1 Activities in Amsterdam @Trip Advisor and joined his Red Light District tour, and yes, it was truly a nice, humorous and very informative experience! His behind the scenes knowledge of the sex industry and some of the sex workers there provided us with a better understanding and the difficulties these workers face daily. Throughout the tour we were constantly reminded to respect the sex workers by not taking photos of them which we find very commendable. I highly recommend this tour to everyone who is planning a trip to Amsterdam. 10/10 rating for Mark!

Worth a second visit!. Last year I was in Amsterdam for a weekend and, by a chance encounter, took Mark's tour of the Red Light District on my first night. I enjoyed it so much that my friends and I attended his Day Tour the following day. Upon returning to Amsterdam this summer, I assured my travel mate that our first priority needed to be finding Mark. We were unable to catch his day excursion, but we made it just in time to attend his unforgettable tour of the Red Light District (for what would be a second viewing in my case). Since I was last there, Mark has struck out on his own as an independent guide and I was curious to see how his tour had changed. Two things struck me. First, I was in awe at how Mark's tour had evolved to reflect new developments in the city. It is clear he is always researching and adding new anecdotes and facts to best reflect and connect todays Amsterdam with the Amsterdam of the past. Second, I was amazed at how many of the old stories I still remembered. Mark's delivery is that of a man who truly loves his city and as such, he winds an immersive narrative that will stick with you long after you leave. If you wish to explore the Amsterdam beneath the surface and, if your as lucky as I am, make a friend, I highly suggest this tour.

Absolutely wonderful. We visited Amsterdam back in late June. Mark gave us a great in depth overview of everything Netherlands and absolutely everything Amsterdam. Marks tour was informative, educational, interesting, humourous and brilliantly delivered. 5/5 Recommend highly!!!!

Red Light District Tour. We took Mark's Red Light District Tour on our first night in Amsterdam. In addition to being a lot of fun, the tour was very informative about Amsterdam's most famous profession, sex workers. As Americans, we have stereotypes about prostitution, which is mostly illegal. Mark sheds a very different light on this profession and presents the pros and cons of it's legality. His presentation was very respectful of the workers and he was adamant about the people on the tour being respectful, as well (no photos of the workers in the windows). If you are interested in seeing the Red Light District (not for prudes), Mark's tour is a great way to see it with a very informed, fun and knowledgeable guide.

A Fantastic All-Round Tour. Marks tour is everthing you want a tour to be. Informative, educational, interesting, humourous and brilliantly delivered.The tour is deliberately capped at 10 people, so you get to discuss things as a group with Mark3 hours and 15 € very well spent. Thanks again Mark, stay No 1 on Trip Advisor....Best regardsEva and Gary

A very nice tour. After reading these fantastic reviews and I decided to have both tours offered by Mark and I'm glad I did that. I agree with other reviewers that Mark is indeed very knowledgable. My tours were private. We were a group of old and young. Mark was flexible and had the tours tailored to our own pace. He also managed to find us toilets in various places. The Chinese restaurant recommended by Mark was fantastic and authentic. Later I was informed that the chef was from Hong Kong thus that explained. Mark also recommended us his favorite pizza place and the pizzas were delicious. The tours were marginally more expensive when compared to other "free" tours but IMHO the money was well spent.

Informative Red Light District Tour. Mark provides a very straightforward look of the red light district. He takes you to the various shops selling sex objects, the windows displaying the girls in the red light windows and the various clubs and shows offering varying degrees of sexual entertainment. He works hard at being a knowledgeable and honest tour guide and is very protective of the red light district workers. If you want to learn more about the red light district you can't go wrong with this tour.

That Dam Guide is Dam Great!. My husband and I took two tours with Mark in one day, the first being his general overview of the City, and his second being his evening Red Light District Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed both of them, and found Mark to be extremely knowledgeable, personable, and insightful. He's a really nice guy, and he brings his love and understanding of the City, its residents, its history and its politics to the forefront. Particularly interesting to me was how he approaches the Red Light District Tour -- he handles the subject with a good deal of humor, but also with a great deal of compassion and understanding and humanity. He used to live in the neighborhood (above one of the windows), and he knows some of these girls well. He neither condones nor condemns, but he does shed light on a pretty unique area. At the end of the day tour, he invited all of us to join him for the best apple pie in Amsterdam at Winkel (and it really was!), and my husband and I joined him. It was a lot of fun spending a little extra time with him and learning even more about the city, but also about him and his tour-guiding business. And after the evening Red Light District Tour, he invited that group to join him at a nearby bar for a beer. We declined that invitation, but some of the group joined him, and I have no doubt it was a good time. Mark really wants to deliver the goods to those who go on his tours, and he really does. We couldn't have enjoyed our time with him more.

great tour of amsterdam. it's a free tour, with no need of reservation. I had Onno has a guide, and he was amazing: a lot of energy, humour to present the city. it made those 2.5 hours look too short. I would recommend doing this tour to anyone who wants to know more about amsterdam than just walking by themselves.thank you Onno for this great time !

Go On This Tour If You Want To Really Know Amsterdam. Mark Law offers what must be the best tour in Amsterdam. My wife and I travel to a city in Europe every two years. I dread the typical walking tour experience--a herd of glassy-eyed tourists shepherded around by a cheerful guide checking off the "must-see" sights in the city. We can do that kind of tour ourselves with a decent guidebook. What we look for (and can't always find) is a tour that makes us feel like we're really getting to know a place--what it's like now, how it got to be that way, and where it might be going in the future. We also want it to feel personal. Mark delivers this kind of experience as well as anyone I've known. First, he limits the group to 10 people. You don't feel herded, and everyone has a chance to interact easily with him on a personal level. Also, over 2+ hours he gets to know each of you well enough to shade the experience according to the groups' interests. He's smart, funny, engaging, and he loves Amsterdam and it's people. He's originally from away, so he brings an outsider's sense of discovery and objective appreciation for the places and personalities of this great city. He covers the sites, all the must-sees, but gives you so much more. He mixes in generous amounts of history, current events, and anecdotes to bring out all the city's color and light. You walk away feeling like you've gotten a generous taste of what really makes this one of the world's most fascinating cities. That would be enough. But then he follows up with an email containing tidbits and links that enhance some of the things brought up in the tour and recommendations for further explorations on your own. All in all, a completely wonderful experience, well worth anyone's precious vacation time.

Nice trip in a familiar atmosphere. Because we booked the tour on our third day in Amsterdam it was a very nice complement to our previous attempts to independently discover the city. It is a colourful cross-section through the inner city and its different districts. As the group size is smaller than in common city tours there is a lot more space for questions, jokes and chats. Mark is a funny guy with great knowledge across different topics who spreads his enthusiasm about Amsterdam. But instead of stuffing his tour full of information he carefully selects the interesting parts and comibes them with often amusing 'nice-to-knows'. Worth attending!

Good Overview of City. We did a city tour and within a few hours got a pretty good overview of how Amsterdam's historical event shaped its culture today. Mark has a unique way of relating history to current, cultural practices. He also had some pretty good statistics that he shared, which was quite interesting to know. He kept us laughing throughout the entire tour. I wish that we had a bit more time in Amsterdam so that we could have booked a more detailed tour with him.

Mark Law - the Guide to get in Amsterdam. We spent over 2.5 jam-packed hours with Mark Law. As we made our way through the city streets, Mark provided colorful details related to the industrial, social, and religious influences that helped form the current culture of this amazing city. Mark is well-informed and enthusiastic. Mark has the ability to make his audience feel very comfortable and right-at-home in a foreign city.I believe he hit the highlights of the city and offered suggestions for our future consideration.

Excellent tour and way to spend the evening. I went on his tour and found it to be quite informative and insightful (not to mention funny at times). It was a surprisingly well balanced perspective on the industry. I don't think you could find a better tour guide for this part of town.

Very interesting tour - highly recommended!. Thanks to Mark for this very interesting Red Light District Tour. I enjoyed it very much - Mark is funny, sympathetic and knowledgeable. You get to know a lot of whats going on behind the scenes and the cost-performance-ratio is very good as well. Euro 15 for a 2 hour tour is extremely fair. Keep it up, Mark!

Splendid. I could listen to Mark talk about Amsterdam (or any other subject, for that matter) for hours on end. He took us on an adventure through time with fascinating detail about real people and places.

Well deserved No1 position. Had a great, informative red light district tour with Mark yesterday followed by a drink at the brewery. Mark has a passion for this tour and is keen to pass on his knowledge (which is a lot) to visitors. You will learn more about the issues, probs which are faced by those 'behind the windows'. Thanks.

Super Authentic, Super Knowledgeable. I read the reviews of Mark's tour minutes before a tour was supposed to start. Taking a chance I called Mark to plead to let me on. He was extremely friendly and invited me to come join. I'm so glad I did.It's rare to meet someone so friendly, upbeat, and happy to share his love for a place. You can see his passion for Amsterdam as he unconsciously caresses the bridge rails and rusty bicycles along the tour. Shop owners step out to wave to him, and he calls back to them by name. He stops for a second to take photos of people who aren't even on the tour. His eyes light up talking about the water in the city, and somehow he even makes that exciting. Reverently he describes individuals from the city have influenced our world to become a more tolerant place.Authentic and open-minded, at one point I overheard him discretely explaining to a more seasoned couple from the States how to enjoy smoking a joint before dinner. Then he stopped the tour to explain that he refuses a commission from his favorite cheese shop for bringing customers because he wants his tours to know he only recommends the best he can find. Finally, he carried the tour on an extra hour just to show us his favorite out of the way nooks in the Jordaan and share his favorite apple pie with us.Wow! Congratulations, Mark, on an unforgettable tour! My only warning to would be tour participants is to keep in mind where you are and what you're doing. You will see prostitutes, smell pot wafting along the route, be invited to eat raw fish, talk about sexuality, and be asked to keep an open mind. It's Amsterdam, after all, not Disneyland.

City Tour with Mark. Mark is a delightful, entertaining, and very knowledgeable tour guide. We booked our tour based on the Trip Advisor reviews. The online registration process is very efficient, and I have never had a tour guide provide followup information and reading suggestions. I'm very impressed!Mark offers insights on modern day Amsterdam. As a history buff, I would have preferred more history, but that is my personal preference. He is very willing to respond to all questions. His enthusiasm for Amsterdam is infectious.

Great tour and excellent guide. Mark is a wonderful tour guide. We joined his Red Light District tour and found it informative, fun and full of reflection on protitution. Mark is not only a tour guide, he is part of the community of the RLD, so to speak, because he cares about those who actually work there. Highly recommended if you want to know more about the RLD from an insider's perspective.

Great fun, very informative, fabulous pace!. I can totally see why people are loving Mark's tours! He is a really nice guy with a great love of Amsterdam. I've been to many Amsterdam many times and felt it was time to learn a bit more about this intriguing city, Mark's tour really helped me to understand some of the geography, environment, history and politics behind the making of the city. If you can do the tour at the start of your visit it will really help you to orientate and get the most out of Amsterdam during your stay. Do use Mark's recommendations, more on his website 'That Dam Guide'. Enjoy 10% off but more importantly the best pizza (ever!!!!), fabulous waffles and freshly made ice cream and a great massage! I was simply showing off to my local friends with my knowledge of Amsterdam after the tour…particularly the best pizza ever!!!! If there are a few of you you can book Mark for a private tour, I'm sure he would do a fabulous job. I'll be booking on his Red Light Tour next time I'm in town. Thanks Mark.

Great way to experience Amsterdam. Mark was a great guide, ever so knowledgeable about the area as well as being so so so entertaining during the tour. My wife and I did both the City tour and RLD tour and definitely enjoyed it. Wasn't too sure what to expect from the RLD tour but it was well worth it to get an insight into the city life after dark and hear from Mark's inside stories as well. Def worth a go if you want to learn more about the city and its many different secrets

We had a terrific time. My husband and I traveled to Amsterdam without a prior agenda. We signed up for the walking tour and had a terrific time. Mark was extremely informative and entertaining. I just wish we would have hired him for our entire time in Amsterdam.

# 1 for a reason. Mark was an excellent guide on our City Tour. We had a pretty diverse group both in age and background and he kept us all interested and entertained. Very professional and informative. Great value.

Awesome Walking Tour!. My girlfriend and I recently went on one of Mark's walking tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. Mark is a really funny and enthusiastic guy, and it's evident he is super passionate about what he does. The tour was informative and engaging! This was definitely the highlight of our visit to Amsterdam. If you have a few hours to spare, this is the best way to see all that Amsterdam has to offer. Highly recommended!

Interesting view in RLD. My husband and I took the Red Light District tour with Mark based on the good trip advisor reviews. It turns out that TripAdvisor wasn't wrong! Mark gave an excellent tour which gave the 8 of us an excellent insight into the "other side" of the district. He is friends with a number of the girls and as such, his information is very real and not sensationalised. After the tour, he showed us a great little microbrewery where we sat and chatted further over a beer. Highly recommended!

Very Good tour of Red Light District!. Went on this tour as an introduction to the Red Light District. Loved hearing Mark's stories and insider info about individual women working in the area. He definitely had the inside scoop.This tour is meant to build the women up, and not demean them--so if you're going to gawk, think again. Great way to say you did the RLD....without actually doing it. Ha!

Learned SO MUCH!. My husband and I took Mark's city tour a couple weeks ago and found it to be excellent! He is very knowledgeable and a terrific guide. I'm now reading the book he recommended, _Amsterdam_ by Russell Shorto, and learning even more. We saw many of the buildings that I'd seen in tour guides, and now understand a lot more about their background and about the history of the city.We are in our 60s, and the walking was not a problem. Mark included both a bathroom stop and an ice cream stop. He really made the city come alive!

RLD tour - come with an open mind. We went with Mark because of all the recommendations here on Trip Advisor, and we weren't disappointed. This tour may not be for everyone as it can be quite graphic, but if you are interested in how the whole system works, you must go with Mark. He was straight forward, open to questions, and is very informative. We were a private group of 8 - don't hesitate asking Mark to set up a private tour if your schedule doesn't jive with his planned tours. We learned a lot.

Red Light District Tour. I recently joined Mark's RLD tour with a friend of mine who lives in the Netherlands. I find the tour to be very informative with Mark providing backgrounds of the RLD, including the legal framework. My friend who joined the tour with me has been to the RLD a few times on her own but said Mark was able to give her a deeper understanding of the district. I would recommend this tour to others who are interested in visiting the RLD!

Highly recommend the RLD tour. If you are interested in seeing the Red Light District or learning about prostitution in the Netherlands, then a tour with Mark is a great way to do it. We learnt loads from our tour, and it never felt disrespectful to be there- this was much nicer than going around in a big group which is what all the other tours seemed to be. As others have mentioned, Mark will share personal stories with you which makes everything much easier to relate to- he has clearly put a lot of effort into preparing a tour which puts across an accurate reflection of life for the women who work there which makes it a very worthwhile experience.

Great tour. We were in Amsterdam for a few day before we boarder a hip for the Baltic, and decided we wanted to show us around for a few hours. That Dam Guide was very highly rated and, after spending three hours with Mark, we understand why. He is extremely knowledgeable about the city, very personable and has a great sense of humor. We covered a lot of territory in the time we were with him and answered all of our questions - he stayed with us after the tour was done just so he could answer everybody's question. The cost of the tour was most reasonable. Mark limits his groups to 10 people, but when we contacted him, we learned he already had 8 and there were 4 of us. Mark was really accommodating in agreeing to expand the group to 12 - and we were so glad he did. If you're looking for a really good guy who knows a lot about Amsterdam and makes it interesting - Mark is your guy.

Touring with Mark. A don't miss when you visit Amsterdam. Mark had a small group which was great when explaining sites and relating history. His friendly disposition made the tour fun and he was so informed about the history of the city. We experienced so much as we travelled through the city. Mark encouraged questions and had the answers to most and what he didn't we learned through contacts of his along the way.My husband and I would definitely recommend Mark to anyone who wants the background history and a quick trip about Amsterdam.

Excellent introduction to Amsterdam. Mark is extremely knowledgable and extremely personable, which features make his City Walking Tour a pleasant and educational introduction to Amsterdam. I am especially impressed by his flexibility, both in adjusting his route to his clients' interests and in the use of time, showing no anxiety when our tour extended well beyond the contracted time. I had already done a self-guided walking tour from a popular travel book, but it wasn't until I took Mark's tour that I understood Amsterdam.

a real gem in Amsterdam. Mark is a highlight in Amsterdam. We booked the red light district tour. A lovely international small group of people joined Mark for our tour. Mark was highly knowledgeable of the district, offering personal insights that were not in guide books. We never felt hurried and time was always made to answer questions. My daughter and I would never have gone to this area without a guide and Mark made our experience memorable for all the right reasons. This is a tour that should not be missed when in Amsterdam.

a must for any visitor to Amsterdam. Love the fact that Mark keeps the group size small and friendly. We were a group of 4 visiting the city for the first time. marks knowledge and passion for the city was amazing and diverse, the facts about its history mad for a thou grouchy enjoyable tour of the city. Our only regret that we did not book it for our first day in this lovely city. I would highly recommend the city tour. We particularly enjoyed the quirky historical facts that Mark included in the tour. Don't change a thing Mark its perfect . will be back to Amsterdam again soon and will definitely be booking another tour.

Must take this tour if you haven't been to Amsterdam before!. My wife and I came to Amsterdam for our 20th anniversary. We read all the great reviews on TripAdvisor about this tour so we knew we had to try it. Almost every other review has been spot on except for the 2 or 3 people that gave Mark less than 10 for their review, some people can't ever be satisfied or be happy! What a great value too, $15 Euro for 3 hours! We really enjoyed the tour, the history & all the little secrets of the city that Mark pointed out and experienced. I never knew what a bitter ballen was until now. Thanks Mark for a great time & for putting up with all my follow up emails, we really appreciate it!

A Must When In Amsterdam!!. We had an amazing time seeing the city with Mark. He is an excellent guide blending history and fun together. Mark gives you all that you expect and more. Don't miss the opportunity to see this beautiful city without him!!
A great tour!. I took Mark's city tour.He is an excellent guide, a nice person. The tour is a must do in Amsterdam!

Great guide, must do!. This is a must do for Amsterdam. Mark is an amazing guide, blending the history of amsterdam with the quirky, fun things that you could only find out through him. We did a great impromptu eating tour as well, sampling local treats, visiting a cheese shop. Our private tour was supposed to last 3 hours and ended up being 6hours, ending with several rounds of beers at local bars--with the bar tender he knew of course :) don't miss doing this!

A must do in Amsterdam. We took Marks Red Light District tour and loved it. He was very informative in the history of the district and had some great stories about when he lived in the area. Truly interesting and fun. Take his tour, you'll love it too.

Great guide. Mark was an excellent guide. He is a nice person, who never assumed the persona of a guide.He was knowledgeable and attentive to the needs and wants of his group. There was a total of ten of us. Our 2-2.5 hour tour lasted 3 hours and he offered to stay around to answer further questions.He occasionally related the recent history of Amsterdam--last 30 years or so--to his own experiences, but never in a self-centered or irrelevant way. His anecdotes illustrated a general point.

Great tour. Don't miss out!. Just did the City Tour with Mark and we were not disappointed. His knowledge of Amsterdam was outstanding and it was delivered in a way that was easy to follow, amusing and very very interesting. He covers things you would never normally know or find on your own so in my mind, that's a tour worth doing without question. Another plus was Mark's attitude to not upselling and taking commissions for recommending particular shops like other tour guides do. Just book it and don't even look further.

Awesome way to see the city!!. We spent the day and evening with Mark. Did the City tour in the morning and the Red Light District tour this evening. Mark is FULL of great information, and really knows the areas. The small size of his tour groups is a bonus, easy to hear, understand and ask questions. Very accommodating. Would definitely recommend him to anyone. The price is very fair for what you get.
THAT DAM GUIDE. We went on a tour with Mark recently and were enthralled with his knowledge and enthusiasm as we toured Amsterdam. I would recommend him with no reservation.
Informative and eye-opening. Great behind-the-glitz tour. We got to see a side of Amsterdam that we wouldn't normally see. Nice small tour group, and Mark was honest, sensitive, and courteous.
Outstanding city tour. Mark Law provides his small groups with a humorous and fact filled tour. Superb command of Amsterdam history and sites. Best tour offered in the city.

Don't miss this tour. My sister and I did the daytime tour and would highly recommend it. Mark was a wonderful tour guide and delivered the information in such a way that the time just went by. His knowledge of Amsterdam today and of the history that made it the city it is, was amazing. No question went unanswered. Money very well spent and worth every penny.
A great tour. Mark puts on a great tour and takes personal interests into account when he maps things out right at the beginning. Things flow at a nice pace, both walking and information wise.

Absolutely great fun and excellent quality. I did the Red Light District tour with Mark and it was most certainly one of the best tours I've done! Mark made the tour really fun by giving both very interesting and entertaining information. It was time and money very well spent and I would join a tour of his again!

Vision Impaired Friendly!. I had already been on one of Marks tours back in October and decided to go back and see the sights in the summer and see how much things had changed. Mark was absolutely brilliant as per usual and was lovely of him to remember who I was from all those months ago. The tour was filled with hilarity, amazing stories of the workers, laws and history of the red light district along with current issues surrounding the area. I highly recommend if you do a second visit to Amsterdam going on one of Marks tours again. I learnt a lot more and it helped rejig my memory of all the knowledge he shared with us last time.I have now been on a few tours however none of them scratch the experience you'll have with Mark. Especially in these smaller groups you get so much from the tour.

That Dam Guide is reMARKable. If you're thinking about touring the Red Light District in Amsterdam then a guided tour through this area will provide you with amazing facts and stories. "That Dam Guide" is Mark. He is very familiar with the area, having lived above it for 2 years and has friends in the industry, which allows him to add personal stories in amongst his facts. The small tour- (max 10) people ensured you got to hear what he had to say. Watching other groups of 30 and more in other tour groups made us realise that we made the right choice picking "That dam guide" for the tour. Two hours of walking and talking. Mark responded to all questions efficiently. I found him interesting and very ethical towards the ladies in the RLD. We even went to a bar after the tour, where Mark was happy to provide further insight about Amsterdam and what to do. Thoroughly enjoyable.Check out his website for more details. thatdamguide.com/

Brilliant. We did the City Tour with Mark and we were so glad we did. Having been in large tour groups in the past we found that it was much much better being in a small tour group. it made for a friendly atmosphere, it was easy to hear what was being said and also to ask questions, of which Mark was more than happy to answer ( and he is a mine of information). The whole tour was highly enjoyable, well paced and informative. If you come to Amsterdam, don't miss doing this tour.

Recommended!. A must do. No better was to get to introduced to Amsterdam and appreciate all it has to offer. Walking through the interiors and hearing stories and facts leading up to it was captivating. We took the red light district tour as well as the city tour as enjoyed them both totally. The group was kept small which kept it more intimate and got everyone involved. He keeps the tone informative and funny. His passion comes across and gets you involved as well. Also appreciate the emails he sends across post the tour with additional information to read up.

Best Guide on our trip!. Mark was upbeat, informed on most all aspects of the Red Light District, and very empathetic to the folks working there. They don't like photos taken, so Mark made a point to stop anyone trying to sneak a shot. Even from other groups and individuals. He was very engaging and open to all questions. He also included anything additional sites our group wanted to see.Very FUNNY. He has a knack for his "phrasing" .Take him a new pom-pom for his hat!
Learned so much!. Worth every penny! Mark is very helpful and funny. I suggest this tour to all who enjoy small intimate groups.

Go for it! . I had the chance to spend my first night in Amsterdam doing the red light district tour with Mark. I have to say that Mark did an awesome job walking around the district and telling us stories. I also love the fact that Mark keeps himself updated about the district by regularly visiting sex workers. Furthermore, he also talks about how legislative changes affect the neighborhood which I find very interesting. Overall, Mark is definitely a guide that I will recommend. He knows what he's talking about and he loves it! You might even have the chance to go for a beer after the tour and discover how nice this Dam Guide is!

Exceptional. Great day with expert in a small group. Mark was accommodating when we changed tour and his website was a source of valuable information that we used in advance of the tour. He is also setting up a group of good places from which the visitor gets a 10% discount. We rated all the places he recommended ( and there's a lot of choice re food places so good to have a heads up)

Exceeds all expectations. Mark Law's "That Dam Guide" personal tour of Amsterdam was absolutely wonderful in every way. His love and knowledge of Amsterdam. His sense of humor made our tour fun and we learned so much about the city's history. His tour was perfect in every way. Dennis and Louise B. Acton, MA

GREAT guide -- GREAT afternoon!. This tour is great! The guide Mark is really personable and fun. He provides both interesting historical background and quirky information. We went over the 2-1/2 hours because everyone had lots of questions and was interested in staying on, and Mark had the time as well -- he was very generous with his time and knowledge. Our tour group was a great group and we felt like we made new friends as well. This is the best 15 euro you will spend in Amsterdam -- just book it!!

Dam it was a fantastic tour!. We did the city walking tour with Mark a few weeks ago and everyone in our group loved the tour and Mark! Mark is very informative, really enjoys what he does and it shows. We saw a lot of the city and enjoyed Mark's commentary and stories. One of the members of our group is deaf and Mark checked to make sure he was speaking at an okay pace so the interpreter could keep up the pace (we really appreciated that). Can't go wrong with That Dam Guide!

Very entertaining and informative. We did the Red Light District tour, and I cannot say enough positive things about this! First, our group was limited to a 10 person max. We saw at least 4 other RLD groups of 30+ people walk by with their headsets, and that really is just not a fun way to learn about such a fascinating part of Amsterdam. Mark (the tour guide) was one of the friendliest people I spoke with the entire trip, and was such a wealth of information. He not only knew so many facts about the Red Light District, but had so many personal stories and experiences to share which really made the experience so much more personal and enjoyable. After our tour was over, he invited us out to have a drink with him at a local bar. We went with him and another couple and really just had the best time relaxing, drinking, and learning even more about Amsterdam. A must-do, even if you only have a short amount of time in the city!

Energetic and informative. Mark gave us a wonderful overview on a history walking tour of Amsterdam as well as an evening tour of the Red Light District. He was extremely personable and enthusiastic. Sometimes he spoke a bit fast and one had to listen very carefully. I would highly recommend his tour and his recommendations for restaurants.

DAMn if you don't do DAM tours with Mark. I've traveled to several countries and cities and Mark definitely is the best tour and guide that i had. Before booking his tours, I was so intrigued on how come he got good reviews. Now, I perfectly understand. He loves his job and is so passionate about it. He is a people person, very warm without even having to try really hard.He gives insights that you won't find in textbooks. I have had a lot of realizations specifically on prostitutes in Amsterdam. He seems to continually hone his craft by learning. He doesn't stop and keeps going. After the tour, he goes out of his way to email links about things we talked about on the tour. Don't be wary and feel to ask him stupid questions.

Really made Amsterdam special.. We booked a private Monday tour with Mark and we're able to connect with him even though the Ocean Princess unexpectedly docked out of town. Since we were "good walkers", we covered a lot of the central area. Mark gave us great info and we saw and understood much more than if we'd been on our own. Nice coffee break in the museum's courtyard with free wifi - a huge plus when coming off a cruise ship with insane internet charges.

Great Amsterdam City Tour. I did the City Tour with Mark and it was great. Mark is extremely personable and funny, and he provides many stories and anecdotes about the city and its history. The tour was the highlight of the trip.

The Best!. The Red Light District is a busy and fascinating place, and I would highly highly (yes, twice) recommend Mark to show you around! He doesn't just tell funny stories - he also is super informative and interesting - AND he'll describe the area like no one else will, and you know that you can trust what he is saying.. no money wasting here. I am hard of hearing, and even on the busiest streets he projected his voice to the 12 of us and made sure he was heard - without disturbing the work lives of anyone around. He knows all the greatest places too, and is willing to share. A highlight of my trip. The best!! Wish I'd got to do the other tour too! Thank you Mark! :D

Not to be missed!!. Having done both the Red Light District tour and the City Tour we cannot recommend Mark highly enough. He's very personable and knowledgeable and only too happy to help with anything else one may want to know - like other things to see and do, places to eat, drink etc. We had a very slow group but he was unfailingly pleasant and polite and generously gave an extra hour of his time to fit it all in which we really did appreciate. Fantastic tours with a wonderful guide - he's damn good!

Best way to acquaint yourself with the Red Light District. We enjoyed our small group tour of Ams's RLD. Mark was fun and didn't hold back on any of the inside scoop for this exciting (and no where else in the world) area.

Awesome Guide in a Great City. Mark delivered a great three-hour city tour for us on June 13. It is obvious that he loves Amsterdam and enjoys sharing his knowledge with his guests. Mark has an engaging and entertaining personality, which makes the tour fun yet informative and educational. Mark’s knowledge of the history, architecture and culture of Amsterdam provided a highlight of our time in the city. The tour was well-paced and a good value for the time spent walking through the area. The average tourist would never learn so much in such a short amount of time. Mark is a delightful guide, and his tour is highly recommended. He also has arranged discounts with local businesses, and the cheese, gelato and waffles were a great lunch! Thank you Mark and when in Amsterdam, we will see you again!

A different, more in touch perspectivee. Mark's communication, even before the tour, was excellent. He provides a humorous, respectful and real tour of the red light district. He interacts with a group of 6 to 10 people in a way that larger companies can't (they are dealing with mobs of 40 -60 people). And... very importantly, Mark respects the working girls and conducts the tour in a way which does not negatively impact them.

An Amsterdam MUST!. We did the Red Light District tour from 7pm-9pm and the City Tour the next day, and both were just as fantastic as each other! Mark is absolutely fantastic and hugely entertaining and knows Amsterdam inside out, he can tell you anything you want to know! After these tours we knew Amsterdam like the back of hand because we knew where everything was! Both tours are extremely entertaining and informative, and with the tours capped at around 10 people it ensures that you get the absolute best experience, and can ask any questions along the way. Overall, I would totally recommend this tour to anyone of any age! You won't get the same experience from any other tour operators (trust me, our group was the group laughing and having a great time as we walked past the other tour groups of 40+ plus people who looked miserable!!) DO IT!

Loved loved both tours. I don't think I could speak more highly of Mark even if I tried. After booking both the RLD tour and the city tour I had a few questions that I send thru in email and Mark's response time was phenomenal and very helpful. The RLD district tour was a personal favourite, extrenely informative about current information and also the history. He is very passionate about what he does and does research about what he tells you, which is what made both tours so memorable and amazing. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. We took a canal tour the next day in Amsterdam and it was poor quality information and crappy service. Nothing compares to that Dam Guide! Thank you again Mark for all you help, advice and really being our number 1 favourite thing about Amsterdam :) :)

Entertaining Tour. Great walking tour to give you an idea of what Amsterdam is all about, what to see and where to eat. Mark obviously loves his city and is knowledgeable about its history without being boring about it. The walk was easy with interesting things to see on every corner. We have done several walking tours in other countries and this one did not disappointed. It's a great way to get to know a new city when you first arrive.His website is also very informative.

Do it. If I had only 3 hours in Amsterdam, I would spend them on Mark's tour. He met us with a group 11 and spent three hours walking and talking. The time flew by. He also suggested where to visit, boat, eat, relax.
Red light tour. Was an entertaining night with a lovely small group of people. Mark was funny and very knowledgeable about the ins and outs of the RLD. He is also very passionate about what he does.

The best tour in Red Light district. Took the tour today with two friends and a pleasant group of girls from Australia and New Zealand. Fantastic. Thank you Mark for telling us about the place, like no one else can. Cheers mate!

Best Dam Tour!!. My wife and I were in Amsterdam for 3 days prior to a cruise. On Friday, July 4th, we had the opportunity to take both Mark's City Tour and then later in the evening, his Red Light District Tour. His tours are advertised as a tour of the history and growth of Amsterdam, as opposed to a "highlights" or "best sights" tour. He was SPOT ON!!!Mark was very informative, funny, and went out of his way to answer any questions thrown at him. A previous reviewer that was on our same tour was bothered by Mark trying to get away from loud distracting noises, and we found that to be a very good thing. It is really hard to be able to get information across when the streetsweepers are chasing you across the square, and when kids are just mindlessly ringing a bike bell!His City Tour covered a lot of ground, including China Town, the Red Light District (briefly... much more in depth later in the evening on his RLD Tour), the history of the canals and their purpose, and then ended up over by the Anne Frank House.We loved both of his tours and would highly recommend Mark for anyone wanting to get a good overview of Amsterdam and its history, culture, and current life. One last item.... Mark told us about the bar at the top of the Doubletree Hotel and said it was a great view of the city. Also, since we were there on a Saturday morning, he told us about a great local market in the Jordaan area that we went over to and walked around. Both of these suggestions were very much appreciated.

Red Light District Tour with That Dam Guide. We toured the Red Light district with Mark a week ago and are still talking about what we heard and saw. Mark was passionate, opinionated and funny! One would think a tour of the RLD would emphasize the titillating sights, which Mark's tour included but we also were schooled about the history, the politics, the problems, the hows, whys and wheres. Thanks, Mark, for a fun AND thought-provoking tour.. We look forward to returning to Amsterdam and will book Mark's other tours when we do. Fyi: the price was fair and our group was 8.

Informative Tour!. Great tour and my wife and I agree with his mostly excellent ratings and did not see any of the really limited criticism. Mark was very likable and outgoing as well as passionate about his adopted city. He came across as really concerned that we all learned from and enjoyed his tour. We were a small group and he made it clear that he was open to tailoring the tour to our interests and we did indeed adjust as we went along. We thought he gave a great overview not only on the city layout, but it's overall history without being overwhelming. He gave an introduction to the Red Light District, but unfortunately his Red Light tours weren't available during our visit. Next time! We think the cost of the tour was quite reasonable, but note that if you choose any coffee breaks or exhibit admissions those costs are extra. One note on a critical comment from a review concerning Trip Advisor. He did make a reference to TA reviews, but only in the context of any self aware businessman. He certainly didn't ask us to write a review much less anything favorable. Mark made every effort to make the tour entertaining and worthwhile. We certainly recommend him.

Dam Good Tours. Mark makes his tours fun and educational. He is truly part of the fabric of the city. We did both the Red Light District and City Walk Tours. The Red Light tour was interesting and Mark knows the players, the history, and brings you up close and personal with the action. Mark takes that industry seriously and also has fun with it. The City Walking Tour was our favorite. Mark allowed for stops with the herring vendor, explaining the history of that in Amsterdam. He also stopped at the Cannabis College as an optional stop to listen to the "weed professor", another great character in Amsterdam. Of course, Mark stops and walks you through and over canals. For history buffs, there is the visit to world's first stock market and the Guild building. Mark is full of energy and entertains and teaches. He also answers everyone's questions. A couple quick points on the negative review below. We happened to be on both tours with the Plano couple. Mark certainly did recommend the top of the Doubletree for a drink and great views. His problem with noise on the morning tour more related to finding spots where a full group could hear him. In any case, most everyone loves Mark's tours and it's easy to see why.

Best dam tour. We booked Mark's tour and we were really glad we did. It was simply amazing. We could not have asked for a better introduction to Amsterdam than this. Mark is truly a gifted story teller! He has a real flare for history and is extremely knowledgeable. I think we could have followed him around all day and I think he would have kept going too. I really appreciated that he took the time to entertain any and all questions. You really felt that you were learning about the city, its history and people. Excellent value. Thank you!
