Excellent tour with some welcome added humour!. I travelled as part of a group of 6 to Amsterdam at the beginning of July, and having read positive reviews on Tripadvisor, I decided to book a private tour for the group with Mark.I told Mark where we'd be having lunch and he offered to meet us there when we'd finished, which was great as we were totally unfamiliar with the area. After a quick intro, what followed was an incredibly interesting and fun three hour walking tour of the city. Mark knows his stuff, not only was the tour educational but his openness was very welcome. He knew stories that I can't imagine another tour guide telling (in a good way!).We even enjoyed a couple of local beers with Mark at the end of the tour and he recommended places for us to visit that evening near our hotel, which was very helpful.Don't hesitate in booking a tour with Mark, you'll definitely learn something new and have some great laughs along the way!

High expectations, did not quite meet. With the #1 rating (at the time we booked), we did have high expectations for this tour. To compare, we went on the #1 rated walking tour in Paris and truly felt it exceeded our expectations. Unfortunately, the tour with "That Dam Guide/Mark," did not meet our expectations which was disappointing. We had wanted to love this tour. As a person, Mark has a fun personality with a good sense of humor. A recent reviewer may have hit the nail on the head that Mark can be impacted by the environment at times. After reading more reviews on here, I feel Mark's expertise and passion may shine more during the Red Light District Tour. The tour was beneficial to us in that we saw several sights that we wanted to see and allowed us to gain a better bearing of the city. However, it was underwhelming in terms of amount of ground covered.

Great tour. This tour is fun and informative, Mark gives you lots of information about Amsterdam past and present. Small groups make this tour enjoyable and friendly. I booked the wrong date via the website (don't know how I managed it!) however I emailed Mark and he added us to the tour even though it was fully booked. Four people who had also booked onto the tour did not turn up so all was well in the end. Great tour thanks Mark

Just follow the orange pom-pom!!. My boyfriend and I took the Red Light District Tour with Mark and it was great! The most important thing for me about this tour, it's the openness and how up-front he is with the prostitution subject. You will get a different perspective that is often lost in this matter, and with him, you will not only get more educated (he'll show you some really nice places ;) ;) ), but you will have lots of fun too.Totally worth the money!!

Great tour. I really enjoyed this tour of Amsterdam. The meeting place is easily located and full of interesting info. I really didn't know much about Amsterdam before I went, and this tour definitely provided me with lots of history and background. It is very clear that Mark (the guide) stays on top of important issues and continues his research on the city. He answered all of our group's questions. We really enjoyed this tour!

That Dam Guide. My husband and I just got home from vacation. We spent 4 of the days in Amsterdam (June 25th - June 29th). On June 27th we took a walking tour with Mark (That Dam Guide). It was one of the highlights of our vacation! He was incredible! We walked for 3 hours and could have kept going listening to him! He is so knowledgeable and entertaining at the same time! We thoroughly enjoyed our time with him. I would highly recommend his tour to anyone going to Amsterdam! Definitely the BEST!!! Definitely a 5 star experience!

Excellent tour by an excellent guide. My wife and I took Mark's tour today and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was interesting, informative, fun, and great value for money. When he learned that we would be in Amsterdam for 11 days, he gave us some recommendations for special things to see, such as the Six Collection. Mark is a five-star guide. Regarding the two-star review that someone gave him, everyone has a bad day, including reviewers.

Brilliant. A great tour, well worth the money. We found mark to be very knowledge and really was connected and loved the cityThe tour covered the main areas and was perfect for us as it was our first time in the dam, Unlike the review below we had no issues with mark, he really wants to give you the best tour possible, and so what if he stopped for noises!! It just shows his care and devotion to the history.Would recommend 1000%

Like Night & Day!. My wife and I visited Amsterdam last week and decided to take both the Night and Day tours with Mark based on his #1 TripAdvisor rating. After reading about the disappointment of many that they did not take both of his tours, I decided that we would book both. The Red Light District tour was great - I would give 4 stars. Mark really seemed, on this tour at least, to love the city and he keeps it interesting and it was fun. He showed us great pubs and told us about the coffee shops. He definitively seems to have an affinity for the sex worker and that industry and was passionate about fair treatment - almost to an annoying fault. That was the NIGHT tour. Overall, it was worth the 15 Euros per person.Now for the DAY tour...first I will put a disclaimer that everyone has bad days, and maybe that was his day. Mark was irritable from the beginning and perhaps it was because he, admittedly, stayed out late the night before. He was really bothered by noises that are natural in a city environment: Street Cleaners, babies crying, people talking, bicycles ringing bells. From the start, he moved us all around the square trying to avoid the street cleaners that were doing their job and CLEANING THE SQUARE!, He snapped at people walking by that he thought were making too much noise because they were simply TALKING, he gave babies evil looks because they were crying, and he even stopped our tour to tell a family on bikes to stop ringing their bells because he was giving a tour. Each time a noise occurrence happened, he stopped the tour and showed his frustration. That became increasingly bothersome to us and we could not wait for the Day tour to end. The next day we took a cab out to a golf course and the cabbie was more informative about the best places in Amsterdam. For example, we did the Heineken experience, against Mark's advice, and we LOVED it. We also went to the top of the Double Tree Hotel for the "best view of the city" which we learned from our CABBIE!In summary, Mark is a nice enough person and kudos to him for breaking away and starting his own tour service. I imagine that the reason Mark gets #1 ranking at Trip Advisor is because he is good at asking for reviews at the end of his tour and also following up via email and asking for reviews.

No better! . Lots of cultural and historical information, at a great pace. My wife and I just finished this tour minutes ago and it was better than we expected. We also really appreciated his suggestions on places to eat, even waking us to a place he enjoys. Can't recommend enough.

Amsterdam with Mark is an absolute must do !. My husband and I took Mark's City Tour and it was a highlight of our trip . I absolutely love that he keeps the group small. We saw other huge groups walking around and it takes away from the experience. Loved the history behind Amsterdam and you can tell Mark loves Amsterdam and now we do too ! It was our favorite city in our Eurotrip ! Don't miss out on a tour with Mark and book now since he gets full quick ! The funniest and most entertaining guide !

Enjoyable afternoon out - one for the history buffs. Mark is clearly passionate about the city and his history, and that makes the tour really enjoyable. If you are after a tour that takes you through the history of the city, then this is the one for you. This is so different to the run-of-the-mill tours conducted by the larger companies,and you can tell that a lot of thought and effort has gone into planning the tour.Personally I would have liked to get more of a feel for the current-day city and its little quirks & hidden secrets - though we did stop at a lovely ice cream and waffle shop mid-way through the tour. I completely agree with reviewer B.G._Chicago (see review 2nd July 2014) - I would have preferred a shorter tour with some more emphasis on the architecture & the people. Also felt a bit rushed taking photographs - its feels rude to take photographs when your guide is talking, but a few minutes at the end just to give people a chance to take photos would be appreciated :) Overall, we felt it was great value for the price we paid, and we had a really enjoyable afternoon out walking around this beautiful city.

I recommend!. Last week I've been on the Redlight District Tour with a friend of mine. Both females, we were very interested in the history of the area. After reading great reviews on tripadvisor we chose the tour from That Dam Guide, Mark. This turned out to be a great choice: a small group, a lot of information and funny facts! You can tell that Mark knows a lot about the area and that he is very passionate about his work. I really liked the fact that Mark showed us articles from newspapers and other funny pictures which he took with him. Fortunately Mark didn't mind me translating some bits to Polish for my friend during his tour. He even offered to take more pauses, a huge difference compared to standard tours with larger groups. Thanks again!Although I'm from the Netherlands and I'm often in Amsterdam, I plan to do the tour through the city center as well some day! I recommend!

The right way to do a walking tour. My wife and I really enjoyed Mark’s tours. We booked both tours on Mark's excellent website before we left home. We have done many walking tours in Europe and Mark's were the best walking tours we have done. The small group really helped but it was Mark’s style that made the tour something special.It was like he was painting a historical picture of Amsterdam. He didn’t recite facts and figures but told stories of the people and places. He took us to places we would have never gone to on our own. By the end of the tours, we had gained a really great insight and a real fondness for his city.While on the city tour, he took us to a really tasty waffle shop for a break and while we enjoyed our treats and rested our feet the stories continued. The walking pace was just right allowing time for some picture taking without having to run to catch up with the group. Mark always waited until everyone was gathered around before he started his talk. The red light district tour was really fun. We learned so much about the history of this area and the people who work there. We felt that this tour was a little long and the pace a bit slow but I think this was more due to us being really tired after a day of touring on our own. I highly recommend That Dam Guide tours.

Best tour guide I've ever had!. We had a very limited amount of time in Amsterdam so we decided to do a walking tour to get ourselves orientated. Mark was fantastic, he showed us everything we wanted/needed to see and was an absolute font of information about all things Amsterdam. He'll tailor the tour to suit the group - whether you want the whole inclusive history of the place or if you just want to see the 'real' Amsterdam, he's your guy. Thanks for everything Mark, will look you up if I'm ever back in Amsterdam!

Perfect tour. We really enjoined Mark's tour. Perfect blend of history and today's life of the city.Funny and knowledgeable, he made it memorable for our family ( including two teenagers who are very difficult to impress with history). Will definitely recommend without reservations.

A must do item in Amsterdam. My wife and I did the red light district tour on the day we arrived in Amsterdam with some trepidation about what to expect. Mark was BRILLIANT, explaining all the background of the area amongst other useful snippets. We would have missed so much stuff if we hadn't gone on this tour and it has been the experience we hoped it would be.Groups are small (up to 10) and this was perfect for hearing Mark talk and also the personal feel with all questions answered informatively. We saw a few of the larger tours going around with 40 or 50+ of people and I have to say we made the right decision
very nice tour. Within a few houses I got to know many interesting stories behind the scenes we have seen nowadays, thanks Mark :)

Different than what I expected, which was a good thing. Our tour was a great highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. Mark was very informative and gave unique insights to the underbelly of Europe's Sin City. Although fairly opinionated about certain topics, he was a little soft-spoken and I found my attention drifting a lot of the times. That could have just been the Red Light District though. I would definitely try another of his tours if I found myself in Amsterdam again. My favorite part of the tour was timing a 'customer' and comparing him to the average customer time. Right on cue!

Excellent way to orient yourself to Amsterdam. Mark was a great guide and offered an ideal introduction to Amsterdam. He was very generous with his time and happy to offer recommendations. Definitely worth doing!

Nice Introductory Tour to Amsterdam. My husband and I took the City Tour with Mark, and we had a nice time overall. Mark has a true passion for the city and its history, and his passion shines throughout the tour. We started the tour near the Red Light District, and then walked over a few "must see" bridges. Mark pointed out a variety of things we would have not noticed on our own, such as the fact that the city has few stairs, the interesting outdoor "bathrooms" throughout the city, and a funny demonstration on how women can also use the bathrooms. We then traveled through the Dam Square area (where Mark introduced us to delicious croquettes on a break), and ended up near the Jordaan neighborhood. He kindly pointed us in the direction of a great Saturday market nearby after the tour. It was quite easy to book the tour with Mark, and his website contains fantastic information on restaurants, bars, coffee shops, museums, etc. I cannot stress enough how knowledgeable Mark is about Amsterdam.My only criticisms are the strong historical focus of the tour and the tour length. As noted above, Mark is passionate about history. He really highlighted the strength of the Dutch throughout history, the spice trade, and Dutch influence on other countries. On an introductory city tour, however, I expect a brief introduction to the history of the place I am visiting, and then I hope that the tour will focus on the present facts of the city: what people typically eat, why is there such a influx of bikes compared to other cities, what is a typical day/night like for someone living in Amsterdam, etc., etc., etc. I want to leave a tour feeling like I know every aspect and sense of a city. This was lacking a bit. Perhaps Mark can offer a separate history tour for history buffs - I think he would be perfect at that. Additionally, the tour dragged on a bit for us. Our tour lasted three hours, and we would have been happy with two hours. Once again, if the history parts were cut out a bit (like the extended stay in the spice trade building center and underground bike rack area), I think this would have made us perfectly happy. Overall, however, we did not regret taking the tour with Mark, and we wish him the best of luck with his tours.

Great overview of Amsterdam and its history.. Mark was a very good guide. The balance between giving useful information and historical information was spot on. I would not hesitate recommending the tour to fellow travellers as I have already done.

Superb tour!!!. We took the red light district tour and it was soooo awesome! Mark kept the group small at about 10 pax and was certainly easy to move with... hear him speak of some real life stories and this could paint you a better picture of the area... Ooo he also reccomended the best pizza i had :) really yumz! thumbs-up for the excellent job!Toon & Dynelle

Great Guy, Great Guide. Mark just absolutely LOVES Amsterdam making us LOVE Amsterdam also. His knowledge is outstanding. From history to current day, he makes the tour very very interesting. The whole experience of the tour was just perfect!! Great job Mark and hope we meet again sometime. Get booked up before you go or you will miss out on a very enjoyable experience.

A Dam great trip!!!! !!. Mary and I thoroughly enjoyed the guided tour provided by Mark. He is not your typical tour guide , that made our experience special. He has lived throughout the area, hence knows the local environment and not the tourist attractions. Well worth the 15euros each and a bit more at the end. Stay in a small group and enjoy their country and culture. We did!

We all loved Mark!. I went on a tour around the red light district with Mark with my class and we all thoroughly enjoyed his tour. He gives a fresh perspective on Amsterdam and is very informative yet very personable and fun to listen to! Highly recommnend

The perfect start (or end) to your Amsterdam experience. We were in the final "planning" stages of our Amsterdam visit when I stumbled upon "That dam guide" on TripAdvisor. Neither of us are "tour oriented" people, we'd usually rather just discover cities at our own pace. That being said, a guide with a Ponpon already told us that this wasn't your average walking tour. We got lucky and booked the last 2 spots on the 3 pm walking tour of Amsterdam... and we both agreed we were very glad we got to go on Mark's tour. It was informative, the content was anything but generic and there were no "hard sell" stops like with big tour companies where you stop at souvenir shops/chocolate shops (etc) and feel forced to buy things you really don't want/need. We instead made stops at unusual places that you wouldn't otherwise go in as a tourist, I learned a lot about the Netherlands' history and got to see quirky alleys and better understand how Amsterdam came to be the city it is. Lots of humour on the tour, a bit of a political talk, so if you are the kind of person who likes neutrality and monotone, boring tours, then this may not be for you, but otherwise, you'll wish the tour was longer than 3 hours. One of the best investment of our trip! Go and book ahead to save yourself a spot!

Try it out!. It was a lot of fun to have a tour with Mark. He really does make Amsterdam lovable, despite all the crazy bicycle people (no offence) and all that noise. He has a very nice manner of telling the interesting stories, while making them simple and easy to understand, he also gave us lots of tipps about where to go in the evening, what to try out, and helped with finding the location, which we were looking for, so he was very helpful, but...enough about him:) My advice: take the tour and enjoy!

Six star tours. We booked both tours before we arrived in Amsterdam because of the good reviews on trip advisor and we're not disappointed We did the walking tour on our first day and it is a great way to find your bearings and learn a lot about Amsterdam in a fun and innovative wayHis tours are small and not rushed and great value for money The red light district tour was great as well very enlightening and funny and a nice way to look around this area at night with a groupWe met very nice people on the tours and mark takes the trouble to find out where everyone is from and there is a lot of interaction and jokesHe was very helpful with lots of ideas about where else to go in Amsterdam, great places to eat,which "cafés" to go toHis website is full of great tips and he is generally a nice guy doing a great job at helping tourist to enjoy Amsterdam I would recommend his tours to everyone

Great first day. We booked this tour our first day in 'Dam and it was a great way to learn about the history of the city, some of its quirks, and the general layout and high points to see. Mark is very personably and obviously interested in history. I liked the small group (10 in ours) and he has plenty of time (and is willing) to answer questions.

Engaging, Informative, and FUN. We took Mark's Red Light District tour last night, and it was awesome! He guided our intimate group through the nooks and crannies of this historic area, and taught us not only the history, but also about the perspective of the women that work here. He is very passionate about them, their safety, and their privacy. It was an eye-opening adventure (Drake972 gave a great detailed description of the experience - it's exactly as they described). Thank you Mark for a great tour! I'll defintely leave your card & info with our airbnb host to pass out.

Mark is the best guide, hands down!. Mark loves Amsterdam and The Netherlands and you cannot ask for a better guide! His erudition is impressive. What is even more remarkable is that he was able to keep attention of twin 14-year old boys, who later commented that they "wanted for the tour to be longer and can we please have another tour with Mark!" He has a great sense of humor and tells interesting stories, but by the end of the tour you suddenly realize that you just attended the highest quality lecture and know so much more about the city's history! The only regret I have is that we did not reserve another tour with him in advance for a second day. Please make sure to contact him far in advance: having him as your guide makes all the difference. Thank you Mark!

Much more than expected. OK. It is about the red light district. You know what that means and why you want a guided tour. You can find your giggles and experience your self rightousness or secretly lust. Whatever. For me what made this tour special was that Mark goes beyond the perspective of these women as objects. He has developed friendships with some of them, talks with them about their attitudes toward their work and he helps us understand as well. Mark is a strong advocate for these women, their rights, and the political structures that support their rights and safety, or that need to be changed. This is so much more complex an issue than I imagined and greatly appreciate the intensity Mark brings to educating his guests for a few hours. This is the tour for those who want to learn and understand this cultural phenomenon. Who are the women behind the glass doors? Where do they come from, and why? What are their hopes for a future life after this work? Mark helps with some of the answers, and helps us see the sex workers as real peopl. And, Mark makes it a lot of fun along they way.

fun and informative. What else can I say that hasn't already been said?! We took several guided tours on our recent trip to Europe, and I can honestly say that this one came out on top. Mark has so much information to offer and is obviously passionate about the topic...so much more interesting than listening to a guide just giving facts and figures. Take this tour...you won't regret it!

Nice tour with lots of historical facts. My wife and I along with our 19 and 22 year old daughters took this tour last week on a beautiful morning on our first full day in Amsterdam. The walking part was not strenuous so anyone can do it. Mark hit the highlights of this wonderful city with a lot of historical stories. We would have appreciated a few more sights with more current events and facts. Overall we would recommend this tour. Mark was a wonderful and energetic tour guide and seems it really enjoy his job.

A Fantastic Start to our Trip!. Mark's walking tour was a great start to our trip and allowed us to see some sights that aren't in the tour books...quirky little enclaves of houses, a coffee shop, and numerous back streets and alleys that weren't filled with throngs of tourists...perfect! I'm pretty adventurous when I'm exploring, but I never would have thought to take some of the turns Mark took, and without him I would have missed some charming sights!Mark is passionate about his adopted city, and he's a masterful storyteller who knows the history of the city and the people who shaped Amsterdam. There were four of us on our tour, on a beautiful May afternoon, and we enjoyed ourselves so much we ended up extending the day through a light dinner and drinks at a café.I highly recommend Mark's tour as an introduction to Amsterdam, or just as an alternative to all the museums and crowded tourist attractions.

Don't miss!. My husband and I did a tour with Mark today-it was spectacular! Tons of great info, personable, and funny:). I cannot imagine a better way to understand Amsterdam from a historical perspective, as well as the country's progress into the 21st century. Highly recommend:)

Lots of laughs during the tour!. Mark's RLD tour was a perfect fit for my husband and I, as it was our first time to Amsterdam. We wanted to see the area without roaming endlessly, and settled on this tour based on others reviews. We were not disappointed! We not only saw the district but learned so much about the women and society's views. Very intriguing tour and well worth the money. I initially considered his city tour too, but wasn't sure I wanted two tours with the same guide.... looking back I wish we had! He made it lots of fun!

Fun and informative. We took Mark's walking tour of Amsterdam on May 31 after my sister-in-law had found him on TripAdvisor. It was a fantastic tour. Mark is passionate about "his" adoptive city/country and gives excellent insights into the city's culture and history - past and contemporary. He possesses in-depth knowledge that he is able to share succinctly and accessibly. He also has a great sense of humour.I would take a tour with him again in a heartbeat and highly recommend the tour for anyone who really wants to get a feel for the city in a short amount of time. His tour helped put Amsterdam on my "Will definitely visit again" list.Sharon and Tony Moren

As long as you're not easily offended, this is a TERRIFIC tour!. My wife & I spent 2+ hours walking with Mark Law through the Red Light District on our first evening in Amsterdam, Friday 4/25. What fun!As long as you're not easily offended, this is a terrific tour for seeing & learning about the unusual ways that one world-class city deals with sex & prostitution. Mark has so many stories based - according to him - on personal, factual experiences, that the tour is endlessly fascinating, funny, & provocative. He's one of the most engaging tour guides we've had anywhere on our travels. And he keeps each group small, so all the commentaries & discussions are easily heard by everyone.Perhaps most interesting were the many floor-level, full-length-window doorways, behind which a variety of [mostly] young ladies posed & gestured to attract clients.As you might imagine, the different varieties of sexual experiences that you can pay for in Amsterdam cover a WIDE spectrum, & so do the devices for sale in the sex shops. Be prepared for some very frank use of language that - to us - seemed appropriate for the topics.

Stick it to the man, go with Mark!. In addition to all the great things about the actual tour that everyone else has already mentioned, Mark limits his tours to 10 people while the other tours guides (which follow pretty much the same route) have a herd of people following behind them. This allows for a lot more interaction and less distraction. Also, Mark is not just another employee of a big tour guide company, he is the owner of That Dam Guide and how can you not support small business owners especially in a place like Amsterdam?

Well worth the tour!. This is an awesome tour. I would say that if you book his tour, to please show up on time. We had to wait for a large group that was late, Mark waited but we started getting impatient as time went on. This was a very informative tour and wished we would have came by the city tour to see if there was any no shows. Take this tour for the price and the information, you just can't beat it,

A must-do in Amsterdam-Have a date with Mark!. We, 4 ladies from Singapore chose this tour based on Tripadvisor's positive reviews.You won't miss Mark, the guide with the orange pom pom. Mark is very knowledgeable and knows Amsterdam inside out, the past and the present. Very informative tour. He even brought us to an ice cream shop that gave us discount upon showing his business card, nice yummy ice cream. If you are in Amsterdam, make it your 1st stop and a must do: have a date with Mark, That Dam Guide! Cheers from Sunny Singapore!

Fabulous Tour!. We visited Amsterdam for two days in May and by far Mark's tour was one of the highlights. He was very knowledgeable about Amsterdam and entertaining too with loads of tips for places to visit. The small group size made is easy to hear his commentary and to ask questions.I would highly recommend his tours!

Hands down - Mark's Red Light Tour is a must-do!!!. I was so impressed by Mark's tour of the red light district! Having never been to Amsterdam or the red light district in particular, I really didn't know what to expect but thoroughly enjoyed my tour experience with Mark. He is knowledgeable, fun and his personal stories and research made the tour unique and engaging. I enjoyed this tour more than any other tour I have been on. It is affordable (only 15 euros) which you pay in cash at the start of your tour. Mark was there early to greet all of the tour members (small group, 10 person max) and gave a brief background about himself. The tour is 2 hours (began at 7pm and ended at 9pm). Mark walks you through many notable sites within the district, providing some historical background throughout the tour. This tour made me really challenge my initial perspective of the red light district all while having fun!! I would recommend this tour to anyone! Thank you Mark!!

A great way to see the Red Light District. My husband and I as well as my sister and her husband had only a day and a half in Amsterdam and did this tour with Mark. What a great way to see and learn things about the area that we would have had no clue about otherwise! Mark has so much knowledge about the area and answered any questions we had at all. He was great to book with over email and was right on time the day we all met. Very cool way to see and learn a lot in a short visit!

Passion and Knowledge. We greatly enjoy Mark's tour, it lasted for over 2.5 hours, he went through a lot of history and interesting facts about Amsterdam. We were only there for 2 days, so to have someone that knows the city well explain to us all the interesting history and facts was a great way to get to know the city. I highly recommend the tour.

Great way to start a visit!. Mark was on time, and full of information. The tour actually ran longer and contained more information than promised! And, Mark was very able to adjust the content to the interests of the group. Visits to and about the red light district, social housing and coffee shops were very beneficial in understanding this very interesting city. Finally, Mark's insights on the fundamental philosophy behind the government and social norms here helped understand why Amsterdam is the very interesting city it is.

Amsterdam-dammmm... Excellent tour with a knowledgable guide!. We took the tour based on the trip advisor reviews and couldn't have been happier with the experience. Mark was promptly on time and gave us a short background of himself before setting out on the two hour tour. He had wonderful anecdotes and interesting facts about the changes in the red light district since it's beginning. He was extremely knowledgable and answered all of our questions. This tour was without a doubt the best tour in Amsterdam and really gave you the bang for your buck! I highly recommend the red light tour hosted by Mark and look forward to future visits!

Best tour guide ever. Mark is full of knowledge of the city in and out. I first planned to join the city tour only and have decided after the tour, to have Mark guide us thru red light district as well. Best decision ever as he has so much information that I would have missed if I was to visit alone.

That Dam Guide Walking Tour. The tour was absolutely great, i would definitely recommend doing this tour, Mark is very knowledgeable and passionate about Amsterdam and you can feel it in the way he relates the history to the places we visited. He also recommended some great places to eat and see, my partner and i thoroughly enjoyed it, thanks again :)

Must do in Amsterdam!. Simply put.. This tour is amazing. The red light district tour is 15 euros and is 2 hours long. Rather than being shuttled around in a large group, Mark's groups are 10 or less people. Mark provides an in depth and honest view of the red light district. He provides detailed information and has a great deal of insight into the world of the red light district. Mark's unique and personal stories about some of the girls that work in the district provide a unique opportunity to see a different side of the industry. Mark's perspective allows you to challenge your views and opinions, and reconsider the industry in a respectful way. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone!

One of the best tour guides . This is a fantastic tour that gives a good overview of the city, explains the rich history, and keeps you well entertained. I highly recommend making this the first thing you do during your trip.

The Zeitgeist of my Amsterdam Holiday. This tour unlocked the quirky and interesting bits of Amsterdam that most tourists would never see. Mark also provided invaluable insights to places and times that I should visit other area of Amsterdam.

Wonderful tour!. We had the best time on our city tour with Mark. He was so helpful in finding a tour time that worked best for us as he promptly answered all of my emails which was so appreciated. He is more than just a tour guide - he relates stories and interesting facts to each place that we visited - I wish we could take him with us on every tour we take! We also took the Red Light Tour with Mark - again, a great tour!! The small group size is wonderful, and his price is very affordable. He is also punctual and a really great guy!!

Great Way to Start Your Stay. We had an amazing tour with Mark the first day we arrived in Amsterdam. He's very knowledgeable and passionate about the city in every way. If your interested in history, cuisine or entertainment just ask him and he will point you in the right direction. Our tour was very personable which doesn't always happen in a tour setting. Even though our tour ended we felt like Mark was always around to help our journey from his awesome website to responding to our email questions. If you want a great start to your vacation I'd for sure book a tour with Mark! Thank you Mark!!!!

The best way to start a stay in Amsterdam. Mark, we enjoyed every bit of our tour with you, your stories made us connect to this wonderful city in a way we never imagined could be possible on our first day! Even the rain and the wind couldn't convince us to opt out. Every minute and euro was well spent. Thank you for that amazing afternoon! Regina and Daniel

Must take Tour. We were only in Amsterdam for the day. I was so glad we found Mark on Trip Advisor. He made the day in Amsterdam wonderful. We learned so much about the city. Loved having the small group and could hear everything. He is so knowledgeable. If you go to Amsterdam, you must take his tour.

Fun and knowledgeable guide of Amsterdam. The reason we chose Mark's tour is that we know who would be our guide, since all the tours are guided by himself. The tour was great, as we expected! We liked the way how he introduced the city by sharing his own experience and his view. After the tour, he introduced a nice lunch place and he actually took us and some other people in the same tour there. The stomp pot of the restaurant was awesome. We tried stomp at other restaurant recommended in a guide book later, and found that the one he recommended was much better. His website is also great with a lot of useful information.

Amsterdam Plus. Our group had a great tour with Mark Law. It would have been lots of fun just sitting on a park bench and talking with him, but seeing the city through his eyes was exciting and educational as well. He made the city come alive for us. I highly recommend his tours.

an entertaining and interesting introduction. Mark knows and has thought a lot about the culture and history that shapes Amsterdam. Lucky for us, Mark's passion is introducing the city he loves in a way that he must tailor to the diverse interests and personality of each tour group, no small challenge. With this interactive approach, I expect that the more you interact, the more he will add of interest. Mark, the dam guide, captured the interest of everyone in our family (parents and two college-age offspring), and presented the sights of Amsterdam in a way that everyone of us found entertaining from the humor and from the depth of discussion. He added to our vacation, giving us a little more understanding of Amsterdam.Thanks, Mark.

Superb Tour Guide!. Mark led our U.S. group of 19 Friendship Force members on a most interesting and informative tour of the city. We highly recommend him! He has done his research and paces the group as they want. He was not in a rush to get finished.

The best decision of my week long visit to Amsterdam. Joining Mark's City Tour on the morning of my first day in Amsterdam was the best thing I could have done to give me an orientation of the city neatly wrapped in an overview of its history. Mark has a great sense of humour and built a really interesting historical story over our 3.5 hour tour. It gave so much more meaning to the many museums, canal houses and other activities I undertook over the following days. The benefit of Mark's insistence on having a maximum of 10 people on his tour became really obvious when I joined his Red Light District tour at the end of my visit. This meant he was able to share his experiences and knowledge of the area quietly and discretely to our small group who didn't stand out at all, compared with the snaking lines of 30+ people who would take up much of a small lane way as they followed a single guide from one of the larger tour companies. I highly recommend Mark's tours to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Awesome tour of Amsterdam.. Mark's tour is must-do. He has two types of tours - The City Tour and the Red Light District Tour. We did the city tour on 31 May 2014.Mark is very friendly, has a great sense of humor and is very informative. He knows the city's history and every nook and cranny extremely well. His recommendations on what to see and eat is spot on fantastic! He guides you with such enthusiasm and patience, you will not find any other tour of Amsterdam that compares. Thank you Mark for the tour. We loved every bit of it, and the pizza you recommended is soooo good! :)
Loved this tour. My wife and I did the city tour. It was informative, relaxing and fun. Mark is a great story teller and showed us parts of Amsterdam we would have never found on our own.

This is a MUST DO tour in Amsterdam!!!!. We took two of Mark's tours on our first two days in Amsterdam and it was the perfect way to start our holiday. First, we had the Red Light District Tour on the night we arrived, and I have to say that Mark KNOWS Amsterdam like the back of his hand, and has ALL of the insider information!! The second morning we took Mark's City Tour and it was so informative and gave us a fantastic overview of the city and all the sights. I love that Mark limits his tours to 10 people because it is so much more personal than the large comercial tours that are much more expensive. If you want to do a walking guided tour in Amsterdam, you MUST at least take one (or two) of Mark's tours!! Word has spread about how great they are, so sign up online because he gets booked in advance.Thank you Mark for a wonderful introduction to Amsterdam, such a unique city. Was a true pleasure!!!! ~Stephanie & Tracy
Great guide. Loved the rdl tour it's was very informational and fun. After the tour I really felt like I knew my way around the red light district. Would recommend to anyway

Fantastic!. If you were to do only one tour during your stay in Amsterdam this is the one! Mark was a fantastic tour guide; highly knowledgeable, fun and you get a real story behind RLD from the inside. My favorite part was when he shared personal stories from his time living in Amsterdam and also from the many girls he knows working in the windows. Special! After the tour, if you're lucky Mark might even join your for a pint at the local brewery and tell you more stories. Thanks Mark!15 euros - what a bargain! If you were to do only one tour in Amsterdam this is the one!

Great Tour of Amsterdam Center, Recommended. I made a mistake in my travel planning and Mark demonstrated flexibility by adding an extra afternoon tour for us.Mark explains the history and background information and we learned (and saw ) a lot of Amsterdam City CenterHighly Recommended and we would do it any time again

Wonderful!. We had less than two days to spend in Amsterdam and were so glad we spent part of it on the city tour with Mark. We fell in love with the city at first sight, so it was wonderful to hear about its history and see the sights with such a knowledgeable guide. He was so open and friendly and made everyone feel so welcome—he was a great sport about posing for a picture, too. :)

Excellent tour. Highly recommend!. Mark's RLD tour is a bargain at only 15 euros per person! It was so informative and it was great learning about the history of the RLD as well as his conversations with the girls. We learned so much and would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam! The small group size is also a plus!
Great tour. We took the red light district tour with Mark. Very entertaining. Group size was perfect at 10 people.
Great Tour Highly Recommend. Thanks Mark for a great afternoon wandering the streets of Amsterdam - very informative and fun for the whole family!

Excellent Walk Tour. Mark's way of doing this walk tour was one of a kind. It was a perfect blend of witty and vast knowledge of Amsterdam's history. I enjoyed both his city walk tour and red light district tour. Thank you so much for both walk tours!

An exceptional tour!. While visiting Amsterdam we joined Mark's city tour. It was an exceptional tour for many reasons. First, Mark is an experienced tour guide so knows how to plan a tour and organize the group. Second, the size of the tour group was perfect, 10 people, which allowed Mark's commentary to be easily heard by everyone and helped in moving us efficiently along the tour. Third, Mark knows his material. He has an extensive understanding of the city and it's history as well as it's current state. He is informative, knowledgable and makes the tour fun. I would highly recommend Mark's tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.
Highly Recommend. Our family thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour of Amsterdam with Mark - he's incredibly knowledgeable and entertained us with his great sense of humour!

Highly Recommended. Did both the Red Light District and City Tours with Mark and thoroughly enjoyed them. They were relaxed and informative and the small group sizes meant that it was easy to ask questions or simply chat. The Red Light Tour in particular was really worthwhile for a better understanding of the of this side of the city - the history, legislation, people and mixed views of Amsterdammers themselves. Easy to book online, good comms by email, great value for money and a fun guide. Enjoy!

He is a dam good guide :). Absolutely informative and refreshing! It was one of the best, if not THE best tour, I have ever been on. I have been to Amsterdam before but my group of 4 friends had not been. Mark's tour just helped us to explore the interesting, little things, which I'd have never seen, if it wasnt for him. Mark is a very open, smart and genuinely nice guy. All in all, if you have 15 Euro to spend , his tour is the best way to do it.

Great tour!. Mark is a really talented guide in that he is very entertaining, knowledgeable and passionate in his presentation of the city. He has a great perspective on the local culture and history. I am giving him my highest recommendation. If you book with him, you will absolutely enjoy every moment and not be disappointed!!!!
Great Introduction. Mark was knowledgeable, friendly and entertaining. I enjoyed the combination of history and modern culture, with funny personal commentary thrown in.

Great way to start your visit to Amsterdam. My family of four, including two college students, thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with Mark. He was informative, funny, and knowledgeable. He provided thoughtful, historical perspective on all the sites we visited. We passed a couple of the much larger "free" tours. We much preferred our small group. Our tour ran over time, and the three hours passed quickly thanks to Mark's lively commentary. This was a very helpful, comprehensive introduction to the center of the city.

Best Walking Tour. We have taken a number of good walking tours around the world. Mark was possibly the best ever! He did a great job blending history, sightseeing and current Amsterdam culture. I am so glad we didn't just wander on our own as we are prone to do. Mark made the story of Amsterdam come to life. Thanks for the great tour!

Great Tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our Red Light District Tour with Mark. Mark is very informative and delivers information with a great touch of humour. The small group of 12 people was also preferable to some of the large groups we encountered and we moved at a comfortable pace. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this tour. Mark is deserving of his high ranking on Tripadvisor.

Mark is truly deserving of all accolades. Took Mark's city tour on the Thursday. Beautiful weather to experience a well thought out guided tour of Amsterdam city. Learned so much and every tidbit of knowledge Mark gave us was done with care and attention to detail and truth. Even one of the Spanish guides who passed us with his group yelled out that Mark was the BEST. Can't disagree so if coming to Amsterdam and can get on one of Mark's tours - do it as you won't be disappointed.Sharon and Gloria, Vancouver
Great guide in Amsterdam. Mark Law was a wonderful guide. He was knowledgable, funny, and enthusiastic. Would highly recom.!Ron and Jan
The Best. Mark was "the Best Dam Guide". We were a group of 19 he expertly led us around Amsterdam. Kept us interested and laughing. Thanks for all the great info and experience.

Awesome Tour!!. Mark Law is the consummate tour guide. Not only does he know tons of facts about Amsterdam, but he infuses humor and great storytelling into his tours which makes the experience fabulous!!

The Dam Best Guide. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed both the Red Light District tour and the City Tour. The communication and the easy to find meeting places made it stress-free. The length of the tour was perfect for our needs and the pace good but not hurried. The size of the group is perfect. We've been on tours in the past with 40 plus people and Mark's 10 person limit is perfect and shows he really cares that he gives a great quality tour. He gives a uniquely balanced perspective as he is a long-time resident but not originally from there. He gives recommendations along the way. As a result, we had the best pizza of our lives! This will be your best money spent while in Amsterdam.

RLD tour & city tour. We took both the red light district and the city tour with Mark while we were in Amsterdam. Both tours were very informative & fun and well worth braving the elements for!! highly recommended!
Informative and fun. Just spent a great morning walking round Amsterdam with Mark.So much info and insight but not a bit boringHighly recommended

Excellent Red Light Tour. We took the RLT in May 2014 with Mark and really enjoyed it. He answered all the questions that no one wants to ask, but really want to know about. It was both entertaining and also put a human face to the sex industry in Amsterdam. Thanks Mark and all the best to you.Scott & Lisa Weingust

This tour is a steal. We joined Mark for a city tour of Amsterdam in May 2014.The tour was excellent and was dollar for dollar the most value-for-money experience we had in the city.He was also very helpful in pointing out great places to eat and shop, as well as providing directions to other attractions.Thank you Mark!

Insightful tour. Mark was a very accommodating tour guide, giving us step by step instructions to the meetup spot even after google maps failed us. We took both the day tour and the night time red light district tour. Day tour was broad but still with insightful details about history and culture of Amsterdam. Red light district tour gave us a nice roadmap of which places had what type of pros available.Highly recommended.
RLD Tour. Great tour of the Red Light District. Thanks Mark! I would recommend this tour to anyone wanting a guide through the RLD

Worth every penny and then some.. Where to start... if you are considering another tour, free or not, look no further. Mark's tour (capped at 10 people) is the only way to go if you want the best. He knows Amsterdam's history and detail and I found it extremely interesting.We saw the "other" tours while we were out on ours. They had large groups 20-30 people, most were not even paying attention to the guides, and the guides seemed half interested at best. They seemed more interested in bringing the tourists to shops to buy goods.Mark on the other hand doesn't take any commission from shops, he just tells you where to get the best (whether it be ice cream, waffles, cheese or other treats). I highly recommend his tour for anyone who wants to learn a little more about the city and loves history. Thanks Mark!

Excellent tour. Thanks Mark for an excellent and informative tour through Amsterdam.I joined Mark for his City Tour which took approx. 3hrs during which he provided very detailed and interesting information about Amsterdam. The group size is small so it is easy to move around and hear what Mark is saying. On Mark's recommendation we finished the tour in a little cafe (I can't remember the name) with some delicious Dutch food. Unfortunately the weather was not great but do not let a bad day put you off as it would be a shame to miss out.

Dam Informative and Dam Interesting!. It was raining and cold throughout the tour. However, Mark did an excellent job in getting our attention with his interesting and informative stories (and facts! I believe so). This was our second time in Amsterdam but our first time with a city walking tour. I have learned so much from Mark on Amsterdam and how the city shaped its current unique society and trades. Also, thanks for the ponchos and the 'lady-special' gift :D

Dam That Was a Good Tour. Thanks Mark! We had a great tour through a great city. Your knowledge and stories made for a colorful and insightful visit through the canals and streets of Amsterdam. You spent way over and above your time and effort to make sure we were happy and I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants something more interesting than the usual! Thanks for the dinner suggestions too. Great stuff and a great time.

Dam Super Tour. Wow, Mark really went all out. This was no packaged tour very personal and entertaining and Mark's love for the city really comes through. Wrapping up with a visit to the market that was going on that day for ham broodjes made it even better. This is definitely a tour that is worth doing.
Great tour, worth the time.. Although the weather was not great, everything about the tour was. Mark was engaging even as we trudged through the cold and rain. Would highly recommend.

Excellent tour. We were really lucky to get in on a Monday morning tour. He had really great information and took a lot time to answere all questions! If you get the chance to book a tour with him: do it :)
Excellent. What a great 3-hr tour! Mark is extremely friendly and worried about everyone's comfort. Despite tha rain and cold wind, time flew quickly. Highly recommendable.

Dam good tour. Mark is a fantastic tour guide whose love of Amsterdam and wit ensure a great tour, or tours.We went on the Red Light District tour on Friday night and followed this up with the City Tour the next morning. Although some information about the Red Light District is included in the City Tour I recommend doing both if you can. The RLD tour was fascinating and thought provoking, providing insight into the history and current challenges in the area. The City Tour mixed history, humour and recommendations to provide a great overview of Amsterdam and the influence of the location on the residents.The small group meant it was always easy to hear Mark and the tours were great value.The only thing that could have improved the tours was better weather. The free ponchos provided made things much more bearable. Don't let the weather put you off going - you'll miss out on a great tour if you do.

Highly recommended!. I was so happy that I was able to get in on Marks Red Light Tour. He was well informed and enthusiastic! I learned a lot about the history,culture and overall lifestyle from him. He only does small groups which makes your time with him much more personal. I highly recommend this tour, its a fabulous way to see a different Amsterdam!

Not to be missed!. My husband and I took this tour upon our arrival in Amsterdam. It is a GREAT way to get an introduction to the city. Mark is an amazing tour guide! He keeps the group size small so that it is very personalized. Besides providing the essential historical and cultural information, he also offers great restaurant/sightseeing suggestions throughout the tour. Highly recommend it!

Green light for Red Light Tour. Adjectives that come to mind are funny, thoughtful, provocative, personal, intimate, honest. Two hours passed very fast, and left us with more hours of conversation processing what we saw and heard. Highly recommend. 15 Euros very well spent.

Fantastic, Fact Filled and Fascinating. This tour covered the sights, history, culture and politics of central Amsterdam with an informed running commentary from an enthusiastic knowledgable guide. Mark covered a lot of ground literally and figuratively in our four hours of walking the city. Our group of 12 easily threaded its way past huge groups of fellow visitors trying to hear their guide.

Great tour of Amsterdam. We did the morning Amsterdam tour. The tour covers many basic sites of downtown Amsterdam, as well as some highlights not covered by travel guides. In general, Mark had a lot of insight and background information that made the tour much more interesting.We loved that the group was small. We passed by many other groups, usually at least double or triple the size of our group, and I must say I was glad we had chosen Mark's tour, as it was much more personal and detailed.To Mark: we are over 30, and we do appreciate the 10.30 start, not earlier :)
Worth every penny. Excellent tour very informative lots of tips regards were to eat etc I would highly recommend this tour and look forward to booking my next tour with mark on my next visit

Fantastic tour from an excellent guide. (19:00 tour, May 2nd)My mom and I thoroughly enjoyed our evening tour of the red light district with Mark. I learned so much more than if I'd just wandered around the district by myself. I loved hearing about the history of the area, and about the current political challenges. He's a very funny guy and really knows his stuff. Thanks for a great evening!

Great walking tour of Amsterdam. We only spent a few days in Amsterdam and managed to book the last 2 spots on one of Mark's morning walking tours. We are really glad that we did. We enjoyed the tour alot, Mark was very knowledgeable about Amsterdam and gave us lots of hints and tips about the city. The length of the tour was great and extremely good value for money. Thanks again Mark!

Informative and genuine. We enjoyed Mark’s tour immensely. His love of Amsterdam and obvious interest in the city’s sociopolitical history and global influence made for an informative and fun tour. Plus he was very good company for lunch after. Highly recommended, thank you....Trev and Sarah.

Loved this walking tour!. With only a few days to spend in Amsterdam, we decided to book a walking tour. Mark was a great tour guide! He was very knowledgable about the area, and had a lot of indepth information for us. With a small group of about 10 people, it was personal and we were able to ask questions with ease. The walking pace was perfect (not too fast, not too slow) for two adults and a pre-teen.Mark brought us to not only the "must see" locations, but also to some out of the way locations that tourists would never venture into (which was worth it)! We stopped for a bathroom break near a spot where we could buy a snack as well.Having completed walking tours in several other major European cities, I can promise you that Mark is highly professional, reasonably priced and very knowledgeable. Highly recommend this tour!

Great introduction to Amsterdam. If you want to learn a lot about the history, politics, architecture and finance of Amsterdam you must spend the 3 hours with Mark. Told in an intellectual and humorous way it is time very well spent. It is a small group ( we were 11) and more than worth the price. Mark is very generous with his time and very willing and able to answer all your questions

Great walking tour. We took a private walking tour with Mark. He has a vast knowledge of Amsterdam history and culture. It is clear that he as read quite a bit about each area that we passed through. It is not a typical "look over there...that is the Old Church building." Rather he included an in depth accounting of the religious history of Amsterdam and how it related to the church and to current customs. Because it was a private tour, we (three of us) could stop and ask questions and divert him from the normal route to things of our interest. It offered us a great overview of the city. Mark offers much information in person as well as on his website. I would highly recommend Mark as a tour guide

Fun, Tasty, Insightful. I highly recommend the walking tour with That Dam Guide. Mark is entertaining, engaging, and very knowledgeable of Dutch history and culture. The group was kept small so that you can really make the tour your own. The break at Vleminck for fries was outstanding. ThatDamGuide website is also a must see as it has lots of great suggestions which helped me with the remainder of my vacation in Amsterdam.

Fun tour of the RLD. Mark's enthusiasm and knowledge of the area makes for an enlightening evening. He dishes out many interesting facts and keeps the group engaged throughout the tour. A great way to get to know this fascinating place in Amsterdam.
Great Experience. We had a great experience! It was a cold day, but it was worth wearing a coat and walk away knowing Amsterdam

Best Guide!!. We traveled two weeks through France/Netherlands/Belgium, taking various walking tours through various cities, and hands down, Mark's was the best!!!My kindof tour guide: a wealth of historical knowledge that he's spent hours and hours reading/researching and acquiring over the years, and then delivering that info in a pleasant, fun, relaxed manner to help us get a deep understanding of this beautiful city! Can truly not recommend this tour and Mark enough! Loved it!
Mark and Amsterdam. Best tour in Amsterdam. Mark is very helpful, friendly. he gives good suggestions what to do and see. I liked the small group!

Educational, Entertaining, Fun tour in Amsterdam.. My husband and I had a wonderful walking tour with Mark. He is knowledgeable, entertaining and it shows how much he loves to tell facts about Amsterdam. Mark took his time and never rushed from one place to another. At the end of the tour he gave us the name of a great place to eat. We loved the ribs and chicken. We will definitely refer The Dam Guide tour with Mark to everybody who ask us about Amsterdam. Thanks Mark.

That Dam Guide. Very informative tour, Mark also share interesting story and history Of dutch making the tour fantastically interactive and lively. Tip was transfer into 10% Discount to delicious ice-cream and cheese purchase which I think was uniquely brilliant.Highly recommended.

Book Mark for a great tour. Mark brings Amsterdam to life. His passion for the history and culture of this fascinating city make his tours so memorable. Small groups and Mark's personal interest in everyone are added bonuses. We were all as engaged at the end of the tour as we were at the start. Thanks, Mark.

A great representation of Amsterdam!. Let's face it. Amsterdam is an eclectic, quirky, energetic and friendly city. Mark is definitely all of these things. And I enjoyed his humor tremendously!My boyfriend and I did the city and red light district tours. Both were exactly what we were looking for: brevity (less than 3 hours), knowledge about the history of the city, entertainment (humor, personality from the guide) and sights of the city. Done and done!Mark is a history wiz and knew all the answers to our questions. He recommends things do, gives tips on where to go and has a real zest for life. You won't be disappointed!The tour is also priced right at 15 Euro. Thanks, Mark!

Great tour - great personal touch. This was our favourite tour of our spots in Europe, Mark was terrific and informative. We had our son with us and it was his birthday and Mark went the extra mile and then some.We did the standard tour and felt it covered everything we were curious about.I'd also point out that Mark's site was helpful as well, with suggestions and extra spots of interest. I'd highly recommend Mark.

That dam good guide. Mark is not only very knowledgeable he is avery nice guy. He makes the whole experience a relaxing pleasure as you drift around the fascinating city of Amsterdam. The tour number is limited to 10 so it is never crowded. If you are spending a few days in Amsterdam then make this your first activity, it's great value for moneySylvia and Dennis April 2014

Very interesting tour in the centre of Amsterdam. My brother and I spent Easter in Amsterdam. On our first day we had a tour with Mark who showed us many places of interest. We enjoyed it very much because the tour was very personal as the number of participants is limited to 10 persons.We can highly recommend taking part on one of Mark's tours and will surely come back to this wonderful town one day.

Excellent Way to see Amsterdam!!!. We did both tours. The City and the red light district tour with Mark. Both were amazing. Informative, pace was good and Mark kept us engaged all the time. His recommendations for places to eat were excellent too.Being a small group it was more than just a usual tour. We had discussions, asked plenty of questions, exchanged ideas without having the feeling of being rushed along. All in all a fabulous experience.Would definitely recommend this tour if you are visiting Amsterdam.

Great tour of Amsterdam. We booked Mark (That Dam Guide) to give us a private tour of Amsterdam. He was great. We got the history of Amsterdam, information about the canals, hidden gems behind buildings, pissoirs(!) and great stories. He was very entertaining and answered all and every question we asked. He told us about the war, the gay movement, current social issues and showed us the only street steps in Amsterdam. The tour lasted over three hours. We stopped for coffee mid-way through the tour. All in all he gave a full overview of the city. It was my first time in Amsterdam and this tour really made the trip for me. Thank you Mark

Excellent way to see Amsterdam from another perspective!. I am happy to review Mark's guided tour! It's been very instructive and interesting, despite having been already to Amsterdam and having done a guided tour, this time I learned a whole bunch of new things, like about Matatuli, or the happenings in the 70s and the fact that historic houses have survived also thanks to those that occupied them "illegally"...! Also the "policy" of sticking with only 10 people or so makes it much easier to follow and listen rather than "fighting" with other participants to get your share of questions. Also, Mark makes it last much more than the planned 2 hours, so there's no hassle and if you have time, you even have the chance to have a beer with him after the tour (not sure if this applies to all tours though). Thanks a lot and keep up with the good work!

Best way to start..... Taking in Amsterdam would have been overwhelming on our own. Having just two days we needed the help of a professional. And what a professional we found with That Dam Guide! History, culture, and the world-wide influence of the people of Amsterdam over the years. We got all that - oh and we also saw where it all happened - the old city centre. Throw in tips and suggestions during the tour and Mark's very useful web site (an Angie's List for visiting Amsterdam) which is packed with information on where to eat (we loved the pizza at Da Portare Via) and all variety of things to see and do and you have quite the jump start on maximizing your Amsterdam experience.

That Dam Good Guide!. We went on Mark's walking tour just last week. Mark does an excellent job of helping you understand Amsterdam while introducing you to the main parts of the city. He really knows the history and makes it very enjoyable adding in lots of short stories to make things really interesting. The pace was just right, stopping just long enough to take things in. The other wonderful thing is Mark only takes up to 10 people so you are not fighting for space to hear what he is saying and it makes it easy for him to introduce to locals along the way. He's very attentive to what the group wants or questions they have. We really enjoyed his tour and would highly recommend that you go with Mark. Free tours are free for a reason but at just €15 Mark was worth every penny because you left feeling you now know where you are and what to see next.

Dam good guide!. Following the excellent reviews on here, Becky and I booked the red light district tour for Thursday night (17th April). I regularly do walking tours when travelling and this was one of the more intimate ones with a maximum party size of 10. I think this says a lot about Mark – sacrificing potential money in his pocket to provide the most personable and best tour possible. So book up early!Despite the weather being uncomfortably wet/cold we stayed until the end of the tour because Mark was both fun and interesting. His tour provides a good mix of humour/seriousness and the whole group clearly enjoyed the experience. After the tour, most of the group went home. However Mark took myself and Becky to a quirky little microbrewery which served some impressive local beer. We all got on really well socially and he seemed genuinely excited to share his experiences and funny stories with us. I think it shocked him at first but once he got used to us – I think he enjoyed our outgoing and cheeky personalities.Becky and I are both glad we met Mark – really felt he helped make our holiday such a good one.

Loads of dam fun. We took Mark's tour at the beginning of our long weekend in Amsterdam...and it was the best thing we could have done. Mark was entertaining, funny and extremely knowledgeable about the historical facts and political environments that existed throughout Amsterdam and the Netherlands as a whole. It made for a thought-provoking and lively tour.In addition to the famous touristy spots in the city, Mark will also take you into some out-of-the-way places that only locals know about. This is easy on Mark's tour because he limits the size of his group, so he can get in and out really cool places...something the big tours with 40-50 people can't do. Be sure to make note of various shops that he points out: We ended up going back to the cheese shop (for a wine and cheese tasting afternoon) and a sweet shop (best stroopwafels I've ever had). Not to mention a beer pub with over 40 beers on tap (need I say more?).Great time, great conversation, great memories. Dam loads of fun.

Highly recommend -- great experience. I would recommend Mark to anyone! He's highly knowledgable but also patient, kind and passionate about his city. We loved our tour -- a great experience for my parents' first time in Europe. Mark made it really special an memorable.

Damn Fine Guide. We took Mark's tour on the last day of our holiday and we couldn't have had a more convivial guide around this beautiful city. We came away with new found knowledge, political, historical, social and recreational. The small group size made for it much easier to navigate the narrower streets and a stop at Nice 'N' Ice (for the best waffles and ice cream in the city - discounted of course) allowed us to find out a bit more about our fellow tourists. If you are to take any guided tour at all, it has to be Mark's.

Mark was the highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. After a relaxing week of vacation, we were ending our trip in Amsterdam. I doubt that we would have liked it as much if we hadn't toured with Mark. He was able to share his passion for the city in a way that was enthusiastic and contagious. He presented a perfect mix of history and current culture. The small group size made the tour personal. It would be a shame to be in Amsterdam and not tour with Mark!

Great Amsterdam walking tour. It was one amazing tour. Mark explained everything so nicely. This was my first tour. I always use to think tours are boring but this one I can say it was very interesting and informative tour. He explains it very well in a fun way I must say.I recommend him.

Brilliant Walking Tour of Amsterdam. As a group of 3, we spent the afternoon of Sunday April 13th with Mark exploring the city's canal belt and learning so much of its history in a really enjoyable way. From the moment Mark met us at our hotel, it was obvious that this was very much tailored to what we would like to see, as opposed to a generic 'one size fits all' tour. We got to see some hidden gems that would have remained hidden were it not for the fact that we had such a popular, well-known character as our guide. A really memorable experience - worth every cent. Thank you, Mark.

Great Way To Learn About Amsterdam. Booked both the City Tour and the Red Light District Tour with Mark & would highly recommend them as Mark is a really nice, fun guide with a vast knowledge of the city's history. Mark is full of funny anecdotes which make the experience effortless and always interesting. He clearly has a passion for both the city and guiding. Both tours fly by and you walk away with a much better understanding of your destination. Mark also selflessly passes all his commissions from shops to the customer rather than receive them himself. Top man!

Must do in Amsterdam. Why i booked it?-Was ranked 1 on TripAdvisor-had great reviewsWhat I liked?-The guide- Mark was awesome, he was funny, informative and made it very interesting.-The insights of red light area were very well covered which made me and my hubby really happy.-The visit to condoms shop, sex shops, narrow lanes were amazing. Mark explained all well with his witty attitude.-Mark knows that area sooooo well, he knows people, the sex workers, the bars around which was cherry on the cake. He showed old newspapers cuttings, told us about people, legal and non legal activities and so many interesting things.....-2.5 hours just flew by and we dint realize that we were actually walking.-best part which i loved the most- Mark believes in quality and not quantity. The groups are small and thus he is able to pay attention to each one, answer everyone's questions.-He charged 15 euros per person but it is totally worth it:) Red light area is awesome with himMark I wish you all the happiness and success.

A great walking tour around Amsterdam city. We went on a 3 hour city tour with Mark (the guide) on the 10th of April 2014 when we first arrived Amsterdam. He was very informative and funny that helped us learn about the history and political situation of this country. We really enjoyed the tour as we walked around this busy and interesting city. We recommend this tour to every one and thank- you Mark for giving us such a good time.Shau- Ho and Cam-Huong Chau

Great tour of the red light district!. Mark gives a fantastic tour of Amsterdam's RLD. Tour group sizes are intimate, and Mark offers a great insider viewpoint of the industry. I was very impressed with his awareness and respect of the area, he truly appreciates that the red light district is a place of business and not a circus! I would definitely recommend this tour! Great value for the experience, for sure! Thanks again, Mark!

Excellent start for Amsterdam. We thought a guided tour would be the best way to get an overall view of the main sigths of the city and its history. We thought right! We walked for three hours and got so many information and anecdotes to fill a small book. Absolute recommendable: informative and funny. Thank you!

A fun and interesting tour. We took the city tour Friday 11th with a lovely American family and Mark(the guide). The fact that we were not more than ten people really made this experience more individual and cosy. It was a great tour were we learned a lot, laughed a lot and had a lovely walk trou town. We really recommend this tour to everybody and will tell all our friends about it too. Thanks for a great time! Hanne and Lars.

A Respectful and Ridiculously Fun Tour of the Red Light District!. I am so glad I located Mark to give my boyfriend and I a tour of the Red Light District. I was reluctant to go on several tours of this neighborhood, for fear the sex workers operating in the Red Light District would be overly sensationalized or pestered, which strikes me as extremely rude. I fortunately met Mark randomly in a cafe, and after chatting with him about his presentation on the Red Light District, my interest was certainly piqued! That evening, we went on a 2 hour tour of the neighborhood, and Mark gave our group an intimate, respectful, thorough look at many aspects of the RLD, giving overviews of the history of legalized prostitution in the region, who worked there and how, and what the political situation it today in the area. Mark plotted our tour so that our group would not impede upon the business of the women working in the windows, and gave us a thorough insiders look at how prostitution in the area operates. I came away more informed, and feeling like I had just been as ethical as a tourist to the area as I could have hoped to be. Oh, and Mark is, by the way, totally hilarious, peppering his tour with a slew of naughty observations and jokes that kept the evening light and engaging. Thanks Mark!

Great tour!. We had a wonderful tour with Mark! We scheduled for our first day in the city, which was a great way to acquaint ourselves with everything. Mark loves Amsterdam and is enthusiasm for the city shines through. He is very knowledgeable, has a great sense of humor and keeps his groups limited to 10 people. I highly recommend!

Highlight of my trip. I joined Mark on both his City Tour and Red Light Tour. Both were very different but nonetheless interesting and informative. The City Tour provided me with an initimate and intellectual viewpoint of Amsterdam (perhaps helped by the small group size we had that day), whilst the Red Light Tour was light-hearted fun. I enjoyed myself tremendously on both tours. I would recommended both tours to anyone visiting Amsterdam!

Best way to explore Red Lights. Instead of going around and staring blankly, we had decided to take a more intellectual approach and booked Mark's tour of the Red Lights district. It proved to be the best way to explore the district. Our group was small which kept our tour quite intimate and not intrusive to others. Mark is very knowledgeable and happy to share his passion for this part of the city. He managed to guide us in a very informative and detailed but at the same time humorous way. It felt very natural to tour around Red Lights with Mark, and I'm sure that we would have felt a bit uncomfortable to do that on our own. My husband and I enjoyed the tour very much and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Great tour, very helpful & super informative. We booked with Mark on the first morning of our stay in Amsterdam, he was excellent. So much knowledge, really interesting. Very easy going & was great when we asked advice at the end of the tour. Loved it & would defo recommend it to get your bearings in this great City!!

What a great way to spend 2-3 hours in Amsterdam. My wife and I went on the City Tour and liked it so much we went on the Red Light Tour the next day! We found both tours equally entertaining and informative. When in Amsterdam you do occasionally see other tour parties which are much larger and they just seem to be herded around. Mark on the other hand keeps the party size to a maximum of 10 and that is a real plus as you get to both hear and see everything.Mark himself is a very interesting character who obviously knows and loves his adopted City.

Awesome and entertaining. I had the pleasure of joining Mark for his tours through the city, and I was very struck by his detailed knowledge of the city's history. (Turns out that he is a veteran tour guide who has struck out on his own.) Mark prefers smaller groups, and the quality shows, since there is more time for questions while keeping the tour moving along. I strongly recommend Mark for three reasons: (1) He provides better quality tours because his groups are smaller; (2) His experience is as much or more than other tour guides; and (3) his pricing is very competitive. I hope you enjoy the time with him when you are in Amsterdam as much as I did.

A Great Afternoon in Amsterdam. My daughter and I just spent a great afternoon with Mark, That Dam Guide. Over the course of three hours we learned a great deal about the 800+ year history of Amsterdam and how it came to be the beautiful and exciting city that it is today. With a small group of fellow tourists it was easy to hear Mark and get our questions answered. He is, entertaining, incredibly knowledgeable of the city and a tremendous resource for other things to do in Amsterdam.

Great introduction to the city. Whilst visiting the city with my mum for the weekend we decided to book this city tour with mark as an introduction to the city on the first day if our visit. It was the perfect introduction to seeing some if the highlights of Amsterdam. Mark was a very interesting and amusing guide and his love of the city is obvious. The tour was verging on 3 hours when we finished the tour in a market none of us seemed to want it to finish. We learned an awful lot about the city with some good recommendations on places to return to. I just wish we'd had time to join his red light tour in the evening. Thank you Mark for a great beginning to our weekend away.

very informative and never dry. I went on this tour today and it was incredible. Because a group no-showed, there were only three of us, which I liked as the guide Mark was very good at answering my individual questions.
