Mark was very knowledgable and clearly very enthusiastic about Amsterdam and its history. The tour was about 2.5 hours long and I was not once bored for a moment. I highly recommend this tour for anyone looking to learn more about this amazing city.

If you want to learn more about all aspects of Amsterdam book a tour with the Dam Guide!!. My daughter and I joined Mark for both his daytime tour and evening Red Light tour, both of which we thoroughly enjoyed. It was good to be in small group which made it much more personal. Mark is an excellent guide - very knowledge on all you would want to know about Amsterdam and amusing too. Mark also showed us a couple of places that I do not think we would have found on our own - Reypenaer Cheese Shop where we went for a cheese and wine tasting the next day and the wonderful waffle shop with it's homemade ice cream. Thank you Mark for helping to make our trip to Amsterdam so enjoyable. Hope to be back one day and join in another of your tours.
Excellent!. Mark is a knowledgeable and entertaining guide, making the whole tour thoroughly enjoyable and very informative. Would not hesitate to recommend him.Trina A
Recommended. Excelent tour!! Nice guide who has love and knowledge for the city!! Very kindness!!I recommend!!!!

Fun and Informative. My daughter and I had a great time sharing 3 hours with Mark as he led us through some of the more interesting areas of the city. We loved his depth of knowledge and sense of humor... still laughing about the Rabbit King!I think we had about 10 people in our tour, which is the most he generally allows. Even with a group of 10, it is occasionally difficult to take in sidebar conversations along the way. But Mark made sure that everyone had a chance to ask their specific questions, and would be sure that all were present at the next stop before beginning the stories.Good job, Mark... will certainly recommend your tours to others!

Recommended. A fantastic city and the best man to show you round is Mark from "That Dam Guide". He really has a love for the place and it comes out during the tour, hes very informative and best of all makes it fun.

A guide with so much local knowledge. We met mark at stock exchange square for a two and a half hour walking tour of amsterdam. Originally from South Africa,Mark is full of energy and has an abundance of local and historic knowledge. He puts it across in a humorous and entertaining way. My concern for him is that the fifteen euros per person is not enough for him to live off. I also feel this is exceptional value for money. If you only do one tour whilst in amsterdam, do it with Mark as you will learn so much and have fun. We ended the tour with a drink in a local bar where Mark gave plenty of ideas for where to eat and drink.

Very knowledgeable. If you are looking for an incredibly knowledgeable tour guide who will add historical and quirky Dutch facts, then Mark is your guide. He really made the city come alive and was eager to answer any question that we had. I highly recommend him.

Great City Tour!. I highly recommend "That Dam Guide" Mark! My husband and I took his city tour last week. We maneuvered in and out of the streets and alleyways--many off the beaten path--throughout Amsterdam. We started in the historic city center where we learned about the history, architecture and the politics of Amsterdam and ended in the newer Jordaan area where we visited hidden courtyards and rested by a canal as we watched a lady feed a stork from her window. Mark really does give you a local view of his city and you never know what you'll run across while touring with him!

Excellent RLD tour!. My 16 yr old son and I joined Mark for a Saturday night RLD tour. Mark was a hoot! He lived in the RLD for a while and has many stories to share about living there. He has such enthusiasm, and his stories made us laugh a lot. I did a different RLD tour last year, and I enjoyed this one so much better. Mark told us everything you would ever want to know about the RLD. His personal stories added so much to the tour. I've done a lot of city walking tours around Europe and I have to say, Mark's RLD tour is at the top of the list! Sign up now!!!

Great Tour Guide & Tour. We thouroughly enjoyed the tour. Before we booked we weren't sure if it was going to be worth the money. From the begining to the end though, Mark was really engaging with the storytelling and history of Amsterdam. I came away from the tour with a sense of the evolution of Dutch culture and some memorable stories about wealthy merchants and modern activists.

Best City Tour we've ever done. The tour with mark is a "must-do" when you visit amsterdam!!!! His knowledge about this city is stunning and whatever you would like to know, he has the answer... We made the tour this morning and it was very entertaining!!! Thank you Mark!!!

Entertaining,. My boyfriend and I booked a RLD Tour with Mark last weekend and would definitely recommend it to anyone as not only was Mark very knowledgeable but he made us laugh the whole way. He gave us a deeper understanding about the history and the present day and added a few of his own stories which made it feel personal rather than someone giving a tour and reading it off of a script! He was very friendly and humble which made the whole group feel like it was a friend showing us around. It was without a doubt one of the highlights of our trip and I'm so glad we booked it as we now look at the RLD through different eyes!

Excellent tour!. Mark is fantastic! We went on both the Walking Tour and Red Light District Tour- both were well worth it! The groups are small enough to enjoy your time, and Mark gives you a real feel of Amsterdam.. I would highly recommend his tours to anyone visiting!

Top Notch Guide.... even for Germans ;). We had an awesome time with Mark , we really enjoyed the brilliant tour guiding ! Even though we only booked the City Tour he made a little side tour into the " älteste Gewerbe der Welt" as we Germans call it , this was just another highlight of the tour !!Mark made an big effort that everybody in the group enjoyed the trip, even for non english natives. Go for it !!

Best. Tour. Ever. So great!. What a wonderful value for your money! We did both tours with Mark- City and RLD. So happy we did both! The tours are very different but both great fun. We learned SO much! Mark is in the upper echelon of tour guides!!! He is extremely knowledgable, charismatic and articulate. Will tour with him again upon return to Amsterdam!

Best tours in Amsterdam. I went on the city tour with Mark and thought that it was so good that I booked on the Red Light District tour immediately for the night after! I normally go on City tours when I visit a place as I find it a great way to orientate yourself and find out about an area and I have to say that this tour was excellent. Mark was extremely knowledgeable and humorous and I felt that I learnt alot about the history and culture of Amsterdam whilst also having a ton of fun! I also went on other tours during my stay but this by far surpassed them in terms of quality and atmosphere. Highly, highly recommended!

If you do one thing in Amsterdam, go on a tour with Mark!. Mark was very friendly and funny, and took us on a great tour of the RLD. It was really interesting and I can't imagine there is a guide out there who knows the city and it's inhabitants as well as he does! It was great value and I would highly recommend one of Mark's tours to anyone.

Very knowledgeable and friendly. Mark really brought Amsterdam to life. We did the city tour and enjoyed it very much. Mark personalised the tour and his depth of knowledge meant you could ask all sorts of questions and go off on interesting tangents that made the tour special. Highly recommended.
very funny and awesome guide!. booked two tours with Mark - city tour and RLD. very informative and fun! you can see that he's really passionate about Amsterdam!

A great service and an excellent tour. Mark not only gave us a great tour, he also went out of his way to accommodate our special requests. Despite the weather raining on our parade, Mark was able to provide everyone with a poncho and made sure he stopped in sheltered places to protect us from the cold and rain while also giving us interesting facts and history about his fantastic city without getting too cold and wet. He also stopped in a lovely cafe for us to get warm which was just what everyone wanted. Only because he hosts such small groups is this possible and it's definitely worth the extra money as you also get to chat freely and ask whatever questions you want.It's a shame a group of 4 had booked but then didn't show as Mark always has to turn people away and we had to wait a bit to guarantee they weren't running late. We passed loads of huge free tours but being with Mark was like going on a stroll with a knowledgeable friend. Thanks Mark! The Joes.

Excellent thorough walking tour of Amsterdam. Mark has a great knowledge of both the quirky and mainstream history of Amsterdam. He is very personable and went out of his way to add some extra visits on our tour. We had a nice stop and rest halfway through while Mark explained the history of the Royal Palace. Definitely worth the price.

great thing to do during the evning hours. we recently joined marc on his tour through the rld and we really enjoyed it! its a great thing to do during the evening hours, he is friendly, funny, knows a lot about the area and its history and was happy to share his knowledge with us. we were a really small group, only 4 ppl and seen other groups with 15 plus ppl passing by. he told us that he has a max of 10 ppl. i really liked the private athmosphere and enjoyed the walk around the rld. much better then just passing by the windows yourself. definately recommendable!!kira and jose

Excellent City Tour. I booked this tour following reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, I was not dissapointed. Mark is a very knowledgeable tour guide who clearly loves the city, and his enthusiam was infectious. The tour group was small - 10 people in total (3 couples and four lads) which meant that the tour was tailored to the group and questions were always welcome. It also took in parts of the city that we'd never have seen if not for Mark and he even suggested places to visit that may be of interest after the tour had finished. Fantastic tour, I would definitely recommend it.

RLD Walking Tour. We met Mark a couple of weeks ago on a Saturday evening for a tour of the RDL. It was very small group - only one other couple which was great especially when we saw other tour groups that were massive and in multiple languages. Mark really knew so much detail about the area and it was really interesting and informative he answered all questions we had not only about the RDL but all of Amsterdam. The tour lasted over 3 hours as we stopped for a drink mid way through and then all went to a pub at the end! Would really recommend to everyone as it will change all your preconceptions of the RLD!

Excellent tour. We had an excellent tour with Mark. Informative and stimulating for the whole family (2 adults and 2 boys 12 and 15). Mark is incredibly enthusiastic and even extended the tour by about 30 minutes to take in a few extra sights. At the end he was very happy to make recommendations for other activities and mark points of interest on our map.

RLD tour - The best walking tour I have ever had. I have been to walking tours in various countries and cities before, but the RLD tour that I had with Mark was the best of them all. Mark took us around the RLD and educated us about the history and the life of the people in the area with great committment. I use the word "educated" against "told" as Mark spoke from true experience and did not tell us stuff that came purely out of a guide book, something that most other tour companies do. Mark obviously enjoyed his what he doing and I felt more informed and educated thanks to his knowledge and enthusiasm.A MUST-DO tour for every visitor to Amsterdam.

Something For Everyone. I live here in Amsterdam and have visitors all the time. I took my parents on a tour so they could get a good impression of the city and did not expect to learn so much about the cities history and inner workings as I did, nor to have as much fun as I did. It was the high light of the weekend and something we will all be remembering fondly for years to come. Mark has an unparalelled knowledge of the city and a way with people that puts you ease in his presence. I will be taking all my future visitors on this tour.
March Private Tour. I contacted him and set up a private tour. He did a great job and even extended the tour out to cover more neighborhoods. Highly recommended!

Enthusiastic, knowledgable and enjoyable!. It is obvious Mark enjoys his city and job! He did a great job, with our group of ten, in showing us around and telling us about Amsterdam. He seems very adept at basing his tour on the customers interests and has a passion for the history of this city. Let him know ahead of time how much time you have as his passion for his city could lead to a longer tour (at no additional charge). Great job Mark! Thank you!

A tour like no other. I have visited Amsterdam many times and am very familiar with the city, and even so Mark's tour taught me so much about the city and its history. His enthusiasm is infectious and he smoothly moves between history, fun facts and tourist information seamlessly so that you feel like you are taking part in a wonderful story, the time flies by! I was amazed by the incredible breadth and depth of detail he knew about the city and its history. There is something for everyone in the information he shares, whether you prefer quirky facts, the history or just getting a feel for the city, he covers it. Even better is that he is incredibly communicative and based on what the people in the group particularly are interested in he will slightly change the tour and focus more on some information rather than others. I had such a great time and would recommend it to anyone visiting, or living, in Amsterdam!

Small private tour. We opted for a private tour with Mark as we wanted a combination of both his tours. We had the best of both worlds and with just 4 of us we had loads of chance to ask questions.He also recommended some things for us to do over the rest of our weekend and we took up his suggestion to do a bike ride and crossed over on the free ferry to the north of the city.Great fun. We couldn't find the micro brewery!! Thanks Mark

Interesting, funny and enjoyable!. The city-tour was really worth it. Mark knows all the interesting things and funny facts about Amsterdam. And if you have only a limited time in the city he shows you what you shouldnt miss. That all in a small group, so the atmosphere is relaxed and enjoyable.

Best Tour Ever. The tour was funny, interesting, and informative. The whole time we saw beautiful places in amsterdam while also learning a lot about it's history and cool facts. I enjoyed every bit of it and highly recommend it to anyone who visits amsterdam and wants to to a great tour.
Great tour. Mark is not only knowing the city, he really loves it and it's history. That is what makes the difference between informing and passing on passion.

Fun with an in-depth knowledge of Amsterdam. This tour was great! Mark knew the details of Amsterdam history and was very good at answering questions that came up. It was so nice to be in a small group. We went by other tours that had more that 25 people. Mark also was fun and peppered his talk with stories about characters in Dutch history. He was happy to tailor the talk as we went along and if anyone needed to stop for a drink or wanted to hear more about a topic he was very willing. We paid for 2 hours but got a 3 hour tour. As he extended the tour he asked if anyone was ready to wrap up or if they wanted to see additional hidden courtyards in the Jordan. We were all very eager but he would have accommodated us either way. It was an exceptional tour that lead us to explore parts of Amsterdam we may not have ventured into otherwise. We went back to see the church Our Father in the Attic the next day. I highly recommend this tour!

Excellent RLD tour. Tour was fun, informative and interesting.Mark keeps everyone interested in the tour with his anecdotes.His knowledge of the area is amazing and you are sure to find outunknown/little known things about the place.You can find out what to do/not do in this amazing place called amsterdam with help from Mark.

Dam Good. Personable, punctual and very knowledgeable about the Red Light District. Small group so we had time to ask questions, take photos, etc. Fantastic for someone solo (as I was) who doesn't want to tour this area alone (even though it seemed safe--lots of police!). And at the end of the tour, Mark even flagged down a taxi so I could return to hotel. Ovrerall--well worth it!

Nice Guide!!. This guy knows very well about Amsterdam. i had a very nice walking tour with him, he really like the city so he tells nice stories about it. And also he can give you great personal advices to enjoy the city.

Intimate and different. Great little walking tour - small and intimate, Mark knows so much and cares so much about the city. In the end ours went on a little too long (about 4hrs) - I think because actually it was quite a small and intimate group, but it was fascinating and despite walking the streets of 'Dam for three days before, this tour somehow covered all the bits we hadn't yet seen and there were quirky and funny stories thrown in too.Pleased I did it and was a perfect way to finish the trip. Small outfit, deserves to do well so keep it up!

the highlight of my weekend. I went to Amsterdam on Saturday with a group of friends who were planning to drink the weekend away. As I am not so hard-core I decided to take a private 3 hour tour with Mark. It was fantastic - Mark really knows his stuff and no question is too random. He has loads of great stories and has such a passion for the city. It's very easy to go to a city and not really see it at all and I was at serious risk of this this weekend! Mark is very entertaining and he really made me laugh. He really knows his history and presents it in such an entertaining way. I managed to totally impress my friends afterwards with my knowledge nuggets of the city over the rest of the weekend. Thank you, Mark xxx

Simply Great!!!. Mark is an excellent guide! His tour is relaxed, interesting, informative! My boyfriend did't want to take the tour, but eventually he said it was the best thing we did in Amsterdam.Great stories, flexible route, most importantly small and personalised approach (small groups - we were 6)! There is certainly quality in Mark's tours. On the way we saw other guided tours with huge groups of 30-50 people wondering around like lost sheep. So I felt even more special being in such a small group.The tour was supposed to be 2.5 hours, but Mark did it for extra one hour without extra charge! Also because I was the first to book this tour and I could not manage to do it at 11 in the morning due to late arrival to Amsterdam, so Mark very kindly changed the time for us! He is superb in all senses and very very funny and knowledgeable! He simply loves Amsterdam and you can understand this if you go on his website. We visited many of the places he suggests on his web and we were very pleased in every single place we went! DO NOT MISS the opportunity to have a great time in Amsterdam!!!

Two Thumbs Up. This is a fantastic tour. We met Mark and were initially unsure of what to expect from a tour of the Red Light District. We had a small tour (4 people), Mark made us feel very welcome, then proceeded to walk us through the Red Light District stopping to tell us it's stories and history in great detail. He was very passionate about all aspects of the area and it's people, telling tales that had all 4 of us laughing throughout. I think this is where "That Dam Guide" really stands out. This is not a by the numbers tour but took different directions depending on our interaction with our guide. Mark also answered questions on all aspects of Amsterdam and introduced us to a few very nice bars - he even helped us order some local beers and stayed for a chat.I would highly recommend taking this tour if you are in Amsterdam, it shows that the RLD is not just stag parties and prostitution. Every door tells a different story and Mark seems knows them all.

Excellent!. Mark was the perfect tour guide. He was very informative, friendly and funny. It was a great way to see the city and learn about the history and culture. I would highly recommend anyone visiting Amsterdam to get in touch with Mark

Best Tour Ever!. Mark gave one of the best tours I have ever been on in any city! He really knows Amsterdam and has a real passion for the city. Any time you are in Amsterdam no trip is complete without a tour from Mark!

See the details of Amsterdam!. Mark definitely knows his Amsterdam! My wife and myself were there for 5 days and I booked a personal guided tour by Mark for our first day. He had personalized the tour to what we had asked him for. The history, culture and the things Amsterdam has to offer now. He had listened to what I had asked for and did a fantastic job. We spent 7 hours with him and that set us up for the remainder of our trip to the city. Mark made a number of suggestions about places to see and visit and we tried them all. Not one was a disappointment, in fact they were all great. I did a personal guided tour of Moscow last year and that was also the best way to see the city. You can save a few Euros and go in a group, but if you really want to see the city in all it's "lights" then book Mark. One recommendation though is talk to him beforehand and let him know what you are looking for, he will sort it.Thanks Mark. If we ever come back to Amsterdam I know you would be happy to meet us for a beer!

Loved it!. Very informative and entertaining! Mark clearly LOVES Amsterdam! You can see it in his eyes and in the way he keeps you interested from start to finish! Forget those free tours of 60 tourists to one guide! Pay a few Euros and choose Mark instead! Worth every cent! Thank you Mark!

If you've never done a guided tour.... I've never done a guided tour before, why would you? Just read a book, visit the city and do your own tour. Well I cynically went to meet our "orange bobbled hat" guide, wondering what could he possibly talk about for the next 3 hours. Well I learned at least 2 things; 3 hours went so quickly, Mark can talk, he knows so much about the city. What he did not know, he e-mailed us later that day, such a thoughtful person.If you planning a visit to Amsterdam, this was my 4th visit, book a trip with Mark, we went for a private tour, highly recommended. You'll get a unique insight into Amsterdam and Mark as well!

Great Tour and Guide. The tour was very informativ and mark is a funny well knowledged guy. He talk about the history of amsterdam and guide us through a lot of historical places. The group was small (maximum 10 people) and therefore Mark can focus on all people within the group. I can advise this tour to everybody who visti amsterdam.

Excellent! Mark is very entertaining and informative!. So glad I did this, we learnt so much and was a great way to see all the sights.Mark is lovely and makes the tour. He really knows his stuff and is passionate about it all, totally happy to answer any questions.The fact he keeps the numbers to max 10 is great, as it means you are all involved and get to chat as a group together. Totally recommend it!

Best tour in Amsterdam. I did a lot of other tours in Amsterdam, but this was by far the best one. Mark is such a good tour guide, and he knows the city so well. He does not just tell you what you will hear on so many other tours, Mark knows all about the ´real Amsterdam´ and he will tell you all you need/want to know. He is very funny, kind, and just a wonderful person. I did his free tour, his coffeeshops tour, and his red light district tour, and all were full of humor and interesting facts and information. I really really recommend you to do this tour, preferably at the beginning of your stay in Amsterdam. Thank you so much Mark!

A city brought to life!. We did a full day walking tour with mark today. It was awesome and he was so knowledge and funny. He provided loads of information about the history of the city, red light district and coffee bars. He showed us some beautiful buildings and areas. We had the best fries and mayo ever!he has also recommended loads of stuff to do this week. Would thoroughly recommend him to anyone who really wants to get to know this city.

Wholeheartedly recommend this tour. Mark is a very knowledgeable, fun guide - and he managed to give me a lot of information about my own city that I had never heard of before. Very entertaining and interesting - really recommend it if you're visiting the city, or even if you have lived here for years. Eye-opener and never boring!

Not a fan of guided tours.... ...BUT MARK CHANGED MY OUTLOOK COMPLETELY!! If you go to Amsterdam and don't go on a tour with Mark, you haven't truly been to Amsterdam. The three hour tour was very informative and interesting with entirely too much to list. Mark's humor and true knowledge of the "real amsterdam" was the highlight of our trip. I can't wait to visit again!!
Soo much fun!!. This was a really fun tour. Mark was an awesome tour guide. He's super friendly, quirky and funny with lots and lots of fun facts and stories to share. Highly recommend it.

Intelligent and Fun Guide. Do not hesitate to book your Amsterdam tour with Mark! My husband and I did two private tours with Mark, the Amsterdam overview and the Red Light District. Mark not only understands the history of Amsterdam, but gives great insight into the present day Amsterdam culture and politics. The Red Light tour was a compassionate take on the people that live and work in the district. I really appreciate this thoughtful approach rather than just gawking at the women. Great educational and entertaining experience, it's like experiencing a city with a friend!!!!

Great tour: small group, well researched and presented, entertaining!. Myself and a friend joined Mark for his RLD tour on 8th February (a busy Saturday evening). I had booked the previous evening online via Marks website, and received confirmation email straight away, which gave details of the tour meeting point which was easy to find. There were 8 people on the tour that evening, I think it's great that Mark limits the numbers to 10 people as it really does make a difference i.e. being able to gather round and hear all the information and there were plenty of opportunities to ask questions. We saw some other tour groups wandering round in groups of around 30! When we arrived in Amsterdam earlier in the day we did a brief walk around the RLD, and so had several questions and things we wanted find out about from the tour. Mark was able to provide all the information we had wanted plus more. Highly recommended!

Don't miss the chance! Book a tour!. I am not a fan of guided tours, but this one was outstanding! Mark is not only the funniest guy but is extremely familiar with Amsterdam and the Red Light District. We had not only a guided visit in the RLD, but numerous remarks of the very history of the city around it. Very thoughtful with its crowd by not overcrowding the tour, first of all, and, also, to deliver such good explanations you can feel that the guy does his homework for the tour, not just pointing and telling shallow things (which is my impression on most guided tours). Fully recommended! Don't miss the chance! You'll have the funniest guided tour ever! =)
I Learned so much during this tour and I live in Amsterdam!. Had a great time! Mark was funny, friendly and informative. Will recomend to all my friends when they come to visit.

Amazing Experience. Mark is fantastic. He made my trip to Amsterdam worthwhile. He not only knows alot about the city, its history, places to see etc but he adds this personal touch to the tour, which makes it awesome :) I ended up doing both; the city and red light district tour! Definitely recommend him.

Best walking tour guide!. Mark was absolutely fantastic! He has a very vast knowledge of the city, it's rich history and he could explain the structure and architecture of the buildings really well and i reckon not many other guides would be able to give a tour like him. His entire tour was just so interesting and at the end of it, we knew so many things about the city and it was just amazing. BEST TOUR GUIDE EVER! Kudos MARK!

Fantastic, Funny and Knowledgeable. Mark did an absolute fantastic job! I had him as my tour guide for the Red Light District tour and it was amazing. Not only was he extremely knowledgable with first hand accounts, interviews, and insights, but he was also extremely funny and personable. Mark is a well-educated and intelligent tour guide that really knows his facts. He has even taken the time to interview girls in the red light district and has many friends that have shared various interesting stories with him. Thus I could not think of a more perfect tour guide. I highly recommend him and any tour that he gives.

Best guide ever. Marc is not only a well-educated guide through beautiful Amsterdam but also brings you the city's history on a funny, humourous way that you forget everything around you...even the bicycles coming along (thank god, Marc also takes care about this and you, too!) Thank you again and all the best. July and Ben from Germany

2 tours - best part of our trip to A'dam. Mark was kind enough to squeeze me and my partner in to two tours at short notice - the city tour and the red light tour. Both were awesome. We liked the smaller group size (which is capped at 10 people I think) which allowed for more communication within the group and also speedier tour with more stops and info. Mark was great - showed us some very interesting sights and taught us lots about the history etc of the city, architecture, policy, trade/finance and the RLD. Definitely recommend That Dam Guide - provides an invaluable and local perspective of the city and is far better than the large groups of 20+ people. Thanks Mark. All the best! -Adam and Jess

Very enjoyable and informative. Never had a walking tour before, found it very informative and interesting. Mark managed to convey the history of the town and it's culture in such a friendly and warm way. He has a strong insight into the Dutch way of life . Glad it wasn't raining but it was bittery cold walking round. Would definately recommend it to anyone visiting the city for the first time. We were only in Amsterdam for two nights but would certainly recommend people to take the tour at the beginning of their stay, he gave us some good pointers and references. Would love to go back again .Thanks again Mark

Great Tour and Great Guide. My Girlfriend and I both really enjoyed Mark's guide of the Red Light District. Mark is very friendly, he has a great insight to the area having lived there and having also become friends with some of the girls who work in the area. This allowed him to be very knowledgable and insightful as to how he presented the tour and the information he shared with the group, mixed in with some humour and stories / experiences that he's witnessed along way made for a great tour that we would definately recommend is worth joining.

went above and beyond to customize our perfect tour. I need to remember to keep this short and simple otherwise I will end up blabbing on for pages on just how much we appreciated this tour, Mark's time, and really that he made our Amsterdam trip one of the best cities ever visited, and leaving with that feeling 'I need to come back soon'. It was really unforgettable.He knew of the WWII tour we had previously done (and really enjoyed), and did a private tour with us weaving in the red light district, as well as a historical tour, and basically customized this really specific experience based on what he knew we were interested in, and the things he knew we couldn't miss. It was perfect, absolutely perfect. I could go on and on about all the things we learned, but what I can remember the most is the feeling I left with after the tour, feeling so enamored by the place, but also there were now so many more things we wanted to do and visit before we left. We ended up canceling the rest of our country list to spend more time in Amsterdam as a result, no regrets and was my favorite part of our vacation!We pretty much followed Mark's website for all our food and sightseeing needs and left with a feeling that we had gotten past the tourist layer, and was feeling like an Amsterdammer just getting a burger and meeting new friends on a Thursday night and going to our favorite pub for our usual tripel karmeliet. Really, we are lucky to have met Mark, and highly recommend this tour, any tour! Check out his website too, there are a lot of good recommendations for food/sightseeing/things currently going on. It ended up being kind of a one stop shop for us!All the best to you Mark!

Very informative! Definitely recommend!. Great tour guide! I joined the red light district tour. He talked about all the things that you can think of or you might want to ask. It's great to let someone who actually have lived near red light district to tell you the story. I would say this is the most valuable experience in my Amsterdam trip. For the price you pay, it's totally worthy. Definitely recommend!

Don't miss this tour!!. Mark's red light district tour was fantastic. Very informative and entertaining. I highly recommend it! Unfortunately, the weather was against us, but Mark brought along ponchos for everyone. Wonderful tour!

Was absolutely awesome!. Great tour guide! So glad I looked on here to find him!!! Amazing value for money, extremely knowledgable and interesting! He goes the extra mile to ensure that your visit is unique and spectaclur! (Free panchos-Great touch in the rain!) You won't regret it!!!

WOW!. I was reallly impressed by the Red Light District Tour. If I haven't been there with Mark around, it would be just wandering throught the streets and staring at these purple windows (and girls behind them) from time to time . But with this guide I got to know all the backgroundand ots of cool and interesting stuff about the neighbourhood. The general tour was also quite awesome. I recomend walking with this guy on your first day in Amsterdam. This way you'll realise what a fascinating citu you've just arrived in

Simply fantastic!. Cannot put into words how great Mark is as a tour guide. Witty, knowledgable, friendly. Shaped the tour based on us & our questions, clearly knows his stuff, general information, history, personal stories thrown in. One of the Highlights of my trip. Loved it!
Amsterdam walking tour. Thank you mark for the great tour. Great reference to historical sites and indicated current local attractions. If you only have 1 day in Amsterdam, do he's tour.

Knowledgeable and Interesting. Mark was extremely knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam, not only from history books but also from personal experience. He was very entertaining and articulate, and was able to keep the tour group hanging on his every word. I would thoroughly recommend this our to anyone, whether solo, a couple, in a group, or as a family.

best tour guide in amsterdam. My friend and I enjoyed this tour despite the freezing weather, which we persevered through in January because we didn't want to miss a second of it! He really knows his history and could give in depth answers to every question.

Best tour. . Visited Amsterdam during a 5 week trip and was fascinated by the uniqueness of the red light district. Went on the "Red light tour" with "that Dam guide" and it was the most interesting and enjoyable tour I have done. His knowledge and sense of humour made it such an experience. Highly recommend going on the walk on your first night to hear his tips and ideas in regard to this wonderful city.

Entertaining and educational. I did the Red Light tour with Mark. He was funny, entertaining, and knew a lot about the area and people. I was impressed! I loved hearing the background information and the stories he shared. Highly recommended!
A very good GUIDE!. A very nice experience, Mark helped us to recognize all the curiosity of the red district! Now I am an expert!!! Thanks also for the coffee!
The less than 3 meter mountain. Mark was great! Not only did he show us Amsterdam, but helped me understand the mentality of today's resident and generally why that is.
great tour. Amazing, educational and funny. Anything you want to know about Red Light District ask Mark. He knows people, places, habbits, everything. Worth every cent!!

Amazing tour guide. I had the pleasure of doing a Red Light district tour with Mark. It was insightful and highly entertaining. He really knew his stuff and clearly enjoys what he does. I got a lot out of it, would highly recommend.
Great Guy !. We had a great and funny day with mark !We can recommend him to everybody and he is worse any money !

Mark is the man.. Mark is the man. Highly recommend for tours. WE really appreciated his recommendations for cafes, sights, restaurants etc. - all of which did not disappoint. In particular, Mark recommended an excellent value cheese tasting experience, waffles, canal tour, and restaurant which we really appreciate as (very) budget constrained tourists. Don't miss Mark and his pompom.

The best guide in Amsterdam (and perhaps ever)!. I did the Red Light District tour with Mark in January of this year and it was the best 10 euro that I have ever spent! Not only was he very informative, he was also incredibly entertaining! He was full of great stories about his time in Amsterdam, which made all of the information so much more relatable. It was a really fun two or so hours and I would highly recommend this tour to everyone going to Amsterdam! If I'm ever back I'll do it again.

And interesting walk. I did this tour in January 2014, I really enjoyed and I found out the craziest things about Amsterdam. I recommend this walking tour. The guide knows a lot about the subject (Red light distric)

Fun and educational city tour!!. Our family took a tour with Mark in July 2013. It was the best tour of our European vacation. We learned so much about the city and it's history, Mark is very entertaining! Would recommend this tour to anyone, and will be taking it and the other tours he offers again if in Amsterdam.The CartersCanada

Great tour. Amazing tour experience of Amsterdam, the dam guide gives a very enthusiastic tour. With lots of laughs along the way. He has a great passion for the tour and the city! Was very interesting to learn more about the amazing city of Amsterdam from this delightful gentleman!! Will definitely be recommending mark to friends and family!!!

Wonderful Tour!. I went on a tour with my family and had an amazing time. I am now going to school nearby and am not only telling my friends to go with him, but am going with them! Such an interesting guy with lots of fun little details. Gave a wonderful tour even in the rain. Loved it!!

Walking tour of Amsterdam. Wow! Mark is a very down to earth man with a fantastic sense of humour making the 2.5 hours absolutely fly. Mark knows a great amount about Amsterdam and it's way, he doesn't just give you that memorised script that most tour guides do. Mark has his own unique way of informing you of Amsterdam and it's interesting history. I have done a lot of tours throughout Europe and Mark's tour stands out without doubt. I would definitely recommend him to anyone who is wanting to find there way around Amsterdam and learn the ways. Well done Mark, you should be very proud of yourself and your achievements. All the best!

Very interesting and enthusiastic tour of the city. Mark clearly loves his history and knew how to present it in an engaging way. He coped very well with such a large group of people and managed to keep everyone interested. He was willing to field questions and was very knowledgeable

Amsterdam tour Oct 2012. We took an Amsterdam tour including the Red Light District in Oct 2012. A great communicator, intelligent and entertaining. I have recommended Mark to friends travelling to Amsterdam and they have not been disappointed.

Red Light District Tour. Mark is a fantastic tour guide! 6/5 stars. If you are interested/ can fit this tour into your schedule, you must. I learned so much. Very informative and super interesting. Jennette from WA
Great tour!. excellent tour! Friendly, informative, entertaining. Would take any tour he has offer. Highly suggest

Mark's walking tour of Amsterdam. Mark was a fantastic guide, very funny and so informative, I don't usually go on trip advisor but I think he really deserves it! I would recommend him to everyone as he truly works for the people doing the tour and not for the money involved! The tour goes for 2.5 hours and goes around Amsterdam explaining the city's history and why it's like it is today! I have done many tours and I always measure them how much info I can remember at the end, if it's lots it means the tour guide did a great job and made it memorable - mark achieved this!

Really Dam Great. Met a friend on Christmas Eve and decided to join in on the tour. Great decision! Mark was a fantastic guide for the Red Light District. He knows a lot about Amsterdam and is really passionate about the city, the Red Light District, and informing people about the history of the neighborhood (as well as explaining current events that jeopardize the sex industry). Learned a lot, saw some interesting things, and Mark made every stop on the tour enjoyable. You have to do this tour, simple as that.

Absolutely loved it!. It is always so refreshing to meet someone who is so passionate about what they do and Mark is as passionate as they come. I only had one day to tour Amsterdam and was so glad to be part of Mark's tour! He didn't just show us the landmarks; he gave context, history and insight and wove the whole tour into a great story (with lots of funny bits). If you are going to be in Amsterdam for a few days, I recommend going for Mark's tour first. The tour will have a sense for what to spend time doing for the rest of the trip and he also gives really good advice on fun things to do! Also, such a friendly guy!!!

Fun and highly recommended. Mark's walking tour was great. Whether you only have one day or all the time in the world to discover Amsterdam you can't go wrong starting with a tour from Mark. I am generally a terrible tourist and thought I would start out on the tour and split off when I got bored or saw something better along the way. That just didn't happen. Mark was super informative, and entertaining. His history of Amsterdam and stories kept me wanting more and eager to see the next point of interest.

Best Dam Guide Ever!!. We did an afternoon city walking tour with Mark and enjoyed it so much we decided to book the Red Light District Tour in the evening. Mark is incredibly knowledgeable and has some fantastic insights from personal experiences having lived in Amsterdam. We also had the pleasure of sharing a drink with Mark between tours. Best guide you could ask for and not to be missed tours!

The Best Amsterdam Tour!. I took the city walking tour and the red light district tour, and it was a wonderful experience. He absolutely loves the city and he knows the city really well. He has really interesting stories and I really liked the explanation and the deep insight of the sex industry in amsterdam from both sides. I definitely recommend this tour for all tourists planning to Amsterdam!

Excelent and fun. Mark provides a personal and fun city tour. I enjoyed the tour a lot. He made from 3 hours walking a nice experience to remember. You get everything you can get in a tour; history, secrets of the city, curiosities, jokes plus a lot of fun. Highly recommended.

Informative and entertaining tours. I did the city walking tour with Mark in late October '13 and came back to Amsterdam with my girlfriend in January '14. Mark was fantastic on the city tour so naturally I was thrilled when I saw that he would be the guide for our tour of the Red light district! I rank both tours among the best I've done anywhere in Europe. Mark is highly intelligent, entertaining and has a great outlook on life. I wish him all the best in his career as a tour guide!

Knowledgeable and fun!. Mark's tour is a great way to spend your first couple of hours in Amsterdam. He gives a quick overview of the history, points out interesting features of all the buildings, tells lots of colorful anecdotes, and freely dispenses opinions on everything from politics to restaurant and coffeeshop tips for later in your stay. He ends each stop with a teaser about the story for the next. As other reviewers noted, he clearly loves his job and often invites his guests to join him for refreshments during breaks and after the tour. Rain or shine, it's great fun!

Recommend this tour. I went on one of Mark's walking tours in Amsterdam - he was very insightful and knowledgeable as well as entertaining and fun. Thoroughly recommend him to anyone interested in learning more about Amsterdam.

Perfect!. Mark is awesome, besides having a great passion and knowledge about amsterdam, he is really friendly, we had some drinks after the tour and he gave us great tips for what to do afterwards. 100% recommended

What a lovely, informative guy!!. Mark is absolutely made to be a tour guide!! He took us all over the city, from Dam Square, through the red light district ending at Anne Frank's house. He has a real way with words and can spin a yarn!I would thoroughly recommend Mark as a tour guide- he even stayed in the pub with us after the tour to tell us more tales!What a genuinely lovely guy!!! Could not recommend more xxx

Excellent introductory tour. Having a 12 hour layover in Schipol, I joined a tour, led by a very fun guide called Mark Law (http://www.marklaw.org/) was a great way to spend my limited time in the city.The tour goes through some of the well known areas in the center of the city with explanations about old and recent history, social issues and what to do next in Amsterdam.Mark guidance was above all expectations: capturing, humorous and never ever boring.My only disappointment was that I could not stay and take the other tours.

Great tour. We went on an tour with him on Christmas day and it was very pleasant! Mark is a very calm, funny guy that knows a lot about Amsterdam history. I sure recommen a tour with him, it totally worth it!

That great dam guide. I had a very nice tour with Mark. He knows a lot of curious stuff about the city and also he is very funny. He is very receptive to questions and answers them straight. I wish I could have done the Red Light District tour with him too. Tour recommended!

Great guy!. I went on a tour with Mark today and it was really great! He knew so much about amsterdam, the history, the now, the funny and all interesting!! He pointed us in the right directions for the things we wanted, and answered every question we asked. I have already recommended him to friends and recommend him you! Thanks Mark!

Fabulous, informative guide. I took the Red Light District tour with Mark and had a wonderful two hours walking through the area. This is definitely the best way to visit Amsterdam - doing so with someone who loves his city and takes great pride in showcasing it to visitors. Cannot recommend him highly enough - follow that orange pom pom and you'll have a great new view on the Red Light District!

Fantastic, first hand experience tour!. I went on a red light district tour with Mark in Amsterdam and I actually came out at the end of the tour with a different perspective of the prostitution industry in Amsterdam! It was a very knowledgeable tour and it was great to have a guide who knew his stuff from first hand interactions living in the area and having friends who worked in the industry, instead of someone who had just done a little reading on the topic. For a very reasonable price, it has to be the best tour and tour guide you could get in Amsterdam!

Not to be missed - a real insight into the red light district. I was very lucky to have Mark as tour guide on the Red Light District tour. He knew everything there was to know (and probably more than you thought there was to know!) about this infamous area - who the people are, where you should visit, how much things cost, history and future plans for the area. Having lived in the city for many years and being familiar with the ladies of the area, Mark's stories were entertaining, interesting and insightful. I couldn't recommend his tour enough.
Fabulous!. I took part in Mark's guide to the red light district. He was great!! So knowledgable and made the tour not only informative but entertaining and hilarious!!
Great tour!. Very fun experience filled with interesting facts about history and current Amsterdam, thanks for this fun experience Mark :)

Fantastic!!!!. I took the red light district tour and all I can say is that Amsterdam is lucky to have a guide like Mark. His interesting narratives during the tour were fantastic. I highly recommend this tour to everyone who plans a trip to Amsterdam.

A must do!!. For something that I wasn't really interested in seeing when in Amsterdam but the husband wanted to (obviously) and thought I'm here so i had to go see it all for myself. It was nice to be walked through the red light district with an explanation to go with. Very interesting and knowledgable tour. Would definitely recommend to friends :)

Excellent tour!. Mark gave a great tour including historical places, good stories, and a quirky sense of humour! He was very friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the area! You won't regret taking a tour with him.

Must go for the first time in Amsterdam!. I went to both the free walking tour and the red light district walking tour. Mark gave a very good presentation on both tour. If it is your first time in Amsterdam, I would suggest you to join the free walking tour to get a good introduction of the city. Mark is also very friendly and you can just walk up to him and chat with him.

An Amsterdam Tour Not to Be Missed!. The tour with Mark Law was professional, informative and fun. The three hour tour was filled with historical information as we had an easy walk during our journey throughout and in between the canals and streets of Amsterdam. His lighthearted nature and energy made the tour exciting as he provided us unique and sometimes hilarious stories of the sites we visited, the diversity of the people, the rules and regulations and the leaders of the country. This tour was fantastic and we recommend it to be the first thing on your list to do when visiting Amsterdam. Mark also provides other exciting tours which we will be sure to take upon on next journey to this wonderful city. Thank You Mark! Jim and Patty Penta, Denver, Colorado

Our walking Tour of The Red Light District was a highlight of our trip.. Mark's Red Light District tour was recommended by a friend and I can't thank her (and Mark) enough! My 21-year-old daughter and I were fascinated by everything we saw and learned on the 2-hour + walking tour. Mark knows a lot of characters who reside in the District and shared many of their stories with the group. You can tell Mark respects the ladies in the red windows and has in fact chatted with many of them so that he can share accurate facts and figures. DO NOT just wander through the Red Light District on your own. Spend two hours with Mark and let him show it to you. You will not regret it.

Interesting, knowledgeable and quirky guide! . I was apart of the red light district tour that Mark led. He was a fantastic guide that gave a great insight into life in the red light district and Amsterdam. Definitely a must do!
When in Amsterdam. Take part in the red light district tour. Mark is a great guide and gives a very entertaining tour. Don't miss out!
Mark is a great tour guide. I went on the city walking tour with Mark and it was great, he knows the city very well and has a very fun and particular way to tell stories. Super recommended!

super interesting. whether you are coming to amesterdam for fun or for more formal visiting, you should give mark a try as he is simply awesome - up-to-date, funny, gets you to nice spots in the city and is very interesting. do not miss out! loved it.

Excellent walking tour. My boyfriend and I went on a 3 hour Amsterdam wide walking tour with Mark. We have been on walking tours in a lot of other European cities and have found that the quality can be very variable. Mark met all of our expectations and more! Despite having a larger than expected tour group (30 or so people), Mark battled on giving a detailed, entertaining and thorough tour of the city. He went to extra lengths to make sure everyone could hear what he was saying and that everyone was safe (it's hard to keep an eye in so many people around bikes and cars). I'd say this is a good tour to do on your first day in Amsetrrdam to give you a general idea of what the city has to offer - then you can explore further in your own. Definitely hit up Mark for an Amsterdam tour!
brilliant. Loved the city tour...lotsof anecdotes and history facts that were very interesting. The red light tour was a lot less exciting.

Fun! Incredible! REAL MUST DO in Amsterdam!. I was walking around, and suddenly I saw a group, listening to this guy, with the orange "pom Pom"... He looks cute, so I got closer to hear what he was saying! After a minutes, I understood it was the guided visit I was looking for!!! I joined the group! It was really fun! He told us a little about history, architecture, and many other stuff, but he did it in that special way, that it was just impossible not paying attention! He's fun, cute and he really knows the city!!! He gave us, lots of recommendations, and GREAT advice!! After we finished the tour, he told us about the "red zone" tour... THAT WAS THE MOST INTERESTING AND FUN TOUR I've ever done!! Mark did it great! He told us stories, real stories of those girls (and boys!!) some how, he show us, the real life in the Amsterdam Red Zone! And, he also gave us Some great tips about where to go, and where NOT to!I really recommend this tour! I mean it: is a MUST DO do during your stay in the city!
very interesting. Attended the free city tour and red light tour.both were quite nice. He really knows his stuff. Cheer's

Fantastic!!!!. I took the red light district tour and all I can say is that Amsterdam is lucky to have a guide like Mark. His interesting narratives during the tour were fantastic. I highly recommend this tour to everyone who plans a trip to Amsterdam.

Excellent intro to Amsterdam-Can't Miss!. We got lucky enough to take a tour with Mark today in Amsterdam and couldn't be happier. Even in the less than desirable weather, Mark was able to keep us interested and laughing all afternoon. By combining his personal experience, historical knowledge, and passion for Amsterdam into the tour, Mark left us wishing the tour lasted all night. He sets the bar very high for city tours!

Put this on your To Do List!. Mark gives great tours. I learned so much about the area and it was so much fun! I did a 2 hour walking tour of the city and he answered all my questions and recommended places to check out during my trip. So helpful. Be sure to check him out!
Excellent guide!. Mark is an incredibly knowledgeable and passionate tour guide - he REALLY knows his stuff, and it never feels as if it's scripted. And his stories as the absolute best!

Very, very good.. I can't imagine other guides being so knowledgeable and passionate as Mark. He is probably as good a guide as there is. He knows details most others do not, and from an intellectual perspective, his Red Light District tour was spectacular. Fun, with a sense of humour, easy to talk to. If you can go out for a quick drink with him afterwards, it's always a nice highlight of a travel, being able to have a conversation with a local. Christmas Day might have been a bit of a down time for the RLD area, but on a positive note, it was easy to navigate through the streets without dodging large crowds and drunk people. Thank you Mark (and Eric too), maybe I'll bump into you again some day.

Pretty Dam Good!. Make this the first thing you do on your visit to Amsterdam! This is not your run-of-the-mill, scripted tour delivered by some boring guide who can't wait to get away from you. Mark is very passionate about Amsterdam, and it shows! A great tour that mixes historical facts with personal anecdotes, and allows you to gain insight into Amsterdam and it's people. We did the City Walk and Red Light District Tour: both highly recommended! Keep up the good work...
Must do while you are in Amsterdam!. That was amazing walking tour. I loved that guide was telling not only facts, but also interesting stories from his own experience :-) I had a really good time!

Passionate, knowledgable guide!!. Mark provided us with an exceptional tour of Amsterdam city. His passion for the history of Amsterdam was clearly evident and made our experience better than we could have imagined. He was witty, helpful and respectful (even regarding some of the more colorful aspects of Amsterdam). I particularly liked that he made plenty of time for questions and you did not feel rushed like some of the other tours I've been on. Mark even spent time with our group after the tour had ended where he took us to a local pub for Stampot and marked our maps with other places to visit in Amsterdam. It was a genuine service and Mark clearly was happy to provide it. I highly recommend a tour with Mark. He's a damn good guide!!

One of the favourite parts of the holiday. Such a good experience, had lots of fun on our tour and would recommend mark to everyone, such a friendly guy, one of the highlights of our trip and good value for money aswell

Excellent Walking Tour of Amsterdam!. Mark does an awesome walking tour of the Red Light district. Very passiomate about his tour and delivered with many personal stories and experiences that really add to the feel of the tour. If you have a few hours spare, definitely worth going on.

You got to book a tour with Mark!. The walking tour we had with Mark was the highlight of our holiday. This guy is so passionate about Amsterdam, it is actually contagious!! we loved it, We were told lots of facts and funny stories that just made us fall in love with this amazing city even more. Simply great!

Would definitely recommend. It's refreshing to have a guide who is really passionate about what he's doing and strives to give the best tour he can every time. I felt the effort and appreciated his humor and wit. This was a lovely tour given by someone clearly in love with the city.

long live the republic!. learnt a lot of cool stuff about my home town with mark-with-the-orange-pompom. he was excellent: funny, knowledgeable, clear, and passionate about amsterdam & holland's, including the little known time that the country was a republic.a great way to get to know and/or learn more about amsterdam!

Best Dam Guide!. Mark is a excellent guide! He's very knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam, embodies the spirit of Amsterdam and delivered both on his tour. He shared his favorite spots along the tour and was able to offer suggestions for anything that any of is asked. He seems to gave a true passion for sharing his city.
Worth joining. I joined the Red Light District tour, very informative and interesting. Good to know whats going on behind the windows! Would definitely recommend this to my friends!

Absolutely the Best. My wife and I travel frequently in Europe, and Amsterdam is one of our favorite cities.We are partial to small group walking tours because they generally offer a more intimate tour experience. Of the dozens of walking tours we have done over the years, I can honestly say that Mark's is the best. He possesses a vast knowledge of Amsterdam's history and culture, and he presents it in an amazingly entertaining and engaging manner. As a teacher, I quickly recognize those with an ability to connect with others. Mark certainly has that gift. Both on the city tour and the Red Light District tour, Mark keeps his audience fully engaged with his humor, intellect, and insight. His tours are also wonderfully unique because he loves his city deeply. This comes through clearly in the anecdotes and insider information that he shares with his tour participants. In every city one is typically presented with a vast array of options for touring. When in Amsterdam do yourself a favor and allow Mark to introduce you to his beautiful city. I assure you that you will be very happy you did.

Perfect!. Mark is an awesome guide with a very very joyfull heart . You can see he is in love with the city and the people to show arround. You made my view on the city much much brighter . Thank you!!

Knowledgeable and entertaining tour guide. My patrner and I took both the free city and red light district tour with Mark. We found Mark to be a wealth of knowledge and was very eager to answer questions. His humorous and laid back nature were appreciated. We loved the red light district tour where Mark shared his insider knowledge and demonstrated a true understanding and respect for the women who work in the industry.

A guided tour with mark is a must for anyone visiting Amsterdam.. Had a great tour with mark, he has a wealth of knowledge on Amsterdam, all delivered with great enthusiasm and humour. Definitely book yourself a guide with him, highly recommended.Thank you for a great day Mark!

Never a dull moment!. Mark is an amazing guide, his knowledge of the city is amazing, and every spot, monument or location he takes you to, he has plenty of funny stories and thoughts about. I have been on both his Amsterdam tour and the red-light after-dark tour, both immensely deep and fun! Mark definitely knows what he is talking about, and has gone far beyond what you expect from a guide. If you want to get to know Amsterdam, there is no better way to start, than to let Mark guide you!
Fantastic Guide!!. Really funny, interesting and enthusiastic! Showed unique places of the city and gave good advice and lots of history. Would always recommend for a fab tour in a fab city :D

Knows what he is talking about. Mark (that dam guide) seems to know everything about Amsterdam.. We did the red light district tour with him and he was amazing.. He could answer every question we had and even enjoyed discussions about whether prostitution should be legal or not.. He even took us to a great bar afterwards for some beers! Amazing tour! Thanks mark!

Loved This Tour with a First-rate Guide. My family (including a teen and a pre-teen) took a 3-hour city tour with Mark this summer. He makes a great first impression as a really nice guy, and then proves to be knowledgeable, observant, humorous, and personable as well. The tour took us past some places we'd seen but knew nothing about - the old Dutch East India company, a market place - and I made sure I could always hear Mark's talks, because he always had interesting, historical information to impart. He talks knowledgeably and respectfully about all sides of life in Amsterdam (though is sensitive to his audience regarding drugs and prostitution, and was discreet!) and could answer any questions his group asked. Mark has talked to prostitutes about their lives, and I REALLY wanted to join his Red Light District tour that evening, but was unable to due to short time and family plans. I have no doubt that it's an excellent tour, though, given Mark's humane approach to this subject. We live in Europe, and I hope to visit again soon and take this tour with him. Our tour ended at a nice café, where Mark had a beer and made himself available to chat and answer questions. The kids and I enjoyed a snack there, and actually stopped by again later (with the kids' grandmother, too) so my husband could have a beer and we could all enjoy appetizers. Quite a decent place. If you have the chance, get to know Amsterdam with Mark Law with the orange pom pom on his hat: highly recommended!

Wonderful guide! Excursion is full of fun and first-hand knowledge. Keep your eyes open and head empty because this guid is going to fill it with lots and lots of fascinating facts and stories about Amsterdam and Dutch people! The most interesting thing for me - he worked on his tour himself: he went to prostitutes to ask about their being from first hands when he was working on Red Light District tour, he read all about Amsterdam history, he knows all the latest news and gossips of the country. You can ask him about everything, he likes to talk ;)Had my head full for another couple days.. Would advise all my friends to go to him when they visit Amsterdam.

The ONLY way to see Amsterdam!. This is the best way to see all the things Amsterdam has to offer, I went on a 3 hour day tour and the red light tour. The best thing I have ever done to see a city by far! Mark is extremely knowledgable, lively and funny. He is passionate about living in Amsterdam and is extremely helpful and tells you stories of his experiences in Amsterdam which not many other guides do. Hang out with him after the tour and get to know him a little - he is a great guy! I posted a picture of me and Mark on the Red Light Tour- it was such a cold night!

A great introduction to Amsterdam. Mark was extremely lovely and knowledgeable. You can tell he really loves his city by his enthusiasm on the tour. A mixture of history and stories from his own experiences in the city. Even gave us the option of joining him for Dutch beers afterwards at his favourite cafe. Where else can you get an introduction to Amsterdam like that! Highly recommended.

Dam according to Mark. Mark was a really great tour guide, he took us around some interesting areas and told us facts that you wouldnt normally know. He is also extremely friendly and we had a drink with him after and he showed us some nice beer bars.Thanks mark!

An excellent start to a trip to Amsterdam!. I am travelling through Europe over 2 & a half months and this was one if the best tours I have been on so far! Mark was funny, informative and genuinely wanted to be there! His information was interesting and he even took us to a Dutch Pub for beer after! Highly recommended!
Well worth it . I found this tour to be very informative and interesting. Our your guide was lovely and made it fun. Definitely worth the 15 Euro a great tour and definitely recommend it to others

Worthwhile when visiting Amsterdam - and much more fun than alone!. The tour was incredible - thank you so much for a fabulous time! I had no idea there was much more to the red light district and he definitely educated us well. I definitely recommend going with these guys versus alone or with friends. You'll learn so much more AND know where to exactly go and see the best of RLD!
Fascinating!. RLD tour was an eye opener for us. Truly educational and real. Thumbs up! For the clear and precise explanation.

An edutainment tour. Martijn was incredibly knowledgeable, friendly and engaging. It was a pleasure to take this tour with him and to learn not just about the business in the red light district currently but the history of the place. Thanks Martijn!

Must do!. We had a great Red light district tour with Martijin. He had perfect English and was very knowledgeable and funny which made the tour interesting and hilarious! We met Martijin at Dam square at 9pm where he gave us a brief intro and then moved on with the tour which lasted about 1 hour 45 mins in total. We visited a number of places including the first condom shop. I would highly recommend this tour and for 15 euros you really can't go wrong. It really was a highlight of my trip to Amsterdam. Just hope that you get Martijin as your tour guide and you'll hurt from laughing so much!

Our guise Martjin brought the tour alive. Our guide Martjin brought fun, humour and personal insights to make this a great tour - highly recommended. The Red Light District is not at all seedy, and Martjin took us on an easy walk around the main areas, making it fun as well as informative. Not to be missed!

More efficient with a guide. You can walk through Red Light District on your own and discover it on your pace but it's a lot more informative doing it with a guide. You can probably read about stuff before hand but you'll probably remember it better if you learn about it as you go through the area. We met our guide at Dam square and followed him for the next hour and half. The tour was a combination of walking and stopping to listen to our guide. He was a Italian guy called Stephano; very nice though a bit shy. He talked about the history behind prostitution in Amsterdam and then the explicit and implicit rules and regulation around the windows. We proceeded by visiting the world first condom shop (it was closed at the time of the tour) and then walked through an extremely narrow alley way which apparently had more expensive windows. At one point we passed by a live sex show place. There was a rope light going from outside of the place to the other side of the street. The lights were all red and our guide said it meant there was no seats available. At some point the lights turned green and it was a sign that there were seats available at the show. Later in the tour we stopped by the old church and heard about the interaction between the church and the prostitutes back in day. There was a kindergarten across from the church and right by some of the windows. Our guide mentioned at some point kids were asked about the windows and the best answer was that "they sell kisses"! The last stop was at a statue of a fictional prostitute called Belle.

Better and better....... Am going to make this easy for you:1. Go on a Red Light District tour2. Go with MartijinThat's all you need to know. It will be one of the best times you can have in Amsterdam, you will remember it for a long time, and if you're like us, you will repeat the tour with Martijin the next tine you come to Amsterdam. Thanks Martijin for a fabulous experience.........again!

Well worth doing. . We had visited the famous red light district by ourselves but Martin offered a new perspective - the 'business' of the red light district. It was a wonderful tour, Martin was a very informative and fun guide. We really learnt a lot!

Very informative . Great tour to show people this area of town. Informative about the does and donts and history and information about the industry. Now have a more informed view of this area/industry. Very interesting.

Amsterdam redlight streets.. It is a small city, one day is enough to walk all over.
Many coffee shops there, careful before you smoke any blunts, i saw people getting a hangover from oversmoking.

Team Trip. I took my team to Amsterdam for 3 days and wanted to do something different that they can't do anywhere else.. This was perfect!The tour was funny and informative and the twins are REALLY good fun and will answer any questions you might have!I would definitely reccommend the tour, but it would be better at night, once dark and a little more going on.Also, the twins do not speak the best english so you have to be willing to get some random answers and stories that you didn't expect or ask for! Great fun all round!

Great tour. Our guide Martijn was the perfect person to take us on this tour. He has a cheeky and infectiously fun personality and this added to our enjoyment of the tour. Sure you can walk around the red light district by yourself, but then you would miss out on all the stories and information that made this tour worthwhile.

Mind-blowing tour with an Amazing guide. It's was my 4th times visiting Amsterdam but this time was a total different experience. Martijn, our guide tour (fully passionate about his country) captivate our attention with funny stories and history about how Amsterdam become the way it is. I have a total different view and opinion since this tour. If you come in Amsterdam I definitely advice you to book this tour with Martijn. 1,5 hours of your time well spend !
Amsterdam at evening. Very good trip to the red lights district. History and funny stuff as well. Lisa, our guide was excellent! Thanks again!

Brilliant tour. Very interesting and informative tour. Jan was our tour guide and he was fantastic. The small group size was ideal and he did not run out of interesting information to give us. We learnt a lot. I would definitely recommend this tour to friends and family.

Wonderful tour and great guide. Booked the tour couple of weeks before going to Amsterdam. Tour guide was fantastically knowedgeable about the whole area and showed us lots of interesting sights and gave us information into the whole goings on in and around the red light district. It did last the full 1.5hrs so does invlove a fair bit of walking. This is a definite must for visitors as it doesn't just show you the district but gives you a history lesson and useful tips about the area and city. As this was a nighttime tour the area was bustling but i would also recommend going back under your own steam during the day to see the difference, which we are glad we did. Definitely worth the price and we were very happy with the tour.
WORTHWHILE. Booked this walking tour with Tours & Tickets. Tour guide was fabulous and so informative and comical. Tour was 1.5 hours. Didn't want it to end. Request a "small" tour (16 or less).

Red Light Tour on a Saturday night. Stefano was a great guide and he did really well with the craziness that is the Red Light District on a good weather Saturday evening in August. The place a was absolutely packed. There were streets that we could barely get through because of all the people.With that being said I have to commend Stefano for getting our group of 15 people through the area all together. He did a great job and was very informative. The RLD is an interesting place. OUr guide had good information and was able to answer our questions. I would recommend taking a tour but probably choosing a night other then Saturday to do it.

Fantastic Tour & Excellent Tour Guide. Our tour guide Jan was fantastic! He was so down to earth and just a really cool guy. He shared all his knowledge about the Red Light District with us and gave us a really thorough tour. We visited places such as the Museum of Prostitution, Casa Rosso, Peep Show, the first condom shop and other quirky places! He also recommended popular nightclubs and coffee shops we could go to. My boyfriend and I couldn't have enjoyed it more, it's a tour you cannot miss!

Good time. Great tour. Martijn was fantastic. He has just the right personality for a tour like this with the perfect amount of humor and passion for his country. I would definitely recommend it. But don’t expect it to be PG13

Mrs. I would like to recommend Matteo my guide for the red light district. He was informative, humerous and respectful. His English was easy to understand and he happily guided me back to where I could catch a bus back to my hotel.
weird but fun. left from dam square--and on time.guide was knowlegable and fun.weird place....definate must on a visit to amsterdam

Excellent guide. Martin is a great guide....very kind, funny and down to earth.
We wanted to take him back to Aussie with us.
He has a lot of interesting info you would never know if you just walked around on your own.
We found it well worth the €15.

Awesome experience. Notwithstanding the sexual connotation attached to the place, this is a must visit during your Amsterdam trip. Just take a good walk through the streets, eat the waffles with strawberry, and enjoy along with the crowd.

Highly recommend this tour! Very interesting and entertaining!. I really recommend taking a tour, it was 15 euros and our guide Martijn did an excellent job explaining the history, regulations and current lifestyle in the district. It's an overwhelming place to explore on your own (by that I mean it could be a bit uncomfortable) so it's very helpful to have some context before. It also makes you understand the Dutch mentality more than just walking around on your own. Very interesting and entertaining!
Enlightening. Martijn was a very down to earth and informative guide. Highly recommend his tour to discover the real red light district. He has lots of stories to tell as well as personal ones.

Great tour, the twins were worth every penny ;-]. Jan's meet the Fokkens tour was fantastic. Informative stroll around the red light district with an experienced ;) local. After walking around for a bit we met up with the lovely twins and spend the bulk of the time with them. They are treasure trove of knowledge, not ashamed to answer any taboo questions (or condescending ones, as a lady in my group was prone to do), and quick with a joke. All locals and tourists should take advantage of this opportunity before they retire for real and their stories with them. The tour concluded at a sweet secret beer garden, where we got to sit down with Jan and the twins and really learn about the nitty gritty of hooking.

One of the best tours we have taken.. Wow what a amazing insight into the world of the Red Light District. We were on the 9pm tour which was a great time as streets were busy, with plenty to see.Our tour guide Martjin was just great, very informative and with a great sense of humor. Would definitely recommend this tour if spending anytime in Amsterdam.(PS) My husband and I felt completely safe while waking around the district. This is a tour that would suit 18yr old and upwards. Our group ranged from 18 to 60 years of age.

Best Tour I Ever Had!. My wife and I just returned from our European vacation. This tour was the highlight of our vacation. Our tour guide was Martijn. He was funny and very knowledgable about Amsterdam and the history of the red light district. My only complaint was that I wished that it was longer. Martijn is definitely honorary mayor of the red light district.

Fantastic Red Light with the Fokkens!. We booked the Meet the Fokkens red light tour which was brilliant! We were a group of 11 ladies on a hen weekend and it was the best way to kick start our visit to Amsterdam. Jan was a great tour guide and meeting Martine and Louise was certainly a highlight of our trip - we had a such a laugh with them as they answered all our questions - you really can ask them anything! :) Thanks again Jan!
Great tour. Did this walking tour on our arrival into Amsterdam. Was a great tour and very informative. Good valve for money and would recommend to tourists.

Great tour. I went on a 9pm tour and the tour was led by Jan. Jan was a great tour guide, he was very informative and led the tour at a leisurely pace. He explained the history of the Red Light district and answered all questions. I would highly recommend this particular tour to others who want to learn about and visit the Red Light District in a safe and secure manner.

Great information, tour and group. Saturday night, 9 pm, what better to do than a walking tour of the red light district. Great introduction with some questions and answers then right in to the tour.
