In your face, which was great.We had Jan as our guide, nice pace and easy to follow through fairly busy streets. All the sights, sounds and information could be a bit overwhelming but delivery of detail was great.Pretty happy we chose to do it, guess you really need to if you travel to Amsterdam.Thanks heaps.

Informative guide with fun & fascinating facts . My 17 y/o niece & I had Martijn as our guide and we were very entertained by his knowledge & his tour. He was prompt, informative, very amusing, & had us laughing throughout the tour. We learned so much about the Dutch culture and views on drugs & prostitution & it really gave us a spin on our "close mindedness" with our American views on this subject. We highly recommend this tour and if you are able, get Martijn as your guide!

Amazing tour and excellent tour guide!. Took the 730PM exclusive tour which has only 8 slots. When we arrived at the meeting place, Martijn, the tour guide, was there exactly as stated in the instructions emailed. He was excellent, cracking jokes, making everyone comfortable, and he knows what he is talking about! For one, I learned that the Dutch established the stock market, and the building which they built to house it is still standing at present in the same spot, which is part of the Red Light District.I'd recommend taking the exclusive tour vs the non-exclusive tour so that you can really experience it!
Red light walking tour . Took a tour with a guide around red light district very very informative funny and real started at 9pm so real in the night stuff lasted about 1 1/2 hours

Fantastic!. Discovered this tour through Google, and decided to take the plunge. Took the 9pm tour, which this day was led by Jan.The total group was around 25 people, and Jan was exactly where the pre-tour emails said he'd be located, in the open plaza behind the royal palace. (just a few steps from the W hotel, for reference).The tour itself was fascinating and informative. Jan knows his city and its history, and he did a great job communicating it all clearly, despite the constant crowds. He was happy to answer questions, and threw in some great jokes and asides along the way. The 1.5 hour tour flew by, and we hated to have to go!As for the area itself, the RLD was in full swing already that night, but we never felt unsafe. Jan kept the group together nicely, and we just moved through and among the crowds like anyone else. Of course, there was beautiful scenery as well, if you catch my drift. But in all seriousness, you'll leave the tour with a much better understanding of the environment these women (and some men) work in, and how it all manages to work in such a cosmopolitan city.Highly recommended tour!

Amazing Tour. Take the time to talk to the Fokkens twins and ask away. They have so much experience in the industry and are very kind, approachable, and full of good humour. Taking a red light tour with those that have been there for decades really helps shift your perspective. They share their insights and the reality of life in the district. The tour walks you through the area but really grounds it from their gaze. You certainly become aware of things I doubt other tours would even touch on. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to hear real voices of the red light district and get the hidden stories behind even the most mundane looking buildings.

All you need to know and more. From coffee shops, to the condom shop, peep shows and the 'blue-light' area, this tour is a well spent 90 minutes. The tour guide was a local who was passionate about his country and city, and the choices they have made. Very interesting

Gained a whole new perspective - great experience. Attended: May 30, 2016As others have said, you don’t want to pass up on an opportunity to visit the RLD while in Amsterdam. As I have reviewed the tour company for something else, I’ll review the activity instead. For the record, the tour guide we had for the 2 hour tour was very good. He really knew his stuff. What he really emphasized was the good treatment of the women. He was clear that they are there doing a job – and in most cases one they don’t enjoy very much. The whole area, which is a pretty big size has “windows” all over the main streets and down the small alleyways. We gained a whole new perspective for the industry and were glad we visited. I would definitely recommend doing the visit with a tour as the guide is very helpful in explaining the history and how it all works.Highly recommended.

Fantastic Tour!. I would recommend this tour to anyone who's visiting amsterdam and wishes to see the red light district. It POURED the night we went, but our guide was still very informative and enthusiastic. He kept us out of the rain as much as he could. He showed us all around the red light and gave us lots of information not only about prostitution in The Netherlands, but also churches, drugs and the history of the district. Jan was knowledgable and passionate about educating us on all the positive and beautiful things in the red light district! Definitely a must if visiting amsterdam!

Very informative tour!. We weren't expecting a lot from this tour but we were more than pleasantly surprised. We paid for a private tour which was well worth the few extra pounds. Highly informative and not at all smutty, guide even paid for us (this came out of his own pocket, we had no change) to experience the peep show as he said it was important to understand all aspects of the district. The tour didn't feel scripted, he really knew his stuff and was passionate about the history of the area as a whole not just the sex workers. Highly recommend this tour.
Awesome!. Juz weeds and watching these girls on street wooing me, makes me entertained! This city is so amazing!Be prepared to spend more

Great safe way to see around the red light district . We had Jan taking us around the red light district on Saturday night and it completely changed my perception on the whole area. Well worth the trip!

Excellent - knowledgeable guide; safe way to explore; wonderful to understand context . My husband and I really enjoyed this tour. We had done 4 (!) that day of various sites in Amsterdam and this was by far the most unique, most informative, enjoyable and memorable. The time flew by even though we had been very tired from a very long day and my husband did not have particularly high expectations of the tour and was not particularly interested in the first place. Martin was an excellent guide. He started off with some trivia and essential history to contextualize the tour and the neighbourhood. He provided clear guidelines and was clearly very knowledgeable about the subject. He provided thought provoking information, was clear about his biases and his positions on things and provided clear disclaimers of what to expect and what not to expect. I would have spent another hour and a half learning more about things. The tour itself was very well varied, felt very safe and was a nice mixture of serious and fun. My only surprise was that I thought that the tour included entry to the Museum of Prostitution but it did not, it was only pointed out and we passed by it. I would suggest making that clear as to enter would be an extra cost and time obviously. Another thing that was not explicitly pointed out was the Hangover Information Center, which I would have liked to see. I would suggest being more intentional about this. Overall it was excellent, I would highly recommend it. I really appreciated the stories, the experience and the guide. Thanks!

Safe and informative way to see the Red Light District!. Mary Anne gave us the 1-hour 45 minute tour. We were a group of 20. She provided an historical perspective, then provided us with facts related to the "process and procedure" of this profession. Serious sometimes but often funny! Definitely worth the €25 to see; especially if you hesitate for safety reasons. Safety in numbers and she watches out for you like a mother, ensuring we stick together.

Top Tour in Amsterdam . During a two day vacation to Amsterdam I went on several popular tours (e.g., canal cruise) and this was easily the best one. The guide knew his facts and answered all my questions. The tour was very social, so I was able to make friends and join a group for dinner after the tour. I highly recommend this tour for people who like to explore.

Great tour!. The tour was excellent and our tour guide Martjin was great as well. He kept the tour very lively and made jokes on the way. He was very knowledgable about the whole city and stayed back to give advice about other places to go. Overall a great experience!

Great tour and even better tour guides!. Very interesting tour to take through the Red Light District at night with Jan, a native from Amsterdam. We really wanted to see the Red Light District at night but did not want to go by ourselves. This was the perfect solution and our tour guide knew so much about the red light district. I definitely recommend this tour to anyone!

Best tour for the faint hearted. I was slightly abashed and scared about going to the red light and even when i did all alone, i did not know what to look at. With this tour and the Rose, the guide, I learnt a lot about the area, the girls working there and how it could change. It was funny, entertaining and educational.
Fun Tour. Martjin was great. He had the four of us laughing and enjoying the evening. Highly recommend the tour. Well worth the cost plus more.

Friendly guide, interesting sights, thoroughly recommend. To be honest I previously really disliked the red light district in Amsterdam, not for the businesses based there but the type of people it attracts. Doing this tour with Jan meant however that my eyes were really opened to how interesting a place it is and gave a bit more insight into the places and the people. It was quite a large group on our day so you have to keep your eye on the guide as you weave in and out of alleyways - he said unlike other tour groups he refuses to hold up a flag/umbrella as many of the ladies in the windows will shut their curtains as soon as they see it! Go with an open mind and you'll really experience an insight into something very unusual and memorable. Thanks for the great trip Jan.

Drug advocacy. Whether you like this tour depends on who you are and what your interests are. Martijn was very friendly and gave some good info but really focused on drugs more than prostitution. Indeed, he was really advocating the benefits of weed and psychedelics over prescription drugs. We agreed with much of what he said about drugs, but he was strongly urging us to try mushrooms which seemed a little over the top. Again, we're not opposed, but chances are 70+ year old educated women are capable of making up their own minds about what they do or don't want to try. Also, he made somewhat disrespectful remarks about transgender people and didn't really seem to have much regard for sex workers. Eight years ago I was here and had a very educational tour in which the tour guide seemed respectful of the people he was discussing. I went on this tour b/c my travel companions had never been here before and I was disappointed. On the other hand, if you are more interested in the history and current practice regarding drugs, this is the tour for you.

Something you should DO !!. Well, when you are in Amsterdam or about to travel to Amsterdam , all you will be hearing that stereotype of weed and sex !!but this tour will show you something different , show you how locals are react with that, some informations about the history of Amsterdam and how everything in here became legalise, organise and safe, and of course they will give you some notes about good places over there if you want to try something ;) ..So for me It was a very helpful and interesting , Our tour guy Jan was a professional and polite one , we enjoyed walked there and hear him talking about the area.I recommended it so much .Enjoy it :)

Must Do. You must take this tour to really understand the red light district. We had Steven as our guide he started with the history of the red light district and continued to give us all the information about the girls what they charge. You haven't experienced the red light district until you take this tour.

Amazing experience and coolest Guide ever!. We really loved the tour! Martijn was an amazing guide who did a great Job! We were happy that he did the tour with us, altough my girlfriend and me were the only ones :) A must do for everyone who is in Amsterdam!

Unique Experience! . My boyfriend and I wanted to see what the Red Light District was like, but I was a little apprehensive about going just the two of us! This tour was therefore a perfect solution - there was about 15 of us (all ages and walks of life) and we felt very safe, even thought we were there on Saturday evening and it was packed with people. An eye opening and insightful tour - John the tour guide was very informative and funny but he also told us the history of prostitution. We would definitely recommend doing this!

Interesting tour. Guide was punctual. We spent one and a half hours walking around the red light district. The guide was informative and besides seeing lots of prostitutes, I learned a lot about early Amsterdam. We had a couple, four ladies along with another single guy on the tour. So this is not a guy thing. Do the tour, you won't regret it.

Highly informative tour and a must for first-timers!. I had been in the Red Light Districts only once before and didn't know the place very well but on this tour I got to know the place a lot better and got to see some other secret places and shops that I might have missed if I hadn’t attended the tour! My only regret was that I had booked the tour a little bit too early for that evening because the best time to experience the Red Light Districts is at night! But yes, it’s a must if you want to educate yourself about the place and especially if you’re there for the first time!

Naughty But Nice. We where 2 couples in our 60s who wanted to see the Sights, so I booked the walking Tour from Dam Sq to the Red Light District Martijn was the guide he was very knowlegeble, and according to the ladies good looking. Anyway, the whole time while moving round the RLD Martijn gave us an insight to all aspects, and we even went into a working house which was an experance we would not had had had if we had not gone on the Tour. along the way we also got lots of info on the Coffe Shops and the Drugs in the Neatherlands. This Tour is a must in our opinion. Great evening out.

A great experience. We have spent a couple of days in Amsterdam and the Red Light District tour with Martijn was the most memorable and entertaining 1,5 hours of our weekend. Even now, back in our country, we have been telling everyone about the amazing tour and of course lovely Martijn. He was not just giving information like a regular tour guide. We have really lived and felt the streets with him, and omg he was so funny. I mean really really funny and very good looking if you are planning to go to Amsterdam, try one of these tours, you will definitely not regret it. Even if you have seen the area before, try experiencing it with Martijn again. Next time we are in the city, we will try the tour with the wine testing. Lets see how that will go. -Nihan

Red Light at Night.. Wonderful tour to take through the Red Light District at night with a native from Amsterdam. We were curious about the drug and prostitute culture but we're unwilling to go at night by ourselves. Martijn informs, entertains, and takes the group into places we would never enter on our own. Fun night in Amsterdam.

A must do while in Amsterdam. This tour is perfect to get a view on Amsterdam's red light district. The tour guide provides not only facts but makes as well jokes or tells stories of his own live. The 1.5 hours felt like 15 minutes.After the tour that guide offered to go for a drink for those who were interested.In my opinion this tour is a must while you're in Amsterdam.

Do Not Skip This Tour!. My husband and I wanted to visit the Red Light District, but honestly I was a little nervous to go on our own. I am so glad I booked this tour. Martijn was a wonderful guide and did so much more than show us the area; he provided a great history of drugs, prostitutes and sex in Amsterdam. I left having truly experienced the area. This was unlike any tour we have ever been on and I learned so much.

Exclusive Red Light District Tour With A Local Guide. Was recommended by a friend to join this tour, no regrets! Martijn was really informative and brought us to the highlights around the area, many of which we would not get to see on our own. It also feels safer navigating through the crowded streets with someone who knows where he is going!
Very funny. Good fun, for Dutch people as well. Nice history lesson about amsterdam in combination with the drugs, hookers and sex.

Very interesting. I was lucky to get an one on one tour with Martijn for the red light district. He is such a funny and friendly guy who showed me the history and background about this special city in a very interesting way. (and also with some personal funny story lol). Highly recommend :-)

Highlight of my long weekend!. Martijn was our tour guide last night. He was super entertaining and highly knowledgeable of the red light district. We went to have a drink afterwards amongst fantastic company. Really awesome way to spend an evening. I will not hesitate to recommend this tour to my friends.

Really interesting & cool tour. My boyfriend and I went on a tour lead by Martijn. Very interesting and Martijn is very funny and knowledgeable. It wasn't just about going to oggle the girls in the window but he told us so much about the history of the red light district that was interesting to learn. He kept the group engaged and made it fun and he also came out for a drink afterwards! Thanks Martijn, definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam as you get to actually learn about the history of the area. From the aussies Alex and Luke

Great tour (its a must) !!!!!!!!!. Very intresting tour by martijn. It was fascinating to learn about the RLD history, He is telling the stories in a very fun way. we learned alot and really experienced the Red light district from a diffrent point of view.
Thanks !!

Interesting . The visit gave me some real education about women (and me). I was expecting women who are socially viewed as "beautiful" i.e tall, slim, blonde etc. But I saw all sorts of women.....fat with cellulite, none blonde, short you name. This means there are men who go for these women and that explains why they are still in business. Conclusion: all women are worth it! Some of the best sex shops I've ever visited. .makes a very good shopping venue.

Amazing value and such friendly Tour guides. Absolutely unreal would highly recommend to anyone that visits Amsterdam. Martijn our tour guide was so friendly from the start and gave us a really fun, informative tour of some important historical areas. Well worth the money and would go a second time in the future!
great tour. This is a fantastic tour and martjin was a great guide , i would definitely recommend this tour to anyone wanting to check out the district

A must when in Amsterdam....! . I found this tour so entertaining and intriguing! Our tour guide Andy was super informative and very fun but respectful. Our tour also included a trip to the Red Light Museum which was very interesting. If your curious about the red light district doing this tour is the best way of experiencing it! It was by far my favourite tour i'd done in Europe. I would definitely recommend it!

Perfect birthday gift for my husband. Martijn was a brilliant tour guide! More like being shown round by a friend than someone who does it for a living :) Definitely go for the smaller tour; you get more interaction and its more personalised.When emailing the company they were very helpful too - we wouldn't have done half the things we did in Amsterdam if it weren't for Marcel's suggestions :) Thank you!Would definitely recommend!
Red Light tour with Martijn was great!!. Martijn had a great deal of knowledge about the red light district and he made the tour really fun. It was a great time!

Awesome tour in RLD. Great tour through the Red Light District of Amsterdam. A bunch of Australians visited me and wanted to see some of the RLD. The tour was a perfect combination between history and fun facts. Even though I'm a local I still enjoyed the tour! The tour guide was really friendly and we had some drinks with him afterwards. I'd totally recommend this tour!

Remy from Dam 360 gave a really excellent guided tour. Remy from Dam 360 gave a really excellent guided tour, he was informative and funny and made it a really great experience. I would not have walked around the area without a tour so it was well worth it to pay for a guide in a small group.

A must do while in the Dam . This is such an insightful and fun tour to do whilst in the Dam. Martijn was so fun and passionate about not only the RLD but also the history of Amsterdam. Will defiantly recommend this tour

Good walking tour with Martjin, group a bit large though. Met the group to walk with Martijn, it was a bit of a large group so not as personal, and sometimes the pace was quite quick considering the crowds of people around on a Fri night.Very knowledgeable and funny though.

A local view of the Red Light District. If you want to tour the red light district in Amsterdam stay away from the big tour companies to get a look at the Red Light district from a local company who has a real love for the city. It's so much more interesting then just getting recited facts. A definite must do if you want to see the Red Light District.

Excellent tour. Must do in Amsterdam!. We booked the "Red Light District Tour with a local guide" on the website for 30th Feb 16 and met Martijn at the Dam square. There were supposed to be 5 of us, however another 3 did not turn up, thus it turns out to be a great private tour for me and my partner.Martijn is very informative and knowledgeable. He knows everything about the history of Amsterdam and told us how hash and hookers originated in Amsterdam. It is very insightful. His personality is very sincere, genuine and had great of humor. We enjoyed the tour very much!!! Do book this tour without hesitation and please turn up!! You won't be disappointed.

Must do on a visit to Amsterdam!. We thoroughly enjoyed this tour, lots of new things to see and incredibly informative. Martijn was a great guide who was happy to answer any of your questions. Give you a great perspective of the RLD. Highly recommended.

Well worth it. Went on the tour with Martijn he was extremely informative and very much so in tune with the area. He offered a lot of different knowledge and experience of the city as a whole and offers a different perspective. I loved the small size of the tour and how personal he makes it feel. Would most definitely recommend.

To do when in Amsterdam!. We booked relatively late and only a few hours before the tour, but this didn't seem to be a problem at all. We met Jan at the designated meeting point and he was very friendly and was asking about where we had come from. Having been to Amsterdam and the Red Light District before, but with a friend that hadn't, we were keen to learn about it more instead of just wandering through as I had done before. The tour was perfect as it gave us the history and let us ask all the questions to Jan when we wanted while we were looking round. We felt very safe while looking around and Jan was very approachable and happy to answer all our questions. This is the perfect tour to learn more about the Red Light District and get to know how it began and how it has evolved. Jan was the perfect tour guide and would highly recommend.

Great tour! . We weren't sure what to expect from this tour, but my boyfriend and I were really pleasantly surprised. Jan met us exactly where the confirmation email said with his company hat. On the night of the tour we happened to be the only ones. But this in no way altered Jan's enthusiasm and we had a wonderful time on our tour with him. I couldn't believe his wealth of knowledge on the district. Jan knew so much about the area and I really enjoyed the photos he showed us to compliment some of the stories he told. I couldn't believe the rich history behind the red light district. It's such a fascinating place. Jan made us feel very safe and comfortable throughout the tour. He was professional and extremely friendly. I would certainly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Thanks again Jan!

This is the Red Light District tour you want!. Jan, the owner, was our guide and we had a great time. He is very knowledgeable about the area, interviews the prostitutes and has great time capsule pictures from years gone by. He takes you right into the shops, alleys and shows but definitely includes the interesting history. Don't forget to ask about the unknown sculpture at the old church.

Highly recommend this tour!. We did this tour on our first evening in Amsterdam having never been before.We thought this would give us a good insight to the Red Light District as well as help us to get our bearing with the city which it certainly did.The tour was eye opening and our guide was really knowledgeable and very happy to answer any questions you had to throw at him.Everything was covered from history, places to go and recommendations.Well worth the money as you get to see parts of the Red Light District I imagine would be hard to find for those not going for the ladies!
Great experience!. We were very fortunate to have Martin as our tour guide! The tour was extremely informative and fun. My husband and I would highly recommend this tour.

Very informative & fun. We had a great fun taking this tour. Our guide was Jan who kept the tour very informative and entertaining. We went to parts of Red Lights district where we wouldn't go otherwise. This tour is really for everyone who is interested in history of Red Light District but also would like to check this part out in the safety of a bigger group:)

Interesting tour with a great guide. We booked the normal red light district tour but were lucky - since there were too many participants, we got an exclusive tour and even went inside a brothel. We had lots of fun with Martin and he knows tons of interesting details. We highly recommend to do this tour!

An entertaining and informative evening. We were a group of 5 diverse ages and outlooks. Martijn's enthusiastic and interesting tour was a fabulous way to see the Red Light district while gaining lots of knowledge tidbits. Martijn is an engaging guide who kept us entertained and laughing. We would recommend this tour for anyone who wants to know (and see) a little more than just passing by. Thanks for the fun evening Martijn!

Really fun and informative walking tour 5*. I booked the red light district tour online for me and my partner. Meeting Jan was very easy in Dam Square (just look for the man with a black cap with a red light bulb printed on it!) I loved that it started at 9pm, we had time to have our evening meal and then venture out all wrapped up for the tour, and being that time of night you see the red light district in full action! We had a lovely group of people on the tour which was great. Jan told us some history about the red light district along with showing us around, he even had his iPad to show us photos from a few decades before to show comparisons. There was also a secret church which you would never know was there unless you were told! The time flew by as it was great fun, Jan was very friendly and informative and was happy to answer any questions we had. The tour is suitable for couples, groups of friends or even solo travellers (we had a couple in our group). We are so pleased we did this tour whilst on our trip and would recommend it as a must if you are travelling to Amsterdam!

Interesting eye opening and informative Tour. Probably the only place in the world that legalizes adult and sex services openly and mixed freely among other local businesses. Took a fantastic tour with AmsterdamRedLightDistrictTour.Com and it was very informative, fun and eye-opening. Highly recommended!

not the only way to see RLD, but interesting anyway!. Took Jan's your last Monday night with a good size group. Jan was very friendly and welcoming. He provided history of the area and the evolution to today. He made it enjoyable and the hour and a half flew by. I took my parents as well and they thoroughly enjoyed it. I highly recommend Jan's tour to anyone! Sure wish he was selling his hats. We would have bought two on the spot.

Not to be missed, even if you are shy!. A mid-December cool night and I finally was able to convince my husband to join me on this tour with Martijn and he had not a single regret. Martijn put us all at ease (we were just 4). He spent lots of extra time asking and answering our questions, took us to lots of fun places we would never find on our own and made sure that we had a blast. This tour is a must / we learned a lot about the history of central Amsterdam and life there today. It ended with a small celebration : )

Without Jan's help, you'll never really understand Amsterdam. Jan is a great tour guide. He really did research for the job. We went to many places that we would have never found on our own. Not only that, Jan knows how to surprise his crew. But this tour is not just about excitement. You can actually learn a lot about the area's history without feeling being lectured.

All you ever wanted to know about the RDL in a safe, fun tour!. My wife and I had a great time walking the Red Light District with Jan on a chilly night in Amsterdam. Jan instantly put us at ease with his warm welcome and friendly demeanor. Despite the potential for awkwardness the evening actually turned out to be quite the opposite from start to finish. The RDL was busy but tame for anybody who's ever visited Bourbon Street or any college town during a sporting event. Jan mixed in entertaining facts about Dutch culture, politics and history plus he encouraged questions and even elicited responses from us to gauge our comfort levels on what we were experiencing that night. If you've ever been curious about Amsterdam and/or the RDL I strongly suggest booking with Amsterdam Red Light District Tours over any other tour operator.

Do not pass up this tour!!!!. The short version: If you are researching for a tour, you can stop now. I did all the research for you (hours of it over a month's time) and I promise this is THE tour to take - you will go places you would never find on your own and you will learn things only the locals could tell you! It's less like a tour and more like a friend showing you the most interesting parts of his city. For more details, keep reading....Let me start by saying, Amsterdam was the last stop (and this tour was on our last night) of a whirlwind European vacation with my sister that took us through 6 Italian cities, Belgium and Holland. In every city, we booked a tour. All of them very good and all of them different. Jan's red light district tour was far and away the BEST and most FUN we had in any city! You simply cannot go to Amsterdam and not check out the red light district. But, it was not something my sister and I were comfortable doing alone at night. I researched pretty much every red light tour on Trip Advisor and Yelp. I kept reading about how awesome Jan's tour was. They were right!! I can't imagine getting a better guide or tour anywhere else. Our tour group was small - the way we like it - with a total of 3 girls and one guy (plus Jan). Jan is a young guy with a great personality who really knows the city and everything about how the red light district operates. He took us through alleyways, past the infamous windows, we even checked out a peep-show (that's not mandatory, if you want to see it, you just get in a room, pop a Euro in the slot and the screen comes up for a minute). How many gals can say they squeezed into a peep show box with their sister in Amsterdam?! What's really great is if you walk past a store or see something interesting, Jan will stop and tell you about it. He will even go in with you - we ended up going inside the hangover remedy store! I don't want to give away all the secrets and fun you will have on this tour, but suffice it to say...you will not be disappointed! Jan even gave us a yummy gift! On a side note, we ran into him hours after the tour and asked where we could buy his hat (it's an ultra cool black hat with a red light bulb on it). He doesn't sell them, but offered the one off his head! He is so sweet. We didn't take it, mainly because it was chilly out and because my sister and I would have fought over it! I mention it to illustrate how nice and amazing Jan is. ENJOY!

Would Recommend to Anyone Traveling to Amsterdam. We had on the tour. Jan, our tour guide, was very personable and provided information on how the Red Light District has changed over time. It took away our weariness of walking around the area by ourselves.

Interesting tour. It was curiousity that made me book for this tour, aside from the fact that my hubby asked me to book it. The tour was great (2 hours) and the guide was able to explain well the history of the RLD, the way of life and the profession that the working ladies have in the area. I loved the sightseeing tour, the girls in the windows, the information on how this has become a cycle of life in this bustling area. I suggest don't go without a tour guide, its important.
Amazing tour! Cure your curiosity! . Amazing tour! Jan was fantastic! We were curious about the district and this was the perfect way to explore and get all of our questions answered.
Great tour!. Martin was our guide tonight and guide us around the red & blue light district. We visit places we couldn't dream of or find our selfs. Great tour for Dutch residents as well.

Interesting and well done. I've been to Amsterdam too many times, but as this was my Dads first visit, I wanted him to see the Red Light District and hear the history - not just see the seedy bits.Our tour guide Johan was very good, informative and he has clearly done research into the area, including showing images from 'years gone by'. From a personal point of view, it was interesting to see the changes and the impact the Dutch government is having on the area. Our guide was excellent at answering our questions, keeping a good pace yet still ensuring we saw a good deal of the area. This is the third tour I've done, but this is definitely the best as he knows his stuff rather than 'winging it'.I'd recommend this tour to anyone

Great intro. We had Jan for a tour guide and he was great. We were able to get a great history of the area and learn things we would not have otherwise been introduced to. We felt safe and Jan was able to provide us with other suggestions for our stay in Amsterdam.

Great insight into Amsterdams red light district. Thank you Martin for a most entertaining and informative tour on the 3/11/15. We both enjoyed the tour and sorry we couldn't join you later for a drink.We learnt so much about the history and also about,drugs ,prostitution and coffee shops.great to have a guide that is local and can provide a lot of info but who is also very respectful of the people that work in the area.We never would have seen and learnt as much if we just walked around.

Red city. Well jus go on to see this Red city. Well Its different with all the clubs and parlors. You have lots to explore here. Definetly you can get amazing pizzas and French fries at every corner. Try the cakes,they are amazing.

The seedy side of Amsterdam. I visited Amsterdam and had pre-booked this tour after reading good things online. My guide was Martin - he gave an excellent tour covering how Amsterdam came to develop the way it did and how the city came to accept so many different religions, and lifestyles. The tour then took us through the narrow streets of the Red Light District. Along the way, Martin had entertaining and funny stories and pointed out lots of things that I would have missed without a guide.Highly recommended way of spending a couple of hours in Amsterdam.
A must see in Amsterdan. Martin is a great guide to show us with humor the red district and its history. It is such a pleasant trip a must see to understand Amsterdam. Thank you Martin

A real insight in the Red Light District. We were in Amsterdam for holiday in September and booked a tour on their website. It was a great experience and we thoroughly enjoyed the guides' passionate stories about the real Red Light district. Of course you get to see the prostitutes and we even saw a peepshow!! But he also takes you around small alleys and shows unique places such as a secret church. I can recommend the tours to everyone as you get so much background info that we would have never gotten to know had we not booked the tour. Highly recommended and great fun! We even had some drinks after the tour in a local pub which was awesome. Thanks for the wonderful evening!

Red Light Reality. This was one of our favorite tours in Amsterdam! Our guide showed us the ins and outs of the RLD and gave us the low down on how things work. We visited smartshops and coffeeshops and learned what you can and can not do to make the most of your Amsterdam trip. Awesome tour - I totally recommend it!

Unique!. We did the night time tour with Jan, it was a fascinating experience...I liked the way he gave us the history of the industry and showed us photographs from old Amsterdam. I thought he treated the topic in a sensitive but open way. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting this unique city.

Great Tour with Jan!. We had a great time with Jan on the night tour that started at 9pm. I am so glad we did a nighttime tour with a guide because I am not sure I would want to wander around the Red Light District at night without a guide showing me where to go. Jan was great and very informative explaining the history and what is going on in the present. He made awkward topics funny and interesting and with such a small group we were able to wander around smaller alleys to see different places off the beaten path. Highly recommend this tour. Be sure to keep your mind open to different lifestyles!

..... Definitely do this tour while in Amsterdam...!! It tells you everything you need to know about the sex workers...!! Very interesting some information you find out...!! Can remember the name of the man who took our tour but i do remember he was local..!! Big thank you to him...!! 25euro well spend...!!

Great!. These tours have been listed by Fox News as one of the wackiest tours around the world. So, I couldn't wait to joining this tour when I booked it. Fox News was right! This tour was brilliant! Worth every penny!! Martin, our local guide, showed us the best, hidden places in the Red Light District. Within 1.5 hours he explained us how everything worked here. It was really fascinating! One of the best highlights was a visit to the last peep show in Holland. That was AWESOME! I learned a lot and this tour was definitely the best part of my visit to Amsterdam. Thanks guys!

A Red Light Night. As a solo traveler, I was leery about visiting the Red Light District on my own at nighttime so I signed up with a tour with Jan. No regrets here. It was one of my favorite tours during my week in Amsterdam. Jan knows his history in regards to the district and he led our group (six tourists total, so we were lucky it was small) through streets, alleyways, and even through a brothel (!) that I NEVER would have wandered into on my own. It was a unique and eye-opening experience.

Sex and Drugs and Rock n Roll. Well no rock n roll actually! Martijn's walking tour delivered everything else. Book direct to avoid paying extra for the privilege of booking through an agency. You don't pay until the end. Trusting or what! We tpped and he was worth it.Martijn explains the historical background before walking you through the red light district (blue if you fancy trans gender sex). The area is crowded most nights but safe. And if you fancy Chinese food after, Chinatown is slap in the middle. First time I've walked right through a brothel! Plus you'll see Amsterdam's last peep show, first condom shop, sex shops that make Fifty Shades look tame, the live sex theatres and, of course, hundreds of windows populated by very pretty sex workers encouraging you in.Martijn also explores the background to the coffee shops and drugs industry. You probably end up being offered a drink and a smoke at the end of the tour.I felt 15 euro was a very fair price and would happily recommend. But you need to be broadminded and nonjudgmental. If you can't tick both these boxes,don't bother!

Interesting, but a bit pricey and unorganized. We had a group of 13 and when we found the guide, he was very nice but didn't ask for our voucher up front. At the end of the tour he asked for payment, but was OK once I gave him the voucher. The guide was very informative, and we did get to go inside a brothel, but having been on many guided tours, I felt that, for the money, it was lacking.

Amsterdam Red Light District Tour with Jan. Oh my gosh. I had no idea what to expect!!! Jan took my group into the depths of the district and to the perimeter. He explained the history of this area and the cultural influences that create the current venue. I felt safe, being the only female in the group, and Jan was most kind to me. Please use this person to teach and show you about the unique area of Amsterdam and possibly the world.

Loved it!. My two friends and I paid 15€ each for the tour. There were only about 10 people total. Martin was our funny, informative guide. The tour gave me new insight the prostitution and drug cultures in Amsterdam. Plus, we walked through a brothel, got cussed by an old lady, and accosted by a drunk old man. Those were fun bonuses we didn't even have to pay for! We had a great time, and couldn't have asked for a better guide.

Ok. We did the small group tour for 30€ per person. This is overpriced in my opinion. Although the guide was nice and enthusiastic, the tour was rather superficial and sensationalist. It was entertaining, but unfortunately not nearly as insightful as I had hoped.

Educational and fun tour of the RLD. Martijn was our guide for the night, and was a very charismatic guy. He balanced the educational with the fun on our tour, letting us know all about the positives and potential negatives around the area's prostitution policies. He also talked through the coffee shops, smart shops, and sex-themed attractions in the area so no stone was left unturned. I loved this tour because it was very reasonably priced and the small group enabled us to interact and learn more. I can't imagine experiencing something like this in a big group tour, but I imagine it would be a big detractor. Also, Martijn is a blast to hang out with, which some of us did after the tour, in a great bar I doubt I would have found otherwise. As a side note, the area wasn't dodgy as I expected; it's actually one of the prettiest neighborhoods I walked through, and felt safe the whole time.

I real eye opener - not for faint hearted. Only 5 of us on this tour. Guide was excellent. Learned about Amsterdam's history about the Red Light District and also tolerance of the official drug culture. This late night tour took us around the real, in your face, world of the red light shop windows and peep shows etc as well as the back ground to the Coffee Shops etc. If you are faint hearted or sensitive to the realities of darker side of city "business" then this is definitely not for you. The experience was jaw dropping in its honest and our guide who was also a good laugh. Cost 15eu each and well worth it.

Excellent insight!. We booked this tour for our first night and paid extra for the premium tour with fewer people. I fully recommend doing so as it feels more intimate and you can walk around more freely and hear what is being said.We had Jan as our tour guide who was interesting, funny and incredibly knowledgable. I think that because this is unique situation that it attracts many tourists wanting to view the women working and without this tour we would have missed so much and only focussed on the naked women. Jan was able to show us historical pictures to show what it was like in the past compared to now, which gave us a great perspective.I cannot recommend this tour company enough, by the end I had learned a great deal had many laughs and seen many things that will stay with me but more importantly I could go back again on my own and see things that many others could not. Book this on your first night and you will honestly not be disappointed. There may be other tours, but they won't offer you anything like what this company do!

Informative and funny tour - Unforgettable experience!. Booked this tour through TripAdvisor/Viator to see the famous Red Light District. Me and my American friends wanted to know what the RLD was all about, therefor we decided to be guided by a local. So, we followed Viator's instructions to go meet the tour guide - Martin - on Friday night at nine o'clock at the National Monument. The tour started with an introduction and a brief history lesson, which was really interesting! After that, we walked through the district for 1.5 hours and Martin showed us everything we wanted to see; first condom shop in the world, the Old church, the window brothels, cannabis stores, hidden art, chinatown, and we even visited the last peep show in Holland; which was hilarious, haha! Martin was very knowledgable and really explained how everything works here; like safety measures for the ladies; free std-checks; registration at the Chamber of Commerce; taxes, rent for brothels, etc. After the tour, we hung out with Martin and treated him on some beers. Overall this tour was very informative, funny and above all; an unforgettable experience! Thanks Martin!

Beware--Guide Never Showed. Booked this tour for a Friday night at 9:00 pm. Got a confirmation number. Instructions were explicit as to where to meet. We were there 10 minutes early and waited for a half hour In the rain. Tour guide was a no-show. Our credit card was charged 38 Euros. I emailed Viator and have never received a response. Will not book through them again!

Great & safe way to see the Red Light District - Plenty of history to the area.... There is so much history to the red light district in Amsterdam and going on a tour is a great and safe way to learn about how the red light district came about.

Fun and educational tour not just about sex. I liked the tour and Jan the tour guide he's very friendly easy to talk to. The red light district is not all about sex and drugs, but it's an unique place that is full of contrast elements, i.e. oldest brothel and oldest church opposite each other, place to have fun and shop to sell drug to get rid of hangover... I didn't realise 1.5 hr tour finish so quick, enjoy every minute of it.

Amazing tour!!!!. Fox News listed the tours of this company as one of the wackiest around the world. So, I was really looking forward to joining to tour in Amsterdam when I booked it. I must say that this tour was definitely one of the best things during my trip in Holland's capital. The local guide Jan showed us around and explained everything very well! Within 1.5 hours I experience the real Amsterdam. Yes, this tour is wacky! And yes, it also tells the history, the current situation, do's and don'ts, fun-to-do's and whatnot. After our tour, I treated Jan on some local brewed beers in a nice bar in the Red Light District. It was lots of fun and really great to get to know a local... Unforgettable experience!

Best part of our trip!. We really enjoyed this tour, we went on quite a few guided tours whilst in Amsterdam but this was by far the best and awesome value for the full hour and a half! Our group consisted of 7 and everyone was really friendly which made for a relaxed informal atmosphere! Jan our guide was hilarious and very knowledgable, he answered all our questions (no matter how stupid they were!) The tour was a great mix of history and humour. Jan took us to places we would never have known existed had we walked around on our own, such as an old peepshow theatre !!! He was always respectful and made sure we weren't to take photos of the girls working in the window brothels!I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting the area, even if you have already visited the red light district as I guarantee you will learn something new and have a great evening at the same time!

Fab. Our group had a man called Steve as our guide and he was great.fun, knowledgeable and strict on interlopers who tried to join our group. It was a fascinating look at a vibrant part of Amsterdam and a must do for adults when in Amsterdam Well worth the 25 Euro.

Great Tour!. Jan was a very polite, well organized and knowledgeable tour guide. The meeting spot to start the tour was easy to find and the information was presented in a very non-biased, positive way. We love learning about such a unique place in the world and would say this is a must do activity when in Amsterdam, so much better than just walking through the red light district on your own!!

Great Experience! . The red light district tour was brilliantly organized. We, being a group of girls were initially hesitant as we were unaware. Our tour guide, Jan, not only made us comfortable, but also enlightened us with interesting facts, and patiently answered all the queries. It was by far the best guided tour we experienced. I would recommend this tour to everyone who wants to visit the red light district in Amsterdam.

Such a good tour! . Went on this tour on Saturday night having done some research online. The tour was informative and really interesting and we definitely found out lots about the red light district. The tour wasn't seedy at all and the size of the group was kept to around 11 which was really good. Would recommend this tour to anyone. Such good value as well

Redlightenment. We had great time with a fun group lead by Martin our tour guide. He showed us around and shared a lot information on the life of a prostitute. Even though there was a lot of walking on cobble stone, definitely wear comfortable shoes, it was worth it with the experience we had.
Informative and interesting. Awesome tour. Neat to see all so much variety intertwined in one area. Great information throughout the tour. Martin was fun and entertaining. I recommend.

Highly informative, very interesting, great guide!. Excellent tour - both informative and entertaining! The guide was fabulous - extremely knowledgeable and charismatic. Excellent way to see the city by night and get the 'inside scoop' on this fascinating district.

Exciting tour. This tour was really great! You get a good insight into the red light district. When you are in Amsterdam you have to go there and I can totally recommend Jan for this tour, he was great!!

Red Light District Tour with David September 2015. David was such a lovely, hospitable and knowledgeable host. He looks like a young Paul McCartney, too for you Beatles fans out there.His tour took us to places we would never have seen if it were not for him. He was also very gracious when other drunken folks would stand in the midst of our tour, and he made sure we were well looked after too.My boys and my best friend and myself learned a lot of great facts and received a great Sex Education while in Amsterdam! Highly recommended-- and while the tour is funny, at times exhilarating, shocking, very informative it also made you reflective about the girls as well== every emotion was evoked for us.Natasha

Brilliant and informative. Had David as our guide. Funny knowledgeable and showed us things we would have missed had we bimbled around ourselves. Great tour and lifted a lot of the myth..worth every penny(cent)

Worthwhile & fun!!!!. We of course wanted to check out the red light district in Amsterdam, but didn't want to have to navigate ourselves alone. The tour was great, it provided a great balance of some history, humour and a wonderful insight into the laws and life style of holland and how they live. The tour guide was hilarious, and clarified a lot of assumptions in a light, conversational style. Definitely recommend!!

A rather interesting tour. Took a tour with Tours & Tickets, an enjoyable tour, very informative, the guide was very knowledgable, only thing I'd say was off putting was the visit to the museum being done at the end of the tour, this could possibly be put in the middle on busy tours like ours was, but it was a good tour, interesting to see

Wonderful tour, excellent and knowledgeable guide. A very interesting walking tour of 2.5 hours duration. The guide was quite knowledgeable and tells you abou t the histor y of the district, the way the workers work, the way the tax is collected. He gives a you a lots of information in a lighter way. A must tour for the knowledge.

Fun and interesting tour!. As a female traveling solo I wanted to check out the red light district at night to see the action but wasn't sure if that was the safest idea. This tour was the perfect solution! Martin was fabulous, mixing a bit of history and humor. It was my favorite part of the trip and I think I'd be comfortable venturing to that area alone now that I know what it's like.
Great tour!. We had such a great time on this tour, our tour guide Jan was excellent! It was very interesting, we would highly recommend it!
Awesome tour. Really knowledgeable tour guide. Learnt a lot of things about the area - great value for money! If you go to Amsterdam do this tour!

An Amsterdam Must-Do!. The tour was great and I would highly recommend it for both tourists and locals. Jan was a great guide- excellent English, friendly and provided some great insight that I as a Dutch person myself didn't even know. Additionally he recommended some great bars/restaurants that are frequented by locals and aren't the usual tourist traps. I did the tour on my own and felt perfectly comfortable and included.

Awesome tour!!. The tour we got from David was awesome, he knew a lot about the area and we even got to see a peepshow!! haha :)) My Swiss friends also enjoyed the tour a lot and we even got to do the tour in the afternoon by request because of an early flight. So excellently organized as well!! :)
Amazing Tour!. Jan was awesome and I had a lot of fun exploring and learning about the Red Light District from him! If you are in Amsterdam, this is definitely a "must do" experience!

Great Intro into the Amsterdam RLD. A great tour with friendly guides who really give you a rounded history of the area, not just about the prostitution but also about the general history of the area, very knowledgeable guides, highly recommended

Amsterdam Red Light District Tour. A lot of fun and very enlightening! The guide, David, was very good. Had a group of only 8 so it was easy to get around the crowded streets. Any larger a group would have made it difficult. Would definitely recommend this tour!

It is not what you say it is how you say it. The Red Light District or as we know it in South Africa as Walletjies street was always talked about when we planned our holiday to The Netherlands. We booked our tour not knowing what to expect. What a huge surprise the owner of this tour Jan was our guide for the hour and half tour through the RLD and this was a personal tour for only ourselves my fiancee and I. Jan entertained us with background as well as the History of Amsterdam and the RLD. His humor and knowledge made this tour very good and interesting. It is not what you say it is how you say it...and believe me you will enjoy Jan's chatting. I would recommend this tour to everyone planning a trip to Amsterdam's Walletjies street.

Great tour of Amsterdam's red light district . David was a brilliant tour guide. Very informative and humorous- a safe way to immerse yourself in the fascinating sights and history of the RLD. Definitely recommend this tour!
Excellent experience. I really liked the tour. The red light dostrict it's a must see in Amsterdam and this tour guides are very knowledgable about the history and the zone.

Brilliant Tour. Our tour guide David was excellent, very informative and entertaining. Definitely the best way to tour the RLD and definitely the safest, not that the RLD is dangerous just that we felt much safer and we could take in everything we saw by being part of the tour. A must do whilst in Amsterdam!

Informative Tour. Our guide was informative and gave us a good history of the area. While one might feel awkward or sad on this kind of tour, he worked to make us feel comfortable, although it was still not the happiest of tours. It really is a fascinating area with a lot more than prostitution going on.

One of the high points of my holiday!. When I said to friends that me and my wife took this tour the main thing people asked was why pay for a tour when you can freely walk around and experience the sights on your own? Well obviously you can walk the red light district and have a look for yourself however the amount of information and the insight you learn on this tour was quite something of an eye opener (and I don't just mean the sights). The tour guide Carlos was very informative and funny and had the correct mix of providing a lot of information without feeling like being at school and keeping your intention with his (very bad) jokes and one liners. A very enjoyable experience, albeit I was disappointed with the visit to the museum of prostitution which I feel could really be skipped altogether, I certainly wouldn't pay to visit that on its own. All in all I would highly recommend it.

A great tour to kick off your visit to Amsterdam!. Our guide Martin was friendly and easy to follow. Overall, the booking process went smoothly. We booked on the same day and received follow up emails and text messages that made the process very easy. The tour is a great intro to the red light district, so you can feel free to walk around later on your own as well. Lots of fun bits of history and info along the way – a really well balanced tour of the area :)

Interesting, very knowledgeable, but didn't feel like a history lesson. Our guide was Martijn. He was very knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam, particularly with regard to drugs and the sex trade. His approach to sharing this information was comical and interesting, so you didn't feel like you were sitting in a history lecture, even though you were getting a lot of great information. It was one of the best things I did while visiting Amsterdam.

Perfect!. I mean it was awesome. Our guide Martjin was passionate and full of life! And he definetely knew what he was talking about. We learned some hideen history of Amsterdam in general, and then about the fascinating and bizarre red light district. We would never go places we went with our guide. Well worth it, best 15€ spent. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Red Light District Tour. Worth the price. We used this site to book a tour. It ended up getting rained out the night of our tour, but the company was nice enough to move the tour to the following night.Overall the tour was very informative as Martin, our tour guide, shed light on the history prostitution in the city of Amsterdam. The tour included a brief 10 minute introduction outlining what we would see, and then for the next hour & 15 minutes, or so, Martin led us through the various alley -ways and local hot spots of the Red Light District, explaining stories and the Dutch laws. He even threw in hands on trip inside a brothel and peep show house.Overall, the tour was very educational and full of historical value as the Amsterdam Red Light District is a cultural experience unique to Holland. Concluding the tour, Martin also pointed many of the tourist in the direction of a very high quality coffee shop (not the liquid kind) that sold yummy treats, which made the experience even better!Top

Great tour of the RLD. Great tour of the red light district. Started of with some brief history before we started walking. As I had not been any place like this before it was pretty intense.As far as the guiding the vibe of the tour was relaxed, felt a little like being guided through the district by a friend. Also included inseresting details and stories that should have otherwise been missed. After the tour Jan and Martjin went to a bar for some drinks and invited everyone who wanted to come along. Really friendly guys. I am not sure this happens every time but it was a really appreciated. Recommended!

Interesting and fun!!. Great tour of the red light area with Martjin as out guide. He was really interesting and knowledgeable and made the tour an experience that I am happy to recommend.Learnt so much about the worlds oldest professional as well as lots of interesting things about Amsterdam itself.If you want something away from the norm then I suggest you do this tour!!
Great Tour. Great Tour. Our Guide David was a good source of information about the red light district. He also knew a lot about the history of Amsterdam.

One of a kind. It was a brilliant way to see this side of Amsterdam and our tour guide through Tours and Tickets was fabulous. Her information was interesting and relevant. It was a great evening, very shocking at times (the men walking the street's attitudes and responses) but overall would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Good insight to the area!. David did a nice job of presenting the facts and with some humor! It all made sense after the tour as to why this anomaly can be seen as so normal in Amsterdam! He provided a good top line history and was quite entertaining.

Best way to see Amsterdam's red light district in action!. Weave in and out of the district's narrow pathways, learn about the laws and regulations, as well as Amsterdam's history that makes it what it is today. You'll stop outside the notorious "coffee shops" for a description of how they operate, walk inside a maze of red light windows, as well as have answered all your questions and curiosities. The guide Martin was upbeat and gleeful, hopping skipping and jumping his way around what clearly were streets familiar to him. He had a fun attitude, and was clearly an expert in the subject matter that is Amsterdam's drug and sex industry. Highly recommended as it is not the same as walking around, naturally lost, by yourself!

Red Light District Tour- Jan was the best!. My friends and I learned a lot on this tour. There's so much more to the district than we originally would have imagined, both good and bad. Jan was absolutely fantastic! Very cheery and welcoming and informative; he made a walk that would have been very intimidating just like a stroll through the [very alternative] neighborhood.

Fun Experience!. Martijn was our wonderful and fun tour guide! My husband and I went on the 9pm tour and I can honestly say that we really enjoyed it. We learned quite a lot about the history of Amsterdam, it was educational and informative - also, very eye-opening! I would definitely recommend to anyone interested in seeing and learning about both sides of the RLD. Thanks for a great night out!

Steven is the Best. We did a walking tour of the Red Light District through the location at 26 Damrak. Steven was our guide. He was fantastic: funny and had so much good information and stories. But also very respectful of the workers in the district. We had such a fun time and would recommend this tour, especially if you're lucky enough to have Steven as your guide.

Fun Night!. A light-hearted walking tour through the Red Light District that showed us all the highlights (red lights, blue lights and even peep shows) and also gave us historical and cultural tIdbits about the area. Very reasonably priced and David was a charming and informative guide

Great Tour!!. Jan was great, he took us (stag group) to places we would not have discovered on our own, he even had a few beers with us on the way! It was interesting to learn about the history of the district and it gave us all a better perspective of the local area while keeping it fun and interesting. I booked Jan on the recomendation from my wife who had also been to Amsterdam two week earlier on a hen wekend and said it was great fun. Highly recommended! Good value for money! :)

Red light tour-great. My husband and I joined the tour on Saturday night and David was a great tour guide, he struggled a bit with our tour party as they were very quiet women who seemed quite naive. He was very knowledgeable and great fun. I would definitely recommend the tour. Well worth the money.

Bachelor trip. I booked this tour for a group of friends on a stag night. Jan was a great guide, he knew what he was talking about, he had fun with our group and showed us the best places in town. We met the "old Hookers", the two retired ladies that worked for years in Amsterdam. It was really nice to meet them and hear all of their stories. When the tour was finished Jan dropped us at a little cafe " de Dijk", great beer, great people, great atmosphere! After we had dinner we did the tour again without Jan, and indeed he did show us the best places....what a night.....thanks Jan

The Extraordinary Tour.. Excellent Tour Guide Martijn. He showed us the very essence of the Red Light District. The historical artifacts and the transformation to a modern lively society. A tour that is not in excess but just gives you what you need to know for that time. A brief, understandable, concise and perfect in length of duration. Many links to the multiple diversified cultures and foreign settlements due to the past and the ways of doing businesses. An eye opening experience to the uninitiated! Amsterdam really has a libertarian way of life and does a big respectable job of keeping it in control. Martijn also gave us many insights and at the very end; an extra friendly cozy chat and chilling tutorial on the 'fun' and 'lively' life. Absolutely recommend it if you are looking for a headstart. - John.L
David was a great tour guide--very knowledgeable and very funny. This was a really fun tour, and our guide, David, was fantastic. David is very knowledgeable and funny, and he made it a great tour.

A lovely informal tour with wonderful guides. This tour was very informal and Martijn was able to answer all of our questions as well as recommend places for further information. We had an awesome night and was entertained by someone who had a passion for the area and for the people. These guys are committed to spreading respect to those who live the life of the Red Light District to the tourists who have no idea :-) As two very small women we were worried about the tour but with these guys you are very safe!

Must do!. I did the tour last Friday and met up with Jan at the Dam square. Jan speaks English fluently and was very knowledgeable and funny. You can walk through the red light district yourself of course but with the tour and all the information the guide gives you, it is much more of an experience as otherwise you would pass by the interesting spots probably without visiting or without knowing the history behind it. We loved the tour and totally recommend it, a must do when you're in Amsterdam!

Fun and Interesting. Only having a few days in Amsterdam, visiting the Red Light District is a total must. That said, we didn't want to wander through the area aimlessly. We wanted a little information on the history and the culture of the district. We met our tour guide at the designated location. He started by talking about a brief history of the country as it related to the development of the district and the culture of the area. We then headed down to the district while along the way pointing out different sites, artwork, and important cultural aspects of the area. Our tour guide answered a bunch of questions from the group. My husband and I were curious about the gay life too and he seemed to have a good knowledge of it as well. The tour even took us to peepshow. I've never been to one before and now I can say, I don't need to go again. At the end of the tour, our guide also accompanied a few of the group members to a coffee shop (look it up). He was awesome- friendly and knowledgeable. I would do it again in a second. Try it, you'll love it.

Interesting Walking Tour with a Great Tour Guide. Martijn was a very knowledgeable and funny tour guide, making the walking tour more fun and understandable for everyone in the group. The Red Light District Walking Tour was an eye-opener and we enjoyed every bit of it.

Red Light District. We met up with Paul at Dam Square there was 14 of us we interduced ourselves to each other and then we started walking Paul was very funny informative and we all had a great time if you don't agree with the idea of a Red Light District you should still go it might change your mind and if you get Paul you'll have a whale of a time

Great tour, also for locals. Did the tour last friday (19 june).It's funny that most residents of a city don't know a lot about the city they live in, including me. This tour is a great way to learn a bit more about the most popular district for tourists. Jan is a very nice guy, speaks English fluently. He knows his way around of course and has some nice stories on the history and current situation of the Red Light District. Absolute recommendation for both tourists and locals.
Well paced tour!. I think it was a well paced tour! Would recommend to anyone who visits and want some insights to the history of Amsterdam. Thanks Jan.

Great tour, even for locals!!!. Great tour by Jan on friday the 19th of June. We were with a group of colleagues from Amsterdam, so actually we're locals and know the red light district. But even for us it was very interesting and fun to do. Jan is a enthousiastic guy and showed us places we've never seen before! So if you visit Amsterdam this tour really makes your trip complete :)

Most do in Amsterdam!. We really enjoyed the red light district tour we did last Friday. We had a fantastic tour gide (Jan) who was explaining us (locals) things we didn't know about the red light district. That's why I will recommend this tour for tourists as well as locals!Thanks again Jan!

Excellent tour. We took the tour of Friday the 19th of June, and I have to say it was awesome. Jan knew a lot about the area and in the beginning of the tour he really gave it a best shot to loosen up the group. Even though it's just a tour it's starting to look more like an experience, because he seems to know the ins and outs of the red light district. What surprised me was the tour took 1,5 hour but you don't walk for 1,5 hour straight, leaving you with enough energy to do something after the tour as well. Great job!

Red Light Tour - June 12th. We had a fantastic tour of the Red Light District with Martijn. He was funny, interesting, well educated and able to answer all of our questions about the Red Light District. Martijn met us in Dam Square and then gave us some preliminary information before we headed off into the Red area. We would highly recommend this tour with Martijn to anyone looking to see and learn about the Red Light District. Well worth it!

Red light district tour. The tour was good. The guide knew the area well and gave good information about the district. He was enthusiastic person and upbeat. But although it was good. You can visit the district yourself for free and explore it by yourself without the aide of a tour guide and paying for it.

A great experience. I arranged a 9pm tour of the Red light district and was so glad that I did. I was a female traveling alone and wanted to experience the night light in a way that was safe. I was a little nervous but found it to be very fun and very informative.The tour was with a group of about 6 other travelers and our guide who was a very clearly spoken native of the city. The meeting instructions were perfectly clear and communication was very effective. No problem getting started.The tour was a great intro into the history of Amsterdam and the red light district/sex/marijuana trade. Walked the streets, visited a few places inside. All in a friendly, upbeat, fun way. No question seemed off limits and it was a very down-to-earth tour.I think I would have missed out on what makes Amsterdam unique without this tour. Very well run company!

must do in amsterdam. The tour and our guide (Jan) were both fantastic, it was a unique experience. You can stroll around the streets on your own but with the tour you get a better perspective and history of the area.

Good tour, bad tour guide.. This could have been a good tour if we had a tour guide that would have been better and not a homophobe. I almost left 45 minutes into it if it was not for my partner wanting to get the information about the red light district. A lady in our group asked if they had Male prostitutes in the red light distict and he replied "they found women don't get aroused in the same way of seeing a man in the window, and that the men with men sex is just disgusting, so that is why they don't have it. I was amazed that he said this and couldn't believe how he kept telling us that having drugs and sex legal was absolutely the best way for society, but didn't have such an open view when it came to gays. I would recommend this tour if it is available with anyone other than Jan, or unless you don't care that he is a homophobe.

Old Hookers & Red Light District Tour. We took a tour of the red light district and met the lovely twins "The Fokkens". Our guide was Jan or "Young" as we called him for some reason. We met our guide on dam square and went into the red light district, stopped off in a few tourist spots, seen some of the girls working and had a history lesson from Young, after this we went to the dolls museum which was strange but good fun. A few glasses of wine & a good natter plus photos with the twins we headed off to enjoy the rest of the night. Great if your looking for an activity for a hen party.

Private walking tour of Amsterdam Old Town and Red Light District. Ah Massimo, still thinking back on your skillfully guided and insightful tour of old Amsterdam to include the Red Light District.This tour began at 8PM from Prins Hendrikkade 56 in Central Amsterdam. Massimo was engaging from the outset and insightful into the Old Town history and sights. He showed and explained this area of the city that surrounds the Red Light District that gave us a complete understanding of how Old Town has evolved and survived these many centuries. The time flew by concluding with a skillful and insightful tour of the red light district taking us into the innermost areas to give us the complete picture of the oldest profession and it's impact then and now on the city. Hats off to Massimo for a wonderful evening...we highly recommend you hire him for his private tour of this historic portion of the great city of Amsterdam.Joe and Linda Sherman, USA

Great informative tour!. We did the 1.5 tour on Saturday night and had a great time. Jan, our guide, was very knowledgeable and took us to places we wouldn't have gone to on our own. It was a great intro. to the RLD and gave us knowledge to explore on our own. I am glad he told us what the blue lights represented, because I thought that meant the girl was running a special sale. I highly recommend this tour!

Great guide, great tour!. I've been in Amsterdam many times and taken many tours, but never toured the red light district. Since I'm in town for a week, I decided, hey, why not. The night I was scheduled, it was crazy wind, torrential downpour, and I asked sweetly to the tour company if I could switch my day. They were kind enough to agree! So my tour began on a beautiful dry not so freezing evening, with Steve as the tour guide. As I said, I've been on many tours, and all have been good, no complaints. But this one was fantastic. Steve made all the difference in the world. He was informative, fun, funny, and he took good care to see that our group was always together and safe. I hope I have him for a tour guide again! He said he also does the coffee house tours. My recommendation is tour the RLD, and try to get Steve as your tour guide. Tell him Robin from Florida said HI.....

Excellent tour. We went on the tour with Martjin, he was a brilliant tour guide and knew a lot about the history of the area. He seemed enthusiastic and passionate about what he was talking about which kept everyone engaged in the tour. Despite it being raining everyone enjoyed themselves and we saw parts of Amsterdam we didn't know existed (ie Chinatown, the 'real' Hilton of Amsterdam etc) highly recommended, well worth €15

Thank you Jan for a fantastic tour of the RLD!!!. You must do this tour!!!!Our group was informed of the history of the site and how the RDL evolved. It was a very informative tour and we discovered lots which we would never have seen or been aware of us just by visiting the area ourselves. This was the best 15 euros we spent and the duration was just right. We were completely safe throughout the tour. Thank you for a great tour!!

Great snapshot of the iconic red light district . I did the 9:00pm 1.5hr tour with Jan. He was very sincere and welcoming, which created a safe, comfortable environment. It was a small group of 8 in total which meant we could easily hear and ask questions. Jan took us to points of interest that you wouldn't know about from walking by. He presented a range of view points from within the industry to give a wholistic tour.It was a snapshot, but didn't feel like I missed anything and it was great value for €15!I have recommended this tour to my friends.

If you're only in Amsterdam 1 night Do This!. I did the Red Light District Walking Tour with Jan & Daovith in May 2015. Honestly if you only have one night in Amsterdam and you want to learn a bit about the city and have a great night at the same time, this is the tour for you!

Great tour, friendly LOCAL guide. Great tour with a friendly local guide. Showed us around and kept his enthusiasm high throughout. He was having a beer hours later and shouted out to us by name! Very happy with him, it's a shame I can't remember his name!

Great guide makes all the difference. We decided to take this tour as we really did want to know more about the 'red light' district instead of just walking around feeling uncomfortable. Steven was a fabulous guide and told us lots of very interesting history and some of the more 'colourful' details that make the visit a must. He made us reflect on our own attitudes to legalised prostitution and legalised cannabis and explained some of those details that we would have been too embarrassed or would not think to ask. Good work Steven you made our visit worth remembering.

Discover the Red Light District of Amsterdam.. During our visit to Amsterdam, my husband and I booked this tour to find out more about this part of the city. Our guide for the evening was Jan and he did an excellent job. He gave us a brief history of the area and pointed out the oldest buildings in the district as well as what some may consider to be the "seamier" aspects.
