Our tour was early in the evening and due to the fact that it was Remembrance Day in Holland so the district was quieter than normal. That did not detract, however and you could really get a feel for the area. We both felt safe walking the streets and Jan answered every question. You could tell that enjoys interacting with the tourists and giving them a behind-the-scenes look at the city.

A Great Evening Walking Tour with Carlos and his 'Aid' !!. My Wife and I decided to do this tour a little on the last-minute side and we signed up at the hop-on, hop-off bus/boat sightseeing tours main office just down the road from the central station. The tour was 25 Euro each but included just over two hours being walked around and free entry into the Museum of Prostitution. Our guide was a chap called Carlos who wore a little 'sexual-type' attachment on his finger so we could follow him easier. As we walked around we all loosened up and began to ask questions which was a tribute to Carlos who definitely put us all at our ease. This tour is definitely one in which to lose all your inhibitions as the more YOU put into it the more you will get out of it; no question/s are taboo and you would be amazed at what you learn and find out. You certainly get to go everywhere and see everything. If there was any drawback I would say that the visit to the Museum of Prostitution was quite short and felt a little rushed, it was very amusing to be taking a picture of my Wife in a red window though, especially when people waved back !!In short this was money well spent and a REALLY good evening just make sure you relax into it, lose the pre-conceptions and ask questions to get the most out of it.

Fab evening. This tour is a must and our guide, Steve, was really funny, as well as giving loads of facts and figures as well. There were details that you wouldn't think of that gave an amazing insight to the area and the profession. Went with my mum who last visited in 1989, Steve gave a good insight to the changes that occurred and why. Really good.

Red light district walking tour. We booked to go on s walking tour of the red light district.Our tour guide was s guy called Steve . He was brilliant! He was informative, interesting and amusingThoroughly enjoyable x

RED LIGHT TOUR. This is one of the best tours I have been on, The guide was very informative and entertaining. I went on the tour with my wife, a little apprehensive I may add not knowing what to expect. My fears were unfounded it wasn't intimidating or dangerous in fact we both felt very comfortable and very surprised how clean everywhere is. I must add that if you have never been and been told it is seedy I can assure you the ladies are absolutely stunning. Well worth a visit.

Great, even for a local. For my company I wanted to show our international clients a good taste of Amsterdam. Of course the Red Light District is an unique side of this great city. We did this tour with a small group, which I prefer. Large guided tours are impersonal and often drag on for hours, but NOT this one! It was great to have so much interaction with our local guide Jan.My guests where very happy afterwards and thanks Jan for sharing some of your favorite bars and restaurants with us! The guests had a great time, and so did our company because of this.

Best Amsterdam tour you can imagine!. WOW, this Red Light District Tour was really awesome! I'm so glad I took it on the beginning of my holiday in Amsterdam. Jan was the best guide I ever had!! I was fascinated by his stories and all the hidden places he showed us. He provided me with lots of cool to-do-tips as well. Also, he told me which bars to go to and which ones to avoid. Would definitely recommend it to everyone!

Jan is a Legend 🚬. We had Jan as our today guide and he was brilliant. He knows his stuff, speaks perfect English and is very easy to talk to. Would definitely recommend his tour to people. Very good value for money.

Red light district walking tour. What a wonderful insight of Amsterdam's red light district Steve gave us. I shouldn't think that he missed a single detail on this fascinating subject. Although the evening was rather chilly, our laughter certainly made up for it. Well worth the visit.

One of the most interesting tours I've had so far!. I had a private Tour with Jan because the others didn't show up. It was very interesting and personal, not only did he tell me about the Red Light District, he even explained the history of Amsterdam and showed me some really cool buildings. Jan does a great job and I'd highly recommend this tour to everyone who wants to know a bit more about the Red Light District.

Great tour!. Our red light district tour was amazing. Jan provided us more information about the whole city than expected. Also his talent and knowledge gave us the trust to ask him so many questions and he had no problem answering them. The most amazing part was that he gave us some surprises we loved. Very versatile tour. I'd recommend him 100%.
Red light tours. What a tour to do. The tour guide name steve from time and tours. Gave us a real insite to rhe red light area. Must say the ladys are nice aswell to look at. It is a must to do.

Tour with Martijn. Martijn is a tall and friendly guide (see photo of him). We were quite surprised to find that we were the only 2 who signed up for the tour during the timing so lucky for us, it was like a private tour of the RLD. Unlike other tours which required upfront payment, this tour only required booking and payment only after the tour. The tour was very informative and it was like a fun history lesson with Martijn. He showed us so much in the RLD and the 1.5hr tour seems so short went it came to an end. We highly recommend this tour and especially Martijn as your guide. Awesome!

A worthwhile and affordable tour...far exceeded my expectations!. While visiting Amsterdam for the first time, I knew that I HAD to check out the Red Light District, and obviously wanted to do this at night; however, because I was traveling alone, I was a little reluctant to do so having read some things online about the area that made me feel a bit uneasy. I decided that the best thing to do would be to take a tour, and I am so glad that I ended up finding THIS tour! My guide was Jan, the owner of the company, who is very nice and down-to-earth guy. I originally had booked a 7:30 pm tour but it was changed to 9:00 pm. I thought about backing out after the time change, but am so glad I didn't because the 9:00 pm tour is definitely the way to go in order to get the full "Red Light District" effect. Jan was very knowledgeable and walked us by several key spots in the area, including one of the founding coffee shops, some brothels, Chinatown, and a Peepshow. The tour really gave me a sense of comfort with the area, so much so that I returned the next day alone and had lunch at a Thai Restaurant in Chinatown (Bird) that Jan recommended, which by the way is AMAZING!! Do yourself a favor and check out this tour! It was only 15€ for a basic 90-minute walking tour, and the information that you get alone is worth every penny!!

A great tour. Jan was our guide on Sunday eveninghe was polite, friendly and very knowledgeable about Amsterdams night life in the red light areas. my wife and I enjoyed our tour and found Jan to be a funny likable guy.I would recommend this tour to anyone.

Good tour . We booked the tour as we were a bit apprehensive about the red light district; I think this tour appeals to people who like us are a bit unsure! It was an eye opener- not exactly how we imagined, very touristy these days really. Jan was helpful and told us the background and history which was interesting.

a good laugh and important information. Went with a friend to this tour. Geert was the host. We did the tour in English. Although i already knew the place, Geert could tell a lot of new stuff. He did it enthusiastic. He calls the things by the name, Shows condom shop, women in the windows, ladyboys in the windows, sex-shops, peepshow etc. Important is, that you get a lot information about how safe it is now, no minor prostitution, well organised etc. Go there and look with other eyes to this business.

Great Insight......Martijn Was AWESOME!!. We had a great time tonight getting insight into not only the RLD but the City as well. We have been, on our own, in the Red Light District 3 or 4 times but had missed a lot of the nuance and a few 'hidden' spots. This tour covered those and more. It was a small group so we got the benefit of a lot of 'off script' comments and information. It's a fascinating place and well worth your time. Go at night for the real RKD. Our tour was at 9 and, while the tour officially ended much earlier, we had a few beers and sampled some local 'products' to round out a great evening.DO THIS TOUR WITH MARTIJN OR JAN.... Just do it.

Very Interesting Tour. We visited the Red Light Area to see if it had changed since first visiting some 30 years ago. It hadn't. Our guide showed us the area in an amusing manner. I was amazed at the number of people just walking and the number of girls waving! There were hardly any empty windows!! A must see tour if in Amsterdam.

Greeeeat tour. My friends and i thoroughly enjoyed this tour. Very good value for money. Our guide Martijn was hilarious and extremely knowledgeable, there were no questions left unanswered. I would not hesitate at all to recommend this tour, but i would recommend doing the tour at the beginning of your stay rather than the end like we did.Thank you Martijn and crew, you were amazing and interesting.

Interesting, non-cheesy, affordable private tour with local guide. We noticed reviews of this tour business on tripadvisor, went on their website, and decided to give it a shot while we were in town. Jan was our tour guide who is the owner of the business - a younger, unassuming guy, very down to earth. It was 20 EUR per person for 1.5 hour private tour option in the late afternoon - we felt this was a very reasonable deal upon conclusion of the tour. He was prompt and met us exactly as communicated in advance. The experience was kind of like walking around with a friend; he gave us some historical commentary and amusing anecdotes, and also pointed out interesting and noteworthy locations. He was perfectly professional and polite, not sleazy or cheesy. The only odd thing he included on our tour was a stop at a doll museum, which just felt like an odd destination to make a deliberate 5 minute stop (does he get a kick-back for bringing tourists in there?). We did run into the famous "old prostitutes" there though which made it memorable. Recommend this tour company.

An enlightening experience!. After visiting Amsterdam for the first time and attending one of these amazing tours, I am so glad that we booked as I fear we could have been lost forever! Our tour started at 9pm, the meeting point was at the national monument in Dam Square which is really easy to find and a central location. Our tour guide was fantastic! He was incredibly knowledgeable of the history and culture of Amsterdam, explained things I would never have known if I'd been attempting to walk about the Red Light District myself. We walked through a brothel, explored around some coffee and smart shops as well as taking in some of the local heritage. Worth every penny!

Many - dimensional and full experience of this district.. It is always nice to walk with a local!)I think I was lucky, that Karel was giving this tour. He is really awesome tour guide. He told a lot of stories and jokes about it. He also has given a lot of advises about Amsterdam and Netherlands in general.I think this tour worth visiting. Especially because it is free.
Excellent walk tour!!!. Great walking tour through red light district! Excellent tour guide who will walk you through the dam and district with lots history to tell!

If you're nervous, don't be. . The Red Light District is definitely part of the Amsterdam culture that tourists come to see, and just because it includes things that seem strange to people like me (a small-town American), doesn't mean it's not worth seeing. My tour guide (Geert?) was very knowledgeable and funny. We even started at the police station to discuss safety and police protection and involvement in Amsterdam. I am so glad I went on this tour and learned about the area instead of just relying on rumors.

You cannot visit the "dam" without seeing this area!. Amsterdam is well known for sex and drugs.. All in controlled environments too.. The Dutch have got this so right!Many refer to this area as seedy but let's face it, it's the oldest profession in the world it's always going to go on so the rest of the world should follow their lead and keep the workers safe and they pay their taxes like anyone else!!An eye opening experience not for the faint hearted, lady's in windows, sex shops selling things that make your eyes water and among all this little bakeries selling gorgeous cakes, pastries and WAFFLES!! Coffee shops buzzing with atmosphere where even non smokers leave high on the fumes or the muffins!! Lol I love this place, I love the Dutch and a must for anyone travelling to this amazing cultured city

An absolute 'must' when in Amsterdam. I have visited Amsterdam multiple times so I know my way around in this wonderful city. What I love about the most is when you think you’ve explored everything, something new will cross your path. This time I ended up on this website http://www.amsterdamredlightdistricttour.com/ . Usually I’m avoiding the RLD in Amsterdam (it’s just not my thing) but decided sign up for a tour anyway. The tour started at 9 pm and we were with a group of 8 people. Guess what! The Red Light District turns out to be more than a place filled with drunken tourists. It’s actually one of Amsterdam’s oldest historical heritages filled with beautiful stories. The local guide (great guy) took us to places I would have never been able to find myself. This has again changed my perspective looking at this city. It’s an absolute ‘must’ when you’re in Amsterdam. Thank you for a great, fun and educational time.Jay

Great tour. Very friendly and knowledgeable guide! Would recommend.. We recently joined this Red Light District Tour and it was brilliant! Our tour guide, Jan, showed us what the area is all about. We were shown around so many of the cool places in Amsterdam. Its has definitely more to offer than just brothels and coffeeshops. We also visited a games cafe, where we played some air hockey in the middle of the Red Light District. Thanks guys! Great memories.

Very Entertaining Experience by a Local Guide with a Personal Touch. I had the opportunity to tour with Jan and found him to be very friendly and attentive. Instead of a scripted tour, it felt like a fun night out with a friend with good knowledge about his own backyard. I have learnt a great deal about Amsterdam, much more than the typical sightseeing would offer.The Amsterdam Red Light District is an entirely different place at night and I highly recommend Jan and crew for an extraordinary tour of it.

Great walking. I did a walking tour with Jan an Local who lives in Amsterdam...But that guy is great!! He's so funny ! He gives us a lot of attention and information.I learnt a lot that I never have learnt on my on walking through Amsterdam. It was really a pleasure ! Thank you verry much!!!

Thank you, Jan!. I visited Amsterdam with my brother in March 2015 and before we left we booked tour over the internet with this company after comparing prices and reviews etc. We were NOT dissapointed! We were met at the monument at Dam Square, as agreed, by Jan. Jan was lovely, very friendly and down to earth and as my brother and I were the only ones on the tour that night (it was a Sunday) we had the opportunity to ask a local what the city was really like. Jan was very informative, full of historical facts, recommendations and local knowledge, which enriched our tour and subsequently our time in Amsterdam immensely. He started off with a brief history of the city and then we set off. At all times Jan was happy to stop and answer any questions we had, have a laugh and a joke with us, point out things we'd never have noticed and took us to see things we would never have seen otherwise. He really does show you the red light district at it's best. For those thinking it's all drugs and prostitutes, a lot has changed in recent years to make it better, cleaner and safer for all involved. Being it was just the three of us and there were a lot of stags parties around, I thought I might have felt threatened and intimidated by the whole thing but I couldn't have been more wrong. Jan helped us feel at ease and safe and encourage us to experience the area fully, and I'm glad we did. If we hadn't been with a guide I don't think we'd have plucked up the courage to even go at night. If you have any worries or reservations, definitely go with this tour company, you will be made to feel comfortable and at home in what can seem like a strange, alien world.Thanks Jan!

Very entertaining tour from a well-informed local. We were in Amsterdam for a citytrip and booked this tour. It was really amazing so I'm glad we took this tour on the first day we arrived. Our local guide showed us some hidden places in the area, which we definitely wouldn't have found without him. We went to one of the oldest bars in town and we drunk some Dutch gin. Delicious stuff by the way! Also, he gave us some cool to do tips which were very helpful. Especially because some of those tips weren't described in our Lonely Planet guide book.Thanks guys!!

Our tour with Geert. Best experience of Amsterdam. On the tour we learned some awesome formation about the Red Light District while having some fun along with it! Geert was the best part and his knowledge of the area and history we outstanding!!!

Red light, delight.. Booked onto this tour for our first night in Amsterdam and fully enjoyed the experience.Met outside the monument and was introduced to our guide Jan, a friendly local young man who has lived in the city for some years.We got a brief, yet informative introduction into the history of Amsterdam and then set off walking into the infamous Red Light District.The tour guide was friendly and informative and he took us to some of the highlights of the area, including the worlds first condom shop, red light windows, blue light windows, oldest church, hidden art, brothels, Chinatown and a special trip into a peepshow.Its a great tour which balances information with humour and at 1.5 hours its long enough to satisfy the price tag.I recommend this tour and thank Jan for our first introduction to the delights of the red light district.
Red Light District Tour. Great tour! Interesting, fun and healthy… I think I've burned around 400 calories while during the walking tour. Thank you guys. It was awesome!!

Best tour in town!!. I've done many tours in Amsterdam, but this is definitely the best one! The local guide told me so many things I didn't know about interesting city. He even showed me alleys and streets which I hadn't seen before. Great memories! :-)

Fascinating Tour!. Very fascinating tour! Definitely worth the money. We learned a lot about this interesting city. Our guide showed us all kinds of things which we wouldn't have found without him. Plus we were given a great recommendation for a restaurant in the red light district which we visited after the tour.

Best tour ever. This is definitely the best tour I ever did! In 1.5 hours I got to see the whole Red Light District and listen to a very interesting story of our passionate local guide. Very cool guy who knew very much about the area and the history of it. After the tour I've had some drinks with him in a nice bar. Great night, great place!

Very interesting and fun!. Booked this tour some weeks ago. It was awesome! I joined it with some friends as we were looking for something fun to do in Amsterdam. Our guide showed us all kind of secret and hidden places in the Red Light District. Really cool! Great tip for those who are looking for fun things to do in Amsterdam!
Walking tour with Martjin. Informative, fun! Would recommend to anyone wanting to see the red light district if you are new to the city!! :)

Exciting. Walked the guided tour in the RLD in Amsterdam with guide Jan. Saw women in red lit windows in narrow streets, but also shops with nick-nacks, nice design and fashion shops.In a bonbon shop we bought hand made sweets. We went to Mata Hari for dinner, a hip restaurant. Good food too. During this 1.5 hours I burned a lot of calories as well. Healthy stuff that walking tour! :-) LIKE ! "

Worth the money. Hi all,with only a few hours available in Amsterdam, my friend and I took the VIP tour at 4pm ... for only 20 euro ... it was fun, nice and very informatif. Even in the rain, our guide Jan was smiling and very willing to take the time to explore all the red light district area. We were surprise of all the stories and history about that area. I recommand this tour to all .... its worth the money

Great tour!. Altough i life in Amsterdam the tour guy named Jan surprised me and my friends with his knowledge about the history of Amsterdam in general as specific about the Redlight District. During the walking tour he tells abouth the history, public figures, well known prostitutes, gangsters, residents and governmental issues and plans. Besides that he brings you to places you would never find on your own. Great tour!

Great tour with a good balance. Great tour with a good balance between the history of the district and entertainment. Definitely one of the most unique tours I've ever joined. Our tour guide spoke perfectly English and showed us what the Red Light District is really about. He was friendly, funny and definitely knew a lot about the Red Light District. Would definitely recommend this tour to others!

Great tour!. With tours taken all over the world and mostly hosted by locals I must say this is one of the best ones I've done so far. I can recommend this tour to everyone who would like to learn, see, experience the true Amsterdam, hosted by locals.

A fun and interesting tour of a fascinating city. I'm so glad I opted to go for this tour. Found the site after a quick google and the booking was a breeze. Our local guide was very knowledgeable on the culture and history of the district, answering all our questions and the tour flew by as we took in the sights making our way through the narrow streets. Our guide helped us find some good spots for us to take some pretty funny photos which was great! Once the tour was over our guide led us to a good watering hole and we shared a few drinks - a great and late night in the end! I'll be recommending this tour to friends visiting this amazing city in future. Thanks again!

More than just red lights!. This tour is brilliant! Our local guide showed us that the Red Light District offers more than just prostitutes and drugs. He showed that this is actually an urban hotspot for both locals and tourists. Great to be guided through all those narrow alleys and see all those hidden treasures.

Amsterdam the way you want to see it!. I recently booked this tour via their website, and in short: it was a really amazing and unique tour! It is always great to have a local guide with you, but especially in an area such as the Red Light District in Amsterdam. He told us so many interesting stuff about history, prostitution, drug policy, fun facts, do's and don'ts, the current situation, etc. Things you won't find in your standard city guides! Also, he pointed out which bars and restaurants the locals like to go to, something I always appreciate :-)…I'd definitely recommend this tour, as you'll have a whole other mindset of the Red Light District after doing this tour.

Awesome tour. Sex, drugs & rock & roll baby XXX. I don't want to spoil the tour for anyone and for that reason I will not go into too much detail. This was not my first visit to Amsterdam and I do know my way around but I did learn many things.Jan our guide was very knowledgeable and clearly passionate about this great city and of course the red light district (RDL). I really enjoyed learning about the history of the city, the origins of the RLD, religion and tolerance. The tour started at Dam Square and we headed into the RDL via Warmoesstraat with some interesting facts shared along the way. The highlight of the tour of course were the beautiful window girls in De Wallen. Jan took us up and down the main RDL strip including, Oudezijds Voorburgwal and Oudezijds Achterburgwal. We visited the Sex Palace Peep Show, De Oude Kerk (The Old Church) and the Waag in Nieuwmarkt and again along the way Jan explained the History and the changes that have been made to the RDL over the past 10 years.I really enjoyed this tour and its well worth the money. If its your first time visiting Amsterdam then I highly recommend it. The RDL is a relatively safe area but having a guide take you through the alleys does put your mind and ease. The RDL is a rapidly changing place with many windows and facilities being closed down so book this tour while you still can and enjoy some of Amsterdam's more colourful and erotic history.
Great Tour with Sam. Sam showed us Amsterdam with such a passion, it was wonderful. We laughed a lot and his stories were just great. The best way to explore the city!

walking tour amstedam is a must. the free amsterdam walking tour was recommended to me by a friend who also thought it was great.I think walking around amsterdam is the best way to meet the city. The tour was about 3 hours we got to see a lot, learn about dutch history and culture in a very fun way thanks to our amazing guide Kor. (Hard)Kor made this tour what it was ,interesting and fun, he was very funny had a lot of energy , you could tell he loved what he did, and most importandly knew his stuff!! i would highly recommend this to groups of friends

Great tour. Me and my son had the free walking tour with Monique , we had a good time, she told us interesting things about the history of the town, buildings and its people.I recomand everyone to take this tour for a great view of the beautiful Amsterdam.

Great tour. My husband and I joined the free city tour with Tim. He was a very knowledgable guide who really opened up the central area of Amsterdam in a most informative and entertaining manner. Certainly a great tour to follow
Free city tour with Micheal in Amsterdam.. Micheal was Very informative, witty and well presented, a must 'to do', at the beginning of your stay in lovely Amsterdam.

Kevin & Vanessa. Monique was a great tour guide, plenty of information and sights to absorb (including the wonky buildings). We always take in a city walking tour to give you a good start to the break. Some idiosyncrasies are priceless!
Walking Tour trough the center of Amsterdam. The tour with Monique was brief history and interesting facts about Amsterdam. Not too much information and well guided.

Excellent Walking Tour. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed Rocco's tour around historic Amsterdam. It was very informative and fascinating and we definitely learnt a lot more than we would have from our guide book.

Amsterdam City Free Tour. I and two fellow travelers took the Amsterdam City Free Tour on September 18, 2016. We were very pleased with the tour and would highly recommend it to anyone who would like an introduction to the city. Our tour leader, Rick (Ric), was very knowledgeable, personable and shared interesting insights to the city. The tour is contribution based and we each gave the gently suggested amount which was still quite a bargain for a high quality and informative 2.5 hour guided tour. Try it -- you will be pleased.

Good Value Tour. Excellent overview of Amsterdam city center area. Guide was friendly and knowledgeable. Compared favorably to other city tours we booked through our Viking cruise, but for a much lower cost (tip).
Walking tour. Axel was a great guide ..knowledgable and with lots of fun interesting stories. Great tour, even in eve rain

Highly recommend . Great tour with jasper , very informative and really enjoyable , with a break to purchase other tickles for attractions which was useful. This is a free tour and you are requested to tip the guide, I was quite dumbfounded at how little some people left , I would stress the guide only gets the tips so dig deep - they do deserve it :-)

Walking tour of Amsterdam. Monique was quite delightful and charming. We enjoyed the walking tour, which even went over time. It was informative without too much historical data, rather about the current issues and situation at the places we visited.

Brilliant Tour. I was passing through for just a day and wanted to see the city so I took this tour and was delighted with it!Ask for Morgan - she has a wicked sense of humor, is a wealth of information of the city and is a natural entertainer!! I'm always impressed when guides can go into some of the deeper history and cause and effect as to the "whats" and "whys" of a city.Thank you Morgan, you're a peach but not a Georgia peach, a Louisiana peach!!

Free red light district tour. We attended the free light district your. Was amazing. The guide Rocco was very nice, informative and entertaining. He told us a lot about the red light district and we enjoyed it a lot. If you think about taking the tour around this district, this is definitely the one.

Good Overview. Very nice overview of city, tour guide (Monique) was energetic yet patient and extremely friendly, cute and funny. Even though the tour went a bit over time (~3hrs), I was engaged the whole time. recommended...
very good. very good way to start your vacation in amstardam, we had great time, thank you Morgan it was fun and happy :)))

Very good guides!. I've booked the two free tour this company offers: Amsterdam and red lights district. Both of them were very good. In the Amsterdam free tour, a very nice and sweet girl told us everything about Amsterdam including secret spots that ordinary guides wouldn't tell you about. In the red lights district your, Roco told us everything about the history of prostitution and etc in a very funny and theatrical way so you wouldn't get bored!! Totally recommended.

A great start to our vacation. We took our tour about six hours after de-planing from a long overnight flight. We should have been tired, but Monique kept us informed and entertained and we didn't have time to think about being tired. This was a great introduction to Amsterdam - a very thorough tour. I would highly recommend it.

A Great Walk Around Town. We booked this free tour on our first day in Amsterdam. We thought it would keep us awake to adjust to the jet lag, but it turned out to be much more. The guide was entertaining and informative. He kept us on track to see quite a few historic sites while he filled us in on Dutch history and modern life. You learn about art and architecture, canals and culture while being guided through the busy streets of the city. (And yes, of course -- don't tell mama -- we took a quick stroll through the Red Light District.) The tour is indeed free, but a generous tip for the guide is more or less expected at the end. (It isn't required). The experience was so good we were glad to pony up, and you probably will be too.

Great walking tour!. We scheduled this tour for the same day as our arrival from the USA. We were going to cancel due to fatigue and the very hot weather (a record). We started the tour with Monique thinking we would leave it when we got too tired. However, she did such an interesting and at times, amusing commentary that we stayed for the entire walking tour.We highly recommend this tour!

Fun & cheerfull :). Very entertaining intro to many famous landmark across Amsterdam. You do not need to keep nose within your maps - just follow your guide and enjoy excited stories about places that you saw at the tourist's booklets. Thank you Emmy for your enthusiasm and sense of humor!

Great Introduction to the city. We found the walking tour very helpful in gaining an idea of where major sites were in Amsterdam. Our guide was helpful and informative throughout. The walk was great, we learned a lot about the history of the city. I would highly recommend doing this walking tour at the start of your trip to Amsterdam.
Great tout. Our guide, Kor, was very funny and we had the best time. He explained everything really clear and was ready for answering questions anytime. Recommended!

Inside information. This was a great tour. Our guide, Monique gave us all kinds of fascinating info about the city without being too showy. So much more interesting then just walking around and looking at things. We got a real feel for the history of the city and what it means to be an Amsterdamer.

Great walking tour. I enjoyed the tour guided by Rik very much. He told great anecdotes about Amsterdam and its history and presented the facts about the city in a fun way. I would most certainly recommend this tour.

Excellent . Very enjoyable and informative tour around the city centre. Rick the guide was genuine and quite Witty and managed to steer all 20 of us safely through the city, would definitely recommend this tour
Little off time in Amsterdam.. Went to free tour with Jonathan as our guide. Tour was great, received good knowlede about the city in a lively way.

Great walking tour. Monique was our tour guide, she was very personable and knowledgeable. The pace of the tour was perfect, we were a group of 12 and no one was left behind or missed out on the information. Monique delivery of the information was professional and entertaining.Highly recommend this tour.

Amsterdam tour. The tour was very good, I was surprised I could get on the tour with only booking at 11am on the day and the tour starts at 13:30. The tour guide Rick was very knowledgeable and did a brilliant job of keeping a group of around 20 people together through the crazily busy streets of Amsterdam and got none of us run over by any bikes. Definitely worth doing and the best thing is you get to pay what you think the tour was worth once it's finished, so the guide has to really impress to earn his wages.

Great abs enjoyable . Rick was awesome .. Around 3 hours of walking . It was my 3rd time in Amsterdam, but first time to know all this info about it!
Recommended

Great tours. Did the day history tour on wednesday with Rick and the red light secrets tour with Rocco on friday night. Both guides was really good and gave awesome stories. The tours are really recommended if you want to really know the city.
Introduction to Amsterdam. Despite the hot weather, I have enjoyed the tour with Rik. Have received just enough amount of info for my first stay in the city.
Amsterdam free city tour. Great walking tour with Michael who had a great sense of humour while being very knowledgeable on the history of Amsterdam. The tour covers a great area of the city.
Great tour. The tour was really great and very informative. I recommend this experience for everybody! The guide was Rick was really nice and gave us many tips about Amsterdam.

Great introduction to our stay in Amsterdam. Monique gave us an informative and also funny introduction to Amsterdam. No information overkill, but all the essentials. I would definitely recommend this tour for first time visitors.

Free walking tour. Our guide Tim/Finn, not quite sure because of his accent, but he was a fabulous tour guide. He was really informative and humorous so really brought the city to life. Definitely do this tour at the start of your holiday to get the most out of your stay 😜

A must do in Amsterdam. This tour is a must. Monique our guide was excellent and full of funny stories (and actions) to lighten up the factual side of things. About 3 hours in total but at a very easy pace with regular stops to share her knowledge. She also managed to keep us together and out of the bicycles way. Highly recommended to do.

Wonderful walking tour. . We really enjoyed our walking tour. Our tour guide was friendly and informative. We learned a lot about the city and its history - everything from the red light district and 'coffee shops' to hidden convent courtyards and secret Catholic Churches. Highly recommend this tour.

Great tour with useful and interesting information. I only have one day in Amsterdam and get on a walking tour with City Free Tour is really amazing. Only in 2.5 hours, we have been walking through all the significant places of Amsterdam with a humorous tour guide, I remembered all the introduction, the stories, the histories of Amsterdam until today. It was truly an amazing tour that you should have never missed.

Great introduction to Amsterdam. The tour was very informative and covered various areas. The weather was extremely hot and Monique kept us on the shady side as requested. The stories of the canals and the red light district were covered along with the old part, hidden gardens, a museum and a couple of churches. It was a fun way to get to know the city.It is a free tour but you tip at the end, we gave more than the recommended amount and enjoyed it very much.

Red Light Tour. We took a day tour with a different company who were incredible, so this one had a high bar to reach, but it was amazing. It's the only free Red Light tour, and we were lead by Rik, who was brilliant. He was really fun and told us loads, and the history of the area is incredible - you get so much more than just walking through and looking at the women. Definitely take this tour.
Monica was excellent. Yesterday we did the walking tour with Monica. She was very knowledgeable and informative. We enjoy it a lot.It was our first walking tour ever.

Great tour. We liked this tour a lot. Our guide Monica was knowledgeable and we learned a lot. Booking is needed. We booked a day before via website. There is no set fee, but you need to give tips by the end of the tour. I believe most people give about 10-15 euro per person.

THE BEST . I'm a huge fan of walking tours as a way to get your bearings and be told the stuff you should be reading in the guide books. Having done about 8 I can honestly say this was the best by far. Monique was charming, friendly and informative punctuated with wicked humour! One of the high lights of our trip.

Totally amazing. The houses in Amsterdam is really out of the world! Every building is different from another and that's the thing that I like the most. Every house has it's own characteristics and details. Even the doors are fascinating to see.
Great guide, Monique. Interesting walk through some of the historic areas of Amsterdam as well as some of the more modern highlights. A good introduction to this cosmopolitan city.

Walking Tour. We walked for about three hours in the Old City.The guide Katjalisa was great and full of knowledge. We did so immediately when we arrived in Amsterdam. Definitely a good experience for those who want to understand where they are . Do not forget to leave a tip.

very enjoyable. We really enjoyed the tour guided by Monique. The tour was detailed and very interesting. We had it on the first day of our arrival to Amsterdam and it was a great introduction to the city. Thank you!

Walking tour. Spent 3.5 hours with a local guide. He was entertaining and informative. We got to see the city from a different perspective you can't read about in books. Worth the time and the 10 Euro tip.

Informative and intresting tour!. Having visited Amsterdam 5 times previously, this tour was exactly what I was looking for. The tour guide was very informative and approachable. She gave a an insight into what it is like to live in Amsterdam and the culture of the Netherlands. Unlike other tours, the content was delivered at the correct depth, it did not feel like you needed a degree in history to understand what she was staying. I registered online for this tour, the process is very simple and easy. Not sure if you can attend the tour without registering.

Great tour!!!. A group of four of us were lucky to have Monique as our guide, in a group of 12 in total- good size. We learnt so much about Amsterdam and its history! And Monique did it in an interesting, well humoured way. We thoroughly enjoyed it and highly recommend it. It does go on for 3hrs so bring water or snacks and comfy shoes. The tour is free in the sense that you are free to pay what you felt the tour was worth. Monique does such a great job that by the end you are only to happy to pay 10-15euros each (it is probably worth more).Must do when in Amsterdam :)

Take this tour!. Monique was a great tour leader! The trip was perfectly planned and she managed the group so that we could hear her comments and get to all the locations. It was a wonderful way to be introduced to a week in Amsterdam.

Great way to see and learn about Amsterdam. I have been visiting Amsterdam for business for over 1o years and I finally took a walking tour to get a more intimate look at the city and a better understanding of its history. Monique did a great job taking us to many areas of the city I had never seen. In the 3 hours we were treated to a great view of the city and it's many diverse and colorful neighborhoods. Highly recommended

Brilliant tour. Enjoyed the tour, and the historical nuggets were really interesting. :)Our tour guide was Monique, who led us through the hidden corners of Amsterdam. Interesting info on Amsterdam's multicultural history.
Very informative. Learned a lot about Amsterdam and the 2.5 hrs covered most attractions in the central part of the city. Tips are expected so it's not really free.

A great way to see the city. Monique was very knowledgeable about the city and was always happy to answer questions. We saw some places that I would never have known were there and it was great to get stories related to each place. I have arthritis in my knees and was concerned the 2.5 hour tour might be too much. However, I managed ok even though the tour was hitting the 3 hour mark. I do recommend comfy shoes, especially on a hot day. It is important to bear in mind that these tour guides live off the tips you give and it is recommended that you pay about €10. I feel that this is a bargain for the insight and information you are given. Don't tip less just because there might be a group of 20+ and you think you can get away with it - not good karma!!

A Summers day in Amsterdam. A warm humid day in Amsterdam, but a really enjoyable walk, taking in some hidden treasures of the city. Monique supplied countless stories & facts & figures, making our near 3 hour tour super interesting. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED - Steve & Margaret.

Fun and professional. Nice, fun and enthusiastic guide. Even though there was some problems with the meeting location (blocked by a movie set), they managed to make the tour smooth. Interesting stories.

City tour. I only had a few hours in Amsterdam and this tour was perfect. Monique gave us lots of information and made it a worthwhile experience. Thank you for a delightful and informative afternoon. Annette

Great!. It was not my first time in Amsterdam, but my first official tour and it was a great experience. Tijs was the tour guide, he was very funny. It was a good and detailed introduction about the city and I am sure that the details which were shared I would never got to know without this tour. I recommend this on the first days of your visit in the city. :)
Very informative. Zain's was very inthusiastic and informative. She had good knowledge and a great sense of humour. We thoroughly enjoyed our tour

Great alternatives to Museums. Monique our guide was really great. She spoke clearly and intelligently about the history and sites of Amsterdam. We had been in Museums in the morning and it was terrific to be outside and walking. Much better than those canal tours. She also did the red light district last so those with children and didn't think it was appropriate could leave. Great tour - i recommend it.

Good info, but the standing still.... We joined a large-ish 25 or so group on a sunday. We circled the market meeting area twice before finding the guide who was holding a binder that said City Free Tour. To be fair, we were a tad early. The information along the tour was interesting, a good intro to Amsterdam and with a joke thrown in here and there. My only complaint is I can do 2.5 hours of walking, but we would actually walk a bit then stand still while the guide talked about the area we were in. By the end of the tour, everyone was looking for places to sit when we stopped. I'm in my late 20s and my lower back was not happy. That being said, the tour itself is worth it if you are ok with the hike. The guides work purely on tips so we brought about 10 euro per person for her at the end. Recommended!
Great tour. We had lovely time with Monique. She gave us detailed tour around the center and great tips for the rest of our Amsterdam trip.

Helpful Introduction to Amsterdam. We did this on our first full day. I almost cancelled thinking that a free tour probably wouldn't be very good. I'm so glad I didn't. Tijs was a terrific tour guide and showed us all around the city and answered our questions. It is important to tip the tour guides - we had a small group - only 9 people and a few students who didn't tip..
great way to see the city. free tour is very good way to see the city, it showes you good places and give you a good overview for rest of you stay.guide was very friendy, very recomemded

Great tour!! . My husband and I were on Monique's tour and it was really wonderful. We had a small group and she took time to answer everyone's questions. She had a great sense of humor but was also very professional. She showed us details and alleys that we never would have found on our own. Thanks Monique!!

Very Knowledgable Guide. My husband and I joined Monique for the walk a few days ago. We found the walk very enjoyable and received helpful information for our stay in Amsterdam. We highly recommend City Free Tour Amsterdam. Having a guide with local knowledge is always appreciated for the free city walks. Good job!
Great!. Lovely walking tour with Monique! Would definitely recommend and is a great way to see the city. Easy walk with cheese samples included :)

Excellent, very informative. We took this tour along with another 14-15 people. Monique out guide was outstanding. She was very informed, interesting to listen too. We visited places that we would never have know even existed. I would strongly recommend this tour to anyone who wants to experience and see things that a tourist wouldn't normally even know about.Thank you very much Monique

Highly recommend this tour. This tour is a great way to start your visit to Amsterdam as it give you an overview of all of the things to see in this beautiful city. The tour guide was excellent - great sense of humor and full of interesting facts and lots of history. The group was kept small and the guide moved right along but kept us together and safe from the crazy bicyclists. While the tour is billed as free, it is expected that if you enjoy it you would compensate the guide with some amount. Given what other tours cost, you can be generous and still be less than what you pay for the other tours.

Great experience!. This tour is a great way to learn more about the city and its people! You will explore the old part of the city but you will also learn about present life. Our tour guide was Monique, a lovely woman with a great sense of humor! Enyoj!

Fun tour. My family and I did this tour two weeks ago during our first days in Amsterdam. Rik was our guide, and he was excellent. Great way to get a good introduction to a fabulous city. We learned a lot about the history and the culture. As others have mentioned, tips are recommended for this free tour, according to the value you feel you receive. We tipped Rik €12 per person and feel this tour was well worth our time and money. Highly recommended.

Great intro to central Amsterdam. Despite on and off rain, with a hearty downpour for the last half hour, this was a great tour. Monique is very knowledgable and personable. She took us to several out-of-the way squares and corners of central Amsterdam that I had not seen in any guidebook. She even offered us a tasty sample of aged cheese about midway through the tour. I would recommend this tour to anyone wanting a good introduction to this lovely city.

Do this when you get into Amsterdam. This tour is a great way to begin your visit to Amsterdam. Monique took us on a back and forth but ultimately circular tour of the old area of Amsterdam, with a great deal of historical and contemporary information about the city. We came away with a good sense of the layout of the city and the areas we would want to return to. I highly recommend this tour.

FABULOUS Company to deal with and TOURS are a MUST!. I had a large group so emailed Monique prior to arriving and unreal how many times she emailed me to answer many of my questions; and the help she gave me re. planning our 3 days in Amsterdam; way beyond the call of duty. Re. the walking tour; she set it up for just my group at specific time; had three guides and afterwards; all my group were fighting for the rights that their guide was the best. They all gave 100 %plus. They were all fabulous; knowledgeable, enthusiastic, educated; and fun to be with. This tour is a MUST to do in Amsterdam; best to do it shortly after you arrive; gives a good layout of the land plus you pick up a lot of hints for the rest of your time in Amsterdam. I have taken many other free tours in other places and this one rates the highest. You will see so many things that a travel book will never tell you to see; so many hidden spots and fabulous history of Amsterdam. All the guides had strong voices plus were very considerate of people in their group .. re. walking ability; needing a break; time to take pictures ,etc. Plus they all gave excellent tips on what to do for the remainder of our stay; where to eat, drink; avoid lines for certain things, etc. I feel bad that they don't make the tip mandatory as it's well worth 15 E per person for three hours. Monique also helped us plan dinner/drinks for 6 in a beautiful castle like restaurant where the guides met us at 8 to do the Red light District Tour. How interesting; eye opening, plus safe that was ; having a guide with us plus learned a lot about prostitution. Again fabulous guides , information and so much fun. This tour is offered also; if you just show up at their recommended spot; also easy to find. The suggested tip for the Red Light tour at night is a bit less as it's only 2 hours. They are so kind; they even walk you back to where you get on the subway to your hotel. Will not find a better company, guides or tour than these ones. Make sure you take both of them if you can.
Great tour!. Really enjoyed our walking tour of Amsterdam! Rik was our guide and he gave us a great tour of the city's highlights. The tour was informational and entertaining.

Very nice and enjoyable tour. We had the tour with Monique. She was very fun to have around, she took us through all the old city center, explained and described with many details in a fun way. She was really really nice. Throughout the tour we could ask her all sorts of questions about the city and she also gave us tips in the end regarding restaurants and other places to visit in Amsterdam. I really liked the enthusiasm with which she talked all the time. I 100% recommend it :)

Wonderful Story Teller. This walking tour gives you a good sense of the major attractions in the City Center. As a first time visitor to Amsterdam, I learned a wealth of information--but what really makes the tour memorable is that the guide (Rick) is a professional story teller who really knows how to grab your attention and keep it with his well crafted anecdotes about the history and culture of Amsterdam. He has a great sense of humor as well. A special experience.

Awesome for free !!. The tour was done by Rik. A very enthusiastic guy with answers to all the questions about the city. Totally recomend it.
It was really easy to book ourselves, and the starting point was in a place very close to Centraal Station. Very hard to miss the meeting point.

City Free Walking Tour. We booked on-line for the walking tour. Rik was a great guide. Very pleasant, helpful and informative about Amsterdam. We only arrived into Amsterdam that morning, so it was a great way to get to know the City. I would recommend this tour and I hope everyone gave Rik a generous tip, as he deserved it - the tour was nearly 3 hours!

Great City Overview. Tijis was our guide and did a very good job with sights and a history lesson. Really great way to spend an afternoon plus get a little walking exercise. Guide even gave us a sample of local cheese. Very international group. Even though free, I like the idea of making a reservation online to try to control crowd size. Guide is only paid through tips so be kind and pay what a tour would cost. It seemed that most gave him at least 10 euros each. 2.5 hours long.

We spent two days in Amsterdam. Since we were on a tight schedule, we decided to get a tour to help us make the best of our time. This tour was fantastic since it provided us with an overview of everything the city offers. The guide was absolutely great. She showed up on time, knew all of our names, and was very accommodating.

original freewalking tour AMSTERDAM. I had little time in Amsterdam and I went for the original free walking tour for about 3 hours. The guide Hotto was great and show us the really special attractions that you cannot find in a guide book.He has done a great job introducing us to small details that made us wander around Amsterdam as locals. I surely recommend it

Brilliant tour.. We had Monique as our guide. She was funny, informative, aware of all the possible 'dangers' a hectic Amsterdam has to offers and was always pointing out these to us. Ie, those billions of crazy cyclist! The tour is free but a €10 euro tip is recommended and I've paid more for much less in the past. Certainly worth reserving a place on this tour via the website. :)

Great way to introduce you to the City.. We did the 'free' walking tour on our first day in Amsterdam, we figured it would be a good way to get to know our way around and learn about the city.Monique was our guide and she was very knowledgable, kind and upbeat, the tour from start to finish was a little over 3 hours stopping at many famous spots and learning about a few hidden gems of the city. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour, it was all in English and there were about 14-16 of us in the group from all different places in the world. It states that it's a free tour, however you are generally expected to tip if you enjoy it. We tipped €10 each after reading other TripAdvisor posts and it seemed like the others tipped around this too. Overall it was a great introduction to the city and really helped with being able to find our way around, we also learned a lot about the history. I highly recommend doing this tour if you have the time too!

BOOK NOW!. This is a great way to start your trip to Amsterdam as Monique’s tour gives you a great feel for the city, provides you with a better idea of how to get around and her informative talk permeates through the rest of your trip. I have been to Amsterdam before but this time got to see a number of really interesting places that I had missed (Begijnhof was superb) as well as learning more about the history (including recent times) of this incredible city. Monique was fantastic, the nearly three hour walk was a mixture of fun and education and we were lucky enough to be in a small group of 10 with some wonderful people from across the globe (including Chris, the guy who actually set up the company). We have used a few other walking tours in other cities but would definitely recommend City Free Tours as they appear to have a brilliant customer ethos.

“The best introduction to the city”. Having just arrived in the city this tour helped us get our barings and introduced us to the history of Amsterdam. Monique's insights and anecdotes made for a fascinating three hours as we walked through the city. We thoroughly enjoyed EVERY minute. We highly recommend this tour not only to orientate yourself with the city but to get a feel of Amsterdam and those who live there. Monique was friendly and engaging and the tour was an absolute pleasure.

Not to be missed!. We met the tour guide Monique on our first full day along with another two tourists.Monique was very conscientious organising this second tour of the day so no tour party was too big. She replied to our email to request a place on it very quickly. She had a lovely fun personality and was knowledgeable and passionate about Amsterdam.I would recommend that you do this tour before any other sightseeing to give you a great overview of the city.Monique brought us on a three hour walking tour which passed quickly. It gave us a base knowledge to appreciate things about city as we explored it on our own after. We were lucky to make good friends with the other two tourists who we met every day and made it a brilliant break. The tour has no price, you give the guide a payment of your choice at the end.
Don't miss this with the lovely Monique....... Excellent, knowledge and personal insites into Dutch life. Just don't under tip this lovely lady with amazing eyes.

AMAZING!!!. Monique was a fabulous tour guide. She engaged the participants throughout the tour thus making everyone feel welcomed. Her knowledge, her communications skills, her story telling and her sense of humour also added to our experience. This tour provides participants with historical facts, tips and tricks in experiencing and navigating Amsterdam, information on architecture (why are some of the buildings leaning?), some insight on Amsterdam culture and much more. This was an enlightening tour with an amazing tour guide. Happy adventures in Amsterdam!
Fantastic!!!!. The best i ever had so far! Was funny and with cheese tasting! Monique was super nice and created a great atmosfere.

It was really enjoyable. We had an amazing time during the free city walking tour. We were a small group on the day and our guide Monique, gave us a long stroll along the canals of Amsterdam and the core of the city center. She explained the history, the construction and the habits (some funny facts as well) of Amsterdam and its people over time. I recommend it to anyone who interested to get a closer look to the culture and history of this beautiful city. Well done Monique!

Great start to a visit to Amsterdam! . We really enjoyed our tour with Monique - she was friendly and helpful and made sure we all understood her and didn't get hit by cyclists! We found it helpful to learn about the history of Amsterdam (both recent and not so recent) and it was a useful orientation to the different districts in the city. Reserve your place online and start your visit to Amsterdam with this tour!

Much-needed tour to get to know the xkfy. We really enjoyed this tour as it was a great way to get to know the city. Our guide, Monique, knew a lot about the city, the best places to go, what to avoid, etc. It was a big help and without the tour, my girlfriend and I wouldn't have been able to see half of the things we saw.

A great introduction to a great city. We joined Monique on this 3-hour tour, she was very informative, funny and nice. This tour whetted our appetite for the city and pointed out the areas we should explore more. The weather was drizzly, but we had fun anyway.

Great way to get a feel of the history and size of the city. Monique guided us through the city for 3 hours, explaining the history from its origins up to the present day. Telling us of the freedom to worship and be whoever you want to be in this city. We visited places we would never have found on our own - like the Begijnhof courtyard - a little gem off Spui Square. We saw the two thinnest houses in Amsterdam and had a sample of cheese also (if you get time book the cheese tastking it's excellent!). This was a great introduction to the city and Monique was the perfect guide!

Excellent way to see the city. Really enjoyed this tour. It was my first time in Amsterdam and I just wanted to get a feel for the city before venturing out on my own. Monique was a great guide, she is funny, enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. During the 3 hours, she told us a lot about the city's history, old and modern, and we also got to taste some cheese!I definitely recommend this walking tour.
Great . I enjoyed very much this tour. We visitee many interesting places and the guide was very kind and with a great smile. I recomend this for sure.

Interesting and fun. Monique was our guide for this 3 hr tour and she made it clear at the start that although she didn't get paid, if we enjoyed her presentation of the tour, she would accept tips at the end. I like it when guides are clear about this at the start - it saves feeling uncertain of what is expected for 3 hrs! She well deserved our tip! She was funny, knowledgeable and interesting and we learned about the history of Amsterdam right up to the current time. She took up to places that we would never have found on our own and was always open to questions. Great tour!

Highlight of our two days. . Monique ! Really good tour of Amsterdam . No idea what we saw and where we were! Just follow her quick pace and soak it all in. A great way to get a quick feel of the city with history and antidotes thrown in. Keep in mind this tour is not really " free" please tip after... Truly the best value for your tourist euros !
Excellent tour!. Monique gave us a great tour through central Amsterdam. She was very knowledgeable, funny and made sure that no one was hit by the speeding bicycles.
Great tour . Our guide Monique was very friendly, polite and funny. It is a good way to start your trip in order to be geographically aware of the city before moving on alone.

Interesting walk tour of the old part of Amsterdam. The City Free tours is a great way to see and learn few interesting facts about Amsterdam. Our tour guide Monique was very pleasant, and I recommend this tour if you want to learn something new and have couple of hours to spare. The tour is created to show the visitors little bit of the history of this great and somewhat unusual city. The tour will go through Red Light district but its still suitable for children. The tour is free, but the guides do appreciate tips, and usually is 10euros/person. Be aware the walk tour is 2.5 hours long rain or shine, and you should reserve it via website

Great tour with no predetermined cost.. Monique was obviously enthusiastic from the start, and her enthusiasm showed throughout the tour. Lots of background information about Amsterdam as well as seeing the main sites.
Great tour. The tour was great , 4 people and it was for 2.5 hours. Went throw Dam square , Red District area, old church ...

Great experience with Tijs. I did this free walking tour May 13th 2013.Our guide was Tijs and he was amazing,I learnt lots of history about Amsterdam.The weather helped as well.We visited different areas and we could feel he enjoys what he does.Thanks a lotI would recomend it without any doubtMar
Excellent tour!. Super nice to get to know the city, even when it's not your first time! Must do! Plus it's free, what else can you ask for! The tour guide really adds value to the tour!

Passionate Tour Guide. Worth to try!. My tour guide is Monique. A very cheerful and sincere lady that take good care of everyone in the tour to make sure we are comfortable and catch what she said. The weather wasn't stable and it was raining in the beginning. Monique came and gave us a big smile under the bad weather. She tried best to engage with all of us so that the tour will be more interactive. For the tour, it's informative and gave you a basic knowledge about Amsterdam. Compared to other tour company, City Free Tour may have less people but it doesn't mean their quality isn't up to standard! Try it!

Great Tour. Tijs tour of Amsterdam was great and very insightful, he showed us around places that we would not have found on our own and provided loads of interesting information.
I would definitely recommend this trip

Great Tour. They were so generous and added another tour since the later tour was full, it was only 4 of us on the new tour and it was great! We hit so many spots and learned much more than if we had walked the city on our own.

Excellent guided walking tour - highly recommend!!. Thanks to Rick for a fantastic walking tour on 23/04/2016 - excellent guide, almost 3 hour guided tour. Highly enjoyed learning about the city while getting to walk around and get a real sense of the history and evolution. Would highly recommend to anyone, we pre-booked just to make sure we would get a spot on this tour! Meets just in front of the old town gates "de waag" - get the metro to nieuwmarkt. Would highly recommend!!

Great tour with Monique. Informative, friendly and well organised. We really enjoyed it. Do the tour during the week if you can as the groups tend to be smaller. There were only 8 of us and it felt like an individual tour. Will definately do the tour again if we go back to Amsterdam. Thank yo Monique, you were great.

A fantastic insight to the city. Our guide Monique was engaging and informative. We were brought around the city for approx 3 hours and learned the history, the history of the architecture, about the people living in the city today . Even the visit to the red light area had a back story. I would really recommend it.
Amsterdam in a nutshell - a must!. Rick was excellent! He told us some very interesting facts about Amsterdam and was very entertaining! Highly recommended

Really interesting walk through lovely areas of Amsterdam!. We decided to do this walk on our first full day in Amsterdam in order to orientate ourselves. We learnt a lot and found the tour very informative. Tjis our Tour Guide was knowledgable and very interesting. We would not have found some of the places he showed us had we not done the tour. Our tour lasted nearly three hours and there was no comfort or coffee stop which did not bother us. Do wear comfortable shoes and take a bottle of water with you. We had a great time!

You will get to know Amsterdam Much better after this Tour. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and our tour guide Monique did her best to display the beauty and history of Amsterdam within 2.5 hours. It was a very interesting free walking tour, me and my friend were there only for two nights and we did the right thing by joining this tour. The added benefit of this tour is, it starts in the afternoon. After hanging out at couple of nice pubs of Amsterdam on our first night, we got back to hotel quite late. It was good to sleep long on the next morning and then to join this tour, perfect timing. Highly recommending this tour......
Nice Tour in Amsterdam Central. Our tour guide Monique is friendly and funny, very informative and educative in term of the historical part of the city. Recommended definitely!
Great tour. Monique was a great informative and funny tour guide. Best part of our stay and we were glad we did it on the 1st day to get the history and layout of Amsterdam.
Great tour. Our guide Tijs obviously loved his city and transmitted this enthusiastically to his audience. Even kept his audience with him through the rainy start of the tour.
Interesting and funny!. I love Free tours! They are always very interesting, educative, funny at the same time. Our guide Tim was amazing! Thank you, Tim!

So good we booked again!. Myself & seven other friends ( 4 couples aged from mid 40's to late 60's) recently visited Amsterdam for a long weekend from England. As part of the holiday we chose a private walking tour of Amsterdam (so it wasn't "free"). Monique was our guide - she was excellent! Friendly, informative, amusing & helpful. We agreed to meet in a local cafe ( "Vinnies") for a coffee where we discussed what we wanted from the event and so it was a "normal" tourist tour (omitting Anne Frank's house since we were visiting there the next day). We certainly enjoyed a snack & refreshment afterwards!During our walk of 3 hours (?) we stopped frequently to re-group / take photos & we had coffee! Our tour (& Monique) was that good we arranged to meet again a couple of days later for a slightly "alternative" view of Amsterdam! We met behind Central Station by the ferry before crossing the water to "North Amsterdam". I really enjoyed this rather fleeting visit to see the former dockyard with its submarine / new wave / retro / alternative lifestyle - although it should be said that one or two in our group weren't impressed! The free ferry also gave us some good views of Amsterdam & its architecture from a different perspective. It was then back to Central Station & a tour around the Jordaan area (pity the "hidden" courtyards were closed!).Highly recommended - furthermore, although I can't make a direct comparison, we were glad that we hadn't opted for an organised cycle tour. We knew there would be a lot of bikes but the place is heaving with them! so a group touring round could have been a bit fraught! In any case the touristy parts of the city are close to each other & easily walkable

Engaging and time well spent!. First trip to Amsterdam and booked places on this tour. Monique was the guide, couldn't have asked for a better guide. It took close to 3 hours, well thought out plan to see Amsterdam central. Landmarks were covered and Monique gave away few secrets of the city. Even my 8 year old wasn't bored and was able to recall points of interest later on. It's free but tips are to be given to the guide at the end. It's money and time well spent. Highly recommended!
Great walking tour with monik. Monik is wonderful and funny guide.We very enjoyed the explanations and little stories about the places we toured.Very recommended.

A little gem. On the recommendation of a friend I booked a place on the tour. I was not disappointed. Monique introduced herself as a 16 year resident of the city and this shows in her presentation. A 2.5 hour walking tour that covered all areas of the old city. Her presentation dealt with not only the historic sites but gave background on different features of the city. The free part of the tour is that you are free to decide how much the guide should be paid at the conclusion of the tour. You will not be disappointed.

Pleasant guide :). Monique was our guide for that day, we found her very nice to talk to, we liked her explanation and extra information through private conversations, couldn't ask for more.Super important - bring an umbrella if the weather is not looking good. Also, wear something that you will be comfortable walking for 2.5hours.There are some good fun facts to Amsterdam, enjoy!

The amazing Monique. I would highly recommend this walking tour especially with Monique....she is well informed ,very funny and really gives a feel for the Dutch psyche,Dutch history-especially well handled was the Jewish history of the city which was very moving. Highly recommended as a way to know the city and love it.thanks very much.

Great tour - thanks Monique !. We booked on line for this tour, in advance of our trip to Amsterdam and were not disappointed. Having read the reviews, this seemed to be the one to go for. We had a group of 14, all keen, no problems, everyone kept up and participated, and all gave Monique a healthy tip at the end. She told us lots about the history of the city, and pointed out things of interest as we went round that we certainly would not have spotted ourselves.

Great Tour, Would definitely recommend to a friend. The tour itself picked out some very interesting locations.The little anecdotes on history about the city were really interesting and made me feel like I knew some of the Amsterdam culture in more depth.The brilliant tour guide Monique was very knowledgeable and answered all questions I had. She even took the time to individually speak to everyone in the group and help them plan their time in Amsterdam specifically picking out a few record shops for me.The tour was thoroughly enjoyable and I couldn't have asked for a better guide, I would pay for this kind of tour in the future and cant believe it's free.

Nice tour with lovely people. Our guide Monique was very nice and knew a lot of stuff! The group size was a big + on this tour, as we were only 18 people- this could also be due to low-season though.
I'm a big fan of tip-based tours and we liked this one on particlular!
Great tour. Brilliant tour! Monique was really friendly, informative and answered all our questions. The tour gave a great overview as to how Amsterdam was founded and why it is like it is today.

Great tour and very competent guide Monique. We just had a really exciting and informative tour with Monique. I can recommend this to everyone who want to learn more about Amsterdam. Wear good shoes and bring water😀

Do it! Do it! Do it!. It snowed halfway through our sunny tour but we didn't mind! Guided tour was interesting and informative and brought us all over the city through side streets and along canals, took about two and a half hours including a coffee break. Entertaining and so worth it!

This is the Free Walking Tour to Take!!!. I had decided to take a free walking tour with two different companies when I was in Amsterdam. The one with City Free Tour Amsterdam was by far the best of the two. Our guide, Monique, was very knowledgeable about where she was taking us and even though I'd been to some of the same places the day before, Monique offered much more information about where we were and what we were seeing.I would highly recommend taking the free walking tour with City Free Tour Amsterdam and hopefully you will be lucky enough to have Monique as your guide.

Historical insight, political titbits, cultural delights...and cheese! . Walking tours are easily the best way to learn about a city, and this one was one of the best I've been on. The tour guide, Monique, was both informative and very funny (in that typically dead-pan way of the Dutch). We'd wasted €14 each on one of the dull, tourist-baiting canal cruise tours the previous day. This walking tour, however, proved that Amsterdam is a very interesting and vibrant city after all, and was a brilliant way to spend a couple of hours of an afternoon (not least because you get to visit an AMAZING cheese shop on the way round where you can try a variety of unbelievably delicious Dutch cheeses!). Highly recommended.
great way to know the city. I took the 11am walk tour with Bram,it was informative and fun, he went through beautiful alleys with great stories,highly recomended!

City free tour. Hello everyone :))) I want to say that I am so happy that I went to City Free Tour in Amsterdam, it was amazing experience :)) I am already living here for 1 year, but I learned the most about Amsterdam and Holland within these amazing 2 hours. It's so much worth it. It's amazing opportunity to find out something new and also meet new friends. It was a great adventure and discovery, Monique took us to such places, where I would never find myself, and also the way she tells the story is so interesting. I definitely recommend visiting City Free Tour Amsterdam. 10/10, would visit again :)

Fun tour!. Been to a lot of places but what I always miss is a good tour guide who has decent knowledge about the place.. I was really surprised when I got to know about this free tour concept and I must say the tour was amazing.. The tour guide was very friendly and humorous person herself and made the tour super interesting with all the amazing and funny facts about the city. I could not expect anything more in a 2 hr tour. I highly recommend City free tour for anyone visiting Amsterdam and wish to get the flavor of the city.. Thanks for the amazing tour!
Informativ und sympathisch . Very nice and informative tour with a great guide. Fully recommended for anybody new to Amsterdam but also for peopl the who have been here already.

Great way of getting to know Amsterdam. Really enjoyed the tour! it was very interesting to learn all the facts about Amsterdam. Our guide Monique was very good and it was very interesting to hear the views from the local.Two hours passed very quickly. Would definitely recommend this tour.

Excellent Tour!. This is a perfect way to start a day, and I'd recommend start your Amsterdam visit. It'll give you an excellent foundation for this beautiful city and its rich history. Our guide, Rafael, shared insights that varied across areas, time periods and topics. All in all its a great way to spend 2-3 hours in Amsterdam!

Great tour of the city. I was in town for just a day so I wanted to get a nice overview and see some unique neighborhoods. It ended up just being me on the tour because the weather wasn't so great, so it ended up being a great afternoon. The guide was very knowledgeable and had some really interesting facts about the architecture and history. It was totally worth the 2 hours and was a great intro to the city.

Impressed by a great tour and a very charming leader Britz. January 4th 2015. This was our first time at this kind of tours and we were impressed by the young lady. Her eyes were shying when talking about her country. 2 hours passed quickly, we got very interesting facts and visited beautiful places where we took great pictures! Thank you very much! From Russia with love .

A fun and factual tour of the city centre. I liked the tour very much; Monique is an experienced guide with a warm personality and it was extremely beneficial hearing about historic anecdotes this city had to give.The tour helped me not to look at map to find out where i am, but to orientate based on little excerpts from the tour.We visited most of important cultural and historic places, but what i liked most isn't the factual and dull historical data, but the stories that were following these facts. The other side of the history, so to say.I would also like to point out that the tour lasted longer than average, and this felt like a good bonus.This helped me learn more about the city, canals, its citizen and to share this knowledge back home.I definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in original, fun, but also factual and precise tour of the city core.
Very Interesting!. I live in Amsterdam but I did the tour because I had my friend from the states over and thought it would be fun for him. In the end I think I enjoyed the tour more than he did!

Great experience. This was my first walking tour but my friends had taken some before in other cities and we all loved the tour. It was very interesting and informative we got the places we normally wouldn't have and got to learn some very interesting facts, stories and history. Since we were so excited we had tonnes of questions and our guide was very friendly and patient and provided great answers.We each gave around 10 euros for it.

Amaze-ing Amsterdam. Visiting the city is like being on a miniature golf course, full of mazes and curiosities and, everything is down sized in scale. One thing for certain to is that when you travel there an umbrella is a necessity as it will rain at point on the trip.It is quite easy to get around the city and walking is highly advised and maybe a bike rental for the day.
