The inner square is where the main crowds gather in the hustle bustle day to day activity and is close to main attractions and the circular maze-like streets.. Rijiks museum,and its shiny wooden floors houses a wonderful collection of Dutch masters artists and the awesome larger than life painting of Rembrant's "Night watch" will take one's breath away! Anne Frank huis is also not far and has a lot of memorabilia from WW2 era. One of the best attractions is the Artis zoo, its the oldest in all of Euroland (since 1838)and has quite unique exhibit displays of native and rare specimens. Madurodan a tiny replica of the city in miniature is located some distance from center town is quite a delight for children as well as adults. The outdoor air and light museum surrounded by wind mills is also worth a visit as is the Keukenhof tulip gardens a showy display of all sorts of the gorgeous imperial bulb. Crafts of wood and delft dishware are good buys as well as umbrellas!. One rare yet pleasant sunny afternoon we walked with our child in the comfy stroller all around the city and in no time the fresh air and walk brought on a restful sleep, so we were able to enjoy the city in full, the canals all lit up at night,having a rice table ristafel meal, and walking to the outer river bank and glimpsing the huge North sea in the distance and appreciating just how amazing a tiny city like it can be,indeed.
Great 2hs walking tour. The guide Monique was great, and we made a nice walking tour trough the main highlights of the city!

free city guided tour with Monique on the 5-th of November. The weather was...just a normal Dutch weather for this time of the year, i.e. from time to time rainy. But we hardly noticed such discomfort because the tour was very informative, very cosy with a personal touch of our lovely guide Monique. It was clear that she loves the city where she lives and tried to show the best of HER Amsterdam. The tour was perfectly balanced with information, humor, and respect for the tourists.Highly recommended also due to the small groups

Enjoyable tour of Amsterdam by foot.. Monique our guide for the tour was excellent. We learned so much of Amsterdam's history and culture in the two hours and she made it interesting and fun. A must for all virgin visitors to this wonderful city.

Great city tour of Amsterdam. Our guide was Monique and she did a great job leading our small group of 3 people last Monday.. She told us many interesting things about Amster-dam and I would definitly recomend doing this tour if you are visiting Amsterdam..

Informative and amusing!. Our group had Monique as our tour guide and she was excellent. The group was quite large but she managed to get everyone's attention and keep it. She really made the group gel even though we were all varying ages and nationalities and there was lots of banter going on. Monique had lots of information which she told in an entertaining way, she welcomed questions and certainly made the tour very entertaining. I would highly recommend this tour in Amsterdam and I'll be looking up similar tours in the next city I visit .
crazy Dutch men. Are tour guide was Dutch! he was brilliant it was wet horrible and rainy but he made the tour worth it!

Free walking tour of Amsterdam Central. Bram was our guide and he was brilliant! - funny, easygoing, insightful and helpful. He gave a great introduction to Amsterdam within the allocated time of 2 hours. We went to many great locations, including a secret Catholic church disguised within an appartment complex. He also gave hilarious commentary and background anecdotal stories about the locations we visited and was keen to give advice about things to do after the tour. He was also very easy going on the eye! ;)
Nice Intro to Amsterdam. Monique was great. My family took an approximate 2 hour walking tour of some of the highlights of the city. Highly recommend.

Amazing sights, sounds and little secrets of Amsterdam uncovered. This was our first time visiting Amsterdam and we decided to join a walking tour to get the most of our time. It certainly didn't disappoint. Our guide Monique is an Amsterdamer and is very knowledgeable with good sense of humour. She gave good explanation of the city history, Dutch mentality, architecture, Dutch names and more. She brought us to places only the locals would know. The pace of the walk is just nice and our 2hrs walking with her feels so short. Didn't realised there's so much history and stories behind the city of Amsterdam. Will recommend anyone to Amsterdam to go on a walking tour with Monique. It is pay-as-you-think-what-it's-worth which is totally acceptable and no pressure.

Great tour of Amsterdam!. My mom is in the Netherlands for a short visit, and wanted to see some of my new home country. I'm so glad we chose this particular walking tour of Amsterdam! Our guide, Kim, took us on a fabulous walk, including the city's history and visits to some of the main landmarks. The tour was supposed to be about 2 hours, but ours was longer because of a family whose pace was a bit slower. Kim was very accommodating, and made sure we were all enjoying ourselves.I will definitely be bringing any other visitors who are interested in Amsterdam on this tour!

Free Walking Tour Amsterdam. We are a family of 5 (16 yo, 14 yo, 10 yo) in Amsterdam for only 1 full day. We chose the walking tour based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Arthur was a great guide who gave great tips about avoiding tourist traps whilst enthralling us with fun history of the city and what life is like for him, a local. It went for over 2 hours but we didn't walk far. It would have been great to be able to sit down more as standing for long periods was tough on the kids. The 10 year old tuned in and out but our older 2 children really enjoyed it. We tasted some delicious cheese and saw where all the important places were to go back to after. Highly recommended.

Our amazing tour of Amsterdam. Britt took us on an amazing tour of Amsterdam, she explained the city's history in great depth. We had our 2 little children with us and she made it fun for them as well.Such a fun filled day and we learnt a lot.Keep up the great work Britt! :-)

Fully Reccomend. The Free City Tours are daily from 1100, 1300 and 1500hrs start point is in the main square by the Royal Palace outside the Coffee Shop. Don't worry these guys have very large orange umbrellas you can't miss them - they appear about 20 minutes before start time.When they do go and make yourself known you will get a ticket.The tour guides speak excellent English...ours Sergio had a great sense of humour. The tour itself takes between 2 and 2:5 hrs and is packed with interest.Toilets are available at the start point - the distance walked is not great and there are plenty of rest stops.We learnt about the Royal Palace, the Jirdaan Area, the bridges, canals, houses, traders, maritime history all fascinating.Moving on we discovered Amsterdam's old river routes, how the city was formed and developed - it's Catholic and Protestant history.Sergio took us to the Jewish quarter (although not Ann Franks House) - we were shown pictures and informed of those dark days when hundreds of thousands of Dutch Jews were deported.Next was the old town walls, tax collections, the Cannibis Cafes et al followed by the red-light area..and yes the girls were still working in the morning ! Your guide will take you through the fascinating history of the area.You finish were you began at the Coffee Shop - now the tour is titled "Free" and it is you could just walk away with a thank you....however we gave €15 each other's €10 or 20 it is entirely up to you.The tour was great and we think a must for all visitors to better understand Amsterdam :).

Great tour guide. Our tour guide Sara who was excellent. She was born in the city and it certainly showed with her knowledge. Very informative and funny. Having been with her for 2 hours, we were able to walk around all the different areas and not get lost. No fee but she was grateful for the 20 Euro tip from us.

Great attention. Great tour guide!. The city tour is really interested. I really recommend you to ask for Vannessa as a tour guide, in case you speak english or spanish. She gave us great tips on places to go and how to behave, plus we shared some laughs.

Informative . Loved this tour! I learned so much and was able to get a handle on the area covered ( Dam Square, red light district...) wasn't awkward being solo on the tour. Well organized and tour guide (Josh?) obviously loved the city and was very knowledgeable.

Learn True Culture and History. This trip was one of the best things we did in Amsterdam. I am glad we did it the first day there and suggest it to others as well. Our guide, Monique, was amazing and very knowledgeable. The fact that we understood what each area/building stood for really helped us appreciate the rest of your trip.
Informative, fun, local guide . Had a great morning walking with guide Monique and another small family. The personal touches on the tour added to the experience. Thanks guys!

A great way to get to know Amsterdam better. Amsterdam is full of tourist attractions, and I've found that just wandering around is a great way to get to know the city. However, if you are looking for a guided tour that will let you know a bit more about those crooked narrow buildings and the reason why the opera house does not match the rest of the city, this is a great alternative. The guide is very friendly and tries to make the 2 hour walk really amusing, and you can get to know other tourists while you are it. The tour is free (although they expect a tip for their effort and in the website they suggest something around 10 EUR). I would highly recommend this for people in their first visit to Amsterdam.

Excellent walking tour of the centre of Amsterdam with guide Sergio. This walking tour (2-3 hours) gave an informative and entertaining introduction to Amsterdam. The guide had a very good knowledge of Amsterdam. Many topics were covered: architecture, drugs, history, drainage, tulips, prostitution, free trade, the church.... Some unexpected things were explained!

Amazing day in Amsterdam. Me and my boyfriend had the most awesome day in Amsterdam, with such adorable guide Britt. I've had many tours in several cities the passed year, but none like this one; Such incredible detailed fun stories and fun facts! Britt defenitly kept me interested all tour long, she's super passionate about the history of the city and found a great way of telling the stories and keeping it exciting. A fun detail for exmaple; I loved the fact she sometimes asked us some questions (about a statue for example) -which we never had the right answer to- and then started telling more about the actual answer, it makes you a part of the tour instead of just a listener. It also surprised me how she had clear, fun answers to lots of things I always questioned about Amsterdam, it showed how much she knows the city, not just the tour. We had an amazing and unforgettable day, thanks so much!

Amazing Tour. Monique was a very funny and informative guide who tried her best to give us an original and authentic look on Amsterdam, although it rained quite heavily. We saw various sights, eg. the city hall, the statue of Spinoza, the red light district,.. and heard a lot about the city's history- past and present. Overall very enjoyable and fun!

Great tour, great guide, don't miss out!. Sara was a great guide - very knowledgeable about her home city as well as having a great sense of humour. We were just 3 people and this tour tries to keep groups to 10. We saw others along the way with 30-40 people so were very happy with our choice. I had 2 children (aged 11 and 12) with me and they also throughly enjoyed the walk through Old Amsterdam, learning about the city's history, seeing the Jewish Quarter, red light district, royal palace, spotting wooden and very small house fronts etc. The tour was just over 2 hours, Sara answered all of our questions and even gave us the perfect cafe tip for after the tour (avoiding the tourist-filled side streets of chain stores). THANK YOU!

Tip based small group walking tour. The two plus hour tour was great. Our guide, Sara, was very knowledgeable and had perfect English. (You did not need to spend time trying to figure out what word she was saying, and in the meantime forget what the rest of the point was.) They use a system where you reserve a space at no cost, but because of the system they are able to control the size of the group. When you see the other groups of 30-40 people, you are very happy you are in a group of 10 as we were.

Excellent tour of Amsterdam on foot and you will see it all!. Monique was a very good guide and took us to all major points of the Old Town Amsterdam. She had wonderful and funny stories to tell of history of Amsterdam including why it's called Amsterdam, funny Netherlanders' last names, history of Dam Square and Stopera, why some houses are leaning and why houses have small doors. These are just a few synopsis...you need to take the tour. Lots of good and entertaining information and 2 hours of fun walking around a beautiful city.

Great free walking tour. Monique was very friendly & informative.Her English was impeccable and she knew the city very well.Also the tour covered various aspect of the city- architecture , city growth, history, canals, major icons etc etc.Despite of frequent rains she was never distracted.We both loved the tour

Interesting tour. A really good way to learn more about the city and to find some of the main tourist sites quickly. Some really interesting information. I would recommend it, though I did get the feeling sometimes that the guide got a tad peeved with some of the people in the group. This is unlike any of the other walking tours I've been on in other cities.
Great guide. Tjis is knowledgeable and enthusiastic. We were in Amsterdam for only 3 days and this was an excellent way to get a feel for the city. Definitely recommend.

So good i took it twice. the guides are all different, i took the tour 2 years in a row and loved it both times, and both times it was different. Great for history lovers, getting the lay of the land and having a laugh. although it is free its good manners to tip your guide.

Walking in the sunshine!. Monique guided us on a tour around the central area of Amsterdam, enlightening us on Dutch history and the growth of Amsterdam (Amstel-Damm) to the modern, vibrant city that it is today. This was my second visit to Amsterdam and I am happy to say that it changed my overall opinion of what the city was about. Amsterdam is a city that offers something for everyone. It is progressive and our guide was able to explain to us how the evolution of the Netherlands lends to such forward-thinking. We travelled as a young couple, however, be aware if you are slightly prudish or travelling with children that the tour does take you to various parts of the red light district. However, I believe that these areas are an essential component to understand Amsterdam. Monique was pleasant, open to questions and cheerful throughout the tour.

Interesting and Informative. Monique was an excellent guide with plenty of interesting anecdotes to tell as she led us around the city. The walking was at a leisurely pace with a stop for ice cream as we were lucky enough to have hot sunny weather. There was plenty of opportunity to ask questions and also to take photos. Highly recommended, especially if done at the start of a visit to the city as it orientates you and identifies areas to explore in more depth.

The long history of Amsterdam in a short trip. Monique's talk and conducted walk was excellent. She gave an excellent insight into the history and development of Amsterdam. The weather was wet but she made the city come alive in such a short time. She deserved her tip at the end of the afternoon.

Great 2 hours walking tour in Amsterdam with City free tour. We were a small group of 15 people including children and arranged this tour just few days before arrival. We had just one day. Monique of City free tour has helped us even before arrival, to finalize our plan for a day. After visiting Zaanse Schaans, we met Monique at Heinken Experience and she took us for over two hours into various attraction points , crossing the small bridges, some interesting building structures, and so on. We were really tired as we had just landed in the morning after flying for over 7 hours, and Monique took us to a nice coffee shop and she even said not to worry about the coffee time and she took us all around the city. Great service.

Lovely twisted angel on the city of Amsterdam and its citizens. Most enjoyable 2 hours spend in Amsterdam ever! So nice with a guided tour, that did'nt list up year after year, and then repeated it in 3 more languages! Loved the small anecdotes, giving a twisted angel, but a far better understanding of the city of Amsterdam and its tolerant citizens with their intollerant kamikaze-bikers. On behalf of Nathalie, Daniel and me: A big "Thank You" to Monique!

Close up walking tour of old Amsterdam. Rather then walking around a city we have never visited we took a free walking tour of the old city near the river .It was easy walking and very informative. The guide was great and pointed out many old areas and buildings .We got to stroll thru the red light district in the afternoon. There are over 300 prostitutes sitting in front windows strutting their bodies. If the drapes were closed she was busy. There are cafes on every corner that sell pot with a drink. It, s all legal and I guess closely watched. You could high just stopping at every café and taking a deep breath. There are old taverns that sell many varieties of beer in that area. I was good experience and gave you and ease of mind in a so called seedy area.

Great Tour!!!. We went on an afternoon tour with our guide Monique and had a great time!! She told us about the history of the city as well as showing us many of the central sites. She was engaging and funny, and the other people on the tour were friendly too. Even though it started raining in the middle we had a great time!! It was a great way to get to know the city and very entertaining. Definitely recommended.

Great little walking tour. We had a tour with Tijs. I've been on a few free tours in other cities so knew what to expect, and I have to say this definitely met my (high) bar. A friendly guide, who took us around the main parts of central Amsterdam, with a good slug of history and local knowledge put in. The only thing I felt this tour/guide was lacking a little bit was some of the local knowledge that's useful for tourists - where are his favorite restaurants, any nice cafes / bars / coffee shops or whatever that only the locals know about, etc etc. But definitely worth going to all the same!
Great memories from Amsterdam. Excellent tour. Very informative, with good sense of humor. Must to take this tour first thing in the city, especially if it is a first visit in Amsterdam.

Absolutely Brilliant. Probably better than most tours of Amsterdam, and this one is free! You really learn a lot of information which would be hard to find anywhere online, and you are taken to some areas of the city with secrets and bizarre facts. This really is a must-do if you come to the city. You will not regret it.

A walk through the Amsterdam that I will always remember !!. Tijs: Our tour guide- A person who was humble, happy and hell yeah AWESOME ! Gave us the best trips across Amsterdam on this 2 hour walking journey of the streets of the city. Trickling with History and information, Tijs made Amsterdam an awesome visual treat. If one has not come to Amsterdam just for the weed and the sex, City Free Tour Amsterdam is one of the best methods to explore the city. Just hop on with one of them and they will get you to love Amsterdam !Hi-fives to these people who do it for free and leave it upto you for your contributions. In fact we were a group of 10 Students and we donated around 50€ as a goodwill for the amazing tour ! I wish I could have given him a greater tip but well, hats off again !!

Private free city tour. As our family were the only people that showed up for the tour we had a private tour with Monica (sp?). She was everything you would want in a tour guide. Knowledgable, friendly, funny and easy to talk to. She made only one reference to us paying what we thought the tour was worth and was appreciative of what we gave. Would recommend for anyone. COmpared to the expensive canal tour we took narrated by a recording the night before this was a steal and a great way to see the city!
Excellent experience. I joined this tour at the last second and had a wonderful time! Monique was really friendly and incredibly knowledgable. Fantastic tour!
Loved it!!. Our tour guide Tijs was really friendly and funny! Really nice tour on the city! Shown all the important places of Amsterdam!
Very nice and informative. Our guide Tijs was very competent and friendly! He answered all questions with passion and had a big knowledge of his homecity Amsterdam! Great tour!

Informative and humorous!. We had a very entertaining and humorous walking tour of Amsterdam with Rik who is clearly very passionate about his home town.The customer service started the day before when we tried to first book. We were told that the tour was booked out but that the organisation would get back to us if they decided to run a second tour. Sure enough, Monique called back an hour or so later and confirmed our place on a second tour.The tour started on time with Rik and Tjis dividing up the walkers into two appropriately sized groups of around 15 people in each group.Rik's patter covered everything from history and mythology, to street art and the characteristics of the people of Amsterdam. In particular, he handled the potentially awkward topic of the business in the red-light district with humour and tact. Questions prompted often humorous and witty answers. One thing we have noticed over the years is that some tour groups can be discourteous and crowd out people who are already there; this happened frequently in Berlin when we would be looking at a monument or feature only to have a tour leader walk in, stand in front of us and start on his speech completely ignoring that we were already there. Rik took care to ensure that our tour did not interfere with other groups and individuals. Rik was also good in ensuring the safety of the walkers with regards to avoiding the ever present cyclists of Amsterdam. Ideally this tour is probably best taken on your arrival in Amsterdam. The question of how much to pay for the tour was handled honestly by Rik and basically amounted to what value you gave the tour. He drew comparisons between other tours and the amounts paid for them.People in our group paid between 10-20 Euros per person with the exception of two young female adults who snuck off without paying. Not good form!

Great Tour. We had a great tour of Amsterdam with Rik on Saturday, he was fun, enthusiastic and knowledgeable. There were about 30 on the tour so 2 guides were provided meaning the group size was more manageable and this made the experience more enjoyable than other tours we have done with a large group.The tour started in Waterlooplein in front of the Moses and Aaaron church and finished 2 hours later in Dam Square.

The tour made my day!. We had a tour on rainy and cold Sunday. I can tell that the tour made my day! Now Amsterdam looks as a friendly and positive place to live. Our guide Monique was very friendly and told a lot of interesting facts about Amsterdam. Definitely will recommend to my friends.

If you only have a few hours, this is a great way to see a little bit of everything in Amsterdam. We are big fans of free walking tours, and we typically go with Sandemans New Europe Tours, but went with City Free Tours based on a friend's suggestion. Our guide Tijs, couldn't have been better! He was enthusiastic, friendly, well-spoken and very knowledgable about Amsterdam. The tour took a satisfying path through the city center and hit a lot of highlights, including the Red Light District and lots and lots of canals. There were lots of opportunities for photos, and Tijs was happy to answer any questions we had.

Great free walking tour. My two friends and I were visiting Amsterdam for our first time and we really enjoyed the tour. It's a great way to learn interesting facts and history about the city. Our tour guide was Monique who was so helpful and very informative. I would definitely recommend this tour

Fun tour of Amsterdam. I had a two day layover in Amsterdam and this tour is the best way to get to know the history of Amsterdam. My host Monique was very informative and engaging.I was travelling solo and this trip gave me the opportunity to meet other travellers alike. Thank you city free tour amsterdam!Sam

Charming, educational and entertaining.. I was with my family in Amsterdam and forced my parents and my little brother to join the free walking tour with me, although their english wasn't as good as mine. And it was the best deciscion ever. Our tour guide was Tijs and he had a very clear and good understanding english, also for non-native-speakers, and he was very charming. He told us a lot about the city and if we had more questions he was able to answer all of them. Also he gave us some tips after the tour. It was really worth the time and we were pleased to give him a nice tip for his good work.Thank you very much for the nice time! :)

Great walking tour of Amsterdam. Myself and 4 friends did a walking with Tijs today through Amsterdam. Although the weather looked not so good and it was very cold the tour was still very good.We covered a lot of ground in 2 hours without the tour being too long and boring.Tijs gave a lot of information and was happy to answer any questions.I would recommend this walking tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam for the first time or returning.The walk is free, but tip is expected and deserved.

Great way to star your Saturday in Amsterdam. Our tour guide was Tijs and he is a really enthusiastic guy. The tour started on time at 11 and in the next two hours, he took us around the old part of the city and gave many fun anecdotes and facts about the city. Highly recommended!

My worst experience with free walking tours. I've experienced some walking tours before this, and I have to say this was the worst so far. We were a tour of only 9 people and yet I still couldn't hear my guide as she spoke so weak, and her tone made me really sleepy. Yes, she did provided us with some information and her own view (which I personally find not that interesting nor humorous), but that only saved my opinion from being terrible to poor.

I enjoyed the tour!. Tour was wonderful! It started raining when we were on Red light district, our guide stayed with us in small cafe and then we continued the tour.Because of the bad weather there was a small group of attendees, but good for us, we could hear the guide perfect)

Great introduction to Amsterdam. Really enjoyed this 2 hour walking trip around Central Amsterdam. Monique our guide is friendly and knowledgable, she gave a really good introduction to the city, got a good rapport going with the group and had fun. We enjoyed the afternoon and learnt interesting facts about the city. Definitely recommend this tour.

Well done!. On Saturday, April 25, 2015 we had a 13 hour layover in Amsterdam before flying to Dublin. We decided to take advantage of our brief time in this most interesting City. After reading about the City Free Tour Amsterdam on Trip Advisor, we booked the 'Tip-based Classic Walk' tour a few days ahead online through the company website link and promptly received a confirmation and all the information we needed to meet up with and find the tour, including tips on wearing warm clothing, having some rain protection and good walking shoes. It was a warm, welcoming and professional confirmation letter that was very much appreciated.After a long overseas night flight and arriving in Amsterdam around 6:30 a.m., we ended up having leisurely coffee and exploring the nicely laid out Schiphol Airport for awhile, deposited our carry-on bags at our nearby airport hotel (Radisson Park Plaza) we'd pre-arranged and taxied to Dam Square to meet our tour which assembled around 11:15 a.m. for the 11:30 tour. It was so very tempting to stay and rest at the hotel, but we carried on and are very happy we did.Kim was our very personable and articulate guide and took the time to first have some casual introductions as to where everyone was from. It was a very informative tour and the pace was just perfect. We had a few countries represented in our group of about 15 (+ or -), which was very nice. It was a couple of enjoyable and entertaining hours that seemed to fly by.The City is vibrant and so historically interesting that unless one was visiting for some time, it would be impossible to see all it has to offer in the very short time that we were there. We were thrilled that we could have the opportunity to partake in such a excellent tour that covered so many highlights in a casual, fun and educational way.As we had a special taxi rate arranged through the airport hotel, Kim took the time at the end of the tour to call them for us on her cell phone as well as making restaurant suggestions nearby. The guides work hard (and have fun) and are definitely deserving of their time and enthusiasm in being tipped appropriately.We would highly recommend this great tour for anyone visiting that wants to have a little more insight into the history of the beautiful City of Amsterdam. Thanks, Kim!

First thing to do in Amsterdam!!. Everyday at 11:30am you can find at Beursplein 1 probably one of them best free tour of Amsterdam. The meeting point is very easy to find. The time is not too early and not too late. I would say it is perfect. It is a walking tour and it lasts for around 2 hours, it ends around 14:00pm. It is very funny and the guides know how to engage the people.MAIN ATTRACTIONS:In this tour you will visit the Red Light District, the Chinatown of Amsterdam, the old Jew District, the Nieuwmarkt, the Dam Square and you finish at the Homomonument. You'll pass through different districts and you'll notice the difference between older and newer buildings and how the city is changing.STORY:The story presented by the guide is divided in 3 main periods "so that you won't have to try to remember date you'll forget anyway" :) . And the tour is organized in such a way that you go through each period one after another along the path and you won't get confused. Here a few topics of the different stories: the "horny" sailors, the red light district, Multatuli, the inclined buildings, chinatown, De Waag, the dutch "original" naming method for everything etc...STAFF:Our guide, Sarah, was so nice. She told us a lot of stories about the city, all very interesting. She told us some places to eat something good and also the main events that were going to occur in those days. She even told us how much is an apartment in Amsterdam center per meter square (of course someone asked her). To tell how good was the tour I can say that I still remember almost everything after one week (I already forgot what I ate yesterday!! Just saying).TIPS:Try to ask how to say "88 beautiful canals" in ducth. For a not-dutch person it is almost impossible! :) .You tour is free so you don't have to pay...but the truth is that you'll give money anyway. So here another tip: pay the lunch to your guide :) . You'll pass some more time listening to other stories.I did not follow other tour so I cannot actually compare with others.But for me it still remains a MUST DO experience in Amsterdam.

Excellent free tour of Amsterdam!. Monique was a pleasure to listen to, keeping everyone's interest with stories about the history and events and places that we saw, adding to the experience. I enjoyed how she kept the "secret of the XXX's" until the end so that we would have something to wonder about:-) There was no fee for this tour but we were happy to tip her at the end!

The new face of Amsterdam!. My acquaintance with Amsterdam started over 5 years ago, and back then I read several guide books, and explored the city by walking around a lot on my own. I ended up coming several times later on, and over the years got to know the place pretty well, or so I thought. When I moved to the north of the Netherlands a few months ago, a friend came to visit, and insisted on going on a free walking tour around Amsterdam. I was introduced to a completely new side of A'dam. There are so many small wonderful details which makde the picture of the city I had formed before complete. Many heartful thanks to Monique, our guide! What a great job you're doing, and what an amazingly patient person you are!

Very interesting insight into Amsterdam. Monique was our guide and she was fantastic! She was so friendly, interesting and didn't rush us through our tour of the sights of Amsterdam. The 2 hours plus we spent walking the streets of the city went all too quickly and I am sure everyone in our group would agree that we had a most enjoyable time. The next day we did a canal boat tour and saw many of the sights we saw on our walking tour but from the canal which really complemented our walk.I would not hesitate to recommend this tour as a way of seeing the main sights of Amsterdam. Absolutely well worth 10 Euros each and she even took a group photo en route - a lovely touch! Please do this tour and support these enterprising people - I am sure you will not be disappointed!

"'An interesting insight tour of Amsterdam with a touch of fun"". An easy and practical way to discover Amsterdam city culture and history,where you give a tip to tour guide according to your satisfaction and we were really satisfied!A tour guided by a real Dutch guide (Tijes?) giving a local perspective of the city life.We 'trip' advise you to do it!

Enjoyable Tour. I saw this listed on the internet prior to leaving home and easily found the departure point near the Royal Palace in Dam Square. The young man who conducted the tour was friendly and informative although the pace of the tour did make it a little difficult to get good photos. It was certainly worth doing.

An absolutely MUST. Together with a couchsurfer we joined the tourguide Monique and a dozen other peoplefrom 4 different countries. Monique told me - a Dutch guy who knóws about A'dam - many new facts & stories which I've enjoyed until the last minute. Allthough Monique didn't ask for financial support before and afterwards, we were glad to donate her 10 euros each.Keep 't up CFTA and thanks again.
A fun, informative tour. We spent an enjoyable afternoon with City Free Tour. The tour is enjoyable and relaxed, and the tour guide made us feel very welcome. Highly recommended!

Would highly recommend!. We joined the afternoon City FreeTour lead by Bram at the very last second having missed maybe the first few minutes.We liked the tour very much and would highly recommend it to anybody who wants to get around the sightseeing highlights of Amsterdam town centre. It was informative without being to heavy.the information was delivered yet delivered in a witty and informal way.Bram was knowledgable and able to answer all additional questions .We had our 11y old daughter on the tour with us and she found it very interesting.Bram was very considered and gave us a tactful warning before taking the group to the Red Light District.Great stuff:)As for the donations -they are all at your personal discretion but I think people of our group were quite generous and this reflects their overall satisfaction .

Fascinating insights!. I was looking for an informative tour that I could take before leaving Amsterdam. And I am really glad that I joined this tour as it gave me a different perspective to the buildings and story of the city. I forgot the name of the guide (sorry), Thye I think, brought us around streets that I wouldn't have known to explore and shared with us interesting stories. Thank you for the tour, really enjoyed the walk!

Definitely must try!. I took the one with history knowledge about the city. It was my first time experience using this tour and it was definitely a great experience. I get to know and understand the city a to better. It also helped me understand why some buildings are there and why they are how they look like right now. definitely a worth knowledgeable experience!
Excellent whistlestop tour of the city - plus its free!. Great guide and v.informative and friendly for all ages. Good if you are only passing through the city!

Great overview. Loved our walking tour! Did it on our first day in Amsterdam to get an idea of the city and note the big attractions we would want to go back to. We were super appreciative of the information our guide was able to provide. We learned so many bits and pieces about Amsterdam that you can't get from a guide book. This tour is run by "tips" so please do show your guide your appreciation because after all they give you their time, answer your questions and share invaluable inside stories with you. We sadly saw a few people sheepishly slide away when the guide stated how they work off tips. We continued to do these walking tours in cities all over Europe throughout our trip

Nice way to see a bit of Amsterdam. Was a terrible day for a tour really since it was cold and rained all day. To top it off our Irish-origin guide had a bad throat. I know it's a free tour and I'd be rude to comment but the fact is that the tour guide seemed quite tired and bored from doing the same thing for God knows how long now or maybe it was just his sore throat. The tour overall was pretty informative and picked up towards the end when we were near the Anne Frank house. I would recommend it if its your first time to Amsterdam and you want some interesting information on the place.

Just Right!. Tijs was a great tour guide--friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the history and flavor of Amsterdam. The tour was the right length (hour and a half or so) and included great background info as well as interesting tidbits that you wouldn't get elsewhere. I liked his theme of explaining the "DNA of Amsterdam." I felt that I got to know the city much better and I wish we had been able to do it a little earlier in the week! While most people tipped well, I also got the feeling that the tour guides here really do this because they enjoy it!!

Wonderful!. We participated in a free 3-hour walking tour of Amsterdam. It was me (age 54), my daughter (age 18) and a cousin (age 24). We all loved it. It was supposed to be the marijuana highlights. I was leery. But our tour guide was incredibly smart. He answered every question thoughtfully. And he made multiple suggestions on other things we would enjoy.

excellent!. This tour was one of the best I've ever been on! Monique (spelling??) was a great tour guide. She gave us a great history of the city and cracked some jokes along the way as well! This was a great learning experience for me, and I recommend it to anyone who has never been in Amsterdam before!

Why not. A tour that was guided by a local guide, friendly, answering every question that was asked. Still, it felt like a basic tour, not very personal or individual, nothing special. Our group of 8 was split up, the other half of the group was way more satisfied. Apparently it depends strongly on which guide will tour you around.

Excellent intro to city. This was an excellent introduction to Amsterdam. Our guide, Tijs, added historical and cultural background that made the cityscape come to life, and took us to some scenic backstreets that I wouldn't have found on my own. The distance, pace, and route were all good. The company is good about keeping groups to about 20 people max (about the largest group that works well with this walking tour format) -- if they get more people than that, they bring in another guide and form an additional group. (Note that while there's no fee for the tour, you should plan on tipping the guide.)
A great way to see the city. We loved it. It was the right level of homour, the right leel of history, the right length and our guide did a fab job keeping us altogether and engaged.

walk amsterdam. In early Nov '14 we scheduled walking tour with city free tour in Amsterdam. Day was cool and cloudy but the tour was excellent. Led by Monique we were provided with considerable information on attractions and the city itself. The group consisted of about fifteen people and we could hear her clearly at all times. No fee was required but we did provide a tip.Thank you Monique!!
Great Tour. Great introduction to Amsterdam's city center, history and architecture. I highly recommend doing this on your first day there. The guides are friendly and entertaining.

Great intro to Amsterdam!. Had a fantastic morning walk with our guide Rafael, he was very friendly and knowledgeable. The tour covered off most of the sights we wanted to know more about in the city centre and gave us a good lay of the land. Love that it was free (but tips are expected), would definitely recommend to anyone!

Really worth it!. I really recommend this tour if you are interested about getting information about Amsterdam.The guides are funny and interesting, they make the tour very funny and they tell you a lotof funny stories about the city.If you don´t mind walking you should really try this kind of tour!!!

Always a useful starting point to any city. I love these tours because you always know that you are going to get value for money. We did the classic tour taking in a fair chunk of the sites and came away with a good understanding of what we wanted to do next and how to get there. Our guide was both informative and amusing and luckily about 6 foot 6, which was a bonus when it came to the busier streets. The group wasn't too big so everyone could hear and there was a good mix of ages and nationalities. Online booking is expected, but there was a couple who hadn't booked that came along.

Very informative tour. We had a nice walk, with a lot of relevant information about Amsterdam and Netherlands.
We enjoyed! Thanks!

Interesting and Informative. We booked this online before we went and because it was free we didn't expect much. How wrong were we. Obviously you have to like walking. We were given information about Amsterdam going back hundreds of years. We were taken to places we had not heard of e.g The Church In The Attic. We were given advice on how much we should pay for things and were the best coffee shops and cheese shops are. We were not sold anything. Its advice you can take or leave. We walked around with people from all over the world and we all got chatting. At the end of the walk (which was about 2hrs) you pay your guide what you think the tour is worth and there is no pressure to pay anything. All of the people on our tour gladly paid. It also helps you get your bearings if your a first time visitor to the city. We have decided that we will look for these tours whenever we go on a city break.

Excellent introduction to Amsterdam . Monique was our guide and gave us an excellent and humorous introduction to Amsterdam including its rich history. Tour is absolutely free and tip based with booking essential online.

Great introduction to Amsterdam. We did the Amsterdam Free tour with Tijs on Friday 3rd October. I was initially concerned at the large number of attendees, so was pleased when we were split into two groups of approx. 15. Tijs is a native of Amsterdam, and clearly knows the city well. His spoken English is very good and he was very approachable throughout the afternoon. The tour was a combination of the more obvious landmarks (e.g. Dam Square, the Red Light district), but also took in some less known locations that could easily be overlooked by the independent traveller. Tijs' commentary was an interesting blend of history and current issues, which certainly brought the city to life. I'd definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wants to find their feet in Amsterdam.

Great visit of the red light district, plenty of information given all in spanish or english!!!!. Great visit of this area with a guide called " Garran", he really give us a lot of information and show us around the area, he was talking in spanish or english.He explained us also some of the history of the city, really i would advise it to everybody as they are doing the same that the paying city tour and with this one you can give whatever you want.The day they are showing the city and the night the red light district, honnestly don't waste your time and your money with the other companies that are asking a lot of money for exactly the same.

Great tours!!. Michael was a great tour guide. We went for 2 tours (Amsterdam and the Red light district tour) with him, and both were very interesting and fun, and Michael was a great tour guide with a lot of knowledge and good sense of humor (great to look at too...)Thanks a lot! It was worth every dime!Adi from Israel

Cori and Javier are amazing! (Spanish tours). We went on the city tour with Cori and on the Red Light District tour with Javier and had a wonderful time. They were funny and very well prepared. Just the kind of people you want to hang out with while in Amsterdam. Both tours are a must!!!

Walking tour Amsterdam. Amazing! We knew very little about the history of Amsterdam and we had this incredible local girl who explained so much, and with heaps of humour. Even though it was free we ended up tipping heaps (AU$) because she was just so funny and informative. Highly recommended.

Awesome Walking Tour of Amsterdam. We lucked out by joining this tour today. Onno was a very informative tour guide who told the history of this beautiful city with a passion and a great sense of humor. It was a very large group but he patiently waited for everyone and answered questions thoroughly. Along with the terrific weather it was a great day.

Great tour with a friendly guide. We really enjoyed our tour. A quick introduction to Amsterdam, and a bit about the local history. I always recommend these tours for people arriving in a new city. This was my 2nd time to Amsterdam, but I still found it very informative.

Very informative. I did this tour with my friends on 22nd Sept. Ono was really a fantastic duide in fact the best I have come across. Recommended for all coming to Amsterdam
Andrew Rogers Dsouza
Goa India

Thank you Monique!. We booked this tour because of our prior positive experience, we had a few years ago, with City Free Tour in Paris! :)Monique is very knowledgeable about Amsterdam. She guided us throughout a pretty extended area of the city. She made the tour interesting and fun without rushing us.It was the perfect introduction to the city.We recommend this tour with no hesitation!Thank you Monique for enlightening us about this great Dutch city!

very nice walk excelant guide. We booked this tour for our first day in Amsterdam. the group was small and we started right on time. Monique the tour guide speaks very good English. we walked for two hours, and Monique explained us the sites we see on one hand and the spirit of Amsterdam on the other hand. it was a very good start for our vacation!!!

Thanks Monique!. We enjoyed our free city tour very much. Monique, in her quiet and capable manner, walked us through the streets of Amsterdam and we saw so much in our walk. Later we tried to trace where we had been on a map and realized we had covered quite a lot of area. Monique always waited for everyone to group around before she started her talk. She walked at a reasonable pace and kept making sure everyone was present so no one was lost. We learned many interesting facts about the city of Amsterdam. Monique works on tips so please remember to tip her at the last stop. Thanks again, Monique! You did a great job introducing us to your city.

Amsterdam. Recently took the tour and its was excellent. No rush, very nice funny tour guide who showed us loads of interesting sites and informed us of the history of Amsterdam without being boring or tedious as these things can be sometimes. Would reccommend using this company and will definately use them again should we ever do another city break

Great Intro to the City. Monique was a knowledgable guide with a sense of humor that we enjoyed. We also appreciated our walk and her talk...it is always the small details and anecdotes that add pleasure to a tour like this. Almost like you are in on some of the city's secrets...I admired the gracious way she managed people who tried to join the tour as it progressed.We highly recommend taking this tour, particularly if you are a first time visitor to Amsterdam. Thank you, Monique for not rushing us...we also enjoyed the extra time you spent with us.
Nice tour (tips based). Nice and interested info to discover the city with a local guide :)We were three friends from Spain and we enjoyed a lot. Totally recommended
.. Worth emailling a couple of days in advance if you have the time, just to check everything is still going ahead.

Really great tour, helps you get your bearings of the city . I went on one of the Amsterdam walking tours as soon as I arrived in the city, and I am so glad I did because it really helped me understand the lay out of the city, as well as learning a lot of Amsterdam's history. I think it is very easy to visit Amsterdam and just see it for the coffee shops and red light district, but there is so much more to it than that and this tour shows that. Can't remember the name of our tour guide, but she was really knowledgeable about the city, as well as being interesting and engaging to listen to. Really high quality tour and couldn't recommend it enough!

Interesting. Monique was very nice and provided a lot of information about the city that helped us understand how it got to be what it is today. Definitely worth doing if you're in town and interested in the historical to present day perspective of the city.

One one the best tours. Amsterdam tour was definitely the best I've done, is very informative, explains many things of culture and its sights in addition to being a very complete and entertaining tour. recommend to all

Great tour, will come again. Great tour that was guided by Monique. Monique has a lot of knowledge about Amsterdam, and she is willing to share her knowledge and love to the city. I'm looking forward to visit again, and to book to the Jewish Quarter tour.

do it on your first day - discover all details. "free tour" always sounds good - but because its free we did not expect a high-class tour. We were surprised in a positive way because our guide was great and even though we walked for a long time it did not get boring. We gave her tips because she really entertained us.
Great tour!. A must undertake tour for an informed explanation on the history of Amsterdam by a local. Although the tour groups are a bit too large, the explanations provided were clear.

First rate tour and lovely experience. I visited Amsterdam for a couple of days and took this tour with the lovely guide, Monique. It was a great experience and very informative. I have actually lived in Amsterdam in the past, but during this tour I got to know so much about the city that I didn't know before.The ambiance was also super nice. At first we were a lot of people, but then our guide decided to split up the tour so that we went in two smaller groups. That way it felt rather intimate and it was easy to walk up and ask the guide a question during the tour. She took the time to answer, and I really enjoyed that. I learned a lot and I felt I made new friends during the tour. Thank you!

Great tour and guide but too many people. Monique is a lovely, informed Amsterdam ambassador. We enjoyed the content of the tour but felt that the group was way too large (over 30 people). The pace was slow and Monique had to spend time bringing late-comers up to speed. I imagine that it is difficult to set a cap on the number of attendees for a free tour - so, I guess you get what you get. Still, I would recommend the tour to all travellers. Hopefully your group size will be a bit smaller.
nice visit. Good city tour with some interesting explanation.tour guide was very interesting, unfortunately speaking a bit too fast sometimes.

Great tour!. This free walking tour was awesome! Monique, our guide showed us very interesting parts of the city, not only the typical tourist places. I've learnt a lot about Amsterdam and its history and even though it was terribly hot she still kept the group engaged. Do not miss it!

Fantastic tour!. We went on this tour and it almost felt like a private group. There were only 2 other people taking part in it aside from us which meant that we were able to really go at our own pace and ask lots of questions along the way. Our tour guide (I think his name was Tijs) was fantastic, friendly and super knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend this tour!

Really nice and informative. We were guided by a portuguese guy. He was really nice and knew a lot about Amsterdam. I liked how he combined the historical facts and the consequences in the modern society of the Amsterdam. I can only recommend this tour. Thanks

Very Professional Guide!. I booked online same day and got a prompt and friendly confirmation answer. It had precise information about the tour, meeting indications and the following notes:" - We never miss a tour.- To start on time, please be there 5 minutes earlier.- Weather is always uncertain, so bring protection if it rains"In fact, was very rainy. But, I decided to go according to the instructions.Monique was on time, and we waited for others persons but they didn't show up on time.Since it was just me in the tour, I left the door open to Monique to cancel the tour, because I thought it might not be worth for her to do a tour for a single person. However, She wanted to do start the tour ( Private tour only for myself, very lucky!).After a few minutes she noticed a missed call on her mobile and called back, she was concerned because some others arrived meeting point after our departure.Very professional attitude!Tour was excellent, it had an overview of Amsterdam's history, architecture, art... All information was well layout and given with the best attitude ( and patience because my English level).I've written this review after finished a trip to 15 European cities and have done various "city tours" in many of them. But, undoubtedly this has been the best.Thank you very much Monique!

Thank you, Monique!. We really enjoyed our walking tour of Amsterdam. Our guide, Monique really helped bring the city to life, as if it needed that! We loved Amsterdam, way beyond our expectations. Recommend it to everyone.

A must do!. Enjoyed out walk, meeting point worked out very well, walk was extremely informative. We had Monique and you can really tell she loves her city. We had been in the city a couple of days already and had gained bits and pieces of info. However, she gave you the heart of the information as well as improving our bearings.Well worth doing and very happy to give her compensation for her time and energy!

Excellent walking tour. we really enjoyed our guided walk with Monique .there was the right mix of information and explanation about the city and the people who live there both now and in the past .would highly recommend it .

A must. As it was our second trip to Amsterdam, we had the basic awareness of what is what. This tour helped us to get to know details of mostly the important places. The 2hr walk was not tiresome because of the guide who tried explaining everything clearly. It's a must for first timers. Best way to know more about this awesome city!

Excellent orientation to Amsterdam. This is a must for first timers to Amsterdam as it covers a little bit of everything - history, culture, architecture and interesting facts. Local knowledge of lane ways, pedestrian walkways, car free bridges enables the guide to cover a lot in a short time. Just watch out for bikes - they are everywhere and riders expect right of way. Our guide, accompanied by Monique was very professional and had many quirky stories to tell making the tour even more interesting. Definitely recommend this tour.
Fun and educational tour. This tour was a great way to see different sites around Amsterdam and learn about it's history and some interesting facts. Monique was a knowledgeable and friendly guide.

A must for your first time in Amsterdam.. A great way to be introduced to this fantastic city. Monique was our tour guide and she made it very enjoyable and told us quite a few things we never knew about the city. We also got to briefly walk through the red light district which I felt a bit more comfortable doing whilst in a group! Definitely do this if it's your first time visiting the city.

A good introduction :). A nice little tour of the the city of Amsterdam focusing on its rich history. Did learn about some of the dark history of the Netherlands, our guide was excellent and presented things in a refined and balanced way :)Our group was large but they do try and keep it to less than 20 to maintain the quality of the tour, they say. I did reserve a place using their website. They function on tip based system and it is generally recommend 10 euros per person (what was in my email)It was well worth my two hours :)

DAMazing... and FREE!. I booked this city free tour online about 5 days before going to Amsterdam, for 3 people. Replies were friendly and prompt.The tour itself- took in all the major sights and boroughs of the Dam. Tour guide was personable, friendly, very knowledgeable about the city and clearly in love with it! She provided many interesting facts about the city and kept all three of us interested for the entire tour. The tour was paced well, and didn't feel boring or rushed at any point.I went with a friend who has been living in the dam for 8 weeks; she has been on the bus and canal tour, and says this tour was the best of all!Well done city tours and thanks for a great introduction to an awesome city!

Nice overview walk around town!. I should have done this tour first instead of the mob tour on the bus. Monique did a very nice job explaining everything to us during this (free- tip based) two hour walking tour. It was not at all hurried nor were you talked down to as in some I've attended. Monique tried to put you into the flavor and attitude of the city. Her English was very adequate, we began in the Jewish section and ended up at the Royal Palace. Ask her for restaurant recommendations too!

Excellent tour. Monique was our guide. She was very informative and told us very interesting stories. Her knowledge of both history and culture is excellent, she is truly fluent in English, and we went to both the typical tourist sites as well as not as typical.Beside this, thank Monique we spent an excellent new years eve in an Amsterdam house. I highly recommend to take this awesome and also cheap tour.

The Best way to see Amsterdam for 2 hours. Monique was our guide, and she led me and my colleagues around Amsterdam. She told us about the historical facts, about the monuments, architecture, interesting things to see around, and even some tips for later on. It was overall a nice walk around the city and very informative. It was a very pleasant tour, and I would be happy to recommend it to anyone who is visiting the city for the first time for a short insight!

The nicest way to visit Amsterdam. The first time I see Amsterdam from the citizen point of view. Absolutely a must for the people that is visiting Amsterdam for the first time, but even a good occasion to discover the city for the people that have already been here. Monique, our guide, has been very kind and informative, with a very fluent and understandable english. History, facts, curiosities about the city, the best that you can get in two hours. And the tip was absolutely deserved.

Super Awesome Tour!. This tour was absolutely fantastic! It was super cheap (free! But the best thing to do is tip at the end although it's not required) Lee was our tour guide. She spoke excellent English and had really informative AND really interesting stories to tell. I would recommend doing it first on your trip because you can get some great ideas of places you'd like to visit. The tour took just over 3 hours with pretty relaxed walking and covered I think almost all of the older city. We went on a busy Saturday in a full tour (40 people) and they mentioned that you can reserve spots online because if you get there and all the spots are taken up then you're out of luck.

Great informative walk. Had Monique for our guide and she did a great job taking us through the city and telling us informative and historical facts about the places we'd walk through. It was a perfect amount of time (2 hour walk), and the meeting location was easy to find. I would recommend this walk to anyone visiting Amsterdam as a nice introduction to the city to get a feel about where things are because once you go through the city, it's small enough that you can roam around comfortably. With the tour, the benefit is is that things will look familiar and you won't be reliant with a map.
Geert was a fantastic guide. Super enjoyed the tour thanks to Geert. Our guide was well spoken, told nice jokes, was able to give us a fun time

Great tour! Don't miss it!. First thing's first, it is not free. but it is the fairest way to see the city. You decide what to pay at the end of the trip, but I have no doubt that anyone (who is not a total duch) will enjoy the trip!The guides are dedicated, young and fluent, and they make this tour an amazing experience.See all the major sights and get all the information: The history of the city rolled-up and served in short, interesting, and fun bits!Do yourself a huge favor, take this trip ASAP when getting into the city. It will set you up for a great stay and help you decide what sides of the city you wish to dive deeper into.A MUST!!!
New Amsterdam free walking tour was great.. This was a great way to see the city and learn a bit about its making. Our tour guide Geert was great. A must do for amsterdam.

Informal and informative. Thanks to Monique for an enjoyable tour of Amsterdam. This was my first city walking tour but definitely won't be my last. A good way to see the city from a local's perspective and uncover some insights you don't get from the guide books.

Great start to my trip. After arriving in the hague, I decided to go on this walking tour Amsterdam as I didn't have a lot of time. I took the tram and met up with our tour guide outside the flea market (got some well priced souvenirs here) and off we went. The tour is about 3 hours and it was very comprehensive and great. The only thing I noticed was that we didn't stop by the Anne Frank Huis (this was the day after). I didn't actually notice during the tour because we covered so much in that short period of time. I was able to walk around Amsterdam on my own and find my way around easily. Very colourful stories from our tour guide. Tipping is optional but appreciated. I'd do this tour again if I'm in Amsterdam.

Best way to see Amsterdam. Monique was our guide for this tour. Really sweet, knowledgable and willing to answer questions. Read a lot about Amsterdam before but I learnt even more through her. Well worth the 2 hour investment

Tourific!. Who said nothing in life is free?! Obviously they have never gone on this fantastic guided tour through the city of Amsterdam. You would think that it would be short and not very informative but this is not the case as you could clearly see that our guide (Kendra) really loves the city and this came across through a in depth, passionate guide through the history and modern day Amsterdam. I advise you to do this as soon as you arrive as you can then pick out key points of interest that you can come back and visit at your own leisure. The tour guide doesn't get paid for what they do instead working on a tips basis but they do not badger you at any point for money purely doing it for the love of the job!

Excellent introduction to Amsterdam. The free walk tour is good in its own way. It is not very long so it ends just before everyone got tired. The tour covers most old town sights, and the guide really knows the town. And if you ask him, he will tell you many more. If you are running low on time, or just need a brief introduction to the City before you dive in, this is an excellent choice. As contained in the notice - weather can be unpredictable - bad weather can ruin some fun, especially when it comes to windy winter rain. So perhaps choose this attraction in a different season will enhance the experience.

Your guide to the real Amsterdam. As the title goes, it indeed is your GUIDE to the real Amsterdam... discover the little bits and pieces and small pieces of information that could make your trip truly memorable... Having done their tours in Paris, we weren't going to miss it in Amsterdam and we loved every second of the walk...All the lovely places they take you through and the information they impart that aside, their walks provide ample opportunity for that lovely click (for all photography enthusiasts) that's got the potential to make your trip extra special.All in all, something that you shouldn't miss!!

Not to be missed!. I am so grateful I did this tour in the beginning of my stay. It not only made me much more comfortable wandering around on my own, but I learned so much about the history of this city. Our tour took 31/2 hours and our tour guide Mark (with the orange Pom Pom) was The Best! The tour is free but you can tip the guides at the end if you enjoyed the tour (and you will). There is also the option of 2 separate paid tours (12 euros each) which I also recommend. One is of the Red Light District, the other is the Coffee House tour. Both are very interesting, and educational.

Can't be beat ! Free walking tours.. The tours leave from Dam Square and they are free !!! Very well organized and fun. I think they leave about 11:15 AM 1:15 every day. They really are free. You can contribute at the end if you wish. The 10 Euro I gave was a great deal when you consider the price for tours. The same group that does the free day tours also does tours you can pay for. The Red Light District tour is an example.

Amsterdam walking tour is great. Amsterdam walking tour with guide Mark Law was outstanding. Provided historical, cultural, and political stories which made me feel a lot more knowledgable about Amsterdam than the standard boat or bus tours. A great way to be active, outdoors, and entertained, all while paying only what you think it is worth.

Free and Fabulous. Our tour guide, Bastiaan, provided us with 3 hours of interesting information about the history of Amsterdam, including commentary about the red light district, the large church adjacent to that area, and the availability of marijuana in the numerous coffee houses. He shared his views of many of the attractions, including the marvelous Anne Frank House, answered all questions, and kept us moving for 3 hours. We also had a rest stop with free cheese, and a "potty" stop part way through the tour. Please do give your guide a generous tip (if you feel the tour was a worthwhile experience) because that is all these guides earn.

Amsterdam Walking Tour. Really great value for money (it costs nothing - other than what you are willing to tip). You learn a great deal about the city in 3 hours from a knowledgeable and entertaining guide. My guide, Paul Russell, was great. Funny, intelligent and obliging - He even gave everyone on the tour with me free cheese samples.

Amsterdam easy and funny by an expert guide. WE would like to thank you for the nice and so interesting FREETOUR experience in Amsterdam. I was in Amsterdam few years ago for 2 times and I read so many information on this city but Monique gave us so many news : very difficult to remember everything . She was really able to give us in a funny way so many historical advices about many things and famous artists. Of course this is an experience that we will advert to all our friends who are coming in the city. Monique had anything less than a professional guide. When somebody has the passion doing something you can feel his mood and his behavior even from his words. That is way all the information given by “your young guide” will be kept in our “life luggage” with care. Maybe one day I can teach the same information to my children.Thank you and see you again, maybe in Italy or around this small planet.

Excellent. Very worth while on your first day in Amsterdam. Apart from a beautiful walk through a beautiful city with a very lovely informative guide, I met some fellow travel let's who recommended other places to visit! A great orientation of the city.

Amsterdam free walking tour. We did this tour with Julian who was extremely knowledgable, entertaining and generous with helpful tips and information. He kept a large group of people from many different countries entertained for hours. We would highly recommend this tour as soon as you arrive in Amsterdam.

excellent. We did the tour with Irishman David. He was very knowledgeable and had lived in the city for many years. Took us all over the place, from the red light district, to the canals, the Jordaan etc. He recommended which museums to visit and places we should explore further. We walked for 3 hours and found the experience wonderful. Try and do it at the beginning of your stay to get an idea of the city. They do this for free so tip afterwards. We gave him 20 euro.

Worth doing!. We had a lovely Aussie girl (Rachel) take our tour and, having only lived here for 4 months, she was great! Very knowledgeable and funny. Plus, you get to decide what the tour is worth so you don't have anything to lose.
Informative, friendly ,easy and free. fabulous tour!! I was hesitant as I have an injured knee but there are many breaks and the walk itself although extensive covers a relatively small area.

Friendly tour with some beginner issues. We attended this tour in july. We had pre booked through their web page. We received information that the tour would be given by new guides under training. We met up outside the Moses and Aron church where the tur start. It was a little hard to spot our guide since she didn't wore any badge or sign to tell she was a guide from City free tours. This was one of the first tour she had. Polite and friendly, but obviously still under training. I have no dont that the tour will be great after a period of training, but for now the quality was above average. We received little information about the different sites, and thus the sites picked out seemed less interesting. The whole tour takes 1,45 minutes. Reading other reviews it is obviously our tour suffered from the lack of a properly trained guide, but I still give it average since we where noted that we would have a new guide. And she was very friendly and will probably be a great guide after a while. The tour is free, but you still end up giving tip close to what other companies would take. Or at least we do.
amsterdam free tour review. We had a realy good historic and global picture of Amsterdam. Many thanks to this iniciative. Dont forget to book it in advance.

4 Friends Traveling - Highly Recommend This Tour. I think it's important to know that we were 4 50+ friends traveling together for the week with the trip starting in Brussels and ending in Amsterdam. With that said, we all have different wants, needs and energy levels. We came upon City Free and couldn't have been more pleased. Raphael, our leader, arrived promptly and was most informative. We had all done a lot of walking tours and what was especially great was that he was willing to deviate if there was something more specific we were interested in. Perhaps, even better was that if there was a monument and/or subject he was not aware of, he told. us. If I recall we booked Raphael for 3 hours, which for us was perfect. We got to experience the public transportation, walking throughout many districts so we knew where we wanted to return to. I also think Raphael could adjust the tour to any age group so don't let the fact that we might have been a little on the slow walking side deter you. Raphael made up in energy, gently pushing us along.Go to Amsterdam! Tour with City Free! We had a great time.

A must-do in Amsterdam!. This was a great way to be introduced to the city. Our guide, Mattie, a dual Canadian and Dutch citizen, was knowledgable and funny. She even got us free cheese samples at Repanaer. A number of people went for lunch with her afterwards. Even the others on the tour were super friendly. We had fun and learned a lot.These guides work only for tips, but Mattie certainly earned one.

Very interesting tour. The tour guides work for tips so naturally they try their best to be informative and entertaining. I found the tour to be very informative, lots of amusing and enlightening stories about Amsterdam which I couldn't wait to share with people back home. I really recommend this tour as a great way to get oriented and learn more abut the city, it really helps you appreciate Amsterdam.The tours meet at 11am and 1pm every day in the dam square right near the big pillar statue, just look for people holding red signs. Also, don't book online, it is quite unnecessary and a waste of the 3euro booking fee in my opinion.

Highly recommendable. I have done today the free tour in Amsterdam for Spanish speakers and I discovered a different Amsterdam than the one I know! Nice tour, interesting tips, surprising stories! I highly recommend this trip to everyone that wants to go a bit deeper into the Dutch society! Thanks Jaco for these 3 pleasant hours today!

Best free tour I have been on!. I have been on quite a few of these tours throughout Europe. I was feeling quite under the weather on my only weekend in Amsterdam. I wanted to see the city, but did not have much energy to seek things out on my own. This was the perfect way to get a flavor of the entire place! I am so happy that I went on it. I discovered many new things I probably would not have learned about this city otherwise. The guide was awesome. He was from Ireland, but very knowledgeable about the city that he now calls home. I recommend this tour to anyone starting out their trip in Amsterdam! You will not be disappointed!

Informative, effective, and entertaining!. I'm very glad I went on this tour!! The tour guide was very knowledgable, was open to questions, and the tour was fascinating. I learned way more than I would have in any guide book or website because of the interactive manner of the tour. Highly Recommended!!

Funny and informative!. I thoroughly enjoyed this tour. Our guide, Kendra, was simply wonderful. Her quirky sense of humour and great knowledge of the city made her the perfect person to show us around. If ever she gives up showing people the delights of the city, she could take to stand up comedy. The tour gives one a good sense of the city's origins, its current customs and a decent idea of what Amsterdam is all about. I'd highly recommend this tour. We followed it up with the Red Light District tour which was informative and respectful and well worth doing.

great tour!. This tour was one of the best i have ever done, the guide really told us alot of the history and everything you could possible want to know about amsterdam, they dont hold back with any of the information! it was a fun, intresting tour. I personally loved every second of it, it was also really great that in the end you can decide to go back to the cafe that he recommends!

To get a proper feel of Amsterdam do the tour!. This was mine and my partners 3rd time in the Dam and we had never done a proper guided tour before. We decided to have a go with the tour as it looked good on the leaflet and we went to the city center thinking we would receive a beige talk, We were so so so wrong! We had Ged as a guide who really told the tale of the beautiful city, he brought the history alive and also gave you a better understanding of the amazing cities driving power! I recommend the tour highly out of all of the things that I did in Amsterdam this tour was well worth the walk and the 3 hours that your taken on the journey. Ged really loves this city and that is translated in his guided tour, he really does make you feel like you too are part of this wonderful tale. Please Please go, if your low on funds and cant afford the other pepper expensive attractions DO THIS TOUR, if not for the wealth of knowledge, do it to understand the pepper reference!!

The best way to discover Amsterdam. This has been a second free tour that I have taken and it was great! Our guide was very funny and had much information to give away, I have learnt a lot about Amsterdam by taking this tour. I really recommend it!

Excellent Day in Amsterdam. We are from Puerto Rico and travel for a weekend to Amsterdam...we made the Free Tour in Amsterdam by a colombian guy named Jaco...very professional and know every detail of the city. Very helpful in his tips to find nice place to eat and have fun. I recomended 100 %.

Ged gives a fascinating tour. If your going to Amsterdam, I warmly recommend the free (though tips are welcome) city tour given by the tour guide Ged.It's a bit long (it take 3 hours) but it never stops being interesing. So if you really want to know the city and it's fascinating history, his tour is the best place to start!

Great free walking tour. My wife and I went on the free Classic Walk tour in Amsterdam. There was a bit of a communication error regarding where to meet, but once we met with our guide Steije we had a great time. Our guide had a very strong knowledge of history and was both informative and a entertaining. On a day where it was pouring rain, our guide was most accommodating and catered the tour to our interests and time limitations. It was one of the best tours we'd been on in Europe. Highly recommended!

City Free Walking Tour. My city free walking tour was average. The negatives were that the tour guide walked the entire tour with his bicycle...he should have parked it somewhere. The tour was a whole lot of history which got a bit boring at times....I was hoping for more interesting tid bits of local insider info and interesting stories. Overall I thought it was average and definitely enjoyed the Canal tour more....Expect to tip at the end of the tour.

Great tour of Amsterdam's Jordaan district. Ana met us on time and gave us a lovely walking tour of the Jordaan district. She showed us beautiful little courtyards, streets, and homes with lots of narration and history. We stopped for coffee and apple pie at a wonderful cafe. Ana did not rush us. We loved hearing her stories and getting to know her. It was a well planned, comfortable tour.

Mudwalk to the island of Schiermonnikoog. It is always one of the best weekends of the year travelling with Tom and many more nice people to one of the beautiful Dutch islands! Tom knows how to create a very nice atmosphere within the group. Compliments!!! Looking forward to the next edition!
