Private Small Group Tour. We were a group of seven extending our river cruise for several days in Amsterdam. I contacted Tom and he was able to provide a great one day tour out to the countryside. He was our guide and driver. Tom was knowledgable and personable. He even took pictures of our group and sent them to us.

The best and easiest way to see some Dutch Highlights. We had a great experience with Tom's Travel Tours.He took my husband and his parents, and our 6 month old baby on a fantastic day trip to see secret flower fields, eat pancakes, tour windmills, and watch clogs being made!He arranged everything, and made the experience really easy for us to enjoy. He also took great pictures of us all for us to remember the trip!I really didn't have the energy to do the research for my in-laws trip. I very much recommend this company if you would like to see Holland and not have to organize anything, read one guide book and recieve 5 star treatment in return. Thanks Tom! We look forward to taking another trip when we have the chance.

Great Tour with Karin. We had a wonderful bike trip with Karin, who explained and showed us beautiful places in Amsterdam! Also the booking was professional and I received always quickly answers to my questions.

ALKMAAR: A Lovely Kaleidoscope of Matchless And Adorable Region. Touring Holland provides you some amazing sights such as windmills, canals, polders, flowers particularly daffodils, artwork, a variety of cheese and landscape. The healthy beautiful cows grazing in the well-preserved neat and clean lush green fields attract our attention, and wide open the secrets of its highly reputed and admired cheese of various taste and sizes. The countryside is remarkably attractive, and we were thrilled to view inside a windmill the utensils, the machine used for fetching the water through the wheel, and the history visualized through their antique craftsmanship. The ladies attending the visitors explained to us how windmills have always played a great part in the life of Holland and its inhabitants. They served to grind corn, to remove excess water from the low-lying districts, and to saw timber, thus making the country fit for human habitation and adding to the habitable area, they developed - especially in the seventeenth century - into a most important factor in the social structure of those days. The tour was fruitful, helpful, wonderful and delightful.

1000% attention for you. Every time we join a tour organised by Tom & Ana from Tom's Travel Tours we are having such a good time! Tom has the great gift of making each trip feel like he thought of it especially for you. His cheerfulness is like a sunny sky that you CAN count on, to brighten your stay in Amsterdam.

Amazing Tour.. We had this great grouptrip into the Dutch tidal region "the Wadden". walking to an Island with low tide. An unreal landscape, expert guides and sooo much local knowledge and enhousiasm made for an unforgettable day.Thanks again Tom!

Outstanding Tours. We organised three tours with Toms Travel Tours last month and they were all absolutely outstanding. The first tour was a 2 hour walking tour of the Red Light District with Marco and he was absolutely lovely, extremely knowledgable, fun and very interesting. The second tour was with Henk who took us on a full day personalised tour of the countryside north of Amsterdam including Marken, Edam, Monnickendam and much more. Henk was just simply wonderful, he catered for our every request. The car was extremely comfortable, perfectly clean and we were provided with snacks and drinks. Nothing was too much trouble for Henk and he was unbelievably knowledgeable and interesting. The third tour was another personalised tour of The Hague, Deft (just gorgeous) and Voorschoten. We particularly wanted this to be a special day for Mum who hadnt been back to her place of birth for over 60 years. From the first enquiry to saying goodbye, our experience with Toms Travel Tours was outstanding and I highly recommend them.

Five Star Ratings for a Good Reason. All the good reviews are well deserved. As part of a 4-day visit to Amsterdam on our way to a photo safari in Tanzania, 5 of us booked Tom's Tours to take us out of Amsterdam for a day of photography in the countryside. Although Tom is a photographer, he was not available due to his own travel schedule. But he sent us Carin for a wonderful day of grand photo ops.We appreciated her knowledge of the area, her understanding of our desire to get off the beaten path while still capturing some of the iconic Netherlands views (yes, windmills, canals and polders), and her patience with our repeated stops to get yet one more photo of the reflection in the canal or the cows in the fields.Tom was very responsive with timely (considering 9 hours time difference) to my questions in a series of emails as we shaped the day in consultation with the others in the group. He and Carin exceeded expectations and provided us with a much better day than we could have had on our own or in a bus tour with non-photographers.

Awesome tour of Countryside. Our day spent with Tom in the countryside surrounding Amsterdam was above our expectations! First, we traveled to FloraHolland to witness an auction of over 2 million flowers to be delivered around the world. Next, we visited Schermerhorn to observe several windmills. Then, we were off to Edam for a walking tour and lunch. Finally, as we meandered back to Amsterdam, we made a quick stop in Markem and some other lovely towns. All in all, the day was amazing. Tom shared his wealth of knowledge and kept us on tract with our schedule. Would highly recommend Toms Travel Tours to anyone in the Amsterdam area.

Terrific Tour. Hello Tom, We just returned from our day tour with Jacqueline. Thank you so much for hiring her. She's a wealth of knowledge about your city and nearby towns. She couldn't have been nicer or taken us to very memorable sights. We are so happy we saw your reviews on Trip Advisor. If any of our friends come to Amsterdam we will definitely have them contact you. Thanks again. PS: For my Trip Advisor review we went to Edam, Markum, visited a windmill and got to climb inside it, and took a nice country tour. We started at 10:00 and was delivered back to our hotel around 5:00.

A great custom trip of Amsterdam surrounds. Toms were great at customising the trip to see what we wanted. Visits to a cheese factory, clog-making, Edam, Marken and an operating windmill; we had a great time! Highly recommended.

A great way to see the city like a local. Loved everything about our tour. Tom was incredibly accommodating and helpful in arranging the ideal tour for our visit. Very patient with multiple emails and questions and always prompt and cheerful with his replies. Our guide Henk was wonderful - smart, gracious and attentive. Toms Travel goes out of their way to make you feel like a local and come away with a deeper understanding and appreciation of Amsterdam.

Little trip to Schiermonnikoog including Mud walking. Our trip topped our expectations! With Tom as your tourguide it seems you are visiting a new place with a good friend. He is the perfect combination between being laid-back, taking the lead and sharing food at unexpected moments. Would definetely recommend it.
Surprising and energizing trip. Tom has a unique way of showcasing The Netherlands, its culture, the people, the treasures, highlights and hotspots.

Long Day in Amsterdam. Tom and I began an email correspondence a couple of months before our trip to Amsterdam. I explained that we would be returning from a trip to Africa, would only have 1 full day in Amsterdam and wanted to customize a tour to see as much as possible. As we corresponded we narrowed down the most important sights we wanted to see and Tom put them into a FULL days itinerary. We were picked up on time at our hotel by Carin, who was our driver/tour guide for the day. As she took us to all the places we had requested she was also giving us a history lesson of the Netherlands. After a very enjoyable day with Carin, we were dropped off to tour the Anne Frank House. From there we walked to the Hard Rock Café for dinner. Tom met us there at a pre-determined time to take us on a tour of the Red Light District. After a very through tour and history lesson we were returned to our hotel.We have done private tours of many cities around the world and highly recommend Toms Travel Tours as one of the best!

Beautiful walk. We could not have asked for anything better. Our day began with a driver who was very prompt and delivered us to our hotel. We were able to store our luggage until our room was ready and our walking tour was complete. Our tour was informational,interesting,historical , and best of all to areas that were part of Amsterdam's heritage. A tour we would highly recommend to all.

Awesome countryside tour. We had Jacqueline for a private day tour of the countryside around Amsterdam and we weren't disappointed. It was my wife and I with our 8 year old, and the tour kept our daughter's attention for the full day. Jacqueline was a great guide, very knowledgeable about the areas and very accommodating. We went to Marken, Edam, and Beemster area for windmills to end the day. We thought it was a perfect way to get away from Amsterdam and see the country for a little while. Not cheap, but well worth the price. We highly recommend a day doing this in addition to the various things to see around Amsterdam, as it provides a little more perspective.

Best way to start your tour of Amsterdam. Anna was our guide of a four-hour walking tour of Amsterdam. We saw and learned so much during the tour that it made the remaining three days we spent in the city more worthwhile. Anna is patient when answering our questions and doesn't try to sugarcoat Amsterdam as some type of utopian city. For example, the cost of living there is high, especially real estate prices. But it is obvious she likes her adopted city and enjoys taking visitors on these tours. I strongly recommend a Tom's Travel Tour an a great way to start your visit to Amsterdam.

Outstanding bespoke bike tour of Amsterdam and the area!. We recently completed a 5+ hour private bike tour with Tom. I gave a 5 star rating because Trip Advisor won't allow 6!We wanted to see more of Amsterdam than just the center and Tom delivered. We wanted a focus on the food and beer and some of the neighborhoods.Highlights of the tour (in chronological order) Vondelpark, Near in Western Neighborhoods, Jordaan and some 'secret' courtyards, a stop at the open air market by the North Church (and stocking up on cheese, charcuterie, bread, olives and fruit for a picnic); a nice picnic along the water on one of the '3 islands'; riding through the crowds by the central station (ok, not the best part ;) ); taking a ferry to North Amsterdam; riding through a large North Amsterdam park - hard to believe we were that close to the center; riding along one of the dikes and the 17th century houses built along it (google Café t Sluisje to get an idea where we were); crossing the locks to get back into the city: some tasty - and well earned - beers at Brouwerij t' iJ. (Very good beers and a cool place); and a quick ride back to the start while passing the zoo.Tom customized this tour for what we wanted to see and he delivered. In addition to a bike guide, we got a lot of great history and information and some awesome photos too. My wife booked the tour and I had no idea that we would get Tom or that he is a professional photographer. Amazing pictures! In some of the more crowded places, I felt like we were some unknown celebrities with our own private photo crew chronicling our journey.If you want to see Amsterdam and the area in an in-depth, customized and private way, I highly recommend Tom and will send all of my friends to him. We travel a lot and this was one of the best tours ever!

Private Tour of Amsterdam. Excellent!. Having investigated via TA and other sources as to the best options for a private tour guide company in Amsterdam, we choose Toms Travel Tours. It was our best decision of the whole summer holiday! On the first day in Amsterdam we did a walking tour of the city with Simon. Simon was just great. As a couple of our children are quite young, we did not want to yet expose them to certain aspects of Amsterdam, and Simon did a GREAT job showing us everything but whilst staying off the streets where a few uncomfortable questions may have been asked of us by our younger children. Simon kept it interesting during the whole tour, even for the younger children, constantly asking them questions to keep them on track.The following day, we did a whole day trip with Chris to visit the surrounding villages and windmills. Chris is incredible. He arranged to go cycling, with some great local snacks and refreshments along the way, followed by a visit to a cheese factory, and a wooden clog traditional factory where one of the very few traditional clog makers left in the world expertly showed us how to make them. The visit to the windmills was our last stop, and the highlight of the day. Chris is incredibly knowledgeable of the history and geography of the area, and made it interesting all along the way both for the adults and the children.We could not recommend Toms Travel Tours higher. Perfect organisation, and fantastic tour guides.

private short walking tour of Amsterdam. We went with Ana who did the tour exactly as requested, I did not want to walk too far or too fast. Ana was kind & helpful & we had an interesting tour away from the tourist areas.

Perfect bike tour!. We took a 2 hour tour of the city with Tom and had the nicest time. He took us to some very nice parts of Amsterdam we would never have been able to discover on our own and explained very interesting things about the country and city. Last but not least, he took beautiful photos of us, which we loved. It was a very relaxing and fun time for our group. I highly recommend it!!

Excellent tour of Amsterdam. Our group of four visited Amsterdam in November 2015 so my review is rather late. We were only in the city for one day but wanted to see and learn as much as possible in a short amount of time. I found Tom on tripadvisor and he did not disappoint. Although he was not able to be our guide, Jac was just as knowledgeable and gracious. We learned about the history, architecture, education system, political system, water management, immigration and, of course, the red light district. Jac was so patient with us and answered all of our questions while showing us this lovely city. Tom even offered information on restaurants and museums before we arrived. I would not hesitate to recommend Tom when visiting the Netherlands.

A wonderful day outside Amsterdam. Tom was our guide for a trip outside Amsterdam. We toured the outskirts of Amsterdam, went to Broek, and other sites in The Waterlands, through Beemster to Edam and ended up at the working windmills that were built to pump water out of the Polders. Tom was a gracious and informative host. He helped us understand the history of the Netherlands, the way the new lands (polders) were created. Tom is warm, charming, with an excellent sense of humor and fully fluent in English. It was almost like traveling with a friend and we had a wonderful time despite it being a wet day with off and on rain storms. He was very receptive to our desire to spend more or less time in some places, and revised his proposed itinerary to accommodate our requests. As a photojournalist he helped us frame pictures and took many candid pictures of us and emailed them to us. We highly recommend this tour service.

Incredible!. We did a tour with Tom which was incredible. He took us through Amsterdam city and showed us things we would have never found on our own! All the while with a smile and happily telling us all about his great city! He was a incredible guide and we HIGHLY suggest doing a tour with Tom!

Excellent tours - highly recommend. We had two excellent tours -- one with Karen to Delft and The Hague and one with Tom to the countryside. Both were excellent and highly recommended. They were both very informative and delightful, with Tom also taking photos (he is also a professional photographer) during our trip. As a private tour, we were able to spend more or less time as desired at various places and they tailored both trips to accommodate our needs (travelling with two teenagers plus a less mobile senior). Both were able to take us to places that you couldn't see easily on a bus tour and we were able to get away from much of the tourist crowds. Their recommendations for lunch, both in Delft and Edam, were excellent as well. Our questions were answered quickly and professionally by email in advance of our trip. Highly recommend the private tours by Tom's Travel Tours.

Excellent Netherlands Tour Service. Recently had a countryside tour with Tom. Communication to book tour was fantastic and included restaurant recommendations and instruction on when/how to book tickets in advance to some of Amsterdams main sites. Car was comfortable and itinerary was tailored to our interests. Tom even took the time to share his knowledge of photography while he took many pictures of us to remember our time. Lunch spot was perfect. We also enjoyed a walking tour of Amsterdam with Ana.This is a top notch operation for those seeking a personalized experience.

An amazing experience in Amsterdam. We recently booked with Tom for a day long countryside tour, a walking tour of the city and an airport transfer to our hotel. All were perfectly coordinated. We were with two teenage girls, my husband and myself. For our daylong tour Tom picked us up in the morning and we spent the whole day touring different countryside areas. The highlights were bike riding, climbing the bell tower steps in Edam, the windmill museum with a personal tour with the miller and the cheese and clog shop. Tom has a great personality, he is very warm and friendly, he really customized our experience. Our family really missed him for the rest of our trip. The next day we did a walking tour with Jaqueline and she was also amazing, Very personable and fun too!!! She made sure we saw everything we wanted to see and had so much knowledge of the area. I would 110% recommend this company to anyone. We will definitely call Tom again if we are lucky enough to be in the area. Oh I almost forgot Tom has the best snacks on board for the day! We were introduced to the best cookies and he takes pictures of the day for you and sends them to you afterwards as he is also a professional photographer, that made the entire trip that must better. Thank you for making the first part of our trip a very memorable one.

Great local knowledge. We loved our tour through Amsterdam with Tom. Our tour was customised to what we wanted/hadn’t seen yet, meaning we had a local guide pointing out all the secret spots we should see and things we could do. On top of a great tour, it turns out Tom is a professional photographer, so he brought his camera along and now we have some beautiful photos of us in Amsterdam that aren’t just phone selfies! Tom was great fun to hang out with, if you’re looking for a way to familiarise yourself with Amsterdam it is a great option – somewhat similar to hanging out with a local friend.

A Must Do In Amsterdam. If you are thinking about exploring Amsterdam by bike, Toms Travel Tours is the way to go. Toms Travel was extremely accommodating in creating a unique afternoon ride that visited a range of locations. We communicated a number of times via email prior to our visit where I was able to share my preferences; I was always impressed on the timely responses. We were pleased to coordinate a meeting time and place that allowed us to visit a popular site and meet outside the exit. Our bike trip inside Amsterdam and beyond allowed us to experience the city in a special way. Tom is extremely knowledgeable and shared a great deal of information in a friendly and easy going manner. If that wasn't enough, he goes above and beyond to capture the tour in such a memorable way using his photographic talent. We were amazed how quickly the photos were shared with us and the quality of shots. Don't hesitate to book a trip with Tom and experience Amsterdam to its fullest!

Toms Tours are Terrific. We enjoyed two GREAT days while in Amsterdam with Jacqueline. She was knowledgeable, efficient and a lot of fun. We first went to the countryside and its quaint villages and windmills. There was a fair in Beemster and we stopped on a lark and were treated to cotton candy and a walk among the locals. Just fun. On the 2nd day we went to The Hague and the Vermeer Museum, which was amazing. Then to Delft. Ran out of time in the Square as it was a beautiful day. Jackie was one of the best guides we have ever had. Highly recommend her and Toms Travel Tours.
Countryside tour. Henke did a great job of taking us to countryside. We enjoyed every minute of the tour and Henke was wonderful
Great service. We had booked 3 tours, all excellent. friendly and knowledgable staff. Would definitley recommend them

Great tour of the Dutch countryside!. Just finished the Dutch countryside tour with Tom. We saw many postcardlike scenes in quaint villages, farms, and of course the windmills. The windmill design and history was fascinating. He exceeded our expectations! In addition to his vast knowledge of history along the drive, Tom had some nice surprises including some Dutch snacks and wine/cheese following our visit to the windmill. As an added bonus, Tom turned out to be a professional photographer and he was snapping some really great shots of our family with his professional equipment. He clearly enjoys showing off his country with pride. We also did a walking tour with his wife Ana the day before. This was a great way to experience many of the lesser known places and courtyards that you would never knew existed. Behind each closed door you stepped back into time. PS - he recommended a great place near our hotel for these little Dutch pancake...It was amazing. Thanks Tom and Ana!

Excellent Amsterdam & Netherlands guides!!. I arranged three tours with Tom's Travel Tours for my family group of 12, which included two babies and two elderly adults. Communication prior to our trip was easy and quick, and I loved receiving the details of our itinerary prior to our arrival. We were so pleased with our excellent tours of the Dutch Countryside with Carin, Amsterdam Walking Tour with Saskia, and a custom tour of Friesland that Tom arranged and guided for us. We felt like we saw so much of the Netherlands in our very short stay, and the pace was perfect for our group (despite the complications of young children and limited mobility). We were especially grateful with the special arrangements and details that Tom gave to our beautiful tour of Friesland to St. Anna Parochie and Leeuwarden, where our family history in the Netherlands began. Tom also shared with us some lovely portraits of our group shortly after our tour. Thank you for making our visit to the Netherlands so unique and special!

A wonderful day!. We just returned from our trip and had the most amazing time in Amsterdam. Saskia was an excellent guide who made our walking tour not only fun but we learned so much. Would highly recommend this company to anyone. They were exceptional from start to finish!

Two day tour, one great, one average. We had a two day tour of Amsterdam. The first day was a walking tour with a young tour guide. Although he was knowledgeable and friendly he did not relate well with the age group (seniors). He did not take us inside any buildings and left us for lunch at a very unacceptable café. The second day was a travel day with Karen to The Hague. Karen was marvelous. We enjoyed the tour due mainly to Karen's obvious experience and her enthusiasm. Thank you Karen.

Amsterdam family visit. We did both a walking tour of Amsterdam and a tour of the Dutch countryside. Both tour guides were excellent and the tours were great. Would definitely recommend this company to friends and family.

Walking tour in amsterdam. Had an amazing tour with Saskia in amsterdam, she showed us all the hidden local spots and really knew her history! We had a great time and she gave us great tips on food places and answered all our questions. This was a great experience and we would defiantly recommend it! The tour was 4 hours and we got so much out of it and really learned so much about Amsterdam!
Private Guided Tour of surrounding cities and country side outside of Amsterdam. We enjoyed our guides knowledge and fun facts of the areas we visited. Would definitely recommend them.

Best Private Tour you can do in Amsterdam and it's countryside. Me and Mother wanted a private tour in the dutch countryside because with a public tour you are very time bound and don't get much freedom to see the beauty in the small towns and villages in the dutch countryside. Tom provided us a perfect tour. He was very quick with his replies in email, knew everything about the area and also about many other places (good source to plan your next trip), and made us a tour where we could relax and see everything! He also knew the place where you find less crowded Windmills to see and take pictures. I don't think anyone else could even come close to proving a great tour like he did.
Everyday life in Amsterdam. Excelent overview especially the housing fore widows - best apple pie - great walk by canals,boats,architectural styles!

Excellent Amsterdam Countryside Tour. We have a very enjoyable countryside tour with Henk as our tour guide. He was very friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. Henk took us to various beautiful spots in the countryside and he didn't rush us from one spot to another. Very relaxing and enjoyable. The day went by too quickly.

Dutch countryside. We had 6 people and Karen picked us up at our apartment in Amsterdam. We spent a lovely day driving through the countryside with Karen as our guide. She was informative, engaging and showed us the towns of Marken and Edam as a local would see them. The working windmill ended the tour and was an amazing sight to see! Karen was a wonderful tour guide!! We highly recommend Toms Travel Tours.

amsterdam countryside. It was an amazing tour. We have never experienced a "surprise" from any company before. Tom's Travel Tours surely put an extra effort of making the tour personal with such warm touch. Karen is cheerful throughout the day. Tom is such a nice guy! Keep smiling Tom!

Absoultely the Best. This is our second time touring Amsterdam and the country side nearby with Tom and Ana. The arrangements are always flexible and designed for whatever you wish with great suggestions on what is best to see. You can see details and reviews from others and will see that we are all impressed and excited over the results from our tours with Tom and his group. Very highly recommend his services.

Wonderful Day in the Holland Countryside. This tour of the Holland Countryside was great. Our guide, Jacqueline, was terrific. We very much enjoyed her company. During our tour, we visited the truly lovely and quaint village of Marken, stopping for coffee and hot chocolate at a pleasant cafe where the friendly owner dressed in traditional Dutch clothing. We toured a windmill, which was very interesting. We also went to Edam and tasted delicious cheese and had a Dutch lunch at an open air cafe. I booked this tour because of the reviews on TripAdvisor and am glad I did. This private tour was really worth it.

Amazing Dutch Countryside Tour and Amazing Care. Our flight to Amsterdam got cancelled due to bad weather and we had to postpone the tour date by a day. Tom was very comforting throughout the whole ordeal even if he was inconvenienced himself. Now to the Countryside tour. We are 2 families with young adults, teens and a child. No problem for our tour guide Karen to cater to the interests of each one. Karen was exceptionally warm and had a nice surprise for us at the end of the tour. That won't be forgotten! The tour had a little of everything Dutch: cheese, windmill, dikes. Too bad we were late for tulips season. Karen made sure that we did not only take in the sights but also the culture, the history, the people, food, and current events. Since our trip was cut short, we will certainly go back and call Tom and Karen once again.

Dutch countryside tour. We booked a private tour of the Dutch countryside and we couldn't be happier with them. Tom gave us the tour. the booking process was very easy, and Tom was very responsive to my emails. he even took pictures for us and later emailed the pictures to us...which was awesome, since my husband and I rarely have pictures of the two of us together! Tom was very knowledgable about everything about his country. highly recommend it!

Great tours - Amazing Team!. We recently did 2 amazing tours with Karen - a walking tour of Amsterdam and a day-long tour of the Dutch countryside - and we couldn't be happier. Our group included 3 kids - ages 6, 11 and 13 - and Karen was great with all of them! She managed to hold their attention and keep them engaged throughout the trip. The tour of the Dutch Countryside was the highlight of our entire trip to me. You visit these quaint little villages - it's like stepping back in time. We got to see not only how they made Dutch cheese - but also wooden shoes. Definitely something everyone should see. We also toured a 500+ year old windmill - the miller was even there to answer questions and show us around. Beyond the tour itself - Tom and his team are simply the best. From my first email exchange to my last minute request to pick up a package from our hotel - they were 100% customer focused. If you are considering a trip to the Netherlands - this is the team to do it with - you will not be disappointed. We can't wait to come back and see more of this amazing country with this great group of people.

Highlight of our Amsterdam trip. Ana's tour was wonderful! We were hoping to learn about the "real" Amsterdam beyond the guidebook highlights, and Ana was able to show us places we never would have found on our own. She shared with us real insights about what is happening in this vibrant city!!

Toms Travel Tours. We just did a 2-night “stopover” in the Netherlands. We had a tight schedule but Tom made it appear seamless. We never felt rushed and totally enjoyed the whole experience. We had not expected to learn so much about The Netherlands in such a short time. This brief stopover truly exceeded our expectations and Tom was a big part of the reason. He is quite personable, knowledgeable on many fronts, and totally unflappable. We could never have accomplished this on our own in the time we had.

Countryside Tour and Custom Arnhem Tour. My husband and I had just a couple days open to explore areas in the Netherlands outside the city of Amsterdam. We opted to take the Countryside Tour with Karen on one day, and a custom tour in Arnhem revolving around the WWII Operation Market Garden, Battle for the Arnhem Bridge with Dirk. As our tour in Arnhem was a custom tour, Tom took great care to determine our desires, and offered a couple priced options depending on whether we would want a private car and driver from Amsterdam to Arnhem, or if we would hop on the train and meet the guide on the train platform in Arnhem. We opted for the train (much less expensive) and were furnished detailed instructions for the direct and easy one hour trip from Amsterdam Central Station to Arnhem. Our guide, Dirk, is a retired Colonel and former teacher at the Dutch Higher Military School. Dirk is an expert and engaging guide. He took us in his personal car to battlefields, paratrooper and glider drop zones, the Hartenstein Airborne Museum (where he also volunteers), and of course, the bridge. When he guided us through the Museum, and although he wasn't calling attention to himself, he was so obviously knowledgeable that a couple military cadets started discretely following us so as to listen in. My husband was beaming during the entire tour. This was easily the highlight of our visit to the Netherlands for my husband who is very interested in WWII history.The next day we toured the countryside north of Amsterdam (Markem, Edam, and Schermerhorn polder) with Karen. She promptly picked us up at our hotel and dropped us off there after the tour. As noted throughout the Toms Travel Tours reviews, Karen is an experienced, knowledgeable and fun guide. I won't repeat her accolades other than to say they are richly deserved. The tour locations were unbelievably beautiful, and the polder in particular with it's fantastic windmills would have been completely inaccessible to us without private transportation. Don't hesitate to take either of these tours. They were organized for our comfort and convenience and provided a wealth of local knowledge and insight that would not be accessible to people like us who are visiting the Netherlands for just a short time.

Wonderful experience. We had 2 days in Amsterdam prior to a cruise and wanted to experience the city. We had read reviews for this company and arranged an afternoon walking tour. Simon was our guide. He met us exactly on time in our hotel lobby for the tour. We like to walk and we adjusted the tour on the go based on what we wanted to see. Simon is from the city and knew all of the streets, history and details. And how to keep us out of the way of the bicycle riders. He took us into some of the quiet gardens and off the beaten path areas. He gave us an understanding of living in the city now as well as the history. Simon offered to stop for coffee and rest for a while but we enjoyed the walk and the scenery. We visited the waterfront, red light district, Dam square, along the canals, and the Joordan area, and then back to the central rail station and along the waterfront. Scheduling the tour was very easy, through email with the owner. This was a great tour for us. Simon was a wonderful guide. I would recommend this company without any hesitation.

Relaxing, Well-Paced Countryside Tour. Tom was very responsive in answering all my email queries when booking a private countryside tour from Amsterdam for four of us (about 9:30 am -5:30 pm). Tom was not available for the date we requested so he hired Karen to be our guide. Karen was prompt, personable and extremely knowledgeable about the history of the Netherlands with lots of interesting stories about customs and myths.Our first stop was Broek in Waterland, a lovely traditional village. We walked the quiet streets and stopped in the local church where bible stories are presented in a big panel of painted Delft tiles and chatted with a local inn owner who was setting up for a private party and invited us in to see the traditional historic building. Then we stopped in Marken, a picturesque harbor town. From there, we stopped at a set of shops that demonstrated and explained the making of cheese and wooden shoes. Although a bit touristy, it was fun and we learned a great deal from the friendly young demonstrators. After that, we went to Edam and had lunch at a tavern on the square and walked around the town. Our last stop was in the Schermerhorn Polder to see a still working windmill where you can enter and observe all the moving parts and how the occupants would have lived. Karen had brought us some Dutch goodies to sample including chocolate, waffle cookies, wine, cheese--it was nice and convivial way to end the day before heading back to Amsterdam.Highly recommend this tour.

Countryside Tour Outside of Amsterdam. We spent a day with Jacqueline on a customized tour for two of us. We saw a bit of Amsterdam and its port areas and then traveled to Marken, a beautiful old sea side type town with unique homes. This was followed by a drive to Edam - yes cheese! We had lunch after a wander around town and a stop in a couple of shops. Afterwards, Jacqueline became a big help as my wife had a tooth crown break loose and Jacqueline worked with staff at our hotel to get a dental appointment for the next day which was essential since we were boarding a cruise ship. After handling this we traveled to a polder and had the thrills of climbing inside a windmill to see its working parts and operating an Archimedes screw to move water!

Great informative tour. Carin, our guide picked us up right on time at the hotel. From there she took us through the city and did an excellent job explaining everything, including the dike system. Very interesting. We then visited a quaint town of Marken, a little fishing village. My favorite part of the tour was the windmills. I found that fascinating and we were able to see a working windmill. Truly amazing! We visited a town called Edam, where they make cheese and Dutch shoes. We all enjoyed that visit. Carin was a very warm person and you could see she really enjoyed her job. She was always around if we had questions but she was not intrusive. If you book a private tour through Tom's Travel, make sure you ask for Carin.

Fantastic day in the Holland countryside. I found Tom on tripadvisor and emailed him almost a year ahead of our trip to Amsterdam. My husband and I were interested in a private tour of Keukenhof Gardens, the flower market, and the countryside. After hearing his suggestions we quickly booked him, not knowing how many of our group would be able to join us. There ended up being 6 of us and it was just such a perfect day. Tom was gracious and accommodating, giving us many options throughout the day. I was so much fun to have him as our guide. We were able to see tulip and hyacinth fields that were off the beaten path and very picturesque! He suggested a pancake restaurant for lunch in a small town and it was perfect. Another side trip to Edam offered more quaint and lovely scenes, in addition to the cheese we bought and the snacks he so kindly provided. I'm a photo enthusiast and was very happy to find out that Tom is also a travel editor/photographer. He was snapping photos all day and forwarded some to us after the trip-bonus! Tom was just a terrific guide with a great knowledge of the history of his country. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. Highly recommend Tom!

Trip planning help and a great guide in Jacqueline. My husband and I spent 3 days touring the city of Amsterdam and the countryside with Jac. She was enthusiastic, knowledgeable, funny and accommodating. Jacquie really showed us her city, what she loves about Amsterdam and the quirky things that make it unique. Jacquie loves to break into song and knows many great spots for an on the go taste treat. We especially enjoyed her spontaneity - changing plans, stopping to visit a windmill, wandering into a shop, etc. was never a problem. Prior to our trip, I was in touch with Tom to help plan, suggest restaurants, set up an itinerary, etc. Tom provided advanced information to pre-book Anne Frank House, Van Gogh Museum and several other attractions. Very helpful information.

Best Private Tours in the Netherlands!. Our experience with Toms Travel Tours was amazing from start to finish! From my initial email inquiry to the end of our amazing day long country tour, we were thoroughly impressed with their awesome and personalized customer service. Karen, our tour guide, drove us around the beautiful Netherlands countryside telling us the most interesting stories of their history and showed us some of the most picturesque towns. She also managed to make it feel like we were the only tourists in the Netherlands at the end of May (which we of course were not) which was incredible! She even surprised us with very sweet and thoughtful treats at every stop that she prepared for us the night before, and got us hooked on stroopwafels! We are so happy we chose Toms Travel Tours for our tour guide in Amsterdam!

Excellent guide!. Booked an exclusively guided bike tour. Ana Ines is an excellent guide with a good sense of humor and warm hearted. Perfect way to get to know Amsterdam. Not the cheapest experience but worth the money.

Best guide/companion to see Amsterdam. I'm a solo traveller and have travelled over 50,000+ miles in 2016 alone to this date. I never write any reviews but in this case, I had to. Tom really is that good of a guy. Words cannot do justice to how good Tom really is when it comes to showing you around Amsterdam. A lot of other people have written a lot better and more descriptive reviews and I can easily back them up; without a doubt. If you're visiting Amsterdam and looking around for tours or tour guides, just stop and get a hold of Tom, you won't be disappointed. I booked a last minute trip to Amsterdam (8 hours before my flight from Toronto) and sent him an email. It was the weekend so I wasn't sure if he'd even respond. As soon as I got off of my flight from Toronto to Munich, I got a phone call from Tom. He was extremely professional and I told I'm that I still have 2 more flights before reaching Amsterdam. We made plans to meet in my hotel lobby in a few hours. He explained me how to reach my hotel from the airport, just an amazing guy. The private tour started, he arrived in time and we started walking around the city; we took a tram, saw so many attractions, he took my pictures, explained the history (dating back to 13th/14th century), it was one of the best experiences. Once the tour ended, he went his way and I went my own but he made sure i could get back to my hotel without getting lost. He even followed up with a few emails and text messages afterwards to make sure I had arrived safe and recommended a few more places to see and visit. I'm typing this on a phone and have skipped quite a few details here, but as I mentioned above, my words cannot do justice to the kind of service Tom provided, so I'll leave it at that.

Bike tours are the way to go!. We had a great experience with Toms Travel Tours! Tom was always very quick to respond to my emails and answer all of my questions. He set us up with Ana and she picked us up from our hotel and took us on such a fun bike tour! We loved learning about Amsterdam and getting to know her a little bit. It was so nice to be able to go on this tour with just my husband, and Ana, and not a big tour group. I love how Toms Travel Tours caters to whatever size of group you have. Ana was a great tour guide! She took care of locking and unlocking our bikes whenever we stopped. She introduced us to some delicious treats and she showed us some really cool parts of town. She was always watching over her shoulder to make sure we were ok and I felt very safe following her on my bike. If you are going to do a tour, do it on bikes! You will see so much more in a smaller amount of time! I will be referring Toms Travel Tours to anyone I know of going to Amsterdam in the future!

Highly recommended!. My girlfriend and I were lucky enough to come here to Tripadvisor.com and find this magical guide. From the moment we expressed interest, Tom was extremely helpful in his recommendations on attractions and activities to check out during our stay. The morning of our excursion, Tom met us out front of our hotel promptly at the arranged time and we set off upon our journey to the tulip fields. Although the weather was not the best, we enjoyed ourselves and all the fun that Tom had to share with us.All in all, I would highly recommend Tom’s tours to just about anybody! Tom was such a great host that I hope to host him in my neck of the woods someday!

3-Day Tour of Amstetdam. We scheduled our trip months in advance to Amsterdam & asked Toms Travel Tour to tour us around the three days. He made excellent suggestions of different places and provided the best tour guides we could have ever asked for. The guides were very knowledgeable about every aspect of Amsterdam, very professional and had great personalities. I will recommend Toms to anybody - you will not be disappointed!!

Vacation. We could not have asked for a better tour company!! Tom was so helpful, courteous, and made our stay in Amsterdam. He arranged our pick up at the airport and 3 days of the most perfect tours. From Kukenhof Gardens, Edam, Marken, Delft & The Hague to our final day with a City Walking tour. Our trip to Amsterdam was the best because we booked Tom's Tours. Thank you Tom, Jacqueline, Henk & Saskia for a great time, we hope to meet again when we come back to your beauty city.Steve & Karen MahnkeDaytona Beach, FL

What a great day!. Ana, our tour guide, was absolutely wonderful! Her English was as clear as could be. There wasn't a question she couldn't answer with authority. She was very flexible as made adjustments based on what we were interested in seeing. Without Ana, we would have probably walked aimlessly around the city. With Ana, we saw things that most tourists wouldn't have known were there. Her personality kept the tour enjoyable at all times.  I'd also like to comment about the company, Toms Travel Tours, for their excellent communication with us as we went through the booking process. Emails were answered quickly, and unlike other companies with whom we inquired, Tom's answered our specific questions (several others provided us with only vague answers, often having a cut and paste feel to them)Ana toured us in English, but we understand that she is equally able to tour in Spanish. The company has other tour guides who can provide services in a host of other languages as well.

A 5 star "tulip" tour. We booked Tom for an all day tour of Keukenhof and tulip fields. The first thing he did that we really appreciated was picking us up early enough to get to Keukenhof around opening time. That gave us the chance to see the gardens without the big crowds. As we exited the gardens there were A LOT of people waiting to get in. We just smiled and went to the van. Then he took us to flower fields out in the country side which were beautiful and allowed us to take some outstanding pictures with no crowds. We had a wonderful lunch, not included in the price of the tour, at a restaurant in a small town. Then our last stop was Edam where he gave us some cheese to sample and then led us on a tour around the small town. It was a great day.

Nothing but praises. From email correspondance; to the choice of selected private walking (Jordaan district) and full day @ Keukenhof garden and working mill visit. To the 2 fantastic guides (Jacq & Simon) who showed us around; to choices of eating places and food tasting recommended for our group of 23 people and the airport transfer arrangement. It was absolutely fantastic and very professional . Would highly recommend to anyone who would want to know Amsterdam intimately. Well done!!

FABULOUS customized 3-day pvt. tour. I can't rave enough about Tomstravel Tours. I just returned from a 3-day pvt. guided tour with Tom. From my first correspondence via email I knew I had selected the BEST touring company to meet my specific needs. I wanted to visit the areas north of Amsterdam, specifically the picture postcard village of Geithoorn. He created a terrific and very FLEXIBLE itinerary based on my personal interests & activity preferences---biking, boating, wildlife, & photography. I felt quite fortunate to have Tom as my guide for those 3 remarkable & memorable days. He spoke perfect English and knows his native country inside and out. I learned so much about the areas we visited in addition to enjoying all the sites/activities. Everything was included except meals, but he always had a great stash of yummy treats & water. I was so happy I used this company after reading other great reviews on TripAdvisor. Tomstravel Tours will custom tailor tours that will surely deliver! It has my highest recommendation.

Amsterdam Tour. We visited Amsterdam on May 1-2 and did 2 tours with Toms Travel Tours. I found them through Trip Advisor. Karen and Ana did an excellent job. We visited the Kuekenhof, Edam, and Marken.The next day did a 4 hour walking tour through unique neighborhoods. Snacks and drinks were provided. Well organized, professional, tour company and I highly recommend them.

Wonderful tour!. We used this tour company for a tour of Amsterdam. We had Simon as our tour guide and he gave us an excellent tour. He grew up in Amsterdam and it was so informative and enjoyable to be introduced to this city by a native Amsterdamer. We would highly recommend this guide and tour company. They were easy to work with. We had a very enjoyable experience.

Amazing. Karen was our excellent tour guide companion. We experienced the most beautiful tulip fields, visited and learned the importance of windmills, had the most delightful lunch, and met another amazing lady who absolutely loved the tulips and their history. We were a group of seven ladies with one wheelchair and Karen was amazing! The absolute unexpected bonus of wine, cheese, and chocolate at the end of the tour was provided by Karen. Thanks, Karen

Amsterdam. i contacted Toms Travel Tours for our recent trip to Amsterdam and we had an absolutely marvelous time! From the start, I felt comfortable with Tom. His email exchange was always prompt and addressed my questions thoroughly. The guides were charming and presented the city and surroundings to us in a relaxed, thoughtful, and comprehensive manner. Our trip to The Hague was the highlight for me - Mauritzhuis was incredible! My daughter enjoyed Keukenhof best. I only wish we had more time to spend there! Thanks, Tom, Ana, Karen and Simon.

Tiptoeing Through the Tulips with Tom. Tom took my friends and me on a full day tour through the tulip farms outside Amsterdam and it was amazing! We visited several fields where was a rainbow of tulips almost as far as the eye could see and took tons of gorgeous photos. We also toured the inside of a windmill, went to the beautiful village of Edam, and had wonderful savory pannekoeken for lunch. Tom arrived on time, was fun, expert, and completely flexible. This was the experience of a lifetime.Tom also arranged a half-day tour of Amsterdam for us guided by his wife, Ana. We had a wonderful time learning the history of the city by visiting several markets, touring 'hidden' courtyards, and more. It was a real treat to walk the city with an expert.

Great private tour in Ámsterdam!. I found Toms in tripadvisor and decided to contact him. It was a great decision! From the very first approach the attention was superb. He arranged exactly the tour I wanted and listened to all my demands. Besides that, they arranged many other activities in Amsterdam, such as museum visits, restaurants, etc. I booked two tours in the city with them. I went first in a photo tour and we had great fun while Tom told me many tips about how to make pictures. He is really nice and funny! And he will take care of you (believe me, you need it with all those cyclists around!). I went in a second tour around the hidden gems of Amsterdam and that was really surprising! We visited so many places I couldn’t imagine existed. We went to some funny places in the north of the city, hip enterprises in old industrial buildings and to the Jordaan… I loved it! We went to a beautiful organic market, where we tasted many nice things and we topped the tour with an unbeatable appelpie. I would love to visit you in Amsterdam again!

Fantastic tours--individually tailored and personal. I wrote Tom with what I thought we wanted to do in Amsterdam. There was a form to fill in to get a feel for our needs, and Tom wrote back saying he was very willing to do what I had outlined, but that since I wanted to avoid crowds he could suggest an alternate tulip and windmill tour. The tour was perfect! We had a peaceful tour and were able to toss in some great stops for our kids as well (such as tuliplandia). Tom took incredible pictures of our family along the way and so we have amazing keepsakes from our time in the tulip fields.I loved the personal attentiveness to the tour, right down to the lovely snacks along the way!Also, Anna guided us on a 4 hour city tour. She had such a wonderful way with my 10 and 11 year old that they learned just as much as the adults did. She was open to changes in the itinerary as we wanted to stop a bit more along the way. She included some great stops that the kids enjoyed too. We learned a lot about the city and had a wonderful time overall. I highly recommend going with Tom and Anna!

Excellent Amsterdam tour guide. Toms Travel Tours provided my wife and me a fantastic experience in Amsterdam. When communicating with Tom via email to plan our tour he was very responsive and provided thorough information about itineraries, costs and logistics. As a guide Tom is knowledgeable and personable. Best of all, he's willing to customize the tour to suit one's interests, and offers helpful suggestions without being pushy. The entire experience from beginning to end was a great pleasure and exceeded our expectations.

Amsterdam and beyond. I had three tours with Toms Travel. The first was a great half-day walking tour of Amsterdam including the Red Light District with Saskia. I saw and learned so many things with my wonderful guide. On my second day, I went to Haarlem and Leiden with Karen for a full day. It was a great tour and Karen also took me to see the North Sea where we enjoyed a wonderful lunch at a restaurant right on the beach. We even stopped to see and take photos of big, beautiful fields of colorful tulips during our drive. It was one of the unexpected nice extra surprises on this trip. Karen helped make the day interesting and fun. My third tour was also a half-day walking tour of the Jordan area of Amsterdam with Ana. We walked through the wonderful Saturday markets and stopped for apple pie at Winkels. It was the best pie I ever had! We took a ferry across the IJ river to the former factory area that has been transformed to a working space for artists with restaurants and night life re-vitalizing the area. I am very glad I was able to see so many places with Toms Travels that I would not have been able to see on my own.

Tulip and Windmill tour. I don't know where to begin. It all started with my many emails with Tom before we left for Amsterdam. He was so full of enthusiasm and friendliness I wanted to hire him to hang out with us for the whole of our trip. In the end we had one happy day with Jacky, who showed us tulips, hyacinths, small towns, and windmills. She took us to an amazing pancake house, fed us yummy food, and regaled us with stories. By the end of the day we were all happy and exhausted. Jacky went the extra mile, introducing us to people, answering my many questions about the history of the Netherlands, laughing with my quiet but quirky family. I couldn't have asked for more. Seeing Holland that way made our trip so much richer. I hope we can get back to Amsterdam. If we do, our first call will be to Tom. Thank you Tom and Jacky! PS...We are loving our Edam cheese, but I wish we had brought back some of your special liquorice.

The best way to experience Amsterdam!. My husband and I had the pleasure of taking two tours with Toms travel tours while in Amsterdam. After reading all the rave reviews I knew they were the company we would use for our explorations! The first tour was a 4 hour walking tour with Toms lovely wife Ana. She brought us all over Amsterdam and was so knowledgeable and kind! Ana is a Professor of Euroean history so you can only imagine how interesting it was to walk around with her around the city while learning so much about the history and culture. She told us things and pointed out places and architectural knowledge of the city we would have never learned on our own. The next day Tom picked us up at our hotel and we were off for our countyside excursion! We started the tour with the famous flower garden Keukenhof and it was great having him there to guide us all around the enormous gardens all while taking beautiful photos of us and the gardens. (Tom is a former professional travel photographer!! This was a huge perk as anyone who has ever traveled as a couple knows that getting enough pictures of you and your significant other without the embarssing selfie stick is a challenge!) After the gardens Tom took us to a beautiful old windmill for another photo op and history lesson! From there we went to the beautiful suburban town of Broek in Waterland that I fell in love with! We had lunch in a charming small local pancake (crepe) restaurant that Tom and Ana recommended, it was incredible!! From there we went to the fishing village of Edam which was so picturesque!! Tom was an amazing guide! He was fun and friendly and so knowledgable! He quickly felt like an old friend! I can't say enough good things about Tom and Ana! The tours with them was the highlight of our weeklong trip in the Netherlands and London! Do not hesitate to book with them!!! Thanks again Tom and Ana for an experience we will never forget and the beautiful photographs to cherish for years to come!!

Tom's Travel Tours is your best start in Amsterdam. Contacted Tom van der Leij and asked about scheduling a tour. They have a great questionnaire that is really helpful in letting them know about your interests, dislikes, time, physical challenges (KNEE!) and other important info. Tom gets back to you ASAP with some recommendations and some info to help you determine what you would like to do. We went with the introductory tour, an three-hour walking tour with Ana, one of Tom's associates, the afternoon that we arrived in Amsterdam.Ana was just great. Met us at the hotel, she was on time, we were on time, and off we went. We walked, rested, talked about the history, about restaurants and museums. Ana was great in guiding us and in providing helpful tips and hints. Amsterdam is VERY easy to get around in using public transportation but there were some little things that helped us even more. Ana had a great sense of humor and could not have been a better introductory guide for us and our four days in Amsterdam. I highly recommend reaching out to Tom and his people if you are going as they are very helpful, really glad to see you, and will keep you from wasting time while in Amsterdam. My wife and I talked about our time with Ana and it didn't feel like an introductory tour....it felt like a local friend walking us around on our first visit to the city in which they happened to live. That's how it should be done.

Great day in Opende. My husband and I had booked a day trip with Tom to visit his grandfathers old house and possibly any family still there. Tom over exceeded our expectations. With the little information we gave him, he managed to find the plot of land, knocking on doors and asking questions for us. We were also able to find a relative and had coffee with them, using Tom as a translator when needed. And we were able to find family gravestones at a local church. On the way back to Amsterdam he tried to fit in some extra sight seeing. We were just a bit too early for tulips but saw some, and walked fields of crocuses. We also stopped at a windmill and a water dike.Tom was not only a great tour guide explaining and answering all and any questions we had, but he was also an amazing photographer including pictures in our package with him. It was nice being able to enjoy your surroundings and not worry about taking pictures. And the pictures he took were amazing. He definitely has an eye for it. He also suggested a few places to eat in Amsterdam for our last night which we used and experienced one of the best dinners we've ever had. I, myself was 7 months pregnant during this trip and Tom took all the care to make sure I was comfortable, and had as many bathroom breaks as needed. Snacks, water, and beer for my husband. Although a private tour can be a bit pricey, Tom is worth every penny and we would suggest his service to all who are looking to do an out of the box tour.Tom we already miss your cheerfulness and wish you the best.Your friends from Canada

Beautiful Photography and Learning!. Tom's tour was fantastic! Tom met my girlfriend and I at our hotel and first spent a few minutes teaching us about the different functions of our compact cameras. Then we walked around Amsterdam and Tom showed us good places to take pictures and also took a lot of us as we strolled through the city, some posed and some natural - then sent them all to me shortly after. He also explained a lot of the history of Amsterdam as we made our way through different areas.This is exactly what I was looking for. Anyone can walk around with you and take pictures (and Tom was great with that too), but the best part was learning how to use our cameras properly and figuring out how to take the right shots and use the light appropriately. This is something that will stick with us and really help us to get the most out of our trips going forward. I would definitely recommend Tom!

Wow!. We just had a terrific day with Jacqueline. We started at Keukenhof, drove to Edam and ended with a glass wine by the sea. She was very informative, set a pace that was perfect for us and we laughed a lot. Just a great day!!! B

Wonderful day out of the city. Tom picked us up for a 1 day tour to the countryside. It was a private tour for my husband and myself. When we started to talk about the day, Tom realized that we had not seen part of the city and he offered to show us around, even though it was not part of the tour. The trip to Edam, the Windmills, and the countryside was a highlight of our time in Amsterdam. He has traveled around the world and his knowledge about both the country and other parts of the world was wonderful. Thanks for a great day.

Lovely day out of Amsterdam. April 9 2016, 2 couples after visiting Amsterdam during 2 days, we took a privet tour with Tom to see the tulips blooming, wind mills and bike few hours.We enjoyed very much the tulips fields, biking in and near Bergen and learned a lot about Holland geography, history and infrastructures.Tom was a great guide!

Lovely Dutch countryside and Tulip Tour. We reserved for a private tour and were thrilled with every aspect of our day. Our guide was attentive, friendly and impressively knowledgable of all things Dutch. We were taken in a van north to see early tulips, hyacinth and daffodils. By the end of the tour we had also visited windmills, had lunch in a very old pancake house, and visited a clog and cheese making shop. It was a full and memorable day and worth every euro.

A Wonderful Dutch Countryside Experience. I contacted Toms Travel Tours about a tour for a one day tour Amsterdam. We were only in Amsterdam for three days, so we wanted to make the most of our time there. He promptly sent us a detailed list of choices. We chose to do the countryside tour. We were picked up by Jackie who is extremely pleasant and has the gift of gab. She was a very good driver (seems like a weird comment, but I get nervous with some people driving, ask my husband). Jackie tailored our tour to what we wanted to do and was very flexible. We visited Marken, Volendam, Edam, the Beemer cheese factory and Zaanse Shans. There were so many special things that Jackie showed us that you could only see and experience with someone with her caliber of knowledge and outgoing personality. You can tell she loves what she does, and that's why she is such a good tour guide. The wine, beer and snacks were the icing on the cake. We had a great time! Thank you Jackie and Tom's Travel Tours!

Private tour by Toms Travel. We arranged for Toms Travel to arrange a few private tours for us. The tour guides; Andre, Jacky, Ana and Tom, were all very friendly and punctual. They are flexible and adapt to changes that we requested. They are not very particular with the timing of the tour and accommodated requests for diversions. The trip to Keukenhof was the best as it was nice day out seeing the tulips and other flowers in bloom. However, we could have gone to more places like Harlem which we understand was a nice place. But overall, it was an enjoyable trip.

Dutch Countryside Tour -- A Must See!. Tom’s Travel Tours came highly recommended by Trip Advisor, so we decided to try it out. We went on the Dutch Countryside Tour ( Marken, Volendam, Edam and Zaanse Schans) just a week ago ( late March ) with Jackie and could not have enjoyed it more! A visit to Amsterdam is not complete with an excursion to the countryside to the north, and Jackie was a wonderful guide. She was warm, entertaining and knowledgeable, we really felt at home with her. First, she picked us up from our hotel, and gave us a whirlwind tour of Amsterdam, giving us a historical and cultural background of the Netherlands ( like why is it sometimes called Holland? ) , why the Dutch are so friendly and pragmatic ( if you had to rely on your neighbors to prevent your home from being flooded every day you would be too !) and how such a tiny nation with almost no natural resources became the World power in the 1600s ( industrial espionage, religious freedom, the sawmills, and a pluckiness brought about by centuries of fighting against the water), then we went on to Marken. Marken is a sleepy and cozy, ex-fishing village ( there are only about 3 fishermen left, according to Jackie ), which is primarily a residential area now ( you can only own a house in Marken if you have associations with Marken ) not a tourist trap like neighbouring Volendam. We went into a wonderful gift store ( the first gift store in Marken, opened up by an old granny some 70 or 80 years ago who discovered that she made more money selling gifts on the side to American tourists than her rooming house business ) where the current proprietor ( a really nice and friendly fellow ) showed us how to tell “real” Royal Delft porcelain from “fake” ones. It was drizzling and windy, but the town was so lovely, we just shrugged off the weather and went all around with Jackie as a guide ( she has very good friends in Marken ). Then it was off to the “tourist trap” of Volendam, but only because it had really good smoked eel ( not bad, but I think I like teriyaki eel better ) and pickled herring ( like kimchi, definitely an acquired taste ) , our young son enjoyed a croquette from the local Febo chain, and we saw a real Herring Boat. At Edam we had tea, and enjoyed a walk down town, to try different cheeses ( finally buying a small “wheel” of Baby Edam) , went to an old-time sweet shop ( where our son loaded up on different kinds of sour gummi bears) and went to the best bakery in Edam ( I can personally attest to the excellent quality of their almond tarts). Edam is very scenic, and tranquil, as if from a different time, like the postcards of a sleepy European village you often see. Jackie seemed to know almost all the shop owners there, so they were very friendly and accommodating. Then finally it was off to the Zaanse Schans to see the Windmills. Without a doubt, visiting an actual working windmill was the highlight of the trip – there are at least half a dozen you can choose from, each with its own history, function and name. We went into Het Jonge Schaap ( "The Young Sheep"). Het Jonge Schaap is the only working sawmill, originally built in the late 1600s, demolished in the last century and “rebuilt” sometime in the last 15 years as a cultural preservation project. Although the winds were not very strong, we actually saw it at work, sawing a huge tree trunk! The people running the mill (all volunteers) were really friendly and told us that the mill was actually “profitable” and explained (as the saws were running) how everything worked. We also saw a Chocolate Museum, and tasted roasted cocoa beans ( Jackie said that while the Belgians might think they have the best chocolates in the world, all their cocoa comes from the Netherlands! ) and a Wooden Shoe factory. Overall the Dutch Countryside Tour was quite exhausting, lasting almost 8 hours, but very, very enjoyable. Thanks for the wonderful tour Jackie!

A wonderful day at Marken and beyond. We had a wonderful (albeit chilly) day touring with Jackie to visit beautiful Marken, Volendam and the windmill area. Jackie was fabulous - she had deep historical knowledge, and gave us a true local insight not only into the sites but to life in Holland. She was fun, engaging and a true pleasure to spend the day with!!

A highlight of our trip to The Netherlands!. We booked Tom's tours for both the City Walking Tour and the Countryside Tour. Both were excellent and were a highlight of our trip. We are a family of 5 (with 3 teenage girls) and the tour was an excellent balance of information and fun. Ana took us on our walking tour, and by the end we were sad to say goodbye to her -- we felt like we had made a new friend! She provides information in such a casual, yet informative way that all of us learned a great deal. Our girls tend to "soak in" information and then process it later, so for the rest of the trip we heard them talk about the walking tour and the Countryside Tour. We were lucky to have Tom himself guide us through the countryside. He knows that our kids love animals, so we visited a dairy farm, met cows and calves, and then met a very smart pig at a cheese & clog shop. The tour was well paced, and Tom is a wonderful guide. He is a professional photographer, so we ended up with incredible photos of our adventure. He also has a relaxed and conversational style, so that you feel like you are being led by a family friend and not a guide. Both Ana and Tom provide snacks and refreshments, so we never felt tired or grumpy. We highly recommend both of these tours. You might not think you need the walking tour of Amsterdam, but I felt like it gave us a view of the city that we'd only get if we lived there for a long time. Both tours made us want to return to The Netherlands! We left the US thinking "Is a week too long for Amsterdam?" and the answer was a resounding "NO!!" from all of us. Our kids have asked us to look into moving there--that was how great the vacation was and how much the tours contributed to their understanding of the culture. Thank you, Tom and Ana!

Friesland Tour. Tom's Travel Tours deserves the highest rating! Tom was fantastic--weeks before, during, and after our tour. Tom was extremely responsive via email--we must've had a dozen exchanges creating the perfect itinerary and answering my questions (including interpreting some 19th century Dutch handwriting for me).We hired Tom to take us to Friesland, where my husband's great grandfather was born before coming to the US. I researched some things unique to our family history (property my husband's family owned in the 1800s, where family members were buried, etc.) and mentioned it to Tom via email. He then went above and beyond and arranged for the church to be open for us to see AND spoke to the current homeowners of one of the properties my husband's ancestors owned so we could take a look inside! Tom even offered to contact people living in the town with the same last name as us to meet while we would be in the town. On top of all of that, Tom is a professional photographer and documented our entire time together. I had mentioned to Tom before we arrived in Amsterdam via email that I also really wanted to see tulips (or some flowers) in the ground, even though I knew we were a few weeks early. He made a special detour on our way back to Amsterdam and we searched and searched for flowers and he delivered! Not only did we stop at the first patch of flowers we saw, but he kept looking and we stopped at least another two times! Our tour with Tom was the highlight of our time in The Netherlands and we are so glad that we found him on Tripadvisor (and that he was available). Just book it and you'll see for yourself!

Tour of amsterdam. I had a wonderful tour of different places in Amsterdam with Tom. I have lived my whole life in Amterdam and he still managed to show me places I had never seen before. He is an amazing, lovely and funny host. I highly his recommend tours.

EXCELLENT TOURGUIDE WITH OWNER TOM. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TOURS WITH TOM. tom took us for a day through all the neighborhoods and spoke of all the wonders of his city. we went to a market and tasted all the dutch specialties, we took the ferry to see the nord etc. we had tom line up a special art consultant who took us through the museums on our private tour. my teen kids now love art as it was informative , fun and 1.5 hours. tom is organized, fun to be with and the best part ishe is pro photographer and he takes candid shots of you all day and sends you the photos. they are amazing. what an unexpected bonus.

AWESOME!. Ana came early to fetch us from our apartment. It was our first time in Amsterdam therefore I requested her to fetch us as we might get lost getting our way to the bike rental shop. On our way to the shop, she bring us to a street market and had some local pastries which was very nice. (we could not get it anywhere else on any other day!) After we get our bike, she brought us to a lot of places which I dont think I will visit if we were to explore on our own. We even took a ferry to go over to the north area which was more peaceful than the city and we had our cup of coffee in a very cool container cafe! Ana wouldn't stop talking & we had to keep on catching up with her, which is good! We learn a lot of things about the city, the people and their culture. We are six ladies and we felt very comfortable with Ana, especially when she brought us to the red light district. (which I requested as I did not know what to expect there but with Ana around, we felt safe! Hehe!) The tour is very flexible right from the start when I emailed Tom and Ana. Although they have their own route for that four hours of tour, they were flexible when I requested on some places of interest which we would like see. I would definitely recommend this tour to any of my friends whom going over to Amsterdam!

Outstanding Tour Company. Tom was able to tailor our excursions to accommodate a family member who uses a wheelchair. He spent a lot of time emailing back and forth with me to ensure he addressed every single detail of our tours to ensure we wouldn't encounter any challenges or obstacles once we arrived in Amsterdam. Tom and his guides were exceptionally professional, knowledgeable, patient and friendly. Tom put together a wonderful package that included transfers to and from the airport to our hotel, full-day excursion to Bruges, Belgium, full-day tour of the Dutch countryside and a half-day walking tour of Amsterdam. Thanks to Tom we were able to really make the most of our trip to Amsterdam. We will most certainly call on Tom again the next time we visit The Netherlands.
Great countryside trip. 7 of us -- teens to 70s -- spent a wonderful day visiting interesting and picturesque sites with Tom . He is very professional, knowledgeable and fun. I highly recommend it.

A perfect day in the countryside outside of Amsterdam. Our day with Tom and his associate was the highlight of our three day stay in Amsterdam! A terrific visit to a windmill lived in and operated by a friend of Tom's with a personal tour of the facility by the caretaker who lives there was extraordinary. The fishing and other villages that we visited were charming. The restaurant in Edam where we enjoyed our lunch in was outstanding. We would never have found such a spot were it not for our knowledgeable guides. There was not a dull moment the entire day. A feature we all enjoyed was the tasty array of fresh fruit, cheeses, cookies and beverages that Tom provided for our snacking pleasure. I would heartily recommend Tom's Tours to anyone without reservation. We were a group of 11 adults visiting Amsterdam as a "topper" to our ski trip in Verbier.

Relaxed and very friendly tour of Amsterdam!. We had a lovely tour of the countryside with Tom learned how cheese and clog are made while also sampling delicious chocolate. Tom is very passionate about being a guise and worked with our pace. We have 4 children and he made it quite enjoyable for all of them given their various ages. Our tour also included Delft which is a must if you're visiting Amsterdam. He also made reservations at a quaint little restaurant with delicious food. Tom also provided us with snacks including cheese, beer, soft drinks for the kids and even prosecco for my wife. The following day we had a tour with his lovely wife, Anna, who is a history professor of the center of Amsterdam. It was a great way to learn the prospective of how Amsterdam was created and the reasoning behind what has now become the central hub of Europe. Anna also made reservations at a great pancake house restaurant which is a must to try when you visit Amsterdam. We also had a great glass of Gluwein, a warm red wine made only around Christmas time which was absolutely delicious. Our family travels quite a bit internationally and I must say Tom's tours have been the best that we have ever experienced!

Fantastic Countryside Tour with Tom. My family and I had Tom for our tour to the countryside of Amsterdam. We had visited the town of Marken, Edam & Zaanse Schans. It was one of the best tour we ever had and Tom deserve a 5 - star for his knowledge of the city and his initiative.During the tour, Tom stopped us at a few beautiful neighbourhoods which were beyond of our pre planned itentary. We were glad he took the initiative so that we can see more of the countryside. He even brought along some wine and snacks for us! Tom takes very beautiful pictures which he emailed us a few days after the tour. We couldn't have asked for more from his tour. I will recommend anyone visiting Amsterdam to take a day out to see the countryside. With only a short drive, you can see a completely different side of Amsterdam. Tom definitely did a good job in organising this day trip for us.我和我的家人非常满意Tom为我们安排到阿姆斯特丹郊外的一日游。Tom不只对所有景点非常了解,也能拍出非常漂亮的照片。让我们收益不少!

Friendly tour guides made our tour complete.. Simon, a young & ambitious tour guide.We had great time with him during the tour eating Must Try Foods & Drinks. Jacqueline was our outskirts tour guide, another knowledgeable tour guide..

Great photo tour. We had already stayed a week in Amsterdam and toured with several guides before engaging a photo tour with Tom. He is a professional photographer and a real natural with the camera. While teaching us a few tricks with the camera, he still managed to incorporate a tour of old Amsterdam and the medieval courtyards (Begijnhof) in the process. We also managed to catch a beautiful sunset at an old shipyard in noord Amsterdam for great pictures. It was all in all a memorable photo tour!

For locals and tourists!. Being born and raised in a place you often develop your own fossilized perspective. Through friends I met Tom and took a tour through Amsterdam and I loved being (gently) kicked out of my own comfort zone. He graciously and humorously led me (us) through my hometown, showing me tons of places I never knew about. Tom’s tours are for locals or a tourists, there’s no difference! We all wind up with a great experience and definitely a new perspective

Great overview of Amsterdam. For our weekend in Amsterdam we had planned an afternoon with Tom Tavel Tours. Our guide (Saskia) showed up 15 mins early and asked us if we had lunch already before leaving. Some of us didn't, so she was flexible enough to guide us to a quick luch stop before starting the tour itself.
