She was very excited, kept it funny all the time as requested and was able to respond to every little or stupid question we had. I'd recommend this tour to everyone I know if they are new to Amsterdam.

Perfect program and guide!. We had a nice program custom made by Tom for our yearly team event. It was very nicely composed with a very good mix of activities and relaxation. We had a very good guide who really knew Amsterdam very well and she managed to keep our team (15 IT-guys) interested from A to Z during the whole afternoon.

Mudwalking was great!. We had a wonderful time mudwalking. It was a fantasitc programm. We found and ate oysters and really enjoyed nature. The proffesional, friendly and enthousiastic crew made this a trip to remember!

Fabulous time with an amazing private guide. Wow. Tom and his guide were just amazing to work with. We arranged a custom tour, focusing on Kinderdijk, a UNESCO heritage site with 19 working windmills. Before our trip, Tom helped with everything from helping us find a hotel to finding a historic place in Amsterdam to taste genever. (Wynand Fockink has been a tasting room since 1679!) He answered emails quickly, and was able to give us ideas we would never have known about.For our tour, our guide, Henk, met us in an sparkling clean late model comfortable sedan. We had made special arrangments to be picked up at the Hook of Holland, in the south, after our ferry from the UK. Since we had only a short stay in the Netherlands, we wanted to maximize our time. Henk took such great care of us! We started the day with a koffie in a local bakery, and this was a time we were very glad to have a native speaker with us. Then, in Kinderdijk, he assisted us with the tickets, the boat ride (which ended up being private, too) and even defied the parking laws to pick us up directly at the end, saving us quite a bit of time. He was fully stocked with drinks and snacks, too.We proceeded to Amsterdam and had a narrated driving tour, stopping several times to examine interesting architecture and beautiful views. Henk is extremely knowledgeable and pointed out many interesting things. He's also led quite an intriguing life, and his personal stories were fascinating. And I was so impressed with his driving - Amsterdam is full of narrow streets, an infinite number of bicyclists, and agressive pedestrians, and I would never want to drive there! At the end of the day, he dropped us directly at our hotel. Another reason we loved this tour was the flexibility. We made several changes as we went along, and it all fit perfectly. Obviously, a private tour is more expensive, but it saved us some money on trains and buses. The real value for us, though, was letting us see and do so much more than we would have been able to do otherwise. I would absolutely recommend Tom's Travel Tours, and hope to be able to return to the Netherlands soon to see more wonderful things.

Enjoyable two days with our tour guide Henk!. We spent two full days with Henk which was such a great learning experience. He was extremely knowledgable and made the tours so much fun and enjoyable. Our first day we visited the countryside and made several stops including a cheese factory, windmills and quaint little towns. Lunch was great, as well as the coffee break we took along the way. Day two we started in Rotterdam seeing the sights then ended at the indoor market place where we had lunch. We continued on to Delft and visited the factory which was definitely worth seeing then walked around the town before heading to The Hague which was very impressive. Tom was wonderful to deal with and always got back to us promptly. We highly recommend this tour company to anyone visiting the area. Thanks again Henk for such an enjoyable two days!Barbara & Mike NC, USA

Fantastic. Did a 4 hour tour of Amsterdam with Karen. It was so much fun. Karen is one of the best tour guides we have ever had. She is knowledgeable, interesting and very social. We spent all day with her the next day in the countryside. Thru no fault of hers we had to end our day 2 hrs short due to a problem with our river cruise. We suggested skipping lunch! Karen instead brought us to a great shop in Edam where we bought sandwiches which were delicious and ate them on the fly so we didn't miss any part of the tour. It was money well spent. I would absolutely hire tom's tours again and request Karen for a tour guide. She was terrifuc

Netherlands - Amsterdam, Delft, The Hague, Countryside. Hank was our guide for 2 days. We had a lot of things we wanted to see and do in 2 days!! First day we traveled to the countryside to see windmills, a small cheese store/factory, and various other towns along the way. We asked for a van size vehicle which was provided (smoke free) due to the fact I have motion sickness. It was a lovely drive. Hank knew most of the information. The next day we went to the Delft factory which was amazing and highly recommend. We walked around the small town near Delft. The Hague was also lovely to see the parliament building. We did not stay long since we wanted to get back to Amsterdam to go to a museum before it closed. However, I did get to see the King drive right past me in his car on the way to Parliament. Hank did a very nice job and I would recommend him. I just would like to know a bit more details about main buildings and history in places that the company takes us. The company was very professional and Tom was excellent in communicating all the information to us. Price was reasonable although anyone should know that private guides/cars are always more expansive than a "big bus" tour with a large group of people. We wanted a private guide/car and were fine with the price since we wanted to do our own thing but would not go higher in price. I absolutely would use this company again!!! Tom's knowledge and prompt responses are great!!!! LJ Abrams - Indianapolis, Indiana USA

Mud walking tour to Ameland!. In September Toms Traveltours Amsterdam organised a mud walking tour to Ameland from Holwerd with 2 nights staying on the beautiful island Ameland. We had two guides who took us through the wonderful world of mud walking. We ate oysters en mussels fresh from the sea. We travelled approximately 11 km.When we arrived we got a warm welcome from the owners of the house where we stayed for the weekend.Through the weekend Toms Traveltours Amsterdam took us to al kind of neat places on Ameland.Thanks for this lovely weekend!

Toms Travel Tours - the best !. Forget the rest, Tom's the best!. From start to finish, Tom and Karen from this tour group were spot on. There was great communication regarding the types of tours offered from the first email. We were a group of 10 who wanted a customized country-side tour so he was able to get a mini bus and great guide, Karen, to take us all over the beautiful northern countryside. We saw the small village of Marken and the picturesque Broek in Waterland. We were able to sample (and buy) Dutch cheeses and see how Dutch wooded clogs are made. We also visited a working windmill with a guided tour. Our full all day tour ended with a surprise picnic of dutch cheeses, chocolates, wine and other treats. Thanks, Karen, for a great day!

A memorable day in the Dutch countryside. We wanted to see the countryside and booked based on Trip Advisor reviews. The process was smooth and Tom was prompt in answering emails. Our guide Henk picked us up and we had a beautiful day to see the small towns. We loved Edam and spent a lot of time walking before lunch. Henk was very knowledgeable and we learned a lot about the area. Lunch was terrific. We saw several other small towns and then the windmills. It was very interesting and quite picturesque. It was a highlight of our trip and I can highly recommend this to others.

Fantastic personal tour. When was really knowledgeable, from the neighborhood, and spoke English perfectly. He customize the tour to our needs and was really fun to hang out with for the day. We felt like this was a total value. I saw a side of Amsterdam I had not seen before. I highly recommend Tom's Tours:

Dutch Country/Villages and Amsterdam walking tour. We so much enjoyed both tours! Very diverse from one another and both guides were very knowledgeable, helpful and fun to spend time with. Would strongly recommend to friends, family and when we return will call again!Sandy and Dan from Alaska
A rainy day in Amsterdam. Jackie was excellent and enthusiastic providing a personal tour. Toms Travel Tours provided a great expererience

Highly recommend. I contacted Tom based largely on the good Tripadvisor reviews. We wanted to do a tour that wasn't on his website at the time - to Delft, The Hague and Madurodam. Tom's reply was immediate, welcoming and enthusiastic. He planned a tour specifically for us. Two other private tour companies I contacted did not seem keen to do anything other than their standard tours. Our guide was Henk, who was a terrific guide - very knowledgeable, friendly, and easy to talk to. He picked us up at our hotel right on time, and during the one hour drive to Delft we chatted about Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and the places we were passing. The tour of the Royal Delft factory was very good, followed by a walk around the old town of Delft (a very picturesque town). Henk was very considerate of my 86 year old mother, always parking as close as possible to where we wanted to go, to minimise the walking. After Delft, we visited The Hague and Madurodam - both very interesting, and well worth seeing.We will definitely contact Tom's travel again before our next visit to Amsterdam, and hope that Henk will be available to take us somewhere different.

WE HAD A FABULOUS DAY WITH KAREN. We toured with Karen on September 18th to the country side outside of Amsterdam. We were a group of 9 people and Tom had arranged a very comfortable van, driver and our guide, Karen. The pace was excellent for those in our group and we thoroughly enjoyed the various smaller fishing villages, a cheese demonstration, excellent lunch and walking tours of the smaller towns. It definitely gave us a different view of the Netherlands. Everyone in our group would highly recommend using Tom's Tours. The tour was personalized, efficient, and met all our desires. Karen shared not only facts, but her insights and a great snack including drinks on the ride back into the city.We thank you for a great time! We will definitely recommend Tom's Tours to our friends!

Magical mudwalking tour. If you want to see Holland's nature at it's best, eat fresh oysters you picked yourself, and are in for a bit of exercise, you can't miss the mud walking tour Tom offers. You cross the Waddenzee when the tide is low (ebb) and Tom will make sure everything is arranged once you set feet on the island of Ameland (nice hotel, good food, bikes).It really was an amazing experience.

More Than A Tour. I've traveled around the world and taken a number of tours but Tom is the only tour guide who has driven me to return for another tour. Last year, it was a tour of Amsterdam and most recently a visit to the Dutch countryside to see the windmills and the beautiful historical village of Edam. Both are not to be missed! Tom is the most well traveled person I've ever met, so in addition to being extremely knowledgeable about the history and culture of his hometown of Amsterdam and the surrounding areas, he has amazing travel stories to share. He's also a renowned photographer who will take plenty of professional photos during the tour which will last as an unforgettable remembrance of the day.

Superb! one of the best. I am an avid traveler and in each new city I try to get a guide to take me to see the highlights of the place I am visiting. I usually do a bit of research and work with the guide on planning the tour. For this visit I had no time at all and left 2 half days up to Tom to design. My husband and I couldn't have been happier! The first day, Anna, Tom's wife took us on a walking tour of the Amsterdam's city center. We not only walked away with knowledge about the architecture and culture of the city but she told us many other places to go if we had time. Day 2 was a half day with Tom driving to places in North Holland. He took us to see a working windmill, a beautiful fishing village, an amazing town Edam, and drove us through many other towns along the way. my husband and I will always remember Tom and Anna (and Tom took pictures of us the entire time which he shared after we got home). We highly recommend this tour. You will not regret it.

Outside and Inside of Amsterdam. We had a wonderful day exploring some of the areas just outside of Amsterdam (my favorite was Edam) and then a walking tour inside. Our tour ended with a boat ride through the canals. It couldn't have been a more perfect day. We so appreciated the "tailored tour" and our guide was fantastic - full of energy and enthusiasm!

Wadden Sea Mudwalking to Ameland. I would definitely recommend Toms Travel Tours. Tom and Ana guided us on a wonderful weekend. Mudwalking has been on my bucket list for quite some time already, but because of the treacherous tides, guidance by a professional guide is required. Walking through the mud was a lot of fun and during the 4 hour walk over the bottom of the Wadden Sea we encountered oysters, mussels, and seals!!On Ameland we displaced ourselves by bike, which matches the relaxing rhythm of the island. The weekend was smoothly organized and we got introduced to a lot of Ameland's hidden gems. We stayed in a spacious accommodation with a lot of privacy and close by the main attractions. Ameland has very long beaches and beautiful dunes and nature.

Mudflat hiking to dutch island Ameland, Wadden Sea. Had a great long weekend mudflat hiking to the dutch Island Ameland on the other side of the Wadden Sea. What a beautiful trip! We left Amsterdam in the morning to be at the Friesland coast at low tide. Tom arrange a professional Wadden Sea guide to help us crossing. What an experience. Beautiful nature, mud, sandbanks, oysters, mussels. Sometimes deep water to go through. After the hike of about 5 hours we still had plenty of time to spent on the island. Cycling here was great. Lot of nature, simple but good accomodation. A fully active holiday in just 3 days :-), great!

Fantastic day with karen. Karen was informative and presented a fun and educational day for the 8 of us on the beginning of a fun European trip. Some rode bikes in the countryside and some enjoyed the wooden shoe demonstration. Very enjoyable day. Thank you for the memories

Mudwalking to Ameland. Last weekend I made the most amazing mudwalking trip to Ameland with my friends. Toms Travel Tours arranged the whole weekend for us and it was superb.We met Tom and Ana at Holwerd, which is the place all the way up in the North of Holland from where we left. They were both very kind and knowledgeable. Mudwalking is a specific kind of walking trip that's only possible in some parts of the world, with the Waddenzee in the Netherlands to be the most famous spot.We continued on a walking tour of about 4 hours through mud, and wading through hip-deep water. A true adventure!On Ameland everything was organised beautifully. Tom had arranged everything for us, from the comfortable accomodation to our daily outings to the beach, lighthouse and woods. We got lots of information about nature and natural history which was very interesting, and had a lot of fun outings, with the car-sailing on the beach to be the most exciting.This trip is very highly recommended, as are our guides! Both Tom and Ana were a pleasure to be around. Be sure to take the trip in he warmer months though! I can't imagine how horribly cold it must be to wade hip-deep through water in the winter. So definitely a summer-outing.

Toms travel. We booked 3 separate things- a tour of Amsterdam, a visit to the outlying area and a bike tour.The first 2 trips were with Karen. She was a wealth of information and very pleasant! My grown children went on the bike trip. They had a great time. They reported that they totally enjoyed it and Jac was very flexible. The ride was originally scheduled for the countryside, but they wanted to stay in the city. Jac changed her plans- they had a wonderful time.

Convenient, Thoughtful, Informative and Enjoyable. We were met at the airport upon the arrival of our flight from the US by Karen for a tour of Holland's countryside. Karen was very helpful and a wealth of information about Holland, the Dutch language and also spoke flawless English. We appreciated her company as much as anything we would see. We visited a few small villages, medium sized towns and functional windmills. In short it was a perfectly planned day for myself and a friend to learn about Holland and their battle with the sea. We were dropped off at our hotel at the end of the day on time.The communication prior to our arrival was also exceptional. An appropriate level of information was gathered to make sure that the day was as fulfilling as it could be. Replies were prompt and there was never a doubt that we would be met upon our arrival. Being able to pay the deposit via PayPal invoice was yet another nice touch.I would strongly endorse the use of Tom's Travel Tours for your tour needs in Holland.

Wonderful Day. We had a great experience with an all day trip with Jac! She took out to Marken, Edam and the UNESCO windmill sight. She introduced us to the miller there and he was so interesting to talk to. The lunch by the canal was delicious and as we ate we watched the bridge keeper raise the bridge so a boat could go through. Jac was very knowledgeable about history and current events.

Walking tour of Amsterdam. We met our German speaking guide, Katylisa, at the central train station, right on time. We exchanged information and proceeded our tour of Amsterdam. Kate was extremely knowledgeable about all of the historic and present day situations in Amsterdam. She had done graduate work in the red light district and was involved in the changing of rules for sex workers.  She weaved present day Amsterdam with highlights from Golden Age as we walked through the various neighborhoods. We visited many famous sights and present day areas of social significance. Thoroughly impressed by her knowledge of new and old Amsterdam!!! I would highly recommend Tom's tour to anyone who wants a bit "more" of an insight to Amsterdam.

A day to remember. Karen took our family of five for a day trip outside of Amsterdam. Karen listened carefully to our questions and responded thoughtfully and in detail. Her enthusiasm for history and interest in other cultures is evident. It poured during lunch and part of the afternoon , so Karen went to the trouble to borrow loaner umbrellas from our lunch stop restaurant for our comfort. We learned so much about Dutch culture, and could not have asked for a better day.

Perfect Day !!. Wonderful day tour with Karen . She was warm , friendly and full of information regarding Amsterdam and Holland . She took us to the most beautiful villages that we would of never found on our own. Cheese tasting , wooden shoe "factory " and windmills . Ended the day with a perfect picnic with wine , cheese and chocolate . Expensive tour , but with every euro !! Tom was a pleasure to work with through e-mail .

Great day tour. We toured with Tom and Ana in early August. They customized the tour to our interests. They were concerned with our comfort and safety at all times. They prepared a nice lunch for us and provided snacks throughout the day. By all means, tour with them. We highly recommend Tom's Tours!

great photo tour with a great guy. We wanted to do a photo tour because our 17 year old son has developed an interest in photography. Tom was the perfect choice from start to finish. Booking the tour was so easy and he asked questions to make sure that he knew how to cater our tour for our needs. We did the night tour to get the great sunset photos. Tom took us all around the city and really interacted with both us and our son. He tried to teach him more about photography without making it a class but just making it fun. At the end of the tour, he took time to grab a drink with our family and just talk to us. We did a 14 day cruise after this and all agreed at the end, that this tour was our favorite.

Wonderful tours. Tom was quick to reply to emails, and mapped out the day on each of two tours. Karen was our guide, and she took us on an all-day countryside tour outside Amsterdam. We saw quaint homes and villages, and the inside of a windmill. It was a "touristy" excursion, but we did see and learn quite a bit. Karen led us on a 4-hour walking tour of the Jordaan and Dam Square the next day. Again, we saw a lovely part of the city and got all the tidbits of information.Karen was fun, knowledgeable and entertaining--the perfect host in an unfamiliar city. She kept a balanced pace for my group of 6, including myself, husband, two teens and my elderly parents. Thank you, Tom and Karen.

Expensive but worth it. We had a great time with Tom! He tailored the tour to our preferences and was very flexible based on the weather and time constraints. He also had great knowledge of little secrets, like a guided walk up the bell tower of a church. The snacks and drinks included were much more prolific than expected (cheese, chocolate, nuts, cookies). It seems minor but it just shows how much care goes in to the day spent with Tom. We had been on a bunch of private tours during this trip, but this one was clearly the best. He was so congenial and just a pleasure to spend the day with.

Personalized --- Flexible, In Depth, Unique!. We booked three tours - walking, biking and countryside with Tom's Tours for our family of five and all three were outstanding. The walking tour with Ava gave us the foundational information on Amsterdam and how the city was formed. Our daughter especially enjoyed the countryside tour with Tom --- it was really worth going further out to the working windmill. We climbed to the top of a church with spectacular views of the countryside. Our third tour was a bicycle tour in the north of Amsterdam ... we experienced artist spaces, reclaimed entrepreneurial space and the 3D printed house as well as the Jordon neighborhood.

Okay tour but expected much moer. Having used many private guides over years of travel we were looking forward to our Amsterdam experience based on the great reviews and emails with Tom. We were booked with Ana... as Tom had said... she has a degree in history and that was one of the main focuses for us. Ana is delightful... but was not a great tour guide for us. We lived near and worked in Wash DC for years. Her tour was as if I offered a tour in DC... yes, I could show you places others may not see, I could give you a brief history overview BUT I am not a trained tour guide. History? We asked about Ann Frank... she didn't have much to say. In answer to a question my hubby asked ... "that is what the internet is for". No mention of Van Gogh... really? If you only have one day in Amsterdam I would not recommend this tour... if you have several... maybe. If you are going outside of Amsterdam the reviews look stellar so maybe that would be a better use of this company. Perhaps since we had an incredible guide in London Ana just could not compare. For whatever reason, we were this was not a memorable tour for us.

Do not hesitate! Book Now!. My husband, 2 teenage children and I spent an unforgettable day in the countryside with Tom in early August. In the past, we have enjoyed private tours in Italy, Prague and Germany and can report from experience that Tom is by far the best guide we have had the pleasure to know. He is professional, knowledgeable, fun, funny and so easy to be with.We spent a 7+ hour day exploring the countryside, biking in Marken, climbing to the top of a church tower in Edam and touring a historic windmill. As others have mentioned, Tom is a professional photographer so having him take photos of our family documenting our day was an added bonus.I found Tom on Trip Advisor and was struck by the number of "excellent" reviews he had received. There is a reason that he deserves such accolades. Tom picked us up in his car (not overly spacious but certainly comfortable), and drove us to several towns in the countryside. We were offered yummy snacks, drinks, beer and wine throughout the day. When it was time to go he even gave my daughter and I a parting souvenir. These small touches and Tom's ability to shape a tour to meet our interests and abilities along with his charming personality really make Tom's Travel Tours a must for all visitors to Amsterdam. Honestly, do not think twice, just book it.

Wonderful tour of the countryside. My husband and I, together with our 1.5 y.o. son, travelled to Amsterdam for 4 days. We would like to spend a day to the scenic country side of the city so reached out to Toms Travel. Tom reverted to my email promptly with lots of attractive suggestions. He also gave me suggestions on where to visit in the city in addition to the proposed itinerary on the country side.Tom himself was our guide for our day trip. He had everything very well planned and explained the route to us on the map before we set of. The weather was not with us in the morning of our day trip but we managed to make use of the morning to visit some indoor places - cheese factory and the windmill indoor museum. The sky turned clear in the afternoon and Tom took us around to all the scenic places - we went back to Schermerhorn Polder where the windmill museum was at and took some beautiful pictures, and then to Edam, then Marken. All are beautiful villages. We spent some time walked around these villages at leisure and Tom took a lot of beautiful pictures for us (he is a professional photographer!). He had also prepared a lot of snacks and drinks for the toddler and for us. We are all very impressed with the tour, as well as the beautiful pictures that Tom took for us. Highly recommended!

Great Private Tour of Amsterdam and Holland. My wife , daughter (9) and I took two tours with Tom's company.. We really enjoyed them both. The walking tour with Ana was a great way to learn about the city . She answered all of our questions (and my daughter had a bunch!!!) and customized the tour to our pace (injecting a stop for coffee when we needed a break - with a 9 yr old we needed one !)..She was punctual,very polite and full of knowledge. Our second tour was with Karin..a day tour of the countryside...It was truly a memorable experience - Karin was great -we loved it and her. She was fun and informative. a great way to experience the Netherlands - with little time to do so...And she provided a special treat at the end of the day.. The tours were well set up- great stops ( loved Edam)..and the cheese factory..and the windmills...the tour company does a great job of planning and customizing..I highly recommend them..

Great Introduction to Amsterdam. July 20, 2015 My husband and I arrived from the States at 8am and met Ana later in the afternoon. We had never been to Amsterdam. (It was the kick-off city for our Viking River Cruise.) Ana was the perfect guide for us. She was very knowledgeable of the history of the city. She did a great overview of the city and took us to the important sights. We enjoyed seeing the out of the way courtyards in the residential area. We finished with a stop for a coffee and apple pie at one of her favorite places! Yum. We felt we had enough of a feel for the city after spending time with her that we didn't join the Viking-provided walking tour. We love Amsterdam and hope to return some day. Thank you ANA!

Excellent walking tour with Eva in Amsterdam. My wife and two kids (ages 10 and 12) had a lovely walking tour with Eva last week. We learned some details about the city, saw some very interesting hidden courtyards, and overall got an excellent feel for the city. Eva was great with our kids and was flexible with last minute timing changes.

Fun City Tour. We had Anna as our tour guide; We were late getting to our hotel and we were able to work it out so we could enjoy our tour. She was very knowledgeable about the history. We walked all around up steps so have your tennis shoes for sure. It was a 4 hour city tour. Great people to work with!!!

Terrific Tours of Amsterdam and the Countryside. Toms Travel Tours in Amsterdam deserves a top rating. I researched private tours in Amsterdam and contacted Tom by email. What a wonderful decision! Tom replied quickly and was ready to give us an excellent experience in The Netherlands. He wanted a little background about my grown children, my wife and me. He used this information to tailor our tours. The payment through PayPal was easy. He made certain that I had cell phone numbers for each guide, and the meeting places for each of our two tours was crystal clear.Our first tour was a countryside tour with Henk. He was a terrific guide! He had studied our profiles and made certain that we had the experiences we desired. He was not just a guide, but a very engaging individual. It was as if he were a friend we had not seen in a long time. He connected beautifully with everyone from 61 year old me to my 20 year old daughter. He is knowledgeable, patient, and kind. We encountered a strong storm. Henk changed the order of itinerary to make certain we had a meaningful experience. I would enjoy taking a tour with Henk again when I return to Amsterdam.Our second tour was with Esther. What a delightful and energetic woman! Once again, she knew about us and tailored our 4-hour Amsterdam walking tour to make certain we obtained the most from the experience. She knew history, architecture, and art. She showed us many “hidden treasures” we would have never seen if touring on our own. Again, I would enjoy having Esther guiding us through the Netherlands again, when we return.Of course, none of this would have been possible without the organizational skills of Tom van der Leij, the owner of Toms Travel Tours. His promptness at answering emails, his making certain we knew where to meet guides, and his employing superb guides make this a top-rated organization. The price is reasonable; the service is superb!!!!

Great family fun. Able to schedule a fantastic, last-minute bike tour for my family. Eva was a terrific host. A true test was that my teenage daughters said that it didn't feel like a 4 hour bike ride. That is saying alot! Definitely would recommend!

1 Day Outskirts Tour of Amsterdam on 28th Jul15. Toms Travel's services are very expensive. Even then we had a very good and interactive time with Katjalisa (our guide) though weather was not with us. She put all efforts to make best out of it specially going hour by hour weather predictions and planning as needed. She is a very warm, pleasant and engaging person. Edam, known for cheese, was a very colourful and beautiful village. We learnt about the cheese making process in a cheese shop look of which took us back in old times. We found Bergen beach, though we have visited many coastal areas around the world, very wide and flat. Drive itself to Bergen via Beemster Polder was very green and beautiful. Windmills at Schermerhorn Polder were picture postcard perfect. One of them was working too. Thanks Katjalisa for making our tour very pleasant.Thanks Tom n Ana for arranging our tour at a short notice and picking Katjalisa as our guide.

Efficent tour operator in Amsterdam.. We got a terrific experience dealing with Toms Travel. Email exchanging was efficient and the ground tour guide and all staff involving to our trip was very helpful.There were very flexible to made changes for our itinerary and made it happen in the best way. We love to see the city with Tom. He is very energetic and knowledgeable.Well-worth for a day trip, well-recommended agent !

Tom's Travel Tours Evauated by a Travel Agent. I travel a good bit, having logged in more than 1 million miles worldwide and have contracted with private English-speaking tour guides in many countries. I researched tripadvisor and Tom's Travel kept popping up as a recommended guide. My wife and I toured with Tom and his wife in Amsterdam, followed by a Viking River Boat Cruise down the Rhine in July, 2015 and I can say that they are some of the best guides I have used! I study and publish articles on travel and customer service and it was a pleasure to work with them for multiple reasons. He (1) communicates well prior to the trip; (2) is customer-driven and plans the venue around your needs: (3) is fun and flexible; (4) provides unique pleasures like wine, snacks, great cookies, bottled water, and unqiue treats; (5) is professional but casual; (6) speaks various languages; (6) is a native of the area; (7) is safety concious and prompt; (8) knows unique places to visit; and, (9) just a great person to be around. Book at least two days with him to realy see the area! Two detailed articles on my visit to Amsterdam with Tom Travel and the River Boat Rhine Cruise will be published in late August, 2015 and will be available on my non-profit website mikedubose.com

Great custom created tour!!. We had the pleasure of touring with Ana, a very knowledgeable and terrific guide. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour and the effort to maximize our 4 hours. If you desire to create your own tour, this group is a must. We asked if we could switch to bikes half way thru to cover more area and Ana said "absolutely". Thank you Ana!!

It was like seeing the Netherlands with a friend who lives there.... We took a full-day countryside tour with Tom and could not have had a better experience. Tom was responsive and thoughtful in the planning process (including answering other questions I had about Amsterdam), picked us up right on time and had us back exactly when he said he would, and most importantly, was such a delightful person to spend a day with. It really felt like Tom was our friend who was taking us around the countryside - we didn't feel like tourists with a guide. The day was perfectly planned, with no wasted time; we saw so much, but we never felt rushed. Tom took a lot of pictures and emailed us some really charming pictures of our day. The next day, we took a city tour with Ana which was also wonderful. We went off the beaten path and saw some of Amsterdam's neighborhoods and hidden courtyards, and had a delicious coffee break with apple pie. Both Tom and Ana are really considerate of their guests and pace the tour according to what we want to see. There is obviously a lot of work they put into planning the tours that you don't notice - and that's why their guests can have such a great time. I would recommend Tom and Ana to anyone and everyone looking for a private tour guide in Amsterdam.

Excellent way to spend a day!. We really wanted to see Amsterdam and thus spent much time on-line researching. Don't waste your time-just book with Toms Travel Tours! We booked a private tour and Tom was super fast and helpful during the planning process. We needed to see lots in one day and Tom was able to help us customize a tour of the countryside, Polder area, windmills and the city center. Our guide Jaq was lots of fun, very flexible, and full of great information. Additionally, she kept us well fed with stroopwaffles, yummy chocolates, delicious cheese, beer, champagne. What more could you ask for?! We had a blast spending the day with her while we learned all about The Netherlands past and present. I recommend Toms Travel Tours without hesitation. Book it- you'll be glad you did!

Wonderful Day in the Country. We had a fantastic day visiting Marken, Edam, the Polder, and windmills with Tom. He's a terrific guide: smart, easygoing, able to adapt the tour on the fly to our interests and needs.

visiting around amsterdam. we make a tour with Karen, our guide, to some towns near amsterdam.We spent all day, learning about cheese and special shoes tipically from Holland. We have lunch in a small town and we finish the day with a picnic admiring the views of the land of the country (polders). The day was GREAT. I couldnt put all the feelings in my poor english. THANK YOU KAREN!

Bicycle Tour around Northern Holland. I had a work trip to Europe (from the US) and decided to layover in Holland for a week for a bicycle tour. I somewhat blindly searched the internet for help and found Tom. His kindness and positive nature had an edge of magic to it. So the trip was on! He offered great support via email and Skype in the planning and routing for the trip. He even contacted me when I was silent for too long. When I arrived in Amsterdam we met up and he offered to store my other luggage, offered to lend me a tent... So all thumbs up!

Fantastic Experience. My family of four had a great two days with Ana and Tom at the end of June. They are a bit more expensive than some of the other tours I checked into, but it was well worth the price difference. You do get what you pay for. They treated my family of four more like old friends from out of town than the tour customers we were. I honestly cannot say enough positive things about Tom, Ana and their company. We started the first day with a pleasant walking tour of Amsterdam with Ana. We had never been to the city before and were a little worried about finding our meeting point with her. But before we could ask if Ana would meet us at the hotel, she offered to do so. The tour was around 3 hours of easy walking, and we were able to hit many of the highlights around the city including a nice little market Ana knew about, many lesser known courtyards, and traditional apple pie and coffee. Ana is a historian so you will get a ton of information about the history of Amsterdam too.The next morning Tom met us at our hotel for a day long countryside excursion. This was one of the highlights of our entire three week vacation. My 13 year old son told me on the way home that it had been his favorite day. Tom, like Ana, is a gracious host and very knowledgeable about his country. He planned the entire day around the very vague requests we had made and turned the trip into something special. We visited two really nice small villages including Edam, a working windmill, a 17th century church, saw a lot of beautiful scenery and the major waterworks north and east of the city and had a picnic for lunch. Tom drove 45 minutes north at the very end of the day so my some could see one of the large dykes there despite the tour running long and Tom expecting dinner guests that evening. Tom is also an accomplished, professional photographer, and he documented the day for us at no additional charge. The photos were great.We've done a lot of tours in Europe, but never one like Tom's. I highly recommend him.

Awesome tour!. My family had a one day layover in Amsterdam and Karen met us at our hotel and we had a 3+ hour walking tour. She was amazing, funny and very knowledgeable! She was professional and kept us entertained! I highly recommend Toms Travel Tours, they were excellent!!

Karen and the countryside provide an excellent day. Tom scheduled us with Karen, an extremely knowledgeable and likeable tour guide who works for him. Spending an entire day with a stranger can be tricky. The person needs to be in control and communicative but also easy to get along with. Karen was just that.  She took us to small villages, including the amazing Edam, where we had lunch on the canal at a wonderful restaurant; to a cheese and clog demonstration (yes, you can buy; no, we didn't feel pressured--it was all just fun and informative); to a working windmill, which we toured; and ended the day with a picnic she brought overlooking the polder (the reclaimed land, filled with animals and beautiful scenery). Snacks and drinks were available in her very comfortable van throughout the day.  Truly wonderful to get out of (lovely) Amsterdam to see Holland. Highly recommend. Not cheap, but how often will you have this opportunity? A trip highlight.

Pleasant and professional. Having read all the raving reviews we decided to go with TTT for two private tours, in spite of their significantly higher prices than that of their competitors. We had booked well in advance; even thus Tom and Ana were not available any more. On Saturday morning we did the three hours walking tour in Amsterdam with Saskia. She picked us up in the hotel perfectly on time, and we did a leisurely tour of the city – just the way we wanted. We walked around in the Jordaan area, the canal district, a bit of the centre of the city and ended in Spui (where we had booked lunch in the Seafood Bar – superb). Saskia was nice and relaxed, we had a good time with her.Sunday we did the one-day countryside tour with Karen. She was also very nice, and perfectly knew her business. She drove around with confidence, showed us Marken, Edam, Schermerhorn – we had a very enjoyable day.TTT are a very professional up-scale tour company. If you want privacy, absolute flexibility, knowledgeable and pleasant guides, and don’t mind the cost – go with them.

Awesome day visiting the sites around amsterdam. I emailed Tom on Monday, hoping he could possibly have an opening for a tour on Tuesday. Tom was instantly in touch with me, and after a few emails, we were scheduled for a full day tour with Henk around the Amsterdam area, Henk was awesome and both my girls, 11 and 14 took to him instantly, as my husband and I also did. We had an awesome day! Both my girls told me what a fun day they had and again how much they enjoyed Henk! You guys are awesome!!!

Very helpful. A great guide. Toms was very helpful. We booked last minute and during the summer rush. They worked hard, kept us in touch and found a great guide, Jacqui. They really tried to match a guide with our family's need and did it right. A guide can really add "color" to the trip, particularly in showing you the less touristy neighborhoods

Responsive and thorough!. Although we won't be able to use them on this trip, I have to write to let you know how helpful they were and what a delightful itinerary they offer. We are only in Amsterdam for a short time, but they provided links for me to purchase museum tickets as well as looking into car service. They were also very quick to respond. Hopefully, we will be back to Amsterdam soon and have a chance to use their services!

Two days with Tom. We were fortunate to have two special days to spend with Tom exploring Amsterdam and the countryside. My husband and I received an educators grant to explore Dutch culture and polish photography skills. Tom was so easy to work with and took our physical abilities and interests into consideration when planning our itinerary. Because Tom is a professional photographer, he is skilled at teaching amateur photographers how to capture great pictures and was also a big help in learning how to use the features of our digital camera. One of our favorite things we did in Amsterdam was going up into the tower of the Westerkerk for a truly breathtaking view. Great spot for photographs of the city! Tom knows the city inside and out and fills your tour with history and tidbits about the Netherlands. We also loved the apple pie at Winkel's. We took the train through North Holland and "camped" overnight in a Pipowagen. A truly one of a kind experience for us, as we love camping. We also biked through the sand dunes, spent time at the beach and cycled through little villages. We really enjoyed our time with Tom--he is easy to get along with, concerns himself with your needs and is also funny! We enjoyed his affectionate attention to pets and he is also a great BBQ chef! Tea? Coffee? :)

Perfect tour of off the beaten path Amsterdam!. From the moment I received my first email from Tom, I knew this was the right your company for me and my family. He was friendly and ready to tailor a walking tour to exactly our taste. On a very warm morning, the six of us (all adults) met our guide Karen near the Anne Frank House and took a 4-hour walking tour through the Jordaan, the islands and back into the city center. We stopped at a great coffee shop and at a herring stand to taste some local treats. Karen was fun, knowledgable and the perfect guide. I highly recommend this personalized experience for anyone traveling to Amsterdam!

Great overview of Amsterdam. Esther picked us up right on time at the Hotel Pilitzer for our private walking tour of Amsterdam. We walked over ten miles and really felt the vibe of this amazing city. Esther is a delightful young woman who has a command of the English language as well as a historical and current perspective of the city. We loved our day together, and learned so much. We felt as if she was a friend/daughter. Money well worth spent!

A Great Day in the Countryside Around Amsterdam. After spending a few days in Amsterdam last year, my wife and I decided to take our day in Amsterdam off the Oceania Marina to see the Dutch countryside. Tom of Tom's Travel Tours was easy to work with as we ironed out the details over the Internet. Our guide was the charming and funny Karen. We started our Countryside tour with a pick up at our cruise ship at 9am. Our first stop was in Marken, a fishermen town connected to mainland thanks to a dike built in 1957. This traditional Dutch town has a beautiful sea (nowadays lake) front with its typical green and white houses. Then we went to Edam, a little town that has existed since the 12th century and is famous by the internationally known Edam cheeses - which we had a chance to sample. We visited the Speeltoren, the Kwakelbridge and a cheese cellar. We had lunch at LaFortuna and feasted on Dutch specialties and bier. Afterwards, we drove via the Beemster Polder, a UNESCO Heritage Site due to the perfect design and the water management improvement that it meant in the 17th century. We will saw numerous windmills in the Schermerhorn Polder and visited one of them. On the way back, we drove through Rijp, a beautiful old village. We stopped in Rijp and visited and beautiful old church. Outside of Rijp we stopped at an area that oversaw the polder and Karen provided us with a snack of various delicacies and drinks. We were back in Amsterdam around 5pm. We were there in plenty of time to make sure we weren't' left in Amsterdam.

All Day - Amsterdam country side. Our guide, Karen was prompt that morning at out hotel and delivered us back at the end of the day.She was outstanding and fulfilled every expectation and more. We were able to visit a working windmill, a wooden shoe factory, a cheese factory. a lovely informational/historical tour of the countryside and a walking visit through Marken (a quaint fishing town), Edam and 7th century town and finally Rijp a beautiful old town where we had a special treat. Karen stopped her VW van along the roadside by a bench and provided us with a wonderful picnic of cheese, wine, beer, water, olives, crackers, sausages, assorted nuts, fresh fruit and even a Snicker or two for the road and all complimentary! Top THAT! Couldn't have been more worth our money (which was very reasonable) and time! Many priceless photos and memories.

An Excellent Adventure with Tom!. Our Girl Scout Troop requested Tom's Tours and we had an excellent experience with Tom and Karen. Communication prior to our day was so helpful and clear. He helped us with planning a good tour and also offered information about our stay in Amsterdam. We were 15 people --we had a walking tour of the city in the morning and a bike tour of the countryside in the afternoon. We had a great time and learned a great deal from Tom and Karen - thank you for an excellent day in Amsterdam.

Private Tour - one day excursion, no crowds, more time to enjoy. I recommend Toms Travel private tours as a great alternative to the mass tours.Tom has the knowledge and attitude that will help you make the most of your vacation, he will work on your priorities and schedule to build a customized program.You are provided with choices, whether you’d like to visit the known tourist spots as Keukenhof Gardens and the village of Zaanse Schans or if you prefer less crowded and spaces as the tulip fields in Koop van Noord Holland with a visit to the actual flower farmer and the Schermerhorn Windmill Museum with a chance to climb up in the mills and see them working from the inside without any waiting lines; you will be guaranteed a great time.During this one day tour we even had time for an outdoor picnic in a private cottage and a brief walk in the famous village of Edam where we tried and unavoidably purchased some delicious cheeses. Accommodation for children is provided and you can stop anytime for pictures which can be taken professionally by Tom; plus his educated explanation and cultured conversation makes this an opportunity that shouldn’t be passed.

Amsterdam Walking Tour. My husband and I had a 9 hrs layover in Amesterdam, and we wanted to take advantage of it. I contacted Tom via email, it was a last minute decision. Tom promptly responded and was very helpful! We were able to get a private 3 hours walking tour of the city. Our tour guide was Saskia and she was awesome! She was flexible and very knowledgeable. I highly recommed them!

Tour with Henk. We planned a last minute tour with Tom, and although he was going to be out of town, he set us up with one of his guides. Henk picked us up right on time. We drove to a small village outside the city and rode bicycles, walked through the village, and stopped at cheese and clog shops. As we talked he realized I like talking about real estate from all over so on the way home drove us through some area of town and explained the areas. We had a great time and would highly recommend it. We tried to rent scooters outside the city (I have three daughters and did not want them to try scooters in downtown Amsterdam). Henk was more than happy to try and put it together but found out two things....you must be 16 and must have your license with you. One of my daughters was 12 and neither of my other daughters figured they would need their drivers license with them. We capped off the day with a round of drinks at a nice café Henk knew about.....Great time for the whole family!

Fantastic Family Tour!!. Tom designed an amazing family tour for us - our middle school aged children wanted to DO not SEE things in Amsterdam. As an urban city dweller, I was concerned that my kids were not good enough bike riders to manage the traffic in Amsterdam. Tom designed a tour where we could pilot our own boats through a scenic small town's canals, climb to the top of a historic wind mill and end up renting bikes and riding to the beach. It was a perfect itinerary - executed by a eloquent, kind, and thoughtful guide, Henk. Henk could not have been nicer - he was extremely knowledgeable, well educated and yet could not have been kinder to my children. He went beyond any expectation when he rode his bike and helped push my son on his other hand up the hills - i could never have managed thatt!!

Fantastic tour!. Our guide Saskia was wonderful! She gave us plenty of information about the city without overwhelming us. Saskia customized the tour to our interests and took us to several "off the beaten path" places that we never would have seen on our own (some of them ended up being some of the highlights of our time in the city). I have done a lot of city tours in a lot of places and this one was definitely one of the best. Highly recommend Tom and his team! They were quick to respond to my tour request and worked with our tight schedule. Must book with Tom's Tours!

Fantastic Tour of Amsterdam & the Countryside!. Words cannot express how great a time we spent with Tom and Anna touring Amsterdam & the beautiful Dutch countryside. On first day after arriving in this beautiful city, Anna took us on a 4 hour walking tour showing us the special sites & activities of the city. Fantastic coffee break with real Dutch Apple Pie! Next day Tom picked us up after our Anne Frank visit for a grand tour of Keukenhof Gardens, a trip to Marken & a picnic in the countryside. That evening, we went with Anna on another walking tour of the city including RedLight District. Next day Tom picked us up again at the Van Gogh Museum to go to Volendam to see how wooden shoes are made in a real workshop, a visit to Edam, cheese tasting & a cheese cellar. We saw tulip fields, windmills in Schermerhorn Polder (I climbed to the top of one) and lunch in Beemster - delicious pancakes! Tom is also a professional photographer & took many wonderful photos of our group. I can totally recommend Toms Travel Tours. It was definitely one of the best experiences of my life & we learned so much about Holland & The Netherlands from a native. If you really want to see Amsterdam, call Tom!

Incredible 3 days in the Netherlands. After reading many reviews and exchanging a lot of emails, I chose Toms Travel Tours for our group of 7 seniors on our 2 1/2 day trip to Amsterdam. It was an incredible choice! We were lucky enough to get Tom and his lovely wife Ana as our guides. Tom's planning was meticulous. We were able to see everything on our list and so many things we never dreamed we would see. Ana took us on 2 walking tours. One around Amsterdam where we not only saw the popular tourist sights but so much more. The other let us explore the Red Light District. Her information and explanations gave us a much better perception of the area and allowed us to see it in a different light. Tom took us to the Keukenhof Gardens, Tulip Fields, and several countryside villages. We saw how cheese is made, how wooden shoes are made, and went to, as well as inside, a working Windmill. Tom also helped us arrange tours to several of the museums. We never felt rushed or even tired. Tom prepared a picnic and snacks for us and there were plenty of stops along the way. Tom even took us to a camera store so one of the couples with us could buy a new camera when their camera malfunctioned. I can't believe how much we saw! It felt like Tom and Ana were old friends and we were all out for a casual afternoon. It couldn't have been any better!! The van was very comfortable and everyone had windows to view the countryside as we passed by. Tom is also a professional photographer, and as a bonus, he took pictures of all of us throughout our tours. They are some of our most treasured souvenirs. Not only are they excellent pictures, they allow us to remember every little place we visited and all the things we saw. Tom and Ana are amazing, easy to work with and a joy to be with. Write them now, before they are booked, I promise you will not be sorry!

Wonderful Day. Henk was our guide and I cannot say enough good things about him. We were three couples who were in Amsterdam after a river cruise. The cruise company had taken us on a brief walking tour to get acquainted with the city and some of us had explored areas of the city on our own. We didn't want Henk to take us to places that we had already seen. He listened to our comments and made suggestions. We spent the entire day with him and he showed us not only places that we wanted to see, but also places that we would never had thought to suggest. Henk took his cues from us re: the pace and everyone had a very enjoyable visit to Amsterdam. Also, the company for whom Henk works (Toms Tours) was very responsive to all of my queries. I highly recommend this company and Henk in particular.

Above and beyond our expectations. We had a very short time in Amsterdam (only one full day) and wanted someone to show us the city. Tom was recommended by another tour company that didn't have any openings for us, and I am so glad they did! Tom was knowledgeable, interesting, prompt, and accommodating. It felt like we had a friend showing us around. I couldn't recommend him more highly! Thank you Tom for being a wonderful part of our vacation!

Memorable countryside tour. I found Toms Travel on Trip Advisor. Their prompt response and suggested itinerary helped me made a quick decision to confirm our day trip with them.Tom showed up punctually at our hotel on Sunday morning, drove us to Marken, Edam, Beemster Polder, Schermerhorn (will never forget its pronunciation with the help of Tom).The pace of the tour is just right, and we avoided the crowd. He brought us some snacks, drinks and we even had a picnic next to the windmill! He also took many beautiful photos for us, we learnt some photo taking techniques by watching him pressing the shutter in all sorts of positions :)We missed the Keukenhof Tulip Festival by one week. However, Tom took a detour via Egmond at the end of our trip and we found the last tulip field in the country!Tom is well travelled and know our needs. He is really professional and amazing! We had a wonderful time together.His service doesn't just end after our day trip. I wrote to ask him some questions about travel within Netherlands and he was quick to response in details.We would like to express our appreciation and share this with other travellers.

The Best Choice We Made In Amsterdam. Our group of two, related couples booked a half-day walking tour with Tom's Travel Tours several weeks prior to our river cruise from Budapest to Amsterdam. From my first email enquiry, Tom was extremely quick to respond and to answer every question that I could think to pose. We corresponded multiple times as he developed the perfect itinerary for our time together, so we were had high expectations. Then, during the cruise, four additional people asked to join group so, once again, I was in contact with Tom while we were on the Rhine River. Doubling the size of our group at the last moment posed no problem and he assured me that we would all have a terrific time. On the day of the tour, May 28, 2015, it was cold and blustery with showers, but it didn't matter. Our guide for the day, Henk, was absolutely superb! A world traveler himself, with an amazing knowledge of "his" city, he held our rapt attention for over four hours. We had a wide range of ages in our expanded group and Henk was able to accommodate our varying rates of walking speed. Tom's Travel Tours treated our group to coffee at about mid-morning, which felt and tasted so good, given the cold day. Both Tom and his guide, Henk have perfect mastery of English, so there was never a need to ask for a clarification or a repeated phrase or description. We walked through the Jordaan area and then took the ferry to the modern side of Amsterdam where we visited the site of the world's first 3-D printed Canal House. It is totally amazing that a real home is being constructed from printed components. Henk shared so much information on the architecture and history of Amsterdam that we came away with a much richer understanding of the place and the culture. I am convinced that travelers simply cannot go wrong by booking Tom's Travel Tours. I would do it again in a heart beat!
Holland beauty. To be that that place was very good to know a bit better that country! Holland is a beautiful country to be explored! I really enjoys that!

Two tours. two great experiences. We, my wife, two 20 something kids and I, spent half a day with Ana on a walking tour of Amsterdam. Ana was great.She showed us areas we never would have seen besides the usual sites. Tom took us to Bruges for a long day trip. He was great fun as well as an excellent guide. He was very attentive and efficient. He also took great photos of the family. At the end of the day we were sorry to leave him but glad to have met him.

Tom is fantastic. Could not recommend more!. Tom took our family on a very personal and informative tour. He met every need we could imagine and then some. His personal perspective on the history of Amsterdam and knowledge of the area provided a wonderful experience. He caters to what you want/need to experience during your time with him.Thank you Tom!

Immersing ourselves in Amsterdam . We had a group of four (60+ age group) on a morning walking tour of Amsterdam with Ana. It was perfect weather for walking and we really felt part of the local culture learning what it is like to live in this lovely city and discovering so many sites off the tourist map - hidden courtyards, lovely lanes and canal streets and coffee and apple cake! Ana was a fabulous guide, friendly and warm and she managed to tailor the tour to suit our needs and interests.

Tulips, Windmills, cheese, and wooden shoes-quintessential Holland. What a bonus for us to spend a day with Tom Van Der Liej touring iconic Holland. We wanted to get out of Amsterdam to see more of the countryside and Tom had the perfect tour arranged for us. We are still oohing and aahing over our time in the tulip fields and the Keukenhof Gardens. Tom's enthusiasm and photographic skills had us feeling like models as we played in the tulips, and left us with phenomenal photos of our time there. We loved watching wooden shoes being made in Marken, tasting wonderful cheeses in Edam, and topping off our tour by climbing inside to the top of a windmill. We couldn't have asked for more. On top of that, Tom is delightful to travel with and very knowledgeable. We highly recommend his tours.

Tom = Terrific time tiptoeing through the tulips!. We spent a day and an evening with Tom and both were truly memorable. Our day was spent cycling the tulip fields in North Holland and our evening photo tour took us to places in Amsterdam we wouldn't have found on our own in a million trips. Each tour was exactly what we wanted. Tom did a great job creating fun and interesting itineraries based on our input, but he also tweaked as we went along, as he got to know us, adding stops he thought we would like. Aside from being tons of fun, Tom is thoughtful (always keeping his eye on his, making sure we were safe on our cycles), patient (we made MANY photo stops), knowledgeable (ask him anything about Holland and I'm pretty sure he could answer it), has a superhero ability to take amazing photos while cycling and can carry more snacks on his cycle than anyone I know (would you care for an olive, chocolate or cheese or maybe carrots, waffles or nuts or just maybe you'd like blueberry raspberry juice, beer and Prosecco). I can't say enough nice things about Tom; stop thinking about it and book; there's no way you'll regret it.

Tom is Amsterdam!. THE ONLY WAY TO SEE AMSTERDAM!My husband and I recently spent two days with Tom touring Amsterdam and its beautiful surrounding areas on bikes. Tom expertly and safely led us through the busy streets of the city, taking us past the major attractions as well as to some hidden gems that most tourists would never find on their own...all the time snapping our pictures! I didn’t think the city tour could be topped, until the next day, when we had one of the most special travel experiences we’ve ever had. Tom took us by train to Alkmaar, about 45 minutes from Amsterdam, where we rented bikes with the express purpose of cycling to the tulip fields. Due to a late season, finding tulips in bloom was no easy feat, but Tom worked his contacts and was able to direct us to some beautiful fields where he essentially facilitated our own private photo shoot! Along the way, we stopped to take in the awesome sights, including windmills and a charming farm/ranch where we posed with cows. After stopping for lunch at a quaint pancake house, we hit the road again, riding through beautiful towns, a magnificent forest, awe-inspiring sand dunes all the way to the North Sea.Tom had come highly recommended from a friend, yet I could never have imagined how exceptional he would be! We were searching for tulips, but, thanks to Tom, saw so much more!

Great four days!. Our group of three consisting of me, my wife and a good friend, Sandy, spent four days in Amsterdam preceding a Tauck river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest. We stayed at the Hotel the Toren on the Keizersgracht Canal near the Jordaan area which turned out to be a very good location for our activities. Prior to our arrival, we scheduled activities on each day with Toms Travel Tours. Toms Travel Tours is operated by Tom van der Liej and his wife, Ana Rodriquez Giles. On the afternoon we arrived, Ana met us at our hotel a three hour walking tour of the oldest part of Amsterdam including Dam Square in the oldest part of Amsterdam. On the next day, she met us at the hotel for a walking tour of the Jordaan area, Amsterdam hidden gems and we also took the ferry across to the newer Noord area. Ana took us to Winkel’s for its popular apple pie and introduced us to caramel filled stroopwafels. On the third day, Tom drove us to Keukenhof Gardens, the fishing village of Mark and the village of Markem. On the final day, Tom drove us to the Kop van Noord tulip fields, the cheese market and village of Aldmaar, the windmills of Schermerhorn and the Beemster Polder. In the time available, Tom and Ana introduced to us to the history, culture, and lifestyle of Amsterdam in the surrounding areas of the Netherlands. Tom is also a photo journalist and he took many pictures. Both Tom and Ana are wonderful people. They are wonderful, very knowledgeable guides and are very entertaining. They assisted us in making very efficient use of our time. They provided many value-added extras. They were highly professional, courteous, and punctual. It was easy to communicate with them by email. They completely fulfilled the terms of our understanding at the price agreed upon. I would unconditionally recommend them recommend them.

A day in north Holland. We had the pleasure of spending a remarkable day with Karen touring the northern Holland countryside. I can not say enough about the day and the scenery. Karen was extremely knowledgable about the amazing history of Holland. Tom created an itinerary from my email "wish" list and did a fantastic job. Karen was over the top had helped us plan the rest of our time in Amsterdam and gave us a lot of places and things we shouldn't miss. We can not thank Tom Travel Tours and Karen, our new friend for an amazing day.Lee and Janice Texas, USA
Great. Tour was great. Henry (Hank) was highly knowledgeable and personal. Very good at story telling about history, personal, events, etc. I would highly recommend him to anyone.

Fantastic Experience!. Tom's Travel Tours was the best activity decision we made while in Europe this year. We had a fantastic time in the crazy and beautiful city of Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside. Tom's tours were fantastic and allowed us to see more in two days than most see in twice that long. For us, the best part of all was the feeling that we were not on a tour, but rather spending time with friends from the city. We did three separate private tours; A city tour with Anna, a Red light/Night Tour with Tom, and a full day countryside tour with Karen. From the moment we met each of them we felt as though we were with old, new friends. Spending half a day with Anna wondering the city provided us the opportunity to learn about everyday life in Amsterdam while we were seeing the sights. Anna is lovely, charming, and was a pleasure. Our countryside tour was a wonderful educational experience. Karen is very knowledgeable and lots of fun to be around; she went out of her way to make sure we saw as much as we could and learned to appreciate the Netherlands and her ingenious people...and we laughed, a lot! It was a great day. Our evening tour with Tom was something else all together. Tom is a charming, fun, educated man; it was a pleasure and a privilege to spend an evening with one of Amsterdam's true sons. His love of his native city shines through everything he says and does. I was particularly impressed with his respect of the women in the red light district and the way he handled that particular experience. Bottom line, our experience in Amsterdam was more than we ever hoped it would be thanks to Tom's Travel Tours! Tours were easy to arrange and Tom worked with us to ensure we were able to do exactly what we wanted in a way that fit our schedule. If you are on the fence about booking, just do it, you won't be disappointed!

Outstanding Photo Tour and City Tour!!!. We had the most spectacular experiences with both Tom and Ana. From the first contact, Tom engaged us and made sure he knew exactly what we wanted. We did a nighttime photo tour with Tom and he is an excellent teacher. I would classify myself as maybe beginner photographer with just a little experience, and he was able to teach me more about the camera settings, how to compose the picture, and how to make the picture come alive. We also did a tour with Ana the next morning and she was just as knowledgable about Amsterdam's history. She took us to areas of the city that we would have never visited on our own, and gave us a much more personal insight into Amsterdam instead of just the typical tourist overview. We had our almost 5 year old daughter with us, and they were both so wonderful and accommodating with her. I really can't say enough positive things about Tom and Ana, and we thoroughly enjoyed both tours. Highly, highly recommend them!!!

Amazing 8 Hour Sightseeing Day in Amsterdam and Environs!. What happens when you only have one day for sightseeing in the historic charming picturesque city of Amsterdam and surrounding area?The answer is to maximize your time, forget about sightseeing on your own, definitely do NOT take a crowded bus tour with too many strangers each with their own interests/agendas, and hire, as we did, an outstanding and knowledgeable private driver/guide, Tom van der Leij, a resident of Amsterdam, and owner of Tom's Travel Tours (www.tomstraveltours.com). Tom is an extraordinary person, knowledgeable guide, some who loves showing people his incredible city and country, as well as a travel editor/writer and professional photographer who has travelled to over 100 countries! Since we were traveling with a van full of luggage, and ending our tour at the airport, Tom also enlisted the assistance of his charming wife, an equally knowledgeable guide, Ana Rodríguez Giles, to make our sightseeing experience truly unforgettable!As seniors in our mid 70's travelling with my partially disabled wife who uses a transport wheel chair during sightseeing, we outlined what we wanted to do and see, and Tom made excellent suggestions and put together an incredible sightseeing adventure for the day sightseeing in Amsterdam along the various canals and districts, as well as traveling outside the city to the picturesque 'cheese' city of Edam, where we stopped for our first ever 'tailgate picnic,' to maximize our sightseeing time. From Edam we viewed and visited fields of miles and miles of the most beautiful Tulips in full bloom in magnificent colors, followed by a visit to a working windmill where I climbed to the top and learned the reasons for their being in Holland, and what function they served. We ended our adventure with a drop off at the airport, where Tom assisted me with my wife, all of our luggage and wheelchair.Throughout the day Tom offered professional photography tips and suggestions so I could take more interesting, exciting, professional photos. In addition, in honor of our 51st Anniversary celebration, Tom took numerous professional photos of our sightseeing experience and emailed them to while we were still in Europe. Our adult children and grandchildren were astounded by the outstanding quality of the photos, how well they captured our enjoyment of what we experienced, and posted some of them to their facebook pages.My wife and I are planning to return to Amsterdam in a few years so we can sightsee at a more leisurely pace, as well as see some of the other cities of the Netherlands. Without any hesitation, we will definitely contact Tom and Ana and enlist their services!.

Fantastic Cycling tour with Tom.. Four girl friends have just had a lovely day cycling tour with Tom. We picked national open windmill day (by accident) and had an extra treat seeing inside a working windmill and another which is a beautiful house It was a full 9 hour day and we managed 30 k cycling, a lovely picnic stop, windmills, 2 or 3 lovely little villages outside Amsterdam, a beautiful ride through a forest and dunes to a stunning beach, tulips and chocolate ! A really super day with photos later to remind us of the wind and recommendations of places to visit in Amsterdam. Thoroughly enjoyable. It gave us the confidence to book our own cycles and ride around Amsterdam the next day.

Tulips, Watermills and Cheese. Very personal, very informative tour in Noord Holland with the tulips in full bloom. Toured a windmill to discover how it worked and what it's purpose was. Enjoyed a walking tour of Edam which is famous for its cheeses. Finished with a delightful late afternoon wine and cheese snack that Tom brought along. All in all a delightful, informative tour of the Dutch countryside outside of Amsterdam with Tom as a wonderful guide.

Thorough, Flexible and Outstanding Tour. We had a fabulous day with Tom touring the Keukenhof, Edam, churches, windmills a cheese shop, and a clog shop. Tom designed an itinerary that met exactly what we were looking for: a full day of sightseeing with two young children that was fast-paced, but not rushed. Mother nature (rain) and traffic threw a couple of challenges our way, but Tom handled them quite well. He packed a terrific picnic lunch in the car trunk that saved us the time of sitting down for a meal mid-day. His English was outstanding. I highly recommend Tom to anyone looking for a day in the countryside.

Exceptionally good tour. Tom guided us through the superb Keukenhof gardens and assorted pavilions effortlessly and efficiently so that we could enjoy the beauty of this magical place. It's a must see attraction in Amsterdam, made especially pleasant by a knowledgable experienced private guide. He was very flexible in adjusting our tour to maximize our experiences here as well as Tulip fields and a hundreds year old windmill. We enjoyed learning how the windmills were integral to the reclamation of land from the sea. I would recommend this tour to friends without reservation.

The best way to see the Netherlands. Over the course of our numerous travels my husband and I have found that reserving private customized tours is the best way to see the countries we visit. Local tour guides know where to take you and show you things you wouldn’t see in normal tours. This also allows us to keep our own pace and focus on what we want to absorb from the visit. We selected Thomas’s Tours based on all the very positive reviews on trip advisor. Thomas lived up to and went well beyond our expectation for our tour of the Netherlands. He provided several options for the day long tour. The final package was based on our desire to see the tulip fields, windmills, cheese production and to try some local beer. We started at Keukenhof to see all the tulips in bloom. Afterwards, we headed to North Holland to explore the several small towns and tulip fields along the way. Due to the weather instead of having picnic we stopped for lunch at a quaint inn, it was a very good meal. After lunch we headed to three historic windmills that still work today. We were allowed to venture into the windmills while they were working. Thomas gave us a look into Netherlands’ culture making it a very memorable, educational experience. We highly recommend Thomas to provide you a wonderful experience during your visit to the Netherlands. A few additional things Thomas provided were pictures of our tour and refreshments along the way. Both were a pleasant surprises that just enhanced our day together.

Enjoyed 2 great tours!. Our group of 4 (ages 23-77) enjoyed a lovely walking tour with Ana our 1st day in Amsterdam. It can be confusing to navigate the canals so it was nice to have a guide. We also had a private day tour with Henk. Tulip fields with just our group, picturesque villages with a stop for lunch, a visit inside a working windmill...just perfect! Book with this group. You won't be sorry!

Remarkable insights into Amsterdam and the Countryside. We booked two full days with Tom and his wife Ana, and they gave us one of our all time most enjoyable and memorable vacation experiences. A day walking with Ana through Amsterdam was fun, exciting and enlightening. Seeing the buildings, canals and architecture in parts of the City most tourists never get to see was wonderful, but seeing these things through the eyes of a PHD in European history (which Ana is) gave us a special perspective on the remarkable Dutch and their place in European and world history.The following day with Tom was equally enjoyable, as we toured the blooming tulip fields, visited the seaside to see the dykes and land reclamation projects for which the Dutch are justly renowned, walked around the town of Edam, and toured an antique working windmill on a blustery day, topped off by lunch at the charming bungalow where Tom's family has summered since he was a boy.Best of all, in addition to their knowledge and professional courtesy, and Tom's wonderful photography, both Tom and Ana are warm, charming and delightful companions, and they make you feel as if you are being taken on tour by long time friends sharing with you the City and country they dearly love.

Northern Amsterdam, Tulip Field and King's Day Walking Tour. We did a full day Northern Amsterdam and Tulips Field Tour and also a half day Amsterdam City Tour on King's Day. For the full day tour we went to Marken, Edem, Cheese Tasting, went inside an old windmill, took photos at tulip fields. We wanted to find a tulip field with windmill in the background and Tom accommodate to that and drove around the places he knew might have and we found it. That was really awesome and we had great photos.For the half day King's Day city tour, Tom brought us to NDSM to see the King's Day flea market there which is much different from those in the city center, saw cool cafes and beautiful architectures. Later, he brought us to Jordaan, soaked up the King's Day atmosphere there as well as walking through beautiful buildings, visited a petting zoo from the outside as it was closed and chance to take lots of photos. He also brought us to a few hidden courtyards which were really beautiful. We ended the tour with the best Apple pie in town. But Tom also recommended places we can visit next before he left. He definitely took care of us.Tom is friendly and he will tell you where he will bring you and you can always give your opinion on where you are interested to visit and he will try to accommodate as much as he can. He is friendly and very fun to tour with. He will take lots of photos and share them with you. He will bring food, drinks for you do you can always snack and drink. You won't get hungry or thirsty in this tour.Awesome tour guide and awesome tours. We definitely enjoyed ourselves. I am so happy I chanced upon tom's website and decided to take his tour. Money well spent.

Keukenhof, Marken, Edam. Our tour with Karen was wonderful. She was very knowledgeable and a pleasure to spend a day with. The little touches that Tom's tour provided were unique and special, such as a picnic alongside a beautiful tulip field and traditional Dutch snacks along the way. I would highly recommend Tom's Travel Tours to anyone who would like a personalized, exceptional experience in Holland.

The only way to see Amsterdam. We were on a Tauck Tour and got the precursory bus tour. I found Tom's Tours on Trip Advisor, and we were really glad we did.
