Ana, Tom's wife met us promptly at our hotel at the time we had arranged and asked us if we had anything in particular we wanted to see. She was full of suggestions and knew the city inside out. We walked at a leisurely pace and she kept us going with stories during the whole walk. She was very knowledgeable and spoke excellent English, but was also fluent in Spanish. THere were four of us on the trip and she made the trip very personal. We stopped when we wanted to for photographs. She took us to one of her favorite spots for coffee. SHe brought us to small areas that only a local person would know of.We would all highly recommend Tom's tours and in particular Ana.

Delightful day with a charming and personable guide in Amsterdam. We loved our time in Amsterdam with Ana as we explored the Red Light District by day and then ventured out to Jordaan to see some of the hidden courtyards outsiders rarely get to see. We were having some leg issues and Ana was very patient, governing her pace to match our needs. We would highly recommend Ana as your guide in Amsterdam. Just tell her what you want and/or need and she will go above and beyond to meet your needs. Our only regret is we never got to meet Tom or have him take our photo. Next time, Tom, as we fell in love with Amsterdam!

Marvelous one day private tour of Amsterdam with Keukenhof. Our family of four (two adults, one senior citizen, and one teen) had a 9 hour flight layover in Amsterdam on April 3rd. We didn't want to miss out on an opportunity to see Keukenhof during tulip festival and found Toms Travel Tours on TripAdvisor. Tom was prompt to respond our e-mail inquiry and he suggested an excellent itinerary with everything we wanted - a tour of Keukenhof and Amsterdam with our own private guide; all at a price comparable to some of the crowded Keukenhof bus tours. Tom picked us at the airport just as scheduled (he actually had to wait on us for nearly an hour since our flight was a bit delayed) and he quickly made us feel at ease with his warm personality. Our day tour was truly a most enjoyable, relaxing, and unforgettable experience. Tom even packed a delightful picnic lunch of local cheeses, breads, fruit, chocolates and stroopwaffles. As a bonus, Tom (a very talented photographer), took some beautiful photos of our family during our tour and e-mailed them to us. What a wonderful souvenir from an absolutely marvelous day! He then delivered us back to the airport, safe and sound and right on schedule. We would recommend Toms Travel Tours without hesitation to anyone visiting the Amsterdam area. If we are ever fortunate enough to get back to Amsterdam, we will definitely use Toms Travel Tours again!

A Highlight of Our Trip!. We just returned from 5 days in Amsterdam with our two young boys. We (the adults) wanted to see the countryside and landscape, but were worried the kids wouldn't tolerate a day of sight-seeing. Tom did a fantastic job of designing an itinerary with them in mind - stopping at cool windmills, walking along the dikes, cheese tasting and even a box of chocolates for the car ride! He was a wonderful guide - full of information, super personable and fun to spend a day with. He is also an incredible photographer, so as an added bonus, we got an entire photo shoot of the days activities. Christmas card photos - check!! We have done quite a lot of private tours over the past few years and I can honestly say this one was the best. Thank you Tom for a memorable and delightful day!!

A Lovely Day with Tom. We just returned from visiting our 21-year-old daughter in beautiful Amsterdam. We wanted to be sure that we saw some of the countryside, so we booked a tour with Tom's Travel for the three of us. What a delight. Tom is the perfect person to tour with. He is warm and welcoming, professional, flexible, and does everything he can to be sure his guests are having the experience they want. Tom picked us up at our hotel at 9:30 AM and drove us to explore the countryside. We began in Marken, a fisherman village connected to the mainland by a dike built in 1957. We then went to the town of Edam, a little town that exists since the XIIth century and is famous for its internationally known Edam cheeses. We ate a lot of cheese! And bought a lot of cheese! We drove via the Beemster Polder, a UNESCO Heritage Site due to the perfect design and the water management improvement that it provided in the XVIIth century. Later in the day we saw windmills in the Schermerhorn Polder. We actually met the windmiller who happened to be there at the time. He knows Tom and we were treated to a personal tour. When we were through touring the windmill Tom had laid out a lovely afternoon cheese and wine snack for us, which was a welcome treat near the end of the day. We had a perfect day and were sad to see it come to an end. Tom clearly loves his country, and he showed us exactly why...we are looking forward to visiting again one day and touring again with Tom!

Amazing experience. We were a family of 4 that included grandmother, mother, and 2 adult children visiting Amsterdam for the first time for 3 days. We chose to do a 4 hour "hidden gems" tour with Tom in the city the second morning of our adventure and our experience with him so exceeded our expectations. He was so knowledgeable, so friendly, and so courteous and caring especially when it came to our grandmother in the group. I am excited to return to Amsterdam in the future and would happily have Tom share more of his amazing city with us.

Perfect tour. This was our first trip to Amsterdam and we had only 2 days to see everything we wanted. We decided to spend our first day getting the lay of the land with a 4 hour walking tour of the city. We were lucky to get Karen, who is not only super knowledgeable but very friendly and warm. We instantly felt as if she was a friend. She took us all over and we fell in love with the city.Communication with Toms Travel Tours was also great, easy and fast.Perfect from start to finish, thank you!

Outside the city with Tom. Our group of seven friends arranged to see some attractions outside the city of Amsterdam for the second day of our trip. Tom took us to a charming fishing village, a cheese and wooden shoe making demonstration, another lovely suburb where we enjoyed a delicious lunch in a beautiful old restaurant and finally to visit a windmill. We were invited in by the mill keeper, shown his home and then taken to the top of the mill where we watched the inner workings of the mill while the mill was in motion. Tom not only had everything perfectly organized, but was able to accommodate a change in our plans to pick us up at a different time and place than originally arranged. Tom and Karen, his assistant, were knowledgeable, friendly, and genuine and kept us well fed from the tail-gate picnics they offered at each stop. To top it all off, Tom, a professional photographer, sent us the pictures he was snapping throughout our adventures. We all agreed we would recommend Tom to anyone going to Amsterdam.

Amazing memories. We had a spectacular trip in Amsterdam with Tom. He took such good care of my mom, my sister, and me. He is an outstanding guide, a warm and genuine person, and that special type of individual who loves to find the beauty in life.The memories from the day we had in Amsterdam as well as our day trips are so special. Tom goes well beyond good service. Truly exceptional experience and I would book again each time I came to Amsterdam. We loved Tom and give him our highest recommendation.

Nice Guy. I had a very nice time with Tom. He showed a lot of nice things in Amsterdam. The 'hofjes' where really beautiful. Tom was easy to communicate with. It was a great start of our holiday in Amsterdam. The days afterwards it was very nice walking around and recognizing the things we had seen during our tour.Cindy B.

An unexpected adventure with Tom on a bike. What a brilliant time with Tom and Ana , they took us off the normal routes and travelled Amsterdam like a local, these guys really know the city and have taken the time to make the trip memorable, which I guess shows how . Professional service and warm people , It was so much fun, I really felt like I was riding the city with a bunch of friends with the cherry on top having a professional tour of the real Amsterdam. The beautiful courtyards, were particularly my favorite. I recommend this tour company to anyone who visits the city

Amazing Evening!. I was in Amsterdam only for the stop over night on the way from Russia to California in December. Because it was my first time in Amsterdam, I wanted to make sure to see as much as possible for the short period of time. Tom made the impossible a reality by careful planning and great service. My plane arrived at 7:30 PM. Tom picked me up at the airport and we went right to the train with tickets he bought ahead of time. After arrival at the rail station, we dropped of my bag in the hotel that I booked from California based on Tom's recommendation. I could not believe that by 8:30 PM we were already sitting on the boat, sipping hot drink and enjoying the view of the Festival of Lights Celebration. During the pleasant trip on the boat Tom provided interesting information about the city and I took pictures. After the boat trip we started on the tour of the city. Tom is very smart and warm. He cares about his customers and provides information that is interesting for each specific client. Tom is also hard working and does not mind long hours if needed. Our tour ended after 11 PM. I could not believe that with arrival as late as 7:30 PM I was able to see so much of Amsterdam and have such a wonderful and memorable evening. Tom is also a very talented photographer. He took great pictures. Thank you very much, Tom for the great evening. Cannot wait until my husband and I will visit Amsterdam again, spend more time and learn more from you.Helen

Unforgettable !! Tom knows his stuff!. Tom took us places even the National Geographic never heard of... We discovered Amsterdam and learned stuff.... very very interesting! Lots of fun mostly. Tom felt like a best friend!

Tom, THE guide in Amsterdam. Last week I visited Amsterdam, again, after quite a few years. I took a private tour with Tom along some hidden gems of the Dutch capital. It was just inspiring, entertaining and relaxed. In short, awesome. I know Amsterdamquite well but Tom took me to places I haven't been before. We visited several hidden courtyards (hofjes) in the Jordaan for instance, but also some animal farms (more fun for the kids), wonderful, old bookshops, galleries and urban beekeepers. We took the ferry to Amsterdam Noord (North), across the river IJ, where many architecturally interesting new developments have sprung up and where one can meet fun and inspiring small business owners and entrepreneurs, as well as stare at the ships sailing by with a beer in hand. Tom showed me new and surprising places; another side of Amsterdam one wouldn't expect and can't find in most guide books. Tom took a personal interest in his customer, was culturally and historically very insightful, and rather charming and humorous … a great guide. I highly recommend his private tours in Amsterdam!

Brilliant fun day.. I had such a great tour with Toms travel tours. Tom, our guide took us to see many local places in Amsterdam that we wouldn't get to see on any other tour. We went for coffee in a great cafe and you really got the sense that Ana and Tom really know their city well. Not only that but the tour is brilliant fun and Ana and Tom are really funny. I really feel that I know the city well now. Can't recommend it enough.

Fun Afternoon in Amsterdam. My 10 year old son and I had great time on our 3 hour tour of Amsterdam with Ana and Tom. Ana was our guide for the entire tour with Tom joining us to take photos and enjoy the best apple cake in a local cafe. Ana and Tom make a great team, and we really enjoyed having them show us their city. In addition to the popular tourist sights, we also got to see the quieter side of the city. Tom is an accomplished travel writer/photographer who has traveled all around the world. The photos he captured of us in Amsterdam were a perfect reminder of a special day.

Best way to start a vacation. We arrived in Amsterdam on the red-eye the morning we took the tour, so we were a little apprehensive about whether we'd be able to do so much walking, but it worked out great. Ana was our tour guide and she took us around the Jordaan area. I love getting to see the city from a native's perspective. Ana took us to a local market and bought us some Dutch cheese to try. Then, when my parents were feeling a little tired and needed a break from walking, she took us to a small cafe that has "the best apple cake in Amsterdam" (it was delicious). I would recommend Ana to any friend visiting Amsterdam, and if I make it back any time soon, I'll definitely be giving one of their other tours a try.

Deep knowledge, fine eye for detail, warm person.. My wife, our baby-daughter and I went with Tom for a walking tour. Although we live in Amsterdam ourselves, we heard about Tom's tours and knowledge and we wanted to see our city from a different angle, so to say. Well, Tom did an excellent job. What a deep knowledge does he have of the history of Amsterdam, and he showed us all these little places we never went to before. And he is such a warm person with eye for little details along the way. And the fun thing is: everywhere we went with Tom, he meets aquaintances, which is quite unusual in such a big city. So the city knows Tom, and Tom knows the city very well. Highly recommended!!!

Best tourguide ever!. Tom really goes out of his way to provide a never to forget experience. He was in constant communication regarding the planning and arranged for an amazing tour eventhough we only had 4 hours available during the stopover. His photos was excellent and the information provided absolutely insightful. We have already referred many of our friends to contact Tom for tours and we wish he could accompany us on the entire europe tour. Thanx Tom. Blessings.

Fun tour of the city. Tom arranged for one of his guides to take my 12 year old son and me on a tour of the city. The lovely Dusica met us at the agreed time and took us to rent our bikes and then we headed out to visit the city. We lucked out with the weather as it was a beautiful summer day so perfect for biking in the city. Dusica was very patient and caring towards my son and careful to make sure he (we) were both safe cycling through the busy and hectic city. It was a fun tour and Dusica took the time to share some favorite spots and history. I would highly recommend Tom's company and Dusica was a fantastic guide.

Tom van de Leij - travel guide & photographer. I have had many guides throughout Europe who were expert in their knowledge, but Tom is far and above special. He is the epitome of the Amsterdam citizen - handsome, nice, polite, giving, and helpful. My friend and I plowed through the details of our tours to exhaustion via email before we met him (the first tour was to get us acclimated to the city when we arrived in Amsterdam, the next tour was into the countryside later on in our week ). He handled all our questions regarding details with ease and respectfulness. Not only is Tom a natural Dutch citizen with much knowledge about Amsterdam and the countryside, he is a professional photographer for Dutch magazines, travelling around the world. As an addition to your tour, he will photograph you like a paparazzi...let him do it! I'm still going through the photos that he took of my friend an me...such great photos...his sense of composition, space and depth is superb. If you get tight with Tom, perhaps he will invite you into his childhood life on the North Sea! He is a truly talented and unique person.Veronica K.

Individual is good !. I am a solo traveller and Tom arranged a day for me with another female solo traveller, we chose what areas to explore with our cameras and Tom. It was a comfortable, fun day and I learnt and saw so much, areas I would not have visited as a new tourist to Amsterdam. Great ! Just do it !

Tour Leader Extraordinaire!!. Tom first and foremost is an incredible person- filled with a joie de vivre second to none! He listened carefully to the requests we had for a special Amsterdam tour as well as a day North of Amsterdam in the countryside. And what a time my friend and I had! Hidden courtyards in the Jordann with a trip to the Western Islands was a great first day treat topped off with Apple cake and coffee at an authentic brown cafe. And our day in the countryside was spectacular..visited many small villages-- walked the dikes in Durgerdam munched on cheese in Edam, explored the windmills of Schermerhorn and had a picnic at Tom's family campsite! Our appreciation for the Dutch people and lifestyle increased a thousandfold as Tom recounted the history and culture of his beloved country. I cannot recall enjoying myself more on a "tour".. Thank you, Tom, for making our trip so memorable!

A Different View. Tom van der Leij is an accomplished professional photographer, but also a down-to-earth guy who can show you special parts of Amsterdam outside the common ones. As a bonus, you can learn how to use your camera more effectively and what are techniques for improved picture-taking.Furthermore, you can choose a bike riding experience to broaden the coverage of areas you wouldn't normally walk to.This is not some 50 euro bus tour with a big group, but a private one with experiences you can really recall - in your mind and also in quality pictures.Highly recommended.

A wonderful day with Tom and Ana. My friend and I had not been to Amsterdam in many years and knew we could see the museums and other touristy attractions on our own.We wanted a unique experience seeing places less chaotic, authentic and historical yet off the beaten path.Tom and Ana were charming, knowledgeable and willing to shape their tour to our requests.As a result we really enjoyed our day with them and would highly recommend them to anyone wanting to see some of Amsterdam's hidden treasures.

A great tour, even for frequent travelers to amsterdam!. We had a private tour for 2 persons and asked for visiting the hidden places of AMS. It was the 8th time we where in Amsterdam and know almost every touristique attraction. This is why we called Tom. His wife, Anna showed us breathtaking-places and hidden treasures which we never had seen before. We enjoyed the tour and are sure, it wasn't the last one.

Great Time!. Having just moved to Amsterdam, we wanted a tour that would show us a more authentic side of Amsterdam than the normal touristy tours. Tom took us on the Eco Tour and we had a blast riding through Jordaan, the organic market at Noordermarkt, and the north side of Amsterdam (across the river by ferry). Tom even sent us some pictures of us on the tour. Thanks again!

Toms Travel Tours a Highlight of our Amsterdam Trip!. Ana and Tom were fantastic guides! Our family was looking for a look into Amsterdam and Toms Travel Tours was the answer! Tom responded quickly to our inquiries and scheduled his wife, Ana, to guide us on a fabulous tour of Amsterdam. She has a PhD in history and was quite knowledgeable about the area. Tom even joined us later and helped my son, an amateur photographer, with tips on photography. A stop for apple pie and coffee at a local restaurant was a welcome treat for two teenagers! Ana also arranged for a cab for me when I felt ill and had to return to the hotel, allowing the rest of the family to complete the fabulous tour. We highly recommend Toms Travel Tours!

Incredible local insights into Amsterdam. Went on Tom's Eco Tour with Eva back in July - it was my major highlight of my time in Amsterdam. Eva was wonderful and informative and gave us local's insights into the city. I learned so many new things that people are doing to better our environment, and I also ate the best cheese I have ever had in my whole life. The Eco heart of Amsterdam by bike, and wonderful people to share my day with - made me fall in love with the city. A Tour with Tom's Travel Tours is an absolute must-do when in Amsterdam!

Personable, fun, interesting and easy. We stayed in Amsterdam for four days and one afternoon we spent riding with Tom. It was great and one of the things we remember and enjoy talking about when we look back on our summer. So what is that we found so great with Tom? First, the booking was easy and straightforward. Although we missed the obvious thing that we should have rented the bikes beforehand. Now Tom had to help us out and solve that mistake from our side. But he did it in a smooth and easy way. Second. He adjusted the tour according to what might interested us but also integrate that with some of his own interest. Third, he took us to some really interesting and cool places around Amsterdam. And also told interesting things about what we saw. Fourth, the tour was easy to go on. You do not have to be in great shape. Fifth, Tom was a great person, helpful, funny and easy going. And he take great pictures to while riding on his bike. So the essence of this is, DO IT!Among the things we could do and did, this was on the top three list (museum and a restaurant is among those three :-) )

Touring with Tom. If you have never biked in a large city, such as Amsterdam, it can be a little intimidating with the rules, traffic, pedestrians, and other bikers. Tom made our family of four feel very safe while exploring and learning about his city, via bike. He even brought along sweet local treats for us to enjoy. Tom has a deep love and appreciation for nature, photography, children, animals, and his town - which reflect in his smile, enthusiasm, interactions, and knowledge. Everyone seemed to know him and he exudes genuine happiness. He is the kind of person you wish you could be friends with forever. A few days after our visit, Tom emailed us photos of our family that he had taken while biking. His tour was one of the highlights of our two week Baltic Sea vacation. Book a tour with Tom...you will love him! And if you're biking, buy some padded biking shorts/skort - most of the roads are cobblestones;)

Local, Personable & Most enjoyable. We arrived on a Cruise docking at 3pm. Tom took my brother and I for a bike ride as soon as we disembarked and this was the first time I did anything like this! One word: Fantastic! We rode at our own pace, but being on a bike meant we could cover quite a big area in a short period. We do not like to be too touristy, so this was perfect as we were able to see all the postcard sites taking in the sights and sounds, and also get into the interesting nooks and crannies only locals have access.The next day, Tom and his wife Anna showed us their countryside; they made our day tour most relaxing and enjoyable leaving us all with a beautiful memory of Amsterdam. Our party of 5 included my 81 year old mother, and they looked after us so well it really was like having a trusted good friend as our host. Tom and Anna's attention to detail and safety made us feel safe and worry free throughout.The added bonus of course was Tom taking tons of great pictures enabling us to fully enjoy the sites and really soak in the atmosphere.Oh, they kept feeding us with nuts and biscuits throughout the trip too, which was a nice touch ; )

Ecotour. We had a great time with Tom and he showed us some 'hidden places' of Amsterdam and made some great recommendations how to best spent our time in Amsterdam. We cycled througout Amsterdam and stopped at beautiful spots and enjoyed the scenery. Tom has always a good mood and a little smile on his face while riding the bike through the streets of Amsterdam.The price for the Ecotour is really worth it!

Tom as Therapy. Tom took us cycling through Amsterdam and showed us the most wonderful spots and sustainable initiatives along the way. Although I live in Amsterdam for six years now, none of these places was familiar to me. It opened up a whole new Amsterdam to me, one to be really proud of. What a positive people and ideas. If you need to get out of your daily routine, you should try a tour with Tom, it will help you (re)gain a very positive outlook on the wonders of Amsterdam and more specifically its people.

A great afternoon in Amsterdam. From the first email contact we had with Tom, it was clear that the person we were dealing with was efficient, genuine and has a sense of humour. Tom arrived promptly at the meeting point and after a brief chat we headed off to visit hidden courtyards, backstreets and interesting little places that most tourists would never otherwise discover. We enjoyed interacting with the people Tom met (and photographed) and we shared many laughs along the way. Tom is a knowledgeable guide on sights, food, coffee shop culture and local history. He was always careful to ensure our safety in the path of many passing bicycles. We finished the tour feeling that we had known Tom for years instead of just a few short hours. We have no hesitation in recommending Tom's tours.

tailored to our needs. We had heard of Tom from some friends of ours that had recently been to Amsterdam. They really enjoyed their experience. What drew me to Toms Tours was that he was prepared to tailor the tour to our requirements. Four of us travelled to Amsterdam for a 4 day weekend. I do a lot of cycling but the others dont. What really impressed me was how Tom took the time to assess our ability on the bikes before taking us on the busy streets of Amsterdam! He took us away from the busy areas into the wonderful Vondel Park and watched us ride!!!. Some of us were really nervous about the idea of cycling in the busy streets. He asked us what we wanted to see and off we went!!!! He took us completely off the busy routes and we absolutely loved it. Fabulous canals, hidden courtyards and coffee!! We all loved it - he tailored it exactly for us!

So much fun!. We've just returned from a 2 day trip to Amsterdam, celebrating a 50th Birthday and a 22nd wedding anniversary. Bicycles hired, temperature 30deg and Tom arrives! A wonderful 3 hrs, saw Amsterdam through the eyes of someone who clearly loves the city. Entertaining, fun and 10/10. Don't hesitate! G. Doyle (Ireland)

Amazing hidden gems of Amsterdam. Tom made me see 'my' city through different eyes. I have been living in South Africa as a Dutch expat for the past seven years. I lived in Amsterdam before and it still feels like a second home. But things change and Tom showed us the new hotspots and hidden gems. I can recommend this tour to anybody, even those that think they know the scity, Tom's knows places where you have never been. He is sincerly passionate about his city and his enthusiasm rubs of on you. A must while visiting Amsterdam!

Excellent tour guide! Perfect!. Tom was such a GREAT tour guide!! We only has a few hours to tour and he did a perfect job in every way. My daughter wanted to go to a certain bench that was in a movie and she could not find where it was online and he found it ! She was so excited!! He showed us some private courtyards and knew so much history of Amsterdam! We look forward to coming back and seeing the countryside with Tom! Also, he is an EXCELLENT photographer and took almost 100 pictures of our family and emailed them to me a few hours after the tour! A true professional in every way! Went above and beyond to make our tour AWESOME! So much fun too!!!

Amazing Tour!. Tom is very knowledgable, professional and made our tour FUN! I highly recommend him for trips around Amsterdam or through the countryside. Tom's attention to safety was also a priority. He created a wonderful tour for us.

Insider's Guide to Amsterdam!. We are so glad our friend recommended Tom as a guide on our recent trip to Amsterdam. He really made an effort to understand what we wanted to see and accommodated our young son so nicely. He is such a positive, outgoing person! We did three days with Tom. He showed us some secret courtyards in the northwest part of the city and told us the stories behind them, took us on a biking tour (tandem with our son!) to Amstelpark and he and his lovely wife Ana made a beautiful little picnic for us with traditional dutch cheeses and all kinds of little goodies! On our last day with him, he took us out to the country and to visit some really charming little seaside towns. It was wonderful! By the end of the trip we felt like we had just visited friends who lived there, such was his care of us. Even when he wasn't with us, he was sending us dinner suggestions or ideas of things to do on our days off. Thanks Tom for a wonderful first visit to Amsterdam! It won't be our last. :)

You'd be mad not to!. We were given Tom's card and recommendation from fellow guests at The Toren Hotel and we were not disappointed, in-fact it was the best private tour we have ever had. Tom is charismatic and a wealth of knowledge on his home town and it was an absolute bonus that he is a professional photographer and not only able to show us Amsterdam's hidden secrets but to also give us a photo memento of our cycle tour was just above and beyond. Thank you Tom and we look forward to seeing you next time or in New Zealand when you fancy it.Greg & Wendy.

The Most Amazing Experience...EVER!. My friend and I traveled to Amsterdam for three days. We spent two of the days with Tom - all I can say is that Tom took us to the most wonderful and beautiful places that we normally would not have seen, both in Amsterdam and outside as well. In two days we did walking, biking, picnicking, cafes, beer tasting, apple pie, tulip excursion and more. Besides being an excellent tour guide and photographer, Tom is one of the nicest people I have ever met. If you want an experience that is filled with fun, beauty and adventure, this is it.

Phototour. What an experience with Tom and his phototour! His personal touch, his knowledge of the camera and Amsterdam, made this a wonderful tour. He knows the right people and right places and listens well to the need of the customers. He brings a nice atmosphere in the group and he tells a lot of nice, useful stories. This is not a typical tourist tour, this is Tom Traveltours!

Perfect. Tom is charming, intelligent, caring and funny.He loves Holland and knows of its treasures. We spent 2.5 days with him exploring Amsterdam and the north. Spent a lot of time on bikes and some in the car. Stopped and met dozens of people on street and heard their stories. Tom has a way that leaves all smiling. It's his warmth and genuine interest ! He packed lunches and refered us to great dinners to share alone. He was there when we need him and gave us spce othe times. Worth the price if you can afford it.

ACCOMMODATING!. Tom's tour was indeed excellent that we felt the warmness of his service from the transport to the tour and the food that he prepared. If i would go back to Amsterdam i will not make a second thought in getting him as our tour guide. Good spirited and yes a good photographer too! Never tired of taking our pictures. Thank you Tom! More power and more clients to come.

Personal approach to tours perfect for the family. I was happy to have chosen Tom's Travel and tours based on the reviews here at Tripadvisor. Glad i made the right choice.We did a customized tour to keukenhof and volendam. The countryside tour may not be Tom's expertise but he tried all his best to give us a great service.Rate was a bit high for us Filipinos but it was all worth every cent that we paid. We were very satisfied.Tom was a great tour guide, photographer, and driver all-in-one person. He even went to our hotel a day before the tour to discuss the details of the tour. His approach was personal and he was very attentive to our needs. The tour included snacks and lunch that Tom himself prepared. He was amazing! He also made sure that our grandparents were at eased. It was challenging to travel with wheelchairs but Tom made it easy for us. Our Netherlands countryside tour was memorable.Denkjewel Tom! " Salamat"as we say it in Filipino. Looking forward to return and do the other tours that he offered.

The other Amsterdam. Visiting Amsterdam with two teenage girls can be quite a challenge but Tom managed to show us places that they will definitly remember!Even though we stayed in the Jordaan we haven'nt seen all those nice backyards that were hidden behind the doors until Tom took us along.We just loved the atmosphere at the NDSM Warf in Amsterdam-Noord with all its graffiti. The girls were so happy taking pictures to show their friends at home!Even when our 4 hour tour with Tom was over the girls wanted to continue looking at the new housing area on Java Eiland! Tom showed us how to get there and where to go on our way back. During the tour there was always enough time to take pictures, have a cup of coffee or a delicious smoothie or to go to the bathroom... Tom was such a caring host. Thank you so much!

Great tour to discover Amsterdam (even for a local!). Really enjoyed the eco tour!! Perfect thing to do on a Saturday and Tom really made the tour, excellent tour guide - we had lots of fun! :)This is how a weekend is meant to be… would definitely recommend this tour to both locals and tourists!

Great, feeling like a local. We had a wonderful time with Tom. He showed us a lot of special places in Amsterdam.We really felt like a local going around and seeing all those spots only local people knowand your alway looking for when your in such a great place like Amsterdam. The nice Amsterdam market, the biological stores, the wonderful lunch, the beautiful canals, and much more...He told us a lot about all the things we saw and he was very helpful to answer all the questionswe had. You can't find a better guide in Amsterdam. He is very nice, warm and enthusiastic person.If you're planning to go to Amsterdam you definitely want this guy as your guide.

AMSTERDAM ECOTOUR. We had a fantastic time during the tour. We started at the Noorder 'biological' market and visited several interesting stalls where we could taste and experience. After we toke a pleasent walk through the beautifull old 'Jordaan' and visited a restaurant and a shop. We went further by bike and Tom showed us places we never seen before (and we live in Amsterdam). We could choose where we wanted to go and so we went to the east to see the tosti fabriek. Very friendly people and nice project. To finish the tour we had a fabulous lunch in a eco shop/restaurant. A day we will never forget and highly recommended for everybody who is interested in the good life. Thanks for the beautifull day!!!

A great day of cycling, tasting and learning in Amsterdam. This summer we - me, my wife and little boy - cycled the city with a group of Dutchies and tourists with Tom on his Eco Tour. It was great! Tom is a likable, experienced and fun tour guide. He showed us off the beaten track places, interesting and inspiring people and fun cycling routes through the city. We visited honey growers, natural wine makers, eco hoteliers and many more. It was just a great day and way to spend, learn, exercise and taste our day in Amsterdam.

A fun and interesting tour. In november we cycled the lovely Eco bicycle tour of Tom Travel Tours in Amsterdam. Nice routing, very informative, learned a lot of new stuff about the eco world and how to live better, also as a Amsterdam native it was very surprising to find so many places which we'd never noticed before. I highly recommend to join one of Tom's tours if you are visiting Amsterdam or even when you live around the corner.

Fantastic Experience. Tom's organisation is superb. We went with him for a team event and he built a specific program to inspire our team. The pace is just right allowing you to meet and chat with some inspiring individuals and really get insights into their work. We enjoyed some sights, tastes and smells of Amsterdam along the way - all by bicycle in true local style. Tom has great local knowledge to some of the more unusual eco places in the city and his enthusiasm and patience really helped us get the most from the experience. Would really recommend this to anyone who has half a day to spare and wants to enjoy getting under the "green" skin of the city.

Inspiring day as a tourist in my own city. Tom took us around Amsterdam to meet with some local eco-friendly entrepreneurs. It was very inspiring to see the other side of the city I have spent most of my life in and experience the city as a tourist.Tom's enthusiasm and knowledge were the icing on the cake!An absolute must for anyone interested to see the city a little bit more in depth.

Highlight of Amsterdam!. We did this tour on our third day in Amsterdam and saw so much more than we did in our first two days! Tom is so personable and he grew up in Amsterdam, so he knows it like the back of his hand. Not to mention that he is a great photographer and took some of the best photos of our whole trip on our camera. This was truly the highlight of our time in Amsterdam. I highly recommend this as a must do activity when visiting Amsterdam! Tom is the best guide.

The best. Mind blowing experience! in just a few relaxing hours on the bike photo tour with Tom we covered most of the city which changed my preconceived negative views of Amsterdam. It is one of the beautiful city's I have visited in my life form many stand points. Tom is a people person and knows his city well it was very pleasing to see him as we rode around how he interacted with us and the many friends that would wave to him as we rode. How can I not recommend his service. I don't really take many photos although my friend is deeply into it, I was more of an observer as they talk cameras, lens and techniques.Tom thank you for this memorable experience!!!! Richard from Santa Barbara

Photo tour of Amsterdam with Tom. I did a 5 hour photo tour on a bike with Tom. I found him to be an extreamly warm person with an in depth knowledge of the city, it's history and of photography. He took me to some awesome locations were I was able to get stunning photographs. On the whole I had a great time photographing the city and its sites with Tom and would highly recommend it to fellow enthusiasts.

Tom's tour was a highlight of our trip to Amsterdam!. Our family of 5 took a great bike/walking tour with Tom. He took us to his favorite special spots, like the beautiful hidden courtyards that we would never have found on our own, and the apple pie place, and the flea market, and his buddy's houseboat, and the ferry to the Filmmuseum (the restaurant has a great view of the city) etc, etc.Tom allowed us to see so much in a few hours, exposing us to the Amsterdam biking culture and helping my daughter who was nervous about biking in the city. I recommend the tour with Tom early in your trip as you will see areas you may want to visit in more depth later.Tom is an accomplished photographer and taught us some of the techniques he uses for his work. The pictures he took of us are great!He also hooked us up with a friend with a small boat for a canal tour. Much better than those huge tourist boats.

Tom's Photo tour to places in Amsterdam only known by the in crowd!!. It was an excellent 4 hrs photo tour on a bike through Amsterdam to many special places.You will smell, see, watch and take pictures of real Amsterdam.With Tom's photo tour, you will feel part of Amsterdam.He enthusiastically shows you where and how to take the best pictures and give you advise on your camera.His specialty is to take pictures of people in their own situation.Very enjoyable and meaningful tour.

A great guide and his name is Bram in Dam Square. We were on a very short visit to Amsterdam so really just stumbled on Bram in Dam Square carrying an orange umbrella. We did a solid two hour tour of central Amsterdam with him. There's no charge - you contribute at the end - we packed into two hours what would have taken a day if we had to discover it ourselves. A particular attraction is the Beguines (ladies whose community goes back to the Middle Ages) settlement totally off the "regular" tourist's path. he's charming, very entertaining, very concerned about our safety (vis-à-vis cyclists) while at the same time being very informative about the history and present-day culture of Amsterdam. Highly recommended.

Great Tour. Thanks Sam.. My husband and I booked this tour on line a few weeks before we travelled to Amsterdam for the weekend. However it is not really necessary to prebook as we saw some people walk up to Sam and he was more than happy to welcome them on his walking tour. Sam was very pleasant, great sense of humour, open to lots of questions and did his best to answer them, and told us lots of very interesting facts as we walked about the city. We really enjoyed the tour and would highly recommend it. It lasted exactly two hours! It is up to everybody to tip at their own discretion. Thanks Sam.

Exciting introduction to Amsterdam!. My friend and I have done 3 other walking tours during our backpacking trip, and they were all wonderful! However, we took a tour of Amsterdam with Sam today, and it was by far our favorite! Sam was captivating and informative. The weather was less than pleasant, but Sam's enthusiasm and knowledge of this city kept us out in the pouring rain, eager to explore. He also gave us some great tips that have already come in handy! The tour was more than worth it! Thanks, Sam!

Always start with this 2 hour tour!!!. Free Walking Tour Amsterdam was one of best ones I've done around Europe!! It was fun, informative, light-hearted & interesting! We walked through lots of cool areas- some were quiet, busy, beautiful, grungy, different & lively. We tasted cheese, analysed the angles of the Amsterdam buildings, learnt about the Dutch history, talked about the notorious coffee shops & discovered the red light district. Karen was smart, funny & charming- an awesome tour guide!! She was easily approachable and happily answered all our questions- weird & wacky! Thank you!I always recommend starting with a walking tour and then exploring the city on your own.This way you are equipped with some knowledge about the history & culture of the place you are in as you set off. Sometimes I have realised I went past a building that has 500 years of interesting history without knowing it because I didn't know what it was. I find that after doing tours I have an extra enthusiasm and appreciation for a city and I love it!

Great introduction to the city!. I always opt for the free walking tour when I visit a city and this one did not disappoint. Sem was an excellent and well-informed guide,the pace was just right and I learned a lot about the history and culture of Amsterdam. The tour took us to places that I would not have discovered on my own. Also love these tours because you tip according to what you think it's worth and you meet other, interesting tourists from many different countries.

A great tour!. This was the best tour I've had so far. I had the tour with Sam who is a great storyteller and knows how to captivate and maintain the group's attention. I was in tears at the end of the tour and his stories were so wholehearted and passionate. I definitely recommend having a tour with him.

Very nice introduction to Amsterdam. I took part in free walking tour at first day of my stay in Amsterdam, Marius was perfectly prepared. The walking took more than 2 hours, but he showed us the greatest monuments and places in Amsterdam, also he talked about history but in a funny way. He did some comparison to another countries and global situation. If you want to spend nice time with people from all over the world try this!

Great tour but overcrowded.. We were in Amsterdam for a few days in October and did this walking tour on a Sunday, with Marias as our guide. The tour was great and Marias was a fabulous guide...very knowledgable and made the tour very interesting with his wit and humour. My only criticism is the size of the tour. There were over 50 in our group, and it was too large. It would have been better to split the group into two, with another guide taking the other group. We booked on line months ago, thinking this was necessary, but it didn't matter as anyone could walk up and join the group on the day.

Worth doing it first day!. Went on the walking tour the minute I arrived and got a really good tour guide which I can't remember his name(He was Irish and ginger) but really good. He made it interesting by adding a few jokes into the tour. Helped me get my bearings of the City and also an inside feel of the history there. Would definitely recommend going!

Awesome and relaxed tour with super friendly tour guide. Marius was so friendly and genuine. He has lived in Amsterdam all his life and his love of the city was really infectious. He was very open to answering any questions we had and seemed to do his best to be honest without sugar coating anything. Definitely was the best way to start off my trip!

Very interesting and fun tour!. The tour around Amsterdam was led by Sem. He's a great tour guide, knows a lot of interesting facts and has a great sense of humor. Don't miss the opportunity to go on this tour, it's a must do!

Phil. Went on the alternative tour with Axel and had a great time! He was a funny and informative and helped me learn a few things about the Netherlands government, which was interesting.
Would definitely recommend touring with Axel.

First thing to do!!!. Me and my mother visited the tour today and we were lucky to have Kor for our guide. The city itself is astonishing and the guide was really informative. The tour was 3 hours and no matter the cold weather, Kor's enthusiasm kept us all happy and smiling. It is rare nowadays to see such passionate guides as him, but from my experience i can tell that the people who make tours for free are exactly the ones that adore their city the most. Yes, the tour is free, but it really deserves a good tip at end for the well done job! It is a must do! Thank you Kor once again!
Morning walk. Great to walk around Amsterdam, our guide Kor was fantastic very informative and funny. Our tour was 3 hours not the advertised 2. Really well spent few hours.

OH WOW!! THIS MADE OUR HOLIDAY!! INFORMATIVE, FUN, EXCELLENT!!!. After getting up at 03.00 a.m. to catch flight from UK for 4 days in Amsterdam, we booked a free walking tour as we thought this would be all we could manage in the day! Marius was our guide, and what a superb narrator! (In English) A proud Dutchman who managed to integrate all of the group with his conversation, a knowledgeable man who enjoyed using the language of various nations to keep our interest (there were people from New York, Finland, Australia,Germany, UK etc) and used very funny tales to regale us with. An interesting person who kept our interest, and actually I am sure overran the time he had with us such was his enthusiasm! I had been to Amsterdam before many years ago and thought I had a reasonable knowledge of the city, but Marius put new light onto history, events, buildings, etc. and I can highly recommend this walking tour as one of the very best I have undertaken. Marius, keep on walking, you are one of the best!! (From Lana)

Informative . Did the city tour in English and Karin our guide was awesome. Very informative and entertaining. Saw wonderful streets and heard stories about the city that you don't get in tour books. Highly recommend.

Fresh, funny and informative. Our guide, Marius, was an awesome Tour guide and he had great knowledge of Amsterdam and it's history as well as the history of the Netherlands. 10/10 would recommend! Greetings from Denmark!
2 hours well spent. The guide Bram was very informative and the places we visited were interesting and a good way to get your bearings.

you get what you pay for. I found the tour uninformative and dull. I like walking tours as a way to learn the history and culture of a place, but this one was lacking on both. Very little information provided; it was mostly vignettes without any substance, that provided mild amusement for some (not me).
Fun and well done. Joost did a great job handling a huge group. He was loud and enthusiastic and made the tour quite fun.
Informative & fun. Sam was fantastic. As a history major, he knew his stuff. Friendly and polite - free cheese sample was a nice touch.

Walking tour Amsterdam. Really enjoyed this walking tour with Otto who made it very interesting and entertaining.
Definitely recommend it !

Great and funny guide. All I can say is that I had a very good time with Sem.
He is a good guide, very funny and enthusiastic. He managed to create a good atmosphere between the participant of the group. I would definitely recommend his city tour.

Revisiting Amsterdam ...43years on. Our tour guide BAS was excellent. Engaged the group and had a wealth of knowledge re the historical side of Amsterdam. Highly recommend. This a tips base tour. Excellent value.

Great guide!. I love walking tours in general, but this was particularly great. I was at the meeting place rather early, as I didn't want to miss it. Sem, the guide, was already there. He was super friendly, fun and knowledgeable. Not only did I learn about Amsterdam, but also about the "Dutch way". The walk includes free cheese tasting and a small art museum. It was very interesting. 100% recommendable!
Excellent Tour. Great walking tour of Amsterdam, seeing all the key tourist spots. Tour guides are great and very engaging.

Great walking tour. If you like to walk and discover new cool things of the city, you should definitely try it. You will walk through the city center and the young guides will take you to discover Amsterdam and it most iconic spots. Tips minimum 10€ per person.

Our amazing free tour with Rik Vuur.. My friends and I decided to go on this tour on our third day of walking around Amsterdam and it was great. Even though we might have walked some of the places beforehand he shared with us interesting and fun facts about and created whole new meaning to architecture and history behind it.

Great tour! . Awesome and worth while tour. Mike our tour guide was fantastic and wanted to make this a memorable event. He encouraged you to talk to people within the tour and get to know each other. Was very knowledgable and fun. Felt comfortable asking questions and did not feel rushed.. Even had a little nibble of local delicious cheese. Highly recommend.

Otto Was Excellent. Our gang of 4 took the early tour 2 days ago, on Sunday. Otto was our guide and he was great. He was informative, funny, and encouraged questions. He walked us through several interesting parts of the city that we would never have seen if left to our own devices. Highly recommended.
Excellent Tour!. Our tour guide was Kor Hobe. He was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable. We learned a lot about Amsterdam during the tour.

Informative tour spiced up with a few funny anecdotes here and there. Otto did a great job - he has a broad background knowledge and knows how to spice things up a bit thus making the tour both informative and entertaining, e.g. by trying to involve the participants.
Highly recommended!

History of Amsterdam walking tour. Tour takes in the red light district and China town plus other smallcourtyards you dont relalise are in the city centre. Seems to be a number of guides all with knowledge of the city.
It's the small things these guides point out that make spending the 2 hours in their company.worthwhile.

Great Tour with Tim. Very nice and relaxed tour with Tim. This tour is an ideal way to start your vacation in Amsterdam. You really get the knoiw the inner city and at the same time you'l learn some history and some fun anecdotes.

Excellently informative tour - Bas was brilliant!. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to the meeting point where we were then split into language groups (our guide spoke four languages!). We saw points of historical interest such as the red light district and where Anne Frank lived, and gained a lot of insight into how the city of Amsterdam was formed. I really enjoyed learning about the history of Amsterdam, and that our tour guide knew a lot of detail. Bas was a friendly and funny tour guide who I'd recommend to everyone!
Informative. It was easy to find the meeting place and we were grouped by language. it was a good way to get an overview of the Downtown area.
Great tour with many fun by humorous guide Otto. The tour was well designed and Otto has been really helpful and considerate. Enjoyed the tour and definitely recommand it if you are new to this city!

Walking fun with OTTOman ;) Free Walking tours in Amsterdam.. It was a pleasant funny walking tour with Dutch guy OTTO. He has not only a good knowledge of the city but he retells it in a very understandable and interesting way, especially pointing at those less-known facts about Amsterdam. His telling gives answers to many historical pecularities and stereotypes and is full of theatrical gestures and funny stories. Nice to meet you, Amsterdam and OTTO, in person. :)

Excellent! . Great way to know every small detail about the city! Our guide was amazing, very friendly and his English was understabdable for non speakers! Would definitely recommend to everyone! 10/10Thank you

A great tour by a great Dutchman - Otto. A really fun and interesting tour in the major locations of Amsterdam, guided by Otto - a true Dutchman with high spirits, vast historical knowledge and cool and fun facts about the city, e.g. snoop dog's favorite coffee shop or the number of bicycles drunk Dutch men throw to Amsterdam's tunnels every year.. Don't miss it!
A fantastic way to meet Amsterdam. Our guide was Karin. She is an excellent guide. Funny and informative. I highly recommend, it was great even though it rained.

Great way to explore the north of the city. 2 hours went very quickly with the perfect amount of stops and informative talks from Otto about everything from history, architecture, to prostitution laws.

History insights + great entertainment. A must do! Had a lovely tour with Otto on a sunny Sunday afternoon, when he took the group around the old part of Amsterdam. Our guide told us a lot about history, as well as interesting facts about the city that only a local could have known! Otto is not only knowledgeable, but also extremely funny, which adds incredible value to the tour. An open air history class around Amsterdam with an extremely entertaining teacher. Cannot be missed!
Sightseeing . We have had a superb walking tour around Amsterdam this morning with Otto as our enthusiastic guide. Highly recommend. Oksana and Andy, UK

Great way to hit the high points and get your bearings.. Great tour with Otto today! Friendly, funny, and knowledgeable guide. Tour is a great mix of history and an introduction to the things that make Amsterdam "weird" (to include a helpful explanation of the less-than-clear legality of said weirdness). The city is an imperfect grid so a guided tour is useful in getting the lay of the land. I recommend you check out some "pre-pay" tour rates to get an idea for what's a fair tip.

Great tour!. I had the chance to follow a free walking tour in Amsterdam with Otto as guide. I recommend the tour to everyone. It was simply interesting and funny, and the most important thing is that I still remember everything he said. A free walking tour is the best way to get to know the city, especially when the guide combines so good technical knowledge, direct experiences and funny stories about the place.

Perfect for a short stay in Amsterdam!. Fun tour with Tim! Interesting facts and some insider tips about the city!Perfect if you want to see as much of the city as possible in a short amount of time!Would definitely recommend it!

Excellent tour with Otto: there is more to 'Dam than meets the eye (but yes, you'll cover the basics, too). Excellent and fun tour with Otto on 20 August. We have found our new details of the city, got a brief but thorough enough tour of the famous naughty bits, as well as for a respectful account of WWII events. Despite what anybody else mentioned here, the guide was polite, yet entertaining. Lekker, indeed!

Fun and interesting Free Walking Tour with Otto. We had on Saturday afternoon a very nice free walking tour with Otto. My friends and me really liked how he showed us Amsterdam city centre and the way he provided information about history, stereotypes and other data. It was a very interesting and fun experience!
Grade tour with tim!. It was a very good tour and the guide told us many things and story's about the history. It's free but if you want you can give them a bit money at the end.

Go there :). Went on that tour with Otto. Had some nice hours exploring the city. Our guide was very kind and gave us a lot of informations about Amsterdam - and always in an entertaining way... was fun - I highly recommend to go there!

Free Walking Tour mit Otto was awesome!!! :). We did the free walking tour in Amsterdam with Otto and it was great!! :) He could provide a lot of information about Amsterdam and it was very interesting!! He has a good sense of humor, so it gets never boring!!! Thanks Otto!!! :)
Excellent, super interesting and very educational tour (+ FREE!). Highly recommended! Our guide Otto was quite the showman, both funny and very knowledgeable. You don't want to miss this!

Otto - good guide but could improve . We did the tour with Otto this morning. He was fun, friendly and knowledgeable, but several of his comments were in poor taste or ignorant. For example, he talked about men 'needing' sex from prostitutes, referred to 100 000 jews and 90 000 Dutchmen dying in Amsterdam in WWII, (forgetting that those Jew people were Dutch too), he referred to The Dutch East India company as successful in claiming new land for Holland, (I doubt the inhabitants of those countries would have thought of it as new land), and later made a joke about slavery (albeit then saying that it was a very serious matter). I don't want to cast this in the wrong light, the tour as a whole was interesting and fun. I also understand it is hard to be respectful and entertaining. All the same, if he could consider these things more, it would improve the experience.
Otto is the man. Like this guy he know some cool stuff and know a lot about the city. 5star rate. Love amsterdam. The tour cover each area and a cool approach to the city

Otto did a great job!. We took this walking trip and it was really fun. Otto made it a real entertainment. It was a lot more than just a cultural and historical experience. It was an enjoyable dutch adventure.
Wonderful!. Otto made us a free walking tour around ansterdam city centre. I wholeheartedly recommend it, excellent experience.

Very enjoyable. My daughter and I decided to go on the free tour to get a better insight into the history of the city and the wonderful surroundings. Our guide Otto was humorous, laid back, very Dutch but also superbly informed on all the stories and history of the places we visited and was full of little facts about everything from cheese to prostitutes' kindergartens! The tour lasted just over 2 hours and if you manage to last the pace and not get run over by a bike, tram or car you'll have a great time. Well worth the top. Thanks Otto. Lekker!

Great learning experience but not heaps of sites. My mum and I did the 10.30am tour on a Sunday morning.Our tour guide was really lovely, down to earth, and refreshingly frank about the history and culture and goings on of Amsterdam.The tour took about 2.5 hours and wound around the streets of Amsterdam city.We would recommend this tour for people wanting to really learn and gain knowledge about what really makes Amsterdam what it is today.We wouldn't recommend this for people short of time and wanting to see beautiful sights.We didn't really stop at many picturesque places to talk about them, rather we just stopped near the area where it was quiet to talk. For a free walking tour, you get what you pay for so to speak, and I think the real sights and sounds are what you will find after you have explored the city yourself after gaining your bearings from the info on the tour :)

Little Bit Of Amsterdam. This was the very first thing I did in Amsterdam and it was nice cause it gave a good basic layout of central Amsterdam. While also sharing key bits of history and fascinating facts. The pace is pretty good and the stopping places were well chosen. Ultimately a nice free walking tour for 2 hrs.

SUPER. I attended Otto's tour. It was basically what I expected: a guided tour by a typical Dutch guy who knows a lot about his city, it was really amazing! He also gave us some proper Gouda kaas van Holland and Dutch waffles, lekker!
Thank you Otto!

Amazing . Otto was absolutely amazing and anyone who gives me cheese instantly becomes my best friend, so now Otto is family. Learned alot about Amsterdam and some great local history that can not be found any where else.

Free city tour Amsterdam. The tour was nice.We had awesome guide who make excursion by her own and it was unique and interesting.I highly recommended to join the group and visit this tour.
Greeting from St Petersburg

Great way to see the city. Our guide was Brit and she was amazing. A lot of fun, a lot of facts and information about the city and Netherlands. Very friendly and gave us the best tips about places to go.We saw a lot of places in 2 hours and you actually don't feel tired at all. It's is totally worth it! My friends didn't want to go initially but they gave it a shot and loved it!Totally recommend it.Oh, and don't forget to tip!!!

Very interesting 3 hours. When an Australian called Julian introduces himself as your Amsterdam tour guide I must admit I felt this was going to be a bit disappointing however I was completely wrong. Obviously the tour company provides the basic information for their guides but Julian,who has lived in Amsterdam for 5 years, has made sure he has accumulated a lot of personal experiences and information to add to the standard commentary. He also made every effort to engage with all the people in the group. We had done the tour several years ago but we still completely enjoyed this one. Make the effort its worth it and ask for Julian
Very good tour!. I really enjoyed it and got to know the history of this place better. We walked the streets of Amsterdam and got to ask the guide any questions we had about the things we passed by.

Nice and inreresting. Joost was a great guy. Very good Tour with perfect lenght. 2 hours and you get start to your stay in Amsterdam. You can ask him everything and he also knows some nice funfacts about Amsterdam.Just Do it!Thank you Joost!

2 hr walking tour. We toured with Leonard. He is a history major who knows everything about Amsterdam. He's knowledgeable and entertaining. We only had three days in Amsterdam and we got all the info that we need from him. I highly recommend this tour!N

Fun at the same time educational tour with Leonard . My sisters and I really enjoyed the free walk tour of Amsterdam. Our guide, Leonard, from White Umbrella is an excellent young tour guide with a lot of knowledge about the city. He's also very funny. For the first time tourists, I recommend this free tour with the locals. It pretty much gives ideas about what to see with the little time you have.

I learned and saw so much on this tour. I would always recommend free walking tours. I learned so much and saw the major points of the city. The tour guide was a local that had grown up in Amersterdam so we got great insider info on the area.

Interesting walk in getting to know Amsterdam.. A good two hour walk with Brit, the guide. She takes you all over, stopping now and then to share information and history of the city. It's great to listen to Brit telling her stories which enlightens us about the city.I love that she took us to all the routes and different parts of the city. I just wish that we could take longer stops so we could take more pictures, but it is understandable. Overall it was a very good walking tour and Brit is knowledgeable, friendly and a warm person and for sure, a great guide. Thank you Brit for everything.

A Must!. Walk around with a local to discover secret pathways and city secrets. You'll get to be more than just (another) redlightdistrictdroolingpotsmokinghungry-tourist. It was awesome and you won't regret it!

Great tour through the heart of Amsterdam. Our Guide Tim gave us a great tour through the city, with a lot of useful information, interesting background and a good amount of fun. We really appreciated the walk. Thanks a lot from Germany!

Enjoyable tour. Good to do this tour as soon as you arrive as you get your bearings, gain information & see the back streets. Interesting facts given & our guide was quite funny too. A very productive & enjoyable way to spend two hours in Amsterdam.

Too superficial. We came to this tour after reading that it was going to tell the history of Amsterdam. Apparently our guide also had a history degree but the tour was too superficial and didn't deliver what is written on the website. Basicly a nice walk with a nice guide and some fun facts along the way, but you don't learn a lot.
Excellent . Enjoyed this completely. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and funny. Best part of my visit to Amsterdam.

Expected better. I've done free walking tours in many cities and they were excellent, but if this was the first one I'd ever done I would never have taken another. Our guide Stephen was unfocused, rambled a lot, provided few historical details, pretty much phoned it in. It sounds like other guides have been much better.

Great Tour. Our tour guide, Joost, was very friendly and knowledgable about the city. The tour covered the major areas of interest and had great stories about what was going on around the city over the ages. Joost gave great recommendations on other things to do around the city after the tour was over.

Interesting & engaging tour !. We were a group of 4 friends and had booked the tour with Joost beginning of July. Joost covered many general information about Amsterdam but also added some less important but funny details. All in all a very engaging experience, we definitely do recommend it!

Small groups mean personal attention.. We went on a wonderful tour today with Joost who gave us a great overview of the city of Amsterdam. I had a number of questions about the city's history and about the tremendous efforts that the country has had to make over the years to stop from being flooded. I am very interesting in their efforts to protect themselves and in their efforts at land reclamation and Joost was able to answer all my questions while pointing out other resources that could provide more information. These questions aren't part of their basic tour.Full disclosure: we had come to Dam Square with the intention of doing a walking tour with Sandeman's (i.e. the top ranked tour in town). We jumped ship because this tour had 14 people and there were 25-30 on the Sandeman tour. My wife and I have been all over Europe this year and have done several Sandeman tours. They have good tour guides but they don't control the size of their tours very well. With a large tour, you can't see, you can't hear, and you can't get your questions answered. Very much an inferior experience. For my money, go with the smaller guy. In this case, that was Joost and Free Walking Tours Amsterdam.

Awesome Hard-Kor Tour of the city!. Amazing tour from our awesome tour guide Kor. He looked like Keith Lemon except he was actually funny. Thoroughly entertaining, whilst informative and thought provoking, Kor did an amazing job and putting across the varied history of the city as well as a feel for it's customs and traditions. Would highly recommend and would definitely do again.

Fun walking tour!. We booked here because it was the only FWT we found in the afternoon. It was a great choice because we had an awesome time with Tim around the city. Tim has no filter on explaining all the "wild life of Amsterdam" so it is useful to do the tour on your first day in the city.
Great tour. I had a great time during guide Joost's tour through the city. He told us many interesting facts and funny stories about the cit.

Great way to learn about Amsterdam. . Had a great tour with our guide, Tim. The group was a good size and we moved at a quick, but comfortable pace. Tim was able to provide historical facts about the places we visited, as well as a few interesting bits of trivia.

Good Tour. Did a walking tour with this outfit. Our guide was excellent and engaging. The tour itself was a bit heavy on information about vices (drugs, alcohol and prostitution) and a little light on information about the history of the city for my taste. Hence 4 stars instead of 5.

Very interesting, the right speed and length, great guy!. We had a great time with Tim. He's very personable and has a lot of great stories. He also strikes a good balance between seeing enough of the city without seeing every possible thing. He also was very willing to answer any questions people had. Highly recommend!
Free tour with Joost. Enjoyed a free walking tour with Joost this morning. Very informative and enjoyable. I would certainly recommend him if you have a chance to join histpur.

A must do for this City. Unfortunately i spent the first 2 days of our holiday trying to find all the treasures that Amsterdam holds- waste of time!There are simply too many side streets and hidden alleys that are all too easy to miss.The 2 hour walk was highly informative, interactive and I was impressed at the enthusiasm and knowledge our guide had on a city he obviously loves and admires.

interesting guided tours that fits your budget. I really enjoyed this walking tour with a guide Marius. He is a nice man and has a good sense of humour. He showed us places and told facts that official guides wouldn't show. Highly recommended!

Fun tour with Tim. We met Tim, the long tall Dutchman with the WHITE umbrella at Dam Square for a 2 hour walking tour. Tim guided us through main streets, back streets, the Red Light District, crossing canals every so often while providing historic and informative commentary about Amsterdam. At the end of the tour we posed for a photo that Tim e-mailed to the people in his group who had booked a spot through his e-mail account (timlunshofgmail.com). Be sure to generously tip the great guide with the WHITE umbrella!!

Fun and informative - A great introduction to Amsterdam with Joost. My husband and I took the 1030 walking tour with Joost on our first day in Amsterdam. Joost our tour guide was well informed, a great communicator with a good sense of humour who really entertained and enlightened us about this special city. It was a wonderful way to get a grasp of the city and find out what to do and some of the great history as well. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone wanting to know more about Amsterdam and have some fun as well!

Great 2h tour with Joost. We took 10:30 tour with Joost - very young and enthusiastic guide. The tour started in Dam Square, covered RLD, NewChurch, OldChurch, Begijnhof, Bushuis, etc. Joost explained well all the visited places, from origins to actual state, from historical point of view, and had the answer to all our questions. He also shared useful information on legal drugs, prostitution, and other Amsterdam attractions. Thank you Joost!

Lots to learn. We had a great and knowledgeable guide. We learnt lots about Amsterdam (past and present) and got to see things that we wouldn't have seen/known about if we did a bog standard tour that just went to the tourist attractions.
Great walking tour!. We signed up for a free walking tour...what a great experience! Super guide, great pace, the best! Highly recommended!!

Pleasant and informative. Our tour guide, Marius, was very personable and knowledgable. As a native to Amsterdam he was able to dish out great insight to the city, including information about the past and current culture. Definitely recommended.
Very fum. It was very nice and interesting, we learnt a lot of interesting things about the city, its past and current main issues. Plus, the guide was great, always interacting and very responsive.
Excellent. I love the tourThe guide was so nice and helped us showing the city and giving a lot of tips about the city

A MUST. What a great way to see Amsterdam Our guide was an Australian who had lived in Amsterdam for 7 years and was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining He made the 3 hr walk go so quickly you get to see the real city and its people You pay what you think it is worth which is a great way to reward someone for their work A tour worth doing at the beginning of your visit to orientate yourself to where to explore the exciting city more

Great tour in the best part of Amsterdam!. The tour was great! You got nice tips, cultural and historical information of buildings and places difficult to find by yourself. Good spots to take picture and info to go later other places. It's worthy. Recommended!

A great tour in Amsterdam. We had a fun tour of Amsterdam conducted by Marius while we were on a cruise in the Baltic. Not only was the price reasonable (free except for recommended tip) but it provided a great overview of the downtown area, including the infamous red light district. Marius even took the time to help me find a church that my ancestors attended. We also appreciated the email confirmations. Well managed - well done!

Great Trip with an Awesome Guide!. I had great time with Tim When he be the guide of city tour. He told me so many Histories of Amsterdam and recommended me nice place for hang out there.
Do not hesitate to follow this tour!

Free Walking Tours Amsterdam. Good walking tour with fairly good mix of information about Amsterdam and the Netherlands in general, the upside was that there were not too many people so it was easy to keep up with Tim.

Fantastic. A very nice tour which helps me go deeper of Amstedam, the housing style, cheese and different kinds of historical buildings all have their stories and reasons behind, without the tour, they are not special anymore! The tour guide explains in a funny style, 2 hours is never too long for it, lovely!
Great walking tour with Tim. Great walking tour! Tim is a great guide funny, know the History and a really dutch man! Very direct open en honest tour!

Entertaining enough to keep interest of our jet lagged group.. Took an overnight flight to Amsterdam from Canada. Went to the Anne frank Museum in the morning, By noon, jet lag was kicking in but us parents wanted a walking tour. When we got to Dam square, there were 2 other groups offering a free walking tour, but I'm glad we chose this one. Our guide Marius kept our interest all the way. Just a little warning to parents, this tour is not suitable for children.
Tim. Was a wonderful walking tour packed full of information, would recommend to anyone and everyone! Big thanks to Tim for the wonderful experience!

Let down!. Before our trip to Amsterdam, friends recommeded to go to this site and pick a walking tour that had positive reviews. That lead us to this tour. What a let down it was. Our guide Tim, wasn't very engaging, or approachable. To us it seems that he was just going thru the motions. The tour felt rushed and the talks in between were not that interesting. Also the jokes he made in the end about tipping, we found a bit embarrassing, and made us feel uncomfortable. The parts of the city we saw on the tour were nice, but there will be other tour companies (on Dam square there are at least 3 other tour companies who also do a free walking tour) who will show you the same things, but hopefully with a bit more enthusiasm, a bit more fun, and with a bit more historical sense.

Meh.... Take Sandemans instead!!. I must say I'm an experienced 'free tour' tourist. This tour doesn't meet the expectations at all. I took the tour with Tim Lunshof, and yes the tour is laid back and he's a nice person. If you are used to the free tour experience, the idea is that the guide will make you have a blast, will be funny, will be interactive, will tell you interesting things only a local would know, hidden jewels, etc... and then you feel like paying the guy. Tim doesn't come across as someone passionate about his city that wants to show you a great time. The commentaries are very short, not too funny and scarce. You walk a lot (normal), almost no time for pictures, he skipped almost the whole of the IIWW history, no (funny) stories about the Dutch royal house, no (funny) stories about the red district, nothing about the current political climate, etc... Expect a 'nice walk', relaxed guide and enjoy the city.
Great tour. Great tour, perfect as a starter to understand the city on the whole. Our guide was really knowledgeable and nice!

Great tour! Recommended!. Tim was our tour guide and he was great! He was very informative and interesting with lots of history. It was a great way to see the city in two hours. Actually, it was one of my favorite parts of the trip. (Also, Tim went out of his way to walk us to the nearest supermarket after the tour.)

Around the Dam in 120 Minutes. As someone who had planned a solo trip to Amsterdam, with all my heart I can say that this 2-hour tour around the centre of Amsterdam came totally in handy for me! I, personally, had so much fun and I learned a great deal about the attractions of Amsterdam, especially thanks to our guides Joost and Karen. We even tasted Dutch cheese! If you are into these types of tours which take you to pretty much all the tourist attractions around, but if you do not want to pay too much either; I highly recommend you these wonderful tours of "Free Walking Tours Amsterdam". Do not hesitate because of the unbelievably unstable weather of Netherlands, because these tours always go on anyway. Just take your umbrella and camera with you and let these kind and sweet Dutch guides walk you through the streets of Amsterdam or should I say... canals?
Best Walking Tour in Amsterdam. Very informative tour and very useful especially if your schedule is tight and want to get a feel for Amsterdam!
Lovely city and interesting tour. I really recommend the tour! In two hour you get to know the main part of the city. Really interesting.
Must do!. One of the first things to do when in Amsterdam. Super informative and great fun. Great way of meeting new people aswell.

Great walking tour in Amsterdam. This tour is the best way to begin your visit in Amsterdam. When you arrive in the city with jet lag it's great to get an introduction and be led through the maze of streets without having to navigate on your own. The meeting place was centrally located and our guide Marius was knowledgable and fun.
A perfect way to know the city. It was great. Interesting and complete description .. we walk around wonderfull streets full of history and it let us know the real amsterdam
Very nice walking!!!!. The tour we were provided with interesting facts and local dutchie knowledge.Our guide knows all about the city! It's the greatest introduction you can have to Amsterdam.

Nice way to see the city. Our hotel was a fair walking distance from the central meeting point, but walking is a pretty great way to scope out the city.
