The tour started out by stopping at an interesting [redacted] shop, then through the red light district and then up and down many other areas of the city.The red light district wasn't the main focus of the tour by any means, but it is an interesting part of the city - definitely quite different from any other city we've walked through - and to be honest, I'd probably feel too much like a voyeur to walk through it on my own. Just be aware that it is extremely tacky and disrespectful to photograph the workers.Also saw the former opium trade areas, walked past a few "coffee houses " (coffee may be available here, but that's not what they are really selling!), the new and old houses, and learned a lot about why the houses tilt toward the canals, and what the hooks on the roofs are for, and how houses were taxed based on the width of the house, and many more interesting areas.I really enjoy taking walking tours of a new city, and this one fit the bill - thanks, Marius!
Interesting Walk. Karin was our guide for an infomative walk through parts of Amsterdam. She is well spoken and enjoys shariang her city with tourists.

Free Walking Tour. Definitely try and do a free walking tour on your first day that way for the next couple stays you know more about where things are and can get recommendations on where to go, eat, etc. Our guide was Morgan and she was super friendly and nice and tried to make sure the tour was interesting at all times. Great knowledge about the history of Amsterdam, highly recommend! Please keep change with you at all times as this is the only way the guides get paid - through tips.
Must-Do. Tim showed us the city in a very humorous and informative way. We saw the main sights and some streets and corner I never recognised before. Really worth it!
Great walking tour. Really interesting. Full of unexpected facts and interactive too so not the usual full on blurb! Easy walking time

Good intro to Amsterdam. I joined the walking tour on my first day in Amsterdam and it was actually quite good. We had a local guide who'd been born and lived most of his life in Amsterdam (apparently this is quite rare!) and he was very knowledgeable about the area and its history, passing on tips on where to go, things to do etc. He brought the stories to life for each of us visiting from different countries.Although there's a lot of walking around involved (it's a walking tour, I know :-)) it didn't feel like it was too much so l think it'll suit most people with different fitness levels and walking abilities. It can get very crowded in the university area so do stay close to the group. I'd definitely recommend doing this tour first to get an idea of places/get your bearings and then if any particular area catches your eye you can come back to it later in your own time and at your own pace.
Free Walking Tour Amsterdam. If you do not have a full day to walk around Amsterdam, this is the best way to see and learn the most of the city in 2 hours.

Free Walking Tour and Red Light District Tour with Dominique. I went to the free walking tour with a fellow backpacker and we had a lot of fun! We were led through the city for i believe 2 and something hours by our tour guide Dominique who presented us the charming Amsterdam. Lots of interesting facts and great tips from a local! We booked the red light district tour during the break. Which gave us even more info on the infamous district of Amsterdam. I'll recommened these tours to anybody interested in fun sight seeing tours! Also, they say Free, but I think we all know that it'd be rude to not tip the guide atleast 5 bucks at the end (if you can afford it).

Awesome Tour. Walking tours are a great way to get a better, holistic understanding of the city and to learn more about its history. Our tour guide was very knowledgable and great at making sure that nobody got left behind/had any unanswered questions. After the tour I had a couple of questions about the social climate in the Netherlands and race relations there, and we ended up sitting down for 20 minutes and having a great conversation about it. That conversation and the tour were probably the most informative parts of my whole trip. Plus, it's pay as you wish! So really there's no downside. Highly recommend.

not historical walking, different sometimes unnecessary informations. firstly I don't like if tour guide does so many jokes. He did. Some of place was useful but not everywhere which he showed us. He is good man. but he said for example for tips that people shouldn't give him less than 10 oe 20, 30 euro. People should decide it if they like or not. It was rude.
BEST WALKING TOUR EVER. Our guide was super knowledgeable and HILARIOUS. Kept us entertained the whole time! Must do in Amsterdam!

Amsterdam Free Walking Tour. Gert was our tour guide (possibly incorrect spelling), though he has been the best tour guide I've had to date. Super funny, punctual and informative, not over the top or not enough. Learnt quite a lot about Amsterdam, definitely recommend.
Nice introduction to Amsterdam. Very good tour. The guide was very knowledgeable and the tour took you around some of the key areas in Amsterdam
free walking tour amsterdam. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly. Very good experience, at the same time cheap. I met some other tourists in the group who also liked the walk.

New Friends Made. What a great tour. Not only did I learn more than I could ever expected on a free tour as our tour guide was authentic and was proud of her dutch heritage, I also made some life long friends on the tour. This tour was one of the best tours I have been on to date in europe and I can't recommend this enough for whomever is reading this to go on it. It is pay as you want so if you don't agree with me at the end you just pay less but I recommend having a some bills in hand because it is better than a paid tour!
Exhausting. Concept is fantastic, we've done it before in a lot of places. The guide was just too much for us. Obviously very personal, probably very nice in another group
Fun tour. It was a very Informarive but in the same time funny and lighthearted introduction to center of Amsterdam.
Good tour. Tour was good. Guide was informative and funny. Guide covered a lot of area and didn't spend too much time on history of any one thing.
Great tour. Knowledgable guide;, good anecdotes,; thorough coverage of the city. I came away glad that I'd done it and with a much better understanding and appreciation of Amsterdam

Perfect to get know Amsterdam. This tour is perfect to have a good view over Amsterdam, his history, the small bridges, tasting some typicial dutch cheese and so on.....We can really recommend to do this tour. The guide was very friendly and had to all questions an answer.
Great walking tour. We really enjoyed the tour and saw sites that we wouldn't have found on our own. Marius was a very informative and dynamic guide
Very good!!!. I enjoyed a lot the free-guided tour, the guide is very funny and told good curiosities about Amsterdam.

Interesting but odd tour. The tour began at the national monument with our nice and eccentric tour guide. To start with the bad, the guide talked more about himself and the visitors than the history and beauty of the city around us. I'm pretty sure we were shown the incorrect narrowest house in Amsterdam, and we didn't get to see the front of the stock exchange on the tour.Now to the good stuff. Our guide was very nice and made sure everyone felt included and could hear and understand the tour. He spoke English very well. We talked about the palace, then walked over to the backside of the stock exchange and saw the Condom store. From there we walked through the red light district and saw everything there. With various stops along the way we walked on to the old East India Company headquarters, then to the Heilige Stede where the miracle of 1345 occurred. We learned more about the city history as we continued our walking tour back around to the national monument where the tour concluded.For anyone who has not been on a "free" tour before here is your warning. The tours are not really free, but are tip based. I have found some of the best tours to be tip based since the guides try their best to get better tips. Unfortunately, this was not one of the best free walking tours I have been on.

Free Walilking Tour of Amsterdam. We had a wonderful time on our tour with Karen. She was very informative, showed us many places we would not have seen on our own. You could tell that she loved her city and she was enthusiastic.
Fantastic tour. Excellent way to know the basics of the city centre. Tim was very informative and answered every question. Much recommended
Great Fun in the Sun. We had Marius for our tour who did a fantastic job explaining his quirky city. If you need a good start to this amazing city, this tour is a great option to get you started!

free walking tour amsterdam. we had a tour a tour for 2 hours and every information during the tour was interesting. The tour made us feel like local and know amsterdam, their people and culture more closely. I suggest every traveller should take this tour to know more about the streets of amsterdam. just a small rewarding tip to the guide at the end of the tour.

A fantastic introduction. I'd highly recommend this fantastic introduction to Amsterdam, took just over 2 hours and 4-5 miles, covered most of the major attractions and sights and provided some valuable information for us newcomers. The 4 pm start time (don't think anyone else offers this) allowed us to land, check-in at the hotel and almost immediately join the tour, which was quiet with only 9 guests (I know because they take a photo of the group and e-mail to you). Our native guide Karen was warm, entertaining, informative, knowledgeable, well organised and diligently answered our questions (pointing us specifically to some good value eateries). She could be clearly heard in the busy streets, with superb English. And I don't think she ever once alluded to tips, which made for a very refreshing change compared to some other tours I've been on where they are constantly mentioned!For those with Red Light District reservations, the tour does pass through it (right at the start), but it's a key part of the historic city centre, quite interesting and not nearly as seedy as you may think, plus it's not unduly focused upon. Overall it's a well rounded and interesting 2 hour tour, and I'd suggest it's one of the first things you do in Amsterdam.
Great Overview of Amsterdam. Loved the overview knowledge that we learnt about Amsterdam with a personable guide. Had a nice tour.

An entertaining walking tour. Our tour guide was Karen. She is cheerful, pretty and tells a lot of information about Amsterdam along with funny stories. A Walking tour is a good choice in case you don't have much time there and want to get acquainted with the city center highlights

Great tour. We took this "free" tour all around the old town of Amsterdam. About 16 of us from all over the world. Tour was in English, conducted by a life long native of the city. Very informative and also funny. Alvin told us all about the history of the city and the laws regarding prostitution and drugs! At the end of the tour, he walked several of us to another neighborhood where he pointed out good local restaurants for dinner. Great tour and great guide. We have done the "free" walking tours in several cities now and find them much better than the regular scheduled tours.
Great guide, great tour. Thank you :) That was a great pleasure to spend an evening in your company. I've learned a lot, I've seen a lot.

Great - even in the rain. This tour was exactly what our family needed to get our bearings in the urban chaos of downtown Amsterdam. Marius was a super guide and made the tour fun for both adults and children. He even tweaked the tour a little to shield our two young sons from the most brazen parts of the red light district (no way to avoid all of it but he did try). This is a great tour to start your explorations of Amsterdam. Thanks for making our rainy afternoon so enjoyable!

TOUR GUIDE COMPLAIN ABOUT TIPS!!. The tour guide today complain to us that we didn't give him enough tips. He collected $50 EUR total from all 10 of us. We paid attention to everyone who gave him $$. One couple gave him $5 EUR and we gave him $7.50 EUR for 2 of us. Tipping is optional so people should be able to give whatever we want. If he wants a minimum cost per person then set your price like a tour group like $5-10 EUR per person. Not tell people its a tip and complain when he feels its not enough. If we had known, we would go book with another free walking tour group. We had walking tour at other cities and never heard of tour guide complain about tips. If we had known better we would go book another walking tour group as there are 4-5 other companies to go with. We will write about our experience as review on trip advisor and warn other tourists about your tour company. Your tour guide complaining is unprofessional and I would never use or book anything with your company again!!

It was really good, we did the walk with Alvin and he was great. Totally recommended, the english tour was very good. We walk through some iconic places and we really enjoy it. Very friendly city, not recommended to to do the walk with kids.
Mighty Marius. Good jokes, good anecdotes, good weather. We enjoyed! If you want to discover Amsterdam in an alternative way go on!

A great walk. I have been to Amsterdam many times and am still in love with it. Your walking tour was not just fun, but I learned many things about the city, the country, and the people that were new to me. Thank you.

Great start of Amsterdam adventure. Marius is a great guide and tour content and route are really interesting. Valuable info for first time city visitors. Do not hesitate to stand close to guide not to miss all interesting facts he's teling and ask him about tips for your own city exploration.

Wonderful way to see Amsterdam!. We chose Free Walking Tours Amsterdam as they were the only one that had a tour in the afternoon. It was a pure delight during the whole tour. Interesting and funny facts were mixed together and made it the best way to see Amsterdam. I absolutely recommend it and would do it again when in Amsterdam.
Highly recommended. Marius took us on a 2,5 hour long relaxed and entertaining tour around Amsterdam and it was certainly the best part of my trip.

my first time to amsterdam. I registered for this free walking tour of Amsterdam as I only had 2 free days in the city and wanted to learn as much as possible. Tim was a great guide who knew alot about this wonderful city. I would highly recommend this tour to all first visitors. Please note wear proper walking shoes

Great, Entertaining Tour. On a rainy Amsterdam afternoon we took the walking tour. Tim, our guide, was awesome. He was witty, knowledgeable, friendly, and entertaining. The tour last for about 2 hours and we stayed engaged the whole time. I would highly recommend doing this tour - especially to help you familiarize yourself with the touristy portion of Amsterdam.

opinion. The tour was nice. :) Our guide was interesting, funny and so friendly. Only one "minus", because he did us a photo and said that the photo will be available on Facebook, but unfortunately it wasn't :(

Knowledgeable guide. My granddaughter and I enjoyed the informative and enjoyable tour of Amsterdam. It gave historical and current information that helped us to understand the city/country in the past as well as it is today.
I will recommend this tour to everyone I know.

Great experience. It was our first time in Amsterdam and we went straight to the walking tour as some friends had recommended. The girl was super knowledgeable and passionate about her city and her culture, its amazing to hear someone talking with that amount of passion and involvement! The tour took us to the most important sites of the city and told us all the interesting facts and histories behind everything. We will definitely recommend it to everyone!
Free Walking tours Amsterdam. Fantastic tour. Very informative. Tour covered all the best sights in the city area.Tour guide excellent.
Great experience. We learned so many interesting things during the 2-hour tour. The guide was very well prepared, information told in an entertaining way, we had fun!! :)
A useful walking tour. Mr Marius (Apologies if I didn't spell that correctly) was our guide on 14 May and he was very good at what he was doing.

Great way to see Amsterdam. I have done a few walking tours now, it's always a great way to see a new city.. The guide in Amsterdam was very helpful and very entertaining. Was a good mix of history and pratical information about the city.. Highly recommendable .....
We were expecting more. Compared to a walking tour in Santiago Chili, the Amsterdam one missed information that would have been relevant. ( like history, biking culture, food habits, surroundings...)

Fabulous experience. If you want to get a to know Amsterdam from the perspective of a local Marius can provide it in abundance. The tour was 2.5 hours. We have been to Amsterdam before but out about places we didn't know existed.

Very good insight from a local. Very good tour with a local, dedicated to his city and to making us love it too. Good quality visit, cultural, historic, and modern aspects. Excellent network of "free tours" in many cities and countries, much appreciated. Thanks a lot !

To much information.... First I will say that we have taken walking tours in about a dozen locations around Europe and for the most part they have been very good. We arrived in Amsterdam on Saturday, May 28th and the weather was fantastic. We were a little shell shocked by the amount of craziness going on downtown on a Saturday afternoon after visiting quaint little towns in Belgium and Germany over the last month. We understood that the tour would include the red light district but our guide "El" seemed to be a little preoccupied with it. He gave way more detail for a general tour that was not Red Light district themed. We eventually bailed on the tour (which is a first for us). This was not a great introduction to Amsterdam, but the day before we left we decided to give it another go with Sandemans walking tour and we found that one much more to our liking (one of the better ones that we have taken over the years). Yes, they touched on Red Light district stuff, but did not going into minute detail. That tour was filled with interesting historical facts, and a clearer view of Dutch culture (which is what we like). It was a good way to spend our second last day in Amsterdam and gave us a much more rounded view of the city.

Great intro to the city!. We took this tour our first day there. It was a great way to get accommodated to the city. Our guide, Elvin(spelling), was funny and had great knowledge of the area. Be prepared to tip at the end. Its a free service and these guides work hard to make it fun and informative.
Awesome tour!. I forgot the name of our tour guide but he was very tall and had lots of funny stories. Whoever did the morning tour on April 1st, that guy was great! Highly recommend

Fun and informative!. The tour was fun and informative. The guide was professional and enthusiastic. I feel I learned a lot of the city but it was in a way that was not too boring but fun. Well spent 2.5 hours!
Very nice tour of the city. Nice tour and very knowledgeable tour guide. I like that you tip them according to what you think the tour is worth.

Best way to see the city. This is the best way to see Amsterdam. Our group walked for 2.5 hours (leaving from Dam Sq) all over the city explaining its history geography architecture fables economics and answered every question put to our guide Marius. Would I do it again - certainty, as from every guide and every walk you learn something else

Don't waste your time. Our reservation said the the tour was limited to ten people. Well there were over 30 in the group. My group of four could not hear the guide. Some in the group were smoking. We dropped out after the first 15 minutes. In this case, we got what we paid for - nothing.

Great way to explore the city. Wonderful experience with friendly knowledgeable guides. Over two hours getting the know the city, visiting all the major sites and learning a lot about Amsterdam's history. Our guide was lots of fun and kept the group entertained despite the miserable weather.

Tim did a great job. Joined this 'free' walking tour with guide Tim Lunshof. The tour wandered around old Amsterdam starting with the Red Light District. Tim was amusing and straight forward, answering questions in a frank and honest way. He even took a group photo and emailed it to all of us who registered on-line. The tour took us along canals and we visited many interesting places, all with good humour.Well done, Tim!

Converted to walking tours now.. This was my first walking tour of a city and Im hooked now. What a fabulous way to get the history of Amsterdam while having fun and seeing so much of the city. Our tour guide Mike was funny, informative and answered any questions put forward.

Great information. This tour is a great way to get your bearings within the city and see some of the popular sites, along with gaining a ton of great information. It is just the right amount of time to get excited about the city, but it doesn't drag on. I would advise everyone to do this tour as soon as you arrive in Amsterdam!!

Fantastic Experience!. We loved the tour that we took with Olvin (sorry about the spelling!). He was very knowledgeable, enthusiastic and took us to some areas where we noticed no other tourists were present, a true local guide! Thank you!

Good starting point for the city. I've been to Amsterdam before but visiting museums doesn't count to getting to know the city, so I signed up for this tour. Our guide, Tijs, was very friendly and chatty. During the long walking parts several of the attendees (me included) asked him questions, which he gladly answered and was quite knowledgeable about the city and Dutch history in general.

The best thing you can do to start your trip. I decided to go on this tour since i was going to be in Amsterdam for only 2 days and on a tight budget. I can tell you that it was the best decision, you get to see the city and understand what you are seeing. Our guide was very helpful, knowledgeable and funny (if you don't have a sense of humor don't even try it). You can tell he's very passionate about what he does and i really admire that. I highly recommend it.

Left 15 minutes in. We spent the first 15 minutes of the tour with our guide just talking about random things, such as asking us stupid questions and being borderline rude to some of the nationalities in the group. We then started the tour, again will irrelevant information - he loves the sound of his own voice!! I would not recommend this tour, especially if you get the guide we had. If you want to see all the sights of Amsterdam, you can easily do it alone or pay for a professional, informative tour with a good guide!

Great Walking Tour by Passionate Tour Guide. A great walking tour! Being a Dutch person myself, so thought I already knew a lot of Amsterdam. I was wrong. Today I learned so much about the history of the city and had lots of fun at the same time! Thanks Marius for being an awesome tour guide.

Nice tour giving a good overview . I visited with friends and was really looking forward to a walking tour. This tour gave a good overview of the city and visited a lot of the main areas. We didn't visit Anne Frank's house which was a little disappointing however where we did visit I felt we were given lots of information. Tour lasted around two hours. We were given time to take photos and our guide was friendly and chatty throughout. I didn't feel pressured to tip at the end but was happy to do so. I would say a walking tour is a must in Amsterdam and this one was a good tour for a new city I had not visited before.

Excellent Tour. We were advised by our hotel receptionist to take this tour rather than the paid ones. Our tour guide Rebecca took us in a loop around the city and took us to lots of places we wouldn't have known about. She was knowledgeable, interesting and had a good sense of humour. I would certainly recommend this tour.

Brilliant tour , would recommend joining Marius for an entertaining , educational , humerous couple of hours .. We booked on line with Marius before our trip , he confirmed our meeting in Dam Square for 10 30 Sunday 13th March . We were a varied group of nationalities , English , Turkish, German , Chinese, New Zealand and Israelis , 13 all told .A nice size group , easy to group around Marius and hear his stories , his English was perfect , the tour was in English but he did have a few words of welcome with the group in their own language as they joined us.Marius was very humerous , he made us all laugh , he remembered all our names and included us in the banter as we explored the old city We learnt so much during those 2 hours , he really whetted our appetite to know more , so after the tour we had lunch and did the walk on our own , spending time at each talking point . Originally we had hoped to explore the Royal Palace in Dam Square on our return but the Royals were in residence that weekend so our plans had to be revised .So we started the tour again , needless to say 5 hours later we collapsed in a bar , very knowledgeable about facts and also full of ridiculous trivia , but what great time and so lucky having had a dry sunny March day to do it .My daughter and I were staying in a super little hotel in the redlight district and we'd walked across the cobbles of the Old Church numerous times the previous two days . Yet until Marius pointed it out , we 'd never noticed a bronze life sized breast concreted in amongst the cobbles , a couple of metres from the church doors where the priests walk. Also the single ladies sanctuary was beautiful and so peaceful , the whole block built without a door on the outside , so you can only enter from the inner courtyard garden, through an alley , therefore differentiating the occupants and their homes from the many 'doors' nearby. We d never have found it or entered the two tiny churches inside the garden courtyard without Marius . We 'd seen the helicopter flying over the city very low all weekend , Marius explained they fly a grid daily with thermal imaging looking for drugs.You can buy, sell or smoke it , but you can't grow it, people have cannabis farms in their attics but are soon caught . A pilot first noticed the snow had melted on certain roofs as he flew over the city , so the drug patrol began , very successfully a few year ago .Talking to people back home who've visited Amsterdam , they are amazed at what we've seen and learnt and they had no inkling of any of it .So do join Marius , best bit , you pay at the end whatever you think he was worth , you cant lose , enjoy .

False advertising - not reliable!. The site says "rain or snow" but that was not our experience. After rushing in the rain to get to our scheduled time, we were met by Tim only to tell us, "Yeah, you're the only ones who showed up so.....no....no tour". I was so upset that we could show up but they couldn't deliver. And to top it off, it stopped raining about 10 minutes later and the sun came out! Really disappointed!

A great introduction to the city. After previously having done a walking tour in Lisbon we were very surprised to see the size of the group that turned up- approximately 30 per group. This was also when it was raining! The tour was great but I think the large numbers did impact upon how many attractions we saw. Despite this however our guide was funny, informative and went around individually to answer people's questions and give personal tips. I found it to be a great introduction to Amsterdam!

Exciting tour. Usually I am a bit concerned about walking tours, because they can be too boring.
This walk, was everything but boring! The guide was nice, he could answer all the questions, he had a good attitude. We had fun for sure, this is the best way to begin your Amsterdam holidays with.

Fantastic! . We took a walking tour on Saturday morning to begin our trip to Amsterdam and would highly recommend it! Brette (I think) our guide showed us around and gave interesting insights into the history of the city. She answered questions and shared her knowledge in an engaging way. There were only about 10 of us on the tour which made it very personal. If you're going to Amsterdam, put this first in your itinerary!

Pick this one!. "Free" walking tours can be a bit hit or miss, and this one is definitely a hit! It was great to have a true local as a guide, who provided an excellent introduction to the city without any upselling.

Great Introduction to the City. We did this tour in March on a somewhat of a cold breezy rainy day - not ideal condition. Tim was our guide and he did a fabulous job despite rain of finding spots for us to take shelter when needed. Tim presented very good overview of the city and lots of informative facts. We enjoyed it very much.

Great free walking tour to descover the hearth of Amsterdam. Wonderful way to spend an afternoon in Amsterdam. Although I've been living in Amsterdam for two years already, this tour gave me new insights about the city and its hidden treasures. Great explanations from the tour guide that was able able to make the walk interesting and fun at the same time!Recommended

Good tour. We did a walking tour in Amsterdam, was really good. We learned much about Amsterdam, we could never learn so much about this great city. Our guide Tim was really nice entertaining and knows a lot about the history and places to go! DO THIS TOUR!!

A fun walking tour!!. We took amsterdam free tour with Alwin,it lasted for around 2 hours but pretty much everything was covered. Alwin was hilarious and he answered everything we asked. He was very energetic and tour provided us with great introduction about the city, it should be first you should do when you land in Amsterdam. we thoroughly enjoyed our trip.

A great experience!. We met with Alwin on the Dam and we had a great morning tour. Even for us as Amsterdammers it was a very nice tour and even we learned a lot of new things about the city centre and the history of Amsterdam in general. Alwin was very flexible and accomodating, adjusting his 'standard' tour to cater for us. I can warmly recommend Free Walking Tours Amsterdam and especially with Alwin to tourists and locals alike.

It was incredible!. The guide (I think his nickname is El or Alvin) said such interesting things about Amsterdam. He had a lot of knowledge and he was fun. He talked about the recent history of the city and how people live nowadays (I miss the history of the country. But, the guide answered all of my questions!). I do recommend this tour!
Great. Marius was a great tour guide. He took us to some neat places and told us some interesting facts. Would definitely recommend!

Awesome!!!. This tour is one of the "must to do" while visting Amsterdam :-) I've been already on this tour 2 times ( one time is never enough).. our guide Marius was extremely knowledgeable,energetic and with amazing sense of humour which is really hard to find.I can higly reccomend Marius as your guide,trust me,you won't be dissapointed :-) just look for the man with hat and white umbrella front of monument and I guarantee you 2 awesome hours with lot of interesting informations about this awesome place :-)

Perfect start to Amsterdam . This tour was great to get an overview of the city and to find out interesting facts. Marius was great, he was very engaging with the participants and his humour was spot on.

Perfect start for our trip. We started our Amsterdam experience by completing the free walking trip with Marius. He was a good guide, and a really nice character, had detailed info about everything the was asked about, made up some good jokes on the go, made the tour as fun as it can get.Thumbs up!

Fun couple of hours. Marius was our guide and he was both informative and entertaining. We had about 10 people in the group and the pace was good. Great way to see the sights without getting lost. Would do it again.

Helpful tour. It's helpful to know Amsterdam :) I really enjoyed that time!!Also I made some friends there.I can recommend the tour! Thanks for touring and i got a picture from Marius. Nice to meeting u.It was so good!!!!!!!!!!암스테르담 시티에 대해 잘 몰랐는데이 투어를 통해 조금이나마 알 수 있어 좋았어요.게다가 무료고 투어에서 만난 친구들과도 어울려 하루종일 같이 지냈는데 너무너무 좋았습니다

AWAZING TOUR. We did the free wlaking tour with a small group of 9 people. This made it a personal tour. It is fun to do it because you get to know the city really whell and quick this way.Would recommend this tour to anayone a must do on you fisit to Amsterdam

Greay Walking Tour! . Fantastic walking tour of Amsterdam, we had a great time and saw lots of things we wouldn't have known about otherwise. Marius was a great tour guide, fun and very informative! Lots of history about various areas of the city, a great way to spend a couple of hours! Would definitely recommend to anyone ☺

A great way to explore Amsterdam, even if your visit in it is short. Since I had only one day to spend in Amsterdam, I consider this walking tour as the perfect choice. It was fun and very informative. It really caught my interest. Who knows, maybe next time while visiting this city I'll bring some friends along to join this tour.
Informative and joyful tour. Hear it from a local and get information about the city and its soul in a entertaining manner. I can highly recommend the tour.

Great way to see the city. Great way to spend 2 hours with a great guide. We had a group of 6 including us and had a wonderful Whistle Stop tour of the city. Our guide was very informative and funny and although it was pouring with rain we still got the full experience - red light district, architectural gems, canal history and lots of little anecdotal information. Highly recommended.

Walking tours. Highly recommend the free walking tours! We had Kor show us the sights and even in the rain and snow he was upbeat and full of information!! A great way to get your bearings on the city. Only pay what you feel the experience is worth

Slightly awkward tour with too small a group. While our guide, Marius, seemed knowledgeable enough, he didn't present this information particularly well and lingered a lot in the Red Light district, while our group was composed with only 2 females, making us uncomfortable. We think that the issue was due to the size of the group so could have been managed better and if it had been a larger group it probably would have been better.

Amsterdam crash course. We were walking through Amsterdam for a bit more than 2 hours and visited a handful of the most famous places in the city, but also some sites that one wouldn't find so easily. Throughout the tour we were provided with interesting facts and local dutchie knowledge.I can highly recommend this kind of tour, if you're having a short stay in the city and would like to get an Amsterdam crash course.btw: Our Guide was Tim.

Not as great as I expected. I've been on excellent walking tours in other European Cities and I had high hopes that these tours would be a great start to my stay in Amsterdam. The tour started off to a great start with introductions, but the explanations of the places we visited were vague/ I did not grasp the information. I suggest there being more enthusiasm in the story telling. I was also hoping the tour guide would also tell us information about where to dine for local food but that was also unclear. But we did get a good tour of the red light district.
Next time. While i was in Amsterdam unfourtunately i didnt ride a bike cause of cold weather but next time ride a bike in amsterdam is on my list! :)
Well worth it to see and understand the city. Knowledgeable guide. Interesting history. Easy pace. Friendly group. Well worth the time. Be sure to give a small donation at the end!

great experience. free walking tours are something I do more and more in all the cities I visit: very prepared guides tell you stories you wouldn't just find out by yourself. awesome thing: it's really free, you just gotta give the guides a tip. the free walking tour in amsterdam was incredible, the guide was nice and gentle.

So much to see. GPS was my best friend in Amsterdam and I made sure to "pin" where my hotel was. The streets run every which way but north and south/east and west so it is very easy to get turned around and then get lost especially because you won't be watching closely to where you are going, there is so much to see.From the buildings to the shops to the little cafés and bars there is a lot to take in. I spent 4 days walking around Amsterdam and on some days clocked over 35km on my feet! It is all stone, brick and concrete so good shoes are a must.

You must take this tour!!!. Tim was a wonderful tour guide and the tour was perfect for our schedule. It was easy to meet at the National Monument and the information was both informative and entertaining. Tim gave us great information and helped us see why this is such a wonderful city to visit. Don't worry about the free part. Of course tips are given at the end of the tour, but well worth it. This couldn't have been any better.

Great tour. Had an enjoyable tour with Marius. Very informative and he kept us engaged. Toured through many important landmarks. I enjoyed learning about the red light district and the history of the Dutch trading empire. Plus it doesn't hurt that Amsterdam is gorgeous even when it's cloudy and extremely windy.

Great way to spend 2 hrs and learn some interesting facts. This is a brilliant way to spend 2 hrs, our tour was taken by a history university student, she gave an enagimg tour, good level of details while restaining the attention of our teenage girls.

Informative and fun. Took the free tour with Marius on a sunny Friday in February. Saw a bit of the center, learned a bit about the city and about my fellow tourists. Marius is really good at engaging the group in conversation.A nice way to spend a few hours and the price right, but you should definitely give a gratuity for the tour.
Loved it.. The guides are local and know their city. We got to enjoy the city while learning a bit about it's history and getting some advises on best places to eat.
walking around city. Amsterdam has a lot to offer and is very easy to get around city .I see it that is worthy to visited this town .
Enjoyable . We did the tour with Marius on a cold Saturday morning. The tour is good as walking tours go. Marius is easy to understand and the pace is good.

Relaxed informal walking tour. Informative and very friendly. Marius is a great guide willing to answer any question taking you places and giving facts that you would never have found yourselves. Every time we visit a new city we are going to look for walking tours to educate us.

Excellent! And great charm from Tim. Our original tour guide was a no show, and Tim was kind enough to bring my partner and I into his morning tour group. Tim took us through the many hot spots of AMS from the Red Light District, the Jewish quarter, several shopping spots, museums, squatters area, Catholic community, canals and the most amazing house in Amsterdam (2 meters in width...or close to. It's so thin in width), etc. His approach to the tour progressively becomes a pop quiz, which inadvertently forces you to pay attention. He even treated us to a quick Dutch aged-cheese snack (great sustenance for the 2 hour trek). Tim is an excellent tour guide and will instill in you a confidence to roam the beautiful streets of Amsterdam like you're a local. If you get the chance to, donate him a neat €20...well worth it.

Fast walking Tim. Great walking tour ! We met our guide Tim at the Dam square in front of the national monument.He gave us a good and sometime funny explanations of this liberal city! The tour was about 2 hours which was perfect! You end at the same spot on Dam square.Would recommend it to anyone! Thanks TimVisited February 2016

Great Dutch experience of Amsterdam!. Great walking tour with a humors way of exploring the city! We met our guide Tim at the Dam square in front of the national monument. He gave us a good explanation of this liberal and relaxt city! The guide was really easy going and knowledgeable about the city.The tour was about 2 hours which was perfect! You end op at the same spot on Dam square. Would recommend it to anyone! Thanks Tim

Quirky. We went on the free walking tour with Marius who has a very quirky sense of humour which we enjoyed. There were only four of us on the tour so it meant it was very personal.I would not have ventured into the Red Light District had I not been on the tour but Marius was able to tell us about the conditions that the girls work under.As there were only four of us we were able to enter churches to see works of art.Marius recommended the Foodhallen which was excellent and also the Noordermarkt held on a Monday.A really good way to spend two hours.

An unexpected gem of a Free tour for a daytripper in Amsterdam .. I was not planning to take a walking tour , as I missed my flight and had to find how to spend the day , till I could fly out of Amsterdam . On a very windy and cold day , decided to go to Dam square to visit a museum and get away from the cold wind . Was trying to find my directions and noticed a very smart looking lady holding a sign FREE walking tours . The lady standing in the middle of Dam square , later I got to know her name Britt , on a very windy morning said that the tour would start in about 15 minutes and I could join even if I had not booked . I was not expecting much from a free tour , but was pleasantly surprised that the tour guide had perfect English and knowledge of the history and the different locations as we were expertly guided around the streets to a number of tourist attractions for the next 2 or 3 hours. I would recommend anyone visiting Amsterdam , to start his holiday with this short walking tour , to get a good background of the highlights of the tourist attractions . The tour guide was very informative and answered all the questions , even on matters which may not have been relative to the locations we were walking thru .This was my first unplanned walking tour and will look for walking tours in other cities if they prove to be as good as this one . Will be back in Amsterdam , on a less windy day , and spend a few more days to experience this very interesting city . Thank you Britt .

One of the highlights of my mini-holiday. To book a free walking tour with Marius was one of my best experience of my staying in Amsterdam. I've learned details and trivia that I would never knew about otherwise, he has a great sense of humour and deserves generous tips, as I learned more about Amsterdam in those 2 hours than in the other 4 days by myself.

Huge disappointment. We had a tour with Marius but his infantile and offensive style was too much for us. I took many free tours in many cities and I never hesitate to tip good guide, but we left in middle of this tour. Moreover pretty boring and I really dont think guide was speaking English well enough to lead guided tours.

The best walking tour ever. Walking tours are generally great. But this was awesome. I do recommend great attention to everything that Marius says, as he is very much knowledgeable. As a historian – and having studied Holland for a while – I did not expected to be surprised. But I was. I truly deeply recommend this tour. Thanks, Marius. It was great!

Fun, friendly, and with the weather on our side. I was leaving the cita when I saw Alvin under the rain. We were a group of 10 or so and we had a lot of fun and Info about the city. It's a 2,3hs walk and you can't Miss it. Alvin is great.

Very interesting and fun!! . Great tour!! I did some tours around the world! but this is the best so far! Local guide ho loved his city!!!You make a walk in the center go to the red light district and they explain about the old buildings and history of the city

Lovely tour. We went on the walking tour on our first day in Amsterdam with Marius, and he welcomed all the group individually which made us all feel relaxed. He was informative and humorous and took us to many interesting places. We would recommend Marius to anyone going on this tour

First time to Amsterdam and so impressed by your city and how it is being preserved.. We had a great trip around bits of Amsterdam with Alvin. Such fun and informative and despite the weather. We would recommend Alvin and hope your other guides match him. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and an afternoon with Alvin great value.

Amazing experience. Our tourguide Tim showed us some of the most interesting places in Amsterdam. As a relaxed en well informed guide he was able to tell us a lot about Amsterdam. Looking forward to next visit, gonna join the tour again for sure. Keep up the good work TIM.

Indepth, historical, fun and so much more. Our guide was Alvin, and he was awesome. A born and bred "Amsterdamer" he was so full of quirky facts, we covered the main areas as well as buildings, shops off the tourist path. It was nearly 2 1/2 hours long and I saw and learnt so very much.I can not recommend this tour highly enough or Alvin, who keeps you engaged at every step of the way.I have had many tours around the globe, after a while they become very dry and one looses interest fairly quickly as there is so much information. With Alvin, he keeps your attention focused and really ignites a very real interest in his fantastic home town.

Fantastic tour!. The tour does exactly what it claims - it's a free walking tour of Amsterdam. On top of that it was very informative, amusing and relaxed, so we didn't feel like we were being dragged round against our will which is a sensation I sometimes get on this type of tour. The organisation was good; being NY Eve they guessed they would have lots of punters so two guides were on hand and they split the group. Really enjoyed the almost two and a half hours. I thoroughly recommend it.

Free and enjoyable. Easy to book online but I recall it was only for the upcoming week ahead. Meeting point was at Dam Square and it was quite clear of the guide but didn't know his name. I went by myself and our group were taken around by Marius. He was very engaging and entertaining. As we were waiting for others to turn up he asked where we were all from and had something to say to keep conversation flowing.The tour was around the RLD. Not gonna lie, I had a different perspective of the RLD before going. The history was very interesting and we were taken around to a lot of different places. It actually got tiring towards the end of the tour.Marius took us down small alleys, which I would never have thought to go down and it was very unusual to see women at the windows in broad daylight. Knocking on the windows to get your attention - it was actually a little awkward!The purpose of the Free tour is that you tip whatever you feel it is worth. The general rate is between 10-20 Euros. This means the tourguide needs to give a good tour in order to get good tips.

Marius Is An Excellent Guide!. I had my reservations about going on a walking tour, but this was excellent. Marius is a funny, knowledgeable guide, who showed us parts of Amsterdam we would never otherwise have seen. At the same time, he kept us engaged and informed on the day-to-day aspects of living in what is a most vibrant city. Strongly recommended, look for the man with the white umbrella!
great tour. 2 hours with a local guide gives you better understanding about he city. definitely recommend. if you are traveling alone, you should do.

Really good!!!. The guide-Tim is super nice person and his tour was really interesting (I like the way he connectes facts with funny things about city), we were walking around Amsterdam (not only famous buildings but also a Red lights district). REALLY WORTH TO TAKE THIS TOUR!

Great tour to see the city. I like walking tours because you get to hear historical and cultural information from a local.The information that they share is not always the kind of stuff that you find in a guide book. This was a good way to begin our visit to Amsterdam

You want to learn about Amsterdam? Do this tour!. Our tour guide Marius was awesome. Funny, engaging and full of knowledge about the city he grew up in. He was also happy to answer any questions we had. I imagine most people might have a few as Amsterdam is such an interesting city. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour and highly recommend participating.

Friendly, causal, relaxing tour. I joined this tour after seeing it in tripadvisor, Tim was very easy to notice at the square we met (with the orange pullover). Group was mixed of people with various nationalities. It was a fun group but it was Tim who was always explaining the stuff like a Q&A session, it was very engaging. Thanks to him we had great fun as a group of strangers. I had been in Amsterdam many times before that but the details that Tim explained was very interesting and fun. Even I had a tour before, Tim's view of the city was unique and brief. I definitely advise to choose Tim if you are planning a walking tour.

What a good tour. My husband and I always try to go for a walking tour when visiting a city and this was one of the nicer ones. With a small group of 8 people the guide was friendly and very informative. It was a lovely way to spend a couple of hours and I really learnt a lot, a great way to see parts of the city you otherwise may have missed.
Good lighthearted tour. We had a humorous tour with Marius and enjoyed our walk around amsterdam. Definitely worth doing a tour as its easy to miss things otherwise.

Great walking tour of Amsterdam. This was a really enjoyable walking tour that my husband, 2 teenage daughters and myself went on. Our tour guide Sergio was fantastic, extremely knowledgeable and a had good sense of humour.This tour is promoted in pamphlets as being free but before actually going on the tour you are asked to provide a tip of €10 per person at the end of tour. We were more than happy to do this as it was cheaper than other tours and very informative.

Below expectations. It is difficult to criticize something which is offered for free when many agencies offered similar but really expensive tours. The thing is that we had previously taken part in free walking tours in other city and we were never disappointed. But the tour with Marius offered poor historical explanations of almost all the spots selected, somewhat a disappointment if you would like to know more about this beautiful city. To me it felt more like a friend showing around the city, which can be cool, but it should not be compared with a tourist guide. There are other companies offering free walking tours of the city, I would suggest to look for them, even if I don't know if they are better,

Great intro to Amsterdam. We did the morning walking tour and is a real great experience the guide was really funny! And gave us some good tips where to go in Amsterdam. Would not have had such a good time in Amsterdam without this tour! It was 2 hours just perfect as a short introduction!

Interesting and fun tour.. Took the tour with Marius today. He was a fun, fountain of knowledge and we learnt about Amsterdam past and present. I particularly liked hearing about the cabal houses and why they lean like they do :)

Realy interesting fun and friendly tour!. Loved the stories about the history of hidden churches, prostitution and the three x-es. Tim knows a lot about Amsterdam and tells it in an attractive way with a lot of humor : )

Highly enjoyable and interesting. The would not have been the same without Tim, he is such a good tour guide who appeared more like a friend who was showing his city to some other friends instead of a typical tour guide. I loved how he involved us in the discovery of some places by asking us some questions, looking around to notice stuff... It was fun ! The cheese testing was a really good surprise, I appreciated that. Anyway, if you want to go for a walking tour... pick Tim ! I didn't see the 2 hours passing by. Thank you !

best ever city guide. booked this tour before traveling not knowing what to expect, Tim was the best tour guide we have ever had in any city and despite getting drenched at the half way point we were determind to continue after the 20 minute break in a bar He was clear ,witty and very informative and deserved every euro of the tips he received. Would have loved to taken the red light tour he was doing later

Learned interesting facts and saw places I would have otherwise never been exposed to. Tim is a friendly, approachable, and informative tour guide. Although it was windy and raining when I went on the tour, he made it enjoyable. He took us down cool little streets and showed us parts of Amsterdam that were touristy and others that were hidden gems. He was able to answer all our questions and kept us engaged throughout the tour. I highly recommend taking his tour.

Great Tour with helpful man. it was a great tour with Tim, we covered most of Amsterdam central area in just 2 hours, I like the cheese we tested it within the tour, thanks Tim for such amazing 2 hours in my Europe trip.

Really interesting experience from a local point of view. I would recommend anybody going to Amsterdam to do this tour. As opposed to many tours that are so boring and predictable, this one is completely different. During the two hours tour we visited pretty much everything in the center and the tour was full of anecdotes and curious information that you can only get from a true "Amsterdammer" Tim, our tour guide was a really funny guy and made tour really enjoyable. So have a look on it and get into this truly local experience. He is Leuk!
Excellent walking tour. An excellent introduction to Amsterdam. Be warned that the tour goes through the red light district so don't go if easily offended. Lots of history and fun facts.

Great way to see the city . These walking tours are a fantastic way to see the sights of the city and get recommendations for food, activities etc. Our guide was very knowledgeable... And even helped get the bird poop out of my hair when that unfortunate disaster happened :/

2hour walking tour - best way to explore small streets of Amsterdam. Free Walking TourMariusEasy 1 1/2 to 2 hour walking tour of Amsterdam that meets at Dam Square, in front of the monument. We took the 10:30 tour and were walked thru the Red Light District, Big mama light district, Chinatown (Europe's biggest), old Jewish quarter, Church in an alleyway - Our Lord of the Attic, University of Amsterdam, outside book market, etc.We sometimes walking single file they alleyways learning about Amsterdam's historyAnd symbols ( XXX), in places it would be hard to find on our own.Marius was our leader and was an encyclopedia of the city's history, with his personal spin. Groups walk and stop to look at various places,,and one can take pictures along the way, or grab a coffee at the many places you pass.Tips are recommended and are well deserved as these tour guides make it a business to know their history.Learned some Meaning of Dutch words:Stock, partnership.

Off the Beaten Track - Very Insightful.. Tim was an excellent guide who gave us some great insights on our trip. It was by far the best tourist experience we had in Amsterdam. Even the locals that joined us picked up some really useful bit of information about Amsterdam and it's rich history.

Fun walking tour!. I signed up the day before, not sure what I was getting myself into. I've never done a free walking tour, and I was so happy with this one! Tim was funny, knowledgeable about Amsterdam, and he made the tour very special. We have been to Amsterdam before, but he took us to places that we had never seen before. I would definitely repeat this tour when I more friends come to visit me in the Netherlands!

best walking tour. Tim did a fantastic job, very informative, innovative, and he kept my interest the entire time. I could have listened to him all day. We have been on other "free" walking tours in other cities, and this is by far the best we have been on. He appeals to all age groups. I plan on coming back next year with some friends and going on this tour again. thank you Tim for a fabulous tour!!!!

Great way of getting to know Amsterdam!. I went on this tour with my friend on a rainy Tuesday afternoon and had a great time. The guide, Tim, gave a really good insight in to the history of Amsterdam and places we might want to visit. The group I was in was about 8 people and lasted just over 2 hours. We even got some free cheese!We did this at the beginning of our trip, and it really helped my find my way around the city for the rest of the trip!

GREAT TOUR!!!!!!!. We went on a tour with MARIUS who´s a GREAT guide providing tons of interesting information about Amsterdam and Netherlands history. It was a small group, only 5 of us, so he´d answer all the questions thrown at him with a great deal of patience.We actually stumbled on Marius in Dam Square. He was holding a very small sign where it read "free walking tours amsterdam" talking to 3 other ppl who looked like tourists. We had just been turned down by this other free walking tour ran by Sandemans. Let me tell you, last year i went on sandemans (see my review), and I can assure you that Marius did a much better job: more info, less jokes and he didnt try to sell me a pricey canal cruise.

Great tour. We did this tour with Marius on Monday afternoon - the tour lasted about 2hs and was a very informative tour which explained lots about Amsterdam and how it came to be how it is today!We learnt lots on this tour and really enjoyed ourself - Marius did a great job on this tour!I would recommend this tour when I'm Amsterdam!!

Nice tour, probably just a bad day. I'm sure that my review hasn't got much to do with the usual business. Our tour guide, Tim, was not on his best day, I think. The tour was very informative, but in comparison to other tours, it didn't feel like the tour guide was very excited about the things he was presenting us. Also, it was way too fast for us, I hardly got to take some pictures and when I did, I got left behind. My review is not supposed to scare you travelers off, I'm sure that our experience is more of an exception, but one of which the tour guides would like to know.

Great Tour with Tim. I joined Tim's tour after i found him in the Dam Square in front of the National Monument.
This guy makes an amazing job showing you the best sights of the city.
He's very funny and friendly and his passion for the city makes the experience even more interesting.
Keep up with the good job!

A Great Way to Start Your Stay in a Fascinating City. Amsterdam is a very interesting city. For me it was quite a shock as to how out in the open certain elements of it are - in this case I am of course talking about the Red Light District and the Coffeeshops. In order to get a handle of this city I think a tour such as this is the perfect way to do it! Our guide was an Aussie by the name of Julian and he was a very humourous and informed guide - he has lived in the city for the last 5 or 6 years and has really got to know the place. The tour took us through the history of Dutch tolerance, the massive wealth accumulated by the Dutch East India Company, and how the city functions with the legalisation of soft drugs and prostitution. He showed us to some of the main sites and we certainly got our money's worth (a tip to the guide) from this 3 hour tour! He even showed us where we could get traditional Dutch food afterwards which was delicious. I highly recommend the Free Walking Tours of Amsterdam if you want to try and make sense of a fascinating city.

great introduction to the city. Our guide for the walk was Marius, and he was excellent. Very informative, and with a good sense of humour. There were only 7 of us on this tour, and it helped to make it seem more personal than some "free walks" we have done in the past.Highly recommended.

Free walking tour of Amsterdam. Amsterdam free walking tour3 hour excellent tour meeting point- Dam Square next to the Royal Palace in front of The Coffee ClubTour guide Arthur was fabulous,knowledgeable , great sence of humourAble to give us great recommendations of places to eat

Best walking tour in Amsterdam without any reservation.. Our tour guide KOR is a wonderful story teller and an entertainer, who keeps the whole group amused for a total of 3 hours.There is not a moment of boredom and at the same time we did learn quite a bit about Amsterdam and the Dutch culture, even on certain sensitive subjects. I wish there are more wonderful tour guides like him with a natural communication talent. He deserves a good tip, since the tours are free. The agent Sandeman is very well organized and they do appreciate it if you book the tour in advance. My sister and I are totally impressed. This is infotainment in the best sense.

Best Walking tour in the city!. Our guide, Tim Lunshof, is extremely knowledgeable on all aspects of the city, culture, history and architecture. The tour began, like most, at the WWII monument located in the Royal Palace's plaza. From there Tim took us on a calculated route to maximize all the historic value within the city. The tour lasted 2 hours, which in my opinion is the perfect amount of time. We would high recommend this tour and Tim as a guide. Thanks Tim!

Fun and informative!. The guide was funny, personable and knowledgable! He has lived in Amsterdam all his life and gave us some interesting insight into things we would otherwise never have known. It was interactive and an amazing way to get to know the city. We did the 13:30 tour. Time just flew!
city in a hour . This guy is so so funny)) This short walk was full of information and if you have a question or when u dont get something, he can explait tsomething was

Great introduction if it's your first time in Amsterdam. We had a 3 hour (don't worry, break is included) guided walking tour through Amsterdam, with lots of fun facts, historical insights and top of the list tips & tricks. Our guide, Onno, truly knew a lot about Amsterdam (he's a local) and was very open for queries, of whatever kind. Would really recommend it!

FREE WALKING TOUR AMSTERDAM. Execellent tour! Very informative and responds to tourist queries very well. Very friendly and really knows what he is doing and the culture and historical background of amsterdam. Would recommend to have a tour with Tim. Dank u well!:)

walking around Amsterdam with free Walking Tours Amsterdam. We took the walking tour in a rainy day. So it was pretty short. The guide although was very nice and enthusiastic.Interesting facts about Amsterdam and the history of the netherlands

A crash course introduction to the city. Was told by my organisation I had to attend a last minute meeting and would be transiting in Amsterdam for 24 hours. Therefore, I hardly do any preparation to spend my 24 hours there, so the best way out would be to do this tour as I had done in Paris years before. Our tour guide is Tim and he's very knowledgeable with many interesting facts and stories to share with us throughout the three hours tour. Basically one of the best three hours I had spent throughout my entire trip and gave me some ideas on how to spend the whole afternoon rather than sleeping in the hotel. Tim and other guides are working on tips so kindly tip them according to what you think their effort and knowledge are worth. Been recommending this free walking tour to every friends of mine since 2009.

Great Intro to the City. We did this tour mainly because we had arrived in Amsterdam at 8am and could not check into our apartment till 4pm. They were meeting at Dam Square and to keep us awake we signed-up although the weather was horrible (rainy and cold) that day. Even with the jet lag, the weather and our overstuffed backpacks it was pretty fun for us and our kids. It definitely kept us awake and the walk was fairly easy and the guide was energetic and knowledgeable. Not really sure how much to tip but 40 euros seemed reasonable for 4.

Great english speaking dutch guide. Brilliant free walk round the city. In groups of max 30ish people you can always hear the guide. Very knowledgeable and willing to answer questions.Met in Dam square which is very easy to find. Stopped had way through at a large cafe for lunch. There was a reserved room for the people getting the tour which was a nice touch.Would defiantly recommend. 5*.

Walking In the rain😃☔. Inclement weather did not deter us from going on this walking tour. We met our guide Tim at the National Monument. Tim was friendly and helpful & we chatted comfortably with him. Our small group of 5 headed off on a 2 hour, 5km walk through the streets & lanes of Amsterdam. Tim was knowledgeable & happy to answer questions & engage in banter with us. The tour was fun, interesting and informative. The tour is free, however like all walking tours it is up to you how much you tip your guide at the end of the tour. We tipped Tim €10 each. We would highly recommend this tour.

Good knowledge, great experience. Happy to hit the streets with fun guide Tim and a small group of interesting people around the world. I have been on other free tours where there were 30 or more people and it was sometimes hard to hear or see the guide ... but Tim is "Dutch height" and uses his voice well... so I heard everything.His information was very good and happily explained answers to Questions along the way. It was a very personal experience.

Definitely do this one!. I'm not much of a planner when it comes to travel, especially when I'm traveling by myself, so the first thing I do when I get to a new city is look for a guided walking tour. This one was fantastic. The guide seemed to really enjoy being a tour guide, and we walked around some really nice areas of Amsterdam. She gave a lot of good information about the city, and was very knowledgeable when answering questions. I definitely recommend this.

Concise history, good to get a feel for Amsterdam. I love Free walking tours. The guides are always very knowledgeable and open to questions. The weather was a big grey but my guide's knowledge of the city more than made up for it.

Amsterdam Classic Walking Tour. The free walking tour was excellent. Our guide Pasquale was knowledgeable, courteous and funny. The tour included an intimate experience of the city and its various neighborhoods from the eyes of a local including an overview of the city's rich history. Highly recommend. Totally worth it.

Walking Tour with Tim is a must. This a must do in Amsterdam, especially where everything is so concentrated one can walk anywhere. The tour is a good way to know the history, the culture and the traditions of the city of amsterdam. It provides an honest, intellectual and authentic experience of the city. The tour gives you a feel for what Amsterdam actually is and how it became what it is today and the guide also throws in some useful tips. Tim is absolutely amazing, the best guide I have ever had. He tells you amazing things and makes everything really funny. Unlike other guides does not keep advertising. I fell guilty to have tipped him less. Next time Tim.

Best walking tour I've ever had. Thank you so much for your guided tour! Great fun, you really know A LOT about the city. Thanks for the great tour and having lunch with you after was really great as well. You are a great guy and I am definably recommending your tour to my friends if they are going to Amsterdam!

great walking tour with Tim!. I took Tim's free walking tour on 30th June, which lasted for 2 hours. It was an excellent choice as he is very knowledgeable and very funny. It is so informative and interesting to learn suprising facts about landmarks as well as Hollanders. I really like this kind of tour as we pay what you think it deserves and tour guides usually try their best to conduct a good tour. I would definitely recommend to take tour with Tim!

It was a great learning and fun experience! . I came to know about this while I was planning our itinerary for Amsterdam. I have read great reviews about this tour and the best thing about it is it is free! For something that was free, they sure did a great job and they seemed very enthusiastic about what they do. They were pretty easy to spot as they were carrying bright orange umbrellas with them. There were different guides speaking different languages and we took the English tours by Robin. Robin was really very good. She was enthusiastic, funny, entertaining and very knowledgeable. We had a great time with her. Thank you for this wonderful experience!

Wow. I really enjoyed to walk in Amsterdam! Every single things I saw was new for me. It was crazy sometimes to see bicycle and cars and bus and peoples moving all together around and I in 2 days I didn't see any accident. That's awesome!!!

Interresting walking tour in Amsterdam. Some days ago I walked the Freewalkingtour with Tim. Nice tour guide which shows you the interesting spots of Amsterdam. He knows a lot about the city and tells you exactly enough so you won't get bored. He does that with a good sense of humour. I really enjoined the tour and would say you should have walked this tour if you visit Amsterdam!

Informative, Interactive, Inspiring ... AMAZING!!. Mr Tim is very knowledgable, with a good sense of humour. He is quick witted and keep you interesting at all times. His English is very good, and I literally loved this outing with the group. I will surely recommend him to the visitors, he will give you a summary of Amsterdam in two hours.

Extremely knowledgable guide. I feel bad I don't remember the name of my guide because he was AMAZING!! (April 21 tour) One of the best guides I've ever met. He was easy going, full of information about what we're seeing, friendly and interesting! This tour is a great introduction and a helpful way to start any vacation.

Great time and valuable information. Great time and valuable information. I really recommend this tour, because it is a wonderful walk through many different interesting spots of Amsterdam, it is very variated with the history and current events of the city and Tim is a great storyteller who gives you a true Amsterdam experience. Cheers!

Great adventure!. I am motorcycle traveller, who is going round the world, and was visiting Amsterdam first time. Tim made a really great trip around the Amsterdam, sharing the interesting stories. So i highly recommend it!

Pleasant and very well organized!. Our host Tim took us for an hour or two out through the streets of Amsterdam, the historical centre. Living in Amsterdam myself and as a history student at the university of Amsterdam I wasn't really sure what to aspect from this city tour. Well Tim definetly blew my mind when it comes to his (historical) knowledge from the city. He has accurate knowledge about how the Dutch lived in this city hundreds of years ago, as well he knows the ins and outs about what's going on in the city of Amsterdam today.Comes to say it is definetly worth spending a couple of hours with Tim when spending time in Amsterdam.

Great tour, Great guy!. I am living in Amsterdam and was looking for some sightseeing.. I discovered the freewalkingtoursamsterdam.com site, and went with Tim on a tour. The tour, the city and Tim were great! I really recommend it to everyone that lives or visits Amsterdam.

A great introduction to the city. We met our guide at 10 am and joined a small group for a very interesting tour of four different districts located in the central area. Our guide was congenial and informative. We walked for 2 hours. Our guide knew his history and kept my interest.

New insights of a town i thought i already knew. Tourguide Tim takes you on a trip trough Amsterdam wich in fact can be, even for locals, a very intersesting one. In the trip Tim will take you around show you interesting buildings, take you trough small alleyways and tell you about the rich history of this liberal city. This trip makes you feel at easy, welcome and home in the city of Amsterdam. That's why I recommend to take this trip first thing you do when visiting Amsterdam. Be honest and tip him as you appreciate.

Awesome free tour :). Despite being a rainy day, the tour was really cool. A lot of information about the history of Amsterdam and how this translates into nowadays architecture and infrastructure. We even went in to a university building that was occupied by students whom were prostesting. Only drawback of the tour was the typical dutch weather..

We do recommend this free City Tour!. Very informative, Bram you definately did a great job!!! Very friendly, funny and interesting. Was not too long, plus we also got free traditional cheese:) Thanks so much!!

Fantastic walking tour with Lieke. A big thank you to Lieke for a fun and informative walking tour of Amsterdam. She was enthusiastic and knowledgeable and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this company to others!

Do it! . Would highly recommend this tour to learn all about this amazing city! Our guide was WONDERFUL! It was not so much a history of particular buildings but of the city itself while walking around! Please go!

You MUST fit in this tour!!. I went to Amsterdam for the first time with my friend, we both wanted to go on a walking tour and I'mSo happy we chose to go with Sergio. We had the best tour, he makes it fun incorporates all funny stories to make it interesting you get to go all round and he explains the history etc. We throughly enjoyed it. Recommend everyone to go!!!!! Lots love

Amazing tour. I took this tour with 3 friends and we couldn't be more happy about it. It was really worth it. our guide, Ami, was amazing! she gave us a overview of the history of the city and at the same time she told us some of her experiences, where to go and what we couldn't miss.I'd reccomend it to anyone. It's a fun way to get to know the city and other people

Would Recommend!. I took this tour with three of my friends and we would all recommend it. Our tour guide, Ami, was up-beat, engaging, and knowledgeable. We learned a lot about all different aspects of the city-- if you have the time, take this tour!

Just... Lovely!. Ami is a very enthousiastic and passionate guide. She knows the city really well and not only talks about the history, but she also told us some cool anekdotes and legends, which make the trip more personal than a regular.Thanks, Ami!

Not your average walking tour.... This is not a normal walking tour... I repeat, this is not a normal walking tour. You will learn, you will laugh and you may even cry (from laughing of course). You will also realize that you are part of the only tour group that doesnt look like they are bored to death.Thank you Sergio for such an awesome afternoon. You have set the standard really high!

Sebastian was great!. I booked this tour based on the reviews and the fact that we could book Lastminute and go the same day.Our tour guide was called Sebastian and he was GREAT! really friendly and full of facts that you want to know about with funny stories rather than just dates etc.It was raining when he started but before he took off, he made sure everyone that needed an umbrella was given one and boy were we pleased! The whole tour takes around 2.5 hours and is great for getting your bearings around the cityThe fact that it's free was of course a massive plus and the recommended tip is €10 per person - excellent value! Would definitely recommend
Really Nice Tour with Lieke. Did the tour with a friend of mine, and we really enjoyed.The guide, showed so much passion about the city and it's history.I would definetly recommend the tour.

Great way to experience the city!. We had a very interesting, historic but also funny tour through the inner city of Amsterdam! Our guide Ami did a fantastic job in bringing across facts and personal experiences that were very enjoyable to listen to. She also gave us a valuable tips concerning restaurants, bars and places to see and was generally very open to comments, needs and questions. I would recommend this tour without hesitation!
Highly recommended. We enjoyed the tour with Gianni who shared both history and fun stories. It was informative and a good opportunity to get some tips for further stay.

Fun and Informative tour. Our guide, Gianni, was fun and informative! The casual format was perfect for a couple of us arriving at different times and we got a chance to see and experience different parts of Amsterdam. Weather cooperates and lots of people about for a holiday weekend. Totally touristy thing to do but glad we found this option - love the suggested contribution concept and was worth it!

Fun, funny and informative. Me and my boyfriend chose this tour due to the good reviews on here and it didn't disappoint! Sergio (our tour guide) was really nice, funny and because he grew up in Amsterdam he knew loads about the city. He added little bits about his time in the city and I really liked that aspect about it. Takes you to the places you want to see while giving you some information about their history. Definitely learnt a lot. Would recommend this to anyone if they want a fun and informative tour.

Fun and informative tour with Lieke. Myself and my wife went on the Free Dam Tours, walking tour in Amsterdam at 2pm on Friday 21 October. Lieke was our tour guide. Lieke was very passionate when she was sharing the history and stories of Amsterdam with the group. She was very descriptive and answered any questions the group had in detail. I would recommend the Free Dam walking tour with Lieke,

Informative and fun. Had an excellent time on this tour, the owner Sergio was very engaging, knowledgable and did well to marry the history of Amsterdam to modern day Amsterdam as well as having stories of his own experiences in the city. I liked his use of pictures on the tour and felt like I could have given a tour myself after going on this, would highly recommend!

Excellent. Would recommend . Ami is friendly and very enthusiastic. A great walking tour. Wish we did it at the beginning of our trip. She was full of useful hints and tips. Funny anecdotes. Took us to places you would never know where there. Hidden churches and a mini village! Would highly recommend

On of the best walking Tours. Ive been on a lot of free tours but this on was hands down the best. Me and my friend were looking for a spanish tour when we saw the flyer so we decided on this on instead. Not only was our guide (Sebastian) funny but so knowledable. Do not miss this as the tour only lasted 2 1/5 hrs it is a must in Amsterdam. He also had a lot of recommendations for other places to see and do while out stay.
FreeDam Tours with Sergio. Sergio was great. He gave a lot of information about the city, but did it in a funny & interesting way. It wasn't boring at all.

Ami and the walking tour. Went on a walking tour with Ami. Who knew loads. She was funny, lively and informative. The tour was really good. And came away with funny stories and facts.
