Was just under 2 hours, regular stops and really interesting little hidden spots and bar/cafe recommendations. Highly recommend!
Tourism. We had a great time with SERGIO! Very intersting tour he had a story for everyhing we really enjoy it! Greeting from Colombia

Informative, friendly tour. Gianni was our guide and he was really lovely and informative answering any question I had about Amsterdam. The tour was really informative and as someone who has been to Amsterdam before I learnt a lot. It was a miserable day but Gianni tried to make sure we got cover where possible and kept chirpy throughout even giving us free waffles and a postcard. I would strongly recommend this tour.

Just had a walking tour with Leike. Just had a really interesting walking tour with Freedam tours. Our guide was Leike, who was really informative, personable and friendly. We would really recommend this your. Travelling at this time of the year you'll need warm clothing, comfortable footwear and woolly hat! Heartily recommended!

Awesome tour!. If you are looking for a really interesting and fun tour, this company is perfect. Sergio was a great guide, giving us an insight into the history of Amsterdam which provided a really good context for his stories about modern life in the city. You can tell that he is really passionate about sharing Amsterdam with visitors and there was perfect amount of history and personal anecdotes. Much better than the big, commercial tour companies, this tour is personal and unique. Thanks for a great afternoon Sergio!

Walking tour of old Amsterdam . Sebastian made our two and a half hour walking tour of old Amsterdam both very entertaining and informative. Covering the history of the Red Light district, the evolution of Amsterdam as the global centre of world trade in the 16th century, its transition from a republic to a monarchy, the tragedy of the Nazi occupation and its enlightened and effective attitude to drug control, he stitched these diverse items together with humorous personal anecdotes and insightful commentary on the underlying social and cultural mores of the Dutch people. He also shepherded across the city without being run down by the thousands of high velocity and unflinching cyclists. A great introduction to an immensely attractive city.

Way beyond our expectations. My wife and I did the tour with Sergio last weekend and enjoyed it immensely. We are lucky enough to have done walking tours in many places around the world and I can honestly say that this was the best one. It was informative, heart felt, entertaining and fun. Thanks again Sergio for contributing so highly to our vacation in Amsterdam.
Fantastic tour. Had a great tour yesterday with Sergio, he was funny and informative and very personable. I definitely recommend this tour!

'Dam' good walking tour. Sergio was awesome! My friend Tammy and I were saying that it's one of the best, if not the best walking tour we've ever been on. He was funny, informative and engaging. He shared a mixture of history of the city as well as culture and his own personal experiences in the amazing city. Thanks for the great afternoon Sergio!

Excellent walking tour with Ami. A great way to discover more about Amsterdam beyond your assumptions about the coffee shops and Red Light District. Ami proved a fantastic guide delivering the perfect mix of history, personal experiences and suggestions regarding local food, etc. Thanks again to Ami and FreeDam Tours!

Love it! . Our guide Ami is friendly and willing to answer anyone's questions. She's funny too! I believed she even spent extra time to show us some info you would only know if you are living in Amsterdam (I cannot tell what, you just have to join the tour to find out). We went through the Red Light District, then down south before ending with the palace. Ami even showed us good places to try Dutch food for a decent price (I enjoyed Tomaz). Rmb: it is a free tour. Up to you how much you wanna give! Highly recommended!

Fun, Interesting and Informative.. Just got back from this walking tour with Sergio with my two friends. I've done quite a few of these types of walks in different cities and can honestly say this was one of the best. Sergio brings everything to life combining the past and the present in such a fun way. He has lots of funny stories and moments of personal experience that have you laughing out loud but he still manages to get the information across too. The tour was supposed to last 2.5 hours but stretched into almost 3 hours with the group photo. If you want to get to know Amsterdam try this tour. I highly recommend it and you won' t be disappointed.

Fantastic walking tour with Sebastion. I really enjoyed my walking tour with Sebastian. He had a great sense of humor and he shared a lot of historical information (as well as a few personal stories) to help us learn about the city. The tour was both interesting and fun. My only word of caution is that this tour goes through the red light district (not sure if this is clearly spelled out on the website?) and you will see scantily dressed girls in their windows - working. If you have children or others in your party who are uncomfortable with this, you might want to consider another tour. Otherwise, I highly recommend it.

Tour with personal touch. Sergio was our excellent guide, he mixed history with personal life covering lots of aspects from Amstedam. The nearly 3h ours that last the tour just fly, since you are captivated with his explanations and funny stories. Go and try if you'd like an unconventional tour with current amsterdam life and personal touch!He is very helfpul if you want to get tips for the city: restaurants, coffee shops, souvenirs... any question!

Amsterdam's best walking tour. Thank you, Freedam Tours, for the wonderfully informative, interesting and compelling walking tour on Sunday afternoon. I'm recommending, wholeheartedly, your tour company to clients, colleagues, family and friends.

Walking tour with Ami. The tour was really nice! Amy is a knowledgeable, fun and attentive guide. She gave us tidbits about the history of Amsterdam, a bit of the gossip, and offered suggestions for later!
Awesome tour, perfect guide!. We loved doing this walking tour with Ami. She was very knowledgable but funny and her stories were super interesting. Would definitely recommend!!

Amazing walking tour. This city walking tour was highlight of our trip. Usually I want to know about the history of a city but I get bored listening to all these dates and historical facts and a few hours later I don't even remember most of it. But this city walking tour was different! It was a fun and entertaining way to know a lot about Amsterdam: the culture, the history, the people. Our guide was super fun and knowledgable. Would definitely recommend it.
Great tour. Thanks Lieke, for the informative, funny and interesting tour! Hope you will continue spreading the stories!
Interesting and educational tour. We enjoyed our tour with Sergio. Lots of interesting history told in an entertaining style made this a great tour.

Awesome tour!!! Must do. The tour was fantastic. We really like this company and our guide/owner Sergio was superb!!! He was very informative and entertaining at the same time. It's definitely worth going and it's way better than the tours which are organized by big companies which are most of the time promoting other of their events. If you want to do a free walking tour in Amsterdam this should be your choice. Good job guys!!!
Walking tour. Ami and her tour really made my day. She is awesome! Her sense sense od humor, her ability to put the history facts into interesting details are just amazing:)Go Ami!
City walking tour. Fantastic walking your. The best way to see the city. Our guide Lieke was brilliant. Lots of good stories and facts. Would recommend you do this tour.

110% happy. After reading all the glowing reviews for Ami I was excited to have her as my guide. She gave a very informative tour but on top of that, a lot of her subject matter was not only historical but a lesson on the progressive culture of holland. I could really tell, although she's not Dutch.. she loves what she does. Hope to do this tour again in the future.
Excellent tour and guide Amy. The tour was really great! Specially for Amy, our guide. She was nice and she told us the history of Amsterdam in a fun way!

Ami was awesome. Ami had a great knowledge, and made the 2.5 hour tour very entertaining and fun. She had real enthusiasm for what she was doing, and gave great insight to the city and its inhabitants. Highly recommended tour.
Fun!!!. Great time!!! History, fun and culture. It was very interesting and amusing, we had a really great day!!!

Great tour with Ami. We found the tour was an excellent introduction to Amsterdam. It took around 2 and a half hours, as advertised. We went around on a Monday morning with Ami, who was very good and gave us a good mix of history and entertainment, visiting a number of places we just wouldn't have seen if we hadn't gone on the tour, although some of the stories about the red light district were a bit close to the mark. All in all, well worth a couple of hours of anyone's time. There was a good mix of ages in the group, the walking pace was very relaxed and the whole thing was easy going.

Ami was amazing!. I was in Amsterdam for only 3 hours and I was fortunate enough to spend 2.5 of them being shown around by Ami. She was really engaging, fun and informative. After such a short visit I now feel I've seen and learnt about the main things in this city and, most of all, I've had a great time walking and listening. Warning: rather than "free" you are expected to give a tip at the end according to how much you enjoyed it and, I tell you, you'll feel like this tour is worth a lot of money!
Ami was fantastic . Both I and my daughter had a great and exciting trip with Ami. Ami's guided tour was informative and fun. Loved it from its beginning to the end.
Leike is an amazing guide . The tour was surprisingly informative. Leike was very passionate and knowledgeable. I feel like I know amsterdam already. Definitely recommend to anyone.

Damn good walking tour. We weren't sure what to expect with a free walking tour but we were blown away by our experience. Our guide, Gianni, was a fourth generation Amsterdamer, who was filled with not only historical knowledge but also interesting insight into the Dutch mindset. Every stop he made sure to balance historical content with interesting and amusing anecdotes. Really helped us understand the culture of the city and how it developed to where it is now.

Ami was a fantastic guide. A great way to spend 2.5 hours exploring the city and learning about much more than just the history. Ami gave us lots of background, plus her personal experiences and anecdotes that made the tour so much fun.

highly recommended. Our tour guide was Amy and she was amazing. She was informative, enthusiastic, bubbly, knowledgeable, likeable and definitely not boring. If you want a potted history of Amsterdam then look no further than Free Dam walking tour, and if you do go you might be lucky enough to get Amy as your guide

breathtaking. The Free dam tour was definitely an unforgettable experience. Sebastian, our tour guide is the one, who made that experience so special. Never have i met someone who could charm an entire group and hold them captivated with all the informative yet super fun stories. My proof is that I remember every single info ive heard on that day.I would certainly recommend this tour. Its a 2 hour walk altogether and you get to see the most important sights in Amsterdam. I assure you, you wont get bored!

Amazing Free walking tour. Ami is an excellent guide that show us everything we should know about Amsterdam. We had gread time with her. She gave us many tips for restaurants and things to do in the city.

Super informative and fun. Was lucky enough to tour with the owner, who had fantastic knowledge of the city & a lot of great stories and experiences as well. Perfect introduction for me to the city, and so much to learn. Highly recommend!

Wonderfully informative and entertaining!. A friend and I did a 2.5 hour walking tour with FreeDam tours in late September. Gianni, our guide, was deeply knowledgable about Amsterdam's history and culture and conducted our tour with great warmth and energy. He shared information that covered the highlights of this extraordinary city's establishment and development over many centuries as our group traversed the city on foot. My only disappointment lay in Gianni's failure to mention The Netherland's major role in the enslavement of Africans and the extent to which the Dutch participation in the slave trade made much of the country's great wealth possible during the 17th and 18th centuries.That said, the tour was wonderfully comprehensive, well paced and well organized. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Amsterdam. The 'pay what you wish' ethos that governs this company makes the tour accessible to literally everyone but it is certainly worth as much as any other tour offered by companies with fixed rates.The tour is long so wear comfortable shoes, take some water with you and say yes to the stroopwaffels that Gianni offers when you take a break midway through!
Really nice walking tour. Our tour guide (Sebastián) was excellent, very friendly and easy to talk to. Walked through all Amsterdam, showed us lots and learnt new things about Amsterdam history.

Excellent walking tour of Amsterdam. We found the Freedam walking tour pamphlet in the lobby of the hotel. I was so pleased with the tour. Sergio is highly knowledgeable and funny. he provides a wonderful and interesting history lesson from the beginnings of Amsterdam to the present, peppered with fun facts, stories, and personal experiences. The tour focuses on how Amsterdam became the city it is, in regards to being an open and tolerant town. Highly recommend this free walking tour! Just FYI, we gave Sergio a generous tip since it was an awesome and memorable experience!

Very entertaining tour and informative tour . We booked the tour spontaneously two hours before the start and were lucky enough to be able to join. Ami was a great guide and put her own personal spin on many of the stories and interesting tidbits she told us. Although the weather was everything but in our favor she did the best to keep us well entertained for the 3 hours. She also had some great insider tips for restaurants in the city. Really great package to get to know the dam.

Great energy, Great time. Had a great time with Sergio. He has a great knowledge of the city with a mix of history and modern. Good selection of stories but I think the one aspect that stood out to me is his energy and enthusiasm and even a few dutch treats which was a great touch.

Highly recommend this walking tour!. We thoroughly enjoyed our walking tour with Sergio! He was extremely knowledgable with a great sense of humour. If you're looking at walking tours to do in Amsterdam...definitely pick this company!!

Great introduction to Amsterdam. We saw a flyer for this tour in our hotel and though 2.5 hours seemed long, we decided to give it a try. We're very glad we did! The time flew by as we walked around points of interest (including many we would never have known about on our own). Our guide Ami was great - she has such enthusiasm for the city & really made the history come alive!

high rating is deserved. First thing we did after arriving in Amsterdam. Sergio has the right mix of historical information and entertaining stories to keep things lively for whole time. Great way to get set up for more extensive sight seeing in the Central district.

Nice overview about the city of freedom. It was a great glance overview mixed with small nuts about a city of Amsterdam. It was just long enough to cover the main quarters and not being exhausting. Amy answered any questions, and also recommended some great places to go in the end.

Lovely tour with Lieke! . We wanted a tour that provided more of the local perspective, and that's exactly what we got with FreeDam Tours! Lieke was incredibly informative, knowledgable, and a fantastic presenter. Her clear but spirited style of speaking made it easy to follow all of the information. I learned so much about Amsterdam's history and Dutch culture, and i'd highly recommend this as a good way to start your trip. We absolutely loved this tour - and all of the recommendations she gave us for the rest of our stay!

Ami was great!:). Both me and husband had a great time on her tour. She had a fun way of telling the historical stories, which was not boring at all. She took everybody's questions and tied them up with a story which was awesome. She told us her personal favorites in the city which was super helpful. She ended the tour with sharing stroopwafels with everyone, so thoughtful!:)

Lucky to tour with the 'Owner'. Got in on short notice and had the luck of having Sergio as our tour guide. He has recently opened this tour company and really takes pride in his tours. Gave us a more personal view of Amsterdam while hitting all the major highlights! Lots of great history on Amsterdam with his prrsonal personal flair. You won't be disappointed with the tour but prepared to walk; he covers a good amount of ground during this walk! Cheers Sergio!

Amsterdam described in many ways. Sergio was fantastically entertaining while providing a complete overview of historical and contemporary Amsterdam. Very funny guy - we thoroughly recommend his tour!

Ami rocks-best guide I've had! . Amazing tour with Ami who is by far the best tour guide I've had throughout my many tours in Europe-super energetic, funny, and engaging, she kept the group on the edge of our seats the whole time. Also, really nicely tied in the themes of freedom and the city (and the tour gave us some much appreciated treats too)!! Definitely recommend.
Great Amsterdam walking tour with tour guide Ami!. Ami is super friendly, knowledgeable, humorous, and energetic. Great tour with an interesting mix of history and culture along the way!

100% recommended!. I booked this tour due to a Facebook recommendation on things to do in Amsterdam and what an excellent recommendation it was! Sergio mixed facts with his own personal stories, blended history with present day and the time whizzed by! He is a great host, my boyfriend and I both agreed it was one of the highlights of our trip - if you're going to do a walking tour then this is the one to do, and if you're not.....then maybe you should reconsider!

Something different !. This tour was nicely unpredictable : with all its anecdotes of history, personnal living, architecture, people, culture and so on... More over, the guide is joyful, has in his bag not only little pictures to make you understand, but also a lot of humour for you to have a great time, and little surprises :)!And... last but not least : this guide can understand little salaries (like student ones) and suggest you pay what you think the visit is worth...I learned a lot about the city and met nice people from all around the world, sharing our experiences of life and differences of culture, thanks to the guide who made us interract !This is to experiment at least once :)

Great tour. Amazing tour ! We found Sergio very informative. He has away of telling you about the history with a sense of humor. Never a dull moment . A definite must do. Thank you Sergio!The three generations!

Great Tour with Great Tour Guide. We landed in Amsterdam early in the morning and could not check into our hotel. We started to walk around and found Sergio with his yellow umbrella and decided to join his tour. It was a great way to start our trip in Amsterdam and we were able to hit all of the major places in and around the Central District. Sergio included his personal stories and gave out discount cards for bikes and other tours.

Amazing tour with historic facts & fun!. We had an awesome tour with our guide Sergio. He is an amazing storyteller - from Amsterdams history to today's city - and always mixed with his own personal Amsterdam adventures resulted in an exciting 2.5 hours tour. Highly recommendable!

Thank you Lieke for a Memorable Tour!. My first ever visit to Amsterdam and this tour was booked for me as a way of getting to know the city. Lieke was our guide - she not only knew the city, but gave us so much interesting information on the history of Amsterdam and its people. Her command of English was excellent and she was fun - this wasn't a 'dry, boring' tour! We were impressed with the way she made sure that all the nationalities in our group were made to feel comfortable together, and we went at a place that suited all ages. We toured parts of the city which we would not have found by ourselves. An unforgettable 2 hours and well worth €20 or more.

Dam good tour. I think we spent more than 2h. Tour is in small groups, you can clearly hear everything, and guide answers all your questions. He knows lots of local stories and is eager to help if you would like go somewhere else after the tour. If I used a book I would never found many of places I was visiting. After the tour you will understand how locals understand the world and what shaped them.

A surprisingly indepth and spirited tour!. I didn't check any reviews beforehand, and choose this tour through a quick google search. The tour turned out to be far better than my expectations. Our tourguide (Lieke) was wonderfully spirited. She gave us indepth historical context about Amsterdam, its origins and its important values. She also eloraborates on the many cliche's of Amsterdam as a liberal safe haven. She could tackle any question with a clear answer and made sure nobody was left behind. She was ready to give any recommendation and she seemed to enjoy her part as a tourguide- even giving us Stroopwafels!I highly recommend this tour.

Great walking tour with a local guide. Great tour with Lieke as our guide but leave yourself plenty of time as the tours tend to overrun (2.5 to 3 hrs). Wasn't keen on "icebreaker" start to tour and the whole chatting time spent before we learnt anything of Amsterdam was a bit unnecessary. We were also told, before we got going, that the usual tip for this "free" tour was 10 euros. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly and the pace was slow with lots of standing around. Good way to get to learn about the history and evolution of Amsterdam into the town it is today.

Probably the best walking tour in Amsterdam. We had the pleasure of getting the tour by the person who actually started FreeDam Tours, the charismatic and entertaining Sergio, who will let you know that he is just as Dutch as any Dutch ever could be.The tour is extremely informative and entertaining and a great introduction to the culture and history of the country. Sergio proceeds to make it personal and also shares very interesting personal stories from his time in the town, which adds that final touch, which makes a great tour an exceptional one.We were with our son and his baby stroller and Sergio always kept that in mind and adjusted the tour accordingly.Please note that the tour is free of charge, but tipping is of course expected!Don't miss out on the opportunity to take it, if you ever get the chance.

Brilliant free tour of amsterdam. Picked up a flier in our hotel. Group of about 15; informative and very interesting. Can book but most just turned up and looked fro the umbrella. Billed as free but everyone voluntarily gave a tip of 10-20 Euros. Took 2.5 hours, at a slow pace.
Fantastic tour!. Ami was a great tour guide! Very informative and entertaining!! Would definitely recommend to others!!

Ami, the girl with the yellow umbrella. A brilliant tour guide for FreeDam Tours. She is very informative, amusing and communicative. Always willing to listen and answer questions. She took us to the most interesting locations around Amsterdam and gave us a potted history of the city as we went. We learned a lot on the way round, something you don't get in as much detail on the boat trips.If you only have time for one, take a FreeDam Tour with Ami.You will not be disappointed.

Great way to start a trip to Amsterdam!! . Arrived in Amsterdam and went straight to the walking tour with Sergio!! Had a great time, laughed a lot and learnt so much about the city. I highly recommend!!!

Ami was awesome!. This free walking tour was very informative and very interesting! Amsterdam is soooooo much more than what people think with its rich history and culture. Our tour guide, Ami, was funny and made the tour fun. I would highly recommend this walking tour!

Fun and worthwile tour with Sergio. We did the walking tour with Sergio last Saturday at 11 AM. I booked two spots prior to the tour, though I think it is not necessary as Sergio accepted all people who showed up at the meeting point to join the tour. Even though he told us that the tour usually takes up to 4 hours, it lasted for approx. 2.5 hours as he had to do both tours this day (11 AM and 2 PM).I am so thankful I booked with FreeDam Tours. We had so much fun, got great insights into Amsterdam's history, many interesting facts about the city, and fun anecdotes of Sergio's experiences. Sergio is a great guide. You can feel that he is Dutch with passion and loves to tell about his hometown. I highly recommend FreeDam Tours to everybody who wants to get insider information about the city, its history, and its people.

Had a "Dam" good time!. We found a flier in our hotel and were glad we decided to do the afternoon tour with Sergio. Lasted for a little over 3 hrs but didn't feel that long! Sergio was very very informative, interesting, and fun.... gave as insight into Amsterdam that we certainly didn't get from the hop on/off tours or guidebooks. As our group was about 15 or so, Sergio was able to satisfy all our little queries. Covered areas that are not the usual touristy ones. Though the area covered is not that much, be prepared to be on your feet for a couple of hours...so comfy shoes are a must. Definitely worth doing if you have an afternoon to spare in Amsterdam, rather than wandering about on your own..

You didn't visit in Amsterdam if you don't take the tour with sergio from free dam tour. . Amsterdam is amazing but You didn't visit in Amsterdam if you don't take the tour with sergio from free dam tour.

Thank you Ami!. We did the tour on our last afternoon in Amsterdam and wish we did it at the start! Ami was very informative as well as funny and interesting. Highly recommend FreeDam Tours and hopefully you get lucky to have Ami as your guide.
Fabulous tour!. We had a great time, our guide was knowledgeable and fun, and we got a great overview of Amsterdam. Highly recommended! Enjoyed this lots more than the boat tour we did.

11 AM Free Guided Tour with Ami. Took the 11 AM tour a week ago and it was the perfect way to get acquainted with the city. Ami did a great job. Her energy, passion, knowledge and personalized touch kept the group intrigued right to the very end. Would recommend this tour to every tourist who visits Amsterdam. And Ami, keep rocking :)
Fantastic!. The best tours in amsterdam : ) A lot of interesting story, energy! and smile. Everything was great ; )
Good guide!. Ami is one of the best guides I have met the last years. She made Amsterdam's history really before our eyes - and ears. I really recommend Freedam Tours!

Amsterdam in a nutshell!. I really enjoyed the company of our great tour guide. She has awesome information about the city, adorable sense of humour and generous hospitality. I strongly recommend this 3 hour tour in the begining of your visit to Amsterdam. It will really help you plan your stay.
11am tour. Leike was a fantastic guide. She was very knowledgeable but the thing we loved the most was the energy and passion she provided. Will definitely recommend

Amazing tour. This amazing tour was the first thing we did in Amsterdam and it was really fun and interesting!! Sergio was great, he has a lot of knowledge and a great sense of humour. This is a very good way to get to know Amsterdam.
Quirky and fun. Ami gave us a very informative insight into the life and history of Amsterdam. I was sorry when the tour ended!

Amazing experience. Thank you Sergio for an amazing tour. Your insight and personal stories made this tour super interesting. It was definitely the highlight of my visit to Amsterdam. I would highly recommend this tour!!!

Amzing walking tour with Amy!!!!. We took walking tour with Amy on 12th Sep,2016. Amy has incredible knowledge about Amsterdam and the dutch history. Not only that Amy has a great personality and is incredibly fun and made our 2 hour tour seem like 20 mins.I whole heartedly recommend Amy and Freedom tours to anyone and everyone visting Amsterdam.

Nice 2,5h to get a taste of Amsterdam . Read the reviews and the visit didn't disappoint, living up to our expectations. Sergio was a charming and very funny guide, and even though his geography teacher background shown up at times, it was very amusing and informative and his personal experiences added an entertaining and insightful touch to the tour. Highly recommended!

Sizzling tour!!. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour! Sergio really knows the ins and outs of Amsterdam narrating great historical anecdotes and related personal experiences. A delightful way to spend a sizzling afternoon in Amsterdam!

Thank you Ami ,really enjoyed this tour. We took your advice and stopped for pankakes. AMAZING. Excellent day ,would highly recommend a group walking tour like this .such friendly tour guide and knowledgeable

Ami knows Amsterdam!. I did the tour as a solo traveller to Amsterdam, and wanted to learn about the city without having to subject myself to a talking bus tour.The group was a perfect size, and a great mix of nationalities, our guide Ami really made it for me though.Her breadth of knowledge and charming/entertaining delivery of information really opened up the city for me, and taught me many things that a bus tour would not - nor would a simple trip to the visitors' centre.The tour seemed daunting at 2.5 hours, however time flew by and it did not feel like we spent the whole time walking.Would highly recommend, and try and get Ami if you can!

A must-do!. We found it so helpful doing this tour on our first day. It give you a real sense of the city. I loved all the historic elements as I didn't know Amsterdam had so much interesting history! Our tour-guide Ami was really fantastic. She was funny, bubbly and really engaging. The fact that you decide yourself how much it's worth is a bonus too, but it was worth every penny we spent.

Very Gezellig. My wife and I did the tour and were guided by Ami.Its already been said a hundred times. The tour was informative and fun and did not dwell on architecture and like, but was much more about the quirkiness and lifestyle . A great mix of humour and information, without being overloaded with facts, Thoroughly recommend it.Thanks Ami

Excellent tour with Ami. Really enjoyed this tour and would recommend it. Ami was fun, enthusiastic and knew lots about the city. The tour covered lots of different things on the history and culture of Amsterdam so I found it very interesting and learnt lots.
Waqas Afridi . It was a great tour. Very informative and interesting as well especially the way the historical and personal experiences were related. Really enjoyed it. Thank you :)

Amazing tour!!!. We have to thank Sergio, it was a memorable tour. Besides being an expert on the city history and geography, Sergio is passionate about Amsterdam and about the tour!!! Keep up the excellent work!!! We can't wait to come back to Amsterdam, that's for sure!!!

Wonderful tour to learn a lot about Amsterdam!. Sergio was a very funny guide who made this tour very personal but also informative. I still remember most of the things he told us! It was all very interesting and you also got many chances to laugh! This is the perfect tour if you only have one day in Amsterdam or if you don't know very much about the city.

Great tour!. Lieke was an excellent tour guide! Her love and knowledge of Amsterdam was very well conveyed with interesting stories and experiences. The tour was threaded by the theme of tolerance and freedom, which I found especially brilliant! I highly recommend this tour as a way of getting to know the city and its colourful people. Thank you very much Lieke and Freedam tours!

Amazing tour with Sebastian. Last week I had an amazing tour with Sebastian. His passion and knowledge about the city of Amsterdam was truly a pleasure to listen to on the tour. I highly recommend this to anyone who is new to the city.

Great tour with Sergio . What a great tour this is. Perfect mix of city history, excellent comedy, gripping personal experiences and city sites. I could not have asked for a better guide than Sergio. This was hands down one of the best free walking tours I have ever done. Great tips for restaurants and bars after the tour was finished. Good luck with your bright future Sergio. All the best mate

You have to do it! . I booked the tour from the train on my way to Amsterdam and got a confirmation email before I arrived at the station with clear instructions of the meeting point. The location was easy to find and the tour started on time. Very informative, funny and different. We had an awesome time and he made sure to answer my 100 questions without feeling rushed. The tour helped me a lot getting around for the rest of my stay. A few hours later the owner sent us an email with the picture he took of the group. It was a fantastic surprise and a picture I'll save forever from a great tour! Thank you!

Highly Recommend in Amsterdam. My cousin and I were visiting Amsterdam and wanted a way to get a quick overview of the city. We sent a Whatsapp to Sergio last minute and he said we could get on the walking tour that same day and we're glad we did it-- it was probably the best thing we did in Amsterdam. Sergio shows you many of the sites you might want to see, really takes time to explain how Amsterdam culture plays in, and has a very funny and pleasant demeanor. The tour takes 2.5-3 hours-- you should definitely check it out-- it's the best walking tour we've ever been on and a great intro to Amsterdam.

Funny tour!!. Me and my husband did the tour with Sergio last week.he has lot of knowledge of the city and he explains in a very funny way so you will not get bored. If you are planning to visit Amsterdam and you want to learn more about this beautiful city I strongly recommend to book Freedam tours, you will not regret it. The experience is free but you can leave a tip at the end of the tour.

Fun and informative . Sergio gave us a great introductory tour of Amsterdam. He managed to capture our attention for the entire 3 hours with great stories, anecdotes and attractions. An absolute must if you want a funny, fun and informative introduction to the city.

The Freedam walking tour beats the hop on hop off city tour into oblivion. Energetic entertaining and knowledgeable presenter- a born educator. Best guided tour I've ever struck. We tipped her the equivalent of what the paid tour would have cost and I think the others in the group (about 15) seemed to do likewise. Don't miss it if you can.

Walking tour. One of the best walking tour! Sergio was our guide. We did a private tour. He was very informative and fun. He showed us not only the sights but educated us about the history of Amsterdam. If you have a chance to book a private tour I would strongly encourage FreeDam tours!
Very good experience. We had a very good time with Ami, such a great guide full of humor and good tips.Really cool experience if it's your first time in Amsterdam.

A Must Do Tour. I visited Amsterdam with a friend from Houston, Texas and we thoroughly enjoyed this tour. Sergio is a local whew grew up in Holland so he gives a great perspective on the culture of the city. He was also a teacher so he has a great way of giving you information while keeping your attention. The stops are frequent and no more than 15 minutes and he squeezes in a ton of information (it helps that Amsterdam is so interesting both historically and in a modern sense). I've been on walking tours before and this was by far the best! I highly recommend recommend this tour for anyone. It was entertaining and informative. No complaints.

Amazing Tour Guide. Do not miss out on one of the best city tour guides around! Sergio was knowledgeable and personable, and kept our small group moving and engaged. He answered all questions with a good amount of detail and showed us some off-the beaten tracks sites. We learned a lot about Amsterdam, its history, and culture. Definitely worth a huge tip!

Best guided tour ever!. I and my colleagues had a trip to Amsterdam in the end of August. On the very first day we went on a FreeDam tour and had the most interesting and fun tour in our lives! The spot was very easy to find and we had a small warm talk with the guide while waiting for others. The guide provided us with some history knowledge and development of culture, freedom in Amsterdam, that made many things much more easy to understand. His stories were very exciting and captive - just couldn't stop listening! We laughed a lot and had unforgettable time. Without a doubt, the best tour in my life!

Great experience . Our tour guide Amy was absolutely wonderful. she was full of knowledge about Amsterdam in a fun upbeat way, probably the highlight of our trip to the Netherlands! I recommend the tour and Amy to anyone who travels to Amsterdam!

No big deal to do this solo . I'm traveling alone in Europe for holiday and work and I thought this would be a fun way to learn more about Amsterdam. It was great! Ami did a fantastic job giving us insight into the history of the city but also pointers on how things work around the city. It was a great time and very entertaining too. Thanks Ami!

MISS THIS AND YOU MISS OUT. We did this tour on Sunday 3rd September in a group of 20 with Sebastian who was excellent and lasted over 2.5 hours of information fun and sometimes personal stories and experience. We did have a light shower of rain for a few minutes but it did not dampen the groups mood. Its a free tour tips only and I believe everyone put in a tip. Really pleased we did it as it set up the rest of our short break really well. You learn a lot about the Dutch ideas and attitudes
Personal view of the city. A fantastic tour with Sergio, he's extremely engaging, incredibly knowledgeable and it was nice to have a personal view of the city.
September tour. It was a great tour. I took a tour with Sergio. My only advice is that, in my opinion, the stops should be a litlle bit shorter and in more places.
Fun, amazing and informative . Great walking tour. Sergio is knowledgeable, funny and entertaining as a guide. A must do for anyone who wants to know more about this great city
Super interesting and entertaining tour. Very knowledgeable tour guide who seems to really enjoy what he's doing. Group size was very appropriate.

Engaging and entertaining!. Would definitely say it was worth taking time out of the day to join this tour! Tours are sometimes a little difficult to follow due to their overly-factual nature- the tour with Sebastian however is structured like a theme/story which is entertaining and flows very naturally so it was easy to feel engaged and the time just went by quickly. The standard was very high and Sebastian is a considerate, energetic and funny guide with some great stories- it is great that this tour is available on a tip-based system so that a wide range of people can attend and enjoy themselves.

Good fun and informative. Brilliant tour! Can really recommend this to anyone who appreciates something a bit different. Personal anecdotes combined with a good sense of history and humour without the indirect selling!

An Excellent Way to See The Heart Of Amsterdam. Normally when you are offered something for free, there is a string attached to it. Someone is trying to sell you something, or there is some other motive.Every once in a while, however, someone is so confident in the service they are offering, that they are willing to leave the compensation in your hands. That is the case here with Sergio.Sergio is a very knowledgeable former geography teacher from Amsterdam with a vast knowledge of the city. He grew up here. His technical knowledge, along with his his sense of humor, and genuine passion for what he is doing, makes this a fantastic way to spend a couple of hours.Sergio will take you to see some sites of historical or geographical interest, but some that also hold a special place in his heart and memories. This give the tour a very personal touch.He conducts the tour for tips. A bold move, since if you are not good, you will not make much money. He is worth it.Meets twice a day by the front of the Old Church in the Red Light District.
Fantastic!!!. This trip was wonderful! Full of personal stories mixed with some history of Amsterdam, all mixed with a brilliant sense of humour! Would definitely recommend this tour!!

Lovely way to experience Amsterdam. We had a great afternoon learning new things about the city from Sergio, he has a great presentation style that keeps the tour interesting! Although I have been to amsterdam around 10 times before and done walking tours here before I still learnt a few new things and visited hidden places I didn't know about such as the headquarters for the Dutch east India company. Great tour that I would recommend to anyone!

Fantastic. Fascinating tour with great personal stories and local interactions. I'd highly recommend it to anybody visiting or even living here. It was a friendly and funny way to learn the layout and cultural history of the city

Fantastic tour with great local knowledge. Really good tour, funny, informative with great local knowledge and stories. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a tour round Amsterdam. Tour guide will recommend best local places to eat and drink as well!
Great Tour!!. We enjoyed it very much. Sebastian the tour guide was very good. Great stories. Good time. Nice atmosphere.

One of the nicest tours I ever did!!. As we were looking for a cheap way to get to know the city we decided to do the freedam tour. When we arrived we presented ourselves to our small but nice and especially multicultural group. During this 2,5h tour we were never ever bored, our guide, sergio added a lot humour and personal experiences to his stories and told them with a lot of passion. We learned a lot about the city and the culture. At the end of the tour we gave a tip as everyone else does but we were very happy to do it after such a nice walk around the city!

Best Walking Tour. The tour with Sebastian at 11am was really entertaining. Interesting facts and personal stories from an Amsterdam native for all ages. The whole group was laughing :) I strongly recommend this tour!

Amazing!! . Took the tour at 11 and although the only allow 25 people there was 28 of us and it was completely fine. At first I was worried that we wouldn't be able to hear or see much but this was not the case at all, Sebastian always made sure we could and also tried to keep everyone in the shade and where possible places to sit down. He was more than accommodating!! In terms of the tour itself it took 2.5 hours and started near the old church and ended in the dam. It was a tip based tour and he stated most paid tours are €15 but he was happy to accept whatever you felt it was worth - we gave €10 each, some gave way more and others way less! He gave us a waffle mid tour to give us a boost and also a postcard at the end - very kind!! Sebastian was very informative and has a wide span of knowledge!! It was clear he loved his job and put lots of effort in to make it fun and enjoyable!! Talked just the right amount and showed us many different places and things that you otherwise never would have known like why the houses lean forward and why they all have hooks. Could not have asked for a better tour! Thank you Sebastian! Highly recommend to everyone!!
His style makes the diffrence!. Great tour for those who look for additional info about Amsterdam that can't be googled + guide's little attentions really make the diffrence! Very satisfied:)

Amazing Amsterdam. Thank you Sebastian for a wonderful introduction to your amazing city. The 2.5 hour walk around Amsterdam with you was an entertaining and educational experience. We rally appreciated your knowledge, communication skills and sense of humour. Your endeared yourself to our group. If in Amsterdam, I highly recommend FreeDam Tours.
Brilliantly engaging 3hrs. Best thing to do on your first day in Amsterdam, so you can get excited abt the rest of your visit..

Great tour, great tour guide. Had a great tour with Sebastian, very friendly and knowledgable. We learnt a lot about the local history with the great addition of personal stories of his time in the city.

Insightful and enjoyable introduction to the city. We took part in 2pm today and our Guide was Sergio. Very engaging and knowledgable together with personal experience as a local. We were looking for introduction to the city, his history and customs and we couldn't ask for more.

The best tour of Amsterdam!. Spent a rather rainy morning doing the most thorough and enjoyable walking tour I've ever experienced. A great mix of history, personal experience and humour, this free tour is the best way to see the city.

Entertaining and Insightful. Personally I find walking tours a great way to kick off a stay somewhere. Not only do you cover some of the best areas of the city but you learn about the culture and history which is what makes you appreciate your stay. Our guide Sebastian gave us a varied and amusing tour that included historical and cultural insights as well as entertaining personal anecdotes. He found a really nice balance between providing interesting information and adding his own personal twist.Top tourHighly recommend!

Great way to acquaint yourself with Amsterdam. Had a great tour with Sebastian! Well paced and informative! Sebastian was very knowledgeable and personable…he had a good sense of humour and left lots of time for interaction and questions within the group. I would definitely recommend this tour to friends!

Interesting and entertaining. Second free walking tour that I take. Sebastian, our guide took us in a really interesting trip around the most important parts of the centre of Amsterdam explaining us history, legends and some personal stories of his own. That makes a great tour being able to get to know the city in so many ways. He also gave us a really nice postcard and some stroop wafels to give us some more energy to continue the walking tour.The best way to know the city!

One of the best tours I've ever taken. The guide (I've forgotten his name) was one of the best gudies I've ever had. He was really fun and personal, and he must have told us lots of history because I learnt a lot but it wasn't like a lesson. I thought 3 hours would be long but it flew by and we got a great overview of Amsterdam plus he stopped at the end to give us some great tips on where to eat.

excellent. First of all >> Biiig Thanks to Sebastian(our Tour Guide)
He did an incredible good job of presenting the city in a very cool and personal way.
It was a very informative but still super relaxing tour.
Would recommend the tour to everybody, even Amsterdamers.
Cheers
Hannes :)

AWESOME 👣. It was our first journey to amsterdam, so we booked the tour to get some hidden tipps from a local, named Sergio... And it was definitely worth it, the combination of Information about modern lifestyle, history explained with a lot of humor led to a great experience. Plus you can ask a real local Amsterdamer for some nice recommendation regarding typical food, restaurants and rules! Thumb up and I would hearty recommend this tour!

Good Introduction to Amsterdam. We did the 2:00 tour with Gianni on Saturday. There were about 20 of us in the group and we managed not to lose anyone throughout the whole tour. Gianni was very knowledgeable about the city and the history and he was also very enthusiastic. Occasionally found it a little hard to hear him, however this was not his fault, Amsterdam is just a very busy city. It's a great way to get an introduction to the city and get a feel for what else you may want to see. The tour doesn't cover everything in Amsterdam (being only 2.5 hours), but Gianni was happy to give advice on what else we could see. Best thing is that it costs whatever you want it to. So if you do go on the tour and don't have a good time, then just don't pay!
Good tour to know Amsterdam . 2.5 hours tour. Gianni or guide is informative and I enjoyed the information that he provided. I highly recommend this to everybody want to know Amsterdam quickly.

Interestings Facts about Amsterdam. We did the 11am tour today with Gianni ,He was so informative and enthusiastic and had a great sense of humour.....he needed it with us Irish Scots and English in his tour group :) He had a nice touch with the photos and the way he tied all the history and "Dutch Way" in to the talk through the whole tour........We even experienced a bike falling into the canal !!!! John and I have done a lot of walking tours all over the world....and I must say Gianni was the best most interesting tour guide we have had.....Good Luck and success with your tours Goretti and John from Perth Australia (via Belfast)

Interesting and meaningful. I've joined the FreeDam tour while being in Amsterdam and enjoyed every moment! It was very personal, full of interesting facts, artistic and creative! Sergio is amazing, knows a lot, loves his job and does it with a huge passion! The free-donation price format is so friendly and helpful for those who cannot afford a guided tour! Thank you so much! Definitely recommended!
Really informative yet casual. We really enjoyed our walking tour. I learned so much about Amsterdam from our guide. We took a canal tour too and this tour was way better.

Amsterdam- from the eyes of the locals. I've joined the 2pm freedam tour last Saturday with the very charming Sebastian as our tour guide. It was by complete chance, but how lucky I was as it turned out to be one of the very highlights of my trip! Sebastian has managed to create a great mix of history, personal stories and a light walking tour (that will fit all ages) together with great attentiveness to his audience and a constant smile upon his face. Even the human traffic didn't the experience. I highly recommend this to anyone who would like hear some real facts about Amsterdam and see it from the eyes of a local.

Free tour of Amsterdam. My wife and I went on the 2 o'clock tour today with Gianni as our guide. We found it to be a great experience as Gianni was very humorous as well as informative. He told us lots of interesting things about Amsterdam and also about the Dutch way of thinking.We would heartily recommend this tour to anyone who would like an insiders view of Amsterdam.
Just awesome. I really enjoyed the tour. The guide was friendly and funny, but also prepared and professional. I learned a lot about the city, and I also met some very nice people. Just awesome!

Fabulous Informative Tour. Wonderful tour! The history of Amsterdam is presented in a way that explains the mentality of Amsterdam today, filled with wonderful funny stories and anectdotes from both the present and the past. Sergio is a fabulous teacher, and was happy to give us advice on places to see that were off the beaten path...... We followed up on all his suggestions and as a result had a very unique tourist experience. Highly recommend this tour.

Fantastic Walking Tour !. My husband and I love walking cities and are delighted that we found the Free Dam tour. Sergio is informative, personable and interacts with the group, giving historical information, anecdotes and personal experiences of a city he's obviously passionate about (either that or he's a really really good actor!). His tour shows Amsterdam as a cohesive living tapestry with interconnecting links from past to present and is presented with knowledge and humour. I can't recommend this highly enough. If walking tours are your thing then this is the one to go for. If walking tours are not your thing, take a leap of faith and do this one. It's worth it.

Freedam tours. Lieke, our tour guide was very informative and gave a great tour of Amsterdam. She had many stories to tell us which connected with each other about the different sites she showed us. Not only were they historical but some of her personal stories. Lieke also answered any questions we had about all aspects of Amsterdam, from the culture, to tips and suggestions of where to visit.

Great tour with a cool guide. Wandered around Amsterdam with Sergio today and had a great time. He's a really down to earth guy and mixed information about the city with personal experience. He could also answer every question asked and give great recommendations. We really enjoyed the tour and laughed a lot. Definitely choose FreeDam Tours if you look for a entertaining tour around this beautiful town
Mrs n Miss. Great tour Sebastian told some good stories about growing up in Amsterdam. He also really knew his history and had a great personality! Hope everyone tipped him well.

Mastering the art of walking tours. I have done several walking tours in Europe in the span of a month, and Sergio is definitely one of the best. He provides excellent anecdotes, both relevant and entertaining. And he ties everything together with an enthusiasm and passion that's palpable to his audience. Sergio adds little touches of detail that lets me know he is truly trying to create a memorable experience.

Tour in Amesterdam FreeDam Tours. My husband and I have just been on a fantastic tour with Sergio. It was great and we recommemd this tour to anyone who visits the city of Amsterdam. It's diferent! Thank you FREEDAMTOURS, thank you Sérgio. Helena e José, from Portugal. 12-8-2016.

Best walking tour ever. As I'm familiarized with free walking tours, I decided to take this one in Amsterdam as it was my second time there, but this time I only got two days to see something different from Amsterdam as I had already visit the museums on my first visit. Sebastian was our walking guide, he is amazing knows very single information and took us to very special places with different stories, I gonna say that this is for far the BEST walking tour I had ever been! Highly recommended!

Less talk more walk. Guide Sebastian spent more time with personal Amsterdam experiences rather than actual sites. That is ok except he would take a short story and make it into a long speech with no constructive conclusion or point. Became annoying and left have way through. If looking for facts on city find another tour.

Humorous tour in Amsterdam . It was so much fun to discover Amsterdam with Sergio !!! If you guys are thinking to go Amsterdam, find freedam tours in front of old church... This tour is highly recommended to everyone x

Brilliant informative funny walking tour. . Simply fabulous afternoon spent with Sergio. Great walking tour. Brilliantly funny and passionate local linking history geography and past and present culture. Thank you for having us on your tour. What a privilege. Miss the opportunity at your peril

Best walking tour ever!. Sergio's walking tour offers a perfect over view of Dutch history, culture and the origin of the philosophy of tolerance all told with incredible humor and passion. At each stop during the three hour walk around the core of Amsterdam he builds the story of how Holland was lifted out of swamp land by the ingenuity of wind mill builders, how those same mills led to a lumber industry that launched a shipping fleet that owned the seas, how the explorations and import wares developed the first stock market and how this tiny country kept European royalty at bay. Sergio weaves personal stories into his historical narrative that leave you with memories of having made a new friend in Amsterdam that you look forward to visiting again, and hopefully soon! You will love this tour!

Very interesting and engaging tour!. Sergio was the best tour guide I've had not only in Amsterdam but on any tour I've done anywhere. He was passionate, funny, informative, and held an interesting and cohesive narrative. Can absolutely recommend!

Humorous! I'll recommend it!. A good mix of private anecdotes and historial facts! Sergio is a very cool guy, very friendly and humorous! I would to do it again and will recommend the tour to my friends and family. Thanks!

Excellent choice!. Our guide, Lieke , was very enthusiastic and energetic . The tour was very good and she told us stories that are not found on the internet at first instance. She took care to bring cookies and postcards to remember. I recommend it 100 % , is better than a paid tour , lasted almost 3 hours and is very well to make it in the first few days in Amsterdam.

Book this!!! . Took the free walking tour with Gianni and it was awesome! He said he's a fairly new guide, but i think it wasn't obvious. He did a great job introducing Amsterdam, and Dutch, history and culture in a fun way. He had so many stories that the 2ish hours went by so quickly. You will not be bombarded with dates you'd eventually forget. Rather, the tour gives you great insight on past and present Amsterdam. The group was not too big and Gianni made sure he was able to interact with everyone. Great experience in the Dutch capital! (And thank you for the stroop wafels!)

Great tour guide, wonderful experience. The local tour guide (I think her name is Leka) she was incredible telling the history of the city, adding her own experiences and some true stories from local people. Really unexpensive (they work for tips) Highly recommended. Look for the yellow umbrella you won´t regret

Def recommeded!!. Great Tour of AMS! Sergio is very enthousiastic and tries to create a great atmosphere within the group. Captivated by his stories, both personal ones and of the city itself! Great storyteller... look out for few surprises that will make the difference! ;P Grazie Sergio!!
Great Tour. Thank you Sebastian for that great tour! Absolutely amazing! Perfect mix of history and personal stories. We highly recommend to take this free walking tour when you visit the city.

100% recommendation. Good city trip with a lot of interessting stories. Our tour guide Lieke was a very sympathic person who could answer many questions and gave a lot of insider tipps on where to eat or drink best.

Would Recommend. This was a very fun tour! Lieke was very knowledgable and informative, and she had some very amazing stories about buildings and events that happened in Amsterdam. I would definitely recommend this free walking tour if you're looking for a lot of information on Amsterdam and its history.

Great way to find out about Amsterdam. I wanted to go on this tour as I read fantastic reviews on tripadvisor. It did not disappoint. Sergio was very informative as he has lived in Amsterdam for years & even brought us to where his old apartment was in the red light district. Great mixture of history & present day fun facts. Make sure you go & book with Sergio :)

Fun and informative walking tour!. On this walking tour we learned a lot about the history of Amsterdam and its tolerance. It was a very informative tour and Sebastian our guide did an amazing job, keeping it interesting and funny. With his easy-going attitude and personal stories this tour was very fresh and definitely something for everyone - young, old and families. I've been to Amsterdam a few times already but never did a guided tour, so I now know a lot more.Great tour, would recommend it to anyone!

Interesting and entertaining sightseeing tour. We took part in this tour because of the positive reviews on tripadvisor. Furthermore we didn't want this uninspired "follow the umbrella" tour with a large group of people. Our guide was Sebastian who intruduced himself at the beginning of the tour and he invited us to introduce ourselfs to the group which made it more personal to every member of the tour. He made it very interesting and told some anekdotes from his life in Amsterdam. Also he gave us good recommandations for restaurants and boat tours! Thank you for the enjoyable tour!

Want a really awesome tour? Ask for Sergio from Freedam Tours!!!. Today I had an amazing experience in Amsterdam. I recently relocated to stay in Amsterdam.Today I wanted to do something different. I wanted to NOT do the tourist thing. Being new in Amsterdam, I am still very much exploring everything this city has to offer. Today I had a tour with a guy called Sergio, from Freedam Tours. I just did a Google search and his ratings where some of the highest. And Trip Advisor recommended him. On his website he advertised focusing more on the historical freedom and tolerance of the Dutch Culture, as opposed to all the normal tourist and museums,and Sergio brilliantly delivered on that.He intermixed his own personal experiences growing up and living in Amsterdam, with history and culture, and on this tour today, we did everything from how the red light district came to be, to how the Catholic Church was involved in prostitution, to modern day live. I can honestly not remember, feeling for one second, that I was bored. His humorous look at past events, combined with his own experiences, made this a very very memorable tour, and better than anything you will ever find in a history book or normal tour. What was nice about the tour, and I might be wrong, is that a lot of the history Sergio told us about, or a lot of the little hidden gems, might not be on a mainstream tour. It would bethings that only the locals would know about. Or the darker part of Dutch history that is left out of mainstream tours for convenience sake. He explained stuff to us very professionally and patiently. The tour took a little longer than anticipated, but no one cared, and everyone LOVED IT. I was honestly a bit disappointed when the tour was finished, because time went by so fast! There wasn't a dull moment. You can see that he loves what he is doing, with a fiery passion.And I have a lot of respect for him, because this is not a paid upfront tour, he works for tips only. So trust me when I say, he is bloody brilliant, very knowledgeable, and this will be one of my fondest memories of Amsterdam to date.

Informative Introductory Tour to Amsterdam. Had a fun and educational tour with Sebastian starting from Oude Kerk all the way to the Dam Square on a partly cloudy Sunday. The tour started at 2pm and lasted for around 3 hours. Along the way, he explained to all of us the tolerance of the Dutch culture, some historical tales for the city and the architecture of the houses along the canal belt, with some personal experiences here and there throughout the tour. He is very passionate in leading the tour and the excitement in his tone kept us all engaged for the whole session.I would recommend this tour for visitors upon their arrival here in Amsterdam, so that they have a better picture of the city before exploring it on their own.

Great Guide! - Lieke. Lieke incorporates personal stories with the city history and her experience as a student in Amsterdam. She offers, free tours through "Freedam Tours", with the courtesy of tourists paying what they believe the value of the tour was worth at the end. We have taken city tours all over the world, and she is one of the best guides we have had. Thank you Lieke for sharing your countries history and personal stories!

Amsterdam Walking Tour: Informative AND Entertaining. My wife and I did this tour on 24 July, 2016; Lieke was our tour guide. The three hour walking tour through the city was excellent throughout; Lieke was very well informed and "taught" us Dutch and Amsterdam history with lots of anecdotes and stories. We were an international group of 15 people from the US, Germany, UK, Austria, Costa Rica and Australia. Everyone seemed to have enjoyed the tour very much.
Walking Tour. Had a great walking tour with Lieke today, she was very informative and we learned a lot about Dutch history and culture. Thank you.

STORIES AND CULTURE IN AMSTERDAM. Had a tour the other day with Lieke . She was amazing and we learnt a lot about dutch culture and Amsterdam background. Nice way to meet other people and share few hours together.

Fun guided tour!. Great guided tour with loads of interesting fun facts and historical tales about Amsterdam! Sergio was an entertaining guide, and despite the long trip (approx. 2½ - 3 hours) one didn't feel tired! Great for young and old alike :)

Best Tour Ever!. Sergio gave us an in-depth walk through the history and vibrant culture of central Amsterdam. We saw some famous spots, but also hidden gems off the beaten path which is why I would definitely recommend this free walking tour. Easy to spot outside the bike shop with a bright yellow umbrella, his knowledge of Amsterdam is unbeatable and his stories will definitely leave you wanting more.. A perfect 'first thing' to do in Amsterdam, highly recommended, one of the highlights of my quick weekend trip!!!

great experience <3. it was a great tour, loved the combination of historical details and modern live stories of amsterdam <3 sergio was a great guide and really knows his stuff! the best free walking tour i have ever head, and i travelled a lot ;)

Great tour - very informative, fun stories and a great way to get acquainted with this fabulous city. Sergio was great! Super charming with great stories. It was just the right length of tour - about 2 1/2 hours walking but never got bored. My husband, myself and my 13 yr old daughter all enjoyed this and learned the most of any tour we did in Amsterdam. A great mix of history and modern tales of the city. The tour is "free" but you tip Sergio after the tour - suggested amount is around 10 euro per person - a pure bargain for such an awesome tour!

A Must!. Going in I really did not expect much; however, Sergio was entertaining AND informative! This was our fourth and final day in Amsterdam yet we learned so much. Wish this had been our first tour and not the last! Call him, email him and get on his tour. You will be glad you did!

Wonderful non-conventional city tour. Sergio took us on a great tour of Amsterdam. Good stories, nice use of pictures, learnt lots of new things. Nearly three hours long which suited us but maybe wouldn't suit all. Distance walked was not that far, easily manageable. Nice mixed group from all over the world and Sergio pulls everyone into his stories with his great approach

Small group, informative and friendly. We've just our tour with our tour guide Lieke. The tour started on time, was full of interesting anecdotes and information. We covered history and modern life of Amsterdam. Our guide was open to questions and friendly. I recommend having a walking tour.
Free Tour. It was a really cool tour, both informative and funny. You can hear the daily life and history of amsterdam from a real amsterdamer.

Interesting morning's walk with Sergio. FreeDam tours is an exceptionally well organised tour which combines interesting information about the origins of Amsterdam with tips and advice about modern day attractions. Sergio's extensive knowledge of the history and geography of Amsterdam is underpinned by his background as a teacher as well as his experience as a native. I haven't been on many walking tours before but I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it as an experience. A lot of the information was genuinely fascinating and the personal anecdotes from Sergio brought a really fun balance to the tour. Additionally the tour is free to attend (hence the name) and I really admire the ethos of this business - as well as Sergio for making the career switch from teaching - in that you can choose to pay what you think the tour is worth. It is quite a lengthy tour (around 2.5 hours) so I think it's hard to overlook Sergio's expertise and ability to be able to produce and deliver such an informative tour.

Absolutely must ! . Sergio is the best travel guide ever. The tour is for 2.5 hours combination of history and some interesting stories with combination of fun facts about Amsterdam. Absolutely enjoyed every part of the tour especially the cookies and lovely postcard as souvenir. I have been to Amsterdam several times but Sergio gave different perspective of Amsterdam now I love Amsterdam more!

Unique, personal, passionate and interesting. 4 words that perfectly describe both to the walking tour and Sergio, our guide. I did not want this tour to end - from the very beginning our entire group was captured by his passion for Amsterdam and the enthusiasm he shared historical and cultural facts about Amsterdam combined with some (very funny) personal anecdotes. I have done many walking tours in my life in many different cities but this is without a doubt the best one I have ever been on! Sergio - many thanks for this wonderful experience!

Best Walking Tour I've Done. This was the first walking tour I took as I traveled around Europe, and it set a high bar that none other has surpassed. Sergio had such high energy with the perfect mix of information, humor, and personal stories that really made you understand what it's like to live in Amsterdam. He was also interested in each of us and made an effort to share information he new was related to our interests. I'd recommend his tour over all others every day of the week.

Great tour!. Fun and informative - out guide Lieke did a great job! If she hadn't pointed out that it was only her second tour, I would've never guessed it. Loved the mix of personal anekdotes, historical information and stories of modern day life in Amsterdam. And Lieke, feel free to contact me if you ever end up going to Aarhus in Denmark! :)
Highly recommend. Fantastic tour with a very friendly guy who clearly knew his stuff. It was a great way to learn about this beautify and fascinating city and its history.

A lovely Tour with Lieke in
Amsterdam. On the 8th of july we enjoyed Freedam free Tour guide a lot with our lovely inspiring and enthousiastic guide Lieke! Highly recommend!

Great stories, unexpected places... Wonderful time!. Interesting stories directly from Amsterdam daily life, answering all the questions, even the tough one ;) Good job Sergio, I recommend to all my friends!

Excellent Amsterdam Walking Tour!. Do the right thing. Sergio is a great tour guide & lovely guy. Really knows his stuff and takes you around a lot of cool places. Highly recommend doing this tour, it's fun Love from Scotland,Chris
Best walking tour. Sergio was informative and funny, he mixed it up with the history of the city, personal stories and tipsSergio's passion made this tour interesting and a 'must do' in Amsterdam

Most interesting tour yet!!. Sergio was an excellent guide and it wasn't a boring history lesson but he made connections to life. You laugh as you you unearth and discover the DUTCH...An absolutely never to miss tour..I recommend you take the tour and you will fall in love with the tolerance of Amsterdam. .

Am-azing tour. I had not been on a tour before in Europe so I didn't know what to expect but it was brilliant. Sergio got talking to us all on a personal level when walking round and the group sizes were just right so we could hear what he was saying and didn't lose him during the walks between (which happens in larger groups we've seen). Keep going with your brill customer service FreeDam tours

Great Walking Tour. Great Walking Tour with a great guide. I made this tour with a friend at 4th July and it was a really good experience; much more fun that other walking tours in other cities. Sergio is a really cool guy who knows his city and its history very well. The duration is about 2,5 hours; starts at Oude Kerk (watch out for the yellow umbrella at 11:00 a.m. in front of the entrance of the church. After introducing ourselves the tour started to all the important places Amsterdam City Center has to offer. I had the feeling that the tour is quiete individual depending on the customers. The tour was a great mixture of information about history and people of Amsterdam but Sergio shared also a lot of fun facts as well. Once again, great tour, nice guide. five stars!

but they will never take... OUR FREEEEDAAM!. Had serious doubts before it started - I am not a 'walking guide' type cat.BUT.Sergio is a legend. The tour is legendary. He is down to earth, informative and fun.Apologies for the cliche, but I have a 'new appreciation' for this city having participated in this tour.Thanks, Sergio - had an awesome time!

Fun and interesting, do it!. Five of us did Sergio's tour and we all thought it was great. He relates interesting anecdotes of both contemporary and historical life in Amsterdam. A highlight of my time in Amsterdam.

Informative tour with great guide!. This was Leike's (?) first tour and it was really good! We really enjoyed the stories that she shared and the way she told them. Can highly recommend this tour as a good introduction to get to know more about Amsterdam.

Not to be missed. When I decided to go for the Tour at first I thought it is going to be basic as usual Tour of any city but when I finished the tour I was left with unforgettable memories that will stay forever in my mind.Coming to Amsterdam would be incomplete without doing this Tour and listening to captivating tales of the city which I didn't know much about except the Red light district. I am glad that I opted for this Tour and enriched myself with History and beauty of this place. Stories that I can share with my children. Sergio is a great story teller , serious & humorous

Former teacher gives great tours!. Complete with cultural tips and history lessons (with slides!), this tour is incredibly interesting and educational. Sergio not only includes compulsory history about the city of Amsterdam, but also links to modern culture and shares his own stories from growing up in Holland and living in Amsterdam.It's a great way to start out your visit!

Fantastic way to learn about the city from a local. My girlfriend and I went on a fantastic your with Sergio yesterday. He taught us about the history of the city and shared some anecdotes about city life that were quite fitting to the Dutch experience. Although it rained, he was able to improvise the tour and we still had an excellent time. Please pay him at least €10 per person as a tip. He spent 3 hours with us and I saw some people only give him €5.

'Dam great tour. Find Sergio and take this tour as soon as you get to Amsterdam. It's a great way to orient yourself while learning lots of history and culture from a fabulous and funny guide. If you're skeptical because of the word "free," don't be. Sergio is truly appreciative of whatever you are willing to tip at the end... I only wish I could have afforded to slip him a few more Euros. This tour is a must for your Amsterdam visit, and is a truly enjoyable experience.

Funny, informative and personal. An excellent tour in which we learnt a lot about Dutch culture, Amsterdam and life in the city. The tour was covered the history of the town, some interesting facts about living in Amsterdam and was all presented with a comedic flair. The tour is entirely tip based so you can pay what you feel the tour is worth. Be wary that for a walking tour there are long periods of standing around. Wear comfortable shoes and a brolly if rain is forecast.

Far beyond average. As a history teacher and inhabitant of Amsterdam Sergio found a great way to introduce visitors to the history and characteristics of this crazy city. His mixture of interesting historical facts, funny trivia and personal experiences made the tour informative and entertaining as well.The tour was a great way to get some orientation for first-time-visitors and get introduced into the city and it's lovely inhabitants.Sergio interacted very well with each of the participants and also gives attention to children. On our next trip to Amsterdam we are most likely to join the tour again just because Sergio made us having a good time.

The very best!. We really enjoyed our free walk with Sergio! He is the best guide ever. He did it in a very cool way. It was such an entertainment for everyone in the group. We loved every moment while he was sharing those great stories behind all. Love you Sergio! Keep it up.
Loved it!. I was really cool and interesting! Sergio really gives 100% to make each tour the best tour ever! Time well spent!

Awesome Tour!. One of the best free tours I've had! Sergio is a fantastic tour guide- very personable, informative, and knowledgeable. We decided to go on a rainy day and even though his minimum number of people did not show up, he took me and my friend on the tour anyways. The free stroop wafle was just a bonus :)
Best tour ever. Went with our 14 years old daughter, the tour was interesting and funny.Sergio is one of the best tour guide I have ever had.I highly recommend it to everybody.
Fantastic tour!. Highly recommend taking this tour. Nice mix of history and modern culture and Sergio is a very passionate and entertaining guide.
Freetours. We met with sergio thanks to his yellow umbrella and it was the best thing happen to us that day! :) It was really enjoyable and funny tour

Informative, Personal and Funny. We took the tour with Sergio with our 8 year old daughter. He's very personable and unlike other free walking tours, he let the group introduced ourselves. We like it since we discover people from other countries and we get to talk among the group also. He was a Geography teacher, so he was able to introduce to us how Amsterdam raised from the sea and how it's geography map expanded. He made it personable and funny by sharing his own experience in the city. We thoroughly enjoyed his tour.

Engaging and humorous tour left us with deeper impressions of Amsterdam.. We may have happened upon Sergio's tour by accident but it was one of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam that my group talked about days after the tour was over! Our tour guide, Sergio, was engaging, intelligent and humorous and touched on a great many topics- reaching from Amsterdam's distant and near history to the everyday things you may see in Amsterdam and have wonder about. Be it the culture of tolerance, the Dutch East India Company, bicycles or cannabis- Sergio covered them all. Also, I'd hate to overlook some of the personalized stories he adds to the tour and the snacks and the use of images/pictures during the tour.

Great experience with Sergio!!! Highly recommend :). FreeDam tours must be the best guided tour in Amsterdam. Three hours filled with history, geography, interesting facts, humor. Sergio uses visual objects (pictures) to show you how Amsterdam has changed over the past years. He is very passionate about his job and has the best stories about Amsterdam. Would go again!!! Thanks Sergio for an amazing time.

Awesome tour with Sergio, he even gave us snacks!. Our Freedam Tour was everything we hoped it would be! My best friend and I are doing a tour around Europe and were in Amsterdam for only three days.
