We only had one day to do walking tours, so we chose Freedam Tours because it seemed to be the most comprehensive- and it definitely was! In just three hours, we saw mostly all the highlights of the city we wanted to see and came away knowing tons of awesome facts! Sergio was so nice too, he even brought some Amsterdam-themed snacks for our group so we could get a taste of Amsterdam! And he gave us all free postcards at the end. Such nice little personal touches :) He also had visual cards with pictures to add to his tour, which I thought was a cool touch that we hadn't gotten on any other walking tour. It definitely enhanced the experience. If you want one tour that covers it all- definitely do Freedam Tours!

Better than the others!. Loved our experience with FreeDam Tours! Firstly, Sergio is just awesome, lovely, and knowledgable. And what a handshake! The tour winds through Amsterdam - the Dam, Red Light District, University, Canal District. The points of interest range from historical to modern day cultural, even with some fun, personal anecdotes along the way. You leave feeling really well acquainted with the city. Recommend doing this on your first day! Because Sergio works for himself, he really adds something to the experience. It's the exact opposite of the "mass produced" tours. He carries pictures and maps to give some context to the history. Had a ton of personal Amsterdonian stories. He even gave us a snack mid way through! I visited Amsterdam with my brother and sister in law. We had a jam-packed few days in this amazing city. At the end we recounted our "highlights and lowlights". Sergio and FreeDam tours was the highlight for all three of us!

Most insightful experience!. A big thanks to Sergio for giving us an insightful tour, filled with interesting anecdotes and facts about Amsterdam - I learnt so much! The tour guides are very welcoming, fun and offer a great source of knowledge to give the best experience. Can't say enough good words about it - would highly recommend!

a good opportunity to find interesting things about amsterdam and dutch people. the guide's english is very good. interesting stories regarding both the city history and dutch people mentality. tips regarding good cafes and places where to eat.

Best walking tour!. It was a great experience. I fell in love with dutch people by the way Sergio talked about them and how he introduced their history. I was really impressed and I definitely recommend to all of you who will visit Amsterdam!
Terrific. Sergio has a great personality and knows how to share his vast knowledge in a captivating way. Liked the fact that he interacted with each and every person. Highly recommended!

Absolutely wonderful . Really enjoyed the tour with Sergio. He was extremely knowledgeable, interested and passionate about his job. The tour was efficient and clearly planned, he taught me a lot about the city's history in a captivating manner. 10/10 would recommend.

Best City Walking Tour- A MUST!!!. I have been on many walking tours and FreeDam tours was by far the best city tour that i have been on! I would recommend the FreeDam Tours to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Sergio was really really good and gives it his personal touch. at the end of the tour, he gave us great recommendations and advice as well as lovely surprises and snacks during the tour. I thoroughly enjoyed it. and highly recommend.

Amazing walking tour. My boyfriend and I do a walking tour in every city we visit and this was hands down the DAM Best! We randomly stumbled into Dam square hoping to link up to a walking tour and little did we know what a treat we were in for. Sergio is so charismatic and knowledgable and passionate about his work and it really shows. Thank you again!

Great tour! . I have been travelling around Europe for 3 months and have been in tours at the main cities. By far this is the best tour I have taken. The way Sergio gives the information during the tour makes it easy to remember. Awesome sense of humor and we even got a free waffle cookie which was delicious!! This is the first time I write a review here but Sergio deserves the recognition

Best walking tour I've been on. . I've been on walking tours all over Europe and UK, and this was by far the most interesting and fun. Sergio did a great job, I've already told a few people to come to this one.

Fabulous!!!. Fun, witty, informative and educational. Everything you would wish for from a city tour, without the boring stuff. Sergio's love of the city, passion and enthusiasm is addictive making this a "must do" for any visitor to Amsterdam.

Best walking tour ever!!!. My husband and I have just been on a fantastic tour with our wonderful tour guide Sergio! We are in Amsterdam on our honeymoon and this tour has been one of the highlights of our trip! Our guide was knowledgeable, engaging and very funny all of which hugely added to the enjoyment of this brilliant 2.5 hour walking tour. The small personal touches (delicious stroopwafel), souvenir postcard and restaurant recommendations really set this tour apart from any other I have been on and I can't recommend Freedam walking tours enough! Thank you Sergio! xxx

The best tour to do in Amsterdam. Usually not a fan of walking tour in city with a guide, I tried the adventure with Sergio and it has been a great experience! Fully committed, interesting and funny, it was a real pleasure to discover Amsterdam with Sergio: it is a great way to learn more about the city, its hidden corners and its anecdotes. I highly recommend this tour which is way more authentic rather than the others you can find on Dam Square :)

Must do in Amsterdam. I've never done with walking tour so I am a bit worried about it. Sergio who led the tour was absolutely brilliant! I was the only one who joined the group on my own, he kindly treated me well and explained very easily. Even though he is an Italian, I can darely admit that he may be far better than locals! He knows about Amsterdam very well and love it so much. Everyone seemed to get impressed about his passion and knowledge. In the very last minutes, I get some good info about local restaurants from them, one of them I visited today was fantastic! Thank you very much indeed and hope to join this again someday!
Miss Emma Cawley. Best tour we have been on, funny,informative and All round brilliant. Defo recommend freedam tours to anyone coming to Amsterdam

Sergio have a Dam good walking tour!. So, we woke up late this morning and as we were wandering aimlessly out of our room we happened to come across a flyer for FreeDam Tours. We spotted that it started in 10 minutes time, so, ran to the square and joined Sergio and the gang. We were so glad we did!It was insightful, entertaining and educational. Sergio's infectious passion and enthusiasm inspired us to explore the city further.Bloody loved it! (He also gave us great recommendations for bars and restaurants that so far have lived up to the hype)

A must do in Amsterdam with Sergio . We scrolled through many of the walking tours on trip advisor to the bottom and found a 5star rating for FreeDam tours. Kind of lady minute idea at breakfast, but Sergio was quick to respond and confirm our booking. We are very happy we found this tour and not some of the other larger ones in the area. Sergio was super nice and a fun guide with some great info, history and personal stories. My wife and I had a great time learning and laughing with him as we toured the city. We got to see many many great sights and also some fun insider info from Sergio's life in Amsterdam. Our tour Thursday May, 19th, ran a little long but was totally ok with us cause we were having a great time! We hope Sergio does very well with his new tour and recommend it to everyone visiting Amsterdam

Brilliant tour!. I generally don't post reviews on trip advisor but this tour was brilliant, so I created an account just to post a review. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed the tour! Sergio was a fantastic tour guide, it was great to hear some of his stories from personal experience. We learned a lot about the history of Amsterdam but also quite a bit about modern Amsterdam too! Sergio is super friendly and funny, I highly recommend anyone going to Amsterdam to pop along to this tour!

Great tour!!. Really enjoyed the free walking tour through Amsterdam. Sergio explained the history really well, which gave context to the city as a whole. My friends and I got a lot out of the tour, it wa fun and we learned a lot and I recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam!
Fun. Loved the tour. Sergio was really friendly and I loved how he talked about his own experiences and memories in the city.

THE walking tour to choose. Look for the yellow umbrella on Dam square and underneath you will find Sergio probably the best guide in Amsterdam A brilliant way to discover the city it's people it's present and it's past. His tour was informative and great fun. He asked everyone's names and made the feel of the group very inclusive A great guy and a great way to discover Amsterdam

FreeDam da DamBest . Forget the Reds and the Greens and go straight to yellow! FreeDam doesn't need to get their groups to cheer and yahoo which translates to - look at me! Sergio instead uses your valuable time to deliver a professional, personalised, knowledgeable and sometimes humorous tour of some of the more interesting high lights of his city.What better person to inform you of the facts than a local who is born and bred in Amsterdam and has grown up in the neighbourhood he is showing you.I cannot recommend Sergio enough and only wished we could have spent more time with him learning more about the phenomenon that is Amsterdam! Sincere best wishes for your expansion Sergio.Go yellow!

Best decision for our trip. We were ao lucky to have stumbled on Sergio in Dam Square! He is such a friendly, bubbly and passionate person. What made me enjoy his tour is that not only did he take us to the famous attractions, but also took us to see the less famous parts of Amsterdam, which I really appreciated. It was an amazing experience, a combination of both history and geography! We had a lot of fun! I highly recommend Segio and Freedam Tours!

A Walking Tour that covers it all.. We found Sergio under his bright yellow Umbrella in Dam Square. He was so friendly from the get go, & he made us laugh all the way through the tour. His knowledge of Amsterdam is very impressive & he delivers in such an entertaining manner you will never get bored. The time flew by so fast, he left us wanting more. Highly recommend this superb walking tour.

Amazing Free walking tour of Amsterdam.. Very fun tour of Amsterdam. Sergio was both informative and entertaining, covering many major sites in the centre of the city. 2.5 hour tour just flew by, wished it was longer. Much better than the expensive pay tours I took so far on this trip, well deserving of a generous tip. Really enjoyed his personal stories of living in the red light district. Take this tour on your first day in Amsterdam, you won't be disappointed.

Fun and Exciting. It was great fun, Sergio was very well informed about the history of the area and had great personal stories to add. We got to know about the history of the city, how it was build, the royal families etc...Amazing trip and very entertaining and interesting stories that you wouldn't have on other tours!Recommended tour.

Very Informative and Fun tour around Amsterdam. Had lots of fun and got to learn new facts about the history of Amsterdam. Highly recommend it. The tour is also not so crowded which is also a big plus to get to listen to the guide better.
recommendable tour. Very nice tour, which was funny and interesting at the same time. The guide also added some personal stories.

Best tour ever! . Amazing trip and very entertaining and interesting stories that you wouldn't have on other tours! I can highly recommend Sergio! He knows a lot about the history and the city and at the same time it was a lot fun! Thanks a lot and good luck with all your projects!
Great tour.... It was great fun, Sergio was very well informed about the history of the area and had great personal stories to add. It made the town come alive. Perfect intro to Amsterdam

Got a better picture of Amsterdam with Sorjeo - an insightful man. If you get a chance to take the free tour, choose the YELLOW UMBRELLAS. After my experience with free walking tours in some European cities, I decided to take this trip and it made me happy. I never knew anything about Dutch people except for the trading abilities they had and the being the founder of East India company. This trip will blow your mind about Amsterdam. This places is miraculous and definitely worth to know the history behind all the free thinking prevailing in the city. The story could have not been told better. Sorjeo (The guy in the picture with a lanyard), a local and a Geographia graduate had made this trip memorable for me and had given me reasons to visit this city again. And I will. You may listen to his graduate life stories a bit during some of the chapters of the tour, but this guy has stuff to keep you engaged. If you get a chance to take this tour, you'll enjoy it.

Fascinating tour with a funny, insightful guide!. I've been on many free walking tours and Sergio's was easily one of the best. He's a super friendly, funny and knowledgeable person with tons of personal anecdotes to share about life in Amsterdam. The tour was a really great mix of history, culture and funny stories about the city. At 2.5 hours it was quite long, but I learned so much and had such a good time that the time passed very quickly. It was a great afternoon and really set the tone for the rest of my visit to Amsterdam. Thanks so much, Sergio!
Great tour, Lots to learn. Went on the freedam tour today the 7th of May. I learnt a lot from the tour and Sergio has a great amount of knowledge of Amsterdam. I strongly advise

Very knowledge, know better about Amsterdam. I only have one full day in Amsterdam, not enough time to explore either museums. Therefore, decided to follow this free guided tour! It was really great, Sergio is knowledgeable and very well prepared, I have learned a lot of the geography and history of Amsterdam and the Netherlands! It is a great start point if you just arrived this city! Only after you know a little bit history of the city, you can understand it better.

Great tour, fun afternoon. Had a wonderful walking tour, lots of fun stories and great information, and because it's fairly new the groups were smaller than the huge tours Sandemans and others were putting on. Sergio was brilliantly knowledgeable and took us through the whole history of Amsterdam while walking through lovely parts of the city. Highly recommended.

Very enjoyable. Been on a couple of walking tours before in other cities but this was easily the most educational and enjoyable. We learnt so much more than would have bee possible on a more formal tour or from any guide book.

Free Dam walk with Sergio. Great walk with Sergio. With his excellent sense of humour & endless knowledge he filled our heads with fascinating facts & stories of the history of Amsterdam. Highly recommended.
Best tour I've ever attended. My friends and I attended this tour - truly loved! Very interesting, personal, funny and entertaining. #1 thing to do when you arrive to Amsterdam! :)

Great experience. Really cool visit. Sergio is a great tour guide. The complete tour last 2 hours and a half. I thought at the beginning that a lot of walking was involved, but suprisingly everything is close nearby and there are many stops where Sergio tells some great stories about Amsterdam.We where a small group of 5 persons and everyone enjoyed it really much.

Don't look for another tour, this is the one!. Sergio was really fun and I strongly recommend his walking tour! You get insights on the city and everything seems really interesting when explained by Sergio! I strongly recommand this to anyone visiting Amsterdam!

Great walking tour. My mom and brother and I did Sergio's walking tour. It was awesome! We learned a great deal about Amsterdam and its history. It was also entertaining and funny at the same time. Would highly recommend!

Very enjoyable . Really enjoyed Sergio's walking tour. Sergio is clearly very passionate about his job and Amsterdam. Really gave me a feel for the city and I will definitely be recommended it to friends visiting Amsterdam. Good job Sergio keep going!

DAMn good walking tour around Amsterdam. I was walking alone around the city when i stumbled upon Sergio's yellow umbrella that says 'DAM free walking tour'. Being an almost-broke student and alone, i decided to give it a go. Needless to say, i was not disappointed! Really good mix of culture, history and a bit of personal stories, which i thought was really interesting to give you insight into the local's culture. Later when i went for a €16 canal cruise, the audio guide pretty much told us the same stories (but yknow, what are stories without the human touch). I was taken care of by Sergio and the different people from various nationalities i met in the group (they constantly look around for me bcs i was too busy taking pictures i almost got ran over by the crazy Amsterdam bicycle ghostriders). Pretty impressive considering the fact that he just started doing the tour quite recently. I'd say that the standard is pretty much the same, if not better, compared to other free tours that i've joined in other cities. Overall, a really good experience and intoduction to this lovely city.

Great tour! . Sergio was knowledgable, friendly, unhurried, and quite fun! Strongly recommend his walking tour to give a 2-hour overview of the city and its history. Sergio adds a bit of personal experience in Amsterdam and that's insightful.

Friendly guide and interesting tour. Our guide Sergio was charming and clearly knew the city well, definitely worth doing to get to know history, culture and lay-out of Amsterdam! Tour is around two hours long but it doesn't drag by, there's enough sights and stops to keep you interested the whole way through!

Loved this tour!. Sergio was a funny and informative! No part of the tour felt rushed and it was clear he knew the city and its history very well. He even gave me advice of where to eat after. I highly recommend this tour!

FANTASTIC!. Thought a walking tour of Amsterdam would be a good start to our stay here. It was perfect! Sergio was a delightful, informative, interesting and amusing guide and his approach was informal and friendly. So pleased we selected a really small walking tour, just 5 of us, as it meant Sergio tailored the tour to us. Loads of really interesting info mixed in with personal stories. Well done Sergio!

Amazing and informative. Spent three hours walking around Amsterdam with Sergio. I learnt a lot about the history of Amsterdam and saw parts of the city I would not have seen otherwise. Nothing is too much trouble, Sergio is very knowledgeable and very passionate about his job and the subject and this comes across in abundance when he takes you on the tour. The tour was due to last 2 1/2 hours but went on for 3 because he showed us a few other places. I would definitely recommend this over the other walking tours. Fantastic!

Best walking tour ever.. I would say this tour was the the best tour I have experienced. I usually leave tours early because I get bored with too much detail and not enough topical interest but Sergio has got this tour to perfection. The time flew by and as the group was fairly small there was plenty of interaction and laughter along the way. it was the highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. Thank you Sergio, I wish you every success, you deserve it.

Fantastic. Fantastic tour - Sergio gave us history, culture and his own experiences of living in Amsterdam all his life. The tour wasn't overwhelming on any of these facets yet provided all that was needed for an excellent tour and start to our trip to Amsterdam. Thank you Sergio!

Dam good Tour!. Sergio does a great job on this tour. He manages to strike a healthy balance of the historical, cultural, social and controversial aspects of the City of Amsterdam. He truly loves his city and is able to convey that to his group throughout the tour. We had one day to "do" the city and this was the best way to immerse ourselves in its' magic. Thanks again for a fabulous tour.

Great walking tour. FreeDam Tours was different from other walking tours I've made by mixing the city's history with personal stories from the guide, Sergio. The tour was great even though the weather was bad. It was great to understand the origin of Amsterdam's liberal atmosphere and receive nice touristic tips.

Fantastic way to experience Amsterdam!. Sergio is super knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam. He presents his information in a unique and interesting way. Our tour ended up having only two people, and he showed us around like we were old friends. I cannot recommend this tour enough.

Informative and fun. Although it was cold and rainy yesterday, Sergio (the guide) managed to make time fly buy. So many interesting historical information mixed up with some hilarious personal anecdotes, it was amazing. The Group was quite small so we were able to mix and mingle ;) All in all it was well worth your time!

Entertaining & informative walking tour. Highly knowledgeable, entertaining and charismatic guide shows you around the heart of Amsterdam. A mixture of cultural, historical and personal stories ensure the 2.5 hour tour goes quickly. Would highly recommend to all.

FreeDam Tour with the best guy in Amsterdam!!!! . Despite the rain pouring weather, Sergio gave us an excellent tour around the city of Amsterdam in 2.5 hrs. He knows the city and its history really well. It was an informative tour with the city's background and some personal touches as well. We really enjoyed the time we spent walking around with him and laughed at everyone of his jokes. We highly recommend this tour for your trip.

Free Tour with Sergio. Great guide! We had a tour with a small group today. Sergio showed us some of the main attractions in a 2,5h tour. It was very interesting how he connected the history of Amsterdam to modern facts. He also had quite a few stories to tell about his personal experinces, since he lives in Amsterdam. Try it!

Sergio and his tours are AMAZING!!!. It’s hard to explain how amazing Sergio is until AFTER you experience his tour in Amsterdam. Sergio left us speechless with his enthusiasm, amazing knowledge and passion for the city of Amsterdam… we couldn’t believe such a quality tour was FREE! Sergio told the tales of Amsterdam and the entire group was mesmerised by the beauty around them followed by Sergio’s hilarious and fun way of presenting the city to us. Our trip would not have been the same without having Sergio as our guide. Truly highly recommended!!

Great Way to spend 3 hours in Amsterdam.. Our group loved this tour, Terry our guide is a natural story teller. He showed us parts of Amsterdam that we would never have discovered without him and his inside knowledge brought the city alive, the only disappointing part of this tour was when it ended. Terry even gave us directions to last wooden pub in Amsterdam which turned out to be a great place for a post tour beer.

Wow tours Amsterdam. Loved the tour! Terry was excellent! We didn't want the tour to end. Highly recommend if you want an informative, engaging and concise tour of Amsterdam. A little over three hours and Terry was generous with his time. Would definitely do again.

Walking tour - 30 Aug 2016. We took a Walking tour with Terry O'Leary our guide and owner of Wow Tours. We were only 4 people in total on that day and Terry was amazing in terms of information provided, professionalism, attentiveness and humor. We visited a lot of places including the Rembrandt's Guild, Begijnhof courtyard with its hidden church, the Amsterdam Museum, red light district, and many other places. During the tour there is also a stop at a coffee shop and the tour length is around 3 hours time.Very interesting and this tour is a must.

Great walking tour of Amsterdam before our cruise,. Terry was great! He helped us get to the port and check our bags, then led us of on a walking tour of Amsterdam. Very informative, knowledgeable, with a good dose of humor. Excellent customer service and happy to build the tour around our time and interests. This is a great way to spend the day between landing at the airport and sailing. Highly recommended.

Want the best walking tour in Amsterdam?. Terry O'Leary, Owner/Main Guide, will give you the most wonderful walking tour of Amsterdam! If you want a knowledgable, well informed but humorous guide - Terry knows it all and makes it fun to see Amsterdam at a delightful pace!

Excellent!. Terry gave us an excellent tour! Everything was very interesting. He obviously knows a lot, but was able to relate such information in an engaging manner. Conditions were not ideal. It rained throughout the afternoon, but he remained upbeat and positive, and recognizing that we were tired of wandering through the rain, he added some indoor stops. One of our party was in a wheelchair and he was great in making sure that we could access everything and frequently checked-in to make sure everything was going fine. I have gone on a lot of walking tours and am fairly critical, but I have nothing but positive recommendations.

Best Ever Tour Guide Award. I've been on more than 12 walking tours in New York and London and the Amsterdam Walking Tour with Terry was by far the best!!! A guide can really make or break the experience and in this case, Terry nailed it. Not only extremely knowledgeable, Terry was clear, loud and funny in his delivery of an engaging story woven from the the first Dutch settlers through WWII and the present. He kept our small group moving and grooving despite some rain and had a perfect mix of historical relevance with contemporary times. Highlights for me: Rembrandt's Guild, giant wooden animatronics from the Middle Ages and15th century buildings along our route one would otherwise walk right by-- without giving too much away, this tour has something for everyone! Extremely high value for the cost and definitely an awesome way to spend a morning!!

Great tour!. I have to say this was one of the most informative, funny and interesting walking tours I have taken. The guide is very friendly, open for conversation and questions and knows so much about the city of Amsterdam that you just can't find in any book guide. It lasted for a little bit over three hours including a coffee break, the group was small which made it really easy to hear anything that the guide was saying. All in all a great experience.

Small group walking tour. "A bit of the Irish" A delightful tour in spite of the rain.This tour was full of history, currents facts and architectural details.One of the best city tours we have taken.A 5 star experience.L Q

Touch of the Irish walking tour guide. We did the 3 hour walking tour of Amsterdam through the red light district, old church and ending near Anne Frank's old digs. Terry O'Leary, 11 years removed from Cork, Ireland and now with three babes of his own, lead us on an informative, interesting and very humorous tour of one section of Amsterdam. It is without question Terry knew his stuff but the presentation interlaced with Irish witticisms made the time fly by. I learned more about the history of Europe in that short time than my sophomore year in high school.Never dull, never strenuous but alway entertaining don't hesitate to have Terry O'Leary show you around.

WOW Amserdam city tour. A friend and I took this tour In April. Really a very good "overview". I think there were 6 of us. Very nice, manageable size tour. Tour ended very close to the Anne Frank House which was great because we wanted to do that on our own. I read about a place before I travel there, but I also take a tour because there is always so much to learn, this was fun, and enjoyable, I do recommend it.

Great Guide !. Terry met us at our hotel on our first day in Amsterdam, and treated us to a wonderful 4 hour ramble around the city. He is not only knowledgeable about the city and its history, but could engage with us on general history of the Netherlands and the rest of Europe.We not only saw the historic sites, but also the best Belgian Fry stand. I had used Terry as a guide for some of my clients previously, and based on their rave reviews of their tours I engaged him for myself this spring, as well as recommending him to several other sets of friends. And every single review that I have gotten is that he is a wonderful guide, full of Irish charm and wit, but also so very knowledgeable. I look forward to continuing to work with Terry, as I know that he will provide my clients with the best guided experience in Amsterdam.

Well worth the time and money.. We had been to Amsterdam a number of times and had never done a walking tour. We had visited all the typical sights but realized there was so much more to learn historically so we decided to book a walking tour. Based on reviews and availability (we needed to book the tour on a Sunday) we choose WOW tours. We took the tour at the end of Nov. on a rainy day. Not a time when there is a lot of demand for walking tours so we were lucky enough to have the tour and Terry to ourselves. Terry was very laid back and extremely informative. He was happy to answer all our questions and knew a lot about the city. When it started raining a lot we ducked into a cafe, had tea and talked more about his life and what it is like raising a family in the Netherlands and coming from another country. He is originally from Ireland. It was fascinating to learn his perspective. Terry is a professionally storyteller/actor so is able to talk in a way that was very entertaining as well as interesting. I would highly recommend this tour. Fun to learn more about the city with each visit! Terry is a great guy and feel luck we were able to spend an afternoon with him in Amsterdam.

Tons of great information!. Terry did a fantastic job of helping us learn so much more about Amsterdam than we'd ever get from a museum or guidebook. This was our first major walking tour ever, and we will be looking to do more of these in the future. Terry's walking tour was a recommendation from another guest at our hotel, and it was spot on! I just wish he did them in other major cities across Europe.

walking tour of Amsterdam July 2016. My girlfriend and I recently stayed in Amsterdam for a few days. We did a number of tours, but one that truly stuck out was Wow Tours. Terry was incredible! He was so funny and interesting when discussing the history of the city. I felt like I learned so much in such a short amount of time. He describes himself as a storyteller and that is exactly what he is. Great tour with a coffee/smoothie break. He keeps the groups small so it can be more of a personal experience, which we loved (there were about 8 of us in total). I would strongly recommend this tour!

Great tour with Terry. As a lot of other reviews, we found this to be one of the best city tours we have done. Terry takes you on a relaxed tour of the city pointing out lots of things you would miss by just reading a guide book.

Tour of Amsterdam June 2016. I would recomend that you do this amazing tour as soon as you reach this amazing city. This tour was first class, funny informative and always entertaining. Terry got the balance just right, between information and fun, is easy to listen to, a great story teller. My wife and I where celabrating our 20th wedding aniversary and this tour is suitable for couples and family's. Thanks so much, we had such a great time!

Excellent walking tour of Amsterdam and RLD. What a fantastic experience. Terry O'Leary best guide for learning about Central Amsterdam. He gives just the right amount of history, so you can understand the city and its culture. We (3 couples from USA) opted for a private walking tour. Wasn't disappointed. He is was very much aware of his group at all times. As we also did tour of RLD with him. Since it rained the day we were doing the walking tour, and we had the RLD schedule for that same evening. He suggested maybe we would like to rearrange schedule and do RLD another day. We did and the weather was better. Suggest you take RLD tour with Terry...friends did it on their own...and in no way did they have the same experience...we felt safe at all times. Also did candlelight canal tour with Rederij Kooij...another great way to see Amsterdam

Do this tour as soon as you arrive. We did this tour with Terry on a lovely sunny day in May and I have to say we were delighted we chose this tour. We are 4 Irish sisters and discovered our guide was also Irish. This added to the fun and meant Terry could speak faster than normal and didn't have to repeat himself too much. Don't worry that this is not his native town, he has really done his research. He managed to pack a lot into the 3 hours but it was done at a lovely pace and he managed to keep our interest the whole time. I recommend you do this tour early in your visit as it gives you a great appreciation of this lovely city. Terry is a one man operator and you can be sure you are going to get a high quality tour. Do yourself a favour and book this tour. You won't be sorry

Incredible day with an authentic Irish Storyteller. When your guides name is Terry O'Leary, you know you are in for a treat! Honestly, this is one of the best tours we have ever taken! We covered the whole city of Amsterdam and learned more than this feeble mind could take in! He is a fantastic storyteller! We learned so much and in a fun and engaging way! We had a stop at a lovely coffee house (not shop - you will learn the difference!) for a nice break in the middle! I highly recommend this tour to start your stay in Amsterdam!!

Amazing tour!. We signed up for Terry's tour based off of a recommendation from a family member, and could not be more happy that we did. Terry was simply amazing! It was such a cold and windy day for our tour, but he still made it super enjoyable. A few people didn't show up for the tour, so it ended up being nice and intimate and I feel like we got to ask more questions and learn a little bit more than we would have with a bigger group. Terry took us to a local coffee and tea shop, and we tried some wonderful mint tea just like the locals drink. I didn't know much about Amsterdam before we came, so everything we saw and learned was mind blowing for me! Terry really knows his history and is super knowledgable. We felt like we were hanging out with an old friend all day. I highly recommend making this tour part of your trip! You will not be disappointed one bit!

Super nice. Terry for president. Super nice tour in Amsterdam, value in every euro. Storys thats engage the hole grope, perfect tempo and rout. Right size of the group. Can recomend it as the best tour in Amsterdam.
Very entertaining and enjoyable tour. Three hour walking tour of Amsterdam. Terry was very knowledgeable about the city and provided a humorous slant on the history of the city. Loved the tour.

Tour of Amsterdam. Excellent! Our tour guide was extremely knowledgable, well organized, thoughtful with a great sense of humor!Highly recommend for anyone looking to get a good historical understanding of the city.

Three hours well spent. Terry is well-informed, friendly, witty and very interesting indeed. Three hours on a chilly spring morning? Not a problem - he took care of us, found sheltered spots and a welcome coffee break. We saw corners of the city we'd never have found, learned a lot about its history, buildings and people and heard some stories told by a man who obviously loves what he does and works hard at it. A great way to get to know Amsterdam. Tip - wear comfy shoes and remember you'll be out of doors all morning . Camera is a must.

Enjoyable way to see Amsterdam. Enjoyed a thoroughly interesting walking tour with Terry in Amsterdam. He had loads of interesting facts and made the whole experience come to life for us. We booked a 10am tour which was perfect as it was less busy than later in the day. Would recommend a walking tour to get a great feel of the city and would highly recommend Terry as the guide of choice if you are considering a tour such as this

Tour of Amsterdam including Red Light District. We really enjoyed the tour with Terry he was very knowledgeable and funny. I would definitely recommend this 3 hour incite into the history of Amsterdam.

Friendly personal tour. We thoroughly enjoyed our walk around Amsterdam. Terry is a natural story teller who combines history, anecdotes, humour and knowledge in a very entertaining and engaging way. This was a great way to be introduced to the city which our small group enjoyed. I also had an energetic and curious 5 year old with me, with whom Terry was also a hit !

Red Light made fun and interesting. Met Terry for an evening walking tour on a night of monsoon rain in Amsterdam. It didn't deter him a bit and even though we started out less enthusiastic about the night than he did we wound up having a wonderful time! Terry is true pro and his sense of humour and knowledge of the area made it an unforgettable experience.

Highly Recommended. We met Terry at Dam square. He is very knowledgeable and witty. We learned a lot about the city and its history. Loved that the group is small. The 3 hours went very fast. We had a coffee break on way. Would highly recommend this tour if you want a more personable experience.

Choose only 'ONE' tour.......... I contacted Terry after reading the TripAdvisor reviews on here and was not disappointed in any way. The email communication was spot on and he met us earlier than expected to make us feel welcome before the tour commenced. Unfortunately for all of us it was a bitterly cold day but Terry had ways of keeping us alert and focused, rather than worrying about the freezing fog and spiteful wind. We covered a lot of areas in the three hour tour, with Terry having a vast knowledge of history and covered plenty of informative topics. We stopped for a coffee, halfway round and got some feeling back in our fingers, after which time we were back on the roads thirsty for more sights. I cannot recommend this tour enough!!! We had an amazing time!!!

Amsterdam walking Tour. We had a great time during our Amsterdam walking tour. WOW tours were very easy to book with and they were very organized and reliable. Our guide, Terry, knew a lot about the city and gave us great insight into the history and everyday life of the locals. In the meantime was also very kind and funny making it an experience to remember!

Interesting and Entertaining!. Terry was entertaining and knowledgeable and this was a great way to see the highlights of Amsterdam. Love the small group size which keeps it more personal. Price is right and definitely recommend.

Amsterdam tour with the experts, informative, fun and good value.. WOW tours were recommended by a friend. The experience lived up to the promise. Our guide was knowledgable, friendly and gave us a rewarding and memorable experience (despite the rain). I will recommend WOW Tours to my friends and anyone else interested in a great tour of Amsterdam.

WOW walking tour was WOW. On a cold, wet day this walking tour was the highlight of the day, our tour guide was amazing with his stories and the history of the city! He took very good care of us and kept us all together as it was very crowded that day walking around.  If you are looking for a walking tour of the city, by all means book early as he only does small groups. I think we had 10 in our group so it was easy to hear what our guide had to say! Cheers and gave a great day!

Walking tour of Amsterdam. Our walking tour with Terry was really wonderful. He is extremely knowledgeable and presents things in an easy to listen to way for both adults and teenagers. We really saw everything including a walk through the red light district. We highly recommend this private tour. Stephanie and family

Informative Historical tour. Very friendly and humorous guide with with little gems of detail about some of the fascinating people that lived in this old city. Next time we're back in Amsterdam we will for sure go along on one of Terry's quirky tours !

Enjoyable walking tour.. We took Terry's WOW walking tour on our first morning in Amsterdam and it was a great introduction to the city. Terry was good company and very knowledgeable so the tour gave us lots of tips and ideas on what to see and do during our stay. Highly recommended.

Amsterdam, a very walkable city, and a guided tour is a great way to see and hear insiders view of the city.. WOW Tours, led by Terry O'Leary (yes an Irishman), gave a great walking tour, with sites not seen if unaccompanied, and stories not available in the written tour guides. Affable, friendly, easy to hear.

New Year Tour. We joined Terry on 30/12/2015 for a great tour from start to finish, Terry was informative but kept the style lighthearted throughout.I would definitely recommend WOW Tours a great way to see and learn about Amsterdam.

Fantastic tour guide with a great sense of humour. Had a great time, first day in Amsterdam. Definitely recommend this tour company. Terry is an extremely knowledgeable guy on the history of Amsterdam with a great sense of humour. This is a must for all new to the city.

Well Done!. I have taken a lot of walking tours in my 30 years of solo travel and this tour is among the very best. Terry is knowledgeable, invites questions, listens closely. Respectful of all in our group. Well organized, open (and fun, when appropriate) delivery style. Easy to understand, but happy to clarify points. Knows history, culture and stays on top of recent news. We covered a lot of ground and I learned so much in the 3 hours, but never felt rushed. Terry gets it right.

A great walking tour around Amsterdam ..... Terry was both knowledgeable and highly entertaining ..... All in all a very enjoyable three hours that helped us get a better understanding of Amsterdam and its history. Recommended.

Want to learn about Amsterdam? Go to WOW Tours. Never been to Amsterdam before; wanted to know as much as possible in as short a a time as possible and Terry delivers just that. Friendly, listens carefully to questions, great storyteller, passionate about the City- everything you want in a guide.

Fantastic . This was our first visit to Amsterdam and the walking tour was a great way to find out about the place. Terry was a wealth of knowledge and a excellent guide. Best 3 hour tour ever, he was full of humour and made the tour fun.

A great start to our holiday. M and I were visiting Amsterdam for the first time and have always found walking tours to be a good way to find your feet in a new place, so we booked a tour with Terry before we left home.There was just us and one other couple, and so we walked around the city more like you would with a friend than a big tour group. Terry has lived in the city for ten years and has obviously learnt a lot about the city and the Netherlands in general. We found the tour very informative and fun too as Terry has typical Irish storytelling skills. The tour was just over three hours and this included a short break in a café. I think this was just right - long enough to cover most of the city's main sights but not too overwhelming. A great introduction to Amsterdam!

Best 3 Hour Tour. If you want a great 3 hour walking tour of Amsterdam, Terry is your guide. His tour is comprehensive, fun to experience, and a wealth of Dutch history, culture, and humor. You don't waste any time on your small group tour; ours comprised 4 people. We experienced as much as you can in the center of A'dam walking about. From talk about the Royalty, the Red Light District (in daytime), the canals, the Churches, and the views, Terry's tour is the best you can invest your time and money. Choose wisely travelers.

Best walking tour in Amsterdam . Intimate tour of Amsterdam, with the excellent tour guide Terry. He has a wealth of information on all the sights, along with a broad knowledge of the history of the city as well as its practices of tolerance. I highly recommend Wow tours.
Great tour. Terry is a gentleman. The tour was very interesting and informative and Terry was very knowledgeable. Took us to sites we never would have found ourselves. Great value for money

Amsterdam with an Irish brogue!. My wife is 100% Irish, so Terry’s brogue and wit made for an immediate bond. We visited Amsterdam for 7 days and, during our first 3 days, we took 2 tours with Terry: The Story of Amsterdam (about 10 people) and The Redlight Tour (private tour). Terry gave us a great overview of historic Amsterdam and really helped us to understand the tolerant mindset of its inhabitants. And on our visit to the Redlight District, much to the surprise of these two old-timers (we’re both in our 70’s), we learned that there’s still more to learn!! Thanks Terry!Don and Sharon

you owe to yourself to take this tour!!!. Even if you have read the travel guides to Amsterdam, these three hours with Terry from WOW Productions will enhance your knowledge of Amsterdam's history and culture.Terry is knowledgable, personable, and has a great sense of humour. Our group had three kids and he was very accommodating in keeping them interested and in de-emphasing some of the more adult themes. Book it now!!

Walking Tour. Four years ago my son and I had this tour with Terry, and this year (2015) I said I wished I could Terry again since I brought the whole family. Well my wish came through, Terry remembered my son and I. I noticed that the tour was just a little different then the last one, which was a good thing not seeing the same thing twice. I could not have asked for a # 1 Quality tour, the info and points of interest was 1st class and I would highly recommend this tour (WOWTOURS) to anyone who is visiting Amsterdam, you will not be making a mistake.

New residents get to know Amsterdam with a great story teller. Our parent teacher organisation from a local international school use this walking tour twice a year. New parents to the school,do trips such as this with the PTO to help settle in to their new environment. We are expats from all over the world who happen to now be residing here. We always receive great feedback from our participants. Comments such as informative and funny are typical. Terry is a great tour guide and makes it a fantastic day out

Very Good tour of Amsterdam. My husband and I try and do walking tours wherever we go. We especially enjoyed our walking tour of Amsterdam with Terry. We had been in Amsterdam a few days at that point, so in a way it was much more interesting as it gave us a different insight into places we had already walked on our own.

Terry gets it right. My husband and I recently spent a drizzly Amsterdam afternoon with Terry and very much enjoyed ourselves. Terry is well informed, entertaining and knowledgeable-exactly what we hope for in a guide. We found his tour exceptional and recommend him without reservation.

Great Walking Tour Of Amsterdam. Terry's tour was very informative and entertaining. Lots of interesting and quirky information provided by someone who is now a local and something of an insider, but has also spent a lot of time outside the Netherlands. We enjoyed the Irish wit. Excellent value.

Amsterdam Walking Tour. Just completed a walking tour of Amsterdam with WOW Tours. Terry, the guide and owner of the company, was knowledgeable and very engaging. I booked this tour as an introduction to Amsterdam to my teenage son and it was indeed informative and entertaining. I highly recommend this Amsterdam Walk, particularly if it your first time in the city. The itinerary was enough to give you good bearings of the city and Terry is a great chap, providing snippets of valuable background information of the various sights and places.
Humorous and Informative Walking Tour. Terry was a very enthusiastic guide both friendly and knowledgable delivering his tour with much Irish cheer.
Enthusiastic Irishman in Amsterdam. Informative, fun and entertaining guide. Certainly knew his history. Spoke a little quickly, great for English speakers.
Walking Tours. Terry took us on a walking tour of the city - brilliant! We all really enjoyed the tour, Terry was very informative but the tour was relaxed and fun.

Great orientation to the city. Our tour was led by Terry O'Leary who is the owner and main guide. You need to be able to handle about 2-3 hours of walking and you have to be able to manuever the cobblestones that line the streets and the sidewalks. Mr. O'Leary gave us a great orientation to this city. There was an opportunity to stop and use a rest room and/or purchase coffee, water or other beverages. We did a lot of walking but it was enjoyable and very enlightening.

Walking Tour of Amsterdam. We booked this tour with Terry based on the glowing Trip Advisor reviews and we were not disappointed! Terry was amazing in his knowledge of Amsterdam, the history, the politics, the social scene, the economy etc.. He was patient, considerate, funny and never paid attention to the clock. His love of his adopted city was clear and his genuineness was so appealing to all of us. We learned so much that afternoon....we were physically and mentally exhausted when we got back to our hotel but very grateful to Terry for the most wonderful day we could have imagined. We knew we only had a few days in Amsterdam and we wanted to experience as much as we could in that timeframe and Terry was instrumental in helping us do that. I am sure people spend 2 weeks in Amsterdam and not learn as much as we did in one long afternoon. We highly suggest that anyone visiting Amsterdam book a tour with Terry.

Great Day in Amsterdam. I've been to Amsterdam many times and walked it, boated the canals and been to many restaurants and bars, but Terry still took me to a number of places I have never been! Also gave a lot of insight into Amsterdam I wasn't aware of.Thanks Terry will definitely recommend your tour to future visitors.

Fun walking tour. Great walking tour of Amsterdam. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and showed us a good sampling of the city as well as offering some good tales. Our 20 year old son enjoyed it very much. The only negative was it was very hot but that is very uncommon. We followed many of his suggestions for our 2 1/2 day stay and had a great trip.

Fabulous!!. My family had the pleasure of joining Terry for a walking tour of Amsterdam this morning. Terry was a joy and made the city come alive for us. He was very funny and entertaining. He seemed to really enjoy sharing his adopted city with us. It rained on us for the majority of the tour, and we still had a great time. The was primarily because of Terry's knowledge and passion for the city. Thank you very much, Terry!

Best tour in Amsterdam!!!. I was recommended this tour by a family member and am so grateful she did! Terry is a great tour guide! We had the best time and learned a lot. He is well versed on the ins and outs of what goes on in Amsterdam. He is very informative with a great sense of humor. If I were to go back to Amsterdam, I would definitely look into taking this tour again or trying a different one he has to offer!He stops for a coffee break half way through the tour which is a nice break to rest your legs, take a bathroom break and chat about any and everything. We also had some travel issues and Terry was very accommodating and allowed us to actually take our tour on a different day as our flights caused us to miss our scheduled time.I would highly recommend this tour to anybody that has the opportunity to partake!
Great energy and humor. That was a great walking tour along Rembrandt's highlights. We loved Terry's knowledge, accent and humor!

The Best Way to Start Your Tour of Amsterdam!. I spent quite some time going over reviews online and am very happy to say I chose WOW tours and am so glad that I did. Terry didn't lead the group the day I went-instead I had a lady from El Paso, Texas (I feel so bad I'm blanking on her name right now). She was absolutely wonderful! She knew so much about the city and the rich history and had endless stories to share. We wandered around for about 3 1/2 hours, stopping for a quick coffee during a short rain storm, and saw so much. I learned quite a bit and had a great time in doing so. I would highly recommend booking this tour! One tip-the group met right in front of the WWII memorial statue. It's a small group and can be a little tricky to find so I just asked a larger tour group's guide and they helped me find my group. Just ask around if you can't find them! Supposedly Terry is a tall Irish man and is easy to spot!

Great small walking tour. My friend and I joined Terry's small 10 AM walking tour, which goes through the historic area, including the red light district. You meet at the National Monument and end around 1:30 at the Ann Frank house. The size is small, so you can hear everything and get any questions in. The cost of 30€/person is great for all the information you get. Terry has an affable personality and his tour is very interesting. At the halfway point there is a stop at a coffee shop to get a coffee, snack and/or bathroom break. Definitely recommend.
Great tour guide with humor. Terry was great as a tour guide, and did a specialized tour for my group. Amazing fun, and hilerious up to date jokes. Great experience and worth your money

Fantastic insight to one of AMS most famous residents. We thoroughly enjoyed Terry's Rembrandt tour. We live in Amsterdam and he was able to provide lots of interesting stories and facts on the artist's life. We will recommend his tours to our visiting friends/family and suspect we will also attend one or two of his others tour.
Great Tour. Glad that I decided to do this tour. Terry was a great guide, and had a lot of great information about the city throughout its very interesting history.

Another Side of Amsterdam. Terry was a great Tour Guide, taking us through different sites of the center of the city and having different stories about almost every street. The tour seemed to be as if a friend was walking with you while telling you the innermost details about the place.

WOW tours Historic Center. We took the walking tour with Terry and it was the perfect way to begin our visit in Amsterdam. As Terry showed us around, he told stories which made me remember the history and the sights so much better. It was a small group tour so you did not feel conspicuous either. I really liked the small group tour and he was very informative!
Great Tour!!. Terry was the best tour guide!! Our walking tour of Amsterdam was beyond great. He was very informative and we loved the tour.

Walking Tour of Amsterdam (incl. Red Light District Tour). This was such a great way to see the sights of Amsterdam! Terry was a great tour guide, knew loads of stuff about Amsterdam and its people and was very respectful of the Red Light culture Amsterdam is now famous for. If you want to really learn about Amsterdam, its history and its secrets, Terry is the best guide to book with - he is engaging and entertaining and you'll only want more once the tour wraps up. Thanks for a fantastic tour Terry!

Top Trump. Terry's tour scores a perfect 10. He's a natural and gifted story teller as passionate now as he was a decade ago. With a film directors eye for detail & a curators' editing flair, Terry has crafted a winning formula which works. My son & I loved the tour in spite of a rainy Sunday. Terry appeared to have the weather under control courtesy of real time weather app updates. A true oracle. Genius.

Don't leave Amsterdam before you take this tour!!. Informative and interesting tour. Nice to learn little facts that you would never know without this tour. Terry has a fun sense of humor. Just do it!!

Great walking tour!. We (family if four) had a wonderful tour of Amsterdam with Terry. He is so well informed about this wonderful city. He brings the history to life in a fun and engaging way. We loved it and would recommend it 100%. Do yourself a favour, do the WOW tour.

Fun and informative . I took the tour in June on a stop over in Amsterdam. Terry was a great host and the 3 hours flew by with ease. I would thoroughly recommend taking this tour with Terry. His jovial manner combined with his detailed historic knowledge of the city makes this not only super interesting but fun also.

Worth the Time in Amsterdam!. Terry is a very fun and informative tour guide! We were a small group so getting around was easy. We saw so much and got a great orientation of the city from Rembrandt to the Red lights. He answered everything we could come up with - great knowledge of the city! Would highly recommend!

A walking encyclopedia. This was our first trip to Amsterdam and I knew very little about the place so after reading a few reviews on Terry's walking tour I thought it might be a good start. How right everyone was...Terry was a wealth of information - not only on the city but on associated history. Terry was as interested in us, his clients, as we were in his tour which made it feel a bit more special. It was certainly the highlight of our trip and I'll be recommending him the next time someone tells me they'ye goong to Amsterdam. "Thanks for the craic Terry".

Thre-hour walking tour. We were in a group of 10, a manageable number. The tour touched all the essential bases. The guide, Terry O'Leary was excellent. He was knowledgeable and personable. We felt we got a good grasp of the city and its personality. I would recommend Terry without reservation.

Interesting Amsterdam!. We had a small group of 8, all of us having similar interests so it worked really well. Terry is friendly, knowledgable about the City and provides a non-Dutch perspective. The 3 hours flew by. Would definitely recommend him.

Really great tour. Terry was great. He gave a local's knowledge of things and really made an attempt to tailor the information to wherever we from. He is very engaging and friendly. We enjoyed it very much, but so did our two teenagers, which is saying something.Highly recommend this tour, especially at the beginning of your stay in order to get the lay of the land. It's a 2.5 hour tour or so, but doesn't feel like it. He provides a bathroom / coffee break mid-way.

Informative walking tour . We were a group of 10 people from all our world's continents. All were English speaking. Terry our guide was from Ireland. He was informative and had great knowledge of the Dutch history. The only drawback was his Irish accent. My husband and I are from Norway and had to concentrate really hard to understand what he said.

Should be called Terry's Terrific Tour. Booked this trip based off aviator reviews and so glad we did. We had a small group of 8, so felt like a private tour. Terry had fabulous and interesting facts and showed us hidden little gems. It was the hottest day on record for Amsterdam and Terry was great about finding us shade and cooler little corridors to walk through on this tour. Even better was his great Irish accent, which added another fun layer to his stories. Truly an amazing tour guide and really by far one of the best walking tours we have been on throughout our numerous European vacations.

Very interesting and informative walking tour. I booked this 3 hour walking tour based on the goods reviews on Trip Advisor, and I'm glad I did. My husband, 2 teenagers and myself thoroughly enjoyed Terry's tour of Amsterdam. He knows the city inside and out and we enjoyed learning about the history of the city. He is a natural storyteller and has a great sense of humor. Even my 2 teenagers enjoyed this tour and did not complain about why I booked another boring tour for them. I would highly recommend one of Terry's tours when visiting this beautiful city.

Walking Tour. Terry met us at the appointed location and time, then we proceeded on our 3 hour private tour. We were a group of 3 moms and 4 teenagers. It was a great tour, lots of interesting tidbits and fun was had by all. Highly recommend!!

Fun and Informative. My wife and I were visiting Amsterdam after attending the French Open earlier this month. Our first morning in Amsterdam we were met by Terry at our hotel to start our private city tour. He was prompt ! Terry was very knowledgable about the people and the history of Amsterdam. He knew the city like the back of his hand ! He was quick to point out interesting street situations that one would miss, if not specifically made aware of. He was helpful and engaging with a great sense of humor. Very important to us, his english was very easy to understand even though he was raised in Ireland. The time flew bye.

Great History of Amsterdam. We had a great time with Terry on this tour. He only takes up to ten people, so it is a lot of fun and your not smashed in a crowded tour. Terry is a great guide and a natural storyteller. We really enjoyed ourselves on his 3 hour Story of Amsterdam tour. He also had a great sense of humor and took its to places we may not have found on our own! My family would highly recommend one of Terry' s tours when visiting Amsterdam! A+++

Best walking tour ever!!!. Terry is an amazing tour guide. We learned more in 3 hours than we had in our previous 5 day visit to Amsterdam a few years ago. Terry also tailored the tour based on our interests and on what we had already seen during our previous visit. He is a wealth of knowledge and we will highly recommend him to anyone we know that will be visiting Amsterdam. His Irish sense of humor is an added bonus!!!!

Great Tour of Amsterdam. From Rembrandt to the red light district, Terry covered it all for us on a great walking tour. It was a wonderful start to our three days in Amsterdam as he oriented us to the city and introduced us to areas that we could explore later. I highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Wonderful Tour!. We just got back from our European adventure and I can finally brag about Terry! What a wonderful walking tour we had with him, so informative. Highly recommend for anybody that has never been to Amsterdam, he really knows everything about this place. Thanks for a great day Terry!

Outstanding Tour. We learned more than we ever thought we would about the red light district. Terry was an excellent tour guide and helped us learn the historical, comical, sad and even quricky insights to this well known district. His tour helped us feel comfortable in a setting that we might not have otherwise visited!
Great intro to Amsterdam. Really enjoyed today's walking tour of Amsterdam, despite the horrible weather. Terry is a friendly and informative guide who knew his stuff. Highly recommend.
Fabulous tour. We enjoyed a very informative and interesting tour of the red light district led by terry. Really enjoyed it and so grateful we did it

Excellent City Tour. Terry was an excellent guide. He gave us so much history and information and showed us all of the city. It was even great for our 10 and 12 yr old daughters. They said that they liked all the interesting things he showed them!! Which is great because sometimes a waking tour can get a little boring for Tweens but my girls loved it and now have a wealth of information and history of Amsterdam. It was the best tour we've had in all our travels to date!!!
Wow - A Wonderful Tour. Terry O'Leary gives an interesting, informative, and engaging tour of Amsterdam. Well worth the money and time. I would recommend it without reservation.

How an Ideal Guided tour should be !!. Terry was excellent !! I think he's the only 1 guide who gives this tour. Ours was a group of 8 people from US, India, Denmark, Greek, Canada, Netherlands itself. The tour started with a delay of 15 mins because a mom-daughter were running a little late. Terry was patient enough to give them directions(though meeting point was simple to find) as they were travelling via a car. Rest all were on time. He was also patient enough to let everyone click pics and also kept the group together in an impressive manner. He gave in-depth explanation(even about RLD) about all places as well as answered all our questions of various kinds. The tour ended near Anne Frank House after 4 hrs. At the end, he also gave other tips like where to stay, eat etc.

Best Tour we Did. This was by far the best tour we did on our entire 2 week honeymoon to Paris, Amsterdam and Barcelona. Terry is an excellent tour guide, fun and informative. We were never bored, and he answered all our questions well. If you're going to Amsterdam Terry's tour is the BEST way to see the city.

The best way to see the Red Light District - Illuminating. We hired Terry to give us a private guided tour of the Amsterdam RLD just before dark. He collected us on time from our houseboat, and in more than 90 minutes of strolling around, gave us a real insight into the history, politics, business and shady side. As two mature married couples who wouldn't normally do this sort of thing, having a tour guide saying 'look at this' just gives permission and removes all embarrassment from wandering the red light district. The tour included some dark cramped alleys that were perfectly safe, but would have be intimidating without a guide. It's also good to know the difference between red and purple lights. The tour didn't include actually going in any peep shows, sex shops or the sex museum, which saved getting too sordid, but if that's your thing, you will know where to go after.Terry's a really likeable Irishman who has been resident in Amsterdam quite a while, so understands the local culture. He does daytime tours of the city too, so can talk about the history too. In the tour of the RLD, the presentation was positive and up-beat, but he didn't shy away from the talking about the negatives.So glad we did this on our first night. We invited Terry to dinner and he was an amiable dinner guest too.

Very informative & fun tour. My husband & I booked our tour directly through Terry (he was recommended to us by another tour operator who could not accommodate us) and ended up being the only people on his tour on a Saturday morning in January. I love the fact that he only does small groups so he can tailor the tour to you. We ran a few minutes late, but Terry patiently waited for us at the monument. As this was our first time in Amsterdam, we wanted to do this tour as early as possible in the trip so that we could get a feel for the city & decide where to focus our time later.Terry didn't disappoint in that capacity. He walked us all over the city & shared very interesting stories throughout its history. My favorites parts of the tour were the Jewish Quarter and the walk to Anne Frank's house because he provided a lot of historical perspective about this sad time period. Midway through the tour we stopped for a hot drink to warm up. Great part about traveling in January is the lack of crowds but it is cold! We also stopped in a gourmet cheese shop for samples of amazing cheeses. Highly recommend doing that!Terry is a very funny guy so it was easy to listen to him. We felt like the tour was a good value & wouldn't hesitate to recommend him as a tour guide!

Delights of Amsterdam . Booked this walking tour through Viator. We met Terry by the national monument, it was easy to find an spot him. Terry delivered a good insight into a lot of Amsterdam and Netherlands history. He also made us laugh with some of his stories. Terry also gave us tips on where to go other than the tourist hotspots which was good. I would thoroughly recommend this walking tour to anyone. Go on book it you know it makes sense

Really Enjoyed - Fab Tour & Great Guide. Really enjoyed our walking tour - You can tell Terry has a real love of his adopted city. He was very funny but really informative & maintained everyone's interest throughout. Highly recommended

Excellent, informative walking tour from Terry. The tour was a relaxed walk around the main areas of interest in the city. There were only 4 of us on the tour & it gave us a chance to ask questions & chat about the sights. Terry has a great knowledge of the area & he made the tour interesting & fun. We would highly recommend taking this tour.

Great guided tour, with an excellent guide. Terry was an excellent guide and his knowledge of Amsterdam was extensive. He had an endearing, relaxed way about him and our group really enjoyed his company and the tour, which was very interesting, varied and fun. Highly recommended.

Great insight and informed walk through history. Terry has been living here for some years. We were the only ones on the tour and he really taylored the 3.25 hours walk (including a coffee break) to take account of our interests which were around the history and the buldings that represented that history.We have booked a lot of tours via Viator to a number of cities including Rome and he was the most informed and easy to follow guide we have found so far!

Terry was fantastic, very interesting and informative, tailored to your interests 😊. We took a walking tour with Terry on a cold November Saturday morning, Terry gave us as it turned out a personal tour as we were the only two booked on, he gives a very informative and fascinating insight into the historical and the modern Amsterdam, tailored to the things we were interested in, in a very enjoyable friendly way, highly recommended, sorry it's taken so long to do review !

Great walking tour of the city. Terry was a warm, witty and knowledgable Irishman who has made Amsterdam his home. We did a great walking tour around the central part of the city. Good balance of history, culture and story telling - highly recommended.

Fantastic Walking Tour. We booked a 3 hour walking tour with Terry of Wow Tours - it was amazing. Terry has fantastic knowledge of Amsterdam & has a great sense of humour. The tour was informative & fun. Highly recommended.

Great guide in Amsterdam. We are writing to recommend Terry O'Leary as a guide in Amsterdam.We are a fairly unusual couple, in that I was using a wheelchair.Terry was not at all fazed by this and went out of his way to find accessible restaurants, sites that we could visit, etc.He is very knowledgeable about Amsterdam and was a great guide to all the museums, quickly finding the major works of art and explaining them to us. We saved a lot of time this way.As an added bonus. he is originally Irish, so his English is perfect, and he has the rare perspective of observing Holland as somewhat of an outsider. He and his family now reside in Amsterdam, so we learned a lot about what that was like, about the school system, etc.We highly recommend Terry as a guide.Margaret and Paul Lurie

Amsterdam walking tour. Terry O'Leary shared his vast knowledge of this beautiful city. It was wonderful to be able to have such personal attention and be able to ask questions. We were four friends touring together and everyone rated this tour Excellent.

Terry is a great Amsterdam guide. We booked a walking tour with Viator and on the scheduled day we met up with our guide, Terry O'Leary. It was just my husband and I on the tour so we were able to cover a lot of ground. Terry is from Ireland and I think his perspective as a non Amsterdam native was very insightful. He took us to nooks and crannies of the city we would have never been able to discover on our own. The time we spent flew by and we went away from the tour understanding elements of Amsterdam's culture that we never would have known about.I would highly recommend Terry if you are going to be in Amsterdam.

WOW is correct!!!. 4 adults had a private walking tour with Terry he picked us up at our B&B. He was wonderful and showed an Amsterdam we would have never seen on our own. His insight into his adopted city ( he is from Ireland) was incredible and he was engaging and happy to share insights into daily life of Amsterdam. Should have booked him for a second day....

Terry was a great guide. Lots of stories and facts. Learnt so much about Amsterdam on our tour with Terry and i always have loads of questions about which he was very patient. The 3 hours flew by and as we were lucky enough to a group of 2 he framed some of it around what we had done and were still ti see. Thanks Terry

WOW Tours. We booked a walking tour of Amsterdam with Viator and were connected to WOW TOURS. The guide, Terry O' Leary, who happens to be the owner of the company, provided us with an extended and informative tour of the city. His knowledge and insight relative to the city was exceptional. It was very enjoyable and we would highly recommend it.

Amsterdam fro All Sides. My wife and I had never been to Amsterdam before so we thought it would be fun to take a tour to put the city into perspective--past and present. Local guide Terry O'Leary met us downtown and walked our small group around the historic sites of the city. Far from telling some dry history lesson, Terry made the city's colorful past come to life with fun and interesting stories. Terry is a true Irish raconteur with a quick wit and a talent for making you understand the big picture. I would recommend WOW Tours for anyone wanting to spend an afternoon with a lively local expert! (A bit of the blarney included in the price.)

The other side of Amsterdam. Thank you Terry for giving us an insight in the redlight district. The tour was very interesting and informative. This is a must do when you are in Amsterdam otherwise you will never know what goes on behind those red lights..

Top Notch. Spent three and a half hours in the company of Terry and half a dozen other punters on a showery Sunday in August. Our walking tour of Amsterdam cost us E25 each and it was money very well spent.Terry is a pleasant guy and has the Irish gift of storytelling. The time just flew by and it was a highly pleasurable and entertaining experience. He knows his stuff and seems to delight in imparting his knowledge to strangers. It was as if we were being shown around town by an old friend.Very entertaining and extremely good value for money. If you are looking for the best guided tour of Amsterdam then look no further, for this is it. Highly recommended.

Interesting walking tour of Amsterdam. Terry of WOWTours took us on a three hour walk around central Amsterdam.
We found him an excellent, well informed guide. His comments on both the history of Amsterdam and insights into modern Amsterdam were very interesting. It was a most enjoyable three hours

Walking with Terry. Our friends met us in Amsterdam on our two week vacation of Germany and the Netherlands. Cary booked a few tours for us all, and this was the first one on our first full day there. My husband and I thought this was a perfect way to start off the Amsterdam leg of our trip. Terry O'Leary was very knowledgeable (and funny, incorporating his own brand of humor along the way) of the area we walked through. I really felt like he tailored the experience just for us. I left there with a better understanding of Amsterdam, the history, how the canals work, and the people of the Netherlands.We would totally recommend Terry to anyone visiting and thinking about a tour....BOOK ITTrevor & Joey

Walking Tour of Amsterdam. Our guide was Terry O'Leary and he was terrific. Terry is very knowledgeable, professional and funny. The tour stops at all the highlights of this beautiful city, with a coffee stop right when you need it. We would highly recommend this tour to our friends, and to anyone who plans to travel to Amsterdam.Jane and George, New Jersey

Wonderful Tour. For our first full day in Amsterdam I booked this tour almost a year in advance. I like to plan ahead. After reading the reviews I was looking forward to having Terry as our tour guide. My husband and I still talk about what a great walking tour Terry gave us of Amsterdam. We had no problem finding him at the monument and it ended up just being the three of us for the tour. During the three hours he took us to so many interesting places and had great stories to entertain us about Amsterdam. It was helpful that he showed us were the Anne Frank House was and how to get to the theater for Boom Chicago. Two more great things to include in your trip to Amsterdam. Terry ranks as one of the best tour guides we have had on our travels.

A wonderful introduction to Amsterdam. Following our Rhine River cruise we spent 2 nights in Amsterdam. We spent our first morning with Terry and had a wonderful introduction to this fabulous City.Terry was a fantastic guide and we would not hesitate to recommend.

Very knowledgable, friendly, and a wonderful storyteller. The tour with Terry is an absolute pleasure. It passes so quickly you will be shocked when you notice the time after a couple of hours. It's a city center tour so not much of a distance but a nice walk all around the area and Terry has time to answer any question with a smile.

Balance of Funny and Informative. Tour guide Terry has done his research. Though he is not Dutch, he knows his history and keeps it fresh and well paced, never dry. The tour covers the highlights of medieval Amsterdam, touching on the Royal Palace, red light district, old churches, Anne Frank house, "coffee shops" and more. His sense of irony and humor keeps your attention, and by the end I had a greater appreciation for the role the Dutch played in European trade and commerce. I recommend this tour for young and old.

WOW Tours with Terry O'Leary is the way to explore Historic Amsterdam!. My husband and I took the WOW walking tour with Terry in May 2014. We were fortunate to have him all to ourselves as the other guests were no shows. (It is good for other travelers to know that he will not cancel a walk even if there are only 2 people.) He knows his adopted city and shared wonderful stories and the history of the old town. The many sights he took us to are in the guidebooks as "must see" spots and his anecdotes and stories brought them to life in ways a guidebook cannot. The pace was just right and the rest stop at a nice cafe was scheduled for the perfect time.We highly recommend Terry and his tour as a way to learn the history of early Amsterdam and to orient yourself to this beautiful city.

So informative and friendly. My husband and I were on our first tour of Europe in May 2014 and booked a walking tour of Amsterdam. WOW tours with our guide (and owner)Terry was a fantastic way to experience Amsterdam. Terry was so knowledgeable, friendly and informative, making the tour a fun and definitely worthwhile experience. Small group only and a great way to get to know this interesting city. There was so much to Amsterdam that we would never have seen of known about without him. Highly recommended.

17 of us LOVED our tour!. 3 generations of our family started our trip in Amsterdam with Terry's 3 hour walking tour. The time flew by and the whole tour was so very informative and interesting. Ages 6 to 71 years enjoyed it and we would recommend this tour to EVERYONE!

Pleasant tour. It is undeniable that Terry, the tour guide and owner of WOW tours, has a lot of knowledge about Amsterdam’s history, culture, legends and the best tips that provided us with a very good tour.
