Also, if you don’t have a lot of free time in the city, this is a great way of getting to know the hotspots in 3 hours or so.I just sensed that the specific day I chose to take the tour, Terry was a bit tired and maybe anxious to get it over with, which surprised me after reading all the excellent reviews he has. Well, I suppose we cannot have 100% of excellent days, so I would still recommend his tour.

Great Tour of Amsterdam's History. Terry O Leary of Wow Tours did an incredible job of introducing and explaining the history of Amsterdam in a very thorough and fascinating manner. He was extremely personable and made it fun to learn all about the history of this lovely city. His detailed accounts were amazing. The three hours flew and I really feel like I learned a great deal!!

Great Tour. Terry our guide really made the tour informative, interesting and fun. We learnt a great deal and highly recommend this tour to others.The three hours flew, and I am sure we walked miles, but with the initeresting facts along the way it didn't feel like it.A really worthwhile tour which I am certain would be enjoyed by anyone who went along.

Very thorough and informative tour.. Terry O'Leary was a great tour guide. So much interesting information on the sites visited. Answered all questions and had a very friendly demeanor. We definitely would recommend this tour if you're in Amsterdam. Thank you Terry for a great tour. We will be telling everyone about it. Anthony & Michele

Fun and educational introduction to Amsterdam. My husband and I started off a week in Amsterdam with a Terry O'Leary "WOW tour" -- a three-hour walking tour of the city center. Terry met us at Dam Square where we were joined by one other traveler. Terry is knowledgable, funny and sensitive to the needs of his small group, a natural story teller. The duration of the tour seemed right. We had a nice stop at a local coffee and pastry shop in the middle just when we needed it. We visited the highlights and also got important recommendations for the remainder of our week. With Terry's e mail address, we also communicated with him once after our tour with a question he quickly answered. We would highly recommend a walking tour with Terry as a terrific start to a week in Amsterdam.

The best. We did a walking tour with Terry and absolutely loved it. Everything about it was brilliant. Terry gave us a great history lesson of Amsterdam. His knowledge was amazing. We learnt so much and really enjoyed the morning due to Terry's great wit, and fun and interesting story telling. We would recommend this tour as a must for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Excellent tour - perfect way to get to know Amsterdam. Our family of 4, including two young adults in their 20's, really enjoyed our tour with Terry. We learned a lot about Dutch culture and a great overview of important destinations in Amsterdam. Booking with a knowledgeable private guide like Terry is really the perfect way to ensure that your tour is at a pace that works for you and includes sights that will ensure that everyone in the group gets to see something that interests them. I think we did the right thing by booking Terry for the first day of our Amsterdam holiday. That way, we were able to pick his brain for restaurant recommendations and other activities that we could explore on our own.

Amsterdam Walking Tour with Terry. It was our 3 daughters' first trip to Amsterdam, and I thought it best we take a professional to tell the history of Amsterdam. Terry was highly recommended by a friend, and he did not disappoint. He was a great storyteller, and even if my husband and I have been to Amsterdam previously, we still learned a lot from this tour. The whole tour took 4 hours, and we were very tired after, but it was the only way one can truly appreciate how beautiful this city is. Thank you, Terry and good luck!
Fantastic tours. We had a great time in Amsterdam with WOW tours. We took a city bike tour and red light tour. Highly recommended.

Wow tours with Terry O' Leary. Last summer I spent 3 days in Amsterdam, where I traveled with my colleagues. We were a group of 9 people, female. Terry made for us two walking tours that we liked a lot. We got to know a lot of interesting facts about Amsterdam and Netherlands. With a lot of knowledge, passion and gentlemen approach Terry made all efforts to make our stay unforgettable. Next time we go again in the land of freedom and happiness we will definitely contact him again!

Terry Exceeds Expectations. We travelled as a couple in February. First time in Europe and the first stop of our tour is Amsterdam. Booked the classic walking tour & red light district tour with Terry. As we travelled from Asia and with the limited time that we had, we proceeded with the walking tour exactly 4 hours after our touchdown in Amsterdam. We were worried that we will be too tired physically & mentally to enjoy what the city has to offer within such a short time.All these changed when we met Terry at our hotel lobby. He was witty, charming & very professional not to mention his knowledge of the history, legends & trivias of the city. We were entertained throughout the tour with stories & loads of information...all presented in the most entertaining way by Terry with great humour. Even a non history buff will find his tour interesting. Terry can offer a something that local tour guides can't, the valuable viewpoint & insight of a seasoned tourist in Amsterdam, and as first timers here, we felt 'understood' by Terry.The red light district tour was sweet & exciting, as if we were to walk on our own..all we can see are scantily dressed women & a ghetto-like area. Terry brings us deep into the heart of the district where we wouldn't have dared venture on our own..no matter how safe the district is..also there are more to this area then sex trade. Terry will enlighten and bring the best of the district's landmarks coupled with stories & myths for tourists to enjoy.We left Amsterdam feeling satisfied as we managed to see so much within such a short time frame..without feeling rushed..and we even have time to go on a wonderful tour visiting the outskirts of Amsterdam. Terry has been really kind to arrange an excellent guide for this tour. All in all 2 magical days in Netherlands.Will definitely look for Terry again the next time we go back to Amsterdam!

Terry Hit a Home Run!!!. My family of 6 (children 14,16,18,20) were in Amsterdam for only three days at the end of June 2013, As always, when planning a trip, I contacted TripAdvisors top rated tour services. Terry's Wow Tours immediately stood out from all the other companies with his quick and insightful responses to any inquiry I might have. He was also very flexible, in working around our flight schedules and combining and tailoring tours to meet our needs. Terry arranged for all airport transfers. He provided the name and cell phone number of the driver ahead of time. The driver, Marcel, was very professional, prompt, and an excellent driver. The vehicle was clean, and new.  Since we only had 3 days in Amsterdam we tried to cram as much as we could into each day. Terry came up with a perfect itinerary to meet our needs. We did the "Story of Amsterdam" (SOA) tour but also added the WWII and Jewish district to it as well. After the SOA tour briefly introduced the red light district, I felt more comfortable scheduling the evening “Red Light Experience” Tour for my family. Terry cleared his schedule, and took us out the following evening. We also did the Food/ Jordan Market Tour. Terry kept the tours fresh and interesting. He was both entertaining and informative. Terry helped to make the most every minute. We all enjoyed ourselves immensely.

Terry's Tale of Amsterdam. We spent an entertaining and extremely informative morning touring around Amsterdam with Terry from WOWTours. It was great to meet a fabulous story teller, who really brought Amsterdam to life for us. We saw things we would otherwise have missed, and we learned more in a few hours than we could have in weeks by ourselves...if at all. From the history of the establishment of Amsterdam, through various social and political upheavals over the centuries, Terry took us on a memorable journey through the cobbled streets of the old city, enlightening us about the city's past and present in a witty and informative way, that kept us engaged and enthralled throughout. A fantastic introduction to this historic city. Thanks so much, Terry - outstanding!!!

Most enjoyable and informative tour. We met Terry in Dam Square for our tour on a damp, cold morning on 18 december. There was only the two of us on the tour and we spent a fascinating three and a bit hours appreciating Amsterdam. I loved that he showed us hidden parts of the city and small details we would otherwise have missed or not understood. He had a great sense of humour and was a wonderful story teller. Luckily the dampness disappeared and we were able to complete the whole tour. We will recommend Terry and WOW tours to friends and family.

Excellent Tour. It was a freezing cold day in Amsterdam but Terry kept us moving and entertained. I learned more from Terry than I did on any other tour. He is engaging, witty, and knowledgable. He spent more time with us than the tour was scheduled to go, he answered all of our questions, he recommended restaurants and even other tours to take.This tour was very affordable and I only wish that I had also been able to take the Red Light District Tour that WOW Tours offers.

Fantastic Tour. Terry made a cold drizzly morning in Amsterdam a great one! With a witty demeanor, a awesome Irish accent, Terry knows his stuff about the city and provides an informative and entertaining tour. A group of 4 friends in our late 20s, the tour was the perfect overview of Amsterdam and its amazing past.

Very funny and interesting. We booked a city tour with Terry O'Leary. It was very interesting and funny! Terry has big knowledge about Amsterdam. It doesn't matter if historic, social or anything else.

Great tour!. My mom and I only had a half day to spend in Amsterdam and we chose to do a 3 hour walking tour with WOW tours with Terry O'Leary. I'm so glad we did! the tour was great. Terry was very accommodating. It was nice to learn about Amsterdam from a local. Easy walking, saw all the historic sights, saw contemporary neighborhoods and all with easy conversation and funny insights from Terry. Highly recommend. Great price for the tour. www.wowtoursamsterdam.com

Exactly what we wanted and more. Terry is a great people's person and you will not believe how quickly the 3 hours will go by. The tour will give you excellent bearings in the city; walks you through all must-see points plus the ones you probably wouldn't know if you weren't with Terry. Highly recommended. Next time I'm in Amsterdam, I'm planning to take a private extended tour with him.

Exactly what we are looking for!. Terry is an excellent story teller!! We enjoyed our walking tour with him tremendously. I can't say enough good things about Terry and his tour. He is a fountain of knowledge in all Amsterdam - past and present. He has tons of inside information. He tells the story of Amsterdam in a very interesting and fun way - not just throwing facts and figures. You will absolutely enjoy your time with him.

Excellant walking tour. My partner and I did an extended stay in Europe and did six walking tours throughout Europe. Hands down this was the best! Terry did an excellent job connecting with everyone on the tour and was incredibly knowledgeable about Amsterdam. I got a great appreciation for the history, architecture and residents of this incredible city. I highly recommend "the story of Amsterdam" walking tour for a great experience.

Tour and terry were fantastic!. We met Terry in Dam Square for a fabulous walking tour of Amsterdam. He was extremely knowledgeable with the city's history and added a little humour along the way. An easy walk that most could handle. A great investment of time.

Red Light Tour Appropriate for Families w/Teens & Up. Of course a trip to Amsterdam is not complete without visiting the Red Light District. However, my husband and I had reservations about walking the Red Light District, let alone doing so with our two children who are in their early 20s. Although the Red Light District was safer than expected, as we learned on our tour, we were glad we walked the District with Terry! On our own we would have only seen the many scantily clad women (and a few men), and missed out on the history and interesting facts about the District. To simply say that Terry is a people person does not do him justice. Terry quickly understood our family, our family dynamics, and comfort level with the subject matter, and tailored the tour to our taste. While my 23-year old daughter and 22-year old son initially questioned my judgement in booking Terry's tour, suspecting it would be awkward to take such a tour with the parents, Terry immediately put us all at ease with his great wit and professionalism. Terry shared his knowledge of the District, which included facts about the economics and safety of the workers, security and every-day life in the District, and history of the development of the Red Light District.I highly recommend a Red Light District tour with Terry for all tourists of an appropriate age. It is a personal decision for parents to determine the appropriate age for their children. Had my kids been as young as 16, I would have felt comfortable on a family tour with Terry. While the subject matter is for mature audiences, and some girls were dressed in a way that left little to the imagination, Terry was professional and informative, and in no way crass or inappropriate. Terry's tour was one of the highlights of our trip. We have taken dozens of tours on our family vacations and Terry is among our favorite tour guides!

Linking history with today's Amsterdam. What an entertaining and informative morning! Terry is able to make Amsterdam come to life with his anecdotes and the ability to connect today's experiences with the city's amazing history. Take his tour at the start of your visit and it will make the remainder a richer experience.Peter Hermitage, Canterbury, UK.

Great guy, great tour. As is often the case the best guides are non indigenous. Terry is Irish and, maybe I am biased, but I love that gentle brogue. They all tell good yarns and Terry is no exception. His 3-hour tour (with essential coffee break) is informative and entertaining, with an insight into the Dutch psyche that only an outsider can bring. Ours was a group of just four (shame on those named for that of a hirsute appendage who booked and failed to show) and Terry was very solicitous of our well being. Highly recommended.

Excellent Amsterdam Walking Tour. Last Tuesday 23rd July I took a walking tour of Amsterdam with Terry the guide from WOW Tours. I found his tour through the Viator website and would absolutely recommend it to any visitor to the city. It was my second morning in Amsterdam and it was a great way to find out a lot about the city early in my 5 day trip.It was a small group and it made it very easy to interact with Terry and to hear everything he had to tell us. He had lots of historical information and plenty contemporary info to balance. I thought this was a great walking tour and ive been on many (always the best way to see a city). Terry was both knowledgeable and humorous and I would highly recommend his to tour to everyone.Enjoy!

Best walking tour of Amsterdam!. I took a morning WOW-tour w/ Terry & Wow Tours. In the rain. But that didn't diminish the experience of Wow Tours. Rain is a part of Amsterdam and Terry managed to get the group to near-by stores in rain ponchos. He was upbeat and informative and even went nearly an hour longer than scheduled. He hung around to help w/ people's questions and offered more Amsterdam ideas at the end. This was one of the best walking tours I've experienced (toured Rome, Florence, Dublin & Istanbul). Most personal!

Highly recommended and good value for money. June 2013 we visited Amsterdam for the first time and chose the walking tour of Amsterdam. We met Terry at the appointed time and place and off we set. We were lucky that we were the only couple on the tour. Terry is Irish by birth but had been living in Amsterdam for many years and really knew his stuff. He was interesting and informative and readily answered questions. Definitely worth the time and effort.
A pleasant historical tour. Terry, the Tour Guide, gave a pleasant overview of downtown Amsterdam. The three hours went very quickly.

Excellent Airport Layover Excursion. Terry did a GREAT job with my group of 15 during our 8 hour layover at Schipol airport. We did all the preliminaries by email and he was always quick to respond. I even asked him to buy our group's train tickets in advance to save time and he did so with no advance money. The tour itself was excellent. He tailored it to our needs, was quite knowledgeable, and truly is a great story teller. He presents things in such a way that folks who would not normally care for history can't get enough! Our group highly recommends you use Terry on an Amsterdam layover.

Fabulous, definitely worth the time and money.. We joined Terry for a walking tour, which we found through Viator. He was a fantastic tour guide. Terry was full of interesting, relevant knowledge about all of the areas that we went to. While many people might think that three hours spent walking around is a long time, the time flew. We went to places we would never have found on our own, and we were able to appreciate places more from the information provided. The anecdotes Terry told of his own life and tours that he has previously led were also fascinating. We were thrilled to tip Terry 20 Euros at the end of the tour - given that we are Australian, something that we would only do in exceptional circumstances. Well worth the time and money spent!

Great relaxed informative and friendly. First time in Amsterdam so booked this trip on-line before travelling. Had a nice group of fellow travellers group size was 7, finding the guide was also easy. The guide Esther was fantastic and really made the tour, engaging and informative with a nice pace. Lots of local knowledge and answered all the questions the group had. The tour gave me an idea of the things I wanted to see more in depth and their locations, which was important as only in the town for a few days. I would strongly recommend this trip to anyone especially first time amsterdamers.

Great Tour. Its a brilliant tour. Terry is (as so many guides) an immigrant to the city who really loves it, and its history and wants to share this with other people.The tour was well organised, very informative and fun. I like the fact that Terry keeps the groups small so you can ask questions, and you aren't hated by everyone trying to walk around your massive group. We had a few difficult tourists in our group and Terry managed them with aplomb. A great tour, and really useful to have to start a holiday with as it gives you a lot of background on bits of Amsterdam!

We haven't even toured with him yet and it's already an awesome experience!!!. WOW Tours is very appropriately named! My group of 12 are coming to Amsterdam in June, and we have an 8 hour layover in the city before catching our next flight. I contacted Mr O'Leary's company by email and received an answer back within an hour. He was very thorough, telling us what all our options are, and what his very low prices are. He gave us options wether or not to have our guide stay with us the whole time, guiding us through the maze of train stations for the outlying area we want to visit, and has given us the luxury of being flexible with our times and where we want to go while in Amsterdam. Basically, we're being given an inexpensive but very personal, private tour that is usually afforded to only the very rich! I can't wait to meet our guide in person, and thank him and his company for the assurance and confidence he has already given me and my group, that we will have a wonderful once of a lifetime experience in Amsterdam!

Good Overview. We had a tour in Amsterdam last week that we enjoyed. Our guide was funny and full of anecdotes and was very patient with my elderly mother who cannot walk well. Very good tour for the price, so I recommend this tour. The only thing i would say is that spending half of the tour in the Red Light District and then rushing through more interesting characters like Rembrandt or Anne Frank is not a good use of time. Guide was a great storyteller adn could answer questions well.

An excellent guide. We met Terry in April 2013 for a private walking tour of Amsterdam. I can highly recommend him. He is very easy going and has a detailed knowledge of his city, it's history and its culture. We spent four hours with him as we discovered many new areas and things we didn't know. Terry can tailor the tour to suit the needs of the traveller and we organised it all by email. He is excellent value and I rate him very highly. A must do in Amsterdam.

Excellent, Insightful, Engaging. I met Mr O'Leary (our guide) 2 days back. He was very professional and managed to deliver interesting tibits on the city with wit and "gusto". Was a great storyteller. Highly recommended for tours with family, friends, or significant others. He may be reached via- wowproductions2012@gmail.com

Excellent walking tour of Amsterdam. My husband and I joined 3 other people for a thoroughly enjoyable and informative three and a half hour walking tour of Amsterdam. Terry o'leary, our guide and owner, is quite knowledgable and very entertaining, as he really knows how to tell a story and has a great sense of humor. I would definitely recommend calling him if you want an excellent guided tour of Amsterdam.

Excellent Tour of Amsterdam. We recently visited Amsterdam as part of a work trip. There were 17 adults in the group and Terry was recommended to us from friends that had taken the tour before. From the first email inquiry to the afternoon he met us in our hotel he was very professional. Terry had arranged a 3hour tour around the city centre that was both informative and funny. He was a fountain of knowledge and took time to ensure that everyone was included. I would have no hesitation in recommending a tour, if you are two people are a group Terry is the WOW in WOW Tours.

Brilliant Walking Tour. I bought this tour via a website called viator for my husband and me. We landed in the early hours of a Saturday morning in February and rushed straight to Dam square for the tour. From start to finish, the tour was fantastic. We were visiting out of peak time, so our group was very small (there were just 5 of us) and Terry really catered to our every need. Terry who is originally from Ireland has been living in Amsterdam for a number of years and knew a huge amount about the city and and its history. He was willing to answer all manner of questions about all the areas we walked through.The tour allowed us to see all important areas of the city and meant that during our short stay there we felt confident to explore the city on our own during our stay.Great value for money- I would definitely recommend this!!

A great introduction to Amsterdam. My friends and I were keen to get an overview of Amsterdam before being let loose in the City and that's exactly what Terry provided. His 3-hour tour was interesting and informative, peppered with his lovely sense of humour and his enthusiasm for his adopted city shone through...although that was the only thing that shone - it was FREEZING!! This didn't deter him or us and we were really glad we'd found such a brilliant guide. With only 3 days to see as much as possible, a lot of it was covered by WOW Tours. Thanks, Terry.

Excellent Walking Tour. Terry met me and wife for a private walking tour around Amsterdam and we both found it fantastic. He is a great story teller and interesting person so we found both his tour and his company to be quite nice. Good overview of the city as well. Could've stopped at a better coffee place, though :)

Amsterdam walking tour. Terry only had my wife and I for the walking tour on the 23rd Nov 2012, He met us at the arranged venue and after introdcutions the tour began. Terry provided the tour with great enthusiasm depite the weather (pouring with rain) Terry is without doubt the best tour guide I have ever used. He was very knowledgable and made every aspect of the tour interesting. He was ammusing and friendly. The 3 hours flew by. Do yourself a favour and book for this great value tour. I promise you will not be dissapointed. Highly reccomended.

Educational yet funny!. Terry was the best guide we had come across in Europe thus far! We had a small group, only 4 people and it allowed a very leisurely pace, complete with a coffee break part way through! He was incredibly knowledgable and funny, and managed to show us the sights, as well as educate us on the history, politics, and culture of Amsterdam through a compelling narrative. I would highly recommend Wow Tours for anyone visiting Amsterdam as Terry finds a way to make the most boring or complicated fact interesting, funny, and memorable! The best are his opinions on the various statues and monuments in Amsterdam.

walking tour of Amsterdam - WOW Tours. We signed up for a 3 hour walking tour of the Amsterdam while stopping on a cruise vacation. We met our guide Terry O'Leary in Dam Square to begin the tour. It was a great experience! Terry was very knowledgeable and gave a great insight into the city. Would highly recommend this tour to anyone spending some time in Amsterdam!

Walking Tour: Amsterdam. Terry's insightful, humorous and thorough walk-about of the city was sensational, especially as recounted by an engaging Irishman who is a resident. We'd say his tour is a "must do" for a first-timer to this vibrant city. His knowledge and presentation was clear, memorable, candid and is an excellent way to understand this community of art, canals and a remarkable people.
Great value for money, informative tour. Terry provided great insight into Amsterdam's past and present history injecting his own Irish humour along the way. Highly recommend this tour!

Walking Tour of Amsterdam. Very Interesting and informative and brought the City to life. Terry was an excellent guide. Gave lots of detailed information about Amsterdam, peppered with many stories and good humour. Would definitely recommend anyone to go on this tour.

Walking tour of Amsterdam. Thanks Terry for a great walking tour of Amsterdam. Sorry about the mix up on the euro! We finally learned! Great information about Amsterdam. Just loved what Terry had to say and the route he took us on. We stayed in Amsterdam for 3 days and learned so much about the city. Oh Terry we did get to Cork only because the wind was too bad for us to dock in Dunsmore East. So we saw your city. We berthed in Cobh and did a tour of Cork!!!! But folks do a wow tour of Amsterdam with Terry! You will be impressed!

Our Best Experience in Amsterdam. Terry was recommended to us by another popular tour guide who was completely booked during our short weekend visit to Amsterdam. We were not disappointed! Terry was more than just knowledgeable about his adopted city, he also was a font of little known facts and innuendos of the many places he guided us through. Terry's easy personality made the semi private 3-hour tour relaxing and pleasurable. The time flew by as we walked from Dam Square through the Red Light District, where we stopped several times with explanations of what we were seeing as well as interesting and fun little tidbits of info. We continued on to Rembrandt Huis and the Jewish Quarter, afterwards taking a quick break at a local cafe, followed by more sites that included how and why's of canals, the Catholic and Protestant Church histories, the Dutch East India Company, through the Amsterdam Museum pass, the Royal Palace and finally ending at the Anne Frank Huis. Terry pointed out many other interesting things as we moved from site to site (too many to mention all) and included personal experiences as well as information he gathered from patrons of his previous tours. My husband and I were definitely WOWed by Terry and his amazing Tour!

Even in the wet it is great. Very impressed with the wow walking tour and would recommend it to anyone who wants to get a broad taste of what Amsterdam has to offer. Our guide, Terry, is Irish but has lived in Amsterdam for several years and is interested in its origins and culture. He is able to relate various places of interest to people from other countries in a way that shows the diversity of this country's makeup. The history of the city combined with the political and modern overtones gave a wonderful picture of this magnificent city. I would highly recommend this tour to all visiting Amsterdam. Although remember that the weather is changeable so make sure you have clothing to accommodate the change in weather that happens at a moments notice. Be wowed!

More than we expected!. The WOW walking tour was fantastic. Hosted by a great story-teller, Terry, the 3.5 hour tour flew by. Terry was full of interesting facts, comical stories and most importatly, real knowledge. He took us to places there is no way we would have ventured to without a guide like this. It even included a stop at a local eatery where we could decompress for a few minutes, talk a little and get to know each other better. This was a great opportunity to ask random questions about Amsterdam. This tour was most reasonably priced, very easy going and an excellent source of Amsterdam sights, sounds and stories. Cheers to Terry & WOW for a fabulous time!Kate & Erik, St. Louis, MO

Excellent value for money tour with a really enthusastic and knowledgeable guide. The WOW ( Walk on Water) walking tour was organised by Amsterdam City Tours. We had booked a tour for three of us on a Sunday morning. We had booked online at the last minute because of doubts about our flight to Amsterdam.The booking arrangements were clear and straightforward. However apparently the guide originally booked for the tour was taken ill and the tour had to be rearranged for the Sunday afternoon. Amsterdam City Tours tried to make several attempts to contact us but were unable to do so because we were in transit. When the three of us turned up on Sunday morning we were still met on time by a substitute guide and he took just the three of us on the city tour. Not only did we see all the main city centre sights but also the less common buildings. Our guide was very knowledgeable about the city and its history and the history of its buildings. He was clearly really enthusiastic about the city. With just three of us the guide could easily have rushed us round but he did not - in fact the tour lasted well beyond the three hours advertised. Amsterdam is an easy city to walk round but wearing sturdy shoes would be sensible. A camera is a must and if you have got a voice recorder better still because you are given so much information in a relatively short space of timeand it is difficult to remember everything. We had one refreshment stop but the impression was that we could have had more if we wished. All in all this was a great morning's tour and we were lucky with the weather - it may not have been such fun if it had been raining.

See the polders and villages by bike. We rode the countryside tour, which starts with a quick (free!) ferry trip across the IJ to the north. We were quickly in the country, with charming old villages strung along the tops of the dikes. It was a nice and well-guided tour, not strenuous at all. The tour company limits tours to 12 people max, a nice size. The break in the middle in the tiny village of Holysloot was lovely - excellent pastries, coffee, and hot chocolate; small birds stealing biscuit crumbs; a cow studying us just over the fence. The bikes are rentals (not owned by the tour company) so make sure everything is adjusted to your liking before you take off.

Amazing, amazing, amazing!. We enjoyed the tour very much! We suggest it to everybody who wants to see Amsterdam through an insider´s eyes. Our tour guide was super friendly, cool and open to our questions.

City tour Amsterdam. A must in Amsterdam !! Would really recommend this to anyone, such a family friendly experience. Go to know the city in just a few hours with an excellent tour guide named jasper who entertained all ages alike. Thanks a million Jasper !!!
Awesome. Great ride through Amsterdam, very informative and fun. The ride is easy and the views are amazing. :)

Great experience. We had a magnificent bike tour. We were a quite small team (6 people) and we saw a lot of interesting (less touristic) places in Amsterdam. Anna, our tour guide was very helpful, with deep knowledge of the places we visited. I would strongly recommend that to everyone who would like to experience a bike tour as a local.

City Bicycle tour. Great tour. 3-1/2 hours, including a stop for coffee. Just enough facts and history to keep it interesting. Tour guide was a local student and knew a lot of Amsterdam. Not strenuous.

Perfect for non cyclists!. For once, as someone who is not keen on cycling, a perfect tour for me as it was completely flat!! I love history and am a tour guide myself and so was interested in the history imparted so clearly by Dyas as we made our way around the hidden parts of the city. Interesting, fun and an ideal way to learn about the city.

A great tour into the countryside away from the hubbub of central Amsterdam.. We spent a wonderful 4 hours cycling through the rural countryside a remarkably short distance from central Amsterdam. Our guide, Frank, was very friendly and informative; readily answering any of our questions. The small villages, the dykes, and the cows and sheep made for a very picturesque ride. The apple tart at our rest stop was delicious. The terrain is very flat which makes this an excellent ride for cyclists of all levels. This ride was a lot of fun, and I highly recommend it! I just wish we had time for their city tour!

Great Experience of Biking in Amsterdam. My wife and I had a great time on a recent trip to Amsterdam on the We Bike Amsterdam Tour. The thought of biking through Amsterdam was intimidating, but they did a great job of keeping the group together, and stopping for a great review of the history of Amsterdam. This is a great way to learn how to get around the city as well as give you an overall insight on what to see.You have to experience this on your next visit. Thanks to the staff for a great time!

Highlight of Amsterdam visit. I cannot say enough good things about this company. We scheduled a private bike tour through the countryside, and Jasper and Thijs could not have been more helpful and delightful. The tour was amazing. Jasper had so much knowledge about the towns we rode through and planned a great tour for us. As a bonus, after the tour they were kind enough to send us a list of favorite restaurants and stops in the city which was above and beyond. We stopped at three of the recommended places (would have done more but it was towards the end of our trip) and were thrilled with each one. I would highly recommend including this in your visit to Amsterdam!

3 hour cycle. Dyas was our guide who took us on a leisurely cycle around the canals and parks of Amsterdam. It was easy cycling and worth while seeing areas you would not know to visit. My only comment would be he was quietly spoken and so difficult to hear sometimes plus as a cyclist I could have happily spent more time on the bike. For non cyclists this would be a great tour to see interesting parts of the city.

Great . So I got the date wrong and got to the address to find no one waiting. Despite the language barrier the shop owner of the bike rentals called. After a two minute conversation he met us in less than 20 minutes. He was informative and catered to all of our needs. The price is very reasonable and the biking not overly strenuous even for my nonbiker husband. We thoroughly enjoyed our afternoon and personal service

Countryside Tour. Amazing day! Our tour guide was fantastic, the views beautiful, and the cake delicious. One of the highlights of our trip. We will sure to go back for the city or private tour. My wife & I choose We Bike tour over Joyride b/c we are uninterested in cheese making and clogs and would much rather eat homemade apple pie. Thank you for a great time!

Must do when visiting Amsterdam! . We took the countryside tour w Charlotte and had a brilliant time! The bikes were in great condition, the weather was beautiful, the ride was easy and Charlotte was knowledgeable and very friendly. I must recommend the apple pie at the restaurant... so good. The cheesecake was amazing too!!

Wonderful tour of the city. Our guide Jasper was brilliant! Everything from the meet up to collecting the bike was easy and well organized. Even for my gf who wasn't too confident on a bike, he took the time to make sure she was following nearby so he could keep an eye out. We spent the next 3 hours cycling through the city at a leisurely pace while jasper peppered us with interesting anecdotes and stories about the history of the city. Stopped halfway for a coffee break before continuing through some beautiful parks and cycling right under the Rijksmuseum. We saw parts of the city we could never have covered on foot and overall we enjoyed our tour immensely. After the tour we also got an email with all the guide's favorite restaurants and pubs which was a very nice touch!

Countryside Amsterdam . Just returned from great tour with Jasper. We were a bit apprehensive - my husband's back isn't great - it was perfect - beautiful scenery - interesting and informative commentary all along the way - fun and upbeat - nice stop for pastries and coffee. Highly recommend!

Interesting, fun, personal and relaxed. We had Charlotte as our guide, who led us around some interesting parts of Amsterdam, that might be a little off the beaten track. Enjoyable and informative, the pace wasn't fast, so my eight year old daughter was able to keep up. Thank you!

Best tour for finding off the beaten path locations and local stories. Luke was an excellent tour guide! We ended up being the only ones on the tour so he took his time and added as much as he could to the tour to make it a personal experience. We saw so many locations and learned stories we never would've heard if we hadn't gone on the tour, and biking around Amsterdam was so much fun! Definitely book your tour with this company to get a local's perspective and see the hidden beauty of Amsterdam.

Fun Bike Ride of Amsterdam. What a fun time. We toured the outside areas of Amsterdam on a beautiful Sunday morning. Our guide took us to some great little quiet locations and then a stop for lunch at a side street cafe. The exercise was moderate so nothing to hard to do. Worth every minute of the time.

Great day riding in the Dutch countryside. Nine of us had a great day riding out to Zaanse Schans with Thijs. It took longer than he was expecting, we weren't very fast but he was great about it. Stopped for lunch that was just ok, slow service and ok food. Made it to Zaanse Schans which is cute and as touristy as expected. Boat and train back to Amsterdam. Thijs was great and I highly recommend We Bike Amsterdam.

GREAT INTRODUCTION TO CITY CENTRE. My wife and I joined Jasper and three others for our bike tour of the city centre. I had booked in advance and we waited for a few minutes by one of the two lion statues opposite the Royal Palace for all of us to assemble.Our small group then set off for a four minute walk to the bike shop to be fitted up with sturdy 3 gear town bikes - no helmets. Jasper was young, cool and friendly. He gave us a very good idea of city life and was willing to answer all our questions: he was amusing, knowledgeable and 'controlled' us efficiently. His English was fluent - to the extent of describing much of the architecture as 'wobbly' and then giving the reasons for this (boggy foundations).We toured the city centre but also explored round some impressive residential areas, & the local park before he led us through the Van Gough museum...a long held cyclists' right to ride 'through' the museum ...at a reconstruction cost of millions of pounds!Jasper's tour included a coffee break at a delightful café where we were greeted like old friends. We all thoroughly enjoyed his three hour tour - despite a short burst of rain.Highly recommended as a fun way of exploring a bike friendly city and very good value.
Outstanding Adventure. By far the best Bike tour in Europe, off the beaten path in Amsterdam, things you will never see on your own, Highly recommended

October 11 bike tour. Jasper was amazing! Very funny guy and showed us a lot of cool stuff.Very patient and made sure everyone in our group enjoyed themselves.My wife and I cycle a lot but cycling in Amsterdam is a unique experience and you want someone who is very familiar with the rules and the area. Top-quality bikes!!It was fun to cycle with our new friends from Israel. I would highly recommend this company.

Very bad weather. We went for he country bike tour with charlotte.Charlotte knew her stuff, but I wish the tour had more stops and information.The weather was particular bad for the 2nd half of he tour so we was riding against the wind and rain which made it particularly hard work - but that couldn't be helped.Overall good fun despite the rain.

Awesome way to spend a sunny Saturday. This was our third visit to Amsterdam but by far our best, thanks to this bike trip with Charlotte. We were a small group and spent 4 hours getting to see a different side of the local area...a side that is a charming anecdote to the packed canals.The local area is full of history of the Golden Age of the Netherlands and while the landscape during the countryside tour won't knock your socks off (this is a pretty flat area) the sea views, charming villages, and sense of accomplishment will make it more than worth your while.

Countryside Tour. Had an absolutely fantastic time on the four hour countryside tour. The most difficult part is navigating the city traffic to the ferry once in the countryside it was peaceful & very scenic. Our guide chatted to us about the history of Amsterdam, stopped at various points along the 30k circular route to point out places of interest & we had a stop at the halfway point for apple pie & drinks Would definitely recommend this tour, was one of the highlights to my trip to Amsterdam. Book on & cycle like everyone else you'll love it.

The most amazing day!. I was one of a group of 9 ladies (if varying physical abilities and ages) who went on a tour to the windmills today. For me, if was the best day I've had in ages! I found myself more relaxed and present than I've been in months. We had beautiful weather. It was a stunningly beautiful route. Our tour guide was delightful and went above and beyond to ensure we all had a great, safe, scenic time. I cannot recommend this tour company highly enough, and I know for a fact we will use them again our next trip to Amsterdam.

Got a get my bike on!. After spending four hours on this bike tour I can definitely see why this company is so highly recommended!!Huge shout out to "Charlotte" who was our tour leader / bike master, who was absolutely outstanding!!The bikes while heavy are easy to ride and well maintained big tip ask questions if your not sure about anything because it's easily assumed otherwise.Good stretches of riding on this tour which is fantastic so your not stopping and starting all the time which I really enjoyed.The countryside component is stunning especially the cross country component which I thought was a hoot!!All in all this was a great afternoon of riding and sightseeing with a great group of people. This is a bike tour group I'd definitely do again!!!

Group activity . It was great! We are a group of 10 and it was perfect for a big group. So nice to see non touristic things and learn a bit about the history of Amsterdam. We really liked it.Thank you :)

Awesome country tour. What an awesome tour! We did the 4 hour country bike tour with We Bike Amsterdam and it was a blast. The rental bikes were in good condition and our guide was fantastic. The route was scenic (in Amsterdam North) along the water and into/through small villages. We would stop periodically for quick tidbit sharing (and for a break) and then continue biking. Also stopped to get some delicious apple pie and cheese cake about halfway through.The trip was 19 miles in total so be prepared if you haven't biked in a while. Don't worry too much though, there was not a single hill during the entire ride. The biggest inclines were small bridges that cross over the waterways.Would definitely do this trip again with these guys, they run a tight operation!

A must-do. A fascinating three hours spent riding between some of the lesser-known parts of the city, expertly led by our knowledgeable guide. Being a proficient cyclist is a definite advantage for this tour, (as indeed would having two or three extra pairs of eyes) to be able to cope with the trams, buses, cars, scooters, pedestrians and other bikes coming from all directions! Great fun!

Don't miss out on this!!!. My husband and I took the countryside tour after three days in the city. It was a perfect way to end our visit in Amsterdam. Our friends did the city tour and highly recommended 'WE Bike'. So glad they did! Thijs is an excellent guide, very knowledgeable and fun to be with. You just can't leave Amsterdam without a countryside tour. It was the best.

For the love of bikes, do this tour . We had a wonderful time on this tour, led by Els. Amsterdam is such a bike-friendly city, it's a must do to hop on one yourself. We were able to learn more about the city's history, the architecture and see some amazing sites including the beautiful Vondelpark and riding through the Rijksmuseum. The tour stopped for a small meal/snack break to keep us going and learn more about our fellow travellers. Everyone was friendly and easy going, highly recommend this tour

Highly recommended; fun and informative. Jasper led us through a lovely tour of his home town, warm and knowledgeable and kind, catering for everyone's needs interests and styles. Best thing we did in Amsterdam and that's high praise because we loved so much that we did there.

Great countryside tour. I really enjoyed the countryside tour. It's a good workout but never strenuous. The 4 hours flew by. The countryside is peaceful and lovely, and it was nice to get some info on how the area changed as the dikes were built. The apple pie partway through was a nice treat, very tasty.FYI - our guide mentioned in passing that the best time to do a city tour is Sunday morning when the streets are less crowded. Seems like excellent advice. I don't think I'd want to brave the busy streets as an Amsterdam newbie and try to keep together with the group all at once.

Fantastic Tour. Great tour of Amsterdam with an extremely friendly and knowledgeable woman guide. Half way through the 3 hour tour we stopped for a beer and some food. I am disappointed I didn't have time for the countryside tour. Highly highly recommend.

A Great Way to Tour the City. There are more bikes in Amsterdam than autos which is why you must tour the city on two wheels. Although not for the faint of heart when it comes to dodging hundreds of other bikes, motor scooters, trams or cars, our guide Else did a fantastic job keeping us safe, together and educated about the various parts of the city and the history. Make sure to talk to your bike mates. They usually come from all over the world and have wonderful tales to tell. Highly recommended.

Informative, fun, not too strenuous city tour. I went on this tour with my 18 year old son. I haven't been on a bike in about 15 years, but it turns out you really don't forget how to do it! It was a great introduction to Amsterdam and the biking culture there. Thijs was our guide, and he explained many things about Amsterdam, including some architectural features that we had wondered about (all those hooks, the sloping buildings, etc.) Plus we got to see Dam Square - which we hadn't yet visited - cycle through the Vondelpark (beautiful!) and through the Rijksmusuem. The tour had occasional breaks to show some courtyards and other interesting highlights, so we didn't bike the whole time. Thijs is very knowledgeable and relaxed, and it was a very comfortable, enjoyable tour. Amsterdam is a very flat city (other than the bridges!) which makes for easy biking. A good part of the tour was spent along the canals and side streets which were not super packed with people, which made for a very enjoyable, easygoing ride. I definitely recommend this tour!

Just a great activity in Amsterdam!. We enjoyed the 3 hours city tour very much ! Lots of places you would not see otherwise, top-guide who offers lots of information on all of them and overall the right pace. Good bikes..! One of our favourite acitvities of 3 days Amsterdam ! Thumbs up!

Fun countryside tour. I am not a cyclist, but my husband is. We booked the countryside tour last minute and I was worried because I am not athletic in the least. But I had a great time. The pace was not strenuous and the day was perfect and picturesque. Tijse was full of interesting facts and really proud of his country without being jingoistic. We saw dikes, small towns, farms and the obligatory windmill. Tijse also steered us in the right direction by recommending a great laid back Indonesian restaurant and a fun outdoor drinking place with a great view of the City (although we clearly were the oldest people and only tourist there). I only wish we had more time with him in the city because I'm sure it would be entertaining and informative. I highly recommend the tour and Tijse.

Willem is awesome. Lovely small group of 7 internationals toured around by Willem who took us to secret, usually inaccessible spots steeped in history and significance. Also stopped for a beer in a beautiful neighbourhood. Very safe riding for all levels. Thank you for a great time :)
Great tour, very knowledgeable guide.. Just finished the countryside tour with Jasper as our guide. What a great day! A beautiful ride. Jasper is very knowledgeable and so friendly and helpful.

Great tour, lots of fun!. My wife and I went on a tour with Jasper, the tour guide. Great overview of the city, enjoyed getting started biking, and the group we were with was fun. Jasper is a fantastic guide, personable and interesting, with a great sense of humor. We found it a good value with really nice people

Great time for the family. Had a fun 4 hour ride out into the country with Jasper today. Our family of 4 enjoyed it very much. Stopped half way through and ate apple pie and had a beer. Talked different places around the word with Jasper and our small group of 8, talked football, beers, etc. Jasper kept an easy pace and provided several stops with history and interesting details about the dikes and surroundings. He also provided some great tips on restaurants afterwards.

Very enjoyable. Philip took us and another family of four across the ferry and into the countryside for a four hour tour. If you are a reasonably fit person, you should enjoy this 30km cycle ride. Very impressed with Philip who was a charming guide and very easygoing. He was considerate towards a fellow cyclist who struggled somewhat and helped to arrange her transport back to her hotel when she realised that she couldn't continue. On the next day, we were able to hire bikes via Jasper and Philip's assistance for five euros below the set price and spent another 3 hours cycling with confidence around the city and local parks. Would definitely recommend this company.

Countryside tour. So much fun! Small group of 10 led by Charlotte. (Be aware, the country tour leaves in a different location than the city tour) Easy to ride bikes, no helmet required. We took a free ferry to the countryside and biked along beautiful canals, farms, cows, .... Ate delicious pie at family owned restaurant (less than $5), saw oldest windmill, met lovely people. Very professional, well planned.
Fun!. Frank was a great guide! Worth the $$. Recommend doing the tour before heading out on your own so you can really appreciate Amsterdam!
Lovely morning biking around. Had a lovely morning biking around with We Bike Amsterdam. Interesting to visit not the biggest tourists attractions, but non the least still very important places.

Great alternative. what a great way to discover Amsterdam. Frank our guide was very informative. Saw all the hidden jems of city. Safe and easy even for 60plus travellers! Picked this trip from previous Trip Advisor recommendations

Fantastic and informative . Thank you Phillip for a really good historical tour of Amsterdam today. The whole family really found it informative and fun. Great introduction to the city. Highly recommend you and looking forward to the countryside tour next time.

Great way to explore Amsterdam. We love to do Bike tours. We did it in Paris, London, Sydney and now in also in Amsterdam. We did expect a bit more of the Highlights of the city, and our tour was more an "off the beaten path" kind of a tour. We did enjoy it very much, but still we would have loved a few more highlights of the city in it. The lady guide was very friendly an knowledgeable. The bikes could have been better. Most of the bikes had some small problems, and that in The Netherlands! We expected more of it, but did enjoy. Yes we still recommend this tour. Just make sure that you get the city highlights on an other tour.

Bike the countryside, you won't be disappointed. Jasper, one of the owner's of the company, was our tour guide for our bike through the countryside. He kept a leisurely pace, made stops to explain the little towns we were in, or the dams to be seen, and just provided for a fantastic experience. It is beautiful north of Amsterdam, quaint and quiet, do yourself a favor and if you have 3 or more days in Amsterdam, get to the countryside and enjoy it. I was smiling and having fun the whole time and really loved this bike tour (which was my first ever).

Don't even think about doing yr own tour. We did a city bike tour for 3 hours today & Williams was our tour guide (or was it Vincent) and it was really good, we would never have been able to find our way around all the places we went to today on our own, we learnt so much & covered so much ground. If you are debating if to do yr own thing or a tour, we definitely recommend We bike Amsterdam save looking at maps, getting lost & the frustrations. We had a small group of 7 of us.

Great time even in the rain. We met our guide (Jasper) in Dam Square who then lead are assembled group to the bike shop. Yes it was raining on and off but as they said on the web site, you can sit inside or join them for fun. It was an easy 3 hour bike tour through the heart of Amsterdam. Our guide was well informed and easy going. He took over peddling the bike with the child seat to make it easier and more enjoyable for the mother. We enjoyed a mid-ride stop for coffee as well.In all this was a great bike tour and easy for anyone.

We Biked Amsterdam!. This is a fantastic way to see the city and really get around to some of the neighborhoods. Our tour guide was Charlotte and she met our group at the assigned spot. Bit of a walk back to the shop to get outfitted on our bikes. Pace was good considering that there were 12 or so of us following. I will say that we did this tour on a Sunday morning- so it wasn't too trafficky- yet. As the morning progressed, things did pick up. Amsterdam is a bike city- and people are aggressive on their bikes- so you do need to be prepared for that- especially if you are with kids or someone who isn't quite as comfortable on a bike. Also- they don't wear helmets. So- be aware of that as well as you don't get a helmet on this tour. I would definitely recommend. Tour guide was very knowledgeable and we learned and saw a lot in a fun, comfortable way.

Great cycle tour. This was a great cycle tour, very relaxed and not rushed like some tours can be. The guide was knowledgeable and experienced and took care to ensure everyone was keeping up. It was all very flat and it was easy to cycle around with someone who knew where they were going. He shared a lot of information about the area and showed us some less known sites in Amsterdam which was great as you can do the big tourist attractions on your own easily without a guide. I would recommend this small group tour, if we had more time I definitely would have gone and done the country tour as well.

Excellent tour...if your BRAVE! . Our tour guide, Julia was informative and engaging! We Being from the US (and not bike crazed Seattle), the riding was a bit intense! Not hard, but stressful as we aren't accustomed to this type of traffic: trains, pedestrians, scooters, and assertive cyclists!

Thumbs up for both countryside and city tours. I did the countryside tour with my family including my wife with very little bike experience and 2 teenage girls who are not avid bicyclists. Everybody enjoyed it as the flat surfaces made for a relaxing ride even for inexperienced bicyclists. As mentioned in other reviews, it was really an experience seemingly a worlds away from Amsterdam. Our biggest memories was happy cows! Thijs was really good with combining substantial history and cultural information at various stops along the way. I enjoyed so much that I decided to take the city tour the next day. My family didn't join me (went to Van Gogh Museum instead) as they were concerned about traffic in Amsterdam. Although many parts of Amsterdam look scary for inexperience riders, this tour took a path that didn't have any intimidating parts. Jasper was energetic and really educated us about Amsterdam and the Dutch Culture. Really put a lot of things together. It was a rainy day, but that didn't seem to matter. Took a little longer coffee break and Jasper just extended the time so we covered everything. Been on many city bike tours and this one is definitely top notch!

Perfect for our family (group city tour). We are not new to biking, but were intimated by the many, many cyclists in Amsterdam and all of the lanes in the city, etc. The tour started off along very quiet streets and Phillip showed us some very interesting spots. We stopped about every 5 - 10 minutes at first which was a great way to get our confidence up, and learn about the city. Before long, we were all biking along with ease for much longer stretches, including my 11 year old daughter. Beautiful tour of one of the parks, nice break for drinks, lots of information about the city. Don't worry about your confidence biking in this city ... Phillip cycles at your pace and makes sure everyone is safe. Bring some money for drinks and a bit to tip him at the end. Nice that bikes are included with the rental. They only have 3 speeds because it is so flat. I stayed in 2nd gear the entire time. I booked on-line a day in advance, and there was my family of 5, plus 2 others and the guide. A nice sized group! Thank you, We Bike Amsterdam!

Great way for one day entertainment. Well organized, reasonably priced, good cycles, pleasant routes and nice coffee pause during tour. About 30 km's but not really anything that would stress any human being in somewhat normal physical condition, because there are practically no uphills.Guide Jasper.

Excellent!. My husband & I did hire a private tour around the city by bike and it's a great experience, a relaxing tour with beautiful scenery of the countryside. Guide was so nice, friendly and informative!

Relaxing ride through the countryside. We booked our tour through Hotelscooters located across from Central Station. This informative cycling tour through the beautiful countryside was a great way to see small villages, dikes and dams. Even though the small ferry shut down early on the day of our tour, Thijs took us on an alternate route that we all enjoyed. This tour runs rain or shine and plastic rain ponchos will be handed out if required.

Great tour!. I really enjoyed myself on this tour. Great way of seeing the sights and learning things about Amsterdam I didn't know. Bikes were comfortable and easy to ride. Jasper was a great guide and had lots of anecdotes which made the tour really fun. He also gave us lots of recommendations of other things to see and do as well as restaurants. Definitely a worth while trip.

Professional business with a variety of options. We did two completely different tours this week with We Bike Amsterdam. Both were very good! The first was around the city and surrounding suburbs with Philip as our guide. He was very professional, knowledgable and friendly. We learnt about the development of different areas over the centuries and some of the city's history through trading, fires and religion etc.Charlotte was our guide to Northern Amsterdam countryside on our second tour. We rode out along dykes to Holysloot where many of us enjoyed some divine apple pie or other homemade cakes and drinks at our peaceful rest stop. We also stopped at the very old village of Ransdorp where we climbed the bell tower of the old church, and one of our final stops was at a unique windmill. Charlotte was mindful of the varying experiences among our riders and showed lots of patience and gave clear instructions.The riding on both tours was quite easy and Charlotte and Philip spoke excellent English so it was easy to have our questions answered along the way and receive suggestions at the end of out tours. The bikes were sturdy and included three gears, a back rack with ties and key locking systems. The two meeting points were well explained and the booking process clear and simple.

Countryside Tour with Jasper. I had an AMAZING experience on this bike tour. It was everything I hoped for and more. I truly felt like I got an authentic tour of North Amsterdam and the countryside! It was full of all sorts of interesting facts and breathtaking views. From riding cute little ferries to biking through fields of green and cow pastures to eating fresh apple pie, this tour was by-far the highlight of my trip! Jasper was incredibly knowledgeable about the city and had a great sense of humor! He made the tour loads of fun. Not to mention, our group was the perfect size (around 12 people). I would highly recommend touring with We Bike Amsterdam! I will definitely tour with them again when I am back in town.

Countryside tour . Booked the country side tour the morning of and found our way to the bike place near central station. Our bikes were adjusted and explained and off we went in a group of 8.We were a little worried about cycling for 4 hours, but it was very flat and easy going. A few stops along the way to hear about the history, and have a coffee and a piece of pie! Unfortunately, there is a point where we had to take a little ferry and the operator decided he'd had enough for the day, but this didn't phase our guide and we circled back a different way and still had a lovely tour. Overall it was a really nice experience, the nice weather helped too!

Great overview of city. When in Amsterdam do what the locals do - ride a bike. We saw lots of hidden gems, took a break at an awesome cafe, and guide was very knowledgeable. she had a passion for her city and stopped at places most tours rode by. Highly recommend.
You haven't done Amsterdam without getting on a bike!. Thijs took a pretty good-sized group for an awesome tour around the city...it gave us enough confidence to rent bikes and strike out on our own!

Relaxing. My husband and I did our We Bike Amsterdam Tour with Jasper who was a great guide with a lot of knowledge and helpful eating out information. The tour was very relaxing and beautiful countryside that you wouldn't believe existed if you only stayed in Amsterdam City. The tour was approximately 30kms long but completely flat so easy riding. I would thoroughly recommend this tour to get away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam and see a different side. Thank you Jasper for a great tour

Great tour of the city, but scary at times!. My husband and I booked the 3 hour City Tour and really enjoyed it. Frank was our tour guide and he was informative and took us to places that we never would have visited on foot. He gave us a thorough history of the city. A few things to note (these aren't necessarily negative aspects of the tour, but things that I think they're worth mentioning):-I've been on some bike tours that stop frequently for photo-ops. This tour is primarily biking with just a few stops. I wasn't bothered by it because we did the tour at the beginning of our stay and used it to help us decide which places to revisit. -Be warned that the traffic in Amsterdam is very intimidating depending on where you are from. I almost got hit by a train, but that seems to be a common occurrence there! I'm from California where we have very strict laws for pedestrians and cyclists, so it was difficult at times to navigate people and bikes coming from all directions at all times. Again, that is no fault of the company. But I do feel like it's worth noting that biking in that city isn't always leisurely (though there were parts that were relaxing!). -If you aren't a somewhat experienced biker, a bike tour may not be a good idea for you. There were a couple of girls on our tour that really struggled because they couldn't get on and off the bikes quickly and they couldn't navigate the tight spaces. It is fun if you can ride a bike, but stressful if you cannot!

Yes! Just bike it! :-). We, a family of 4, booked the 3 hour city tour as well as the 4 hour countryside tour. It was a great way to explore Amsterdam and its surroundings. Both guides, Thijs and Jasper are great, very friendly and they had a lot to tell about the history of this city. It was an amazing experience. Thank you again!! We gladly recommend these tours to everyone visiting Amsterdam. Just bike Amsterdam! :-) Judith, Patrick, Julian and Michelle

Very nice tour. We had a country tour, which unfortunately included some rain. Jasper was prepared with practical (if not fully stylish) disposable rain gear. The ride was easy and flat, and took us to some lovely countryside. Although for tourists, this is not your typical touristy cheese maker, clog maker cycling tour (which I've been on before). I really enjoyed the pace and the sights. The bikes were sturdy and three-gears (plenty for this countryside). Would highly recommend.

Fantastic city and countryside tour. Did my city tour with Julia and countryside tour with Jasper earlier this month. Included this only in last minute of the trip but it was quite easily arranged by Thijs. Both the tour guides were excellent and knowledgeable. They really did show some hidden gems of Amsterdam which would have gone unnoticed easily. I enjoyed the vondelpark bit of the city tour and whole lot of country side tour for its amazing views! If u have spare day time and want to explore Amsterdam on a bike then we bike Amsterdam is the choice worth making.

City Bike Tour. After enjoying my first city bike tour in Berlin last year I thought booking with 'We Bike Amsterdam' would be the ideal introduction to the city for my family. I'd read some really positive reviews on Trip Advisor so we booked in advance online, which was quick and easy. We arrived at the meeting point in Dam Square at 10am where we met Julia, who was our guide for the day. After a short walk we collected our bikes and we were on our way. Amsterdam is such an interesting city with wonderful architecture and a fascinating history, which Julia really brought it to life for us. We visited lots of significant points of interest as we navigated our way around the vibrant city streets. The 3 hour city tour went by in a heartbeat and the smiling faces of my wife and children said it all. I couldn't give this tour a higher recommendation and would say it's a must for anyone visiting Amsterdam for the first time. A big thank you to the charming Julia, and to her colleagues Jasper and Thijs, for making our first day so memorable.

Wonderful Countryside Experience. I went solo on the Countryside tour today. We ended up as a group of 5, myself and 2 couples. Jasper is very knowledgeable, and very kind! He lent me his hoodie as I was ill prepared for rain. We had delicious apple pie on a stop that I definitely recommend! The location was super close to central station which is great. The pace was excellent and the bikes were nice. Very wonderful experience and absolutely recommend.

Excellent Tour Guide revealed the Unknown Amsterdam. My husband and I went on the 3 hour city today today with Julia. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour which was a lovely way to see the city. Julia was very informative and thoughtful to ensure we all felt safe crossing roads and answering any questions we had. She was very engaged and a pleasure to spend time with. The entire experience from book in to your was very professional and excellent value for money.

Country Tour was wonderful!. My husband and I were visiting Amsterdam, staying in the center of the hustle and bustle that is the city - cars, bikes, and people everywhere. While my husband attended his conference one day I decided to take a bike tour of the countryside. I had some reservations about doing this tour because of the long distance and going by myself. Even though I was last in the line during some portions, I kept up and didn't feel like I was slowing anyone down. So even if you're not very fit, or an avid biker, you can do this ride. And going alone worked out just great because my co-riders were also happy to be there and very friendly. Frank, our guide, set the tone for a fun, comfortable ride for everyone. He stopped or slowed whenever someone needed to, or when there was a cool spot to talk about. Amsterdam bikers are a brave, steady bunch, and I was shaky when we were pedaling the few blocks on the busy streets to get to the ferry and out of the city, but even that part went smoothly! I highly recommend this group and its country tour if you want to get a good look at the "real" Nederland - villages, farms, an old windmill tucked unexpectedly along the bike path, and to learn a bit about the history/geography of the area.

Bike tour. We did the 3 hour Amsterdam bike tour with Luke. It was an amazing tour - very informative, the hidden gems of Amsterdam. The group was small in size and we biked at a leisurely pace with stops as Luke tools us about Amsterdams history. Highly recommended.

Delightful bike tour in the country north of Amsterdam city center.. The tour was exactly as advertised - it was lovely to see the country, ride atop the dams and view the waterways and farmlands. Our tour guide Phillip was knowledgeable and very personable and maintained a comfortable speed for everyone in the group. We had a welcomed coffee stop in the middle of the tour, where it was nice to get to know our guide and fellow travelers and enjoy a delicious piece of apple pie! I would definitely recommend this tour for cyclists of basically any level - the route is really flat.

Great bike tour. My husband and I took the countryside bike tour and it was very good. It was 30km, but at a very relaxed pace. We took the free ferry to the other side of the 'lake' and rode a large loop out to the countryside through a number of small towns, along the dikes, and through the working farm areas. Nice stops at a cafe, a windmill, and a few other brief pauses along the way. Very nicely organised!

Great way to see the Dutch country side.. My daughter and I did a countryside tour. We were given a discount because we had our own bikes. Our tour guide was super nice and down to earth. Beautiful ride! I highly recommend doing this!

Lovely bike tour . Me and my boyfriend decided to go on the 3 hour bike tour of the backstreets and hidden gems in Amsterdam. The tour guide (Thijs?) was extremely friendly and knew his stuff. It was interesting to learn about the history of the city and also get away from the crowded touristy areas whilst seeing the under-appreciated spots of Amsterdam. I would extremely recommend their bike tours if you are visiting the city and you are only there on a short break. It was the highlight of our time there.

Great tour!. We did the tour with Julia - she was patient and friendly, and very knowledgable about the city. There was no rush, she was calm in guiding 9 tourists on bikes in Amsterdam (no mean feat!), and used all opportunities to educate us on Dutch traditions and history. Would happy recommend!

Amazing Tour of countryside - highly recommend. I did this 4 (almost 5 hour) bike trip into the countryside with my 19 year old son. It did take the better part of one of our 3 days in Amsterdam, but it was the highlight of the trip for both of us. Just 10 mins outside of the city, the scenery changes so much and it was wonderful to see. Our tour guide was Jasper, what a wonderful, friendly, laid back and helpful person. We highly recommend this trip. While biking experience is not strictly necessary, it is helpful in navigating the busy city streets for the first part of the trip and there is a small stretch of somewhat strenuous pedaling in the countryside. Overall, a must do on your trip if time permits!

A great start to a great day.. The countryside tour took us outside of Amsterdam and surprised us with a fresh feel of the area. The guide was nice and the views were great but the tour was a bit overpriced for what it had to offer. You could do some research and rent a bike to take the trip yourself!

Great tour in Jordann, west and Vondelpark. 3 hours of a great tour... the guide Thijs explains clearly the historical issues of different point of interest. We biked through Jordann, then kept south west to a nice and quite neighborhood, stop for a coffee and continue to Vondelpark. The guide stops frequently to enter buildings of interest during the visit... I recommend.

Best bike tour ever! A must do!. We had such an amazing experience. Thijs, the owner, took us on an all day bike tour of Edam, Volendam, and Marken. OK, so we are a bit more experienced cyclists, but you don't have to be amazing, just have endurance for an all day ride. The best part was spending time with a local who knew everything about the Netherlands and is such a pleasure to be around. They keep their tours smaller and that is so rare these days. Truly a must do, however long you go for!

Great Bike Tour. We did a bike tour in July. The tour was fantastic and our guide was great. I highly recommend this tour. Although the streets are hard to navigate, the tour went through a lot less crowded streets. Glad we did this tour.

Fabulous Day!. We took the countryside tour with Charlotte and it was a highlight of our visit to Amsterdam. Great to get out of the city for a while & bike without worrying about busy city traffic. Charlotte was a great guide and patient with all riders. We even got to go up inside a windmill! I would give a caution parents of very young children (10 or under) is that while the route is relatively flat, the bikes are heavy and everyone is expected to keep up with the group.

Countryside Tour - My Favorite Experience in Amsterdam!. I absolutely LOVED the countryside tour by "We Bike Amsterdam." It was my favorite activity/tour that I did on my trip. Being that it was my first time to Amsterdam, I wanted to see as much as I could. I took a walking city tour, two canal tours by boat and this biking tour. Well, this biking tour was my favorite! I really enjoyed getting out of the city for a while and seeing such beautiful countryside. You get to go through quaint little villages and stop at this great cafe for coffee/tea and apple pie.One of the things I liked most about the bike trip was the camaraderie with the other bikers. I got to meet and get to know all of the other bikers - a young woman from England, a young woman from Israel, a family from Seattle, Washington, a couple from Australia, and a mother/daughter from Canada. It is a great bonding experience and a way to be a part of a 'community' while abroad. Also, Philip, our guide was fantastic. I highly recommend this bike tour!!!

Ride it like you stole it!. Okay, just kidding, the tour was not reckless and fast, but the feeling of owning the road on a bike like the locals was appealing - not gonna lie. Luke took us through all the nooks an crannies of Amsterdam, stopped often enough as not to lose any of the travellers and made sure we had a refuelling stop part way through for caffeine addicts and full bladders. We went to historic sites, shopping districts, museum / concert hall site and a beautiful oasis of a park. There was just enough history, expertly delivered with humour and we saw a few new places we decided to return to after the tour was done. The bikes are all very comfortable and new and we would recommend seeing Amsterdam with We Bike.

Different way to experience Amsterdam. How can you not cycle when you are in Amsterdam? This tour offers a different way to see Amsterdam. We went north of the city and our guide Jasper was very kind and helpful. This is not a particular adventurous cycling tour but if you want something relaxing and something to take you away from the city, this tour is a good option. If this tour can be more informative, it'd be even better.

Highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. We had done a boat tour which was good, but the bike tour enables you to see so much more. Our guide Phillip was excellent and very knowledgeable. I was a bit worried at first as I am not a very confident cyclist, but the bikes were great and it was fine as it was all quite relaxed.

Best way to see Amsterdam. A fun active way to see one of the world's best cities. Our guide Anna was outstanding and shared many neat stories about the history of Amsterdam. The ride was easy, the bikes comfortable and we felt very safe. Worth every penny "Dankje Well!"

Countryside tour. We had a great trip with them! To add to what other people have said, a couple tips for people who do the countryside tour:- the cafe they usually stop at isn't open on Mondays. If you go on Monday, you won't have this mid trip stop. Consequently, definitely bring a snack and some water. There is a grocery store right near the bike shop. - put on sunscreen. On a beautiful day you could easily get burned. - wear sneakers. Part of the tour includes biking a well ridden path in a field. Since it's a well ridden path, it's a bit muddy. It's neat to bike through it, but I was also so glad I had sneakers on. - they don't stop as much as other bike tours. You are encouraged to stop when you want to take pictures and they'll slow down so you can catch up, but this tour spends more time biking than some other bike tours. Personally, I really appreciated that!Also, when you are done you get a great email with restaurant recommendations. Recommended!

The best way to see the city!. This was a very relaxed and fun tour. Our guide Anne was amazing, very knowledgable and well spoken. She gave lots of great tips and recommendations for everything awesome in Amsterdam.
