This is a great way to get to get to know the city if you are just arriving or if you want to see all the major attractions and many hidden gems. Also, the apple pie was fantastic. Thanks Anne!

Great overview of the city!. We did a bike tour with Anne, and it was fantastic! She was so knowledgable about the the city, and provided a great overview of the history. The coffee stop along the way was lovely too, as we got to know the people on the tour with us. The company was very well organized, and sent a great email afterwards with ideas of things to do and where to eat in the city. I would highly recommend it!

When in Rome.......... In a city where cyclists are at the top of the food chain; what better way to have a look around than on two wheels. So on a bright and sunny Sunday morning my two sons.(aged 11 and 14) and I set off for a city tour that was wonderfully led by Jasper from We Bike Amsterdam. And what an interesting and informative tour it was, not just the "typical" tourist sites but some cool spots off the beaten track, coupled with great bikes, suitability for all abilities (Even my youngest who is usually as active as a sloth enjoyed it) and just a really pleasant way to spend three hours. Highly recommended to anyone who fancies something a bit different to do in this Great city.
Fun and enjoyable. Wonderful afternoon spent biking in Amsterdam with friends and family. Not too difficult and worth the time to see many parts off the beaten track.

The best way to see Amsterdam city centre. Highly recommended. The tour takes in many of the less-famous historical and cultural landmarks and sights of Amsterdam. The tour guide was superbly well informed, and we learned a lot about Amsterdam that we might not have learned otherwise. After the tour We Bike Amsterdam sent a really helpful email, listing some sights and restaurants that they recommend: a lovely touch. All in all a great experience - thanks guys!

City Center Bike tour. Had a great time cycling around the west side of Amsterdam (Note: you don't go to the east of the city center at all). Anne was our guide and she definitely made the tour. Her energy, excitement and passion for the history of the city is evident and makes the tour super enjoyable. Would highly recommend this tour - a great way to see the sights of Amsterdam/learn about the history like a local would (on a bike)

Perfect cycling for an overview of A'dam. We looked for a 3-hour bike tour at the last minute and only We Bike Amsterdam had availabilities. I went with my teenage son and it was just perfect. The service was super efficient, they managed to get me a shorter bike. The group size of 10 was just right and the guide, Anne was quite knowledgable and rather funny. We really enjoyed her story-telling of the history of the various sites. We had a great time and it's recommended if you're after a short overview of Amsterdam on a bike.

We bike Amsterdam City Tour with Anne. We did a city tour with Anne and she was amazing!!! She was knowledgeable friendly, patient, and she explained the diverse history extremely well. This group was easy to find in the meet up, easy to schedule with and Very organized! We highly recommend!

Great experience!. Did the "hidden gems" tour in the city and enjoyed every moment thereof! The guides are super friendly and really helpful in giving further advice on places to see and things to do. Loved the bits of history on the tour!

Best way to see the countryside!. Bike tours are one of the best ways to explore a new town!! Our group had recently been on a city bike tour in Paris, so we opted for the countryside tour while in Amsterdam. Thijs was a great host, friendly and informative. It was an 18 mile tour, which at first concerned a few in our group, but it was a casual ride, with stops along the way, and the weather was beautiful. In the end, it was an easy enough ride, did not feel too long, and we got to see the beautiful little villages and farms outside the city. About half way we stopped at a restaurant for authentic Dutch apple pie and coffee that were amazing! In our group of 3 adults and 5 teenagers, everyone said this was there favorite of everything we did in Amsterdam.

highly recommended!!!!!!. Philip and Thijs were so kind and the beautiful views on the way were amazing!We got into places with beautiful roads, a different way to see the outside of Amsterdam!Definitely come back again with my husband.Thanks a lot for everything!!!

great time!. We had a great afternoon doing the countryside tour with Frank! A quick ride to the ferry and within minutes of city life, we were biking through quaint villages and beautiful countryside! Biked past lots of animals, learned about the importance of dikes, saw windmills and got lots of fresh air! Great thing to do to break up your trip! We did this with my 10 and 13 year old kids.

Fabulous day in Amsterdam by bike. Being that Amsterdam is a city of bikes I felt the best way to see the country side was by bike. I chose this Bike Tour company because it was small and catered to small groups which I prefer.It was a great day as we biked outside of the city ....beautiful scenery...stopped at a cute little cafe where you could have either a beer..apple pie..coffee or just relax. Jasper was our guide and was so pleasant and knowledgeable about his country.The ride lasted 4 hours and wish I could have also taken the City tour.This is a MUST if you want nice memories of Amsterdam.

Fun!. I wanted to see the countryside and given that Amsterdam is a biking city it was a no-brainer to book a bike tour. The tour was about 4-5 hours and approx. 30 km. Pretty flat terrain so an easy bike ride. All of your focus and energy was on the scenery. The guide was great and the whole experience was well worth my time and money.You start off by their shop near the train station. Then you have a short ferry ride over the river and then the real ride begins. Our group of 12 "followed the leader" through quaint villages, through farms and by the "sea side." It was beautiful. Our guide stopped us every so often to give us some history of the area. About half way through the trip we stopped at this cute little outdoor restaurant for about 20-30 minutes. They are known for their apple pie - they serve food and drinks as well. You pay for whatever you order (pie was about 4.5 euros, sodas/coffee 2.25 euros - bring cash). We continued the ride (it was a large loop so you didn't really see the same thing twice until you got to the ferry). We did stop at one of the few remaining windmills in Amsterdam and our guide explained to us how they worked and how they were used. Interesting. A great day!As a side note, there was someone on our ride who had done the city bike tour the day before. She loved it so much that she booked this countryside tour for the very next day. I'll need to do the city tour next time I'm in Amsterdam.

City Tour w/Philip was Excellent!. This was a great way to get acclimated to the city, and a great introduction to what would be a full week of cycling with and among Amsterdamers. I researched all the other bike tour options in Amsterdam and was very happy to have chosen We Bike Amsterdam for the City Tour. The bikes were great, and super comfortable. Philip was a wonderful tour guide. He was very positive and very passionate about his city, and full of great information and interesting tidbits. I met really nice, friendly people on the tour. The group size was perfect. Highly recommend!

See the Dutch countryside. We did the countryside tour, Frank was the guide for a small group of around 12. The tour was nicely set out, a short ferry ride then we cycled for around an hour and a half with a few stops. The halfway stop was a cute little cafe where we had apple pie. Then we headed back towards the ferry with a couple more stops. I enjoyed the tour and Frank told us some interesting stories but I thought there could have been a few more stops to take photos and appreciate the countryside. The stop at the cafe was very long- around an hour, this was partly due them being very slow with the bill. I understand that's not really the tours fault but I would think perhaps they would have it a bit more down pat if the tour stops there regularly. If you like cycling and want to get away from all the craziness of Amsterdam this tour is a good option. However, there is definitely some room for improvement, hence the 4 out of 5.

Countryside Tour. I went with my husband and friend on this tour as it was rated high on "Things to do in Amsterdam". I don't know if it was the weather (it rained throughout and poured at one point), the tour route or both but we weren't really "WOW"ed. The countryside was great to see but we really couldn't enjoy it because of the rain. We did stop at the windmill and the villages (mentioned on the site) and our guide gave us great information on them. We crossed the bridges and dikes but thought we would get some more information/background on them other than riding across them. The half way stop was needed as that was right after the pouring rain. The spot was really cute and the apple pie was excellent! At the end of the tour we rode for 45mins non-stop, we were thinking that there had to be at least 1 more stop on the way back but it was just riding. The tour overall was just OK, we are glad we did it because it showed a different side of Amsterdam but we really were expecting to see and hear more. The bikes were great and comfy (18.5 miles can be hard on ones bottom!) and the staff were excellent & knowledgeable.

Loved the countryside tour!. My partner and I did the countryside tour and loved it! Our guide Frank was very friendly and knowledgeable - there were plenty of stops where he gave us historical information and time for photos, but it never felt like we were stopping too often. There were 12 of us on the tour and Frank always made sure we were keeping up. The cafe stop in the middle of the tour was much appreciated and we loved the apple pie. Would recommend!

Awesome tour with Anne. I highly recommend this tour to anyone that wants to visit the city, it's an unique and typical experience and you will see most of the city.Our guide Anne was very nice and knowledgeable, she made this tour unique and we also had a lot of fun!!

Very informative and great craic. My partner and I did the city tour on our first morning in Amsterdam. Jasper was lovely, knowledgeable and really enjoyable to be around and chat to. Only wish we had time to do their country tour too as the tour was also really reasonably priced! Would definitely recommend.

Fun bike tour. We booked on to the 3 hour city bike tour had a great morning cycling around the city being told various stories of the local area. The pace and style of the tour was very relaxed and comfortable. Our tour guide was very friendly and answered any questions we had.

GREAT tour!. Absolutely great tour! We did the countryside tour and it was amazing! Highly recommend this for anyone wanting to see the countryside outside of Amsterdam. Our guide Frank was very knowledgeable and a great guide. The stop halfway was nice and if you like Apple pie definitely get a slice, it's huge and so good!

Family bike tour. We enjoyed this country side tour with 2 teenagers and the weather was perfect. We made a few stops to enjoy the scenery and coffee break. Thys was a very nice guide and explained the history of the little towns. He even took a few pictures of us in front of windmill and tower. Even though I was sore from being out of shape, I would definitely recommend this tour.

Memorable journey... and a physical workout!. My family went on the 4 hour countryside bike tour yesterday. We are in our 40's and our kids are teenagers. Our group was a total of 9 people and our guide was Thys. He was very kind and told us informative details about the history of Amsterdam. The weather was wonderful and we didn't need our jackets. It was a wonderful way to see what life outside the bustling "downtown" Amsterdam; however, at the end of our journey, our legs and knees were sore from the biking. At home, we do not go on long bike rides. We typically only bike within our neighborhood and have never biked 30 km before.The reservation process online was simple and the bikes were excellent quality. We were able to strap our jackets and purses to the bike. I wish we had brought a bottle of water since there were several stops where it would have been nice to have a sip of water. We did enjoy one long break at a cafe and enjoyed some apple pie.Overall, I recommend this tour as a fun way to see the non-touristy side of Amsterdam.

North Country Tour. Jasper guided our small group past the Centraal Station and across to Amsterdam Noord on the ferry where we enjoyed a very leisurely four hour bike ride outside of the bustling and crazy city and instead along enjoyable bike paths and through idyllic country villages. One break at a restaurant provided a snacking opportunity with some great apple pie. On the way back to the city we rode along the western side of Markermeer.

Great for our whole family. We booked a private countryside tour with Thijs and it turned out to be one of the best experiences of our vacation. Three generations biked together, ages 70, 69, 45, 41, 39, 38, 4, and 2. Thijs gladly accommodated the two children with seats on the back of the bikes. We stopped for lunch with outdoor seating, which was a nice break to let the children run around. The bikes are high-quality and work well. The terrain is flat enough that those who don't bike regularly could keep up. Very interesting to see the countryside, small towns, canals, dikes, and bike roads. A little bonus is the old windmill at the end of the tour. I recommend this company without hesitation!
Nice ride. My daughter and I did the half-day Countryside Group Tour--just the right length of time, our guide Jasper was very pleasant and knowledgeable. We highly recommend it.

A Fantastic Tour on a Beautiful Day!. I took the countryside tour. A really a great way to see the north side of Amsterdam - scenic water and countryside view along the way - truly enjoyable. Our tour guide was very helpful and brought up very interesting historical facts about the country. Highly recommended! Also the staff goes out of their way to be helpful - I asked for recommendations on local restaurants around the area - after our tour guide recommended a few places, later I also got an email from the tour operator with more local favorites.

Excellent activity. Highly recommend the country bike tour with Thys.Fun, insigthful and a great way to experience the area just outside of Amsterdam.Booked and paid online and all was as promised.You don't have to be super fit to do this.Go for it - you'll love it!

This was something I will always remember!. I booked this online the night before and ended up doing the Countryside tour with a family of 4 - with our guide we were a group of 6. They are conveniently located lear the Central Station.The entire tour took us through the country and some small, quaint towns. Completely un-touristy. It was great to see the dijks, rural farms, cows, the architecture and how people legitimately get around by bike. To see for such a long way (because it's so flat) is really amazing.It took about 4 hours, and although we stopped about halfway through for a coffee it didn't seem that long. It was an easy pace and our guide stopped every once in a while to take pictures or to show us something specific or noteworthy.Our guide - Thijs - was great. He set a good pace, he had a lot of interesting things to tell us and knows a lot about his country and its history. We had a good chance to chat with him during the coffee break and he was very personable. It was a really pleasant way to spend some time to get to know the country outside of Amsterdam. I can't recommend this tour group enough.

Haha.... this was amazingly fun. This was an all round tour and I will explain... We met at Dam square with our guides and were divided in small groups. Our group was 6 people (3 couples) and our tour guide was Svenja (hope I wrote the name well). We had a 5 min walk to the place that we rented the bike from(inc in the tour price) and we started off our journey. We had good, almost new bikes, and we followed our guide to various places around the city. We had a number of stops for our guide to explain to us the history and interesting facts about Amsterdam and its people. During our break we sat at a restaurant and had some coffee and a piece of apple pie. This were things got more interesting... we discussed everything from politics around the world, dutch habits, work, travel.... it was exceptionally fun and almost educational :) We continued on our tour and visited some other interesting places. We cycled back to the rent shop and delivered the bikes. I would say this was one of the most enjoyable things we did in Amsterdam. The pace of the tour was good, never rushed and our guide answered all our questions. And we asked a lot! All in all, well done Svenja! It was a pleasure

Great bike tour. Would thoroughly recommend this tour, we had a small group of 7 of us in total and Svenya showed us all around the different areas of the city. She had lots of knowledge of history, geography and culture and answered all of our questions. The bikes were good quality and we felt perfectly safe cycling around with Svenja leading the way. A great way to spend the morning and to see the city. Thanks Svenja!!

Great way to see the city. Customer service was excellent. We slept through our scheduled time despite that We Bike tried to contact us both by phone and email. They were happy to accommodate us the next day. It was a small group of six and we got some great insight into local life. Definitely a wonderful way to see the city.

Bike Tour of Amsterdam. We were lucky to take a bike tour of Amsterdam with Jasper. We've been to Amsterdam many times but never had the courage to hop on a bike there! The few hours were great and Jasper brought his city alive for us with his interesting facts and anecdotes! Thank you very much! We believe that you offer something completely different and special to the other larger, impersonal companies!Anyone looking for a great tour this is it! I would not hesitate!Sally, Terry, Louis and Hope

Excellent Tour. My wife and I loved this tour. I'm an avid cyclist, and my wife does not enjoy riding. She was worried coming into this that it would be beyond her fitness level, but found it to be very relaxing and fun. We did the 3 hour tour, and absolutely had a blast. Would highly recommend this to anyone in Amsterdam. It was our top tour during our 9 days in Europe.
Fantastic day out on the countryside tour. My husband and I loved this chilled out day cycling through the dutch countryside. Excellent tour guide and nice pace, really good value too. Thank you!
Great tour. We had the pleasure of riding with Philip our guide. He gave us loads of great info about the city. I would recommend anyone visiting to take the Theroux with WBA !!!

On your bike! . We (the 6) were rudely late for our 11:00 start countryside tour. Thijs (our guide) was understanding and by 11:18 we were on our modern and pristine bikes and ready to go. The weather was glorious and it was fantastic to start the tour with a quick ferry hop to north Amsterdam. Thijs gave us good, informative briefings on route, sights and history; other than that he left us to enjoy the ride and chat amongst ourselves. Highlights were the huge Dykes which we enjoyed riding. I personally never imagined I'd be riding a Dyke and it just goes to show you're never to old to try something new. We loved the traditional Dutch houses and pleasant farmland; I got a real sense of what Vincent van Gough himself set out to capture so vividly in his early forays with paint. After around 90 mins we pulled into a quaint little cafe for what was a delicious coffee and apple pie. Back on the bikes we found Herron; Dutch cattle and noisy frogs. The rolling pastures were welcome respite from urban Amsterdam. We crossed another, smaller canal on a tiny little boat. The boatswain was summonsed with the ringing of a bell at the jetty! Fabulous! After another hour or so we reached a magnificent working windmill! What a treat. We hopped back on the bikes for the final half hour ride back to catch the ferry. Our four hours (and c20 miles) flew by. Thijs is a great guide and Amsterdam by bike is a must. Our beers and dinner that night were well earned and appreciated. Although the country tour is suitable for anyone with basic fitness, our bottoms were a little sore the next day, but that's to be expected. Brilliant and highly recommended!

Enlightening. We are an active 60+ couple - have been to Amsterdam numerous times. This was our first bike tour in the city and it was excellent. We got away from the touristy parts of the city and saw real neighbourhoods. And fun to be with and follow a local. Didn't have to think about where we were going next.

Amazing country side tour. We took the country side tour, is was an amazing ride out of the cityThe guide was very nice and shared a lot of stories along the way.Highly recommended tour.One warning for the other un-fit potato coaches like me out there -You bike ~30km in this tour in ~4 hours, although it's a nice flat ride, it does pose some physical challenge.

Recommended bike tour. I attended this tour in late april and it was perfect and met my expectations. The bike was clean and in perfect condition. THe guide was excellent with the perfect amount of stops and information. Too bad it was only for 3 hours.
Worth every penny. We took the tour on our last day in Amsterdam, well worth it- amazing views!!Amazing guide, very helpful and made the trip interesting

A super time!. We did a 3-hour bike tour with Thijs and had a really great time. And since we couldn't find a bike for my younger daughter, I wound up carting her around in "the beast"! Took a bit of getting used to, but in the end we had a great time. Thijs really took care of us and gave us a pretty thorough but easily understandable history of Amsterdam. We also got to see things a bit off the beaten path, which we really enjoyed. Most important of all was that the kids had a super time!Thanks you We Bike Amsterdam and a special thanks to Thijs for giving us a great tour of Amsterdam!

Best activity in Amsterdam!. We did a 3+ hour bike ride with Jasper a few days ago and I have to say it was the best thing we did our entire time in Amsterdam and one of the best tours ever in Europe. Jasper was super knowledgeable with tons of insights into the history, sociology, and politics of the Dutch. This was much more than a bike tour, but a great cultural experience. A must do. Seriously. Do this. It will be the best part of your trip.

Phenomenal biking in the countryside!. Thijs led us on a 30 km leisurely ride north and east of Amsterdam. We would've gotten so lost if we'd tried this on our own! He was very personable and knowledgeable. We learned a lot about this below sea level country. And the villages built on the dikes are so charming. You will not be sorry if you book this tour!

Great time. Got lucky to choose this tour and also to have the best weather in Amsterdam.
The city is so beautiful and you get to see more on a bike than on foot. Ill come back and do it again!

Could not have been better!. My wife and I took the country side bike tour and really had a great time. The weather cooperated and the beautiful countryside made the time there truly special. We have done many bike tours and really enjoyed this one. If you are looking for things to do, put this at the top of your list.

Made our trip to Amsterdam Phenomenal. I can't say enough great things about the "We Bike Amsterdam" tour lead by Jasper. My wife and I agree that I was one of the best choices we made in our recent trip to Europe. Jasper is an extremely personable tour guide that shares with you information that is fun but yet informative. Our tour had a total of 9 people, which I think is perfect. Other larger tour companies often have 20+, which is difficult when you are riding bikes, and listening to information.I highly recommend booking this tour while visiting Amsterdam, and make sure you tour with Jasper!PS: There is also a tour that runs out of Paris, we did not do that one. If we had more time, we probably would have.

Fabulous countryside biking. We had a wonderful 4+ hour tour along the irrigation canals, dykes. through small adorable villages with perfect weather and Jasper as a superb guide at an easy pace. Can really recommend their countryside tour!

The highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. My two friends and I so enjoyed this tour. Another member of our group "chickened out" on the morning of the tour as she was nervous about cycling in Amsterdam but she needn't have been. Our guide was excellent and made sure we were happy and confident with the bikes which were in very good condition and easy to use, and he went over the safe way to ride a bike in Amsterdam. We saw so much of the city which you could never see on foot or on a canal trip and we stopped several times to be given information about the history of Amsterdam and about hidden places. I have done tours like this before and had to persuade my friends who both said it was the highlight of the weekend. I would even recommend this over a canal trip as you learn so much more and go round the tiny back streets as well as seeing the main sights. All in all it seemed a well run and organised company with professional staff who gave great customer service.

Great fun riding through the country side!. Had the best time on the tour with Thijs! We saw some gorgeous country side and learnt a bit about Amsterdam on the way. I have to admit I was slightly nervous about riding a bike for fours as I haven't been on a bike for some time, however the ride was really easy going. Pretty much completely flat the whole way, quiet country roads and bike paths made for an enjoyable ride. I highly recommend going with We Bike Amsterdam for your bike tour. The bikes are comfortable and in very good condition. Thijs is very friendly and a great tour guide, thank you! Hoping to visit Amsterdam again in the future and will certainly book the city tour!

choose this tour over the others. Like you, I read Tripadvisor reviews trying to decide between this the other tour bike tours in Amsterdam. I finally decided on We Bike Amsterdam because it is run by locals. Our guide was awesome and very patient with a few older folks in our group. The groups are small - we were 6. I did see the other tour companies that day and since I haven't taken their tours, I can't stay anything other than they weren't small groups. I would say the average size was about 20. Book with We Bike Amsterdam. You will be happy you did. Plus, the bikes were the most comfortable we had in all of our bike tours in Europe.

Great stories about Amsterdam!. As promised, the group size is limited and our initial large group was divided in two, each with our own guide. I was a little embarrassed having already rented a bike from a competitor (logistical reasons...closer to our hotel) just to get around the city, and I was put at ease in that regard, both through email and at the beginning of the tour. Charlotte did a fabulous job showing us the hidden gems of Amsterdam, sharing many interesting tidbits. At the end of that tour, she recommended areas that we could further explore. Later that day, we were pleasantly surprised to receive an email with favourite restaurants and bars, of which we were able to visit two before returning home. We have already recommended this tour to friends who were also visiting the city.

Best Bike tour!!. Thijs was an excellent bike tour guide! He cares about his customers and wants to show you the true Amsterdam. 4 of us took the 25mile countryside bike tour and LOVED it. The terrain is flat, bikes are comfortable and scenery is beautiful! We stopped at a quaint cafe for lunch and had fun brainstorming tour ideas. Thijs makes the tour fun and informative. We learned about the country way of life and the canal systems as well as saw animals, boats, and quaint villages. Don't miss this tour or the City tour!

Interesting and friendly. We did the city tour and were lucky to have a beautiful day. The tour with Jansen was very informative, some interesting stories about the city, friendly and we cycled at a comfortable pace, not too fast. Highly recommended.

Great day out. We had a great time on a tour with Jasper. It was a great way to get to know the city from the transportation level it's best known for! We got to know some interesting information and got to see hidden places and hear fun stories. Well done guys!

Countryside Bike Ride. My wife and I enjoyed a great bike ride with Jasper to the north of the city in the Countryside. Quiet cycle paths , beautiful views , great bikes , lots of information from Jasper and would highly reccomend.

An Amsterdam Must Do. As it turned out, being the only client, I had a solo tour. Getting one on one attention was an added bonus. Phillip was a knowledgeable and friendly tour guide. Though I'm a bicycle commuter in Portland, I was intimidated by Amsterdam's very fast bike traffic. Phillip put me at ease and the route was mostly very quiet. If you are able, seeing this wonderful city from a bicycle is a unique and thoroughly enjoyable experience. WBA gives you history, trivia, and the local perspective. And, you get a bit of exercise.

Best way to see the city!. If you got to Amsterdam you must go on this tour! Jasper was our guide and it was great to hear from someone with an excellent knowledge of the city, was the highlight of our visit

Fantastic if you do one thing in Amsterdam do this. This was a absolutely brilliant guided tour, I'm so pleased we booked. The famous sights are easy to find in this city but this tour gave us so much more. Jasper and ?Ingrid (sorry if that's wrong) showed us round Amsterdam and places we wouldn't have found on our own. It was like being part of the city and just what we wanted. He explained what it's like to live in the city and lots of stories and information. It was relaxed, great conversations and we throughly enjoyed ever minute. We loved the cafe and the tour through the park. We were so impressed after our tour we hired the bikes for the afternoon to do some of our own exploring. We wouldn't have done this without having been out with Jasper and Ingrid

Amazing!. Our tour guide was Tize (its not spelt that way!) I hadnt ridden a bike for 20 years, Im overweight and not fit at all. Tise made me feel very at ease. Before long I was feelign very confident on the bike. The guide was very good. Tize is knowledgable of Amsterdam culture and hstory, he is Dutch himself with excellent English, good people person and great sense of humour. A must!

Great way to see the city!. Tour started right on time. Bikes were in excellent condition and the day was beautiful. We had a 5 year old so I had a cabby bike (got me some time to get used too but my son truly enjoyed it). Our tour guide was Svena (I may be misspelling it) she was great, very knowledgeable of the city secrets. We learned so much about the past and present secrets of the city and increased our appreciation of the culture. We biked liked the locals in the #1 biking city of Europe and truly enjoyed it.

Countryside Tour. Just got home from our week in Amsterdam. Our countryside bike tour with WeBike and Thijs was certainly a highlight. Before we started Thijs explained the philosophy of the company he shares with his partner, Jasper. To offer folks a unique look of Amsterdam away from the Hop-On or Hard Rock viewpoint is the purpose of WeBike. It was just us for the day as we headed out on our bikes. It's been a while since we have ridden, and our bottoms definitely felt the outcome. But riding along the dikes and seeing several small villages on the outskirts of the big city was awesome. The day was windy but the rain held off for the 24km ride. We even went back the next day to try for the City tour, but we missed the start of it. Next time.

Look for Guide PHILIP! :) :). It was our first 1st time in Amsterdam and the We BIKE tour was the highlight of our trip! We were 8 in the group and although not all of us were expert bikers, the tour was managed very well.Our guide PHILIP was very very knowledgeable of the 'secret' tour spots and at the same time was very respectful of the people living around them. PLUS, during our coffee shop break Philip tried to accommodate every question that we had on where to go, how to get there and etc. :)Tourists from Manila :)

Highlight of Amsterdam visit. We (a family of two adults and two children) followed the Trip Advisor reviews and booked this tour as well as walking tour so we could see as many tourist sites as possible. Philip was our guide, a family of five joining us, and the pace, explanations and sites visited were as good as we could have imagined. The bikes were i very good order and time was taken to ensure that everyone was comfortable setting off into the back streets. We covered a surprising amout of distance for a relaxed pace and there was a welcomed break half way through. The weather was perfect for us, and this just added to this being the highlight of our holiday. Thanks to everyone, especially Philip (have you had the chance to watch Jour de Fete yet?), and we would recommend this tour to everyone.

Perfecte!. Spent a wonderful sunny Friday morning on the city bike tour. A brilliant experience thanks to Jasper.
Explored parts of Amsterdam we would never have ventured to ourselves. So beautiful.
The highlight of the ride was riding through the Rijks Museum tunnels.
Can tick this off our Bucket list. A real adventure with a real Gentlemen.
Thanks very much.

Brilliant introduction to Amsterdam. This was a great way to see the city and learn about its past and present. Thijs was a brilliant tour guide and extremely helpful, witty and knowledgeable. I'd say this is a MUST DO tour. I and a friend did it on our first morning in the city and it was perfect for getting our bearings and seeing what Amsterdam has to offer.

Nice combination of biking and tour. We did an early morning (7:30 - 10:30) private tour (family of 4 (2 teens)). This is a great ways to see the city!Pros:- You are biking...like a local. It was a nice, efficient way to see the city, feel like you are experiencing the city, and get to the different areas.- It was actually an interesting tour. I have been on bike tours before (e.g. Rome) were the guide is a biker, and you just ride around. This was NOT that. This was a tour. You rode to interesting spots and stopped for an explanation/discussion.- Hit high spots...NOT in the city center. We had done a walking tour of the city center. This takes you away from the city center to other areas. For our family, we liked the areas away from the city center better than the city center. - Guide (Thijs), one of the owners, was really very good. Good interactions with teens. Good knowledge of city. Right temperament. Just well done.- Pictures. The guide took pictures on his phone and sent them to us after the tour. Nice touch!Cons:- Biking in Amsterdam is a serious form of transportation. We have biking in other cities, but would not call ourselves “bikers.” We had no problem. If you are very uncomfortable on a bike, try a walking tour. You do not have to be in good shape, but you do have to know the basics of biking.Recommendations:- Get our guide, if you can. I am sure there are other good guides, but ours was great.

Great bike tour off the beaten track . Recommend this bike tour to all those who want something a little different but still has lots of info about Amsterdam's unique history to present day. Aptly named 'Back Streets and Hidden Gems tour' our guide Thijs took us to many interesting spots that you might not notice as a tourist. Getting around Amsterdam on a bike is definitely the way to go, and it's so much more enjoyable with a local that knows all the good spots!

Best Bike Tour in the Dam. Thijs was an amazing tour guide from the time I met him in Dam Square until he dropped us back off at the bike garage. He was extremely knowledgeable about Amsterdam and its history. He took us off the beaten path and into quiet hidden courtyards, churches, etc ... He is extremely friendly and patient and will answer all questions that you ask him.

Such a great experience!. We had such a great tour with We Bike Amsterdam - probably the highlight of our trip so far. We called only a few days before arriving and were able to arrange a private tour for our family of five. Thijs was great about providing info and being in touch, and made everything easy. Our guide, Luke, was a sweetheart - so well-informed, nice, warm, interesting, funny and patient with us as we got used to biking in Amsterdam. It's a great way to become acquainted with the city's history and to see it like a local!

REALY good tour 🚵🏽🚵🏽. Well for 2 old men I'm 66 years young April 10th who had been out celebrating England's grand slam rugby win till 3.00 am!!!! Feeling a bit rough. We were a bit worried as to how we would cope then we got lucky because Julia our guide looked after us so well her knowledge was amazing,even when we got lost!!! Only once she came to find us with a big smile on her face definitely highlight of our weekend in Amsterdam thank you Julia. Tip try to do this on your first day especially if it's your first visit to the city it's much more than a bike tour so you will learn lots of interesting stuff about the place......

Excellent bike tour. We were able to call early in the morning and arrange a private tour for our family. Jasper did a great job getting us set up and helping us learn to safely ride in Amsterdam. The tour was great, he mixed history and stories about our stops. Highly recommended.

Awesome tour! (Even for a local). Even as a local this is a great way to get to know Amsterdam. I've lived here for a couple of years but Jasper still managed to surprise us with these 'off the beaten path locations' and great background stories. We did the tour on a Sunday afternoon with 6 friends and it was a truly fun and great experience. Thanks Jasper for the great day and tour! We will surely come back for one of your other tours :-)Thanks!Frederik

Best way to see Amsterdam. We recently booked a private day trip with "We Bike Amsterdam" and had an amazing experience. Jasper was our guide and our day was informative and fun. We saw sights in Amsterdam that I'm quite sure we never would have seen on our own. At first my sister and I were a bit apprehensive about biking after seeing the chaos that Amsterdam exudes with it's cars, people and bikes, but Jasper reassured us that we could do it and that he would stick to mostly quiet streets and then head out to the countryside. After a few minutes we felt confident and were quite proud of ourselves after the day was finished. I've done a few bike trips in many different countries and I would rate this one among the best. Two thumbs up and highly recommend!

Amazing!. Do yourself a favour and try this tour on your first day in Amsterdam. The tour guide Thijs will take you to the hotspots with background information told by a native. This absolutely worth it, you have to discover Amsterdam by bike and this tour will take you to what you have to discover in this city.I strongly recommend it !!Santiago (Argentina)
Bike Tour. Thoroughly enjoyed the three hour tour around the city, what a great way to see the sights and a Thijs was very knowledgeable and a lovely host... would highly recommend !!

Great value for an enjoyable and social morning. You're only real concern here is the weather. Outside of that the tour guides are lovely, bikes great, sights enjoyable. Whilst the areas visited were not quite hidden gems, you learn a lot about typical amsterdam living. You find out about the growth of the city and the various challenges it has faced.I thoroughly recommend doing this early in your trip in order to get your bearings on where the museums and different areas of Amsterdam are.Lovely opportunity to chat with the tour guide and other group members at a quaint Dutch cafe.

City bike tour. Jasper took us on an amazing tour of the city. Despite the freezing temperature and constant sleet and rain he kept us warm and entertained showing us secret spaces in Amsterdam that we would never have found on our own. He knew interesting folklore surrounding the history of the places we visited and enabled us to really understand the Amsterdammers. Thanks Jasper, great job.

A must in Amsterdam!. We Bike Amsterdam was one of the highlights of our trip to the Netherlands. Our guide Eliza was wonderful! She gave of an insiders view of the city filled with amazing facts and history. Eliza went above and beyond by emailing us after our bike tour with restaurant suggestions with some of her personal favorite choices. I highly recommend We Bike Amsterdam. It's a terrific way to learn and see the city. Thanks Eliza for a great day!

See Amsterdam Like a Local.... An enjoyable, relaxing and very well thought out tour and a great way to get on a bike and learn local cycling etiquette. We saw so much of the less obvious and covered a fair amount of ground getting a good overview of the City and its history. Thijs and Paul ensured it was like a trip out with friends.
Great tour!. It was great! We had a lovely morning and visited beautiful and different places. Good thing to do at the first day! Thank you Thijs!
Best way. This is the best way to know the city, its history, details and curiosities. Our guide, Thijs, was so kindly, gentle and showed us so nice places!!

THE BEST AND MOST FRIENDLIEST BIKE TOUR IN AMSTERDAM !!!!. My girlfriend and I went on one of the We bike tours yesterday with Jasper. First of all Jasper was a friendly and lovely guy who was very happy to answer any of our questions. We rode trough some lovely neighbourhoods which were full of great history and gorgeous buildings. It was absolutely freezing outside but once on the bikes we forgot all about the cold plus we stopped off in a nice little café in a really nice part of Amsterdam and had coffee and biscuits. After riding trough the gorgeous park we stopped off at museum square and Jasper told us a few facts about the Dutch and their buildings. After riding trough the Rijksmuseum we rode trough the city centre which was great because we felt like one of the locals. We had so much fun on this tour we really didn't want it to end. If you come to Amsterdam and are looking for a fun, factual and great experience then go see the guys at We Bike Amstardam. Prices are reasonably good and you get a lot for your money. Thanks again to Jasper for being a fantastic tour guide.
Best part of our trip to Amsterdam!. A superb tour of Amsterdam! Excellent guides, easy biking and wonderful hidden gems. A perfect day - many thx.

Fantastic way to see Amsterdam . My boyfriend and I went on the city tour last week and had an amazing time. We were only in Amsterdam for two nights and we wanted to see as much of the city as possible with the time we had. This tour was the perfect way to do that; we were able to visit places that we never would have ventured to on our own, and our guide was absolutely delightful and full of interesting facts and stories about the area. Additionally, he had a ton of suggestions for what to do/where to eat to make the most of the rest of our time in Amsterdam.For those of you who are fortunate enough to be staying in Amsterdam for a longer visit, I would recommend taking this tour at the start of your trip. It's a fantastic way to become oriented with the city-- more so than a walking tour because you can cover more ground. Finally- anyone who has concerns about the biking experience itself can rest assured that Amsterdam is extremely bicycle friendly. There are bike lanes galore, and our guide made us feel 100% safe the entire time.
A must do . Really enjoyed this bike tour, made the trip! Well worth the money. See the whole of Amsterdam and the hidden gems just outside the city centre

Great ride to get to know more about Amsterdam!. It is always great to get to know deeper a striking city such as Amsterdam, and it would be nonsense not biking here. The tour guys do a great job, they seem to know curious details of their city and take you to places where you'd hardly go. Ride along the park, through the Rijksmuseum and over many many bridges; enjoy a quick stop for a drink and enjoy the crowds of people and bicycles. Definitely a great way to go over the city.

Dive into Amsterdam like a local. My first day in Amsterdam I booked my tour with Jasper and I ended up being the only one on the tour. Jasper was super friendly and started the tour off slowly, keeping me off the busy streets to get me used to biking in the city. Since I hadn't ridden a bike in years, I greatly appreciated that. I also got to see a different side of the city that you don't usually get to see with other traditional tours. Plenty of raw, hidden history in this city that just needs the right guide to show it to you. Also, afterwards the guides will send you restaurant and brewery recommendations, as well as anything else you might find interesting.If you are looking for a fun, informative tour that makes you feel like a local, look no further. I highly recommend this tour!
We loved it. Just back from a great trip with our kids. During our stay in Amsterdam we used this company and we loved it.

Pleasant Tour. My girlfriend and I visited Amsterdam in July. We did a bike tour with We Bike. It was very pleasant and we got a good feel of the city. We saw most of the main sites on the tour, as well as a couple you might otherwise miss. Our only complaint is that it could have been a little more lively. Other than that the bikes were comfortable and the guides were friendly. Recommended.

Easy and convenient way to see the city. My brother and I decided to visit Amsterdam for a shot period of time and went on this tour. For people who are not staying for too many days, this is ideal since in a very short period of time, you get to see a lot of different places. Jasper, our guide, was extremely knowledgeable and funny, ensuring that we were all safe. The tour was done in a really small group (five people total), which was great. After the tour, they gave us an email of all the places they recommend going to or seeing in Amsterdam, including restaurants and bars. That was very generous of them and was helpful!The prices are extremely reasonable, and I would definitely recommend this tour.

Great tour and lots of fun riding around Amsterdam. We took this tour in a big group of 8 last year during winter. Had lots of fun riding around Amsterdam and seeing famous sites as well as places that are a bit more off the beaten track and wouldn't have seen otherwise. Thijs was a great guide and we learnt a lot about the history of Amsterdam.

Great tour & great guide!. We were blessed with a lovely sunny day for our morning tour. Thanks to Jasper who was a great guide & gave us lots of interesting facts about the history of the city. Loved the bikes so much we returned & rented them for another 24 hours!!

Excellent and informative. Would like to thank Thijs for leading a really awesome bike tour around the city and giving us a lot of interesting tidbits on hidden parts of the city. I signed up for the tour based on what it mentioned about peeking beyond the tourist bubble and this tour definitely achieved that expectation.

Great tour, relaxed and friendly. My wife and I took the bike tour in early January and enjoyed the whole experience. The 10am start isn't too early, but forced us to get up and make a day of it. Our group was only 4 strong, plus the guide who spoke excellent English. He took us down narrow streets and canal sides into little hidden locations that you would not get otherwise. You could never cover the ground on foot (about 12k) and take in the experience at to the same time. If you want to get a great kick start to your city break, I would wholly recommend We Bike Amsterdam!!

Best way to visit the city. We booked bikes half a day to visit Amsterdam. I think it s a very nice way to visit the city when you are here for a few days. You are free, you decide where and when you want to go without limit.The plus here are that you burn calories and you don't damage the environment !!

Thorough, knowledgeable, pleasant. So, we're just back from a trip that involved I think four bike tours and this was probably the best.1. It was super easy to find.2. The coffee stop was cute and full of locals.3. The bikes were comfortable and in good shape.4. The guide was knowledgeable and pleasant.5. He covered all the major sites you want to see in Amsterdam plus some smaller details you'd miss if guiding yourself about with a guide book. So, if you're only in town briefly and want a flash tour, this works (I cannot say the same for our tour in Brussels) and if you want to see a bit more, this is also worth your time.I particularly liked the stop at the Dutch West India Company headquarters.

Can't stop smiling!. I'm so pleased I chose We Bike Amsterdam.Phillip was a lovely guide - fun, knowledgable, and eager to answer questions. It was a small group and we all chatted merrily while we cycled, and especially when we stopped for coffee.I smiled for the entire three hours of the trip, and I'm still smiling several hours later.What a great way to get to know the real Amsterdam!

Outstanding!. Our bikes were really comfortable. Our guide, Charlotte, was great - very warm, very knowledgeable about her city, and enthusiastic. She did just the right amount of riding vs stopping to explain. We learned a lot and had a great time. Don't miss this!

Amsterdam Cycling bonanza. I was walking on the streets of the place called "nijerk" a small village nearby Amterdam. Suddenly saw a group of 50 odd amatuer cyclist on their cycles, burstled on to the scene. The most amazing of it was the variance in age group. Few were pretty young like about 20 yrs and few about 65+, all binded together by passion for cycling. They all had tea and beverages at cafe on streets after long stint with cycling. It was spectacle which you can find aroung amterdam, as they take a pride in cycling. Its thing of prestige!! Simply awesome experience.

Scouser 's can bike too.. Our friends talked us into joining them on a 4hr leisurely cycle tour around the city on a Saturday morning Fabulous! Jasper was very knowledgeable, humorous and a great guide. Definitely advise anyone of any ability and dress code to do this tour as you see soo much that your legs wouldn't normally carry you too.

Really interesting. We were a group of 7 people with a tour guide called ThijsIt rained a bit on the tour however, it did not spoil the trip as Thjis was so interesting to listen to about each place we stopped. The stops were not all the usual tourist stops but some hidden ones thrown in to keep it fresh. Stopped for a coffee and a rest half way through which was good. Thanks Thijs, we had a lovely time with you.

City Center. Booked with "We Bike Amsterdam" for our first full day in the city and found it to be a very easy, interesting ride. In 3.5 hours we covered the majority of the city center and saw sites along the way in addition to historical commentary about Amsterdam's coat of arms, East India Trading company etc. What could have made the tour better was if our guide had talked more about the neighborhoods/locations in the context of the rest of the city. We were never quite clear on where we are in Amsterdam at any given point except when we stopped for the snack, which was a bit unusual. Otherwise, a decent tour.

Awesome!. Spent 3 1/2 hours with Jasper touring Amsterdam on bikes! It was an awesome way to see the city. We got lucky in that Amsterdam was not very busy and the tour consisted of just my husband and I and the other couple we were traveling with so it was basically a private tour! Jasper is very knowledgeable about the city.

Great tour through Amsterdam- Great fun guide!. This was a great thing to do our first day! Yhe guide was fun. We go a "lay of the land" and got to experience the way the Dutch travel! On their bikes!

Interesting bike tour of Amsterdam. Loved this bike tour - went to less tourist, but very interesting sites. I would do this your first day in Amsterdam. It will get you comfortable on a bike (which is the best way to see this city).

Great way to see the city. Nice way to see the city and nice laid back pace. Some complete cycling novices in the group but simple bikes to use and the route follows some of the quieter cycle lanes. We stopped at the park for an impromptu photo shoot on a tree branch…great fun. Made me smile. Our tour leader was friendly and laid back and it over ran over by 30 mins which was great.

Excellent, a must do. We had a fantastic tour, the guide was knowledgeable and pointed out the lesser known sites within the city. So its not just the standard tourist areas covered during this tour. This involved pointing out some of the architectural eras the city had been through, landmark buildings with a bit of history, a cycle through the park and a short coffee break.The city is fairly flat so the ride is not taxing and you'll end of wondering how the 3 hours passed so quickly. Also, the tour leaves promptly at 10am so make sure that you are on time or you might be left behind. If you are using a bus or tram to reach the start Dam Square stop would be your best option but Central station is also not far off.Overall I don't think a visit to Amsterdam would be complete without a bicycle tour and I'd definitely recommend We Bike!

A must do in Amsterdam!. When my friends told me they had booked us on a 3 hour bike tour at 10am Saturday morning and after a VERY late night out I can't say I was best pleased. However, this turned out to be the highlight of my weekend, what an amazing way to see the city - as a local. This was by far a much better experience than the boat tour we went on later, which surprised me as I do love a boat :) Thijs, our guide, was warm, welcoming and made my day. The group consisted of experienced cyclist and a few who were more nervous at first, Thijs was patient and ensured everyone was comfortable. The route was great and took in all the sites and local neighbourhoods. I especially enjoyed visiting the local markets and cycling through Vondelpark, we even got involved in an impromptu tree climb with another group.If you do one thing in Amsterdam, make sure it's we bike Amsterdam - absolutely loved it! I will be back in December with another group of friends and will be sure to do it all over again. See you soon Thijs!

Best bike tour. We had a bike tour with Jasper and it was fantastic. Jasper knew so much of the history of Amsterdam and explained it in a fun, interesting way. He made sure he interacted with all the guests and answered everyone's questions. This was a great way to see Amsterdam and learn about it at the same time. It's a must do when you're in Amsterdam.

The best way to see Amsterdam!. This tour was fantastic. We learned so much and had a great time covering city ground by bike. Our guide was great and she even sent us a personal email with vegetarian specific restaurants that she recommended in town.

Lovely Experience,Much Better Than Expected!!. Charlotte our guide was lovely with two very shaky riders. She took us to interesting places off the beaten track and the ride was paced well.Particularly recommended for those out of practice on two wheels.

Fantastic bike tour!. We loved our bike tour with We Bike Amsterdam and you will too - it's brilliant! The tour takes you off the beaten track to many fascinating parts of the city you would not otherwise see. The bikes are great - comfortable and sturdy; and our guide was excellent - she had a vast knowledge of Amsterdam and was willing to share all her favourite anecdotes and stories about the history of the city. We went with our three teenage sons and we all loved it. It is a fantastic way to see Amsterdam. If you are thinking of booking a bike tour - go with this company!

Very very pleasantly surprised!. My son of 13 wanted to ride a bike in Amsterdam. Having seen the organised chaos on the main roads and some of the other write ups on other bike tours left me feeling not so keen. It was nearly an opportunity missed...we had 3 and a bit hours of pure pleasure.We were given excellently maintained and easy to handle bikes suitable for our heights. (Included in the price) and our group was small (7) and of mixed ages and biking experience. This topped with a fantastic tour guide (Jasper) who was not only knowledgable but also ensured everyone was safe and not left behind left me feeling it was one of the highlights of our week. The city tour included riding predominantly off the main roads through little streets with beautiful facades, gardens and hidden churches and communes. It was everything I'd wanted Amsterdam to be. Even the mid way coffee stop in the atmospheric and cosy cafe was perfectly timed and local. So for those of you who are 'umming and arghing' take the leap and go for it. I'm sure you won't be disappointed and we for one will definitely be taking a different tour with the same company next time we come. They were efficient, had great communication, excellent value for money and professional at what they they did in a friendly and relaxed manner.
Great tour. Had a great bike tour around the city. Meeting at Dam Sq was very easy. Equipment was all good quality and the guide knew her stuff.
Good, interesting tour. Tour was good. Because you are riding a bike it's a bit hard to take in all of the sights during the tour, but a fun experience.

Nice people, but not the greatest tour. The guys who run We Bike are friendly and well intentioned, but overall the tour was a bit disappointing. To be sure, it was a great introduction to biking the streets of Amsterdam and maneuvering through the rest of the bike traffic. But the tour itself was a bit thin. Our guide didn't speak very loudly and didn't give much info I hadn't already read in the guide book. Similarly, many of the "hidden" sites on the itinerary should only be a surprise to you if you haven't read anything about the city (or done any sightseeing yet). The Jordaan, Begijnhof, Vondelpark, and Museumsplein are not exactly secrets. We did go inside one interior residential courtyard that we would not have found on our own, which was interesting. And I also loved the bike path that tunnels straight through the middle of the Rijksmuseum, so I give the tour credit for showing that to us. Maybe our experience would've been somewhat better with another guide.

Great tour; interesting traffic rules!. Just six of us on this 3-hour tour, which was just as well - it wasn't always easy to stay in touch with the front runners because of traffic interventions! It did feel as though we were the only cyclists in Amsterdam who stopped at red lights ... Our tour guide was friendly, informative and entertaining; he took us to places we would never have found ourselves, and was a constant source of interesting and quirky stories about the people and places of Amsterdam. The coffee (and I mean coffee!) shop break was very welcome. Highly recommended for teens upwards; probably a bit challenging for younger children.

Awesome!. finding hidden treasures and feeling more like a 'local' was a great way to start our time in amsterdam. Make sure you know how to ride a bike though -- the tour moves quickly in some spots.

Fantastic! Great way to see Amsterdam. I took the 3 hour bike tour of the city! It was great fun and a wonderful way to see he city and learn about the history. In addition you will meet other fellow travelers which was quite interesting! Great guide who brought us to places you might not know about. Highly recommend this tour.

Experience Amsterdam like a local. This was a great tour! The first thing you notice when you arrive to Amsterdam is the mass amount of bikes the the use of bicycles in daily life. I was eager to ride the city but didn't quite understand traffic laws or navigating the streets to do it alone. Take a guided tour (with only 3 other people!) was and excellent way to feel the vibe of the city. even though it was cold and raining it was really fun, highly informative and took you off the beaten path. Highly recommend when in Amsterdam!

Brilliant Bike Tour - Very Friendly and Professional. Our tour guide Caroline was absolutely lovely, she was very friendly, relaxed and stopped off at some little gems with great information (but not too much - I hate information overload!!), We cycled through a beautiful park and along many canals. We stopped off in a beautiful homely cafe were I had the best tomato and mozzarella soup I ever had!!! Even though it rained it didn't bother us. I would definitely highly recommend this tour, I would pay double if I needed to, it was the best money spent and one of the highlights of our time in Amsterdam. Thank you, keep up the good work.

Great tour guide!. More than 3 hours touring around the less known facts and areas of Amsterdam. Our guide was super, and we had time for photos and all. The weather wasn't great, but that didn't move us! I'm going to recommend it to my friends!

Do this to see and feel Amsterdam . Tour guide Caroline. 4.5/5. Biked a lot which was really nice. Took breaks to stop and look at sights along the ride. Got to go inside a hidden church which is only available with this tour company. I don't have much road biking experience but was able to keep up and guide helped me to feel safe. The only negative is that I wish it would've been more convenient to take photos. Definitely recommend as biking is such a large part of the amsterdam culture.
Brilliant!. Fantastic tour and Thijs was a great guide! We visited lots of places we would never have thought to go to. 100% recommend!

Great way to cover most of the city in a short period of time.. Thijs was a wonderful guide. Did the tour on 10/9/15 and we went all over. Not sure I'd categorize what we saw as "hidden gems" but I did appreciate hearing the history of the locations we did visit. I was traveling by myself and would have loved to see more of the popular attractions on the tour.... We did manage to stop by the HUGE "IAMSTERDAM" statue on the tour at my request. The others in the group were also interested so we stopped there and took pictures. Not sure I would have made it there otherwise, so was happy they could accommodate me. If you don't take this bike tour, make sure you A bike tour! Much better than walking!

Highlight of 6 days in Amsterdam. Insider's tour of Amsterdam on sturdy bikes. Best way to see the city - and without the worry of which streets are 1 one way etc. Thijs was super interesting and took us to places we would never have seen otherwise. I never do any sort of groups when on vacation but this is one i would definitely do again!

Lovely way to see Amsterdam. Thijs Bakker proved to be a very knowledgeable and entertaining guide (and partner in the company). It was a lovely way to see the main attractions but also to see the not so touristy areas. Getting some exercise while experiencing the delights of Amsterdam cannot be beaten.

Stephen Currie. Very nice tour! Safe, easy ride fit for all ages. Nuggets of info and exposure to many neighborhoods otherwise not visited. Short coffee break gave us an opportunity to converse with other bikers, get recommendations, and enjoy some beverages at a locals cafe. A great way to spend a pleasant few hours getting a 'feel' for what this city offers

Very nice tour. We found the tour guide to be very friendly and relaxed. She took us to a variety of places "off the beaten path" and offered useful information about the city and high quality restaurants. The bikes were also easy to ride and in good working order.

A great tour!. We booked our tour online two days before, which was simple and quick.The tour itself was excellent, covering places like the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh museum, and also out-of-the-way places like the widows houses and the Red Hat hidden church.Charlotte, our guide, was well informed and took great care to ensure everyone's safety and keep the group together.All in all, excellent value, and very much recommended.

See Amsterdam's less travelled areas on two wheels!. We Bike Amsterdam was recommended to my wife and I. We're glad it was. Charolette, our guide, did a great job of showing us the around the lesser raveled areas of Amsterdam. She took time to explain this history and culture of the area and how they related to architecture and layout of the city of today. She even introduced us to very special chocolate made by three guys using a sailboat to get the cocoa to Holland. The break at a local restaurant was a nice and appreciated touch. Book early to make certain you get the date and time you want.

going local in Amsterdam. Me and my two Canadian friends had a wonderful private tour with We Bike Amsterdam. Not only is it a fun experience to feel like a local, riding a bike, also the tourguide Jasper provided us with so much interesting and funny historical stories on Amsterdam. We toured for over 3 hours but had some delicious Dutch applepie (appeltaart!) in between to catch our breath. We recommend this bike tour to everyone. It is very low key and the guides are really flexible and helpful (especially when it comes to the less-experienced bikers). In sum, a fantastic way to discover the beatiful city of Amsterdam!! CheersMeke

Could be better. The meeting place of this tour is at De Dam, but the bike shop is located 10 min away (on foot) We did a bike tour in Oslo and compared to that, this bike tour was a bit disorganised. They did not have a helmet for our son (10 y.o) and the bike was a bit too big for him, so we were a bit concerned . We were left to set up our own bikes , did not like the bikes at all , they were heavy, no carrier or basket. At least the gears and brake work. We would have loved to get more information on the city during the tour.

Excellent way to see Amsterdam!!. My wife and I took this tour with Thijs as our tour guide. We were shown sites that included, but were not limited to, The old headquarters of the Dutch West Indies Company, Museumplein, the Jordaan neighborhood, and much more. Thijs is an extremely knowledgeable young man who made the city come alive through his descriptions. He showed us many hidden gems of the city that we would have never discovered on our own. I highly recommend this tour. You do not need to be an expert bicycle rider, but I recommend that you wear comfortable, closed toed shoes.

Good tour, but still feel lost!. Charlotte was a lovely guide and showed us some interesting sites. It was great to be able to follow someone and just focus on the biking and traffic without having to worry about directions. The downfall is, I have no idea how to find my way back to any of the places we went to! I would have liked to have been able to explore a bit more for photos at Vondelpark and at the museum area, but I guess that would make the tour too long. Maybe a private tour would have been more suitable for what I was hoping to get out of the experience.

Great Way to See Amsterdam. Comfortable bikes and an excellent guide in Jasper made for a lovely way to cover more ground than in a walking tour and gain interesting informTion about the city. Highly recommended.

City tour. We enjoyed the tour with Thijs. If you want to see Amsterdam on a bike this is what would recommend.We went to places not usually sen in a regular tour. We had a coffee stop as well. The tour is composed of max 12 people so its very manageable.

We Bike is Wonderful!. The bicycles were very comfortable and were adjusted for our individual heights. The bikes are commuting style, not racing or mountain bikes. They have three speeds. Jasper, the tour guide was very interesting and spoke very good English. He customized our tour according to our afternoon timetable, and showed us a lot of hidden points of interest that helped to tell the story of historical Amsterdam, and gave insight into modern Amsterdam and it's culture. The ride was relaxing and fun. The rendezvous at the bike rental shop was easy to find. An excellent way to cover a lot of ground without rushing. The weather in early September cool, but being from Canada, we were comfortable in shorts and t shirts.

Great bike tour!. This bike tour is great for all ages we had a mixed group from early 20s up to mid 50s and we all enjoyed ourselves.Thijs is really enthusiastic about the Amsterdam area, I was very impressed at how he remembered all of our names throughout the ride. We did this tour on the first day of our holiday to get a feel for the area and it really helped. Both my boyfriend and I agreed this bike tour would be gorgeous during the winter months when you're wrapped up in a scarf going down the quant roads in the crisp air. Such great value for money, we tipped at the end but this is not compulsory obviously! I won't give too much away about the routes because it's nicer to experience it yourself Book it!! You won't be disappointed.

A great experience. My friend and I spend our first day of our holiday touring through the city with this company and we thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. The tourguide, Thijs, was very approachable and told us lots of interesting facts along the way, we had a good balance of riding the bikes, and stopping for little breaks where we explored buildings or other spaces, and at the end of it all we really felt we had seen a lot of the city in a very enjoyable interesting way. The bikes were great, easy to ride and the pace was good, and easy to keep up even for me, a very rusty bike user! we would most definately recommend this experience,it was great value for money!.
Great way to see 'real' Amsterdam!. Just finished a terrific 3-hr ride around Amsterdam with Thijs as guide. Relaxed 'easy' rideride;rbgoodvergoodgeenjoyable

Excellent, fun and informative activity.. Delighted to have chosen this small friendly and professionally run co for our bike ride in Amsterdam. Jasper took as around all the lesser known parts of the city, was fun, friendly warm and helpful. The bikes are excellent standard. The only complaint was it was pouring with rain, but it didn't stop our enjoyment with Jasper. We would certainly recommend this activity over many others.

Don't worry, this is easy and fun. We had a great three hour bike tour of Amsterdam. This is not scary. If you can ride even fairly well, you will be fine. You will learn about the city, meet people, and see more obscure areas of Amsterdam. with the help of a fine guide.

Best way to know amsterdam. I took a Sunday morning tour, when the streets are still quiet and is a lot easier to bike (I felt that on regular days, because there are soooo many bikes on the streets, it would be more difficult to bike as group. I was really happy with my decision! The bike tour is a lot more fun than the traditional walking tours and our guide took us to places that are not on most regular tours (my favorite was a hidden garden). There is a 20 minute stop for coffee, which in my opinion was not necessary at all, as the tour is not the long. Despite that, it was an adorable experience.

Best trip ever!!. Our tour was with Charlotte, such a genuine person..She took us all over your wonderful city with ease and great knowledge..A must for any visitor..you'll cover so much more ground and it helps you get your bearings.Thanks guys..Top notch customer service from start to finish and even an email after with a selection of their favourite places to maybe try out..Thanks again xx

Great Way To Spend a Layover!. My wife, step-daughter and I had a 10 hour layover in Amsterdam and wanted to have a chance to see the city and get a little bit of exercise at the same time. We hit a home run! Jasper planned a 4 hour tour for us and it was perfect. We got a great picture of the history of Amsterdam in a really fun and relaxing way. We travelled through a variety of neighborhoods which gave us an insightful look into the past and present of Amsterdam away from the tourist crowds. Jasper also planned a stop at a little local cafe (whose name escapes me) that was a great departure from all the airplane food we had been eating. Due to our time constraints we opted for a private tour and it was perfect and well worth the price!

Great tour of the city. They were great, from the booking process until the end. Tremendous knowledge of the area. Enjoyed seeing different parts of the city. Small sized group which made a big difference. Would highly recommend this tour to anyone

Great escape from Centrum. See really cool sights outside of the city center and get great historical background of how the city slowly developed. Biking pace was perfect and almost all of it is in much calmer and quieter neighborhoods. Absolutely recommended!

Beeing part of the cycling people of Amsterdam. We had a great time seeing many interesting and secret places by bicycle. We had our own bikes with us and got a little reduction for that. Jasper's a keen guide who tells the stories of the city with fun and knowledge. It is an easy-going-tour with many breaks and time to look at gorgeous Amsterdam's houses. If you get lost in the traffic of cars, bikes and pedestrians: don't be afraid, Jasper'll pick you up. Thanks a lot for this interesting trip!

Couldn't of asked for a better tour. Very personalized and informative tour. I had a short layover in Amsterdam so I wanted to get a good overview of the city. This was a great way to see all the highlights of what I wanted to see plus more. They really do a great job of not just taking you to the frequented tourist sights but also lesser known spots of interesting historical importance. Tours are also kept small to make them more personalized. The guide even gave me some great tips about good restaurants in the city. Suffice to say I would suggest this tour for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Highly recommended!. We did this today and were not disappointed! Jasper is a wealth of knowledge (both quirky and historical info!).As for the tour itself, the group is kept small (10 ppl) and the ride isn't strenuous. He prides himself on showing you the lesser known spots, so don't expect to be seeing what you can by yourself (definitely a plus).At 3hrs with a break in the middle, it won't chew through your day either.If your considering this, I would def say do it!

An absolute must-do!. This was one of the first things I did after arriving in Amsterdam and it was an awesome way to see the city! Do yourself a favour and get out of the tacky tourist traps of wax museums and over-crowded squares for a few hours (at least), and be sure you put this at the top of your to-do list. The bikes were comfy, the route very beautiful and the guide shared great information about the city’s history, plus he was super friendly and shared other tips to get the best out of the rest of my stay. You’ll see things you’ll absolutely miss otherwise and the groups are small, unlike some other tours. A++
Highlight of the trip.. Awesome. Pleasant, non-strenuous, fascinating. If you hate bikes, don't do it. But if you hate bikes, maybe don't go to Amsterdam.

Jasper was excellent!. With three teenagers in tow I booked on the 3 hour tour of Amsterdam with Jasper as our guide. Jasper was an excellent guide, A group of 9 in total it was easy to move around as a group and Jasper was friendly, helpful and very informative taking us to the unseen parts of the City and having a v good knowledge of the history of the City. Great value for money and an excursion not to be missed. Booked the night before too which was brilliant for those of us who are not organised! Thanks again Jasper.

Private bike tour through countryside = highlight of trip. We reached out to Thijs to book a private tour a few days out and he was incredibly responsive. Gave us the option of city or country tour when we met (very flexible) and then took us on a fantastic 4-hour tour through the countryside -- something we definitely wouldn't have seen on our own. He was knowledgeable, informative but also super relatable - very keen to answer any questions we had (even if it had nothing to do with the tour or Amsterdam's history).We were running a bit late the day of the tour and Thijs was totally accommodating. The bikes were also high quality. Encourage everyone who has a few days in Amsterdam to try this out!
Let's go Dutch with the wife.... Really enjoyed the tour. Good information from Jasper the guide, very chilled but interesting way to see a bit more of the beautiful city...Jersey Jon....

Great tour, informative and always interesting. We saw a very unique side to the city, which was great in somewhere that is very touristy like Amsterdam.Also we found it to be a very personable experience with a small group and friendly guide.It wasn't a high intensity see all of the sights experience, but you got to see lots of hidden parts that we never would have discovered.If you enjoy a more relaxed and curious experience this would be perfect.

excellent. When it comes to choosing a bike tour do not make it on price. Pay a bit more and you get a more personal tour. In the case of we bike amsterdam never more than ten in a group. 15 turned up so they ensured two guides. We were a family of four and got an amazing insight into Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend.

Great way to see Amsterdam!. My husband and I joined We Bike Amsterdam on a bike tour yesterday and had so much fun! Jasper was a fantatsic and engaging tour guide. The bikes were comfortable and the route took us through many parts of Amstedam we wouln't have seen otherwise. With biking being a very large part of the Amsterdam culture, it was fun to take a few hours and join them. Would highly recommend We Bike Amsterdam!!
Very Good. I recommend this bike tour around Amsterdam center so you will get to know the city inner streets, the main park and along the way you will be informed about its history.

Take your biking to a new "high"!. This biking tour was definitely one of the highlights for our family. Even if you have young kids, you can rent a bike with a "basket" (we told our 7 year old son it was a chariot bike) and easily ride the flat terrain with the young ones safely strapped into their seat. The tour guide (a young German lady with excellent English) was patient with our kids, taught us all we needed to know to ride safely, and really knew her Amsterdam stuff. She showed us amazing historical houses, explained the architecture and took us to all the nooks and crannies we never would have seen on our own.We also rode thru Vondel Park which was quite nice, stopping for drinks (coffee, etc.).It was a bit over 3 hours including all breaks and the time went by really fast - lots of fun.For the "concerned" parents out there, no helmets are provided, but statistically Amsterdam is a very safe city to cycle in, has bike lanes all over, and cars give lots of deference to the two-wheeled riders. So relax and enjoy the sights and second hand smoke :)
