Great Tour-Well organized-Great Bikes. We did a tour with We Bike Amsterdam with our family. We were very impressed. The equipment was top notch and the route and variety of sights we saw was great. Amsterdam is very flat so this is a very easy ride. We spent about four hours with a 30 minute break in a park. This is a great way to get a feel for Amsterdam and identify the sights you want to circle back to on your own after the tour.

Lots of secret spots!. This was an awesome tour! Our guide showed lots of interesting details about the city including historical and popular facts. Biking through the streets was very easy and the bikes provided were quite good!
Great way to see the city!. Friendly and easy way to see the city. Went with my family and they all thoroughly loved it, a do not miss for Amsterdam!

One the BEST things I experienced in Amsterdam. You have to bike in Amsterdam!. I went to Amsterdam for 5 days in June 2015 and decided at least for one day I wanted to ride the city. Doing a little research on Tripadvisor it was suggested local to the hotel I was staying at to do a "We Bike Amsterdam" tour. So I booked it a few weeks in advance and finally I arrived in Amsterdam. Getting to where this tour is - is going Central Station Tram and meeting at the Dam stop where there are two statues of Lions there. Jasper and Luke our guide met us there. We had a small group and to be honest I had been warned prior to booking this event NOT to do this due to possible risk of hurting myself. I was alone in Amsterdam on a mini solo trip - female as I was doing business in London prior to. I did not take heed to this warning and will state that THIS WAS one of the best things I did in Amsterdam. I can not tell you how exhilarating I felt biking through this charming city where the bikes rule! I smiled the entire time on this ride for 3 hours. I was at first worried because I have never biked in a city where there was thousands of people, bikes (yes bikes rule here) to people are masses amounts of people but I kept up. Not only did I keep up but I was always pretty much right behind the guide. Luke brought us all over the city to little spots you probably would have never known about passing by and we learned so much. Hidden treasures within the city. The bike was awesome and during some of the ride yes I got a little nervous because you have to navigate through bikes, people, cars, and its all on you- Not the guide. You have to be in control but I did it! We all did it!!!!! Had I known how much I would have loved this I would have done it everyday! I would highly highly recommend this. Luke was awesome. In fact if you want you can rent the bikes from them for the duration of your stay. This was so much fun!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! PS. We stopped for tea. It would also be wise to bring a sweater for weather change or rain jacket, and water. A backpack works! I had one :)

did not get what we were expecting. i hate to write negative reviews but feel that a negative review truly reflects our experience. the ride was advertised as a 3 hour exploration of amsterdam. we thought we would be riding for most of that time, and get a good overview of the city while biking. instead we had a short ride of approximately 45 minutes or so, visiting several out of the way sites and learning some history (re the history part our guide was quite knowledgeable) and then we stopped for a '15' minute coffee break, which morphed into more or less a 40 minute break. we then got back on the bikes and visited a few more sites, and then the ride was over. this was not even close to what we were expecting. i wished we had simply rented bikes on our own and done our own exploring. the tour was not expensive, but nevertheless we both felt we did not get our money's worth and cannot recommend if what you are expecting is a broad tour of amsterdam by bicycle.

Highlight. Have been to Amsterdam many times but had never thought of taking a bike tour until a Dutch friend urged me to, and am so pleased she did. Read a few reviews and was immediately drawn to WBA. Professionally organised (other tours were quite disorganised) extremely nice and approachable guide Anna, excellent quality of bikes, max groups of 10 people and they cater for all abilities, as I am notoriously rubbish on a bike. Loved it and felt totally safe. Without doubt, amongst the many amazing things to do in Amsterdam, this is in the top 3.

Fun bike ride with Jasper!. My husband and I cycled with Jasper this morning and really enjoyed ourselves. Saw interesting things. Learned about the city and went places we never would have known about. Jasper gave us a great restaurant recommendation for Indonesian food and we went there tonight. It was fabulous. Perfect way to start our stay in the Netherlands.

Lovely ride with 'we bike amsterdam'. Me, my wife and our son joined the tour. It's definitely a great way to learn the city instead of just relying on the map or internet. Our guide was fabulous. Thanks

A good cycling tour of the city. Highly enjoyed the cycling portion of this tour. The bikes are of a good quality and no one had any problems with their bike. Our tour guide was very friendly and managed to keep the group together well even in the chaos of Amsterdam traffic/trams/cyclists! I do feel however that there could have been more "touristy" places that are added as stops on the route. I was hoping this tour would take care of my "touristic" ambitions for Amsterdam, but felt that afterwards I needed to do a walking tour to compliment this one.
Enjoyable Morning. Great way to learn more about the city and great fun too.Completed woth my wife and wee both really found enjoyable. Tour guide Anna was fun.

Fun and interesting bike tourn. Had a few anxieties about cycling in a city, as we are unfit and not natural cyclists, but needn't have worried as it was a relaxed pace with many stops at interesting, off the beaten track places. Great way to discover Amsterdam and our guide Lisa was excellent. Enjoyed seeing the backstreets as well as some of the famous sights too. Would recommend with no hesitation. Family of four, with two teenagers.

Relaxed ride around town. This is not your typical "see all the main attractions" bike tour offered in most cities. We went on the 3 hour group ride and went to many places off the beaten track and most of them we would not have seen or ventured to if not for the tour. Was a really relaxed vibe and got out of the city centre which was nice. Felt like we saw a bit more then just the tourist hub. Jasper was a great guide, very informative, was great to learn about Dutch history and culture in an entertaining way.
Great Outing!. Great outing....highly recommend. Very fun! Guide was gracious and accomodating. Great weather made it really nice.

Great way to start a visit to Amsterdam. This tour was great fun. At the beginning, I didn't know much about the history of Amsterdam. This tour was an excellent way to answer some of the questions I had about how the beautiful city came to be the way it is. It's safe, pretty easy paced and the tour guide was fantastic. Highly recommended.

The best way to explore Amsterdam!. We had the Hidden Gems-tour. This tour was a highlight during our 4 days stay in Amsterdam! Our guide, Charlotte, was very knowledgeable, and took us to a lot of interesting places which we could not have found on ourselves. We got much more insight knowledge of the history of the town. Charlotte is one of the best guides you can get. Not only knowledgeable, but also friendly and helpful. She also had some good recommendations for dinner, which was very useful. We are used to cycle in Norway, but Amsterdam is far more facilitated for cycling. The bicycles was in good shape, and we felt safe all the time. We had a break after one hour, which was perfect as we then had time to get to know the other 6 participants in our group. The tour was scheduled for 3 hours, but lasted for 3,5, which was no problem for Charlotte.We will highly recommend We Bike Amsterdam.

Awesome Bike Tour (2 days). My wife and I made advance reservation with Thijs for 2 days of private touring; one day in the countryside and one in the city. We have done bike tours in numerous countries and these 2 days, by far, were the best experience we have had and at a good value. As a native of Amsterdam, Thijs (also our guide) is exceptionally knowledgeable of the area, the culture, the details, the facts and artifacts. He was able to answer our myriad of questions (we asked lots of questions) and he took us to places off of the beaten path (e.g. The Hidden Church, the narrowest house in Amsterdam, etc.) that are not part of the typical "cookie cutter" bike tour. The pace of the tour was good, Thijs is focused on safety and also ensured we made several stops for refreshments, breaks, etc. as needed. The quality of the bikes were rode were first rate. We would highly recommend "We Bike Amsterdam" if you are interested in a bike tour of Amsterdam (city or country or both)!

Highlight of our trip to Amsterdam! Recommended.. The best way to see Amsterdam is by bike and the best bike tour is this one. We took the Hidden Gems of Amsterdam tour and would recommend it to anyone with the ability to ride a bike.Our guide, Charlotte, was engaging, funny and spoke great English as she explained our way around the Jordaan and other parts of Amsterdam. She was extremely well informed and gave us some information and recommendations that we never would have heard otherwise. The bikes were modern and comfortable, and we felt safe all the way through the tour - despite Amsterdam's hectic bike lanes, we kept the the quieter areas which inspired confidence. We stopped frequently for explanation and/or water breaks, so the tour is not at all taxing or physically demanding.Bikes are a way of life in Amsterdam and we found them the best way to really see the city, from hidden gardens to the wonderful Vondelpark to the cool Jordaan area. Thanks Charlotte!

Excellent way of getting your bearings and some history. This tour was the highlight of our trip to Amsterdam!! We were told at various points where we were about to cycle to, the group wasnt too big, the information and sites were wonderful and our guide was excellent. Highly recommended to everyone, the bikes are in great shape and you start off around the quieter parts of the city to warm up!!

Discovering a jewel by bike. This tour is a great way to uncover Amsterdam in a unique fashion while at the same time getting the feeling of being "at home" and belonging - you get a glimpse in the life of your average Amsterdam everyday life - biking along the canals and busy streets. The guides are very nice people, willing to explain anything you would like to know and also help you find your way around even beyond the actual tour. I would highly recommend it to any tourist!

Hidden Gem Tour. Our tour was interesting. We learned some unique facts about Amsterdam. The bikes were in good shape. Enjoyed the cafe stop. It was sometimes difficult; however, to hear our tour guide. Also, be careful, cycling in Amsterdam is not for the faint-hearted.

Great way to see the city. This tour was perfect! Our guide was so friendly. We managed to see a lot of Amsterdam without ever getting bored. Our guide pointed out lots of interesting facts about the city and the people bringing the history right up to the modern day and making it relevant. It was so relaxed. I would recommend this tour to anyone coming to visit the city. Don't forget to book in advance!

Brilliant way to see more of Amsterdam. We had our tour on a gloriously sunny morning. We all started off slightly worse for wear following the previous nights' shenanigans, but the easy pace and interesting sights of Amsterdam soon soothed our hangovers away and we had a brilliant time. Extra thanks to Lisa our guide who was friendly and knowledgeable, making our tour infinitely more entertaining. The stop at the cafe in beautiful Vondelpark was much appreciated (we recommend a slice of the apple pie to get you round the second half of the tour!) and the followup e-mail I received from the tour operator had some really good recommendations for other places to visit during our trip. 10/10 A* from us, there is a reason these guys are rating number 1 on Tripadvisor! x

Great Fun. Easy paced cycle through the city. Safe and fun. Got me confident enough to cycle around the city for the rest of my stay. Took us to some hidden gems of Amsterdam. Didn't stop at the major attractions, left those for us to explore on our own . Definitely recommended .

The Secrets of Amsterdam. Many things in Amsterdam are not quite what they seem to be. On this tour you have a very much grassroots, local perspective. We saw amazing things we could've totally missed out on if it weren't for this tour. This is a great way to begin your stay in Amsterdam and get a feel for navigating the area and how people in Amsterdam bike! You can even rent your bike after the tour! Our tour guide was Lisa, she was amazing. :)

The Nicest Most Accommodating Folks EVER. First let me say that due to my families travel constraints we did not actually get to go on the bike which made us all very sad. We booked this tour a week prior. When we got to town and our flight was slightly delayed so we could not meet the group on time. I was in constant communication (although spotty because of my wifi) and these guys did everything they could to make this happen they tried to come meet us later but I my communication was delayed so we missed them. We so wanted to meet them especially because of their heroic efforts to make this work. They offered to reschedule but when they heard we were there for one day only they made a special accommodation to refund us. These are the kind of people that make traveling special. I will always recommend We Bike Amsterdam and next time we have the opportunity to get to back we will schedule a day with them.Thanks We Bike Amsterdam!!!!

Great Bike Tour of Amsterdam. I would highly recommend We Bike Amsterdam. The bikes were in great working order. Our guide was very knowledgeable of the city. The meeting place was easy to find and very timely. A bike tour is a must while visiting Amsterdam.

So much fun!. I went on this tour last week and it was worth the money I spent on it. It was an absolutely gorgeous day (sunny and 75 degrees!) to go on a bike ride through the beautiful city of Amsterdam. I had Jasper as my tour guide and he was very knowledgable and friendly. He also gave us recommendations after the tour regarding places to go for lunch and a good brewery to check out. Definitely would recommend this tour and if/when I make it back to Amsterdam I'd do it again.
Europe vacation. Great bike tour! So fun and informative. Amazing tour of this beautiful city. Would highly recommend. Can't wait to go back.

Wonderful Experience - Tour guide was great. I took two bike tours over the weekend. The one with We Bike Amsterdam was by far the best. The guide (I believe Jasper) was fantastic and extremely helpful (given I'm not an expert bike rider). The bikes were better quality and it was a fantastic experience. Would take the advice of another reviewer and do this early in your visit and it's a great way to see the places to go back to and get a good sense of the city.

A great way to experience Amsterdam. What better way to see Amsterdam than on a bike?! Jasper, our tour guide, was very helpful and friendly (despite the pouring rain) and gave us a lot of insider information and fun facts as well as showing us the "must sees" as we rode around the city. Despite biking seeming intimidating, Jasper made it very approachable and enjoyable. Great company- definitely would recommend!

Fun, exciting bike tour. Eight of us did a private tour. Charlotte was our guide and was wonderful.Two of the 8 were not real comfortable biking in Amsterdam, so We Bike Amsterdam arranged for two tandem bikes, which made it a much more enjoyable tour for everyone.With over 1,000,000 bikes in Amsterdam and bike lanes that also allow small motor bikes on them you really have to stay alert. Then you add trolley's,buses and a lot of walkers to the mix and it is a totally different experience than your normal bike ride.It was one of the highlights of our stay in Amsterdam and we would recommend it, if you are comfortable on a bike.

Fantastic experience!. We arrived in the pouring rain at 10:00 to Dam Square to find Jasper (our guide) still (thankfully!) waiting on us and two others in our group. It ended up just being the four of us on the tour plus Jasper. He was so informative, knowledgable, and most of all friendly. Because it was raining (and thus giving us the "true Dutch experience") we stopped halfway through the tour for about thirty minutes at this cafe in th Jordaan. It was such a fantastic and personal experience that I wouldn't trade for anything. After the tour had concluded Jasper was also more than happy to give us a suggestion for a lunch spot that was on par. This was the best experience I had in Amsterdam. I suggest this to everyone!!
Take the Hidden Gems Tour!. Our family of four had one of the best days of our 2-week vacation with Thijs and We Bike Amsterdam! You don't know to look any further...just book!

A great introduction to riding in A'dam and seeing all the different areas.. Great bike tour - took us all around the gorgeous streets of the different areas of A'Dam (it was the hidden tour so not the major inner areas) and discovered a lot we went back to visit the next day. Was also great to ride around on the bike and get used to it as it gave us the confidence to borrow bikes ourselves the next day which was fantastic.

Bike Ride. Overall the tour was interesting, and covered a good portion of the city. We did stop more than expected, but it makes sense to do so in order for the guide to provide insight as it would be difficult to ride and talk/listen as the same time. You do ride a good amount on streets and cross some busy streets, so would just recommend you are comfortable riding a bike. I went with my two kids 8 and 11. My 11 year old did just fine, but he does like to ride bikes. If you are a helicopter parent you probably would be too stressed out to enjoy this tour. My 8 year old is not mature enough to ride on his own so originally was going to ride tandem but he was too short for it, so ended up with a child seat, which he was too big for and threw off the balance of the bike, but I just went ahead as I'm pretty comfortable with bikes. Point being I would just ensure your have the right bike set up if you have a child above 5 or so, but they aren't able to ride on their own. If you are an avid biker looking for a good long ride, probably should do a private tour or look for something outside the city.

A great tour of the city!. Four of us booked a bike tour with We Bike Amsterdam. We meet at 10:00 AM at our appointed place, a square easily located on any city map and within walking distance from center city.We met Thijs at the square, we walked a short distance to where the bikes are kept, and he fit each of us to our bikes. After a quick explanation of the traffic rules, we were off. Thijs made frequent stops to explain the sites we saw. We had a stop for a cool beverage, very refreshing for the heat wave we were having. We were two couples in our 60's and had no problems with the tour, as long as you know how to bike!Highly recommended! Experience Amsterdam like a local!

Private bike tour a terrific overview, pay attention. We booked a private bike tour with Thys so that we could sleep in later after flying across the Atlantic. He's a low-key, friendly, knowledgeable man, and we very much enjoyed our bike tour. Please note that Amsterdam is bike crazy and there are many pedestrians, to boot. There is more need in terms of looking out for onesself than most will be used to. Be well rested and have some experience walking in Amsterdam before you take on the bike tour, just for safety sake, because bikes come and go in both directions on both sides of the street. It takes some serious getting used to. Look three times before stepping out.

FANTASTIC Private tour of North Amsterdam!!!!. Go, Do, See, Experience!! Cannot say enough good things about our private tour... Beautiful scenery, a peaceful escape from the city experiencing quintessential landscapes and villages... Broek-In-Waterland, wow, so charming; a delicious lunch of traditional "pancakes" at De Witte Swane, delicious! A big Thank you to our guide Thijs Bakker for showing us a slice of the Netherlands that we otherwise would not have seen! And because of our fitness level, my partner & I were able to travel a bit further and see a bit more than most ~ thank you, thank you Thijs for a wonderful biking experience!!

Terrific tour!. My husband and I joined a group of seven other travelers to take this charming and off the beaten track tour of Amsterdam. Our guide Thijs was well versed in city history and spoke excellent English (he was native Dutch). One of the tour travellers was not a strong bike rider (frankly none of us were compared to the Dutch) but Thijs was kind and encouraging throughout the trip and she did just great. We saw the original West Indies Trading office, the Begijnhof (secret garden), Vondelpark and a few other sites, crossing off lots of the lesser known sites in Amsterdam. We stopped for a short respite where you could order lunch if you wanted to. Our tour lasted about 3.5 hours. A wonderful way to learn the rules of the biking roads in Amsterdam, see some hidden sites and spend time with a charming Dutch guide. Thumbs up!

Wonderful morning by bike. We had a group of 10 people biking around Amsterdam enjoyable biking lanes. We stopped to see several intresting places when our friendly professional local guide described the roots of the city and the people living in the city. Bikes were in good condition and comfortable to ride. I enjoyed a lot.

Can't complain. This tour was good fun and cycling around Amsterdam gave us a good feel for the city as well as an idea of what to visit next. Our guide spoke decent english and had satisfactory knowledge, although not too in depth (but hey it's 25€ and you get a bike!). The only thing that bothered me was the mandatory stop at some cafe, it was nice but I'd rather sightsee on my tour rather than sit around.

Great way to see the City. Very enjoyable bike tour led by Jasper. Very friendly and accommodating guide. Full of fun facts. And at all times I felt very safe. Would really recommend We Bike Amsterdam.

We choose the right bike tour. Our tour guide, Lisa, was an excellent leader. She was knowledgeable and attentive. It was delightful to see a less touristy side of the city. We needed to rent a tandem bike & it was initially very tricky for us to ride. I wouldn't recommend the experience on the busy streets of Amsterdam unless both riders are capable cyclists. Unfortunately, this was not the case for us. It was a fun 3-hours anyways. To the woman who suffered a minor injury while on the tour: I hope you made a complete recovery and all is okay for you (Lisa was very attentive to this matter..thank you).

Terrific way to see authentic Amsterdam. Did the We Amsterdam bike tour of Amsterdam this morning and had a terrific time. Our guide was excellent - very pleasant and highly knowledgable on the history of Amsterdam, the culture and took us to many interesting non-touristy spots. The bikes were in good condition and despite a little rain we all had an excellent experience!

Enjoyable city to bike with a good guide and a small group. We took the We Bike Amsterdam city tour as a family of 4 and had a great time. Amsterdam is an easy biking city, and we enjoyed feeling part of the crowd that we'd seen riding around us during our time there. The tour route was well designed and took us through various parts of the city, mainly in the west and south. We stopped at several sights, including a hidden church and Vondelpark, and learned a little about the history of the city. Our guide, Thijs, was friendly and spoke good English. I was impressed that he learned everyone's name in the first few minutes. There were 11 in our group, which was a nice size for keeping together - more would have made it much more difficult and felt less personal. We've taken bike tours in several cities and find them a good way to get the lay of the land, and give our feet a rest. This one did not disappoint.

A highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. This was one of the best things we did in our three days in Amsterdam.We did a private tour with eight people including a couple of members who weren't confident about riding themselves so we'd arranged for two tandems. We Bike Amsterdam was great about accommodating our request which made the trip possible for our entire group.Charlotte was a great guide and took us to some beautiful spots and found great routes for us to get there. Biking in Amsterdam can be chaotic for the uninitiated, so her choice of routes to allow for a relaxing, informative ride was very much appreciated. The sites and information she provided was terrific and she was incredibly patient with us (and she needed to be). We saw things we never would have seen without this trip which were all memorable.I'd recommend We Bike Amsterdam to any of my friends without reservation.

Great way to see the city . We had a great time, the riding is easy with lots of stops at points of interest. Very informative and a great way to learn about some parts of Amsterdam you might not usually get to see. Very friendly tour guides.

Great experience and highly recommend to get to know Amsterdam. These guys are great.. The tour and the guide were really very good. the ride is super easy and very informative about the city. One of the very best things to do.

Brilliant 3 hours, fun, informative and great people. This was a brilliant way to get to see parts of Amsterdam, learn some really interesting facts and all done by someone whom was genuine, not just reciting the same thing monotone but really making you feel like you're out with a friend showing your the sites including some hidden gems. Really insightful but delivered in a casual way. Love the stop off for a beer at a cafe! Saw a lot of other tours during my stay and they all had the obvious look of a tourist event delivered daily but this one felt personal and could not recommend it highly enough.

The best way to see Amsterdam!!. Bar none! My wife and I took a 3 hr private tour with "Ties", probably butchered the spelling, but he is one of the owners. Nice relaxed pace, got us off the beaten path and j to many beautiful neighborhoods. He speaks great English, took time for water and bio breaks, I would do it again and highly recommend.

A highlights of out trip. This was a fantastic activity. Fun, informative, a great way to get around Amsterdam and tour. Our guide, Charlotte, was great, upbeat and very knowledgeable. Highly recommend this activity!!

A definite "must do" in Amsterdam!. Not sure of our schedule until the last minute, we booked the night before and were not disappointed. Charlotte took 10 of us on a tour of the city, through quiet neighborhoods as well as the more well known sights. Rode nice bikes, three speed and hand brakes, always felt safe with our guide. She was patient and calm even through the more crowded streets. We have travelled to 5 continents with our family and this was one of our favorites!! Many thanks to We Bike Amsterdam!

Thoroughly Enjoyable . Booked this bike tour having read the reviews on here! I couldn't recommend it more, our guide Jasper was friendly, helpful and informative. Great value for money and a fantastic way to see some of the sights of Amsterdam. A great morning!!
Fabulous. Very well organised tour, great guide, super bikes and so much ground covered that we wouldn't have managed on our own. We learnt a lot and would highly recommend this company.

Super fun family experience!. This is a MUST do for anyone visiting Amsterdam. After a couple days in awe of the bike culture here we decided to join in, but it can be daunting, navigating the streets in this busy city on a bike, so what better way to do it then to join a fun group of English speaking travelers and a handsome, informative guide (Jasper!) and hit the road. You will cruise like a local, learn about this cool city, burn off that croissant and have a blast. Our kids are 10 and 14 and did great, it was fun for all!

A Must. I booked this tour before I came here! It's in a small group which makes it great! Also the guys at We Bike Amsterdam are really friendly and helpful! I can totally say that I had a brilliant time! You learn things that the guide book doesn't tell you! Also you get to meet like minded people! Fab tour!!!

We took a tour with Jasper. Hi, we were lucky enough to take a tour of Amsterdam with Jasper. He is a rather attractive young man, cracks some good jokes. Pity my husband was with me, but I had to bring him along.The ride was well paced, good stops at some unique hidden places to explore. We also stopped at a cafe to warm up, good coffee.Thanks! Danke

The dutch way of seeing Amsterdam. When in Amsterdam, do what the locals do. Take a bike! With "we bike amsterdam" we saw different parts of the city and were told stories that most guidebooks will skip. We were only six plus our guide so it felt really personal. As we were lucky to do the tour on a sunny day, Amsterdam was really at its best too.

Interesting and informative bike tour!. Bike tours are one of my favorite ways to see and learn about a city when I am traveling. This tour was no different! My father and I quite enjoyed our morning ride around Amsterdam with Julia. She was full of information, made conversation with people in our group, answered questions, and was very aware of where her group was at all times. The ride was not strenuous and, in that way, was quite relaxing. The most challenging part, at least for me, was trying not to get lost. There are so many people on bikes in Amsterdam, it was hard not to start following the wrong person, or get stuck waiting behind a car. About half of our group got lost, as we were caught behind a delivery truck, and guessed at turning the wrong direction. Once we returned to the point at which we made the wrong turn, Julia easily found us. On other bike tours I have done, we wore reflective vests so we could easily stay together (and it was less of a challenge, anyway, in cities with wider roads and less bike traffic). I wonder if having participants or the guides wearing something like this would make keeping the tour together easier?Getting lost for a short period of time did not take away from our experience, however, and we would gladly go on this tour again! Thank you, Julia and We Bike Amsterdam, for an interesting orientation of the city's common, and not so common, sights!

Weekend break. We booked the trip after seeing it on TA not ever having done a cycle tour or visited Amsterdam before, so it was a leap of faith. We weren't disappointed. For 25 euros we got a 3 hour fun, informative tour of the less well known jewels of Amsterdam. Our guide Thijs made sure we were safe but treated as adults and went at a pace that suited all abilities. There was a chance to stop and talk as well as just enjoy the ride. Highly recommended!

Excellent way to see the City. We were in Amsterdam for a few days and booked the 3 hour City tour as we love cycling and as the tour promised to show us the unknown City sights. Our guide Jasper was at the meeting point on time and was very friendly. We walked for about 5 minutes to collect our bikes and after Jasper explained the basics of cycling in Amsterdam, we set off. Jasper kept the pace just right and showed us areas that we would not have visited otherwise. This is a great way to see the city, to meet fellow travellers and to cover a large area in a short time. On the tour, we stopped at various places and Jasper was very informative with lots of local knowledge and some myth. I would definitely recommend this tour.

Best way to see Amsterdam. Thijs was the best tour guide we could have imagined. We took a private tour with our two granddaughters . He took into account their ages, interests and was incredibly thoughtful in his presentation and timing. We recommend him and the experience as a must do to enjoy this magical city.

Great way to start your trip!. We decided to book this tour on our very first day in Amsterdam and it was well worth it. We learned about Amsterdam's history, cycled through the popular parts of the city and also off the beaten path. Thijs kept it interesting and fun, was approachable and answered all our questions. I would definitely recommend this tour as me and my partner enjoyed it a lot :)Greetings, Eva and Lance

Great host and fun tour. Personal bike ride with only 6 people in our group (although I think this usually is 10)Took us to nice spots mentioning history and myths behind many of the sites, and then shared a coffee at a little dutch cafeHighly recommend if it is your 1st trip to Amsterdam

Fabulous bike tour of the uncommon. Highly recommend this bike tour, fabulous tour guide, very interesting sites (not the common tourist sites). Tour guide had the history behind unusual and usual practices in Amsterdam.Easy cycling, good group, comfortable bikes, enjoyable coffee break.

A must-do in Amsterdam. Went on a bike tour with a group of friends while visiting Amsterdam during a long weekend...and I truly enjoyed it. It was a great way to experience the city and get to know about its history. The tour is roughly 3 hours long but the cycling is easy and the tour guide was attentive to any individual difficulties that could arise. I would definitely recommend a bike tour around Amsterdam.

Brilliant private bike tour to countryside with thij. Highly recommend taking a private countryside tour with thij he was great, a really nice friendly guy and he was great with the kids ( 8 year old twins). Kept thrm really engaged anc kept us all safe and at a good pace. lots of interesting info, lovely trip with breathtaking views, and nice lunch / drink stop in pretty canel cafe. Highlight of our trip, we all loved it. Keep up the great work thij :-)
Highly recommended. Great tour and guide, excellent mix of outdoor activity, seeing all the sights, interesting anecdotes and history and a good group of fellow travellers to enjoy it with.

Highlight of our stay!!!. We were in Amsterdam for a couple of days prior to a cruise. I booked a tour with We Bike Amsterdam for our family of 4 and it was the highlight of our stay! We love to rent bikes in cities we visit, but having a Thijs as our guide here in Amsterdam really helped in navigating the local traffic. We also saw parts of Amsterdam that were off the beaten tourist path. It was a lovely day spent pedaling around the city....I wished we had had more time with Thijs!

Best tour in Amsterdam. This was my second trip to Amsterdam and my partner's first. I don't think there is a better way to see the city than this. We were fortunate to be part of an awesome group of people and Thijs, our guide, was informative, intesting and very pleasant. It can be intimidating on a bike in Amsterdam but we found it a great amount of fun with our guide and got to see so many awesome things the normal tours never show you. The intimate nature of the tour also helps and now we can say we biked through this beautiful city. I would highly recommend it! Baie dankie Thijs vir die uitstekende toer en diens! Sien julle volgende keer weer.

Short Break . We booked this trip before we left the UK so that We wouldn't miss it as numbers are limited . I saw Hidden Gems I have never seen previously . We are British and all the other people on the trip were American . We had a nice chat during the scheduled coffee break at a local cafe. The bikes were very easy to ride and had comfortable saddles! It was magic and very safe .

Best €25 spent in Amsterdam. What a lovely tour! Our host Lisa was very personable and gave some interesting facts about the city's history and architecture. This tour lasts three hours, including s café break, and covers some ground in the less-touristic areas (which are lovely!) I'd definitely recommend for anyone who loves being outside, exploring (not very strenuous) and seeing as much as possible in a short amount of time.

Brilliant. What a fantastic trip. Our two guides were very knowledgeable and guided us around this interesting city stopping off for coffee and chat. This was very welcomed as my husband and I hadn't been on a bike for over 15 years. The bikes were up to date and easy to control. The tour took us all around the city stopping now and again for the guides to explain points of interest.

Great way to see Amsterdam. A real highlight of our recent visit to Amsterdam - great way to experience the city ! Jasper was very informative about the city and paced the tour well - great way to feel like a local!

Top two-wheel tour. The best way to see Amsterdam and discover hidden gems behind the facades and down narrow alleyways. Thijs was a very knowledgeable, helpful and friendly guide, happy to offer advice for things to do for the rest of our stay. Well worth doing!

Highlight of our Weekend in Amsterdam!. Just had a family weekend in Amsterdam and we all loved our bike tour with the knowledgeable and amiable Thijs who took us to the less touristy backwaters of the city. 3 hour trip in total including a really pleasant coffee and cake stop. The cycling itself was easy - even my 21 year old daughter who "doesn't do cycling" loved it. A great way to see the city!

Wonderful tour!. We went on the city tour with Jasper and it was wonderful! We had our 19 month old son with us, I was a little worried how he would do on the tour but it went great! Jasper was very helpful and patient. The tour itself covered a lot of city highlights we wanted to see. Jasper was full of great information and good stories. If you are traveling to Amsterdam with our without your kiddos this is a great tour!!
Brill bike tour. We all really enjoyed our bike tour with Jasper. Great way to see Amsterdam by bike and Jasper was lovely and very informative. Also gave some good recommendations for places to eat!

Enjoyable way to get an overview of Amsterdam. My husband and I enjoy doing bike tours when we arrive in a new city. The We Bike Amsterdam tour was a very enjoyable way for a first time visitor to Amsterdam to see different parts of the city. Our guide very helpfully emailed us after the tour with some restaurant suggestions - one was for Cafe Kadijk which was excellent.
We like We Bike. Very nice tour around Amsterdam. Some history and stories about the locations where we stopped. We loved it! And also time for a coffee break. Nice!
Best way to discover Amsterdam!. is was an very nice tour. Amsterdam is the best city for viewing with a cycle. i would recommend this for sure!

Awesome tour to see the city!!!. We took a private tour where there was 17 of us and Thijs did a great job of keeping everyone in check. Considering that we just came from a 16 hour flight and we had some kids along in the bike tour, we had an awesome time seeing the city for the first time! Despite being a slow group that had to stop and wait for everyone else to cross the street or whatnot, He was very patient and helpful with everything. Thijs was also friendly and gave a lot insights on the history and information about Amsterdam that we really appreciated.

Great tour . Highly recommend this tour!!
You won't regret it!! For all ages! Nice way to see the city. Gives you information about the city's history and most icon places!!!

Great experience in Amsterdam. It was my very lucky option to visit Amsterdam. I enjoyed this guided bike tour despite the fact I am not an experienced biker. Everything was excellent: our guide (the passion for history, the professional and friendly attitude), the group, the hidden place visited that introduced us in a lovely Dutch history lesson. I highly recommended this way to start to explore Amsterdam.

The best 3 hours in Amsterdam!!. We booked a bike tour for 3 hours and were so glad we did! Both guides were very informative and taught us so much about the history of Amsterdam and took us away from the city centre and the things we already knew from our guide books before visiting. We got to see the outskirts of Amsterdam and hear about all sorts of things and see all sorts of places as well as enjoying riding our bikes around the areas! Both guides were very friendly and helped with any extra bits of information you wanted to know and were very personable. They also keep small groups to under 12 so you get a real personal experience. We both thoroughly enjoyed this tour and would highly recommend them as a company!

The best way to see Amsterdam. We booked a private tour with Thijs. We spent three hours cycling around in glorious sunshine. Really informative and relaxed tour with stops to explore markets etc. Great to have a half way wine stop too. I cannot recommend this company highly enough, even our two teenaged daughters loved it. Nice to blend in with the locals even if we didn't really get to grips with who had right of way!

Favourite part of our trip. This was an excellent bike tour. Amsterdam is the perfect size for viewing from a bike. Our guide Jasper was fun and informative. We had a great time and would put this on top of a list of recommendations for anyone visiting Amsterdam.

A fun afternoon. We booked this for while visiting Amsterdam, and asked for an adult trike for my self. They got us the trike as requested but rather than go with a group we decided that it would be better if we could do the tour with out holding other people up.This was better for me as I could then go at my own pace and not get in a flap trying to keep up with a group. A trike is a little harder to maneuver than a cycle and can feel heavy for me especially on a hill.We can thoroughly recommend doing this tour either in a group or as we did it. We went further out of the city to see other areas, were given plenty of information, went along the canals and round Vondelpark, it was a lovely sunny afternoon which also helped.Thanks to Thijs for looking after us.
Excellent. This was a great way to see Amsterdam, we were there in January with another couple. Even in the rain it was incredible. Highly recommend.

What a fun and informative way to see Amsterdam!. Four of us did a private tour with Thijs and it was such a wonderful experience! He took us to cool places we would never have known about nor visited on our own, and not only did we have fun, but we learned a lot too. He made sure we all stayed together and safely got across sometimes quite busy roads. We took frequent breaks so the bike riding was never tiring. Thijs even borrowed my camera and took candid pictures of our group while we were riding--Now that's a full service tour guide! At the end of the tour when we asked him if he could recommend a boat tour company, he called a friend of his and arranged a private tour for that same evening, which was awesome as well! Could not recommend Thijs or We Bike Amsterdam any more highly! There is no better way to explore the beautiful city of Amsterdam than by bike!

History made fun. An informative biking tour of Amsterdam, taking in green parks, quiet, side canals, off the beaten track areas of Amsterdam. Visiting tucked away courtyards which you may have walked past unnoticed. No one was left behind on the tour, although some of the busier road crossings were not easy. You had to remember to ride on the right hand side, look out for trams, cars other bikes and pedestrians, stationery vans blocking the way etc. An exciting challenge.
Well deserved top rating. Had a fabolous experience. Great tour guide and very knowledgeable. I felt like a real local and throughly enjoyed the tour. I would recommend to everyone to do it!!

Not just a Bike Tour but an Experience.. We booked our tour with We Bike Amsterdam last minute and had a great time.We meet with Thjis at Dam Square where he took us for a short walk to a shop to collect our bikes. The bikes are comfortable and ver easy to ride and stable on the roads.Thjis is very knowledgeable about the city, but best of all were the stories of Amsterdam and you would may not necessarily pick up in a guide book. The highlight was cycling through Vondlepark.. where Thjis was so kind to capture some really memorable shots of our bike tour.I couldn't recommend Thjis highly enough as well as giving us a great tour around Amsterdam but also sent us a list of great places to eat, which we followed up on and had a great time. This tour group really know their city and how to provide great customer service.

Highlight of my holiday. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour with Webikeamsterdam. The tour was accessible for all abilities, interesting and very relaxed. There was even time to get to know the other people in the party - a real mix! Everyone had a great time and we saw parts of the city we wouldn't have thought of visiting as well as learning all about them. I would recommend that anyone visiting Amsterdam book a bike tour with this company. It was the best bit of my trip!

Fun history lesson. Thanks to Lisa our guide we were able to see and learn about Amsterdam's history. This tour is suitable for families young children sit in either a seat on the rear or a caddy in front (caddy is a bit tricky to ride). We took our 6 and 7 year old who thoroughly enjoyed it. Thanks guys!!
Fun, exercise, and education. The bike tour of Amsterdam was terrific. Our guide, Thijs, was very knowledgeable yet made it very fun. I highly recommend booking this.

Fantastic Tour. I wanted a bike tour that would be away from the normal sights and we got just that. 25 Euros per person which included bike. Thijs was absolutely brilliant. We met him in Dam Square, collected our bikes having had them adjusted to our needs, a short chat on biking etiquette!! and we were off. I'm not particularly fit but the biking was so easy and not at all tiring. I had no problems keeping up There was 11 of us in our group, just right, we followed each other, stopping at secret churches, intimate little courtyards, parks and saw places and were told about areas, just enough to make it interesting but not too much to get bored. My 13 year old son loved it and thats something. We stopped half way at a cafe for refreshments and we had some lovely chats with our fellow tourers and Thijs. He's very knowledgable and thoughtful. Stops and waits, points out things. 3 hours from start to finish zoomed along so fast. If you are thinking of a bike tour I would highly recommend. Well done "We Bike Amsterdam" xx

Great way to start a holiday!. We booked this (on the back of reviews) and they were all correct! Excellent tour on bikes around Amsterdam. A bit of history, a bit of story telling, a few interesting facts and a lot o fun. The three hour trip gave us a great overview of the city, highlighted some areas we wouldn't have found on our own and gave us enough ideas of where to go back later on during our holiday in Amsterdam.If you're thinking of going to Amsterdam, then book this cycle tour

Refreshing View of Amsterdam. I've been to Amsterdam a few times but this is my first bike tour of Amsterdam. I was part of the group led by Jasper who provided an interesting narration of the city. I am now aware of new facts about the city which has given me a better appreciation of the city and made this visit more interesting than previous ones. Leading a cycling group can be challenging in a city with so much traffic and Jasper was very attentive to the safety of all participants. Jasper's attitude was also one of fun and humor and his demeanor pleasant and courteous. I would recommend this groups of guys to anyone wanting a safe cycling and informative tour of Amsterdam.

Brilliant way to see the town and learn a bit of history. We had a great guide (Lisa?) who took us to the big sights (e.g. the cheeky cycle tunnel under the Reichsmuseum) and lots of hidden squares. The pace was very easy, the bikes smooth with big comfy saddles, and we had a stop for a lovely hot chocolate which we needed as it was a chilly day. By the end of the tour we had a great overview of the history of Amsterdam, and it was nice to chat to the other visitors whose backgrounds spanned three continents. We had our 14 year old son with us so I was glad we didn't go into the Red Light District which many of the other tours seem to cover. We also felt it was good value at 25 Euros. Highly recommended.

Great Experience. A cycling tour of Amsterdam for any visitor i would say is a must. More so with We Bike Amsterdam. We chose them as we did extensive research and they were the only company that offered tandem bikes for young kids as well.Jasper was a great guide with an excellent knowledge of the city, its hidden corners and sights - no just the touristy stuff - which we appreciated. There was absolutely no rush and we even spent time having coffee and snacks at a cafe, with no tight schedule, as in some tour companies.Only one improvement though, is that they should perhaps check bikes before being given to clients, my bike had suspect brakes that didn't work too well, all other bikes were fine. Besides that a perfect tour.

Highly recommended. A great to start a trip to Amsterdam. This tour is great way to begin your visit to Amsterdam. The tour groups are kept small (there were 6 in our group) and the bikes are really easy to handle. Our guide, Jasper, was excellent. He was very knowledgeable about the city and showed us the big sights, as well as lots of local secrets. There was a break in the middle for coffee, which was a nice opportunity to chat with the other people on the tour. Cycling along the busier streets can be a bit of an adventure sometimes but Jasper was careful to look after the less confident riders. And they even gave us a great recommendation for lunch afterwards!

The highlight of our family trip to Amsterdam!. I hired Thijs to take our family of four (me, my sister and her two children (10 and 14) on a bike tour of the historical sites of Amsterdam. We did this on the second day of our trip and the kids said this was the very best tour we did while in the city. Thijs was patient, funny and a lot of fun. He also paid attention to the safety of our group and made sure it was a comfortable trip for all of us. We especially liked the break at the Amsterdam "diner" style cafe. I encourage anyone who is looking to do a bike tour to use this company. Very professional and responsive. Fantastic customer focus and great bikes!

Excellent tour. Definitely recommend . Very interesting cycle tour of Amsterdam. Well guided, just the right of information and cycling. We saw many different neighbourhoods which we wouldn't have on foot.

Interesting way to see the city. Good tour round some interesting parts of the city. We learned some historical facts and stopped at an organic market. There was no rush and felt safe and secure on very comfortable bikes. The tour guide was friendly and informative and the fee included coffee. Would definitely recommend this tour.

Brilliant tour. A great family trip with Thijs, a patient, kind and funny guide who pitched it just right and extended the tour cause we were too slow. Kids loved it. Wear gloves though - your hands will get cold!

A very nice experiance!. This was a very nice experiance.What we loved most was that this company guarantee small groups (we were 6 persons) and the enthusiasm to our bike-guide Thiesh . He seemed to enjoy what he did ..he knew Amsterdam like his own pocket ...and most og all took us to new places..not the usual tourist-traps.. We recommand this tour 100% !

Excellent way to take in hidden Amsterdam. My friends and I booked our tour with We Bike Amsterdam and had a great time.We starting out with a straightforward meeting with Jasper at Dam Square where he took us for a short walk to their shop to collect our bikes. The bikes are solidly built, easy to ride and stable on the roads.Jasper is knowledgeable about the city, but best of all wasn't him reeling out facts but adding humour and anecdotes to the tour. It really was memorable.The highlight was either cycling through The Rijksmuseum or a trip into a 'not Church'.The guys who run the company are great and so are their tours. I'd definitely recommend.

Surprisingly perfect!. The tour was way more then we expected. We wanted to bike the city but I was a bit worried about my 8 year old. They have a bike with a seat that accommodates younger children or adults that do not want/can bike but my child wanted to bike by all means. So we went and it was amazing! Jasper, our guide, is extremely caring, attentive, fun and took good care of her :)Besides, he knows a lot about the city and its history and we learned way more than expected. We usually prefer to do tours on our own but this one you can't miss. We had a lot of fun and would definitely do it again and recommend!
You'll be regret if you don't join this!. The tour guide was very friendly, helpful, informative and approachable. Can be one of my best experience in Amsterdam, should really join this!

A must do!. You must do this tour. My partner and I did this tour last week with Thiesj and he is brilliant. So informative and made us feel so comfortable. If you are going to Amsterdam you HAVE to do this tour.

Great bicycle tour. Really loved this tour! Great way to see the city. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and showed us some lovely hidden gems that we otherwise wouldn't have seen. Would highly recommend.

Great for the lone traveller. I had a morning off on a recent business trip to Amsterdam. This bike tour is perfect if you want to explore the city alone. It happened to be the first tour for the new guide. He did a fantastic job of showing the group some lesser known gems in the city. Wonderful three hours that I recommend to anyone.

A lot of fun. This tour is excellent value for money, I feel like I learnt a lot about the city and it was a lot of fun seeing it by bike.Our tour guide told us that it was actually his first tour with the company (I think he was called Luke!), and he did an excellent job, knew so much about the city and was easily able to answer any questions.

Perfect way to experience Amsterdam. Our guide did a perfect job showing us around the city of Amsterdam and revealing all of the hidden gems. He was very educated and friendly - it was like a bike ride with friends. The only downside is that we did not plan for it to rain all morning. Prepare for the weather! The guide was sensitive to this and we took a break to warm up and dry off a little in a cafe. This is a great way to get around and experience the city. Highly recommended!
Very Informative. Really good value at 25 euros, very informative and our guide took us to some interesting locations that we would never have know about. Takes about 3 hours, so just about right.

Excellent Experience. We spent a week Amsterdam and by day 2 we knew we needed to book a bike tour. Riding a bike is the essence of Amsterdam and by going on a small group tour it gives you a true local feel. We had Thijs as our guide and he was great. The bikes are of the highest quality and we got the true local experience. Thijs has found the right mix of information, beautiful sites and getting the biking experience. He kept us together, made sure we made it through the the intersections and took well timed breaks. Thijs cares about his clients and their experience. While our tour was staring he got a call about taking an American celebrity on tour. As a testament to his character he did not change our plans but welcomed that person to join us. He ended up giving a private tour after us so we missed our 60 seconds of fame but it speaks to his character.This was not a physically challenging ride and we saw a lot on the tour. We would strongly recommend. You can't go to Amsterdam and not try riding a bike around the city.

best way to experience Amsterdam. Thijs, our guide, did a great job showing us the secret beauties of Amsterdam while explaining the highlights of the history of Amsterdam and the Netherlands. I was surprised about the influence of Amsterdam through history! Our guide made us feel comfortable and we had a great time and a good laugh. definately recommendable!

Great tour, excellent guide!. Thijs takes you along great, hidden places in Amsterdam. Along true Amsterdam. With him you get to see places of the city which you wouldn´t easily go to yourself, but which are very interesting and beautiful to see. Thijs is relaxed, knowledgeable and funny. I can definitely recommend biking with We Bike Amsterdam! For sure, it's worth your money.

You can see so much more by cycling on this trip. Really enjoyed our cycling trip today with Thijs around Amsterdam. Cycling in this city is expected and while the greatest danger is other cyclists a trip like this is a must do. We saw beautiful areas that we could never have covered on foot and it was so nice to cycle around the Vondelpark. The trip is interesting but not too taxing so you don't need yo be a great cyclist to enjoy.

Definitely do this!. Our tour guide literally started our tour saying that he was taking us to places that weren't the typical tourist spots, which was awesome, because I got to see some of the real Amsterdam, plus get historical facts about the city and the different sites he took us too. Plus our guide was totally cool, that gave us great tips on where to eat. The pace was relaxed and fun. Definitely recommend these guys!

Fun and Unique!. The tour manages to bring you to the true gems of Amsterdam in a relaxed and fun way. I can definitely recommend this to everyone! Even if you're not used to riding a bike that much. Bjarke

Great way to explore Amsterdam. We enjoyed a tour with we bike. We saw places I've never been even though I've been to Amsterdam many times. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable. I recommend this tour to everybody that likes to explore and learn some things about Amsterdam.

Amazing tour . We had a great trip with jasper around the city, he was absolutely lovely and full of knowledge. Stops to see things were good and off the beaten track. Really enjoyed ourselves and the bikes were great :)

Great tour!!. Took this tour on my last day in Amsterdam and definitely would recommended to anyone that wants to see more than just the tourist destinations. Great experience from beginning to end, friendly environment and awesome tour guide.

Getting to know Amsterdam . I was delighted to be shown the real Amsterdam by Thijs yesterday. 3 hours of good knowledge and chat with a coffee thrown in.I was the only person booked on the ride yesterday but that was no bother to Thijs who was proud to show me his city and work our way round the centre and the parks.No better way to get to know Amsterdam.Thank you Thijs.

Great way to see Amsterdam. We absolutely loved this tour.. Such a perfect way to see Amsterdam and lots of hidden gems. Thijs was a fantastic tour guide, really friendly and full of interesting facts. We stopped on several occasions to learn more about the history of Amsterdam and had enough time to cycle around. I would definitely recommend this tour!
Great tour. Thijs was a tremendous guide and was really informative. The tour was a great mix of the big sites and the quiet backstreets. A must do in Amsterdam.

Best Part of the Trip! . This bike tour was by far my favorite part of my trip to Amsterdam! Walking the city is fun, but seeing it by bike is amazing! Our tour guide was great! He made sure to point out some of the main tourist spots in the city, but also took us "off the beaten path" to show us some spots outside the city center that a tourist wouldn't normally see! Would definitely recommend this as a must do when visiting Amsterdam!

Cruising around in Amsterdam. Nice to bike around in Amsterdam city. Beautiful Village town. Great bike opportunities by map. From one Place to another. Best way to see the town. Stop at a Nice resturant for lunch. With Norwegian salmon and wine. Yum. Pictures on my blog.http://pearlsreiseglede.blogg.no/1413054894_cruisien_around_in_am.html

Really insightful tour of Amsterdam - thanks Jasper. Firstly can I say, Tulsi and I thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Jasper was both highly intelligent and funny. He knew his facts, and made the tour fun. He makes sure nobody gets lost, yet allows you to freely bike at your own pace. This equilibrium of freedom and concern allows you to cycle like you're a local, and not on a tour with an eye up your backside. Bike - I thought it would be hard. Jasper assured us it would be easy, and guess what? It was. He adjusts your bike to your needs. My girlfriend said it was too tall for her mere 5'1.5 stature, so he gave her one of the 'low-rider' bikes. (This made her look a little like the Undertaker when he was an American Bad*ss. )I really liked the tour. you stop off for some Tea and one point - which I happily replaced for a Vodka Soda. Yes - drink cycling is more fun. I can see why these guys are number 1 - definitely do this tour. ps. They give you "after-care" emails about where to go and what to do. They do this as friends, and they don't need to. Nor do I believe that they are influenced by any particular company/friends - they just tell you the best things to do. I liked that touch.

Top tour and a top guide. This is a must-do activity in Amsterdam!We did the tour as a family with 3 children, the youngest 10 years, who rate this as the "best thing we did in Amsterdam...". It takes you at a leisurely pace through parts of the City that you are unlikely to discover yourself and offers a fun and insightful aspect on history and culture.Our tour guide was Thijs who was fabulous and really ensured that the younger children on the tour were safe and got a great hot chocolate to warm cold hands half way through!. Thijs clearly knows and loves his City and this gave a tour that I suspect is much more personal and insightful than many of the others (though we didn't do them). The only dampener for us was the fact that I stupidly lost my wallet during the tour - Thijs could not have been more helpful in trying to find it - from cycling back around the route, calling lost and found and even offering to lend us some money! - he really went the extra mile to help and is a top man!Make sure you do this tour (just keep your wallet safe). Thanks Thijs

See more than the main paths. This tour took us down areas that we probably wouldn't have done on our own just because we didn't know about them and all on a bike. We were in a small group of 7 and our guide kept the ride easy, plus we learnt about the history, architecture and some very interesting facts about the city. We weren't riding the entire time, we stopped regularly at certain spots to learn about things and had many opportunities to take photos. We learnt about different areas outside the main touristy spots, rode around the largest park and even stopped for a delicious hot chocolate. We highly recommend this as its a great way to see the city.

Hidden depths. Our group cycle tour covered Hidden Amsterdam. As we visited places I would never have otherwise found ( from parakeets in the park to washer women airer racks from the seventeenth century and the HQ of the West India Trading Compay) ,Thijs was very informative explaining the history of Amsterdam 's success in a friendly manner .Our ride took place on a crisp February day so the coffee stop in a lovely little café was a welcome chance to warm our fingers! We had children ( 8+) in our group who he made sure were directly behind him and happy as we travelled. The bikes were really easy to ride and the pace leisurely. A great, informative tour for half term. Thanks!

Must do in Amsterdam!. My experience in seeing Amsterdam with Thijs as our guide for 3,5 hours was unforgettable. Thijs's knowledge of the city, country and area from history to current events is amazing. I count myself very fortunate to book such wonderful tour to see Amsterdam on the bike!

Great tour in one of the more bike friendly places we've travelled. It's easy to get to know the Red Light District & more touristy parts of Amsterdam on foot, but the best way to see it all is definitely on a bike and we had an excellent time strolling around the city and learning so much about it's history, architecture, arts, and more. I think there might have been some options that were a few Euros less, but this provides a smaller group and gives you a tour that you won't get on foot or in larger groups. We were very pleased with the time we spent here and would encourage all to book a tour with We Bike Amsterdam.

There's no 'fault in these 5 stars!'. Don't stop and think about doing this...book it now! It is a brilliant way to see Amsterdam!It didn't feel like a touristy tour, it felt like a bike ride with friends. We learnt so much about the city and saw things we would have never seen on our own. Our guide even took time to point out the bench from the film 'The Fault in our Stars' which my teenage daughter had been desperate to get a photo of! We cycled like locals around markets, museums, courtyards, the park, over bridges and canals and even had a break for a delicious hot chocolate. Let's face it....you can't come to Amsterdam and not get on a bike and this tour shouldn't be missed!!Thank you!

great fun, despite the cold rainy weather. It was a rather gloomy, cold, rainy morning, and we started having second thought about doing the bike tour when we arrived at the meeting place for the bike tour. But we were so glad that we spent this cold wet morning biking around Amsterdam with Jasper! Riding on the bike actually made us feel warmer, and the experience was something we will never forget. It was fun, informative, and just very pleasant. Jasper was very personable, and we learned a lot about the city and the country and had a great time! Hope the weather gets sunny and warm so we can do the countryside tour!

Best Way to See Amsterdam. As a traveler, I like to see cities in a way that reflects either how the locals or how history sees the place. Seeing Amsterdam by canal boat reflects it's past; seeing Amsterdam on a bicycle shows it's present. We Bike Amsterdam is a REALLY REALLY AWESOME tour to take. Our guide, Thijs, was amazing: fantastic showing the sights and terrific with our nine year old son. Traveling the city by bike and in We Bike Amsterdam's exceptionally capable hands, you get to see quite a bit of the city, learn about it's past and see the town the way it's bike-riding inhabitants see it today. If there is one thing you do in Amsterdam, let We Bike Amsterdam be it.

amsterdam bike tour. Myself and partner booked bike tour for our first day, our guide Jasper was very informative and very helpful with some good recommendations of places to go see. The tour gave insight into Amsterdam's history which was not too much of a history lesson, it was well adapted to suit a short break and we got to familiarise ourselves with Amsterdam before hiring the bikes ourselves the next day. Definately recommended.

A Must Do!!. If you are visiting Amsterdam, please,please arrange for a cycle tour with this company one of the days. I promise you will not be disappointed!We pre-booked two places before our visit and the payment and info' provided before we met on the day was supurb.We met at 10am in the square by the lions as pre-booked and found there were another 8 booked to join us, which was no problem what so ever.After a 5 minute walk to the bike shop we collected our hire bike (looked brand new) and set off. Every so often our guide would stop and explain about the history of Amsterdam and particular places of interest which were not only fascinating but hard to believe.The tour itself lasted 3 hours but the time just flew by. We stopped for drinks half way through the tour at a lovely coffee shop in the suburbs of the city, cycling through parks, avenues and markets to get there.Our guide truely loves the city he lives in and it shows with his passion for explaining any question you may want answering. He even sent us an e mail after with directions to bars/resturants in the city that he recommended.10 out of 10. Brilliant!!!

Excellent way to experience Amsterdam by bicycle. My partner & I really enjoyed touring Amsterdam with Jasper & a small group of other tourists. Jasper was enthusiastic, knowledgable, friendly, & approachable. One thing that really impressed us both was Jasper's willingness to alter the 'set tour' so that one tourist could visit the location of a favourite film. The tour went longer than advertised, which was ok with us all. The bikes were in good condition - comfortable & easy to ride. At the end of the day Jasper gave us some advice on places to visit - we especially enjoyed beer & apple pie at the 200+ year old bar (Cafe 'l Papeneiland)... Very highly recommended!

Excellent way to explore Amsterdam!. We moved to Amsterdam about three months ago and this was the first "touristy" thing we tried. What a fun day we had! The bicycles we rode were in great condition and the tour itself was interesting and lovely. Thijs was an excellent tour guide and so interesting to listen to as well as chat with. If you're visiting Amsterdam, this is a must do and you'll be happy that you did!

Class Dutch transportation...and a great guide. Since bicycle is the traditional means of Dutch transportation, this tour feels very authentic.Due to the small size of the tour, Jasper was able to point some attractions specific to our personalities (one of us on the tour was interested in modern art) and specific bits of history relevant to us (I am from NYC, so we got to hear about the Dutch history of NYC).A great tour from likable tour guides. Thanks to both of them.

Well worth doing this with a guide. We did this cycle tour with Thijs in early November and were lucky with the weather as it was like a warm summer's day.Thijs is a fantastic guide, very knowledgeable about the city and you do get to see so much more than you would if you just stayed on the tourist trail.We had 2 children aged 10 and 13 with us and it was fine although you do have to be careful as the traffic comes from all directions with trams, cyclists, cars etc.Thijs also very kindly pointed out the hotel where the film "The Fault In Our Stars" was filmed because we had some fans on the tour.We would have done a countryside tour too if we had had more time. Definitely do this tour to see the city like a local.

A fantastic way to see Amsterdam. We selected We Bike Amsterdam based on the reviews on Trip Advisor and the fact that they offered to show you the "hidden" Amsterdam. We chose to do a private tour and we were not disappointed! E-mails beforehand to organise the tour were responded to quickly and efficiently and Thijs met us at the bike shop at the agreed time (we were actually running a bit late). The bikes given to us all worked well and had hand brakes and 3 gears as opposed to the traditional Dutch bike with foot brakes and only one gear - we found this very helpful! We spent about 3 hours riding the streets of Amsterdam and visited a hidden church, a hidden courtyard, the headquarters of the Dutch West Indian company amongst many other sites. We also stopped for a cup of coffee and some apple tart about halfway through the tour. Overall, a very entertaining and informative tour. Thank you, Thijs.

Small tour with great guide. A friend from work had taken the bike tour in Amsterdam a month ago and suggested them to me. The reservation process was easy and fast email. We met on Saturday morning at Dam Square and Jasper our Guide was there before had to meet and greet us. The shop is a short walk away and we started the tour from there. Jasper was very informative, comfortable and accommodating. The history and sites we stopped at were beautiful. We had a great small group of people (5 total) and our pace was perfect for everyone on the tour. We also stopped at a small bistro for coffee and cakes and chatted as a group with Jasper. I would recommend this small start up company above a big large tour company (and we saw a lot of them with 30 or more bikes riding around) as our time was informal, and high quality.

Amazing Amsterdam Experience. A great 3 hr tour to explore the city and it's hidden attractions. If you want to sample the city and not get overwhelmed, Jasper and Webikeamsterdam is the way to go. Great bikes, good dictation. Loved it.

Excellent!. We booked this online at the last minute after arriving late one evening into Amsterdam and we were glad that we did. Although the early morning start was a bit of an ask (and only 3 out of the 4 of us managed it!) the tour guide (Tice) was terrific. He was well informed and very passionate about his city. Also, very patient with those of us less used to riding bikes. The tour takes you through parts of Amsterdam less likely to be on the tourist route. Thus, you get to find out lots of interesting facts about its history and see some more unusual but very interesting parts of the city. This is a great way to get to know the real Amsterdam. Highly recommend this tour.

Great bike tour to discover hidden parts of Amsterdam. My girlfriend and myself had a wonderful time on this bike tour. Thijs showed us around and the tour was really informative and interesting. Good pace of tour and the group was mixed ability, you could tell some people had not been on a bike in a long time. I would definitely recommend this tour to everybody especially those who are looking for something a bit different to the more commercial bike tours.

Great way to see the city!. Our group thoroughly enjoyed this bike tour. It was well organised, easy paced and really informative! The guide was great and it was good to be able to see the lesser known sights of Amsterdam. Some of the backstreets and courtyards were among the most beautiful parts of Amsterdam so I would really recommend this tour to get off the typical tourist track!

The Best way to see this city is on a bicycle. Amsterdam is a bikers' city. Everyone uses a bicycle and with dedicated cycle lanes, it's also safe. You can go into the bylanes and enjoy the city with a freedom of cycling anywhere. You can hire the cycles from your hotel at a reasonable price. But make sure that you lock them and tie them to the nearest poles before you go anywhere.

Covers good ground. Such a fantastic insight into the city with facts, history and knowledge from our lovely guide. A perfect way to see the city and some of the surrounds and get a taste of how it feels to be on those famous cycle paths with the locals. Didn't actually start cycling til 10.20 or later after walking to the hire shop and getting fitted with bikes but by the end it's of no relevance.

By far the best way to discover Amsterdam!. Our local guide Jasper took us by bike to the best places of Amsterdam. We had enough short breaks to listen to his interesting stories about hidden neighbourhoods, bridges and courtyards. He even took us inside a large and old remaining hidden church. I am from Amsterdam myself, but discovered a lot of new things during the tour. I really recommend this tour for tourists and locals!

Best way to explore the city. We booked this tour on our last day. It was the highlight of the trip as we were exposed to so many hidden treasures we would have never discovered on our own. In addition we received an overview of Dutch history and met new people. We couldn't have covered that much ground on foot. At the three quarter point was a lovely stop at a cafe which provided a great opportunity for people to get to know each other. Off to Bruges now; hope to find something similar.

Amazing!. The most wonderful tour, well worth it! Amazing guides, i learnt a lot about the city and on bikes was even more fun. Best way to see the city! Was lovely to have a pit stop at a cafe (i recommend getting a fresh mint tea, to warm up). Can't recommend this enough!

Excellent choice for a bike tour!. We had Thijs lead our small bicycle group and he was a super host. We met at Dam Square and walked a short distance to the bicycle rental shop. It wasn't long before we were all on bikes and making stops at local sites of interest. I won't spoil it by naming the sites he took us to but they definitely aren't sites I would have found. Thijs was very knowledgable and knows much of Amsterdam history. He takes his time and makes sure everyone is comfortable. The tour is about 3 hours and there are stops at cafes to warm up with a hot chocolate (if it's raining like it was when we went). He also emailed me a bunch of recommendations for restaurants,etc after the tour. I would recommened this tour to anyone interested in seeing Amsterdam's sites by bicycle.

Start here for awesome. I booked a bike tour with these chaps the first morning I arrived. A great choice. For some strange reason I was the only booking, and would have happily gone another day when there were more people but my schedule didn't permit. Didn't faze Thijs though - I had an amazing personal tour across the best parts of Amsterdam.First I learnt the basics of biking in Amsterdam (a must if you're a tourist like me). Then Thijs showed off the best of architecture, history, and stories of Amsterdam. I loved that it was off the beaten path, with an amazing stop for coffee. The bike tour got me orientated with the city, and thereafter knew immediately where things were. We avoided touristy parts (with the exception of the Museum Square) but his tips for visiting Amsterdam were priceless. Go with these chaps - they love the city, and it shows.

Back streets and hidden treasures 3 hour tour!. This tour, given by Thijs was undoubtedly the highlight of our time in Amsterdam! It was fun, informative, leisurely and just an excellent way to see Amsterdam. We were shown and told about the 'real' history of the city and taken to parts you would never see normally. If you truly want to see the best bits of amsterdam you must book this tour! The only way to get around! Thijs is a great guide who knows all there is to know and a real nice guy too!

Awesome bike trip through Amsterdam. I've thought about taking bike tours on other trips, but was always hesitant about doing so because it seemed too difficult for some reason, and would always end up just doing a walking tour. Since Amsterdam has so many bikes, I thought this would be a good place to try it out. Lisa was our guide and was so knowledgable about everything, and would share different pieces of history throughout our stops along the route. We were able to ride through almost every major neighborhood in Amsterdam, and stopped at a really cozy cafe to have a drink. Absolutely loved the tour and loved Lisa. It's an amazing value, and would totally do it again in a heartbeat.

Fun and relaxed way to see Amsterdam.. It was a lot of fun to take this tour and discover Amsterdam. Thijs, our guide, presented Amsterdam in a unique way by showing us points of interest along the ride and explaining the history behind them.
