It was interesting to learn the history of Amsterdam and how it has resulted in the designs of the buildings we see today. It was also nice to see some hidden places and ride through some beautiful neighbourhoods and parks. Overall, it was an interesting and fun tour. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who is planning to visit Amsterdam. It provides a nice platform upon which to plan the rest of your stay. Also, don't forget to ask your guide for recommendations of things to do while in Amsterdam.

Perfect way to See Amsterdam. Everyone around was biking so why not? I took the 3 hour tour with Lisa and it was a perfect way to see a lot of the city and some of the nooks and crannies. Lisa had a lot of good history for us and the weather was perfect. Nice to stop for a beer in the middle as well. Definitely recommend.

Our last minute decision.... Our last minute decision to do a bike tour with Thijs was the right decision. For us it was clear, when we discover Amsterdam, then with a bike. Having a guide helps a lot with the first visit. The normal tour was occupied so we decided on a private tour. You just follow the guide, he shows you 'hidden' places, with nice background stories and you just follow, soak in the beauty of the city and the atmosphere. Having a coffee break to warm up, he chooses a very cozy place, which we enjoyed a lot. Overall the tour of around 3 hours went by far too quick. A reason to come back. 'we bike Amsterdam' is a bit more pricy compare to others. Just pay attention how long the tour takes place and what the maximum of participants are. This can make a big difference. Now you may ask when I am so satisfied why do you give only 4 stars. I thought about it for a while and being fair to my other reviews (including bike tours). We Bike Amsterdam is fairly a new company which has a great success - look their placement at Tripadvisor. But I think they is more potential - I mean in different options, tours, etc. I wish them all the best, keep your passion for the city and your wonderful way how you talk to your clients including teenagers.

Highlight of our Amsterdam trip.. My husband and I are in our 60's and after dodging bicycles as pedestrians the previous day, we nearly cancelled on our scheduled bike tour. So glad that we did go ahead with the tour as it turned out to be our favorite activity in Amsterdam by far. Jasper was great! Super friendly and knowledgable. Highly recommend this tour for all.

Friendly and relaxed intro to Amsterdam. We did this in October and Jasper took good care of the group - which included children. It was a friendly and relaxed way to see the bits of the city you always suspect are there but never seem to be able to get to! Spot on.

bike tour of Amsterdam. We took the We Bike Amsterdam Hidden Gems tour and had a wonderful time. Jasper is great, he answers all your questions, provides suggestions of places to visit or eat or drink, and gives you a great insight into life in Amsterdam. The biking was easy and only a bit intimidating a few times. We parked the bikes a couple of times and Jasper walked us through some very interesting buildings. He knows his history thoroughly. I highly recommend this bike tour.

This is 1000% a must.. Biking in Amsterdam is a must, biking with the company We Bike Amsterdam is absolutely the only way to go. We booked a private tour (for 7 of us) on a Sunday morning with Thijs, and it was absolutely incredible. A great way to see the backstreets of the city, a coffee break midway, and a ton of history and back story about Holland as we rode. I would totally do this tour again, and probably will as friends visit me in Europe. I simply cannot say enough good about Thijs and his company. Did I mention 4 of the riders were children (ages 9, 7, 4, and 2).
Biking in Amsterdam. The first thing you gotta do after reaching amsterdam is to rent a bike. You can travel to all places in Amsterdam with your bike. And if the weather is good, its a jackpot.

Fantastic way to see Amsterdam. I loved this tour. It lasted around 3 hours and took us on a gentle ride around the beautiful and historic areas south of Dam Square (the nicest bits!). Do this as early in your trip as possible because you'll see so many other places you'll want to go back to. Our guide was friendly and very knowledgeable. I don't remember her name, but she also stayed very calm when a crazy lady started screaming at 'the unwelcome tourists'. The only person we met on our whole trip who wasn't incredibly chilled out and friendly. Highly recommend this tour.

Start your visit to Amsterdam with this fantastic bike tour!. We did this tour in mid-September and it was a great way to see most of the city and get a feel for what we wanted to go back an explore. The trip is billed as "Hidden Amsterdam", and there are certainly lots of under the radar stops and stories, but you also see most of the city while you are going place to place. Our tour guide, Thijs, couldn't have been a nicer guy, and was extremely knowledgeable about the city and it's history. It was a very personal and low key approach, I enjoyed every minute of the tour!Upon first arriving in Amsterdam, the chaos of the bikes everywhere had me a little hesitant about going on the tour, but once it started, I had no concerns at all. It was a blast cruising around town, and we decided to rent bikes for the rest of our visit as we were able to cover much more ground.I highly recommend this tour! enjoy!

Best Bike Tour!. So glad we did this bike tour! This was referred to my wife by a friend. What better way to see Amsterdam than this! Jasper was friendly, knowledgeable, and a real down to earth kind of guy. The tour itself felt more personal than most I've been on. Stopping for coffee was a nice touch as well. Would highly recommend this to anyone!

Fun tour full of interesting facts. Wonderful guide!. My 12-year-old daughter and I loved this tour. Jasper was very attentive to everyone on the tour, has a winning personality and shared lots of fun little facts about Amsterdam.He made a point to make a detour to show my daughter where the hotel from "The Fault in our Stars" was, which put a HUGE smile on her face. Would definitely recommend. We are Americans and met interesting people from Indonesia, Australia, London, New York and Illinois on this tour.

Joy ride Amsterdam . Bikes, bikes, bikes, that's the most notable thing, besides the very obviously tall Dutch and the canals. It is believed that there are more bikes in Amsterdam than there are people. There's a more likelihood of being driven over by a bike than a car, as was the case with me. Given the culture of biking in Amsterdam, it makes sense to do a bike tour. It is a fun way to experience Amsterdam under the guidance of a local and to also meet fellow travelers. For the most part, my bike tour was pleasant, except for part of the historical element of the trip. But I suppose it is to be expected on a bike tour that the historical accounts will unlikely match those by a historian or narrator, who would be able to give a clarified historical account of Amsterdam in a clear manner e.g. The account for merchants homes in Amsterdam leaning forward vs the houses in Amsterdam that are also tilted, or leaning. There are distinguishable accounts for such. In simple terms, worthwhile trip, enjoyable and worth doing. However, if you a historian and perhaps looking to gain a more insightful historical account of Amsterdam, I would add other tours as their historical accounts of Amsterdam is very simplistic.

Hidden Amsterdam . Really recommend this tour. We had a great time biking around Ansterdam with Thijs and our fellow cyclists. Took in a lot of lovely sites - a hidden church, the original offices of the West Indies Trading Co., Vondel Park, etc.. Had some good laughs, learned some Amsterdam history, and met some nice people too.
Brilliant!. The best way to have a look around! Thanks Lisa for a great tour! Very informative and interesting about the history of Amsterdam!
Great way to see and learn about Amsterdam. Great tour, guide, and bikes. Enjoyed the small group and learned quite a bit about Amsterdam. Highly recommend!

Great experience. My wife and I visited Amsterdam in September and felt that the best way to see the city would be to do as the locals do, and hop on a bike. Our tour guide,Thije, was very knowledgable as well as fun and good-humoured. He took us to hidden places that we never would have found on our own, like a hidden church. Not only did we see some great sights but we also learned a lot, about the sites we were seeing, Amsterdam's history, and information on present day Amsterdam. Thije made biking the city fairly easy as we stayed in some less populated areas and side streets. Just be warned that biking in Amsterdam can be a little bit scary when you are trying to watch out for other bikes (many of them!), cars and pedestrians. Once you get the hang of it though it comes more naturally. Overall we had a fantastic time on this tour and would highly recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Also, don't miss out on the Hungry Birds tours!

Wonderful experience!. Spending 3days in Amsterdam, we found info on "we bike Amsterdam" and made our reservation online through their website. We received within minutes confirmation on our reservation, info on meeting point. Thijs was at Dam Square on time and walked us to the bike rental shop. We had a great tour of the less touristic areas of the city, special access to hidden gardens, small streets of residential parts all of this with history facts. We had a break stop at a nice pub. A good 3 hours with nice people who all enjoyed this unique visit.

Best way to see Amsterdam. Is on a bike! Tour was great for seeing great "gems" around the city. Had to keep the bike if was so much fun. Friendly and interesting tour guides, too. Very easy online setup.

They advertise "See Amsterdam as a local does." That's exactly what you get. You already know all about the tourist hot-spots, this tour skips all of them and shows you what Amsterdam really has to offer. You'll get a real feel for the important historical significance of Amsterdam-as you'll see the home of THE WEST INDIES TRADING COMPANY (the organization that supplied African slaves to the Americas), or learn why almost all the houses in Amsterdam are tall but narrow-we even learned the origin of "Yankee", and why many areas of New York city are named after places in the Netherlands. Have you ever wondered why prostitution is legal?or why smoking marijuana is permitted in Amsterdam? It all has something to do with"Dutch tolerance" as we were educated on. Or perhaps you'd like to see the oldest building in Amsterdam(trust me you won't easily find it on your own.)Our tour guide was Thije (Tice) who wasn't just helpful, and knowledgeable but humorous. (Anecdote-when we stopped for a break about half way at a lovely outdoor cafe, the city street cleaning crew decided that was the exact moment that they had to vigorously clean THAT EXACT section of the street, spraying up dust and dirt to the point that we had to cover our drinks and after multiple apologies Thije just rolled with it joking "Well the city of Amsterdam just wants to make sure you're riding on the cleanest street in the city"Thije was not only friendly, but I feel as if we now we really are friends. While riding through one of the most beautiful parks I have ever seen, I was jokingly trying to ride with no hands, he saw this and put out his hand for me to hold for help and the rest of tour joked that "We had that moment back there, we're like best friends."  The bikes were so easy to ride that I'm trying to find one in the States to purchase. Full disclosure: you will pass by some landmarks tourists prefer-this tour isn't about stopping to see them. So you'll have to stop by them on your own time. After the tour was over we asked Thije for someplace good to eat- again he didn't disappoint as we had an amazing meal that wasn't expensive. So we got to eat like a local does too.

Fabulous Bike Tour Comes Highly Recommended!. Visited Amsterdam for 4 days for a long weekend at the end of September. The pre-booked tour was certainly one of our highlights. Lots of the previous reviewers cover all the plus points. Specific to our own experience (2 adults) I would make reference to:1) Thijs our guide and co-owner was a great knowledgeable host2) The 3 hour duration was well paced and a small group was ideal for cycling around the city3) Amsterdam is really busy in terms of bikes (push and motor) - this tour takes away any potential fear factor as much of the itinerary takes you to the quieter areas and when the traffic is busier Thijs ensures everyone is comfortable on 2 wheels!4) Excellent visits to hidden churches, museum square, residential courtyards, parks and several districts are coveredI wouldn't hesitate to recommend this tour and if I could turn back the clock might have done it earlier during our stay - certainly an excellent way to get a feel for navigating around this fascinating city and at 25 euros per person represents great value.

LOVED IT. Great way to see Amsterdam. Jasper was a wealth of knowledge of a fun guide. We did a private tour as we had 6 people. We loved it and learned so much. A bike tour is a must do while in Amsterdam.

Only way to see the city. We had an awesome time on our bike tour. Beside seeing the museums we hadn't really learned much about the history of the city until Thijs showed us around. We learned so much from him. It was so great to have such a small group. I really recommend everyone do this while you are there especially first time visitors. Best thing we did in three days.

Excellent bike tour of Amsterdam--Highly recommend!. My 9-year old son and I had the pleasure of taking a private bike tour with Jasper of We Bike Amsterdam today. It was cool because he focused on the "low lights" of Amsterdam, that is the parts of Amsterdam that are less well known to tourists. He was friendly, flexible, funny, and full of facts. He also gave good directions as biking in Amsterdam is not for the faint of heart. We highly recommend this company if you want to see Amsterdam and exercise at the same time!

Awesome experience!. We had such a wonderful time on the bike tour with Jasper. It was beautiful, interesting, educational, and absolutely worth it. What a great resource for everything from history, symbols, culture to sightseeing tips and recommendations. Our only regret is that we didn't do it on our very first day in the city as everything we learned made the rest of our time in Amsterdam better.

Best way to see the city. Absolutely have to recommend these guys! Bikes were great, had hand brakes, easy locks, simple gears and very comfortable to ride. Thijs, our awesome guide, was very professional gave us lots of interesting information, history etc. Pace was a bit slow for me (an active cyclist) but only because we had a large group; so no real compliant there. We got to see a number of out of the way things, more of the real Amsterdam. Price for the time, thought put into the tour and what we saw was ridiculously good. Loved the pit stop at a lovely cafe in a quiet residential neighborhood. Thijs also gave us a fabulous recommendation for a meal afterward. To sum up good bang for your buck! Go with We Bike Amsterdam if you want a great bike tour that's more than just the tourist traps.

Local small business with a brilliant formula. There seemed to be a lot of Bike tour options to choose from once in Amsterdam but luckily we found this one on Tripadvisor because it had that real small business feel to it - not like some of the other larger tour companies: very down-to-earth, genuinely interested guys. The bikes were very user-friendly compared to other ones I saw being used in other tours; although still authentic looking they had good gears, brakes and locks and were easy to handle even for novices like me.
When in Rome.. A great way to see the city and experience first-hand the awesome bike culture of Amsterdam. Our guide Thijs was a great guide and a great guy - friendly and professional. Just do it.

Perfect way to start a vacation in A'dam. Wow; what a GREAT find. We read about We Bike Amsterdam on (wait for it) Trip Advisor, and we're so glad that we took this bike tour. Thijs was our guide, and he was a consummate professional. He was friendly and knowledgeable, which made for a pleasant few hours. He was also attentive: we had a group of ten people on this ride, and Thijs did a great job of keeping us all together and safe... no easy task, with ten tourists from a variety of different countries, all navigating the busy streets and bridges.I'd recommend taking this bike tour at the very start of your visit to Amsterdam, because it's a great way to get your bearings... plus, Thijs provides a lot of historical perspective. It will definitely enrich your trip. After the tour, Thijs sent us a nice email with his personal suggestions for restaurants and bars, and his choices were spot-on.My wife and I cannot say enough about this experience. It was a definite highlight of our trip.
Wonderful, only 2 people in the group. So much funVery informative Could not have learned without it Bikes were good tooThe tour guide was also very funny and knowledgable.

No better way to see the "insider's" Amsterdam. When in Amsterdam, how could we not bicycle around? This way, we got to bike around AND see all manner of hidden gems in the city. Jasper was a wonderful guide - we could tell immediately by his fabulous smile. He took us behind the facades of houses to see hidden gardens, hidden churches and more. We spent time in off-the-beaten path neighborhoods. Stopped in a cafe (not a coffee shop! - if you don't know the difference, Jasper will educate you!). He gave us restaurant recommendations for later in our trip. This is the way to see Amsterdam and to build your confidence in riding through Amsterdam the way the locals do. Thank you, Jasper!

Perfect "Fietsen" in Amsterdam. Thanks to Thijs - we had a lovely morning fietsing (dutch for cycling) around Amsterdam. He gave us a lot of information and the possibility to see places and quarters off the beaten track, that makes this tour interesting for first-time visitors but also for tourists that know the city of Amsterdam already. The cycling was very safe and so much fun and Thijs was friendly, sympathetic and very knowledgeable. I can highly recommend this tour to everybody :-)

Thank you. Great tour with Thijs, lucky enough to have a very small group of just 4 of us. Loved getting through all those quiet streets, not only giving some of us more confidences ( not used to bike on streets ) but also great to see places that we would never visit on our own.Coffee stop was great, we had lovely weather, enjoyed the sitting outside with fellow members, and Thijs was so relaxed, all of us shared out travel experiences just like old friends. Cycling through Wondelpark was fun, all seemed a bit quick to finish. I would highly recommended this tour, the bikes were very easy to ride, Thijs was very attentive and ensured non experienced bikers like me crossing busy roads safely, wishing We Bike Amsterdam all the best and looking forward to joining again when they run any countryside bike tour!!

A great way to see the city. It's not only a great way but it is the local way. You gave never seen bikes like you will see in this city. Millions! And get out of their way .Rides thru all bridges , stop for beer and burn a few calories . Enjoy Amsterdam the Ansterdam way.

Excellent tour. We chose We Bike Amsterdam due to its high Trip Advisor ranking and it did not disappoint. Jasper took us on a great tour of the "lowlights" (his words) of Amsterdam - ie. instead of stopping to see the large well known attractions, he took us to see the parts of the city that you wouldn't know what you were looking at if you were just touring the city yourself. Highlights were the "secret" church, and the Begijnhof (a hidden city behind an inconspicuous door that is so detached from the urban bustle around it). We also had a nice stop at a coffee shop. Wondelpark was also a highlight of the tour, as was biking through the Rijksmuseum (the one major attraction along the route). The whole time, Jasper had tons of funny and interesting anecdotes to share. Highly recommend!

Best part of my trip. My friend and I started our weekend break with this tour and it set up the whole weekend. Thijs was a great guide and the tour was well organised yet relaxed. He immediately made everyone feel at ease and took us to a brilliant range of places including pointing out the well known landmarks so we could easily navigate our way around and find the galleries and museums for the rest of our stay. The coffee stop was excellent and it was perfect for sharing travel tips with the rest of the group and find out more about Amsterdam from Thijs. Can't recommend it enough!

LOVED this tour!. One of the real highlights of our visit to Amsterdam, this tour showed us areas and sides we would never visit. A great way get oriented and a feel for the city.Jasper was an excellent guide, giving us insights and insider info mad kept things light and safe. Bikes were all solid and comfy. Riding was generally enjoyable, a few dicey areas, but hey good to feel like a local!I booked this since it was stop rated on TripAdvisor, which is well deserved!

Bike and Barge on the Feniks. Did a Bike and Barge from Brugge, Belgium to Amsterdam, Netherlands. We slept and ate on the barge named the Feniks. The service was fabulous and the meals fantastic. It is a great way to see parts of Belgium and the Holland area of the Netherlands. We biked about 250 miles in 6 days, stopped at small towns every day for a coffee or beer break and lunch. We met the barge around 3 or 4 pm. Had time to shower and refresh and then dinner around 6 pm. If you have never experienced a bike and barge go for it while you are still healthy, you will not regret it. It was one of the best trips we have ever done. I recommend the Feniks if you go.

A great way to get to know the real Amsterdam. I loved this tour because it had just the right amount of moving around but also stops to smell the roses for a little bit. I had been wandering the canals by myself the day before, but doing it with a tour guide was so nice to learn about why the houses look the way they do and what local Amsterdam-ers like to do in their daily lives. I liked that the tour started at 10am, a little earlier than some of the others I was looking at. The small size is also really nice. If you're staying in Amsterdam for a few days I would recommend doing this as a first thing so you're familiar with the city so you can really enjoy it the rest of the time! Highly recommend this tour.

Great way to get away from the touristy areas. This is a great way to see the areas of Amsterdam that aren't smothered in stag and hen parties.Thijs is a lovely bloke and a great guide with a genuine passion for the city. I feel that, without having done this tour we'd have walked away from Amsterdam having not experienced the real place at all.Highly recommended.

Great way to go behind the touristy Amsterdam. Thijs was a great tour guide showing us the local version of Amsterdam. We appreciated his knowledge of Amsterdam and history and it was a fun way to see the city.

Great way to start Amsterdam!. My husband and I took a private tour around Amsterdam with Jasper to the lesser known, less touristy parts of town. We had a great time, and it was the perfect way to a. start our trip/get accommodated with the city, and b. confidently ride our bikes (because it was private, and on quieter streets--I don't know about you, but riding bikes is not an everyday thing for me). Jasper was lovely, patient, and full of funny anecdotes. We stopped midway through the tour for a coffee, and he gave us several restaurant and bar recommendations. I truly feel like had we not done this tour we wouldn't have accomplished half of what we wanted to do. Jasper also gave us recs for other tours, and followed up with us the next day to see if we had everything we needed for the rest of our trip. Definitely recommend taking this tour when in Amsterdam! Thanks Jasper!

Just Perfect!. My boyfriend and I did this bike tour with Jasper last week, not only was it a perfect day but the tour was fantastic. Jasper was full of knowledge and answered a lot of our questions. We even stopped for a latte half way through the ride just to hang out for a bit. This was our first day in Amsterdam and the best activity we could've picked to get to see the city and feel a part of the hustle and bustle. Jasper also emailed us some recommendations after the tour to make our stay that much better. We Bike Amsterdam is a must.

Best way to see some more of Amsterdam. If you're looking to see the real side of Amsterdam and something over than the normal tourist sites, take this tour!We had Jasper as our guide who was excellent and really brought the city and it's history to life. The tour lasted 4 hours for us and is very easy going in terms of cycling so don't worry about that.Thoroughly recommended!

Don't Miss this great Bike Tour of Amsterdam. This was such a fun way to see Amsterdam. We are not regular bike riders, but it made no difference. It was the highlight of our two day visit to the city. Lisa and Thijs are first class tour guides. Don't miss the chance to see the city and hidden gems by bike. Do it early in your visit if you can. We received a thank you email, post tour, with restaurant suggestions. Nice!

Good relaxing fun. We did out bike tour with Jasper in a pretty small group. The 3 hours went really quickly and the whole thing was good fun. Riding around the neighborhoods to the park, taking in the sites, somehow managing not to crash into all the other cyclists! Jasper told us some amusing tales and kept it interesting and took us to some 'off the beaten track' type places where we parked up and went inside for a better look around. I would definitely recommend the tour to get a flavour of what Amsterdam is like! There is lots more to see though so save some energy for the rest!!

Loved it!. I don't think I could say anything that someone else hasn't already said. It rained the entire time we were out but we still had a great time. The tour guide (we had Jasper/Jesper?) was a lot of fun! Would love to do it again!

Great tour experience. Even being rained on for part of the morning, this was a great tour. We saw parts of Amsterdam we'd never have seen on our own. And by the time you've been walking around Amsterdam for even an hour, you're kind of looking at all the bikes thinking "this is clearly the way to go in this city," so getting to experience it for yourself feels like an important part of visiting there. Highly recommended.

Nice introduction to Amsterdam. We really enjoyed our tour with Tijs who took us to some hidden corners of the city which we would never have seen otherwise and told us some interesting facts. The pace was perfect, and although you have to pay attention whilst cycling, we always felt safe. The bikes were also really good quality and once you've done the tour you are entitled to a discount on hiring them which is a nice bonus.

When in Amsterdam, this the way to do it!. Couldn't think of any other way to have fun, explore the city and know Amsterdam better but through We Bike Amsterdam. The city is surrounded by canals and alleys, wanting to see it all and exploring this on foot may have your feet soar at the end of the trip. Tram may provide you an overview, but unlike the tour, it will entice you to how great Amsterdam is and was, that there is more to it aside from the two things that it is famous for. The group stops at each landmark to let you enjoy the location. The bike was light and no trouble riding at all, tour is done in a pace that despite the duration to be 3 hours is still enjoyable and convenient to all members of the group. Was having trouble booking through their website, but their staff was really accommodating in booking us through e-mail. Definitely recommended to anyone visiting Amsterdam, great for all ages and family traveling with children.

Great way to see Amsterdam!. Let me begin with saying that I hadn't ridden a bike in almost 5 years when my husband got me to begrudgingly agree to go on this tour. To say that I am a rusty cyclist would be an understatement. Seriously, I'm an awful cyclist. However, despite my limited biking skills I had a great time zipping through the Amsterdam streets on this tour! Thijs is an excellent tour guide and provided great tips for less experienced cyclists (like myself) to feel more confident on our bikes. I couldn't imagine getting a better look at Amsterdam on a different tour. Even the boat tour we went on wasn't as informative and fun as the We Bike Amsterdam tour! So here is why I think this tour was so awesome:1. Thijs Thijs is an excellent tour guide. He's very friendly and personable, and knows quite a bit about the history of Amsterdam. He gave great insight on the history- good and bad- of Amsterdam and how it connects to the current culture. Thijs kept a medium level speed on the bike that kept our group together without anyone falling far behind. Also, he was great about explaining beforehand when we would be going into heavier traffic areas, so we would know to be more aware. Thijs never made me feel judged for my wobbly skills, and by the end of the tour I felt much more confident in my abilities to not run someone over! 2. Comfy bikes!I'm short. Comfortable bikes don't normally exist for people like me. When we arrived, I was pretty certain that I would have to use a children's bike (I'm thirty years old) because I am about a foot shorter than the average, tree-like Dutch person. To my surprise, I was able to fit on an adult bike... at the lowest setting... but still. Hooray! The bikes were in great condition.The seats were comfortable for most of the ride. I started to feel a little discomfort at the very end of the tour, but after three hours of biking, that's to be expected. The breaks and bell worked well. I had no problem switching gears when going up bridges, etc. I didn't even need to roll up my pant leg to avoid tearing my jeans. If I could've bought the bike and taken it home with me, I would have!The route:We spent quite a bit of time in the Jordaan neighborhood, which I loved it. It's full of cute shops, restaurants, cafes, you name it. We stopped at a few 'hidden' sites that most tourists wouldn't know to visit. My favorite was a huge park (can't remember the name) with a lagoon inside. It was absolutely gorgeous and was my favorite part of the whole tour. In addition to a few hidden gems, we rode past staples like the Rijk and Van Gogh museum, etc. Our group mates:In our small group we had people from the USA, England, Ireland, and Canada. It was great to get to chat with each other and learn more about our different cultures. Summary:This tour is so much fun. Riding around the streets gives you a perspective of Amsterdam, that you might not otherwise get. The small group size is perfect for asking questions and really getting to know your group mates. Also, the length of the tour may seem long at first, but it flies by in no time. If you are not the world's best cyclist, don't worry. This tour is fun for people of all biking ability levels, even terrible cyclists like me!

Fun Way to Explore Amsterdam. This tour is is great was to explore Amsterdam and learn about its history. My family (ages 11-70) joined a small group to explore the city. The ride was non strenuous at an easy pace. Thijs was an awesome guide. He made traveling thorough the streets fun and exciting. He also shared interesting historical facts about the city. We were able to take a break and enjoy a nice refreshing drink while the group chatted. I would highly recommend the We Bike Amsterdam!!!!

A great way to start your break in Amsterdam. We decided to go with We Bike Amsterdam after the ratings and reviews here in. Trip Advisor, we were not disappointed. Our guide Thias was informative, friendly and funny. We travelled in a group of 8 people, the tour lasted for 3 hours. It was not strenuous nor dangerous as we started on the back streets to get used to the bikes and roads, by the time we finished we were all riding like true Natives! We had a wonderful time, Thias is very knowledgeable and a delight to spend time with. Thank you, we would definitely recommend the tour.

Great tour - even with some rain !!. Like some others we did this as my daughter has moved there to work and we thought it would be a good introduction to the city. We met Thijs as planned and got underway. It's all at a gentle pace so no worries for those who haven't been on a bike for a few years. A surprising amount of history is covered at the various stops, and done with good humour, with a nice drinks break in the middle.We did this on our second day and it really paid off as we traveled round over the next few days as the things we had picked up helped us appreciate and understand everything better.Booking is super simple and we even took up one of the restaurant recommendations sent in a follow up mail (A nice tapas called Duende).All in all can't be faulted.Tim, Andrea, and Steph

Must do. A really enjoyable and informative tour around Amsterdam. Liza was our guide and did a great job.The bikes were easy to manage and we saw lots of the main attractions around the city and some that we would never have found by ourselves. Highly recommended.

Great fun and a must do!. We had the bike tour today with Jasper in a group of nine people. Booking was super easy and they answered questions per mail quickly. The bikes were great and it was a good opportunity to see a lot of the city quickly and get a good overview. I really recommend doing it in the beginning of your trip. Jasper showed us great places we otherwise would have never found and told us interesting stories about them! He answered all questions we had and told lots of funfacts and even recommended places to go. We definitely can recommend this tour!

Enjoyed "We Bike Amsterdam"!. It was well organized right from when we booked the tour, to a reminder the day before etc. of the tour. Jasper and Liza were very friendly and informative. They seem to enjoy what they are doing, which shows in their tour. Afterwards they recommended places to eat lunch, dinner, pubs, sights that were good value that one would not likely come across as a short term visitor. We highly recommended We Bike Amsterdam

Recommended. A must do!. We chose We Bike after seeing such brilliant reviews on TripAdvisor and have to say it certainly did not disappoint. Our daughter has moved to Amsterdam to study and we thought it would be a good introduction to the city particularly as like us she hadn't been on a bike for years.With our guide Liza we were soon on our way and we all agreed how chilled and relaxed it was as we moved around various neighbourhoods with such ease.With several short stops Liza would tell us historical facts and information about the city. We learnt about a local drink called Geneva and discovered 2 hidden churches behind an otherwise unassuming facade.The 3 hours passed really quickly and even an odd rain shower didn't dampen our spirits. Thanks very much, it was a great activity and really did live up to our high expectations.

We Bike Amsterdam Tour. We took the tour with Thijs as soon as we got to Amsterdam and it was a unique experience to get to know and 'live' the city of Amsterdam. the tour took 3 hours but we were able to visit places in Amsterdam and learn about its history in a wy that we would not be able, on our own. The experience of riding the bicycle around the city is a 'must-do' as it is the way we live the city and Thijs was able to teach us the most interesting details about the city and make us want to see more, after the tour. Thank you Thijs for the wonderful experience and next time in Amsterdam, we will defintiely call for another tour.

So happy we did the tour !!. My girlfriend and I started our visit of Amsterdam with this tour. Great tour, fun, and a great way to get yourselves orientated. Highly recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam

Great way to see the city!. My brother and I went on a tour with Thijs and had a great time. Very nice way to see amsterdam, especially early on in our visit. Went to some neighborhoods and areas we otherwise never would have seen and over the 3 hours saw a ton of the main sights as well. Absolutely worth doing!

Great bike tour for Amsterdam. I booked this tour for my first proper day in Amsterdam as I thought it would be a good introduction to the city and I was not disappointed! The tour took in a big chunk of the city and there's nothing quite like being on a bike in Amsterdam to feel inducted into the city. We covered the main attractions as well as some locations a bit further off the beaten track and the guide was great and providing information and context to the things that we saw.I was pleasantly surprised by stops we took where we actually parked the bikes to go an explore some points nearby on foot which was nice. There was also a break in the middle for a drink and plenty of time for taking photographs along the way (I wish I had taken my camera in hindsight).The pace of cycling was gentle and the guide seemed to try and avoid the busy highways were possible to make the ride as least stressful as possible! The bikes had mountain-bike tyres rather than road bike which I preferred and they were solid and seemed to be well maintained. I'm short (5'1") and ended up on a child's bicycle but it was pretty plain and you couldn't tell the difference between mine and the other bicycles. The bicycles were also pretty plainly decorated which I preferred compared to some of the other cycling tours which had brightly coloured bicycles which screamed 'tourist'.Would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Good fun!. Did a brilliant 3 hour tour in the pouring rain...got soaked...and loved it! Thanks to Jasper, our friendly guide, and the lovely people in our group. If you like something a bit different and off-the-beaten-track this is for you.
Biking Amsterdam. Great bike ride around Amsterdam. Saw some off the beaten track sites, stopped for a latte and biked through a lovely park. Wonderful way to spend a few hours!

One of the highlights of our trip. Just returned from a 2-day trip to Amsterdam and this was definitely the highlight of our trip. Our bike tour was on August 17 and even though it was a cloudy and rainy morning, it didn't take away from the lovely 3-hour tour. Our group was small and because it was a Sunday morning, bike traffic (which can be very scary in Amsterdam) was very light. Jasper was very friendly and knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam and I learned a lot. The spots he took us to I wouldn't have been able to find on my own (nor would I have even known they existed). Riding was done at a reasonable pace and the bikes were in good shape and comfortable. There were 2 young kids in our group and they were able to keep up with everyone just fine. I would highly recommend this tour to everyone.

Great way to get to know the city..... We did our bike tour on our first day in Amsterdam. Thijs was a great tour guide. He showed us parts of the city we wouldn't otherwise have seen. Gave you a nice feel of the layout of the city. The list of bars and restaurants was a plus as well.

Start with this tour. I suggest to take this tour at the beginning of your Amsterdam visit to get initial information about the city.Bicycles are in good condition and it is very easy to cycle in Amsterdam, it is a flat city.Our guide Thijs was very friendly.It is better than walking because it is possible to visit more places in a short time, without getting tired. I recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

The highlight of our trip. We just got back from visiting Amsterdam with our three kids. I would highly recommend We Bike Amsterdam. Our kids would tell you it was the highlight of our trip. Thijs was a fantastic guide. He took us to many unknown spots and shared lots of interesting history and anecdotes. He was great with the kids and chatted with them about life in Amsterdam. We biked to historical buildings as well as through cool neighborhoods and through the park. We stopped for a bite and Thijs then extended our tour for about a half hour so we didn't miss any sights.Both he and Jasper were very accommodating and run a wonderful, personal company. Enjoy!

i love it!. I joined We Bike Amsterdam in my first day in Amsterdam. It was my first time coming to Amsterdam and I was rarely know the city. I was happy to choose We Bike Amsterdam to be my first thing to do in Amsterdam. I chose this bike tour because it ranks no. 1 in tripadviser and with ALL excellent comments. The tour guide Jasper was very friendly and handsome :p, and he was really well prepared, coz he explained the history of this small city in very details and accommodated us all the questions. It was really a good experienced to me to bike in this bike city. I really had a great time with We Bike Amsterdam. Thanks Jasper and the team!

Bike tour of Amsterdam . My two daughters and I went to Amsterdam for a long weekend and wanted to take a bike tour around the city. If you are looking for an experience of the city's history this is the bike tour to take. They respond efficiently by email, the bikes are in good working order and our guide Jasper was a delight. Over all we had a most enjoyable trip around the city and would defiantly recommend this company to anyone who's going to Amsterdam.

Not to be missed. We went on the We Bike Amsterdam tour today and had a great time - even the pouring rain couldn't spoil it! You can't come to Holland and not cycle, so this really is a great way to explore the city. Our guide (Lisa) was brilliant and told us lots of interesting things about Amsterdam's history. She also showed us a few things that I, despite having visited a few time before, hadn't seen. Five stars!

Great bike tour. I loved Amsterdam and the best way to see it is by bike. I was a little unsure about hiring one so going on a bike tour was a great way to build your confidence. The we bike amsterdam tour was excellent, the guys were prompt and friendly with lots of interesting information, taking us to bits of the city we would never have found. They even followed up the trip with some emailed recommendations which were very useful. I will definitely book with them again next time I visit.

Excellent tour. We had a great time on our bike tour around Amsterdam today. Phillip was an excellent guide around all the hidden gems within the city. Engaging, friendly and accommodating to all questions asked. It was a truly interesting 3+ hours. He even followed up our session with an email of bar and restaurant recommendations.If you get a chance, this is a worthwhile spend of time and money (€25 a head).
Amazing experience. With Jasper, you know places and histories that you can´t even imagine if tou visit the city on your own.Excelent choice to get the "Big Picture" of the city.

Must do activity. I visited Amsterdam with 3 of my children age 18, 15 and 6. As all of us (except my 6 year old) had visited Amsterdam before we wanted to experience something we had not done previously. We chose the 'we bike Amsterdam' which was fabulous. It was so easy to book. Sent an email and had a response back within minutes then tour was arranged. Meeting in Dam square was easy, then short walk to collect bikes. I rode a bike with a cart on the front which my 6 year old rode in. It was easy to ride and I managed the 12k no problem as it was spread over 3 hours with regular stops to look at interesting landmarks and hear fascinating history. We all thoroughly enjoyed the tour and our guide was great. He made the tour fun and informational. We even found a few cats for my son! Many thanks for a lovely time. We all recommend this bike tour most highly and would definitely book again if we return.

Fantastic Experience - Do it!. Fantastic! My wife and I toured the city with Jasper @ webikeamsterdam.com These guys have it going on...fun, charismatic, informative, engaging and energized to talk about Amsterdam. After meeting our group at the Dam, Jasper took us to the shop, explained the tour and set us up on our bikes. He explained biking etiquette and lead us on our way! We discovered the red house, headquarters for the West Indies company, the Jordaan, widow house and the real meaning behind X X X !The pace was leisurely; so no worries if you don't bike. We covered a wide area and learned much about the City and culture. Super way to check out the town in a safe and relaxing way. Coffee stop is perfect!All around fantastic experience. Do it! Young entrepreneurs building a great business. The best!
Excellent. Excelente bike tour, very interesting, knowledgeable and helpful. ..I highly recommend Jasper great tour guide! !

Favorite thing we did in Amsterdam!. We were a little apprehensive about this, as neither of us had ridden a bike in almost 15 years. There is a reason the expression "just like riding a bike" exists--it didn't take long to get used to! I was also afraid that my legs and butt would be sore for 2-3 days afterwards, but the terrain was so flat and the tour was so leisurely that I was not sore at all! We were able to see so much of Amsterdam in the 3 hours and learned so many things that we otherwise would have never known about the city and its culture. The tour guide (Jasper) was so friendly and willing to answer any and all questions we had. We stuck around afterwards for a map of the city, and he was able to give us some great recommendations for restaurants and attractions. This tour is a must-do!

A perfect day in Amsterdam.. We had only a day in Amsterdam and since we know that biketours is a perfect way to see a city we didn't hesitate. We found "We bike Amsterdam" on Tripadvisor and since it had the best reviews - we booked the tour. We didn´t regret it. Our guide knew what he was talking about and he showed us some great places that we wouldn´t had come to if it wasn´t for him. The bikes were great aswell. And they try to keep small groups.We were 5 in our group and we saw other companies with over 20 bikes....Just do it. Book now :)

First thing to do in Amsterdam. An excellent way to get to know the city, it's history and main attractions. The guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. I highly recommend you take this tour on your first day to gain some perspective of the main attractions and places you'd like to visit.
Perfect for our Teens. Our teenagers said this was the best thing they have ever done on a vacation. Our guide Thijs was incredible and we all had the best time. A must do while in Amsterdam.

A Ride in the Countryside. We are a middle aged couple with modest biking experience. Not the fittest people, but not completely out of shape. We didn't want the historical tour, since we have been to Amsterdam before. We wanted to see and experience the "real" Holland. As much as we could in a few hours, anyway. :-)We booked a private tour at the last minute. Thijs met us at our hotel with the bikes right on time, and we were off!From the hotel, a short ride to the ferry, across the lake. 2 minutes later we were out of the city, riding through some of the old villages along the dikes. Plenty of time to take pictures and even stop for an adult refreshment!From there, we rode along the dikes, seeing the swans and ducks, just admiring the countryside.We then turned inland, and headed to a small town with maybe 100 people where we had (a tasty!) lunch and a beverage.Then, across a canal with another ferry (very tiny ferry) into a pasture, riding among the cows, crossing the special bridges over the small canals. All this time Thijs was taking pictures for us, checking to see if we were too tired, taking care of us.From there, we headed through several other small picturesque villages and back into Amsterdam. We took the long way, and as a result, we got to see an antique windmill! I think we rode about 5 hours, maybe 35k. A nice pace, not too fast, not too slow. The ride is mostly flat (it is Holland, after all), with a few small hills. You don't have to ride as far as we did, we were just having a great time, so we wanted to keep going. Thijs was very accommodating in this respect. He was having fun, too!Afterwards, sharing a beer and photos with Thijs and Jasper, a great close to the ride with very nice people, on a beautiful sunny day in Holland!

A safe and enjoyable ride. The first thing you notice about Amsterdam is that there are bikes everywhere and the locals comfortably navigate their way through all sorts of traffic! Riding with Jasper's tour group we felt safe on the road and quickly got a sense for the laid back freedom that comes with bike riding! We learnt a lot about Amsterdam's past, the mentality of the people and got a good overview of the area. Jasper was friendly and easy to talk to. We enjoyed it a lot.

Excellent Tour. This was the best tour that we did in Amsterdam and gave a great insight into the history and lifestyle of the Dutch people.Thijs (pronounced Tice) was passionate and informative about the tour and provided lots of other recommendations for us to do (including renting a boat and touring the canals).Biking around Amsterdam is by far the best way of getting around and the bikes hired by We Bike Amsterdam are very comfortable, sturdy and safe.Would recommend this tour to everyone.

Very positive experience. My family and I took the group tour and it exceeded our expectations in terms of the sites seen and the conduct of the tour guide (Liza in our case). Liza was very knowledgable and took care to include all in the site discussions. She went further than just leading the tour, she also followed up with some additional information and recommendations via email one the tour ended.The bikes were ideal for our travels and the pace and route were great. I would recommend this tour to anyone interested in seeing the city centre the way it best shows, via a bike of course.

Perfect way to see Amsterdam. After being rained out the first day, I rescheduled no problem to the next day and I'm so glad I did! Brilliant way to get a feel for the city as a first time visitor. Great to do if you are on your own as well. Highly recommended it

A wonderful way to discover Amsterdam. My daughter and I took the 2 hour group tour yesterday, led by Jasper. We both enjoyed the friendly local knowledge of our guide and were fascinated not only to learn the history of Amsterdam but also the social history of it's people. We would both highly recommend this tour - it was relaxed, fun and informative and gave us lots of ideas of what to visit next in this beautiful City. Huge thanks to Jasper for such a great insight into Amsterdam.

Another great review....no coincidence!. We took this tour this morning. It was my wife and I, who are both in our late 30's and my parents who are both around 70. We were joined by a family of four from Malaysia.Like other reviewers, we left the tour very happy. My wife and I had been to Amsterdam before and had seen many of the most popular sites, so it was nice to hear about some of the less common sights that tourists might not regularly come across on their own.At 25 euros, this tour is a great value. I highly recommend it to anyone whether you have spent some time in Amsterdam before or not.The ride is very easy and not lengthy by any standards. I think we did about 12 km total over the course of 3 or 4 hours, so it would be suitable for just about anyone. Thanks for the great tour!

Best Tour in Amsterdam. Thijs, our guide, showed us the sights and sounds of Amsterdam. We had a fantastic experience and truly enjoyed the day. The bikes were comfortable and well-maintained, and everyone on the tour loved it. Thijs also took the time to email all of us with some of his favorite city spots. Best tour in Amsterdam!

Ask Jasper for his list of local cafes!. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour. Arrival instructions and meeting spot were very well organised and easy to follow; our guide Jasper was knowledgeable; the group was a good size; relaxed environment with plenty of time. Be sure to hit Jasper up for his list of good cafes and breweries. Highly recommended.

great introduction to the city. Really lovely tour of the city. The bikes were comfortable and excellently maintained. Our tour guide was knowledgeable and very nice. Overall I couldn't pick a better way to see Amsterdam. One bit of advice they don't take credit cards so make sure you have cash. totally worth the price though so just make sure to hit the ATM before the tour.

One of the best ideas ever!. So this was my first time ever visiting Amsterdam and I planned a solo trip to be able to explore by myself. I signed up for this bike tour my first morning in the city so that way the knowledge I gain from the tour I can then use to explore on my own.I have to say this was one of the best ideas ever, our tour guide was incredibly witty with his comments and gave us really good information on the history of Amsterdam. We were also taken through some of the most beautiful canal viewpoints throughout the tour and I was lucky enough to hangout with the main tour guide after the tour ended!!In conclusion I highly recommend this tour, since biking is one of the main modes of transportation in Amsterdam, this will give you a feel of the city from the eyes of a local.

A must during your visit. A fantastic way to enjoy and explore the streets of Amsterdam. The tour was well organised, we stopped in some lovely places, the tour guide was very knowledgeable. Well worth the time and the money.

awesome bike tour. Thijs (pronounced t-ice) is a wonderful tour guide. The leisure cycle around amsterdam's hidden places were enjoyable and proceeded at a good pace. Not to mention Thijs had amazing stories to tell of the places and gave me very good recommendations for food and attractions to further explore on my own. Well worth the time and money spent!

Very pleasant way of wondering through Amsterdam !. If you're visiting Amsterdam, you should take a bike and spend some time exploring the city. This is the way most locals move around. You will literally see thousands of bikes everywhere.Searching for outdoor activities here at TripAdvisor, I found "We Bike Amsterdam" as a highly recommended tour. I booked the 3-hour tour for me and my wife, and we both enjoyed the day, even not being bikers.Thijs (co-founder and guide) took our small group of 10 people through the large avenues and attractions, but we also rode on back streets and the lovable Jordaan neighborhood. Price is EU$ 25 per person, and you should take cash to pay. A stop along the way at a street corner cafe was nice, and an opportunity to know with whom we were sharing the tour.For the next time I'm planning to take the longer tour, outside Amsterdam (5-6hs) which is also promising.

One of the best activities in Amsterdam!!. My family spent a week in Amsterdam and this was one of our best experiences! We loved the ride so much we rented another time and went North into the countryside. Thank you Thijs for giving us the tips on the microbrewery, the countryside ride, and all the history on the city. Awesome tour guide!!

Excellent half a day spent on bike. Loved our tour guide, Jasper, who is nice and fun! He took us to interesting hidden places that we would have never discovered on our own. Making Amsterdam a wonderful city to visit. An excellent way to explore the city with yound kids. The boys had lots of fun riding the well fitted bikes and learning about the history of the cities in an interesting way. Jasper was so accommodating by taking us to see the narrowest building upon request, though it was not originally on the tour. Highly recommend this to everyone, especially those who's traveling with family!

Fantastic. We had a most wonderful bike tour! Our guide was knowledgeable, personable, and professional. She met us in Dam Square then walked us a block or so to their shop where we were fitted with extremely sturdy, 3 speed bikes. The tour took us through various neighborhoods, some very busy and some very quiet. When appropriate she had us park the bikes and walk into courtyards or other sites. And she gave us ample time to take photos.About 2/3 into the tour we stopped at a cafe and just enjoyed the day and our fellow tour mates.Cycling in Amsterdam is a great experience for all skill levels. Do yourself a favor and go on this tour!

Always choose the little guy. Forget those big, corporate tour companies. You get a much richer experience and more attention from the small businesses. Our bike trip was excellent! Tice took great care of us. I highly recommend seeing the city this way.

Schooltrip to amsterdam. I am a teacher and I was with a schoolclass in Amsterdam! The "we bike Amsterdam" was the best way of seeing and getting to know the city! My students loved the tour and at the end of our trip they all said that it was the best thing we did on our trip!Thanks toThijs and Jasper!

Perfect way to enjoy Amsterdam. 12 of us, including three children aged 11-14 (guessing a bit) spent three hours leisurely biking through some lovely parts of Amsterdam City today. Expertly guided by Jasper, one of the two owners of We Bike Amsterdam, we were shown some of the must sees of the city as well as some of it more hidden treasures. Perfect weather and a calm city didn't make the experience any worse, quite contrary. For anyone new to the city, or and experienced visitor that want to see Amsterdam in a new way, this is an excellent way to spend some time. I can really recommend a tour with We bike Amsterdam.

Do this early in your trip. On the first morning of a recent trip to Amsterdam I arranged to do a bike tour. It's a great way to take in a lot of the city in one go and useful for getting your bearings for the rest of your stay.Luckily for us, my partner and I were the only two people booked on that particular day, so we had our guide, Jasper, all to ourselves. (They have a policy to do the tour no matter how few people are there - excellent for customer service.)The mix of cycling along just looking at the buildings, plus some background history, plus some stops at specific points of interest was a good one. We went to places we'd never have gone to under our own steam. I'd have actually liked even more information along the way as it was so interesting. The great advantage though is we could ask Jasper other questions as they arose, so we learnt extra stuff. Plus the bikes were good quality (better than some I saw ridden around by people on other tours). It's a bit more expensive than similar tours, but I can't compare what they're like.Tip: We went on a Monday and Jasper said it's usually quieter then, so it made getting around a lot easier and safer.

A tour to get to know Amsterdam.. We found the tour really excellent: very well organized, bikes of first quality, Thijs - the tour guide- knows the city and provides very helpful information adapting the tour to our needs. At first, I thought perhaps was too much money for the 4 of us, but I was very glad and pleased with the experience, and found it worth the money. I really recommend it, specially if your stay in Amsterdam is short ( this way you can see a lot in 3 h)

Great bike tour!!!. We had such a great bike tour with We Bike Amsterdam!!!! Our guide was extremely friendly and knowledgable. He was also very helpful getting our kids back on their bike seats every time we stopped, which was greatly appreciated! We had such a great time and would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam. The price of the tour is very affordable too!!!

Great bike your with a wonderful Guide. We spent the morning biking with jasper and thoroughly enjoyed it. His English was fantastic and he did a great job of showing us around. The weather happened to be gorgeous that day as well, which didn't hurt. The bikes were in great shape and the tour itself was not strenuous. We had a blast! I would absolutely recommend this tour if you are looking for an active way to see Amsterdam!

A must do bike tour. Just came back from a few days in Amsterdam and one of (or actually two of) the highlights was the bike tours. Booked a city tour for our first morning in Amsterdam, and Thijs was an excellent guide. Round the back streets and lesser known squares only to keep emerging at one of the famous sites. We enjoyed this so much (including 2 teenage kids who are hard to please) that we came back a couple of days later and went on a tour out in to the countryside with Thijs and Jasper. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend either of these trips, or better still both.Thanks again Thijs and Jasper for showing us Amsterdam.

Great bike tour!. Our guide, Phillip, was very knowledgeable and friendly. He showed us around to spots we never would have seen or known about on our own. The pace was leisurely and we stopped about two hours in for a coffee break. It truly was a wonderful experience!

Best bikes. The rain set in but didn't dampen the tour.Had a great tour that was not on the normal tourist routes.Nice place for coffee and cake and tour guide willing to answer any of your questions and great explanation and bike route.Bikes were fantastic, so easy to ride and extremely comfortable.

Wonderful tour that changes my impression!. It was a lovely day with wonderful 3 hours tour! The local guide, Thijs, leaded us cycle around peaceful streets and beautiful parks. He not only talked the history and famous places in the city, but also took us to some hidden churches and secret gardens. We took a break at the normal coffee shop outdoors and I had a very nice yoghurt drink with fruit. All the experience changed my impression about Amsterdam – it’s not a city just with red-light district and cannabis, but a peaceful and joyful place to live. Definitely recommended this tour to any friend who wants to visit this city!

The Best Bike Tour to see the ulitimate Biking City!!. Amsterdam is built for bikes and this is the perfect introduction for new visitors and old. I have been to Amsterdam many times in the past but Jasper managed to show us many new places I had never seen before. The two older kids had their own bikes and we were a bit nervous about letting them loose on the narrow roads but Jasper managed it really well and kept them under close supervision. The youngest went in the front of a cargo bike I rode. It was a bit hard work at times as the road gets a bit steep over some of the bridges but our youngest loved it as he thought he was in a Star Wars movie. I didn't mind riding this bike as I ride most days anyway but if you are not the fittest then Jasper was more than happy to ride this bike for us. Jasper was great, very knowledgeable and amazingly enthusiastic about his home. It was a great pleasure to spend the morning with him and highly recommended.

This is the first thing you have to do in Amsterdam.. We biked for four hours with Jasper on our first morning in Amstersdam. It was the very best way to really feel what the central old part of the city is all about, as the pitch was perfect and the info was genuinely from an insider and personal perspective. It was leisurely, so very interesting, and above all fun (and safe) We went on to have many great experiences in the city, but we always wished we were back on the bike and had Jasper back to keep us from getting lost. The small group guarantee is real, and we saw several other larger groups and were so happy we read the fine print and chose these guys!

Great way to see Amsterdam and learn about its history!. This is a must if you're visiting AmsterdamFirst of all, our tour guide Jaspter was awesome. He brought a lot of energy and enthusiasm to the tour. Amsterdam is a great city and has a lot to offer on its own, but the tour guide made the overall experience that much better. He was very much excited to show us around and knew his stuff, which is great because there is so much history in the city. Plus, biking around is the best way to see city. It isn't too large, and biking around really allows you to see a lot of cool side streets and attractions you wouldn't otherwise fine (and of course the tour brings you to these places).I highly recommend this for anyone traveling through Amsterdam on short or long stays.

The Way To See Amsterdam!. The whole core city of Amsterdam is built for bicycling, and We Bike Amsterdam is a first class bike tour company. The reasons are clear for their high ranking on Trip Advisor. They keep the groups small and have very personable guides. We met the guides at Dam Square and took a short walk to a bike shop where we got set up with a well maintained city bike. Our tour was a lovely sampling of the city minus the heavily congested tourist areas. We have taken bicycle city tours in 5 other cities and enjoyed this one the most!
It's a nice way to feel the atmosphere of the city. Our family with two children really enjoyed the tour. Especially the youngest one (5 years old) while sitting in the bicycle cab :)

Good tour. I found this tour via Trip Advisor and it is as real as the numerous comments. It is indeed the best way to get around in the city and experience it like the locals do. Our young guide Jasper was excellent in telling us about some city history and was attentive to our needs. My wife is not an avid cyclist, but too found it enjoyable and not highly demanding on fitness level. Highly recommendable!

Tour of Amsterdam and The Fault in our Stars. My husband and I (with our two teenage daughters) already would have given this tour five stars for its leisurely pace, super cool bike locks, fun company, interesting overview of Amsterdam history, and opportunity to feel like a real Amsterdammer. BUT, when our awesome guide Phillip told us he could show us some real movie sites from The Fault in our Stars movie/book, our girls just about kissed him! Super fun. A highlight of our trip.

Great time!. We had a really enjoyable tour with Phillip, our guide. It was a really big group that day, which meant we had to travel pretty slowly. Phillip was very knowledgeable and willing to answer any and all questions we had. In the middle of the tour, his chain broke on his bike, so I ended up riding on the back of my bike while he cycled like a true Amsterdammer! The tour takes you through the Jordaan, to see a Dutch resistance church, through Vondelpark, and to various other hidden gems. We had a ton of different stops, so if you're worried about being on a bike for 3-4 hours straight, don't be. My only issue with the tour had nothing to do with the company, but with the other tourists who joined us. We had to wait twice for the same group, who got lost in Vondelpark and then insisted on stopping at their hotel to grab rain jackets. I'd recommend maybe running two separate tours for those who are used to cycling and able to keep up with a group and maybe another tour for beginners/those who want to go slower. It was rather frustrating to wait for this group at every single intersection.
Great way to see Amsterdam. We had a wonderful time biking around Amsterdam with Liza. It was a great introduction to the city. The bikes were great, the tour even better.

Now I've seen Amsterdam. If you don't book your bike tour with these guys you will have missed so many secret places in the city. A bike in Amsterdam is a must but it is also an exciting experience. Our guide Phillip made us feel safe and we only got lost one time. Our fault not his. They do not take credit cards for the 25$ euro trip so bring cash and for the delightful coffee stop mid-tour.

We Bike Amsterdam. This is the best way to get around in the city and experience it like the locals do. Our young guide Jasper was excellent in telling us about some city history. It takes between 3-4 hours, there are many stops at different places, even a pit stop for coffee. I'm sure he'd be happy to accommodate special requests for specific interest, and he does change the route he uses anyway, depending on the group. This is an absolute must, if you like bikes.

Great time!. I'm traveling by myself so wanted to have some activities to meet people. This ride was so fun. Jasper was great and really helpful. Loved seeing the city on bike without having to worry about getting lost. Thanks Jasper:)

Make This Your #1 Thing To Do. This tour shows you what your guide book doesn't. Thijs Bakker was our guide (& co-owner). He is a local bloke and his passion and love for this beautiful city really shine through.The meeting point is right in Dam Square, where we met Thijs and walked 5 mins to the bike location. The bikes were all excellently maintained, clean and easy to ride ( and comfortable saddles).  The tour meanders through undiscovered little treasures off the usual tourist trail. But Thijs takes the time to tell you all about the history behind the sight in front of you. You really get an in depth understanding of how Amsterdam became the place it is now. If you are lucky enough to do the tour on a Saturday, Thijs will also take you to a wonderful local market where the locals shop. At the end of the trip, Thijs also sent an email listing his favourite places (that are local haunts, rather than tourist traps) including a local microbrewery and gave his contact details for any follow up questions. He couldn't be helpful enough!I would say that the pace of this trip would suit anyone of any age as long as they have a degree of bike and road awareness. There were no steep climbs and the pace was set by the mix of the group. Half way through, the group stopped at a little corner cafe where beers, coffee and juice were readily available at a reasonable price. Thijs and his co-owner, Jasper have up relatively recently set up 'We Bike Amsterdam' so I can only 100% wholeheartedly recommend that you support local independent business such as this.

Great tour . We really enjoyed the tour. The tour guide was really motivated and had a lot of background knowledge! We have seen a lot of hidden places and went beyond the standard city centre. Thanks guys.

Best afternoon in Amsterdam.. This was a great bike tour led by Jasper who is quite easy on the eyes ladies! There were only three of us, but he was still so enthusiastic and friendly, I was glad we ended up in such a small group. I really got to know some interesting facts, and you get to stop and go into a few places, its not just a drive by tour. If there's one thing I would complain about is that its not long enough! Thanks!

A must do. This is an excellent way to see the real Amsterdam. Our guide Phillip was a great guide full of knowledge and tips for your stay. Not too much information, but enough to give you a little insight into Amsterdam life. Slow pace, easy ride plenty of stops even my great grand mother could do this!! book now!

Take this tour.. Taking a bike tour in Amsterdam is a must--it's the best way to really get a feel for being an Amsterdammer. And, We Bike Amsterdam is the tour company you should use. Our guide, Jasper, was knowledge, showed us things off-the-beaten path, was able to answer our questions, and gave us great recommendations for restaurants and other things to do. One thing I particularly liked about this tour is that the bikes were white (as opposed to the obnoxious green, orange, or yellow rental bikes I saw other tour groups riding that screamed tourist) and the tour groups are kept small. I was tempted to sign up for the tour a second day because it was so enjoyable!

We Bike Amsterdam. This tour was the highlight of my visit to Amsterdam. Our guide, Thijs, was extremely pleasant, knowledgeable and professional. A bike tour of Amsterdam is a must on your itinerary and from my inquiries, I believe that We Bike Amsterdam gives you a personalized tour like no others in the city.Thank you Thijs for such an enjoyable day!

Not just the tourist traps. New companies do try harder. A great tour with lots of interesting smaller quieter spots in Amsterdam. Thijs (co owner)was helpful not rushed and very informative. Highly recommended once you've visited the tourist traps

The perfect way to see Amsterdam! Fun for young crowds. Fabulous tour that is especially fun for young(ish) people! Not the regular sight-seeing you get but incredible and amusing insights presented by our smart and humorous guide Jasper, who took much more time than he had to and adjusted the stops according to our wishes. We were ten girlfriends on a bachelorette trip and had a perfect time. Pretty much just awesome all the way through, nothing to complain about. Absolutely worth its price.

The wheels keep turning. What a lovely way to explore a beautiful city with so much to see at a leisurely pace. Phillip was a very pleasant and knowledgable guide who conducted a safe and varied trip.

Great tour whatever the weather. We turned up with our 2 daughters at 9.45 to discover the other people who had booked had either cancelled at the last moment or had become ill so their loss became our gain as we were the only guests on a slightly cloudy and later drizzly day.After a 5 minute walk we collected our sturdy Dutch bikes which have 3 gears (to help get you over the bridges) and went off to discover the quiet, pretty and far more interesting side of Amsterdam. After 3 hours we had visited the Jordaan area, around the park (seen the storks), to the museum area, and lots of other points. We also found out what the hooks are used for, 3 crosses mean, east & West India companies and all about new Amsterdam!Really interesting cycle ride visiting the nicer areas and cross crossing over the canals and side streets.We also stopped at pleasant cafe for a drink, and then picked the guide for ideas on where we could have lunch (greenwoods 3 minutes from where you drop your bike off) and a good Indonesian restaurant as well.So if you want to see a more interesting side of Amsterdam (it avoids the red light, canabis and poor flower areas), then I would highly recommend even with teenagers who also enjoyed it!

Highly recommended!. We took this bike tour on a sunny Sunday at the end of May on the strength of the TripAdvisor reviews which we had read previously. It seems the 92 people who had posted before me were not wrong!!Amsterdam is a city built for cyclists and this was an ideal and highly entertaining way to see it as the locals see it. The tour took us around the suburban areas and parks - places you wouldn't necessarily visit on a typical tour and as a result, we got to see some hidden gems and learnt much about the history and culture of the city.Jasper was our tour guide and he was friendly, knowledgeable and had some great stories to share with the group. We met in Dam Square and walked a few minutes to the bike shop where we picked up our bikes which were of an excellent quality and began our 3 hour tour from there.The tour is suitable for people of all abilities as the terrain is completely flat and there are multiple stops along the way, including a break for drinks at a charming coffee shop.At EUR25 per person, this tour was great value for money and very highly recommended!

Brilliant experience. We booked the tour one day in advance after finding about the company on Trip advisor. Thijs, our tour guide was very accommodating and organized extra afternoon tour just for the four of us because the morning one was full. After couple of days wondering the streets of Amsterdam we finally got to know something about the city's history, culture, architecture etc.. Thijs was a great company and took us to some fascinating places. The tour was definitely a highlight of our trip. I would highly recommend it to everyone.

Do this bike tour!!!. My husband and I just completed a We Bike Amsterdam tour with Jasper and most strongly recommend. Jasper was very personable and informative but also fun. Riding in Amsterdam is easy but Jasper showed us a different side to Amsterdam which we would never have found on our own - various leafy lane ways in residential areas, private courtyards tucked away from the hustle and bustle.It was nice to get away from the very touristy (and somewhat tacky) side of Amsterdam and focus on the "real" Amsterdam that the locals enjoy. It is easy enough to find the Red Light District and other major attractions yourself but do this tour and you will come across other gems of Amsterdam which will show this quite beautiful city in a whole different (and delightful) light"!!

What a way to visit some hidden treasures of the city! Top experience! . This bike tour is a must! Biking around Amsterdam, we visited places we would never have found on our own. Thijs was our tour guide sharing his wealth of knowledge of the citie's history and beauty spots which he delivered in an engaging and entertaining way. His lighthearted chitchat and banter made the experience by far the best part of our trip! Top bloke! I would highly recommend and would do it all again next time we visit! All in all a brilliant tour! Thank you Thijs! :)

Great Way to Experience Amsterdam. I joined Jasper for an Amsterdam bicycle tour and had a blast. It's no joke that the tour proceeds rain or shine. Due to rain that day, I was the only participant but Jasper had no issue with moving forward with my now "private" tour despite the low attendance. Shortly after starting, the rain stopped and we were able to enjoy the day and all the sights, both on and off the beaten path that Amsterdam has to offer. As a urban bicyclist in Washington DC, I was in great envy of the bike infrastructure in Amsterdam and loved riding the step-through upright bicycle that is the norm in the Netherlands. Jasper did such a great job explaining the history of this fine city as well as explaining what it's like to be an aspiring stand-up comic living in Amsterdam. I recommend this trip to all and best of luck to Jasper and partners!

A Must Do in Amsterdam. We have just completed a fabulous tour with Thijs which we thoroughly enjoyed. The booking via their website was easy and organised and Thijs has a charming personality and excellent knowledge to share. It was great to be off the tourist track and feel like we experienced just a bit of everyday Amsterdam life. We would highly recommend this bike tour.

Great way to see Amsterdam. We thoroughly enjoyed our bike tour with Jasper of some of the hidden treasures that Amsterdam has to offer. The bikes are in excellent condition and it is a safe way to cover a lot of ground. Don't expect the focus to be on the usual main attractions. You do pass by a lot of these but the great thing about this tour are the more,out of the way places you visit. Jasper was fun and informative and took the time to mark up places of interest on a map for us at the end of the tour. We Bike Tours are deserving of their high ranking and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.

Such a great bike tour!. We booked a private tour for four with Jasper in May 2014.
