Immediately upon arriving in Amsterdam, you'll notice that the bicycle is the preferred mode of transportation, and we were glad to be able to experience the city the way a native might. We had a delightful three hours as Jasper took us to hidden Amsterdam gems, with a stop at one of his favorite pubs for local beer along the way. We learned a lot about the city and Amsterdam culture and felt very comfortable riding in traffic, despite the fact that none of us are regular cyclists. I would definitely recommend this company and our friendly, funny guide. Consider booking this tour early in your trip to get a feel for the layout of the city.

FABULOUS! FABULOUS! YOU WILL LOVE EVERY MINUTE OF THIS TOUR!. We were met by Thijs in Dam Square for our 3 hour bike tour in Amsterdam.Thijs is passionate about his city and very informative. We were the only 2 on the tour the day we went- so it was like a private tour for the 2 of us. Thijs has a wonderful personality and explained all the sites in detail. He took us to many places we never would have found on our own. The bikes are easy to ride and you will get the hang of it very quickly as you go through all the different neighborhoods in Amsterdam.He responds very quickly to emails to confirm our tour.If you have one activity in Amsterdam to do- then this is the PERFECT tour! We asked him about the culture, daily life etc and he was happy to answer all our questions. The bike tour was one of the highlights of our 2 week trip through Europe! We will remember this wonderful day for the rest of our lives! Thank you Thijs for making it such a special day!

fantastic day out. We only had two days in amsterdam so booked in a tour with these guys based on previous trip advidsor reviews. We were very lucky that we booked the group tour on a day no one else had booked. But they still ran the tour and we got our own private tour. Really friendly and knowledgeable guide. We learnt so much about the area that you would not get on your run of the mill tour. Half way through we stopped at a cute little cafe and we sat and had a drink and a chat. Very relaxed but hugely enjoyable and educational tour. Highly recommend!

Fantastic Bike Tour. My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on the We Bike Amsterdam tour. Our guide, Thijs, was really friendly and knowledgeable about the area. The tour was focused on parts of Amsterdam not normally visited by tourists. It lasted approximately 3 hours with a cafe stop. The bikes were very comfortable and easy to ride. After the tour we were e-mailed information regarding recommended restaurants and other places of interest from the tour organisers.

Great Experience. Booked this tour at the last minute on a Saturday. received a confirmation that I was good to go for Sunday morning. Jasper was my tour guide. We had a very small group of 6, it made for a very personal tour. Our guide was very knowledgeable and took his time in showing us around. It didn't feel as though he was just going through the motions, very passionate and nice. I would recommend this tour to anyone.

So much fun!. I was tentative about taking this tour since I had not been on a bike in decades! It turned out to be an incredibly fun way to tour Amsterdam and to explore areas that are not covered on other tours. Thijs is a great tour guide and made sure that our small group stayed together as we navigated the streets of Amsterdam. This was a truly memorable way to tour the city even for an inexperienced cyclist like me!

Super bike tour. The bike tour was great. Met in Dam square and then had a short 5 minute walk to pick up the bikes. Good quality bikes - better than the yellow bike you see around! Thijs was an excellent tour guide and showed around some ofthelesser known parts of Amsterdam. Definitely a must!

Laidback, easygoing and informative. Our guide Jasper showed us some hidden treasures of Amsterdam. Do not expect to see all of the major highlights of Amsterdam in this thoroughly planned trip - it focuses on some of the history regarding Amsterdam in a fun and interesting way. Enjoyed it very much!

Best thing I did in Amsterdam. Who knew Amsterdam was this beautiful?I arrived into Amsterdam the night before taking this tour and decided to get outside and be physical to assist with overcoming the jet lag. I'm so glad I did this as Thijs made it all so simple and loads of fun.We saw parts of the city that you'd never see on other tours or by stumbling around yourself, and with the knowledge that Thijs has, we got an appreciation of what lays beyond the tourist path.The bikes were easy to use, the group once and small, and Thijs was uber cool so it made for a great few hours. Thijs also sent through a list of places to see and eat, plus some specialty brewpubs, which was icing on top of the cake!I'd highly recommend We Bike Amsterdam.

Great ride great guide! . Had an awesome time on our ride this morning. Was a great tour of Amsterdam getting to see the main sights and a few lesser known areas of the city. Thanks for the ride Thijs!
Everything was great!. Everything was great! Few bikes and a careful service are important in our opinion, so We bike deserves 5 ​​stars

Excellent way to see the city. We were only in Amsterdam for 1 day (I know, we're crazy) and we decided to do this bike tour at 10 am. It was WONDERFUL! Thijs was incredibly friendly and very knowledgeable. He shared lots of facts, interesting stories, and pointed out little details in the city that we would never have noticed on our own. The bikes were comfortable and easy to ride. We stopped at a cafe in a very nice part of the city for a small meal and a drink and had lots of fun with the 3 other people on the tour. If you're not sure what kind of tour you want to do - BOOK THIS NOW! It's a great value for the cost and you'll learn a lot about this beautiful city.

Friendly Tour of Hidden Amsterdam. My husband and I love going on bike tours in any city we visit. Our tour ended up being just us and our tour guide, Thijs, and it was a lot of fun. The pace was leisurely so there was plenty of time to look around and enjoy the city. Thijs took us to places that you wouldn't normally get to visit on a tour and he shared lots of interesting facts about the city. After exploring the city on foot the rest of the week, we saw how much of the city we had really toured on this excursion. It was a lot! From the canals to the Museum District to Vondelpark. (We didn't see parrots on the tour, but we knew to look for them because of it). Our guide was friendly and we had fun talking with him. He even gave us advice on where to bike outside of the city since we were going to be in Amsterdam for a whole week.

Fantastic bike tour. Having only booked a couple of days in Amsterdam we decided to book a bike tour to make sure we got round it all, our tour guide was Jasper and it ended up just being myself and my husband who had booked. Jasper made us feel at ease, was very laid back and didn't rush us at all. He said as it was just us 2 if we wanted to see anything in particular he would cater it more to suit us which was great! The tour was about 3 1/2 hours and we stopped for a coffee too where Jasper chatted to us and marked out sites good spots to eat/drink on our map which was brilliant. He was very attentive in the tour always checking on us and giving us plastic ponchos to wear when the rain got worse. As it was a bank holiday there he even went to the effort to get keys to the hidden church to show us around. Nothing seemed any bother to Jasper and it felt more like being shown seeing by a friend. If we hadn't done this tour we would have missed out on so many interesting facts and stories as well as having our many questions answered. Definitely worth it and would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Top bike tour!. We recently went on the 3hrs tour with Thijs and were really pleased that we did! It's an excellent way to see the city. The tour shows you places you wouldn't find on your own and provides just the right amount of information. We finished the tour with more knowledge and a greater love for Amsterdam as well as a gained a friend in Thijs. Thank you

Greattttttt. Highly recommend to everyone who came to visit Amsterdam. We had tour with Thijs: comfortable and modern bike, nice and friendly atmosphere, useful tips about Amsterdam ;) Time has passed so fast. I think its better to take bike trip during your first days in Amsterdam, so you will be familiar with the places you want to visit later again :) Thank you a lot for the trip and for this wonderful idea of activity for tourists ;)Nastya from Norway

nice bikeride through beautifull Amsterdam. After searching tripadvisor for the best bike-tour this seemed to be the best, and we were proven right! In a small group of eight we were guided in a fun and interesting route through the city. Thjis showed us places we would not be able to see had it not been for his invovlement in different parts of the local living. Facinating hidden churches among other things, and also the most famous spots. We felt safe and well taken care of through the tour, the speed was plesant, and we got a nice overview of the city.

A must do while in Amsterdam. I took this tour with my two teenage children. We all loved our time cycling around Amsterdam with Jasper telling us interesting stories about the City along the way. He shows you places that I doubt you will find by yourself. We did three tours while in Amsterdam and this was definitely the best!

Friendly and a fun time. Jasper was our tour guide around Amsterdam. There are many things to see in Amsterdam and many items we may not have seen if it weren't for this tour. This bike tour was great, safe, and comes highly recommended. The tour took about 4 hours and no one seemed to be in a hurry to have this end, the guide or the others on the tour.

great way to start vacation in Amsterdam. We took our excursion the first day of our holidays after the owner kindly changed us the booking without charging us due to our flight being cancelled. The experience was great , they showed us great places and give us tons of tips of were to eat and have fun in the city .The two youngsters who were on training were lovely and all in all it´s the best wayto start your vacation in Amsterdam . A MUST !!!

Incredibly exciting and so worth it!. A bike tour in general in ansterdam is a must. To become a part of the culture really makes it extra special. From pick up to drop off, it was smooth sailing. Everyone was on time and we began our journy at the bike shop. Jasper introduced himself with a warm welcome! It made me and the rest of the group feel so comfortable. The group of 11 got a long so well! We introduced ourselves to each other and talked along the way. it was family friendly a solo friendly! Maybe having everyone introduce themselves to the whole group would even enhance the experience! Jasper took his time and was so patient especially when crossing the streets! Other bikers and drivers are crazy! We stopped for a coffe break to enjoy the amsterdam canals. It was a beautiful day with a very informative, friendly and relaxing guide, Jasper. It completely exceeded my expectations. We went to all the main sights in amsterdam. Although i wish we spent more time in Vondelpark. The whole tour was about 3.5 hours. I thought it was suppose to be 2. I didnt mind its length but maybe a note of that would be helpful to others. Take this tour with Jasper and his partner! Totally worth it!

Great start to a short break!. Great tour - Thijs is an excellent guide! He took us to places we would never have found and showed us the real Amsterdam. Halfway through we stopped for coffee at a lovely little coffee house where Thijs had reserved a table inside out of the cold - perfect! The bikes were really good comfy ones and I couldn't recommend it more highly.

Exceptional Tour and Fabulous Guide!. I highly recommend this bike tour if you are visiting Amsterdam. I took this tour with two friends, and it was the highlight of my trip. Thijs was our tour guide and he was superb! My only complaint is that if you are taking this bike tour to please show up on time. Thijs is very professional and has a true passion for making this bike tour a success. The bike tour itself is full of fascinating information about Amsterdam, as well as showing a tourist some "secret" gems that one wouldn't ever think to visit on their own. Taking this bike tour is like spending time with an old friend. Thijs was very personable and really made the tour top notch! Don't miss out!

A Must do!. A superb time with 2 teenage kids, guide was super nice and informed.We were shown lots of hidden parts of the city and parks.Relaxed and really informative, you get a great sense of the place from the tour.10 out of 10

Brilliant. Four of us went on a beautiful ride around the city on Sunday morning. Just 3 others on the tour so we were also able to chat to everyone and make friends. Thijs (pronounced Tice) is an excellent guide; he took us to places we would never have found. Mid - way break for coffee at a lovely little coffee house with live classical music. The bikes were really good comfy ones. We are middle aged English teachers, used to organising school trips so we had organised a packed itinerary for our long weekend break in order to see as much of Amsterdam as we could - this was the best thing we did all weekend. I couldn't recommend it more highly.

An Excellent and relaxed tour. My cousin and I went on a group tour with Jasper. We were the only two who had booked, and yet they still ran the full tour. Jasper was an excellent guide. Easy to chat with and an engaging storyteller. Sitting down to coffee for a chat was relaxing and low-key.The tour is a light cycle through Jordaan, the Vondelpark and the Museum District. I would recommend this company to anyone- so many cycle tours have massive crowds following after the guide in this city. Here, you can chat and engage with the guide. With a maximum of ten participants, the numbers are excellent.

One of the BEST tours you'll ever go on!!. With no exaggeration this is one of the greatest things you can do in all of Amsterdam and completely made our trip. This tour was perfectly planned out over a 3 hour trip and you get to see and learn so much about this city you probably wouldn't have ever learned. Our tour leader Thijs was absolutely awesome and took us to locations you wouldn't ever be able to find by yourself that arn't in any travel book you will ever find. His knowledge and want to share of information makes this trip incredibly worth while. It's not hard on the body at all because Amsterdam is so flat and practically anyone of any age can appreciate the beauty of Amsterdam on this bike tour. Thijs was even so awesome to send my girlfriend and I an email of all the amazing places you can eat and drink at. Completely going out of his way to do this for us totally gives him a bonus point or two. I can't recommend enough! Cost was about 25euro per person and bike rental is included in that price. Bikes we're really new and well maintained too Well worth the money! Don't leave Amsterdam until you've done this tour!!You might even get to run into Thijs's mother on the bike track....we did! lol! =)
Great time. Jasper was very informative and fun. Biking was very easy. Great way to see Amsterdam. He will take you to places that would be difficult to find on your own.

An excellent tour with a lot of insider tips!. I took the tour with Jasper. As promised he showed me many hidden treasures of Amsterdam. He is very knowledgable about the places we went, and taught me a lot of fun facts. It felt more like a trip with a friend, rather than with a tour guide! Biking in Amsterdam is exciting and everybody should experience it! Jasper also had a lot of local insider tips to share. I went back to a sandwich shop that he showed me several times, great inexpensive food at a great location! You'd have to ask him what locals do and he'd point out places for you to go on your own.

Amsterdam from a Local's Point of View. Went on a private tour with 2 friends of mine with We Bike Amsterdam guided by the lovely Thijs. Our afternoon on bikes, veering through canals, hitting major sites, learning about the less 'touristy' places and avoiding cars and pedestrians was by far our best day spent in Amsterdam. Thijs made our tour very personal, also taking us to his favorite places to eat (we had asked for a food focused tour), and adding a very intimate point of view of his city. He made a point to show us the less traveled roads and the sights that might not be outlined in a guidebook, like the secret churchs of Amsterdam. He was a very knowledgeable tour guide, lending insight to all aspects of Amsterdam life; economy, politics, art, religion, & CUISINE! He gave us a new lens through which we could experience and appreciate Amsterdam like a local and also as a tourist. I would recommend the tour to anyone and everyone! Very happy to have spent a relaxed afternoon with Thijs, my only regret is that the three of us decided to split a slice of the best apple pie in town! Thanks for a fabulous tour!

Thank you for a great tour and personalised experience!. Me and 4 other friends went on a bike tour at the end of March which was run by Thijs. I would like to say thank you for your relaxed yet informed approach with many interesting facts about your beautiful city. The tour was 3 hours long but felt a lot less. It is very relaxed and I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam, whether new to the city or a regular because the tour goes to places you wouldn't expect to visit on a 'normal' tour. Thijs also helped us out with some cool restaurants and bars to visit whilst we was there too so thanks again!

Amsterdam's much better by bike!. As a 40 something mum and occasional cyclist I approached the bike tour with a certain amount of trepidation! I needn't have worried..Thijs was an excellent guide and very quick to put us all at ease..and as a cyclist in Amsterdam you feel much safer than as a pedestrian! Our 2 children aged 13 and 11 loved the tour and Thijs' training as a primary school teacher meant he talked to them at exactly their level which they loved, we even discussed the Dutch approach to drugs and sex in completely appropriate way. Amsterdam is a great city to walk around but by bike you see so much more and after our 3 hour tour (which included much welcomed stop with fab apple pie!) I really felt like I'd got a better idea of the geography, history and philosophy of the place. I would definitely recommend this tour to families with older kids... and in fact to anyone who can ride a bike!

Best Authentic Bike Tour. 2 of my friends and I did the private bike tour with Thijs. Out of all of my experiences on my trip to Amsterdam, I have to say this was my top. Since Thijs knew my friends and I were really interested in the local food of Amsterdam, he personalized our tour to focus on food as well as see the sights and learn the culture. We got a real, authentic tour of the city..Thijs was very knowledgeable, and taught us much about Amsterdam that we would have never known had we not spent the afternoon with him. I really enjoyed myself and I highly recommend taking this tour!

Best spent hours biking, eating and connecting to Amsterdam. Hands down - wonderful experience and best 4 hours spent in Amsterdam. There were three of us ladies ready to bike through the streets and over the canals of the city. Thijs collected us from the main Dam sq and we had a mini adventure inthe city visiting hidden churches, quiet side streets and we requested food and treats along the way so he made sure we ate well. We sat on benches outside this spot and devoured apple pie heaven within 2 minutes. Thijs took us to a local sandwich shop where Saskia with her shining glowing smile made our lunch with love and care. Then straight to the off the beaten bar on the outskirts where we conversed about politics history and the unique ties we all have. We polished the local beer quickly and grabbed some herring and fried fish from a street vendor before dropping our bikes. This tour exceeded our expectations. Thijs is a dedicated, exceptional guide and now a friend! Many thanks and best of luck with your work – Proost to reaching dreams together.

Start your trip here!. I did the bike tour with Thijs and enjoyed the whole tour. It was pretty chilly on our day out, but we stopped for a steaming hot cup of coffee halfway through. Our group was quite small and that made it so much easier to enjoy. It was easy to ask Thijs questions as we biked through the back streets and he knew a lot about local history and architecture. He also surprised us by sharing a lot of knowledge about the birds of the area. I would never have found (nor tried to find) the small courtyards and alleys he took us through. I was only in Amsterdam for one full day and I am glad this is how I spent the morning. Even for a longer trip this would make the perfect start. I also appreciated Thij's recommendations for restaurants and bars from his follow up email. It was too bad my stay was so short so I couldn't try them all!I also appreciated that Thijs was able to adapt the tour to the interests of those participating. I imagine other groups still see the same sights, but with emphases on different parts of the tour. The tour also made me less afraid of biking in Amsterdam and for a longer trip I would definitely have rented a bike and felt comfortable traversing the city for the remainder of my stay.

Amsterdam up close. A great way to see the "rest of Amsterdam" while the big attractions are part of the tour, the best part was the out of the way, hidden gems! The guide was friendly and knowledgable and had great stories about the sites and Amsterdam history and personal antidotes. We stopped for pictures and questions and coffee. It was a relaxing and laid back tour and I highly recommend!

The Authentic Experience. We had a great time on the bike tour, and were even lucky enough for it to be just us two. We were taken to the markets on the Saturday, outside of the touristy part of Amsterdam. This was a really cool experience. So was getting coffee in the nearby cafe. We enjoyed the cool stories that our guide told us that you wouldn't usually notice about the city.It seemed like he showed us the whole of Amsterdam in just a few hours. I particulary enjoyed riding through the park and seeing the secret church. In terms of logistics, We Bike Amsterdam were extremely helpful. They offered to move the tour back an hour because our flight was delayed. This was great service. We Bike Amsterdam deserve more business than any other company in my opinion. Make sure you bring cash, however, Thijs took us to an ATM because we forgot. Thats just one example of how helpful he was. You should definitely do this tour!

Bike and Boat. Bike and Boat are the best ways to see Amsterdam. We bike Amsterdam do a great tour covering the bike angle. 13 km of leisurely relaxed pace cycling around the city over 3 hours with interesting stories revealing some of the hidden treasures of this fascinating city. Thijs is a great guide and very knowledgeable about the city.

A must do activity!. There are no words that can completely describe what an amazing tour this was! However, I'll do my best, but it's hard to describe a tour that is as friendly and informational as this. I was able to see the best spots of Amsterdam and see and learn things that I would never have seen on a different tour. The small tour group makes the tour less rehearsed as you get to know your tour guide and learn all kinds of neat and interesting things. To sum up: if you want to really know about Amsterdam and have a great time learning about it, then take this tour!I can't wait to go back!

Best Bike Tour. Book this bike tour. It's the best thing we did in Amsterdam. Jasper is a great guide. He helped us feel comfortable on the bike and confident about navigating the city. He showed us hidden treasures we had not read about in a guide book and answered our questions about the city and its history. He was extremely patient when we stopped to take photos and very generous with his time. Bring a hat and gloves and dress in layers for this time of year. We were lucky it did not rain. The tour is a great value. Our only regret is that we didn't tip more generously.

Great Tour!. This was a fantastic way to get to see parts of Amsterdam that I'm sure I would not have seen on my own. In town for business so had limited time to see the city and this was ideal. The guide, Jasper, was very personable and knowledgable about Amsterdam. We started at 10am and ended a little over 3 hours later. Biked around the city and through the beautiful park--lots of photo opportunities. Even took a short coffee/hot chocolate break and sat outside to enjoy the morning sun. If you have time to do only one thing in Amsterdam, this is it!

I love We Bike Amsterdam. Despite the rain, the bike tour was an amazing way to see the city. I would highly recommend doing this on your first day in Amsterdam to get an idea of the city and the attractions. Thijs, the tour guide, was personable and made an effort to know everyone. Absolutely worth the money and it was fun to see Amsterdam from a local's view

Very Enjoyable . My girlfriend and I took the "We Bike Amsterdam" tour on Saturday morning. I would recommend it, the tour was enjoyable and our guide (Thijs) was informative and friendly.It took a little over 3 hours with a small group and a stop for a coffee. It would help to have a little experience on a bike (this is taken for granted in a place like Amsterdam) but the pace is easy going and guide helps along the way.

Fabulous bike tour- even better tour guide!. My sisters and I took this tour on a beautiful Sunday in early March. Jasper was such a great guide. He was very knowledgable and very passionate about his country. This was a fantastic way to get some Dutch history while doing something extremely fun. Amsterdam is a beautiful city, and I can't think of a better way to see it. Definitely bring a camera. There are so many wonderful photo opportunities. We hit all of our must see's as well as many other's we didn't even know about. While saying goodbye, Jasper sent us with many recommendations of local highlights, including Broodje Bert Lunchcorner which had the most amazing sandwiches with great prices. I would most definitely recommend this as a top priority!!!

Great bike tour with a personal touch. Took this bike tour with my husband in February. Jasper was our tour guide and since no one else signed up for the tour that day, we essentially had a private bike tour of Amsterdam. The bikes were in good condition and very comfortable to ride. The trip was well paced and Jasper was full of interesting tidbits about the city. We stopped at a cafe in the middle of the tour and he also gave us excellent recommendations for cafes and restaurants around the city. Since we are from New York, we stopped by a place which had historical connections to Dutch colonies in New York and learned more about the history between New York and Dutch colonialism. We had a fantastic experience and would highly recommend it.

Great way to see Amsterdam!. I signed up for this bike tour on a whim as I was in Amsterdam for a quick weekend visit and wanted to get a feel for the city. As well as getting an idea of the layout of the city and where all the main highlights are located (Museumplein, Anne Frank House, Vondelpark etc.) this was a great way to see the less touristy side of the city (e.g. pretty little canals, local neighbourhood cafes). The bikes were brand-spanking new and lovely to ride, and the pace of the ride was very leisurely - perfect for a crisp but sunny winter's morning! Most importantly, Thijs was an excellent guide - very professional, friendly and prepared for any situation (even giving me a ride on the back of his bike for the last 15mins when I got a puncture!) I would definitely take the tour again if I'm in Amsterdam just for the great company!

A fabulous tour - even in the pouring rain!. We had a tour with Thijs a few weeks ago and despite terrible weather we had a fantastic time. It was an insightful, interesting and entertaining ride around the town - not just the usual tourist sites but some really interesting places off the beaten track. The tour was done at a leisurely pace, always checking if we were OK and allowing us to ask questions about the places we visited. Stopping for coffee and having the chance to chat about life in Amsterdam from a local's perspective also made the tour even more personal and enjoyable. The beautiful bikes were in great condition and easy to ride. Email communication before and after has been quick, friendly and very helpful. Would definitely recommend!

Just do it!!!. This bike tour really was one of the highlights of my trip. Riding a bike in Amsterdam was one of the top things I wanted to do, but I wasn’t confident to do it by myself. The communication by email was great and they were very accommodating. I thought that we would be given more of the “local” knowledge stated in the advertising, however, if there was then we would have had to stop more, so in retrospect I think there was probably a good balance of a good ride around the town and some good chats along the way.When you turn up at the meeting point there is a bit of a walk to the shop to pick up the bikes.We stopped half way in the tour at a cafe for a coffee; this incidentally was the best coffee I had in my trip!The tour compliments the walking tour (different company) very well. The walking tour takes you around the centre of the town and the bike tour takes you around the town. So there was very little overlap of information.One of the highlights is riding through the building built by Napoleon, I think it’s a museum now, shows how much attention I was paying, but I was having too much fun on my bike.If I had more time I would have gone to hire a bike myself again afterwards, I felt like it gave me the confidence to do it myself.I would definitely recommend this activity to anyone who is keen on riding a bike in Amsterdam for a true Amsterdam experience.

Fun tour, really great start to Amsterdam holiday. We did this tour a couple of weeks ago on our first full day in Amsterdam. The tour was great, we really felt that our guide gave us a lot of insight into the character of the city and showed us some of the more unusual and unexpected sights.We have been on several bike tours of cities before. We particularly liked this one because the tour stopped at a couple of points and we went into some of the buildings - on most bike tours you stay on the outside.Our tour guide was lovely, we enjoyed his company and particularly appreciated the care he took to ensure that our eleven year old felt safe crossing the couple of major intersections. I would highly recommend this tour.

Absolute Delight!. We went for the bike tour without much expectation to begin with, and we finished off feeling very pleased on every aspect of the journey. Even in the rain, our guide for the day, Jasper, gamely went on with the tour.Bike we rented were sturdy & dependable, from a local bike rental shop near the meeting point. Jasper had guided us through the streets of Amsterdam, filling us with nuggets of trivia & information along the way. He was indeed knowledgable in his narration, and mindful not to overload us with too much information. To sum it up, a very enjoyable tour for us, in every aspect. From the guide, to the bikes, to the city itself, we're glad to have chanced upon this bike tour! Definitely worth the price for what you will get in return. 2 thumbs up for these guys,

Best bike tour! . We booked this tour because of the concept of seeing alternative parts of Amsterdam. I had done a similar tour in Paris which I loved, and wanted to give it a go in Amsterdam too. Being my 3rd time to the city, Jasper's tour was a great way to see other parts of the city I hadn't come across already! There was 5 of us on our tour and my friend had a little difficulty with riding her bike, so Jasper was happy to slow down the pace and we ended up with a great 4 hour tour as a result. He was also open to showing us things at our request, and modifying the tour to fit the group. We stopped for a coffee at the half way point so was nice to warm up inside. Overall, we had a great time and I would definitely recommend this tour!
Highlight of the trip!. Nice bikes, wonderful tour guide, amazing sites!It was the best way to ride bikes around town while also sight seeing! Great value!

Cold But Cool Tour. Bike is by far the best way to tour European cities. I was fortunate to be the only tourist for this off the beaten path tour of Amsterdam. Despite being the only tourist, Jasper was enthusiastic and professional in his tour of the city. He was very informative and gave an excellent history of the city and it's people. Over the course of any visit one will see the main attractions, so you want a bike tour to cover a lot of ground and learn about how the people live on a daily basis as well as learn about the signature events from the past. I highly recommend this tour.

Great tour with a personal touch. We turned up at Dam square to meet Thijs in front of the large lion statue. Easy to find as it is the basically the centre of the old town. After collecting the other 2 couples we had to take a short 5 minute walk to the bike hire shop. 'We Bike Amsterdam' don't own the bikes themselves as they are hired through a 3rd party, this means if you enjoyed the cycling they will happily let you rent the bikes beyond the scope of the tour.The bikes are 3 gear Dutch bikes and were very easy to ride. They were quite heavy but this made them feel very stable on the winding Amsterdam cycle lanes. They also had some really comfy saddles.Our tour with Thijs lasted just over 3 hours and allowed us to experience some of the more elusive attractions Amsterdam has to offer. Also, cycling is the most popular form of transport in Amsterdam and we felt we might miss out if we didn't partake in it.Luckily, our tour was on a Saturday which meant a special stop at the famous Noordemarkt to sample some organic food and see the flea market. This is well worth a visit even if it isn't part of your tour.Overall this was a great beginning to our weekend break in Amsterdam. It helped us get accustomed to the culture and general layout of the city.Thijs also sent an email after the tour with some restaurant recommendations and other attractions. This really added the personal touch which would be lacking with a larger tour company.We would recommend this tour to friends, family and strangers on Trip Advisor :-)

Amazing, best bit of our trip. I originally booked this tour as one of the other bigger companies wasn't running during January - what a happy accident!We met Thijs and walked a short way to pick up our very good, easy to ride rental bikes (included in the price) and set off - the tour keeps a great pace with lots of little stops which helped us to get used to the bikes, as well as learn some fascinating information about Amsterdam. We felt like locals riding around and Thijs gave us access to some secret spots which are really memorable. Some cyclists in Amsterdam do go fairly quickly but they are quite used to slower paced tourists and you soon get used to crossing the canals and waiting for a gap to cross if it's busy - felt safer on a bike than as a pedestrian! The cafe half way round had amazing hot chocolate too.When we got back Thijs offered to send an email with a few other tips for markets, cafes and restaurants which all turned out to be great.Best tour I've ever done, we're still talking about it!

A must do in Amsterdam. We didn't realise how riding a bike was such a big part of Amsterdam, so after joining Thijs on a Sunday morning we quickly found ourselves immersed in the city. Thijs' local and historical knowledge and personal touch of the tour was fantastic. The tour varied between short little rides down lane ways to long lesuierly rides through the park and streets. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour. If you are visiting Amsterdam, riding a bike is a must do, even better is to take a tour with a local.

Best bike tour I've done - Trip highlight. This is hands done the best tour, let alone bike tour, that my partner and I have done. Despite booking as part of a group tour, we were alone as no one else had booked on this Wintery day. Thijs, our tour guide made us feel safe and very confident in and amongst the ofttimes chaotic Amsterdam traffic. Thijs was also incredibly knowledgeable about the city and took us through the parts of Amsterdam often sadly ignored due to the fame (or infamy) of the Red Light District. The aim of the tour is to experience Amsterdam from the point of view of a local and we did exactly that - touring through beautiful hidden churches and quiet courtyards otherwise inaccessible to the public. This tour also hits the big spots like the museum district as well, so nothing is left off the menu. We stopped for a coffee in a small cafe bar for a break midway through and chatted with Thijs, who proved to be fantastic company throughout the tour, not only knowledgable but funny and enthusiastic too. After the great tour Thijs followed up with an email to remind us of restaurants he'd recommended in Amsterdam so we did not forget.Can not speak highly enough of this tour. Fun, young guides who love the city and you get to see parts otherwise left off the tourist radar.

Highly recommended, highlight of our trip.. If you can only do one thing in Amsterdam, make sure it's a tour with Jasper or Thijs. Price was so reasonable, they should charge more! (Shhhhh, don't tell them, just tip high). Price includes bike rental and the bikes are of good quality and service. Jasper's tour was fun and friendly. Often times the tour became comical because his friendly nature allowed everyone (other tourists) to interact with each other freely. We (family of four adults) loved the way the tour took us to the hidden parts of Amsterdam and to a nice cafe for a rest and refreshment along the way. The frequent stops along the way were always complemented by an excellent historical story or fact. Only complaint would be with regards to the the unfortunate typical tourist road, bike and pedestrian traffic that made it at times difficult to stay together as a group. Recommend tours be done outside of peak times. Jasper's patience and flexibility was greatly appreciated by all, we were not at all accustomed to the traffic rules and occasional local unfriendly (vocal) attitude toward tourists on bike by the hurried locals. These people need to relax and not verbally attack the tourists.

Hidden Amsterdam - Made Fun and Friendly!. One of the best city tours I have done - by bike or otherwise. Thijs was friendly, knowledgeable and a really fun host, and he led us along beautiful paths to lovely hidden parts of Amsterdam I would never have otherwise seen. If you have not been to Amsterdam before you may not realise that Amsterdammers mostly cycle which means the bike paths are excellent and safe (compared to other countries), and as everything is flat, this is not a hugely strenuous tour even for people unaccustomed to cycling. Having said that, Thijs was super vigilant and took particular care getting us through traffic safely. He was also full of interesting detail which I'm sure changed the way I think about the city of Amsterdam, and we left with lots of great recommendations for things to do, see and eat the next few days.I would highly recommend this to any of my friends coming to Amsterdam - even if only for a day. It's a great introduction to what the town has to offer as well as good fun. I was a solo traveller this time, but I do have kids who bike and am definitely going to try to arrange to do this as a family next trip!

Couldn't ask for more!!. My wife and I enjoyed a tour with Jasper on 3 Dec 2013. By chance, the tour was 'private', as no one else had booked. Jasper was as knowledgable as he was kind. By the end of the tour we truly felt as though we had the lay of the land, a taste of the vast history of the city and quite a few local tips for restaurants and bars. Indeed, after the tour, as promised, Jasper emailed us a suggestion for a cocktail bar (Dvars) that was on the money.If you're looking for an easy going, laid back bike tour, look no further.

Excellent experience. Truly the best bike tour I have been on. I joined this tour as a solo traveler and it couldn't have been easier. Thijs was great fun, knowledgable, and easy going. He offered us the chance to make an extra stop at an outdoor market (with a side bonus of getting apple cake) when it was clear that we were itching to check it out. It's very obvious that this company has a mission of treating people visiting Amsterdam as engaged & interested guests rather than shuttling people through the hotspots in large masses. We saw beautiful spots through the city, learned more than a thing or two, and ended up exceeding our tour time by at least 30 minutes because of how much talking we were doing (Thijs asked first if it was ok to finish the whole tour and we agreed that we wanted to keep going). The bikes are very comfortable, the pace felt just right, and Thijs kept a close eye to make sure we were navigating the busy streets without problem. If you are looking for a great tour, a true personal experience, and a chance to support a growing business with a terrific mission, go with these guys.

Experience Amsterdam like an Amsterdammer!. After having done several bike tours in Europe and Asia, and having lived in Amsterdam, I was truly surprised by this amazing bike tour that Thijs and Jasper provided!! It was personal, innovative and authentic, I learned and discovered so many new things! They show you the real Amsterdam, the places and stories that you won't find in the guidebook but that you can only discover on this tour and because of the fact that these guys love to tell these stories! They are this small company of two lovely guys, that work from the heart and are flexible and passionate about giving you the best. Biking with them feels more like having your knowledgable friends in Amsterdam showing you around instead of feeling like a tourist touring with a big commercial company. So if you want to experience Amsterdam like an Amsterdammer, this is the tour you're looking for!

AWESOME bike tour & great guide!. My husband and I traveled to Amsterdam in October, and were fortunate to have Thijs give us a wonderful tour of his city. I completely recommend this bike tour...it was a highlight of our trip! Lots of other bike tour companies are available in Amsterdam, but they appeared to have large groups. With We Bike Amsterdam, we were the only two on the tour so it was very private, and he tailored the tour and pace to our interests. This company also responded quickly to our last-minute request, so you can't go wrong with great service and customer satisfaction.

Tais has talent. We went to Amsterdam last weekend and took a bike tour with "We Bike Amsterdam" and we were so lucky to get Tais as our guide. He is fun, very knowledgeable and he's definetively a real Amsterdamer! He showed us lot's of hidden places we would have never found by ourselves, we stopped at a nice coffee shop and had the chance to know him better. I feel like riding bikes at home now everyday after our Dutch experience!! Thank you!!!!!

Touring amsterdam can't get better. Very friendly guide, although I was alone he did the tour anyway. It was very interesting to look at and hear all the things a local has to say about their city. These people make sure you ate not one of a big group but very small group to get a better experience. Best thing I did in Amsterdam :)

Great way to spend a morning. There were 3 of us on our trip to Amsterdam, and only the 3 of us on our bike tour as no-one else was there! So we had a private tour all for E25 each, what a bargain! The tour was interesting and informative, but not too much information to take in, it was still relaxed. Seeing the city by bike was the most enjoyable part of the trip, you get to see so much! Thijs was our guide, & he was really chatty & friendly, & was even told he looked like George Clooney on the trip!

jasper wins. I got there and it was JUST me. he could have bailed or the company could have called it off, (especially because it was crazy weather knocking down over eleven massive trees from wind) but jasper soldiered on and never stopped smiling. he was willing and informative. I saw back alleyways and hidden gems of the town. I asked a ton of questions and felt like he knew a lot of neat facts about Amsterdam. bravo

What a great way to see hidden Amsterdam. My two daughter & I recently did a tour with Jasper, what a wonderfully insightful & informative tour. We saw parts of Amsterdam I'm sure an everyday tourist would walk on by, hidden gardens & churches. I totally recommend this wonderful new bike riding company if you want a small and personal tour.

A Personal and Unique Biking Tour Experience. Highly recommended. This new tour company is putting the customer experience ahead of volume of clients. My wife and I had a wonderful experience with our guide Jasper. We have spent the last 4 weeks on various tours throughout Europe and this one was a highlight.Despite being the only two that showed up we received a private tour for the regular price. A lot of companies would have just cancelled. The bicycles were very good and less identifiable than the large tour company bikes. The pace was comfortable and safety was a priority. Our tour was very personal. We stopped for a very pleasant lunch in Vondelpark where our guide took the time to get to know us and provided personal stories about himself, his family and country. The sites visited involved a number of hidden gems that we missed on our other tours. A hidden church and secret garden to name a couple.

See Amsterdam like a local.. Both Thijs and Jasper are warm, knowledgable and accommodating taking you on a tour that bypasses the usual touristy spots you'll easily enough find on your own. We toured the interesting hidden gems of Amsterdam at a cruising pace through the prettiest, quiet streets. Learnt about the unusual architecture of many buildings, as well as hidden churchs and courtyards you simply wouldn't find on your own. A great way to get acquainted with this beautiful and quirky city. Highly recommended!

Great last minute decision. This was our 4th stop on our European vacation and we were tired of walking. We booked our tour very late the night before. We got a confirmation email from Thijs the next morning and met him at Dam Square which was right by our hotel. A quick walk later and we were on our bikes enjoying Amsterdam on a beautiful day. We ended up having a private tour and Thijs was great. Great information, great recommendations (try the sandwich shop!!!), and we got quickly acclimated to the city with the tour. Definitely the way to go to blend in and ride like a local unlike the other bike tours. You must give We Bike Amsterdam a try, well worth the money!
Best tour ever!. They took me to the best places in amsterdam. A better bike tour than all the commercial ones. They know Amsterdam and have the best things to say.

That's the way to do it!. I'm not sure I can say much to add to the previous 'rave' reviews of this small tour operator (Seems odd to call it a company-as it only has 2 owner/guides!!). Having experienced a 'back of a Vespa' tour of local street food in Saigon recently It is clear that you get much more from a city with a local guide who knows and takes you to places away from the tourist 'hot spots'. Jasper was brilliant in this with a knowledge of someone who lives locally and knows the interesting sites and views to see. We were luck that another party had pulled out so we had his sole attention for the tour--just lucky! We had a wonderful relaxed few hours learning about the history, architecture and culture of Amsterdam visiting many off the beaten track buildings.--as well as learning the technique of cycling in Amsterdam--No1 rule--Don't stop--this creates chaos !This is an ideal introduction to the city--and for 25 euros per person extremely good value. If you are visiting Amsterdam make 'We Bike Amsterdam' your first port of call ! Then hire a bike for the rest of your stay---don't bother with the bus, tram and canal bus passes!

great bicycle trip in Amsterddam. we took a 2,5 hour tour with WeBike this summer. Jasper and Thijs showed us some great Amsterdam highlights, both in the old centre and in the renovated areas on the banks of "Het IJ". The guys are very friendly and knowledgeable. The half way " pick me up" on the "magere brug" kept us going till the end. thanks again for a great trip.

Great FUN!!. I traveled to Amsterdam for the first time with my 3 daughters and the best thing I did was connect with We Bike Amsterdam. We really wanted to see the city by bike....like the "locals" do and we wanted a fun and informative guide. Once we booked with Thijs, our guide, we were eager to pick a place that represented Amsterdam well. We decided on ZAANSE SCHANS an approx. 5-6 hour bike ride to authentic windmills. It was an easy and flat ride and we also took a ferry and boat to get to our destination. The town was so wonderful, right out of a storybook. And smelled like chocolate!!! We took a little tour and had a picnic lunch and took lots of pictures. What a fun day and the most amazing memory to take back.

BEST bike tour in amsterdam!!!. A bike tour with Thijs and "we bike amsterdam" is an ABSOLUTE MUST on any trip to Amsterdam. A bike tour is always a great way to see Amsterdam but if you want the BEST bike tour in Amsterdam and a really unique experience then forget the rest and pick we bike amsterdam. The tour stops by all the major sites like the anne frank museum, jordaan etc but Thijs goes one step further and shows you many of the hidden gems in the city which you just wouldnt get with the other "stack em high sell em cheap" bike tours. Price for the group tour is ?25 per person and well worth every penny. If you want something special and off the beaten track, dont think twice and book. I will be recommending this tour to all my friends.

There is no better start.......... We had a wonderfull tour with Thijs and Jasper on the second day of our trip. They know and show us so much of the real Amsterdam. Incredible. Because of the tour our other days of our stay in Amsterdam were also more interesting. You are looking in an other way and talking about other things..........A nice compliment for "We bike Amsterdam": After a nice conversation about Amsterdam with a some older man who lived his whole life in Amsterdam, he finally said : I guess you have many relatives or friends here, for you know much more than usual about the real and beautiful Amsterdam.Absolutely Value for Money !!

We biked in Amsterdam!. If you are looking for a real Amsterdam biking experience go with Thijs and Jasper! These two young, fun guys know the city by heart and took us to places which we would never have found by ourselves. During the trip they told us all about Amsterdam, the people and where to go, things you dont find in the travelguide. Small group, safe route, good bikes and happy to help any time or adjust the programme to whatever our group was interested in. I recommend this tour to anyone who likes the unexpected!

Biking Raining Drinking. Never knew that biking in the rain could be so much fun, and could be so informative. Our friendly guides (Thijs and Jasper) took us to: a secret church, hidden lanes and small Streets, buildings of great historical and architectural significance, a romantic park and many other places of interest. Not only the touristical 'hot spots', but also the less known (but not less interesting) places. We got the typical Dutch weather for free, but after a glass of real Amsterdam gin, we felt dry and very satisfied!

We Bike Amsterdam. Last June we booked a cycle trip with We Bike Amsterdam. Although I had seen quite a bit of Amsterdam allready, it proofed a very interesting tour. Cycling through Amsterdam is the best way to get to know the city and the We Bike tour brings you to parts of Amsterdam you would not find by yourself. For example we visited a so called `hidden church` De Rode Hoed and got a clear explanation of the history of the church now being used as a theatre.. As a tourist one is allways distracted by the `hotspots`, the nice and best parts of a town are diificult to find. The We Bike tour brings you to these nice areas. e.g.we loved cycling through an area called the Jordaan. As we were in a small group, we had ample opportunity to put questions and interact with our guides.Thijs and Jasper. Even though the weather turned out to be real Dutch (halfway it poored with rain!) Thijs en Jasper created a pleasant atmosphere which (together with the glass of Dutch Jenever we were offered on the `Magere bridge` over the river Amstel) made us forget about the rain.
One of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam. My family thoroughly enjoyed our bicycle tour. It was a lot of fun and a great way to see the city. I highly recommend this company.

Get te know amsterdam. Me and my familie had a great time with Thijs, our most friedly and funny leader of the trip!We got to know all this small and beautifull pleaces, we would never be able to figure out ourselfs! Thnx We Bike Amsterdam, we will be back!

The Best Bike tour I have ever been on!. Sean and Allison are very knowledgeable about Amsterdam's history and sights.We thoroughly enjoyed Sean's history of Amsterdam tour and couldn't imagine a better way to get to know the city. Allison's countryside tour was easy to do and so much fun! Their bikes are high quality and easy to use. A definite must when visiting the city.

A Must for Amsterdam. I was a little nervous about a 23km bike tour in Amsterdam. It seemed like a long way, I hadn't been on a bike in awhile, and I was worried about other riders and traffic. This ended up being my favorite activity on our trip. The pace was perfect with plenty of stops to hear about the city and culture of Amsterdam. I wasn't the least bit tired, and only for a short time were we riding amongst cars and heavy bike traffic. Amsterdam caters to bikers with plenty of bike paths to keep riders safe. The majority of the ride was off the city streets through beautiful Vondelpark and outlying areas of the city. Antoine was a great tour guide, very knowledgeable. If I have the opportunity to return to Amsterdam, I will book this tour again.

The best day in Amsterdam. It was a wonderful tour,we were the last tour of this season.The tour was very safe, great comfy bicycle. So much fun,the guide explained many interesting facts about Amsterdam.

Great day!. My wife and I took this tour yesterday. Our guide, Antoine, was articulate, enthusiastic and very safety conscious. The brief period of riding in the city was a bit stressful as I hadn't been on a bike in about 30 years. But once we reached Vondel Park I started to feel confident. I thoroughly enjoyed the variety of stops and the stories that accompanied them. This was a great way to spend 5 hours.

Amazing bike ride with Antoine! . My husband and I had an amazing time on this bike ride to the country side. The scenery was absolutely break-taking and we fell more in love with this wonderful city. He made sure everyone was safe and was very knowledgable. We really appreciated his passion for the city and being a guide. The cheese and clog tour was great too. The farmer there is quite a character and funny.We wished the bike ride was longer. The five hours we were on the tour went by so fast. Thank you Antoine for making our trip more memorable!

Great day out. We did the cheese and clogs tour. This was a really fun way to see the city sights, learn a bit of history and also see some of the countryside. Really well organised, great guide and a nice gentle pace. As long as you can ride a bike, have a go. We are a mature couple and kept up, no problem. Highly recommend

Joy full indeed. The best 5 consecutive hours we spent on our visit to Amsterdam. Antoine is a first class guide with a vast knowledge of Amsterdam and a lovely sense of humour. He was attentive, considerate and patient with each one of us. The cycling is great fun and does not require a person to be fit or young. I highly recommend it!

Fantastic Day Trip!. This was by far our best day during our week long visit to AMSTERDAM. The bike ride was leisurely, informative and just plain FUN! Book your tour during your visit and you will not be disappointed.

Had a great ride with Antoine. My wife and I spent five wonderful hours biking through the parks and farm areas of Amsterdam. Our group of 14 adults pedaled through streets and parks and more rural area surrounding the urban areas.While initially concerned about the no helmet policy, our leisurely pace dispelled all concerns.Our guide, Antoine, was fantastic. Personable, witty, and extremely knowledgeable about the history of Amsterdam are just a few of his strengths. The pace was moderate, as we had many kilometers to cover, but everyone made it fineI would definitely take another tour with Joyride Tours. Their equipment is top notch and practically new. Spacious saddle bags for storage and rain gear included!A wonderful day!!

Our Joy Ride Tour was wonderful fun!!!. We had the GREAT PLEASURE of joining in on a Joyride Tour through and around Amsterdam on a recent visit to this wonderful city in July. We had a WONDERFUL guide named Antwone. He was extremely personable and spoke English very well! Our group was a nice size - not too big, and Antwone did a GREAT job keeping "watch" over all of us to make sure we all had a safe, enjoyable, pleasant ride! He did an excellent job explaining about the history of the area and we learned a LOT and had a LOVELY afternoon! It was such a treat to leave the city behind and ride through the countryside surrounding Amsterdam and really get a feel for what life is like for people living in this area. Of course, it was also interesting to see a real windmill up close, visit a farm to hear about how cheese is made, and have the farmer show us how he makes wooden shoes! I would highly recommend this tour to anyone. You will have a very nice time and you will see and learn a LOT about this wonderful city and the area that surrounds it! It's a lovely bike ride through beautiful countryside - not too hilly or "hard" of a ride - with nice bikes -- and a terrific guide! PERFECT!!!!

Fabulous Tour and Guide -- A Must Do!. Just back from the Joy Ride Amsterdam countryside bike tour with Antoine. It was a beautiful day, a fun and informative tour, a great group, and Antoine is a terrific guide. He, and Sean and Allison, the owners, clearly enjoy what they do and it shows. It felt like being out with a group of friends. Antoine tells great stories and I learned a lot (not always the case on a tour!). He took excellent care of us and made navigating the roads on a bike easy, turning us all into pros. So glad I signed up for the tour. Everything about it was perfect. If you are traveling alone, sign up! It's for everyone.

Great way to travel in Amsterdam.. Travel the way everyone does in the city. You get to see the city, parks, and the countryside. The guides are friendly and informative. The ride is easy - my wife has arthritic knees and had no trouble. The Netherlands is so flat, I spent more time gliding and braking than pedaling. You will really enjoy this ride!
Country tour. Had a great day out with Antoine our guide who was informative, amusing and took great care about our safety. The group was the right size and all friendly people.

Awesome tour!!. Antwone our tour guide was brilliant!! Very informative about the history of the Netherland and Amsterdam!! Bikes were terrific!! You will not be disappointed with this tour. Top day out!! Thanks!!

Awesome tour!. Went to the countryside with Antoine. Very beautiful tour! Our guide was fun and kind. Gave us a lot of informations about the things we saw, but always in an entertaining way. Enjoyed that tour a lot. Would highly recommend to go there!

Great fun, quirky and entertaining. Excellent tour, fun, insightful, quirky. Was a very quick day. Got to see lots of Amsterdam that I would otherwise have never had the chance to see. I was pretty tired by the end of it but during the tour I didn't feel tired during it as Amsterdam is very flat so not hills to cycle up. Not a tour for people who like to take lots of photos unless you can do it whilst cycling as there isn't a lot of opportunity to stop to take photos. The ones I did get were good though. Luckily it stayed dry for your tour but I imagine it would be equally as fun in the rain. Recommended tour.

Fun tour, even in rain! . The day we had our tour it rained all day. The company owner offered to reimburse us if we didn't want to go. We still went and so did everyone else that signed up. They provided us with special ponchos for biking that kept us pretty dry. My feet were still soaked. Even though it rained we had a GREAT day. We loved the cheese and clog farm, and even got some of that delicious cheese to bring home. This was an amazing tour and we got to see the country side we wouldn't have seen. Worth every penny.

The true Amsterdam experience!!. The day you have your Joy Ride Tour will be the best day of your trip. We were in Amsterdam for three days before departing on a Celebrity Cruise, and we wanted to experience the Netherlands on bikes. After researching several tour companies, we decided that Joy Ride Tours was the best option with the tour covering exactly what we wanted. We chose the tour that started in the city and went through the countryside to the farm where they make cheese and clogs. Our guide, Antoine, was absolutely wonderful. He was early to the meeting place, easy to find, kept track of every guest at all times so there was never a moment when anyone was separated, and he made it all incredibly fun, low pressure and informative. He is very well educated and loves history and it shows! We stopped several times to discuss various things and he always kept it maximally interesting and just the right length. He was able to handle just about every question guests came up with. I think we booked about 3 months in advance and they were fully booked already on two of our days there - so plan ahead - this tour is well worth it! Our party ranged in height from 5'2" to 6' tall, and there were taller and shorter people within our group. Joy Ride had bikes to fit everyone. Not only that, but the bikes are also equipped with saddlebags that hold a surprising amount of items. We had two backpacks, a big camera and three larger professional lenses, and we were able to bike with nothing on our backs or tugging at our shoulders. Fantastic!! We took three bike tours while in Europe and Joy Ride was the only company that provided any adequate cargo rom on the bikes themselves.This tour was fantastic. I can't think of a single person I know who would not have enjoyed it. The company is small and independent, which gives them the flexibility to make sure every detail is cared for. They are passionate about biking in Amsterdam and it shows. Book early and enjoy!

OUTSTANDING - A Must Do. I highly recommend Joy Ride Tours and it is a must do in Amsterdam. Read the reviews - at the time of my review there are 424 5 star reviews and I am adding 425! I took the The tour is very relaxing and it was much more than a bike ride. We learned a lot of history about the Netherlands, Amsterdam, Kings/Queens, Windmills, Dutch farms, cheese, wooden shoes and so much more! Honestly I would go again! Stop thinking about it and book a tour!

Fabulous tour to the countryside!. Joy Ride does it right. We had a fabulous tour with Antoine. He was most enthusiastic and dramatic, which really added to the tour. The tour was very well organized, the bikes were well maintained and everthing was ready for us to begin our tour. Antoine even handled a flat tire in the middle of the tour with no issues. I would highly recommend this trip to anyone interested in getting out and seeing all that Amsterdam has to offer. We went through a few places that we liked well enough to go back and visit again.

A great taste of the Netherlands. The Joy Ride Tours deserve their name. We participated in their bike tour from Amsterdam into the countryside. Although the weather wasn't optimal, our guide, Antoine, brought his A game. He lavished us with historical anecdotes, murder stories and entertaining warnings. His knowledge of history, coupled with his knack for dramatic flair, made the tour thoroughly enjoyable. He gave us valuable tips about cycling in the city and was very safety-conscious.The views through the park, the city and the countryside are breathtaking. We loved the visit to the cheese-making farm. The company owners obviously take the pleasure of their guests to heart. Sturdy Riding capes were provided for the rain, solid bicycles were used, and for our exceptionally wet tour (it rained pretty much through it all), a towel and nice hot drink were offered to cheer us for our resilience. That was a very nice, generous and elegant touch.

Great City Bike Ride in Amsterdam. We loved our city bike tour with Joy Ride Tours. The bikes were in excellent condition and the guide (Antoine) was great and made the ride really fun. He had an art history/history background and a thorough knowledge of Amsterdam and its surroundings and shared that knowledge with us. While part of the ride was in the city, the majority of it was in the countryside. We loved every minute. Very few bicyclists in Amsterdam wear helmets, but we prefer to ride with a helmet and Joy Ride Tours was happy to provide them, along with a saddlebag so we could carry our stuff on the ride.

Great guide, lovely ride. Took the tour in pouring rain and our family of 4 still loved it. Joyride provided very nice ponchos and saddle bags that kept our gear dry. Our guide was upbeat and knowledgable. The ride was flat and went through many beautiful paths, woods and parks. I have average at best bike skills and did fine. There is some city riding getting to the less congested areas but they were manageable. There is a short stop where you can eat your own snacks, however, the only suggestion I have on this 4-5 hour tour is to build in an extra hour for a proper lunch stop. Even without the rain, it would have been very nice to sit for a minute and get something hot to eat.

Great Tour!. We really enjoyed the tour. We saw very different aspects of Amsterdam, and the guide (Antoine) was very knowledgable and pleasant (as well as Sean and Allison!) It is a very nice way to see a bit of the countryside while staying in Amsterdam. We would highly recommend this tour!

What a Joy Ride. My husband and I booked a bike tour that took us through Vondel Park and the outskirts of Amsterdam. We learned how Vondel Park came to be, why dogs aren't required to be on leashes, how boat-houses came about, a farmer and his land, how Gouda cheese and clogs are made, and much, much more. Antoine, our tour guide, had a wealth of knowledge, was very personable and honest, and never skipped a beat. Although they only accept no more than 14 riders per tour, ours ended up with 16 due to a booking error. However, the owners of the company were upfront about the oversight and to make up for it, they offered a free drink and Stroopwafels upon return of our tour. They also offered a return of payment to any unhappy riders. Not one person requested a refund. We think that the gesture went above and beyond expectations especially in today's world. Don't hesitate...book with this company and if you are lucky enough to get Antoine, you will surely have a 'Joy Ride'.
Website is a really helpful guide. Just planning a second trip to Amsterdam and I found the Joy Ride website really helpful for planning my excursions

5 Stars Just Ain't Fair!!!. There are some experiences where 5 stars just don't do it justice. This is one. Until today, I have never wanted to give someone more than 5 stars. This tour deserves 10+. I discovered a side of Amsterdam that I never knew existed. So much beauty that each turn took my breath away. I am sad to leave but can't wait to return. Our guide Antoine was over the top good. Incredibly knowledgeable and he kept things rolling despite a flat tire. This tour is a MUST if you ever visit Amsterdam!!!

Entertaining history lesson!. Just back from our Cheese & Clog Tour led by Antoine who made the whole trip so interesting. Top marks to him! Was a bit worried about length of tour, time just flew past as was broken up with stops & such interesting facts about the Netherlands. Only negative observation was the toilet facilities at the cheese/clog farm. Another entertaining host, just disappointing and surprising for the volume of visitors they must get. Otherwise would have been full marks!

Excellent tour. Sean and Allison always answers my email and questions promptly prior to our tour day. They stores our luggage for us while we were on tour. My father-in-law was unable to join us and Sean gave him lots of information and directions as to where to spend a few hours in the city. The bike was in excellent condition. There were stops for photos and informative information along the way. It was one of our most memorable and fun thing to do during our Europe trip. Great for family. Both of our teenage kids enjoy the ride as much as we did.

Great tour with a friendly and entertaining guide:). Had a lovely tour with Antoine! He was very professional, informative, considerate and fun guide! Antoine took great care of our group! Would recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam!

great guide and tour. Highly recommend it, guide very knowledgeable about history and also very attentive to our safety, had a wonderful tour through part of city and then country with a real sense of how life is here; they give you rain gears and helmets upon request; bikes have purses where you can stuff sweathers or waterbottles in, some shopping can be done at the cheese factory and clog factory. Biking is very easy as the majority is done outside town where there is no traffic.

Fantastic trip with fantastic and funny guide. I would like to start by saying I don't like riding bikes. I own one, and can ride one, but am much happier running or walking. Despite that I had a wonderful time! The bikes are maintained really well, and are surprisingly comfy for a four hour bike ride. The tour my fiancé and I did was the Windmill, Cheese and Clogs, but it was so much more. Our tour guide (I want to say Alison?) was such good fun, and was full of little anecdotes about the region, as well as the typical historical bits. We both had a fantastic time! The tour guides also gave out a restaurant guide and a map with things to see and do in Amsterdam. Well worth the money, a great day out! Also worth mentioning the ponchos they provide are specifiacly designed for bike riding, so if anyone is considering taking a coat, it is not needed

A Perfect Day. We decided to take a biking tour on our second day in Amsterdam. I am so glad we chose Joy Ride Tours. We learned about many historical buildings in and around Amsterdam and in the countryside. The farmhouse we visited was lovely, the shoe maker is quite a character and the cheese delicious. The weather started out warm and sunny, but towards the end of our trip the rain started. Rain coats were provided, very much appreciated. I highly recommend Joy Ride Tours!

Worth the time and money!. My 13 year old daughter and I decided to try a bike tour while visiting Amsterdam. She was nervous about it, but we both ended up having a fabulous time. Our guide, Sean, was super friendly and very informative. He was so relaxed about riding through town that it helped my daughter relax as well. Even with a little rain on the way back into the city, this bike tour was one of the highlights of our trip.

Awesome Countryside Tour!. Recently went on the 'Windmill, Cheese & Clogs Tour in the Dutch Countryside' tour. It was pretty fantastic and the people were very cool. The guide was great, Sean. He's lived all over the world and really knew his stuff. We learned a great deal and his ways of relating historical facts and concepts was quite excellent. We cycled through some really beautiful parks and along various canals on our way outside the city. The countryside quickly opened up and we were in a beautiful rural setting with fields and low dikes and polders and such. Really quite picturesque. We stopped at a working dairy, cheese-making and clog-making place (1 of only 3 places in the Netherlands that still makes clogs by hand). They had very nice painted clogs; very traditional. But, the ones that really caught my eye were hand-carved wedding clogs. Really beautiful. We were able to taste their cheeses: young, garlic, aged, and smoke. All Gouda. All delic. And, even though it was torrential down-pouring just 25 miles south of us, we weren't rained on for the entire tour.Fantastic tour. Great bikes, and super comfortable seats. Excellent tour company, and such incredibly reasonable prices!

Perfect Daytrip - Rain or Shine. Tour is as advertised. The bikes are in great shape and the rain gear provided is a big help in the typical Amsterdam weather. A great way to see a bit of the Amsterdam countryside and learn about the region.

A favorite day of all time!. A friend had recommended this company to me for my trip to Amsterdam. I was a woman on my own and this was a perfect half-day adventure! One of the owners, Allison, was our guide that day. I was glad I'd made a reservation online - not only did I save 3 euros but a couple that were walk-ups were unable to join us because the tour was full. You meet on foot at the I Amsterdam sign in Museumplein - at the head of the reflecting pool, just behind the Rijksmuseum. It is also close to a public toilet (50 cents) that is very modern and cool, BTW - at the Cobra Cafe (I think they open at 10am). There are also a few "snack huts" close by where you can buy a snack for the approximately four-hour ride (while cheese tasting was included on the Country Bike Tour, I was still glad I'd brought a bag of trail mix; there are several stops where you can eat your snack). Be sure to bring water too - you can fill up your bottle at the farm. After everyone was there, our guide walked us to their shop, located near the Hard Rock Cafe (about 1/4 mile), all the while telling us about the city and some stories about the locations we were passing. At the shop, we all got a bike, checked the seat height, and loaded up our saddle bags with essentials only. The shop will keep your bigger backpack if you don't want to wear it on the tour. Request a helmet or "short bike" if you need to ahead of time with the company. No one wore helmets on my tour. The terrain is so flat and the tires are good and sturdy - plus you pass very few cars (except for crossing a few intersections exiting and re-entering Amsterdam proper), mostly other bikers and walkers. The tour itself was so enjoyable - and I am not, by any means, a regular bike rider. It was easy and we didn't go very fast. It had been many months since I'd been on a bike and there were some people on the tour that hadn't ridden for years. Our group was a good mix of people from several countries, in their early 20s to 60s-70s, couples, singles, friends, etc. The bikes are the highest quality town-style bikes; very comfortable seats and very easy to change gears. There are several stops, such as at the Vondelpark, a houseboat "neighborhood", a cheese and clog farm, a windmill, and sometimes a few other stops along the way. I felt safe and very relaxed; it was great to get out of the city for the afternoon. Bring sunscreen and a hat if it's sunny out but know that much of the paths we followed are partially shaded by the beautiful trees. The air is so fresh and sweet, and the countryside is so close to the city. I believe our tour was a round trip of 23 kilometers that day (about 14 miles). After a shower I was ready to go to dinner that night - not too tired and full of enthusiasm from a wonderful adventure! I would absolutely recommend this to anyone comfortable riding a bike and being outside for four hours. It is a beautiful way to see the city and beyond and learn about the history and culture of Amsterdam and Holland.

Top 'To Do' in Amsterdam!. Start your perfect trip to Amsterdam with this great bike tour! Sean was our guide that day, he was a fabulous guide, full of knowledge, fun and entertaining. The ride itself was easy, anyone can do it and great bikes too! Put this tour at the top of your Amsterdam plans!

An amazing tour through dutch countryside!. I and my husband had an awesome ride last Saturday with Joy Ride Tours! The first thing that I have to mention: the bikes that Joy Ride provides to you are very comfortable and works fine without any problems. The trip planned wisely so it is quite hasteless and I even haven't noticed that we traveled about 20 kilometers, we had about 5 stops while this trip. We have seen all main dutch things on this trip: houseboats, windmill, cheese farm and clogs making process, and also riding a bicycle is a very dutch way to move around :) So, I would say that if you want to get familiar with Holland in one day this trip will suits you well :)

Great way to see Amsterdam. Highly recommended. The riding isn't hard or strenuous and it's a great way to see a different side of Amsterdam. The Cheese and Clog farm was very interesting and the owner was quite a character who knew multiple languages and was very passionate about what he does.

Outstanding Tour. This is an outstanding tour of more countrified areas near Amsterdam. Quite a contrast to central Amsterdam. The cycling is easy and relaxed on very good bikes which are well maintained. What makes the tour special is the guide, Allison. She is very knowledgeable and very personable. Definitely a worthwhile experience while in Amsterdam.

Highlight of our Amsterdam holiday. We both thoroughly enjoyed this tour. The weather was a bit cold but myself and another couple of riders were given an extra jacket to wear. We didn't want to ride in the centre of Amsterdam but wanted to see what was further afield. The tour was an easy ride - the bikes were good and Alison, the guide was friendly and had lots of information to tell us about where we were. The cheese and clog farm was interesting but it was great just cycling along the paths next to the fields etc. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Amsterdam

Great way to see the country side.. My wife and I took the countryside tour. I wasn't overly confident getting on a bike after seeing how busy Amsterdam was. Any reservations I had were eased as soon as we started. Felt safe and it was a nice pace. Our guide was great. Very knowledgeable and personable.

A must-do if you're visiting Amsterdam!. My husband and I LOVED the Windmill, Cheese & Clog tour.
