We're seasoned travelers and have taken bicycle trips in the south of France and Tokyo's coast, and this was one of the best ever. I signed up for it because I wanted to get a different feel for the city than navigating the crowded streets of Amsterdam on foot. We were not disappointed. Allison was a terrific tour guide, leading 14 of us around and keeping us all together, while stopping at various points of interest to explain the history of Amsterdam through its parks, locks, rivers, windmills and very thoughtfully taking photos of each of us. I would highly recommend this -- even if you only have three days in Amsterdam, do this on one of them!

Don't hesitate, do it!. The Windmill, Cheese & Clog tour was brilliant. It was pouring with rain and freezing cold but it was still our favourite experience in Amsterdam. It was so nice to get out of the city and explore the forest and fields. The guide was very informative and had lovely stories about the Dutch to share with us.Couple of tips, if it is going to rain on the day you booked in absolutely still go! You are given a poncho and a satchel on the side of the bike. Take with you a beanie, GLOVES and probably a spare set of socks (in a plastic bag). I wore runners that got soaked so if you have boots or other "wet weather" footwear wear those. Can not recommend this tour enough, just do it!

Bike Tour 4/21. We really enjoyed our Bike Tour. It was a highlight of our trip! Biking is an excellent way to connect with Amsterdam. Quite a range of experiences from in town , to quite suburbs to the surrounding countryside - that is closer than you think to the urban center of Amsterdam. Thanks for everything!

Amazing way to see out of the way places in Amsterdam. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip! The bikes are great and comfortable to ride. It was windy and chilly so hats and gloves are definitely a must! It's paced just right for all ages and levels of fitness and Allison was very knowledgeable and fun. We got to see places and learn things you can't do from a car or bus. The cheese farm was a plus as were the fun photo ops Allison suggested. All in all, a great day and something everyone should do!

So Much Fun!. This is a "must do" while in Amsterdam! Alison was very friendly and knowledgeable about the town and surrounding areas, and even gave us a recommended restaurant list at the end of the tour, which led us to even more great experiences. We took the Cheese and Clogs tour, which gave us the opportunity to see some of the surrounding house boat communities and countryside around Amsterdam, as well as a 700 year old working cheese farm with the most interesting farmer I've ever met. Great value for the money!

Best cycle in Amsterdam. The country tour which takes in a cycle around the country side, a working cheese farm and clog making family! Run by a couple who are long time residents of amsterdam and we'll travelled themselves. About 20 kms. And aroind 5 hours. Great and add this to you must see list of things to do. Great for families or those travelling alone.

Wonderful experience . Allison was the most personable, charismatic tour guide I have ever had! It rained off and on during our small group bike ride, but we still had a fantastic time! It was great exercise, vastly interesting, and super fun! I recommend this activity for all visitors who want to explore the city and bike like a local :)

Brilliant day!. My friend and I booked this tour and we were not disappointed! Alison was a wonderful guide, she was funny and appealed to every member on the tour (there was quite a large age range!) She was informative and provided us with interesting information as well as a good laugh. We visited a windmill and cheese and clog factory, which was a fabulous insight into traditional Dutch life! I would highly recommend this tour for any age! Thanks for making our day so fantastic!

Good even n the rain!. Sean & Allison provided great bikes and an awesome tour. Allison was our tour guide, on the second ride off the season, and provided us a wealth of historical information during the 23k ride through the country side. The ride included several breaks and a couple of photo opportunities. The tour was just as described and a lot more. I highly recommend this tour.

Most excellent experience . What a fun way to spend a day in Amsterdam. Allison and Sean are wonderful ex-pat hosts who want to share their love of their adopted city while guiding you on two wheels through the bicycle dense streets of Amsterdam and out into the countryside. Allison gives you the history and Sean ensures the bikes are safe and fitted to you. The ride took five hours of easy pedaling. My wife and I enjoyed every minute. We recommend these ebullient people who will make your trip to Amsterdam special.

bike not hike. if you rent a bike ,make sure you know some rules as well in the traffic .bud with nice weather you go outside the city ,take some drinks as well,and look for other places arround AMSTERDAM as well.like we have VOLENDAM ,MARKEN and ZAANSE SCHANS.you can make a day tour by yourself.the best is to rent a gear bike ,it is better if you have to go up.good luck you all.

A Highlight of our Vacation!. My partner and I met Allison and opted to do a ride just outside the city. Allison was extremely friendly, personable and knowledgeable! She answered all our questions and took us to areas that helped us learn more about the Netherlands outside of Amsterdam. We visited a farm that made and sold cheese and clogs. She was very flexible and generous with her time. Allison was helpful with restaurant ideas and how best to get to the airport. I highly recommend!

Don't Hesitate!. Don't hesitate to book the windmill, clogs and cheese countryside tour! Allison was friendly and very knowledgeable. In addition to the windmill and Rembrandt Hoeve (farm that makes cheese and clogs), we stopped at locks, where Allison explained how the water is managed; and the Olympic Stadium area and the polders (again, a great explanation of the farmland). The pace was easy (in fact, a bit slow, but I'm sure that depends on the group). The bikes were in excellent shape, and Allison and her husband could adjust the height of the handlebars or seats to fit you perfectly. The saddlebags are spacious enough for all the cheese and clogs you might buy! It is challenging riding through the city intersections, but that is a very small part of the time; mostly, you are on flat, country roads without much traffic. The tour lasted about 5 hours, including walking to the bikes from the meeting place and getting fitted properly.

joyride took me where i needed to go without question. Ryan is the best driver, he takes us where we need to go and plays blink 182. Ryan helped our adventure at night and made sure to guide us in the correct direction. he made it clear our well being was at the top of his priority list. Thank you and Dean the passenger for us.

Great way to see Amsterdam and surrounding area- plus great food. I took a private tour about a year ago, and it is one of my fondest vacations memories so I am finally writing a review. The best part was that Allison personalized the tour for me, taking into account my love of history and food. We started with the Country Tour, with time for tasting delicious cheese and to watch the clog-making, and lots of time in the countryside to see a windmill and ride through, and learn about, the polders, which are fascinating. The tour included peaceful moments riding through the forest and we ended up back in Amsterdam to explore the food stalls at the outdoor market. The terrain is flat and the riding is easy. Because I took the tour at the beginning of November, it was helpful to wear layers to accommodate the temperature changes during the ride. Allison has great sense of humor and offers wonderful local "insider" tips for exploring Amsterdam.

Informative, best tour we did in Amsterdam.. Four of us did the ride in June 2015, with light rain they gave us the option to reschedule for the next day. We chose to ride that day and the weather did clear up a bit. Easy ride, combo of city, park and rural, very safe moderate pace. Alison is a knowledgeable, warm and friendly tour guide.

Ride in the rain and still so much fun. We had the wettest bike ride of our lives but we were in Amsterdam! Would not have missed it and enjoyed the sights as well as the history we learned....Bikes were well maintained, route well thought out and stops were informative and entertaining.

Cycling heaven. Biking where the land is constantly flat is sheer bliss. We had a great day out of the city on the Windmill, Cheese and Clogs tour. The bikes provided were in good condition and easy to handle and had fairly large side saddles where you could stash your water bottle, jacket/sweater and if need be, a sandwich lunch for the day. Allison was constantly ensuring that the group was safe and her chatter/descriptions were quite humorous. It wasn't a difficult ride at all and there is no need to be super fit for this. Also, although there was no lunch break, my husband and I made do with a banana each which was just right when there was a break at the farm. If at all there was a downside, it was that the clog demonstration part was cursory and could have been done without. All in, however, it was extremely enjoyable!

What a wonderful way to spend the day!. We had a five hour private tour with Sean out into the countryside. The bikes were so comfortable and easy to ride that I could have ridden all day long and into the next. We were lucky to have a nice sunny day and the parks and polders couldn't have been more lovely. We had a nice easy pace for the ride interspersed with lots of great historical and interesting Netherlands information. I personally enjoyed riding through the Vondelpark, the Amsterdam forest and out into the polders. There was a small amount of riding through town to get around but Sean was always watching to make sure everyone was okay and comfortable. I would definitely do this again and would recommend it to anyone staying in Amsterdam for a few days! Thanks for a great day!

The only Bike Tour to do in Amsterdam. Sean led off our group on a very wet day out into the countryside for our Cheese, Clogs & Windmills Tour. It was 5* quality & the knowledge imparted to the group was immense. You wouldn't find it on the internet or in a library. A really lovely guy and highly professional. We were supplied with top quality ponchos and hot towels afterwards to dry off the excess rain (that is normal in Amsterdam by the way). The farm is wonderful and gives a real insight into how Gouda cheese has become a world famous product. I cannot recommend this tour highly enough and I enjoyed every single moment of it & so will you :-)

The Tour That Stares At Cows:). To say that it was a great tour is an understatement. We took a tour in Rome that ended at a working farm with sheep and a cheesemaking factory....I properly named it the "Tour that stares at Sheep!"...hence my title for this tour and as you can guess we end up at a fabulous working farm with cows. Complete with eccentric cheese producing, clog making farmer!....fantastic way to end the day. Our tour was informative and took us along a beautiful park/city route, more park than city so very quiet and very lovely. Our tour guide Allison was amazing...."no man left behind!" Aside from her wonderful demeanor, she was very knowledgeable and full of fun facts. The ride was wonderful, the route was magnificent, the bikes were stellar! As soon as we got there we were individually fitted for each bike along with a saddle bag for our personals and fully equiped with rain cape if we needed one.We've toured many countries and many cities with bikes and this without doubt ranks up there with a most enjoyable day. Well worth it!Thank you "Joy Ride Tours" :)Ed and GretaGeorgetown, Ontario

Biking for the non natives. We chose the private day trip outside of Amsterdam for our family of five. Our guide helped us navigate the busy streets then through the park out into the surrounding country. Loved stopping by the lock to see how it operates, learning about the houseboats, and stopping for cheese at a farm with cows just out the back door. Our guide was lively, and had so much to share about Dutch culture. Take this trip!

Excellent Tour!. What a fantastic way to get out of the city and see the area surronding Amsterdam. I am the "anti-tour" person normally but the reviews were so good for this company so I gave it a try. So happy I did. Allison is great and provided the perfect balance of information vs letting you sit back and enJOY the ride. A few people had a bit of trouble on their bikes (which was really strange because it is a dead easy ride) but I think it was because they were either taking selfies, not paying attention or hungover from the night before! Highly recommend the Windmills, Cheese and Clogs tour!

Great Ride. A fun and authentic cycle out of Amsterdam. Led by our knowledgeable and very enthusiastic local guide, Alison, nothing was too much trouble for her, and she happily adjusted the pace to suit the group. The bikes were super comfy and we even got to buy some cheese along the way! Very glad I chose this tour.

Such a relaxing ride!. Took this tour with Allison in the first week of August - we had amazing weather on the day. I emailed ahead to request a shorter bike (I'm 5'3) and they responded very quickly and had one ready for me on the day. The bike was great, I wanted to steal it and take it home with me. Very comfortable for a 4 hour ride! It was great to get out of the city and explore some of the outskirts of Amsterdam, and much less stressful than navigating through the city! Saw some beautiful parts of the countryside, and the farm was also fun to visit. I really enjoyed the Windmill, we got some great pictures and Gelato along the way! Allison responded well to questions from the group and you can tell she has a great love for the city and loads of knowledge. Really glad we chose this tour, and thought it was great value for money! Would highly recommend to anyone who feels comfortable on a bike!

Fantastic Tour!. We did the windmills, Cheese and Clogs tour earlier today with Joy Ride Tours. It was fantastic! We booked this tour because it went outside the city and has smaller group sizes. We were definitely not disappointed. Our guide was very knowledgeable, and adjusted the discussion topics based on the interests and background of the participants. The bikes themselves were quite new, well maintained and very easy to use. All in all, it was a great way to spend the day.

Best memory of our trip. This was amazing. In minutes we were outside the city in the countryside in incredible beauty. Alison the owner/guide was fun, supper informative, enthusiastic, and a joyful spirit. My daughter and I had a great time. Easy for non-bikers too! Stopped off at anthemic cheese farm ad that was fun too! Great times!

bike with a knowledgeable local. We went with the owner on the country tour and stopped several times to listen to interesting facts about the area. We chose this tour over the others based on the reviews and were glad we did.

Pretend you live there, if just for these few hours!!!!. I booked because of the previous reviews, the small group size and the country tour because it was away from Amsterdam's crazy traffic for most of the way. I loved it because: The equipment is fabulous, great newer bikes, rain ponchos worked very well. No sore butt from the bike seat at all. Went to places you would never find on your own, heard history told in a great way, you can tell they love the place!Just the right mix of riding, stopping for little chats on the area/history, and photo ops!And for a few hours, I forgot that I was a tourist and pretended that I was just out for a ride in my neighbourhood! My face was sore from smiling!!! Just thinking how many people visit this beautiful city and miss riding a bike here makes me sad for them. You just need to know how to ride a bike, not well, not fast. Book it and if you are unsure, practice a bit before your trip. Thanks you Joy!!!!

A real treat not to be missed. The locals in Amsterdam are the city's greatest asset. They are some of the most relaxed, kind and patient people you could ever wish to meet. However, give one a bike and a fang-framed snarl emerges amidst expeditious follicular activity and they blitz the streets with the sole intent of auditioning for the next remake of "rollerball". It was with this image in my mind that, much against my better judgement and having ensured my next of kin was fully briefed, I booked the country tour with Joy Ride. Alison, who, I am happy to report, lacked any dental exaggeration or facial hair, was a vivacious and capable tour guide, although I was unreasonably perturbed by the revelation that her name wasn't "Joy". She bounced her informative, witty banter off our group for the first half-hour with little reaction but her resilience (probably born of her, mercifully subdued, American heritage) eventually won the day and everybody warmed to her natural exuberance and passion for her home city. Our trusty aluminium steeds boasted seven gears, good sized pannier storage and the world's most comfortable saddle... seriously, I photographed it so I could buy one for my own bike. All the cycles were relatively new; a benefit emphasised as we parked alongside another, less fortunate, tour group at least two members of which were animatedly expressing their discontent over some aspect of velocipede maintenance. The tour itself was purposeful but leisurely with rest stops at points of interest including a cheese farm, a windmill and, most poignantly an amazing ice-cream stall. Interestingly the itinerary effectively described Dutch life beyond the aberration of Amsterdam; canals, dykes, windmills, houseboats and a conservative (and apparently unforgiving) people still mad at the Germans for stealing their bicycles seventy years ago. This is a unique and fascinating experience which pairs the history and culture of the Netherlands with a mode of transportation ingrained into its heart. Joy Ride Tours appears to be the “Rolls-Royce” of a plethora of options, and at something around 6 Euros an hour why wouldn’t you do it?
Excellent. Gracious owners and just nice people. Well worth it. On time, easy to find right near the Rijks, nice bikes.

Countryside Tour: Cheese, Clogs and Windmills. I can't ride a bike. Well I can, I just tend to wobble a bit and sporadically fall in hedges due to lack of concentration. When my better half booked this I wanted to cry, especially after seeing the sheer chaos and quantity of bikes in Amsterdam that fly past each other mere centimetres apart. Dreading the worst I went along and it was the best thing I did during my weekend in Amsterdam and I cannot recommend this tour highly enough. Shaun takes you from The Museumplein through Vondelpark to the surrounding countryside, seeing a wealth of canals, dykes, houseboats and windmills along the way. You stop at a working cheese farm and clog factory where you can feast on delicious Amsterdam cheese for lunch. You take several stops where Shaun will tell you of the history of Amsterdam in such detail and enthusiasm that you cannot go away without having learnt something.The bikes are great quality and so comfortable to ride. It's completely flat and you need no prior fitness to enjoy the tour. As you're cycling in the countryside, it's not busy at all and even as a 'nervous cyclist' I found it easy, relaxing and enjoyable. Words that I would never have associated with the use of a bike before!Shaun does tours in the centre of Amsterdam, but we chose the countryside tour as it gives you a chance to see a bit of the Netherlands beyond the city.
Enjoyable experience!. The owner/operator took us on a bike tour and he is very knowledgeable about everything Amsterdam and Netherlands. I highly recommend!

The Best. Sean was a whiz of a guide, providing great information and taking care of everyone. The tour starts in Amsterdam but shortly meanders into the country. It is not a rushed ride so you will be able to savour the experience. Absolutely loved it.

Do not miss this.... This is one of the best things I have done during my travels. Shaun showed us a mixture of city, country, art, lifestyle and gave us information about culture, history, religion and politics all in a fun and lighthearted way. It was well organised and the cycling was very easy and relaxed. PLEASE do your self a favour and take this tour. If we ever come back to this beautiful city we will certainly do this again. You certainly get your monies worth and some.

Great bicycle tour out of the city. Sean led a very good bicycle tour into the countryside. His informative stops were interesting. The route was very picturesque. My only criticism is not Sean's fault -- the farmer who ran the cheese and clog farm was more than a bit odd. Sean says he has good and bad days and we appear to have caught him on a bad day. However, the rest of the trip was highly enjoyable and I recommend it.

Countryside tour gets you out of the busy city. This 4.5 hour bike tour led by co-owner Sean Cody, at 30 Euros, is a deal too good to pass up. The 7-speed bicycles are in excellent condition and have a saddle bag. Enthusiastic Sean has a wealth of knowledge about the history, people, and culture of Amsterdam, and can recommend restaurants and things to do after the tour. With a chance of rain, he even offered full refunds to anyone who wanted to back out, but all 15 group members rode on (It sprinkled our last 5 minutes). From the starting point in the usy city we crossed the street into Vondelpark, passed through quiet neighborhoods, and rode along canals and poulders. It was a leisurely and enjoyable ride and Sean stopped along the way to give insightful talks. We visited a farm that makes cheese and wooden shoes, stopped at a windmill, saw row boat races in the Amstel, and viewed wildlife, including cranes and herons. This was one of the top highlights of our European trip. Be sure to reserve in advance. The Hollanders do not wear helmets, but you can reserve one in advance.

Out of the city!. This tour gives depth to visiting Amsterdam. Sean took us out through the parks, residential areas, by canal boat residences and into the farmlands. Along side of all these sights was a commentary involving the culture and history of the country. The city is great for the museums and the eats but this was a tour that talked about the people and the country of the Netherlands. Talk about getting your money's worth! I won't forget it!The bikes were very comfortable, but yes you must be an able rider to enjoy and be safe.

Our best day in Amsterdam. We had the most wonderful experience on our countryside bike ride with Sean. He gave us so much information in a very approachable manner. We loved his wide breadth of knowledge of subjects ranging from history to politics to Amsterdam's social structure. He took us through lovely parks, by canals and through farm land. We visited a farmer who made cheese and was one of the last wooden shoe makers in Holland. We also got our windmill photo op! One of the nicest aspects was the personal attention and small group size. This was truly one of the most memorable days of our 3 week journey.

MUST DO!. What an experience. You see so much on this tour and it's worth every penny. The bike ride is pretty easy and you see so much. You start going through Vondelpark and then stop by houseboats, you then head over to the countryside where you visit a Cheese and Clog Factory. By far one of my favorite stops of my Amsterdam vacation. You get to sample cheese and also they will engrave your name on a pair of clogs for free! You also stop by a beautiful Windmill. The guide Sean is ridiculously smart about travel, not only in Amsterdam but about the world. I enjoyed just riding bikes near him and talking about the world and places he's visited. My husband and I LOVED this tour.

Worth It!!. Awesome tour in Amsterdam! Do this tour as one of the first things you do in Amsterdam. Allot of fun and some great information during the ride. You get some city riding but mostly country riding which is great. The ride is not hard at all and our group had no problems even during the heat wave.  Bikes and owner/guide are better that other bike tours I have been on in other cities.

Great time! . This bike tour was awesome! I did the country side tour. We did get some rain in the beginning but they provided great rain coats to put on top of our own rain coats since it was a little chilly. It was very informative and it was nice to go outside of Amsterdam central and see the other part. Highly recommend this tour!

Honesty and Integrity. We were supposed to have a bike tour with Joy Ride on the 8th of June. Unfortunately our flight leaving the US had mechanical problems so we were delayed 24 hours and were not able to take our tour. As soon as we found out our flight was delayed I immediately wrote to Joy Ride. Without hesitation they refunded me in full. We will absolutely book another tour with them when we return to Amsterdam someday.

Would Give It Six Stars If I Could. Our experience with Joy Ride will stand as one of the best experience of our six-week trip through Northern Europe. We joined Shawn, the owner and guide, for a 5-hour ride through Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside. The weather was typical for Amsterdam – sunny one moment, then rain a few minutes later. But it didn’t matter. He provided rain ponchos and a professional sense of when and where to stop. Shawn has a showman’s flair, a historian’s knowledge, and a true joy in what he does and where he lives. The bikes are fun to ride, and extremely comfortable. There’s no need to describe the actual trip. Just believe me that it was one of true joy and of long memory. I cannot give it higher praise. Just do it.

Bike tour with substance. . Dispite the expected rain we had a great ride with Shawn and fellow travellers. We were able to ride safely with confidence. We saw beautiful parts of Amsterdam, locks, wildlife, boat houses, expensive suburbia, cheese and dams. We continue recommend this tour highly enough. Get your place booked !
=-). The best thing to do to get around in Amsterdam, traffic is designed for bikes and ppl really respect it.

Awesome bike ride filled with learning moments. We had booked the Countryside Tour to help us to get oriented in the city and to enjoy a bike ride in Holland's countryside. What we didn't expect to get was a guide that educated us on the city's history in such an engaging manner. Our guide Sean is a world travelling teacher who wants to share his knowledge and experience with his guests. If you want to learn as much as see then do yourself a favour and book this tour!

Fun Cycle Tour. My wife and I did this tour which is an excellent way to see Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside. The cycles are in top condition and are very comfortable, mine had a large pannier to carry lunch/coats etc. Our Guide Alison was great, chatting, taking photos and making sure we all had a great time. Tour of farm that makes cheese and clogs was also very interesting, with a good shop to buy goods from. The tour is also fairly flat so it is not too strenuous, covering around 14 miles over nearly 5 hours.

Must Do!. We took the bike tour into the countryside which was amazing. It was about 4 hours and our guide was so incredibly interesting and knowledgeable. A fun stop at a dairy farm for cheese samples and a lesson on how clogs are made.

Great Day!. What a great bicycle tour! We went on several throughout our stay in Scandinavia but this was by far the best! Allison was fantastic -- she knows her adopted home very well -- and guided us safely through the city and out into the countryside and to the clog and cheese maker. She was funny and accommodating and loves to take pictures of her riders! It was a 4+ hour ride, but very leisurely and flat for the most part - I have a semi-bad leg and did it easily. Totally professional outfit, well run, and super comfortable bicycles -- I found them so comfortable that I have now purchased one and am the proud owner of my Orange Pear Townie Electra! Thanks so much for a great day!

Beyond Expectations . Sean, the tour guide, is a legend! He knows so much about Amsterdam & Netherlands you will be left wanting to know more. He is always available to answer questions and his first priority is that you enjoy your tour and get the most out of it. A truly enjoyable and informative experience. I would highly recommend this to anybody. If you go to Amsterdam DO THIS TOUR! You won't regret it :D

FANTASTIC!!. My husband and I have just returned from a 4 night stay in Amsterdam. Our whole trip was great but this cycle tour was definitely the highlight of our stay. ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!! We were met promptly at the meeting point on Thursday morning at 10.15a.m. by Sean our guide who was so friendly and immediately put me at ease. He took us to collect our bikes and we met the other couple who were also on our tour. The bikes are fabulous. So very comfortable and easy to ride. I wish I could have brought mine home with me!!! Great saddle bag on the side where I could put my hat and gloves, my bag with my camera in and snacks. The 4 of us set off with Sean who took us past canals, windmills and into the countryside. We stopped at certain points and Sean told us so much history about Amsterdam. He was absolutely great. We stopped at a cheese and clog farm which was so interesting. Well worth a visit! I would recommend this bike tour to everyone, young or old, it was just AMAZING. Sean and his wife obviously work very hard and they deserve 10 stars for what they do. If you are going to Amsterdam you must do this tour, it is absolutely BRILLIANT, I will certainly be recommending Joy Ride Tours to all my family and friends and we will certainly be doing another tour when we return to Amsterdam next year. Thankyou Sean, you were fantastic.

Great Amsterdam experience. This is a great way to see Amsterdam and explore a bit of the country side. Sean is a fantastic guide and extremely knowledgeable about the city. We absolutely enjoyed the tour and the thorough education of Amsterdam.Make sure to bring water, lunch, and layers.

Fabulous Way to Experience the Amsterdam Countryside!. This is the first time I have done a bicycle tour anywhere and this experience touring with Allison, co-owner, with her husband Sean, has set an experience that I don't believe can be surpassed. It is as described by the other reviews. I think it is important that you are comfortable on a bike as the "busy-ness" of biking in Amsterdam can be intimidating. Allison did a great job of ensuring everyone's safety getting our group of 14 riders in and out of the city. I was so surprised to be in the Dutch countryside within 20 miles minutes. Once in the countryside it was like drinking a fine wine, relaxing and oh so enjoyable. I learned so much from Allison about Amsterdam's history and culture. She's an American who has fully embraced this beautiful country. It is very well priced for what you get. It was absolutely at the top of our highlights. And, if you're worried about the length, don't worry. It's a leisurely pace with frequent stops over 4+ hours. Do bring your own water and lunch, both of which can be easily obtained from food vendors on the Museumplein grounds. There is one bathroom stop at the cheese farm. And do check out the "award-winning" bathrooms nearby the meeting point. They are one-of-a kind and great! Thanks Allison and Sean for creating such a great touring experience. Laissez les bon temp roulez Allison! :)

What a joy!. A great way to experience Amsterdam - would highly recommend this tour as a way to see the countryside and enjoy some great cheese! Alison and Shaun run a professional business - the bikes are well looked after and easy to ride. Alison was a supberb bike leader, friendly and knowledgeable.We loved hearing stories about Amsterdam d her restaurant recommendations were the best! If you come to Amsterdam you have to have a joyride!

Great time!. We had a great time riding around Amsterdam and into the country side with Joy Ride Tours. The wait at the cheese clog place is a bit longer than it needs to be, but otherwise, it was a great time!

From excellent to average. Our guide is very knowledgable about all things Netherlands. The bicycles given were very comfortable. We rode the bicycles for over 4 hours effortlessly.The start of the tour was very enjoyable until our group were dragged down by the other 4 riders. We kept on stopping every few minutes just to wait for them to take pictures. The guide kept on saying that this is the great thing about the tour because nobody is rushing for anything, but apparently we can see that he's trying to keep up with the time. I was expecting him to be more outspoken to those 4 riders as they dragged the other 11 riders too much.I've been clarified by the manager that the guide we got was new and it's the first tour that he's leading alone. As they are offering money back guarantee, Joy Ride Tour has refunded our money back in full instantly. I believe they are taking customers feedback seriously and this matter won't happen again for their new guides.

Excellent!! Fantastic way to learn about Amsterdam!. We booked a bike tour in advance for our first morning in Amsterdam. We were lucky as our group was only made up of 6 people. Simon was excellent. His knowledge of Amsterdam and the Netherlands was second to none. The bikes were all equipped and comfortable, considering we rode for 4 hours I didn't feel it afterwards at all! He recommended restaurants, bars and areas to visit. We saw someAmazing sites, and the weather was great (although this can't be controlled it made the tour all the better for us!) I would definitely recommend tour for people arriving in Amsterdam! A fun way to learn more! Money well spent :)

One of the highlights of our trip. We went on the country ride out to the cheese and clog farm. I can't say enough about how nice Alison was and so full of great information not only on the tour, but on what to do after it. She couldn't have been more helpful. The bikes were in great shape, but had a different center of gravity that took me a few minutes to adjust to. I was honestly intimidated by biking in Amsterdam because of the sheer volume of bikes on the road, but Alison chose a great route that helped us navigate Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside as easily as possible. The length of the trip was not an issue as she kept a good pace and it was all flat. We stopped along the way so she could share information and we could take pictures. She was awesome at providing great Kodak moments! There are a lot of biking tours in Amsterdam, but I can't imagine there are any better. I would highly recommend this tour and tour company.
Suitable for everyone. Everyone should do this. Alison our guide was a wealth of information She kept a great pace totally safe. A fantastic way to see Amsterdam and it's suburbs

Great ride in the countryside!. We had a great windmill, cheese and clogs tour with Allison and Simon! It was nice to get out of the city and see some of the countryside and Allison and Simon provided great info about what we were seeing along the way. The ride was ~20km, but the bikes were great and the terrain was totally flat, so it didn't seem like it was that long. Absolutely recommend for anyone who wants to get out of the city and see more of Holland.

An amazing ride. We took a private tour with Alison, that took us from the busy streets of amsterdam out to an active dairy farm. She is extremely knowledgable about the history of the city (and the country), and was able to answer any question we came up with on pretty much any topic. Her energy level and enthusiasm were so contagious - def recommend as a fun way to see and learn about Amsterdam.

Fabulous :). Hubby and I did the Windmill, Cheese and Clogs tour with Allison and Simon! A great day getting out of the hustle and bustle of the city and seeing another element of the Netherlands! We had various stops along the way and learnt heaps about the history of the country, interesting stuff! Thanks also for the suggestions of the stroopwaffles at Albert Cuypmarkt and the rice table, both amazing :)

Amazing way to see Amsterdam!. Such a fun day, and a brilliant way to explore Amsterdam! It's a 14 mile ride, but it really doesn't feel that long! There are a stops along the way at interesting points, Alison is really knowledgeable about Amsterdam and the history of Holland. Beautiful stops at the cities parks and the cheese & clog muse am - great cheese! I'd definitely recommend this tour.

Good fun . We did the private tour out into the countryside. The bikes were great, saddles matched to our heights. Allison our guide was super organised and friendly and ended by a rousing rendition of happy birthday in Dutch, I'd turned 40. It was 3hrs and not tiring and bum wasn't sore either! I'd recommend it a lot!

Highlight of my holiday!. I cannot recommend this tour enough, it was a really beautiful way to see Amsterdam! You get to see the city and some of the countryside which was brilliant. The farm was fantastic (you get to sample some incredible cheese and feed the cows). The tour is really informative and I learnt all sorts of interesting things about Amsterdam that I wouldn't have found out otherwise. Alison and Simon are incredibly friendly, easy to talk too and really know their stuff! Thank you both for a brilliant day that has begun my love affair with Amsterdam, I will be back!!

Hugely fun and informative. The two of us - a regular cyclist and an extremely lapsed one - loved our Sunday morning trip out to the countryside near Amsterdam. Alison and Simon, our guides, were both super-friendly and had a great insider's knowledge of the city and its surroundings. The sun came out and it was fantastic to bike along the banks of the Amstel and out to visit locks, polders and a farm selling seriously good cheese. Highly recommended!

Great way to see the country side and traditional windmills and canal locks. . We took this country bike tour to get out of the city and see the country side and some traditional windmills after spending 2 days in the city. The tour offers a100% no questions asked guarantee but I guarantee you won't need it! Our tour guide was the owner and she was informative and educational. We stopped every 20 minutes or so at all the interesting points and she described the history. She took photos with our cameras at great locations. We stopped at a working cheese farm and wood shoe factory as well. I would recommend this tour for bike and non bike enthusiasts. You don't need to be in great shape as it's mostly flat terrain but you ride for over 3 hours so be prepared. Great tour and at this price a must do in Amsterdam.

Windmill, Cheese and Clogs. We were the first trip of the season and despite the cold we had a very enjoyable cycle through through the park, out of the city, along the dykes, through the polders, to the farm past the windmill and back. Allison is very knowledgable and was able to give us lots of local history and facts. High recommended. Hat and gloves also highly recommended at this of year (March).

Outstanding!. We are the class 3SW from the academic high school in Liestal, Switzerland. We took your bike-tour through Amsterdam last May and loved it. The wide span of general- and insider-knowledge combined with the wit of the guides made it a really fun experience. The bikes where in top condition and you managed to guide us on a safe journey through the busy streets of Amsterdam. We will definitely recommend and choose Joy Ride Tours again when in Amsterdam. Thanks againClass 3SW

Great day in Amsterdam. My daughter and I took a graduation trip to Amsterdam in August and wanted to see a little of it from outside a bus or canal boat. The country tour with Joy Ride was an absolutely wonderful experience, even though it rained for half the tour. Allison is a great guide, with lots of enthusiasm and knowledge of the sights we passed. My daughter is 30 and I'm 63 and the riding was easy for both of us. Being out in the country and along the houseboats on the canals was truly a breath of fresh air. We joined others for a group of eight and all of had a great time. Sean takes the time to make sure the bikes are fitted for each rider, raingear was provided so we all stayed relatively dry. There is a stop at a cheese farm/dutch shoe factory which, while interesting, could have been just a bit shorter in time.As we came back to the drop off point, a local ran into my daughter and started to yell at her. Sean stepped in and calmly took control of the situation, reminding the local of his failure to ring his bell as a warning that he was coming through. No one hurt and a crisis averted.I would recommend this couple and their tour to anyone. You will have a fabulous time and remember it much more than any canal cruise.

The best of the City. Enjoy the city in every inch like a native. Ride your trip to an unforgettable experience. We were a group of friends and had so much fun. it was so easy to reach everything, but pay attention before starting the ride and make sure you know how to, because if everywhere there is car traffic in Amsterdam you have bicycle traffic :))), so you may get hurt if you're not careful.

Great Fun - Great Value. When traveling, it can be difficult to find activities that you walk away from truly satisfied. I'm a basic traveler - I like seeing the sights, enjoying the people and trying to get a glimpse into the everyday life of a place. Too often I find myself getting sucked into tourist traps as a result of suggestions from well meaning fellow travelers. Wasting even a few hours of your time when it is so limited hits hard. I've been to Amsterdam on a few occasions and continue to find new things to do. Of all the time I've spent in Amsterdam, perhaps the best use of my time and most enjoyable day I've had was spent with Joy Ride Tours. We got to see so much diversity in such a small city - I was blown away at what I had missed on my previous trips. What's more, I'm a big active sports person so finding an activity that allowed me to get the heart rate going a bit, although the cycling was very easy and relaxing, was very much appreciated. I can't express my enjoyment of the tour enough - Alison was incredibly personable, fun and knowledgable. You could tell she loved the city and enjoyed sharing it with those on her tour. If you want to see Amsterdam and stretch the legs out a bit, the Joy Ride Bike Tours is the answer. Some of the best money I've ever spent while traveling - easily my favorite tour and one of my favorite guides of all I've met.A must do activity in Amsterdam. I'll definitely go again if I return.

Two Wheels Dutch style. I really wanted to see the outskirts of Amsterdam This tour had great diversity. A husband and wife business. Meeting centrally we walked a short stroll to pick up our bikes, great bikes too, a pack on the back to hold your personal items, help adjusting the right bike to suit your height. The group had a short lesson with riding in Amsterdam which can be quite daunting.The tour was historical as we were lead out of the city. Was a beautiful feeling riding free. This tour included a stop for lunch at a cheese and clog making factory, a farmer with a few cows and machine turning clogs, but he does show you original way. You must take your lunch unless you wish to buy cheese to nibble on. The shop here was great, clogs everywhere and cheese tasting, yumm. Small gifts of all sorts. Next stop a close up with a windmill, we were very lucky to see it move, our guide Alice in 5 yrs had not seen it move on a tour! Half day tour excellent for $40 AUS Alice very informative with historical and country way of life here. Love Amsterdam.

Highlight of the trip. My three young teens say this was the highlight of our visit to Amsterdam. We had a lot of fun biking from the city to the country and learning some history on the way. The bikes were really comfortable, the views were wonderful (forests, rivers, farms), and Allison was easygoing and made it very fun. We also enjoyed stopping at the working farm and eating fresh cheese and seeing how clogs are made. We even walked around in some. I highly recommend Joy Ride Tours!

Highly recommend. This was our best tour in Amsterdam.It was great to see the countryside of Amsterdam and the ride was easy going (even if you're not a big bike rider).Allison was friendly and informative. Make sure you take snacks to eat along the way as there's no formal stop for lunch (though plenty of quick stops). The bikes were in good condition and they all had side bags to hold any gear you bought along.

Best thing we did!. We went out with Allison a week or so ago and it was seriously the best part of our trip. We did the CWC private tour and had the best time! Well worth the price, plus we got some great restaurant recommendations afterwards. This is a must do if you go to Amsterdam!

Excellent service and experience. We can highly recommend Joy Ride Tours for biking in Amsterdam. We contacted the for a ride in the city with our two children of 10 and 12 - and they honestly replied that they do not take children on a tour in Amsterdam city, due to safety reasons - which other bike companies does. We went instead on a great tour with Sean to the countryside and had a great time. Sean was a great company and was like a Wikipedia in knowledge. Thank you Sean for making a good memories for us all in our trip to Amsterdam

Beyond Beautiful- A total Joy. Spending the afternoon with Allison guiding the country tour was a total joy. If you do only one thing in Amsterdam, do this bike tour. Everything about it was beyond beautiful.The history, the landscape, the cheese farm and Allison's company made for one of the best day's of a 30 day living experience in Amsterdam. I also appreciated that she gave me several tips about things to do while I am here, based on my interests. Every single one of them has been a wonderful outing. If you can, go on a private tour. You get that much more time to ask questions and get to know this wonderful person. I also appreciated Sean's kind service in arranging the details of the trip.
Great Day. I did the Cheese, Windmill and Clogs tour, fantastic! Allison was sensational, the bikes were modern and easy to ride.

Biking in Amsterdam is a MUST!. My husband and I had a fantastic time doing the bike tour through the country and a bit of the city. I felt like we got to experience Amsterdam the way it should be - by bike! Allison was the perfect guide - knowledgeable, easy-going and fun. We saw the Vondelpark, houseboat communities, windmills and a working farm (with cheese!) in the countryside, all while hearing interesting stories along the way. Wonderful day.

Joy in the Rain. Alison was fantastic even though we were the only couple to turn up on what was to be a very rainy day. The country tour was delightful and being typical Aussies, the rain was not going to stop us, in fact it made the experience all the better. Private tour for a group price and Alison made us feel special. The last part of the tour was through a torrential thunderstorm, lightning and all. Thanks Alison. Hope you got to enjoy a warm bath afterwards. Gold Medal Bike Tour. Neil and Robyn

Great way to see Amsterdam. We did a private bike tour of Amsterdam with Joy Ride and it was worth every penny. It was very educational and fun. We got to see a lot of Amsterdam with Sean who was a funny and very knowledgeable tour guide. He also catered it to what we were interested in. We have done several bike tours in different European countries and this was by far our favorite! I highly suggest it!

Unexpected insights into Amsterdam. Ditto the other great reviews. A couple unexpected bonuses:1) Alison, our guide, is a seasoned traveler and has unique insights into all facets of life in Amsterdam. We had very illuminating and unexpected discussions about the mores, the culture and history, it was much more than dikes and windmills.2) Riding as an American along the paths among the locals, with my American individualist atti-tudes and style, really gave me a visceral feel for their more group-based conduct. Most interesting.

Top way to spend an afternoon. My husband and I did a private country tour with Sean and had a fantastic time. He tailored the bike ride to what we wanted to get out of it. He gave us lots of interesting information about the history of Amsterdam and the surrounding villages and took us to some lovely areas. I will certainly be recommending this bike tour company to anyone looking for one.Natalie

Excellent way to get out of the city.. This was a great way to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city. Allison was a great guide! She was very knowledgeable of the area and history, with a touch of humor to boot! She also ensured everyone had great photo opportunities to remember the day by. I highly recommend taking a Joy Ride!

Amsterdam with different eyes. We booked the country tour on our last day in Amsterdam and had discovered the inner city quite well to this date. However, the tour led us to places we would not have found or even expected to see. It was not only fun but also interesting and entertaining. The guide is a great person who knows much about the city but imparts his knowledge and enthusiasm. We had a great time and in a retrospective it was surely the best part of our one week stay.

Joyride Tours is Excellent!. My husband and I were excited to be taking a Joyride but were concerned about riding in the city of Amsterdam. Our tour leader, Allison tried in every way to prepare us for busy corners, etc. Riding outside of the city was lots of fun and we saw some beautiful countryside. There were nine of us on today's tour and that made it easier for us to stay together. Allison was always watching to see that no one was left behind and on one occasion we did wait. Besides leading the tour and sharing LOTS of information about the Netherlands, she did her utmost to keep us safe and together. We would recommend this tour to anyone looking to find out more about the Netherlands and wanting to explore the countryside. Make sure to bring water and a snack. From time to time, Allison will have the group stop for an explanation, photos, etc. Since we never ride without helmets, we asked for helmets for the ride, such a foreign thing to do in the Netherlands. I was worried we would be supplied with not so great helmets but we were supplied with excellent ones. The bikes this tour company uses are of excellent quality as well and they were set up for people of varying heights. We booked ahead and online and doing so will save you a little bit of money. We felt the price was reasonable. Joyride Tours has put a great deal of thought into your ride and if we were to come again, I am sure we would consider choosing this company. Joyride Tours is excellent!

Great experience - Perfect way to learn about the country. We were very lucky to have an amazing sunny day when we took this tour. We joined a group of about 15 and we think the size was perfect. Our guide was very nice and very attentive, and she is really good with her history - she makes the tour very interesting, and you can really see that she enjoys her job. We are so happy that we took this tour!Bring some snacks and water since the tour is long.

Best Bike Tour!. My hubby and I joined a bunch of folks on this bike ride. To be honest, we were a bit apprehensive with the idea of riding a bike in or near Amsterdam where bikes and cars seem to share the space and do so in such a coordinated manner that it seemed like an experience one could have after a lifetime of practice. The Joy Ride Tours introduced us to our bikes and the rules of the road and shortly we were on our way. We rode through part of Vondel Park and past many canals and houseboats arriving at Amstelveen. Along the way we learned the function of windmills and how the land was cleared. Our ride was informative and a ton of fun. At no time did it really feel scary to ride across the road as the instructor was very good at telling us how to enter the lane of traffic. In Amstelveen we visited a farm and saw a demo of clog making and sampled cheese after a brief overview of how cheese was made there. A quick re-application of sunblock (bring some!) and we were on our way back to the city to return our bikes. This experience gave us great joy during our vacation and allowed us to participate in a very Dutch experience. Thank you to the Joy Ride Tours for such a wonderful time.

Get out in the countryside. We had a fantastic bike tour with Alison. It was a great way to get outside of Amsterdam & see the beautiful countryside. The cycling was easy and 90% on little bike paths or cycle lanes. We saw another side of Amsterdam by stopping at a windmill, a farm making cheese & clogs & seeing the dyke system up close. Alison was a wonderful guide, knowledgeable & fun. It started to rain on our tour - but no need to worry as they had packed rain hoods in the bike panniers! Also one of our group felt ill & unable to do the tour, even though it was a last minute thing & we'd already paid some time before Alison & Sean really kindly refunded the payment for this tourer which we didn't expect or ask for. If you have a half day to spare you must do this tour. You will learn so much & see much more than just staying in central Amsterdam. The cycling is easy too!

Amazing personalized Central Amsterdam bike tour. My 16 year old son and myself decided to take a private bike tour with Joy Ride Tours based on recommendations we found on the internet and we absolutely loved it. Sean was an excellent host and guide giving us diverse informations and insights on many different topics related to Amsterdam and it's history and development. Sean is very knowledgeable and offers you the possibility to focus on single subjects and cover them in depth. We highly recommend him, but don't forget to book as in advance as possible!

Joy Ride Tours is a JOY. We had a fun ride with Joy Rides in Amsterdam! It was a great break to tour the country side with Allison. This tour added variety to our trip & was really fun! Bike riding is HUGE in Amsterdam & it was great to see the rhythm & flow of the riders everywhere. I would recommend to add this to your must do list.

Perfect day - worth waiting two years for!. Two years ago we had booked a private tour with Joy Ride only to have it cancelled due to severe weather. Apparently ours was one of only two tours they had ever cancelled in their company history. Our travel schedule did not allow us time to re-schedule so we vowed to return to Amsterdam and do the tour some day. This summer we made a point of scheduling our European holiday around a flight out of Amsterdam and were happy that we were able to complete the Private country Tour with Joy Ride. Allison is an excellent guide and very knowledgable, and our tour was more like enjoying a relaxing cycle tour with an old friend. She happily offered to take many photos of our family ( me, my hubby and our two sins ages 17 and 20) along the way. The scenery through the forest and along the polders and Amstel River is beautiful. Her suggestion for lunch at a riverside eatery in the village of Ouderkerk was excellent. The bikes provided seemed brand new and very comfortable to ride. An excellent tour, well worth the price and the two year wait! I Highly recommend this private tour. Thanks Allison and Sean for an awesome day!

Loved it - Scenic and Fun!!!!. My husband, daughter and I took the Country Tour with Allison and had a great time. Allison was super fun, informative, laid back and added to pleasure of the ride. The ride was truly scenic and relaxing from the Vondelpark to the Amsterdam forest to the Amstel river. Despite some reviewers saying the cheese and clog farm being too touristy, I think they're wrong -it's one of those occasions that should be taken at face value. Yes, it was a smidge touristy (not overly touristy) but it was fun, we are still laughing about the quirky farmer and him calling people "happy lady" and "happy man" and just how often in life do you get the chance to see someone make clogs and get yummy cheese from a real working farm? And let me tell you the cheese is good. The garlic and mustard cheese is superb! We brought some home with us back to California and only wish we'd brought more.Overall, this is a fun, relaxing, informative and very scenic tour that is a must do while in Amsterdam. Plus, at the end of the tour Joy Rides gives you a great list of recommended restaurants and their top 75 best things to do in Amsterdam list. Thanks, Joy Ride!!!!

Wonderful experience. My daughter and I did the country tour with Sean and loved it. He is very knowledgeable. We learned a lot about Amsterdam, the Netherlands and all the places we visited. Such a wonderful way to see the area and get out into the countryside a bit. We even rode home in some rain, which made us feel like real natives -- nothing stops us! The bikes were great and there was rain gear we popped on when it started raining.

Joy ride tour. Allison and Sean are fantastic! The tour itself is great, but afterwards we used the map and "75 Best things to do in Amsterdam" list for the rest of the trip as well. Get to see the city and countryside of Amsterdam; definitely recommend.

A High End Tour with Sean!. My husband and I had such a fabulous tour today with Sean. He was so knowledgeable about the city and it's history, the bikes were new and top of the line and we rode through Amsterdam neighborhoods that were off the beaten path. Our tour was 3-4 hours and we were having such a great time that we spent an extra half hour with Sean chatting at a restaurant in the park! It is clear that Sean is passionate about what he does and works hard to customize his tours to the individual interests of his clients. This was truly a memorable tour and Amsterdam experience. If we ever come back to Amsterdam, we will absolutely book another tour with Sean and Joy Ride tours as we felt we had just scratched the surface of his deep reservoir of knowledge.

A real highlight to our visit to Amsterdam!!!. While walking through Vondelpark we had a chance to meet Sean (owner) of Joy Ride Tours as they were on a brief stop in the park. We lucked out that they had a cancellation for the 19th of July, so we quickly booked a city tour for the 19th via their web site. Quite simply this was one of the highlights of our trip. As Sean explained to us, there is almost a 2:1 ratio between bikes and people of Amsterdam, so doing anything by bike in Amsterdam is to truly live like a resident of the city. I think the best part of the tour is the fact these are private tours; it was Sean and the two of us for a good 4 hours hitting all the major areas of Amsterdam. Also, his tours are not a one tour fits all; depending on your tastes (i.e. WWII / foodie / etc...) he will tailor the tour to what interests you the most. His knowledge of the city was incredible and he will share stories/data that you would never find in a guide book. He will also treat you to some local foods that you may not try on your own. Try the herring and fried cod cheeks!! They also have a country tour which will be on our agenda the next time we come to Amsterdam. Great fun!!

A must do when in Amsterdam. Taking a tour with Allison was like meeting up with one of your favorite college friends for the day. She was engaging with all of us and was very easy to hang out with. The ride was great-we got to see parts of the city we wouldn't have otherwise. The cheese from the farm is delicious. Our tour was definitely one of the highlights of our trip.

Best part of our trip!. We did the tour with Allison the day after we landed. Getting outside the city, and seeing great views. I loved her passion and fabulous informative stuff of the city. I have been to Amsterdam proper many times, but this showed us a new side. This is a must. She made it so much fun, and is more than happy to give you hint n tips to travel around. As I've travelled around euro, I'm realizing a bike tour is a fantastic way to see a bunch in a short time. Additionally, it's a great way to get out with fresh air and help with jet lag :-). Do not miss ths bike ride.

Fantastic, enjoyable and great value for money. We spent 5 hours with Sean who owns and runs the company with his wife. No need to worry if you have not been on a bicycle in some years, the land is mostly flat and there is very little time spent in the city centre. You cycle through parks, forests and into the country, spend an enjoyable half an hour with a local farmer who shows you how cheese and clogs are made on his farm. A bit further on from the farm and you stop at a windmill that was built in 1600 and something. Sean is a mind of information and made the day a really enjoyable one. Thank you Sean see you for our 35th wedding anniversary :-)

Wine, cheese, clogs and a great guide!. Allison is the greatest guide in all of Amsterdam. The ride is pretty easy thanks to the premium Electra bikes. You will get to go see the Amsterdam you find on post cards, namely windmills, and the countryside. It is a refreshing break from the busy city, and you will learn a bit about Amsterdams history and rich culture. Recommended for anyone who can ride a bike.

Wonderful time.. My wife and I - 30ish adults - took this tour on a lovely Saturday afternoon with Allison, one of the owners of the company. It was a great tour from start to finish.Pros:- It was a leisurely paced ride, with ample stops for history, discussion, or just for her to show us something really cool.- We got some great photos, and she knew all the best places to take them, too. - We saw a lot more of the city and surrounding area than we would have by any other method. I definitely would recommend taking one of their tours. Completely enjoyable.- It was great for adults and kids too - provided they're big enough to ride an adult bike. No drinking or annoying carousing going on, which while in Amsterdam, can be hard to find.Cons:- None. We had a spectacular time. Wish we had taken a longer tour, and probably a private one.

Loved this tour!. My husband and did the Cheese, Clogs and Windmills tour this week, on our first ever trip to Amsterdam. We had an awesome time. It was such a great way to see the city (particularly the canals) and then some of the countryside. Our guide (Shaun) was knowledgable and friendly - and we were all encouraged to ask questions and participate.We even had people in our group who had done the tour multiple times - so that should give you a indication of how good it is!Also the bikes were super comfortable and easy to ride (it helps that Amsterdam is so flat also), and they had a bag on the back to store snacks, drinks etc.

If you can't beat the cyclists...join 'em!. A gentle ride through city and country, with a great tour guide. Alison was a fabulous host, humorous and informative! Cycling through Vondelpark and the clog and cheese farm was a real highlight. A great way to experience Amsterdam beyond the inner city.

So much fun!. My husband and I did the Cheese, Clogs & Windmill tour last week. Allison (who is American but has lived in Amsterdam for many years) was a WONDFERFUL guide. She took us on a fun tour and gave us lots of great information. We rode through parks and past windmills and into the countryside to a farm where you get to try some delicious cheese. The bikes were very comfortable and in great shape. I have back problems, but riding the bike did not bother me at all. And, I never felt unsafe riding. Be sure to bring lunch or a snack with you since the tour went from about 10am-2:30pm. Do not miss this tour - it is a great way to see Amsterdam and was so much fun!!!!!!!!!!!

Good for mixed ages. This ride was perfect for a grandmother, and 2 teens. The info along the tour was made entertaining by Allison for the teens and the pace was perfect for an adventurous adult. We took sandwiches and had time to eat while visiting a farm. The country side of canal houses, horse farms, polders, just outside of the city was beautiful. Try for a sunny day. Very good value for the money and easy to book on line.
Fabulous day. We joined Allison on her Bike tour into Amsterdam's countryside and had a fabulous day. The trip was well organised, the bikes were great and the tour was really interesting.

"Joy Ride " from Heaven!. Fabulous from beginning to end. Professionally organised, Excellent bikes fabulous people, most enjoyable day in Dam, thank you Allison and her hubby. we will be back!Regards Eva and John
Allison is the BEST!!. Just finished a European tour. In each city we did a bike tour. Our 4 hour tour to the Dutch farm with Allison was by far the best! The reviews say it all. Thanks Allison.

Wonderful escape to the countryside :). This is such an escape to the country side. Allison brought us around and her bikes were in tip-top condition, easy ride out to the vondelpark, beatrixpark, the cheese and clog farm and the windmill. Had tons of cheese tasting and the farm owner was exceptionally entertaining. I would say that the tour is very well organised and paced evenly, Allison was an excellent guide and such a rare chance that we could escape to the countryside for fresh air, picturesome skies... excellent weather for the ride!Thanks for organising this :) Cheers, Dynelle & Toon

Thanks Allison. What a wonderful and relaxed way to see Amsterdam and surrounding areas. My son is convinced now that he needs a bike just like the tour one and that he should learn Dutch... Highly highly suggest you do this trip.

A great way to get to know Amsterdam and the Netherlands. We went on the cheese, clogs and windmill tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. Allison was our guide and her knowledge and enthusiasm for her adopted city / country shone through. She was very personable and was able to handle the diverse range of people on our tour who had differing abilities, languages and cultural needs. The bikes were good, new and well-maintained with lightweight frames so younger and older people as well as cycle novices would be comfortable on this tour. If I was being picky I'd say that the farm part was a bit over-commercial and aimed at the tourist's pockets with a surprisingly large gift shop but if you don't have to buy anything and it didn't detract from getting out into the countryside. Overall it was a really good day run by experts with a a clear passion for their job which can only be good for the customer. I can highly recommend this tour.

Fantastic Experience, Wonderful Genuine Owners. This tour was one of the highlights of my 3-day solo stay in Amsterdam. Country-side, windmills, forests, houseboats, suburbia, city, parks, a great way to see so many aspects of this country! The owners are friendly, down-to-earth and genuine. Although you do visit a cheese factory with a shop attached I never felt pressure to buy, and there was no cross-selling of other tours which is refreshing. Definitely recommend booking online, bring lunch with you but no need to bring a raincoat as they are supplied if necessary. If I ever have the chance to head back to Amsterdam with husband and kids in tow I would definitely book a private bike tour through Alison and Sean.

Excellent Bike Tour!. We booked the Cheese, Clogs & Windmill tour online before arriving in Amsterdam (3euro saving) and we were not disappointed. The meeting place is easy, right next to the Iamsterdam sign in the Museumplein. We were greeted by Sean and his assistant Merlot who both couldn't have been friendlier. The weather was beautiful but rain ponchos were provided should you need them. The bikes were practically brand new and easy to use. This tour is ideal if, like me, you're a bit nervous of cycling round the busy parts of Amsterdam. A short ride through Vondelpark and we were in the countryside. Sean was so knowledgeable and i learnt more about Amsterdam in that few hours than i have done on all my previous visits to the city. The pace was perfect to take in all the sites and even with a group of 14 and different ages, shapes and sizes, nobody felt slow or a hindrance. I honestly couldn't recommend this tour enough, and for the cheap price I couldn't believe just how professional and well done it was.

Excellent Bike Tour!. My husband and I booked a tour through the website which was very easy to use.The tour was fantastic! I loved riding through the countryside and learning more about the Dutch way of life and cool history.The bikes were easy to use, Allison was very friendly and knowledgeable.My husband ended up being ill and couldn't come along on the tour. They were empathetic and credited his tour, without me even having to ask!Thanks for a great outing!
Well worth it. We spent a lovely day with Alison, who has great knowledge & passion for the city & area. We even got used to the Dutch weather with a torrential downpour. Definitely worth the money.

Top notch. We always hire a private guide when visiting a major new city for the first time and Sean was among the very best we have ever experienced. He is exceptionally well informed, good humored, and gave us the perfect four hour introduction to Amsterdam. Truly top notch.

Best part of my trip in Amsterdam. Guide/Owner was delightful, helpful, and warm. He was very helpful in giving recommendations for other things to do in Amsterdam no matter what type of experience you're seeking during your trip. My best friends and I are college students are really enjoyed the tour through the countryside.

Awesome bike tour. We booked the Cheese, Clogs & Windmill tour and it was so much fun. Allison was a great tour guide -- she was extremely knowledgeable and funny, but without the tackiness of most tours. The bikes provided looked like new and were very comfortable and rode well, and even had a small side bag for your belongings. We were fortunate enough to have great weather on the day of our tour, and Allison stopped the group every once in a while to give us some background on the area and time to take some pictures. We rode through some very scenic parts of the city as well as the countryside. At the end of the tour, Allison and her husband were able to provide us with some tips on what to do/where to go in the city. Overall a great tour!

Outstanding. Allison is outstanding. An American transplant now living in Amsterdam provides an incredible tour through beautiful parks and countryside of Amsterdam. We had great weather and comfortable bikes too! The crazy Dutch farmer (plus wives and girlfriends) is a hidden bonus.

Fantastic! Very informative and fun. Allison is a great tour guide - very knowledgeable, funny, caring, and will answer any question from historical, political to recos on where to eat. The bikes are in awesome shape and will be adjusted to your liking. They have side bags to store your belongings and food. Make sure to pack a lunch and bring water. We got prepared sandwiches from the local grocery store. I would recommend taking this tour on your first day visiting Amsterdam. The owners provide their 75 favorite places to visit in Amsterdam. We ate at their favorite Indonesian restaurant and it was fantastic. Book this tour!!!

Great Bike Ride. My husband and I were recently in Amsterdam. After researching for fun activities, I decided to book this bike tour. I am very glad I did. We had a fabulous time, even with the pouring rain,rain ponchos were provided! The bikes a brand spanking new, with a selection to fit the height challenged, like me.i am over 50 and had not really ridden a bike for years, but this ride was easy. This most difficult bit was riding against the wind through a portion of the polder, the wind was fierce. Allison is very friendly and knowledgable. This bike ride is one of my favorite memories from our two week trip.

Best Tour Yet. This was probably the best tour I have had the chance to go on. I don't often do tours, but traveling solo, I figured it would be a great chance to meet new people.When Allison rolls up and you learn your tour guide is also the owner of the company, you know it will be good. It's her baby, she's going to give it her all. And that she did!The tour was great and Allison is very informative. She was great to bike alongside and discuss everything from politics to whatever else was on my mind that day about my time in The Netherlands. The bikes were top quality, the stops we made were fun, and she really goes out of her way to make sure each tour is found to be enjoyable by everyone. I took some of her suggestions that she prints out on where else to go and what to eat while there, and each time was great!I remember I was deciding between this and a couple other tours that were slightly cheaper, but I noticed this tour seemed to offer the longest time out and while I can't speak to the other tours, I can say I'm sure I glad I spent the extra three Euro to go with Joy Ride- it was a wonderful experience!PS- Book online- you save 3 Euro which is nice!

Great way to spend a day. Three of us met Alison neat the Cobra Cafe. We began by utilizing the award-winning toilet that is nearby. Alison's love of great stories was immediately evident. We then moved to the bike area and received high-quality bikes for the day. We were happy that Sean was willing to keep our bags with him for the day, while we kept the essentials in the bike's trunk /9a bag that is attached to the bike). We then started cycling at a comfortable pace and saw swans, ugly ducklings that hatched four days prior, and many more interesting sights that were coupled with Alison's passion for the city, its surroundings and story telling. Highly recommended . We had a great time.

Worth it!. Dislikes - the weather. Which is obviously out of everyone's control so really, I don't have a single dislike with Joy Ride Bike Tours. The weather was rainy, windy and cold yet we still journeyed out (fortunately, Joy Ride does provide warm / large riding ponchos in anticipation of this weather) to learn about Amsterdam. Many different and unique sights to see and our tour guide Allison was able to explain them all (and then some!). As I mentioned, the weather was horrible - so to surpass our expectations, there was free hot chocolate waiting for our little group upon our afternoon return. It was really refreshing to have gotten that little bit of extra-special treatment as a tourist!!

Informative, fun, authentic Amsterdam experience. This ride through a bit of the city and out into the countryside was a terrific introduction to Amsterdam. What better way to see the city than on a bike...but given the bike traffic in Amsterdam, the novice needs a guide! We learned so much about the city, the history and life in Amsterdam....windmills, houseboats, culture, the Dutch perspective on life and liberty. Alison is a great tour guide. We had fun AND we learned many things. Plus, as an added bonus, Alison generously shares her tips on what to see, where to eat etc....that alone is worth the price. If you are secure on a bike seat, take this tour.

Country tour of excellence. We (3 people) took a private country tour with Allison. First let me say the bikes are first class! So comfortable. This is a 7-gear bike, not a granny bike. Sean was there at the beginning to customize bike size and seat height. They have panniers so you can comfortably ride with a purse or satchel. They supply rain gear if needed. Amsterdam is a bike community. Leaving the city and riding through the park and Amstelveen was a pleasure. The ride was about 24km but had a leisurely pace and was not stressful. There were many stops along the way including a working dairy farm (we bought some Gouda) and a market where we enjoyed the local food. The Herring was SO GOOD---you have to try it. This tour took about 4.5 hours and Allison and Sean then distributed information and recommendations about things to do and restaurant recommendations.I could not be happier with this tour. In retrospect, it was our best experience in Amsterdam. And as a side note, I am looking into purchasing a bike like theirs.

Highly recommended!. Excellent tour! It was a very relaxing beautiful scenic ride through the countryside. The bikes were very new and had comfortable seats. Allison was very knowledgable and entertaining.

Fantastic memory of Amsterdam!. I've done 8 bike tours in 5 countries. This tour was by far was one of my favorites! Allison is extremely knowledgeable of Amsterdam - I learned so much. Together with her husband they have a top notch company that go out of their way to make sure you have an enjoyable time. PROS:Organized; special attention is made to the details.Nice comfortable bikes.Breathtaking views of the countryside.Easy, fun ride.Perfect group size (max 15).Great stops for picturing taking and a quick history lesson. CONS:Nothing! Loved this bike tour!
great company. Excellent tour company, bikes run great on Amsterdam's terrain!!! I recommend this company. My husband and I loved this tour
Great ride. Informative and good value for the money. Excellent tour leader. Brand new, nice 7 speed bikes that ride great on Amsterdam's flat terrain.

Best day of the trip!. Had an amazing day out with Alison & fellow bikers.Found Joy Ride on TA so decided to book as we are keen riders, we booked in advance on-line. Run by a really lovely couple who are really friendly & full of information about AmsterdamI think we did around 20k in & around the city, via the Vondelpark & returning via Beatrix Park. A great way to see the city & beyond.Had a fantastic day, visited a windmill & a working cheese & clog factory. I guess it was slightly cheesy (pardon the pun) but we were under no pressure to buy anything.Alison was such a great host that after the tour, may I suggest in future that she invite everyone to lunch back at hers so were can listen to tales of Amsterdam :) fabulous!

Extremely insightful. My sister and I absolutely loved this tour. Allison was so informative and articulate when talking about Amsterdam's canal's, dam's and history. If you had a question, Allison had the answer.I don't consider myself fit but I found the 23 km bike ride easy. The bikes are brand new and easy to use. About 10% of the tour is in the city and the rest in the countryside so don't worry if your new to biking because they'll always have someone at the back to make sure no one get's left behindThe best part was the cheese stop. I could have eaten the whole plate if I knew no one was watching;) It was nice to see how the clogs were made too;and to actually see people wearing them.Overall, I highly recommend this tour and strongly recommend you book for your first day. You won't regret it!

Wonderful bike tour!. We rode thru Amsterdam and it's outskirts, Allison did a great job explaining everything and was patient with our small group of 4. I am not as fit as I use to be but was able to stay with the group. We loved the fact that it was a great day to ride and learned a lot about the city.
