You are taken to a real clog and cheese factory and get to see a lot of the flora and fauna. I highly recommend this to all ages!

Great day out! What a beautiful country and tour!. We did this tour in September. It obviously has to rank up there as the best tour to do in Amsterdam.  Things started off fine, but I happened to stop to take a photo of the statue of Vondell in Vondell park and when I came back around 20 seconds later the group was long gone. The park was full of hundreds of cyclists that day since it was a Saturday, and I now had no way of catching up to the group or my wife, who I had advised to stick with the group whenever I stopped to take a photo. Well after cycling down numerous paths and only seeing hundreds of other cyclists and trees blocking the views in the distance I had to go back to the office. They then sent someone out with me and we were lucky enough to find my wife who had gotten lost looking for me and eventually caught up with the rest of the group. Word of warning.. Stay close to everyone in Vondell park. It is like a maze and there is no way at all to get your bearings. Our guide Yuri was very apologetic and even bought everyone a beer to have with our lunch to help make up for the extra 45 minutes we had to add to the tour because of the mishap.  We finished the tour and got to do everything though and missed nothing. Got some nice pics of windmills and the cheese factory. It was just awesome being out in the dutch countryside, and feeling my roots with Dutch ancestors. Its so surprising to find beautiful countryside like this so close to a major urban city. I would not have missed this for the world!!!  NOTE:THIS TOUR IS NOT FOR EVERYONE AND ESPECIALLY NOT FOR BEGINNING CYCLISTS OR PEOPLE WITH A LOW FITNESS LEVEL. You need to possess a medium cycle skill level and enough stamina for all these kilometers fo cycling. It seemed to me like a very very long ride coming back especially after running all around Europe for the past week. It was at least 30km ride for me, since I had already done alot of fast pedaling looking for my wife in Vondell park. Honestly it took me weeks to recover from this ride since we really didn't have much rest on our trip to Europe. I was still feeling tired in the quads 4 days later in Paris when doing a night cycling tour, and again when doing a cycle tour of Versaille which I was barely able to finish. That being said, I recommend this tour 100%. It's so perfect to get away from the crowds of Amsterdam and breath some fresh air and see the countryside. Don't miss it!

Great way to see the city. Joy Ride Bike Tours give you a great way to see the city the way the locals do: by bike. It can be a little harrowing at first, but once you race through a couple of intersections all fears of a collision are gone; just remember to use your bell in the pedestrian areas.My wife and I did our tour just a couple hours after arriving in town, which was a fun and easy way to get the lay of the land and scout out some places to stop by later in our stay. It was a cold day, so there were only 4 of us on the tour, but that only made it better. We were able to make a couple of fun stops with a little more flexibility than if we had a full group. We stopped at Wynand Fockink for some genever. Our tour guide talked us into posing for a photo in the giant clog at Dam Square, with the cheesy moment now displayed proudly in our home.

Cheese, Clog & Windmill Tour - FUN!. Had a great time on this tour. My husband and I went in May for my birthday. It was a little touristy - but we loved the whole bike ride and seeing the landscapes! Our tour guide was great - and gave us lots of info. We saw the houseboats and a canal lock also. I suggested bringing a sandwich to eat at the Clog place - or at least a snack with you - as there isn't any place to stop to eat. We would do another tour with this company.

Best Way to Learn About Amsterdam. We have found that the best way to experience a city is to take advantage of a bike tour. We chose Joy Ride Tours in Amsterdam and booked the Windmills, Clogs and Cheese tour that takes you outside the city. It was fantastic!The tour was one of the highlights of our time in Amsterdam (and that is saying a lot because Amsterdam has so much to offer). Our tour guide was Yuri (hope I spelled that correctly) and he was great. Entertaining and funny and with a wealth of historical and cultural information on Amsterdam and the countryside. He also gave us an appreciation for the ability that Amsterdam (a city below sea level) has in redirecting and containing the water that surrounds the city. It was fascinating.We chose the Windmill, Clog and Cheese tour because we wanted to get out of the city and see some of the countryside and because it was a longer tour. 40% of the people in Amsterdam are on bikes so navigating the streets in the city by bike can be a little stressful. You have to watch where you are going and can't really sight see. Getting out of the city was the way to go. The tour was long but not tedious or tiring. You go at an easy pace and make informational and photo stops along the way. Although some reviewers found the the clog and cheese stop a little commercial, we thought it was great. And just sampling the cheese was worth the stop. Do buy a sample of their Gouda. Delicious! The bikes themselves are sturdy and very comfortable. Nice big seats! They have roomy saddlebags so you can bring a jacket, camera, etc. and definitely bring food with you. This tour does not stop for snacks or lunch.
forever remembered. I wish I had done the longest tour available. This was a-mazing! haha. Fun, not hectic, bikes were reasonable. Loved the tour guide!

The highlight of our Amsterdam trip!. We were travelling through Amsterdam for 3 days and had booked in with Joy Ride on our first day for the Windmills, Cheese and Clogs tour, and without doubt it was the highlight. Our tour guide was Allison, she was absolutely lovely and provided insightful commentary throughout the day. She also provided us with heaps of recommendations for restaurants and things to do for the rest of our stay. We were both a little nervous about riding bikes (because we haven't ridden since our teenage years!) and in Amsterdam, where there are literally thousands of bikes everywhere. But the tour takes you out of town into the country side (even though its only a few kms outside Amsterdam) and was a relaxed pace and easy ride. We were luckily enough to book in on the last public tour of the season, but Alison mentioned that she also arranges private tours. I would definitely recommend this tour !

A great day out. A group of us in Amsterdam for a wedding on a joy ride tour. What fun! The guide managed to cater for a variety of skill levels in bike riding by interspersing the rides with story telling and photo opportunities. I saw a different side to Amsterdam, even venturing out not the surrounding countryside. Yes there are cows within an easy ride of Amsterdam. Highly recommended.

Great tour of the countryside! . We did the country bike tour today with Alison, and it was fabulous. Very informative and great to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre and see some different scenery. Alison (one of the owners) was super friendly and gave us heaps of information (sights, restaurant recommendations etc) too. It was an easy ride and we enjoyed the farm and we did not feel obligated to buy anything but we did purchase some cheese as it was great. Would highly recommend to anyone coming to Amsterdam as a must do!

Good tour. This was a fun tour to take. The staff was extremely friendly, and made sure everybody was comfortable on their bikes. They never rushed, and made the tour enjoyable. The bikes look like they're in good shape. You don't really need to be fit for this ride. I'm a bit of a cyclist myself, so this is not going to be much of a workout if you're looking for a physical challenge. It was certainly fun to ride the bike in the country and visit the mill. The tourguide was kind enough to take pictures of you, and seemed good at taking pictures as he seems to do this quite often (-: I cannot remember the name of our tour guide, but he was from Australia, I believe.I didn't take any snacks. The ride was not that arduous. It's a good idea to take some water though. Note that their bikes have some bags in the back, so you can pack a few small items. Some of the people who rode took a sweater (note that I rode at the end of August).The cheese farm was ok. I was ok with this part of the tour because: 1)although they do try to sell you stuff at the end of the tour, nobody is pushy about it, 2)it's interesting to talk to the people who run the farm, 3)you get to see them build those wooden shoes. The people who run that tour are not part of Joy Ride Tours. It made the bike tour a bit more diverse, lets just say (-:
What a great way to experience Amsterdam!!. This is the best way to experience Amsterdam! our tour guide Yuri was really fun and full of great insights into the past and present Amsterdam.

Another way to look at Amsterdam!!. Straight to the point.This bike tour introduces you to the suburban area of Amsterdam. People tend to focus on the more explicitly fun side of Amsterdam, such as red light district, or the famous coffee houses. But those are not the only things that Amsterdam has to offer. This tour guides you to parks, water gates, dikes, and farms, a cheese maker, and a windmill. It lets you experience the quiet, peaceful, yet very interesting side of Amsterdam.If you had to choose one tour in Amsterdam, I think this should be it.As for the red light district, coffee houses, or canals, you can guide yourself. They are mostly located in the central area of the city. But this tour takes you to rather hidden gems of Amsterdam. I definitely recommend this tour. My guide was Yuri, and he does not need any description. You want to go with him. He is not only pleasant and cheerful but he also knows practically everything you have to ask about Amsterdam and its suburban areas.Definitely worth the twenty something euro.

The perfect afternoon. We went joyriding on Sunday, and it was such a pleasure and such good value. The tour operators have a well thought out path, so you leave the hustle of the main streets of Amsterdam and tour around the outskirts of the city in a landscape that includes parks and farmland and lovely residential areas. You ride a little, stop and hear about the city (the history, water engineering, culture, monarchy, etc.), and then ride a little more. Our tour guide Yuri impressed us with his knowledge and enthusiasm. Remember to pack lunch, it is not provided and can be stored on the saddlebags on the bike, as can purses. The level of fitness required is moderate - the route is flat and there is lots of starting and stopping.
Awesome bike tour. Great view of the countryside in Amsterdam, great tour guide, and overall, just great. Wish I would've bought more cheese with me back to the states!

Great way to experience Amsterdam!. My partner and I did a bike tour on September 16th with the charismatic Yuri as our guide. We were lucky with the weather which stayed mostly sunny but they give you ponchos in case it goes the other way. I was a bit worried at first having not ridden a bicycle in over 10 years but after the initial wobbly start it was smooth sailing for all of us. We stopped at a few nice locations and Yuri did a great job of filling us in on the history of it all. We eventually made our way out of the city and through the wetlands and forest to a tradition cheese farm which also makes clogs. Was very interesting and we picked up some lovely cheese to take home. All up we rode about 22km and it was a great day out - would highly recommend to anyone thinking of doing it and I hope you get Yuri as your guide as he was great.

Excellent Way to Experience Amsterdam. We took the countryside tour and were very happy we did. It was a 4.5 hour trip with stops and commentary. It is a wonderful way to get outside the city and experience some of the Netherlands in a different way. Tour guide was energetic and interesting. We learned some new facts and facets of life in Amsterdam and were guided safely in a city that is hard to explore alone on a bike. Highly recommend!

A great day in the country!. Had a fantastic time on the cycling tour with Joy Ride! Everything was hassle free. It was very easy to find the meeting place as it is just off a tram line. Also, our guide was very big on safety and explaining the Amsterdam road rules! We got to see a beautiful side of the country, which was very different to the city itself! FYI if you book online you get a 3 euro discount!

Excellent!!! Worth every penny!. Alison was amazing! I've done bike rides before but this was fantastic! She was enthusiastic and had great knowledge! Best tour in Netherlands by far! Bikes were fantastic and Alison was very safety cautious.

It was the right choice! First time in Amsterdam.. If like me, you were drumming up your list of things to see and do in Amsterdam for the first time, this should be on everybody's bucket list. Like many of you reading this, I booked the trip based on the reputation and quality of the tour on TripAdvisor and I'm pleased to say that this trip has fulfilled all of this and given so much more!I've done many tours in major cities and this ranks amongst the best. The guide Yuri is friendly, knowledgeable and passionate about Amsterdam. He is worth his weight in gold. The bikes were well looked after and the journey never felt rushed. The staff want you to have a great time and the whole experience had fun written all over it. This is the BEST way to see Amsterdam - the experience was very memorable. Thank you Joy Ride Tours!

Cheese, Clogs and windmills tour. We had a great time with our tour guide Yuri, he was full of real info about the beautiful city of Amsterdam and it's history. The 'townie' bikes are great. The tour lasted 5 hours but we never felt as if we were rushing from place to place....unlike other bike tours! I have been on several guided tours before but must admit this was my most memorable even with Yuri's jokes. I can HIGHLY reccommend this tour as one of the best in the city and also the meeting place was easy to find!

Awesome start to Amsterdam stay!. We did the Cheese & Clogs country tour - HIGHLY recommend! It was a fun, informative few hours and our guide Yuri made it a delightful time. It was a perfect balance between learning about the area and enjoying a fairly relaxed bike ride through some beautiful parts of Amsterdam that we wouldn't have otherwise ventured to. Agree with others that the cheese farm was indeed a little 'cheesy', but still OK, and you didn't feel you had to buy - not a big part of the trip either. Owner was happy to give recommendations for a variety of things when we returned the bikes too -- a super enjoyable time !!

Great! Just Don't Buy the Clogs. We took a Joy Ride tour last week, and it was lots of fun and very informative. We choose the clogs and cheese tour. You get to explore a bit of downtown Amsterdam, the park, suburbs and countryside (Amstelveen). The tour lasted about five hours, and there is a stop at a farm where you can buy homemade cheese (true) and homemade clogs (FALSE).After a brief tour of how cheese is made, and how the clogs are "homemade" and sold on premises, I made up my mind that was going to purchase and schlep clogs all over Europe for my nieces because I thought it would be a nice story. I found two pairs that looked nice. They both had flowers and looked as though the painting on the clogs was applied with a sticker and not by hand. I asked the man who showed us how clogs are made if the clogs I choose were actually made at the farm. He told me that they were made there and then they painted them and then applied a sticker on top for the intricate art detail. So I bought them. Packing up those clogs city to city was a real pain, but once again, I was excited to send them to my nieces with a note when I returned to the states telling them the cool story about how I biked to a clog farm and bought them HOMEMADE clogs.When I got home, I decided to look a little closer. There were barcode stickers on the inside of the clogs. I goggled the name of the company, and the clogs are actually mass-produced by this company: http://www.woodenshoes.com/Over-ons.aspx "THE LARGEST WOODEN SHOE FACTORY IN THE WORLD"Talk about a bait & switch. €21 a pair.I know that Joy Ride cannot control what I purchase, but they should be aware of this. The tour is called "cheese and clogs", right? I could've just had these mass-produced crap clogs shipped directly to my nieces instead of taking such care of them all over Europe. With all that aside, the ride was great. I'm just a little annoyed that I did not have an authentic experience. It's like buying Godiva and getting Hershey’s - leaves a bad taste in your mouth.

Fun bike tour. Enjoyed this tour a lot. Biking is a great way to see a lot in Amsterdam. I agree with the other reviewers that the cheese and clog stop was a little touristy but it is a very small part of the tour. Our guide was very helpful in making recommendations on where to eat and sites to see after the tour. She wanted to make sure we had a good time in Amsterdam.

Nice Country Ride. This bike tour was well organized and fun. Bikes were quickly distributed, a safety orientation was given and we were off through the Vondel Park. No busy streets until the end when riders were more acclimated to the bike and traffic. There were several stops to rest and listen to the guide talk- mostly interesting, but dragging on a bit much. We biked through several different areas- houseboats, woods, a lake, along the river. One rider had a flat tire which the guide took care of very efficiently with little inconvenience to the other riders. The only thing keeping this tour from an excellent rating for me was the stop at the cheese/wooden shoe farm. It was a blatant attempt to get you to buy something, and the "tour" of the premises was not very well done. How many folks on a bicycle are going to buy full size wooden shoes anyway? An alternative rest period could be a stop at a cafe, or even a picnic in a park. Overall, the tour was good, and I'd recommend it as a nice day out of the city.

Book! Book! Book!. My 19 year old daughter and I had the most fabulous cycle tour with Yuri this week. Having not been on a bike for years, I was a little nervous at the thought of 4 hours cycling but wow - I wish it could have gone on longer. Yuri, our guide, was a brilliant 'mother duck' and we little ducklings followed his lead through park, woodland, houseboat village, olympic park/rowing lake, cheese farm, windmill and polder lands with not a worry in the world. Yuri was both entertaining and knowledgeable about the Netherlands and all that we saw and discussed. And if you're worried about the cycling - fear not! The saddles are well padded, the bikes easy to use and after a couple of initial wobbles your fears will quickly disappear (if you're a bit rusty like me!). We only wish it could have gone on longer - and that was even with Yuri giving us more time that the tour allowed. Don't miss this chance to get out of the city (as wonderful as it is) and get peddling. You really won't regret it.

Really relaxing, beautiful scenery,great to get of the city. This small company knows how to show you a good time! Bike seats are so comfy, Yuri the guide is a kiwi originally (awesome) but is so passionate abut his place it really shows he loves his job. It was great to get out of the bustling touristy city and out into the cool, green areas of Amsterdam, you get to see a calmer, more genuine side of what Amsterdam is all about. Learnt heaps about the history of places, tasted some awesome cheese, and really enjoyed the tranquility of being able to experience Amsterdam by bike. Awesome job Yuri and the team, highlight of our time in Amsterdam!

Fantastic Tour. A small company delivering a big tour. The bikes were new and in great shape. Some city riding but mostly country with great scenery. Yuri was a great tour guide. He was knowledgable about all aspects of the tour and other facts about Amsterdam. The Cheese and Clog stop was touristy but a very small part of the day. Make sure to bring food and water with you on the tour.

GREAT VALUE. A well organized excursion into the countryside. The owner was our guide and is extremely knowledgeable. Good bikes with bags and helmets on request and I would advise that you order a helmet ahead of time. The cheese and clog farm was a bit touristy but the scenery and history made up for this. You don't need be an expert but you need to be familiar with riding a bike in the city and country. They don't provide water so make sure you bring your own.

A highlight of your vacation in Amsterdam. What great guys they are! A cool and small team, far away from the big guys in Amsterdam tourist industry - in a positive way. They dont oversell their tours just to the squeeze the maximum amount of possible $$ out of it, they actually care more that you really see some new faces of amsterdam, that you have not been aware before (most likely). The bikes are VERY comfortable ( I am searching the whole time for a model i cant afford, as riding my one bike doesnt satisfy me anymore...), Juri was well-knowledged, super easy to go with, a nice and funny guy that has so many great stories to tell. Do yourself a favour and avoid the mass-tourist-tours with +30 riders, they arent fun for anyone - Joy Ride Tours are perfectly spent 4 hours of your Amsterdam Holidays. Dont sit on the fence anymore, go and order your tickets and literally "generate" one of your trip highlights.

AMAZING:D. MUST DO! very great tour! Our tour guide Yuri did a great job! He told us lots of stories about Amsterdam. The ride is easy and in a relaxing pace. The bikes they provided are comfy and safe. There's bag on the bike so don't worry about your belongings. Just remember to bring your own water and food for lunch:) p.s. the tour meet at 10:15 at the "I AMSTERDAM" sign, there's not many people near the sign, so it's the best time to take photo with "I AMSTERDAM"!!

Number One Family Activity In Amsterdam. Along with our two sons (ages 16 and 12) we participated in the countryside tour lead by Yuri. What a wonderful way to become familiar with Amsterdam and to learn a piece of its history. Yuri's insights engaged all of us - even our twelve year old. It provided a more meaningful understanding to our visit here. Plus, the biking was so much fun and not difficult. Remember to being your own lunch and drinks. Note, you can always pick up good sandwiches at the meeting point behind the museum. The bikes have saddle bags for carrying items. Also, after the tour we had the opportunity to speak with the owner of Joy Rides who provided additional insight and ideas for our visit. We did this the our first full day in Amsterdam and the timing couldn't have been better.

Lovely tour!. This is a great tour for getting out of the city and seeing what other things are in Amsterdam other than the red light district. As two 18 year olds we really enjoyed this tour, we had a great time. It was really interesting, we were worried about the pace of cycling but it literally is a leisurely bike ride around the beautiful sites.Our tour guide (Uri) was really funny and interesting, and made the tour better as he kept making jokes about the sights. The cheese and clogs part is quite good aswell, a nice break between the tour.I would definitely recommend this tour as a good day out, everything is so relaxed and lovely, it's a really good thing to take part in when you go to Amsterdam.

"Best thing I've ever done in Amsterdam!". Having been to Amsterdam twelve or so times I thought it was about time I hoped on a bike. I’m so glad I chose joy ride tours for my first Amsterdam cycle experience. As a single traveller I was made to feel welcome and included without anything being to OTT. We meet Alison (who runs the business with her husband) outside the Rijksmuseum as advised when booking after a few minutes’ walk around the corner we were taken to our bikes, not having ridden for about ten years I was a bit apprehensive but it all turned out fine as we made a short ride to Vondelpark where we were given some historical and interesting info by Alison. We then headed off through the park and off to see some rather posh house boats, the 1928 Olympic stadium, then into the Amsterdam woods. After another quick stop and more interesting, if gruesome facts we were off out into the Dutch country side. I have to say this was amazingly beautifully, although I’m sure the lovely sunny weather helped! We visited a farm, which for me was a bit naff, the supposed crazy farmer was clearly going through the motions which the American tourists seemed to love, but hey each to their own and all. We then headed off along the Amstel (I think) river and back towards Amsterdam, this is where things got a little hairy, if you’re not used to Dutch road cycling! It was really fun though if a little scary. I’ll defiantly be doing the tour again next time I’m in Amsterdam. The only way this tour could be improved is if the guys charged more, went further out into the countryside and including their love and knowledge of food and restaurants by including lunch in the tour, all in all though an amazingly good value for money tour which I’d highly recommend. P.S there are two toilet stops on the tour.

Perfect way to see the countryside!. My husband and I decided to test our luck with bike riding in amsterdam. We didn't feel comfortable going out and renting our own bike, so we booked the windmills, cheese and clog factory bike tour. The bikes were in amazing shape and our guide was super informative. We loved getting to see the outskirts of the city, especially the trails alongside the river. The owner also was wonderful and gave us a sheet full of great restaurant recommendations. Definitely a great add-on to our trip.

Wonderful Experience. This was one of our favourite activities from our trip to Amsterdam. My husband and I both loved this tour. The tour guide was great, stopping lots and sharing all kinds of information. Some of the information was relevant to the site we were pausing at, and others were just bits of informational trivia. We even had an opportunity to stop at a less popular 'I Amsterdam' sign for a photo op. Don't be too concerned about the stressfulness of the bike ride, it was a slow, relaxing bike ride on an almost flat terrain. Perfect for almost any fitness level. The bikes were in excellent condition!! One thing to note is that the Cheese and clog section of the tour is almost secondary, not the focus. If that is something that you really want to spend a lot of time on, you may want to look into another tour.I could not recommend this tour more! Book it today!

Bike ride in holland country side. Fun and exciting bike ride. It is 12miles but the guide makes time fly away. Guide is very friendly and helpful. It's nice not to be in the city with all of the cars.

Very cool day out. Tour covers good ground at an easy pace, with plenty of stopping to take in the sites. Sites include some city places of interest, but mostly country sites - windmill, cheese-and-clog farm, polder, beautiful forest. Yuri has loads of interesting facts, stories, and cheesy jokes to keep all types entertained; it makes for a nice change of pace from the rest of the city. Def one of the best things you can do with a single day in Amsterdam. Bikes have a carry bag; bring snacks.

relaxing ride. this tour didn't really have the wow factor, what this tour gives you is a nice, quite bike ride through parts of amsterdam you normally wouldn't venture out and see on your own. our guide yuri did a great job with giving us fun stories and information along the way. he did everything he could to make sure everyone was having a great time, which for me is important. perhaps the cheese and clog farm is a bit touristy, but (we are tourists) it was fun none the less and the cheese was delicious (can't go wrong there). i was also a big fan of the saddle bag they provide with your bike, which i found to be extremely useful. i would recommend this tour if you are visiting amsterdam and would like to bike away from the busy life of the city center.

Beyond our expectations. We visited Amsterdam in July and had prebooked the classic tour through Joy rides web site. We met our guide (Yuri) at the designated meeting point. (The Iamsterdam sign in museumplain) Yuri was an excellent guide informative, fun and friendly. First we were off to get the bicycles which was a short walk. The bikes are comfortable and you ride sitting upright. Then it was off to Vondelpark, where we had a fun "history lesson". We had multiple stops along our 4-5 hour tour where Yuri served us fun and informative stories. We had some longer stops at a beautiful bridge, a sluice system, lake with house boats, a cheese factory/clog factory (with an over the top intens owner), windmill, and multiple other stops along the road. The pace is nice, and you don't need to struggle to keep up. Very safe. At the end of our trip those interested would receive recommendation for restaurants in Amsterdam.Easily 5 stars. They go beyond what that could be expected.

A fun way to learn about Amsterdam. I really enjoyed the tour with Yuri! It was a great way to see the countryside surrounding Amsterdam and learn more about Dutch history and culture. As other reviewers have said, the cheese/clog factory was very touristy but I enjoyed it all the same...especially the gouda samples! Taking this bike tour was a great way to spend a morning/early afternoon.

Nice day in the countryside. We enjoyed the bike tour with Yuri. The countryside was beautiful, but we could have done without the cheese and clog factory, as it was definitely a tourist trap. As others have mentioned, it would have been nice to stop for lunch somewhere along the way (maybe do that instead of visiting the factory!), but otherwise, we enjoyed the tour.

Highlight of our trip!. Just go ahead and book this tour and you will be glad you did. Great activity for our family of 4 with teenagers. Everyone thanked me for booking this for us and enjoyed spending quality time seeing things we could never experience on our own. A very welcome break from the hustle and bustle of the city.

An easy and enjoyable tour. My wife and I did this tour. There were about 14 in the group and we were led by Uri. It was a pretty easy ride – it went along at a relaxed paced and along a very flat route. Most of the time was on bike paths so the traffic was not a worry. The bikes were very comfortable and well maintained. We saw a lot of the countryside on the tour and had a few interesting stops along the way. Uri was very informative although at times he seemed to ramble a bit, but this probably reflected his relaxed and friendly approach. There are no food stops along the way, so we were glad that we had taken some snacks with us. I would highly recommend this tour as a way to see some places that are a bit different from central Amsterdam.

Awesome way to see Amsterdam. My sister and I had an awesome time on the Country Day tour, the weather held out and we got to see much of the city and countryside. The Townie bikes are well maintained and fun to ride too!

Good trip. The company is opened by Shaun and Allison. They are well regarded in the reviewsThe bikes are cruiser tiles . 7 speed clunkers. But this is standard for Holland. They do the job.The tour included old and new sluice gates on the canals. Interesting. Views of pumping stations and a polder which is how the reclaim land. InterestingExternal view of a old style windmill. Would have liked and inside view.Visit to a cheese and clog farm. Interesting in its own way. Some folk thought it was touristy and tackyA ride through canals, the Amstel, normal houses and millionaires row. Interesting.Negatives. it would have been nice to see in the old windmill. The tour went to 3 pm and they did not go anywhere for lunch. Be warned BYOOur guide Uri tended to ramble and was not as knowledgable as he should be. Nice person however helpful and pleasant and a really nice bloke.I would recommend this tour over its competitors but ask for the tour with Shaun/Allison the owners

Great Day Out. We have not been on bikes for years but decided to take a chance and have a go at this tour so that we would see Amsterdam from a different aspect. Our guide met us at the appointed time and looked after our group of thirteen people very well. The bikes were in excellent condition and were very easy to ride.We started our tour by going through a large park where the guide stopped and explained some of the history of the place. We saw house boats, the canal locks, the Polders fields, and the countryside. We stopped at a cheese and clog making farm and tasted the cheeses. The people here were very nice.The only slight drawback is that there is no stop for coffee or something to eat. The tour starts at 10.30 and finishes around 3.30 so it is a long time to go without food. We did bring a snack as recommended by other tripadvisor reviewers but there was very little opportunity to eat it and it seems rude to eat in front of the others in the group when they had no food. I would recommend the company to include a twenty minute stop for a coffee somewhere and make this an even better day out. This was a great tour and we were very pleased we decided to do it.

Great way to see Amsterdam. Definitely a great way to see Amsterdam. There were 10 in our group so nice and small. The tour guide was from Australia but he was very informative and made for a wonderful day. We started in the city and rode out to the country side, stopping at several locations where our tour guide told stories and information about Amsterdam. We ended up at a dairy farm where we tasted cheese and saw clogs get made. Rode past an old windmill and then back to Amsterdam a different way. It was pretty easy ride so you don't have to be an experienced rider. I highly recommend this trip you will not regret it.

Best thing to do in Amsterdam!. The bike experience in Amsterdam is almost a must try. Still, I wasn't very convinced that I could make it since I didn't ride a bike in a long time. All my doubts vanished as I started pedaling with the rest of the group (a diverse small group of many ages, nationalities and biking skills - some with the same fears I had).We took the countryside tour, visiting a cheese and clog factory and an old windmill. The views were fantastic and the weather was really good on that day so we enjoyed even more. The guide was very informative of the places and the dutch culture.Summing up, the tour was absolutely wonderful, the better experience in our Amsterdam trip. I totally recommend taking a Joy Ride Tour.

Perfect day trip. Good value.. My wife and I very much enjoyed this tour. It was a great way to experience some of what Amsterdam has to offer outside of the city center. Our tour group was small (15), and our guide was helpful and informative. It's a small, family-run business. You can tell that they genuinely care about providing a safe, fun experience. Definitely bring water, a snack, and a camera.

Lots of fun!. We had a fantastic time on our Cheese, Clogs, and Windmill tour! We were lucky to have glorious weather, which made the easy ride even more fun! The tour is well run, the bikes are all good quality, and the ride is lovely. A couple bits of advice: bring snacks or lunch and a water bottle. The small bites of cheese at the farm do not constitute a snack. You need to bring your own. If you are lucky enough to have a sunny day, bring sunscreen too.

Great tour!. My husband and I loved the country tour with Uri (sp?). I was a little nervous about biking 12 miles, but the tour was so fun I hardly noticed how far we'd biked! Great information, and we loved that we took a bike tour in Amsterdam, since the bikes rule the streets there! Very fitting!

Excellent tour!. I booked the private tour. It was a little more expensive, but totally worth it! Petra was our guide and she was great, very informative, with a great sense of humor, and at the end she even had a few good tips, such as visiting a nearby city, Zaanse Schans, and see working windmills! Overall, just the perfect way to get to know the city!Eu fiz o tour privado com meu marido, foi um pouco mais caro mas valeu muito a pena.A nossa guia foi a Petra, e ela foi ótima, nos passava muitas informações relevantes, tinha um ótimo senso de humor e nos deu boas dicas, como visitar a cidade de Zaanse Schans para ver moinhos em funcionamento.Enfim, é o melhor jeito de se conhecer a cidade!

Beautiful day in Holland. We took the Cheese and Clogs Tour and had a great time. The bike ride is a 22 km tour just outside Amsterdam through beautiful countryside full of canals, lakes, windmills and much more. No matter what level of fitness you are, don' be concerned about the distance. The pace is slow with lots of stops. The terrain is level. The bikes are new "Townie" cruiser bikes in perfect condition with very comfortable seats. The bikes have a pannier (saddle bag) to store your rainwear or water or whatever so you don't have to worry about carrying what stuff you bring along.The folks at Joy Ride couldn't be more fun and helpful. Yurt (sp?) the guide is entertaining and knowledgeable. At the end of the tour when you return the bikes the owner Sean gives you great advice on restaurants and things to do in Amsterdam. These guys run a great operation. Give yourself a break from all the fun mania in Amsterdam and take a nice easy fun bike ride in the country.

Dutch Culture Brought to Life (for Pedalers of All Skill Levels). My wife and I are hosting a visitor from abroad and found the Country Tour to have plenty to offer for all of us - whether a tourist from the US seeing Holland for the first time or two expats that have been in Amsterdam for 2.5 years.I don't like to give too much away, as I think not knowing what's around each bend adds much to the pleasure of this experience. For starters, the group included short and tall people and young and old people, many of which had not been on a bike for some period. JRTs has bikes of all sizes and the pace is incredibly relaxed - no one had any problems with the physical part of the tour.The attractions were great - at the expense of learning about Amsterdam in particular, we learned about the Dutch and how they used ingenuity and practicality over the last 800 years to develop their own unique way of live. Yuri guided us through the sun, wind and shade and a wonderful variety of architecture, agriculture, industry, and culture. He was entertaining throughout and kept the history lessons amusing and light-hearted. Sean, the owner, was also incredibly helpful and accommodating and made use each feel like valued customers.Upon logging in to TA to leave this review, I was so pleasantly surprised to see JRT as the #2 attraction in A'dam. I'm so glad to see JRT getting the recognition it deserves here on TA.Take the tour! And when you do so, make sure to bring layers (even on a beautiful day, the wind can be nuisance) and also bring some water and a snack. By the time we made it to the cheese factory, we were very grateful for the Albert Hein sandwiches and sliced fruits we'd brought along in advance. And it's also probably useful to know that you definitely should make a reservation in advance, and I recall Sean offering before we got started to store some personal items for customers in case they had things they prefer not to take on the tour.

awsome, brilliant, fantastic.... My Wife, 11 year old daughter and I took the Cheese, Clogs and Windmill Tour today. We had Yuri (hope that's the way its spelt) as our guide who for a Kiwi had a great knowledge of the area. We would highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see the countryside and a cheese/clogs factory.. (Guy at clog factory needs to probably stay in the workshop and not interact with customers). Bikes were brilliant all lightweight and modern very comfortable cruiser style. Small group and regular interaction made the tour very personable.

Best way to see Holland. I took the countryside tour in May 2013, and I really enjoyed this tour, despite getting soaked by the wonderful Northern Europe weather. The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. This tour is worth every penny, and of course Amsterdam is the best bicycle city in the world.

100% local way to experience Amsterdam. We really wanted to do a more relaxing yet active tour of Amsterdam without walking for hours. Joy Ride Tours was the perfect fit. With Amsterdam being a total cycling city, it was the perfect way to feel local and get the right of way of the road after day of running over by them cyclist. You ride from Amsterdam and out onto the suburbs/countryside, so we got to experience the torturous, slow city-riding to a more relaxed riding adventure with nature as we strolled along. 100% worth it and totally affordable. On a side note, the owner was 100% accommodating in our group of 4 . I thought we booked for a Thursday tour, when in fact we booked a Friday tour (european calendars starts with Mondays and American calendars starts with Sunday, so I had no idea until we showed up); the owner let us join them for the day since they had spots to go even though we put them one over the limit. They did ask the group if it was ok to go over the limit though (so thank you to our group too), so you know when they say small group of 15, they keep their words!

A perfect break from the city. Amsterdam is full of hustle and bustle, which is good but you really owe it to yourself to take a breather from it all, hop on a bike and head out of town for a bit. A trip with Joy Ride was an ideal day out. Small group, great bikes, friendly guide and beautiful scenery. What more could you want?

Outstanding fun day of cycling. I had an amazing day cycling with Allison. The 22km zoom by and are not at all arduous. You will have sensational fun and see things you would miss without a great guide to point you in the right direction.

The right choice for a bike tour in Amsterdam. Great team, though rather small, they run everything perfectly smooth... The bikes are in very good condition and Yuri the guide does a great job giving the right amount of information with a smile.This is a good way to see some parts of Amsterdam and a taste of the countryside.

A Fabulous Ride. My husband and I took the Cheese, Clogs and Windmill Tour earlier this week and had a fabulous time. We would highly recommend this tour to anyone wanting to see the countryside. We had Yuri and Allison as our guides (great job on leading your first tour, Yuri!!). They both did a fine job and made sure that everyone felt safe and confident during the tour. The equipment is top notch and while I worried about the length of the tour (22 km), I never felt rushed or that I would fall behind. We had some very informative stops along the way and a longer stay at the Cheese and Clog farm. This gave us the perfect break to eat the small lunch we packed for the trip. The bikes are equipped with a saddlebag, so it is easy to bring along something to bring your energy level back up. We would go again in the future, for sure!!!!

Best Part of Our Amsterdam Visit. My husband and I took the Countryside Joyride tour yesterday, and agree it was our favorite part of our visit to the city. Our Guides, Allison and Yuri, were sweet, knowledgeable, and professional - we couldn't have expected anything better. I was a bit nervous going in, as I'm not athletic and 22K sounds pretty far with no backup! But the trip was easy, and if anything, we were sad to see it end. Since tour sizes are kept small, with a guide in front and back, it was easy to keep up. You never go very fast, and there are breaks every 20 minutes or so yo see points of interest, learn about sites, and take pictures. Allison was very good at making sure everyone had their pictures taken, what angle was good, etc. The cheese and clog stop was so funny, and a lovely break in the middle of the day. Bring water and a snack or lunch. Oh, and the bikes were new, comfortable, and super easy to ride. We would go again in a heartbeat.
Excellent tour. A must do tour if u r going to amsterdam. I will book this tour again if I have a chance to go back to amsterdam.

highly recommended! :). me and my hubby enjoyed the countryside ride..it was a lovely weather on a sunday..alison is a knowlegeable n pleasant lady who shared alot of interesting stories with us at each stop. cheesefarm is a bonus though we didnt see the actual cheesemaking as its supposed to be sterile. we seldom cycle..but after doing 10 miles in e tulip fields last week..this 22km is not a problem..except riding thru e city especially on e return trip thru the sunday crowds is challenging..we were splitted by e traffic but thankfully there was always someone at e back with us when we went e wrong way.

A Joyous Ride with Joy Ride Tours!. This is a wonderful way to see the countryside and enjoy biking near Amsterdam with knowledgeable leaders and interesting attractions. My family took the one day countryside ride, including a visit to a cheese farm. We got to taste the wonderful aged cheese and watched them make future batches. The trip is well paced and good for all levels of rider. If you enjoy seeing a city and the surrounding countryside on two wheels then you should definitely make time in your travel plans for this adventure!

Great time. We did the countryside tour with Adam and had a great time. While I think the tour would benefit from a little less chatting and a lunchtime food stop, overall we still had a great time. The countryside is absolutely magnificent and Adam was a very friendly and knowledgeable guide. Highly recommended.

Absolutely Joyride!!. You must ride a bike when in Amsterdam! We took the Countryside Tour which was so much fun! Adam was our guide & he was really terrific! In my opinion, taking a countryside tour as opposed as the city tour was much better because you don't have to deal with as many stop & go's with the stoplights, the multitude of bike riders & waiting for your group to through all the city stoplight etc. We took a very easy path out of the city with some stops for historical insights. We also stopped at a Cheese (delicious) & Clog Farm. The bike ride itself was not in the least bit strenuous at all. It was a fabulous time!

On a scale of one to five, this is a six!. As many of others have said here, this was one of the highlights of a recent trip to Amsterdam. I take that back. Hands down, this was the best thing I did there. And yes, that includes the coffee shops. We did the country tour as part of a group with Alison as our guide (their last group tour of the year). A knowledgable, engaging and humorous individual, she did an excellent job of orienting us to the city as well as the beautiful countryside and showed us another side of Amsterdam and the surrounding areas that we have never gotten to see or appreciate. The trip of 22 kilometers was well-paced, with plenty of stops, explanations, responses to questions, bathroom break, etc. Parks, a windmill, cheesemaking, clog making, canals, birds, levees and boathouses! Fortuitously, we did the tour early in our visit, which provided an excellent overview and tons of info that we wouldn't have had otherwise. Alison and her husband, Sean, also gave us handouts of their favorite places which proved helpful in providing new ideas on places to go or validating other recommendations that we already had. While we are regular but casual bikers, do not be intimidated at all by what might seem to be a long trip (it's not). It's done over a period of four hours or so and is paced in a way that literally anyone who can ride a bike will be able to do this. The terrain is flat and the equipment is really good. If this wasn't the last group tour of the year and if the private tours weren't fully booked, I would have booked other excursions with them during the course of our stay. Alison and Sean: thank you so much! Great job.

It's a must do!!. This tour was one of the best things my hubby and I had done in Amsterdam. We were lucky to have Adam as our tour guide! He is very knowledgeable and added a new view of the city for us. We totally loved the cheese and clogs farm...oh gosh, I loved petting the calves...so cute!! What amazed me was that my husband loved the tour. He was skeptical at first, when I invited him to go with me, because he doesnt like riding bikes, but when he met Adam, I could feel he felt more confortable. Thank you Adam for all your attention and parience with us!! I will definitely recommend this tour to all my friends going to Amsterdam!

Best Bike Tour!. I absolutely loved this bike tour. Our guide was a cute Aussie guy named Adam who was oh so super nice and charming. He knew so much about the city and we rode through the beautiful countryside. It's kind of shocking thinking about how the the entire city was man-made on top of swamps. We rode through the city and stopped the windmills where we sampled some great cheese. Of course we saw windmills and even saw an area where the luxury houseboats were docked. Everyone who went on the tour was really friendly and the staff provided us with maps and directions to our next destination after our ride was over. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who visits Amsterdam!

Excellent way to see the real Amsterdam. We chose the country tour which started from the 'Museumplein' at 10:30am and lasted for between 4-5 hours. Our guide Adam was on time, friendly, knowledgable and very engaging - he kept the whole group entertained. Adam also looked after the group very well and made sure we were all OK, one of the group did have a problem with the chain but this was easily and quickly sorted out by Adam and we were soon on our way again. There was seven in our group. Would highly reccommend this tour.

A'DAM rules!. We took the country tour with Adam - lovely chap with an entertaining quality and somehow he managed to move all 18 of us safely through our 4.5 hr. journey. This is a brilliant way to see the other side of Amsterdam and the meeting place is right in the heart of the city. Ride on!

Great bike tour the best thing we did in Amsterdam. Myself and a group of family and friends booked a private bike tour for 12 people, it was really really good fun and Alison was a brilliant guide. We did the country tour it was a really nice way to see other parts of Amsterdam and the guide gave lots of information about the history of Amsterdam and also lots of good advice on where to eat/visit etc. Everyone in the group really enjoyed it, the ages of the group ranged from 23-36 and we would all definitely do it again if we visited Amsterdam. The bikes are so easy to ride and its so flat that you don't need to be a fitness fanatic to enjoy it. If you have a big group id definitely recommend booking a private tour.

Enjoyable adventure to the countryside. We took the country tour with Adam and it was a lot of fun to see a different side of the city other than the city center. The company was very flexible because I had to reschedule to another day and they were fully accommodating. The owner made sure that I was comfortable and able on the bike, which I wasn't initially since I haven't been biking for a while. I am a wobbly rider and except for a few stretches of the tour where we had to ride next to cars and traffic, I felt that most of the ride was very relaxing and comfortable. We made several picturesque stops and at each stop Adam would fill us in on some facts about the city. We also stopped at the cheese and clogs shop, which was fine for the most part except for the clogs guy who was a bit creepy (you know...like that weird uncle at family reunions). Anyhow, with most tours it's usually the tour guide who makes or breaks the experience, and Adam definitely showed us a good time with his enthusiasm and thoughtfulness! After we got back to the shop, the owner came out and helped us with any other information we may need about the city. He was really helpful with the questions we had. These are really great guys and the tour was a good value as well. Highly recommend even though I don't like biking!

A must do!. The highlight of our trip! Had great fun cycling round Amsterdam and definitely the best way to see the city! The guide was great fun and gave us great knowledge of the city we wouldn't have otherwise known. Even finished off with a group beer which was a nice touch. Thoroughly recommended!

Peaceful break from the city... My friend and I thoroughly enjoyed the city tour last Saturday. We were in a group of about 12 people of all ages and nationalities. Our tour guide was Adam who was enthusiastic and made everyone feel welcome and included. We rode the 20kms at a steady pace on very comfortable bikes, stopping at about 5 different points of interest.My favourite part was cycling through the peaceful forest area where it felt safe to ride alongside other members of the group and chat. We stopped at a picturesque farm where we were given a cheese and clog making demonstration, which was ok.Overall, the trip provided a peaceful break from the lively city and I learnt a lot of interesting historical facts from Adam, the fabulous guide who is a true credit to the company!

Lovely way to experience Amsterdam. My husband and I went on the Clogs, Windmill&Cheese Tour with Adam and we loved it. The tour is 4h30 long and starts with Vondel park then takes you out of the city passing along house boats, through a large park, by a windmill and stopping at a cheese farm before taking the Amstel river banks back to the city.We stopped along the way and Adam would talk about the history of Amsterdam and the different places we saw. We liked the way he told the different stories and feel we learned a lot about the city from him.The cheese farm tour was nice but the farmer who did the tour had a funny sense of humor and was a bit commercial, but we enjoyed it non the less.The biked were very comfortable but watch out for the grease on the chain, it can easily get on your clothes if you don't pay attention. Adam was very accommodating with participant who had problems either by trading his bike or lending them a sweater.Be sure to bring a sandwich and some water, you can store them in the packs attached to the bike. We had good weather, but in case of colder weather gloves and a hat as well as warm clothes are a must. One of the best tour experiences we ever had!

Awesome tour. This tour is ideal for Day #1 or #2 of your trip, as the guide will tell you alot about Amsterdam, what to do and what to see, as well as what the locals do - and you will start to see what he has been talking about during your next few days touring Amsterdam. If you take this tour only at the end of your trip in Amsterdam, it would be a waste of all the knowledge gained not being put in practice!The guide (we got Adam) brought us around the countryside for a great view of out-of-city- Amsterdam. We took the Cheese, clogs, and windmill tour - I didn't like the cheese and clogs factory as i found it incredibly touristy - but the route we took to-and-from the factory more than made up for that! The scenery was beautiful and the windmill was totally picturesque, better so if there is good weather!Note that when booking online, you will be asked to Print out the receipt upon online payment - however that is not necessary so long as you have identification with you - as many tourists will not have access to a printer.At the end of the tour, you will be given a map and a list and description of good things to eat/see/do specially recommended by Joy Ride Tours, which is another reason why I recommend scheduling this cycling tour at the start (rather than in the middle/at the end) of your trip to Amsterdam - there is great fun in hunting down the recommendations!Important NOTE: the meeting point is at Museumplein (It is directly behind the Rijks Museum, BETWEEN the Cobra Cafe and the Museum Shop, near to the northeast end of the long pool). Take careful note of that!!! If you miss the tour, you can rebook it without extra charge provided the session for that day is not fully booked.

We loved the city tour!. Myself and 2 friends were in Amsterdam for 1 day at the end of July 2012 and thought a bike tour would be a good way to see the city... We were right! And we are so happy that we chose The Joy Ride City Tour. The couple that owns the company leads the tours and were both so nice and full of knowledge! It lasted a few hours and we got to see all the main sights in the city, they even bought us a Dutch treat along the way and our whole group stopped for a drink afterwards. I would definitely recommend Joy Ride!

Wonderful way to see the city & get out into the countryside!. Our family of three, including a teen, went on the city tour with Petra on our second day in Amsterdam. It was a great introduction to the city, and we learned more about its history than we expected on a bike tour. Petra was an amusing guide, so we all had a lot of fun. Also really enjoyed stopping at the brewery near the windmill. The perfect intro to Amsterdam! A couple days later we took the country tour with Allison. Despite a few showers, we enjoyed riding through the countryside – a more relaxed ride with scenery much different than the city. We had rain jackets, but Allison had ponchos for those who didn’t. We’d recommend bringing food on the country tour, which is longer and runs during the lunch hour. You can picnic at the cheese farm, where the tour stops along the way. Highly recommend Joy Ride and both tours if you have the time. As a side note, we rode bikes in four cities on our trip and the ones from Joy Ride were the most comfortable and in the best condition.

4 Hours of Heaven. We loved every minute and will treasure the freedom this tour gave us to see sooooo much more of Amsterdam and it's countryside. My 10 year old daughter was with me and we completed without any problem and thoroughly enjoyed. The stops were well placed and very interesting and the cheese and clog tour were worthwhile. Joyce is lovely and a real cool girl, she is on the ball and very helpful. We will definaly repeat this experience when we are back in Amsterdam .

Great tour!. We did the Cheese, Clogs and Windmills tour and had a great time! It took a lot of us a little bit to get used to the bikes, you're sitting upright rather than leaning forward, but they took very little effort to pedal and Amsterdam and it's surrounds are quite flat so it's a very easy ride overall. There are quite a few stops along the tour including a houseboat community, Olympic rowing lake, windmill, cheese and clogs farm, and a garden, at which the tour guide spent quite a bit of time explaining the history and significance of each area. Since the tour goes over the lunch period, I would recommend bringing a snack and drink as we were quite hungry by the end! Each bicycle has a large zippered bag on the side to store your belongings which is great. We purchased our tickets a few days in advance (it saves you a few Euros to purchase online) and found the tour meeting point easily enough, near the "IAmsterdam" sign behind the Rjiks Museum. I would highly recommend this tour, particularly if it's your first time to Amsterdam.

One of the best parts of the trip!. We had a tour with Adam and it was fantastic! We had amazing weather and a small group (8 people). We did the countryside tour and got to see a lot of Amsterdam as well as the countryside. I thought the cheese farm was great, despite very weird staff, and the cheese was amazing. Adam was very knowledgable and funny and it was just so nice to spend a beautiful day riding around their city on new bikes. Would absolutely recommend it!

Joy Ride Tours -- an excellent diversion in the countryside for a day. We pre-booked our bike tour with Joy Ride in advance. We easily found the meeting place and were part of about 15 people for the day's ride. The leader was "Petra" who was beyond enthusiastic, to say the least. She was full of information and clearly enjoyed leading the bike tours, chatting with people, etc. She made a few stops along the way (there and back) to provide a historical perspective on Amsterdam as well as an overview of what we were seeing. She was open to any questions one would have and made the visit "come alive". The trip to the cheese farm was much better than the cheese farm itself which was a little "cheesey" (excuse the pun). The farmer was a little creepy and clearly held the monopoly on being the closest cheese farm to the city as there were 2-3 other bike tour groups onsite at the same time. I could have easily skipped the cheese farm visit but it served as our ultimate destination so it was hard to avoid it, but it didn't detract from the enjoyment of the day on the bike and in the countryside. We saw things we would never have otherwise seen and the price was quite reasonable. Would definitely recommend, but don't expect much at the cheese farm other than a toilet stop and a "cheesey" gift shop.

Lovely Country Bike Tour. What a nice way to spend a few hours! Having already explored the city for a few days, we found this tour to be a perfect way to see the parks and outskirts of the city. The tour was well organized with a quick walk to where the bikes were kept. Sean and Allison were well organized and fit us all to the right size bikes It was an easy ride and our guide, Petra, was very energetic and full of lots of fun facts about Amsterdam and its history. There were about a dozen of us on the ride, and the pace was good. The stop at the farm to see the clog and cheese making was not so memorable - our personal preference would have been to skip this part and have a longer ride, but all in all it was a very worthwhile tour. Thanks to the Joy Ride team for the lovely tour.

Fantastic Time !. Geoff and I have visited Amsterdam many times and experienced many of the bike tours on offer. We particularly liked this tour as our guide, Petra (hope I got the right spelling!) was very informative and fun. She was always checking she had all her 'ducklings' with her and judged the pace of the ride very well, nobody felt that they couldn't keep up or that it was too slow. We chose the country tour and took a really great route through the forest area which we had never done before and it was great. We felt that we had really seen a different part of Amsterdam.We went on this ride on our Silver Wedding Anniversary and at the end the owner arrived with a bottle of champagne for us ! A really nice gesture from a really nice group of people.Would certainly recommend this tour.Sue & Geoff

Great tour guides, and great way to see the city. I did the city tour and it was great! Amsterdam is a very bike friendly city, and there are no hills, so this is a great tour for just about anyone who is able to ride a bike. Allison, our tour guide, was very friendly and informative, and there was a good balance between biking and sightseeing. We ended our tour with a beer, which gave us a great chance to talk to others on the tour, and to take a break for pictures. Overall, one of the best parts of my trip to Amsterdam!

Great way to see the city and learn some history. As a family of four, with two teenagers, we love bike tours as they provide the best way to see the sights, learn some history and interact with our guides. With this company, the email communication in advance of the tour was fantastic. We decided to go on two tours. First up was the City tour with Shawn. He was extremely knowledgeable and in addition to providing contemporary history, also gave us a snapshot of the history of Amsterdam for the past 400 years. Traveling by bike in Amsterdam is very safe as you have your own bike lanes rather than riding on the road. Our country tour was given by Adam. This was a more relaxing scenic tour ultimately ending at a farm where they made clogs and cheese. While also enjoyable, a lot of the history of Amsterdam was a repeat of what we had learned from the City tour. Not sure if I can recommend going on both tours for only that one reason. I highly recommend this company though for at least one of the trips. Do also recommend grabbing something to eat before either of the trips.

Great way to discover Amsterdam. I visited Amsteram for a long weekend and did both the City Tour and the Country tour - both of which were brilliant and one of my favourite things I have done in recent travels. City tour is great to get your bearings and then going into the country is very relaxing. Great people on the tour and fantastic guides.

really great day. We can't say how much we enjoyed our tour - we had a great day - a knowledgeable , friendly tour leader with a good itinerary . They were extremely helpful ( when they learn't that we had been unable to book in for the tour we had wanted to do - the owner sat down and helped us work out how we could do it by ourselves )

Dutch country-side biking - doesn't get any better!. A great way to spend four hours! Adam was a great guide - friendly and knowledgeable. We enjoyed getting out of the city and seeing the Dutch country side. It's amazing to see how the land was reclaimed from the wetlands, learn how the Windmills worked, and see how the locks and canals work to control flooding and allow navigation. Visiting a farm and sampling delicious cheese was fun, too. The bikes were great, the route was easy and beautiful. Highly recommend!

Very fun!. It was a great experience, we met behind the "I am Amsterdam" sign and walked a few minuted to where they have the bikes, great new bikes and surprisingly very comfortable :). Tour guide was very friendly, outgoing, and knowledgeable. If it rains they DO HAVE rain coats, may not be a good idea for younger children as you will ride between other bikes and cross the streets. It's a loooong ride... we started by passing though a beautiful park, a windmill, the beautiful green forest, and a few houses. Best part was the little family owned farm, make sure you buy some cheese! Its delicious!

Best day in Amsterdam. My 13 year old twins enjoyed this as did 45 year old me. It was nice to get out of the city and see the country like the natives. It is all flat and not terribly taxing although we were tired afterwards. We were lucky to have beautiful weather and our guide was very nice.

Great First Day. I strongly recommend doing this on your first day in Amsterdam. It's a great way to get the lay of the land, plus you learn where to go the rest of your trip. Bikes are the easiest way to get around the city so this is a great introduction. Make Allison take you to the Windmill bar for a pint. Perfect way to finish the tour, plus you get a lot more brave navigating the streets after a few beers.

Great tour!!. Awesome! Allison is a great tour guide, she’s very knowledgeable and shares a huge amount of information with great energy and enthusiasm. She was very interested in helping us learn about Amsterdam and giving us personal recommendations based on the interests of people in the tour. She spent a lot of time making sure each person had his or her questions (about the tour, Amsterdam in general, tips on places to go and things to see) answered fully. The bikes were very comfortable. It’s a fairly small group (about 10 people) so best to reserve in advance. The tour was all in English, and while the company has more than one guide, ours was an American who has lived in Amsterdam for 13 something years, so she was both easy to understand and very knowledgeable about Amsterdam. Would definitely recommend this tour, and if we return to Amsterdam it’s very likely that we would take a different tour with this same company!

Excellent way to see Amsterdam. We took a bike tour through the City with Petra. We were more than a little nervous due to the fact neither of us had ridden a bike for a good few years and the prospect of riding through the packed streets of Amsterdam, but we can honestly say it was the best thing we did whilst there. Petra was very informative and kept the tour fun throughout and we learnt so much about the city. The guide they give you at the end is excellent with lots of info and a map. Honestly could not fault the tour at all and we will give the countryside tour a go when we return.

Lovely day in the countryside. We went on the Joy Ride Countryside tour with Aussie Adam as our guide. It was a very easy ride (terrain as flat as a Dutch pancake!) through beautiful countryside. We were extremely lucky to have a bright sunny day with a fresh breeze, which made the ride that much more enjoyable. The bikes were comfortable and seemed well-maintained, and they had helmets available for those of us more used to riding through hair-raising NYC traffic. Adam was an engaging guide, full of interesting and well-presented historical information and anecdotes at our several stops along the way. My favorite was seeing the gorgeous houseboats and barges! At the end of the tour we were given Joy Ride's restaurant recommendations--we went to one for a late lunch directly after the ride and it was delicious! The only negative, and it is very slight and is really nothing to do with the ride or Joy Ride, is that the man who runs the cheese and clog farm where we stop for a taste and clogmaking demonstration, seemed certifiably crazy and more than a bit creepy. And this was noted independently by everyone on our tour, so it wasn't just me!! But this shouldn't stop you from taking this tour--a very professional organization, great guide, wonderful experience overall.

Excellent Way to See More of Amsterdam. Everything about this tour was great (right down to the weather, but I guess Joy Ride can't take credit for that!)Two tours are offered (city and country), and I had some difficulty choosing. In the end, I'm glad I went the country route. The roads were less crowded (with people and fellow bikers) and it was a wonderful way to see things outside of the city - from houseboats to a cheese/clog farm and some really beautiful scenery. Further on in Europe, I met some backpackers who took a city tour (not with Joy Ride) and they confirmed - it can be tough to maintain a peaceful "enjoy the outdoors" vibe when navigating the city streets.Adam was a terrific guide - fun, friendly, and informative. We took several bike tours during our trip to Europe and I can say that he was definitely most concerned about "the group", as a whole. For example, he would stop at intersection lights to make sure everyone could get through together. This sounds like a minor detail but think about what a pain it is to keep following someone when they get through the light and you don't!The tour seems to attract a lot of really nice people and we met some fun fellow travelers. Again, I think Adam set the tone by making introductions early on, and small talk about where people are from.Definitely the most (wholesome!) fun you can have in Amsterdam!

Bike Like a Local, and Loving Every Minute!. My daughter (29) and I took a Joy Ride bike tour last week into the Amsterdam countryside and it was one of the best things we did during our three days in Amsterdam. Our guide, Adam, was friendly, informative and full of interesting information regarding Amsterdam's history, The bicycles seemed new and in perfect condition. It was fantastic riding out into the countryside, through beautiful parks and along back roads. We also visited a windmill and cheese factory where they made clogs as well. Along the way, we stopped for photo ops and lots of interesting commentary from Adam. By the way, for those of you who are possibly concerned that the long bike ride will be difficult, I just want to add that the terrain is practically flat and we went at a very comfortable speed.Our Joy Ride tour was a wonderful way to see the outskirts of Amsterdam and I highly recommend it!

Excellent. No wonder the joy ride tours are getting such a nice feedback. We had a great countryside tour with Adam. He even told us some stories about dragons as we (to be honest only me) requested it. It's a must do if you are visiting Amsterdam, no matter how long you'll be staying. The countryside tour is so beautiful and relaxing as Amsterdam has a beauty beyond the canals and the too crowded places. Everything is flat, so you won't be tired after the tour. Book your tour and enjoy :)

Great way to get out of Amsterdam. I was in Amsterdam on business and wanted to see some of the surrounding countryside. This is an excellent way to do it. Adam is a friendly, knowledgeable guide, and he loves showing people around. The "rural" ride takes one through Vondel Park into the outskirts of the city. You see houseboats, windmills, and lots of picturesque vistas. The visit to the cheese factory is a bit "cheesy," and it would have been better to have just a bit more biking and fewer stops, but this is an excellent operation and a great way to get away from the touristy areas of Amsterdam. I highly recommend Joy Ride tours.

Thank you for a GREAT birthday!. My husband and I took a country tour with Adam on my 30th birthday and had an incredible time. Not only was he beyond patient (some members of our group were a bit unruly), but he was funny and kept spirits up, despite the fact that it POURED for almost all four hours. I couldn't have asked for a more memorable day! Thank you!! And thank you Sean and Alison for your flexibility. You didn't have to let us on the tour that day (we mixed up our dates), and we truly appreciated it. We wish you all the best!

Great Bike Tour. Did the "Clogs, Windmills and Cheese" tour of the countryside with our guide Adam (Aussie, as mentioned below). The tour is very easy and pleasant, I highly recommend it. We stopped several times and Adam would tell us all sorts of interesting information in English. The tour is 4.5 hours long though, so bring water and a snack/lunch, otherwise you will be famished. There is no real opportunity to buy this along the way. The only down part for me was the "clog maker" - he's too tacky, just hoping to sell you stuff. But other than that, definitely a worthwhile.

Wonderful Tour!. The tour was in July 2011. We had scheduled for a day that dawned raining in torrents, we went to the meeting place because they said they would come out even in bad weather, but the guide was kind and let us come back the next day because the forecast was for good weather. We came back the day after and luckily it was sunny. We strolled through a park, where there was a Picasso just there, out in the open, then went to see an old windmill and visited a farm where they made cheese and clogs (dutch wooden shoes). It was a wonderful ride, and the guide was perfect! I can't remember her name, but she was Adam's Australian cousin and very nice. Remember to book in advance, there are a limited number of people allowed in each tour.

Fun way to see the city. My wife and I went on the city bike tour and had a great time with our guide Petra. She is a local and made the tour lots of fun. We learned about different areas of the city through history and saw quite a lot of the major attractions. Petra also gave us some tips on how to see some of the museums and landmarks and avoid the long lines which was a great help. Stopped off for a quick beer at a nice bar by the water. All in all this was a nice little tour.

So much fun. My husband and i really wanted to experience the countryside in Amsterdam and thought a bike ride would be the best way to do that. We booked a private tour and loved every minute of it.We had a tour guide called Petra and she was amazing, we had so much fun and learnt so much about Amsterdam. If you are not that fit or worried about riding around Amsterdam (the only city in the world with more bikes than people) don’t worry. I never once felt scared and there are no hills in Amsterdam so fitness is not an issue. Not only did we have lots of laughs we got to experience some Dutch food and beers and got lots of photo opportunities especially in front of the windmills (which was my personal request). After the tour Petra marked a few places on our map which we did end up going to and really enjoyed. If you are looking at doing something different and fun I would totally recommend the Joy Ride Tours.

Fun and informative!. We did the afternoon city tour with Petra and all 4 of us enjoyed our experience. It was a relaxing afternoon full of laughs, beer, and a few good photo ops. You definitely gain a different perspective of Amsterdam on a bike and it should not be passed up! You will learn interesting facts about the city and ou will meet interesting folks from around the world...a definite must do!

Joyride .....awesome tour. I booked a joyride amsterdam city tour during my first trip to Amsterdam and boy was it worth my while. I played tour guide with friends from the info I learnt during the trip. Donthis first to get an orientation of the city but beware the Dutch cyclist (even the 80 year old ones) don't take too kindly to slow tourist types in the bicycle lanes. The tour was well paced, not strenuous and very informative. Our guide Petra was a good laugh. We could have done without the stop for a drink but that was just an opportunity to get to know the other riders. Group was small...only 10 people which was excellent. I will definitely recommend this to anyone who can ride a bicycle of course. Next time I will do the country tour. Well done joyride ... Fantastic way to see your beautiful city.

Do as the locals do, and bike Amsterdam!. There is no better way to see the sites and sounds of Amsterdam than by biking the city. The guide was friendly and enthusiastic, and the bikes were in great condition (if you have never been to Amsterdam then you will see once you get there why this is important).The tour was not quite as informative when compared with other tours that we have been on around Europe. However, it was a nice way to spend the afternoon and get introduced to the city.

A great way to see the city. Given the amount of bikes in Amsterdam it makes sense to see it by riding. We did the Country Tour which did a little bit in the city before going through the Vondel Park and into the country to the north of Amsterdam, which was a lot less stress than trying to ride in amongst all the cyclists in the city! The tour guide Adam while not Dutch (he's actually an Aussie) is passionate about Amsterdam and provides lots of very interesting information about the history of the city and what life is like living there. The tour is not strenuous at all and anyone who can ride a bike should be enjoy the tour and feel a little bit like a local.Two points of advice if taking this tour are that you need to take something to eat because there is no stop for lunch and you won't get much to eat at the cheese farm and secondly the cheese farm only takes cash, not cards.

Highly recommend. What a great tour! Our guide, Adam, was very friendly, knowledgeable and INTERESTING. We were in Europe a month and went on 25 tours, and this tour guide was in the top 5!
