Easy bike ride, scenery was great, the stop at the cheese farm/wooden shoe factory was informative and interesting as well. Bike riding is a fun way to see the countryside rather than a typical walking tour. I am 50 and my daughter 18, and we both throughly enjoyed this tour. It was a gorgeous day as well, that always helps!

No better way to see Amsterdam.. These tours book up in advance so don't delay! My wife and I did the afternoon City Tour. Our guide was Petra who is a native of Amsterdam. She brought such amazing local insight to the tour. We stopped and lingered wherever the small group had interests (may have included a pub... just sayin'). The bikes were super comfy. The guide was awesome. The company was so easy to work with. It was one of the coolest city tours I have ever taken. Strongly recommend this.

A great way to see the real Amsterdam. Joy ride tours provided really comfortable, easy to ride bikes for a wonderful ride through Amsterdam. The city and parks are well set up for bike riders and the tour was a nice easy ride with plenty of stops and really interesting commentary by Adam. They also provided information on places to eat and maps. Thank you Adam for a great day and for turning on the perfect weather!

The best way to get to know Amsterdam. Highly recommend this to anyone visiting - not sure how we would go riding the bike having not slept for 30+hours but we had a great time. Sean was really informative and fun and happy to ask any questions about the town. It really is a great intro to the town and helps to prioritize what to do around the town. Thanks for a great tour

Would highly recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam. we try to do a bike or some sort of tour anywhere on our first day, good way to get the lay of the land and a history lesson. This one is unique as you get the owner to take you. He sets the tour when you hook up based on what you want to see. Is great with kids (teens) and we learned more (usefull data) about Amsterdam than on any other tour. There is a reason that over 1M bikes are in this city. It is certainly the best way to get around and see the sights. Also very easy, there are no hills in Amsterdam.

Best Tour in Amsterdam!. First off, Sean (our tour guide) was amicable, friendly and easy to talk to - hats off to him for an amazing time! It was very entertaining and informative; he seemed to love his job and in turn, we loved the tour that much more. It also helped us muster up the courage to rent our own bikes for the next day and to explore the city on wheels. I would absolutely recommend this tour to anyone who's visiting the Dam :)

Very enjoyable. Business operated by a husband and wife team. Very entertaining, good fun riding around Amsterdam (slightly chaotic at times). Sean was very friendly and took the time to ensure he was connecting with everyone on the tour. Very impressive. I would highly recommend. Excellent value for money.

The best tour in Amsterdam. what a fantastic tour! I am still thinking about the many interesting facts I learned. I really can't explain just how satisfying the experience was :). We took the city tour. Very conversational and personal. I felt like I could have chatted it up with Sean (our guide) for a couple hours after the tour. This tour is a must do!https://vimeo.com/44598801
Great way to check out amsterdam! Even if it's raining!. Must do if you don't know much about the history of Amsterdam! Cheese is amazing, and the tour guide was great! Must do in Amsterdam!

Wonderful bike tour in Amsterdam!!!. I was on business few days ago in Amsterdam and decided to do something different the last day of my trip. I made a decision of taking the country tour with joy ride and it was the best decision ever!! The day started a little cloudy/rainy but I decided to go anyhow. Got to the meeting place and there was Adam (our tour guide) waiting for us. Because of the weather, they provided rain coats... despite of the rain, we had a wonderful tour... the biking is awesome... the sites are wonderful... way more that what you can see on your own. They provided a great deal of history along the way which was really interesting... I learned a lot. All in all, this is a wonderful tour... I will highly recommend this to anyone who visits Amsterdam. By the way, the customer service Allison and her husband offered is OUTSTANDING!!! Next time, I will take the tour with my entire family as well... Great job guys... keep it up!

A dam great bicycle tour. I had arrived in Amsterdam at the Central Train Station, and in less than an hour I was meeting Joy Ride Tours for a bicycle tour of Amsterdam. From the meeting location at the Museumplein, I Amesterdam sign to the easy going nature of our guide the entire tour was incredible. Our group of 10 cyclists included people from Greece, Germany, Canada and the USA. Everyone felt welcome and learned in-depth, local perspective information on a wide range of topics including: the history of The Netherlands and Amsterdam, WWII, The Red Light District, Amsterdam's music and drug cultures. A short stop for a local beverage along the way, and many great photo oppotunities were appreciated. Incredible local insight. A slight mixup in tour costs prompted the owner to practically insist on the entire fee be refunded. We allowed a simple correction. I would have felt too guilty to not pay for such a fantastic tour. A great way to see the city.

A great way to start your Amsterdam Experience. Allison and her husband are a great way to start your Amsterdam experience. We had our kids and took the country tour. Filled with great facts and super sites. It was a lot of fun, very easy to do and the kids were engaged the whole time.

Best tour ever, we r now hooked!!. What a fantastic tour. We did an afternoon city tour about 2 weeks ago and it was one of our highlights of the trip. Sean was our guide and we learnt alot. We also stopped for a beer as well as a traditional Dutch Tradition - Herring!! We r now hooked on bike tours we booked one in Berlin, Barcelona. You don't need to be someone who rides a bike all the time and it's a great was to see Amsterdam without walking all over the city. Great memory, thanks Sean ;)

Stag weekend. The first weekend in June brought with it my little brother's stag weekend and we had organised a weekend trip to Amsterdam for 7 of us in total. We needed something to do on Saturday which would (a) help us recover from Friday night and (b) stay out of the bars until lunch time! We were heading to the Northern Ireland v Holland match that evening so we had a few hours to kill. I decided that instead of traipsing around museums and breweries that it would be much better to get a bit of history and combine this with some exercise and a bike tour seemed to fit the bill perfectly. The only worry was that none of us had been on a bike in over 10 years! I emailed a few of the companies and decided on Joyride Tours as the reviews were very good and they did a tour that sounded like it would suit us. ie beer stops on the way with a bit of history. We also decided the stag should have a nice pink bike and this was arranged no bother. It was great to find on the day of the tour that Sean was our host as I had been corresponding with him by email and he knew exactly the idea and the form for what we wanted from the tour. It also helped that the weather was fantastic! Sean gave us a great insight during the tour with a bit of history and geography as well as stopping at 2 lovely local pubs for a few "small" beers. After the tour he told us to contact him if we had any questions about Amsterdam during our stay or had any problems which was very nice and beyond the call of duty, He gave us a lot of advice on where to go and where not to go and what restaurants and pubs to try and which to avoid.It was a great 3-4 hour tour and very good value for money. I would recommend this for groups of guys or girls as something a bit different but could also suit families and those only interested in finding out about Amsterdam's history. I hope to be back soon and I would do the bike tour again.

The tour had everything. We went on the tour in early June and were fortunate enough to have an excellent day of weather; we even got sun burnt! Adam our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and really made people feel part of the group. We had 8 in the group and it was a fairly leisurely pace for ages 16-60ish. Heaps learnt and would definitely recommend to anyone who wants to see a different side of Dutch culture than the Amsterdam city life. Good idea to book online to get a 3 Euro discount per person.

Best bike tour ever! Very fun!. We took the Amsterdam city tour with Allison and a private countryside tour with Sean. We had 7 people including grandparents in their 70's and kids in their early teens. Everyone learned a lot, was entertained and overall had a great time. The city tour was in a light rain which was no problem with raincoats. After both tours we really felt we had a great exposure to Amsterdam and it's waterways, history, culture and engineering. Highly recommend these bike tours!

Excellent and incredibly informative. We were a group of 4 who joined the country and city tour. It was EXCELLENT and incredibly informative. I would highly recommend this for seeing the most of Amsterdam in one day. Both guides (Alan and Allison) were friendly and helpful and could answer all the questions that were thrown at them. I definate must

Excellent. Just back, we had a bike tour with Sean and it was excellent. So informaitive, likeable and interesting. Guy really knew his stuff and was a great guide. Would reconmend to anyone.Super job Thanks CB BelfastN.Ireland

Wonderful country ride with visit to windmill and cheese farm. We just returned from a four night stay in Amsterdam and had the opportunity to participate in the countryside tour which was a highlight of our trip. Our tour guide, Adam, was super friendly and informative. We first stopped in the Vondelpark and a houseboat village and learned more about the city. We also made stops at a local windmill and a clog/cheese factory which was so much fun! The farmer/clog maker is a TRIP which made the whole adventure really memorable. The ride was scenic, beautiful and a great way to spend an afternoon in beautiful Amsterdam!! Everyone should do this tour!

great bike tour. 4 of us went on the city tour on 27th May. Really good tour guide in Alison, who was very informative and answered all our questions. Hot sunny day made it better and the bikes are easy to use for all abilities. Been to amsterdam a few times before but this is the first time on a guided tour - wish i'd done it before, you learn so much more. We all had a great time and highly reccommend this company. Will will definatley do the countryside tour next time.

Velo Good. Amsterdam is a cycling city, so go with the flow and get on yer bike. We started our trip with a cycling tour within and on the outskirts of Amsterdam and were very glad we booked with these guys (there are lots to choose from). Our 'yellow jersey wearer' was excellent, informative, friendly and very accommodating (he put our cases in his flat because we arrived staright from the airport). The tour itself was excellent, including a trip to a cheese farm, mmm mmm yessir! I've never approached a holiday in this way before but will do in future, you develop a good understanding and knowledge of a place before you have gone a-wanderin' under your own steam. We also picked up lots of handy tips and hints on where to go, where to eat etc. And when we finished we were invigorated and raring to go! So the message is clear 1. Do a cycling tour; 2. Do it with these guys and you'll have a 'wheely' good time!

The tour you should be taking while in Amsterdam.. Other companies seem to generate better publicity and get all the recommendations from the guide books, but this is the where they genuinely care that everyone has both an enjoyable and informative experience. Sean, the owner and an American expat, was our guide through the countryside tour, and, in a group of about a dozen, he routinely made stops to tie information to Dutch history, geography, and contemporary life. He even quizzed the group now and then and kept the conversation going strong, so it never felt like a dry lecture on two wheels. And then he also did something you can easily take for granted: he tested the younger children to make sure they could bike safely in a protected open space before embarking on the tour, in order to ensure safe conditions for everyone--this is a great idea! Lastly, he and his Dutch assistant Rolf were happy to answer any questions or provide recommendations about what to do in Amsterdam, based on our individual interests. Having embarked on a far less successful bike tour the day before, I can say without a doubt that Joy Ride is worthy of all the good reviews it seems to be earning here.

What a joy to ride with Joy Ride!. Our family of 6 booked a countryside bike tour with Joy Ride Bike Tours. We rode for 5 hours and enjoyed every minute of it! Adam, an Aussie, was a friendly and informative guide and a pleasure to be with. I recommend this tour for anyone who can ride a bike and enjoys being outside!

Best tour in Amsterdam. We spent one week in Amsterdam and had two peaks, City Tour and Country Tour with Joy Ride Bike.
Good personal information and fun to. We recomend it to all.

Great countryside tour. What an awesome way to see the Netherlands. Had a great guide, nice bikes and a great tour. Clog factory and cheese farm were awesome. We ended up riding back ourselves the next day!
Price was great.

Adam the Great. Adam was absolutely spectacular. He guides the country bike ride. He was extremely knowledgeable of the history of Amsterdam. I would definitely recommend this to anyone. It is an easy (12 mile) ride through the countryside.

Great tour!!. One of the best part of our trips to Amsterdam was our tour with Joy Rides. We LOVED it! The day before, we went on a canal tour and were very disappointed with amount of history we learned about Amsterdam. We learned so much during our bike tour, however. Adam, our tour guide was very informative. He knew so much about the Netherlands and always made sure we had time to take pictures. The tour ended up being longer than we expected, which was a plus. I was a little nervous at how much we were going to see, since all the country tour pics on here seem to be of the windmill, but it was great. We saw house boats, a farm where cheese and clogs are made, canals, and much much more. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who visits Amsterdam.Tip: Go at the beginning of your trip. They give you a list of recommended places to eat and a map of the city.

Terrific bike tour of Amsterdam. The best way to see a city is by doing bike tours. This rated at the top of all the cities I have done, including Munich, Buenos Aires, Barcelona and Madrid. Great "townie" bikes with very comfy seats. Alliso, our guide was great and gave lots of inside info to areas and sites. Awesome tour. It was the highlight of my visit to Amsterdam!

Fantastic!. Unable to fault the tour in any way, me and my wife joined the city tour on a Friday afternoon and it was fantastic, both informative and fun, our guide was Allison who obviously has a great passion for her City and is very enthusiastic.If this is your first or fifth visit to Amsterdam i cant recommend it highly enough it gives you a great overview of the city , stopping off for Herring and a beer, perfect.I also gives you the confidence to actually hire a bike and do Amsterdam like a native! Allison also provided everyone with a list of places to eat even offering to make reservations etc.A brilliant time, a brilliant guide, do yourself a favour and just get it booked.

"The best 4hours I spent in Amsterdam". I joined a group of 3 others on this cycle tour of the countryside around Amsterdam. I had an amazing time - the bikes were immaculate and comfortable with waterproofs provided in the saddlebag should we have needed them, fortunately we didn't. Adam, our guide, was lovely, so friendly and knowledgeable, I learnt so much about the history and geography of the Netherlands- much more fun than reading a guide book! The tour took us through parks, woods, along canals and dykes and past windmills. It was easy cycling but we made a welcome 'beer' stop at a cheese and clog making farm. Joyride Tours is a small family company who do all they can to make sure you have a wonderful experience & they do -so if you visit Amsterdam, a bike tour with JOYRIDE TOURS is a must, I cannot recommend it highly enough!

Best way to see the city!. I was only in Amsterdam for a day and a half so I wanted to see as much as possible. There's no better way than on a bike! It is the national mode of transportation, anyway! I was waiting at the wrong spot thinking I was going to miss my tour when Sean, the owner, came riding by looking for me! He is so knowledgable and tells a great story! We even veered off the tour to grab a beer at a windmill! That is the benefit of going with a small, private company! Do a bike tour in Amsterdam and do it with Joy Ride Tours! You won't be sorry!

what a fab time. i joined a group of 6 travelling Oz`s yesterday on a tour with Sean(tour leader), his wife and his dad and step mum visiting from the US.. What a great day... riding into the Amsterdam countryside mixed with historical and hysterical banter about the Dutch and its history.... I recommend this to anyone with a few hours to spare...even to the odd Brit businessman seeking a bit of R&R (it worked for me .. i was given this as a surprise gift from my kind wife...it kept me away from window shopping!!.) . even visited a farm, bought some cheese and came away with a pair of cloggs... it must have been the Heineken !! Big thanks to Sean... cool guy ... age range 20's to 60++ so something for everyone....go for it.. You will enjoy

Wonderful Country Bike Tour. A great way of seeing the countryside around Amsterdam is to take this bike trip, which my friend and I did last week with Sean and Adam as guides. Cycled through parks, forests, along canals (learnt about loch system, house boat community, "polders" and much more) and visited cheese and clog-making farm.

Perfect way to get to know Amsterdam. Highly recommended! Allison was an excellent guide. Very personable and lots of great insider tips about Amsterdam. Nice bikes. Good route. And even stopped for a beer along the way at the coolest bar. Trust me, do it!

Great Bike Tour. We did this bike tour on our trip to Amsterdam last week with 2 guides, Sean and Ralph. Neither of us had been on a bike in a while so I was just hoping we would not lag behind. Not a chance of it though. The bikes are very comfy even for those non-cyclists among us. Brought us through the park and out of the city into the countryside with stops every so often to give us information about both what we were seeing around us and also general Amsterdam history etc. The guides were very informative and knowledgable and were very willing to take questions or take pictures for us etc. I learned a lot more on this tour alone than I would have from a guide-book. They even took us to see the famous Gouda being made and also to a clog maker. Think everyone wanted some cheese after having a little taste! The only downside really was nothing to do with our tour at all. There was another tour in the gift shop (at the cheese & clog makers) and they kept skipping queues to pay for gifts so we were ages waiting to buy anything. And it was their guide telling them it was okay to skip!! Apart from this, it was a really great day and I would definitely recommend this tour. They even provide rain-wear for if the weather gets bad. Very few tours will do that!

Great bike tour. My wife and I did the country tour with the owner, Sean. We didn't make a reservation just met up with the group on the museumplein. The bikes were comfortable and easy to ride. We would ride a few minutes and then stop for information from Sean about different aspects of Amsterdam/The Netherlands. Would definitely recommend. Would love to do one of the private tours that Sean offers, he has a wealth of knowledge.

Awesome Way To Spend A Day. We did the country tour and could not have been happier. Having not riden a bike in quite a while we were somewhat worried we would be lagging behind but definitely not the case. The bikes were extremely easy to ride and were very comfortable. Our guide was extremely knowledgable and made the trip quite fun and infomative. We would ride for a few minutes and then stop and he would explain things or tell stories so you never felt tired from riding too long. We also stopped at a Cheese / Wooden Clog factory which was great and very interesting. The only bad thing was that the weather did not co-operate and was somewhat cold but really that is a small thing and not really anything the tour can control. All in all it was a wonderful day and would love to do the tour again.

very nice. Amsterdam has major problems with traffic. It is very busy and there are many roadworks. Would you like to discover the city do not do it by bus!. Go in a boat, or take a bike ride. The advantage of the ride is that you come in more places than by boat. A good guide will give you just a little different look to highlights the city, so you can see a lot in half a day. Very nice!!

GREAT BIKE RIDE. We had a private tour with Sean and it was the best intro to Amsterdam you can get. Extremely informative with lots of fun thrown in culminating in a pub with a windmill on top, just what you want on your first day. Excellent.

Best Dam Bike Tour Ever!. By far the best thing that we did in Amsterdam. You really feel like a local on the bikes. The bikes were in great condition and didn't scream tourist. The tour was to some great areas. Allison was very nice, patient (with the less experienced riders on our tour), and very informative. I would highly recommend seeing Amsterdam by bike, and after the tour we felt confident enough to rent bikes from our hotel for the next few days.Allison also gave us a list at the end of the tour of other attractions and restaurants. The Blaue Hollander that she recommended was incredible! (Thanks Allison!)The only thing I will say (and should probably go without saying), is that people that aren't experienced riders or are not that comforatble on a bike I would not recommend a bike tour! It's not fair to the other people in the tour.

Fantastic Tour Of Amsterdam. We scheduled a private tour for two and were not disappointed. We choose the type of tour (WWII history) and were not disappointed. Our guide took us off the beaten track to sites we would missed. The guide was professional and had great knowledge of the history of Amsterdam. When we return, we will definitely schedule another bike trip.

Great introduction to the Netherlands. We chose Joy Ride to explore Amsterdam before our cruise and were pleasantly surprised. Since you can't visit Holland and not ride a bike, we thought this would be the most 'local' way to get around. The tour was informative, fun, and relaxing enough for the least athletic members of our group to have a good time. We would have never ridden out into the Dutch countryside without taking this tour. Our teenage kids even had fun.

Wonderful day trip. This tour totally exceeded my expectation. I joined the tour alone but enjoyed myself tremendously. The tour guide is helpful, caring and informative. She even shared some stropwafels with us!

It's just like riding a bike!!!. What could possibly go wrong?!10 ladies on a Hen Weekend. in Amsterdam. On bicycles. Hungover. On a Sunday!?!Well, absolutely nothing went wrong and we had the best day a girl could have on two wheels ; )When we heard the tour was going to be approx. 3-4 hours long, we didn't think it was possible, but the day flew and we got to see some fantastic sights that you wouldn't get to see by car or by bus.Sean was particularly patient with is all given our very short attention span - we even managed to learn a few facts about beautiful Amsterdam!No need to bring provisions as we stopped at "Vleminckx Sausmeesters" - best chips evvvver and the "Brouwerij ‘t IJ" Brewery to sample some local beers.We all had a super fun day and would highly recommend Joy Ride Day Tours for any occasion as we're sure Sean knows exactly how to tailor-make it for your theme!!Well done and thanks again for a great trip around the city!Andria

Great Insights into the City of Amsterdam. We had a lovely time riding around Amsterdam and learning the ins and outs of the city. Highlights included the Palace, Red Light District, learning about the neighborhoods, the moving process (throw a rope over a hook at the top of the building and haul it up!). The enthusiasm and knowledge of our guide was awesome, and she took great photos of everyone in front of the final stop, a brew pub with a giant windmill on top of it. Highly recommended! Wish we'd had time to do the country tour as well!

Fantastic tour taking in both city & countryside. My wife and I joined both the City Tour with Sean and the Countryside Tour with Alexander and we a had a great time on both. The City Tour is worth booking on at the beginning of your break as it gives you and sound background to the city and gives you the opportunity to get your bearings. It also lets you experience what it is like for the bike riders of Amsterdam so you will appreciate them as you walk around yourself. We would definitely recommend the tours and would do them again ourselves. Steve & Denise Morris

Superb. Was an awesome tour.We took both the city tour and the countryside tour,Sean and Alexandra were both fantastic and explained to us about the history of netherlands.The cycling was not physically demanding,and the route of the countrside tour was great.

The Best!. One of the best things I did in Amsterdam! Sean was a great tour guide and very knowledgable. We saw great sights and learned so much about the city. This is one thing I would do again if I return to Amsterdam!

Believe the 5 Star reviews. We had been to Amsterdam in the past and seen most of the city and wanted to see a bit more of the countryside. Joy Ride Tours was the perfect solution...we had Alexandra as our guide and we were pretty quickly out of urban Amsterdam and into the countryside. Here commentary was spot-on, her pace was perfect (and the weather was great!) so we were able to spend a great day on 2 wheels. Would probably do this tour again so that is probably the best recommendation.

Great tour - both times!. My husband and I recently went on both the city and country tours of Amsterdam with Joy Ride. Both tours were excellent! Our guide for the city tour was Sean (The owner and founder of Joy Ride) and our guide for the country tour was Alexandra (Sean's Aussie cousin, Joy Ride is a true family business). Both guides were very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about Amsterdam. They gave us great insight into the culture of both Amsterdam and the Netherlands, as well as showing us the sights. At the beginning of both of tours, they asked if anyone had any time constraints. Since no one had any significant constraints, they went over the original allotted time to make sure we had the best tours possible. I definitely felt like I was able to hit all the highlights of Amsterdam during the tours, and was able to relax on the remainder of the trip and just enjoy the culture without running around trying to see the area. The tours also felt very personalized, because the groups were small (10 people or less) and they did a great job of getting to know everyone and providing recommendations for restaurants and other things to do in Amsterdam. During our time in Amsterdam, we stayed with friends who live there and joined us on the country tour. They loved the tour and learned a lot about Amsterdam that they did not already know! I would highly recommend Joy Ride to anyone visiting Amsterdam!!!During our recent Europe Trip, my husband and I did bike tours in Amsterdam, Paris, and Munich, and Joy Ride was easily the best of three in all phases; best guides, best bikes, and a fun group of other rides.

Brilliant to deal with. Sadly, I had to cancel my tour with Joyride due to a travel mixup of my own creation. I emailed Joyride just to let them know, and was thrilled to get a refund without even asking or expecting one. Excellent customer service guys, hopefully I will be back in Amsterdam someday and will get to do the tour.

Fantastic!. It was my favorite thing we did in Amsterdam. It did help that it was a beautiful sunshiney day. Alexandra is a really lovely guide, she gives you lots of very interesting facts and history bits.

Great way to see the countryside. We took the country tour which was a great way to see some other parts of Amsterdam than the busy hustle and bustle of the Canal Belt. The tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. It was a pleasant, leisurely bike ride and a great way to see some of the country side.

Great bike trip while in Amsterdam. Went on a bike tour with Joy Ride Day tours a few days ago while in Amsterdam after finding lots of great reviews on the site.Booked online saved us a few EUROs and all the needed info was on the site (with lots of pictures and explanations) so we could find the group on the day of the tour.Our great guide, Alex, was right on time to greet us all and escorted us to the "shop" nearby to get our bikes.The equipment is well maintained and in good condition for riding - also got raincoats for bad weather.Bike ride out to the country was great, not hard at all even though we were quite worried before arrival but the area is completely flat so no trouble riding at all. The group stopped every 15-20 minutes for explanations and a rest - total time was around 3.5 hours.Stopped at a cheese farm and clog factory on the way to see how both are made.I would recommend this tour to everyone stopping by Amsterdam for a few days - it is a great way to see the sights, the guides are great, prices are fair (we were told there is a money back guarantee for whoever wasn't happy with the tour) and its great fun.

The best way to get the inside scoop ...... great deal !!!. All of the staff of Joy Ride Bike tours were great and really cared about what we wanted to see and do ... we did the city tour the first day and then the country tour a day later it was really worth the money and time. the equipment was awesome and a very easy ride. It was wonderful to be the one on the bike with the bell and not just a moving target for others. Pay in advance to save a buck and you will find it really speeds things up when you get there. I highly enjoyed our tours and if you really want to see the city from the inside out... call Sean he will take very good care of you ... I will do the tours again when we go back in 2013.

A great way to see the city and surrounding countryside.. We took both the city and country tours and enjoyed both. You should review the official website (including the FAQs) because it is accurate and has all the information that you need for these tours.I preferred the coutryside tour because of the beautiful ride through the parks and woods and the opportunity to see the houseboats and water management system. The city tour was very informative. Neither tour was physically demanding.The traffic on the city tour was scary (although also scary even if you're just walking!), but the guide did an excellent job avoiding the worst intersections and helping us negociate the streets.

Great bike tour with wonderful guide, good sights, well-paced. We did the Country tour and had a wonderful time. Alexandra was a great guide, the bikes were super comfortable, and the whole trip was well paced. We especially enjoyed tooling through Vondelpark, the clog/cheese factory/farm, the houseboat area, the rowing venue and just enjoying the outdoors. Biking can be a challenge, but they made it easy, fun, and thoroughly enjoyable.

A must while in Amsterdam!. Having visited Amsterdam before, I looked on trip advisor for something to do that was different and Joy ride tours were the number one so I booked with them.The tour did not disappoint and I would highly recommend to anyone else. We did the Country side tour a couple of Saturdays ago- and lucked out actually getting sunshine! Alex our tour guide was great- very informative and funny.It was a great way to see the surrounds of Amsterdam, and feel more local than tourist while ridding a bike.

Highly recommended. The tour is highly recommended. Even when it was raining for the most part of the four hour ride we enjoyed every minute of it. Our guide Alex was great, she is very knowledgeable and entertaining at the same time. Cycling is the best way to explore amsterdam especially the country side.

Excellent bike tour. We did the city and country tours: both were given by very knowledgeable, helpful and enthusiastic guides. The groups are small compared to the other cycle tours that I saw -- they are limited to 10 for the city tour and 15 for the countryside tour. I would definitely recommend both tours!

Wonderful Ride in Amsterdam!. We joines this ride this August. I, my wife and my two teenager children all enjoyed this ride very much. The guide was very smart and she told us many, many interesting things about Holland. The countryside tour can let you enjoy the amazing lanscape of Amsterdam. It,s a good trip, don't miss it if you go to Amsterdam.

Perfect break from the city!. Booked online, directions on the website were easy to follow, even for a new traveler! Allison gave us a wonderful tour through the city and to the country side- great variety of sights to see and she is a wealth of knowledge on Dutch culture and history! No big hills or fast riding just fun and enjoyable! She also took great photos of us to share with our family! Wish we had time to do another tour with them!

Very nice way to see hidden amsterdam. Took the countryside tour - relaxing pace covering 21 Km. We saw how the locks on the canals work, Went through houseboat communities and the Amstel woods through the "backroads", learned about windmills how they work and how land was /is reclaimed from the sea. Our guide was great- energetic, friendly, she tailored the tour to the group members ( one lady was from Canada and our guide explained the special relationship between canada and the Netherlands.). Would love to o the city tour next.

A great day out. The countryside tour was so much fun and very informative. It was a pity that we didn't have more time in Amsterdam or we would have hired bikes again just to re-explore some of the areas, particularly Vondelpark. Our guide Alexandra was funny and informative. The tour is structured so that you spend enough time at each attraction and the riding is very easy on flat roads or paths. Our tour did run slightly over time which was fine but just something to be aware of if you have other plans for the day. We will definitely go again if in the area.

The best way to see Amsterdam. The website states that tours will still run in the rain, and we certainly put that to the test. Through pretty much relentless, and at times torrential rain we cycled out of the city centre into the countryside surrounding Amsterdam, but it did not dampen the enthusiasm of the small group (around 8) or that of our friendly & knowledgable guide, Allison. We did the countryside tour, which takes you through the peaceful Vondelpark, along the river Amstel, and takes in a visit to a cheese farm, a windmill, the house boats and canal locks. The majority of the tour is away from traffic, and even the route in and out of the city is on cycle paths rather than roads. Amsterdam is, of course, very flat so there are no real challenges even for novice cyclists like we are.Allison offered lots of information on our surroundings as we progressed, as well as giving plenty of advice about our stay in Amsterdam in general (such as restaurant recommendations.) This really is a great way to visit the city - you will see so much more than if you just visit the usual attractions on foot, plus you have somebody on hand to answer any questions you might have. If you can spare half a day from your time in Amsterdam, I highly recommend taking this tour. With any luck you'll have better weather than we did - but if not, wrap up and persevere, it's worth it.

This should top your list when in Amsterdam. We had a private tour with Alexandra and enjoyed every minute. She is a wealth of information with a great presentation. Our ride was unhurried and were able to stop and talk in depth about each sight. This was my brother's first trip to Amsterdam and he felt it was the highlight of the trip. We would definately recommend a tour with Joy Ride Day Tours.

Would Definitely Do Again. My family had so much fun during our bike tour. Alexandra couldn't have been a better tour guide. She had an answer to every question we came up with, whether it was about Amsterdam history or something we saw that we came across during our tour. We were able to experience so much along the way, and even though it was pouring, Alexandra kept her upbeat personality and entertained us throughout the entire tour. Her uncle, the owner of the shop, is really nice and funny as well. Amsterdam is beautiful and we will definitely be back.

Something everyone should do when visiting Amsterdam. We went on the Joy Ride Countryside tour and have to say it was the highlight of my trip to Amsterdam. The bikes were in good condition and the ride very easy for someone who hasn't cycled seriously in more years than I'd care to admit! Our guide, Alexandra, was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable, and we learnt a lot about everything from the history of Amsterdam to the intricate water management system of the Netherlands. A wonderful day!

A truely enjoyable ride. Totally enjoyed the countryside ride. My partner and 1 were lucky to have Allison as our guide and since it coincided with the Gay parade that day, it was a small grp of just 3 of us, somewhat like a private tour. Allison was full of energy and there was never a dull moment during the 3 hr ride. The ride brought us to places in Amsterdam which we would never have seen had we stayed in the city, what a beautiful place. Totally worth the money and would highly recommend all to make some time to go for this tour.

Best bike tour yet!!. If you are in Amsterdam for a day or more get yourself on one of these tours. Myself and my partner did both the country side and city tour. We really enjoyed both tours as our guides were full of interesting knowlege, fun and easily approachable. It was definately a laid back experience and would totally reccomend this to anybody who likes to get a bit of exercise, learn a little history, see the sights and have a bit of a laugh. Would totally do it again next time there.
Great Tour. We had a great time, very good tour, the guide was very good, and the value is great, very comprehensive people

Wonderful. My girlfriend and I did the City tour last saturday with Alison as our guide. We both loved it. It was so nice to be shown round the city by someone who has the same passion for her city as we do for ours. Considering we chose the worst day for biking around the city - in pouring rain - the fact that it did not dampen our enjoyment is testament enough.The tour was full of stories and anecdotes, with a personal touch. The groups are limited at 10 people, which is fantastic, you see a lot of the other tours going round with 20 or 30 people on them.A really nice touch was stopping at a Belgian Beer pub at the end of the tour where Alison took a real interest in what people were planning to do and offered individual advice to us all. She recommended a rock pub to us, The Soundgarden Cafe, which was awesome! 2 pinball tables and a cat to amuse us whilst listening to Motorhead! This goes to show she has very specific information she can give to make your holiday better.if we ever return, we'll do the Countryside tour for sure. Thanks Alison.

So much in a short time. I booked this tour online (countryside one) and it was perfect as I was going solo. Everything seemed very non-touristy. The bikes didn't have a big sign that advertised that we were on a tour! We didn't see other tourists in any place except for the few minutes we spent at the the windmill. Alexandria was a very helpful guide giving us great background into not only the sights but the country's history. She also helped us out afterwards when we were trying to figure out some restaurants to try. Great trip!

great way to see Amsterdam with the little ones. We booked this tour during our very short 3 day stay in Amsterdam. I wholeheartedly agree with the majority of posts that it is a very lovely ride, with a very friendly tour guide. We traveled with 3 kids, (10, 8 and 4). We were nervous riding with the toddler, since Amsterdam does not have the typical US style bike trailer, but a "bakfiets bike". The online photos of the bike are quite unlike kids bikes in the US. That being said, my son LOVED it. He asked us to "buy him one"of course...(and no, we did not). My other 2 children enjoyed the ride immensely and despite the 4 hour tour, wanted to continue riding (shocking!). We did the countryside tour which included the clog, cheese and farm tour. It was charming. We had time to stop and take photos, and we learned so much about the canals, the pulley systems, the windmills etc. Allison was a great guide with lots of information. She was patient with our kids, and she was a delight with my little son.My only comment is, we had a 45 minute + mis-start since we had to rent our own bakfiets bike, and there was confusion re: which store the rental was booked. This did cause "overtime" on the back end of the tour. (Overtime charges are clearly stated on the website). It was only partially charged (which was very kind) but, at the same time, if the bakfiets bike had been rentable from Joy tours directly, we would not have been late. Perhaps your company could facilitate this process for future customers, to avoid delays and make the tour more seamless. Since travelling with really young kids is already so challenging, anything your company could do to make it easier probably would be appreciated by future families.It was such a delightful day, that I did not mention it to her at the time. The tour says a 6 or 7? euro credit will be given if you rent the bike elsewhere. We rented the bakfiets bike elsewhere and the credit was given for 1 rider, but my little son didn't ride a bike and yet we were still charged full price for him. (For a toddler, really? The US rarely charges the same price for children and adults for anything...) If he were an additional adult rider with his own bike, the policy suggests he would have been discounted. It is really minor detail, and I probably should have brought it up then, but with the rain, and the kids I decided not to. Overall a great tour ride and I would highly recommend it despite the minor issues.

Our best day in Amsterdam. We booked the countryside tour online and we loved it. It's a 20 kilometers ride in the south of Amsterdam very instructive and pleasant, we were only two (there is only small groups). Our guide also gave us several good addresses in A'dam after the trip. Don't hesitate and don't let the rain stop you !

Lots of info and history about Amsterdam!. My wife and I recently did the City Tour with Sean as our guide. Sean was enthusiastic and engaging as he stopped at various spots in the city to explain how Amsterdam well... 'became' Amsterdam. The bikes were in very good condition and the overall ride was relatively flat. What makes this tour worthwhile is that Joy Ride keeps the tour groups quite small (no more than 10 people for the city tour with no exceptions). So I would suggest book in advance online (you would need a Paypal account). We learned a lot from the tour and had a great time!

History of Amsterdam on a bike. My wife and two teenage daughters did the country tour with Sean. What an incredible experience. It was a European history class on a bicycle. Sean could not have been nicer. He was enthusiastic and seemed to be having just as much fun as we were. The pace of the ride was easy enough that it was indeed a "joy ride". I would recommend this tour to anyone. I can't wait to do it again the next time I visit this wonderful city.

Perfect introduction to Amsterdam and the Netherlands. We went on the city tour on the first day of our stay. It was a perfect introduction to the city and we learned so much about Amsterdam, the mentality, architecture, history, the present... Our guide Shawn was very enthusiastic and knew a lot about everything. We also got many useful tips about where to go and where to eat. I really recommend Joy Ride Tours!

Fantastic!. Joyride Tours treat their guests as friends. Our tour took a couple of hours and Sean showed us the best Amsterdam has to offer - from where to get a good beer to which stall sells the best herring. He answers everyone's questions and adapts his tours to suit the group he is with. Sean had us all captivated with his informative and highly entertaining tour. We look forward to taking the Country Tour next time we are in Amsterdam. Our 15 year old son particularly enjoyed it. Thanks Sean!

A great day out!! even when you miss the tour you booked!!. Booked the countryside tour before departing for our 3 day break in Amsterdam. This was done based on the reviews on tripadvisor and yes all the very positive reviews are well deserved. We mistakenly turned up for the city tour on Sunday afternoon but Allison quickly spotted the problem and very promptly suggested that we go to the Van Gogh museum(also booked) and turn up on Monday morning for the tour that we were supposed to go on. Could not have been more accommodating or more helpful. Very professional yet very friendly. Now to the actual tour. Alex (cousin of the owners) took 7 very diverse people on a very enjoyable and informative tour. Knowledgeable and easy to listen to. We were so fortuntate to have lovely weather but still think that even if the the sun had not being shining it would still have been a good experience. If you have not been on a bike for years the countryside tour is so well geared and thought out I have no hesitation recommending it to families, teenagers, young adults and the not so young adults like myself. Enjoyed my second visit to Amsterdam but my time with Joy Ride Day Tours was definitely the highlight of this visit. Glad I did not miss it even though it would have been my own fault!

Highlight of our Amsterdam trip!. We did a 4-hour bike tour with Sean last week during our vacation in Amsterdam and it was the highlight of our trip! Sean was knowledgeable and personable and funny and really gave us a flavor for the people, the history, and the lifestyle in Amsterdam. His stories were memorable and my husband and I referred to them throughout the rest of our stay. He was also really helpful in recommending things to do and see and eat in Amsterdam....I would HIGHLY recommend this tour (if you don't get Sean, you get his wife or brother).

Great way to see Amsterdam. The weather was wet but we hardly noticed. The tour covered the highlights with some personal insights. We go on bike tours where ever possible and this was one of the best.Recommend it for anyone who wants to know more about Amsterdam.

Great Bike Tours. We did both the city tour (with Allison) and the country tour (with Alex). Both were outstanding. Guides are very informative and know the city and its history. Bicycles are top of the line and very comfortable and easy to ride. Highly recommend Joy Ride Tours. You will not be disappointed!

Can I go again?. Terrific tour - even though I haven't been on a bike in years (stationary doesn't count!) - it's like they say, you never forget. Sean is an excellent tour guide-entertainer-historian. A well-paced, fun and interesting tour. Stopped off at the only remaining windmill in Amsterdam for beer. It was a blast. Will look into other tours that Joy Rides offers the next time we are in Amsterdam.
best day of our trip. loved it! Wish it could of lasted all day! Next time we visit we will use them again.
happy town, easy riding. easy and simple to join the ride, very informative, easy to understand the clear english,warm and nice people, look forward to meet them again.

Best bike tour I've done hands down. We did the city tour in May and had an absolute ball! The tour provided us with a fantastic orientation of the city and it was great to visit some more quirky places that we would not have otherwise known about, including an old distillery, the red light district and the Jordaan area. This was truly a fabulous experience and I can't recommend it more highly!For more about our experience, please see my blog: http://fabulousfoodandalittlefrolicking.blogspot.com/2011/07/eurotrip2011-day-19.html

For true insight to Amsterdam with qualified guides, look no further. As a resident of this lovely city, I had the arduous task of taking friends visiting from abroad around to show them our magical city. Racking my brains as to the best way to do this without seeming to trek the usual tourist routes, I turned to Joy Ride.What an eye opener! Our guide, Sean couldn't have shown us a better time. His knowledge of the city's history and its surroundings could easily surpass history professors, but it was his delivery that made our tour invaluable. Service to the hilt, care and attention to everyone in the group made all of us feel a part of a collective trip through past and present.There are many tour operators in Amsterdam, but consider yourself just a rat in the pack with those others. Joy Ride delivers exactly what their company name signals. A true Joy.Thank you Sean for taking a huge load off my hands in entertaining my guests, and thank you for teaching me things about this city I should have picked up over the years!Would I recommend Joy Ride? Implicitly. For me, there is no other choice.

Superb!. Took the Country Tour and was very impressed. The guide (Sean) was extremely knowledgeable and helpful, the bikes were comfortable, and the places we went to were great. My only regret was not having the time to go back and take the WWII tour they offer.

What a great tour!. We booked a tour with Joy Ride Tours during our recent Amsterdam visit. We opted for the country tour and would like to recommend this tour to everyone who wants to experience Amsterdam and the Netherlands in a new way.Our tour guide was very informative and after the tour we had much more understanding of the Amsterdam’s and the Netherland’s culture, history and soul. We had bad weather on our tour with heavy rain and strong winds, but that did not bother us at all. We had a great time cycling through the city and some of the surrounding area. We got to visit a farm where we saw how their cheese and clogs are handmade. The bikes were great, in perfect working order and seemed quite new in fact. Some in our group seemed less experienced bikers than others but the guide led us through the tour at a nice pace suited for everyone. We give Joy Ride Tours our highest recommendation.

good fun for the day. My husband and I went with Joy Ride tours for the day. It was good fun and exactly as they described on their website. It's a good way to experience a bit of Dutch fun outside Amsterdam centre, especially if you're just there for a few days. The group was about 14 people and we had a lovely cycle in the wooded paths, on the dykes, fed some geese, saw a windmill, some lovely houseboats, and finally had some cheese in a farm. The owner was the guide and he gave us a brief history of the country and description of the places that we went.

Great fun and the highlight of our trip to Amsterdam!. I organised a hen do to Amsterdam and found Joy ride tours through trip advisor. From start to finish Sean/Alison couldn't have been more helpful and friendly. We had a private country tour and they organised a prosecco picnic and trip to a cheese farm en-route so we didn't have to worry about taking anything. A couple of the girls were quite nervous on the bikes to start off with but Sean took us through Vondalpark first to get used to them and made sure they were ok throughout the day. The bride to be had a specially decorated bike, We couldn't have asked for a more chilled out and friendly, yet extremely knowledgeable and interesting tour guide. A great day was had by all, its definitely a great way to see Amsterdam and a must do trip, worth every penny!!

Good tour. We took the countryside tour last month. Owner's cousin, Alexandra, took us to the country side. Overall it's a good tour. Not sure if it's a must. If we had a bike and a guide book, we could have done it ourselves.

Enjoyable and engaging. Sean - who runs the tour is a likeable chap with a great personality and years of travel experience under his belt. He's got the gift of the gab and provides great commentary, good bikes and a thoroughly enjoyable bike tour.We took the country tour and it was great from the start. He's very approachable and is quite happy to answer any of our questions. The bikes were in great condition and he slowly got us into the biking groove - eventhough it was sweltering (by Amsterdam standards)The tour had regular breaks and he kept track of all of us. He was very organized in the booking process and we were quite pleased to find an honest tour guide.All in all, i'd really recommend him to anybody taking a bike tour in Amsterdam

Wonderful Bike Ride in Amsterdam and Countryside. A great guided bike ride in Amsterdam and surrounding countryside. Sean provided new multigear cruisers, just right to navigate this city of bike riders. After a ride through the park, Sean took us through the countryside by the Amstel river. We stopped at a working dairy farm to sample local cheeses and watch a demo of how wooden shoes are made. A small group and Sean's knowledge of history and personal attention made for a wonderful day. Thanks Sean.

Great Introduction to Amsterdam - Cycling In the City and Country. The bike tours both the City and Country Tours were great. The guides were friendly, knowledgeable, fun and made the experience memorable. I appreciated the insights on Dutch culture and history. These tours are a must when you are in Amsterdam!

The Best. A great tour for those who want both a history tour and a perspective tour. Sean gave a great country ride (no hills..not physically challenging) that explained everything from history, geography to tolerance. His wit and smart storytelling made a beautiful ride better. Strongly recommend!

FAVORITE THING IN EUROPE!!. We absolutely looooved the Country bike tour through Holland/Amsterdam. Our tour guide Alex was fantastic and took extra time to show us around the sites. The information was very interesting. You cannot miss this tour!!!

The BEST way to see Amsterdam!. I was in Germany on business for 2 weeks and went to Amsterdam for the weekend. I took the country tour with Alex and loved it from beginning to end. She gave us the history of Amsterdam and the Netherlands during our tour. She was knowledgable and fun and it was the best part of my whole 2 week trip to Europe. How can you not enjoy being on a bike, soaking up the fresh air and learning about a city from a totally different perspective. I particularly liked that she took us Canadians to the Freedom Ribbon. Thank you Alex!

Fantastic, better than I could have imagined. We got back earlier this week from a 2 dayhen do trip to Amsterdam and all the girls were raving about the bike tour. Wanted to say a big thank you again to Sean for completely making our trip. He was so informative and fun, yet all the time very proffessional. The bike ride itself was lovely and the only was to see the Amsterdam surrounding countryside. I learnt a lot more than I thought I would about Amsterdam and was not bored at any point. A huge thumbs up and would definately do it again xxxFrom Ceri- one part of Sarahs hen do

Great way to see Amsterdam. I was in The Netherlands for a business trip and had one free day to see Amsterdam. The tour with Joy Ride was wonderful. We got great photo ops at most the major attractions around the city and Allison was very knowledgable about the histroy and legends of the city. We ended at a historic windmill turned brewery for a beer. Absolutely a great experiance. I would reccommend to anyone.

Definitely the highlight of our time in Amsterdam. Both my 9-year-old daughter and I loved our private bicycle tour with Allison. She was clearly a professional who knew exactly how to keep a 9-year-old interested, engaged and energetic (not to mention the 9-year-old's mother...). Yet at the same time it felt like we were being shown around by a friend who was only too happy to tell us about everything. The ride was beautiful, the bikes were wonderful and spending time with Allison was a privilege. We experienced every kind of weather during our 3+ hour tour: sun + warmth and also cold, wind and rain. Even the bad weather did not make us any less enthusiastic about the great tour we had with Allison.

Simply the best!!. Fantastic 4.5 hours with Alex!! She can change a tyre as my wife's back one got punctured and also put the the chain back on as well!!Great itinerary for the countryside tour including the 350 year old windmill and cheese farmThe saddles are extremely comfortable and the 7 speed bikes very simple to use. We had a superb time and would recommend this trip to anyoneTHe sun shone and rthe conversation amongst our group was good and Alex had so many facts to hand it was incredibleNot to be missed

Outstanding tour!. The guide showed us several parts of the city and told us interesting und funny stories about the history of amsterdam, the dutch people and their living style. He was very flexible in adjusting the tour to the questions raised by the bikers. The ride through the city lasted more than three hours and ended in a bar. We will certainly do the tour again.
WOW. This is the perfect way to see Amsterdam if you don't have a lot of time.Allisson was a great guide .Highly recommend.

Joy Ride is a great way to experience the city and countryside of Amsterdam. I had only two days in Amsterdam. I was lucky to walk up on the afternoon city tour which is limited to ten people (you should reserve online to ensure your place)- a nice size tour with Allison. The tour covers all the main parts of the city and was fun and informative - you would need multiple walking tours to do the different parts of the city that we saw on one tour. Allison loves what she does.  I signed up for the morning country tour the next day. The countryside tour was a wonderful overview into different parts of Amsterdam not far from the city center. It is very different from the city tour - it is so relaxing especially without the traffic as you ride through the park, neighborhoods, trails and along the water. It is also a limited small group no more than 15 riders with mostly flat roads. It was fun when we were given food to feed the ducks? - I realized that that was a necessity as they block the road we need to ride on - once they moved for the food we could then ride though. The cheesemaker/clog visit was fun as the farmer was so entertaining and the prices reasonable although no credit cards -cash only. The bikes are very easy to ride and quite comfortable which was good as I haven't been on a bike in years. The regular bikes have a side bag for your personal items such as purses, camera, bottled water, snack, etc. These two tours are a great way to experience Amsterdam -

Absolutely worth trying!. I had an amazing time really. I went to the Country side tour. We went to a cheese farm and a clogs maker. The team is absolutely AMAZING, they tell you lots of information about the Netherlands and their main concern is your safety and to make sure that you are enjoying every minute. Alex from Joy Ride Tours also suggested a great Indonesian Restaurant near Leidsplein called Saba Sebo which was really gooood. You have to ask her about the Heineken story.Absolutely worth trying!

an awesome experience. Just as advertised- we took a party of 8 on a private city tour. Sean went out of his way to ensure we saw what we wanted and cruised around town at our pace. The tour was very informative and quite fun. Equipment was very nice. Would highly rec this tour-- all 8 of us felt it ranked amoung the best things of this type we had done.
Don't like tours, loved this one. This was the perfect tour, great sites and just the right amount of information about the history and current facts about what we were seeing.

Fantastic!!!. Took the tour last year with a buddy of mine. Needless to say, we missed our original tour time but they took us without issue for the next day's tour. We were the only ones for the city tour the day they rescheduled us which turned out to be to our advantage. Allison took up on private tour tailored to our likes and interests. It was DA BOMB! We're looking forward to going on another tour this year in a couple of weeks. This tour should be a NOT TO MISS on your things to do in Amsterdam.

Fantastic highlight of our trip, with 2 small kids. My best friend & I went to Amsterdam with our daughters (4 & 7 years old) and, based on the reviews, I signed us up for a private tour with Joy Ride. We were quite concerned about our ability to bike all day with our daughters (box bike too cumbersome, one of us had to rent a tandem & the other a normal bike with child seat) and we almost cancelled due to these concerns. However, we are SO GLAD we went ahead with it because the country tour with Allison was the best part of our amazing trip to Amsterdam! Allison is great, super friendly & mellow, and she adapts the tour to your needs/your kids. We fed geese, gave milk to baby goats, saw an interesting residential houseboat area, rode through a forest & had lunch at the farm. We are in ok not great shape, and yet this was easy (flat holland). Of course, there was also the obligatory windwill. We really loved the tour, the girls had fun, and it was a great day. Thanks so much to Joy Ride & definitely anyone thinking about this tour should book immediately!!

Best thing to do in Amsterdam!. If you do nothing else while you're in Amsterdam, book yourself onto to the Joy Ride city tour. Allison our guide was so knowledgeable and informative - and great fun too. We had a really good time whilst learning so much about this fascinating city. Allison and her husband own the company - hence great service, a very friendly approach and all very efficient. Cycling in Amsterdam is the very best way to get around and this tour teaches you everythng you need to know about biking safely around his busy little city.Thank you Allison for a great afternoon/early evening. Your recommendation for an Italian dinner was fabulous - thank you for making a reservation for us - the food was superb! All the best for the future - we hope you continue to make a huge success of your business. You thoroughly deserve your top rating on Trip Advisor.

Excellent, would Definatly recommend.. This bike tour was absolutely fantastic. We were a group of 2 couples which was nice and personal. Sean was really knowledgable. He had so much to tell us and could see he really loved sharing his stories and information. Took us round all the major tourist areas and kept us really entertained. Loved the little extra of a traditional Dutch drink sample. Would Definatly say if visiting Amsterdam, go have a tour with these guys. Even told us the best steakhouse to go to which we did and Definatly good steak. Thanks Sean really loved it

Fantastic, Intimate tour. In a city of tours and tourist this is an oasis of dignity and caring. Sean is a great tour guide who's fun and thoughtful presentation belied the diligent research and thinking that clearly went into it. He is someone who obviously loves this city and loves being on a bike. His enthusiasm for it is infectious. By the time we were done our private WWII tour we had a greater understanding of the multiple dimensions of this difficult time in Amsterdam's history as well as the challenges going in and out of that war the city and it's inhabitants had to face.It was a great time and I would recommend a private tour to anyone who would ask me. It is the BEST way to see the city!

Fabulous.... But not with a hangover. :-( My friend Chrissy booked both the in town and countryside tours. In town was fabulous even tho I had to dodge the trolley (purely my fault!). The country tour was also great fun. I just don't recommend drinking the night before.

Awesome!. I had a great time! There was only one other person doing the tour that day so sean asked us what we wanted to see the most and tailored the tour to us. We saw alot of the country side, went to the cheese and clog farm and then to the markets to sample some food. I highly recommend this tour to everyone. Thanks again sean!

Eh. I was really excited for this tour, but then from the beginning it just wasn't that great. First, the group was pretty large for the huge/busy streets of Amsterdam. While I think riding a bike in Amsterdam is a must, it isn't a must for the tour. He was only able to stop every 20 minutes or so and then he'd lecture for a good 15 minutes straight. Plus, you couldn't ask questions while riding really, because you were paying attention. Further, after riding a bit and stopping he'd say things like, "Did you see {blank}?" and most people would be like... uhm, no, we didn't realize there was a specific thing we were looking for. It would have been nice to get warning about important things to look for. I say skip the bike tour and go with a walking tour for more information and a better stroll around the City. He was very friendly and knowledgeable, but the style of the tour wasn't great.

Fantastic!. This was an excellent tour with a very knowledgeable tour guide! If you do one thing in Amsterdam then take this tour. We chose the country tour in November and despite the cold, which we didn't feel because we live in Scotland, it was brilliant! We learned so much from Sean about the history, geography and culture of holland and Amsterdam but without feeling we were being given a lecture, just a ver informative 'chat'. His knowledge knows no bounds ! We will return with our kids when they are older and hopefully he will still be around! Brilliant experience... Thank you Sean!

the highlight of our trip. The best activity we did in our 10 days in Europe. Sheer delight and excercise rolled into one. Very easy bike ride. Don't be afraid of the 4 hour length. Flat with lots of stops. Allison was a great tour guide. Funny, informative and fascinating.

Highlight of our Trip. Absolute must see. We took the country bike tour with Sean when we were in Amsterdam and it was the highlight of our trip. The journey through the countryside was wonderful, and we saw lots of great things, but I'm sure you could do that on other tours too. The real reason to take this one is for the guide. Sean was fantastic as a guide. Very knowledgeable and funny, and we ended up discussing all sorts of things, everything from the history of Amsterdam from its birth to the modern political climate. Absolute must do in Amsterdam.

Very informative and just a good time!. We loved our bike tour! Our guide was very informative and made sure we had a great time. We felt welcomed and the ride was a joy. He tailored the tour to the group… asked about our preferences and made sure we saw what we wanted to see. Our group decided to get a drink at a local pub. We walked around the Red Light (our group had an interest to do so). He gave excellent condensed, not boring versions of local history. He explained why the red light district would close eventually. He bought us a pickled herring with onions and pickles for us all to try a bite. Apparently, it’s the Amsterdam version of a hot dog. We actually liked it. We highly recommend a joy ride tour! It was a lot of fun!

Highlight of Amsterdam. We had seen recommendations for Joy Ride Tours when we were planning our almost 3 week trip through Europe, and are so glad we actually followed that advice! Amsterdam is a walkable city, but the history and fun that come with these tours are unforgettable and CANNOT BE MISSED!! We did both the Country Tour and the City Tour and found that we saw many different sides of this amazing city. The tours are very informal and the guides are friendly, welcoming, knowledgeable, and funny! Loved that we were able to finish our city tour with a traditional Dutch liquor and great company in a rustic, back-alley distillery loaded with history.

Really relaxing and great to be part of the bike scene in Amsterdam. Have to add my kudos to all the other reviews. I was in Amsterdam in September over a week-end in between business meetings. Based on the reviews for Joy Ride Day Tours, I decided to book the country tour. Sean was a great guide - had lots of interesting information and stories for us and he clearly enjoys taking groups out. Our trip lasted 4 hours but the pace was leisurely (no hills!) and we saw a wide variety of landscape. After watching the Dutch riding their bikes around the city, I was thrilled to be experiencing the bike paths myself. One note - the cheese farm just provides a small tasting of cheese, so I would recommend packing power bars and water for the trip. Fortunately it was cool, but I didn't have either water or food with me and wished I had.

My husband and I just returned from.... My husband and I just returned from Amsterdam where we took the countryside tour. The tour was a blast! It's a very peaceful and relaxing ride through a less well traveled area in Amsterdam. We particularly enjoyed visiting the cheese farm, sampling fresh local cheese, and visiting the site of an old windmill. It rained on us for the second part of our tour, but our guide was equipped with ponchos for everyone. We loved this tour and tour company and definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Wonderful country bike ride. We recently visited Amsterdam on our return from Tanzania. We enjoy cycling so our daughter gifted us with a "country tour" with Joy Ride Day Tours. In summary we really enjoyed the tour and would highly recommend it to others. We particularly enjoyed our guide (Sean) who has a great sense of humor and is full of information about Amsterdam, culture, art, countryside, etc. The bikes were in good shape and we enjoyed the relatively small group (8) and personal attention. Sean stopped often to share information and facilitate picture taking. We visited a windmill (fascinating story about windmills) and a farm where we learned about cheese, wooden shoes and had an opportunity to shop in their little store. One caution...Amsterdam is a high traffic area for bikes so be careful, look both ways and stay in the line.

A fresh new look at Amsterdam. My wife and I booked the countryside bike tour through Paypal after reading all of the positive reviews about Joy Ride bike tours on Trip Advisor. The reviews were totally spot on, and we cannot recommend this sweet little cycle tour enough. It was amazing!The tour guides, an exuberant couple from the U.S. now based in Amsterdam, were very knowledgeable, witty and Amsterdam-savvy. The city bikes are made by the Dutch manufacturer, Gazelle; all comfort and smoothness and upright sightseeing. We chose this particular tour as we wanted to get away from the city centre hustle and bustle, and it was definitely the right choice.Our 20km cycle tour took us through meandering countyside roads and paths, serene suburbs and sprawling farmland. We got to see a different side to this lovely city which we've visited many times before, and will not hesitate to book another tour with Joy Ride next time (the coffee shop tour, perhaps!).

A great ride. My partner and I did the countryside tour on our last day in Amsterdam and we're really glad we did. It goes to some really lovely spots and Allison is a great guide - funny, patient knowledgable and really nice. 20km may sound like a long ride and I suppose it is for some folks, but for us the time flew by. It rained a fair bit during our ride but Allison provided lightweight rain gear and it really didn't become bothersome, especially as Allison improvised a slightly drier tree-lined finish at the end when the rain became more than the light drizzle it had been.There were some great stops along the way in just the right amount. Stopping to feed an army of geese who've been spoiled (and fattened) by Aliison's rides was a definite highlight. My partner and I had considered renting bikes for our whole trip, but once we saw Amsterdam's somewhat chaotic traffic flow, we decided against it. It's true that Amsterdam is quite walkable, but some of the walks are very long. If we were to do it again, we'd acclimate ourselves to riding with the Joy Ride city tour at the start of the trip and rent bikes for the rest. Biking is the way to go and a tour seems to me the best way to get started.

Such a great investment!. My husband and I took the countryside tour today and it was fantastic! We saw amazing landscapes and were able to buy some pretty awesome cheese at the farm. As mentioned in another review, there are stops, but you do pass a lot of picturesque views. I didn't mind this at all because I could snap photos and pedal at the same time. Alison, one of the owners, mentioned that there is a photo-op tour, but I didn't see one on the website. Would probably be worth it to email her and Sean to ask about that if you don't think you could multi-task. All-in-all, we had a wonderful time, got some great pictures and a pretty decent workout, all for a reasonable price!

A wonderful way to see Amsterdam. Shaun is a fantastic tour guide - very knowledgable and entertaining. Definitely go on the Country Tour - it's much less stressful because you don't have to contend with as many cars, other bikes, trams or pedestrians. Riding through the more peaceful streets is much nicer!We booked the Country Tour ahead of time, which is advisable as it's cheaper to book online and because they can get booked up (our tour was fully booked so Shaun had to turn away one person who came along without a booking - though he did put her name down for the next day).Our fitness level is reasonable, so we didn't have any trouble keeping up with the tour, even if it did last about 4 hours. Fitness however doesn't stop you from having a sore bum after sitting on a seat for so long if you're not used to riding! Be warned!

Amazing, but be prepared to ache!. We booked the Country tour online as I had read on here it gets very popular and I had previusly done a city tour with another company on a previous visit. We met at the designated point then went to collect our bikes, the bikes are quite heavy and I found a little difficult to handle. We didn't really have a chance to get used ot the bike, we were told to choose our bike, make any adjustments and then we were off!The tour is fantastic as it takes you to places that, as a tourist you would probably never see or think to go and see, or probably never find! Sean was our guide for thetour and we were lucky to have great weather, we stopped to see a windmill and visited a cheese and clog farm, I enjoyed this as it was great to see how both are made, although the owner seems very eccentric and loved the petite women who were on our tour!I have a couple of negatives about the tour though, firstly the bikes have gears - we were told about these as we were riding off, so I think a quick 1 minute chat about these could have helped so you weren't trying to get your balance, navigate across to the park and figure out your gears all at once!Secondly the tour was supposed to be 10km, ours turned out to be 20km, yes it was lovely to see more but it was a lot and gosh did I ache on the evening and next day! This actually spoilt the tour a bit as by the end I couldn't wait for it to finish! So if you book this tour be prepared for it to be longer than expected or if you have health issues then check if it is going to be extended.Thirdly, it would have been lovely to take pictures of some of the places along the route, yes we had designated stop points but there were some lovely places I missed out on taking photos of as I wasn't confident enough to try and take a picture whilst cycling along and I dodn't want to stop and posibly lose the rest of the group.Overall the trip was amazing and I would recommend it, we saw so much and even with our aching legs (and we are quite active) we really enjoyed the experience and know we would never have seen so much if we had tried to venture out to the country on our own.

Best way to see Amsterdam!. Based on the reviews on this site. I decided to booked this on-line. All I can say is we wasnt disappointed. It was great fun. I would recommend it to everyone.I went along with my girlfriend. We booked the countryside tour because the we didnt like the idea of cycling next to cars. It was perfectly paced. The weather was wonderful too. Amsterdam has plenty of cycle lanes. So it was very easy to ride even for novice riders like me. Its defintely a great way to see Amsterdam and also learn a little along the way too.Sean was knowledgeable, funny and hugely entertaining. We loved every minute of it. Be warned the chess farmers is an 'intersting' character ;)So what are you waiting for... book it!!

Beautiful Ride in the country!. My family(teenager & parents) signed up with the countryside tour and the female tour guide was down to earth and very receptive to questions. We had to wait for a family to show up and even though we started a bit late, she never rushed the group.She opened our eyes to the lovely parks in Amsterdam and the beauty of suburban Amsterdam. It helped that the weather was absolutely perfect! We stopped at a local farm where we were shown a small demonstation on clog & cheese making. It was informative but the stop could have been a bit shorter (clog making was drawn out and a bit corny). By the way, I have not rode a bike in quite a while and even this middle aged woman had no problem keeping up with the group. I would definitely recommend this fun family activity!

4 hours of fun!. This tour was one of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam. Very well organized and meeting up was very easy and convenient. The bikes were in good condition and easy to ride. The route was very pleasant and easy. Amsterdam is REALLY flat so anyone of any fitness type can do this. Our guide Allison was very nice, funny and knowledgable. Overall it was a great break from the city and a great way to see the countryside.

AWESOME. Although I've used tripadvisor for years, I apparently have yet to feel strongly enough about anything to write a review. However I felt I owed it to Sean to give my opinion this time. My girlfriend and I spent 4 days in Amsterdam mid-August. We did the city tour and both agreed that that it made our trip.
