We've pretty much told everyone we've seen since coming home about it, and I've made a friend visiting next month promise he'll do it. In my opinion there is no better way to see the city. I can't give Sean enough praise really, he's an absolutely awesome guide, super friendly and a walking (cycling) encyclopedia on Amsterdam. I'm sure I'll be returning soon, and will no doubt be booking the countryside tour and perhaps even the city tour again.You'd have to be slightly deranged to not enjoy this tour, so book it, you really won't regret it.

Don't miss out on this!. I'm so glad we took TripAdvisor's advice and put this on our to do list. I signed up ahead of time for the city tour via the internet and paypal. Allison was waiting for us at the designated spot as promised. She was awesome! She gave us an overview of Amsterdam with lots of fun stories and we even had time to stop for a beer. She can answer all of your questions and give you the 411 on how to ride a bike in Amsterdam. My husband and I felt brave enough to rent bikes the following day and go out and explore on our own. It was the highlight of our 2 week vacation. Don't worry about being in good shape. I haven't ridden a bike in 20 years and was totally fine.

Tour de Amsterdam. Since AMS is one of the best cities for biking, I figured the best way to see the city was on a bike. This was a great tour. The one that stood out was Shawn's passion for what he does and his knowledge of city and its history. Shawn is a great tour guide and this was definitely the best bike tour I've been on. I would recommend the day tour so you can get a feel for the city and check it out for yourself after the tour.

The ONLY way to see the countryside and experience Amsterdam. Of the 3 cities we toured in Europe, Joy Ride Tours was by far the best biking experience we had. Sean, the owner and tour guide for our 20 km jaunt of the countryside knows the country and REALLY cared about our safety! He pointed out various sites and recommendations for additional exploration. Wish we had time to do more tours.

Fantastic Tour Guide. We booked this cycling tour of The City of Amsterdam based on the reviews on Trip Advisor. We always prefer small groups on tours of this nature and on this occasion there were 10 of us. Sean, the guide, certainly knows his stuff about his city. In addition to his obvious knowledge, he was entertaining and was able to interact with all of us rather than just going through a scripted explanation of what we were being shown in different parts of the city. He said from the outset the tour would take 2-3 hours, depending on the amount of questions we had, which I thought was excellent. I would recommend this to anyone who can ride a bike! Thanks again, Sean!

Simply an awesome trip. I recently got to do the Coutry tour with "Joy Ride Trours" and it was a very nice experience. We rhode our bikes in the country side and got to see many cool things that you definitelly don't see in the city. This was one of the best tours we took while visiting Amsterdam. I would definitelly do it again, and definitelly recommend it to anyone.Thanks!

city tour - recommended, especially as initial orientation to Amsterdam. Allison couldn’t have been a nicer guide on the City tour. Some of the nicer elements of the bike tour were the personal stories Allison offered along the way, mixed with humor and the history of the city, her offering of herring to bike riders, and the stop at the brewery on the return trip. I found the history information, particularly around the Anne Frank house, to be very interesting, and I found myself wanting to learn more about WWII era in Amsterdam because of her comments. I bike very regularly and had been to Amsterdam once so was already generally oriented to the city. With that background, I found myself wishing the tour had been a little longer in length, with more stops, and with even more information. For example, the tour didn’t go into Vondel Park, one of my very favorite areas of the city, even though it was close to the starting point; there were also missed opportunities for discussion of artists (e.g., van Gogh) even though the meeting point for the tour was the Museumplein, and we could easily stopped there on the way back. I also believe I may be spoiled by my only other experience with bike tours in Europe, Fat Tire’s bike tours in Paris, which set a standard so high that it may be difficult to compare. Nonetheless, I think the City tour may actually be a perfect first introduction to the city, and the guides are extremely nice hosts. Amsterdam is a beautiful city, and biking is the only way to see it.

great ride!. Just have to tell that we also enjoyed the joy-ride. We went outside Amsterdam and it was really nice - Sean is great at telling interesting stories!!! So the trip is highly recommendable and a nice break from the city.

Loved our ride with Sean!!. We loved our country bike tour out of Amsterdam!! Sean keeps the group small and is a wealth of knowledge about the Netherlands. This was a great way to see the outlying areas of the city - biking is the only way to go. The stop at the cheese farm was great and the cheese was delicious! I recommend booking and paying in advance. The system works great.

Wonderful way to see and learn about Amsterdam. We booked online because we read about Joyride Bike Tours on Tripadvisor and we did not regret it one bit. We had the luxury of perfect sunshine on our Country tour which made the tour even more enjoyable. Allison was very friendly and very accommodating as well as very knowledgeable with the history of Amsterdam. We felt safe the whole time and the ride itself was very relaxing and not very hard at all. If you are a regular bike rider this is a walk in the park - however if you have not ridden a bike before or have serious health problems, maybe this is not for you. The bikes themselves were very easy to ride and of high quality - some had saddle bags to put gear into if you needed.Our group only had 10 people which made it a lot easier to ask questions; and there were plenty of opportunities to stop and take photos. The stop at the Cheese Farm was fun and had really tasty cheese that was relatively cheap. All in all a great tour - a good mix of fun, history, quirky facts, fun characters and exercise. Don't think twice about booking this tour - just do it!

Best Bike Tour and Tour Guide in Amsterdam!. After reading the reviews on Trip Advisor, we booked the City Tour on our first day in Amsterdam and the Countryside Tour for the following day. Allison was our guide for both tours and we couldn't have been more pleased. She's incredibly knowledgeable about Amsterdam and the surrounding areas and enthusiastically shares her favorite haunts, restaurants, bars and stores. Her city tour was the perfect start to our time in Amsterdam, giving us an quick overview of the different areas of the city and its history. She treated us to "Dutch Sushi", herring with onions and pickles–which is surprisingly delicious, and the tour ended sampling brews at a bar in a windmill. But as much fun as the City Tour was, we enjoyed the Countryside one even more. The pace was a tad more relaxed, and the areas we rode through were simply gorgeous. Again, Allison's expert knowledge of the culture and history enhanced the experience. On other bike tours we've taken, the groups have been very large and it was hard keep up and hear the guide, but on both these tours there was only one other couple, making it much more enjoyable. We had considered renting bikes and tackling the city on our own, but there is no way we would have seen as much or had as much fun. We were in Amsterdam for a week, and did several other tours as well, but the Joy Bike Tours was by far our favorite. Thanks Allison!

Joy Ride Bike Tours---The highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. The highlight of our trip to Amsterdam. We took both the city tour and the tour of the surrounding area. The tour guide was fantastic and an expert on Amsterdam. He gave us a visual history tour which took us from the beginning of Amsterdam all the way through to today's modern city. Our highest possible recommendation to anyone who visits Amsterdam, even if it's not your first time to the city. You'll sincerely enjoy it!~

A Must-do in Amsterdam. This bike tour far exceeded my expectations and was the highlight of my trip to Amsterdam. Sean is so knowledgable and made learning about this city so fun. I knew nothing about Amsterdam but now that I know about the history and culture everything else I'm seeing and doing makes more sense. Plus now when people ask me about my trip I have something more interesting to say than "the canals were pretty". I'd highly recommend taking this tour, it's the best money I've spent here. And even better would be to do it at the start of your trip to get familiar with the lay of the land but even if you can't---just do it. You won't regret it. As far as biking in Amsterdam, I wobbled on the bike a bit (ok more than a bit) but Sean gave me some pointers and it was fine (I didn't mow down any other bikers!).

One of the most memorable tours in our 30 days through Europe. After having somewhat a disheartening experience on another bike tour in another country, I must admit I was not looking forward to this tour completely, nor was my husband (as I'm sure he was worried about how I would fare...) However, the reviews are all 100% true to their form, this is by far one of the best tours we went on throughout Europe. Sean was our guide and he was amazing. His knowledge of European history, specifically Amsterdam, was astounding. The bikes were comfortable, they had a few different sizes and he was willing to adjust the seat height to make the bike easy to ride for females (a trouble I had with another bike tour). Amsterdam is a fantastic city to ride around in, I'm not a biker, and I felt incredibly comfortable and competent on my bike. The tour was a good pace, the guide really caters the tour to what you want to see and what you want to learn about. We went to quite a few historical sites, a brewery in a Windmill, through the Red Light District, one of the Queens palaces, etc. He pointed out great places to hang out with locals, eateries, breweries, etc. I would recommend this tour to everyone, it was the perfect way to start out sightseeing in Amsterdam. The reviews don't lie! Thank you, Sean and Joy Ride Tours for such a great cultural experience throughout Amsterdam!

A great bike tour in Amsterdam. Chosen for a bike tour because of its #1 TripAdvisor rating, we (family of our) were delighted with the private tour provided to us by Sean. We spent about 7 hours traveling through Amsterdam and the surrounding countryside as Sean narrated, stopping at key destinations. Sean is friendly, knowledgeable and a great host. The equipment was first class. Highly recommended.

Best way to see and learn about A'dam. This was a fantastic tour. Sean is so knowledgeable about Amsterdam that he was comfortable asking us what we wanted to see or focus on. I guess we were a little spoiled because the group was very small, just four of us including Sean. It was my first and only day in Amsterdam and he showed me more than enough sites that I walked around the rest of the night trying to find my favorites. I was not man enough to eat the traditional Dutch snack, but I was glad that he introduced me to it. I did try the Dutch liquor and even got some more later. We were not rushed at all and I got many wonderful pictures from the tour. When it was over, Sean gave me a map and highlighted places to eat and additional places to go.I would highly recommend this tour and I will probably be back next time I'm in Amsterdam. I definitely want to try the country tour next time.Thanks for the great time Sean!

A wonderful time in Amsterdam. The country bike ride with Sean was a highlight of my European tour. Sean is well educated and well informed and tells his stories of Amsterdam history, politics, windmills, canals, dikes, etc. with the flair of a good teacher. The countryside was idyllic and the ride absolutely delightful. I highly recommend this experience for anyone who likes to bike, learn, and experience the beauty of Amsterdam. He is a class A-! act.

AMAZING! We may have been extra spoiled.... AMAZING! We may have been extra spoiled as we had a very small group... Sean took us on an amazing tour showing us the sights along with some great historical highlights and stories. We even had some drinks and snacks that we would not have known to try without being shown! Without a doubt this tour needs to be on your list! We did about 10 tours on our trip and this was the best by far! Great way to see the city. Thanks again Sean!

Great People!. OK, So I didn't actually get a chance to take the tour because I can't had a short term, temporary disability and could not tell time, even though I had pre-booked, paid in advance, and was SUPER EXCITED about the tour. Sean and the Joy Ride company were *VERY* professional about this and have made things right from a customer service perspective. I am sorry that I missed out on the adventure, but would have no reservations in recommending them to somebody else based on my experience with them.I'm not sure what it is about Amsterdam that makes you a little less..... say... sharp about your senses??? :o)

Countryside tour by bike. Mellow, interesting, entertaining.. Very experienced world-traveler himself, Sean, led us on a perfectly paced tour of the outskirts countryside of SW Amsterdam. He had interesting and entertaining stories. For example, he told about the cultural and political struggles of Vondelpark, and the flora and fauna too. At each stop there were stories, history, and fun facts. Much better than just taking off on your own. No better way to experience this area than by bike!

Great countryside trip, highly recommended. This bike trip to the countryside was one of the best parts of 4 great days my 2 friends and I spent in Amsterdam. Even though it was a full group of 15 people, Allison was very personal in her attention and the trip was simply fun. Highly recommended!

Awesome!!!!!. One of the highlights of our trip to Amsterdam was the bike tour through the countryside to see the windmill and cheese farm. We got to see so much of Amsterdam, and learn some great information along the way. Allison the tour guide was friendly, entertaining, and full of great local facts. We loved the experience!!!!!! Make sure to wear some sunscreen.

Great way to see the city!. This is a great way to see Amsterdam and get a feel for the area, with a good introduction to history of the city! Would definitely recommend as cycling around Amsterdam was very easy, don’t be put off from comments about the volume of bike and how dangerous it is as the tour takes you along the outskirts, so it’s a lot less congested!.

My family did a personal city cycling.... My family did a personal city cycling tour with Joyride tours yesterday and WOW, what a great experience! Shaun was a wonderful guide that not only loves and knows history very well, but conveys it in a captivating manner that everyone can follow. He tailor made the trip so that we could see everything we wanted to. Our understanding of the city (and the nation) increased 10 fold and the "big picture" view of how it developed and brought it to where it is today, was exactyl what we were after. If you have a short time available, this is THE activity to do in Amstardam. If you have long, start with this one, as it will put the rest into perspective. I have travelled extensively and on a Euro/minute basis have not had better value from an information/orientation trip. You don't have to be sporty or super fit to do this either, its an easy, leisurely ride. Thanks again Joy Ride. The White family, Somerset West, South Africa

Easy Rider - great fun!. Our group spent a very enjoyable few hours being guided by Sean around the sites of Amsterdam. The cycling was easy, paced by Sean just right and he was extremely knowledgeable about all aspects of this great city. I would recommend Joy Ride Day Tours to anyone!

Joy Ride Day Tours for the personal touch and friendliness.. Small family run business so you get the personal touch and friendliness. Shawn took our company team building group of 14 around Amsterdam telling us lots of interesting facts about the City and some fun stories. He kept us all safe and made sure we all understood the rules of road and how to handle the bikes. He was very obliging when last minute changes in times were requested and accommodated requests made prior to the ride. Many of us have already said we would return with our families and we would use Joy Ride Day Tours, without question.

truly fun experience, one of the best attractions in Amsterdam. We found out about Joy Ride Day Tours here in tripadvisor and we are so glad we did! We took both the city and the countryside tour and we were thrilled! The City Tour was a unique way to learn about a city we had never visited before, with many stories and historical facts. The Countryside tour was simply delightful with exceptional sightseeing and lots of places to take photos. Sean and Allison thank you for a lovely time! Kisses from Greece!

Great fun, well worth it. We did the country tour in the pouring rain and still managed to enjoy the experience. Alison is lovely and had lots of stories which made the soggy ride much more enjoyable. Even when we finished the trip she was happy to offer advice for filling the rest of the day. I'm glad we did the tour and would definitely recommend Joy Ride to others.
A family run business. Sean is the owner and lead tour guide for Joy Ride Tours. We had a fantastic tour of the city with tons of useful and interesting information!

Fabulous Tour!. My roommate and I took their countryside tour on a beautiful Monday morning. Our guide knew so much about Amsterdam and tailored his discussion to what we were interested in. The tour was at a great pace and I would definitely highly recommend it to anyone looking for a leisurely, informative bike ride around the countryside. The guide was very friendly we couldn't have asked for a nicer person!

Joy Ride Bike Tours is WONDERFUL!!. My husband took a city tour with Joy Ride Bike Tours. Even though there was only one other person on the tour, Shawn took extensive time with them. He showed them everything they were interested in along with adding helpful local knowledge. Shawn is a perfect gentlemen, eager to please all customers. The ride lasted almost four hours, no shorter than his tours of many more bikers. My husband was overwhelmed with the tour and Shawn's expertise. He is accomodating, friendly and helpful. I would recommend Joy Ride Bike Tours as a #1 choice when visiting Amsterdam. Rudelle Battista, New Castle, PA

Alison you are fantastic !. Thank you for the day out and all the information. This is a really good way to start your visit to Amsterdam and gain some knowledge from the experts who actually live there. I have been several times but never taken a bike out before. Cycling is excellent in Amsterdam, no hills and you feel like one of the locals instantly. I told my sister about the countryside tour and now she wants me to go on it again so she can try the Cheese. I would definately take another tour on my return, hopefully later this year. I also very much liked the pit stops for beer, coffee and chat. Best wishes, thank you. Paul, Roslin.

Fantastic. I had a fantastic time on this Tour. Allison was awesome as a guide. Unlike some tours where everything is so strictly planned, we were not rushed at all- if we wanted to stop to take pictures (which i did a lot of) we were more than welcome to. Learnt alot about Amsterdam and i believe it is the best way to see a side of Amsterdam that you otherwise would not. Definitely recommend.
A highlight of our trip. This was a fanastic day. Saun really gave us a taste of Amsterdam and the Netherlands. The cycling was safe and easy and it was one of the highlights of our trip.

The best part of our honeymoon in Europe. The owner of this tour company gives most of the tours personally. We were lucky enough to get him. Anyone can bike around and read off a script but it’s rare to find someone who can truly bring the entire city to life with an in depth understanding and deep passion for the creation and evolution of the city. The tour was uniquely tailored to what interested us and the level and depth of knowledge was reminiscent of my days taking history classes in university.It’s rare but so clear when someone is doing something not because they have to, but because they love to.My wife and I would like to thank you for making our trip truly special. All our best,Dustin

WOW! What an awesome day! :). I would highly recommend this tour! The guide was full of great information and history about Amsterdam. We got to ask lots of questions! The ride to the countryside was so relaxing and gorgeous. And I actually learned what a windmill is really uused for! The dairy farm was amazing too! Loved petting the baby cows in the barn :) We had a perfect day for riding...our guide was so cool we even got to see a few extra places off the tour. What an awesome day! I would do this tour with this company again and again! :)

Best thing we did in Amsterdam!. What a great tour!! We chose to do the Countryside bike tour and it was amazing! Sean, the guide, knew EVERYTHING there is to know about Amsterdam, the country side, the history, the current city life, the economy... everything! He was so fun and nice and made the tour that much better! We got to see a family-run farm make incredible cheese and cool clogs among MANY other amazing things! The country side was gorgeous and by bike is the only way to see it! We felt like we were really able to experience Amsterdam in a local, cool way! I would absolutely recommend Joy Ride tours to everybody!! Thanks Sean!

Fantastic Tour. I rode with Joy Ride Day Tours while on a weekend trip to Amsterdam in the spring. It was the highlight of the trip. Sean was entertaining and informative. The route was beautiful. We rode out of the city to the countryside to Rembrandt's windmill and through a houseboat community. Sean's tour offers a brief history of the Netherlands, funny anecdotes about the places you pass, a view of the city but also the gorgeous surrounding countryside, light but invigorating exercise, and an activity that appeals to travelers of all ages and interests. It is really the perfect tour.

a leisurely way to see amsterdam on land. when you're tired of musuems and touring by canals, this is the way to see amsterdam. up close .the country tour was leisurely paced and our guide, sean gave us an insight into the day to day life of the people of amsterdam and some background into how the atmosphere of tolerance developed. very informative and insightful.this is THE BIKE TOUR!p.s. the bicycle seats are the comfy-est i've ever ridden on.

Excellent, informative, friendly, Dutch Bike Tour!. I booked a Private Outer Villages Tour with Joy Ride Tours to the Village of Marken. We road our bikes through the ctiy where we stopped and discussed how the city was built. The guide did a really good job of explaining the history of Amsterdam. Then we took our bikes on a boat over to the north where we road along the river. We passed through several little quaint towns, then the towns stopped, and we road along a huge river with lots of ships. We road to a village that used to be an island, but 30 years ago was connected to the mainland. Until recently it survived off of fishing, but tourism seemed to be the dominate industry when we visited. The houses were all wood and many of the people still dressed in traditional cloths. My wife and I dressed in traditional clothes and had our pictures taken, At the time I was not too enthousiatic about the idea, but looking at the photo now I realize it is one of my favorite souvenirs from our whole European trip.The ride was great, the guide funny, and informative. My only complaint was the wind was in our face the whole ride back. It is a long ride to Marken, but the way back was twice as long with the wind in our face. Thank god they had nice bikes. The ride itself was very beautiful and lots of fun. Our guide was named Sean. He took good care of us, always had a smile, full of information, and stopping to take photos of us whenever we asked.Dank u wel!Mike and Molly CrehanSan Francisco

a tour with Sean and Allison is like going on a bike ride with old friends!. Sean and Allison are the most inventive and knowledgeable tour guides we have ever had the pleasure of meeting!We spent a most enjoyable afternoon cycling around Amsterdam, looking at the sights and chatting about the history as if with two old friends! - Thanks for making the tour a highlight of our trip to Amsterdam.

Amsterdam by bike. When in Amsterdam it's all you see. Bikes, bikes, bikes! The chaos seemed frightening and yet appealing to me at the same time. I wanted to get on a bike but not just by myself so I decided to take a tour. I found these guys by speaking to the receptionist at my hotel, Hotel Freeland, and they suggested I give them a try. I'm so glad I did. The meeting point was in walking distance to the hotel and the experience was just what I was after. Though he is not Dutch, Sean loves this city and it shows. If you want a different view of Amsterdam while you are in town I can highly recommend Joy Ride.

Locals love it too!. As a long time resident of Amsterdam I thought I knew my town inside and out. What a surprise it was to take A’dam bike tour with Joy Ride Tours this weekend with my out of town Guest! Our guide Sean knew great stories about Amsterdam that even I haven’t heard before and managed to make this old town seem fresh and new again. He was extremely patient with my friend—she hadn’t ridden a bike in ages—and made sure she felt totally at ease picking her ride and starting out…In no time she was riding like a local and I’ve had her on a bike the rest of her trip—thanks Sean! I loved that we stopped for a quick Jenever and I was able to have a chat with the other riders too. It turns out I wasn’t the only local in the group, and Sean managed to impress us both with his quirky insiders knowledge of our town. I’ll definitely be checking out their country tour too!

Perfect Joy. Every time I visit Amsterdam I'm so jealous of all the people riding on bikes. This time I tried it myself, and had a wonderful time with Joy Ride Day Tours. They have bikes to fit every size person. I'm short and haven't ridden a bike in years, but Shawn took the time to fit me for the right bike. He gave a short orientation on bike riding rules and safety and we were off. I felt confident from the beginning of the ride. The bikes are in excellent condition, and Shawn matched the pace to our tour group. We stopped at many less known sights and bicycled out into the country. Shawn gave us the story behind all the places we saw, and answered all our questions. I can recommend Joy Ride Day Tours for people of all ages. It was a perfect time in a wonderful city.

The best way to see the city and country in one morning. After watching everyone zooming around the city on bikes, I decided to take a tour; it is an eye opening experience. I took a countryside tour with Sean, and was shocked to see how close the countryside is to the heart of the city. Less than 30 minutes of riding (along very well-defined bike trails) and we were in the countryside; it really made me appreciate the Dutch way organizing their city.The bikes worked well (handbrakes are appreciated), the tour covered everything from leaning townhouses to beautiful rural vistas, the group was not too big, and the weather was perfect; I had a lot of fun. The owner (Sean) is definitely a character

My kids loved it, I loved it. Will do again.. I had been to Amsterdam about 20 times before I took the day trip with Sean of Joy Ride Tours, but during this day trip I got to know more of this wonderul city then in those 20 times before. I liked it so much that I came back a couple of days later and took with Joy Ride outside Amsterdam. It was perfect, the cheese farm, the wind mills, the stories we heard.. these guides know what they do, know how to treat us customers, and - in my case more important now - know how to treat customers' kids. My kids loved it. I was a bit worried that we will all be terribly tired, but no... since Sean makes all these stops, with snacks and fresh drinks. Kids want to do it again. So do I.
